reviews.review: Fab express cookery course. We loved the cookery course in Bangkok as it showed how to make our favourite Thai food which we can now try again at home. The place is well set up and ready for you to get cooking quickly with friendly staff explaining the Thai way. Plus you get to eat it all as you go and leave rather full!

Sign Up for 3 Days!. For any traveler visiting Thailand, a cooking school is a MUST! My fiance and I are vegetarian and discovered May Kaidee's cooking school in Bangkok and Chiang Mai. We both love cooking international cuisine and what better way to bring home Thai culture than with a cooking course. We debated a single day but after seeing the itinerary and menu items we would prepare at May Kaidees, we had to sign up for 3 days. That was the best decision we could have made during our trip!May Kaidee's cooking school teaches local Thai cuisine with an all vegetarian flair. Dishes are prepared with no meat, no fish sauce, and fresh vegetables.Our first day, we were greeted by our wonderful teachers and quickly went upstairs to prepare our first meal. During Day 1, we prepared Tom Yum chili paste, tom yum soup, tom ka soup, Masseman Currey, Pad Thai, spring rolls, and much more. We received small printed cook books with the recipes and had ingredients already prepared and chopped for us to create our meals. In only 4 hours, we created 10 Thai dishes.One word of advise, come prepared to cook and EAT! After preparing each meal, we got to taste and eat our creations which taste exactly like what you would order in a restaurant. The food is very rich since most food is made with coconut milk and sugar so just be aware as you fill your tummy. Food can be taken home for later which is always the best option.At the conclusion of class, we got to engage in some fun Thai dancing and songs related to cooking which made the class fun!Days 2 and 3 were a completely unique experience as we got to influence the menu for each day. My fiance and I wanted to learn how to make Pad See Ew and Thai tea and our teachers graciously modified the schedule to allow us to specifically learn those dishes in addition to a variety of other That curries (red, green), pastes, salads, and noodle dishes. In all, we learned about ~30 dishes during our class. We had more of a 1:1 experience in days 2 and 3 as most students take only the 1 day class which made our experience that much more special and unique. We got the opportunity to really know our teachers, ask any questions about Thai cooking, and spend time decorating our plate and taking pictures. Our Teacher even went into the refrigerator to get garnishes so we could make our plate restaurant quality!Many times during the Day 2 and 3, you can have the option to learn other skills provided by May Kaidee such as raw food and carving but upon request. While we did not take the carving class, we knew the instructor very well and saw the output of the class which was incredible, ornate, pieces of food artwork.In all, I HIGHLY recommend taking the 3 day cooking class at May Kaidees! The instructors are incredible, the food is delicious, and the recipes you learn you will use for a lifetime!

Best cooking experience. I booked classes for ten days and it was a perfect experience. Friendly staff awesome recipes. They also have a vegan restaurant. Perfect place for vegans cooking Ave and dinning
Excellent class😊. It was good time that how to make Thai food. Teacher was unique who was very kind. If you like to know how to cook, I recommend them

Absolutely Amazing. We arrived early and we were promptly greeted with cold water. Amazing cooking class. We did the afternoon class and made spring rolls, pumpkin humus, Thai chili paste, peanut sauce, papaya salad, pad Thai, Tom yum soup, mamassan curry and mango sticky rice. Did I mention you get to eat it all!? Great clear instructions and very fun atmosphere. Thank you to our amazing teachers!!

Best part of my trip. We found this cooking school through an agency and are so happy we went. Great teacher and great food. You learn a lot and eveything tastes amazing! I will go a second time if I ever go to Bangkok again

Brilliant experience . We did this as part of our ThaIntro tour and it was brilliant! We got to make Tom Yam Soup, Pad Thai and Massaman curry. All the ingredients are pre prepared and you are talked though the steps, as well as being provided with a recipe sheet. The meals we created were absolutely delicious - will definitely be trying when back in the UK! May is a fantastic hostess - definitely recommended if you're looking for something more unusual to do in Bangkok!

Amazing teacher and great recipes.. Amazing class with a great selection of dishes.Our teacher Ice was outstanding and considerate. Explained step by step and provided alternative to ingredients if difficult to buy back home.My friend has a nut allergy and was provided alternative recipes for her to use/cook so she was not excluded from any of the cooking. You leave with a very full belly and lots of recipes to try at home.Would 100% recommend to anyone travelling in Bangkok!
Amazing Host. Had such a blast with our tour group learning how to cook delicious Thai meals. We also learnt a Thai cooking song and even how a traditional Thai dance. Amazing fun.

A good vegetarian course with nice team. I booked the course at 9 am. They picked us up inour guesthouse because we booked over the reception. The dishes are easy to cook and the whole team its really nice and funny. If you would likr to know the basics of thai kitchen like padtai, soup and sticky rice then its this the right course. Only the english from the team was sometimes not easy to understand. Maybe i was also a little bit tired from the night before :). Thats why only 4 points. Enjoy it!

Best food ever cooked by me. Of course under the guidance of Ice I cooked best Thai food. I am true vegetarian and finding school which is vegetarian I thought I m at the right place to start learning cooking. I m not a person who enjoy cooking. After the lesson I will enjoy cooking thai food.

Amazing lesson. I just had the Afternoon class (1500 Bath). Very welcoming people. Water and fresh mango was served until the class starts. The instructor I had (Ize) is the best, always smiling making sure everything was clear and asking if I had questions. We made chili paste, tom yam soup, peanut sauce, massaman curry, spring rolls, pumpkin hummus, papaya salad and.. sticky rice with mango! I am grateful and I highly recommend :)

Such a great experience. YUM.. Great food, great staff (Ice! :)), great atmosphere and vibe - laid back and fun so there's no pressure. We could try what everyone made and it was amazing how different everything turned out. If and when I return to Thailand in a few years, I will absolutely go again! We did the afternoon class, 3-5PM for 1,000 baht. There were four people in the class total - perfect size. Everything was awesome and they send your leftovers home with you, which was GREAT, otherwise I wouldn't be able to try it all!

Excellent class, wonderful food, great teacher. When next in Thailand, make sure you take a cooking class at Mays school. Ive just returned to my hotel from my evening class and have to say my tutor Ice was excellent: clear instructions, food was prepped and really to go. I enjoyed this class immensely, Ice was fun as well as informative. Great to do even a preliminary class; these dishes I can easily replicate at home. Food with authentic Thai flavours.Yummmmmm

The Best Food I Have Ever Eaten. I am not vegetarian but this was seriously the best food that I have ever eaten. Our instructor was Ize who was so bubbly and friendly, and even added us to facebook afterwards! We had such a fun time and learned so much. We received a little cookbook and were given additional instructions as we were cooking. We were encouraged to send any questions when had while we were trying to cook at home (even send pictures of ingredients we weren't sure of!) We were also informed of substitutions that we could make with ingredients that are easy to find in North America, and which recipes could have meat added to them if we desire. I would definitely recommend this class to anyone who wants to learn how to cook thai food!

Absolutely amazing!!. Let me start off by saying I am not a vegetarian. I eat meat constantly and love every minute of it. That being said, the food I made here with my wife was the best I have eaten yet. Ize our cooking instructor was awesome, great attitude, and very knowledgeable. He even provided suggestions on how to modify recipes for ingredients you might not find back home! It was basically a 9-course meal and we left full to the brim. Can't wait to show off my new cooking skills back home. I recommend this to anyone who enjoys spending time furthering their cooking skills. Thanks again Ize! Your dance moves are the best!

What a fun morning!. There is tons of cooking schools in Thailand, and to be honest, I booked one last minute and this was about the only one that had spots available, but I am so glad that we chose May Kaidee! It felt very authentic and it was a small group of only 8 people, so we got to know each other quite well and learn more about Thai cooking methods. We each got our own wok and we cooked 8-10 different things. Our instructor was great and told us tons of different ways to modify our food according to our taste. We made papaya salad, pumpkin hummus, tom yam soup, chili paste, pad thai, massaman curry, mango sticky rice and more! The class ended with learning a Thai cooking song and Thai dancing, which started off kind of awkward, but if you just let loose, it's a good time. One warning: Do NOT eat breakfast before you go. We left so incredibly full and even had 2 dishes that we took home.
Wonderful authentic experience!. If you are in Bangkok area, dont miss this cooking classs, come with your belly empty!This is an activity that stay with you for lifetime...

Everything and More!. First off, as soon as you walk in May Kaidee you're greeted with one of the most pleasant aromas in all of Bangkok. Once the class begins you quickly know that this is going to be a fantastic class. Ize was an incredible instructor! He was energetic and easily explained how to cook many dishes I thought I would never be able to cook. He really made the experience as great as it was. It's a must for anyone who is visiting Bangkok and has a love of food.
Amazing class!!. Our teacher was Ize and he was so funny and informative. I am so surprised at how much I learned and how amazing the food was. I'm full and happy.

Best Vegaan Food in Bangkok. Luckily for us, wa stumbled across this establishment on our first day in Bangkok.It is a Vegetarian restaurant and cooking school, with about 90% of the menu Vegan.The lady who served us (and as far as we could make out, did everything else too), spoke good English and was very pleasant. This was the best food we found in Bangkok, for the places we tried.
Great experience!. Had and excellent instructor that was not only knowledgeable, but had a great personality. Ton of fun and learned a lot to take back home!
Fantastic. The cooking class was fantastic. I had such a good time and learnt how to make delicious and authentic Thai cuisine/ The class took place in a beautiful building as well.

Absolutely worth the money. Three 20-something year old Americans here:We were 30 minutes late to our 9am lesson due to traffic, but it was totally cool. We went on a Monday and the menu we cooked was great, like a 5 course meal.Real authentic Thai food, well instructed in English and May will repeat it if you miss something. Everyone makes mistakes and you walk around tasting everyone's dish. May knows immediately what you need to do differently next time. This was less expensive than other classes we found around the area and I absolutely feel like we got our money's worth.I leave confident to take these recipes and skills home to cook this dishes for my family.Thanks again!

Fun and good for you. A very nice experience, they teach you in a relaxed way and the dishes are delicious. And of course it's very good to have a vegetarian cooking school. Location is also very central, so May Kaidee is the best and easiest option for a veggie cooking class.

Best experience in Bangkok!. This is by far the best experience we had in Bangkok. We did a 2 hour class in the afternoon, and it was by far the best food we have tasted after spending 2 months in Thailand. We made a Massaman curry, Tomyum soup, Phad Thai and chilli paste. Definatly going to bring these skills home with me. And to top is off we got the best mango sticky rich we tasted and to digest all this yummy food, our teacher thought us how to dance Thai Style! :D

Excellent vegan/vegetarian Thai cooking lesson. My partner and I booked a cooking lesson for two hours at May Kaidee's. It was a great lesson, lots of fun, fresh ingredients and we're definitely following up with our "homework" to make our own Thai meals back at home. The teacher had good English and a fun, spirited attitude. We made vegan tom yum sauce and soup, and then vegetarian Pad Thai (skip the eggs for vegan). We learned to make peanut sauce and sticky rice too. Learned how to use some of the basic ingredients such as coconut milk, galangal, kaffir lime, rice noodles and lemon grass. We learned more about cooking wok temperatures for making sauces and dishes. My only wish was to repeat the lesson a few times to make sure I can make these dishes properly at home.

Authentic Thai Cooking experience!. My cousin and I went for the half day Thai cooking class at the May Kaidee's cooking school in Bangkok. If was one of the best experiences ever! The restaurant is located in a backlane off the famous Khao San Street, and the directions on the cooking school's website are very accurate. We didn't have any trouble locating the place. The website also mentions a detailed agenda for the course and they pretty much follow that to the T. The class size for the afternoon session was just 4 people, which ensured adequate attention from the trainer. My cousin and I, both LOVE Thai food but had never tried cooking the cuisine earlier and found this to be a perfect introduction to Thai cooking. Right from learning about the most basic ingredients (names of which we hadn't even heard of!) to basic building blocks of the main dishes (such as preparing the green chilly sauce for green curry and peanut sauce for Pad Thai) to complete dishes such as the Massaman curry and Tom Yam soup, the course covers it all! They hand out a detailed recipe book to each participant right at the beginning, and one only needs to take incremental notes when required. The only piece of advise I would give is - go with an empty stomach and lots of appetite since you will be having a delicious 6 course meal (all prepared by you!).

Cooking fun. Entertaining, insightful class, perfect for vegetarians looking to make tasty Thai food. Lots of hands on work. Parn definitely made it all the more enjoyable. Best thing we did in Bangkok!

Seriously, do it. The best parts:+great for, couples, or solo+learn 10 popular Thai dishes that you can actually make+you won't be hungry for 5 hours+food is yummy+class is fun, you even sing a song together and dance terribly+vegetarian food, but they explain how to make it non vegetarian+friendly teachers who will crack you up+cheaper than almost every other class+khosan roadThe bad parts-nothingYou won't regret it.

It isn't good when it doesn't feel good!. I booked this for my family of 7 after reading many positive reviews. We were aware that it was in a shoddy ghetto location but did not mind that to have the experience. We were looking forward to meeting the warm, funny instructior who teaches you even to sing while cooking. We were the only ones in the pm class conducted by Patty. She was cold from the get go. She short-cut us on the no.of items we cooked. She gave us absolutely no introduction to the ingredients in spite of me reminding her about it more than once. She asked us to cook two dishes as a team and cooked 3 more herself all with a grim face!! She was annoyed that we clicked pics. And finally, she almost chased us out of the place. 2 stars is for the concept itself and nothing more. For this fee, I am sure there are many many others that would have accommodated a party of 7!! If you still want to try this place, make sure you request for one of the other instructors. From the other reviews, we might have ended up with the lemon!

Amazing - would do again!. Did the morning class and despite being jet lagged was SO worth getting up for. Noo Dee taught us for most of the class - he was patient and hilarious and an all round great teacher. There were 5 of us altogether which felt like a perfect size. The dishes we made were so quick and easy but tasted delicious and will be easy to recreate at home. You get to keep a booklet with the recipes you make in class, and a larger cookbook is available to purchase. If you like Thai food, vegetarian or not, I would definitely recommend this. Money well spent!!

The Highlight of my Visit to Bankok!. I made an appointment at May Kaidee's and was unable to make it due to my travel schedule; they graciously allowed me to reschedule and add two additional students!Once we arrived, we were greeted by May Kaidee who is lovely, passionate about her culture and cooking, warm and inviting! Not only did we create several dishes from her cook book (which is included with the class), she also shared tidbits about her culture and we learned and song and dance! The 4 hour class was 1200 baht ($34 USD). We created a chili paste, tom yum soup, thai pad noodles, and finally mango sticky rice. All delicious! I can't say enough about what a wonderful experience this was! I must mention that May Kaidee is the ONLY vegetarian cooking school in Bangkok. She offers many types of cooking classes as well as a thai massage class! Warning: Go with an empty stomach!

A Must Do In Thailand. Out of everything we did in Thailand, this experience was the best. May's positive spirit was so contagious. Everything we made was INCREDIBLE and easy to do. I found the class very organized and the setting intimate. May gave so many alternatives to ingredients and tips to use. I can't wait to get started on these dishes at home!
Amazing!. They really know what they are doing - I'd definitely recommend. The staff is very nice and the flavours, incredible.

Great experience & delicious food. I was worried this would be a bit of a money making tourist trap as situated just of koh san road but I was proved wrong. It was a quiet day so it was only me and my partner and mai kaidee so was basically a private cooking class. Mai kaidee has plenty of experience and is a very good teacher. I have tried thai cooking from recipes online and found them to be really complex, the dishes we cooked here were so simple with only a handful of ingredients that can all be found back in the uk. Neither my partner and I are vegetarian however that didn't matter as the dishes were all delicious and can easily be adapted for meat eaters, the massaman was unbelievably good! You will get a recipe book to takeaway with you with all the recipes you made plus extras. Tip - don't eat anything before, you make about 7 dishes and eat all of them as you go!

The best cooking course!!. The most delicious Thai vegetarian food I've ever made and tried.May Kaidee is just amazing, the most fun and kind chefI strongly recommend taking her course, not only you will learn a lot about thai food and culture, but also it's extremely fun!Vegetarian, vegan, delicious and super healthy!You will leave the place singing in your head May Kaidee's song. Sap sap sap sap saaaaaaaaaap

The best cooking course I visited! Ever!. You must visit this amazing place! Doesn't matter if you're a vegan or not, just come! I was in May Kaidee's school 3 weeks ago but still feel happy because of things happen there and check out her restraints as well.

A ton of fun. This was really just a blast. May was late so one of the managers started our class. The restaurant downstairs looked a little run down and had some bugs on the floor and wall so we were initally nervous, but we went upstairs to the cooking school and it couldn't have been nicer. There were individual stations for everyone. Once May arrived, we started cooking. She is a bundle of energy and a ton of fun. As opposed to some of the other cooking classes which are actually demonstrations, we made everything. We each had our own ingrediants and cook stations. She helped us to understand the process and let us adjust our own food to our liking. And most importantly, it was easily the best food we had in Bangkok.

Great fun. We also arrived late, as the Oasis school is hard to find and traffic was the normal gridlock. We were the only couple present and had a wonderful experience. Wan was a happy enthusiastic vibrant teacher, and no stupidity on our behalf was too much trouble for her. The school was really well equipped and the recipes totally authentic and vegetarian. The recipe leaflet and instructions were clear and easy to follow.We do like to cook, but are no way near professional, but our finished product was delicious and way too much for us to eat. Because there were only two of us, we did race ahead with the cooking, so we took a time out in the middle and Wan took us for a bike ride around the neighbourhood which was great fun.I would definitely recommend this experience to anyone regardless of cooking ability

The best vegetarian cuisine ever!. A little bit difficult to find as its tucked away in a back alley but only a couple of minutes walk from Khao San Road. We had a reasonably priced exquisite vegetarian lunch at May Kaidee's. The ambience itself is like a street shop and the staff appear to be juniors/trainees but the quality of the food is excellent! Don't judge a book by its cover. ;-) Truly mouthwatering scrumptious vegetarian food! If you are a vege lover, you must most definitely visit May Kaidee's. One of the waiters even went the extra mile to get a taxi for us from the main road so great hospitality and great food.

Fun class and delicious food. My children (ages 13 and 15) and I thoroughly enjoyed this class. We arrived a bit late as traffic from our hotel was terrible and it took us an hour and 20 minutes to get there. Our taxi driver had to call the restaurant to get more information on where it was located as he did not recognize the address. If you are not staying close to the restaurant and need a taxi to get there I suggest printing out a map of the general area to be able to show the driver. Definitely have the restaurant phone number handy in case it's needed.Although we missed the first recipe due to arriving late, we quickly fell into place and got to work. We made many different dishes. Our teacher was very friendly and helpful. She made sure at the end of each dish that we made to ask if we had any questions before she moved on to the next one. We were given a recipe book with all the recipes in it and we always had time to add notes when we wanted to as we were working.All the food we made was great and she made suggestions on substitutions for ingredients we didn't care for. Overall a great morning and I would definitely recommend it. We ended class by learning a fun song about our yummy food.Just keep in mind if you decide to take the class that the restaurant can be hard to find as it's tucked away in an alley and it may take you a while to get there depending on your hotel location.

Average teaching, bad customer service. Paid $140 for the raw food class. Started late, moved location at last minute. Thought the teachings and recipes were average and i've done a couple of raw food courses now. Still haven't received the recipes after 2 months of waiting and several emails. I was told not to write down the recipes and ingredients as they were to be sent. Extremely unprofessional.

Expensive and too short. Went for a two hour class, we finished 30 minutes early with a 'free' desert (that was included in the brochure)and hurried off because there was another class at 5pm. We didnt get the two hours and the three dishes we learnt were very basic. I dont think it was good value for 1000 baht. I felt it should have gone until 5pm regardless of us finishing the dishes. perhaps some other dishes we could learn instead. Its false advertising.

Excellent Thai Vegetarian Food!. While slightly off the beaten path of the major tourist areas, our May Kaidee cooking experience was filled with laughter, singing, dancing and great food. We highly recommend a trip here!
Good fun and great food!. An enthusiastic teacher made this class really memorable. Make sure you go to this with an empty belly, there is a lot of delicious food to be eaten.

Great Intro to Thai cooking. There were two no-shows for the class when I went, so it ended up being a one on one lesson for me with May Kaidee herself. As there were only the two of us, we rattled through the lesson at quite a pace, but that suited me well. I found it a really good introduction to a broad range of dishes, and how a few core ingredients can create quite different flavours with just a few tweaks.I was told to come with an appetite, and thinking that meant a big lunch at the end I ate breakfast - big mistake as the format of the class is to cook, eat, cook, eat and I was tucking in Tom Yam by 9.30am. Several things I couldn't manage to get through in the morning were packaged up for me to take away though.The school can be a bit hard to find as it's actually on a little street tucked away behind Tanao road, but if you head behind the Burger King at the end of the Khao San road you should find it.

Not professional. I did not receive recipes from several dishes I learned to make over the course of two sessions. I took classes for dishes beyond the basic ones every cooking school teaches. All schools provide written recipes. May Kaidee promised to send recipes for dishes taught. I have inquired twice, once to the teacher, once to the school. Both requests were met with no reply, no explanation as to why the recipes are not forthcoming. This is unacceptable. It's unprofessional to not deliver what whas promised. It is rude and disrespectful to not respond to my requests. I'm sorry I wasted my time and money with this school.

Would definitely recommend. Went to the morning cooking class with my sister and it was great! There were only 3 of us in the class in total. It was a really friendly atmosphere and we got to learn how to make loads of dishes. We booked it in advance but it turned out to be a really rainy day here so was a perfect activity. I would definitely recommend it!

Lots of fun and easy for a greenhorn like me. It was lots of fun and easy for people who need to learn the basics. Our teacher Wah was very clear, very friendly and patient and her English very good. May made the dessert herself, showed us how to make it. The singing and dancing at the end is not for me, but we were in such good spirits that we enjoyed ourselves anyhow. This is not for people who know how to cook Thai.

Planned to take one class ended up taking two.. I went for the Monday Thai Cooking class. My class had about 7 people in it. My instructor was so funny and cute. She is a natural people-person and I heard she is being prompted so she will likely be there for a while. We cooked a ton of food and the recipes (7 or 8) were super easy. You can find most of the ingredients in any grocery store (no matter the country). The class was about $50-60 and I thought it was a good deal. I learned about 7 recipes and got to take home a small little pamphlet with all the recipes. NOTE: You eat a ton in this class so come hungry. My second class was the Wed Tofu Making Class. It was fun (the Thai Cooking class was a little funnier because the instructor was so funny.) May Kaidee teaches the Tofu Making class. She did a good job, too. We only made about 4 dishes because the main focus was making the tofu. Afterwards she surprised us and took us to her other cooking school and let us try on some of the traditional clothes. (I think she did this because she and the other student formed a bond, I'm pretty sure this is not usual.)Con: It was a little hard to find. I stayed in downtown Bangkok so I had to take a 100 boht taxi. I had to ask several taxis because most didn't know where it was even though I had the map MK supplied. I suggest you take a working phone so the taxi driver can call and ask for directions.Bathrooms were ok. Not sure if it is wheelchair accessible. *******Trip Advisor won't let me mark the visit as more than one "type of visit", but it is prefect for couples, family with teens, and friends.

Great fun while learning new recipes. My husband and I went to the May Kaidee cooking school to complete a 1/2 day vegetarian cooking class in August 2014. Our instructor was Parn and she was a lot of fun. It was a great morning learning delicious Thai vegetarian recipes. We enjoyed the cooking class and would recommend to others.

Raw cooking class Not value for money esp in thailand & very very basic. Very disappointing - dear $100. Lots of raw food to eat by good demonstration only - no recipe handouts - write yr own notes- mai kaidee 10 min appearance - teacher left 1/2 way thru & sister & another person barely understandable :( took another class elsewhere $25 - excellent food, notes & very happy

A cooking course that's a joke!. "Vegetarian Thai Cooking Course with Thai Dancing" was the strange hook in the restaurant advert. The course was very basic - could be appreciated by beginners, but for those with intermediate skill and up, don't keep your hopes too high. All ingredients are pre-cut to save instruction time. Much of the instruction is given in the cooking booklet provided - so, might as well follow from a cookbook! The questions on substitutions weren't well-handled by the instructor (all of us were foreigners, not all ingredients could be easily found outside Thailand). The Thai dancing lesson - is a complete joke and merely an icebreaker to kill a few minutes off the four-hour course. Don't take it seriously.

Might be the best cooking school on the planet. Been here in January 2014 and shall return again next weekend. Ms. May Kaidee (the international stage name of Ms. Sommay Jaijong) is a professional, fun, cook, and her vegetarian cooking lessons (taught by her personally) is something to cherish and to return for again and again.

Amazing vegetarian cooking course. Both my boyfriend and me we are not vegetarian. But we are both so exited after the day with Tuk. Only vegetarian food will be cooked, but Tuk will tell you when to add meat if you want to cook the recipe with meat. Each of us get a recipe book with all the dished we had cooked that day and we could write our notes while cooking. The recipes are very easy and so delicious. We have tried a lot of thai food during our holiday and have never imagined that we could also cook these delicious dishes by ourselves.We mad first chili paste and Peanut source. And then we cooked tom yum soup, massaman curry, pumpkin hummus, Papaya salad and pat thai. At last we had mango sticky rice (the best we had in Thailand) as dessert. They were all so easy and delicious. We will try the recipes at home definitely.Tuk speaks very good English and is also very funny. During our cooking course he taught us a song in thai and showed us thai dance. Thanks so much we had really a great day. This was absolutely one the highlights in our trip in Thailand.I wished to go to the market, but they have changed the program in order to have more time in the kitchen. But it was still nice.

Amazing cooking experience for (non-) vegetarians!. Being a vegetarian I couldn't be happier to find out (via Lonely Planet) about the cooking classes at May Kaidee's. I followed the 4 hour Thai cooking course in the morning (9 am-1pm) and it was worth every penny (or the 1500 baht I paid for, easily on the very clear website).The instructor of the day was Tuk, an amazing young guy with a passion for Thai vegetarian food. He explained everything with a smile, in his breathtaking English. Thumbs up for Tuk, he let us prepare around 8 dishes, and gave so much (clear) information about tastes, ingredients, ... We were 10 people in the cooking class that morning and there was a lot of space, and we worked by two, which made it easy to cook and listen en take notes and look for the ingredients at the same time. Would I recommend this cooking class to other vegetarians? Yes. Would I recommend it to non-vegetarians? EVEN MORE. In half a day you learn about some great dishes, and Tuk also makes notes on when and where you will have to add meat/fish in case you'd want that. Win-win for everyone.Thanks Tuk for the amazing cooking class, we'll stay in touch as I will send you some pictures of my Thai prepared dinners at home!

Great cooking course to learn the basics. I had a few hours to spare on a long layover in Bangkok so I booked a bicycle trip with Grasshopper tours. On the way back to Khao San Road and stumbled on this place and decided to enquire about a cooking course. I booked at 11am for the 2pm 3 hr cooking class. As I recall it cost about 1000 baht. The class consisted of me and two other people. You can't expect to learn to give up your day job and be a full time Thai chef after a 3 hr course, but it was definitely a good introduction. We made a number of dishes and soups so definitely don't eat beforehand. Most of the ingredients are pre-chopped and most of the grunt work has been done beforehand, but to be honest who wants to spend money to chop veggies. Essentially we did all the glamorous stuff like fry stuff in the wok and season and salt to taste. The recipe book we were given was fairly basic and we scribbled some notes in the book during the course. To get the best from the course you really have to ask questions as it's impossible to cover everything in the book. They were extremely knowledgeable and all questions were answered. Afterwards I felt like I could come back to Europe and safely cook a Thai meal for my friends without anyone choking on their noodles. All in all I'd say it was a great experience if you have a few hours to spare in Bangkok. The real value comes from having an interactive experience with an excellent teacher. Go with an open mind, ask lots of questions and enjoy the food and you'll definitely have an unforgettable memory. Unless of course you get Alzheimers later in life, but that is hardly their fault.

We love Thai food now!. We gave the cooking class as a birthday present to one of our friends and we absolutley loved it. Our teacher was Parn an amazing skilled and energetic person. She thaught us 7 different dishes, her explanation was very clear and she made it joyfull for us to prepare all the dishes. We had an amazing afternoon and were completly full after all the snacks, curry's, pad Thai and mango sticky rice!

2 Hour Cooking Class - Highlight of Day!. I would HIGHLY recommend this class to anyone visiting Bangkok.Positives:1. Value - for $30, we got to learn to make 3 dishes, Tom Yum paste, and eat a full meal2. Fun - Tuk was an amazing instructor - funny, kind, clear and passionate about Thai food. We learned so much from talking to him. No matter what your cooking skill level, you will learn much from this class3. Delicious - I was shocked at how delicious the food we made was. It was honestly one of the best meals we had in Thailand, and the food is always good in Thailand.4. Location - Easy to find location just off Khao San Road - plenty to see and do nearby either before or after class.

Learnt to make lots of great thai food.. Really pleased to have chosen this cooking course. We decided the night before whilst eating at the restaurant, persuaded by the delicious food we had at the restaurant. On the course we cooked a lot of thai dishes, and left with a great booklet filled with recipes. Our instructor, Tuk, was really informative and helpful, and gave us a lot of advice on the different flavours and techniques to use. He was also friendly and talkative. I now feel confident in cooking some impressive Thai meals at home. As an asides, this course isn't just for veggies. Although we didn't cook with meat Tuk told us where to add it in on the recipes. Word of advice, don't eat before going because you'll eat so much there!

Tofu Making Class & Vegetarian Buffet. This place is a cooking school & also a restaurant, focusing on Fresh food & veg food.We did the tofu making class, was very good :) Starting from scratch, & finishing with a big buffet lunch we rolled out the door. I think (from memory) the class was stated as 10am-3pm, but we were finished by 1pm. Was very good & I'd recommend it to any vegetarian/vegan/cook or anyone looking for a bit of fresh food in BKK.

Highlight of the Day!. I had wanted to do this cooking school from the minute I saw the reviews. When I planned my trip to Bangkok I made sure I fit it in. My husband wasn't to keen on joining me. I was really glad that my tour guide helped me find the school. We were very impressed with the cooking class. There were only two of us in the class. Our teacher Parn was sweet, funny and great cooking instructor. She guide us through all the entrees. The food was already prepped. Our food came out tasty and it was so easy! My husband laughed and really enjoyed the class. We learned so much. I would recommend this class to anyone and everyone!

Yummiest food. Go there for the most amazing vegetarian food... Didnt have enough time in Bangkok to do their cooking classes. Everything from entrees to dessert is so fresh and the produce used is so yum too. Must try if ur in Bangkok and if you're keen on vego food.

Very yummy and easy!. This cooking class was excellent! The organized setup here makes it fun and simple to try your hand at cooking many dishes. Super delicious and great advice on how to make Thai food vegetarian!

Excellent cooking class. This was a very professional operation. The vegetables were precut, the recipes were all written out clearly in a little booklet, and someone was doing the dishes for us. So we made a lot of different classic Thai dishes in a short time. We were lucky enough to get Mai herself, who spoke great English and could explain things like what to substitute when shopping in a Western grocery store and green papaya isn't ready available.My wife and I did the cooking school at the Tanao location in Bangkok, near Khao San road. (Careful! There are two Mai Kaidee locations in Bangkok, and some poor girl in our class went to the wrong one first.) This was a nice space, with plenty of little gas stoves and woks, so were we able to work 2-to-a-wok. Then we got to eat everything. The food was delicious. We had a wonderful experience here.

Thai and Vegan cooking course! Really excellent!. We came to eat for the dinner and we subscribe right away for a cooking course.... So many thai cooking classes but rarely vegan oriented! We were really impressed by the quality of the food and the teacher. Tuk, the teacher is really charismatic and he loves to cook, he put a pinch of love in every dishes!They have many course... we took the beginner one already amazing... tom yam.... pad thai... massaman curry... mango and sticky rice.... pumpkin hummus! miammm!!! So good!We will definitely come back for more! Come and eat in this small restaurant really close but outside from the busy street of Kho San!A bit pricy but it worth it!!!
Amazing food. Vegetarian Thai food at its finest. Staff helpful and well informed. May was an amazing person to meet. There was not a thing on the menue that we did not enjoy.

ABSOLUTELY WORTH IT. Who would have thought that the best thai food we'd had was the food we cooked ourselves. My girlfriend and I are keen home cooks but never attempted to crack cooking Thai from scratch. The food you will make will be leagues above anything you can buy at a restaurant in Australia. It is just SO tasty and actually very simple. Beautiful ingredients, suggestions on how you can get them or substitute them at home, and a trick to substitute fish sauce with a mixture of soy sauces.If you are vegetarian, or even just interested in learning to cook thai DO NOT miss this opportunity.We also bought the cook book because the food was so good and we'd learned the basic techniques already (which really are not hard to do). You will be surprised how many of the ingredients in Thai are things you already have at home (oil, onions, tomatoes, chillies etc.) It is simply the combination of them that makes it thai.
Good Cooking Teacher. We had great time with Tuk, our teacher in May Kaidee's school.We cooked a lot of delicious Vegan food, including ice cream and some raw food.Talma & Haim Ron

Incredible - DO NOT EAT BEFORE!. This was such an amazing experience to take part in in Bangkok. We booked with May Kaidee because it was advertised in our hotel and it had great reviews on here...we were not disappointed! When we turned up and we were told it was a Vegetarian lesson, we were very disappointed as big meat eaters. However, once we started making and eating the food, we realised it did not matter at all. We made 7 dishes, huge portions and tasted delicious. Our teacher was lovely and really pushed us to try our hardest in making the dishes. We also made great friends through the class, and I think that really was down to the friendly atmosphere of the place.Would definitely recommend!

Awesome Food, Amazing Cooking Class!. My husband and I took the afternoon Thai cooking class with Tuk, and we really enjoyed it. It was wonderful learning how to cook authentic (and vegan!) Thai food. We ate a ton, and definitely had to take some leftovers back to our hostel. We took it on our first day in Southeast Asia, which turned out to be a great move, since we learned a ton about Thai food.They gave us each a small cookbook with all of the recipes that we made in class (plus extras!) The cookbooks were set for individual portions, though, so I'll have to keep that in mind while making some of the recipes at home. Still, I can't wait to try out some of my new Thai cooking skills out!We ate at the restaurant at another point on our trip, too, and the food was fantastic. Everything was really fresh, and the interior was one of the nicer veggie restaurants that we ate at while on our trip.

Tasty, educational and fun!. I loved the morning cooking here. We learned to cook lots of pastes, sauces, starters and mains in 4 hours - and ate them all (tip, you don't need breakfast before this course!). Dishes also always had a vegan option - great if you don't eat egg, and she told us when you could add meat if you wanted to.As a veggie it was really useful to know which dishes traditionally use fish paste (and how you can adapt them at home!).A highlight was our teacher - Parn. She was sooo kind, friendly, and helpful!

Funny, Tasty and definitely educational!. We went to the morning class and it lasted over four hours, we made/were shown how to make about 12 different dishes and sauces and they were all amazing! I especially loved the peanut sauce. The cooking instructor was absolutely brilliant, she was so kind, so funny and so entertaining, its a definite must. Even if you're not vegetarian, you'll enjoy this and learn something, and they'll tell you when and how to cook meat for the dish if you wish.I can't wait to try some of the dishes myself, also its best to come hungry because you get to eat all your creations :)

Highly recommended. What a fantastic morning!We did this morning class and it was better as expected! We cooked four different Thai meals and it was more than delicious. We had so much fun over the 4 hours and definitely we are coming back when we are in Bangkok again!

If you want to a vegetarian cooking class then do this one!. I had a great afternoon with Ploy and one other student. The 3 of us had a great time cooking up and devouring:1. The classics - Tom yam soup, spring roll, green curry, massaman curry,veges with ginger and cashew nuts, pad Thai, green papaya salad with all the pastes and dipping sauces2. Pumpkin humus - amazing3. mango and sticky rice (ok Ployhad to cook this alone since we ran out of time chatting while stuffing ourselves silly.

The best fun ever. Had an amazing afternoon here, learnt how to cook some thai food, which i have used at home, my son had 4 servings of my pad thai so it must be good. Was fun, light hearted and a really great addition to any trip!!

Great vegetarian food . Variety of delicious Thai vegetarian food here. Casual atmosphere. A little warm but it's represent Thailand (the land of summer) pretty well. Buffet dinner on every Saturday night is definitely not to be missed!

Must visit for vegetarians!. I love the food at this place, though there's not much choice of food in the menu. The massaman curry with brown rice is my personal favorite and I never had a better masaman curry in Thailand. Very nice staff and a great location.

Great Thai Vegetarian Food. Being strict Vegetarians, I had researched about BKK prior to my trip and hit upon this place through TripAdvisor reviews and posts. An especial when we were staying in a Hotel just 30 m away from May Kaidee on Samsen, how could we miss it ? So, we treated ourselves to a dinner on Songkran day, and truly, it was easily one of the best Thai Veg which we had ever tasted anywhere. The service was friendly and excellent. We also met with a gentleman who appeared to us as one of the partners, and he told us that after Songkran, the Samsen Road restaurant was going to go through a makeover, and there would be more of short eats/quick bites that would be served hitherto. But the other two locations near Khao San would continue to offer the full cuisine. We really enjoyed the cuisine and truly, the prices are reasonable and the portions adequate ( eg 600 Baht for 4 Adults). This place is a must visit to all Veg and Veggie livers.

Fantastic time!. My sister and I had a great time with Pran and assistant, Boom. According to the website, it said that we would start with a trip to the market; however, the actual agenda differed and there were 4 other recipes added instead (we were fine with this, but you might want to confirm before booking if this is important to you). Pran was patient, funny, and knowledgeable...giving us kind words and suggestions when tasting our creations and reminding us of safety (you're in front of a big open flame all morning). Yes, it will be sweaty, busy work--you do just about everything yourself (stirring, cutting vegetables, adding ingredients) except for the dishes (Thanks, Boom!). We left with a recipe book of of the dishes we made, stomachs overly full, and a wish to return for the 5 day cooking school offered (we met two of the students in the restaurant who were taking the 5-day and we were insanely jealous--private instruction, specialized menus, time in the market, and they were very happy). So happy to have Pran as our cooking guide--she is marvelous. PS...While I like spicy food, you are in control of making your dishes as hot or MILD as you want. :)

Great cooking class if you can afford it. If you are traveling as a backpacker, you probably won't want to spend 50 dollars in a cooking class. However, if you can spend that money, do it! It is a vegetarian class but I you are not, you can always ask them when the meat should go in, etc.We had a lot of fun, we ate, we danced and met some new people. Great idea!

Up your game in the kitchen. I love Thai food, especially Isaan food. I also have pangs of guilt about eating animals ... but I've never been able to commit long term to a vegetarian diet because of flavour and texture temptations. The flavours and textures in May's recipes are so amazingly good that the lack of meat isn't an issue.I've learned to make a number of the 'standard' Thai dishes but with May's secret twists. Each dish is a little taste of Heaven. The puddings are superb, especialy the mango with sticky rice and banana fritters.I am currently doing the 3 day course. The first day is shared with one-dayers and is a lot of fun but I feel that the rest is more focused and serious. Both are good of course!

Wonderful delicious experience. A must do when in Bangkok.. So much fun, Well worth the price and the time! Loved everything. Participated in the morning class, and could not eat another thing till evening.

Amazing food!!. We didn't do the cooking school (although everyone who does says it's incredible so we're going to do it in Chaing Mai) but we ate here every day we were in Bangkok (sometimes twice a day) and it never disappoints! Have the fried tofu, it's incredible!

Honeymoon bliss. This was the first thing we did on our Thailand honeymoon and we really had to force ourselves to get up early on our first morning after arriving in Thailand late the previous night. I'm so glad we did. It was fantastic and a great introduction to thai food. I think we cooked about 10 dishes in total (all vegetarian) and they were all delicious. My wife is vegetarian and I'm not, but the lack of meat didn't bother me one bit. Our teacher took the time to let me know when and how I can add meat to the dishes when I cook them at home. We had a very small class of 6 and it was really fun. By the time we finished the class at 1pm we had eaten so much fantastically tasty food I was full up for the whole day. Even if you don't fancy taking the class, I'd recommend eating at this restaurant as all their food is marvelous.
A must for all food lovers!! . An absolutely amazing cooking class!! Worth every cent!!! The food was simply delicious and the cooking was explained thoroughly!
Vegetarians delight!. Excellent vegetarian food. Wide range and delicious. Cute cafe, we just ate here but cooking classes are also available.

Amazing time!. We absolutely loved our time at May Kaidee's! We took the morning class, and it was just my husband and I and 2 other people in the class. A very personal experience! The restaurant is a bit difficult to find, but if you give them a call while you are on their way, they can direct the taxi driver no problem. The day started out with a fun song that you sing throughout the day. I could see how that could be annoying to some people, but we don't take ourselves too seriously. Once the cooking begins,it is so much fun! Others have complained that you are "just throwing things into a pan," but we were okay with this. It allowed us to make a lot of dishes in a short amount of time, and I don't really need instructions how to cut up carrots and onions anyway. Being vegetarion, it was a bit difficult to find food in the city and be certain that it did not contain fish sauce, so we stuffed ourselves! We are very excited to try out the recipes at home. If you are vegetarian and love Thai food, this class is a must!

Didn't even miss the meat!. I had a friend recommend May Kaidee's from her time working in Bangkok and I had cooking class on my SEA Bucket list so I knew it wasn't a place to be missed. I love that you get the option of going to the market in the morning to buy the vegetables and rice papers (even if it is only a man with one wagon of vegetables is it cool and you get to see the woman making the rice papers!) The food was sooo flavourful and I did not even notice that it was all vegetarian. Take the morning class if it will fit in your timeframe. We were sooo full after making and eating all of the dishes but the dancing at the end of the class is a good way to end the morning full of food! She was really great at explaining everything that was going on and we even went over our time but she was in no rush to kick us out. Her cook book is worth buying and I have made the recipes since getting home and they bring me right back to BKK! The place was a little tricky for our taxi driver to find even with my friend being able to speak a little bit of Thai so if you have a GPS it could be helpful!

You'll remember even years later!. Didn't know that we could review this place on trip advisor... So I can only add my feedback now. Honestly, even though I was there a while ago.. I still have so wonderful memories about these days.I was there too early in the morning... A lady spotted me in the street and asked if she could help, after confirming that this was the place and that I was something 2 hours early, she brought me inside and quickly prepared the most delicious healthy breakfast, Thai muesli style.Then slowly , people started to arrive. And off we went to the kitchen place behind. 16 foreigners from all over the world following orders from 2 charming teachers... It looks easy when you are there but with a bit of memory and some 3 pages of notes in addition to the mini book they gave us, I have since been able to prepare many times some pad Thai, curries, tom yan soup, Isaan veggie, and even a nice coco mango dessert. Will I go again: yes without a doubt Thanks to all the chef students and also a huge thank to May's family so welcoming and genuinely sharing their knowledge. A day that I will never forget

Boring... poor variety of rececipes. The course of three never-end hours starts with a song that we all have to sing. Since that moment the course is just puting ingredients in a wok saucepan, that's all! Do not pretend to learn more about the food you're cooking or the country you're visiting. The variety of recipes is so poor that you will feel that you're cooking always the same dish. Do not pretend to learn how to cook a sticky rice with mango, because you won't! The sticky rice will appear already cooked at the end of the class, and you will enjoy it, but no one will explain you how to cook it...! They have made very good brouchers but the course is not up to the task.

Easy, fun, good intro class. I signed up for a morning class; there were just three of us, and we cooked about 10 items that included spice pastes, in about 2 hours, with time in between to sit and sample everything we cooked. We had plenty of time left after cooking and eating. Wan is a good, patient, teacher. If you are an expert cook, the lessons might be a bit underwhelming, but the food is still great! Eat a very light breakfast waaaay before class begins as you end up sampling food throughout the class. We weren't taken to any markets for shopping, and while there was some singing, there was no dancing or trying on dance costume accessories in our class. No big deal for me, but if you care to do all that, it may or may not happen, be prepared. Tamarind was never used in any of the ten dishes, lime juice was always substituted even when Tamarind would have been a good choice. If you are a serious cook or a chef or a knowledge-hungry foodie, you will not get answers to serious questions about technique or origins or ingredients or the rationale for substitutions or regional differences for the cooking class menu items. You get a fair basic education about vegetarianizing the basic Thai staples you tend to find in Thai restaurants outside Thailand. However, great bang for buck. The class I took was in Tanau Road.

Fun class. We signed up for the afternoon class and it ended up being a private lesson since we were the only two signed up. Wan, our teacher, spoke excellent English and was very, very pleasant. She walked us through all the recipes and paused here and there to allow us time to sit down and sample our cooking. Our class ended up taking about 2 hours since we didn't have the delays of waiting for others. The cooking space is very modern and well laid out, which was a surprise as the Khao San Road area generally feels very commercial and old. We've eaten at both this location and the Samsen Road location and the food is excellent, but now we have the skills to make all of our favorites at home and it was the best yet. I am amazed at how quick and easy Thai food is to prepare so I hope to use my wok a lot more often now. They give you a recipe book, but I think they skip certain dishes, as we didn't make the pumpkin curry or Issan vegetables. I already had way too much food, so that's probably a good thing. I'm a vegan, but she taught us how to make each dish the traditional way if you want to add meat. I think this class is great for anyone who is not a gourmet cook, vegetarian or not.

Can't wait to make Phad Thai back home!. My (non vego) partner and I did the cooking class this morning (9-1pm) and both really enjoyed it. We got a booklet with all the recipes, step by step, and we cooked (and ate) our way through almost the lot of them today. May and her two lovely assistants set aside a few minutes to teach us her special cooking dance too, a special bonus ;) For meat eaters you get advised where/ what appropriate meat can be added in the process. Very professionally run, in an air conditioned, spanking clean room set up with cooking stations, above the restaurant. (Just a few doors along from Ethos, another gem I found on tripadvisor). Use the map and directions on the website not tripadvisor as its not quite accurate. I'd suggest you pop in beforehand, make your booking, explore the amazing vegetarian area it's in, and then you will know how to get there in the for your class. May is really fast becoming a real legend in many countries, and I can see why.

Don't take the tofu course- it's a total rip off. My boyfriend and I were looking for a different/more advanced class since I had already taken a cooking course in Bangkok at a different school and he's already a great cook. The tofu course looked like the perfect thing for us and started off very promising with free appetizers and we found out we would be taught by May Kaidee herself! After a late start, we were left picking the shells of beans for about 20 minutes while May and her sister ran around and seemed pretty disorganized. After, May went about making the tofu with pretty much no explanation and my prying questions had to pull the answers out of her. Then, after limited involvement the first go around, we were left completely to ourselves to make tofu #2 while May and her sister chatted and proceeded to eat about half of our tofu treats. We were expecting a mini cooking class after making tofu including tofu based recipes but nothing of the sort was offered. We were given cold soup as an afterthought and some leftover brown rice with peanut sauce lying around. We did get to make peanut sauce after my boyfriend asked to do something else. And by "make" I mean I read the ingredient list out of the cookbook and May threw the prepared ingredients into the bowl.It was a huge disappointment and completely not worth the 1500 Baht each we both paid. It sounds like the "normal" cooking classes are better and if we hadn't felt so ripped off, maybe we would have tried one of those.

Best Thing I Did in Bangkok. We made 10 authentic tasting delicious vegetarian dishes in 4 hours. The Massamam Curry was a highlight. Well worth the price and plenty to take back to the hotel's mini fridge. Lovely, enthusiastic Thai cooking instructor. The cooking room was large, bright and pretty and fully air conditioned, a rarity in many Bangkok establishments. Recipe booklet to take back home, time to take notes, well organized. A real Thai experience.

Singing, cooking, eating!. Loved this cooking class - one of the highlights of my recent trip to Thailand!Had so much fun experimenting with ingredients, trying our amazing creations, chatting with the other participants, making new friends and having a little dance to finish off with.Don't do what we did and eat lunch right before the class though! Trust me, you will need the stomach room :)

Loads of fun!. This was a highlight of my trip. Really fun atmosphere, the teachers are very good at getting the group relaxed before you get into it!The recipes are really good and I mean it. I don't cook much, I'm quite a novice, and the recipes were easy to follow and execute. The recipe book is yours to take home, they even gave my group their secret tom yum recipe which I cant wait to try now I'm back home!Really good way to learn the different Thai cooking ingredients, what the flavours taste and smell like on their own and how they work together. Made me much more aware of what I liked and didn't which was a fantastic context for the rest of my trip.

Saep Saep Saep- cooking, eating, and sing alongs too!. Nice way to spend the afternoon. The food and experience both was great. They give you a book with recipes to take home too! We had a small group and we treated very well.

Great Activity. My wife and I spent a morning at May Kaidee's cooking school and had a fantastic time. The cooking lessons were great and the facility was clean and air conditioned. Our 'teacher' was fantastic--sweet, knowledgeable, personable and fun. The food was incredible--even that which I cooked. And, at the end of the class, we sang and danced and had a bunch of laughs. I highly recommend!

A fantastic time!. My partner and I had a lot of fun at the cooking school. May Kaidee is a terrific teacher, very engaging and fun to be around. The class was spaced out nicely, cooking a couple of recipes then breaking a while to eat them, then repeating the process a few times. We made quite a few recipes, and everything was delicious. Even if you don't take a class here, you should definitely eat at the restaurant - the food is amazing.

Fantastic food, great cooking instruction. First restaurant to eat at in Bangkok and I didn't find another one with such delicious food for the rest of my three month trip. Lots of vegetables, good portion sizes, a large range of Thai dishes and delicious shakes! The cooking class was a lot of fun, we received a recipe book and made many dishes including pumpkin hummous, pad thai, tom kha soup, massaman curry, learnt how to make chilli paste and we requested to learn haw mok, which was kindly accommodated for. May Kaidee was so welcoming and friendly, as were all the staff. She taught us to sing and dance as well as cook, a brilliant experience.

It was definetely a let down. I agree with the Gavshellmia's review that the class was disappointing in many levels. They did not teach all the dishes that they advertised. They did not only skip the pumpkin humus in her class but in ours too. It seems that they may have permanently deleted the recipe from the class permanently. It was a pity because I was looking forward to a great Thai vegetarian class. First of all the market tour was a greater disappointment. I attended Cooking with Poo last year and we had a truly extensive market tour in Khlong Toey market and that was a feast for the eyes. In May Kaidee's class, we actually shopped from 1-2 sidewalk vendors near by. Her menu does not change at all so it is no wonder that 2-3 people attend the class at 1 time. It is a pity because her set up is pretty comfortable in a clean air-conditioned place. May Kaidee does not teach the classes herself anymore. She just made an appearance and demonstrated one curry paste and did the Thai dance at the end. I think she should totally stop forcing students to learn her Thai cooking song praising her but instead teach other recipes which were promised in her website.

Disappointing on so many levels. I have just returned from May Kaidees cooking school with my 10 year old daughter and we are both extremely disappointed with the class. To start with we arrived at the location we believed it to be at (Samsen Rd) for the 1pm afternoon class as per the booking we made via the website. I had sent an email after making the booking asking for confirmation as we had paid a deposit online however never received anything back confirming our booking. I did not have a response to my follow up email. (I had also previously paid 99baht online to receive their pumpkin humus recipe and never received it even though my payment went through. I had tried to follow this up via email earlier as well and was told they would send a link, which never happened. All follow up emails I made I had no response from - in the end I gave up as it was only 99baht).Anyway, after arriving at 12.50pm we were asked whether we had made a booking to which I said yes online. I was asked whether I had received a confirmation email (no). I explained that I had tried to follow up in regards to that via email and had had no response. I was then told that the course had moved locations and time and that it now started at 2pm. The man did say he would take us to the new location.Now re the actual course. It was only the two of us for the first 15mins (May started at 1.45 with us which was nice since we had been expecting to start at 1pm and they werent expecting anyone else at this point. Lucky for us another girl turned up at 2pm - which was great because I think without her company we would have walked out of the course half way through. As per other reviews, everything is cut up for you, nearly the same ingredients for every dish. This I already knew from reviews but I didn't realise that we would be literally given the basic cookbook and told 'one read instructions, one follow.'. They may as well just post you out the booklet and say 'here, cook'. The dishes were all way to sweet to the point where they curries were inedible to me. The main reason I took this course despite the negatives that I read in the reviews was to mAke the issan vegetables and pumpkin humus as these were not offered in other cooking schools and I was looking for something different. Well, we were told that 'today we skip issan' and told to move on to next recipe. I questioned this (as it states both on the website and brochure that it is included) and was told 'we skip'. After we were shown how to make fresh spring rolls and I could see that they had brought up a tiny bowl each of sticky rice and mango (no, we did not get to make, only told how to cook sticky rice) I asked about the pumpkin humus. Was told 'today, we skip'. It was then that I spoke up and said that the reason I took this class was to make the issan vegetables and pumpkin humus and they were skipping both. She then said grumpily, 'ok, I show you', went downstairs to get some ingredients then came back up and went over to a wok on the other side of the room and started cooking something while the three of us were leftat a table in the corner. I asked if we could come over and watch what she was doing and she said 'no, I'm just cooking some pumpkin'!! She then came over and showed us what to do making a very small batch of the humus. She did let us actually make it which was nice. She served us each a tsp worth on a piece of cucumber then took the rest away! At the beginning of the course we were shown how to make the essential chilli paste they use for a lot of recipes. It was very quick and didn't look like the end result they had in the bowl already. It was funny as when I got back to my room, I noticed when reading my recipe booklet that it was someone else's from a previous class as they had written in the chilli paste recipe and it was totally different from what we were shown! (theirs had soy sauce, sugar and sweet and sour sauce which we were not shown, which probably explains why it looked different!Overall there was no love or care to the course. We were ripped off as to what we didn't get to cook, what we did was not that nice at all. Same vegies all prepared and didn't even look fresh with some of them (lemongrass etc looked dried up and precut hours ago). Big shame.We are here in Bangkok a week to do a few cooking schools. This was our second. We did Chef Leez two days ago and it was fabulous. Originally I had doubts about chef Leez due to the basic menu but she just made the class and showed us special tricks and techniques and talked to us an discussed what we were doing etc. there was none of this at Mays. It is a production line of dothis, do that.Other than Chef Leez which was great, I have no doubt there would be many other better options in Bangkok. Maybe because it is so Close to Khao San rd they know they can just utilize the backpackers as a way of making quick money?By the way, may only took us at the beginning then left us in the hands of Wun.

SO MUCH FUN!!!!. This was an amazing experience. In 3 hours we learned to make 10 delicious dishes...so much fun...we laughed and laughed and ate and ate. And Parn was a terrific instructor. Mai is a bundle of energy and warmth and we ended the class on a very high and musical note!Highly recommend this.

Fun, yummy, not without flows.... We visited the cooking school recently, finding the place was a long and troublesom.The class itself was lots of fun, food was good and the joy was in the air, we had a great time and learned some nice thai recipts.What we felt was missing was some background - how to approach the special thai herbs and spices, and some explanations on each dish before the actual cooking. We did get some while we worked, but between reading instructions from the book and cooking for the first time, it wasn't easy to understand what May was saying over the noise.All together we had fun, though, and we do recommend this attraction if you like cooking.

Fabulous and vegetarian. I first had a cooking course with May over 9 years ago behind her restaurant. It was taught fantastic and easy dishes that I use in my daily life. I am currently back in Bangkok, and the restaurant was the first place I went. So glad to see that not only is she still there, but also has a proper air conditioned multi station cooking school and new cook book. I took the making tofu class, which was great. May is a fabulous person to spend the day with, and her classes are fun but packed with information. Highly recommend.

Fun, easy, tasty!. I had a great afternoon at May Kaidee's cooking school. We learnt over 10 recipes, they were so tasty but simple enough to know that I could easily recreate them back in the UK. No complicated ingredients, and May and her lovely assistant gave us lots of tips for substitutions we could make if certain herbs/vegetables were not available.I came to the cooking school on my own and joined a small group for the afternoon session (5 of us altogether). It was a fun and friendly afternoon. We had an interesting discussion with May at the end of the class, about food choices, vegetarianism, and health. As a vegetarian it was great to find a cooking school that was consistent with my way of eating, but I would also recommend it to meat-eaters because as we cooked each dish we were told when we would add meat if we were using it.Highly recommended and really good value! I can't wait to get home and cook these recipes for my friends and family!

lots of fun, can be hard to find.... May Kaidee's Cooking School was a fun way to spend a morning!My girlfriend wanted us to take a course while in Bangkok so we decided on May Kaidee's place.You'll find the restaurant portion at ground level and the school is on the second floor above however,It can be hard to find so check the address on your map or call ahead for directions in Thai for your cab driver.The course my girlfriend took was basic Thai cooking and preparation of staple spices. It was a bit junior for her as she already is a great cook and the "sing along portion" of grinding spices she found a bit juvenile.I chose a culinary carving lesson rather than the cooking as I don't share the kitchen at home but I can also cook.I have experience in carving and found the lesson challenging but rewarding! We were all treated to an impromptu Thai dance at the end of the class by May and her assistant which I thought was very entertaining but again my girlfriend did not.The course was not cheep but was a really nice way to spend a morning! It's also close by Kho San road and other attractions in Bangkok. I think it was fun if not as informative as the knowledgeable may want! (check location before you go)

Absolutely fantastic, a must-do when in Bangkok!!. From beginning to end my husband and I had a fabulous experience at May Kaidee's cooking school! We were met by the lovely instructor around 9am at the secondary May Kaidee restaurant, on Sam Sen Road. She took us on a short walk to the main restaurant where the cooking class is conducted. We stopped off to see a lady making the super fine dough for spring rolls where we also sampled a delicious treat of this dough filled with sugar cane (YUMMY!). In the main class we were presented with a booklet full of the recipes we would be making, ten dishes in all! (At this point we realised we should NOT have had any breakfast!) The lovely instructor taught us initially how to make delicious fresh chilli paste, a base for several of the dishes that we would go to cook. We then took it in turns with our cooking partner (take a hubby if possible ;) ) to read the ingredients out whilst the other partner was on the wok side of the action, cooking it all up! Amongst other dishes, we cooked delicious Thai green curry (a standard when in Thailand surely?!), Massaman curry (this was gorgeous), Pad Thai, stir fried vegetables with ginger and cashew nuts, Green papaya salad, Issan, fresh spring rolls (non-deep fried and extremely lovely!) and mango sticky rice. Wow wow wow! A real culinary experience!The food was fab, the tuition light-hearted but very informative and professional, we sang the famous 'Sap, sap sap sap sap' song, and even did some Thai dancing at the end of the class, and took some photos with everyone. It really was one of the best experiences myself and husband had in Thailand. A MUST DO for any visitor to this fabulous city!! :-D

packed a lot into the afternoon. After reading the other reviews it seemed that you got to try a lot more dishes with May Kaidee than other schools. I can confirm that you do get to cook them all - it's not rushed at all, the recipe book you are given at the end is helpful and I picked up a lot of tricks along the way. We were advised that the afternoon class is usually more relaxed so we opted for that. We had difficulty finding the restaurant/school but a couple of phone calls and May met us nearby and a quick tour of backstreets and we were there. We were the only two in the class - May seemed to assess our level of interest and skill and adapted the class accordingly. She left us alone to try things and would magically appear at the critical moment - point out what we could do better and why and then prove that she knows exactly what she's doing by showing us. We tried all the dishes we cooked - all excellent and easy to make at home. Good value - easy to understand - simple recipes - worth doing.

Professional & yummy. It was a great class - I am vegetarian and tire of asking if thai restaurants in Australia use fish sauce etc in their vegetarian curries (they do) - so was keen to do this cooking class. it was really useful and we created some great food. The course is well set out and flows really well. The kitchen is above the restaurant and is clean, modern & professional. Our teacher (Wun? as in 'one, two, three' - her words) was professional and attentive. My 9 year old daughter also did the class and she loved it. We had 3 other guys in the class and they were great fun and really lovely people which obviously helped the overall vibe of the class. The manager was also really nice - sorting our credit card payment and giving us directions etc. The only tricky bit was finding the place! Highly recommended.

Yum! A great intro to Thai cuisine.. Our experience was fantastic. We attended the afternoon class where there was only 3 of us learning and one instructor. She was incredibly friendly, funny, and upbeat. We learned a lot, recieved an organized and easy to follow recipe book, got a lot of time in front of the wok, and ate our hearts out! Go hungry.The food was delicious. Highly recommended!

Shop, Cook, Dance, Eat. (Burp :)). Vegetarian food tasted better. Everything about this experience was worth it. An escape from the crowd in Bangkok, shopping from the local markets, cooking with the fresh ingredients, super YUM!!! The song and dance at the end was pretty cool too. If you love food and cooking and want to do something different in Bangkok worth the stop.

Cook Thai & Dance at May Kaidee's!. Escape from the streets of Bangkok and learn to cook great vegetarian Thai food with May! With over 10 dishes to create and a recipe book to match, it is worth the 1200 baht. They also offer specialty courses depending on the evening and it is all great fun, even for a solo traveler.

Well-run, very enjoyable, delicious and memorable. May is delightful, professional and a joy to spend a morning with. The cooking class runs like a charm as we work through a bigrange of useful recipes. But it's relaxed as well. The food we made was fabulous. I would recommend this to anyone including non-vegetarians.
fun and nice!. it was a funny morning! everybody is really nice and they help and follow you all the time.we ate all the dishes we prepared and by 1pm we were completely full!!

Fun morning. My daughter booked this cooking class and I wasn't that thrilled about it, as I don't like cooking, but I really enjoyed it. There where 7 in our group and all very friendly. Went to the little local market to buy ingredients and to see how real spring roll wrappers are made. May Kaidee made the class lots of fun and interesting. Cooked several dishes - all vegetarian and all very quick, easy and tasty. Was a great way to spend a morning.

Lovely way to spend a day. Overall the experience was quite fun. May is charming and creates a relaxed and convivial atmosphere. She's very generous with food and I recommend that everyone come hungry. This would be a good course for beginner cooks as much of the work (peeling, grating, chopping, sometimes even measuring) is already done for you. You will make many different kinds of dishes which makes it a fun way to try different Thai foods. The trip to the "market" was a bit of a letdown. We went to a vegetable stand, a spring roll maker, and a convenience store. The spring roll maker was quite interesting and I enjoyed watching her much practiced movements. However, I could have happily done without the other two stops.I also took her vegetable and fruit carving class afterward. Great fun! I learned to make all sorts of flowers, leaves, etc using cucumber, carrot, tomato, pumpkin, and watermelon. May was very patient and encouraging whenever my knife would slip or I made a mistake.

Great intro to cooking Thai. The cooking school is fun, I would recommend it. As others have commented it isnt without room for improvement, you make about 8 dishes which are loosely based on the same core ingredients. The hard work has been done for you, as all the amounts have been pre chopped and measured, so you cant really go too far wrong.May is a lovely character and she has a wonderful energy which makes the class great fun, but she does play up to her growing celebrity.The 'market' is a sham; I have been to asian markets and most tourists would not want to eat food if they saw it sold there first. The market you get to visit is a barrow set out with some produce in a car park.
