This was my biggest dissappointment and I think they should remove the market trip as it was unneccesarry.The teaching was clear and the food tasted good, it's at a basic level, you need no cooking ability to do it, and there are plenty of staff around to keep you doing it right!As others have noted, you share a cooking station with another, for me this was okay, as I was travelling with my partner... But it felt a bit cheeky, as we had both paid for a course, the price wasn't per pair.On the whole I really enjoyed the class and the negatives are listed in the hope the school can improve and future customers have a realistic expectation.

A great experience. if you like to eat a lot...laugh, sing and dance while your cooking come here. May is engaging, swift and colorful...and the food we cooked was hot and Thai...there were 10 of us in the 4 hour class and it looked to me like everybody really cooked the dishes...the portions were prepared...the kitchen was simple I guess you could say homey...we left stuffed and in a really good mood...cooking isn't always like that at home...but the class was terrific.

Amazing experience a must go !. We found this cooking class online, not only is it cheap but the experience was a memorable one. May was awesome and she fed us into a food coma. Going to the market, cooking all the food and listening to May was one of the best times we had in Bangkok. I would recommend this class for the money we paid .

great experience. This turned out to be a great experience. May is wonderful, she is friendly and helpful. When I mentioned to her my favorite thai dish she showed me how to make it even though it was not one of the planned dishes. this is not a class in which you will just be entertained, you will do the cooking, so you will leave being able to do it again. She gets everyone involved. and they have fun. The place is small, I can't imagine doing this with very many people as it was we had 6 people in the class. the only bad thing is now I have the challenge of finding the right ingredients here in the States.

Thai cooking made easy peasy!!!. The best part of the trip to Bangkok was this class! May is a fabulously warm person, and the food she teaches is authentic thai and very very healthy! The class location is a little difficult to find, but once you reach there, she makes the cooking seem so easy peasy! You also learn a thai song which you learn to sing with her and she gives you a traditional thai dance show at the end.she did not take us to the market though it was meant to be a part of the class, but it was ok by all of us I guess since none of us asked for it!Top tip: Go there on an empty stomach because you eat what you cook and you cook a lot!Also, ask for a certificate if you need one (like I did since I run a food business and this certificate would add value to it) as she will not offer one on her own.

If you are in Bangkok, do this.. What a fantastic experience. From the warm welcome from May to the trip to the market and all the cooking, it's amazing value for 4 packed hours.We learned to cook 10 dishes and May shows you that great Thai food is quick, simple and doable by just about anyone.Not being Vegan, I kept working out what meat,seafood to add to the dishes but in all honesty, the vegan dishes were outstanding. I can't wait to get home and try out the recipes from her cookbook.As a tip, get your hotel concierge to write the name and address in Thai as it's not that easy to find and Bangkok cab drivers are generally hopeless outside their home suburbs anyway

Perfect. Came for the afternoon class with my wife. We found it to be warm, unpretentious, fun, and healthy. May Kaidee has a lot of "it" factor and seems to have captured the authentic soul of Thai food. Even though she could have gone a more commercialized route, she has stayed true to her values. Definitely recommend.

Amazing experience and so full!. My husband and I were in Bangkok for our honeymoon and decided to check out May's cooking class. The class was definitely one of our highlights of our trip. May Kaidee is amazing! We cooked 12 dishes and all tasted delicious. Do NOT eat before you take this class. You will eat SO much food while you are there. The food is all prepped for you, but that does not take away from the experience. You learn about the ingredients and how to develop flavor. The recipes are so easy yet so flavorful, we will definitely be able to make them at home.We highly recommend this class. It's a wonderful experience and well worth it!

Authentic, flavorful, and fun, but watch out at the cash register.. Family of four, with two adults and two small children. We took the morning class, which included preparation of 12 vegan dishes. May Kaidee has a larger-than-life personality and this guides the entire experience. She met us at the door when we arrived and served us some fresh fruit and bottle water. When the entire class had arrived, she demonstrated a few preparation techniques and described some of the basic ingredients we would use. As newcomers to Thai cooking (though we've eaten it for years), we learned a lot about unfamiliar ingredients. We also learned a cooking song that she probably wrote.After a short trip to a nearby fruit stand and spring-roll wrapper artisan shop, we went into the kitchen. My wife and I each teamed up with one of our daughters at separate woks and stations. May Kaidee and her staff prepare all of the ingredients, and do all of the dishes, so the course moves along at a rapid pace. May continually circulates through the kitchen and helps when necessary, without taking away your control. After cooking each meal, we sat at the table and ate it. After 4/12 courses, we were totally stuffed! Pace yourself and bring some of it home.After the kitchen, we returned to the restaurant dining room for spring roll and dessert preparation. Then May donned some traditional Thai garb and put on a dance show. Everyone was encouraged to dance, and most folks (even other restaurant patrons) joined in.After it's all over, time to pay. This is when you need a printout of the website where you booked. Website says 1200baht/adult, half price children. Total price for our family should be 3600 baht. However, at checkout, May told us the price would be 4,000 baht for our family. No big deal, still well worth the experience, so I paid it without making a stink. I did feel like a little bait-and-switch was going on, however. On the other hand, this was common practice throughout Thailand, where the well-dressed foreigner (esp. American) is expected to pay a higher price.

AMAZING! Both food and staff. My husband and I had the pleasure of taking a morning cooking class in the beginning of March. We love thai food and were excited to learn how to cook it. We had no idea that the staff, particularly On who taught our class, and the others taking the class would be so much fun! We made about 8 dishes and talked through how to make a couple more. In the morning, we went to a local market and On walked us through different spices, fruits, and vegetables, and even bought a few things for us to sample that were not a part on of what we would cook!The food is delcious and you can control how spicy you want it. My husband is a meat eater, but loved all of the recipes we made in class. They give you a book with everything you cook so you can recreate the dishes at home. A great experience and well worth the time and money!!!

Entertaining and useful vegetarian cooking class and cultural experience.. I loved this cooking class. We learned how to make - and ate - over 13 dishes. We learned how to pick ingredients, what ingredients were fundamental to Thai cooking, and the base and variations to different dishes. May Kaidee and her assistant were entertaining and engaging and filled with humor and fun, too. You also learn a song that will be stuck in your head for weeks after the class. I would highly recommend!

Fun, tasty and interesting. We took May's class last weekend and had fun discovering spices we did not know and how to make real thai food - we knew some very basics and usually buy ready made curry pastes at home. we had lots of fun singing while cooking and learning some thai dance moves. appreciated the small group (6 of us) and the great staff. we came back to have dinner as we liked the food we had cooked from maykaidee s recipes.

Delicious Vegetarian Cooking Class - Recommended To Meat-Eaters Too!. First of all, let me start by saying that I am a committed carnivore. Even still, I decided to try out May Kaidee's Cooking School and it turned out to be a great decision. First, May takes you on a quick tour of the local market, and points out the different sauces and spices that are used in Thai cooking. When you get back, May's cooking school awaits you in the back of her restaurant. It is a professional setup, with cooking stations and prepared ingredients all set up upon your return. May takes you through a dozen dishes, all vegetarian (vegan if you want), and helps out with certain tips to make sure your dishes turn out well. During the class, there are frequent snack breaks where you eat what you made...and there was never enough to go around! It is a good idea to have a light breakfast!All in all, it was a great class, and very reasonably priced. Before you pass over this because you aren't a vegetarian, I would give it a serious thought. It was a great class, and a wonderful experience.

A great fast course in cooking the Thai basics - come hungry!!. We really enjoyed this course in cooking vegetarian Thai basics. The prep work (such as veg cutting etc) is done for you and all you need to worry about is cooking the food from instructions. It's really effective and interesting to see how Thai food cooking works in practice - in just under 4 hours (including an hour at the markets and discussing herbs, and 30 mins eating sweets and watching Thai dancing) and working in pairs we made 10 dishes, including green curry from paste, peanut satay sauce, and a really excellent Pad Thai I was very happy with.This course is veggie, and can be adapted for vegans. (I am neither, but figured a little more veggie food in my diet can't hurt and it's not like I don't know how to cook meat already.) There is a bathroom on-site. The kitchen is not air-conditioned and it does get hot while cooking, so dress light.If you are already very familiar with Thai cooking or a particularly accomplished cook, you may find this course a bit basic for your needs, but if you are interested in cooking Thai this is a great way to see how fast it can come together, really boosted my confidence and I can't wait to try it out when I get home.

Who Knew that Cooking Can Be So Much Fun!. A visit to Bangkok isn't complete without taking a May Kaidee cooking class. She's entertaining, uplifting, and fun! It's a fast-paced event that gets the entire staff and customers dancing and singing while cooking and eating.

The best thing I did in Bangkok!. Absolutely fab! May Kaidee and her team were fantastic - showed us to the markets and helped us to prepare 14 dishes in a whistlestop 4 hours. Even managed to squeeze in a bit of traditional Thai dancing. Loved every minute - great value for money and would go back to either one of the standard classes or a private course in an instant. Thanks May!

Passionate, entrepreneurial and fun!. A great and active morning with May Kaidee and her pro-active and entrepreneurial team. You learn to prepare a 7-course vegetarian menu in a very short time. We discovered that Thai food is easy to cook provided you have a few ground ingredients. May Kaidee made us sing and dance while cooking and tasting! A rich and fun experience!

Great educational experience!. I really enjoyed my morning (9am-1pm) at the cooking school!As someone who does not like to cook, it was great to see how quick it was to make some of these delicious dishes!We were taken through several traditional recipes with modifications to make the sauces vegetarian (no shrimp paste, no fish sauce), and, wonderfully, no MSG here. Some recipes were demonstrated (green chili paste, papaya salad and sticky rice) by either May or her wonderful assistant On, but most of the dishes were cooked by us. We were 9 participants that day, so almost everyone was paired off - they had me make dishes on my own because I mentioned my soy sensitivity and they showed me the modifications to avoid soy sauce. (As a side note to anyone else avoiding soy, mushroom sauce does still have 20% soy sauce, but some are able to tolerate that).Tips:-Skip breakfast before going - even doing so, I was too full to eat dessert!-I purchased the package of sauces and the vegetable grater at the end of the class. The sauces can be purchased separately (i.e. if you don't need curry powder) and the grater is about 50 baht cheaper in the markets.

My best day in Bangkok. Very organized cooking school,very clear explaination and I never know that Thai cooking is so easy but after Ms May and Ms Ohn eplanation ,cooking Thai food is completely easy.Ms May very friendly and make my Bangkok visit is memorable.The best of all ,Ms May and her team are very entertaining and fun.

Fantastic Cooking School in Bangkok!. A fantastic Cookery School in Bangkok - 100% Vegetarian! Really well organised experience with May Kaidee which was fun, informative and a great way to learn how to make authentic thai food. The day starts with an explanation and demonstration of chilli paste - including all the raw ingredients. We then went to a local place where a lady was making Spring Roll Wrappers, followed by a small market stall where we got to talk about all the different types of vegetables. We then went back to the restaurant and in the back kitchen we each had a work station with wok and all prepared ingredients. We then worked through the May Kaidee Recipe book - making Green Curry, Pad Thai, Massaman Curry and more! So much food - and after making each dish you then get to eat it! All through the cooking there is laughter and the May Kaidee 'Sap Sap' song - really thai experience! I love Thai Food - but I usually have to be careful of the animal ingredients that are used i.e. Fish Sauce/Shrimp etc. but this was great as I could eat ALL of it and enjoy Thai Food which I can now make at home in the UK! Sap Sap Sap Sap Saaaaap! I found this Cookery School before our first visit to Thailand - I booked it online and paid a deposit - we then paid the remainder when we left. Would also recommend the May Kaidee restaurants - they are sublime!

Don't miss your chance to eat, learn, and enjoy!. May's class was so nice, I took it TWICE! I loved the atmosphere and menu. May's class is vegan, but of course at home you can add and change as you like. The class covered everything from the trip to the market, the cooking of the rice paper, and all the identification of the new Thai specific ingredients through the most challenging steps and wok cooking. We ate until we nearly popped. May and Jo were SO KIND! I took a second, afternoon, class later during my visit. This course allowed me to choose any of the menu items from the adjoining eatery's fare. Foe the second class May was my private teacher. I was even allowed to invite my hungry husband at the end of the course to help eat all of our "lessons". I still rave about May's class. AMAZING!

Excellent food..I must visit for the Thai cooking lessons!!!. this was brilliant place to visit..my parents are vegetarians so this was the perfect place to eat and learnt how to cook Thai food!the whole experience was great...we showed up without booking for the cooking classes, but this wasn't a problem the team were very helpful and Miss On was amazing at teaching us how to cook. As well as making 14 recipes the drinks were all free and cook book. We had a lot of fun and will definitely visit again and recommend May Kaidee's restaurant!

Fantastic and Great Fun.. I decided to do the cooking course last minute as I had a couple of days left in Bangkok before me and my friends flew home. None of my friends fancied it so I went by myself. When I turned up I was the only person booked in so it was just me and May Kaidee together. She taught me to cook over 20 dishes to my taste and provided all the ingredients and I was then able to take them all home and had them for dinner and the lunch the next day! MAy Kaidee was lovely and welcoming. I thoroughly enjoyed myself and would absolutely recommend this to everyone who has the chance. Get along to May Kaidees!!!

Great teacher, amazing food, fun experience. The whole experience surpassed my expectations, It was great fun. I would recommended to anyone who wants to learn some delicious and easy Thai recipes having fun. LOVED IT.

FUN!!!! Very interesting and helpful!. WOW! This was the best cooking class experience I've ever had. I was a little hesitant to do a cooking class since I am a strict vegan and don't like lots of oil or sugar. There were plenty of ways to adjust cooking to personal needs. Ohn, was a wonderful instructor. She communicated clearly, was very entertaining and gave us lots of helpful hints for when cooking in Thai style. We made tons of dishes, went to a little market to explore and even had time to get special goodies like coconut water and see the owner dance a fun traditional Thai dance! Highly recommend!

Too rushed, but good enough food. When I took this class there was only one other student, which gave me hope that we would both get a lot of attention, and have an intimate experience. To an extent this was true, but I didn't get Mai Kaidee's undivided attention like I did with the cooking class I took in Vietnam (there was also two of us in that case).The visit to the "market" was disappointing. We went to the storefront where the rolls for spring rolls are made (which was cool), and then we walked over to a man with a food cart containing a dozen or so different fruits and vegetables. I would hardly call that a market. Again, in Vietnam we went to a proper market with hundreds of stalls where we were the only caucasian people there. It was very authentic.We went back to the school and again I was a little dissapointed when compared to Vietnam. There was only one cooking station for the two of us. Since we made a lot of dishes, there was more food then we could eat, but it would have been nice to have cooked each dish myself. If you count cooking a sauce from scratch as it's own thing, we made something like 12 or 13 recipes. We were in too much of a rush to make all the dishes.Expanding on my last point, I preferred the Vietnamese cooking class where my friend and I had our own cutting boards and we cut all our own vegetables. In this class everything was pre-cut for us. If you want some of the work to be done for you, then you will enjoy this class more than I did.The food was good, but too many of the recipes included coconut milk. I'm not the biggest fan of coconut. So, if you like coconut you'll like the recipes. It's just possible that I like Vietnamese food more than Thai.On the plus side the recipes are all vegetarian, and they can make them vegan for you quite easily. At most other cooking schools you must adapt the recipes for them to become vegetarian. You can take a better (and cheaper) cooking class in Chiang Mai. My friends that took classes there really enjoyed them.Lastly, there was a cultural element - I don't care for singing and dancing so doing that at the end of the class didn't add any value for me. I imagine it would be a big plus for others.

By far the best thing we did in Bangkok. We loved this class. It was fun fun fun, yummy, informative, and did I mention fun? We met folks from all over the world, learned some great cooking techniques, ate delicious food, and were even somehow convinced to sing and dance at the end. This is a great way to spend time in Bangkok doing something other than temples, meet some Thai folks and get to know a different side of Thai life. And did I mention yummy food? Don't eat breakfast as you will be tasting your way through the morning and early afternoon.

So much fun!. I would completely agree with all of the positive reviews on here. May is super fun, friendly, and easy-going. My partner had some experience with Thai cooking and took a course back in Australia, but May's cooking was very different. It was impressive how quick her recipes were to prepare and how easily flavours could be adjusted. Everything was really yummy too! Neither of us are vegetarian, and only realized that the course was that when we arrived that morning, but May was helpful in telling us how you could incorporate meat or chicken into the dishes, or use different sauces. May was a delightful teacher to have, and an impressive business woman. It's hard not to like her! We were expecting to walk away absolutely stuffed, but you only nibble on the food after each dish, so only get to try a bit of everything. It was a meal overall though.

Really fun Thai cooking class with a really engaging fun host!. We did a morning session in early January 2010 with May Kaidee and had a blast. May is a delightful host; really fun personality and lots of energy. I'd highly recommend her. We also found it easy to book with her vs. Silom or Blue Elephant. I would probably rate my fiancee and I as slightly advanced amateurs. This seemed to be true of the other students as well. The cooking was not too difficult, but very enjoyable and all in all a great intro into Thai cuisine. I don't think its realistic to expect more in a 3 hour session anyway.The group is split into pairs and each pair has a set of ingredients and a burner. The chopping and menial tasks are done for you and May watches your moves to keep you from screwing up :). You eat along the way, which is great, so you get real-time feedback on your work.The morning session also includes a walk through a local market to get ingredients which was a lot of fun. Also, we are not vegetarians (quite the opposite really), and still had a blast.The kitchen area is comfortable and very functional; not as polished some high end places, but that's not what we were looking for.

Come hungry. This class was very pleasant to take. We were 8 people in May's restaurant and she started by showing and naming the ingredients we would use, after which we left to shop for the ingredients. The first place was about a 5 minute walk away where we saw how the crepe/tortilla-like sheets that would be used to make spring rolls are made. We then stopped at a cart were May bought the rest of the ingredients and gave us a brief explanation as to what they are. It is not a market, so don't expect to go with your basket ready to shop with the locals. Back in the restaurant, each pair are assigned a table with all of the ingredients to be used in the cooking (already washed an cut/prepped), a wok and an apron in an open-air kitchen.The cooking experience was fun and entertaining as you get to mix the ingredients in the wok by following the order in the recipe booklet. Almost all the dishes tasted fantastic! Of the 14 recipes in the booklet, we prepared about 10. Throughout the session, May ducked in and out, leaving us with her assistants. At the end of the class, she played some of her music (she has a band apparently) and showed us some traditional Thai dancing; the rest of the group then joined in (with "encouragement").Overall, the experience was pleasant, memorable, and well worth the money. Recommended for vegetarians and non-vegetarians alike. Definitely go hungry as you will get to not only cook but also eat lots of delicious food!

We need more people like May!. She is a truly amazing person: genuine, fun, easy going, great personality, her love to cook for others and teach the Word how to cook easy, fast and efficient is unmatchable!!She started her first restaurant at age 16, have three now and looking for extend her business in franchisee format all around the World.Her recipes are so simple and YES, she does use mostly THE SAME ingredients to make 12 DIFFERENT tasting dishes!! This a dream for every cook! We didn't go to the Large Market either, instead we supported the local sellers of vegetable - it was quick, efficient, economical, authentic and fuuuuuuuuun! A lot of fun!. Two people for one station is good - we took turns to cook and to instruct each other, using different types of memory.I am not even talking about the taste of what we've cooked - no wonder every student came back to her place to eat - we did it daily for a week before we took off to South.The tourist with negative feedback of course entitle for his/her opinion - we liked exactly what he/she didn't!I took her class twice! Once with a group, then it was a private lesson.

Good fun to make and even better to eat!. The ingredients were fresh and washed and clean and May Kaidee was friendly and engaging. She even dressed up in traditional Thai costume which was cool! I loved the food and all the ingredients are very obtainable outside of Thailand and not too confusing. After the class I kept coming back for dinner at their restaurant each night because it was so yummy and the staff were friendly.

Not as good as other Bangkok cooking classes. It looks like I'm the only disappointed person in these reviews. May Kaidee was not my first cooking class in Bangkok and I didn't think it was a particularly good one. Instead of the promised market we only visited a lady which had some veggies and herbs for sale on her cart (no other vendors there). In the kitchen we had to share the cooking spots as there was only one wok per two persons. In other cooking classes you go to a real market and everybody has a wok to cook alone. As well, we used exactly the same vegetables for every dish, which was a bit boring. Even though I had a nice morning I wouldn't recommend this class for a first-timer.

Sap Sap Sap... (Yummy, Yummy, Yummy). A fun, delicious and entertaining way to spend 3 hours in Bangkok. Vegetarians and non-vegetarians alike will have fun visiting the market for ingredients and working over the hot woks learning how to cook Green Curry and Pad Thai among many other dishes.

Fun, delicious & a great value. Must try!. I have taken Thai cooking classes before, but since becoming vegetarian, I wanted to try and learn how to cook my Thai favorites in a vegetarian way. May Kaidee's class was extremely hands-on (we made everything ourselves) but she was always around to answer our questions and help us. When I went there were only four people in the morning class. You each get a small recipe book with the 10 recipes you will be cooking, and after you finish each one, you eat it... so remember to save room for the dishes at the end! We had fun cooking, and towards the end when we were getting tired, May had us singing and dancing!I love the recipes because they are extremely simple, and feature easy-to find ingredients (easily found at Asian markets in the US). Also the recipes are for single servings, which is great for people living alone or just cooking for 1 or 2 people. Plus they are all vegetarian, but still taste just as good (or better) than their meaty counterparts. I ended up buying her cookbook because the recipes were so easy and tasty.

A good experience with plenty of suggestions for non-veg too. Enjoyed this greatly, the cooking comes fast and furious but you get the hang of it quite quickly and May does a good job of making sure you pick up the details and the basic techniques. The focus on ingredients and educating the students about where to get them, and what substitutions to make if you can't get them is really helpful. Looking forward to trying these out myself back at home.

Just Do It!. We have taken May's cooking class at the end of Jan'09 and it sure was one of the best things we did in Thailand. After trying her food at one of her restaurants before, we were even more curious to learn her style of cooking. It was just so good and not the same old usual. The cooking class was well instructed, fun and easy. So even suitable for a lefthanded cook like me. Learning about the different fruit and veg when taken to the market was also great. Her cooking and recipes were so well done that even a non vegie would miss the meat.We just loved the food, the class and of course energetic, inspiring and lovely May Kaidee! Be prepared to come and have lots of fun and lot of food. And in case you can not make the class for one reason or the other at least go and try her food at one of her restaurants. It really is outstanding and was probably our favorite meal we had during our three weeks in Thailand!

Yummy, yummy, tasty, delicious. Thai food is one of my favorites. I also happen to be a vegetarian so this was perfect for me. The class is hands on and the instructor has you tasting as you go so you can see what a small difference adding more of an ingredient can make. There was way too much food to eat a lot of any one particular dish, and you won't leave the class hungry. The recipes are definitely repeatable once you get home.The thing that surprised me the most was just how easy and fast it was to cook good, no make that great, Thai food.If you're interested in a Thai cooking class, I would recommend this one. And for non-vegetarians, they tell you how you can modify to use fish sauce or other meat ingredients.

Must take this wonderful cooking class!. If you're going to be in Bangkok you should definitely take this awesome cooking class. Not only is it affordable, it's amazingly fun and interactive. May is such a sweetheart and possibly the best vegetarian cook I've ever come across. I for one cannot cook but she helped us make our food absolutely delicious!She starts off by taking us to the market and shows us the various vegetables and spices we would be using during the class to make our dishes. It was pretty cool to see what the core of Thai food is made up of because normally you just see vegetables on the side of the road and never really know what they're for. She explains pretty much every spice that we used during the class which was really helpful! There are so many dishes she teaches us and each one is as good as the next one even though they are all vegetarian dishes. My favorite was the peanut sauce and spring rolls. Oh and I can't forget the song and dance portion of the class! This was my favorite part because we got to sing a cute Thai song and dance to Thai music. She also has her May Kaidee products such as chili paste and vegetarian cook book which make great gifts. It wasn't as if she was TRYING to sell these, we actually wanted to buy all of this stuff! At the end she had us sign her guest book and give us our e-mail addresses and where we're from. She plans on having a big get together sometime in the future which would be just amazing. If you want to experience Thai culture and food to its fullest, make sure to take advantage of this amazing opportunity. I guarantee you will not regret it.

Wonderful cooking school experience. My husband and i had a fabulous time at the May Kaidee's cooking school in Chiang Mai. The class is a vegetarian class; however, we loved the class even though we are not vegetarians. The energy of the cooking teacher is infectious and each dish was delightfully tasty. The class begins with a trip to the local market where we learn about the look, texture, taste and smell of the primary Thai vegetables and pick the vegetables and fruits for our class. We then prepare the fruits and vegetables and cook 10 delicious foods. All along the way, we taste the dishes so by the end were quite full. For those who do not fill up before the class ends, you can feast on all the prepared dishes. Another bonus is that the class is quite small - only 4 of us, so we each received personal attention. All the recipes are provided so you do not have to spend time writing down all the recipes. We will definitely now be preparing many Thai dishes in our home.

amazing thai vegetarian cooking school. If you love to cook and are visiting Bangkok, this is an amazing and fun experience - you don't even need to be a vegetarian! The classes are small and you cook 11 dishes, tasting each one as you go - you are stuffed by the end. The class starts with a trip to the market, where the teacher (great English) shows you what to look for and what to buy. Back at the school (which is in a large room in the back of the restaurant), you have your own wok and all the ingredients to one-by-one cook the dishes listed in the handout. You have all the recipes and can take notes as you go. Roughly 9am to 1:30pm and only 1200 baht, this is a bargain and one of my favorite activities of my trip!

Wonderful. Worth every penny.. The only problem was finding this locale. First taxi driver dropped us off and told us it was just down the street....not true. Took another taxi and arrived just in time to start, thankfully! Very clean and modern facilities. We leaned to cook "like grandma"... no msg, made our own coconut milk and chili paste, etc, which I appreciated. A good variety of dishes. Everyone left plump full! I highly recommend this class to anyone who wants to learn to cook Thai!

Memorable experience!. I had the opportunity to attend Chef Leez class while in Bangkok for only three days in March.I had learned so much about buying, preparing and cooking fresh food. It is a great way to experience the Thai culture and meet new people along the way. Chef Leez was warm, friendly and absolutely entertaining. I value this as one of the greatest memories during my time spent in Asia.

Best meal in Bangkok, not because I cooked it myself. I had a wonderful experience. Everything was very well organized. Chef LeeZ and her staff make you feel very comfortable. You can tell they all know what they are doing and have it figured out every detail of the cooking process. It's a long ride from central Bangkok but well worth it. You don't need any cooking skills, Chef LeeZ can answer your questions and help you to the process. We had a group of about 15 people but we all received personal attention from everyone in the staff. Chef LeeZ even makes arrangements for your taxi back. Great communication cation prior the class session.

The best thing we did on our bangkok trip. Everyone goes to bangkok with a different agenda: its either shopping , massages or sex shows.I feel tourists should include a thai cooking class in their itinerary.Learning to cook with Chef Leez was the best item on my Bangkok trip.We were a group of 8 ladies and we had an absolutely brilliant time , cooking, chatting , eating and making merry with the vibrant chef lee.She really knows her thai cuisine and bcoz she is so fluent in English and also bcoz she is a warm and fun person , it was a pleasure to spend an afternoon with her.Must visit.I highly recommend it.Its a little far from the main city , but totally worth the taxi ride ( around 40 mins from sukhumvit road)
Best cooking class. She is great!! The class is fun and tasty!! I have learned a lot!! A must do thing!!! She is very happy, simpatic and she is really great
Wonderful morning . We had a great time and learned how to cook curries, salads, pastes and a pudding from scratch. We also learned that laughter is a great sauce - I would highly recommend!

Great Experiance. What a great experience, thank you ChefLee. The class is fun and well educational & profesional as well. The Chef has great knowledge and we would recommend this class as must visit while staying in Bangkok
Cool cooking class. We were a group of four and had a blast! Not only did we learn about ingredients, how to make many dishes, we also got to try them all. It was a lot of fun! We recommend!
Excellent . If you're in Bangkok, you have to take her class. It was great. Lots of history, humor, and detail. Her prep staff is amazing also. Really enjoyed. Will take again if I'm ever in Bangkok.

Delicious Thailand!. We Booker the cookie classic at Chef LeeZ as the one highlight of our short 2-day stop-over in Bangkok. And a Highlight it was!As typical for Germans we arrived one hour early to the site ... due to good traffic in the City. So Chef Lee welcomed us warmly and took us on a walk through her beautiful gardens explaining the exotic plants we would be using.The classic itself was very entertaining and the food we cooked was delicious! Chef Lee mixed her instructions with nice stories of her beloved grandma and we all had a very good time!I was impressed by her experience and her way of dealing with food and - most of all - by her ambition to pass on her knowledge!I wish you all the best and would recommend you to everybody who plans a trip to Bangkok! Cheers,Anne & Thilo

Great Return Visit. We have been to Chef Leez a coupe of years ago at her old location but we were due a refresher course. Pleased to say it was just as good this time as before but the facilities were better still. Both my daughters wanted to be vegetarian this week and this was no problem for them as they arranged suitable substitutes. Not really a hassle but just be prepared for quite a long taxi ride as the location a a bit outside central Bangkok.

A Kind and Compassionate Teacher. Chef LeeZ (Ajaan Lee) is a kind and caring teacher. Her focus is on making traditional Thai foods from homemade ingredients. As she explains affectionately, this is the way that "grandma" made things, before Thai society began to consume more processed, fast-foods. So, in a sense, the course is just as much about respecting Thai heritage as it is about enjoying good Thai food. You'll learn to make several popular Thai dishes in this course, including Pad Thai, Tom Yum Soup, and Mango with Sticky Rice. All the dishes are enjoyable. That said, the amount of work and time that goes into making these dishes can be somewhat time consuming and intimidating. I'm not sure how sustainable it is to eave the course and be able to make all of these dishes back home and achieve the same results. However, Chef LeeZ is inspiring. One thing I really admire about her, besides her great culinary skills, it that she spends time teaching cooking skills to orphans in the community. This is great. Overall, if you have an afternoon to spare and want to learn more about traditional Thai cooking, this could be a fun experience for you. It offers a deeper glimpse into the heart of Thailand.

Amazing! . We loved the class and we love Chef! She not only showed us how to cook traditionally but gave us tips and tricks for navigating Thailand and the taxi's. Don't take a different cooking class, this one is the best!

Thai food cooking class. I loved cooking the most beautiful Thai food with chef leez. The venue is about half an hour taxi from city was Air conditioned spotless kitchen with fresh ingredients. We prepared and cooked many dishes.The class was well organised and all equipment is provided. Was fun and interactive. My favourite dishes were massman curry, green papaya salad and mango sticky rice.

Great Thai cooking class with a lot of useful information. It was a great experience to learn so much about Thai cooking in one day. Very good and funny teacher. We will recommend it to anyone who wants to know about how to cook delicious Thai food by themselves.

Awesome! Thai cooking with a heart.... I just came back from my cooking lessons with Chef Leez and I feel that I am able to right away cook at home the dishes taught in today's class. I signed up for a group class but I was pleasantly surprised to discover that I had a solo class instead (Yay! More talk time with the teacher Chef). Yes you will learn to cook so many dishes as advertised in their website (and we did it in a matter of 2 hours!). I was accorded an instant tour in their garden to familiarize myself with the fresh ingredients used in the recipe. Yes - everything was made from scratch and I learned some tips and tricks in e kitchen. Truly the teacher loves to cook and teach what she knows, imparting all the practical lessons that either an occasional or an avid cook would appreciate. The assistants in the kitchen made the cooking much more enjoyable (no washing up!) and Chef has her own system in teaching how dishes are cooked which made them so easy to duplicate at home. I highly recommend Chef Leez to anyone who would like to learn Thai cooking. No MSG, no oyster sauce, no food coloring. Just honest to goodness fresh and natural ingredients. I hope Chef Leez has another cooking module to offer because I definitely will come back for more lessons.

Cooking with Chef Leez. If you are looking for an advanced Thai culinary adventure then I do not recommend this course. However, if you are a budget concious traveller looking for a quick introduction to various Thai dishes then this is the course for you. First the class is big; about 20 ppl squeezed into a small room with tiny prep counters. When we fried the hot chilies, the entire room was full with pungent smoke and aroma. Second, in order to expedite things much faster much of the prep is already done by the sous chefs ahead of time and during the class; that said so you are not getting the full culinary experience. Third, portions are tiny! You will need a meal afterwards so plan ahead. Finally it's really rushed; I truly can't recreate any of the dishes at home as it went so fast.

Cooking class in Bangkok, Thailand. My husband and I had our cooking class at Chef Leez cooking school and we were so glad we chose this one! We had such a good time, chef leez was very patient and answered all of our questions as she taught us how to make all the different pastes, soups, noodle dishes, curries and dessert. We were completely stuffed at the end of the class. I would highly recommend this class to anyone who wants to learn how to cook authentic Thai cuisine and have no experience in doing so. She even provides a packet of all the recipes you make at the end of the class to take home.such a great experience!

Learn more about Thai food with Chef Leez. We make Thai food from shaving coconut with a traditional equipment to make coconut cream and milk for the soup and curry ; we fried shrimp heads to make shrimp oil to put on top of our Tom Yum Koong , a lot we learnt about Thai cooking ..with fun !

Excellent cooking class - starting from the very fundamentals of thai cooking. To me, an excellent cooking class isn't one that simply provides you with demonstrations and/or recipes, but one that reviews the basic fundamentals of that cuisine - this class did just that. Chef Lee was extremely thorough in her explanation of the flavours belonging to different thai herbs and how to treat/prepare them.I loved the fact that she imparts thai cooking skills, not just head-knowledge about a certain thai dish. These skills can certainly be equip you modify any dish you choose to add a 'uniquely thai' flavour to.My friend and I really enjoyed this class and would definitely recommend it to all our friends!

A-mazing!. I had a private lesson this morning, and it absolutely exceeded my expectations! I was a bit nervous about learning so many recipes in one day, but Chef Leez has a way of simplifying them and then provides access to the written recipes in the end so you don't have to spend the whole class taking notes. She even modified to accommodate my shellfish allergy. Highly recommended!

Chef LeeZ class is a MUST!. I never expected that some of the best food I would have in Thailand would be cooked by me. Chef Lee is funny, friendly, and provides very helpful information through the entire class. We started the class at 3pm and finished around 9pm. Definitely go in hungry, you will be full by the end. You can also take pictures during the class. Chef Lee and her assistants took photos of us when we wanted to get our entire group in the picture.We were provided with recipes during the class that were ours to keep. This was great because we could take notes of the details as we cooked. A lifetime membership to the recipe club was included with the class, so we have digital access to recipes as well.The food was so fresh, we laughed most of the class, and it ended up as one of the most memorable parts of our trip. Call ahead a few days early and book it. This class is amazing!
Excellent. A bit far from the city, but worth it!. Excellent. A bit far from the city, but worth it! Nice explanation, do's and don'ts regarding ingredients, tasteful and easy to cook food.

Great Thai tips to take home. Pros:Learnt some great tips to take home with me about Thai cooking and also learnt more about msg and what forms it comes in.Chef LeeZ is fun and knowledgeable and makes it an unforgettable experience.Probably the best mango sticky rice I've had in Thailand. Every dish, although small, was delicious.If you enjoy great honest Thai food, you will get it here.Cons: Getting a taxi from the center of Bangkok takes 30/45 mins whereas there are some cooking classes centered in Bangkok for cheaper and less hassle - we went with Chef LeeZ based off of all the great reviews (it was good but it's not my first cooking class and found it quite expensive, especially for Thailand).We ourselves didn't do a lot of the cooking as a lot is already prepped. Recipe print outs are great but instructions are basic, make sure to make notes if your enjoy cooking yourself.

Cooking class for the whole family. Our family signed up for a semi-private cooking session with Chef Leez. I was initially hesitant about going with my 6-year old, but it turned out to be the perfect family activity. Chef was warm and engaging with the children, encouraging my son to stir, scoop and fry, giving him just enough confidence to do a few things on his own but always on hand to make sure it was safe for him. The kids were delighted and proud of their cooking, and cleaned up everything on their plates in no time (a rare occasion, indeed!). Chef adjusted the recipes to cater to the children on the spot, e.g. not spicy, chicken instead of beef, etc. Thanks for a memorable experience!

A great experience. I just had a wonderful day learning to cook Thai with Chef Leez! It was a great course covering 10+ recipes. Her staff were attentive and helpful organising the ingredients and cleaning up after each dish which was excellent and made the flow of the cooking very smooth. Chef Leez even took the time organising taxi's back home at the end of the day.I'd highly recommend the class to anyone interesting in learning about traditional Thai cooking!

Chef LeeZ is something you don't want to miss. We went to Chef LeeZ to learn a number of dishes as part of her cooking class. She was thorough and very professional. She gave us the basics to make everything at home, and even the key recipes for pastes and oils that make up the base of most Thai recipes. I recommend if you have time to check out this class. You won't regret it. And you get to eat everything you make! So come hungry!!

Brilliant experience!. I visited Chef LeeZ after reading all the amazing reviews on Trip Advisor and I was not disappointed!!! It is a Long journey to reach the class but the maps and directions provided certainly help the taxi drivers find the place. I took a group morning class and was fortunate enough to only have 2 other people in the class so we had the benefit of being in a semi private class. Chef Leez greeted me as I arrived and I was ushered in while we waited for the other participants. Chef Leez is truly passionate about her craft and spares no effort in ensuring she explains the how and why of every step along the way. The food we prepared was better than any Thai food I have ever tasted and I was so surprised at how easy each dish is to prepare. Our class ran 30 minutes over schedule but she was patient to ensure we had a full experience. Taxis were waiting for us as we finished class and I would thoroughly recommend visiting this school for both experienced and non experienced cooks! I will definitely attend again (to learn different dishes) and cannot thank her and her team enough!

Amaaaaazing. We felt simply worth the money by just eating the dishes there, not metioning learning how to cook them!! Absolutely recommend to everyone who likes thai food. Leez is extremely knowledge and fun. We loved the place!

Outstanding! . Really loved this half day cooking class! Chef Leez speaks excellent English, she is kind, funny and is so knowledge on Thai food, cuisine and cooking! I must say that I really enjoyed making more smaller dishes and experiencing different cooking styles and dishes than other cooking schools which only offer a few dishes but larger portions. The flavours the colours and the taste in just half a day of cooking was the best I've had in the month I've been in Thailand. Chef Leez was also very kind in arranging a taxi to the airport after our class and also storing our bags whilst we did the class. Chef Leez uses a mixture of traditional and modern cooking equipment which makes for an easy and authentic experience. Would 100% recommend!

Great food, great chef! . My mother and I really enjoyed this happy and tasteful cooking class. The recipes were very well explained in a very joyful way and alternatives were given when ingredients in our country (Netherlands) would not be available. Must do in Bangkok! Great experience!

An enjoyable half day cooking class @ Chef LeeZ Thai Cooking School. I enjoyed the recent half day cooking class i attended very much. Chef Lee speaks in fluent and easy to understand English, making the understanding of cooking steps and ingredients easy. She took time to explain all the ingredients / herbs to us. The kitchen / class room was very clean and and conductive for the cooking class.

A wonderful half day!. My husband and I along with our 12 year old son totally enjoyed this experience. We even tried out some of the dishes at home, better than all the previous attempts at Thai cooking!Chef Lee is just charming. Funny and full of tips and tricks. Our son was completely involved in the prep and cooking. It was a great half day.Would definitely recommend Chef Lee, especially for those who love Thai food.

Chef LeeZ, how to dive into Thaui culture.. When I plan my travel to Tailand I would do unusual experiences, I believed that to participate in a Thai food course is a diferent way for understanding Tailand, but Chef LeeZ is more than tis is an unique experience in a friendly atmosfere.

Wonderful! . What a wonderful day! The food was delicious, the best I had in Thailand. Everything was fresh, clean and easy to prepare. Chef Leez is funny, informative and just super sweet. It's worth the journey. Please plan accordingly as the traffic in Bangkok is pretty terrible. It's a must do in Bangkok!

The best cooking class I've ever had. I choose this class thanks to Tripadvisor raiting and didn't regret it! It total worth the price and the journey to the school.This class gives an overview of the main dishes and the basics of Thai cuisine. Chef Leez is very nice and explains every step of preparation, she gave as well a lot of helpful advice and even show me how to cook chicken fried rice even it was not in the program. If you want to learn how to cook thai, definitely choose this class. And in order not to forget - take the video, it will help you remind every step once you are back home.

Don't eat breakfast beforehand!. I did and regretted it, because tastes of 12 dishes really fill you up! My class had only 3 of us, and we did everything from grate coconut and make our own coconut cream and milk, to pounding tom yum paste, to stir frying. I learned so much, the food was delicious, and it felt like I got a taste of true Thai cooking. Chef LeeZ was personable and helpful.I showed up 10 minutes late because my Uber driver cancelled after I waited for 20 minutes--he was so stuck in traffic. It took about 45 minutes to drive from Sukhumvit due to traffic and cost 300 Bhat. Plan accordingly

Amazing cooking class. Amazing cooking class, went to a local food market to buy ingredients to make the many dishes. In depth tutorials on how to cook each dish and was also given online access to the many recipes. Very fun morning. Definitely recommend going!

Very fun experience. This has got to be one of my favorite things I've experienced while in Thailand. Chef Leez and her cooking school does not disappoint whatsoever. I scheduled to take the cooking class from 10am to 2pm for my mom and I and we were currently staying at a hotel in Bangkok. With traffic included, the ride via car took about 45-55 minutes. Upon arrival, we approached such a clean and welcoming alley where Chef Leez's school is located. She welcomed us with such a sincere smile, she even allowed for our driver to stay as we take the class. Some construction was going on towards the side of the building, it looked like people were working on the cement and garden but it did not affect our class whatsoever. Our class included 4 others which was a total of 6 in the class which I thought was perfect and very intimate. Chef Leez also has very great helpers who assist her with the ingredient preparations, cleaning, and setting up that my mom and I couldn't help but tip them at the end of the experience. Everyone is very kind and helpful that they were also willing to take photos while we were cooking.Chef Leez's approach to teach her authentic Thai recipes passed on from her grandma is very simple to understand. Thai cuisine is easier to create than what you would think, it's all about using the correct ingredients and adapting to the style of Thai cooking which consists of salty, sweet and sour. Chef Leez even goes over how to grocery shop for the proper produce, providing the class with tips and tricks to help you to understand it a bit better. Copies of the recipes are also provided to take home and after each demonstration, Chef Leez has you demonstrate back to her the dish and you get to eat it after each demonstration. So yes, you will get full by the end of class! Overall, I would highly recommend taking her class as she is full of life, very funny, experienced, and is the definition of authentic. Thank you Chef Leez for having my mom and I, you were great and would like to wish you prosperity on your great work!

Amazing alternative to the Nightlife!. Fantastic Chef, woman and ambassador!Was fortunate enough to spend time with her and her partner after the class was over and learn her story, their journey.Remarkble story and you can certainly feel the love in the food she teaches you to prepare for yourself.Dont miss the chance to partake in one of her classes. The cost is insignificant in in comparrision to what you take away from it.

Excellent way to understand and appreciate the Thai culture. I was very impressed with the class and Chef Lee, who not only gave a very interesting and Lively class, also introduced details about ingredients, common traps to avoid.The food we prepared was really looking good and tasted delicious

So Much Fun!!! Highly Recommend!. My Husband searched out "Chef Leez Thai Cooking Class". We had so much fun learning to cook all the different dishes we prepared that day! The wet market was very interesting, and learning about cooking Fresh ... Preparing our own spicy pepper pastes, & Curry pastes. SOooo good! I'm still cooking Thai at home. Chef LeeZ is Fun, patient & a great teacher .. Fun, Fun & her class & staff are so very organized & helpful!We now use a mortar & pestle as Chef LeeZ taught us ...again, so good!!We strongly reccommend enjoying "Chef LeeZ Thai Cooking Course" ... Life changing experience!!Donna & Darcy, Canada

So worth it!. This was one of the best activity we did in Thailand. Chef Leez took us shopping for the ingredients at the local market and gave us insight into what we should and should NOT be buying. She then instructed us on how to prepare several Thai dishes and desserts. The food we made was some of the best we have ever ate. I cannot recommend this enough.

Traditional Thai cooking - great interactive class. Chef Lee and her team provide a great 4 hour authentic Thai cooking class in clean, modern and organized air conditioned facilities. The course offers great cooking tips to produce authentic Thai flavours and chef Lee makes it easy and fun. Sample your creations as you cook. Well worth the drive out of the city.

Fun cooking class!. The concierge at the Okura Prestige Hotel generously recommended Chef LeeZ Thai Cooking School on a last minute inquiry and we could not be more satisfied. Although a bit far from the city, it was well worth the drive! Chef LeeZ was more than accommodating, even willing to commence our class before what we signed up for -- possibly because our group of 3 were the only ones signed up for that session. We made a total of 7 dishes, all made with fresh, organic ingredients. She taught us many traditional Thai cooking techniques too. Unfortunately, one down side was the apparent number of mosquitos that we encountered at the school. We understood this mishap because the school was going under renovation after a recent move from another previously used location. Thank you, Chef LeeZ!

Highly recommended. Chef Leez is a real pro who made the experience a fabulous one for our family from the market tour to making Tom Yum from scratch. I liked the way she used high quality ingredients and showed her students the difference. We were genuinely inspired once we returned home and cooked many a meal. We did another course in Chang Mai which in comparison was a sausage factory. Well done Chef Leez.

Great place to learn Thai Cooking in grandma's way. Read some good reviews from the website and decided to take a session with Chef Leez for morning. Had great learning session, with lots of hands after clear explanation and demonstrations. You will get to taste your own cooked Thai Food and it's delicious! Highly recommended.Tips: Kindly plan your journey ahead, if you are travelling in taxi from city area, please be in the taxi at least an hour before the class as traffic jams could be bad.

My lucky (brilliant) day!. I don't know how I managed this, but I was incredibly fortunate today on two counts: I took Chef LeeZ's cooking class AND I was the only one in the class! Chef Leez and her three able assistants had me busy learning and preparing and cooking and eating for the entire time I was there, so by the end of it I was deliciously satisfied and full of information about traditional Thai cooking. As an Aussie, I have eaten and cooked many, many Thai meals but I learned so much today. Fresh ingredients, authentic recipes, balancing flavours, and stories about the healthgiving properties of good food all added up to a wonderful experience. Thank you, ladies!
As couple it is even more fun. Did it together with my wife. We had so much fun it was crazy. The chef is very friendly and takes hes time to make sure everybody can follow. Great experience.

Wonderful authentic experience!. Our family, including 14 year old twins, took Chef Leez' cooking class yesterday, and we all had so much fun and learned so much. Chef Leez taught us 12 recipes, and didn't think we would get through them all, but we did at a very enjoyable pace. We learned how to use the freshest ingredients, making each recipe like her 'grandmother' would make it - choosing fresh coconuts and removing the meat from these, then from these making coconut cream and coconut milk (and comparing these to the taste of tinned coconut milk - what a difference), making authentic chili pastes, and learning the difference between the slice mixes that make up masaman, green and red curry, Indian curry, and panang. We each cooked our own recipes, and we were worried that our 14 year old son would lose interest, but she kept him busy! She even had him dry roast whole spices for the class to watch at one point. This class was a great respite from visiting temples, which we had done the day before, and we highly recommend it! Our best experience in Thailand so far!

Fun, thorough experience!. My husband and I enjoyed Chef Leez four-hour cooking class on July 1st. The class seemed pretty full, but there was plenty of room, equipment, materials, and ingredients for everyone. While Chef Lee explained things and entertained us, her staff worked tirelessly to prepare ingredients and pass out materials to each member. I loved having the printed out recipes to be able to read while I was there and to take home with me to show friends and family what we cooked. The class was a great balance of information about Thai food and Thai cooking and demonstration by the chef, combined with the hands-on cooking, never mind getting the chance to eat everything we made!! Chef Lee kept us laughing the whole time and it was great to be able to take pictures while we worked. Taking home a wonderful memory and a full belly from this experience!

A Wonderful Experience. I was one of 4 people to attend Chef LeeZ's morning cooking class on July 15, 2016, and I had a wonderful experience. Chef LeeZ is a positively energetic person with a radiant smile and great sense of humor with a gift for teaching people how to cook Thai food with all natural ingredients and an old school method taught by her grandmother. While Chef LeeZ was teaching, her staff was busy preparing the trays of ingredients for each student making the transition from observing to hands-on quick and flawless. We ate many delicious dishes which we had prepared in a short period of time. Chef LeeZ teaches her class in a lovely modern home in a secure residential community on the outskirts of Bangkok. When the class was finished, Chef LeeZ escorted all of us to the boat taxi dock not far from her house via a small public transport bus which we were able to catch at the end of her street. I cannot say enough good things about this class, and I would recommend this class to anyone wanting to learn how to cook authentic Thai dishes from a wonderful person.

Amazing class. My partner and I took part in one of the cooking classes here this morning and we could not have been any more impressed. Chef Lee was friendly, happy, enthusiastic, kind hearted and you could tell she is very passionate about Thai food. It was a real hands on experience and make sure you go there hungry!! Highly recommend going here when in Bangkok!

Great food and great company!. Chef Leez is one of the most kindhearted, passionate, and talented chefs I've ever met. Her smile is welcoming, the food that you cook and the ingredients used are fresh and fun, and her new place is very comfortable and clean. Her assistants are wonderful and free wifi is provided. Very much recommended, thanks Chef Leez!
Fantastic!!!!!!!. It was a fantastic experience!!!! Real thai food cooking class !!!! Chef LeeZ knows how To cook the real thai food and how To learn that!! She is very good !!!!!!

Awesome experience and great value!. My 2 daughters and I thoroughly enjoyed the experience. Chef Lee Z was very knowledgeable & entertaining. The class was very hands on and the kitchen was very clean. Chef Lee Z was able to portray her expertise in an easy to understand manner. The class was both enlightening and fun. She even arranged a ride for us to get back to our hotel. Overall, we highly recommend this class. We cannot wait to make some tasty Thai dishes when we get home.

Savvy and spicy. Truly enjoyed our experience at Chef Leez Thai Cooking School. Chef Leez brings her culinary savvy to class and injects her spicy (and oh so lively) personality to her presentation. We learned many iconic dishes and feel ready to share our learnings now that we've returned home. Fun and memorable. Would highly recommend this class.

Fun and Practical. Chef Leez is a fantastic time whether you came for a cooking activity with your partner or as a serious student prepared to take lots of notes. The clean and hygienic classroom features a demo area and spaces for individual prep and cooking. She thoughtfully includes information on variations, for example how to take green curry and with a few substitutions have masa man curry. She also includes variations in the cooking so that, for example, my girlfriend and I made two different soups so we could compare and contrast them. I highly recommend you to add Chef Leez to your next trip itinerary.

A highlight of the trip! . It was fun and informative! I learned a lot and laughed a whole lot too! The classes are small enough to feel like you are being given time, but big enough so that you don't feel all the focus is on you. The little trip to the local market to purchase the ingredients for the recipes was really cool and probably one of my favourite parts of the afternoon! In the class we made mango sticky rice, some curries and a Papaya salad. All delicious!!! By the end of the class I was so so full!!! We got along really well with the others in the class which were a mix of solo travellers, friends and couples. I highly recommend this cooking class!!! Thank you Chef Leez!!

Expanded horizons. What a pleasure this course was. I had been in Bangkok for 10 days already and was starting to feel a little worn thin by the heat, humidity, and massive amounts of tourists. I needed a break and this is what was prescribed. My first thought was about the distance to the school. There are several schools within walking distance of my area in Silom district, so this seemed a bit of a stretch. However, thanks to Uber this was easier than ever. The Chef's sense of humor was a boon to the course. She made it easy to follow and digest the tons of information, history, and reviews of what to look for in other thai restaurants. As an educator, I know what to look for in how curriculum is structured. She had clearly put her time into planning and implementation, but for us it was easy breezy. Almost like watching a ballet. You know it's hard work, but she made it look so effortless. PS. I arrived an hour early to beat the traffic and was able to walk down the street 10 minutes to the local market. Not the same as the markets inside the city. More casual atmosphere and much cheaper prices. I walked down and got a motorcycle ride back for 10 baht.
Perfect !. Leez is perfect, very funny and we learned a lot, couldn't say anything bad. Definitively worthing it ! We ate a lot, you don't even have to tale a breakfast, you'll eat more than enough !

Yum. Great class very entertaining and informative. We enjoyed all the food and making our own coconut cream and milk and tasting the difference between the carton and our own was amazing (our own being so much better).The new school was still having some finishing touches done, however the classroom was finished and functions very well.The taxi trip out to the new location was quite long I hope this doesn't put people off because Chef Lee is very committed to teaching home cooks how to choose and prepare the best meals possible.If you like Thai food I highly recommend this school.

Enjoy my class!. I've enjoyed the cooking class very much as the dishes that we learnt to cook are all of my favourite Thai dish! Other than cooking the dishes, chef has also shared many tips on choosing your cooking ingredients. Overall the class has been very informative and easy to follow :)By the way, I've done a very stupid act by left my luggage key in the apron, chef has been extremely kind to send it over to my hotel! I've really very very very much appreciated for the kindness that save my luggage lock from breaking.Thank you for everything chef!

Súper Good time and excellent class . I live in Thailand for the last 3 years and time to go to another place arrived. We decided to take a piece of this beautiful culture with us and what could be better to learn how to cook some of their most delicious dishes!I put together a group of 12 friends to enjoy one Saturday class. One couple couldn't make it and I thought I will loss their tuition cost since you have to pay in advance but no, Cheff LeeZ said" No problem" and reverse that money to me. That is something difficult to see in Asia, once you paid, most of the time the money is gone...you can change the product but money back is a difficult one. That also talk about the honesty you will find in this class.Every thing was set and prepared when we arrived, the guide with recipes, our prone, etc.Training started and after a short introduction, we walked to a nearby local Thai market where she teached you how to select good and safe products, this part was really nice! We saw many Beautiful things!Then we come back to our classroom to start preparing some ingredient. She also show the difference between "do it yourselves Vs. buying the marked ready to use" products.We cooked like 7 different dishes and eat all that...my group did an extra mile by buying local cold beer to pair with our just cooked delicious Thai food! EXCELLENT EXPERIENCE If you are in Bangkok and want to do something funny and enjoyable beyond the intense night life, go to Cheef LeeZ Cooking Class. She is a very nice, fun and a good Chef.Thanks Chef Less!This review was for her old location, Chef LeeZ mentioned that we were the last group in that place. looks like the new school have much better facilities but the old school was really a fit for purpose site.

Best Thai cooking class for anyone! . I'm a vegan who loves to cook and this class was PERFECT. Chef Lee made me feel so welcome and had no problem at all making the menu vegan. This is the only class I found in Bangkok that would allow me to attend without paying a ridiculous amount or make me attend a private class. You can be vegan or vegetarian and cook with other students who use meat, you all will have your own pans and stations so it doesn't get mixed. She just makes it very easy and comfortable for everyone. The class is so organized and really allows you to learn skills that you can take home. I was surprised to find out how healthy she cooks too. She gives you so many options and alternative products to use at home to substitute for things that might be hard to find in your home town or just ways to make the meal healthier and more flavorful.Chef Lee is a very intelligent and kind person, in addition to being a fantastic chef! I wouldn't recommend going anywhere else.

Fun, informative, and DELICIOUS!!. This is such a great day activity to do! The drive from downtown can be a little far but it's totally worth the trip. Chef LeeZ SERIOUSLY knows her stuff. She can answer any questions you have on spices and other ingredients and elaborate on the origins of dishes as well as how they came about. She calls her way of cooking "grandmas way" because everything is made from scratch (literally everything) and you get to watch how it's all done. If you are looking for a huge diverse and delicious meal absolutely take this cooking class!

Phenomenal...and fun class!. I describe this class as phenomenal bc Chef Leez does an outstanding job teaching real Thai Cooking with raw ingredients, not from a box or bottle. She has a very logical sequence for introducing various ingredients as you cook many Thai dishes, and then you eat what you cook! It was a fun class bc Chef Leez has a great sense of humor and keeps everyone involved. Heed her warnings on the website about taxi: get going 75 min prior to start time, it's a 45 min ride from Sukhumvit area. Get a taxi that will use meter and you'll pay 160-200 Bhat. Otherwise, you will pay 400 bht or more. Highly recommend and I would attend again.

chef lee don't take no guff. my wife and i had a great time cooking.It took us a long time to get there as the website ,we felt,mislead us a bit and we ended up in a tuktuk for almost three hours.when we did finally arrive chef lee brought us in and started conversing with our driver when i went back outside it seemed a bit heated between the two and it turned out the driver was going to try to charge us an unreasonable unagreed upon amount for the ride and she saw it coming,she made short work of the situation,we negotiated shortly and she sent the not so happy driver on his way,i was impressed and immediately comfortable,she is a skilled chef and charismatic teacher her assistants were friendly and fast we cooked amazing food and ate very well ,im a chef and wife doesn't care for cooking and it was perfect for both of us

Fun Cooking Class - Delicious Food!. We really enjoyed our cooking class with Chef Leez. She did a great job explaining all of the ingredients, and it was really fun doing the cooking at our individual stations. Our class size was pretty small, which meant a lot of one on one attention. The food we made was amazing, and very filling! We learned a ton about Thai cuisine and ingredients that you don’t see back in the USA. At the end of class, we received a printout with recipes for everything we made, and we can’t wait to try everything out at home. The market trip was also eye opening and informative. My only complaint is that it is quite a trek to get to the cooking school. We were staying near the Grand Palace, and it was an hour drive (in light traffic). The other thing is that it took 2 taxis before we found one willing to turn on the meter rather than trying to extort us because of the distance. Make sure you print out the instructions before you go, as you will need them to find the school (which is located in a residential neighborhood inside Chef Leez’s house). It is definitely a fun way to spend a half day!!

Very good experience. I had a very pleasant time. Chef Leez share many ideas with cooking for both good taste and health. She uses natural ingredients whenever possible. It's a shame we did not get to visit the market due to heavy rain in the middle ending. The garden is under renovation when I visited, but seems like it's going to be a wonderful place when it's finished.

A bit far, but Chef LeeZ made it worthwhile. The location of the cooking facility is a bit far from the tourist areas of Sukhumvit/Silom, and may be challenging to find a taxi wanting to take you there. However, despite this, Chef LeeZ made the trip worthwhile. Chef LeeZ is very knowledgeable about her craft and is very generous in relaying her knowledge. We learned about which products are not good to use and which products are healthier and better tasting. The ingredients were already professionally prepared and ready for us to cook. This efficiency allowed us to cook many more dishes than the other cooking classes offered. The food we prepared was tastier than that offered at most restaurants/stalls in tourist areas! Thanks Chef LeeZ!

Not only a cooking class. A fantastic experience!. My family and I love Thai food and since all met at Bangkok to enjoy some time together I booked us for a class. I was a bit worried because you don't want to spend time in a class when you have just few days to be with your loved ones and to be in the beautiful Bangkok. Well, you should! Chef Leez is not a class only, but an amazing experience of Thailand's culture, food, humour and an example of perfect organization without any pressure. She will let you experience by yourself the difference of what you thought it was tasty and what you can so easily do to make it a heavenly food.All the technical part is amazingly explained and you will do everything she is showing you. At the end she took everyone to a walk through a local market. Take your camera with you.! I won't try to describe. She has an assistant walking behind you through the market so nobody gets lost or disturbed. He keeps a kind distance, so you feel absolutely free to move.My family (boys of 19 and 22, grandmother 86 that is not a cook at all, my husband and I)had a fantastic time.

Chef LeeZ is all that!. My apologies for the delay in writing this review. The bottom line is that the food is just as good as the entertaining experience. Chef LeeZ is so charming and witty, you feel like family from the second you arrive. The trip to the market alone is worth the cost of admission. We ate a lot of good food in Bangkok, but this was the best meal that we had and WE MADE IT. So fun and delish! Thank you Chef Leez!

Loved it!. After reading all the reviews our expectations were high, but we were not let down! One of the best hours we've spent in Thailand. Chef Lee is so passionate about her food and you learn how to make every dish from scratch, no packet stuff here. Loved the organic and natural thoughts that went into everything! Highly recommend this class!
Well organized, great class!. Chef Leez was wonderful. She made the class very interesting and you could see her true passion for cooking. The dishes are easy to replicate back home.

Best Thai cooking class I've ever had!. Love Chef LeeZ! So glad I found this class! Chef was not only very knowledgeable about Thai food she made the course fun, and exciting to take. I highly recommend Chef LeeZ cooking class!

Loved it. I really enjoyed the cooking experience at Chef Leez. It was informative and light hearted with lots of banter from the chef. Cooked 7 courses and ate the lot. Didn't need to eat another thing for the rest of the day. Such a great way to learn Thai cooking in a short time. I've tried the recipes again at home and they are great. I would definitely do this again

Funny cooking. Most amusing and informative time I spent in Bangkok. Chef is very funny and have many interesting stories, which help you remember useful facts. Class is very well organized, you do not have to bother with much preparation as all ingredients are ready to use. This make the class suitable even for complete beginners. On the other hand, more experienced ones will still learn a lot, especially about quality of ingredients. The food we prepared was no doubt best I had in Bangkok.

Top experience!. Wanted to do a thai cooking class and this is the best! We had 7 courses and then Chef also showed us a peanut sauce as others were asking. A great day walking to the markets to get the food and to know what is good and what isn't. Great stories, amazing food! I highly recommend this!

Level up your cooking skills!. When a friend heard I was visiting Bangkok, he enthusiastically recommended that I take this class. Now, I'm enthusiastically recommending that YOU take this class! I walked in expecting to learn how to cook a few things. I left with recipes for probably a dozen dishes, an understanding of common pitfalls while shopping for ingredients (spoiler: the prettier the ingredient, the more likely its been artificially enhanced), and a motivation to put in a little extra work to get a fresher and better tasting result. This class didn't just level up my thai cooking -- it taught me to be a better cook in general. You cant beat this value!

Beautiful !. Highly recommended. We were a group of 9 noisy Latin Americans and she made it so much fun and interesting even though we reside in Bangkok. She provided many insights about local ingredients that it was eye opening for many of us. She made it so much fun and entertaining throughout the class. What I liked the most was cooking the curry and how it switched from red to green to masala by rolling in and out key ingredients. Fantastic ! My friend did not like fish oil in his food and she accommodated that very quickly. Chef Leez is moving to a new location where hopefully air circulates better. Way to go Chef Leez ! Thank you!
Learning to cook Thai food. We had such a great time, and the food was great. We all left in high spirits. The green curry was the best I ever tasted.
