This is a "must" . My husband and I did this cooking class on a stopover in Bangkok. We had a fantastic time learning all the tricks to cooking our fav dishes. Chef Leez was friendly, knowledgeable and had s great sense of humour. We highly recommend this course!

Local experience in and out of the kitchen. Chef Leez brings you local experience in and out of the kitchen. I recommend doing this class in your first couple of days of arriving into Bangkok allowing you to understand food halls and market food alot better. Chef Leez takes time to explain the technique and ensures your food is adapted to your taste buds. I highly recommend this cooking class.

Best thing to do in Bangkok!. Just finished Chef LeeZ' class. She made it interesting and so much fun. She took the class to the market and explained about the best ingredients to get andwhat to look for. She took us step by step through the cooking process and we atewhat we made at the end of each recipe. If you love Thai food this class is a must.Her assistants were great as well. I wish her all the best in her new location. Chef LeeZ, thank you!

Excellent even if you are not a cook!. If you like Thai food, but don't consider yourself a cook, still take this class !What you need to do is very simple. The excellent part for anyone who likes to eat is that there is a very good explanation of quality ingredients and all the important components to the many Thai specialties. You will have the opportunity to sample many of the best Thai dishes after seeing how they have been put together,The kitchen is immaculate and the food hygiene is on the money. Here you can safely enjoy authentic high quality cuisine without the risk of street food.

Unexpectedly fantastic!. Originally we intended to book another cooking class, but found we were too late. Someone in our party suggested we check out Chef Leez as an alternative. I am so glad we did this instead! The experience from start to finish was top-notch. Not only is Chef Leez a legitimate chef, but she was so thorough in her explanations and demonstrations that I left feeling like I could duplicate these recipes on my own. Plus, she's a delight - so entertaining and fun to work with. I loved that we made everything from scratch...nothing from a can aside from cooking oil. The unexpected outcome was that I experienced the best, freshest, most delicious Thai food of my whole trip to Thailand here at Chef Leez, made by my own two hands. I'd recommend it 100 percent.

seamless. Chef LeeZ threw open her doors 30 minutes early when she saw our group hover around the entrance, thrilled to have made it so early through the notorious Bangkok traffic. I expected to dilly-dally on the streets until 10:00, but she welcomed us inside away from the heat, and immediately conversed with us like old friends. The class structure itself was very efficient, even with just one other helper. Together, they took care of every tiny detail and the lesson commenced seamlessly. The menu was large, and we made EVERYTHING from scratch. With baskets in hand, we took a field trip to a close by market where she hand picked most of our ingredients. Her explanations, along with her wit and humor, never ceased. Her candidness about fresh, safe ingredients and the shortcuts restaurants in Thailand and all over the world was eye-opening and refreshing. She is a professional chef, un-ashamed of who she is and therefore accepting of everyone.I did my research before booking here, and several reviews said the food made in class was the best visitors had their whole trip. I cannot agree more! I am only saddened that here in the mid-west of the United States, recreating everything will be quite a challenge. It was my privilege during my 2-week stay in Bangkok to meet such a gem.

Had the Best time . Mrs. Tranaporn and the rest of the staff was amazing. All of the recipes were made from scratch and the taste was top notch. After the introduction, we went to the local market to get the groceries. Besides being really professional chef leez was really easy to understand and she was really hilarious. We had such a good time, and can really recommend this course.

Spencer & Sarah Trebizo. Chef Leez & her staff were excellent. The class is very well organized & informative. The food was the best we had during our whole stay in Thailand! I wish she was in California so I could go every day!!
Cooking Thai during Songkran. Such a good experience! Professional, fun and the cook is super sweet and funny!Absolutely recommended to anyone!Great for a friends activity away from the hot Thai sun

Amazing fun and cooking class at the same time!!!. This is authentic Thai cooking and chef LeeZ makes it super fun where everyone rolls up there sleeves and chops, dices and stir fry's together. If you have dreamed of learning to cook amazing Thai food don't miss this opportuinty!

Cooking Thai Style. What an excellent experience this was. The school was easy to find and all of the staff were very welcoming. The visit to the market was very interesting and being shown what was good quality and bad quality produce was helpful. I am slightly disabled and throughout the tour of the market and the cooking experience Chef Leez and her staff were helpful and supportive. The cooking instruction was excellent and was mixed with much humour for the customers. I would thoroughly recommend this as an activity and must be one of the best in town!!!

If you love cooking or eating, you can't miss it. took the group lesson from 10 to 14 in the afternoon. Perfect time.We were 16 people which I believe is the maximum number.The experience was simply fantastic. Everything I read from other comments and reviews is true. Go for it!

Definitely worth doing - for both her personality and talent!. When I looked into attending a cooking class for our group of 8 that was visiting Bangkok, Chef Leez popped up on TA as one of the best reviewed. After taking her class it's obvious that she's definitely earned her top ratings. Her personality alone is worth the visit. She's quite the comedienne and a great teacher to boot. Her knowledge in Thai cuisine and preparation is extensive and we learned more in a few hours than I would have thought. It's also nice that she is quite philanthropic and has formed her own charity (Chef Leez Kidz) to help Thai children that have lost their parents and are in need of assistance.Her email communication is also great as when I booked the class, she emailed me back right away to suggest a private class for the 8 of us. It was a great suggestion and I'm glad we did it that way.My only suggestion would be to come hungry as you end up eating quite a lot between the soup and the main courses (I think I counted at least 6 dishes plus dessert.) The food is so fresh and fabulous - definitely one of our best meals all week! All in all a wonderful experience and one of my favorite activities while we were in Bangkok. Thanks Chef Lee!
Very good cooking insights. We did a workshop and especially enjoyed the knowledge the Chef shared on the products and how to use them properly. My favorite dish was Pad Thai.

Sooo much fun!!! . We just finished our class with Chef LeeZ and it was so so much fun. Chef Leez is hilarious but also caring. Both my husband and I had the case of Thai tummy and she gave us charcoal pills and endless bottled water and we didn't even have to ask. The food was the best we ate all of Thailand. You learn so many dishes and each one is amazing. This is such a fun fun fun experience and I would do it again and again. Book now!
chef Leez. Great session really enjoyed the class. Worth doing if you have the time. chef Leez is informative, easy to understand and has a great team who make the whole session seamless.

First Class Cooking in Thailand. My daughter and I attended Chef Leez cooking class. She was absolutely terrific. I loved her humor and her "tell it like it is" demeanor. She gave a lot of helpful hints for picking healthy food. I appreciated her candid way of explaining the difference between cooking oils, coconut milk, and shrimp. I loved the way she makes sure all of the ingredients are fresh and properly prepared. I would highly recommend this class...oh yea, the food we made was absolutely delicious!

An amazing fun filled day😋!!. Chef LeeZ was amazing ,as soon as we arrived she greeted us with a humours joke, she never stopped smiling . We were the largest group with a total of three people, all the rest were fairly young couples but that didn't really matter. We started off cooking a Tom yum gai which is a gingery soup made from coconut milk and usually shrimp but we did it with chicken , we got to cut up all the ingredients and cook them in a Chinese wok. Chef LeeZ and her employees helped us cook like professionals and each and every one of the dishes we cooked tasted incredible. We walked to the market and picked up fresh ingredients. Chef LeeZ also showed us the things that we shouldn't buy . Over all it was a fab day with a fun amiable and funny chef that will always put a smile on your face . It's a must do in Bangkok !!!!

SHE'S AMAZING. I TOOK CHEF LEEZ CLASS LAST WEEK WITH MY DAUGHTER, WE LOVE COOKING AND THAI CUISINE AS WELL. She took us to the market to choose the "good" ingredients, but in a very funny way. She is profesional and has a nice manner to teach, I surely recomend to take the class with her. The food we learnt to cook was delicious.

Small Class and Best Pad Thai I have had. Really enjoyed my morning at Chef LeeZ cooking school. Chef LeeZ and her team were extremely welcoming and have made it a fun experience for my husband and I. The class started with a tour of a local "hidden" market where Chef LeeZ shared tips on how to pick quality products and what to watch out for in the markets and restaurants.Once back, we were taken on a whistle stop tour of 10 dishes with handy tips on how to bring out the best flavours in the food as well as how to make base ingredients (coconut cream/milk, shrimp oil and different curry pastes). I would encourage to be realistic about how much can be achieved in 3 hours. If you are looking for in-depth Thai cooking and doing your own chopping/prep, you may consider a longer private course. For a novice to Thai cuisine, this is a fantastic introduction and the Pad Thai I made has been the best I have tasted whist in Thailand. Chef Leez made it very clear from the start that only the best quality ingredients are used in her kitchen and this has really come through in the taste.

A fun day with delicious food. Pretty much the first thing we decided to do in Bangkok was a cooking class. And we are really glad we picked Chef LeeZ. The day starts off with a visit to a local market where you will buy all the fresh produce you will use during the day. The chef herself does a good job explaining what to look for when buying something from the local markets and food stalls. I would recommend to do the cooking class in the beginning of your holiday so you can make the most out of these tips.You will prepare a wide array of Thai dishes. Don't worry, you won't be making everything from scratch. The cooks from the school will do a lot of prep work for you. This is a good thing since it could take a long while if everyone did everything on their own. On the other hand if you are an avid home cook like me, you would probably want to prepare all of your own stuff rather than just chucking the prepped ingredients to a pot. But again, I understand why they do it like this.The food was actually some of the best we ate during our whole stay in Thailand. I was especially surprised with the green curry. I thought I didn't care for green curry but that was just because I hadn't tasted a proper one. It became one of my favorite Thai dishes and I ordered it in several places after the class. I found only one that was as good as the one we made in the class.Fortunately we found the ingredients for the green curry back home as well. And thanks to Chef LeeZ cooking class I know how to cook it now!

Great starter to our honeymoon!. Chef Leez is funny, warm, informative, just a lovely person~ Everyone's comments on TA have been spot on so I will not repeat what has already been said. After our class was over, I was really interested in buying some of the local ingredients (dried) to take home. Chef Leez had already agreed to take some other students from the class to a supermarket, so my husband and I tagged along. She helped me pick out dried red chillis, tamarind, dried kaffir leaves, etc. Even though the ingredients were dried and Chef Leez warned me that the dishes I made "would not taste the same," I figured having some ingredients was better than nothing. She was really helpful and stayed with us until the end, helping us flag a cab. I would take the class again in a heartbeat!Visited in May 2015

Thai cooking is fun with Chef Leez. A very enjoyable experience with Chef Leez who is friendly, funny, personal & most happy to share all her knowledge about food & cooking. Learnt alot from her about fresh ingredients & how to select natural, untreated food on the trip to the market. Definitely will recommend this school to all novice or enthusiasts alike.

Insightful and fun, highly recommended. Somewhat more expensive that other Thai cooking course I found, nevertheless this was money very well spent! Chef Leez is a fascinating person, the class was not dull for one second, with many stories, insider tips, cultural insights, jokes, and, of course, lots of food. The course was very well organised, with the very helpful (and unfortunately almost unacknowledged) assistants invisibly keeping the process well oiled and flowing smoothly. After a trip to the nearby market for some fresh ingredients, you get to create and sample 7 dishes, including 3 types of soup, 2 types of curry, a salad and a dessert, all of them being some of the best food I have tried in my time in Thailand.

Great Experience!. This is a fun way to pass a few hours during the warmer part of the day. We started off at a local market learning about the local produce and collecting the ingredients we would be using in the class. We cooked around 6 dishes and Chef Leez and her staff were very helpful and accommodating. You definitely get your money's worth for the price of the class!The only criticism would be the number of people in the group class as we had to take it in turns to use the hobs, and the amount of dishes meant that it was slightly rushed towards the end. But this did not really affect the enjoyment of the class! I would recommend it to others visiting Bangkok as a fun activity.

Fantastic Class!. We had a great experience with Chef Leez. She is a brilliant chef with many pearls of wisdom to share. You could see that she knows A LOT about cooking and quality ingredients. We learned a lot of interesting facts about Thai cuisine during her class and got to try many different dishes. She said that this would be the best Thai food we would eat in Bangkok, and she was absolutely right! :)

Great Class!. Having researched all the cooking classes in Bangkok, we choose Chef LeeZ class.The old location is on Samsen Road which is a bit hard to find but finally we found a cab driver who called the school and delivered us per chefs instructions. The school is nicely set up and chef and her helpers did a flawless job. We went to the market around the corner and learned a lot about ingredients and cooked up some lovely dishes. Chef is very talented and speaks good English. Here is my problem. We were the oldest couple in the class but are very active and young at heart. After paying $125for a 4 hour class I resented being called grandma and grandpa by the chef, I was seriously upset because this is reserved for my grandchildren. We are not the chefs grandparents. I tried to contact chef Leez to explain but she choose not to. Highly recommended class but please use our first names or call us students.

Amazing experience!. Chef LeeZ and her collegues where so kind an well organized! I learned so much about thai cuisine and how to understand if food quality is really good.The food was the best I tasted during my whole Thailand trip :)It was absolutely worth to go!

Last day in Bangkok well spent!. After two months of travelling Thailand, I still hadn't taken part in a cooking course and as we were due to leave my partner found Chef Leez in Bangkok on trip advisor.The reviews I had read were spot on, I spent the morning there before our flight that evening and it couldn't have been spent better.Chef Leez is so knowledgable with brilliant English, the rest of the staff are such great help working quietly behind the scenes. The class itself and the local market trip was so informative as others have said - it would be brilliant to do on arrival into Thailand ahead of the rest of your trip however I found it just as good at the end of my trip and look forward to trying out the Massamun curry & Pad Thai recipe when we get home!Thank you again to Chef Leez and all the staff, the highlight of my Bangkok stay.

Highly recommended cooking class for tourist. The market tour was very informative, she teaches us how to choose the best ingredients for the cooking class. Chef Leez has the way of teaching in a very entertaining and fun way. We are all given an area to cook and a hand out was provided for all the recipes.

Small, intimate class, informative and fun. The walk around a local market was informative and formed a great way to learn about Thai produce and ingredients. The lessons are interactive and great for learning theory and practical. The team at Chef LeeZ are super efficient and ingredients and utensils were always ready for the next recipe.High recommend!

Fun and Informative. Chef Leez was great experience. She has a fun sense of humor and kept us entertained the entire time. Some of the recipes are a little complicated (I am not a good cook), but the food was delicious and I will be able to make some of the recipes at home.

Absolutely loved it. We did a cooking class with Chef Leez just over a week ago and it was great. Chef Leez and all her staff are funny, friendly and very helpful - loved the reference to a mortar and pestle as " grandmas blender" - market trip was great fun, informative and interesting - all the food we cooked and ate was delicious - put this class on your to do list when visiting Bangkok - it's a must

Fantastic Thai cooking experience. Friendly staff - Chef Leez was amazing - thoroughly knows her stuffSpeak very good EnglishLessons were well structured and organisedGreat fun we had loads of laughs and very accommodating as we had some special requests just let them know in advance and they will work around this for you...Absolutely spot on would recommend this experience to anyone interested in learning how to cook Thai cuisine.

Awesome cooking class, learn so much!. Recently went I to Chef LeeZ Thai Cooking Class and really really enjoyed it. I liked everything from Chef Leez who is so nice and entertaining, to the wonderful food she taught us how to prepare. Chef Leez is a great teacher and chef. She showed us how to make pretty much everything from scratch with no artificial ingredients, which is a big deal to me. She took us to the market to shop for fresh ingredients at the start of the class. The food was delicious! I didn't expect to learn how to make so many different dishes in one class. Her staff was also amazing, they are a great team! I would highly recommend this class, it's very authentic, delicious thai food taught by an amazing teacher/chef!

The Best food we have had in Thailand. I cannot say enough great things about this cooking class, from the enlightening market trip, to the incredible food we prepared. So far it has been our favorite thing here in Bangkok.... but we are foodies. Chef LeeZ's class was extremely organized and friendly staff. If you are interested in cooking classes or gourmet experience..... GO!!

Wonderful experience! A must do for something different in Bangkok!. Having done most of the tourist attractions in Bangkok I wanted to try something different & get a real insight into the famous Thai dishes. If you're looking for a cooking class, look no further! Chef Lee is wonderful, excellent English & super friendly! Firstly you will meet & greet at the store & then chef will take you along to the local markets where you will pick up fresh produce, vegetable, meat or vegetarian options like myself. All while doing this chef Lee is super informative & you learn & see some really cool stuff. You will learn what to & not to look for when buying your groceries. You then take it back to restaurant & start cooking! I made fresh coconut milk, 3x Thai soups, pad Thai, Thai green curry, mango sticky rice & a few others. Everything is step by step guided & so informative, catering to just how sweet/spicy you like your food. Not only is this class extremely interesting & fun, but very good value for money considering you sit down & eat each dish you make! Chef leez is a wonderful chef & I thoroughly enjoyed this class! Not to be missed!

Learn and fun (dancing while cooking). Indeed it was a great experience to cook from the scratch not anything that is instant and easy. Chef Leez is incredibly a native chef you will to cook in a hard way but in a fun way.

Thai Cooking Lessons with Chef LeeZ. During our trip to Bangkok, my wife and I signed up for Thai cooking lesson with Chef LeeZ. It was a wonderful experience, and our home cooked meals will definitely be changing some.I can say all kinds of nice things about the experience. Chef LeeZ is incredible. She's funny, patient, very knowledgable, and wants this to be a life-changing experience. She even provides on-line support. The class is very organized and the assisting staff are great.My wife and I live by a simple eating rule: if Grandma won't recognize it, don't eat it. Chef LeeZ buys into this theory also and takes it a step further by stating don't be lazy and be careful with convenience...it leads to poorer food consumption. An example would be to use a 'mortar and pestle' instead of a blender, because of the nutritional benefits she explains. We strongly recommend taking Chef LeeZ Thai Cooking Course to anyone wanting a life-changing cooking experience and enjoys Asian cooking (not just Thai)!

Amazing experience with Chef LeeZ and her team, super entertaining and the most delicious food!. We had a wonderful day and learned so much! Chef LeeZ is a funny, dynamic personality with lot's of funny stories and a great knowledge of cooking passed down from her Grandmother. Her staff is super helpful and very efficient. The 4 plus hours flew by and we cooked and tasted so many different delicious Thai foods. There is almost nothing made from pre made ingredients, almost everything is made by hand with heathy ingredients. No MSG! I loved that we went to the market to buy all the stuff for the day and she showed us how to find the best ingredients and how to prepare each one. We loved our day, we would recommend this tour to anybody! So far it is one of our favorite events in Bangkok. Thank you so much!

GREAT FUN!. We had a great time at this cooking class! Chef Lee has a great personality, both entertaining and inspiring. We couldn't believe we made EIGHT dishes in the allotted time! Looking forward to trying the recipes at home. Highly recommended.

Authentic, rustic Thai food. Easily the highlight of our trip!. This is an experience not to be missed. Chef LeeZ's passion and knowledge of Thai cooking is remarkable. At the end of the class, you'll leave with a full belly and possibly the best meal in Thailand. It's a relaxed fun environment for a solo activity or with a couple and you can even request special dishes to be taught in class which Chef LeeZ will try to accommodate. Thank you and hope to try another class next time!
Great cooking school. Loved the class on authentic Thai cooking that Chef LeeZ puts on. She's a character that made this class FUN.

A Great Experience and Good Tips. We went to learn the tricks of Thai Cookery and we were not disappointed. The venue was a challenge to locate - navigating in Bangkok is not always easy. The class started on time with a trip to the wet market to get the produce then a whole five hours of preparing and eating a range of dishes of traditional Thai. The tastes were superb but what was best was the tips on how to handle and prepare the food, The instruction was clear, simple and delivered with humor. A great experience…now I can supervise the cooking at home!!!

Interesting, authentic, delicious and fun!. There's not a lot new that I can say about someone who has 600+ excellent reviews other than if you're looking for a Thai cooking class, this is the one. Cooking classes depending on a host with a good personality and Chef LeeZ fits the role perfectly. She's both knowledgeable and quick witted. We had a great time and definitely recommended!

Thai Cooking and Market trip. Just been to this cookery school here in amazing Bangkok. I was the first one to arrive having given myself one hour to get there from Nana area Sukumvit. It's not on a skytrain or MRT (underground) route so you will have to get a taxi or tuk-tuk. Having stayed in Bangkok for 2 weeks now on my own, I find the taxis are better than the tuk-tuk's. You get fed up of haggling the cost with the tuk-tuk drivers where-as you jump in a taxi, say 'taxi by meter' and you know where you are. (By in Thai language is 'go' but it's spelt, 'bpai' so it means 'go by meter, at least that's what I'm told, it worked every time for me)My hotel staff gave the taxi driver directions written in Thai, so that really helped. Even so we had to stop close by to get final instructions from a passer-by. Once in there you're greeted warmly by the attentive, ever efficient staff. More people arrived all nationalities. We soon got chatting as we made our way to the local market to have our first lesson understanding and buying Thai ingredients from local Thai people. The market is a fantastic treat. If you enjoy local markets there's another couple you should see called 'Khlong Toei' and 'Or to kor' Market. I've reviewed those ones separately. Chef Leez had an English code word when she picked up produce and said this was 'not good!' Or 'Mai dii' as they say here. You'll have to wait until you book to find out more. Chef is passionate about locally sourced and naturally produced products. (No MSG to be found!) Fab! I learned lots about Thai meat, fish, vegetables, different spices, ingredients and much more.Once back in the air-con, wi-fi available classroom we had our first lesson. Chef shows us how to add the ingredients, which had been carefully prepared by her team of helpers. Then explains in great detail how and when to add them. We all have our own cooking stations with separate, efficient gas burner, easy to operate too. You don't have to be a good cook either just turn up with an open mind a will to learn and lots of enthusiasm and you be fine! We cooked lots of different things and got to eat all of them. I like spicy food but other people in the group didn't, that was easily catered for. So if you're not a fan of hot spicy food no problem you will not be alone there. Equally, if you don't eat meat no problem either, that's taken care of. Plenty of bottled water on hand too. In conclusion, I really enjoyed the 4 hours at 'Cookery School' I met some fab fellow travellers, some couples and some people who were there alone, just like me. I even went for a beer with some of them after the course! I still keep in contact with them.You're not pressurised into buying recipes or anything else, but I did buy an apron to help the cause. I would recommend this course to anyone, you don't have to be 'Chef Ramsay' to go here. Hope it all makes sense, one other thing, there are lots of taxis waiting around to get you back to your hotel. Best wishes Chef Leez, I'll be back when the new school is open good luck, 'Chok Dii Khrub' Sawasdee Khrub and Khoup Khun Marre Khrub. Andrew Lloyd. Visited 18th January 2016

A must for any foodies :). I have mentioned the food here in Thailand many times so far but after my class with Chef Lee I have learned that most of what I have been eating (tho great so far) is sub standard.Chef Lee is truly a world class cook and a great instructor! Worth every penny tho I may end up a food snob because of her teachings!!!

Some of the best food we ate!. We signed up in the morning for this cooking class and had no idea it would be one of our favorite experiences in Bangkok. Chef LeeZ is very passionate about her cooking, and the quality of her ingredients. From buying ingredients at the market to plating our food this was a great experience! We made so many dishes! My husband doesn't normally cook and was a little nervous at first, but LeeZ assistants provided a lot of prep support for our dishes but not so much that we didn't feel involved. The food was literally some of the best we ate while in Bangkok and we had a great time. I would recommend this to anyone!

Great class!. Great class and so many wonderful delicious Thai dishes created in this 4hour class. This is a very hands on course, and you will feel like a chef! Chef Lee and her assistants are all great. Class starts with a visit to a small hidden local market. You will definitely learn some interesting food facts about Thai cooking and move on to chopping up some fresh ingredients and making your own dish! We made so many delicious dishes, some of the best food I had after traveling around for 2 weeks in Thailand. You will also get an email after the class for more free recipes too which is a huge plus after you sample your creations! Tip: arrange plenty of time to get here as you don't want to be late and miss a trip to the market. Traffic can be rough in Bangkok!
Wow. This is by far a must do Bangkok. The class goes beyond what ingredients to use. P.S if you like spicy go with 5, you will know what im talking about

Don't miss this!. The first thing the chef does is take you to the market, which may be the best part of the class. She explains what's fresh and what isn't, what's real and what's imitation, what's organic and what isn't, and what all the various vegetables, chilies, and fruits are that make up Thai cooking. For Chef Leez, there really aren't any shortcuts to good food; her food is clean and simple, and it's all about the ingredients. The class itself includes making a soup, a curry, a salad, and a dessert, all in classic Thai style. You'll be anxious to get home to try her recipes (which she shares) out in your own kitchen.

Purple Lady. A visit to the local fish, vegetable and fruit market to select ingredients and back to class for excellent explanations and demos of recipes. Then all of the students cooked soups, green curry, green papaya salad, pad Thai and several others along with consuming all of their efforts. Chef Lee and her sous chefs helped us all have a wonderful experience so that we could repeat our Thai food at home. Don't miss this.

A must do if you're in Bangkok. I had a wonderful time and learned a lot. I have experience with Chinese and Korean cooking so this was my first taste of Thai cooking. Chef Lee explained what we would be preparing and then took us on a short walk to a local market. She explained some of the do's and don't in selecting the ingredients and was able to suggest minor alternatives in obtaining them in the U.S.. I also took a class in Pattaya and Chef LeeZ was by far more educational as well fun. If you enjoy cooking and want to try your hand with Thai cuisine then this is a must during your visit to Bangkok. I must also say her sous chefs were on the ball and the entire program went without delay considering they were backing up 12-14 people.

Great classes to find out more about thai food. That was my first trip to Thailand. I had no idea about thai food. Buying whole menu to try - not my way. I decided to attend this class and see how food cooks and how it tastes. There were 12 different dishes we cooked. We tried them all and that was awesome! Lots of fun and amazing experience. Plus - she cooking these dishes every day and if you want try best of them you on the right way.

Amazing experience! Amazing food!. Joined Chef Leez class with my girlfriend and it was amazing which i would highly recommend.Chef Leez is very friendly, informative, skilled and cheeky. She kept us entertained throughout the whole day with her passion and knowledge of produce and food. We also were given insight into how ingredients are substituted for cheaper alternatives and how some ingredients were kept long overdue but still used in cooking.All the food we made was made from scratch with the best of ingredients. We got to make our own dishes (the serving sizes were prepared for us) and enjoy them right after we had made them. Each step and technique used was demonstrated and easy to follow.The portion of each food was just right so we could enjoy the lot. I even had a double helping of mango and sticky rice which Chef Leez was more than happy to provide.We had the best food we've eaten in Bangkok at Chef Leez Thai Cooking Class and we also learned a lot about the cuisine.Thank you Chef Leez.

Delicious & Fun. Spent the morning at Chef Leez cooking class (about US$67) she explained the various herbs & vegetables, then took us in a short walk to a neighborhood market to explain more. Afte demonstrating some techniques, we had the chance to make soups, chili paste, Phad Thai, a green curry and some variations plus a dessert.The whole morning was fun, interesting and we enjoyed eating our results.I would highly recommend the experience!

That's a go!. I was pleasantly surprised by the way things were well-organized, interesting, eye-opening during that cooking class. During that class you will not only learn how to prepare the Thai flagship dishes and then have a chance to eat them but you will also be taken by chef Leez to a hidden food market where she explains how to make shopping (that's right, she will teach you whats important to get the right flavor). All in half a day.

The best way to learn how to make authentic Thai food!. My mother, sisters, and I visited Chef Leez class on our trip to Thailand last month. We had a great time! Chef Leez emphasizes the importance of fresh ingredients for the best food. Every step was easy and concise, and Chef Leez is a great teacher.First we took a trip to a local market, where we learned how to find the best ingredients. I thought this was really cool because it showed how much Chef Leez wants her students to be able to cook these foods. Then we came back to the kitchen and started to cook! I expected to just make pad thai, but the class taught how to make about 10 different dishes! Chef Leez discussed with the class the different ingredients, how to prepare, etc. while her sous chefs actually did the preparation. Then everyone stepped up to a skillet and got to cook about 2-3 different dishes. And the food was PHENOMENAL. If you don't come out of the class with inspiration to cook, at the very least you'll eat a great meal!My mom, who is the chef in the family and the most excited for the class, had the best time. Chef Leez speaks great English, so nothing was lost in translation. She's also hilarious! Every step was simple enough to replicate at home. There was nothing too fancy or Bobby Flay about the experience; these dishes are simple and good. Chef LeeZ has a passion for cooking and a talent for teaching. She truly wants everyone to be able to make these foods at home. She even made a few extra dishes for my dad, who showed up the class towards the end to pick us up. I thought that was really sweet!Overall, I HIGHLY recommend Chef Leez Cooking Class! It's informative, fun, and delicious. One of the best ways to know a culture is to cook and eat the foods, so I think this was a great way to experience Thai culture.
Brilliant!. Definitely worth the money. Was a great experience. They are moving to a new location but I'm sure that will only make it better. Chef Leez was excellent!

4 hours for market + learn to cook 9 dishes, make sure to bring video camera. HEALTHY COOKING - Chef LeeZ really focuses on natural high quality ingredients with no MSG, and no shortcuts. We made coconut milk out of fresh coconut. We learned how to make the color of pad thai with shrimp heads.Chef Leez has such an infectiously positive, bright, and humorous energy which made the class all the more fun. The market tour was the highlight of the experience for me. She taught us what to look for, and what not to buy. The pad thai we made was the best I had in my 4 weeks in Thailand. The class I was in was quite crowded. It was a group of 12 in a narrow long kitchen. We all got individual attention and the class was very organized. However, everything happened so fast that if it weren't for me recording the process with my GoPro I might've forgotten most of it. The written recipe doesn't include the tips/tricks so you should definitely take notes or record with a video camera. I was so sad when my camera ran out of memory. I highly recommend coming with a friend or a significant other as most people come as a couple.

Best Class and Best Food!. Chef LeeZ is an absolute delight! Her energy engulfs the kitchen as she sweeps around spouting endearing catchphrases. The techniques she teaches are simple, but make a dramatic difference in the kitchen. It's by far the best food I had all trip. Don't hesitate to spend your morning/afternoon with Chef LeeZ!

What a gem!. After a long time hobby cooking at home, this was the first cooking school I ever took, in perhaps my favorite city in the world. I cannot say enough good things about Chef Leez - the cooking school is set in a nice location (pre-February location is the one I know). The chef is fun, loud, funny and extremely educational, welcoming and open to questions. She uncovers a whole world of thai food for amateurs but knowledgeable cooks as well, and she does it so effortlessly it was a true pleasure to attend.The only worry i have now is whether any other cooking school will be able to measure up :) If you are in Bangkok, DO NOT MISS THIS! :)

Great knowledge, but too crowded. Went following the amazing reviews here and the chef really is high energy, fun, nice and knowledgeable. Learned a lot at the market visit and about each step of the process. Downside is that he class had a max size of 14 people, but there were 17. Having to take turns at a burner is unacceptable, the class was rushed, so more of a demonstration than a class. I had another class in Chiang Mai, terrible for knowledge about the ingredients, like we did have at LeeZ, but having a burner to myself and 1 techaer per 4 students helped, so neither was perfect, but they complemented each other

You get to learn, eat and have some fun!. Chef LeeZ Thai Cooking Class was a bunch of fun and a great way to spend over 5 hours (class was supposed to last only 4) learning both how to cook but to pick ingredients for some of the most popular Thai dishes. She was a joy to listen to and learn from and you can tell she is the real deal as she guides you step by step on how to make multiple tasty dishes. Served as both a fun activity and lunch and I couldn't be happier with the experience.

Highlight of our trip to Bangkok!. My partner and I love food and having done other cooking classes in other places, we really wanted to get a good overview of Thai cooking during our trip to Bangkok. We were so happy with our experience with Chef LeeZ. We really learned so much and had such a great time. You can tell that Chef Leez loves what she does and really cares about giving her students the best and most informative experience possible. The market trip was also a real eye-opener and I think I came out of that really more aware of the food I was eating. Unlike some other classes, you actually get to cook! If you love Thai food and want to learn about the real way to cook (like grandma!) then definitely sign up for Chef Leez's cooking class. You won't regret it! PS. don't eat breakfast before class...trust me, you will leave stuffed!

Very enjoyable activity. We had a great time at Chef LeeZ cooking class - she is very entertaining and knowledgable and the food was delicious. I would definitely recommend the class to anyone interested. That said, I'm not sure we would have any luck reproducing any of the dishes as much of the work was done in advance for us ... Ex. quick demo of how to make curry paste then we all make curry with pre-made paste and other ingredients portioned out for us. This made cooking much easier and very enjoyable but not as much of a learning experience. We were fine with this - we spent an enjoyable few hours learning about Thai cooking and ingredients, ate some delicious food and have some recipes and an idea of how to start if we want to try to recreate them.

Would've been five if not for the class size. So, first off, I have to tell you that i really enjoyed the class. It was fun to cook the thai food, and Chef Lee did a very good job of explaining everything and making the class exciting for my wife and I. We cooked a variety of dishes, which were all very tasty, and we had fun doing it. We went to the market and got food shopping advice as well, which was fun.The only problem with our class was that it seemed as though it had been overbooked. We got an email asking if we wanted to move to a smaller class later in the day, but we stayed with the morning one we had booked. I guess everyone did this as well, for there were close to twenty people in the small class. This may have been ok, but many of the other students seemed to want to be center stage and weren't too polite about getting that prime position. During the market visit, my wife and I were at the back of the group because we were there to enjoy, not to push others out of the way. A few of the students even showed up thirty minutes late, but Chef Leez entertained us while we waited by showing us the good and bad of food you can buy. I think she designed this part because she's used to people showing up late.Now, I understand that they are moving into a new location, which will hopefully be more spacious and things will be more organized. For the class I went to, it was overbooked, which shouldn't have happened in the first place, even if it was a busy season (Christmas). That is the only reason the class got four, not five, stars. Everything else seemed to be very good.

Fresh and fun. My husband and I were given Chef LeeZ cooking class as a gift for our recent holiday. Hours of tasty fresh food with great information when purchasing in markets in Bangkok or in our home city in Australia. Chef LeeZ was very knowledgeable and kept the mood light and fun with quick humour. Definitely some of the best food we tasted on the trip and we made it ourselves! Highly recommended. Thank you.

Fun. We went there after reading the great reviews in trip advisor and I have to say I'm not totally in line.The positive side of it is that the food cooked is really really great - some of the best eaten in Thailand.Also you learn loads of back info - like the making of pad thai sauce or the making of coconut sauce. The market visit is also great and Chef leeZ is just a very nice, fun, positive person.Now the negative - if you already know how to cook to a certain degree the amount of actual cooking is very little. This is due to 2 reasons: Firstly - most ingredients are preprepared. You of course add the ingredients to make the final dish, but the ingredients are only very quickly explained before adding them in to the pot; if I attend a class I just expect to 'cook from start to finish' - also because practice makes the chef ;)Secondly, our group was huge (ab. 20) and only 6 cooking stations were available. This meant a lot of waiting and sometimes a bit of chaos. While some cooked, others watched (time could have been used to prepare ingredients.)While in other classes I did, we were ab 6, all could choose from a list of dishes what to do and cooked those from scratch to finish in Chef LeeZ class this was just not manageable due to the size of the class.I have attended much better classes (in Chang Mai or Ho Chi Minh) which provided a very nice atmosphere, preparing dishes from scratch in small groups with lots of interaction with the chef- so I prefer that much more and learnt much more.Conclusion: If you only want to see how the dishes are prepared and get a first insight in thai cuisine and have a fun time - this is your class; but for experienced cookers or people who really want to learn how to cook thai, I would not recommend the class.

Fun, educational and tasty!. Chef Leez is awesome. It shows that she is knowledgeable and passionate about food and the best ingredients and is willing to share. We had an absolute ball and would recommend the class to anyone.
Excellent, genuine and lots of fun! . A must in Bangkok - learn about the healthy way to cook Thai Food! A most generous and fun lesson very much appreciated by all family members.

Great Food and Great Fun!!. I use the dish Pad Thai as my measuring stick for any Thai restaurant; if they can't make it well, I don't trust the other dishes.With Chef Leez's help, I was able to make the BEST Pad Thai I have ever tasted!!! It was clearly a prediction for the rest of the food we would make under her attentive eye.We went as a family and had a blast!! We love to eat and we love to cook, so we were able to do both for the better part of 1/2 the day. Chef had a lot of good advice and a lot of good information. It was a great experience.One note: I could have done completely without the trip to the market and the oft repeated warning about MSG. The market dragged-on and it was difficult to hear/see what she was trying to discuss. It would be much better to replace the visit with another recipe or another cooking skill.

Best Thai food we ever ate. Chef Leez was great! She was fun and informative. We learned how to cook a variety of dishes and learned how to choose foods to eat while in Thailand. She's against using msg and chemicals and warmed us that many street vendors add msg. The group class my fiancee and I attended was great for experienced and non-experienced cooks. We made a variety of dishes, under the guidance of chef Leez and her assistants, and the food was really good. Compared to all the meals we ate in Thailand, Chef Leez food was the best!

Fantastic Thai Cooking Experience with GREAT FRIENDLY chef lee. I was expecting high after reading all the raving review and go ahead with the reservation. And I am NOT disappointed at all. I will recommend any friends of mine to go have a class with chef LeezChef Leez is experienced obviously and really friendly ,funny and informative through out the whole four hour class. From the market visit to the cooking, she has been really detailed in introducing all the important Thai ingredients and making instructions on the cooking steps.Everyone gets their own stove to cook every single dish which is the part I really appreciate most. As I have been to cooking classes in other countries. You may just end up taking turn to cook one same big pot of things for the whole class. The food is FANTASTIC and it's so good to learn so many authentic dishes in well under four hours.Chef Leez is a bit more pricey to what i know than other cooking class in Bangkok from my research. But trust me , completely worth the money.

Exellent experience, practical technique, and even follow up recipes !. We spent 2 days with Chef LeeZ during our last visit to Bangkok, learned 16 dishes over the two half day lessons. On top of regular ones, Chef LeeZ also provided additional recipe based on our request. It was the best thai food I ever had! And the basic technique learned from the lessons are pracitical and I am actually cooking thai food at home, from the fresh ingredient. It tastes so much different :) And the lesson was very fun!

So much fun!. My boyfriend and I had so much fun taking this class. Chef Lee speaks English very well, and was very easy to understand. She was funny too! Her staff was great and very efficient. It seemed like there was no time wasted at all, and there was a really great system in place. The best part was the food. It tasted SO GOOD, and it was made even better by the fact that we all actually cooked our own dishes with authentic and fresh Thai ingredients. I enjoyed every second.
Top. It was very nice and I learned a lot that day . The explanations were understandable .German Klasse

The site is not accurate. We arrived after agreeing on the phone a course without market tour, having read a price of 1800 baht on the website. After a walk around Soi 1 we found it on the main road and then had a long discussion about the price of 2200 baht, and eventually settled on 1900 baht. This was not the best start and put me out immediately. Chef Leez is amiable and very talkative, but the course was not very long - there were only two of us. We were finished after 2 hours of cooking very tasty food. Nice, but not much for your money, considering the price of other services in Thailand.

An Absolute Must!!!!!!. Chef Lee hasn't earned her ratings for nothing! She is by far one of the most nicest and genuine people I've met in Thailand (not like you can find many of those there!). I'm a frequent traveler to Bangkok, and I love Thai food. Although I am not a professional, I am a very good cook. But I realized I've been cooking Thai food wrong all this time although most of my guests found it fabulous.This lady is amazing; she teaches you 'real' home cooked Thai food. Most importantly she teaches you techniques that most chefs would not convey. She holds nothing back, and apparently enjoys imparting her knowledge to others. From picking the right ingredients at the local market to cleaning and cutting, she leaves no secrets behind! My husband who hardly cooks (or boil water!) joined me just to accompany me, enjoyed this course very much!She is witty, interesting and most of all full of knowledge and tips. She taught 8 items in just 4 hours and the 4 hours felt like a day because of all that I acquired! I have done numerous activities in and out of Bangkok, but I recommend this class to anyone who loves Thai food. It's only 4 hrs and worth so much more for the amount you pay! Dear Chef Lee, thank you for all that you taught me and I will see you again with more of my friends from Sri Lanka!

*Best*🇹🇭🍲. I did not want to write a review before I check out the recipes online and now that I have - it's the perfect course!Chef LeeZ is so nice and easy going, very talkative and funny and it's just fun to have a conversation with her.I came to the class with my sister and my husband, my sister wanted to cook vegetarian dishes- she ended up saying that it was the best Thai food she had the whole trip!!! We definitely agreed it was one of the best! Chef LeeZ puts an emphasis on how important it is to cook from zero, grandmother style, and it was absolutely surprising how much more tasty it is if you make something from scratch compared to buying it ready from the local store. I can keep writing more but the bottom line is that we loved it.

Wonderful, Must Do When in Bangkok. We had a wonderful time in Chef LeeZ cooking class. It was so informative, not only are you understanding what each ingredient is but she will show you what are in the quick less savory versions you may happen upon on the street. My boyfriend is allergic to shellfish which is so tough in Thailand. He had a great time, was able to participate in everything and try his own version while I cooked with him and still got to try the one with shrimp paste in it. So delicious, really cannot recommend this class any more.

This woman is gold! . Loved the food, loved the atmosphere and most of all loved chef Leez! Three of us arrived to late to go to the market before the class so she decided to take us after. So so so nice!

Perfect! . Chef Leez has nailed this course with a great intro to good and bad foods around Bangkok, a quick visit to a local market and a jam packed day of cooking and eating. Her staff help with prep to allow maximum time cooking and the food and ingredients were to die for! A must for anyone wanting to learn to cook Thai from scratch and for couples looking for an experience to share. Facilities were all clean and in perfect condition and they catered perfectly for the small group size. Enjoy!

Great Experience. I was hesitant to go to this cooking class because I'm not an experienced cook but I do love eating. It was a class made for anyone who can hold a wok and spatula but did include more info if you could absorb it. The chef was great and extremely friendly. She made me feel welcome from the moment I entered the room. It was a great experience and hopefully now I can make a couple of my favorite thai dishes in my own home. I highly recommend to anyone with a few free hours in Bangkok.

Real Thai cooking. My wife, friends and I all really enjoyed Chef LeeZ cooking class. I am not a cook but learned traditional Thai cooking in an informative and enjoyable manner. All ingredients were local and everything was made from scratch. We got to eat our own cooking and it was excellent. Chef LeeZ has a great sense of humor and she and her staff made our class enjoyable and a lot of fun. I would recommend this class to anyone who wants to understand Thai cooking and the way it should be done.

A Wonderful Way to spend a Morning. The class room is filled with students from different countries. Made new friends. Exciting. Trip to market is fun and good knowledge. Chef Leez is such a fun personality, full of energy, full of information, teaching with passion. Great time spent there.

four hours well spent. If you are going to spend any time in Bangkok, make sure you experience a cooking class with Chef Lee Z! We did everything from shopping for I ingredients, to prepping the food, to making making delicious dishes. Included were making lemon grass soup - both clear and creamy, pad thai, to curries. All while listening to this very informative and pleasant chef. Would do it again.

Great Learning Experience. We fully enjoyed our learning experience during Chef LeeZ cooking class. We booked the cooking class after reading all the wonderful reviews on Tripadvisor. The class was about 35 minutes away from our hotel and getting around in Bangkok is not easy and difficult to time with the traffic. But we made it in time. I would suggest Uber. It was a great resource for us during our time in Bangkok. Chef LeeZ is understanding and accounts for travel time. She starts the class with an informative introduction to the class and doesn't leave straight for the market at 10AM. The market was neat to see and learn all the ingredients to purchase and which to stay away from. We found this not just informative for our time in Thailand but it was also a lesson we could take home with us. She taught us how to make some of the more popular Thai dishes like pad thai and curry. But the best part of the class was eating. We were stuffed. It was really some of the best Thai food we ate on our trip. Chef LeeZ and her staff were well prepared and you could tell it wasn't their first rodeo. I would recommend this class to everyone. If we return we will be taking another one of Chef Leez cooking classes.

The Highlight of Bangkok for us!!. A all around amazing experience. I would highly recommend this to all visiting Bangkok. My husband and I both learned so very much about the wonders of Thai cooking. Thank you Chef LeeZ for an amazing day!!

Highlight of Our Trip. I took a cooking class at Chef Leez recently with a group of friends and it was the highlight of our trip!! Cheef Leez was hilarious and so much fun - I would have paid to spend an afternoon just to hang out with her! We learned how to make a lot of incredible dishes and had a great time doing it. I highly recommend!

Increible, one of the best Thai experince. We decided to spent our last day in Bangkok in The Chef Leez cooking school.In only one sentence: It was the best decision, undoubtedly!In 4 hour we learnt how to cook the tradicional Thai dishes in a very funny atmosphere.At the begining, the chef explained us different aspects about the Thai cuisine and the ingredients that we were going to use.Then we took our baskets and we went to a tradicional market where she continued explaining (but this time with the products in front of us) which were everyone and their differences. The experience was fantastic!! we discovered many different odours (some of them good and other not much), and how was the real Thai market, not the prepared tourist ones.After the market, with our baskets plenty of vegetables, prawns, and more, we continued the class in the school.The local is very clean and you have all that you could need for the dishes.All of us cooked the dishes while The Chef with her helful and cheerful assistants teaching us.Leez is a very cheerful person. She explains very well the dishes and in every moment is pending of you. She do the clases very pleasant with many examples and comparisons between the Thai and European ingredients.The clase flew by without we noticed! and with our bellys full after eating all the dishes that we had prepared.Seriously, if you want to know how to prepare Thai meal, know the ingredients and spend a funny time don't doubt! meet The Chef Leez.

Couldn't attend class due to illness, but awesome management. So I didn't actually get to take the cooking class because I got super ill the weekend of the class, but the management at Chef LeeZ were incredibly understanding, even sending me advice on hospitals in Bangkok. We tried to reschedule for a date in December, but unfortunately my travel plans didn't work out, but they were so friendly to help me out. I look forward to cooking with Chef LeeZ team in the future!!!

I simply love the class. Cooking class is one the best way to know the people and culture! I enjoyed the class, it is also the best Thai food which I had in Bangkok! If you are in town, please come and take 4 hours class with chef Lee! You won't regret.

Brilliant experience . This was one of the best things we did in Bangkok. Chef Leez was great;engaging, funny and attentive. She is very passionate about cooking good food at home and is a big advocate of not using cooking sauces, MSG, preservatives etc. The day started with a tour around the market to explain what we would be using to cook with, what the different ingredients are, how they differ etc. It was all invaluable information. The cooking was the fun part and even though we had a full class she made sure that everybody was engaged. Her assistants were all brilliant too and kept the day running smoothly. Recommended.

Chef Leez Thai Cooking Class. This was such a great experience, I'm so glad to have chosen this class, highly recommend for all! Very hands on, very informative and the food was delicious! Chef Leez was great! Yes the class is 4 hrs but it goes by very quickly and you get so many recipes! Well worth it :)

Our best Thai Food experience in Bangkok, thanks Chef Leez !. Chef Leez made us discover the "grande thai cuisine" : the day started with a market tour for choosing the best fresh products available, with most valuable comments, then followed by very clear cooking workshops for understanding and doing by oneself the delicious and emblematic basics of thai food, all with fresh and natural products. Finally the tasting experience... The results were delightful meals, than can only compare with best "Chef Tables" experiences !!! All that in a simple and cheerful atmosphere, thanks to Chef Leez and assistants kindness (and Leez delicious sense of humour :-)

So you can cook what you'll be craving when you get home!. My husband and I went to Thailand on our honeymoon, and one of the things at the top of our "must do" list was to take a cooking class -- both because we love cooking together, and also because we really wanted to learn how to make our favorite takeout meals from scratch. We did a lot of research (and read a lot of these reviews!) and ultimately signed up for Chef LeeZ class. And it definitely did not disappoint! Having taken a lot of classes here in the US, we were amazed by how much great information/number of different dishes we learned in this class. And, in addition to giving us some great skills, it was also a TON of fun. We enjoyed the other participants in our class and Chef Lee and her team are amazing -- funny, engaging, helpful and knowledgeable. We had a blast, and got to eat our creations along the way!Now that we're back, we've started to put our new skills to use -- safe to say that our friends are also pretty glad we attended!

If you do anything, sign up for this class!. Chef LeeZ teaches a wonderful class, with lots of helpful hints and facts. There is air conditioning in her classroom and lots of hand on experience. Sign up now!!

Fantastic time, great food, learned lots!. I had a fantastic time with Chef LeeZ in her cooking class. I signed up for the 4 hour group class. We started promptly at 10 am, did some basic introductions and then were off to the market. The market was only 5 minutes away. The time there was informative and gave some true local flavor. We then were back to the kitchen to cook. Chef LeeZ did a very good job teaching us and keeping it interesting with not only cooking but also some laughs. Her assistants in the kitchen were on the spot and always had items prepped for us to use. Overall this was a great experience. I would recommend it to everyone. I think at this point I have a good foundation to make honest efforts at authentic Thai cuisine. After the class it was just a short cab ride over to Wat Pho. You can easily do the class and have time to explore the temples afterwards.

Great food taught by a great chef!. I love Thai food and have always made my own version at home. I wanted to take a cooking class to know how to cook and spot good authentic Thai food. Chef LeeZ was entertaining and very insightful. She took us to a market and showed us the difference between "beautiful" food and good food. She taught us how to cook everything from scratch and was able to tell us what foods we could find at home. Food was great as well. I really enjoyed my time in class!
Amazing - never thought I would love it so much . Thank you Chef Lee. That was just an amazing and really helpful course. Thanks to you and your staff. What a great experience.

Big Smile after authentic Thai food experience :-). Excting experience, great way to spend time and to know about Thai cousine. Good vibe with real soul food! Best sticky mango rice and papaya salad! Chef LeeZ is a charming person, great staff that helps you with your cooking.

Fantastic Experience. To open, the classes are billed as 8-12 people, mine had about 16 in it. However, and this is the important point, it didn't really matter. Chef Lee seamlessly managed it and it really wasn't a problem. The whole operation is well run by the charismatic Chef Lee who has a team of helpers. She makes it easy and enjoyable. Highly recommended to fill part of a day and provide a nice break from the usual tourist activities.
Chef Lee is great. I am a very experienced chef and I was amazed how Chef Lee could teach about so many ingredients and recipes in one half day class.....simply amazing!

A Great Little Thai Cooking School - An Awesome Cooking Teacher. This is an excellent intensive little cooking class taught by the super-dynamic and charismatic Chef Lee, introducing the Thai dishes most popular with westerners.Well thought out and organized. Systematically covers a great deal in four intense hours. Reminds me of Emeril. Full recipe hand out. Best if put to use with practice at home.

Great experience in Thai cooking class . We had so much fun learning how to cook Thai dishes from Chef Leez. I had Thai food in the US but I did not know how different it tastes here in Bangkok. Therefore I decided to take a Thai cooking class. I chose Chef Leez because of the fantastic reviews people left for her. I were so happy to learn how to cook Thai food with intricate ingredients and technique came with each dish from different types of curry to Tom Yum and my favorite PaThai. Chef Leez was great in explaining what was good to use or not to buy when going to the market. We went away after class feeling full and had so much knowledge about Thai food. Can't hardly wait to go back home showing off to my kids all these new dishes that I learned from Chef Leez.

I can cook now :D. Getting there wasn't so easy, taxi driver couldn't find it so we were a few minutes late. We went to a market nearby, it was SO hot I started feeling a bit dizzy and walked back to the school, Leez prepared a nice tea for me which was so nice of her :)The class is really informative, she's sweet and funny, we cooked delicious food and now have access to their online recipe with all the famous thai dishes!!! Very happy we chose the right course!

The Best Thai food I had!!. With the luck of a happy traveler, we were pointed in the direction of Chef LeeZ cooking class. She has an electric presence and describes every detail of preparing Thai dishes with tips on how to ensure that you can replicate it at home. We left full & happy, the only way to travel through life!

Fun and educational cooking class. Food is an integral part of a societies culture. It almost helps to define them and gives you a glimpes into who they are. With that, everywhere I travel, I try to take a cooking class to help bring a piece of that into my life. You can look at the architecture, take pictures of the buildings and scenery, and buy the souvenirs. But personally, I've found that if you can take from your vacation a piece of a cultures food, you can relive and share a piece of those memories. On my recent vacation, I took two cookng classes. I wanted to see what the difference between a top ranked cooking class vs a mediocre one would be like. Chef LeeZ has a lot of experience teaching these classes and you can tell. She has it down to an art. Everyting moves perfectly like clock-work, very fluid and with a great pace. She's engaging in her knowledge and background to help you understand the "why's" of what you're doing and how to do it. I think as a standard, she's also entertaining. This is critical in a crash course cooking class you are taking in a foreign country. So with that said, I think the key aspects of a successful cooking class was there.Now when I compare her class with other classes I've taken: If you Really want to learn how to make some of the common traditional dishes, This is the class for you. I went to one of her competitors and they did teach the class, and although it was also hands on, if I objectivly compare the two, I definitly felt that I learned more and felt more confident after Chef LeeZ class. The other class I went to was also great, but it had some differences. Not to spend too much time talking about the other course, but it was more of an experience and hands down my photos there were much better. However, educationally, I'd rank it much lower. Chef Leez class had more of an industrial/academic feel to it, because of how it is setup: Of course with some fun info and stories included. But that being said, It was set up to Learn how to really make the different dishes. If you really want to learn how to make the dishes and be entertained, this is the class for you. I'd say 85% education 15% fun On top of that, the food tasted better here than at the other class I took.I definitly understand why this class is ranked number 1 on Trip Advisor

Great Fun. This was a hands on experience from the local shopping and then hands on cooking class. Class size is small so we got to know everyone in the class. Was so much fun. I'm a Delta Air Lines flight attendant so get there on a regular basis and will do this again.

What a highlight of our Bangkok stay. Wow! My expectations were high after reading so many positive reviews from Chef Leez. I have to stay, our group class outdid my expectation. Chef Lee was tentative, educational and funny! We loved learning to do things from scratch (or how chef Lee would say it, "grandmas way"). I would definitely reccomend this class!

Highlight of our holiday. My husband and I absolutely loved the day we spent with Chef Leez. The visit to the market to collect fresh ingredients was great and the organisation at the cooking school was brilliant - plates and ingredients would appear and disappear right before our eyes! Grandma and Grandad (as we were affectionately called on the day) can't wait to start cooking Thai food together back home.

Best value school. I came here with my girlfriend and we were the only 2 people in the class! The lady was extremely friendly and she was flexible (we wanted to learn certain dishes). We did loads of dishes and ate the whole time. Please do yourself a favour and don't eat before going there!! I will probably go back as she goes quite quickly through the different meals (I'm a horrible cook so I'm a pure beginner). Fantastic value for money.

Wonderful time spent cooking!. I went to Chef LeeZ with three friends during our weekend vacation in Bangkok. I really enjoyed most her absolute enthusiasm for teaching Thai cooking. It's a whirlwind course, where you learn a lot of dishes; but you also learn a lot in general about Thai cooking that you can apply to any dish you want! I think the market shopping experience before we started was really fascinating, and I learned some things about shopping for fresh veggies/meats that I didn't know before too. She did a great job at explaining it, and then having us all in turns go up and make the dish ourselves. We left happy, full, and ready to cook lots of Thai food!

Fabulous Four Hours!. Chef Leez is a wonderful cook with a fabulous sense of humor! It was lovely to take a break from sightseeing and just enjoy authentic Thai food. It was over the top good and so fun to mix with others in the class! Two enthusiastic thumbs up! I totally recommend this as a top experience in Thailand. The only thing in Bangkok that came close to this much fun was the moped ride to get home from there! What an adventure! :)

Customer Service. I recently requested a refund of an advance group class reservation because my nephew cancelled his plans to go to Thailand with us. The staff at Chef Leez contacted me immediately through email and I was given a refund within days. I was very impressed. Unfortunately, my husband and I had to cancel our trip also and I contacted Chef Leez again for another refund of my pre-paid reservation. I was a little apprehensive, but they were again so accommodating and processed a refund to me. I appreciate the efficient and caring manner in which they handled my circumstances. I will be traveling to Thailand in February and will definitely be taking this course then.

Wonderful hands on experience. Chef leez is a wonderful cook teaching us the non lazy ways of cooking. Ha ha. I highly recommend the class because in addition to cooking everything from scratch, she gave us many handy tips about how to purchase items useful for cooking. This was a highlight of my trip for sure. Food was delicious and catered for dietary restrictions.

Absolutely fantastic. Brilliant cooking class and Chef Leez is both incredibly knowledgeable about Thai cuisine and very funny. Learnt lots both at the market and whilst cooking. Well worth it, Food was great! Cooking and eating great food and laughing at the same time. What more good you want?

Best cooking experience ever!. Chef Leez was an amazing experience. We went through all the step of cooking, from the market to the kitchen.Leez is very funny and her class is very interesting. We learnt a lot of classic thai recette. This was one of the best experience I had in Thailand.Thank you Leez.

Truly Delicious Food & AMAZING Experience. On a recent trip to Thailand I followed TripAdvisor's suggestion to try a cooking class and decided on top-rated Chef LeeZ Cooking School. While I can't compare it to other cooking classes in Bangkok, I cannot imagine any experience topping our experience with Chef LeeZ.We started the day by being taken to the local market, where we were taught how to pick proper, fresh ingredients for natural cooking. Back in the classroom, we received step-by-step instructions and demonstrations and were able to cook about a dozen dishes by ourselves. Every single dish that we cooked in this class was fresh and flavorful and everything down to the sauces were made by hand. The food we ate in class was hands-down the best food we ate during our entire trip in Thailand.Chef LeeZ was incredibly knowledgable, friendly, and helpful. One man in the class made an off-handed comment about his favorite Thai dish (which wasn't on the menu for what we'd be making that day), and Chef LeeZ immediately added it to our schedule to appeal to his taste. I cannot say enough good things about this class--if you are ever in Bangkok you are making a mistake if you miss out on this experience!

Fun and Instructive. I cannot compare this class to others in BKK, but to others in big Asian cities. Great experience, highly recommended. Chef LeeZ and her team have planned and prepared the class so that not only ten different dishes are prepared, cooked and tried in three hours, but also preparing, cooking and trying alternates. The class is not only instructive regarding authentic local ingredients and preparation, but also relaxed and fun. It is amazing how Chef LeeZ seems also to enjoy giving classes although she runs them on a daily basis.

Honest Thai Cooking at its Best. Chef Leez, what an inspiration, she made the class so enjoyable and informative and we were all given a copy of the recipes on the day! You can easily tell she loves wha she does and the seamless execution from her staff was very impressive.You'll start off by going to the market to pick up produce, here Chef Leez explains what to look for and what best to buy (my god the produce was so cheap compared to what we pay for back home!). I got a mosquito bite at the market and Chef Leez whipped up an organic paste out of oil and nuts to put on my bite which stopped it from itching!! :)She believes in being true to your ingredients as all the recipes stayed clear from processed goods. We even got to make our own coconut cream and milk! Do yourself a favour, if you have half a day to spare do do do this class. You can thank me later!

Awesome experience. This was one of 4 cooking classes I took on a recent trip, and by far the best experience of them all. I learnt an an easy, comfortable environment about Thai food and culture. Chef Leez is a character on her own, and she passes on her knowledge in a relaxed manner that made sense of food...rather than just cooking severeal recipes alongside her...after all...you can do that on youtube.She passed on concept of the ingedients and how to choose them...and how to combine them....I found it really inspiring and still make my own coconut milk...here in New Zealand. I highly recommend Chef Leez...(I havnt been to the new school)....this was by far the most enjoyable and educational highlight of my trip..

Learn to cook like a Thai grandma. We had a group of 4 and had a great time cooking with Chef Lee. Loved her philosophy of cooking like grandma, with an emphasis on high quality ingredients. She has a great personality and we're still using some of her catch phrases: "Grandma not lazy!" "Everything money!" and "Bea-u-tiful!" (her code word at the market meaning this is artificial crap made to just look pretty) Loved that she had different people make different variations of dishes so that we got to taste an even wider variety. She also was great at having vegetarian options on everything for those who wanted.

Great class would recommend . Chef Leez is hilarious and you will certainly learn a few staple thai dishes from attending this course. When we first arrived we were a bit put off by the location but we're soon at ease once we got into things. The visit to the market is pretty disgusting and it's hard to tell who runs it - the cats climbing all over everything or the vendors if ignoring them - either way you will definitely be glad your with Chef Leez as she only picks the best produce, knows her way around the market and obviously speaks thai, all very useful in this situation. The dishes cooked include soups, Pad thai, green curry, massaman curry and desserts. The course is a tiny bit too long for my taste (4 hours in total) and probably could benefit from some more interaction between attendees, perhaps more of a communal dinner experience towards the end would be especially handy if you are wanting to meet fellow travelers but if you want the option to only speak to the person you came with course this will probably suit you. I'm looking forward to trying out these dishes at home

Great way to spend an afternoon and dinner hour. This was AWESOME!!! We were running out of things to do, so we found this on TripAdvisor. It's as good as everyone said. She was very entertaining, and we learned a lot. Going to the local market was kind of gross compared to a US supermarket, but we love adventure. We made soup, five curries, pad thai and sticky rice. What I liked most is they let us make substitutions and exclusions from our dishes. For example, I hate mushrooms, and they were ok with that. They also took care of people with food allergies.We haven't tried the recipes at home, but when we eat Thai at home we now have an appreciation for the cuisine.

Amazing Chef, Amazing teacher. Chef LeeZ made the cooking class incredibly fun and educational. She is a great teacher who holds your hand (if needed) through the creation of her amazing dishes. She allows you to experiment with unfamiliar ingredients and helps you perfect the basic to complex recipes. We plan on making many of her dishes for our family!

Great experience!. My mom booked this class for my sister, my dad, and me. I am 12 and my sister is 14. We had a great time! 12 is a good age, but any age younger might not be able to keep up. Chef Lee is a very zippy person who is great at teaching. The food she teaches you how to make is amazing! I will definitely try these recipes at home!

fun woman Chef Leez! . Chef Leez was very entertaining and I liked the way she conducted the fast paced four hour cooking session. I was with my wife (35weeks pregnant) and we thought she went out of her way to ensure my wife was enjoying as much as everyone else (she didn't want her to try anything spicy just yet). Only negative we felt was the fast pace of cooking all 12 dishes in four hours. Maybe it was us!That said, it was fun, educational and very Thai an experience in Bangkok. Value for money too!

Highlight of our experience in Bangkok. This is a must do in Bangkok. We only wish we did it on our first day instead of last due to the many things we learned. Chef Leez took us to a local food market and taught us how she shops for vegetables, herbs and shrimp. Her basic rule is that if it is "BEAUTIFUL" she will not buy it. You will need to go to one of her lessons to find out why! We learnt how to make the different types of curries, pad Thai and Tom Yum.
