It was very interesting for us since we can find the ingredients she uses in our local markets. She showed us how to make coconut milk from a raw coconut but using this old fashion tool and also showed us how to prepare whole seeds for spices. All the men in the group indicated that they liked spicy foods so she had them prepare the spiciest of the food recipes. We had to open the doors of the shop as everyone started choking and laughing at the same time it was quite hilarious! After the class my husband expressed interest in purchasing one of the coconut tools and the mortar for grinding spices. She offered to take us to the China Town Market area to purchase. It was a good thing as I am sure we would have failed in finding and negotiating for it. We ended up purchasing both items and tonight we are making our first true Thai food back home using her techniques and recipes. Chef Leez is truly engaged and cares about what she teaches - you will not be disappointed. You will also receives her recipes and options to get more on line free of charge. This is an memory which will continue on with each dish we prepare at home. Thanks Chef Leez.

Learn with Fun. Learn how to cook Thai food can be so much fun at Chez Leez.Chef Leez is passionate about what she is doing. In the market tour, she tells you how to choose quality ingredients.She makes the 4 hours cooking enjoyable and fun-filled.

Excellent Experience . Chef Lee's cooking school is an absolute must in Bangkok! Easily the best Thai food I've eaten and I was the one cooking it! Chef Lee is enthusiasm and funny, she doesn't miss a single detail when explaining cooking ingredients or methods. The food is delicious and you get to try every single dish (don't have breakfast). The class is a full day activity and worth every cent!
Excellent Day. I thoroughly enjoyed this and would recommend chef Lees to everybody, it is fun, interesting and educational all at the same time.

Absolutely fantastic!. This was one of the best days ever in Thailand, and I have been here a year so that is saying something! My girlfriend and I was for Valentines day and it was the best thing. Chef Leez is the loveliest woman who was so open and friendly and funny and mostly informative! She knew her stuff! It was such godo value for money, really felt like a bargain for all that we got. Loads of delicious food and an education about Bangkok - including a trp around a real local market. Absolutely fab! Deffo recommend! She also gives a lot back to her local communities in charites so you not only help yourself but support Thailand in coming here. Also, for those people saying she was saying rude jokes towards vegetarians, mustn't really understand Thai people very well. She was very charming and welcoming and any form of jolliness is just the culture. And as for people who are leavin rerviews about her 'slating' other things in Bangkok - she is telling the truth, you are there to learn about cooking in Thailand - she is there to teach you. You shouldn't be offended by that! I loved it and recommend around another 10 people who also did it and felt the same.

Time and money well spent!. If you want to choose a cooking class in Bangkok, this is definitely the best class to choose. Chef LeeZ makes 4 hours seem not enough as she cracks jokes, teaches you secrets of Thai cooking, explains how to make healthy choices in terms of ingredients, and she is not stingy with information! The class starts with a market visit where she explains the available ingredients and how to choose wisely. The light bulb moment was when she explains how we shouldn't choose "beautiful" ingredients as these are probably full of chemicals such as fertilizers, preservatives, and colorings and we should choose less than perfect ones as well as natural looking ones. We then proceed back to the classroom where we learned how to make pastes and its various uses in Thai cuisine, curries, pad Thai, clear and creamy tom yum, mango sticky rice, holy basil chicken, green papaya salad and even a bonus tom kha gai. We also get access to her recipe club for even more dishes to learn. This is the best value you can get from any cooking class in Bangkok! I'm looking forward to cooking what I learned from Chef LeeZ as soon as we get home.

Amazing Cooking class - best food in Bangkok!. The class with chef Leez was just amazing. Definitely one of the best things I did in Bangkok. Started with a nice trip to the market, where she showed us all the products (good and noooot good ones). Back to the cooking part - we made several (about 10) plates, one better than the other. We made our own curries!! The flavour of the food was just amazing - I can say that the best food I had in Thailand was in the class (and I did went to 5 star restaurants in Asia). It's more then worthy the money and time - it's a MUST DO!

Great Thai Cooking Experience. Grandma's Thai cooking with an emphasis on quality ingredients, "beautiful" produce and the realy fun Chef Lee was easily one of the highlights of our trip to Bangkok and I would highly recommend it to anyone interested in learning about the flavors in Thai cooking and the interplay and repetition between various dishes. More educational than other cooking classes I've taken with a cracker-jack staff ensuring everything went smoothly.

Amazing Thai Cooking Class. We have just come back from Chef Leez’ cooking class. We are stuffed and in heaven. She is enthusiastic about her food and does a great job of teaching you about which ingredients are real and those that are made to look more than they are. We’re new to Thai food and strict vegetarians – which she accommodated for every dish – and not as an afterthought. It was amazing that we were able to cook so many dishes in such a short period of time – but it didn’t feel rushed and everyone gets a chance to cook the dishes. Can’t recommend it enough. Have fun!Also, if she offers you coconut sugar, ask for more.

Good Fun. Chef lee gives an extremely and interesting expirience when participating in one of her classes. Before you prepare the meals you take a 150m walk to a market in which chef lee shows which produce is better for you and what is fake. we then go back to the very clean kitchen/s and start preparing our meals. overall and amazing experience.
Best cooking experience I have ever made. ChefLeeZ is a very charming and wonderful woman, who knows to entertain people. The meals tasted delicious and I had so much fun the whole time.

We loved Chef LeeZ! . This was the first ever cooking class my partner and I have attended and we absolutely loved it. Chef LeeZ and the other members of staff were wonderful and explained everything in lots of detail and made sure we knew exactly what to do and answered all our questions. We made so many dishes including starters, mains and desserts. The tour around the market was great and Chef LeeZ explained all the different flavours and went into detail about the markets and its history which was a nice bonus. We got given all the recipes and instructions to take which is great as we would never have remembered everything! would absolutely recommend Chef LeeZ as it was genuine Thai food and was taught well and in detail! Would definitely return!

Well spent money. Ched LeeZ cooking class was very good and we got to try a lot of different recipies. That was also the only drawback from my point of view. So many to try and so many that therefore went away from my memory...

A good authentic cooking experience. Great experience and a must have for those loving the thai cuisine.Chef Leez really gives an authentic feeling and experience although she is rated no. 1 in TripAdvisor (I found these to feel very touristic many times). The tour to the market was really nice as she explained everything and had a good sense of humour throughout the walk. The class itself was very nice. The food and cooking felt really fresh and healthy.

Awesome. I would recommend this class to everyone. Lee is incredible and has a wonderful staff. After a market visit we prepared plenty of dishes. The only 'downside' is that you judge all dishes that you get afterwards by the high standards set by Lee.

Honestly the BEST Pad Thai in Bankok. Came here because of the reviews on Trip Advisor and my partner and I had a great time. The class size was very full that day. We had 12 in our morning class, 10 adults and 2 kids. Even though the class size was big Chef Leez was able to make sure that everyone was able to cook. I don't know if I will ever make the dishes here at home, but I loved seeing how my favorite dishes were made. All the dishes were delicious. I can honestly say the dishes you will make will probably be the best food you will ever eat in Bankok. It s that good. This is my first cooking class and I really enjoyed it.

Great Morning Class. Spent a morning with Chef Leez who looked after our cool little group. Whilst Chef makes you relaxed and focused on the food this is a pretty slick operation with a well executed programme that takes you through a number of classic Thai dishes. The day started off with a market visit and ended with tasting and and recipes. Leez's team were keen to help and made the whole activity very enjoyable!

Fantastic . Having traveled to Bangkok well over a baker's dozen times, this is by far the best experience I have had here. Chef Leez is so warm, funny and passionate about her job there is no possible way you can't enjoy yourself.The dishes we made were simple, clean and delicious. She explains so much but with simplicity and a warm smile. I could explain more but without a doubt this a great way to explore Thai culture and cuisines. Worth the time and priceless value. Thank you again Chef Leez for a wonderful day and long lasting great memory. Cheers, Grand Pa

Super fun Thai cooking classes!. Seriously impressed with Chef Leez and her fantastic cooking class. She is one of the most sweet, kind and passionate women, who truly loves what she does. Her enthusiasm is infectious. We started with a trip to the local markets, seeking out the freshest, tastiest ingredients. The first dish was a two versions of tom yum, one clear and one creamy. Then we whipped up a delicious pad thai that was so light and fresh, putting anything at your local thai resto to shame. Following that was an introduction to curries and the small tweaks needed to make a red, green, penang or mussuman curry. We made two versions of mussuman, one with beef and one with prawns. Then the boys got stuck into cooking up the green curry and chicken fried with basil. All seriously delicious! Finally we made a quick light and fresh papaya green salad with a proper kick of heat. A sticky rice and mango dessert helped cool our hot mouths down. The thing I liked most was Chef Leez's insistence on using the most pure ingredients, and using as much of each thing as possible (prawn brains to make vibrant red oils that added so much flavour to our soups) she really believes in minimising waste and cooking as economically as possible without sacrificing flavour. Highly recommended. You will not regret joining one of Chef Leez's fantastic classes. The food may well be the best you eat on your trip to Bangkok.

100% must see in Bangkok. By far it was the best experience in Bangkok. Chef Leez is great teacher, apart from just cooking food on your own, you get to know a lot about ingredients you use (even what to replace them with in your home country!). Food was delicious, although we had no previous experience with Thai food. All the recipes are printed out for you and we are definitely going to try them at home. Don't eat to much on breakfast, you get to eat all you cook ;) ขอขอบคุณ!

Unforgettable experience!. She is smiling, she's is funny and above all she's is a great Chef! I really liked that experience, taught by a great person, with a excellent english, fresh ingredients and complete kitchen near Khao San Road Street. I made 7 unforgettable dishes whose kept on my mind till nowadays.I recommend Chef Leez!

Authentic Thai cooking for tourists, "just like grandma!". Chef LeeZ Cooking Class is a must for anyone who enjoys Thai food. My boyfriend and I took part in the group class and, so far, it is one of the highlights of our trip. We both felt like it was definitely geared towards tourists (nothing challenging or advanced), but that's not a bad thing! You get to make (and eat) delicious food and Chef Lee is a very fun teacher. It's a great experience for the money; one we'd be happy to do again.To begin with, getting to the school is very easy as it is on a main road. Follow Chef Lee's instructions for taking a taxi (provided on her website!) and it will not cost more than 100 baht (less than $3.00 each way).The class starts with a trip to a local market, which was a great experience all by itself. The market was located down an alley; definitely a place tourists don't wander on their own! Chef Lee takes the class around, explaining popular Thai ingredients and how to tell with ones are the best ("is beautiful, but is not healthy!") It's a lot of fun to watch Chef Lee interact with the vendors, who obviously know her well.Once back in the classroom, we were given a whirlwind of instruction, covering eight dishes in under four hours. You do spend some time watching Chef Lee or other students, as the group class has more students than it does cooking stations. However, this was not a problem for my boyfriend and me because it meant one of us could learn, watch, even take pictures while the other one cooked. You get to eat everything you make and Chef Lee provides all of the recipes as well.Overall, I think this is a GREAT class for the price. I wouldn't have minded more hands on cooking, but I feel like I got a little experience prepping and cooking. Chef Lee also answers any questions you have--take advantage of that! We would consider taking a semi-private class next trip, just to get more hands on experience with Chef Lee.

Food Glorious Food. A wonderful 4 hours spent with Chef Lee and her hard-working staff. Easily one of the highlights of our visit to BKK. More than cooking too, a bit of culture and health advice. This was brilliant!! "Papa" and "Grandma". Be warned DO NOT eat breakfast!!!

Nash family cook Thai. Me and my family took part in one of chef leez group classes and it was brilliant. My 2 kids (10 & 12) really enjoyed making all the different dishes. For me the best was the pad thai and the green curry, best food we have eaten in Bangkok. Chef Leez is a brilliant instructor, warm, very funny and knowledgeable. I can highly recommend this for a day in bangkok.

A must while in Bangkok!!. As part of our honeymoon to Thailand we wanted to taste and learn about 'real' Thai food. Chef LeeZ surpassed our expectations! The market trip was a real eye opener and learning how to prepare delicious food we could prepare at home. A definite must when in Bangkok!!!!

Makes me rethink all the bad Thai food I have eaten!. The most wonderful educational class, from the tips on how to judge good quality products and produce to how to tell what to buy in the markets, the class was fabulous. The instructions on the actual preparation were excellent as well. Everything tasted magical. Also, Chef Lee is very sensitive to people's different reactions to spice level and helps you make your food the way you are going to like it.
Great fun , yummy . Chef leez is super cute . This is a great value lesson and a trip to the market . So much fun . You learn to make several curries , Tom yum and Tom Ka soup .

Chef Leez. Awesome cooking with Chef LeeZ!!! She is an excellent teacher who could quickly see who could handle themselves and who needed extra help. In the end we all created (and ate) a real Thai 5 course dinner. If nothing else a great four hours of eating. But for those paying attention a fantastic primer on making the basis of Thai food: four curry pastes, infused Thai fish oil, and Pad Thai sauce. Superb!

Inspiring. Friendly and funny Chef Lee, who seems to have a huge interest in and knowledge of food all around the world. The menu of the day is set, but when we asked if we could make one soup in addition, it was no problem. Great tastes that inspired me to making the dishes at home. She had a couple of women working for her, who were cutting our vegetables, dishwashing and cleaning. Wish we did more of the cutting and preparing ourselves, for the learning, but all in all an inspiring experience.

thai master chef and great teacher. Starting with a walk through a hidden local produce market chef Lee teaches on what to buy, how to choose the best products and how to cook a number of dishes during a 4 hour fun filled event. No processed foods, no msg and no chemical ingredients allowed in her kitchen, best morning ever!

Quality. If you're looking for a Chef who REALLY knows how to cook authentic Thai dishes, then this is the place. Chef will instruct you how to make the best dishes without any shortcuts. Highly recommend.

Great way to spend time in Bangkok. Chef Lee gives you both a fantastic understanding of Thai food and cooking and an insight into the local market. Making your own coconut cream & milk and tasting the difference between that & the "ready made" is the perfect start to the cooking session & it just keeps getting better from there. You make soup, 2 different curries, Pad Thai, stir fry & mango & sticky rice eating each dish as you make it. Can't wait to get home & make the dishes myself- the only downside? Haven't had any food as good during the rest of our Thailand trip. Thank you Chef Lee for a great day.

Thai Cooking Made Simple. Thanks to Chef LeeZ, I now have a better understanding of how to procure and prepare the basic ingredients in cooking Pad Thai, Tom Yum Soup, Beef/Chicken Curry and many more.

Best Cooking class ever. Don't hesitate, just book it!Chef Lee is fantastic! She teaches you everything to watch out for and with 4(!) assistants she makes sure everything goes smooth and even the worst cook will make fabulous dishes. Cooking will never be the same for me as I learned so much. The food we made was better than any Thai food, no sorry, any food I've been tasted before which includes a number of 1 star Michelin restaurants.

Worth the time and money!!. We had a great experience with Chef LeeZ. She was instructive and entertaining! This was a great way to experience Thai food. The class was dynamic, interactive and delicious. Tom Kha soup wasn't on the original menu for the day, but when I asked if she could include it, it was no problem. She was really great about teaching us the what goes in to the dishes as well as how to prepare them. Thanks again Chef!
Fun and learn. We went to learn how to cook Thai food. Not only did we learn, but had fun doing it. She is the best.

Very good way to end our trip. Chef Leez was awesome she really shows how to it only prepare the food but to shop for the ingredients. We had a blast. We already recommended some friends who are in Bangkok to try her class.

Good fun for a couple. Great cooking class, good solid information from a knowledgeable chef. Small class, 8 during our visit, great teacher-student time. Class is fast moving, very efficient use of time. Make sure to show up hungry, you eat your creations. Plenty of bottled water provided.

Best of Bangkok. We went as part of our honeymoon, and we couldn't be more pleased. Chef Leez not only teaches you Thai dishes, she educates on Thai food in general. We would recommend you take her class early in the trip because she gives some great advice. Food is great too!

Much more than a cooking class!!!!. Chef Leez cooking class goes above and beyond just learning Thai recipes. She is a funny, charismatic, very proud Thai who loves her culture and food!! From the market walk and tour to learning about Thai culture and its ingredients Chef Leez educated the class so much in such a fun and personable way!! The food we made was the real deal authentic, made from scratch Thai, just like her Grandma used to make!! My wife and I are huge foodies (part of the reason we were honeymooning in Thailand!!) and we were thrilled about what we had learned and what we will take home!! Her class room and staff were great and the end result, the food!!!!! was again simply delicious!! If you are a foodie travelling in Bangkok then make it to Chef Leez for an afternoon, you will be amazed!! Thank you Chef!!

Cooking class in Bangkok. I decided to take a cooking class with Chef Leez since I have done all the sightseeing the last trip to Bangkok, and it was a blast! Chef Leez took us to the market to shop for few ingredients for the class. She also showed us what to buy and not to buy. She tried to use everything organic in her cooking. We has a good time learning the basic recipes like tom yum soup, papaya salad, curry paste, tom yum paste, mango sticky rice, and few more dishes. There were so much food! Chef Leez is a very good teacher, she really teaches from the heart, and it shows how much she enjoys cooking and teaching. She shows us so much tips and tricks that we can use back home. I really recommend this class!

Excellent from start to finish!!!. This is the #1 cooking school in Bangkok for a reason. Chef Lee, thank you SO much for educating us, making us laugh and teaching us how to cook the best Thai food we've tasted over the last 3 weeks in Thailand. We've learnt so much and can't wait to get cooking when we get back home.
Fun and educational. Chef Lee did a great job making her Thai cooking class fun. She taught us a lot about culture, food, and cooking. The facilities were great with WiFi and ac. A great time.

Best food found here!. I enjoyed my 4 hours in here. At the beginning I had a bit of a hard time understanding whatever she is saying but after a few minutes I've adjusted. And yes she is funny.We stayed for 4 days in Bangkok and the best food I've tasted in here in this cooking school! The Pad Thai is the best tasting so fresh and much better in every way than you would fine elsewhere. I wanted more! The chili paste we made was surprisingly delicious I didn't want to eat it when she made it into a sandwich spread but I didn't want to be a killjoy and took a bite and was I ever surprised. I wanted to ask more. Everything we cooked was delicous! I love the tips she shared. Good thing I took notes. I want to go back if we ever go back to Thailand. I understand how some people could be offended by some of the things she said about restaurants or the taxi drivers but she's just stating facts so im ok with that. I actually appreciate the honesty though it could use some better choice of words to prevent offending other people. Thanks Chef Lee and May 21 class I enjoyed the class with you.

The good and the bad. Although we arrived late, Chef Leez's assistant had no problem escorting us to the nearby market where the rest of the class was out shopping for the lesson's meals. We walked to the market where we were met by Chef Leez who was enthusiastically describing all the items she was purchasing. She gave a lot of tips regarding what to buy and what to stay away from. It was obvious she cared about the quality and health of all her ingredients. When it came time to cook, we all paired with our companions and we each got a turn to cook. We were given aprons and a recipe book to guide us as we followed her. All of the dishes we made were delicious. I'm not used to shrimp paste as I have an aversion to cooking with shrimp brains and such, but it was surprisingly tasty when she spread it on a piece of bread. My favorite was the sticky rice topped with mango slices and coconut milk. Chef Leez, if you're reading this, I didn't appreciate the black joke that you made that day. You said that during one summer, you tanned a lot and your family made fun of you for it. You also said that it made you look ugly. I saw in your eyes the moment you realized what you said when you looked at me and my husband and said "Oh, but not you! You're beautiful!" I'm not offended in the least, but saying things like that is rude. Nonetheless, I had a great time and enjoyed myself so much that I bought one of Chef Leez's aprons as a souvenir. Unfortunately, I ended up with the runs a half hour upon leaving the class. I suppose shrimp paste doesn't agree with me after all.

Not Just a Cooking Class. This class was highly recommended by a friend and it met all expectations. The location is easy to find, but allow 30-40 min of standing in traffic if you are coming from Sukhumvit 11 (Nana station). I would recommend getting a metered taxi for it. DON'T TAKE A TUK TUK! The class starts by going to the market to pick out the ingredients you'll use for the day. Chef LeeZ does a fantastic job of educating the students on what high-quality vs. ordinary/cheap ingredients are. This by itself was great to hear and made the class worth the little bit of a premium. Next you cook a series of traditional Thai dishes. Luckily we cooked all of my favorite - tom yum goon, green curry, masaman curry, and sticky rice mango. Chef Leez is quite funny, but I think it's a function of how many people get her jokes - I was the only one laughing in my class...The class starts promptly at 10am and ends at 2pm and she makes sure you have a reliable way to get to your next destination.

Chef LeeZ Thai Cooking Class on June 16. My husband and I love Thai food very much and attended Chef LeeZ cooking class on June 16 while we were holidaying in Thai. I goggled and found the review for Chef LeeZ were great and decided to reserve 2 seats. I was glad I made the decision to attend her cooking lessons because it was a great experience and we had learnt so much. The dishes she thought was not only authentic but delicious too. Most of her recipes do not have any MSG, oyster sauce and using all natural ingredients. The coconut sugar she used for all dishes tasted so great and you will not be able to get it from outside store! This is one of the MUST VISIT place should you be in Thailand the next round!!

Incredible.. I had my first cooking class today and it couldn't be better.Even the unbelievable reviews couldn't prepare me for how fantastic today's session would be. Chef Lee is an incredible person, so much humour and passion for teaching others the art of Thai cooking. I could write for hours for how fantastic, well organised and delicious it was.Truly a highlight of my trip to Thailand and would say it is a must do for anyone near Bangkok.Thank you Chef Lee, I'll be back!

a warm experience complete with delicious food!. Chef Lee was super welcoming and patient. She explained everything clearly - including why we were buying certain things at the market around the corner from the cooking school. The food was simple, healthy, and delicious, and the recipes are easy to replicate at home (if you can find the ingredients). Pricey but worth it. She even went out of her way to make lemongrass tea and provide charcoal tablets for a fellow student's husband, who was back in their hotel room with a bad case of food poisoning... Believe the hype!!

Super Fun Class. This class was a great use of our time in Thailand. Chef LeeZ was a great teacher, a great communicator and just super fun. I felt like I learned so much about Thai cooking! The food was amazing too. This was definitely worth the money.

The highlight of any stay in bangkok. We've been to bangkok a few times and always meant to go on a Thai cookery course and this time we finally made it and what a cracker of a course it was. Chef LeeZ was fantastic. She was incredibly informative about everything that went into the making of the various Thai dishes that we prepared. I can't recommend the class highly enough and it should be on everybody's itinerary.....also, chef LeeZ, you should be charging more for these classes, you really are worth it and thanks for an amazing day.

Best day ever. Booked this trip based upon TA reviews and this turned out to be the highlight of our Bangkok mini break. Loved the whole experience. Chef LeeZ is very friendly, professional and talented chef. The group size was perfect, we had about 13 people in the class but we all had our own cooking station and got to prepare all the 12 dishes during the session. Loved every second of the day and can not recommend this enough you will pick up some great tips on how to prepare and cook Thai food and get to eat all owe lovely dishes you create in class. BOOK IT!

Great fun, Thai food basic knowledge. Great 4hr cooking class limited to 12 people. A short walk to a local produce market to pick up ingredients sets the tone for this enjoyable cooking course.  Make your own coconut cream and milk ( not that inferior processed stuff from the supermarket shelf) thai curry pastes from scratch, simple stir fried dishes, pad thai , kaprow gai. The shrimp oil method and the Tom yam paste was extremely interesting. Well worth the time and effort..... !

OMG!!!!!!!! A must do!. This has to be one of the top highlights of our trip. We arrived in Bangkok around 6am, and were dead tried. We called to see if we could change the class reservation to the next day. Chef Leez was more then accommodating and changed it. We arrived and had an over view of what the days plan was going to be. Next we went to the market and picked all our fresh produce and meats. Once back in the kitchen we started cooking. Chef Leez made sure everybody was hands on and sure everyone had fun. We cooked around seven dishes that we ate right after. Everybody cooked and everybody ate, and What a sense of humor Chef has.(Never a dull time) We learned a lot, and the food was great.

I learned so much!. Chef Leez is a true teacher. She made sure we understood not just how to do certain things, but why. The trip to the market was fun and very interesting. The food was probably some of the best we had while in Thailand.

Outstanding Class & Best Day in Bangkok. I recently traveled to Bangkok with family. I had been before but my mother had never, so I wanted to show her the sights, as well as arrange some fun activities for us. I found Chef Leez quickly online because it had received so many wonderful reviews, and I wondered, "can it be THAT good?' Well, the simple answer is YES! We signed up for a 4-hour cooking class and arrived to the classroom around 10am. We were invited in to a clean and organized cooking area, and Chef Leez wasted no time jumping right in to our day of cooking. We took a trip to a local, hidden market where we purchased fresh ingredients and got to see the where the locals shop. (A great opportunity for photographs of local produce and seafood, meat, etc). We headed back to class and began cooking up over seven dishes which we were able to sample after we cooked. Real, authentic, fresh meals. We made coconut milk and cream by hand, no canned or packaged stuff here. Chef Leez is all about the real deal, no artificial ingredients or MSG. She wants you to know where the flavor comes from and puts real heart into her work. She is a dynamic, funny, engaging and informative teacher. We learned so much but we had so much fun! If you are looking for a cooking class in Bangkok, seriously, look no further! This was hands down my best experience in Bangkok and a great way for me to show my mum more of Thailand.

Fantastic culinary experience with a dose of humour. I've been to Bangkok many times and chose to do a cooking class this time round for a new experience. Overall an excellent decision and most definitely a good 4 hours well spent! Chef Lee is friendly, very knowledgeable and most importantly, FUNNY, which made the class very entertaining and memorable. My class was made up of a total of 6 people, which was just right. The class schedule of activities was well organized, and the sequence and transition from one activity/dish to another was smooth and efficient, kudos to help from her assistants. All dishes cooked were delicious, and Chef Lee was flexible and taught us to cook another curry dish that one of the participants had requested.Will definitely recommend to all who are interested in thai cuisine :) "Grandma not lazy!" - Chef Lee, on her work ethic in the kitchen

Fantastic... The best cooking course that we have attended. The class size was spot on. Chef Leez is extremely knowledgeable and makes the class so much fun. Can't speak highly enough of school and staff. Thanks for making us feel so welcome and for looking after us. Can't wait to try the recipes at home. Mike & Bianca

Make sure you dont have breakfast!!!!. we were only in Bangkok for 3 nights and this has to be the best activity we did on our trip. we were the first to arrive and were met by Chef Leez....we weren't too sure what to expect but soon after the class started. we were taken to a local market (very local and basic) which was a short walk away where we learnt about fresh produce versus the crap we are fed in restaurants. chef was very keen to get the message of fresh healthy eating across. we returned to find that her assistants had prepared our station with different ingredients for the various dishes we were going to make. we made so many dishes and had difficulty finishing it all off. the class was fun, informative and a great way to learn the basics to most of the Thai cuisine. if you have an afternoon or morning spare this is a great thing to do...allow upto 5 hours for the whole experience.

👍🏻 . First up, would like to thank Trip Advisor for the recommendation as I was googling for activities to do in Bangkok. I've been to BKK for the umpteenth time & was really looking for something special instead of the usual eat, shop, massage. It was such a fruitful session & hence, I'm giving my first review on TA to this class. The 4hour group session with Chef LeeZ, her kitchen helpers & my classmates were very well spent. We had so much fun visiting the local market, learning about fresh produce as well as how to prepare some cool local dishes. Chef LeeZ or sometimes known as grandma is a super hip lady who reminded me about one of my late Home Econs teacher from Secondary school. The lesson was well planned, well executed & well paced. You're free to take photos, videos etc. at anytime - it really caters to people like me who find it a great challenge retaining information. A handout of things to note & recipes will be compiled & given to every student. I went with my hubs but not to worry if you're a solo traveller or wish to have fun learning with a group of friends.. At the end of the day, you'll leave her cooking school with an awesome experience of cooking the Thai way & perhaps even got acquainted with some new mates from all over the world - Philippines, Aussie, Austrians, Singaporeans etc.

Every bit as good as suggested in TA. Spent four fabulous hours with Chef LeeZ yesterday and came away in awe of this woman, her passion, her joie de vivre, & her infectious commitment to making something like this so much fun. Class size was 7, looks like 8 would be about it comfortably, and Chef, with her ever-obliging team, strike a perfect balance between making you do some prep work and cooking without going through every knife-stroke and setup chore. I honestly didn't know how we'd get everything done suggested on the menu; 3 soups, 3 curries, green papaya salad and stick rice with mango after learning how to prep the basic pastes for soup and curry. Fantastic. Two men who fancied themselves at cooking and a complete rookie who never picked up a spatula in his life, had a ball in a mixed class.Would absolutely return to Chef's class on my next inbound. After two hours - halfway in - my head was spinning and belly filling with the best-tasting Thai food I've ever eaten, period. This woman outshines ever Barefoot Contessa, Giada or Emeril TV show you've ever seen with the perfect blend of humor and skill; she should be syndicated!Go Grandma go...from the chili addicts at the end of the room!!!

Great Value and an Unforgettable Experience . Chef Lee is a very funny lady! Our visit to the local market to buy fresh ingredients was an intimate experience of Bangkok that you wouldn't have unless you were a local. Chef Lee often referred to how to do things the authentic way without using preservatives or processed ingredients, just fresh fresh fresh. We 'experienced' the creation of so many dishes rather than actually cooking them all, that is, we had a bit of help with the preparation, otherwise you just couldn't create all of those dishes in 4 hours. But we covered enough detail to do it ourselves at home subject to equipment and ingredients being available. It was great to eat mangoes in May! I highly recommend this cooking class.

Amazing Food, Amazing Experience. If you're visiting Bangkok for more than a couple of days and are interested in Thai food or cooking, I'd consider this cooking class a must. Chef Leez is very entertaining and knowledgeable and leads you through the preparation of 5-10 traditional Thai dishes. The food we cooked ended up being some of the best we'd eaten all trip. Come hungry!

Best coming school. A must for Thai food lovers. This was the best coming school I've done. We learnt so much about Thai cooking thanks to chef leez's informative and entertaining teaching. Chef Leez just teach recipes, she teaches you about the benefits of fresh produce, the pitfalls of Thai restaurants and the dangers of MSG and more. I loved that we made our own fresh coconut milk and got to compare it to packet milk to compare the difference. It was booked out on the morning we wanted but Chef Leez kindly fitted us in to a special afternoon class. It was only me and my wife and one other person. Can't wait to get home and start cooking!

Great experience! Excellent Grandma!. We had a cooking class yesterday with Chef LeeZ. It is an amazing experience! Really love the food, the atmosphere, the fun and the Chef! Highly recommend it to all the people visiting Bangkok for leisure holiday! The food we made is the best in our trip!

Necessary and Unforgettable. The experience at Chef LeeZ Thai Cooking Class in Bangkok was amazing! It was totally necessary to complete our trip. You go your whole stay eating all of these foods and even having tried them back home - but learning about the ingredients and the way to make the dishes was phenomenal. She does it in a way that is easy to do and remember, while still being delicious and authentic. Chef Lee takes a lot of pride in her class and is very knowledgeable. I highly, highly recommend this course for an unforgettable experience.She also has an amazing staff who is very helpful.

Fun and informative!. I had a great time at chef leez. We get to shop for ingredients at the nearby market and given lessons on how to spot good quality produce and bad onesOnce back in the "classroom", we were taught how to prepare the recipes step by step and some tricks as well! Chef Leez has a very warm personality and I felt like I've known her for years. Did not regret signing up one bit! I can now go home and cook classic Thai dishes with confidence and know that these dishes are not only authentic but healthy as well!

Great Introduction to Thai Cuisine. Chef Leez is an amazing teacher. She's quirky and informative, which made the whole learning process easy and fun. We glad we did this in the beginning of our time in Thailand to know what classic Thai cuisines really taste like without all the artificial flavorings. We highly recommend Chef Leez!-Josh-

Best part of my trip. Chef Leez was very accommodating to our schedule, we had a flight to catch in the early afternoon and we were able to attend the class earlier than scheduled. The class was very fun and informative. We learned about how the different curries are made and how coconut and tamarind are used in a lot of bases for Thai food. We also learned about what to look for when looking for ingredients (during our market tour), she promoted healthy eating and to not take shortcuts when performing the food. She is also very funny, "same same, but different" :D

Multifaceted experience. We loved our few hours at Chef Leez cooking class.Lee herself is just full of life, and the sort of people-oriented outlook which would make it impossible not to like her.We cooked (well assisted with the cooking of) a 7 course meal. Lee has a couple of helpers who do much of the preparation, and that made the whole process that much easier. My wife is a very good cook, and this was a great experience for her, and she picked up a few handy tips. I just had fun!The other element which i really liked was that Lee has a "charity" which supports disadvantaged kids. Lee is obviously successful in her filed, and that she is putting her success to the benefit of others is very laudable.If you are looking for a fun cooking school experience in Bangkok you could do far worse that going to see Chef Lee.

Excellent 'Grandma' teacher. Started from the market, taught us how to avoid 'artificial' lime and coconut milk etc. All dishes were prepared from natural stuffs and absolutely no MSG, they were delicious even though they were cooked by an outsider like me. Should reserve your places early, though you may need to contact 'Grandma' for the exact location in case the taxi driver unable to find the exact location.

Amazing. Indeed an amazing time. It was my highlight in Bangkok for sure. What could be more fun then learning and creating a 10 course meal? The authentic flavors were amazing as was the class. Just plain fun!

Absolute treat . Chef Leez is absolutely brilliant she is warm , welcoming , has a great sense of humour and is really informative, the visit to the local market and her explanation of various products was great , the cooking class was one if the best I have ever done, thank you for offering me to try Durian it was my first time , I've been inspired to cook some great food now

Fun and Informative. My wife, 10 year old daughter and I did the 4 hour course starting at 10. I was a bit concerned about the number of people on the course, 13, but it didn't turn out to be a problem with more than enough cooking for us.We cooked and ate all the dishes described in the course, I was surprised how simple the dishes seemed but then again I haven't tried to make them on my own.What makes the course so good is Chef Leez, a larger than life character. Always in good humour, making jokes and chatting away. I think she may have been toning herself down on account of my daughter. I think everyone enjoyed the course.

Best cooking class. I tried three different Thai cooking classes during my recent holiday in Bangkok, and Chef LeeZ delivered way beyond my expectations. She is a true professional and I particularly appreciate her integrity, which extends to her cooking philosophy: healthy and authentic cooking. We did everything from scratch -- no instant or prepared sauces; but she does give options and alternatives particularly for those who live in countries where the ingredients are not readily available. Her classes are definitely value for money. She presents 8 to 9 dishes for the three-hour class, compared to four dishes of other classes. I will definitely take another class when I get back to Bangkok.
Fantastic entertainment. Looking for something a little different, I decided to give cooking with chef leez a try. Worth it, friendly staff and great food. Highly recommend.

Different & Fun. Well I was unable to get Chef Leez website to accept my credit card reservation so I just threw caution to the wind and showed up without a reservation. After all it is Thailand. I've actually been a student of Chef Leez from a previous visit to Thailand so I knew the lopes. I was not to be denied. Actually she had no students scheduled for her morning class. I was greeted warmly, paid my 1,900 baht tuition (approx. $61. USD) and received a private one-on-one class with Chef Leez. This is an educational as well as hands-on cooking experience in which students get to eat as much as they like of all food prepared. In addition Chef Leez leads a short field trip down to the local market to examine and discuss produce and talk with the merchants. Chef Leez speaks very good English so communication is not a problem. She offers an assortment of dishes to prepare during class that include appetizers, entrees and desserts. I returned to class a second time to understand more of the details as Thai food ingredients and preparation was all new to me. The results are delicious simple, fresh clean tastes that are much better than anything you find in the states. The only difficulty I suspect will be finding all the fresh ingredients which are prevalent all over Thailand. Chef Leez makes you feel welcome. Class is fun and interesting. Try it for something out of the ordinary.

Chef LeeZ Thai cooking class. My wife and I attended the cooking class 5th May this year.We really enjoyed it very much and learned different ways cooking Thai curries,sticky rice mango pudding,etc ....

Thai Cooking Made Easy. I decided to take this class based on reviews on TA and was not disappointed. Chef Leez is extremely knowledgeable and shared lots of tips and tricks to produce authentic Thai dishes. It was hard to believe the number of delicious dishes that we created in a short amount of time. One would expect a several day class in order to get through the number of dishes. Highly recommend

Best Thai food EVER...Chef Leez is awesome!. We decided to do a Thai cooking class while in Bangkok, and I could not be happier with our experience! Chef Leez is amazing! She speaks good English, she is funny, she references cooking with "grandma" a lot (her recipes are from her grandmother who used to own a restaurant), and she is focused on the best, healthiest, freshest ingredients! The trip to the local market (folks, this is a true local market...very small, no way you would ever find it on your own) was both informative and entertaining. The cooking class was very hands on, and Chef Leez took care to explain every ingredient. I am a terrible cook...really terrible...and even I was able to follow. However, I did manage to spill my food once and burn my hand on the wok (classic form for me - accident prone), and Chef Leez took care of me. She had some lotus cream that she put on my hand for the burn, and it was like it never even happened...I have been looking for that cream ever since! I am also glad that we took the class near the beginning of our trip...Chef Leez gave us some tips on what to wat h out for when eating street food...very helpful! Also, folks...I have to add...this was, by far, the BEST Thai food that I have ever had in my life!!!!!!!! No joke. Nothing we have had since then has compared. If not for the cooking, just go to eat!!! You will not regret it...definitely the highlight of our time in Bangkok. Thank you, Chef Leez!

Wow, I loved it!. Chef Leez is very much a teacher. She has so much knowledge of Thai cooking and a pleasant way of sharing her skills. We made so many dishes and learned how to interchange ingredients. I made a request to learn how to make steamed fish and Chef happily accommodated me. It was delicious! I enjoyed our trip to the market and would love to visit her again.

I love chef leeZ. Chef LeeZ was amazing, not only she introduced us to authentic Thai cuisine, she also shared with us her secret tricks on making healthy, non MSG and yummy Thai food. I had the best pad Thai, green curry and mango sticky rice that I have ever had! Note to the others, don't not eat too much before class, because u will be stuff with all the yummy food you made urself! Thank you Chef LeeZ, I will definitely be back for more class and looking forward to cooking these dishes at home

Great time, good value for your money.. Did the group class on Saturday, April 25, 2015. Chef Leez is the best Thai cooking class I attended out of three others. She runs a fun class and the food we made was outstanding. I would recommended her class to all my friends.

How to make Thai cooking easy and tasty. Very intersiting introduction to Thai products at local nearby market.Very good explanations given by Chef Leez in english, easy to understand even for me (I'm French)In only four hours, many recipes made (about 10 !).Already succesfully done again at home with congratulation from family and freindsTitle of "Best cooking class in Thaïland" is fully deservedTo recommend to all people keen on Thaï cookingMany thanks to Chef Leez !

Perfect cultural culinary experience in Bangkok. I did the cooking class with Chef Lee today and cannot recommend it enough. We cooked variety of dishes (6+) with Lee teaching and explaining every ingredient in each dish in great detail, patience and humour!Also, the Cooking School catered to every person's dietary requirements (I only eat seafood)A definite must do in Bangkok, a perfect experience. Thanks Lee!

Best foods in Bangkok. I've been 3 cooking classes in Bangkok, because i was planning to open a cooking class in Seoul,and this was the best place in taste. Chef Leez has a professional skill in cooking Thai food. She was really kind and helpful also. If you can choose only one place to learn cooking Thai food,i bet this is the place!

More than Better!. Leez is an excellent teacher! I learned a lot from her! The food was delicious and she treated us so patiently.... If I go back to Bangkok, for sure I'll visit her again. You must join this class if you really want to learn about Thailand cousine. It is worth!

Very organized Cooking Class, Tasty Thai Food. Chef LeeZ class is very effecient. You are able to cook/learn a lot in a short time. She tries to show you how to cook healthy Thai vs. using a lot of artificial products. I think it will be difficult to repeat some of the recipes due to the ingredients that we have available at home (would be nice to include potential substitutes...but I guess then not so authentic Thai). I would have liked ot hear more about the charity that she collects for/supports.

Highlight of Bangkok. Can't say enough about this fun, informative and tasty experience. My boyfriend and I signed up last minute and got the last two spots for the next mornings class luckily. We were the first to arrive and miss leez was very welcoming and friendly. I started feeling weak before the market trip due to pregnancy so as the rest of the group went off she had her assistants make me some lemongrass tea and rice. She was very caring and understanding and her english is great. She explains what to avoid in thai cooking and what to look for. I wish I had taken her class in the beginning of my trip so as to avoid many bad street food trials. We cooked all the dishes and they tasted amazing. The eating was definitely my favorite part of the class. She has perfect pace and answers any and all questions. She has a good sense of humor too which always makes a class more enjoyable. We made friends with the other students and at the end she gave us pointers on good quality places to eat. I wish she had her own restaurant! And she has a charity to help local kids who are orphaned to learn to cook and have school supplies. Wishing this cooking school all the success !!

Great food, excellent teacher, amazing time. Learning how to cook Thai dishes at Chef LeeZ was a great way to spend one morning in Bangkok, especially if you are a foodie! Make sure you skip breakfast at all, because you will end up eating all the delicious dishes you prepare!

Amazing food. We attended classes at Chef LeeZ last May. Best value for time and dollars spent. I learned so much. She simplifys the whole process from shopping to tasting. Since then I have been able to serve our friends amazing Thai food dishes. My husband and I think this was one of the highlights of our time in Thailand.

Morning well spent. The place is small, but everything is very well organized and clean. After a short introduction we left to a nearby market, where we bought most of the ingredients that we used later on for the cooking. Chef Leez explained a lot about the different ingredients and gave us hints about what is good and what is not.After the market trip we went right hands on and started to cook following Chef Leez´s intructions, after which we got to eat what we just cooked. Along with Chef Leez there were 2 more women helping out all the time with all the preps and keeping everything clean.I found Chef Leez training informative and fun and I definitely enjoyed the morning I spent with the rest of the attendees at the cooking school.

A must go for anyone visiting Bangkok. We found the cooking experience to be informative, enjoyable, clean and well organised from the time we stepped in the door. Chef LeeZ is an enjoyable and humerous teacher. And the food is beyond fantastic. Every meal was just exquisite. The visit to the local market was educational not only for here but also for when you go home - you will have a better understanding of what to get when you go to the market. Chef LeeZ's willingness to share her knowledge and her passion and commitment to the participants is to be commended. This is the number one to do activity when you come to Bangkok. PS3 you will not walk out hungry.
Amazing!. A really good cooking class in which we learned a lot of dishes and had a lot of fun! We had a great morning!

Enjoyable-Authentic Thai Cooking Day. Go hungry to the class. Don't eat breakfast. The cab driver wasn't sure where to drop us, but the directions given on the website helped us find the location. Once inside we meet a few other classmates, which made for nice conversation in the class. A trip to an indoor market, I admit I would never go to on my own, provided an added cultural visit. Then back to the class where we washed and began cooking. We made soup and ate, then curry ate, then desert. More eating than cooking it seemed, but I'm not complaining. We left with recipes and full bellies. Enjoyable day.

Go with an empty stomach. Totally worth the time and money. Every dish is absolutely delicious and the cooking part is very fun. The correspondence before the class includes directions and some great advice. Chef Lee is very friendly, patient, and fun.The market trip is interesting because it is a very local market where you don't see any foreigners.Everything you cook is quiet healthy as well, she also takes the time to explain about some of the unhealthy options you shouldn't get.I recommend you go with an empty stomach as you end up eating a lot of food and all of it so yummy!!! I went with my boyfriend and there was another couple and a girl by herself, so only 5 of us in the class :) As a couple, some of the ingredients and dishes were shared between the two of us, and the girl that was alone had the same portions we had to herself. At first I also wanted my own of everything bc i didnt want to miss out, but trust me, it was better that way. We only shared a few dishes anyway and I'm very glad as it was a lot of food at the end. The girl couldn't finish most of the dishes.I'm writing this 2 hours after we finished and I'm still full. Highly recommend this if you are in Bangkok.

A fun experience !. Lots of learning and fun with chef leez both at the market and in the classroom ! We finished the class more than full, understanding better all the flavors of thai cuisine.... and ready for a good nap :-)

Fantastic experience!! I would do it again in a heartbeat.. The cooking class starts at 10 am and ends around 2 pm, and I enjoyed every moment! Chef Leez started the class by giving a quick guide to the ingredients, then she took us to a local market to shop for the essentials. Each of us was given a basket to put in our newly-acquired groceries. The class learned how to cook some of the most popular Thai dishes, such as Tom Yum soup, Pad Thai, Green Curry, Green Papaya Salad, and Sticky Rice Mango. And we got to devour our own creations after…….and really, these are the best Thai food I’ve had in my life!Chef Leez is committed to keep the traditional Thai recipes alive, and she is willing to share her secrets with us curious foreigners. She is also an advocate for using fresh products untainted by chemicals, and she taught the class how to differentiate between the artificial and the natural. Chef Leez is also a lovely lady. After class, she walked us out and even helped us hail a cab All in all, an amazing experience. Highly recommended for tourists who love authentic Thai food, especially couples who are looking for a fresh experience together in Bangkok!

Brilliant day. A fantastic day - we went to the market to buy our produce and then Chef Lee talked us through each dish and we made (and ate!) the dished ourselves. I feel like I've got a bit more knowledge around Thai ingredients and cooking techniques and left very full and happy!

Excellent - Cook and eat it too!!. If you love Thai food, this is an excellent place to learn the tricks and nuances from an expert cook and trainer. Once you have done this course you also be able to differentiate between the 'good' and the 'not so good' Thai food.I was planning to do a Thai cooking class for long time and signed up for this course based on reviews. I joined the class on the Chinese new year holiday and I thoroughly enjoyed the experience of cooking and sampling our creations. Chef Leez is a great cooking coach and gives adequate attention to both experts and novices in her class. She also passes on a lot of cooking wisdom that she has acquired from her grand parents as well her own experience.

Fantastic Class. My wife and I attended on Feb 20 and had a fantastic time. Chef Lee is very knowledgeable, a great speaker and teacher, and funny to boot. Our request to substitute seafood for the meat dishes was easily met, and we were both extremely satisfied with the class.

great day with great information. This was one of our best days in Bangkok! Chef Leez made it so much fun!! My husband doesn't even cook and he had a great time! Learning to cook was just a added bonus!

Enjoyable half day, time well spent. Thoroughly enjoyed this light hearted, fun, but informative morning in Bangkok with Chef Lee. A quick tour of a very local market, followed by energetic, fast, fun cooking in spotlessly clean kitchen, with plenty to eat too (about 12 dishes! So don't eat breakfast first)

Fun Time, Fabulous Food, Memorabe Day. We will remember Chef LeeZ as a highlight of our trip to Thailand. It's amazing how much learning, fun and good eating she packs into 4 hours. First off to the fresh market around the corner and down an alley, then back to the spotless kitchen. It was delightful learning how to cook with new fresh ingredients and then eating each dish after it was prepared. Chef LeeZ has a perfect personality for this business - knowledgeable, organized, fun, fun, fun. We highly recommend Chef LeeZ and will go back to her school for another class if we ever have the pleasure of being back in Bangkok.

An experience of a lifetime. Chef LeeZ Thai Cooking School was an unbelievably fantastic experience for my family and I. Not only does Chef LeeZ teach you to make some of the most amazing and delicious Thai food, but she also shows you how to get the best ingredients for your meals. She makes it a family friendly experience with a lot of love and caring to which you can tell she dedicates her services to. She teaches you techniques and family secrets that only a Grandma and Grandpa would show you. She also does a wonderful job of involving the youngest of chefs, as she did with our two daughters (8 & 6 years old). Our daughters were amazed that they were able to prepare Thai food that even they wanted to eat! By far, the best cooking school experience I have ever had. One note of caution: you will never look at Thai food the same way. Chef Leez raises the bar to a 5 star experience! If our schedules permitted, I would attend Chef Leez Thai Cooking School again. She makes you feel right at home and what better way to do so with yummy Thai food!

Funny, fabulous day with great food!. We love Thai food and when we arrived in Bangkok one of the first things we looked to do was a cooking class. All the great reviews about Chef Leez are accurate. We learnt a lot about how to cook authentic Thai food in a funny and relaxed atmosphere. Learning about the local foods at the market and then having a very hands on lesson making all the dishes. Chef Leez was flexible in how she managed the group dynamics and made sure everyone got involved to make the most out of the day.Highly recommended!

FABULOUS TIME SPENT!!. So I'm very very late on writing this review. My apologies to Chef Lee. So here it goes! Whether or not you remember how to cook any of these dishes when you get back....this will be the most fantastic food your taste buds will enjoy your entire time in the city! Chef Lee is super funny and very informative. I took my class when I was there in December 2014. Fast forward to today. I'm going back to Bangkok in 12 days and I will most certainly be taking this class again. I have SO many questions now after coming home and trying to cook this stuff myself, but im eager to learn and she really knows her stuff.

The highlight of our trip. Attending Chez Lees' cooking class on the first day of our trip was the best way to start a wonderful 3 week adventure through Indochina. It gave us a fantastic insight into Thai food and culture which allowed us to more fully recognise and appreciate what we ate through the rest of our trip. We commend Chez Lees for so effectively sharing her knowledge and her passion for cooking. She is a delightful person who communicates clearly with infectious enthusiasm. You will come away feeling content that your time was well spent, full from the delicious food you prepared and ate, and inspired to create more yourself. Enjoy it!

Just Amazing!. I'm a private chef and I found this course to be far more educational than I expected. The instructor does know what she's talking about and creates extraordinary dishes with an impressive amount of knowledge. Her Tom Yam and Pad Thai, especially, are to die for. I've taken quite a few cooking classes and I can say this was the best one so far!

A meal to remember. This has got to be the best thai food I have ever had! All the ingredients are fresh and you really grow a fond appreciation for thai cuisine. Chef Leez has a great personality and deserves all the rave reviews that she gets. I am glad I made this part of my itinerary during my stay in Bangkok. It is something I will always remember.
Really fine experience. Our time with Lee was enjoyable, interesting and delicious! Lee is warm, charming and an excellent teacher. We would heartily recommend her cooking class!

Best day in Bangkok. We had little experience of Thai cooking - apart from eating it occasionally. Chef Lee gave us a crash course in the basics including taking us to a small local market for a tutorial on the raw ingredients and to buy the ones we would be cooking. In the space of 4-5 hours we had learned how to prepare and cook 8 classic dishes - and eat them. We had great fun and staggered away full at the end of it. We can't wait to start getting the recipes in the future. Only downside we now know how it should be done properly - and the short cuts and cost savings taken by many restaurants. So we may be less happy with what we are served in future.

Amazing chef and lots of cooking. We took a cooking class by chef Lee after reading the reviews and we were not disappointed.Chef Lee is amazing and a very fun instructor. She really has a passion for food and also showed the difference between real fresh ingredients and packaged substitutes.We covered many dishes and most staples of the Thai kitchen, at times it was maybe too fast but their claim that you learn as much as in three other classes rings true.For anyone trying to cook Thai I can recommend chef Lee

Great experience. I've done a thai cooking course before but this one had two of my favourite dishes - som tam and chicken with holy basil amongst others. I really enjoyed the course. The teacher was very convivial. She even showed me an extra recipe at the end ( stir fried morning glory ) and gave me a little takeaway for my hubby who didn't do the course. I recommend this course ,you'll have good fun and lots too eat. Some of the recipes we cooked didn't match what was written in the recipe sheet you get so pay attention and you'll get extra recipes.

Don't look any further! Go do this!. Highly recommend this cooking class.. local, honest and fresh produce turned into beautiful dishes and a fantastic chef who gives you, the student, her full attention! A must when visiting Bangkok! Thank you!

Definitely go cook with "Grandma"!. What a professional and well-orchestrated operation! Chef Leez is animated, funny, friendly, and very knowledgeable. She educates you through humor and stories while keeping the pace moving without anything feeling rushed. The course includes a trip to the market and a multitude of dishes that can also be made at home -- Chef educates you about ingredient options as she goes. Her staff are friendly; they operate smoothly in the background to keep everything moving and seem to be enjoying themselves, which adds to the enjoyment of the entire class. The whole crew works together smoothly to create a great experience. Highly recommended!

Excellent course. The course was fantastic. We learned so much about the right ingredients to use, were shown how to make 8 recipes (all my favourite dishes) and then got to eat them. Can't praise the course enough.

Great way to learn Thai cooking - So much fun. Chef Leez cooking school is great. She's on the first page of things to do for a reason. Chef Leez is very personable, funny, patient, and tells great stories to go along with the recipes she teaches. I had a day of free time and signed up the morning of the class. Luckily I got the last spot. It's only 8 people. I'm a guy and love to cook. I had an awesome time. After 3 weeks of eating amazing Thai food I wanted to take home knowledge to recreate some of my favorites. In just half a day Chef Leez shows you how to buy produce from a local market, tells you what to look for when buying seafood, what types of ingredients we can find at home that AREN'T fully processed with bad ingredients...Oh and the 8+ dishes of food we made from scratch too. Come hungry...basically you can skip breakfast and you'll leave with a huge smile, fully belly, authentic recipes, and the know-how to recreate them at home. Highly recommend if you like Thai food, like to cook, and want to bring home more than just pictures and trinkets for friends. Cook your friends at home one of the many dishes you will learn.

Good option. If your goal is to learn as many dishes in one shot, then this is your class. We enjoyed it and picked up a few things we didn't get from another course. The other reviews sum up the negatives. I would add that there's no vent to let the cooking smoke out, so the class remains stuffy. For me this meant a lot of coughing due to the peppers, etc we were cooking.
A Great Bangkok Experience. Fantastic. Uses traditional cooking methods..All natural and quality ingredients. The trip to the hidden market at the beginning was a highlight.Highly recommended

Great experience!. We were 6 people in class, which is just the perfect number for the size of the kitchen. We had a great time and learned a lot. One more time we learned that processed food or ingredients are not healthy... Every single dish we cooked was just delicious! There are only two little flaws: the price is quite high for what you expect in Thailand (1800B), but it is totally worth it. But more importantly you will be a lot more critical about the food you will get in restaurants or as street food in Thailand, not much will be as good as the food we prepared in the cooking class... ;)

Great fun & great learning opportunity. Over 4 hours of fun and learning that left us with great memories from Bangkok. Good balance of food theory & practice (cooking and local market visit) delivered in a fun& friendly manner. You learn to cook the key dishes from Thai cuisine and their interesting alternatives. My boyfriend does not eat sea food, which was not a problem - he was cooking with chicken. There was also a girl in our group who could not eat spicy food, but chef Lee found a way to make everyone learn & cook what they can & like to eat. Highly recommended experience!

One of the Highlights of a Great Bangkok Trip. Believe the hype. This is the top rated school for a reason. Not that I have been to any others, but I would never even think about it after coming here. The school was inviting and clean, the staff very friendly, and of course--most importantly--Chef LeeZ was fantastic. She was friendly, fun, and great at what she does. She allowed us to cook a wide variety of dishes, all of which were some of the best examples of that type of food I had ever had. The best part is you get to cook it all, and EAT it all. Going to the market was pretty cool too, especially seeing the monster river prawns they have there that look like lobsters. All in all, you really can't go wrong here. If you come here and don't have a blast, then you're probably the type of person that doesn't enjoy rollercoasters or other fun things.

Not surprised that this is no.1 rated cooking class. I loved the way Chef Leez ran her cooking classes. She was so engaging right from the start giving us so much information about the ingredients as well as the core values that underpin her cooking eg. How to pick the freshest and most natural ingredients, that many products we buy from markets and stores have added chemicals, msg or do not use pure ingredients etc. The class was interactive but not overwhelmingly so. I actually learn best by watching, reading and writing rather than doing so it was great that I got to watch Chef or other students cook first so that I could write down important tips or notes. She also let us film and take photos during the class. Our class was just the right size - 6 people. The food we cooked was actually the best tasting thai food I had on my trip. Can't wait to make everything again at home. It is definitely worth doing if you're in Bangkok and you enjoy eating and cooking.

Learn to cook fabulous authentic Thai food. Our Chef LeeZ cooking school experience was fantastic. We really enjoyed going to the market around the corner and Chef Lee showing us the tricks of the trade of how to shop in a local Thai market. Upon coming back to the classroom, Chef Lee had us making numerous delicious Thai dishes. We really enjoyed this experience. Chef Lee runs a tight ship in the kitchen and she is a great teacher. The time flew by and we would highly recommend this experience for anyone who is traveling to Bangkok. Thank you Chef Lee for a wonderful time and we can't wait to start cooking at home!

A fun and professional thai cooking course. We (2 of us) joined the group class, upon arrival, Chef Lee took the class to a local market nearby. She introduced us some local ingredients, and the tricks to pick fresh and healthy ingredients. What substitutes we can use when we replicate the dishes at home. To cook each dishes, Chef will first go thru all ingredients with us, we can touch and smell the special herbs being used. And then, she will demonstrate how to do the prep works, then show us the cooking procedures. We will then go to our station and cook our own dishes. We learnt a total of 12 recipes during class! 1, 2) Spicy Sour Soup (Clear and Creamy) 3) Pad Thai 4) Green Curry Chicken 5) Tom Yum Paste 6,7,8) Green\Red\Yellow Curry Paste 9) Holy Basil Chicken 10) Ma-sa-man Curry Chicken11) Green Papaya Salad 12) Sticky Rice Mango All of them taste YUM!Chef can speak very good English, so no worry it may be difficult to communicate. What impressed us is we are making most of the dishes from scratch (making own coconut cream, coconut milk, curry paste, etc.) I believe Chef herself has a very healthy lifestyle, as she kept on emphasizing the importance of using good ingredients (why coconut oil, palm sugar is good for cooking; avoid using MSG, always use fresh lime juice, etc.) We always want to cook fresh and healthy meals for our family, so we loved the way she taught, really practical! My boyfriend was a bit sick when we had the class, his stomach not feeling too well. Chef made him and the rest of the class some drinks with herbs. It was a nice offer :). Will recommend adding 'Chef LeeZ Thai Cooking School Bangkok' to your itinerary!

I truly had a great experience and highly recommend Chef LeeZ!. Chef LeeZ is a great teacher. It's hard to say what part of the class was my favorite, but having the guided tour through the market was an invaluable lesson. It's very helpful to see what to look for in picking your ingredients. I've made thai food at home, but never quite knew if I was getting the flavor profiles right. Now I know. At least, now I know a little more. It would be great to take the class again and again, to learn new things. If you're looking for a cooking class in Bangkok, this should be your top choice. You won't be disappointed.

Best clean and fabulous Thai food ever. My husband and I cannot wait to go home and start trying out Chef Lee's recipes and cooking hints. The food she helped us make was the best food we have had in Thailand so far in the 2 + months we have been here. She knows the secret of "less is more" and uses just the right amount of spices and ingredients. My husband and I have been making Thai food for years, and were familiar with the basic ingredients and preparation, but her teaching showed us how to perfect the art of cooking Thai. All the ingredients were fresh, with no MSG or use of oyster sauce; she even showed us how to make our own coconut milk. The sweet chili sauce was an unexpected taste of heaven! Plus, we had tons of food, and our bellies were quite satisfied. She geared her cooking to our needs and desires and skill level, which was an added bonus

Amazing cooking class!. My husband and I loved this class south. Chef LeeZ was engaging, funny and taught us so much about Thai cooking. We cooked the best Pad Thai we have ever eaten. Looking forward to to bringing our recipes home to try! Thank you for the fantastic experience.

Lean to cook delicious Thai food!. I had a great time with Chef Lee and cooked some really amazing Thai food - tastier and more authentic than most restaurants! It was also nice to learn about the local eating habits and ingredients (including how to get 100% coconut milk. Clue: you can't buy it). Chef Lee is very entertaining and made a lot of jokes to keep the class engaged.The registration process was simple and we got very helpful directions to find the place. There was a Canadian (?) guy who was responsible for the logistics and business side of things, so there was no problem with communication.Some feedback for the team:1. Cut the market portion - I've been to a lot of Asian markets and this was not one worth seeing. We kept getting interrupted by motorcyclists and merchants biking and moving things into the narrow entryways. Also, the market was filthy and hot. I understand that lots of foreigners like seeing it, but I honestly think that the introduction of ingredients can be done elsewhere.2. Too much talking and not enough cooking - Having been to other cooking classes before, I felt that the lecture portion went on for far too long. We did not start cooking until 11:30am (when class started at 10) and I would have preferred diving in right away.3. Too little food - I like that we get to eat our food right away (as opposed to waiting till the end.) However, the portions are too tiny! The pad thai literally had 4 noodles, and it was not enough! I realise that they probably did this to avoid making us too full, but I was hungry still after the class. I would be willing to pay more for more food.Given these complaints, I would rate this as more of a 3.5 or 4 star experience. However, knowing the TA rating system for activities skews towards 5 stars, I am leaving a 5 star to avoid screwing the business over.

Fantastic way to learn about Thai cuisine!. I took Chef Leez' public Thai cooking class today and it was an absolute delight! Chef Leez was extremely personable, knowledgeable and friendly. She made me feel like a welcomed guest in her kitchen. I would definitely return for another cooking class with Chef Lee next time I am in Bangkok. If you enjoy cooking and learning about food, I would highly recommend this.

Awesome cooking experience. I took the class and was simply amazed how good the food was we cooked.Chef Lee explains everything to you and shows how it is properly done. Whoever wants to learn to learn how to prepare authentic Thai food should definitively come visit her!

Loved it (don't eat breakfast before you go!). Arrived just before 10am, everything was prepared and bottles of water on the table. Very friendly host with some funny stories and interesting facts.Headed off to the local market which was very interesting and off the tourist route.Cooked lots of great food, had lots to eat and took home some valuable lessons + a cooking book. Well worth the visit!

A great day!. It was great to have chosen this cooking class with Leez. She speaks really good English and explains well in each and every steps of the cooking skills. She even shared with us a lot of "grandma's recipes" and little tricks in cooking. A really enjoyable cooking class with Leez, who is so passionate and full of sense of humour! It will not be wrong in choosing her class!
Great cooking and lots of laughing . We had a great time there. Visiting a market, learn how to use the natural ingredients and cooking all the stuff we a lots of laughing. Thx from Berlin
MUST DO IT !!!!. Best place to learn healthy thai food with a lot of humor. The food was great, the lessons were very easy to follow and the lady was very friendly.

MUST DO: Wonderful Authentic Healthy Thai Cooking Class. Yesterday I attended Chef Leez Thai cooking school after discovering it on Trip Advisor when reviewing cooking schools.It was fun, detailed, and nothing short of 10 out of 10.The class started with a brief intro to different ingredients, then we went to the nearby (4min walk) markets to select the ingredients Chef purchased. This was a bonus as we were educated on the good, the bad, and the ugly.The teacher had a wonderful sense of humour, facilities perfect.Thanks Chef for the education.

A must do if you're in Bangkok . My friend and I wanted to take a cooking class while in Thailand and decided on Chef Leez because of the fantastic reviews on trip advisor and they weren't lying!Unfortunately, we arrived late and missed the trip to the market. LeeZ was so generous as to offer to take us afterwards, but we didn't have time.Onto the cooking portion. Leez provides step by step instructions to teach you how to make so many fantastic dishes, my favorites, tom yum soup, papaya salad and of course pad Thai. Her presentation is full of humor, history and tips, from knowing when your fish oil has gone bad, to the best way to cut a papaya and how the harder you muddle your ingredients, the better wife you will be!I cannot say enough, just go!! And eat a light breakfast because you are going to want to devour every last bite!
