Great food; great experience. My husband and I took a class with Chef LeeZ a coupe of weeks ago while honeymooning in Thailand. This was one of the highlights of our trip! We had such a fun time learning about the basics to Thai food (buying the right ingredients, techniques for how to prep properly and then making the meal). Would highly recommend this class to less experienced cooks and those people who want to have a fun time. Chef LeeZ is great!

Five Stars and more all the way.. I attended Chef Leez group cooking class with my daughter and am totally glad I did so. It was difficult deciding between all the classes on offer but finally decided on Chef Leez after reading TA reviews. The entire structure of class is casual, friendly and packed with information. From visit to market to the final dessert Chef Leez was a perfect coach & guide. Her manner of teaching techniques and selection of ingredients is what makes the class special. Her attention to each & every student is amazing. My teen daughter, who was earlier a bit wary of coming with me, ended up absolutely loving it. We made 8 dishes and the only part that we did not do ourselves was apportioning ingredient portions. This is a 100% hands-on class in spite of the large number of dishes on menu. And no short cuts - every paste was ground by us. The takeaway from the class is huge for me & my daughter. We learnt things which we can use in our daily cooking to produce great results. But I would give five stars to this class for Chef Leez alone. What a warm & wonderful person she is. From coming to pick us up from where the can stopped to finding us a can after class and making my daughter feel special amongst all adults, she really made our day. We will always have fond memories of this class.

Best place to learn healthy Thai cooking with fun. I walked in and from the first second I liked Lee veey much and the clean school was just inviting. For I had only time on the same day I just stayed there. Another couple was coming so we are just 3 keen learners. It turned out that we have met before at MBK therefore we had so much to laugh about from the start. Lee explained all the ingredients and what to avoid buying. How to discern good products from bad once aso. She was really brilliant in the way she taught us what and how to make the most delicious meals. We had also so much fun and she had sometimes to keep us in line in accordance with the schedule.Anyway go there for the best place to learn how to cook properly Thai meals. I still compare all the dishes with the once we had at her school. And not one of the curries I ate are close to the taste of them from Lee's cooking school.Thanks Lee

Thai Cuisine - Now I get it. Being from San Francisco I'm no stranger to great Thai food but I have to say that my experince in Chef Lee's class today was eye opening. Anyone can provide you with a bunch of ingredients and show how to make a Thai dish as knowing is half the battle( Go Joe!); but what sets this class apart is that it allows you to understand why things are done a paticular way. You will have a new apprection for the Thai cusine and how can you pass that up? Take this class, it's well worth both the time and money. It's one the best things I've done this trip.

Best Experience. I am a, as my bf says, cheap traveler. I want the best deal for what you get because our dollar does not go far. This was more expensive than any of the other classes I looked up and that was hard for me, especially having done a class for less several years back. I am happy to report it was SO WORTH IT!. She was incredibly fun, bright, energetic and patient. All the reviews state it below. It was the 10am-2pm class. The portions were large enough to almost be sick from eating it all but I got them all in. Comments: It is literally 10 mins from Khao San Road;Do not eat before!; We did this on our last day and I am really happy I did because no other food that we had ate tasted this fresh and good (note: I am very particular with ensuring recipes are authentic especially because in my country people butcher the term Thai Food , and this was!)
Great experience . I highly recommend this cooking class. Chef Leez was awesome. I learned so much and was able to use my knowledge of Thai cooking when i returned home. Thanks for an great time!!!!

yummy. What a great experience we had at LeeZ cooking school. Chef LeeZ is so nice and it is obvious she loves to cook. The class is four hours and you cook a lot of thai food. You first go to the market and chef LeeZ show you the ingredient for the class and explain a lot of things about organic and chemical food. Then you cook! And eat. We loved it!

Chef LeeZ amazing experience . I loved the cook experience whit Chef LeeZ! She is a fun and lovely. She is a especial cook teacher and the dish that I had prepared is surprise!! I recommend it, go go go...

yummy. Real nice cooking class! Short stroll on the market with good explanations on what is the good stuff to buy, and what you should rather avoid. Has good awareness on the food and teaches "like grandma did". All natural no MSG etc. Food is so yummy and you get all the recipies printed so you won't forget...

Learn to cook Thai food the proper way. We just returned to Melbourne from our 2 week trip to Thailand, spent 4 nights in Bangkok and was absolutely blown away by the street food culture. My partner and I participated in Chef Leez cooking class and it was awesome. What we loved the most was the fact that she taught us how to cook traditional Thai dishes and that we went to the local market and purchased all of our fresh ingredients before we started cooking. We had a great day cooking and treating our taste buds.Chef Leez is awesome, she is the master. I highly recommend this cooking course if you're passionate about your Thai food :-)Will.

Brilliant, Informative, Fun.. Chef Lee creates a relaxed and fun atmosphere with her engaging personality and energy. The focus here is really on the food and the ingredients rather than technique which is great; Thai cooking at its simplest and best. Chef takes you through the basics of Thai flavours, a short trip around the local market (and I mean local, you would never know it was there and our hotel was right next door), and then it's down to business.The ingredients acquired from the market are then used to make pastes, coconut cream and milk, curries, Pad Thai, stir fry, sticky rice and salads. You get a handy recipe handout to take away and the course really gives you an insight into how you can make amazing Thai food at home, without using packaged sauces and additives. We ate 2 soups and 5 plates of food, there is definitely no need for breakfast! We would definitely recommend a course here.
Excellent class. I loved the class we took with Chef LeeZ. We learned many things in such a short amount of time. I can't wait to try all the recipes from class.

Chef Lee Z Experience. I added a couple of days before work commitments in Bangkok to explore the city for the second time. But wanted to try a different experience, so I booked a group cooking class the evening before attending the next day. Based on the great reviews I opted for Chef Lee - as she is known and the previous reviews did it great justice. Great experience: fantastic cooking lesson, great fun and casual environment, amazing food! Not much breakfast before recommended!During the visit to the local market for ingredients, Chef Lee gave good health tips and an immersion into the Thai culture. Can only recommend!

An extremely enjoyable experience. Booked a cooking class for myself and my daughter over internet after reading great reviews. Today's class only had 2 of us which was great. The class started with a tour to the local market followed by the actual cooking class. Chef was very informative and was generous with all her cooking tips. I have done the Blue Elephant cooking class before. In comparison, this one is a lot more personable and I learnt a lot more from this class given that I am a beginner at cooking Thai food. Although the facility is not as lush, but the authenticity of the Chef and the setting is very attractive if you want to experience the Thai culture. Highly recommended.

Fantastic cooking class. Don't hesitate! I absolutely loved the class, the instructor and the method used to instruct. The class is really fun and informative, Chef creates a really positive and warm environment that permeates throughout the day.I have a seafood allergy and chef catered to this with ease and made me feel very comfortable.Some classes focus too much on technique but this was lots of fun with a focus on a comprehensive understanding of thai ingredients and general methods of cooking. I look forward to going back with my partner in the future!Make sure you go hungry .. There will be lots to munch on throughout the class.I took a taxi from Sukhamvit and it cost 95 baht. I took the river boat and sky train back as I wasn't rushing and it could take some time, about one hour.

Amazing experience!. It was the best experience we had in BKK, great class, amazing Chef, yummy foods!I got a couple bug bites from the traditional market, chef used the fresh ingredients to make me some medicine to put on, it worked well - Thanks Chef!

Great teacher great class. This is indeed a great experience! Chef LeeZ taught us techniques with details on how to make thai food in traditional healthy way~ not by adding instant mix sauce nor msg, but by the "grandma method" as she always says. Tempting to come again in my next visit! My husband who seldom goes into kitchen also enjoyed the class and food! Thx Chef leeZ ^_^

Amazing and a definite thing to do. This is an amazing course. Chef Lee is just a fantastic chef. You get to learn how to make multiple dishes and they all taste amazing! A bit hard for me to find the place though. Incredibly passionate teacher who's also fluent in English and engages her students well. A definite must come.

Perfect!. Booked a class with Chef Lee based in TA reviews...great decision!Chef Lee is a little bundle of cheeky fun. She kept us informed and entertained throughout the class.I'm not much of a cook, but with her help I managed to turn out some very respectable dishes. Especially considering I'd never cooked Thai before in my life.The location is a little tricky to find, so leave plenty of time to get there.We cooled something like 12 dishes between 10am and 2pm and still had time to visit the local market.Food was terrific, so maybe skip breakfast that morning.A very special day with Chef Lee, thoroughly enjoyed by all in our group. A great selection!

One of the best things I did in Bangkok. Chef Lee is excellent. She is a very experienced trained chef but she will also tell you stories about helping her mother cook traditional foods with her family when she was younger. You will make a lot of different classic Thai dishes and learn a little about Thai food and cooking culture and even how to shop for good ingredients at a local market. You will make a lot of different food and it is so delicious! Some of the best thai food I had. And you get to make it! She also shows you how to modify dishes to make things not even listed on the itinerary. For example, we made two soups and then she showed us how to modify the recipe of one and make a third, Tom Kha Gai. We also made green curry and massaman curry but she also taught us how to modify the recipes to make red, yellow and panang curries. You essentially learn a lot of how to make a lot of different types of Thai food in a short amount of time. You eat ALOT though, so come hungry.

A must-do in Bangkok! We loved it, but don't eat breakfast!. We chose Chef LeeZ based on many positive reviews here on Trip Advisor and were so glad we did! It was a 20 minute cab ride for us, from near the Siam Centre in Sunday morning traffic. Chef LeeZ is a delight - her English is fluent and she is very funny and engaging. She's incredibly passionate about Thai cooking and her enthusiasm is infectious. Best of all, Chef LeeZ was sharing recipes her Grandma had taught her as a kid, and it was a big bonus for us that she is pro-organic and anti-msg too. It was great to visit a local market to gather our ingredients - it was a very local market, definitely not one a tourist would normally visit, almost invisible from the street. We learned to make some of our favourite dishes and are now officially ruined for anything but homemade Pad Thai forever, it was THAT good! Recipes are provided and questions are welcome. Chef LeeZ is particularly good at suggesting substitute ingredients in your home country too. Oh, and we got to eat everything we made, so skip breakfast or eat light! Thanks a million Chef LeeZ, we'll see you next time!Meegan and Anne

Great learning experience for all levels. The class starts w a trip to the nearby market where chef Lee shows you the good ingredients for the dishes. We did the group class of 6 couples (about 12 in total) which was perfectly fine, as there is a cooking spot for each couple. The cooking experience among the students varied greatly but I think I can confidently say that everyone got a lot out of it. All in all a great experience and I will def try to cook some of the recepies at home! Thank you chef Lee & co !

Worth every Baht!. We had an amazing experience with Chef Leez Thai cooking school.We had missed our booked class because we were stuck in traffic, but a simple phone call was all that was needed to reschedule our class to a later one that same day. Luckily there was space.Chef was super friendly, communicated well and very knowledgable with the ingredients. Prior to cooking, she took us on a tour to a local food market and taught us how to pick ingredients. We were shown special asian cooking techniques and the best part was eating all the delicious Thai foods that we made ourselves! It was basically a 4 course meal (so make sure you don't eat prior to the class!).A very interactive, enjoyable & delicious experience! Highly recommend!

Group class. Me and my wife chose this class because of the many positive reviews on TA and the good website with detailed information. Only drawback was that the VISA payment didn't work so we were asked to pay by PayPal which we couldn't (it was no problem to pay at the course, great). We got response same day we contacted Chef LeeZ. The class was as good as most reviews describe. It was fun, easy, very informative and with a good emphasis on healthy and tasty cooking. The market we visited was exciting, a "touristfree zone" and with a lot to learn and see.

Fantastic place, book and learn about Thai cooking while having fun. After reading several reviews on Trip Advisor we decided to book Chef Leez (www.chefleez.com) and try for ourselves. What a great experience. The course started at 10am and last about 4 hours, kicking off with an overview of the core ingredients used in Thai cooking, followed by a trip to the local market, somewhere that you would never find as a tourist. We bought vegetables and spices that we would use later in the cooking class. The class seems to have a maximum of 8 places, only 7 people on the day we were there, so there is lots of 1-on-1 attention and the chance to cook several dishes, then eat them :-)The cost is really good, about £30 each, which covers all the food and recipes. Chef Leez herself is a lovely lady, very funny and talented.We will definitely go back the next time we are in Bangkok.

Amazing, so easy to learn authentic Thai. This is 100% authentic Thai cooking.The teacher is amazing in explaining, helping and giving a real understanding in making genuine Thai food, so quick and easy for the whole class to learn.The location is easy to find, I went from sukhumvit soi 21 in a taxi and took about 20-30 minutes with moderate traffic.The whole experiance is amazing, it makes want to rush home and start cooking more and more. I can not thank them enough...This is a must to do in Bangkok, if you like the Thai food.

Amazing experience!. Chef Lee does an excellent job teaching about Thai ingredients. She began with a market tour during which she showed us what to buy, what not to buy, and where we could likely find the ingredients in our native countries. The cooking experience afterward was fun and informative. We had beautiful bright soups, 4 different curries, lemongrass chicken, Pad Thai, and sticky rice with mango. Chef Lee set the bar high in terms of quality and cooking standards--so much so, that I noticed the difference in quality in many of the places I ate during the remainder of my trip.Go to this class for half a day, and go with an empty stomach. You won't regret it!

Amazing experience!. Chef Lee does a fantastic job in teaching about Thai ingredients and how to cook delicious meals with them. You can tell that she truly cares about the quality of the food - we made some of the best meals I've had in Thailand. She will take you on a market tour to start with and educate you on what to buy, what not to buy, and why. Make sure you show up with an empty stomach; you will enjoy tasty curries, soups and classic Thai dishes. I'm excited to try making them all at home now.Well worth every penny!

Fun introduction. my husband and I attended class with Lee today. It was a fun introduction to foods we were unfamiliar with. Everything in the kitchen was spotless. Each of us was taught how to make our own version of each dish to accommodate our own dietary needs, spicy, vegetarian, etc. It was all hands on and easy to follow the instructions. I will certainly add Thai dishes to my cooking at home.
Wonderful Experience. Chef Leez is such a lively and lovely lady. As she says in her own words - "I will show you how grandma makes it!" Very knowledgable chef. Really well oiled setup.

Fantastic!. This definitely was a highlight of our trip when we took it last year. The visit to a local wet market was very interesting and informative plus very entertaining thanks to Chef Lezee's funny jokes! Back in the kitchen, she was very efficient and explained everything in great detail from the individual ingredients down to the special techniques -- and again with her infectious humor! :) A very enjoyable experience plus the food we learned to cook was so delicious!Highly recommended!

just great - very recommendable! . well organized, clean and friendly. first visit a market, get a lot of interessting informations of healthy and organic ingredients. then back to the kitchen, where everything showed and explained good. chef leez keeps it easy, simple and authentic!!! great time and a lot of fun

Great but not as good as they think. When I saw that such a highly-rated cooking class was only a few minutes' walk from my hotel, I booked in straight away. I paid online late the night before and woke up to find a confirmation email. Easy! There were only 2 other people doing the class that day, so it was a nice personal experience. We had an introduction from Chef Lee, who was very charming and good fun. We walked to a nearby food market to buy some ingredients for our dishes. We were told lots of interesting stuff about the ingredients and especially about how bad some are and how lazy Thai cooking has become but I'll talk more about that later. We cooked a wide variety of dishes. You don't cook every single dish on the list, some are cooked by your fellow students and some by Chef Lee. By spreading out the cooking it means you get to sample more dishes in the 4 hours. During the initial introduction I mentioned Jungle Curry and as a result it was added in to the mix of curries we cooked. It was delicious and could definitely be part of the repertoire. By the end you are very very full. I didn't even have breakfast and I struggled to finish everything. This isn't a bad thing at all, just a tip for making sure you're hungry and that you might want to avoid finishing some of the early dishes. Overall it was a really enjoyable class. I have previously done similar classes at Pum's (Koh Phi Phi) and Time for Lime (Koh Lanta). I think my favourite was Time for Lime but there isn't too much between them. However, Chef Lee and her Canadian husband seemed to be on a mission to repeatedly say that most (if not all) Thai cooking is now lazy and uses inferior produce and cuts corners at the expense of taste and health. Multiple times we were told that you are very unlikely to taste food as good as theirs anywhere in the whole of Thailand! Of course this is absolute rubbish. This is my 3rd trip to Thailand and I've had some seriously amazing food, especially outside of Bangkok. I can understand that they are proud of what they're doing and they want to boast about it but it seemed as if they we honestly deluded in to thinking their cooking really is the best in Thailand. A fun experience and one that I would recommend :)

Inspiring!. Cooked with Chef Lee today and can't wait to try the recipes out at home! We visited the market in the morning and LeeZ explained very ingredient and how to spot the best. She is happy to show you anything you ask to learn, we cooked 10 Dishes in 4 hours but at no time did it feel rushed. Highly recommended and just a few minutes walk from Ko San Rd

Amazing experience!. Chef Leez was amazing! There was no rush. She explained everything about Thai cooking with great details. Also, I was very pleased that her cooking is all about organic! She would not use MSG! Highly recommended for people who would like to learn cook organic thai dish!

Just Great!. First I was a bit skeptical whether 4 hours would be enough to get a proper introduction into Thai cuisine. I was proven wrong. Without any hurry Chef Lee showed us how to cook all the dishes and gave us important hints for cooking Thai food back home (e.g. How to replace certain ingredients we may not find in Europe easily). Also our kids very much enjoyed the time! Lee and her team are great people! We all agree that LeeZ was one of the best things we experienced during our 2 months stay in Thailand!

Great cooking class & market experience. Great cooking class!!I went on my own, and there was only one other person in the class - so a great small and hands on experienceWe went to the local market to pickup our ingredients, and were taught about the different local fruit & vegetables as well as the different ingredients available to buy there.We then started cooking straight away, getting great guidance and hits & tips on the way.The class is on the main street and was very clean and well stocked with great services and tools.Our teacher for the day spoke terrific english so our questions were easily handled and answered.Short walk from the ferry stop which was a great way to see the sights to/from the class. The little market at the ferry stop was nice to pickup some gifts for home (silk scarves, etc)Recipes were provided which means I can re-create the meals at home.I consider myself a half-decent cook, but learnt come great hints & tips, and now have all the great recipes to cook for family and friends back in Australia.Thank you for a wonderful class!

Absolutely great!. I have loved every moment of this class and I strongly recommend you go and check it out!You first start with a visit to a small market. Let's be clear, you are pretty much the only foreigners to ever come there as it's at the back end of an alley. So you clearly can't get a more authentic experience! Chef Lee takes the time to explain different ingredients & how to find the good ones and steal clear of chemically produced "stuff". Unlike other cooking class where the curry paste or shrimp stock for example are already prepared for you, Chef Lee explains clearly how it's done. You even make your own coconut cream and milk (and get to taste and compare with the industrial stuff, wow, soooo much better). It's a really enjoyable experience and you realize how creative and fun Thai cooking is. Just beware, you are going to eat. A lot.Don't take any breakfast and be sure to arrive hungry!The cooking school is quite easy to find as long as you have a map of Bangkok, and I recommend you keep their phone close (my taxi driver was completely lost).Thank you very much for this great moment Chef Lee!

A good way to know thai cuisine. The best way to know thai cuisine.The chef is very friendly and we felt like home.She taught all kind of food, always in a natural way, aboiding chemical products.If you like to cook, eat and try new things , you should do this course.100% recomended

Awsome cooking, fantastisch koken!. This morning had a private class, fortunately! And it was great, our instructor was very polite and took all the time to teach us everything. Went to the market and were well instructed too cook ourselves. Also got a few tips to travel around in Bangkok. Overall it was a great experience an highly reccomended.

Great cooking class for beginners!. We had a cooking class with Chef Leez today and it was delightful. Made over 7 dishes and everything was amazing! Not only does she take great pride in teaching her class, she is open to personal tastes and takes a lot of questions! Highly recommend for anyone who wants to learn all the famous that dishes.

It will change the way you see and taste thay cuisine. We really enjoyed our class with Leez. We were lucky and got a private course paying the group price (no other people were at the school that day). The trip to the local hidden market was extremely interesting, and cooking afterwards with her was also great. We did the course only 2 days after arriving to Thailand and it definitely changed the way we experienced thay cuisine from that day on. During the rest of our trip at least we recognized the ingredients!!Absolutely recommendable!

Amazing thai food!. I experienced my first cooking class with Chef leez in Bkk, after reading all nice feedbacks on TA. I confirm that is an amazing course, and you really cook (and eat! :-)) healthy tastes (best dishes i' ve ever eaten in Thai!)Chef Leez Was also very kind to let my husband join the class half an hour Before the end to join my dishes. Cost is absolutely acceptable. Recommended!

Authentic with a sense of humour . We did an afternoon course with the wonderful Chef LeeZ with our 2 boys ages 8 and 11.We had done a course in Laos which was rural, scenic and we learnt a lot. This course was completely different being in the city but just as brilliant and we learnt many new tricks and skills.I loved Chef LeeZ bubbly personality, her great sense of humour and distaste for artificial colours and msg. A testament to her that she held the boys attention for 4.5 hours and they ate or at least tried every dish they made.Well worth doing!

Amazing Experience. The staff were super-friendly and it was obvious that they had a wealth of experience preparing authentic Thai Dishes.All of the ingredients used were fresh with no atificial additives, and the establishment was very clean.With help from Chef Lee we prepared and tasted 8 different dishes ! We left both with full stomachs - highly recommended

Best food in Thailand!. I chose the course here because it was conveniently near my hostel, but couldn't have made a better choice! Chef Leez is passionate about healthy, proper ingredients and shared her knowledge and tips the whole way through the course. Our market trip was a proper food-buying expedition and she told us not only about what we bought, but what else was available. When it came to the cooking itself, it was fun to learn about the best way to use different ingredients and feel like we were getting our hands dirty (learning how to extract coconut cream was lots of fun!).The important part of a cooking course is, of course, the food. Which was universally amazing in this case! Every dish was better than the last and it almost ruined Thai food for me, because nothing else would taste as good! You get all the recipes to take home and it's not impossible to source the ingredients back home. Can't wait to try them out myself!

Awesome family cooking experience in Thailand!. We were visiting Bangkok with our very picky and not food-adventurous daughter, ages 7 and 8, and decided to try a cooking class in hopes that having a hand in the creation of some new foods, that they would at least try them. We chose Chef Lee because of the great reviews she had on Tripadvisor, and I have to say, she did NOT disappoint! Not only was she sweet and engaging, even after the little ones had started to lose interest (the class is generally a little over two hours so this was to be expected) but the food was AWESOME. Her recipes are simple but delicious and she cooks in a very healthy style, using very little oil which really impressed me. Each of us had our own prep and cooking station with perfectly apportioned ingredients so that each of us had the full experience of creating the dishes - I think 8 in all which was impressive! I don't know if it will be as simple to recreate them at home but I will definitely try! What a great find! Chef Lee ROCKS!

A wonderful experience. My newly husband and I had a great experience with Chef Leez during our honeymoon.Not only that she is a very friendly person, she is also open to give the most about her culture and Thai cooking without any time or price limitations. And we think that's what makes her special. We advice this great experience to everyone who would like to get a real taste of Thai cuisine and culture. We should not forget to mention that whatever we cooked was maybe the most delicious food we had during our trip!

Wonderful cooking experience!. This was a wonderful cooking class! We learned how to cook Tom Yum and chili paste, pad Thai, green curry and paste, Masaman curry, chicken and basil, green papaya salad, and mango sticky rice. This is a great assortment of Thai foods to know how to cook! The recipes were simple enough that I will be able to cook them at home with ease. Chef Leez have excellent instructions in English. We were given all the recipes in English to take home. The class also included a trip to a local market. We were able to eat all of the foods we prepared and I left stuffed! The class cost 1600 bhat, quite comparable to other cooking classes in the area. Take this class, you will be very happy with the experience!

Great experience!. My partner and I found the Chef LeeZ 4 hour GC group school to be enjoyable. Chef LeeZ is skilled teacher who only works with small classes. The class took us to a local market for the ingredients for the cooking and after our return to the class room we went forward to cook a large number of Thai dishes for our lunch. We were introduced to 10 dishes!!! Just to mention my favourites; papaya salad, Tom Yum Paste, three soups (Spicy Sour Soup, Tom Yum Clear & Creamy), Green Curry Chicken, Massaman Pork with vegies and sticky rice with mango!It was a good experience and I will definitely try to recreate the food back at home from the free recipe book.ThanksM. Peardon
dleicious!!!. We did the cookingcourse the last day of our Thailand trip and it was far out the best food we had! We learned a lot and it was a fantastic experience.

This is a must do in Bangkok!!. Had a fabulous time at Chef LeeZ Thai Cooking School Bangkok. All the dishes we prepared tasted great. The cooking instructions and demonstrations were easy to follow and understand even for a novice like myself. Include a fascinating trip to the local market and description and explanation of all the ingredients and you are in for a memorable experience!! This is a must do in Bangkok!

Great food. We were in Bangkok for my birthday and I lured my husband along on this cooking class. Best food we had in Thailand, and great explanations on the ingredients and how to get the most out of them. My husband isn't into cooking but still enjoyed it.

"The best food I had all trip is the food we made" - Husband. Being the procrastintor I am, I really did mean to book a class at Chef LeeZ in advance. Really.But it slipped my mind, and seeing that we were staying just down the road, we decided to take a chance and turn up the morning of the class. Luckily for us there was room! I've taken a Thai cooking class previously, but this was my husband's first time. I really wanted this to be great for him. Chef Lee is not only very knowledgable about Thai cuisine, she sprinkles her explanations with interesting/funny anecdotes to keep you engaged.We took this class on the 2nd day of our two week trip. It was both good and bad. Good: My husband got a taste for well prepared foodBad: Some of the food we ate the rest of the trip just didn't measure up. He would say things like, "I bet they used white sugar in this..." or "I hope they didn't use palm oil." :-)This is perfect for young, old, couples, singles, cooks, non-cooks.*quick tip - if you are staying in the Khao San Road area, it's a quick walk to Chef Leez.

Personalized Experience. Chef LeeZ gave me an amazing 1 on 1 experience that I will never forget. I loved visiting the market to learn about the different ingredients. It was great to see how with a handful of simply ingredients you could get such a variety of flavors!
Worth it!. It's been a year since I took a cooking class with chef Leez and I still use all the recipes to impress friends and family. This is a great cooking class and well worth the price!

Brilliant :-). I have wanted to learn how to make an authentic Tom Yam Goong for the longest time and this was a fantastic place to do it - I didn't even realize there were several variety of Tom Yam! (we also made Pad Thai, Spicy papaya salad, mango with sticky rice, 2 different curry pastes and 3 other curries - green, massaman and Holy Basil!) Chef Lee is a very charismatic and enthusiastic instructor - she is very passionate about Thai food and making sure everything is fresh, locally sourced and chemical free. As a single traveller I was not sure what the group class would be like, but it was excellent - from the market tour to the copious amounts af amazing food we made :) Recommend to all!

Vegan rates this Excellent!!. From the moment we entered Chef Leez was filled with passion and enthusiasm and seemed completely unfazed by our request to have the session completely vegan. We were told that this would probably be the best Thai food that we ever tasted and it without a doubt was. The class was so informative and easy to follow, I am not a natural cook but have make use of many dishes taught on that day with huge success. I will certainly come back again for a refresher next time I'm in Bangkok!!

Best Part of my Trip to Thailand. This was hands-down the favorite part of my trip to Thailand. My husband and I took the 4 hour group class and it was so much fun. This class was a great mix of cooking instruction and culture. Before you even begin cooking, Chef Leez takes you to the local market for ingredient shopping. She explains everything and also goes into what can be purchased in the States and what will have to be substituted. We made Pad Thai, Curry (green and yellow), Chicken, Tom Yum Paste, Tom Yum Soup, Mango Sticky Rice, and Papaya Salad.She has amazing assistants who help prepare the ingredients so when you start cooking, you are good to go. She spaces the class out so the time flies and you are laughing and enjoying your own food. My husband and I were stuffed at the end of the class. We will never see Thai food the same again. We learned how restaurants use so much sugar and ketchup to dye and sweeten the food unnecessarily. Chef Leez taught us how to use all natural ingredients and the secret tips used by real Thai cooks to naturally color food with shrimp paste. The moment I returned back to the States, I told all my friends about this cooking class.I recommend this to ANYONE who visits Thailand.

Highlight of our weekend away. My husband and I were taking a weekend away from the family in Bangkok and on a whim, I booked us up for Chef Leez's cooking class. As it turned out, it was a highlight of the weekend. First off, the market tour was invaluable in being able to go home and try to replicate what we had learned. It was great fun seeing all the gorgeous veggies. Chef Leez is obviously very picky about the quality of her ingredients - something that became a theme for the lesson as we used fresh, not canned, coconut milk, for example. Chef Leez's helpers were also awesome - always smiling and helping us and showing us how to do things. As another reviewer said, the only problem was that the food we made was so delicious, it spoiled us for the rest of the trip as we couldn't help compare what we were eating to what we had cooked ourselves. I can't recommend this enough and is really fun as a couples activity.

Only One Problem..... The only problem with this class is that you will make pad Thai so incredibly good it will ruin your ability to enjoy pad Thai anywhere else for the rest of your trip!! My boyfriend and I attended this class and were pleased to find it was only 4 people. We started with a market visit which was very enjoyable. One of my favorite parts of the class was the emphasis on healthy and fresh foods. Everything we made was delicious with the highlight being the Pad Thai, also the chili paste and soups were second favorites. I will say the class is on the expensive side, but we did quite a bit and I was full at the end. I am vegetarian and I had no problem as mushrooms and tofu were easily substituted for me.I will say that if I was doing it again I might have gone for the half class. It is a little cheaper and you still cover a good range of dishes. Also, most of the learning was done on these dishes, the second half of the class felt much more rushed and was more of just quickly throwing the precut things together so we could finish it all and eat. I didn't mind so much because the food was still good, but I would have been fine just doing the half class as well.Either way it was a great day and the everyone at the school is incredibly friendly and nice to meet.

Great experience and very enjoy working with Chef LeeZ. The place is not fancy, but the chef is very nice and tought us a lot about how to choose good quality of the ingredient and egg and vegi. My husband and I both had a wonderful time cook Thai food and eat the dishes we made. Very good experience.

A fantastic lesson in the subtleties of Thai cuisine. I found Chef Leez to be a thoroughly charming, knowledgeable and genial tutor for our visit to her cookery school. Luckily for our party of 2, the other participants failed to turn up during our 4hr lesson (on Sat 21st June 10am>2pm) meaning that ours was effectively a private lesson - which was a bonus as it meant Chef Leez was able to spend more time and be more attentive to our individual efforts and questions relating to the food, preparation techniques and cooking.The cookery school (effectively a shop front) is well laid-out, spacious, extremely clean (with stainless steel worktops for the food preparation) and nicely air-conditioned – thoroughly appreciated in Bangkok in June!The number of dishes that were included in the lesson initially seemed quite a lot - but actually worked out quite well with enough time to prepare, cook, photograph (don't forget your camera!) and devour all of them. This was mainly due to a majority of the major food preparation (washing \ peeling etc) being taken care of by Leez's right-hand lady and on-site Commis chef who was generally out-of-sight, hardly seen and never heard - but always on-hand to tidy-up after us and provide the next set of carefully measured ingredients).The dishes that we were soon rustling-up like pros were made using many of the organic ingredients that Chef Leez purchased from the nearby local neighbourhood market at the beginning of our lesson – which itself was a fantastic experience full of unusual sights, smells and market produce that tourists like us are unlikely to see without a guide like Chef Leez to take us ‘round. This 30min market tour was a great opportunity for Chef Leez to point out the basic set of ingredients needed to produce quality Thai cuisine, including what to look for when choosing healthy & authentic market produce – and avoiding that which is full of the artificial ingredients and additives available in many of the items on sale.Based on the structure of the lesson, Chef Leez experience-led knowledge, the content of lesson, Chef Leez as the host, and the clean premises, I would definitely recommend this cookery school and rate it as one of the most enjoyable ways to spend a morning in Bangkok. PS. Go hungry - as you will be full by the time you leave!

Vegan rates this average. I stumbled into this class just before it began thinking it was a restaurant, and I decided to join in! As a vegan, I was attracted to the "vegetarian" sign outside the door. However, when I stated I was vegan, I was greeted with a response of "oh" by the staff. They seemed surprised.Throughout the cooking class references were made to my veganism constantly. "Okay everyone, put you're chicken in the bowl now, except you, because you're vegan, you can put in mushroom, because you are vegan" kind of thing. It was slightly annoying and the class was very meat-orientated. The staff did not know who was meat eater/non-meat eater before the class began so it wasn't like they had pre-prepared for meat-eaters only or anything.It was an okay class. You get a little bowl of each dish (and I mean little) you make. As a budget backpacker, my money would have been better spent elsewhere. However, Chef LeeZ herself is a lovely woman. :)

Wonderful class and a wonderful teacher. Although I was skeptical about taking a cooking class (I feared another Khao San tourist trap) chef Leez quickly convinced me otherwise. She is a very warm and funny person and most importantly she definitely knows her Thai cooking!

Informative, enjoyable, delicious!. We loved our experience at Chef LeeZ' Thai Cooking School. We booked the night beforehand and paid online - this was very easy to do. We learnt as part of a group of four which was great fun. It was easy to find the school thanks to the good directions on the website, I noticed some people walked by and booked on the day too which seemed to be fine. We went on a market tour which was informative and enjoyable, then went on to cook LOADS of different dishes with Chef Leez's help - 3 soups, tom yam salad, curries and some delicious mango and sticky rice. All dietary requirements and tastebuds are well catered for in this flexible course. My boyfriend and I have done 2 other cooking courses in Thailand but this was easily the best. Chef Leez was very knowledgable, her teaching style was friendly and interactive, and the food that we made was delicious! Would recommend it to anyone

Will be back again for sure!. We have just finished class at Chef LeeZ as i type now and it has really been a fun and enriching class! Starting from a trip to the market, the market and people there can't get any more authentic than this! This is my first cooking class ever and boy am i impressed!Chef LeeZ teaches with such ease and willingness to share her cooking tips and insights on fresh ingredients vs preserved ready made ones. We made tom yum gung, pad thai, green curry and also taught an extra dish of chicken galangal in coconut milk soup, all in 2.5hrs. The only reason we are not continuing with the full class is because we are too full from the awesome and authentic dishes! Come with an empty stomach!

Great cooking school . Loved the school. It ended up being a private class and we loved it. Only turn off I have is reading the bad reviews and seeing the webmaster argue with them. Taking bad reviews with a grain of salt would go a long way. Was going to rate 4 stars just for that but my gf convinced me otherwise since the class and food were so amazing. Would recommend this class to a friend.

I can cook?!!. I showed up at Chef LeeZ cooking school and was greeted by the friendliest of staff! They were positive, warm, and cheerful. Turns out I was the only one who showed up, so instead of a group class I was given a private class. I feel like I'll actually be able to make Thai food when I get back home. Chef Lee is fantastic and will answer any questions, as well as give very thorough explanations. The food was delicious! This is one of my last days in Thailand, and I wanted to do something memorable. This was a perfect way to wrap up what has been a great travel experience, and now I can bring some of my trip home with my new cooking skills!

easy to learn and to cook at home. We walked in and reserved for the 6 Course Class on the next day with an option the do the 10 Course Class if we liked it. On the next day we were in the lovely situation, for us, of being the only attendees. Private Lessons :DChef LeeZ took us to the local market for fresh ingredients and gave helpful tips for purchasing and recognizing fresh hot or mild chillies, thai garlic, seafood, shrimps, fish and so on.Back in the classroom we started with 3 kinds of soup. Tom Kha Goong, Tom Yum Goong (Thai and Tourist version), Tom Yum Chili Paste and Prawn Stock. It was sooooo delicious and if you get all the ingredients in your home country, easy to cook.Afterwards my favorite noodle dish, Pad Thai. (Sweet Tamarind Juice is a nice side you can make while using the rest for your Pad Thai) I tried a lot of recipes for Pad Thai already and they all didn't turn out that great. (could have been me though :D ) This recipe and the easiest way to cook it is just awesome....one of the best Pad Thai Goong ever. And I made it?? Amazing....Green Curry Paste and Green Curry Chicken are the last 2 dishes...lucky me, green curry is my favorite curry..excellent. Chef LeeZ showed us how to make the green curry paste and how to alter some ingredients for a red and yellow curry. And again, the taste was soooo good. After all, probably the best spend 1.000BHT ever. Lot of helpful tips to create the perfect Pad Thai and Green Curry, very nice professional chef and you even do something for a good cause! Chef LeeZ is training and providing food for orphans and underprivileged children. Just make sure you do NOT eat before your class...3 soups, Pad Thai and a green curry are waiting for you! :D if you do the 10 course class there will be Yellow Massaman Curry (Paste), Papaya Salad and Mango Sticky Rice on top. Drinking Water is provided free of charge.

I made this?!. This was a fantastic experience! I had a private lesson with Chef LeeZ, and it was fun, informative and down right tasty! I even added a second day of cooking. Chef LeeZ is was easy to understand, funny, and took the time to made sure I understood the ingredients and the method. She gave suggestions on substitutions I could try once I returned to Minnesota. I have made several dishes since coming home, and impressed friends and family!

Lovely and passionate chef. Chef LeeZ is an excellent teacher, well organized and use passion in her lessons. She gave us easy techniques and tips from how to choose ingredients, replace them once not available in ours country, how to cook and the order to pour those ingredients when cooking that make even a novice to feel He or she can be a master in Thaí food. I and my wife love the experience and the food !!! Congrats Chef LeeZ and thank You.

Hugely enjoyable: best food of the trip!. This is a really great experience. Chef Lee is so friendly and informative; I learnt huge amounts, not just about how to prepare the food, but about how to choose ingredients. It was a lovely morning and I really appreciated that when my boyfriend arrived early to meet me, Chef Lee invited him in to share the food (although possibly not as much as he appreciated it!). As someone else has said, the only downside is that this opened my eyes to all the things that restaurants do wrong! I've yet to get a tom yum as good as Leez!

Excellent Instruction, Company and Food. Advantages: Notes provided, informed of Tips & Tricks, absolutely delicious food, hands on experience, you can see the difference!Disadvantages: You will never eat low quality pad-thai again. LeeZ is the master!

Thoroughly enjoy cooking with Chef LeeZ. Chef LeeZ is an excellent teacher with passion for cooking healthy Thai food with full flavor and aroma. It's great to learn how to choose and use the local ingredients, the Thai cooking technique and all the tricks to make aromatic food. She is so kind to share with us how to make our favourite lemon chili sauce, though it's not one of the dishes on the cooking list, and even give us an extra portion to take home. She's wonderful! Highly recommend her cooking class!

Good facilities, good market tour, great chef. Chef Leez was a delightful guide to Thai culture and cooking. The market tour was to a relatively small but interesting market. Good, fresh and exotic stuff there. The classroom is in a storefront and was well equipped. Chef Leez instructed well and the cooking was great. We were in Bangkok on the Thai New Year, we are really happy that Chef Leez took our small group of three on that day. We were the only ones in the class which probably made it better.

Fantastic Day Cooking with Chef Leez. My partner and I had an Awesome day cooking and learning the Thai style of cooking. Chef Leez was great, so knowledgeable, patient and funny. I recommend this to everyone, it is a fun day out and leave with full and happy tummies. Loved It!
Best Thai food cooking school. The chef is very patient, very friendly, very good technique n skill. U learn a lot from it for sure!

Amazing day with Chef Leez!!. It was an amazing day with Chef Leez! She is extremely friendly and knowledgable. The food was incredible and she added an additional dish for us cuz i told her i liked fried banana! The market shopping was interesting...we cooked we ate...you can come empty stomach and leave all full :) it is a must do if you come to bangkok!!

Excellent 4 h class. I just walked by after reading about it here on TA. Five minutes later we started the class. I came by myself so it was just me and Lee. We visited the market and then made 10 dishes. Lee has a great knowledge about both thai and other cuisine. She always helped me to figure out wich ingredients would work as a substitute when I try this at home.Go there, cook and eat good and healthy food learn about thai food culture and have a lot of fun.Maybe not super cheap but it is high quality cooking!

Fun, authentic, and good food. By far the best experience in Bangkok. The chef and the owner are very welcoming and friendly from the beginning till the end. Is patient and thorough throughout the session. And the final product tastes even better than restaurant. It is definitely a good experience to have. Definitely recommend friends and family to come!

Fantastic Class for Weary Travellers. When we arrived at Chef Leez for our private course we were very tired because we had just completed a five hour walking tour in the middle of the day. However Chef Leez, altered her program slightly by starting our course with other things rather than heading straight out to the markets to buy our food. We were given drinks and time to cool down before we headed to the markets. We learnt six recipes and they were all fantastic. Chef Leez indinidually looks after everyone and it was the best cooking experience I have ever had in Asia. Next time I am in Bangkok, I can't wait to go back to learn some more.

great cook school. Chef Lee is so friendly and helpful. She helps you learn the chemistry behind thai cooking and how all of the flavors work together. Great way to spend an afternoon! Highly recommend!

Brilliant cooking school. The visit to Chef Leez cooking school was easily the best activity I've done in Bangkok so far. Chef Lee is a charming person that escorts her customers through the fine art of thai cooking.I did the class with six courses together with three friends and I think the time was very well disposed. We chopped and sliced a few vegetables ourselves and otherwise Chef Lee would show us how she does it. Two other employees makes sure that everything is ready for the cooking stations where the food is actually made, so no time is wasted by having the customers preparing all the ingredients.The icing on the cake was that Chef Lee added two bonus dishes because I and another customer asked about two dishes not on the menu. I did not ask to make it but Chef Lee insisted that we should. Everyone participating in the class therefore got two bonus dishes with no extra cost. It shows the love and passion Chef Lee has for Thai cuisine. Even if you just have a short time in Bangkok I thoroughly recommend Chef Leez cooking school if you enjoy thai food!

Learned a lot and had a lot of fun. Took a class with Chef LeeZ with my girlfriend and we really enjoyed it! Chef Lee was able to customise slightly different menus for us and another pair so that we got to cook and taste more varieties of curries.We also made everything from scratch. I especially liked how we helped prepare a batch of coconut cream and coconut milk and then got to use them in different ways in the various dishes. The ingredients we used were simple but the dishes we prepared tasted so good! Definitely one of my best meals in BKK (and I made it myself!).I look forward to trying these out for myself, and I'll be back for more classes when I'm in Bangkok next.

Great day with Chef Leez. I went with 2 friends to the cooking school and had an amazing experience. We went for the full day and attended a local market with the chef to begin with. It was a slightly more authentic market than I was used to with only a few stalls selling produce. The chef spoke very good English and explained how to find the best products whether it was dried shrimp of garlic. We cooked six dishes after returning from the market. The room you cook in is air conditioned and well equipped. Everything was ready and waiting for us upon our return. The food really is amazing and you can taste the difference between the food you cook here and the food in many restaurants. Everything is so fresh. The day is really fun and the chef is really knowledgeable with any questions you might want to ask. The only thing I would say is that they are so organised and helpful that it is almost too easy. All of the quantities you need are already prepared for you, but you do get given a recipe booklet with everything you need to know. I have already replicated the Som Tam (Papaya Salad) at home and it is delicious. Thanks for an awesome day.

Fun way to learn Thai cooking. We chose Chef Lee Z due to it's ratings on Trip Advisor and we we not disappointed. Chef Lee really knows her craft, she is an expert with Thai cuisine. She and her staff were welcoming and friendly and made us so relaxed it was like cooking with family. Thoroughly enjoyed the experience and would definitely recommend it. And the bonus is you get to eat everything you cook so bring an appetite with you.

Brilliant Class, brilliant Chef!. Chef Leez organised a class for myself, my wife and best mate during the New Year celebrations. I was nervous about the class but needn't have been as chef made us feel welcome and got us striaght to work! We created a full menu of delicious dishes and her sense of humour really helped the day go by easily. I really enjoyed learning how to make Massaman curry and its become something of a speciality since I got home. In addition, chef took us to the fresh food market and this was a real eye opener for the sheer range of food types from , livestock to eel via thousand year eggs. We really enjoyed this class and will definately be back next time we are in Bangkok. Absolute class!

Perfect start before eating in elsewere in Thailand.. Second day in Bangkok we found this cooking class, verry nice chef and verry verry nice dishes. If you tried this you wil recognize good Thai food during your stay.

A tasty highlight. We did two cooking schools, one in Singapore and this one in Bangkok. I have to say that Chef Leez was better! I was impressed with the amount of dishes I prepared (and ate) and the whole thing was well thought out. We did three soups, two curries, salad, and a dessert. Then after we were full (but not uncomfortably so) took a nice walk to the local market. It was a simple neighborhood open air market behind some alley would never have walked down on our own. I liked that she showed us how she picked the right dried shrimps and which vegetables and not the old dark dried chilies etc. I liked that I finally had someone to ask about the market cats and stray(?) dogs (while none particular owns them, people will be nice and provide water and scraps so they keep away rats and lizards). I just visited a local Thai market in Oakland and will try things in my own kitchen.Would definitely recommended! It's nice to get out of the heat and sun, so many our activities were outdoors a break was nice.

"Best Day in Bangkok". Our second time attending Chef Leez cooking class. My daughters (fifteen and twelve) and myself thoroughly enjoy our day spent there. Right out of the gates the trip to the local'smarket is so interesting.Chef Leez easy going and witty personality makes this day go by so quickly. She always pleases everyone's special requests for certain dishes and truly enjoys teaching and seeing people recreate her recipes. It is such an interactive and great experience to share with your children.

Authentic and Delicious. Chef LeeZ started us off with going to the market and selecting fresh ingredients. With her professional instruction and demonstration we were eager to begin our hands on learning experience. There are no short cuts with the Chef. Each item is carefully selected and combined to meet or exceed the cooking and tasting experience. The five cooking participants were able to sequence the timing of adding each tasty ingredients with precise cooking temperatures. Chef LeeZ explained in detail and carefully demonstrated techniques to prepare sauces and combine elements of ThaI cooking. We were delighted at our results. The meals were excellent. The facility was very functional and her assistant was very efficient in helping to prepare our individual items to cook. We will definitely be better equipped to cook Thai food in our home country thanks to Chef LeeZ. A must attend class if you are in Bangkok. Happy cooking from Bernard and Marie the content Canadians.
Great Activity. The people were very nice and the food was delicious -- highly recommended. Definitely check this out if you're going to be in Bangkok.

Great value for great knowledge. . We did a day course, and were lucky enough to be the only two students.One of us is a vegetarian and the other loves super spicy food. Chef Leez had no problem in accommodating these and showed us both how to alter each recipe to suit our needs. Her English was great and the team were happy and helpful. The food tasted AMAZING.The structure is simple and straightforward: we started with a visit to the local market, guided by chef leez. She introduced us to her philosophies on food, and showed is how to prudently acquire good clean and chemical free food from a busy Bangkok market. Worth it just for this experience. Here we (rather chef) got extra ingredients needed for our special requests (vegetarian & super spicy).The lesson: for each dish we started with the base ingredient and prep, making coconut cream and milk, tamarind paste, and a chilli paste for the soups, curry paste for the curries. From these basics of Thai food we learnt kinetically how to mix and combine them into pretty much all Thai foods. We made and sampled three soups, four curries, two noodle dishes a salad and desert. Even though the basics were so similar we were surprised at how different the final products were. DO NOT EAT BREAKFAST, you'll be nearly full after the soups, with many more dishes to come, and they are that good that you will want to finish every drop.  We left with the knowledge of how to expand and adapt these basics into many more. Five stars.The cost of 1500 Thai baht is very reasonable. Considering in other (more touristy) places like Koh Samui you can expect to pay between 1500-2000 baht and learn only two dishes, and they're not this good. Getting there: was easier than expected, LTS provided us with very simple and direct instructions in both English and Thai. We managed to get a tuk tuk to the door from our hotel in Chinatown for 100 baht, which we and the driver were happy with.The lesson took four hours and we needed a nap afterward as we were so full. Highly recommended to both advanced and novice cooks.

Great experience. I took 2 days of cooking classes in late February and really learned a tremendous amount about Thai cooking. Chef Lee was very personable and made the day go by all too quickly with small anecdotes on her growing up. I though the visit to the local market was a great way to start the day and I learned a lot about how to pick out the best and freshest items. The only thing that could have been better for me is if the written recipes matched what we did in class a little better. While they were helpful, they could have been more accurate and saved some furious note taking. But all in all, very well worth the time and money to go here!

lots of fun!. We visited during some of the problems in Bangkok (which had no impact on us at all) so we (two couples - one in our late forties and one in their early twenties) had Chef LeeZ to ourselves for a morning cooking class. She has a very fun and witty personality and we were able to customize some requests including making vegetarian spring rolls and sticky rice with mango. Learning about the ingredients and the simplicity yet incredible flavour and aroma of some Thai standards (different soups and curries) made for a fascinating morning. Chef LeeZ also did a wonderful job of accommodating the one vegetarian in our group, so many of the dishes were done with meat or fish and again for the vegetarian version. Definitely a highlight of our trip. Chef Leez made it fun and it was a surprise to see that four hours were already over!

Cooking Experience That Cant Be Beat. Cooking with Chef Lee was and absolutely wonderful experience. She is a genuinely friendly woman with a passion for teaching and developing the people around her. Her experience in cooking techniques and her ability to demonstrate and showcase them was exceptional; being both very precise but also cooking with flair.I recommend Chef LeeZ cooking class to anyone who is travelling through Bangkok, Thailand looking for the most admirable cooking experiences with Thai food there is to offer.

Fantastic experience - worth every cent!. Had great fun here learning to cook Thai food, the traditional way, completely from scratch. The entire experience was great the whole way through - from visiting the markets, to learning and tasting the differences in shop bought components to the actual stuff, to the results what cooked!Chef is extremely passionate about teaching you how to make tasty food and the ability get the recipes online with videos well as in paper form just makes more comfortable that I'll able reproduce at home.Great experience, thoroughly enjoyable day.

Lovely cooking course!. Spend my last day in Bangkok taking a cooking class here! It was a great experience! I learned a lot and the meals were so good! The teacher is very lovely and is endeavor that her students get a good insight in the thai cooking tradition. I would definetly recommend it!

Even better than we expected. We had high expectations regarding all the great comments we saw on trip advisor. It turned out to be an even better experience than were expecting. Chef LeeZ is just adorable and knows her subject, we learned all about Thaï products, Thaï main recipes and Thaï cooking technics. We also ate everything and flew in mouth paradise.

briljant cooking class with a personal touch !. This cooking class has everything ! Chef Leez is funny, charming and a very good teacher. She takes time to explain and if you have special requests.......she will put it in the programm. After some experience already in Thai cooking I really wanted to learn to cook my noodles better and learn how to make a very good sweet and sour sauce and the Kanom Thuey ( a dessert). I learned everything !! Don't eat much before the class.........everything you cook ........you eat it. I recommend Chef Leez for everybody who wants to learn Thai cooking.

A Chef's Dream. The class was a much anticipated element of our Bangkok visit and my foodie husband enrolled well in advance. Since he does ALL the cooking I planned to go along to take pictures. We were told on arrival that only enrolled students could attend, so I was signed up, a little trepidatious about what would be required of me. In the end I had a fantastic time, as Chef Lee herself absorbed my part in a kindly subtle way. So if this sounds familiar to anyone reading this, fear not and do not miss the class. First of all, if for any reason this renown chef should choose to stop teaching her very delicious Thai cuisine, I am certain that she would have great success as a stand-up comedian. Laughter was certainly a spice of the day. We joined an international group of three other couples and set off on a field trip to the nearby market, making a brief stop to wonder at the monitor lizards sunning in the canal along the way. Without our guide we would never have guessed what emerged when we entered a narrow alley. A warren of stalls, each specializing in a product Chef Lee narrated (e.g., how the Taiwanese invented the coconut shredder for the essential Thai ingredient, what ingredient was a good or bad choice, how the cats came to enjoy preferential treatment after a flood that miraculously spared the market they frequented, and many instances of products that would never be sanctioned in a Western culture but are essential to the preparation of authentic Thai cuisine and more). The butcher’s stall was remarkable with production ongoing. Back to the school where an incredibly delicious meal was demonstrated, produced and enjoyed, in part due to the choreography of the staff who enhanced the convivial experience. Our menu of the day included the following: chili paste (hot) on toast, both clear an creamy chicken soup, pad Thai with shrimp, green and massaman curry (a name that evolved from the original Muslim adjective), papaya in a spicy vinegar preparation, polished off with mango and sticky rice. We had a phenomenal meal and a truly memorable day. For a final observation, I was curious about the roll of toilet paper at each station before we began to eat, but it was soon obvious it was there to capture the Thai food tears we all happily shed in the process.

Great cooking class!. I took a class with Chef Leez on Jan. 13th, during the protests in Bangkok. This resulted in me being the only one taking the course... I was a bit apprehensive because I wanted a social experience. But the lesson was even more useful because I was the only one she was teaching. She has very knowledgeable, always giving fun details and answering any questions I had (and I had a lot- about culture, food, etc). The market trip was really cool, you couldn't have this experience on your own. I think people are a bit wary of the quality because the location isn't the nicest- but you pay a bit less for this reason, and the teaching and food quality is probably just as good as a fancy cooking school. Would definitely take this course again- it emphasized good food and helped me to understand thai culture. Chef Leez was very professional. She even added my tip to her charity for street children.

Great experience. Hi, Myself and my girlfriend visited Chef Leez towards the end of our South East Asian trip and absolutely loved it. The recipies, the ingredients, the atmosphere and the instruction – all quality. Highly recommended (and about 45 seconds from our hotel). A couple of points that specifically made this course stand out for us were: - The trip to the market. We had been on another cooking class in Vietnam and the trip to the market seemed a little pointless. We just walked around while the ‘guide’ picked out all the produce with little additional information. In the Thai course we were given loads of info on Thai eating habits, quality of the produce, what to look for and more. Very interesting.- Very fresh. All produce was fresh and good quality with an emphasis on reducing reliance on packaged goods where possible. All in all a great experience and of course, the recipes can now take their place in our kitchen.

Outstanding. My wife and I attended Chef Leez's classes today and thoroughly enjoyed it. Her passion, knowledge, sense of humour and ability to instruct so many things is nothing short of outstanding. There may have been an element of reluctance attending this class due to the so called civil unrest, it was none existent. We started the classes with a trip to the market with Chef Leez, this is an education in itself, she loves to pass on her knowledge of all ingredients and ensures only the freshest and healthiest are selected, there is no MSG or jar stored pastes used here, everything is fresh. The meals made today were mouth watering, I don't think I'll ever be able to visit a Thai restaurant again and expect to sample food of the same standard I had the honour to experience today, it was simply delicious. Thank you Chef Leez, I will try my utmost to replicate what you taught us today.

An unexpected highlight. On a 4 week Far East trip, my girlfriend and I were in Bangkok for a couple of days between planned excursions. Wandering what to do, we looked at Tripadvisor (of course) and came across Chef Leez Cooking School.We thought it might be a nice experience and it would kill some time. Well we contacted the school and made a booking. They were very helpful and accomodating (the class was already nearly full).We were so glad that they could fit us in. It turned out to be such a highlight on our trip. We cannot recommend it highly enough.I can't cook. Just a slice of toast is a culinary challenge for me. My girlfriend is a good cook. The course catered for all the skill levels present. I produced the most amazing Tom Yum Gung soup. I'll never forget it.Its a wonderful experience that starts in the market where Chef Leez goes through all the do's and dont's of buying whichever produce. Then back to the kitchen to prepare the most amazing food, so fresh and light and tasty.Take your camera. There are lots of opportunities to photograph some great looking dishes (which you made).If you are like me and refuse to use a taxi, be warned. You can get lost as we did. We took the water taxi from Ratchprarop Street to its end. From there its a walk keeping the canal on your left shoulder.Don't keep it on your left shoulder at your own peril. Whichever way you get there, you must go. It's great.

Stands out from most cooking classes. Chef Leez classes are outstanding!She really wants to teach people about her culture through food and unlike other places who give half recipes she makes sure one is happy.We had a misunderstanding on the dishes we wanted to cook so she made a last minute plan and arrange for extra dishes.One gets to choose what one wants to learn to cook and its not only about the cooking but also going to a local market and understanding the different qualities of ingredients.The biggest proof of how amazing the class is in the food we cooked, each and every single dish was not only amazing but the best thai food we had while in bangkok.After eating here its painful to eat in any restaurant of koh san road. Even if you arent too much into cooking, if you like food go cook so you can eatAlso after being in the class they keep in touch and send you additional recipes and tips

One of our favorite things. Chef Lee took the time to give my girlfriend and I a greater appreciation and knowledge of Thai cuisine. We hit the streets right after with the swagger of experts. Incredible experience!

wonderful experience. we attended a class on the election day in bangkok, we had considered cancelling but we were so glad we went, chef leez was amazing, we were the only two there and she personally took us shopping in the local market and she managed to add in two more recipes for us! the fresh squeesed coconut cream makes and incredible difference in the recipe. she was engaging and very knowledgable - very enjoyable day. my one piece of advice is not to eat before going!

Thank Goodness for Chef LeeZ!. Just two days after my husband and I returned from our honeymoon in Thailand, we were already craving real Thai food. Thank goodness for Chef LeeZ's class! Because of Chef LeeZ's class I was able to confidently go into a local Thai market and successfully make some Tom Yam soup and Pad Thai (both mai pet!), complete with shrimp "ketchup"! Thank you for such a wonderfully fun and delicious class!Both my husband and I highly recommend this class to anyone going to Bangkok - it will be the highlight of your trip!

mmmh best activity in Bangkok. It was just so great - we were avery small, fun group, and chef lee is just great, so much fun! We learned an incredible amount of valuable information. I can only recommend this to everyone, even if you are a beginner or experienced cook. Chef lee was very flexible, when we asked her to show us how to do phad kra pao, she was delighted to do so. We hope that she will continue with her school for many more years and that we will have the opportunity to come back again for a course in the future.

wonderful experience. There's a lot of good reviews of Chef LeeZ's cooking course on TA. Add one more to the list. This one coming from, let me be honest, a non-starter in the kitchen. My wife and I took her course about a week ago. It was delightful - and delicious. She was knowledgeable, enthusiastic and a lot of fun. It starts with a trip to a nearby market, which is interesting in itself. Chef Lee gave us a lot of information about local produce, spices, seafood. Most of it was positive, but she also told us which products weren't quality.Back at the school, we prepared nine dishes (all were the best Thai food we have had in Thailand so far) in four hours. My wife does a lot of cooking and was unsure how much she'd really gain from taking the course, but she was pleasantly surprised that what Chef Leez had to offer went beyond merely following a recipe. An added bonus was that thanks to her recommendation, we now have a full set of quality cooking knives which we purchased in Bangkok. Take the course. You won't regret it!

Upstanding honest business with reputable managment. Unfortunately, I did not get to experience a Chef Leez Thai cooking school class, but I still had a pleasant experience with this business.I paid in full for a cooking class for 2, but unfortunately after my flights to and from Bangkok were cancelled by the airlines, I had to request a refund. Within a few hours, Chef Leez, issued a FULL refund with no further questions asked. I really appreciate the ease and speed of the refund. Furthermore, I am now seeking many refunds from many different attractions/hotels and it has been a challenge to recover any amount, but this was not so with Chef Leez.If you want to support a business that does it the right way, go to Chef Leez - I'm sure they do a great job with the cooking class as well. When I return back to Thailand to vacation, it will definitely be part of my itinerary.

Great value for money. If you want to learn how to make Thailand's most popular dishes, easily and authentically, then Chef Leez is the place to do it. We learnt a lot more than expected and had a lot of laughs along the way.

Old Dogs can Learn New Tricks. My friend and I took a 2-day course on 12/24 and 12/25. Chef Lee was very professional and taught us tips/tricks of the culinary world. She's a stickler for quality ingredients and showed us what to look for and what not to look for (e.g., tricks vendors use to sell dried shrimp). I used one of her tips the next time I bought a snack from a street vendor (e.g., asked for freshly squeezed pomegranate juice instead of one already bottled - they add sugar to make the juices sweeter). She offers up substitutes for ingredients you may not be able to find in your home location. The class sizes are small enough for the chef to teach either variations or new dishes that are not on the curriculum. She's also supported by staff who help to ensure that you have a clean work space and right ingredients. Chef's English speaking ability is phenomenal. We were joined by a family one day and the kids (teens) really enjoyed the class. I highly recommend the cooking school for anyone. I consider myself a pretty good cook and I was able to learn not only how to make my favorite Thai dishes, but I also learned new cooking tips/tricks. I also compared prices for other cooking schools. The fees are very reasonable and worth what I learned at the school.

Amazing Experience. Chef LeeZ is clearly very knowledgeable and skilled at her craft. She is also very funny! The trip to the market was one I could not have experienced without the class. You make everything from scratch, with ingredients bought just before cooking. The dishes are familiar thai foods you can find on every corner of Bangkok (green curry, papaya salad, tom yum soup etc.) but Chef Leez is dedicated to cooking the way "grandma cooked," or rather "for a 5-Star restaurant not a 2-Star restaurant." The result is that the dish you may have had 10 times already tastes amazingly better, fresher, and even more mouthwatering than you could have imagined. And you made it yourself! Chef Leez also gives tips for making your recipes at home without the use of fresh, thai ingredients which you may not be able to get at your local grocery store. Overall, one of the most fun activities in Bangkok.

What a great experience. This cooking class was just what i needed. The lesson went from choosing the food at the markets to cooking the food and helping us to understand the basics. Coconut sugar is my new favourite....

Memorable and fun. We loved this cooking course. Chef Lee is warm and entertaining, and she's a wonderful teacher. We learnt so much from her. And of course the food we prepared with her was delicious.

Fun, educational, and yummy - this is why I came to Thailand. Chef LeeZ really cares about food and about you. When you sign up for her class, she delivers detailed instructions on how to get there, her phone number to call if anything goes haywire (wrong line on the river boat to get there for us), and other helpful hints. The beginning of the class starts with a warm introduction to her and Thai cuisine, followed by a trip to an authentic market you will never forget. She goes through every ingredient thoroughly and every ingredient you should avoid using in your cooking. This was extremely informative and showed how much she loves food, cooking, her country and frankly, all of us. Now the cooking. Wow. I have new techniques down and a newfound appreciation for additives that may be complex to make but provide ALL the flavor. You just have to take the time and effort to get those ingredients, do it right, and make Chef LeeZ proud. We made three soups, two curries, papaya salad, and desert.
