The portions are just right to make it through. She was so sweet to put a candle on our sticky rice with mango to make my husband's birthday memorable. We've had a great time in Bangkok but this was the highlight of the city, by far.

Fun, educational, hands-on and authentic!. One of the highlights of my recent trip to Bangkok was Chef Leez cooking class. The class was comprehensive, yet fun and functional. The visit to the market gave great insight into Thai culture and cooking. As a vegetarian, it was delightful to receive the accommodated instruction for vegetarians. I found her cooking to be very natural and healthy, exactly what I was looking for. Her sense of humor was superb which made the class that much more enjoyable. We've already decided to take another trip next year and take part 2 of the cooking class. ( We did the odd day class, next year we will do the even day class.) Looking forward!!!

I cooked and it didn't taste terrible!. I'm no cook, and honestly my friend and I just took the course for fun and for lack of anything planned for that day. It turned out to be a very good decision, as the class was ridiculously fun and informative. You start by walking your little basket to a local market nearby and get loaded up with all kinds of fresh foods, while being informed of the fake stuff you should never buy ("that's full of MSG"; "that '100% lime juice' is actually vinegar"). Then it's back to the school for a cooking lineup full of jokes and laughter.My favorite part? Cheef LeeZ is open to suggestions! I told her I wanted to make a cake (honestly I was half-joking), so we did. We made banana rice cake, and it was delicious! We also had Thai Iced Tea, and any dish we wanted she would arrange, free of extra charge.

Real cooking school. There are several cooking schools in Bangkok and at least three on the street where Miss LeeZ is located. Don't be fooled by the others, if you want to learn how to cook Thai food and why Thai food is distinctive then Miss LeeZ is the place to go.

So Glad I Went With Chef Leez!. Definitely a must-do if you're in Bangkok. She was so knowledgeable and friendly, and I really learned a lot about Thai cooking and the culture there. Since I cook a lot, this was definitely a class worth taking since we also got the recipes to take home! I had a great time and look forward to returning for some of her other classes!

Funny, healthy and delicious. Me and my boyfriend and a great cooking lesson with Chef Leez!! She is so funny, involves every students during the market shopping and cooking steps.All together prepared great dishes including desert and was not able to have dinner that day because we hate a lot!

Delicious and fun. Even if you're not interested in cooking, the food you eat will be the best in Thailand! Really was the most delicious Pad Thai I've ever eaten, and you can see why when you see how Chef Leez uses fresh, raw ingredients - we even squeezed shredded coconut to get the cream!Chef Leez is such a friendly, interesting lady and made it very fun. When we were running late she spoke to the taxi driver to give fastest route and helped us get to our next destination after the class.I highly recommend this course (you can't sight-see the whole time). Thanks Chef Leez for a great course and amazing food.

Informative, fun, tasty. This was great. Chef Lee not only teaches you how to cook, she also gives a lot of insider information on eating in Thailand - what to watch out of for, where to eat, etc. I would recommend doing this as one of your first things when you get to Thailand. It is a great way to start a trip.

Great experience - highly recomend!. My wife and I really enjoyed chef Lee's cooking class on one of our free days in Bangkok. Chef is a highly educated, talented chef. She speaks perfect English, and makes the class fun for all! We loved going to the market to buy our produce, where Chef gave us hints about finding the best raw materials for our feast.We made several dishes, and she allowed us to customize our food to eliminate seafood. Everything we made was delicious. She gave us printed recipes so that we can try it again at home, assuming we can find some of the produce that may be difficult to find in the USA.

Great Customer Service. Unfortunately, we were unable to get across town to the school as our hotel was on the other side of the protests - and the local taxi drivers didn't want to get caught in the traffic.Chef LeeZ was very understanding, helpful, and accommodating. Was kind enough to refund my deposit and sent me a very nice email with recipes from the class, and inviting me to join them the next time we're in Bangkok.Overall, wish I could have gotten to the school for the class, but I can certainly recommend them based on their customer service.

Fantastic food (safe to eat), wonderful teacher, fun half-day activity. We had a fantastic time with Chef Lee in the Group Class (we were the only two people today, so it was similar to the Private Class). Book a class near the start of your holiday for a safe and authentic introduction to Thai cuisine.It started with a quick walk around a small local marketplace. Chef Lee told us about finding good produce and never to trust labels on Thai packaged foods!You cook more than 6 different Thai dishes from scratch, including soups, noodles, curries, papaya salad, and dessert! Chef Lee and the kitchen assistant prepare the quantities and ingredients, so you only need to chop fresh ingredients and cook the food.The experience is like an interactive cooking show! Chef Lee is very entertaining and knows so much about cooking and Thai cuisine. We enjoyed cooking up a storm, without us having to do the boring grunt work (preparation and cleaning up). All the food was delicious and freshly prepared, which left us feeling very full and happy.Thanks again, Chef Lee! We'll send more Aussies your way :)

Other Thai food will never taste as good as these dishes!. Due to recent protests, my cousin and I were 30 minutes late to our Chef LeeZ's class but she was completely understanding and called to check up on us. She even spoke to our taxi driver over the phone to give him directions.I really enjoyed my experience with Chef LeeZ. The food we made was authentic, natural and absolutely delicious. Unfortunately every other Thai meal I had after this class was disappointing.The portion sizes were good and we were all very full at the end. (Don't have a big breakfast before you go!) We joined a group class and there were only 4 of us so were definitely all given individual treatment. Chef LeeZ was funny, knowledgeable and a great host.I do have to agree with a previous review that comments about the use of MSG and artificial products getting tiresome. It was good to know, but I felt that it was overdone. It still doesn't change my 5 star rating of the experience though.I'd love to be able to recreate these dishes (especially the sticky rice with mango dessert) but I don't think many of the ingredients are available back home.

Knowledgeable and health conscious Thai cuisine. I had an awesome experience learning about Thai cuisine from Chef Lee. She was very friendly, funny, and knowledgeable about the fine details of Thai food.After getting settled at the school, Chef Lee first introduced various ingredients used in Thai food which helped me understand the complex aromas and flavors. Then we took a short trip to the market to purchase more ingredients and continued furthering our knowledge.We started cooking after our trip and followed the set of dishes that had been pre-set. Chef Lee kindly added more dishes as we requested such as papaya salad. Although, cooking itself wasn't difficult nor complex, the main thing that I learned was the technique and small details that make Thai cooking unique. Essentially, it was learning the basics on how to make Thai food taste the way it does. I recommend really paying attention to how the dishes are made rather than what is in it.Overall, this has been my best experience that I've had in Thailand during my trip and only wish I had more time to cook and learn. Chef Lee is a terrific teacher with great communication skills . I highly recommend trying out her class, especially if you enjoy cooking and eating.Finally, make sure you go to class hungry because you will be stuffed by the end of the class.

A wonderful way to spend your morning!. My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed going to Chef LeeZ's class. She, and her staff, we're very nice and helped give us an unforgettable experience. I definitely recommend going do this.

Okay. My husband and I spent the last day of our two week vacation with Chef Leez. Overall, the day was okay. The place is tricky to find but they give directions for taxis which helped a bit. The set up is clean and the food prepared is good. However, The chef and partner spend a lot of time disparaging local thai restaurants making them seem unsafe, unhealthy and unappetizing. It got tiresome. We did many other cooking courses during our trip and this ranks in the of the middle pack.

Family time. Wonderful experience learning how to cook from Chef LeeZ. She taught us all the basics and even threw in a couple of extra recipes we wanted to learn that were not on the agenda. Thanks for a great experience. Highly recommend to anyone visiting Bangkok.

Excellent experience. The class began with Chef Lee showing and giving samples of ingredients. Next, we ventured to a market about two blocks away. Chef pointed out and bought the ingredients for the day's meals. This trip was eye opening! Quite a cultural experience. When we returned to the school, some items had been prepped for us. Our class size was 5 students. Chef Lee was very hands on and helpful. Her English is great and the food was even better! My friend is vegan and Chef made accommodations for her without any trouble at all. This was one of my favorite memories of our trip and I highly recommend taking a class. My only critique would be that the school facility lacks ambiance and the bathroom could use a make over.

Great class!. The class starts with a tour of a local market near by. Everyone holds some items for the class to use later. Lots of information on healthier cooking. Everyone makes his/her own dish and the class size is small so lots of attention. It's within walking distance from the backpacker area (Kho San road). Highly recommend!

Ready to Cook!. My friend wanted to learn some traditional Thai cooking so I booked this during our trip to Bangkok and had an awesome time! Chef LeeZ is very experienced, down to earth and made the class delicious. We learned how to make six dishes from scratch and even answered questions on how to make dishes we were curious about not on the menu for the day. Thai food at the restaurant now will not ever be the same. I love how she gave out recipes especially the Tom Yum paste which can not ever be compared to store bought ones - drooling.The only minor thing I want to point out is I am hoping in time they'll be able to move to a better location. Ready to go home and cook now! Thank you.

good experience. Our class has just my wife and myself. We went to the local market just few blocks away and Chef Leez gave us a lesson on the local ingredients and how to distinguish between good and bad seafood. After that we went back to cook. Being a guy whom visit Thai restaurant often, I have to say the stuff we cooked is amazing, never have that taste before, so fresh and natural. A very enjoyable morning and will definitely try some out back home.

Recommended at the start of your trip.. We decided to take the cooking lessons of Chef Leez the first day we were in Bangkok. Besides another couple, it was only my girlfriend and I. After a small introduction the chef and everything she stands for, we went to a small market a few blocks away. It was somewhat hidden and as authentic as you could have. We learnt about the different keystones of our recipes and the difference between quality and the famous MSG, so often used in western kitchens. After that, we made the coconut cream and paste by ourselves and started cooking.The dishes were so good, so pure. The green curry mixed with coriander still lasts in my memory! Small footnote: there is not much cooking in fact, because most of the ingredients are already prepared and cut by the assistants. In most cases you just have to throw your ingredients in the saucepans. But somehow we completed our five dishes and chef Leez’ enthusiasm and professionalism are additive. She surely does know what she’s talking about and with her friendliness she shares every secret the Thai kitchen has to offer.I recommend to do this cooking class before your actual trip starts, because after this lesson you have a better and more accurate view on the dishes in the various food stalls during the rest of your journey. And last but not least, do NOT under any circumstance have breakfast before you arrive!!We kept the recipes and even though some ingredients are hard to find, we still prepare them at home! (In my opinion one of the best souvenirs you can have from Thailand). I can conclude my review with a justified statement from the brochure: “Relax, you are in Tripadvisors student ranked nr. 1 culinary arts cooking school!”

Highlight of Bangkok!. Me and a friend went to the 10-2pm Thai cooking class with Chef LeeZ. It started with an enlightening trip to the local market for our ingredients, a part of Bangkok we would otherwise had never experienced followed by the class itself. Chef LeeZ is AMAZING! Her friendly charm and constant jokes made the class enjoyable, knowledgeable and fun. I cannot recommended this class more, well worth a visit. The food was delicious too :D

Best thing I did in Bangkok!. We went to the local market to begin with our own little straw baskets, chef leez showed us about the local ingredients and what not to buy and what certain vegetables were. We made lots of delicious dishes with fresh local ingredients, they even catered to me being vegetarian!! I tried a few things I would not have tried in a restaurant, and everything was so flavourfull! After you've been in Thailand for a bit you can tell the difference beteeen cheap gross food and fresh good food and after the course I feel confident I can make fresh good thai food at home! Don't miss out on this!

great thai food. my husband and i loved our cooking class! we got there a little bit early and while we were waiting for the other class members to show up, chef lee z gave us a little lesson in vegetable carving. she makes it look so easy! we went to a local market to buy ingredients for our classes and then spent the next few hours cooking up various thai specialties. our favorites were the papaya salad and tom yum soup. she was a patient and knowledgeable teacher with a great sense of humor! everything that we made was delicious. she gives you a little recipe booklet to take home and my husband and i have had a great time trying to replicate some of the dishes at home!

Great experience. It was a great experience to have this course, Chef LeeZ was really friendly and very helpful, the facilities were good and the recipes were amazing.I have learned not just how to cook but also all the ingredients and the richness of using good quality products.It was a great experience and i do recommend this course.

The best way to learn about a culture starts with the food. I'm really grateful to have found Chef LeeZ cooking class. I went there for the morning class (10am) with my wife and my mum. We had a beautiful and memorable time, lots of laugh and lots of love. Chef Lee is a Master in Thai cooking, we could see that she loved sharing her knowledge in Thai food and her Culture. I'd like to thanks also the team, the 2 students helping her to make the course smoother. Btw, the little market was magic, a lot of things going on in there. Just enjoy!

Yummy Thai dishes on the menu. Chef was patient in explaining things and answering questions. And the food we prepared were really yummy. The menu was actually my deciding factor in choosing this cooking school because they were mostly my favorites - tom yum soup, curries, pad thai, sticky rice with mango and papaya salad. Morning well spent. :) I recommended to friends and they'll definitely consider this when they decide to take some cooking class in Bangkok.

Great cooking experience. We celebrated a friend's birthday at Chef Leez and had such a great time. Leez took us on a market tour where we bought ingredients for the day and we cooked up 6 dishes all from scratch over 4 hours. Leez was humourous, lovely, fun and knowledgeable and her staff were incredibly attentive!I highly recommend Chef Leez Cooking School and can't wait to go back there when I'm next in Bangkok!

Worth it just for the food!. Really enjoyed going around the market and then coming back and cooking with the ingredients. The chef that was tutoring us was very friendly and interesting. The food we cooked was amazing and the mango and coconut sticky rice was the best in BKK! I can't wait to recreate it at home

Perfect experience.. This review is simple: definitely a very worthwhile experience. The previous positive reviews speak for themselves. Chef Lee is an absolutely wonderful person and really wants you to understand her love for thai cooking.

Great Bangkok Experience. My family and I (six adults total) saved the best for last, and had a great cooking experience with Chef LeeZ Thai Cooking School. We were warmly welcomed, and the class was wonderful. The staff does so much work in the background (preparation, cleaning) that you can focus on learning how to make the dishes. Chef lee provides a lot of insight into what is good and what to avoid when cooking Thai food, and the short trip to the market sets the stage for that. I wish we had more time, we would love to come back for more.

Best cooking school for those with dietary restrictions.. I chose chef Leez' school because of the positive reviews on tripadvisor as well as their willingness and ability to veganize the class for me. We ended up having the best time and this was definitely the highlight of my first bangkok trip. I have done quite a few tourist cooking classes and this was by far the best one. We got to pick our own menu for the class. Among the 4 of us there's 1 vegan, 2.seafood eaters and 1 animal eater. It was definitely tricky. Chef Leez was not only accomedating, she remembered all of our preferences and gave each of us additional recommendations on what we could do at home. The food we made in class was what I would call "the real deal." We made our own coconut cream and our own chili paste. None of that processed stuff you get at restaurants. And that made our food sooo much better. The mango sticky rice we made in class was hands down the best mango sticky rice I have ever had. Now, on to the Chef. Chef Leez is just amazing. She is professional and knowledgable. But she was also extremely humourous and easy going at the same time. We had two people who had never cooked before and there was more than your usual amount of spillage and panicking. She handled it gracefully and with time to throw in a laughter or two. She controlled the flow and the timing of the class perfectly. Even though none of us really knew what we were doing, somehow in the end, we all successfully completed our 5 dishes and all were so full on the best Thai food ever we couldn't walk. I really truly had the most incredible and memorable time during our class with Chef Leez. I sincerely recommened this class to those interested in learning the secrets to making delicious Thai food. I already plan to come back and make 5 diffrent dishes next time I am in Bangkok.

Great food, great people...a must in Bangkok. With so many choices available for cooking classes in BKK it was hard to come down to one. Thankfully tripadvisor came through again and provided us with a fantastic experience.The thing I liked most about this class was that we were shown how to cook the dish then each of us would prepare our own individual serving. We couldn’t believe the number of dishes we covered in 4 hours, on top of that learning so much about the ingredients and the traditional ways to prepare each dish. We had a private class with 7 people and all walked out feeling like we were experts on Thai food…no quite but an awesome experience nonetheless!Forget all the rest, Chef LeeZ is the best!

Actual learning!. Chef LeeZ cooking school is a simple establishment that delivers the secrets of Thai cuisine directly, and intensively, if you are so inclined, to you over a few hours. I took the beginner's fruit carving class, and was astonished to learn as much as I did. Chef Lee sensed I was very interested and did not let me rest on my laurels! I had so much fun, and was fully absorbed for three hours or so, carving leaves, flowers, even roses (this belongs in the advanced class, normally, but as I said, the pace was picked up - and I loved that! She could have "taken it easy" and let me fritter away, so to speak, but she was watching me closely, and decided to challenge me progressively). What a great teacher. If you have any interest in Thai cooking or carving, this is a wonderful person to go to. Just so you know, when I was paying with PayPal, I tried following the website instructions of leaving instructions to merchant on PayPal as to which class I could attend... It wasn't possible, but the school contacted me by email super quickly to sort that out. You can just as well email them yourself and tell them. Based on everything I have experienced, they will make it work.

Great experience. My wife and I tried the Chef LeeZ experience over the other available cooking schools because of it's TripAdvisor rankings and were very pleased with our choice. We signed up for the group class in the morning and we happened to be the only ones there, resulting in a private lesson for us! Chef was an extremely friendly and passionate teacher who's depth of knowledge about the ingredients and techniques was mind blowing. A must for anyone visiting Bangkok!

exellent cooking classes. I'd like to recomend cooking classes in Chef LeeZ Thai cooking School as one of the best spend time and money during my trip to Thailand! Verynice, smart and profesional instructor - Cheef Lee - provides nice and very constructine spent time. If you like Thai cuisine - absolutly must be!

Great fun!. My wife and I were there last week and had a very nice time. We appreciated how pleasant everyone as well as chef Leez charisma. Most importantly, we left feeling like we can go back to the US and prepare some of these awesome dishes on our own! We would recommend this to anyone who loves Thai food and wants to learn how to prepare it themselves. Great value, and they are not joking when they tell you not to eat before the class!

awesome fun at Chef LeeZ. My friends and I had so much fun at Chef LeeZ's class! The lady is so friendly, so willing to share her tips and advice, and just made all of us feel so excited on the dishes we were going to prepare! Chef Leez brought us to the market just across the streets and introduced us to the different spices and ingredients used for thai cooking. After our little grocery shopping, Chef began her cooking demonstrations. It was fun watching her cook and telling funny stories, but the real fun begins when we started cooking ourselves. The recipes were simple but taste so good!Chef Leez and her team of helpers were very friendly and welcoming, we had a great time! Will definitely recommend this activity to all who are interested for some fun!

lovely chef, lovely food!. I really had a lot of fun here, it was one of my highlights in Bnagkok. Chef Leez has a great sense of humour and warm personality..v passionate and sincere about cooking. A great way to get to know the Thai culture too, a definite recommend!

Good activity and food was great. Good learning experience, me and my partner enjoy learning the different dish prepared . Chef Lez is very passionate about the quality of her food and it shows on the result of our cooking .. It was a tiny bit of a language barrier as I found that chef lez was not able to respond to my query with the right answer .

Chef Leez, we salute you!!. I'll start by saying do this, you wont regret it! Me and my girlfriend (both 30yrs old) had a lesson with the very knowledgable and sweet Chef Leez. We were welcomed by her and her helpers before going to the market where she collected all the necessary ingredients for our cooking explaining them as she went along which was a real eye opener. We were shown how popular MSG is in the cooking and how much she detests it, opting more for real ingredients with real flavours and boy can she cook! After the market we went back to cook dishes such as Pad Thai, Thai Green/Red Curry and Tom Yum Paste, Sticky Rice with mango and more! She taught at a comfortable pace and I didnt get bored of saying YUM after trying every dish I cooked! We were both stuffed at the end of the class and eager to get out there to cook our own food. We were also able to recognise many of the ingredients within our food through the rest of our Thailand trip. We both agreed it was the best food we had on our entire trip. Thank you Chef Leez!!

Superb introduction into Thai cuisine. Chef LeeZ is a very warm and funny person that clearly has a vast background in food preparation. everybody will enjoy this class, from experienced to 0 experienced. The dishes you prepare are really tasty and are really common so it will broaden your range of ordering when traveling in thailand. We (3couples) had a great time and the 4hours just flew! only beware: do not eat breakfast or reserve a restaurant for dinner, as you will be licking your plates clean during the class...so tasty! TIP: for extra dish to prepare ask for ma-sa-man curry!!

Great cooking course with Chef LeeZ. We did the 4 hour (10-14) lunch workshop with our teenage daughters. There were two other participants in our group totalling 6 people. First we went off to the local market with our shopping baskets. We learned about the different ingredients, some unique to Thailand.Chef Lee is a very enthusiastic cook, very engaging. She did an excellent job teaching us different cooking skills. Everything we made was simply delicious. It was really good to do this course at the beginning of our trip as it taught us so much about Thai food.

Great fun. We're so glad we did this - it was our last day in Thailand and we wanted to do something fun and unique and Chef LeeZ cooking school was a great choice. Neither of us have much cooking nous but we cooked up some amazing-tasting dishes, Chef Leez is great fun and so helpful and knowledgeable, we had an absolute blast and can't wait to cook up some pad thai at home. Shopping at a local market for fresh ingredients was an experience in itself. Thanks so much for an awesome day!

An exceptional experience in Bangkok!!!. It's a funny and practical cooking class. We spent half day in Chef LeeZ with lots of Fun. The market shopping experience, neat n clean cooking equipment, efficient helpers, cooking tutorial and the most amazing lady - Chef LeeZ! With her professional cooking knowledge and her flexibility n houmor, she makes the day!

Amazing class that teaches you all you need to know!!. We lucked out on our only day in Bangkok by calling Chef Leez 30 minutes before class started. She said to come by and we are so thankful. Our class was small and Chef Leez was wonderful. She's nice, answers all questions, and goes above and beyond. I cannot wait to go home and make some Tom yum paste. Mmmmmh. Thank you!!!!!

Favorite Activity in Bangkok. Whether you are an experienced Chef, a novice, or simply looking for a unique experience in Bangkok, a few hours with Chef LeeZ is going to be time well spent!Chef LeeZ is the real deal. She is an incredibly talented chef and more importantly a great person. Starts off with a fun, informative, and engaging market tour. And then turns into a full experience of cooking techniques and execution. Every single thing was amazing. I honestly won't be able to eat at Thai restaurants again in the U.S. I'm making all my own Thai food from now on.This is a MUST DO. Seriously MUST DO for anyone taking a trip to Thailand. Can't wait to come back and do it again. #MEATY

What a great way to add to my cooking experience. Highly recommended Thai cooking course - very well run, excellent staff and food. I'm not a cook, so i was very amazed when i was able to knock up a few Thai dishes that tasted very good ..... yum! Trip to the market was good.

Unforgettable Experience!. As a surprise, my husband booked the class for us ahead of our trip to Bangkok so I didn't know what to expect at all! Even though I didn't have any expectations, I was blown away by the experience....Chef Leez is so approachable, passionate and funny so there was never a boring moment in the class. The morning began with a walk to the local market to source the freshest ingredients which in itself was a great experience! Once back in the 'classroom', we each cooked our dishes and ate them as we went along...YUM YUM YUM! We were even more fortunate to have a few extra recipes thrown in at our individual requests - Chef Leez was flexible and seemed as enthused as we were!If you love cooking and want to know how to make Thai food (including curry pastes and shrimp pastes etc) from SCRATCH then I highly recommend this class!(I'm a UK expat and managed to source all the ingredients here in Saudi Arabia and put together a 5 course Thai meal yesterday - tasted DELICIOUS! So folks - it's a sound investment!)

What a blast!!. Found this cooking school by chance and I'm so glad. Chef LeeZ was a delightful instructor and we cooked 8 different dishes! The trip to the market was an experience as she told us what to look for in selecting vegetables and meats. She had a great staff of ladies who kept our cooking stations tidy. And of course, the food was the highlight of the day. YUMMY.

Amazing person, food and experience.. What an amazing day with Chef Leez - such a lovely, accommodating lady who is very knowledgeable when it comes to food!The class consisted of myself and six other students which gave it a very exclusive feel. I was the only student visiting alone, however never felt excluded or alone.The morning consisted of an explanation of what we would be cooking that day, and allowed us to sample of several varieties of local fruits (Chef Leez even purchased a durian on request which we all sampled for dessert). Chef Leez also asked if we had any requests for recipes which we would like to cook.Next it was off to the market - each ingredient was explained, what to look for when buying, etc. It was interesting to experience a local market first hand although it was very hot and stinky - welcome to Bangkok! I thoroughly enjoyed watching a machine shred fresh coconut which we would later make coconut milk with.On returning to the class room Chef Leez explained and demonstrated how to make fresh coconut milk, tamarind paste, and a few others.It was then time to get down to business - many of the dishes were taught in the following order: Chef Leez makes the dish first with all watching, we all got to sample her cooking than got to cook it for ourselves. After each dish you sit down to enjoy your meal (don't worry, the portions are very small), then on to the next dish. Our class got to learn/make (in English) Tom Yum Chili Paste, Spicy & Sour Prawn Soup, Fried Noodles with Prawns/Pad Thai, Green Curry Paste, Green Curry with Chicken, Pa-Nang Curry with Chicken, Green Papaya Salad, Coconut Sticky Rice with Mango, Shrimp Cakes and Masaman Curry! So, so much variety!I am vegetarian and my needs were accommodated to without hassle. I can not wait to get back to Australia to show off all of my new cooking skills :)The cooking school is quite easy to find and is located along the main road, not down the soi, as I first thought. A taxi from Sukhimvit in peak hour traffic took approximately 60 minutes and cost 200 baht. It took me two attempts in finding a taxi which would take me. I did arrive one hour early though which I was later told if I had of left an hour later than there would have been no traffic!This is a very good valuable experience which you should not pass up while in Bangkok!

A great way to spend your day!. We had an awesome time learning all about the different ingredients, walking to the market nearby and sharing with chef leez's passion for what she does so brilliantly. The nicest lady you could ever meet, with her funny stories and culinary knowledge, we would 100% recommend her and her team of helpers, we learnt so much and cant wait to get home and share the recipes with everyone!

Amazing Experience. Chef Leez is amazing, her food is amazing, her stories & sense of humour are amazing! Truly an experience you don't want to miss out on! Trip to the market was super cool, a great variety of delicious dishes, accommodated extra recipes you wanted to try! Chef Leez and the ladies were so well organized, working like clockwork to prep dishes and get us cooking, there was never a dull moment between her stories, cooking and eating! Eat very light before this culinary adventure, you'll no doubt be well fed! :)
Great class!. We had a private class with Chef LeeZ and it was awesome! She was really nice and taught us how to make some amazing food - definitely worth doing if you're in Bangkok.

We love Chef Lee!. My friends (3) and I are in Thailand on a university graduation trip - we heard about Chef LeeZ Thai Cooking School from a friend. We are SO glad we made time for the 10am-2pm cooking course. There were 7 people total and we each had our own cooking preparation station and stove (or wok) top. Not only did Chef Lee teach us how to cook each dish thoroughly, she explained how to make each ingredient as well. No secrets! Everything is taught so you can replicate it at home. She is such an enthusiastic teacher and if you want to learn an extra dish or two, she is very accommodating. We have loved the spring rolls and their sauce in Thailand and she gladly incorporated it into the course! We never sensed rushed, or pressed for time. Chef Lee wanted to make sure we got all our questions answered and had time to eat! Her energy is great and contagious - Chef Lee is so happy and clearly loves what she does.

Highlight of Our Trip!. Both my 17-year old daughter and I thoroughly enjoyed it ! Chef Leez personally guided us through the whole process - from the selection of the ingredients at the market, preparation of the stock and curry pastes to the cooking and even garnishing !! She was generous in sharing her little "secrets" in bring out the best in the food with natural ingredients. There was never a dull moment. Every dish that we cooked was so delicious ! Highly recommended !!

Great intro to Thai cooking. I have been to a couple of Thai cooking schools, and Chef Leez is certainly one of the better ones. Chef Lee is a real character and a great teacher. My only small criticism would be that unlike many of the other cooking schools you don't get the chance to choose which dishes you would like to learn, instead it is a set menu, and the time spent in the local market is also very short.

Fun afternoon cooking with Chef Lee. What was most interesting was tasting the difference between their packaged coconut milk and the coconut milk she makes from fresh coconuts. I also loved the trip to the nearby market. Chef Lee has a darling personality, she really makes the class fun. We made several different things and they were all wonderful, but it was difficult to take notes and to cook. Still it was fun and I'm glad we did it.

Great experience in Bangkok! Ü. One of the highlights of our recent Bangkok trip was the cooking lesson we took with Chef Leez ü We were lucky that we had 2 extra dishes in addition to the menu that was printed online. Chef Leez is not only a good teacher but she's very entertaining as well ü She made each dish look so easy but when it was our turn to make them, we discovered that it was actually not that hard. She really broke down all the steps and gave us the necessary tips and guidelines to make sure that we don't mess up our cooking. It spanned for more than 5 hours and what was great was Chef Leez never hurried. She really took her time to explain and show us the right way to do it. We didn't mind spending that much time there because we were well fed! We ate all the food that we prepared and we were so full by the end of the session! Ü I am so excited to practice what I learned from Chef Leez when I cook for my family this weekend ü

The best thing to do in Bangkok.. My partner and I had a fab time partaking in this class. It lasts about 4 hours. You start by walking 5 minutes to a local indoor food market. The chef explains the different ingredients and shows you around the market filled with local Thais. You then head back to immaculately clean kitchen where you begin your course and learn to make a variety of dishes (including Pad Thai & Thai Green curry and sticky rice & Mango). It's fair to say this was the best thing we did in Bangkok and we would highly recommend it to family and friends. The chef is all about attention to detail and she is more than happy to answer any questions and be interrupted to explain different alternatives to the ingredients (I.e. Great if the stated ingredients would be hard to find back home). The cost is 1500b and its worth every penny. You leave with a print out of the recipes, fabulous tasting food (which you just cooked) and an enthusiasm to whip out the Wok when your back home and become a Thai masterchef! Tip: have a light breakfast as you will be tasting at least 5 dishes!

Great cooking class for whole family!. My husband and two young adult children attended a cooking class with Chef Leez. You might think that in a group class you don't get attention but you'd be wrong. The Chef paid attention and helped each student in the class. In addition she was able to tailor the recipes for my vegetarian daughter and peanut allergy family. The air conditioning really helped to keep the heat out of the cooking! I'd recommend this fun and tasty class to any Bangkok visitor.

Fantastic cooking and carving experience. I attended fruit & vegetable carving and cooking classes in two sequential days. Both sessions were really great. In couple of hours I learned basics of fruit carving and managed to create beautiful flowers and ornaments from cucumber, carrot, pumpkin and papaya. Cooking session was also excellent. Although I'm quite familiar with preparing thai food, I got many good hints and learned a lot about ingredients and techniques. Chef Lee is absolutely fantastic teacher in both carving and cooking. It was really great fun!

The best thai cooking class. This is simply the best cooking class i had attend so far. To start with, the chef took us to market and taught us the basic knowledge on major thai dishes ingredients. Then we returned to the classroom and start the cooking class. The chef is a very nice lady and we felt her passion in cooking and sharing knowledge. I cannot imagine i can cook such a great tom yum gung, pad thai and green curry in just 4 hours. If you like Thai food, you cannot afford to miss this wonderful learning experience!

Chef Leez shows you there's more to Bangkok than shopping!. one of the most interesting experience in Bangkok! Chef Leez and her team were extremely helpful and eager to share. You will learn about the secret ingredient to all delicious Thai food! Definitely sth we didn't regret!

A great experience. I've taken a wide variety of tours & classes in cities around the world, and I would definitely recommend this one to others! Chef Lee was an outstanding teacher. She not only taught you how to cook, but she shared so much about the local culture - it was a great mix of the two. And she paced the class perfectly - she broke down the recipes into manageable chunks for participants with any level of cooking experience, there was a lot of hands on experience, and plenty of opportunity for questions. What made this class exceptional was Chef Lee's personality - she is adorable - and made everyone feel so welcome. This was a great way to spend a half day in Bangkok.

4 Hours Well Spent. Lots of great information on Thai ingredients and how to create the base of many Thai curries. We will be making our own shrimp oil and Tom Yum paste as soon as we get home!! Lots of tasters, but not so much that we felt full or uncomfortable. Very happy that the kitchen is air conditioned, so no concerns about temperature while cooking at all. Easy to find as we were staying a short distance away and were able to get the bus. Well signposted from the street. One small gripe is that the Chef spends a lot of time telling you that all restaurants use poor ingredients that are bad for your health. If you took everything to heart, you would eat anything else in Thailand out of fear of imminent death. I prefer to be given a few facts about what to look for so I can make my own informed decision.

Love Chef Leez!. She is amazing...this was worth every cent! We learned how to make 8 different dishes...went to the local market to pick the ingredients. She taught us how to make the freshest Thai food and how to spot it when Thai food isn't it's freshest. Learned so much, but also had so much fun! We still think this was the best food we had on our trip :)

Totally fun. I went by myself one day to Chef Leez, and I had a great experience.First, we got a little introduction to a lot of Thai ingredients. It was amazing connecting the flavors I was familiar with to the actual plant / root / leaf / fruit it comes from. Have you ever heard of Kaffir Limes? Me neither...Then the Chef told us what to look for when buying the ingredients. Prices, smells, textures, very informative, though I don't think I'll be able to remember it all.She shows you what to do, then you're off doing it yourself. The class was run wonderfully and was so much fun.I only wish there was a short period in the beginning with a chance for the students to meet eachother. It happens anyway, but some formality would be nice.For anyone, solo or not, it's a great experience.

Not to Miss. Found and selected my Thailand cooking school class by reading Tripadvisor's. Could not have been happier with the results. Let me start with the one minor negative. From the CBD of Bangkok it was a time consuming taxi drive. Chef LeeZ does a good job of representing this on her web site. She provide a good map, accurate time estimates and cost. If you're staying by the river her location is much more convenient. It was very clear throughout our 4 hours class that Chef LeeZ loves what she is doing which translates to a wonderful experience for her students. She speaks fine English and is easy to understand and answers questions in great detail. Although I'm a amature cook I've taken many cooking classes and consider myself well versed in the kitchen. This class strikes a nice balance of being shown what to do and then allowing you to repeat the techniques yourself.I was amazed at how good the simple dishes we prepared tasted. Upon finding adequate ingredients at home I have no doubt I could replicate the tastes we created in class. I was extremely fortunate to select a day for class that only had one other student. Essentially we had a private class but I have no doubt even a full class, I believe 8 students, would be just fine.I would not hesitate to return for more classes on my next visit to Thailand.Chef LeeZ keep up the good work.Ted Kalota

Not to miss!!!!. That's been one of the best experiences in Bangkok. We love cooking and it was a very easy to follow and well guided Thai cooking class. Chef Leez was fantastic!!We would definitely repeat the experience and now that we're back home we have been trying to cook it again and it tastes wonderfully.

Wonderful teacher, excellent food. My husband and I undertook Chef Leez class on our last day in Bangkok, we are so glad we did.This was one of the highlights from our trip, Chef Leez spoke good english and the food menu was amazing.We visited a market first up and then back to cook the first dish - Green curry.I must admit, some of the instructions on the receipes differed slightly from the information Chef Leez was saying (i.e. mix sugar, fish sauce and chilli paste together prior to adding- Chef Leez, however the recipe said add everything at the same time). Just make sure you take good notes and update the recipe with any secrets Chef Leez gives.They give you unlimited water while you are there, and as it was an extremely hot day around 40+ degrees this was very much appreciated. I can not speak highly enough of Chef Leez course, she involved all the particpants in the cooking and even pitted the girls against the boys to see who can make a curry better, which was very fun.I am even going to try and make my own shrimp paste later today (one of chef leez extra receipes she gave out).At the end of the class, we were all stuffed to the brim and Chef Leez, knowing how bad taxis can be in Bangkok, came out with all of us and hailed cabs for each group and told them in thai where we were all headed to.Overall, excellent class with an excellent teacher and excellent food.

Fun, Informative, and Delicious!!!!!!!. By far this was our favorite activity that our family did in Bangkok. Chef Lee has a great personality she makes cooking Thai food look easy. When we got there we went straight to the market to purchase our food. We were please to see she only uses the best ingredients and refuses to take short cuts. This is a must when in Bangkok! We had a blast!!!

A MUST DO!. This was such a cool experience. Chef Lee set up a private course for us - we were two couples. We arrived here after a long day which started early at the floating market as well as the train market. By the time we got to Chef Leez, we were famished. She quickly fixed us up some sticky rice and mango - which was AMAZING. We got to make so many different types of noodles and curries, and she even made some special mango chicken for us. Finally we ended the class with another order of sticky rice and mango. The course was really great, and showed us that when you have the proper ingredients, cooking Thai food is not too difficult. Everything we made ourselves came out wonderful. Going to buy the ingredients from the traditional Thai market was a great experience; it really allowed up to see into the daily life of the Thai. This was one of our favorite activities we did while in Thailand. Thanks Chef Lee!!PS - to this day, we still havent found any sticky rice and mango that compares to hers!

Something for everyone.. We learned a lot from Leez, she is fun and informative. The morning started with a visit to a near- by market to buy the ingredients, then the dishes we created (with her help) were easy to follow and to reproduce at home with substitutions suggested. During the lunch break we wandered over the road to a cafe, though we had eaten what we cooked that morning, then back for the vegetable carving class in the afternoon. This was amazing, even our ham-fisted attempts at decorations turned out looking surprisingly professional. My only negative comment relates to the hardness of the stools.Thanks Leez, and best wishes for your charity, Leez Kidz, for helping under privileged Thai children.

Very enjoyable morning. We had a great morning at Chef LeeZ. She was a delight and the morning went quickly. She was very good at showing us the Thai ingredients we may be unfamiliar with and the recipes were clear and straightforward. I learned a lot.I thought it would be better if the customers were more involved in preparation, much of it was done by her staff, too much I felt.Bangkok is an exciting city with lots to do, however I would unreservedly recommend a visit here to anyone interested in Thai food.

Don't eat breakfast before you go !. Great 3 and a half hours of shopping and cooking! You get to cook a huge array of the most delicious Thai dishes - all of which you will eat ! The quality of the ingredients is excellent and the food will be the best you eat in Thailand . Tip tips thoughoit the demonstrations and an insight into the tricks restaurants play to make food appear better than it is. All very fascinating. Absolutely stuffed though by the time we had finished !

Thai cooking class. What a fabulous experience! Chef Leez is accredited, knowledgeable, informative and extremely entertaining. I took my 11 and 14 year old girls with me and we had one of the most memorable days of our trip together in Thailand. From the walk to the market, the shopping and of course the cooking, Chef Leez made it easy to follow, possible to repeat at home and certainly fun. Her english is also excellent which is helpful.

Great way to spend a more relaxing day in Bangkok. I recommend everyone to take Leez cooking class when visiting Bangkok. Leez makes cooking fun and easy. We used the class as a relaxing day between days of city and country tours and it worked out perfectly..

Great class. To be fair I haven't taken many cooking classes, but of them all Chef Lee's was the best. She is a great instructor with a really impressive vision of food. We went on a tour of a local market which was both interesting and informative, although the instruction is where the class really shines. We made probably 5 different dishes in class, all of which were outstanding, and really learned how integration of different ingredients altered the flavor and consistency and base dishes (e.g., curry). There are a lot of cooking stations in the class (>= 5) so unlike some other classes I have been to much of the class can cook simultaneously. Chef Lee does a great job monitoring everyone and making sure your dishes come out wonderfully. The class isn't cheap but it's worth every baht.

Informative, Fun, and Recommended. I am an experienced cook and husband rarely cooks but we both enjoyed our class with Chef Leez. I particularly like the way Lee tought us to make the curries and sauces from scratch and to adapt the recipes with more healthy ingredients and a fresher taste. Lee was very knowledgable, friendly, and had a great sense of humor. Our market visit that day was to a local market which gave us a glimpse into real life in Thailand. We learned to recognize a variety of unfamiliar Thai ingredients. Since Chef LeeZ dosen't provide transport, it took some research to find the best way to get there. Our hotel was near the river ferry so we took the orange ferry to Pier 13. From there it was a rather short and uncomplicated walk to Chef LeeZ. Given the traffic in Bangkok, I think it was more reliable than a taxi to get there on time.

So interesting and so much fun. What a great way to spend a day. We booked with Chef Leez from Trip Advisor's info and what a great find it was. Chef Leez is enthusiastic, informative and very practical. Our tour of the market was most helpful in showing us what to look for and what to look out for! The cooking was fun. We made several dishes, all with easy variations and she has a wonderful staff that just whisk the plates away, bring on the next selection and speed up the process. Everything was simple and fresh and delicious. We could choose the level of spiciness and enjoyed every bowl of food that we made. Its not too easy to find all the ingredients at home but even if we manage something close to what we cooked there it will be tasty and different. You become totally absorbed in the lesson and it is a great break from the hustle and bustle of Bangkok. I would highly recommend a lesson and the map Chef Leez provides from the Internet is very easy to follow.

Fun day with Chef Leez - though the recipes back home don't work :(. We loved our day cooking with Chef Leez, she's so much fun, entertaining and full of chat. Not only did we have hands on cooking but we got to eat everything we cooked and it was all delicious. Now that we're home, we wanted to try cook some of the dishes but its tough to find a lot of the ingredients... Also we realised how much was prepared and pre-mixed for us, so much of the hard work is done by Chef Leez and her team - we could do with them back at our house. If I was in Bangkok I would love to do the course again, just for fun, not so much for the learning side of things.

Excellent Class!. We did the cooking class based on reviews. We are so glad we did ! We did the afternoon class so we wouldn't need dinner after . I would suggest this - we were stuffed ! Great class size of only 6 people. The trip to the market was interesting and informative. The food we cooked was delicious ! One of the best we had in Thailand - and we made it ! Chef Leez is so funny , she has a great sense of humour and was joking with everyone . We really enjoyed her stories and jokes. One of the other students said " all we need is beer " and Chef Leez went across the street and got us some:) We love Thai food and are so happy to have " real " recipes to try when we get home. Bring your camera! If you love Thai food and enjoy having a great time - DO this class !

Cooking with Flair. We booked the class based on Trip Advisor reviews and we were not disappointed. We learned so much about Thai cooking and the ingredients used to create the amazing flavours of this cuisine. Chef Leez took time at the market to explain all the purchases. Then in the cooking class the explanations here were just as good with time for questions and advice for substitutions for ingredients we might not find at home. We received all the recipes used on the day and are now on their mailing list for more recipes. Great class with great people!

Chef LeeZ and Helping Hands Comparison. I attended two cooking classes in Bangkok (Helping Hands with Poo, and Chef LeeZ) and so will write a single review that discusses both. I will then rate each class separately under their respective headings. I found Helping Hands particularly insightful because of the location, the (so-called) Klong Toey slum, and also because it combined a visit to Bangkok's largest wet market to purchase fresh ingredients for the class. Many, myself included, are sure to find elements of the market disturbing. There will be areas you'll need to hurry through if you don't want to see live animals, including turtles and frogs, slaughtered. That said it is possible to avoid the more grisly sights, and the market is unquestionably a hyper-sensory experience; a vast array of colors, smells and just about every ingredient imagineable is available there somewhere. And the idea of the slum location shouldn't be off-putting; it was fascinating to walk along the narrow pathways, and to see first-hand how the majority of Bangkok's citizens live on a daily basis. The area was both safe and clean, and the class room on a par with Chef LeeZ's. In terms of the class itself, I would say Chef Lee might have been a slightly more thorough teacher than Poo. Her instruction was more detailed, and various aspects of the preparation and cooking process explained in greater depth. If you are in Bangkok long enough, or have the time and resources to attend more than one class, I highly recommend both. If your interest is soley on learning how to prepare classic thai dishes, Chef LeeZ may be the better option. If you want to combine an educational experience with basic thai cooking instruction, Helping Hands and Poo might hold more interest. The story, and history of Helping Hands is also gratifying, and something that Poo shares during the course of the class. I should also point out that Chef LeeZ also features a brief visit to a small local market. The recommended instructions for getting to Chef Lee are by boat, so if you don't have a separate river excursion planned, this also adds to the experience. The boat isn't necessary however, and we actually took a taxi back to our Ratchaprasong area hotel (much quicker than the boat option). I thoroughly enjoyed, and highly recommend both classes.

Great!!. We had a lesson with chef leez yesterday and we had an amazing time! We walked to the market to buy the ingredients and she explained to us the different veg & products we could see on the stalls. She also gave us the prices in case we'd like to buy some later. The cooking lesson then started and we really had a great moment! We learnt a lot of stuff and listening to the chef, cooking seems really easy ! We tasted different ingredients and prepared them. Chef leez is really warm and friendly! She teaches people every day and yet she manages to make you feel special. She is a very friendly and enthusiastic person. Go and try you won't regret it!!Plus, she can speak good English!!

Entertaining, informative and delicious!. My partner and I have just returned to our hotel from our day with Chef Leez and her team. Wow! We had such a great time. No wonder its so highly rated! We are huge foodies and know a fair bit about our cooking, but we still learnt so much today! The course is great and allows you to learn with a hands on approach. Chef Leez is also hilarious and we enjoyed her clear instruction and stories from home. Food and cooking is something very special to her and her family and it really comes through in her class. Also, something that we really loved was learnig about the ingredients and visiting the local food market. We learned how to make an array of curry pastes (which form the base of any dish), made a green and Penang curry, pad thai, Tom Yum Goong (clear and creamy), papaya salad and sticky rice with mango (YUM!!!). And we got to eat it all! The class was incredible value for money and we would highly recommend it to any foodies visiting Bangkok.

Wonderful Experience. My husband and I were there in January 2013 and we could not have been happier with our experience. Chef Lee is such a charming lady and she puts her heart into her teaching. She has lovely staff who are quick to help with everything. Be sure to follow her advice on getting there. If you go by cab, get your hotel bellman to negotiate the rate for you as it can take a long time to get there even though it is not that far away. We paid 150 baht to get there but the three young men who joined us in the class paid three times that much even though they were closer. Chef Lee was kind enough find us a taxi for the trip back to our hotel and make sure that the driver was honest and used a meter. We highly recommend this experience to anyone visiting Bangkok. Thank you Chef Lee! What delicious food!

Full of Fun. My family spent a half day in Chef LeeZ semi-private class and took away a lot of fun from the class. Both my daughters (aged 4 and 8) were always recalling the processes of cooking Pad Thai and Papaya Salad after the class. Chef LeeZ and her assistants are friendly and passionate. I could see that they love teaching kids and they were also keen to share their knowledge and skills of cooking to us. When my mother-in-law felt a little bit sick with her stomach in the beginning, Chef LeeZ quickly made a lemongrass tea for her to make her feel better.My family and I really enjoyed the experience in Chef LeeZ cooking class.

Amazing!. My friend and I had an opportunity to spend a day with Chef Leez. Let me start my saying i love and adore this woman! She is passionate, patient, joyful and one of a kind. She inspired me!We took 2 classes- Cooking Class and Fruit & Vegetable Carving Class so were there from 9am until 7pm. Needless to say we got to spend lots of quality time with Chef Leez and her sisters/staff.Cooking School- As a chef and foodie the class was an awesome intro into Thai cooking. We began by taking a trip to the food market and sourcing all of our fresh ingredients. Chef Leez is a stickler for fresh and quality ingredients with absolutley no shortcuts. The lessons were substantial and she made it easy for people of all levels and skill sets. She event went off the menu to include Lard Na- A dish i requested.The Food- was amazing. Fresh, vibrant, flavorful. Like a party in your mouth each time. After each dish preparation we all sat down family style to eat and enjoy. In between courses she personally took us through the neighborhood to shop for souveniers and goodies. She didnt have to that and Im sure that was her break/lunch time but she patiently took us around and negotiated with vendors for us. She also pointed out what to look for in street vendors as we were concerned with safety- clean oils, cleanliness, ingredients, etc. So helpful.Fortunately for us we were the only 2 people in the carving class. It was as if we were in her living room as she taught us the tricks of the trade. Again, patient, creative and passionate. I ended up with a gallery style presentation that looked like a garden of ornately carved fruits and vegetables.I will return to Bangkok and to Chef Leez class just to be in her presence and feel her energy. I took cooking classes in Vietnam which cannot even compare to Chef Leez. She puts her heart and soul into her passion of cooking and instructing and I am so grateful I was able to spend a day with her.Highly recommended on your Things To Do List in Bangkok!Give her a hug for me!

Fantastic cooking school. This was a great way to spend our last day in Bangkok after 3 weeks in Thailand.We looked at many other options but this was the one with the best reviews and we agree with them all.Was definitely worth the time and money and the market visit was great. We made over 5 dishes and learnt all the basic tricks so we could repeat them at home. Wold definitely recommend this cooking school if your in Bangkok.

Great cooking class. I have done a cooking class in Vietnam prior to this one and it was nothing in compassion to 'Chef Leez' cooking class. What I really liked about the class was that everything was healthy and msg free and that she showed us how to make all the sauces and ingredients from scratch. She also showed as what is the difference between the cheap and the expensive products and how they differ in taste. Everything was well organized and she explained all the dishes very well. What I liked about this course was that we got to make 10 different dishes and taste little bits of all. I prefer variety in smaller portions rather than just cooking one big meal and eating it. She also has a fund for under privileged children which I think is great. Overall she was super friendly helpful and a great teacher with wonderful handy tips.

The Best. There are plenty of options for cooking classes in Bangkok, but none will offer you the insight, knowledge and technique of Chef LeeZ. Don't be fooled by the unassuming storefront set up, there is some real food going on in here. The market tour teaches both what to look for and what to avoid when shopping in Bangkok's fresh food markets.We were lucky enough to have a day with a small group but Chef Leez personality shines with a group of 6 or 14. She will keep you entertained whether you are a professional chef or a novice in the kitchen. In a typical 4 hour class you learn several soups, curries, pad thai and sticky rice mango, plus several variations on each dish. If you have any interest in learning real Thai staples done the right way visit Chef Leez.

A must if you like cooking. It was the highlight of our trip to Bangkok. If you like cooking this is the place to go. Eye opening experience when it comes to Thai food. The trip to the market is an experience worth living it (easily impressed people stay away). Chef Lee is a great cook and also very entertaining. Class is conducted in a very relax atmosphere and you get to cook and eat real Thai food. Stop reading reviews just reserve a place in one of their classes and enjoy.

Highly recommended. My fiance and I went to an afternoon class. The tour through the local market was great and the food we made in class was amazing. In addition to learning some great cooking skills, this was probably the best meal we had in Thailand too.

Fun. This was a very fun day with some great food! You learn a lot about thai food and the different ingredients. My favourite was learning how to make the curry pastes. However, there is not a lot of cooking involved if that is what you are looking for. All the different ingredients are prepared for you - all you actually do is mix them togehter. Chef LeeZ is great! Positive, smiling and explains well. Her husband (?) is also there and his job seems to be to promote the class and make sure we recommended it to others. We found this to be a bit disruptive. Just let Chef Leez and the class speak for itself!

A must do whilst in Bangkok!. My partner and I were looking for something fun to do in Bangkok that wasn't too expensive and perhaps a bit interactive. So cooking seemed right.Chef Leez was fun and happy to have us there, we arrived first and relaxed. From the moment you arrive you feel like you're in her kitchen at home and she's funny and wanting to have a laugh.Same with all the other helpers and ladies who work there. The environment is fun to learn. They teach you everything from preparation of the ingredients for a stock to why certain ingredients Taste better than others. The dishes are fantastic and tasty, I wish we could have had more.Dessert - wow! It's hands down a fun experience and can see why it's a number one on Trip Advisor. You won us over.Thanks to the crew and had so much fun.

Fantastic Thai cooking school - Chef LeeZ - you rock!. If you want to experience first hand authentic Thai cooking, than go no further than Chef LeeZ. I have done many Thai cooking classes previously in other establishments, and although they were good, none matched this experience. From arriving to the cooking school, you are welcomed and feel like you have known Chef LeeZ for much longer than a few minutes. The journey to the local markets to buy produce, the information provided there and then the return to cook was simply divine.I have never cooked such authentic Thai food - Chef LeeZ really did shine and I could easily see where all her experience and study shone through. Do yourself a favour, if you are in Bangkok, make sure you do not miss this experience!

Fun!. As someone who does not cook at all, I thought a cooking class would be something to just pass the time while in Bangkok. I actually learned a lot as Chef Lee seems very passionate about cooking and teaching. The dishes were yummy! and I was soo full after. It was an added bonus that I was the only student in her class that day!

Addictive. Can't wait to try out the recipes at home - and the visit to the market was amazing as an insight into the real Bangkok, not a tourist in sight except us.Worth the price for the eating experience alone - we finished around 2.30pm and without ever feeling I'd eaten too much I didn't need feel the need to eat again till the next morning! So good...

Thai Cooking Done Right. I did quite a bit of research before deciding on Chef LeeZ Cooking School. I am a foodie and have taken quite a few cooking classes in the US, and wanted to choose the correct one while in Bangkok. I can honestly state that Chef Lee exceeded my expectations, beginning when she met our cab, as our driver was unsure where the school was located (even though we had downloaded the directions on the site- our driver actually called her while in transit). We began by going to a local market around the corner, where she shopped for the ingredients we needed for our class. Every student has their own wok, and her instruction is easy to follow. The sanitation is first rate, from washing of hands to refrigerated ingredients. We made 9 dishes in total, each in small portions so we could eat all that we created. At the end of the class, my sister and I wanted to buy some packaged curry pastes at the local market. Chef Lee took us their personally and then walked us to the location where we could catch the river taxi to the metro. The chef is very organized, knowledgeable and patient with her students. She rightfully deserves all the accolades she receives, so enroll now!

A highlight of my trip to Thailand. Thank you-thank you-thank you, Chef Lee, for an incredible Thai cooking experience, stories about brides-to-be making green curry paste from scratch, and the best-ever mango and sticky rice! I've taking cooking classes in Florence, Madrid, and Bangkok during my trips and Chef Lee's class was hands-down the best thanks to a well-organized class, an exciting shopping trip to the market, and fun in the kitchen. I highly recommend taking cooking classes as part of your travels no matter where you go. If you're in Bangkok, take one with Chef Lee and leave well-fed and well-prepared to delight your own guests with yummy dishes (or at least good stories).

Extraordinary day .... We actually spent Christmas 2012 together with Chef Lee and the experience itself turned out to be the greatest Christmas present ever.Short review : Sign up for a cooking class. Now! It will be, without a doubt, one of the highlights of your vacation.Not so short review : Chef Lee has such a warm, extraordinary and fun personality that made the hours fly by.Firstly she took us to the local market to go shopping for the necessary ingredients. Since she has such a deep knowledge about all of them, I learned many useful things from her (spotting ripe vegetables/fruits, sorting out the best seafood etc.).After that we went back to the school and got to the actual cooking. Chef Lee was very informative and extremely patient with everything. On top of that she never let's an opportunity slip by to kid arround ... :)I could keep on writing but let me leave at this : Chef Lee is no.1 for a damn good reason.GO THERE NOW. You will not regret it. :)Bart & Linh

An awesome afternoon!. We had such a great time at Chef LeeZ! The school is very well run, the whole arvo went very smoothly - there are two wonderful ktchenhands who do a great job of preparing all of the ingredients for the following dishes (whether it be bringing out new bowls and washing up used dishes, slicing and dicing little bits and pieces or replenishing water bottles for everyone - they were on the ball!). The real star of the show is of course Chef Lee who is amazing - so skilled, hilarious and friendly! Highly recommended... the coconut sticky rice with mango is to die for!

Chef Leez Cooking School. My sister and I had a wonderful experience at Chef Leez Cooking School and I would highly recommend it to everyone, whether or not you're a great cook. Chef Lee is a warm, friendly, and engaging professional who has grown up cooking Thai food, and instantly makes you feel comfortable with the Thai cooking basics. We started with a short walk to the local market to learn more about and purchase fresh ingredients--and I mean LOCAL MARKET that gives one a true feel for old Bangkok. Once back at the cooking school (a relatively small space, but adequate for our needs), we launched right into understanding how these various ingredients fit into the many courses we prepared. Each participant had their own prep and cooking area, so everyone got the full experience of making delicious Thai food. In our class there was a total of 6 people, and we prepared (and ate!) 9 fabulous dishes. Chef Lee was exceptionally organized, explained the basics well, and led us through the entire cooking process from start to finish. We ate each dish as we progressed, so by the time we completed the 4+ hour course, we were wonderfully full from the many delicious Thai dishes. Overall, it was a really fun way to spend several hours in Bangkok, let alone an educational experience I won't forget.

Great teacher, less than great operator. My husband and I had booked a private cooking class and when we arrived we, and the other two people there who had booked a private class, were surprised that we were actually in a shared class. The man who was taking care of payments (and admin functions) did not handle the situation well, and tried to tell us that the fine print on the website explained that a 'private lesson' just meant that you could choose which dishes you would learn- not that you would actually have a private lesson...we all had a negative feeling about the experience until he left, then it was quite fun. The positive is that chef Lee is very funny and charismatic and the cooking lesson itself was well organized and well worth the amount we paid. I highly recommend this activity and would have given it five stars had it not been for the canadian admin.

Last minute cooking. This was a great experience. We had a limited amount of time before catching a flight. Chef leez let us make a last minute booking and made sure that we cooked all of the recipes before having to head to the airport. Great facility, market tour, and choice of dishes. Would highly recommend.

Good school, lousy decor. I had great trepidations when I entered the school. If was just a shopfront on Samsen Rd. The furniture was tatty and mismatched - there were three tables with two stools each. Six cooking stations were opposite the tables with a wok burner each attached to portable gas bottles. When the class started I was pleasantly surprised - this was a five-star school in two-star facilities.Chef Lee speaks excellent English and really knows her craft. The menu is well designed to teach the basics of cooking and the food tastes great. One thing Chef Lee did that I had not experienced at other cooking schools in Thailand is that she had suggestions to replace ingredients if the Thai ingredient was not available in your home country.Overall, it was a great way to spend a day.

Food is culture. People told me I was crazy to waste my time taking a cooking class when I only had a few days in Bangkok, but I had a really great time and would recommend this to anyone. It was relaxed, it was fun, and I learned a lot. Chef Lee speaks excellent English, is a good teacher, and is entertaining and personable. I was surprised at how simple it was to cook great-tasting Thai dishes - Chef Lee's Pad Thai is simply the best I've ever had. And she emphasizes the health aspects of good home cooking - fresh ingredients, lower sodium content than curry pastes from a jar, and weight control. We got a lot done in a short time (about 4 1/2 hours), including a trip to the local market, but I never felt rushed - very good time management. Plus, you also get some home support - she has how-to videos on her website in case you need a refresher. BTW, I have a Apple computer accessing the internet on Safari, and not all of Chef LeeZ website is compatible with this set-up. If your home computer is set up like mine, you may also have some difficulty with some pages of the website. One caveat: My photo is in the Trip Advisor photos for Chef LeeZ provided by the management. I didn't even realize I was being photographed, and was quite surprised to see myself in the photos. If you don't want this to happen to you, you should probably mention it when you sign up. I'm sure they'd honor the request if you asked not to be photographed, I just didn't think to do it. Bottom line: Chef LeeZ has my whole-hearted recommendation.

Great class and teacher. Great class with a great teacher who really knows her cooking. She teaches well and if you show a lot of interest she will really teach you a lot outside of anything you could learn from a standard cookbook or recipe. Time within the class is used efficiently and the food really turns out excellent. Bottom line is that I think I learned enough to recreate most of the dishes at home given that I can find the correct ingredients. My wife cooks all the time and I consider making toast cooking, but we both had a similar excellent opinion of the class.As for the 4-Hour Group Cooking class itself:- The room was very comfortable and ventilated- Chef Lee's English is great- You are provided printed recipes and a pen so you can take your own notes- You don’t need to bring anything to class except a camera if you wish

When palate and personality combine.... Chef LeeZ is not only a great, fastidious cook ('This -- good, that -- cheap and nasty!'): she was seemingly born to educate and entertain. As if her pad thai or Pa Nang curry weren't spectacular in themselves, they come packed with anecdotes, laughter, and tidbits of Thai pop culture. It's like swallowing a helium balloon alongside some of the best traditional food you'll have in Bangkok -- and you'll leave know your nuaa from your guaa for evermore.

Fun class, great teacher. I attended a group class with my dad in November and it was a great experience. When I booked the class, a clear set of instructions to find the class was provided -we took the BTS to Saphan station and a river boat up to Pier 13. The class is a short 10-15min walk from the pier. Chef Lee was great, we had a short intro to thai cooking and then went to a local market where all the ingredients were sourced. After that it was straight into cooking our dishes: 2 soups, pad Thai, red and green curry, a hot jungle curry, papaya salad and sticky rice with mango. My dad isn't a fan of spicy food, so chef lee tailored his dishes accordingly. If we had any questions during the class Chef lee was able to answer them all clearly -even if the question had nothing to do with Thai cooking! We cooked a lot of dishes, but we laughed even more. Chef lee had a great sense of humor and will be recommending this class to everyone I know.

Best class and Cheff LeeZ is the sweetest person. I love the class because of how amazing Chef Lee is ... she was caring, answered all of our questions, and went above and beyond to give us the best experience. She took us to the market explained everything and when we went back we made a lot of different dishes. My husband wanted to make something he ate in Jersey which is not even a dish in Bangkok but she was able to figure it out and taught us how to make it. The dish came out perfect exactly how my husband wanted it. This is a fun thing to do, takes time so might take a good 4ish hours but it goes by fast because its a something fund and different. We had a good time laughing eating and just enjoying the activity. And the food was delicious. She is an amazing cook, I couldn't believe how much we ate. She even catered to me because I am vegetarian. Trust me if you have a day do this activity you will never forget it.

Wow! Exceeded all expectations. I stayed at the Eastin Grand Hotel which is next door to the Blue Elephant Cooking school but I chose this class over convenience because of the excellent reviews on this site and the cost was less than half of the BE! I was not disappointed. The place was very easy to find as I took a local boat up the river to Pier 13 (15baht) and walked 5 minutes. I was late but discovered I was the only participant. The school runs every day even if only for one student. Chef Lee was amazing. She took me to a lovely little market a short stroll away and explained some of the local delicacies and bought the ingredients for the recipes. I made 3 soups, 2 curries plus a pad thai, a papaya salad and the gloriously delectable mango and sticky rice. I got to taste everything while it was hot but could not finish everything as there was so much food. I had never had thai food that tasted so good.
