I took all the food I cooked back to my hotel room in beautifully packed containers which was readily scoffed by my husband who is still raving about the flavours. I cook a fair bit but I learned so much from this lovely lady. A tip was rejected in favour of a donation jar that she uses to collect for a children's charity. I strongly recommend this class and this very clever chef.

Fab. 3 generations of my family went along ! My mother , myself and my 12 year old daughter. Loved the hands on experience and how interactive it was . Chef leez is fab and a very good teacher. I am a passionate self and tv taught cook and this was a first time for me. My daughter thought it was the best part of the holiday in Bangkok . Keep it up chef .

Fantastic hands-on experience. Some friends and I (all from the U.S.) did the group cooking class and it exceeded expectations in every way. Everything is very hands-on, and you get breaks throughout the class to sample the food you make as the class progresses (unlike some other schools where you eat everything at the end). I cook much more than my friends, and Chef Lee did a great job answering some of my more complex questions about recipe modifications, etc., while also making the class fun and easy for my friends. Chef Lee and all the cooking school staff are very warm and friendly. (One note: If you want to exactly recreate what you do in class make sure to take notes on the recipe sheet they provide - in our class there were a few small deviations from the printed recipe.) I would definitely recommend this class to anyone visiting Bangkok!

Fantasic. I had a thoroughly enjoyable time at Chef Leez cooking school. She is a lovely person and has a great sense of humour. Highly recommended!! One tip: if you are not in the Kao San road area its worth doing a recce as not all of the taxi drivers are that helpful.

One of the best memories of my holiday. Absolutely loved doing this class. We got to learn 3 types of soup, 2 curries and the pastes, papaya salad, phad thai, and mango and sticky rice. Chef Lee was really sweet and fun. She told us all about the ingredients and it was very hands on and inclusive. I enjoyed going to the local market with her -a great photo opportunity, and place to learn about everything and meet locals. Chef Lee's English is great, and she had the natural teaching ability to keep everything jovial and paced the lesson well. You get to keep all the recipes and a few more, good memories, and her work also helps disadvantaged youth in the area. All round -you should do this - don't worry about your culinary skills, its good for fun, but also she has a little something to teach everyone -even my partner who's a wonderful cook of Thai food still learnt something and really enjoyed himself.

Extremely valuable experience.. Chef Lee was warm, practical and down to earth. We left feeling confidant that we could begin cooking Thai dishes at home, and had a lot of fun getting to that point. High marks.

Chef Leez is the BEST!. This is the best cooking school in Bangkok! I did several and found this also the most authentic one. The chef is very funny, there's no hurry and the whole atmosphere is super relaxed and the food is excellent of course.The trip to the market is amazing.KLM Royal Dutch Airlines crew have also chosen this school as their No. #1. Check it out!

Ultimate Thai food experience. During our short trip to Bangkok we wanted to experience authentic Thai food at it's best and thanks to Trip Advisor's recommendations we found Chez LeeZ Thai Cooking School. It was an amazing cooking class. Chef LeeZ started the morning by taking us to a Thai food market to pick up all the ingredients for our recipes. It was amazing to get to experience the market with one of the locals. There were only 5 of us in the class which made it very intimate and gave us the chance to be guided closely by Chef LeeZ in cooking some of Thailand's delicious meals. The food tasted amazing, full of flavour and aromas, better than restaurant quality and we made it all ourselves! I cannot recommend this activity enough, definitely a 'must-do' if visiting Bangkok!!

Dont tell me you know thai food if you have never met Chef Leez. Thai food was a myth to me before I attended this cooking school, but after Chef LeeZ's lively, interestingly teaching, i can say that i know thai food now.She is very open-minded and always willing to show the details of making thai food. she uses every way to let us understand the process of every recipes and let us learning by doing. she taught us step by step and fi there is any question difficult to explain, she found the answers from books, and the picture from the internet to solve our questions.not to mentioned how satisfied we were when we were trying our own cooking result--which is just an epic.again, you will never know how good you can be in cooking thai food, unless you learn from her .if you want to bring something home from thailand and have it forever, come to Chef Leez.by the way, we are a group of four Taiwanese and you will learn more if you can speak and listen to English. Hao.

Excellent Experience At Thai Cooking School. I had an excellent experience at this Thai cooking school. We learned several different dishes, including pad thai, green curry, papaya salad, and sticky rice with Mango. We were able to go to the market to pick out the ingredients so we can cook at home. This is the first time I have cooked Thai food that tasted good. Overall, I highly recommend this cooking school to anyone interested in learning how to cook Thai food.

A delicious lesson in Thai cuisine!. "Galangal...coconut cream...kaffir lime..." These are just a few of the dulcet tones you'll hear from Chef Lee at Ma-sa-man cooking school in Bangkok.Our day began at 10am with a trip to the local market. Chef Lee was clearly a regular, interacting with the shopkeeps as she expertly chose a variety of fresh ingredients for our lesson.Once we got back to the studio, the fun really began. We took a stab at cutting our own vegetables for a round of delicious soups: spicy prawn soups and a coconut milk chicken soup, which may have won the day!Next, we tackled the classic pad Thai. Our wok became our palette as we mixed and mingled the mouthwatering flavors of the Indochine. We followed our pad thai with a duo of curries. For the green, we slaved away with mortal and pestle to concoct a fresh green curry paste.There was no rest for our weary tastebuds as papaya salad spiced up the afternoon. Chef Lee whipped up some delicious Thai iced tea, which was definitely needed to counteract the punch-packing salad.Finally, it was time for dessert. We thoroughly enjoyed the sticky rice with mango, which was perfectly topped with coconut cream.Overall, the food was terrific and some of the best we had in Southeast Asia. But what was better was the personal interest, dedication, and passion with which Chef Lee conducted class. Even though we are certainly not classically trained chefs, Chef Lee refused to cut corners and encouraged us to truly and honestly engage with Thai cuisine. The class was very hands-on and fun- we really recommend paying a visit to Chef Lee during your stay in Bangkok.P.S. her school, like all buildings in BKK, may prove difficult to locate. Ask your hotel to call her first and have the hotel staff explain the location to a taxi driver. Do not get into Tuk-tuks! No MSG :)

Chef Lee rocks!!!. So glad we decided to spend the day learning, cooking and EATING!! Super fun - worth every penny!So we started by going shopping in an open air market to get all our ingredients nice and fresh.We haul it all back to the school/kitchen and get started. The rest of the afternoon was prep a dish, cook, eat, prep another dish, cook, eat, prep, cook, eat... you get the idea. The recipes were so tasty, very authentic, no cheating (no MSG) and after we could eat no more, we took home the recipe books for free and can now confidently treat our friends to authentic Thai food at home.I can't say enough about having a true Master Thai Chef leading you through this process. Chef Lee, Thank you for a wonderful day!Enjoy - StreetGrinder

Fun and delicious. Very friendly staff and lots of interesting information about the ingredients and the process while we went along. Really liked the variety of dishes that were included, along with lots of suggestions for how to vary and adapt the recipes.

curious but delicious. It is the first time I've oppotunity to taste Thailand food. uoy! Whether you love Thai or other cuisines or cookery is a hobby or you are an accomplished chef wanting to polish up on the craft, the technique, that results in that mouth watering, taste bud popping, 5 star restaurant gourmet quality traditional Thai or European or International cuisine, or you’d like to learn fruit sculpture and vegetable carving or learn to make bread or tofu or noodles or you want to set up your own cooking school. You will find yourself totally satisfied by attending cookery classes at a CSI affiliate school.

Now i know the secret technique. Chef Leez had been most helpful and patient to teach myself and wife as a beginner. We are impressed with the taste of our own cooking especially the Pad Thai & Green Curry. One thing for sure.. looking at recipe is just not enough to a yummy dish. The 'secret' technique play a big part which we need to hands-on with eyes / nose / mouth wide open. I can't wait to try it this weekend.Love the taste and the experience too. Thanks Chef!!

Delicious Thai food made simple. The booking process was really simple and the team replied to my email within a few hours. Chef Lee and the team were really friendly and inviting and Chef Lee herself has an infectious laugh and a great sense of humour. The tour to the market was a really nice way to start and the produce was all very fresh, which is always nice to see. Chef Lee gave great tips and easy to follow instructions for all the recipes. It was also nice and hands on so we really got a feel for using the wok and making everything of scratch. We made lots of dishes and everything was delicious. The recipes are easy to follow and I will definitely make them at home. All in all it was a really great day and we got to eat all of the most popular Thai dishes. I also like that you get access to a whole list of other recipes on the website. If they are anything like the ones we made then they will be delicious. The class was really great value for money!!! Highly recommended :)

Excellent Hands-on Experience with an Amazing Chef!. The school room is small, but don't let that fool you. Chef Lee is an excellent teacher with a great sense of humor and will always explain the "whys" in each step of the process. We chose this school for it's great reviews and extensive menu that is learned, and it was well worth it. My husband and I paid for a private class with Chef Lee including the market tour, which was as informative and exciting as the actual cooking. Chef Lee has great skill, but is easily able to break down the steps so that anyone can learn. She also added in a few extra menu items, the yellow curry crab - to die for - and the fried bananas, on top of everything else. We were well-informed and well-stuffed by then end of the class. It was very important to us to have a school that does more than simply give you ingredients to mix together...we wanted to actually learn about the ingredients, how they go together, and the traditional methods for building a Thai meal. We were extremely pleased with the Ma-Sa-Man school and would recommend it wholeheartedly to friends and family!

Chef lee.....simply outstanding teacher!. We booked the course as a couple after reading the various reviews and we were not disappointed at all. The place was quite easy to find and on arrival we were greeted by Chef Lee and her staff who made us feel very welcomed. Before we got started they explained everything we were going to cook and gave us some background to Chef Lee's experiences. it was then off to the local market to buy ingredients which I really liked and Chef Lee was very forthcoming in explaining the different types of foods and ingredients, clearly she is very knowledgeable and was happy to share her knowledge and experience with her students. We cooked many dishes and at each stage she explained why she used certain ingredients and also gave tips along the way for healthy eating. We thoroughly enjoyed the course and would definitely recommend if you are going to Bangkok.

Great Cooking Class in Bangkok. We love Thai food and were looking for things to do in Bangkok on a 2 days trip. When we saw the great reviews this cooking class received we went ahead and booked it. I am so glad we did, we had a wonderful morning cooking (10-2pm) and trying food. Going to the local market was a real treat. The staff and the owner were so friendly and helpful, it was really relaxed so there is no pressure if you are not an expert in the kitchen. We definitely recommend Ma-Sa-Man Thai Cooking School BKK. Thanks for wonderful memories.

Outstanding Culinary Experience!. Ma-Sa-Man Thai Cooking School set the standard for my new goal of learning to cook ethnic dishes in every new country I visit. After reading the positive reviews on Tripadvisor, I tried to make a reservation for Christmas Day and they were kind enough to offer the course for just me and a new friend I met on the plane. Imagine that your warm and funny aunt or grandmother was teaching you to cook at home, and now you know what it's like to be taught by Chef Lee. From a list of common Thai dishes, we created a 5 course lunch menu of Tom Kha Gai (Coconut Milk/Galangal Soup w/Chicken), Som Tom Ma La O (Green Papaya Salad), Pad Thai, Nam Phrik Gang Pa-Nang (Red Coconut Curry Paste) to use in Pa-Nang Gai (Red Coconut Curry Chicken), and Kow Neeow Ma-Muang (Mango Sticky Rice).Chef Lee first took us a few blocks away to get fresh ingredients from a market and she noted the importance of buying natural and organic food without any pre-made additives, MSG, or preservatives. Back in the kitchen, she demonstrated each step to prepare each dish, and then we made our own individual dishes with her guidance. Everything was made from scratch - from extracting coconut cream and coconut milk by soaking freshly grated coconut in warm water and squeezing by hand, to making red chili paste with a mortar and pestle.While other courses may offer fancier facilities or try to teach more dishes in the same amount of time, Ma-Sa-Man Thai Cooking School offers real Thai hospitality with a focus on quality ingredients and detailed instruction. The value can't be beat either, for the price of a dinner in a fancy Bangkok restaurant, you spend 4-5 hours learning how to make the same food with your own hands and enjoy the meal at the end of class!

Fun, Informative and Tasty. Summary: Great price for what you get. Tasty food, made easy to learn by the chef and an enjoyable experience checking out the local market. You can learn lots as an amateur cook.4 of us attended a morning (10-2) cooking session here. It started off sampling Thai tropical fruits and being taught what to look for, feel for and taste to know you've got good produce. Next we visited the local market in some back alley warehouse type of place, learning more about the food we were about to cook with. Then it was back for mise en place, and cooking in pairs.Within each pair you cook generally with the same base ingredients, but making slight alterations to end up with totally different dishes to share with your partner. Throughout the whole process the chef is more than helpful in providing advice on what you are doing, when to add ingredients and why. We went away feeling like we understood much more about Thai cuisine and confident in cooking it in the future. The only issue was that the recipes were sometimes way different to what we actually did, so follow the website recipes with a grain of salt (pun intended).

Fab morning!. Excellent class, small group so very personal attention. We cooked a good variety of classic thai dishes. The trip to the market was just across the road and was not excessively long, we just picked up what we needed to cook that day. Chef Lee explains everything with enthusiasm and clarity. She answers all your questions and gives you lots of tips for preparing Thai food at home. Nothing was difficult with clear demonstrations and lots of patient help while cooking. Everything we cooked was lovely and we got to eat it straight away so it was hot and fresh. We were all given all the recipes to take home. Not expensive and lots of fun, highly recommend!

Cooking made fun? Yes!. This was the best cooking experience I've had. The fundamentals of how to use the different tools, the basic foods used, the shopping trip to the market, cooking and best of all EATING the fruits of your labor. This is a great adventure that I would suggest to anyone visiting Bangkok.

great for novices or pros. As a professional cook and having been to many thai cooking classes, I chose this one as it appeared to offer the most for those who had experience with thai cooking before. I was not disapointed and the two of us enjoyed it immensely and learnt a lot of new tips and tricks as well as reinforce what we already knew. Chef Lee also managed to cater for those who had little or no cooking expereince or knowledge of thai food or ingrediants. she catered without fuss for all of the allergies and food "dislikes" in the class.I could not recommend this class highly enough and hope to come back again to learn more. I fully agree with previous reviewers - there IS a reason why it is consistently ranked #1. It is simply the best.

Fun cooking in Bangkok. Denis, (my husband), Matt (son) and Tess (Matt's girlfriend) and I attended this class just recently, and thoroughly enjoyed it all - from the warm welcome, to the trip to the market, the informative, hands-on learning in the clean, bright kitchen. Great food (cooked and eaten by us!!), detailed and clear instruction step-by-step with Chef Lee in a small group made for a very enjoyable time.

There's a reason why it's ranked #1 consistently!!. Having been to Bangkok a dozen times since it's so near to Singapore, i decided to do something differently for this trip and that's to attend a cooking class with my fiance. Having read the rave reviews for Ma-Sa-Man, i decided to register and pay deposit (so that we will not have any last min change of plans, eg shopping hahaa). We are lucky enough to get a taxi driver who fetch us from Holiday Inn Express Siam right to the sch door step in 15 minutes and 75baht fare. Just rem to print the map with thai address =)To cut the story short, being a first-timer taking cooking lessons, we were totally at ease and have no problems preparing the food. It tastes really good as well. They were generous with their ingredients (juicy prawns ''overdose'' but it was yummy) and Chef Lee is really accomodating by changing the papaya salad after I told her that my partner doesnt take papaya..All in all, it was a good session and we felt the time was well-spent despite being in BKK for a mere 1.5 days! Most importantly, my fiance who has never ever cooks or enters the kitchen commented that he thoroughly enjoy the session :) Just a suggestion, we might be keen to go for more cooking classes with Chef Lee on future visits and it will be great to have a little discount for returning visitors like us. Keep it up team!

Great Service. I booked a class with Ma-Sa-Man cooking school for friends of mine travelling on thier honeymoon. I wanted it to be a surprise so I booked and paid and the staff at the school were very accomodating in terms of letting my friends change the date/time to suit thier travel plans. In the end, my friends changed thier plans entirely and removed Bangkok from thier itinerary - meaning I had booked and paid for two classes I could not use. The school was 100% understanding and within a day had refunded my payment.So this review is not of the class itself, which I have not had the pleasure to attend, but more generally of the very professional and attentive service I experienced from this organization.

Great experience, great food!. Great find via trip advisor. I reserved my spot in Chef Lee's cooking school on line. She communicated via email promptly, and even went so far as to keep a class open specifically for me, that met the only day and time that worked for me. On the day of the class, she was waiting for me outside the cooking school so i wouldn't get lost. She started the class by explaining what dishes we would be learning. After a quick trip to the market, she walked us through each dish, emphasizing traditional thai cooking methods, ingredients, etc . . . LOTS of food to try after you've prepared them, so come hungry! All the food was delicious. I have zero experience cooking, so Chef Lee pretty much walked me through all the preparations, but they all turned out perfectly. That's saying quite a lot coming from me! Chef Lee clearly has the expertise to engage all levels of cooking experience. After the class, she waited with me for a bit for my ride to show up. Great class, very friendly and gracious host, great introduction to thai cooking!

Fun and good eats. Thanks tripadvisor that I found this cooking school! An amazing, joyful experience thanks to our master chef and her stuff!:) our chef was waiting for us in the school's door not to miss the entrance, followed by greetings from the english guy she was in with, our journey started smooth and nice. We went then to the nearby market where we've been introduced to the local ingredients, new tastes, smells, eggs:) the whole class was well organised, the chef has a great sense of humour, excellent english knowledge, it was a lot of fun while we were learning and experiencing different methods and ways to cook thai"ish". Excellent choice to spend your day, have fun and soak the culture.

Great food, great people!. From the moment we were greeted at ma sa man cooking school by Chef Lee I was impressed by her warmth and grace. Having arrived about 15 mins early, I saw other people who arrived much earlier, were able to do some fruit carvings which looked facinating. We started with a trip to the market to collect our local produce, which we would use for the class.The different fruit and vegetables were interesting to me as much of it we cannot get in Australia. On the way back to the restaurant we saw a massive goanna in the river! Wow! Then we made our way back to the restaurant, where we prepared our 5 dishes which were traditionally Thai and very yummy. Chef Lee and her team were very helpful and friendly. The restaurant was also in air conditioned comfort with plenty of bottled water given out to us as well. I would recommoned this course for all lovers of food!!

Awesome food with all your questions answered!. I would rate Chef Lee's course very highly if you want to learn about traditional Thai cooking. Starting from the trip to the markets to check out and buy local produce for the class, is definate eye opener into the different fruit, vegies and meat the Thai people cook with. As experienced chefs both my partner and I would throughly recommend this course to novices or professionals. Chef Lee and the rest of her team were highly professional and eager to help out with anything you needed. Being a little bit under the weather myself, the cool environment we were working in, and the abundance of bottled water were exactly what I needed too! The dishes we cooked were extremely tasty, and was very full by the end of the day. Great job Ma-Sa Man cooking school!!
Fantastic. If you want to learn how to cook Thai food and you leave Bangkok without taking this cooking class, you're crazy.

Amazing food & amazing experience!. This was by far the most amazing thai food I ever experience while in Thailand.We cooked Pad Thai with prawns to start, Pa nang curry with chicken and Sticky rice with mango for dessert. Chef Lee was very welcoming and funny, her english was really good and she made the whole experience enjoyable and easy! We started with a bit of an introduction, everything was laid out in quantities so we had to chop and cut most of the things which was fun. We then took it in turns (we had quite a big group) in cooking as there were only 6 woks which was still fun because you got to watch people do it and then have a go yourself! We then got to eat each meal we made which was amazing, i would recommend not eating breakfast as it makes the food much more enjoyable when your starving!The absolute highlight was trying and making my first sticky rice and mango. I never thought i'd be a fan of sticky rice, but it was absolutely amazing, and we even got seconds! Then once we were absolutely stuffed and had eaten everything we got given the recipes so that we could make it all at home. If your worried about it being spicy they are so accommodating, there are chillies that you can put in if you want and you can put as much curry paste in as you want. If i visit Bangkok again i will DEFINITELY be returning to this amazing place!

Outstanding Experience - surpassing expectations. We attended Chef Lee’s course on July 3, 2013. What an interesting and amazing time we had! Reservations were easy. Chef Lee actually met us at the door. Her charm and demeanor made for a very entertaining time. Heading to the market was an eye opening experience. Overall the demonstrations and practical applications, the knowledge imparted was excellent. We had a GREAT time and the food was perfect! Chef Lee surpassed our expectations and we look forward to trying our knowledge at home.

Thai Cooking School. Wonderful experience, truly one of the highlights of the trip. The unfortunate part is that I haven't been able to replicate her meals back at home due to my lack of experience and ingredients. Chef Lee is so knowledgeable and gives a real world experience into Thai cooking. The market trip was fun and educational at the same time. The food is beyond exceptional, one of my best memories of our trip.

Indulging in Thai Cuisine a la Ma-Sa-Man. Chef Lee's priority is to give you a great insight into Thai food and culture and a wonderful day: she is so flexible and mixes different ingredients until the formula is perfect for your fit! After you buy the ingredients you prepare them yourself and eat them right after that. This way you learn on all possible levels, while listening, doing and tasting what she was talking about when you where cutting up the ingredients. The best thing is that you can read it all back later in the recipes she gives you.While eating one of the dishes in Lee's kitchen I understood for the first time why some people call thai cuisine among the best of the world. And the best thing was, I made it myself. Don't eat a big breakfast before you start you course....

One Day In Bangkok. If I had only one day in Bangkok, I would choose to spend it at Ma-Sa-Man Cooking School.  Why?  Because Chef Lee is awesome.Chef Lee was so sweet to accommodate us considering that the two of us called for availability only about 45 minutes before we showed up for class.  There weren't any other students enrolled for the afternoon session that day so she could have easily cancelled, but she graciously took us in and offered us individualized attention (at the regular group session price!).  When she found out that my favorite dish is pad see ew, she added it to the menu for me!  Thanks Chef Lee!  And because my second favorite dish is mango sticky rice, she packed us an extra portion in a doggie bag.  :)Chef Lee truly loves what she does, and it shows through in her teaching style.  She made everything seem so easy, and it was especially helpful that she would first demonstrate each dish before having us follow.  Then, we got to enjoy our creations immediately after.  The gourmet recipes were delicious, and now that we are back home in San Francisco, we have even tried to replicate some of the dishes we learned.Hands down, this was the highlight of our stay in Bangkok.  Try it - you'll have a great time!

Great Cooking Class. This was a great cooking class. Chef Lee showed us the market and introduced us to several new types of food, including morning glory, galangal and let us try century egg.We also got more recipes than we expected, including learning how to cook several pastes.All the food cooked was delicious, and was so easy to prepare - until now I always thought that Thai food, especially the pastes, were very difficult.The Pad Thai we cooked was the best in Thailand!

Cooking school experience in Bangkok. I was on vacation in Bangkok for 10 days at a friend's house and decided to take a cooking class (mid June 2012). The alternatives were too expensive at the Oriental and the Blue Elephant for my budget. I am not organized with my actgivities while travelling. I called May Kaidee's and Ma-Sa-Man Thai Cooking School which were more on my budget, both were very helpful on the phone and had availability for the next day. I booked for the afternoon class first at May Kaidee's and the next day at Ma-Sa-Man. Very surprised to find out that they were both next to each other, very close to Khao San Road area. On both occasions I was THE ONLY ONE, in short I had two private lessons.May Kaidee's was vegetarian and I was a little bit dissapointed at first because I am not vegetarian. Nevertheless I found that the food was very tasty.The menus were similar which I did not mind and was able to compare:At May Kaidee's: It is a small restaurant with the kitchen at the back. No air condition in the kitchen and hot as usual in BKK nevertheless I did not mind it because it was in the open. The menu: Tom Yam Soup, Tom Kha Soup, Isaan, Friend Vegetables with Giinger and Cashew Nuts, Pad Thai, Peanut Sauce, Massaman Curry, Green Thai Curry, Pumpkin Humus, Green Papaya Salad. Food very tastie, staff very friendly, very informal, had a good time, enjoyed my class.Ma-Sa-Man: Air condititoned kitchen and everything closed, obviously, which made me feel a little bit stuffed. Menu was: Tom Yum Gung Soup, Pad Thai, Green Curry Paste, Green Curry with Chicken, Curry with Beef, Green Papaya Salad and Sticky Rice with Mango. Chef Lee was very friendly and informative. Went to a small market next to the school which was very interesting.Cleaningness was similar in both schools, menus were similar, prices were similar. I felt more confortable and preferred the food at May Kaidees.

Great class. This was a great class. The market tour was fun. We loved everything we cooked. The teacher really knows her stuff. The assistants worked non stop to have everything organised for us. Can't wait to get home & try some dishes.

A recommended experience.. Chef Lee was welcoming, fun and informative. We enjoyed the visit to the markets to purchase produce. We cooked a range of Thai dishes and they were all delicious. Chef Lee covered some great recipes with us and added additional recipes to suit the group. A recommended experience.

A great culinary treat for those with good taste. I am in Alone in Bangkok on business and so only have the weekend to discover new things. I found this in trip advisor, everyone rated it highly so thought I would try and was not disappointed. It was a large class but still everyone got hands on cooking and preparing. She goes at just the right pace, explains everything well and clearly loves what she does. The recipes were excellent and all worked well....some great tips to follow when back home.....I looked it the mango stickie rice and the pad Thai my favourites but something I think for everyone. I was alone and everyone else in pairs so actually I got even more hands on, would be more fun I think in the group

interesting and yummy!. A great way to learn more about Thai cooking and culture. Chef Lee is very professional and clear with her teaching. The food is delicious and fun to make. Would recommend it to anyone who wants to spend a few hours learning something new while travelling!
Thai chef. I could be a Thai chef. Everyone was really helpful and the sticky mango rice was amazing!

Incredibly generous teacher. Loved my class, Chef Lee is such a wonderful and generous teacher. She shared her knowledge on things outside of the food domain e.g. how to use fruits the treat hair loss :) and if you ask any questions on other dishes, she does not hesitate to demonstrate these extra dishes!I highly recommend learning to cook from Chef Lee!!However the trip to the market is definitely overhyped. Was in a class with some Australian guy who couldn't stop raving about how "beautiful" the market was, how "beautiful" the smells were, how "beautiful" the vegetables were..It's really no different from a farmer's market, except it's in a dark and dingy place. Perhaps as an Asian who has seen wet markets in brighter and cleaner settings, the concept of the "market" was not new to me and especially since I've seen that you can enjoy the wonders of a fresh market where there is plenty of light and without spiderwebs hanging over you and mosquitoes buzzing around your legs.

Tasty Thai dishes!!. I've taken several cooking classes while traveling internationally and this was hands down the best one yet! Chef Lee does a great job of engaging students and teaching not just recipes, but small techniques that make a big difference, too! It's very hands on which I enjoyed, you prep most ingredients yourself, watch Chef Lee cook a dish and then do your own. Everything we made was delicious and we left with printed recipes which are so available online.I definitely recommend this course!

Exactly what I was looking for...! Loved it !. I've taken some time to get to writing this review. But I know this is something I want to share with everyone. This was my first trip to Bangkok and that too alone, so I had to try something different. Signed-up for Ma-sa-ma's cooking class in April (this was during Songkran and I am so glad they were functioning, unlike pretty much everything in Bangkok which is closed for those Festive days).I was staying at Soi Langsuan and needed directions to the school, which they explained very well over the phone and I could guide the Taxi Driver to the school by myself. Reached and was glad to see that the setting was soo welcoming and warm. We were all given recipes of the amazing dishes we were gonna cook. After a short introduction to Thai cuisine, Chef Lee took us to the local market (a 3 min walk) to buy fresh ingredients that we were gonna cook with. Me being a Food Enthusiast and who loves to cook and experiment with almost anything and everything, the market was a great place to start. Chef Lee is a FUN person to cook with. Not only does she have the expertise but also the ability to make your experience fun!!!!We bought (technically Chef Lee did all the buying and bargaining; we were the apprentices..hahaa) all that we needed and carried them back to the class in very cute little cane baskets. Ingredients were laid out so well for every dish. It was a complete hands-on experience; we did our own cutting, chopping, slicing, dicing, grating, frying, sauteing, boiling, stirring, etc. Chef Lee would demonstrate and we would follow. After we made every dish, we would sit down and eat it!!! That was my favorite part. Everything we cooked was FANTASTIC!!! TASTED GREAT!!! If you are taking the afternoon batch (like I did), would suggest having only a light breakfast before coming to the class, because you will not stop eating what you cooked. The recipes are simply perfect and what we made was the best Thai Food I have ever eaten.Came back home and tried the dishes and they were absolutely SUPERB!!!!! I would definitely recommend this class to anyone who loves food and who loves to cook. Also a must-do for anyone looking for a different experience !!! Visiting a place and doing the regular "touristy" things are a cliche for me now and I always am looking for something that will leave a lasting experience. This is definitely one of them !! Thanks Chef Lee and the Team ! I will come back for an advanced class on my next trip to Bangkok !!! Soon !!!

Do it!. We decided to do this class based on the reviews here and Chef Lee does not disappoint. The market visit is a great insight into everyday Thai life. The menu is fantastic and SO much food, you need a lie down after. Not sure we needed 3 soups, but the pad thai, green curry and the sticky rice and mango were amazing. The small quantities makes it easier so you replicate it at home. We even asked Lee about our favorite Thai dish back home and she made it for us! We recommend to anyone wanting an enjoyable food experience in Bangkok.

Perfect Thai cooking .... I fully recommend this cooking school in Bangkok's Samsen Road. In approx. 4 hours I moved with Lee, the very professional and very sympathic Thai cooking teacher, to the market, where we bought the meal's ingredients (and Lee explaned the specialities), we prepared and cooked together 3 types of soup, 2 types of Thai curry, one papaya salat, two sortof special paste, and a sticky rice & Mango desert. Lee is very friendly, open for individual needslike pictures motives and she speaks, of course, a very good and understandable English. You can take all food receipes home and can subscribe for eMail cooking newsletters.

Fun, informative and excellent food!. Chef Lee is an excellent teacher, and her teaching style involves a lot of hands on preparation and cooking. The market trip is very educational and helps introduce you to the ingredients you'll be using (it'll also surprise you when you find it). She added a few additional dishes for us since we were a small class, and really showed us the similarities and differences in preparing the thai soups, and the red and green curries.Overall, excellent excellent school that teaches thai cooking techniques and recipes, with wonderful yummy foods and run by great people. I'll definitely come back for another lesson, or three.

Best lunch, so full. Chef Lee is so nice, funny, has great english, and is an excellent cook. We were a small group (4 total) and she happily added an additional soup to our cooking class after finding out it was someone's favorite. They also are so happy and nice about letting you take photos and taking photos for you. The school does a great job making sure you get there ok with all the instructions and photos. We highly recommend and are looking forward to trying the recipes back home.

Excellent tuition and yummy food!. My girlfriend and I had the most amazing time at Ma Sa Man cookery school in Bangkok. We got to the class a little bit late (around 30 mins) as our taxi driver decided to take us on a massively scenic route (apparently taxi drivers in Bangkok have a habit of doing this but only when the meter is still on!) but we were immediately put at ease by Chef Lee and her husband when we did finally make it!The class was run expertly and Chef Lee didn't mind going over anything twice if we didn't quite understand the first time. She introduced us to lots of exotic foodstuffs that we don't normally see in the UK and we both had an excellent time at the class.If you are even vaguely interested in cookery then I would highly recommend this class as it was definitely one of the highlights of our trip! We will definitely be returning next time we come to Bangkok!

Best part of our trip to Thailand. My family, myself and 3 guys,visited the Ma-Sa-Man Thai Cooking School ran by Chef Lee on 5/24/12. It was the highlight of our vacation! Luckily for us the other group that was suppose to be in class with us didn't show and we ended up with what I would call a "private lesson". Right after our trip to the market, Chef Lee got our boys busy making the red chili paste for our first dish. We laughed, chopped, learned and questioned Chef Lee about every dish. She was a terrific teacher and very patient with my guys. The food we made with Chef Lee were the best things we ate while we were in Thailand. I would highly recommend Chef Lee and her cooking school.

Very informative cooking class. My husband and I loved this cooking class. We signed up for a group class with Chef Lee but ended up there were only 2 of us!! We made 9 dishes within 3.5 hrs including a trip to a near by Market to get ingredients. I love cooking but for some reason, my Thai cooking skill isn't that great. I asked many questions to Chef Lee from the ingredients to cooing methods. On the other hand, my husband who loves Thai food, does not cook at all. (only grilling, you know how American guys are.) But he loved this cooking class and says his highlight of trip was this cooking class (!). I mean we did a lot of activities including Phi Phi Island trip, trip to Krabi, Elephant ride, Cubbing tiger, Tailoring, Renting a moped, etc. But this is something that it will last for the rest of your life!If we ever to go back to Bangkok again, we would love to take another class and learn other dishes!Thank you very much, Chef Lee!

Great fun and amazing food!!!. For those lovers of Thai food, this cooking class is worth the time. We had an amazing time learning about different Thai ingredients and cooking some Thai food. Even though you do not do all the preparation and cooking yourself it was great because you could learn/cook about more dishes than if you had to do everything yourself.

She is an amazing chef and as good teacher! Thoroughly enjoyed!. The class was fun and very informative! Chef Lee is very knowledgeable, and teaches at university, too! She is always eager to answer questions and give welcomed extra information! The simple settings and her approach gave the class an informal feel, which made the experience even more interesting! I strongly recommend this class!

Tasty, Fun and I learnt something. This was an excellent 4 hours. We started by a brief introduction and then a trip to a local and small market where we got some of the ingredients. Back to the school and Chef Lee guided us through the preparation and then the cooking of 5 dishes.She gave us hints and tips that real Thai people use. After we had cooked each dish we tasted it and then moved to the next. I was full by the end.Chef Lee has a great enthusiasm and made a real effort to get the authentic tastes and textures.WE each had our own burner to cook on and the kitchen was air-conditioned so made for a comfortable time.Overall a really worthwhile morning with skills I can use, and already have, back home

Real Thai cooking class - THE highlight of my trip!!!. I took Chef Lee's class by myself in March 2012. I wanted a real cooking class. Not a touristy assemble-the-ingredients-and-stir "cooking" class. I definitely got was I was looking for. We chopped, sliced, diced, mashed, stirred, tasted, seasoned, etc. We each had our own cooking station. Chef Lee was amazing!!! She really knows her stuff. I used to think I didn't like Pad Thai. The recipe she taught us was phenomenal as was everything else, especially the sticky rice. Definitely come hungry. We made five dishes. All were fantastic. Everything completely from scratch. We made Papaya Salad, Pad Thai, Green Curry, Red Curry, and Sticky Rice. The best thing about Chef Lee was her passion for food and teaching. Someone in my class asked her about the difference between coconut water and coconut milk. She stopped what she was doing and demonstrated it. When someone asked how to cut the papaya (this was pre-cut), she demonstrated. This was definitely something to leave to an expert. She loved teaching us the intricate subtle techniques that made the food taste better. This was hands down the best meal I had in Thailand.I can't say enough great things. Chef Lee was fun, funny, witty, professional, and completely adorable. I also took her fruit carving class. If you have sculpting experience or enjoy carving pumpkins, this class is another must.One other point, I had gotten prickly heat on my feet and was unable to go to the market. The feedback from others was that it was a worthwhile experience as well.You can stop researching Thai cooking classes and sign up today! You will not be disappointed. It was worth every penny.

Such a GREAT experience. We loved this class...it turned out to be one of our best memories of Thailand. Chef Lee is very informative and witty at that. She is easy to understand, and the food you will prepare with her at this class will be some of the best you will eat during your stay in Thailand. We loved going to the market to pick out all of the ingredients first, and then how simple she made the rest of the day.I could not reccomend this more! What a great experience!!

OMG OMG. This was one of the most exciting FUN experiences i have had during my travels. Chef Lee is amazingly funny knowledgeable and passionate. She believes in authentic Thai cooking and is a fountain of knowledge. Learnt so many techniques during our cooing class. We laughed a lot but at the same time learnt soooo much. I would 100% recommend you take her cooking class. The trip to the market was good as we had a multitude of questions about herbs, spices etc and she was able to guide us, as well as what not to buy etc. If ever back in Bangkok i would so book another refresher course with her. Keep up the amazing work you do. Aidan & Hayden

''Great chef, great cooking experience''. The best trip to Thailand where we can learn authentic Thai cooking from a great chef. With her background in culinary industry, she is able to explain the right and traditional way of Thai cooking. All the ingredients used are 'halal' and this is great for the muslim. Don't forget to bring your camera during the class. Highly recommended for those who love Thai food. We will definately come back for more classes.Nur Haslina Mukhtar, Malaysia.

Delicious Dishes. After a few busy das in Bangkok it was nice to get into an airconditioned cooking facility for some nice relaxing cooking! Finding Thai Cooking school was very easy. We started by heading to a local market which was a great experience in itself. We then returned to our cooking stations to begin cooking! We made about 6 dishes and were absolutely stuffed by the end. Every meal turned out perfect because of Chef Lee's step by step instructions. If you have a spare day and are looking for something fun and easy to do I would recommend this.
Fun, informative and tasty!. Great step-by-step instructions to make outstanding food. Chef Lee genuinely enthusiastic and passionate about the food, and entertains any and all questions.

One of the best days on our trip. A really fun morning, Chef Lee is incredibly generous with her time and we went well over time. We cooked a lot of dishes, probably the best we tasted on our trip and you get to eat them all so don't have any breakfast!

Great intro to Thai cooking. Had a lazy week in Bangkok and decided to do a cooking course. Signed up with Ma-Sa-Man and had a really really good day with them. Chef Lee showed us the cooking methods and was very witty and easy to follow. We even headed to market place before and picked up all the ingredients, which was a nice little touch.Excellent value, will definitely do it again when I go back to Bangkok. As a result, I can now cook many of the recipes at home in China.

It's fabulous !!. We read about this cooking school on the Internet and decided to give it a try in our Easter holiday 2012. It was so enjoyable and value-for-money that we made ad-hoc changes to our itinerary and took another class on the day before our departure. Between the first and second classes, we joined a cooking class of another school in Pattaya, thinking that they were all the same. You know what, there could be a world of difference. And now I have to tell you this: Ma-Sa-Man is definitely the best !!!!! Believe me, it is worth every cent you pay and every minute you spend.I still miss the experience back then. I and my 10-year-old daughter learnt a great deal from Chef Lee, a funny, experienced and professional cook. Her two big boys, Justin and Murray (hope that I spell your names right), were very entertaining and helpful. Chef Lee’s presentation was clear, effective, organised and amusing. The sharing among classmates of different nationalities while we enjoyed scrumptious dishes of our own added to the cosiness of the class. The recipes were well written, containing a lot of useful tips that help us reproduce the same delicacies at home.Do include a visit to this fabulous school in your next visit to Bangkok. You will regret it if you don’t.[P.S. The kind Chef Lee helped us hail a taxi after the class and made the driver promise to charge by the meter. But right after we got into the cab, he said sternly to us, “200 bahts to the hotel”, a charge way higher than the meter fare. With due respect to all the nice and friendly Thai people, we have to say that most of your taxi drivers are robbers!]

Good things come from good ingredients. We went to the school for a lunchtime course, which started, after a quick and clear introduction, with a group shopping trip to a local market. Chef Lee poked and prodded until the very best ingredients were found - a lesson in itself. Then back for each dish to be prepared by us after a demonstration and for us to cook - under careful guidance. Everything was clearly explained and help was freely available when needed. The old addage that good cooking involves quality ingredients, cooked simply could not have been better made. The results from taking some care and combining basic ingredients were stunning. The atmosphere was light-hearted and fun! All in all this was a real highlight during our time in Bangkok. Upon our return to the UK we have tried out various of the recipes (substituting local produce where exotic stuff is unobtainable, or too expensive) and the results have been unfailingly good. We can recommend this highly and hope you do too.

Fantastic cooking school with big heart. We thoroughly enjoyed our 4 hour cooking lesson with chef Lee. We chose this placed based on the reviews here on tripadvisor and the entire experience exceeded expectations. Upon arrival we were warmly greeted and made to feel right at home. Chef Lee ran through the dishes we were going to make and asked us if there was anything in particular we wanted to learn as she was happy to accommodate. We then had a trip to the market where she talked through the ingredients available in Thai cooking and what they were used for as well as what to look out for. The actual cooking lesson was set out so well. Chef Lee would run through how to prepare the dish, you would prep the ingredients, then she would demonstrate from beginning to end. After this she would then recap step by step as you made it. Totally fool proof Thai cooking! Every dish was amazing and we left very full and very happy. Would highly recommend to anyone looking for a Thai cooking course with a friendly atmosphere and lots of laughter. Thanks chef Lee, we'll be telling everyone we know about you and you're amazing uses for Tom Yum paste!

A must do when in Bangkok. Chef Lee is fantastic and really funny too!. I loved this course. Chef Lee was great and everyone else in the team was really relaxed and friendly. Plus I was quite late in arriving and hassled as a result but they were so lovely about the delay that I relaxed immediately.Also, I had booked a private class; not that I needed one but I was tied to a day and time. When I arrived there were 2 others there that the team booked in so it saved me a packet. How lovely was that?Plus, we asked for a curry that was not on the list and Chef Lee showed us how to make it, in addition to all the other dishes.When I was leaving it was lashing rain and chef Lee came out with me to get a cab and held the umbrella for me!Seriously this was a fabulous experience and that was all before the cooking even started which was excellent.I think it is a must do when in BKK.

Great Fun!. Great introductory guide to Thai cooking! Very helpful and informative guides as well as some very tasty food! Simple run through of how to make some of the best known Thai dishes. If i had had more time in Bangkok i would have loved to do the full length class!

Best Thai Food I Ever Had. Who would have thought that I would have cooked the best Thai food I ever enjoyed? Under the entertaining and skillfull tutelage of Chef Lee, I, and the members of our group, learned how to cook authentic Thai food that was far better than what would be found in a restaurant. All preparation is from scratch.We were a group of six and the menu lent itself to a team approach of preparing the day's variouls items. If you are looking for an unique and inexpensive (actually cheap) experience while in Bangkok there can be few alternatives to Chef Lee's cooking school

Great cooking class. I just took a class with Chef Lee. It was lots of fun. The food is delicious. Everything we make was from scratch. All the sauces are made from pastes that are ground from fresh herbs and spices. We went to the market with her to buy all the ingredients that morning. I definitely recommend if you want hands on cooking and fresh food.

Authentic Thai cooking!. Were there a bit early so Chef Lee taught us how to do simple vegetable carving to kill the time and to give us an insight of veg carving.I was quite surprise after all why not learn something new.Glad I sign up I wasn't sure at first. Chef Lee is very professional and passionate to teach all her student how to prepare and cook Thai food from scratch using fresh ingredients. No shortcut please. She's very patient always take her time to explain and pause for photo taking and she always wait until we are ready before moving to the next step or recipes. I ended up taking double class and stuff myself up with all the food I reckon 13 different dishes and all tastes so 'Yummy' . I will definitely go back to Chef Lee on my next visit.

Such fun!. Had a really great time with Chef Lee! She is such a load of fun! We did this towards the end of our trip and almost had a private class with Chef Lee! She is so entertaining and such a lovely person! The dishes were excellent and we licked our plates clean! The penang curry was to die for! Can't wait to try these at home! Chef Lee was extremely helpful and even guided us with places/shops we could source ingredients from to take back home :)

Great Thai Cooking Class. Awesome experience! A 4 hour Thai Cooking class with Chef Lee, who is very knowledgeable and a great teacher. She really made it a very enjoyable learning experience. The day starts with a trip to a local fresh produce market to introduce you to some of the local ingredients, and then the cooking starts, with lots of opportunity to sample! Would recommend to anyone who wants to gain some insight into the finer art of Thai cooking.

So delicious!. Just returned from Chef Lee's cooking school. It was a fantastic experience and would recommend it everyone. The food was sensational and Chef Lee was delightful. I can't wait to cook these recipes at home.

Brilliant course. I decided to take the course in a "what the hell, why not" moment, and what a great decision that turned out to be. Chef Lee was a great teacher, and made sure she didn't just demonstrate the cooking, but actually made sure that we had a chance to practice the cooking ourselves. She was very flexible in allowing us to choose some other dishes off the menu to try, and each meal was different from the one before, meaning that we can now cook a pretty decent Thai meal when we get back home. What a fantastic experience.

Awesome food and service!. Chef Lee is a legend and knows her stuff.I also arrived late and they managed to accomodate me to join 2 people who had started earlier in the days, then once they had finished we cooked the 2 dishes that I had missed earlier.Was a great day!Also have a really good menu to select from if you have a group and want to choose what to cook.

Believe the hype!. Chef Lee is awesome. She adapted our class to what we wanted. We ended up making all the set dishes plus pad see yu and pad kee mao. The market tour at the beginning makes it feel even more authentic and the dishes we cooked were amazing. The pad thai and panang curry were some of the best I have had.

Great Experience!. My friends and I ordered one private class in the afternoon. The chef was very nice, help and humorous. The food we made was so delicious that it could compete with the local restaurants. The staff was kind too, he helped take picture during the classed. We really had a great time there.

Nice and worthwhile experience. My girlfriend and I got a little lost and were late by 20 minutes but Chef Lee came out to find us and everyone was very nice despite waiting.The recipes were simple to follow and the food turned out great even though i'm not a good cook. My girlfriend and I had lots of fun in cooking and tasting and it was a comfortable and worthwhile experience.It definitely helps that the Chef Lee is interactive and speaks fluent English and the lesson was very engaging. I definitely recommend going for the class as the instructions are easy to follow and you will enjoy eating the food you make.

Cheef Lee is a hoot!. We left almost speechless not just because we had so much fun but also because we we ate way too much. We learned how to make eight traditional Thai dishes from steamed curry to papaya salad to mango sticky rice. The day started with a trip to the market with Chef Lee. The class room space was cozy and the staff were extremely friendly. What made the class a blast was Chef Lees great sense of humor. She has a passion for cooking and helping others master the art of Thai cooking. I would highly recommend spending half a day at the Ma-Sa-Man Thai Cooking School during your stay in BKK.

Time Well Spent. My husband and I signed up for the 4-hr group cooking class with Chef Lee at 10am. We took the orange river line to Phra Athit and the school is about a 10 minute walk from the ferry terminal. The class is intimate- there were 7 people including us, and each of us had a work station. First we went to the local market and Chef Lee showed us the various Thai produce and ingredients that we were going to use for class. After heading back to the school, we started our cooking lessons. The structure of the class is as follows: Chef Lee would explain the dish, the steps, and we would prep, cook, and eat the dish immediately. Then it was on to the next dish. Chef Lee also had three helpers who would help set up (provide the plates/utensils and prepare our workstations/tables). We ate so much that we had to skip dinner that night! Chef Lee is professional and personable. Her detailed explanations really helped us grasp the basics of Thai cuisine and we're definitely going to try the dishes at home (albeit we may not find the same fresh ingredients here in the States). I highly recommend this class!

Great food was cooked with the help of a great teacher!. The class was fantastic! I really enjoyed having the chance to cook Thai food. We got a chance to visit the market and learn about some of our groceries. Then we started cooking right away! Chef Lee made everything very easy to understand. I have a wonderful time!

Excellent class, awesome food and great value!. The class was great. From the start I already knew it was going to be a great afternoon. We were unfortunately late half an hour but Chef Lee and the others were so understanding. Everything was explained clearly and the recipes are straight forward but soo tasty! Like others my hubby wasn't keen on the idea of cooking but he really enjoyed it!! We were both so full by the end of it that we didn't have dinner. It was basically our lunch and dinner. Looking forward to try the recipes at home!
Fun and educational. We learned a lot and chef Lee keeps it entertaining. We made 6-7 dishes over 4-5 hours.

Lots of fun, good intro to Bangkok. My partner and I did this cooking class week when we visited Bangkok last week. Did the class on the first day and it was a good intro to the city. I really liked Lee and the local market we visited. Learned lots of dishes and will defintely be making some later this month at home! The only slight issue I had with the class was that it was somewhat long... my partner and I both thought it could have been more like 3 hours instead of 4. Overall, a good experience, though and would def go back on a return trip ot Bangkok.

The most personal, honest, and tasty Thai Cooking School!. I stayed in Bangkok for two and a half weeks, and by far the best thing that happened to me was Ma-Sa-Man Cooking School! Chef Lee gave me personal attention in the kitchen for over 100 hours, and helped me to really understand Thai cooking. She welcomed me as family by the end of my time there, and I felt I learned invaluable cooking techniques from her. I never felt swindled or uncomfortable, and they worked with my schedule to allow me so many hours in the kitchen. Besides all the great learning I did in the kitchen, the best part, as it should be, was the eating! Trust me, I ate all the street food, and everything I could in Thailand, but nothing beats Chef Lee's cooking. On another note, I now work in the fine dining industry, and use thai techniques for my job every chance I can! Chef Lee will inspire you!

The perfect Thai cooking course. In good location chef Lee teaches an easy to follow Thai cooking course. The course started with a trip to the market with information on what to look for when selecting the ingredients to be used throughout the course. We prepared, cooked and ate five traditional Thai dishes. Detailed recipe cards where provide with online assistance available for tips and advice in the future. The food itself was delicious, in fact probably the best I have tasted in Thailand and hard to believe that I made it - highlights being the pa-neng curry and the sticky rice and mango dessert.

Excellent - Excellent Thai Food!!. We took this cooking class our last night in Bangkok. The food that we made was some of the best we had on our 6 week holiday. Chef Lee keeps the class entertaining. My husband rates it a 8 out of 10. I rate it a 10. Would highly recommend!!
Awesome. Chef Lee was so easy to learn from. She has a good sense of humor and is a natural teacher.

Memorable! Easily the best cooking course we've been too so far.... Attention to detail is what this dynamic couple excel at, they are extremely passionate about their school. It really shows from the minute you step through their door. We were 30 minutes early and expected to hang around, Chef Lee had other ideas! We were examining the posters of all the South East Asian fruits and vegetables whilst we waited when Chef Lee descended on us with gusto, showing us extra info from her books and giving us interesting facts from her experience, she is very knowledge indeed. The day was a whirlwind of cooking and excellent information, and since arriving back from our travels, we have already cooked Thai twice!We were supposed to finish at 2pm, but she did 7 courses with us that day and we finished at 4pm. We loved every dish and my partner and I really enjoyed ourselves that day. All our other cooking courses in other countries paled in comparison to this one.We wish Kruzon and Chef Lee every success and all the very best, they undoubtedly deserve to be #1 on TripAdvisor!Top tip: Just get a taxi and don't have breakfast :)

Delicious, friendly and fun.. When you arrive make sure you go into the cooking school on the right hand side as there is another next door. Chef Lee is extremely qualified, has sensational English n the best sense of humor. The market is lovely to experience but it was the extra variations to the recipes I loved the most. All the food cooked was scrumptious, the music in the back ground kept us bopping, and sharing stories with fellow travelers was lovely too.We all learnt and loved the 4 hours.1200 baht or $40 USD at the time was money well spent.I must Aldo add the care for each of us was amazing as 2 friends had a little upset tummy, so gastrolytes n charcoal pills were provided. Gorgeous people.

Highly recommend!. Took the 10 to 2 o'clock course. Chef Lee is really lovely and so pleasent. The food was amazing and I now have a new found appreciation for Thai food. We visited a market first which was great, then cooked 5 dishes and we were shown how to make 2 extra. I would highly recommend this school!
Pleasant staff and great learning experience.. But classes could be smaller and less cramped. Overall good value, go with an empty stomach.

Great Laugh. Had a great time. Everything is explained really well, great set-up, clean, and the hosts spoke brilliant English.And most importantly the food was incredible.If you read this... Thanks for a lovely afternoon.

Chef Lee is a must stop for anyone taking a cooking class in Bangkok. There are so many cooking schools in Thailand but I believe that Chef Lee has to be the best. Not only is she an amazing chef she also has a great personality and makes the class fun. After we were done we wanted to go back. It was nice to go to the food market and have her explain every ingredient and even some that we didn't use. I cook a lot and never realized how simple these Thai dishes could be to prepare. We cooked some of my favorites like Panang Curry and Tom Kaa Gai which Chef Lee says is her Grandmother's recipe. She was so friendly and I highly recommend you take time out of your trip to have this be a stop. There was a nice man there who will take your pictures while you cook too which we found helpful to catch the full experience. We stayed in Sukhumvit area near Asok station. I believe the least expensive way to get there with the best time was to take the Metro(Subway 26 baht per person) to the train station Hua Lampong then catch a taxi from there( 61 baht) Since there were 2 of us we split the taxi cost. We could have taken the Skytrain but that would have been 40 baht with a transfer the 18 baht per person to ride to the last river stop then walk. A long time for the same amount of money. We went home the same way. Don't take the Tuk-Tuk anywhere if you can help it. They are a rip off. And always have the address written in Thai language for the taxi driver to read. Print it out at home before your trip. And stop by Chef Lee for first class education in Thai recipes and ingredients.

Highlight of our trip. Chef Lee is awesome! Our group of 5 had an amazing time. Learned a ton about Thai cuisine. This was by far the best Thai food we ate during our 1 month stay in Thailand. Can't say enough good things about the program or Chef Lee. A must-do in Bangkok.

Food Lover's Delight. Had an afternoon with Chef Lee last week. One of the best activities we did in our week in Bangkok. We ended up being the only 2 people in the lesson as the other people who had booked did not turn up. Lucky for us as we had a private lesson! My husband, who is not a cook, thoroughly enjoyed the lesson and was pleased that the food he cooked was very edible. All the people at Ma Sa Man Thai were friendly and polite. Came away with recipes and ideas for dinner parties. We took a taxi to the venue and then a taxi back, which Chef Lee helped us to flag down. Would highly recommend this if you are looking for something to do while in Bangkok. A great way to fill in a couple of hours. We had our lesson at 3pm and didn't have lunch before or dinner after as there is more than enough food.

Yummmmm........ One of the best pad thai I've had! Really good value as you learn many dishes and take home even more yummy recipes. Chef Lee is very pleasant and patient. Speaks English well so it's easy to understand. Really deserve the marvelous reviews. One of the things you have to do in Bangkok before you leave. Great food, great teacher, Chef Lee!!

MM mM mm !. My only regret, is not taking this class at the beginning of my trip. I really enjoyed my class on Jan 28, 2012 it was a small class of three so Chef Lee gave us all the attention we needed. The food and the ingredients are so fresh and the dishes you make during the class are unbelievable. I would definitely recommend this class. An absolute MUST DO in Bangkok !!

No exaggeration - best food in Bangkok. Hands down - Chef Lee's recipes are the best you'll find around town. Stayed for an entire week in Bangkok so got a chance to sample a bunch of food and restaurants, but could not find a place that could beat Chef Lee's creations. All of the dishes we prepared were delightful, with authentic ingredients and well-balanced flavors. Chef Lee is really fun, and makes the experience a highly personal one. She is generous with her time, though we booked the standard lesson, which is 6 dishes, we got 8-9! Everything is done professionally, and the lesson runs very efficiently, and very well-planned. Highly recommended!

The highlight of our trip. My daughter took the 20 hour fruit carving class, and my husband, my other daughter and I took the 4 hour cooking class. Chef Lee is amazing, she is fun, energetic and an amazing chef. We learned to cook 8 dishes in 4 hours and I feel confident that I can replicate them. She offers modifications for the USA and for vegetarians. My daughter also loved the fruit carving and was carving melons in several patterns by the end of the class. I can't recommend this school highly enough both for cooking and carving.

This is the place to learn thai cooking.. I decided to try this school out as it offered the best value in terms of the number of dishes one could learn in one session.And I was not disappointed.In fact this experience was so good,I will definitely,when time permits, learn some more thai cooking with chef Lee.Chef Lee is very enthusiastic and that spikes your interest.The trip to the market was very informative;she spared no efforts in explaining the various herbs/condiments ,the effect of using them.Now I have a very healthy respect for coriander roots!Every question was answered with much interest.Cooking with Lee made thai cooking seem so so easy.She guides one well and the cooking tips she proffers are invaluable;make sure to note them down and follow them.It makes a lot of difference to the outcome. The phad thai gung was the best ever that I had tasted.I prepared it at home and my son who is a die hard thai food lover,said it was really good.The school is equipped well and staff is pleasant.The learning is not limited to the fixed menu.Chef lee explained the various pastes that can be prepared too,by adding /subtracting ingredients.Thats a big plus.And not to forget,all the dishes I had learnt were packed for me to take away.I term this place as very good in terms of value and taste of food.

Memorable Experience. This was honestly some of the best food I had during my one week trip to Thailand and I can say that I was responsible for cooking it! Chef Lee is incredibly friendly, charismatic and patient with everyone in the class. The classroom experience is very intimate with about 10-12 people. I had no prior cooking experience or taken other classes whatsoever and Chef Lee made it real simple. Good activity to do even if you are traveling solo and are interested in cooking. Not too mention, this is very affordable(at 1100 Bhat online booking) and the actual class lasts quite a while. Definitely go with an empty stomach because you will trying a lot of different dishes and will not go home hungry.The cooking school facilities are very easy to reach by taxi from the Sukhumvit area and should cost a little over 70 bhat. I had the hotel explain to the taxi driver the location and they phoned up the school for precise directions. Once you leave the school, Chef Lee will help you track down a taxi to return to the hotel. I can't wait to try the recipes!

Thai Cooking at its best!. - various recipe- easy to cook- perfect explainations- interesting background informations- best: the (female) instructor: friendly, professional, funny>>> If Thai Cooking School, go for this!

Really Enjoyed this Class. This was our favorite activity during our week in Bangkok. I especially enjoyed the trip to the market. The Chef was super personable, and we learned a lot. My picky teens even loved the food! By the end we were stuffed.

Best food I have ever eaten - and I cooked it!. Can't recommend this class highly enough. Chef Lee is an engaging and encouraging teacher. It took a while to get to the place from our hotel - skytrain and express boat, and it is not some fancy high-end place. But all reservations evaporated as soon as I tasted the first dish we made - Tom Yum soup. I'm not a huge fan of Thai food to begin with - but this was hands down the best soup I have ever eaten - made by me! It just got better from there. All the food was superb, Chef Lee was fantastic and the whole experience was the highlight of our trip to Bangkok. We skipped breakfast and were really glad we did - by the end of the class we were stuffed and happy.

Fantastic Class with Chef Lee. My fiance and I were very excited to find Thai Cooking School BKK on our searches on TripAdvisor, and the reviews did not disappoint.Our class was small (only 6) so we got to decide on our own unique menu between the 6 of us in the class. We went to the market and had a chance to ask Chef Lee about all the things that we had been wondering about during the rest of our trip. The market trip was short, but it was nice to see where our products were coming from and ask any questions.We returned to the classroom on Samsen and began cooking. We made our own coconut cream and milk and then began cooking. Chef Lee was very informative and even amped up the spice for us, as we LOVE spicy food. Chef Lee was able to walk us through 7 dishes during our class and we took notes on the printed recipes that were given when we got back from the market. Some of the instructions differed from the recipes given, as they try to give you recipes that you can create in your own home with things you can find outside of Thailand. After so many dishes, we were stuffed and very happy to finally have some real, authentic Thai cooking experience under our belts.Thanks for the great class and the fabulous recipes. We'll be trying them out on friends over the next few months! The class was one of our trip highlights and we'd recommend it to anyone that loves to cook (and eat) as much as we do!The price for this class is also VERY fair! Many other schools in the area/Bangkok are much more. Thai Cooking School BKK is a very reasonable without skimping on ANY details. Truly one of my favorite experiences from our trip!

Absolutely perfect :). Lee is are verry good teacher, and her english is verry good :) We went ti the market and we learn ti cook more dishes than we should. If you want to go to cooking school in Thailand, go to Ma-Sa.Man Thai cooking school in Bangkok :))

Great cooking class and delicious food. We did the cooking class at Miss Lee's place. It was wonderful! We learned a lot of dishes in a short time. She took the time to tell and explain about the products and delivers quality in what she does. I already miss Thaiand so i cooked some dishes at home. Thank you so much miss Lee!

Best tasty experience ever!. When you go abroad you probably want to eat something "abroadish". Something local. And that's OK. But what about tasting the REAL cusine by learning how to cook local dishes? Even better and the best!That's why we took a class at Chef Lee cooking school. And it was superb. Amazingly how really simple "tour", and not THAT crowded, can be a real, thai journey.We've learnt the theory. We went to the real, thai market with fresh fruit, vegetables and sea food. We cooked dishes we wanted to. We ate them and tasted the best taste ever imagined. Everything with super nice Chef Lee who explained every single problem and adviced how and what to cook at our homes.Remarkable, amazing and best invested money ever!

很好玩的cooking class!. I am not good at cooking, but Chef Lee and Ann used the easiest way to deliver their knowledge to me as much as they can so finally I can cook yum Thai food! The class is not just about cooking, they taught me from "the wet market" buying fresh materials. They were very serious about the students' diet preference so they took good care of what I can eat or what I can't. I'm really impressed...All staff members are very kind and helpful. I enjoyed the class very much but unfortunately my time didn't allow me staying longer otherwise I could learn more dishes. btw the foods I made were very delicious!!Will go again when I visit bangkok next time :)

Highlight of our trip. Our final day in Bangkok after two weeks travelling was spent at this cooking school. Right decision! We had so much fun and cooking some amazing food. The food was delicious and we learnt alot about the preparation. Chef Lee was awesome. The green curry and sticky rice were to die for! The market tour was interesting too.The kitchen was quite cramped and old but other than that it was an awesome day.

If you only have time for one thing in Bangkok.... You have to take a cooking class with Chef Lee at Ma-Sa-Man! A friend and I booked a sunday class with Chef Lee and LTS. It just happened to be a day when they did not have any other reservations. They still accommodated us! Two friends with our own personal chef!Chef Lee is very knowledgeable, teaching everything from form to the minute details of each vegetable and why they are called what they're called. She is the ultimate teacher, leading by example, then letting you try yourself, all while being funny - very funny!My buddy and I cooked up 5 dishes. All were portioned for a single person, making eating each one afterward a rewarding, and non-filling experience. We cooked up: papaya salad, Tom Kha Gai, Panang Curry Chicken, Pad Thai, and mango with sticky rice for dessert. I swear to you, my dishes turned out better than anything I've had in the States!They provide you with recipes to take home, as well as access to video to refresh your memory. Part of me wants to steal this dream team and open a restaurant in the States! But, then they wouldn't be able to share their wonderful gift with the millions of travelers coming through Bangkok. Thanks Chef Lee and LTS for a memorable experience!

Chef Lee is a fantastic teacher and cook. I have been a teacher for twenty years and was extremely impressed with chef Lee's passion for cooking, her knowledge of the history behind each dish, and her ability to keep me engaged for the whole, four-hour class. There were about nine of us in the class and she was able to move about the kitchen and spend equal time with each student. The class was organized and fun, so much that I have reserved a private baking class with Chef Lee tomorrow. I highly recommend Ma-Sa-Man Thai Cooking School BKK.

Best way to eat authentic Thai food.. We highly enjoyed the cooking class. If you want to eat authentic Thai food and have the opportunity to cook it also, then this is the way to do it. The class lasts approimately 4 1/2 hours and includes a visit to a local market to buy the ingredients. One tip: make sure you do NOT eat a large breakfast before coming to this class. I did and was stuffed afterward. Special mention to Chef Lee who did a great job of holding the class's interest. Highly recommended if you have time while in Bangkok.
