I can't believe I can cook Phat Thai from scratch!!!. Chef Lee is the real deal - she is very pleasant, funny, and teaches from the heart. She showed us a variety of cooking and preparation techniques which are very important and valuable in the whole cooking experience. For example she showed what to do and what not to do in order to make sure we get the most aroma and flavor from the fresh ingredients. Most of the ingredients are prepared from scratch instead of using a prepared sauce or secret ingredient. At the end of the 3 hr class, we've learned to cook Phat Thai, Chicken Kra Pao (basil chicken), Som Tam (papaya salad), Yum Neua (beef salad) and Tom Kha Gai (chicken coconut soup), all freshly peprared by each student. We ate the dish after we cooked it, and when we're done we're all so stuffed that we need a long walk to burn it off, but we were very happy and satisfied. We paid 3300 baht for 3 students private class, and a fourth person can attend for free.

Educational & fun intro to Thai cooking for Americans !. Quality of experience was great! Made 8 dishes: best known to Americans asTom yum shrimp soupTom kha shrimp soupPapaya saladPanang curry w chickenGreen curry w chicken - actually got to make the curry paste ( mortar & pestle)Pad Thai w shrimpCoconut sticky rice w mangoExperience started w trip to local market to pick out fresh ingredients - quite an experience for anyone who has never been to an Asian market Then Chef Lee, who speaks English well enough for even a slow talking southerner to understand explains the dishes & off you go. She teaches you to prepare all of the herbs & spices and then how to assimilate the dish during cooking. The class size is small (there were 10 in our class) so she is back & forth making sure you are doing things properly. After preparing each dish, then you eat it before moving on to the next one. Each dish was great! I'm not huge fan of curry but both were good & my husband declares the Panang the best he has ever had!Chef Lee was also willing to answer any questions about Thai cooking in general & about some of the ingredients that most Americans may neer have seen before.Totally worth the money. In the US you would pay more for all of these dishes in a restaurant than we spent on the cost of the class.

A real cooking school. Unlike the cursory schools that you find at high end hotels, this was the real deal. You are taught about the ingredients, how and why you prepare the ingredients, and how and why you cook the ingredients to make some delicious dishes. The chef was entertaining, informative, and thoughtful. It was over four hours, but you wish it wouldn't end. The insights into cooking Thai style food was interesting and helpful. I would highly recommend this school to others.

Fruit carving class. I came in for a 5 day carving class hoping to learn the bare basics behind the craft. I walked out being able to re-create and create anything I could think of! Out of the 6 months I spent in Asia this time her class is by far one of the best experiences I've had. I can never thank her enough. Plus chef lee is such an interesting person if you want to get to l ow her.

Most fun you will have in Bangkok!!!!!!!!!. My parents were really keen on going so I agreed. I was worried that it was going to be stressful and hard to keep up. But it turned out to be so much fun! While it was very relaxed and casual, it was also very proffessionally organised. Chef Lee was very nice and we always knew what we were doing. Even when we made obvious mistakes she made no big deal out of them. But what is also great, is the food you cook is delicious. It's absolutely the best Thai food I've ever had. Even if the food wasn't all that good I still would've had a fun time making it. But the food was really amazing. Chef Lee is very experienced and has many great and interesting tips. Anyone can do the class because it's easy and Chef Lee explains everything to you with great clarity.

Beware of the neighbooring cooking school trying to snatch Chef Lee's students!!!!!!. Chef Lee has sunshine radiating from within and you can tell she loves what she does. She has alot of spunk and is quite the funny little lady. What's not to love? Perhaps her food competes with the spotlight :-) The food is simple, wonderful, and fresh. She has a no fuss approach to Thai cooking.Their next door neighboors, Maikaidee Cooking School (or something of the sort) has someone standing outside of their shop trying to hoax (quite aggresively) customers into their school as opposed to Chef Lee's which is literally a meter away on the same pavement. Not cool. Beware. I'm not saying that they aren't a good cooking school, they might be, but I want sunshine, not bony fingers!

Excellent day, excellent teacher. Loved today.. Had an absolutely great 4 hour class. The food we made was from scratch, we were taught how to make everything including the pastes. Great teacher, small class sizes and incredible food. Cannot recommend highly enough. Would love to go back next time in in Bangkok . Thank you.

If you only have time for one cooking class.... ... this is where you should spend your time. I have been to quite a number of cooking classes, and Chef Lee is the most patient and knowledgeable. Her smile lights up the space as she chatters through recipes, family stories and anecdotes. Come here to learn and taste some of the best Thai food Bangkok has to offer (only because you cook them all yourself!), and leave with your tummy full and a warm fuzzy feeling that lasts your whole trip.

Thank You Chef Lee & Staff of " (Ma-Sa-Man) Thai Cooking School"...You are the BEST!!!. With Chef Lee around...learning how to cook Thai dishes has never been easier. She is an amazing teacher and her cooking lessons are fun & well-paced. My lesson on the 11th of December started off with a trip to the local wet market and it was an eye-opener for me! Thereafter, I learnt to cook 5 Thai dishes (Tom Yum Soup, Pad Thai, Green Curry, Green Papaya Salad & Mango Sticky Rice). Trust me...the dishes you prepare is comparable if not better than those that you find in the restaurants :). I strongly recommend (Ma-Sa-Man) Thai Cooking School to everyone! =)

Excellent staff, and Lee is the happiest person. Her smile said it all.... my daughters and I have been taking cooking classes in every Country we go... And so far Lee has been the best one, she and her staff make the class interesting, we laughed, we cooked good food, and we ended up staying longer because my teenager daughters wanted to learn more dishes and Lee was happy to teach them, with no extra cost. I highly recommended this class. It is well worth it and not expensive, compared to others. Thanks Lee for this opportunity to learn to cook Thai food.

Easy and fun Thai Cooking!. Loved the half day cooking class. We visited the local market to shop for our ingredients after discussing with the 2 other attendees. The dishes were easy to prepare and Chef Lee was patient in explaining all the ingredients and also teaching us how to differentiate between different spices. I happened to ask Chef Lee about preparing Lemongrass tea and she readily asked her assistant to show me how to make it even though it was not in the menu! I will sign up again if I visit Bangkok again to learn other dishes.

Interesting and fun. Simply love Thai cusine. We learnt to cook 5 dishes and Chef Lee even showed me how to make lemongrass tea with honey. Every dish tasted like its from some good restaurant. I already tried out the Mango Sticky Rice recipe the moment I got back home! Will definitely make the school a stop the next time I visit Bangkok!

A fabulous experience! Chef Lee was the best!. Just back from the best four hours in Bangkok, learning about the Thai food ingredients and cooking five different dishes. The day starts with a trip to a local market with Chef Lee to choose the fresh ingredients and then back to the school to prepare the food. Would recommend this to anyone visiting Bangkok. By the way , Bangkok is dry - the river level is higher than usual but all the streets and pavements are dry.

What better souvenir can you get for yourself then these wonderful Thai recipes!. Chef Lee first greets you and then asks you what Thai foods you like. Mango rice, Pad Thai, tom yum, pineapple fried rice....you name it. Then, you go to the market with her and gets all the ingredients for making those fabulous dishes. We head to her kitchen and she cooks one-on-one with you teaching you how to make Thai food, but more precious, she shares with you a bit of Thai culture. Afterward cooking, you enjoy your dinner. What better souvenir can you get for yourself then these wonderful Thai recipes!

Awesome one-on-one half-day adventure. I showed up to this place a day or two before heading back to Canada and I'm damn glad I did. I got one-on-one attention for a solid few hours. My lesson included a shopping trip with lots of info to take home with me, a visit to the local wat (at my request) and more than the promised number of recipes (I forget how many, by this point.Highly recommended! :)

Cheaper than a meal at a restaurant!. Chef Lee taught me and my friend how to make several dishes very well.. Unfortunately we were a bit late and another couple came even later so we were a bit rushed. Overall it was a great way to waste a day .. by the end of it we were absolutely stuffffed... The food was great.. I just did a 30 minutes aerobics class to try and work off some of it...(You learn about 5 meals, which is a lot to eat in 4 hours)

The best souvenir you can get yourself in Thailand!. Chef Lee first greets you and then asks you what Thai foods you like. Then, you go to the market with her and gets all the ingredients for making those fabulous dishes. We head to her kitchen and she cooks one-on-one with you, teaching you how to make Thai food, but more precious, she shares with you a bit of Thai culture. Afterward cooking, you enjoy your dinner. What better souvenir can you get for yourself then these wonderful Thai recipes!

Great cookingschool, chef Lee is Fantastic!!!!. Went to this cooking school two times. In september 2011 and in October 2011. Very good way to learn more of thai cooking, in a very relaxed way. Chef Lee is a lovely lady, with very good skills to teach and to cook. When I go back to Bangkok I would go back for sure.I hope for them the flooding didn't came to bad.

Great Day - Learn't a Lot. I went with my daughter and we both enjoyed the day very much. The people were very friendly and made us laugh. They were totally organised and efficient. The trip to the local market was interesting and a valuable part of the experience. Now I have to buy my daughter a mortar and pestle because she loved the chilli paste so much. Thanks for a great experience
Great introduction to Thai cuisine. Had a really enjoyable day with Ma-Sa-Man’s Thai Cooking School BKK. Thank you Chef Lee!

Brilliant introduction to Thai cooking. This class was a brilliant introduction to Thai cooking. We made a few different dishes and were taught step by step how to make them from scratch, and learnt all about the different ingredients as we went along. Chef Lee and the staff were happy to answer all our questions constantly and go over things as many times as necessary. We really enjoyed our class and we learnt a lot about Thai food. Happy to recommend!

Amazing Chef and Staff. It is a must do!!!. HeyI went here with 6 friends and had an amazing experience. Chef Lee was outstanding, England was perfect and she made the whole day interesting. The whole class ran so well and was very fun. The staff here are so helpful and want you to have the best experience. You feel very at home and comfortable in this great atmosphere. We could pick what we wanted to cook which was hard as they offer over 60 dishes!! We got to eat EVERYTHING that we cooked and certainly didn't need any more food that day. It felt like I was getting great value for money and definitely doing something cultural. This place is located very close to the famous Kho San Road, making it easy walking distance. Thanks you so much guys, I will see you again I'm sure! Chris

Fantastic introduction to Thai cooking. My friend and I did the 10am Thai Style Cooking session with Chef Lee. We both had a really fun time but also informative. I found the visit to the market fascinating and Chef Lee was always keen to point out the different types of Thai vegetables etc. The cooking class itself was great. We got the chance to ask as many questions as needed and were shown step by step how to create the different meals. I will definitely be trying them out again when I get home along with the other recipes that the are on the website. Would definately recommend this to others.

Our Best Experience In Bangkok!!. Chef Lee is a great teacher, and passionate about cooking. Her staff is great also. We did the cooking class the first day, and had so much fun. We came back for more the second day. My wife liked the Intro to Carving, so she decided to do the carving class. I wanted to learn to cook more Thai dishes, so I did two days of cooking. The main reason why we chose this school from many others is the fact that you choose the dishes you want to learn to cook from their extensive menu. Go there hungry, because you cook a lot of 5 star quality food.

Chef Lee is a little superstar!!... I was traveling in Bangkok on my own and wanted to do something cultural which allowed me to meet new people.The cooking class with Chef Lee was fantastic. There were only two of us in the glass (we became great friends and ended up spending time together after the class!).The class started with a visit to a local market where chef lee explained the produce and made her purchases. The food we cooked was the best food in Thaliand. The papaya salad and pad thai was amazing.. its my first day back at home today and i have bought the ingrediants so i can follow the recepie again this evening.I looked at lots of other cooking classes in Bangkok and i am delighted i chose Chef Lee.BOOK IT NOW!..

A fun and worthwhile experience. Spend your time with a master chef.. I had never done a cooking class before. I love to cook but I have so many food sensitivities that many chefs cannot or won't accommodate my needs (for example, I cannot eat wheat, corn, soy, sugar, vinegar, chicken eggs, brocolli, mushrooms, rosemary, peanuts, cashews, etc etc).Chef Lee was wonderful. She taught me how to cook 6 Thai dishes without using any ingredients I am allergic to. And the food was delicious. My two friends have no allergies, and she managed us using different ingredients to make the same dishes, teaching us and helping us to make delicious food. She is a great lady and lots of fun to be with. I highly recommend her courses.

An authentic and remarkably cheap cooking education. I've literally just walked through the door home having spent the last five or so hours at the Ma-sa-man Thai Cooking School (www.thaicookingschoolbkk.com). Simply put, it has been one of the most enjoyable and affordable things I have ever done in this city. As a thai boxer I come to Thailand, especially Bangkok, on a regular basis, and had never got round to learning to cook the cuisine I so enjoy and miss back at home. Suffice to say look no further, O anonymous reader. If you're after a small class-based lesson in tantalizing thai tastes, this place is for you.Located in Ban Lum Phu on Sam Sen Soi 1 (easy to find by cab), the school is situated in a rather small but perfectly practical room lined by preparation tables and gas burners for cooking. You choose five of a list of possibly hundreds of different recipes; the more popular ones are highlighted. With a quick trip to the market to grab fresh ingredients, my day began with cooking Tom Yung Gung (Spicy and sour prawn soup), both the coconutty and the clear brothed manifestations. Chef lee is a wonderful teacher who is both patient and eminently knowledgeable. In excellent English she highlighted the differences between the street foods and those in the restaurant, as well as the differing preparation methods that us farang are often subject to in contrast to the more traditional thai ways. Naturally, following the preparation of each dish, it is promptly consumed with adequate photo opportunities. We then cooked up my favourite thai dish, Som Tam Ma La O (Spicy green papaya salad), a recipe I've been yearning to learn since first coming to this country. After making both a paste of both Red Curry (Nam Phrik Gang Phet) and Panang Curry (which uses a similar base, just with peanuts and tamarind and no eggplant) we cooked up the respective meals and ate those too. I might suggest a light breakfast is in order before coming here because most of the day is spent consuming the hard earned fruits of your labour. One Phat Thai Saig Gai/Gung (Fried thai noodles with chicken/prawns) later and a Plah Rad Phrik (fried fish with chilli sauce) to accompany, I was literally bursting at the seams. So much for the month's worth of Muay Thai and all that weight loss! To finish we made my preferred Thai dessert, Kow Neeow Ma-Muang (Coconut sticky rice with mango), thereby bringing what was a thoroughly enjoyable day to a belly-heavy end. To make things even better for the inordinately cheap 1000b cost, you receive a printout of all of the recipes cooked that day, and you're given access to the website which has all of the others.Insofar as group size goes, there was just myself and an exceptionally friendly German chap who'd spent even more time than I have in Nepal. I've heard that the class does get busy but I called desperately the night before and was able to secure a place.Chef lee is a delightful woman who knows just about all there is to know on the subject of thai cuisine. She answers every question fired at her with ease, and, as the co-owner put it, 'puts her heart and soul in every dish', Whilst not the most glitteringly new or sparklingly clean kitchen (excepting the utensils and cookingware, which was immaculate and received top marks for hygiene), you get an intimate and shockingly cheap panoramic of thai food. So see you next year when I'm back again, Mrs Lee!

Chef Lee ROCKS!! A must do if you love Thai food.... I give Chef Lee my highest recommendation. She is a professional and a true delight to work from. So generous with her time and she shared a number of helpful tips and substitutions. I also highly recommend her fruit and vegetable carving class- my friends and family are thoroughly impressed. I feel incredibly lucky to have found her. You will get your money's worth. A real sweetheart and so encouraging:-)

I didn't know I could cook like that!. What a great experience. Ms. Lee was a patient and caring teacher. Jason made the visit easy to schedule and his taxi directions were simple and effective. We are both very interested in food, particularly Asian food, and Thai is tops on the list. I have often enjoyed Thai food but imagined that its preparation would be extremely difficult and complicated. We started off with a very eye-opening visit to the market where we bought the ingredients we would need. Ms. Lee showed us what to look for, explaining substitutes for ingredients that we might not get back home in Vancouver, Canada. We prepared a green curry, green papaya salad, pad thai, tom yum goong, and a mango sticky rice desert. All from scratch, and the result was extremely surprising. Absolutely excellent. We can hardly wait to try out our new skills back home. We heartily recommend this experience to anyone who loves Thai food. It was the best part of our 5 day Bangkok trip.

very friendly and relaxed class. This was definitely one of the highlights of my trip, and i will certainly be going back. Chef lee was a great teacher and enthusiastic to make sure all of us enjoyed our time there. she not only taught us recipes and techniques but took us to a local market to show us what to look for when buying ingredients, and answered any questions we had on all aspects of thai cookery. I have tried to cook thai food form recipes before with varying degrees of success, but this was a much more enjoyable way to learn, and we got a good meal at the end! A perfect way to spend a day whatever your skill level, and a good way to meet other people traveling to thailand. we were also given copies of all the recipes we learned so had a good souvenir to take home.

Awesome experience! Very friendly people. I did a cooking course here today with some friends. It was great. The owner (Thai) and her husband (Canadian) are very friendly (like you hardly see in bkk anymore). And the food is just amazing. I never cooked something this good. To be short: On a walk-distance from Kao San Road, this place should be on your to-do list!

Loved it! Delicious food and great teaching.. Had a few days in Bangkok to spare and found a flyer for Ma-Sa-Man Cooking School. I live in Cambodia and love SE Asian food but have never seriously tried cooking it (to my embarrassment).Chef Lee has a lovely manner and is totally committed to making the experience suit the client, she patiently answers questions, paces the lesson to suit you, makes sure you do the work (nothing like experiential learning) and shares lots of tricks and hints ... which I unfortunately didn't write down. I have a couple of would-be chefs in the family so was keen to see how sophisticated (or not) her approach was and was pleasantly surprised. My favorite bit was learning how to scrape out prawn (shrimp) brains and guts out of the heads to make a type of shrimp paste.The premises are not flash but the quality of instruction is excellent. The market trip was great and I got to ask about all the weird things I've never had the chance to ask a fluent english speaking foodie before. The Tom Yum soup and Phad Thai were very good but the Green Curry was incredible!!! Stunning. And the mango sticky rice ... what can I say? Chef Lee then carefully packaged up a doggie bag so I could take home what I couldn't eat there. Thank you!

Great Cooking Experience - Local Chef. We visited the cooking school on our second to last day in Bangkok and we were very impressed with Chef Lee. You get to pick your own menu (we didn't want Tom Yum, and we substituted it for other noodles, and we added Papaya salad) and then you go shopping at the local market to buy the food. Chef Lee even helped us find some great cooking equipment that we (tourists) were having hard tome finding at the markets and negotiated the price lower for us. She was really great at making sure we had an A+ day. She allowed us to take pictures and was very thoughtful and would answer any question you have. This is not a tourist show and dance but rather serious cooking, and serious recipes.The food was delicious and we have some great new techniques in cooking Thai food learned from a locally trained chef. Overall, I would rate this as a great experience and will go back next time we are in Bangkok.

my last day in Bangkok !. It was my last day in Bangkok and was very sad about it ! No special program. I just wanted one last bit of pineapple, of mixed fruit juice, of tom yum ... before flying back home ! I was lazily strolling when I was distracted by the add on the door : thai cooking lessons. I came in and immediately registered for the afternoon lesson. Good explanations, market shopping, which is very useful to figure out what vegetable or spice ... to choose, and then cooking, smelling, touching, tasting, and in the end savouring ! Hmmm, it's soooooooooooo good ! And so easy to cook when you know what to do ! Cool and clean environment, nice professional English speaking cook ... what else do you wish ? Go, enjoy ! Gaëlle from France.

A wicked 'eye-opening' Thai cooking experience!!!. One-on-one or in a group Chef Lee is an amazing instructor as well as a expert gourmet cook. Her insight to Thai cuisine opened my eyes to a whole new taste 'palette'. She was really patient with my limited cooking ability. We had lots of laughs. Its the best 4 hours I spent in the Khao San /Sam Sen Road area. I would highly recommend her cooking school.KC from Canada

Its was wonderful learn to cook thai food with Chef Lee. I was in Bangkok last year and i have a wonderful experience cooking with Chef Lee. Delicious, easy and the funniest way to learn thai food. In one day you can do 5 dishes and if u book in advance you can select the ones you want to cook.Chef Lee is an enthusiastic, energetic an a profesional chef.Luis

Fantastic - Just book it. I cannot praise The Blue Elephant Cooking School enough for their fantastic cooking class!The staff were very knowledgeable and so happy to answer any and all questions from the group. Our Chef, Nice, was an excellent tour guide throughout the market trip and went to great efforts to make sure everyone was comfortable and happy on the excursion. The cooking demonstration and practical elements were very well Organised and the whole half day ran very smoothly. We loved that you could try the food cooked by the Instructors during the demonstration before you began the cooking yourself. The only downside is having to wait until the end to try your dishes!

Authentic Thai. Set in what was an old Indian department store this restaurant is a gem. Food and service is outstanding in a lovely ambience. Our guide told us to order food 'cooked the Thai way' and it did not disappoint. Booking is essential, a little pricey but worth it.

Half day experience in Blue Elephant Cooking School. Great experience for learning cooking Thai food there. One of their staff brought us to the market and he was polite and nice! For the cooking school, the place was clean, the instructor was nice and willing teach us everything, clearly explain how to make the dishes and we experienced atmosphere which full of joy and fun during the time.
Great cooking class . Well organised and instructors are nice. Had chance to see and chat with the creator which was a nice extra . And of course food was yummy !!

Authentic taste and fun classes. I'm Thai and I took a class with Chef Non and I found that the dishes I took taste very original. If you're looking for a cooking school with real taste of Thai food, this is the place. Chef Non had a very fun and educational class. He allow us to learn by doing with all the teachers assist us while we're cooking without interupting our practice.

Most Amazing Experiance!. We just completed our Morning Cooking Class at the Blue Elephant Cooking School in Bangkok. I must say this was the MOST AMAZING EXPERIANCE. We have traveled all over the world and the people of Thailand have been so kind and welcoming. Chef Nooror and her Daughter Chef Sandra are so kind and have created such a beautiful experience. I must say I have never cooked Thai food before and I now feel that once I return home I will be able to cook what they tought us. I am excited to return home and have a Thai Dinner Party. The format of the program was perfect. They explained to us each of the different spices (and also alternatives if we can't find them back home). I would highly recommend taking a class. The Cooking School is located on the 3rd floor of their historic Old Thai Building. An amazing piece of Architecture & History. Not only was it about cooking but it was also an experience of kindness and hospitality of Thailand. Great Job. Steve & Ryan

unique and special experience. my husband and i signed up for the afternoon cooking class. our instructor, mr nice, was fantastic. it was just my husband and myself so we got an up close look at the demonstration and great supervision while we worked on the recipes. i don't know how it usually goes, but when we finished cooking, we had our meal privately in the beautiful dining room downstairs and got a bottle of wine with our late lunch. it was such a special experience and made our honeymoon even more magical. as we left they even gave me orchids to take home. like i said, i'm not sure if that's how it goes for every guest, but it felt so special and unique to us.

Not bad not great. Just ok. . I will start this review by stating that we've been to many cooking schools around the world so admittedly we have high standards and expectations. The pluses of Blue Elephant:Easy to get to location by BRT (city Train)Friendly Staff (especially Chef Nun)Facilities are pretty goodBuilding itself is historic and nice to seeSome tips:Take water with you before you go to the market...especially if in the summer, it is super hot.We were told the class ended at 1, reality is it did not end until 2:00 and then we sat down to eat so we didn't actually get out of there until 2:20. The format of the class is they do a demonstration, then you go in and cook the dish, then back to the classroom for the next demonstration and then back to cook the dish...you do this for 4 dishes so it gets a bit long....it's about 1 dish too longBy the time you sit down to eat your dishes, some of the dishes were made over 2 hours ago so they are dried out and frankly not so great after sitting so longLastly, when you sit down for your lunch they will offer you wine or soft drinks...you are under the impression it is included and then you get a bill for your drinks. Since we passed on the wine, we were offered mango juice of which we agreed to. Then as we were leaving we were given a bill for an unreasonable amount. We politely mentioned that we were not told we had to pay for the drinks and it was very misleading how the drinks were offered....bait and switch...the girls at the desk had likely heard this before and quickly agreed we did not have to pay.

Good food but spendy. The food and restaurant are lovely but you will pay for it. We were tired after a long day in Bangkok and thought we would treat ourselves to good food with the ease of being located next to our hotel. The only downside is the price. For Thailand standards this is spendy. We found some of our best meals to be the cheapest. Don't let price fool you. If you want porcelain table setting and fancy atmosphere, then go here. You don't have to eat street food but this is the extreme in the other direction.

Amazing Thai cooking . We had an amazing time during this cooking class. It was professional, friendly, organized, thorough? very clean and the food we made was DELICIOUS!!!! The chef was very informative and she had a very pleasant personality making the experience fun! We loved it and have been to many cooking around the world and would recommend this for anyone :)

Cooking School But Not Wirth the Price. This is the second cooking school I attended in Bangkok.Conveniently located, next to BatS station.We spent an hour including by BTS back and forth to the school and visited the market and ate. Yes, more than 15 minutes in food stand.Four dishes were taught but all cooking practices were in a rush. No enjoyment.Some students were given BTS tickets while the others (like us) who have Rabbit card have to pay our own fare. I don't see see the students paid back the money nor we were reimbursed. So is BTS fare included in the tuition fee or not?No much food ingredients in each dish. For example, Tom Yum Gong has no tomato no mushroom. The main thing they used are just spice.The class fee is not cheap. Because an apron, a pack of Blue Elephant curry, a tote bag and a folder is given.Don't recommend this cooking school.• the chef who took us to the market talked dirty jokes.

Happy Wife. Purchased a morning cooking class for my wife while visiting Bangkok. Excellent student to teacher ratio of 4:1. Well appointed teaching kitchen & knowledgeable instructor. Location is readily accessible from the BTS. While I am sure that dining at the Blue Elephant can be expensive the cooking lesson was reasonable priced and good value for the money. Only disappointing aspect was the rather poor interpersonal skills of the gift shop staff member. Would have purchased more product from the shop as gifts but was put off by the poor interpersonal skills & service.

Amazing experience!. Me and my parents were very interested in doing a Thai cooking course on our vacation in Bangkok, and after a lot of research on my part we decided on the Blue Elephant. We had an amazing time, the course was very elaborate. There was a trip to the market with one of the cooks (nick)named Smile, where we got a lot of information about ingredients. We learned to make four different dishes, first by a demonstration and tasting in a classroom and then we got to cook ourselves. The facilities were great, the cooks all very friendly and the food delicious. We got some freedom to make the dishes our own, but the cooks were always available to answer questions and help us. I would definitely do it again!

Delicious, fun experience!. My boyfriend and I did a morning, half-day cooking class at the Blue Elephant. It ended up being us and one other student, so it was basically private! We started the day with a visit to the market to learn about the foods, how to pick fresh ingredients, and learn about the culture of shopping at the market. We loved this part! Next we sat down in their lovely classroom for some instruction on how to make the first course, followed by actually making it! We did this for four courses: crispy thai prawn cakes with pineapple sauce, pad thai with shrimp, ancient beef soup and yellow chicken curry. All four were incredibly tasty! The space is beautiful and the instructors were energetic, helpful and knowledgable and accommodating. At the end, we sat down in a gorgeous, private dining room to enjoy the meals that we had cooked! Bonuses were getting to take home leftovers, a beautiful apron, certificate of completion, recipes and Blue Elephant tote bags with curry kits to make at home. I'd recommend this class!

Husband cooked. Friends suggested this place for my husband to attend 1/2 day class. We booked at the last minute and it was a great experience. I was able to attend as a guest to have lunch with the students and this was all inclusive in the price we paid for the class. You must ask when you book if you like to bring your partner so that they can set up the table.Very nice location. My husband loved the class and the gifts given to him and I got to eat amazing food.

Restaurant quality food made by ME. This half day cooking class was professional and well organised right from easy telephone booking and welcome cool drink and registration on arrival on the day. We did the morning class and I appreciated the market walk learning how to pick fresh ingredients and discovering the produce that I didn't recognise (very useful as a new expat local). We made 4 dishes (their website tells you what is made each session so you can pick the session which best suits you if you are fussy and have the time). We received the recipes to make notes on. Each dish was prepared in front of us with plenty of tips on cooking technique and variations. We then sampled before cooking our own dish at our individual work station. Everything was set up for us and cleaned up afterwards so our time was spent on cooking. The results were delicious. It was a pleasure to sit in the restaurant at the end of class and eat the four course meal I had prepared. There was far too much to eat and so staff happily packaged left overs to take home. The apron and recipes we received will be a happy reminder of a great morning.Absolutely worth it!

Great restaurant!. We have been to the Blue Elephant several times now and each time has been a delight. Great atmosphere, outstanding high end Thai cuisine and themes. The service is very friendly, efficient, and helpful. A great place to dine!

AUTHENTIC THAI CUISINE in this THAI OLD HOUSE. Started with the Reservation on the Restaurant Web-Site and requested for the response for Confirmation, but nothing. Called in the day before and made the New Reservation, Good thing I did. The Reception at the Front Desk acknowledged the Reservation that we did by Phone !The Waiter is speaking with us in English because our guests are Asian-Americans. So, I don’t have to do all the translation! We ordered different soup for each of us, so we can try the different kind! They brought in the Complimentary Appetizers to have we adjust our Pallet for the Thai Food? For the 5 Entre’ that we will be sharing among 4 of us and with the Rice cooked in the Coconut and/or the Thai Noodle, were served all together at once like the traditional Thai Style! They are all prepared and cooked with the Highest Grade/Standard Ingredients that including the Thai Herbal, Spices which the Waiter has mentioned to us that all the Curry Paste are Home Made with the Fresh Ingredient daily! Every dish are well Balance in the Tastes, Ingredients, Textures, Presentations, with the Utmost Respect in the Authentic Thai Cooking which they are not regular and/or like the Thai Street Cooking as you normally see. Then come the Desserts which they offer both Original Thai Desserts, Fresh Fruit and/or the Westernized Desserts to your liking but with Thai Fairs. Also, a small gesture of Thai Dessert Complimentary Plate! On the way out, the ladies are offered the Orchid Flowers, nice touch!VERY VERY GOOD EXPERIENCES, GOOD FOODS, GOOD SERVICES, NICE SETTING IN THE THAI CLASSIC OLD HOUSE !

Learning from the best. I attended the half day cooking class last Saturday with my niece. It was great fun to go the local market with Chef Nice who showed us how to pick fresh produce by looking for certain signs. He was friendly and also provided local information about the market. After a fun hour going through the market, with ice coffee in hand, buying longans and mangoes, we went back to the cooking school to start our lessons.We were privileged that morning as Madame Nooror, founding partner and executive chef of Blue Elephant taught us how to make curry paste for the first dish that we are learning that day. She was knowledgeable about the herbs and spices used and told us interesting bits and pieces about the herbs and also what we could use in replacement if we could not find the ingredient in our respective home countries. Chef Chay continued with the next three dishes and it was demonstration followed by practice with us all having our own dishes for lunch at the end of the class. The dishes were nicely laid out in the dinning room and we could invite a friend or family member come join us too. All in all, a morning well spent and lots of fun!

Interesting and fun!. I took a morning class to include a visit to a small local market. You can take classes on different days of the week to prepare different menus.Every dish is first demonstrated in the classroom kitchen by a chef and you can follow along in your recipe sheets.Then you go to your personal cooking station and prepare the dish with the help of assistant chefs.After four menu items you are hungry and you can enjoy your own prepared dishes!The people were very friendly and helpful. I learned about the ingredients and the many techniques used in the Thai kitchen. It was also fun to talk to fellow students from all over the world.

In and out in 90 minutes . We chose the Blue Elephant at a significant premium over other schools assuming we would get a really high quality product. Unfortunately our greeting (or lack thereof) set the tone for the very short experience. Upon arrival on the third floor, there was no smiling Thai welcome, just 'what reservation number' and secondly 'you pay cash or credit'. We were swiftly taken to the kitchen where we stood there until we were directed to start cooking. As far as the form to fill out upon arrival I don't understand why they need to know your hotel and room number as well as your birthdate. We left those blank. There was no 'fresh Thai herbal drink' welcome, nor a theory lesson on cooking as described in the program description. We weren't even offered to wash our hands before starting. We seemed like an inconvenience in their day. The chef was nice but didn't really seem interested in getting to know us. One of the helpers was very friendly and cracked jokes with us. The cooking was very much 'watch and repeat'. We cooked the dishes and then ate our food in the restaurant. The entire experience took 75-85 minutes and we were done at 2.30pm. Not quite a half day experience. The food was tasty. It felt very much like they were just going through the motions. There was no passion, no interest in us. We stood there awkwardly as there was not much conversation or critique beyond the helper's interaction.This was very disappointing and they did not offer what their description was, and the certificate we received for a half day cooking course... was somewhat ironic.This was an overpriced, over rehearsed production. At least we got pretty fancy aprons though.

Lots of fun. The class begins with a trip to a market one stop away on the BTS during rush hour, which means cramming 10 people plus the guide into the train. Once at the market, which was in a sort of open air warehouse off an alley, we were told that in order to get the quality ingredients they had already been early in the morning (like 5am) and that everything left was not that good of quality. We still got to see the curry paste purveyor, vegetable seller and packaged goods (soy sauce, fish sauce, cooking oil, etc.) shop and taught how to pick out ingredients. Along the way through the market we also got some Thai iced coffee and iced tea. Once we got back to the school, we went to the demonstration kitchen where one of the chefs showed us how to make a dish and then we went across the hall to do it ourselves where the guide from the market visit was in charge. In this setup was the only problem with the class. The chef in the demonstration kitchen was modifying the printed recipe by changing the order that things were done and for how long and there seemed to be no communication between the two chefs that the recipes were modified. So the chef in the working kitchen would come by and dump some ingredient in your dish that according to what as done in demonstration should have had several steps done before it went in.The course is really geared towards being able to cook the dishes at home later and the chefs were really great about discussing alternate ingredients to use for things that may not be available at home. The food was delicious and the recipes did not require much technique to execute, mostly just knowing what ingredients to use and how to use them.

Impeccable facility and a great cooking experience. Attended the cooking school with two other friends. Our class was for half a day including a visit to the markets.After the visit to the market the class began at the Blue Elephant restaurant. The facilities were very good which enhanced our experience there. The approach of the classes is to demonstrate the making of the food while the students sit in a set of chairs. It is much like a class room where you have a video camera to give you a closer look at what's going on and a mirror above the kitchen for another angle of how the chef is preparing the food. Once the lesson is finished we all hit the main kitchen and do it ourselves. We cooked a number of dishes which provide various approaches to cooking Thai food. There were two chefs helping throughout the class. We really recommend taking a cooking class here given our experience!

My second time attending. As always it was a morning well spent. Picked up much more on this visit. The school is well laid out. All aspects were well polished. The meals prepared excellent. All dishes I had not previously learned. Highly recommended

Amazing Cooking Experience in Bangkok. When my family came to Thailand it was high on our list to go to a cooking school. I found the Blue Elephant and this was a wonderful hands-on cooking experience. They first demonstrate the technique and then you have your own cooking station and do it yourself. You make an entire 4 course meal and then when ready you get to dine and eat it in their wonderful restaurant. The building has incredible architecture since it was originally the first post office in Thailand. They have preserved it and turned it into a wonderful dining restaurant and cooking school. I couldn't believe how good the food was and that I cooked it. I have brought some of their packaged items to bring the experience home.

Learn to make elegant Thai dishes with an expert. My husband and I took their morning course and loved it. It is more expensive than most (about $120) but is in a beautiful facility and was fun and comprehensive. Also very each to get to - you can see the building from the nearby BTS Station. We visited a local market first with the chef (which was not very interesting, having seen many produce and meat markets already), and once we got back to the classroom, spent the next 2 hours watching the chef prepare 4 complex and very different dishes, then moving to the practice kitchen and making the dishes ourselves after each demonstration. The staff watched over us and gave up tips as we worked (grate a little more ginger, add a little more fish sauce, keep stirring, etc.) and each of our dishes came out individualized as we were in control of how much ingredient we added. After we made each dish, they were numbered and put aside so that at the end, a banquet table was set up with each participant's own creations, and the class ate together in the beautiful restaurant downstairs. It was a huge amount of food - way too much to finish. At the end each person got a tote bag (poor quality- mine fell apart in days) with a box of spices, a souvenir apron, a Certificate and copies of each recipe. We will definitely be able to re-create the recipes based on this course and really enjoyed it.

A lot of fun - great corporate event!. My team was visiting Bangkok and working with the leadership team of a corporation in Thailand. One evening, they took us to the Blue Elephant cooking school and we learned how to make Green Curry Paste, Green Curry Chicken and a delicious Prawn recipe. It was a lot of fun and we actually got to eat our own food which turned out palatable! Afterward, we were treated to a lovely meal at the restaurant and that was delicious.

Perfect place to learn Thai cooking. This was my sixth time to attend cooking class at Blue Elephant Cooking School. I took the vegetarian course in Dec 2015. I was so lucky! ! ! I was under the supervision of Ms Sandra, the daughter of Khun Nooror Somany Steppe!. She is fabulous! I've learnt quite a lot from her. I can cook the same taste after returning to my home. I am sure I will go back again to learn more. All teachers there teach students wholeheartedly.

Highly Recommended Cooking Class - 5 Stars. I was enrolled in the 6 Day Chef Course. From a thorough agenda that covers Appetizers, Entrees and Desserts, to the excellent instruction provided by the Chefs, a well equipped professional Kitchen to learn in, to the excellent dining experience in the restaurant, to the tour of the Food Service manufacturing Facility, to observing the passion and care Chef Noor and her Team bring to the Class Room, I highly recommend this course to any Chef or Foodie wanting to learn authentic Thai cuisine. Many Thanks to Chef Tony, Nam, Lui, Baht, and Nui for their guidance and instruction. A special Thank You to Mayurin for being a gracious host and making me feel at home.

Unexpectedly fun. This would be a 5star rating but they started off so slowly and with confusion about bookings etc. Once en route to the market by way of skytrain, it was fun (we were happy to explore by skytrain, but it did eat up some time). The market has nothing to do with the food you will be cooking there later nor with where they procure their provisions - it is essentially just for sightseeing. Back at the school, it became a well-oiled process and fast: the cooking teacher was very proficient, overhead screens were helpful, our cooking stations were always ready with everything pre-measured and chopped. Ended up learning a lot and eating well.

Lovely dinner with impeccable service!. For our last night in Bangkok, my sister and I enjoyed a lovely meal at the restaurant. The food was wonderfully presented, delicious and authentic (adjusted for western palates as requested!). We were never rushed, the attendant took the time to explain the dishes, make recommendations and adjustments for my vegetarian companion. The manager was diligent in welcoming the patrons and making everyone feel at home; one really gets the sense everyone is proud of the restaurant and they really want everyone to have a great experience - and we did. The vegetarian tasting menu is delicious and expansive; also recommend the Betel leaf wraps and that evening the wild fresh red snapper filet was delicious! I know there are thousands of options for dinner in this incredible city, but I can heartily recommend that one will have a lovely dining experience at the Blue Elephant.

Learn to cook like a local. I’d spent a day and a half with a private tour guide seeing the sights and riding the rides and wanted to do something different. I do a lot of cooking at home (by no means am I a chef or a foodie.. I just like to eat good food) so I asked my guide if he knew of any cooking schools. He recommended the Blue Elephant. I came to find out that this company is relatively famous with restaurants and schools in a half dozen cities around the world. Here is the basic setup: there were about a dozen “students” (6 Tawainese women, a Korean guy, 3 from Finland, a Columbian, and me (American). We sat in little desks like I used to sit in grammar school facing the chef and his kitchen. The kitchen was setup like you see them in cooking shows with a mirror above the work surface so you could see his hands and the ingredients as well as seeing all the action on a large screen TV that was off to the side. The Chef introduced some basic Thai ingredients and tools. Then he proceeded to make a curry. We watched for about 5 minutes while he worked. At the end of this session we all got up and went across the hall where each of us had our own workstation including the ingredients, utensils, pans, stove, etc to make the curry. Once the curry was made we went back to the classroom and he showed us how to make a green papaya salad. Then back across the hall to make the salad, then back and forth 3 more times making 3 more dishes. Once the session with the chef was complete we all went downstairs to their restaurant where a table had been set for us complete with all of the food that each of us had made (to be clear, they had each of the dishes labeled so I was eating the ones that I made).I think all in all I was there for 3.5 hours. I don’t remember the cost but I remember thinking it was very reasonable (less than $100USD I’m sure). Once you’re done doing the typical touristy things in Bangkok I’d highly recommend doing this.
Must do if you like cooking!. yuki and i are big foodie, we loved it. what we cooked was great lunch and the teacher are very nice and environment . perfect. Must do for cooking lovers

A must do if you love cooking. This is one of the most amazing things I have done in Bangkok and highly recommend as a 'must do'!!! I did the morning class where the chefs take you to the markets and show you different produce they use and why afterwards we went back to the school and watched each dish being prepared and cooked would try it then go and cook it ourselves with the choice of eating it there in the restaurant or takeaway! You get a certificate, apron recipes of the menu you cook and other items! Really easy to get to by sky train and if I can get there anyone can!!!

Great way to learn about Thai Food. If you're a foodie and love Thai food, this is a very cool way to learn more about the flavours and combinations.We went to the morning school, which meant a quick trip on the sky train to the local market to learn more about the staple vegetables and spices used in Thai cooking. This is a good way to explore the backstreets that you probably wouldn't normally venture down on your own for fear of getting lost.At cooking school we made four dishes and each had our own cooking station in the kitchen, which we head off to after the demonstration by the Thai chef. We then ate the meal with our classmates in the main restaurant.Very good value for the experience and the food, as long as what you have cooked is edible - go easy on the chilli.

A brand name cooking school in the heart of Bangkok. I love Thai food, so whenever possible, I try to enrol in one of the cooking schools whenever I travel to Thailand to learn another couple of dishes.This time, I went to the Blue Elephant Thai Cooking class. It is conveniently located next to the BTS station, so you don't have to walk far.The setup is great - you get to see the chef's demonstration both from an LCD TV as well as overhead mirror. Four dishes were taught and they were introduced to us one by one succinctly. You even get to sit down and have a proper dinner afterwards on the dishes that you cooked up yourself.It is a great experience and the chef there is very helpful.

Your classmates make or break the experience. I've taken two classes at Blue Elephant Cooking School, and enjoyed them both to the extreme. With the morning classes you have a tour of the local market and learn about Thai vegetables and meats - with a sampling of local coffee in a bag. Then it's back to the class room where Chef Noor makes a quick appearance and demonstrates a dish before quickly disappearing back to her busy day. After each demonstration it's off to the prep kitchen where you work to prepare what you've just seen. AC facilities, friendly staff and sometimes great new friends. I've enjoyed this most when it's lots of singles and couples in the group, so you get to chatting and meeting folks traveling the globe. The last trip in March had my friend and I matched with a group of 6 who basically stuck together and didn't want to interact with anyone else. In any event, you get an apron, a certificate, recipe sheets and a cooking set to take with you, along with great memories and a meal of your own making at the end.
Chefs dream class !. Offering a course for professional Chefs, I signed up for a week long class and was blown away by the instructors and quality of the food

Fun and enjoyable . We decided to do the morning session as I thought the visit to the market would be fun. However, we are a well traveled couple who has lived in Asia so we did not get as much out of the market as we thought. As for the cooking, the demonstrations and cooking practical was fun. Most of the ingredients had been pre cut and measured so we mainly concentrated on technique. We cooked a total of four dishes one at a time. i.e we did the demonstration of the dish then we cooked that dish, then went back and did it over again for the next dishes. The only issue with doing it this way was that by the time we got around to eating our cooking it had been sitting a while so was not as good.

Blue Elephant Cooking School - great fun. The well respected Blue Elephant Cooking School was great fun - after carefully observing the chef take us step by step through making Thai fish cakes and prawn curry, our group were lead to the instruction kitchen where we were divided into teams of 4 to try our hand at replicating the dishes. Although the ingredients were pre-prepared (sliced, cut, arranged carefully so that all we had to do was combine and mix), I suspect that was due more to shortness of time than anything else. Once the core ingredients were combined, the chefs (rather than group members, which would have been more fun) then arranged to cook the fish cakes and curry - both of which tasted great.

A fun and Yummy Authentic Thai Cooking Experience!. July 24, 2015 This is my first cooking class at the Blue Elephant Cooking School. This is a half day program where you cook a 4-course meal. There is a morning shift (8:45 am – 1:00 pm) and an afternoon shift (1:00 pm – 4:00 pm). My sister and I chose the morning shift. Only the morning class will have a chance to visit the local market, but the afternoon class will have a dessert lesson for substitution. My sister and I took the BTS skytrain from Siam to Surasek. The ride was not long. Once you get off the BTS, the school is literally in front of you. You can’t miss it. We were the first one to arrive. One of the workers passed out a lemongrass drink as we waited. Very refreshing on a hot summer day! I enjoyed visiting the local market and learning all the different ingredients and spices. My favorite stop was the curry paste and spice shop. The smell was wonderful. The chef even stopped at one of the drink stands and bought all of us Thai tea. Afterwards, we rode the BTS skytrain back to the school where the cooking begins! The size class was comfortable with a total of 15 people. Everyone received a booklet with the dishes/recipes of the day along with an apron that you get to keep afterwards. The chef demonstrated the 4-course meal one at a time. The lesson was well organized, simple and to the point. We were able to sample the chef’s dish. Each dish was amazing and cooked to perfection! After each demonstration, we would then head over to the kitchen to replicate the dish. Everyone has their own work station. I loved the hands on experience most of all. I’m a beginner, so don’t worry if you feel lost because there are chefs around to assist you. Take your time and have fun cooking. Afterwards, the chef presented a cooking class certificate and a Blue Elephant Cooking School tote bag with a free curry paste as a souvenir to take home. I also asked if I could take home a Tom Yum Koong (Hot and Sour Thai Soup) recipe. They were happy to pass it out. After all our hard work, we were able to sit down and enjoy our own culinary creation at the restaurant downstairs. Overall, it was a fun experience. Thank you to the chefs and sous chefs! I hope that my Thai meals will turn out just as great back at home.

A good thai food experience. The service at this place was exceptional, so was the quality of the food. All the dishes we ordered was amazing apart from the vegetarian mushroom with lemongrass sizzler. Too many large chunks of lemongrass were added which were very difficult to chew, however the staff took on board our opinion and we did not get charged for this dish. if you are looking for fine thai dining in bangkok Blue Elephant will not disappoint.

Amazing professional experience. The best cooking school I have been to (been to few across the globe). Complete experience, very well organised and very clear way of explanation of cooking principles. I loved every bit of it.. Will be back for sure

Great fun and food.. We signed up to do the half day cooking class including the market tour and four Thai dishes. Fortuitously, we were staying right next door at the Eastin Grand Hotel in Sathorn, but it wouldn't be hard to get to with the Surasak BTS stop right on the door step. We thoroughly enjoyed the whole experience, the staff were all very welcoming and friendly and we got to eat all our creations over lunch following the class.

Birthday surprise at Blue Elephant Bangkok. After 2 excellent dinners at Blue Elephant in Brussels, I got now an opportunity to try out the Blue Elephant Restaurant and Cooking School in Bangkok. We were 4 colleagues/friends, and for 3 of them, this was a first Blue Elephant experience. And an experience it was! The building is magnificent, an old mansion, both from the outside and inside. Food was great, and the bottle of Chenin blanc of Thai origin was a great match with the local food. When we mentioned to the restaurant manager that I had my birthday dinner 2 weeks ago at the Blue Elephant in Brussels he got me a surprise dessert with the restaurant team singing "happy birthday"! Great surprise! We will come again!

Simply the best Cooking School ever. I took my first class at the school already in 2005 and came back in 2014 for more.Now, the BE restaurants are great (but thats a different review) - their cooking classes clearly deliver against this high quality standardI prefer the morning class, where you go first to a local market, the have the class (cooking 4 course meal) and then get it served for a late lunch in the beautiful restaurant.Classes go step one: the chef will demonstrate the course in front of the class (incl. background, anecdotes, hints), step two: you move to a large kitchen where everyone can cook the course by him/herself ... all perfectly prepared, supervised, coached by a group (!) of cooks ... one is very well taken care of... and last, but not least: the Blue Elephant team is so much fun. Friendly and always up for a laugh. I enjoyed it so much and I will definitely come back next time I am in BangkokThank you Blue Elephant Team!

Well-organised & interactive experience. Although I booked at the last minute, the school was very accommodating. Size of class was just nice - there was 13 of us who went for the morning session. Enjoyed the visit to the local markets...the chef shared interesting facts and tips about Thai food and ingredients. Love the hands-on experience most of all; something even novice cooks would be able to cope with as attendees are shown how to prepare each dish by the chef before heading into the kitchen to replicate it. The self-cooked meal was cherry on the cake.

Cooking towards success!. We came to Blue Elephant for our Management team building exercise. We had one of the Executive Chef taught us 2 simple Thai recipe and then we broke into groups of 3 and cook the recipe at the kitchen. After this we went to the restaurant for a full blown meal prepared by their Chef. Of course no comparison to what we cook ourselves. The meal was excellent. Beautiful colonial building.. Cosy and posh. And we had great fun cooking too! Great place to consider team building or even just to dine at the restaurant. And the price I think it's rather reasonable.

Nice way to spend a morning. Had the morning cooking class, the cooking school is conveniently located, with nice environment and equipment. Everything is a bit commercial but overall a nice way to do something different. The highlight of the class is a walk in the fresh market, which we may otherwise not have this local experience.

Wonderful Experience . The Chef was very entertaining and kind. It was the best insight into some of the unique characteristics of Thai food. They had wonderful souvenirs: an apron laced with gold lettering, and a couple nice recipes

wonderful day at the Blue Elephant. We spent the whole day at the Blue Elephant starting with the first cooking class at 8:30. It started with a visit to the nearby market, which was rather small, good for basic understanding of the ingredient, but the quality of the products are not spectacular.But the cooking class is well organized, and the instructors are really good, they explain everything very clearly, and the chef is so cute! His English is fluent and has travelled a lot so explain what you can replace if you can't find the ingredients at home.Since my son who is 12 and they said he couldnt cook alone, we registered only for one person. So for lunch time I ordered some food from the restaurant! But We had too much food. And the afternoon session went very well too. I let him cook without my help, and went shopping in their gift shop.I highly recommend this class, the service is so nice. Have fun!!! I am sure you will enjoy.At lunch my Lamb Massaman wash more than dry, I couldn't even get angry at them who recommended that dish that wasn't edible, I didn't even have bite, they promptly offred me to change or give me something else in exchange, and apoligize so sincerely. That even that incident was a pleasure by the way they dealt with it!

great fun. the chef took us to the market for some ingredients, mostly to show us what the marketplace is like and then we returned to the restaurnt. everythong was extremely professional and efficient and she was adorable. there was a demonstration of how to cook a dish and then the group each got their own cooking stand with all the ingredients laid out and then we ate the dishes we prepared for lunch. even my husband cooked!! and you get to take home aprons and curry kits!
Good Service. Nice food but it's a tad too expensive given that it's away from main areas and food is averagely good. Not many know of this restaurant..

A taste of Thailand. This my second time at the Blue Elephant, cookery School. It wont be my last. All the classes are well organised and simple to understand. You can do a 1 day course, 3 day course or a week, in a group or 1on1 private classes.The Restaurants and Schools are owned and run by Chef Noor, One of Thailand most acclaimed and respected Chefs, she has a very much hands on approach and is involved with the day to day running of the business so you know that you are being taught by one of the best chefs in the business. The classes start with a visit to the market, and then into the classroom, which is a great demo kitchen, with video screens and overhead mirrors. The chefs show you step by step a traditional Thai dish(4 in total), you taste it and then go off to the Kitchen classroom and repeat the dish. The Workstations are great everything is there for you weighed out in bowls, you simply follow the instructions and create a masterpiece......and don't worry there are chefs there to help you when you set your wok on fire. Each work station has a number, so at the end of your day your food is heated and served at the dinner table and you eat what you've made.....and you get a nice apron and certificate.I've been a chef for 35 years and still enjoy learning something new. Well worth paying a visit and spending a day or so learning to cook.

An Overrated Resaurant & Overprice too. Heard so much of this place but disappointed with food as they are already 'adulterated' to the taste of the visiting tourists. There are better ones in BangkokGood service staff & beautiful wooden house.

The best food I have ever made. I have been testing many restaurants around the world now yet I am no excellent chef myself. So I thought why not to start learning. As I am staying in Bangkok I found this place and although I was bit afraid that I will be the only beginner there it wasn't too hard for me. The chef spoke very good English and made cooking look so simple. And I must say that this definately was the best food I have ever made in my life! Usually I am quite critical about my cooking but I really enjoyd the food I made! Plus the restaurant is beautiful and you can eat all the 4 courses that you learn in the restaurant. I totally recommend it to everyone who is interested in learning some Thai food basics!

A Basic Introductory Afternoon Class.. Neither my partner nor I are new to Thai cooking at home (he more experienced than I) however, we both wanted to see if we could move our cooking experience to the next level. We were not disappointed as this basic introductory one-afternoon class, offered some of the traditional methods of balances spices in Thai Cooking. From bashing Coriander roots, Garlic and Shallots properly in a pestle and mortar, the class delivered some fundamental knowledge to add to our Thai cooking skills. A basic class suitable for anyone, this would suit anyone, even those who have no Thai cooking experience at all. As such, it is very relaxed and our chef made it not only look easy, but very simple to do. And it was! We felt like we could do nothing wrong and we did not. We started with deep fried paper prawns and something new for us, the Sweet Pineapple dipping sauce to go with it (Nam Jin Sub Pa Rod); which we have made at home a couple times since without failure. Simple and delicious I found the class very exciting. Each meal is demonstrated first and then you move directly into the kitchen where you do the practical for ourselves. Great Fun! The dishes are then numbered for each student and set aside to later be served and enjoyed by everyone in the restaurant downstairs.The Bangkok Blue Elephant Cooking School is housed in a beautiful building, reminiscent of the great English houses built in the far east at the turn of the 19th century. High Ceilings and cool breezes through wooden shuttered windows made our welcoming drinks of Pineapple and Coconut all the more appreciated having come from the hot, humid, busy city. Chef Nooror So many Steppe is very proud of her hall of fame and you will be joining quite a few celebrities who have also come here to master the basics of Thai cuisine. Very simple, but once learned never forgotten, and since returning home we have really enjoyed not only those recipes we learned, but added the basic principles we learned, to many other Thai dishes as well with success.This basic introductory class is not hard core or stressing, or made for an elite grand master of Thai cooking. It is for the everyday person who doesn't really know much about Thai, but wants to learn more. For those like us, it is an interesting activity in the heart of Bangkok.

Fantastic time and great chef teacher made the class!!!. My daughter and I booked online with an email for the morning cooking class December 28. After a trip to the local market where we were introduced to many different Thai spices and vegetables and fish we headed back via sky train one stop to the restaurant. The chef was very humorous and gave great demonstrations. There were 12 of us in class and we could all see the demo. It was also presented on a large TV monitor, as well. After each of the 4 demos, we went into a separate room where everything was set up for us. There were several instructors to help. The food we prepared was delicious and beautiful! Our entire class stayed to eat, and a good time was had by all. People from at least 6 countries were attending. This was a great experience!! I thought it was well worth the $100 US dollars (equivalent in Baht).

Brilliant from start to finish. Really recommend if you like cooking! We did this as one of the activities on our honeymoon booked through Exotissimo Thailand tours. There were 8 in our class, mix of ages and culinary abilities! We went on a tour of a local market with one of the chefs which was really good and informative, and then made 5 dishes back at the restaurant. We then ate our own dishes in the beautiful famous restaurant. Great value for money.

Entertaining, informative and interesting class in top class restaurant. We took the option of the market tour prior to the cooking class - this was a really interesting introduction to the class and it was particularly useful to physically see the ingredients which are often used in Thai recipes but which we as foreigners are not really familiar with. The class itself was excellent- our teacher was Jay and he was brilliant! It was a perfect balance of theory and practice and Jay's entertaining manner, together with the alternation of his demonstration and our hands-on experience for each dish made the lesson all the more enjoyable!

Loved our lesson here, great experience. This was one of the highlights of our trip, the trip to the market was really interesting and the food we cooked was delicious. They were good at helping me adapt the dishes I made to remove the soy sauce (to make them gluten free) and everything was delicious. We also had a great time with the other people on our trip which was great fun. The building is also beautiful so you're also getting a banquet meal (that you have cooked) in a gorgeous restaurant which is part of the fun. They bring out all the dishes you have done to the table at the end of the lessons all reheated for you to enjoy.I know it's not cheap but we felt it was worthwhile, its a fantastic treat.

Great Chance to Learn Thai Cooking. I took the afternoon cooking class with my wife, we both enjoy cooking and Asian food so this was a great chance to learn some new techniques and recipes. During the class you will cook many dishes, first the teacher will prepare the dish and then you replicate it on your own, at the end of the class they serve your dishes to you in the restaurant (or pack them to take with you). The facilities and the restaurant are very impressive and the chef teaching the class was very good at demonstrating the recipes. The only complaint I have is that I felt the pace of the class was a bit rushed, and the chef disappeared often after his demonstration was complete and we were cooking on our own. The class is a bit pricey but I did learn some new techniques, if you are interested in learning Thai cooking I would recommend the course.

Great market walk and hands on Thai Cooking. Signed up for the morning class on a Saturday. Our group of 6 was taken by a chef to a nearby market for a walkthrough and introduction to Thai ingredients. Back at the school another chef gave us demos for each of the four dishes we'd cook. Then went to another kitchen where we cooked. At the end of the class, we were all seated in restaurant and served the food we prepared. Great time! The price was a little higher than I thought going in -tax and service charge- but more than worth it. Will take the afternoon class the next time I'm in Bangkok.

Very Fun and Memorable. We did the morning Saturday class. You spend just over an hour at the market looking at the general Thai ingredients. We then went back and learned how to cook four fantastic dishes. Two them will be made several times going forward when I get back home. Clean classroom, expert cook. What will end up making this class is who attends. This would not be as fun if there is only two or three in the group. We were a total of four which worked out perfectly. Believe there can be a maximum of eight. After you finish, your dishes are served to you in the restaurant downstairs. Worth the price. A great memory.

Cooking School. The website promised an extensive introduction to thai ingredients in a theory class , drinks , a cooking set to take home, etc. I only got a solo demo and cooked my 4 dishes which I chose to take home because there was no one else there I didn't want to eat alone. The food tasted great and the chef was friendly but it was very expensive and (2943 baht) for what it promised but failed to give. I would not recommend this cooking school. Oh I emailed them with my complaint but haven't had a reply.

Cooking Class. Oh wow. The cooking class was amazing. The teacher was very nice. And you have a chance to cook the dishes yourself. And the taste was very close to what the teacher made for us to try.And we can have our cooking dishes at the end of the lesson was fun!Overall, it was a great experience.

really wanted it to be 5*... Blue Elephant does have the reputation of being THE Cooking School for Thai Cuisine (at least for foreigners/ expats/ travellers) and the house it's located in is beautiful...but when it came to taking a class, not only was it with a group of +10 but I felt our instructors were a bit too robotic: demo-taste-kitchen-demo-taste-kitchen and so on...it felt VERY RUSHED...I've visited other cooking schools in Bangkok which offered a very different experience in a positive way (some for half the price, at least one that charged the same)..on the plus side, I found the visit to the market very useful, although I did go back on my own after since again, the tour with our group didn't last more than 15 minutes...food presentation, tableware, decor, all the orchids!, the house itself was much appreciated..could give them another try...maybe a different story if done with smaller groups (if they do small groups..)

Tina. I've been to many international cities and have never written a review about anything before, but the blue elephant inspired me to write my first. Not only is the atmosphere historically Thai, yet progressive and vibrant; the food is delicious; the staff is attentive; and the presentation is suburb. For any traveller looking for the best Thai food at a convenient location, as well as an authentic experience, I highly recommend this restaurant. Even the building itself is beautiful. No trip to Bangkok is complete without the blue elephant.

Tourist trap. We did more than one cooking class during our stay in Thailand. This one was not a great one. Limited explanation on how to use the ingredients, and a very quick cooking moment. Fancy place, but lack simplicity and atmosphere.

Great food, excellent cooking experience. What a fantastic experience. After a quick tour of the local market, the cooking started. Cooking 5 authentic Thai dishes, learning a the local tricks of the trade this was a great experience. Our teacher was informative, personable and knowledgable. After cooking our 5 dishes we were invited to sit in the beautiful dining room for lunch. We were then presented with a goodie bag with some curry pastes included. If you a looking for an up market cooking experience with local flair, could strongly recommend.

Yum!. After 15 hours of travel, we were looking for something that would ease us into the world of Bangkok. We thought cooking school might be the perfect activity and it was! We took the afternoon class where we first watched a demonstration then made individual dishes of traditional Thai food. When the class ended, we got to enjoy our personally cooked meal in the dining room of this lovely restaurant. This was my first experience with a cooking school while traveling and based on this experience, will definitely do it again. I have to also say that when I share that I went to cooking school, people say "what a great idea." The Blue Elephant Cooking School made that idea great.

Excellent and Fun Thai cooking experience. Five of us booked an afternoon cooking school session on a recent trip to Bangkok. We had been to the Blue Elephant previously for dinner and found the food to be very good, if a bit pricey, the staff very skilled, and the atmosphere of the place to be classic Thai. With such good memories of our dining experience we were looking forward to cooking and eating our own Thai dishes. We were not disappointed. There were only 7 of us in the class so the instruction was very peron to person and heavily hands on. Our chef instructor was delightful and skilled as she demonstrated in the demonstration kitchen each dish we would individually prepare. Then we crossed the hall to a spacious kitchen where each of us had our own cooking space with mortar and pestle, gas burner, wok, knives and other cooking utensils. The kitchen prep staff had pre measured and prepared the necessar ingredients for each dish, we followed the written recipe plus the previous instructions demonstrated in the demo kitchen to prepare each dish. We prepared five dishes, a pastery wrapped prawn appetizer, dipping sauce, a marinated tenderloin salad, a yellow shrimp curry, and a Massaman beef curry. Between each dish we returned to the demo kitchen to watch the chef prepare the next dish, then returned to our cooking stations to make the same dish. A very effective and fun way to learn the preparation of each dish. We got a certificate of completion, a Blue Elephant apron, and best of all a beautiful table was set for us in the restaurant where we served the dishes we had each individually prepared. Yummy! A really fun afternoon of cooking and dining. I highly recommend it to anyone who enjoys cooking and Thai food.
