Good experience in the morning market. Staff showed us around a market near the restaurant. Good experience with them who live in that city.The cooking school was great, the teacher was friendly. I surely recommend to take part in the class.
To Spicy Food. We had the meny of the day and found it so spiced that we had trouble tasting whether the raw materials were chicken or sheep.Unless you have a strong stomach go elsewhere.

Fun / yum / good for veggies too!. 08/02/2011HiFun half day course.If you love cooking, this course is right up your street!The teaching is very interactive, fun and enjoyable.I was travelling by myself and made some great friends on the course also.

Under promise - Over deliver. Took half day course. Was fun day going to market. Guide explained different foods and let us try. Then went back to restaurant. Comfortable learning environment. Chef was funny and gave good tips. Made 5 different dishes and then had them for lunch. Well worth it.

Good Food, So so Teacher. You either like to teach or you don't and if you don't, best leave it. This goes double for chefs and cooking school instructors because, no question about it, being a chef and teaching how to cook are two quite different things. My cooking class at the famous Blue Elephant Royal Thai Cuisine restaurant in Bangkok was not unpleasant (with the exception of a bad experience touching my face after slicing chili peppers), but it wasn't wonderful. The good part was that the Blue Elephant restaurant and cooking school is in a wonderful, colonial era building just across from the BTS skytrain stop in Sathorn and the teaching rooms are great, a classroom with video monitors to give great views for the cooking demonstration that precedes the hands on lesson, and a cool working kitchen where students get to prepare recipes. The not so great part was an instructor ho is probably an excellent chef, but just didn't seem enthused about teaching three women how to make recipes he has made a million times. It felt like the less he had to deal with the three of us the better. The only person who showed any interest in us was the boss, Chef Nooro Somany Steppe, who popped in and had us try some items she was testing out. She surely has charisma as well as talent, but our instructor seemed to be struggling through the painful process of teaching us. Instructor issues aside, the recipes we were taught to prepare were very tasty. At the end of the class we sat in the empty dining room and ate what we had prepared. It was just two of us students and no one spoke to us or had anything to do with us once we sat down at the table with our dishes in front of us. I found this a bit off-putting. It didn't make me want to rush back for a meal at the place. Still, the class was fun, if somewhat pricey, and one of my fellow students was a pleasure to meet. It might be more fun to do this class with a group of your friends and to see if you can get more time with Chef Somany Steppe.

No show. I booked the cooking school by email in early December for 14th January. As they gave me a confirmation number on the email I thought it would be fine. I did however email them 4 times prior to turning up with absolutely no response.When we did turn up at a cost of A$40 by taxi we were told by the Manager that they did not have our booking and we couldn't participate in the class. When I showed him our email he said he would investigate what went wrong but to date absolutely no feed back. When we complained that it would then cost another A$40 to catch a taxi back to our hotel there was no offer of any compensation, just a very weak apology. With all the cooking schools in Thailand I would definitely look at somewhere else unless you have triple checked your booking.

Thailand Honeymoon. Aside from it taking over an hour to get there from the Best Western by the airport AND it taking almost another hour to wave down a taxi to take us back (not the schools fault of course) everything was WONDERFUL! Great instructors, facilities and food! Highly recommend!

AWESOME. My 13 year old son and I attended the morning session. Our guide and chef were both knowledgeable and entertaining. We made four dishes that were divine and received a beautiful apron and certificates. Highly recommend them. Chef gave us so many tips. Was worth every cent and more.

Fabulous experience with Thai Cuisine. The one thing I was very much interested in experiencing when in Bangkok last October 2013, was attending a cooking class and learning more about Thai Cuisine. We only had one full day in Bangkok and had high expectations on spending that day well. Blue Elephant did not disappoint.Blue Elephant was recommended to me by my manager and checking out their website, which was very informative, made me interested in taking up the recommendation. Booking from Melbourne was an easy experience, just filling in a form and providing credit card details. This was just to secure the booking, we didn't have to pay until we arrived. I chose a morning session as these also included a trip to a traditional Thai fresh food market as well as the cooking class itself. We took the train to the market and were shown Thai fruits and vegetables and even got to taste some. We were also treated to traditional Thai iced coffee or tea. Our guide's was very informative and answered all questions with ease. I really enjoyed this part of the class. Back at the Cooking School, we were sat in a room with little chairs with desks, a pack with recipes and information about Thai ingredients and a very entertaining, enthusiastic Chef. He seemed to love his job and was a pleasure to learn from. After he demonstrated how to cook each dish, we would head into the cooking room and try it out ourselves. I just wish every time I could someone would prepare all the ingredients in little bowls ready for you to cook! It was also great being able to head downstairs in the end and eat the food we had cooked ourselves. I would definitely recommend this cooking class to all. My only gripe was the food we cooked weren't kept as warm as it could. I would recommend cooking the fried noodle dish last as this dish is meant to be eaten straight away when piping hot.

Had been to much better. We were instructed to arrive on 08:45. Got up early to make sure we get there on time. Nobody welcomed us except of a poor sign and a heavy bad smell of a restaurant that was not cleaned last night. A bit mass all around. A young nice girl arrived and took us out on 09:00.We were NOT told what is the Agenda for the day or what is going on. Just started following the girl to find out that we are taking the Sky Train to the station we just came from. We asked and learnt that we are heading to the market. It was a small local market, not the nicest in town. One and a half hour later we got back to the Blue Elephant. We stayed in a nice classroom and enjoyed a very good instructor. Priofesional, good English. Each dish was also practiced nearby and this part of the day was well organized. We then wend downstairs to eat our cocking. Dishes were nice. It seems that they do have the basics but lack all the required to treat you personally. Perhaps like a bus station with clients coming and going. Sorry. Oh, it is not a chip adventure so one could expect much more

Loved, Loved, Loved it!!!. Great day at the cooking school. We started by taking the sky train to the local food market, tried many things, picked up some ingredients for class and then returned to school where our lesson began. We learned to prepare 4 courses. Everything was fabulous and the instruction was fun and informative. They really cater to ensuring that everyone has a fun, but educational time. Afterwards, we ate everything we prepared and it was yummy! Would definitely recommend this to anyone of any interest level to learn Thai cooking in a fun and interactive environment.

Great learning experience. My partner and I undertook the half day cooking class at the Blue Elephant on a Monday morning. Being able to get the Skytrain direct to the restaurant was a big help. Once we checked in and got started we found the chef and the instruction to be fantastic. Really great recipes with advice on what substitutes you can make at home when some of the harder ingredients are not available. As my partner is a piscataerian, it was very easy for the staff to adapt to this and just slightly change the recipe. At the end of the class we won a piggy bank as part of the raffle and this will help us save for our next trip to Thailand or SE Asia.

Shop, Cook, Eat!!!. My brother booked this for me on my first trip to visit...arrived early morning and the small group of us headed to the market. Not just any market, rather a very local food market with every kind of food, creature, you-name-it. We stopped for 'bags' of ice coffee and ice Thai tea....served, yes, in a bag with ice and a straw. The cook who went with us picked up a few things as we tasted, smelled, and gagged at some of the interesting items. Loved the fish, the bugs (HUGE june-bug looking things used in spices)... then back to the school where we watched the demos of what we would be cooking (loved the overhead mirrors for better viewing). Then we headed into the cooking areas, all getting our own space for hands-on, step by step guidance...was truly fun, interesting, entertaining. Once cooked, we cleaned up, and they presented our own food to us on an elaborated decorated table for lunch! Superb experience! We even took leftovers home, along with a special gift from the school! Top notch!

Great experience .. . I attended the afternoon class as I had booked the class the night before so that was the only time available so I missed out in the market bit which is usually included in morning classes but that was ok with me as i had already visited the markets the day before. The place was close to the Shangri-la where I was staying I took the sky train was only one station away so that was cool .There were only 3 students including me in the class so we had a great opportunity to ask questions and learn more .. Chef Charles started the class he demonstrated how to marinate and cook a fish fillet in a banana leave. Was yummy !!Next was chef Nut . Very funny and experienced .. He cooked 2 curry dishes which were delicious .. Then finally we cooked the noodle salad which was nice too . We were lucky to meet Chef Nooror which is the founder and owner of the place .she came to say hello and watch us cooking. She is very friendly and lovely lady.I did some shopping before I left as they sell many of the sauces and curry pastes that we used in recipes . I also bought a book of Chef Nooror which I can't wait to try its recipes ;)I recommend this class for people who are actually willing to get a bit messy and have fun at the same time ;)

Brilliant morning activity. This morning my fiancée and I took part in the cookery class. I must say it was worth every baht. Although its the most expensive cookery course we researched it provided excellent value for money. We cooked a red fish curry, Tom yum kong, black pepper chicken stir fry and a spicy prawn salad. Our instructor was really helpful and enthusiastic and the ingredients and equipment were of a very high standard. To top it all off the setting was incredible. The only thing we liked more than cooking our meals was eating them for lunch in the private dining room. If cost isn't a factor I'd recommend forgetting about the rest and going with the best!

Simply The Best. This is a great cooking course. I can say with certainty because I have done four Thai Cooking courses in Australia, Phuket and Bangkok. They were all different and useful but this was the most hands on informative and value for money.Booking was easy- online. Shopping for supplies started us off and Maryum gave us a good tour and explanation of the various ingredients and market stalls in backstreet Chinatown. Charles, our teacher and chef took over and have us a great demonstration of what we were to cook and great notes on method for each recipe. We then went next door to the kitchen and each had our own burner and group of apprentices to give is pointers when we got lost. You can either take the food you cook away or have it resented to you in the restaurant . I would suggest this as it was lovely to sit down and eat the lovely food you had made. They follow up with some very enjoyable sorbets and you go out into the world feeling replete and that you have gained some new cookery knowledge.Very professional, friendly and excellent value.

First time in a real kitchen. I enrolled in the morning class because I had nothing to do when I came to Bangkok last week. Plus, the school is just on the other side of the street where I stayed so might as well.When I came to the restaurant, we were given a glass of refreshment and were given a quick briefing on the stuff that we'll do during the morning class. Our guide, Maurin (I think that was her name), looked like the Thai actress Sudarat Budtporm. We were taken to the market near Saphan Taksin BTS station and toured around. We didn't use those ingredients in the market, but it was the first time for me to try Mangosteen and it was amazing! I've been to Thailand many times but I'm ashamed that this was the first time I tried such amazing tasting fruit.Anyways, after the tour, we went back and we went to the classroom where our instructor, chef Nat, taught us to cook 4 dishes. There are different dishes to cook in the morning and in the afternoon every day of the week, so choose the day on which dish you wish to cook, unless you want to cook all of them. He gave us a lot of tips and answered a lot of our questions too, while breaking a few jokes here and there.Alternating on each dish, we cook our own on the kitchen beside the classroom. It was an intimidating task to be honest. It was my first time in a real kitchen, and I kinda feel the intensity on how these cooks do stuff on a normal day to day basis. Nonetheless, I had a blast.After cooking, we were given our certificates and we went down to the restaurant to eat our own dishes. Like the other comments, the food is slightly cold already, but I guess it was fine since the dishes are spicy. I did love the dishes, especially the Red Shrimp curry, although I was a bit disappointed because the shrimp that included in my ingredients was not fresh, I can taste it on the shrimp. Ironic, I know. It was the best and worst at the same time.I would've given 5 stars if it weren't for those mishaps. Nonetheless, I would definitely go back and if I have enough money, I would enroll on a whole week's class.

Good experience but slightly pricey. We undertook a morning class whilst we were on our honeymoon. The class started a little late but got underway by a trip to the market. We had thought we would be actually buying the ingredients that we needed for the cooking class but that was not the case and the class mainly focused on fruit. Back to the school we got some nice free aprons (to keep) and recipe sheets. We then watched the chef prepare the 4 courses. After each course we went to the kitchen to cook it ourselves. The chef was funny and easy to follow. I am not a big fan of certain fish and when she found this out she shelled some prawns for me to cook my fish dish which I preferred. You can choose to take your food away or eat it in the restaurant. We chose to eat ours in the restaurant and the staff there heated the food up for us. Problem with this was that they served the 4 courses at the same time which meant that the dishes were quite cold by the time we got to eat it all however they did give us free dessert !All in all a good experience by knowledgable staff but it was quite pricey.

Fun cooking class. My wife and I signed up for this cooking class for our stay in Bangkok. We did the morning class with a trip tot he market. The trip was fine, but it could have been better. We focused on some things, including fruits, that weren't really part of the actual cooking that we did. More of a focus on selecting fresh ingredients would have been nice.The cooking class itself was fun. The chef, who was engaging, funny and informative, showed us how prepare one dish and then we headed to the kitchen to make it ourselves. We did this with 4 different dishes. At the end, you eat what you prepared. Overall, it was a very good, fun experience.

Blue Elephant cooking class-lots of fun. I loved it, it was a lot of fun and I would recommend it. A few things to note that would have helped me enjoy the experience. The market was interesting, but hard to hear at times. Sunday was full of people like me...in Bangkok on business with one free day.1. We were told to be there at 8:30 and did not start until 9:30--once we got coffee, life was a bit better. No one told us what or who we were waiting for.2. I was there until almost 2:30 pm--much longer than I expected, glad I didn't have anywhere to go. 3. They have no system...everyone paid separately and it took a half hour to get all 15 of us paid.4. The price the concierge at our hotel gave us did not include a service charge...thought it was about $95 and it was more like $110--still worth it, just a surprise. 5. As others mentioned, you get your food at the end, and it is cold. I am happy I tasted along the way so I could get a sense of my food hot. 6. I am not a drinker, but I know other classes in Thailand offer wine. I was there Sunday morning so not sure about the afternoon classes. If this is important to you, ask. 7. Everyone cooks their own food so if you really don't want to cook, this is not the class for you.

Fantastic way to spend a day. My daughter booked me on the course whilst I was visiting Bangkok and what an experience. Suggest you book a course in the morning as you get a visit to a local market included, taken by one of the chefs and certainly saw the true Thai market - not for the squeamish. Was greeted with a cool refreshing glass of herbal tea and then the fun began. Each dish was cooked in front of you in a show kitchen and then you went into one of the kitchens to replicate. At the end you can either eat your ware in the restaurant or have it wrapped up for take away - suggest you do this as by the end of day you have been tasting every dish and are full up. Given a small bag of goodies to take home. A brilliant day for foodies!!!

A great experience with lots of food!. My friend and I took their cooking class and we made 4 meals. The only negative I have is that the instructions given while demo-ing the meals were different from the printed recipes. It'll be interesting to see if I can replicate them from my notes.Otherwise, this was a great experience. You get to tour the market, get some thai coffee or tea, learn about the foods which was really fun. You spend the morning cooking the meals and, when finished, they put everything in one of the larger dining rooms for the class to eat together. There is so much food to begin with and then they add more: chicken satay, green curry, green beans and coconut and lychee ice cream. Needless to say, there was a lot of leftover food b/c there was no way I could eat everything. This was a great experience and I highly recommend it.

Great half day course. The school run courses from half a day to whole days and the menu you will cook varies each day so try and organise this in advance (I did the day before). The morning class includes a trip to the market but the afternoon class doesn't. There were 4 of us which made the experience much better. Good instructions and great recipes. I agree with some reviewers that the food you cook should be heated for your sit down meal at the end as it was luke warm. I recommend this course.

Great cooking class in convenient location. My husband and I booked into the morning class for a Sunday morning late Saturday night and were thrilled to get a spot at the Blue Elephant Cooking School. The cost for the 3-4 hour session was 2,900 Baht each (plus 10% service charge). We tried to get into Silom Thai Cooking School, but it was already full - perhaps because the price is only 1,000 Baht per person.I really enjoyed all of the food we cooked (4 dishes) and will go home and make at least three of them right away.The market tour was a bit underwhelming. My husband is half Cambodian and we've lived in Asia for a bit, so many of the ingredients were not new to us. The "market" we went to was also not very busy and seemed a bit dead. Perhaps because we went on Sunday morning. If you're new to Southeast Asian cooking, definitely go on the market tour. If we return for a morning class, we may just sleep in longer and skip that part.After the tour, we sat in a classroom to learn one dish at a time, then we applied our learnings in the kitchen by making an individual portion of the dish. What was nice about this was we could cook everything to our own taste. For example, if we were given 5 bird's eye chilis, I used only three.I had to write every single recipe as the ones provided are too vague and something factually incorrect. I also wish that the instructor provided more support during our cook time. We were kind of left to ourselves, and a few people burned things because they didn't know how to control the heat on their burners.Nonetheless, I'm really glad my husband and I took the class. It was a great experience. We learned some helpful new tips for cooking Thai food, and we cannot wait to go home and cook!I would like to try Silom Thai Cooking School next time we're in Bangkok to compare the two, but I would definitely return to Blue Elephant, too.

The best cookery school in Bangkok!. This is not the cheapest cookery school but it was definitely worth the money! Go in the morning and you get a market tour before putting on your apron and learning how to cook the dishes. You save the food you have made and then sit with the other students in the restaurant to eat it. The sea bass with lime, chilli and ginger was divine! A great experience!

A 'Must Do' If You're A Foodie In Bangkok. So much fun and a definite if you're a foodie and/or avid cook. I spent a morning learning to cook four Thai dishes with chef Khun Nat, who was charming, professional and entertaining. There was no rush and Nat took the time to answer my questions and ensure I learned everything I wanted to. The food we cooked was excellent (all down to Khun Nat and not myself, sadly) and was straightforward enough that I will be able to apply it at home.Included are your recipes, a Blue Elephant apron and a take home cook-at-home thing.Oh and afterwards you get sat in the restaurant and the food you haven't already scoffed while tasting in the kitchen (!) is served to you, plus a yummy Thai dessert.Tip: If you can afford it, I'd highly recommend getting a private class. You will still go to the market with the main group in the morning but after that you have 1:1 attention and more time and space to yourself, plus you get to choose which dishes you would like to cook.

Not responsible at all. I and my family were extied to take cooking class at the famous culinary school. We have researched about the school and Bangkok over few months. Then, I made a reservation to take morning cooking class of 1week program 1MONTH prior to check in day. After I arrived to cooking class, I was told that some of the classes are full of 30 people and I have to give up because of them.  So I had to give up 4days of morning class and take it in the afternoon instead. It was not only totally ruined my plan and feeling but also my family as well. We were very disappointed and upset about it. They only said that they could not open my application in the computer on the 2nd day of the class.  If it was the technical problem, why didn't they ask me to send it again before I arrive? I feel like I waist my time because we could not really do anything for the day: the class take a place in the middle of the day which makes it hard to plan to go to somewhere far. I wish they have told me earlier so it might have been happy ending while I was staying in Bangkok for a week with my family.  I did not want to ruin the image of the school but I just want people don't get treated this way again in the future.  However, the cooking class with Nut chef was great besides this incident. He was the best teacher and his food was tasty to compare to other chefs.

Spent a lot of time and $ here. I would highly recommend video recording these sessions. They are VERY quick about them. THey have great tips but are hard to remember. I wrote stuff down but didn't start recording until almost after all our classes. They teach you very easily how to make these AMAZING Thai dishes. I even put some of my own twists on the dishes I learned. Like the massaman curry. I taught myself how to make it with oxtail. Very very delicious. If you have the money, I would go here. This is high end Thai cuisine.

£55 very well spent. Arriving at 8:45am you are given some iced lemongrass tea an ten minutes later it's off to the market.we were shown lots of unfamiliar fruit and vegetables and as part of the pack we were given an identification sheet was included. We had a demonstration of cooking each dish and then went to the kitchen straight after each, where we then cooked it. Very well run and very professional staff and chef. At the end we were presented with a goodie bag and certificate. When the session ended at 1pm we all went downstairs to sit and eat what we had cooked, identified by the labels we had stuck on them. This was followed by mulberry leaf ice cream and mango ice cream. Highly recommended.

Best Cooking Class. I took a morning class at Blue Elephant and really learned a lot. While most cooking classes I've been to just provide you instructions and recipes, Blue Elephant also explained a lot about the ingredients and the different techniques.The meal I cooked was very, very good. The instructor and her helpers were especially patient and seemed to thoroughly enjoy teaching us the finer points of Thai cooking.This was the best part of my trip to Bangkok! I definitely want to do this again.

very professional, great atmosphere. we took the morning class, including a visit to themarket. since we are no greenhorns to cooking thai, i especially liked the details the chef gave us about the different ingredients, veggies and spices, that i had not known or read in a cookbook before. it gave us a great inside view.the class in the school was very good. you would have the theory part were the teacher would cookthe meal in front of you and you could take notes on and would get valuable information on why it is important to pound the different spices in a certain order in the mortar and not just throw everything together at once. for the cooking itself, every student can rely on the help of an assistantwho will check on the heat, the texture of the food and give you information on why and how to do it like that. the only manko in my opinion is, that the cooking itself was quite fast. for the panaeng curry we first learned how to make rd curry paste, since it is a basic ingredient for this dish, but when itcameto cooking, we rceived our ingredient tray and it already had pasteon it. i would have wished to make the paste myself. if you are not used to cooking at all, this class might be a bit too speedy. we can definitely recommend this class.

Thai cooking classes in elegant historic premises, however.... The Blue Elephant Cooking School is a Bangkok institution, offering competent training in elegant historic premises. Unfortunately it has one fatal flaw...I had heard good things about Blue Elephant (BE), and was looking forward to meeting the team at my Saturday morning class. On arrival at the BE address via the BTS, I was dismayed to discover the elegant premises were under renovation AND suffering the encroachment of nearby office construction. But I digress... I came for the cooking school, not the architecture.A bit before the allotted start time a BE staff member distributed some lemongrass tea which was a nice touch and increased the ambience for our rather eclectic group.BE has an active restaurant downstairs as well as a cooking school upstairs in an elegant old wooden building that was once a department store in 1912 according to the brass plate affixed near the door. Fees are high at 3,000 baht and they do not offer a hotel pickup service unlike some competitor cooking schools. The upstairs are is split into a classroom and an instruction room with around 10 well-equipped cooking stations. All very clean and well laid out... one minor quibble was the lack of a hand washing area for course attendees who had to use the kitchen sink... but so far, so good.Our class first had an excursion to the local markets via BTS, and this was a very interesting part of the course. We were able to taste a variety of fresh fruits and ask questions as they arose. We then headed back to the classroom…BE conducts the theory and instruction part of each dish in the classroom, then the entire class moves next door to cook it, while the teacher and a team of assistants move from station to station to assist and advise. The inconvenience of having to move 4 times during the one teaching session was a bit annoying, but then the bombshell drops… you don't get to eat the hot, freshly prepared dish! It is whisked away to be served later (nearly stone cold) at the group lunch downstairs. This is the Achilles heel of the whole BE operation in my view.Other cooking schools I have been to have a far more successful model, which flows smoothly.They cook a dessert dish first, which needs to be cooled down while preparing other dishes, each 'entree' dish is then cooked and eaten straight afterwards, piping hot. The final main course dish is cooked, and ONLY this dish is whisked away by the support staff to be served to the group with the cooled dessert dish prepared earlier.Overall summary is... great location and ambience (esp the downstairs restaurant despite the encroaching office buildings) very high quality course notes, apron and equipment. Friendly and competent teaching from a very knowledgeable professional cook who made learning fun.However, for me the 'deal breaker' at Blue Elephant is the disjointed structure of the cooking course... I don't want to eat cold food a couple of hours after it was cooked! Unless the management can restructure the course to enable it to flow better I'm afraid I can't recommend it and won't be back.

Best Cooking School in Bangkok!. If you love Thai food and find yourself in Bangkok, register for at least a half day cooking school at the Blue Elephant Cooking School. Teachers are great and their English is superb, the instructions are clear, all ingredients are prepped for you.The day begins with your "class" and teacher getting on Bangkok's new subway to the morning market where you buy the freshest ingredients for that day's menu. When you arrive back at the school, which is also the site of the very good Blue Elephant restaurant, you spend the morning preparing Thai favorites and new dishes, which are labeled as cooked by you and then taken away by the attentive staff. At the end of the morning, you're taken into the restaurant where all of the dishes that YOU personally cooked, are waiting for you for lunch! A great experience.

3 hours, 5 delicious thai recipes to take home with you. This was by far the most expensive thing we did in bangkok for our short 5 day visit but it was worth every dollar! about AUS $90 when we visited in April 2012. We rang the day before and booked in but if you have your heart set on this one i would suggest booking earlier. Easy to find using the skytrain, there are signs to the blue elephant at the train station to help you find it which i thought was awesome. The cooking class was top notch and super professional, the dishes were fantstic and can easily be recreated once you're back at home. A friend and i did the afternoon class and learnt 5 dishes (cooked 4). the afternoon class doesn't take a trip to the markets. The best part was the end where we sat down, enjoyed a glass of wine and ate the dishes we had prepared. highly recommend if you enjoy a bit of asian inspired cooking in your own home.

Poor Customer Service - Booking. I booked a reservation for a Morning class via thier website 2 days in advance. 5:30 PM the night before I sent them a follow-up email asking about the status of my reservation. I then called them from my hotel no response. 30 min later I get a response "Madam" sorry the class is booked. Well first off why does it take 2 days to let me know the class is full. I am only in Bangkok for a short time I could have booked another cooking school, but it was too late every other school was closed or full also. Further more, I'm a man not a woman. They couldn't even address me correctly. I get the feeling this place is getting too popular and customer service is going out the window. I could have just dealt with a bad apple or something at the school, but for 2800 baht (100 USD) you think they would want to keep this money maker going strong? Other school are abundant, cheaper, and some provide transportation. Check out Baipai Thai Cooking School www.baipai.com. Best of luck -

If you like to cook this is a MUST. If you have any interest at all Thai cooking, a day at the Blue Elephant with Nooror and Sandra is a must. This is the most professional of many Thai cooking scholls I have visited. You have a choice of the morning session which includes a trip to the local market (recommended) or an afternoon session where you get to cook a desert in lieu of the market visit. The menus are planned in advance and the school can show you what will be cooked on each day of the week. Of course all the hard preparation and cleaning up is done for you. Chef demonstrates each dish for you in the classroom then you get to get your hands dirty trying out the recipe yourself. The best part, well depending on what type of a cook you are, is that you get to eat your food in the restaurant or they will pack it up for you to take away. Along with your Blue Elephant apron and all the recipes. There are cheaper cooking schools, but there is only one Blue Elephant. You will not be disappointed.

Average cooking school experience. Myself and 2 friends attended a half day cooking school here. The restaurant is very beautiful. We were taken to the local market (took us onto sky train for the return journey), it was a brief visit which included tasting some milk tea and desserts. The cooking demonstration was ok and classroom was nice, dishes were quite basic. However the portions given for us to cook were different and not correct, ie there was always too much of one or more ingredients (we were later told by one the assistants), but we were asked to put everything into the dish during the class so the taste didn't turn out quite right. Everything seemed a bit rushed. They offer to have you eat the dishes you had cooked but everything was cold by that time - all the students left their dishes after one or two tastes. Was a shame to waste. A saw one student asking for all her dishes to be packed up so if that suits you then please ask them up front. I wont recommend this school if you have had some basic experience cooking Thai food at home...maybe just come here for a meal instead.

Average dishes; overpriced. I attended an afternoon cooking session (without the tour of the markets which the morning session offers). While the cooking school is in a lovely Thai style house with a great kitchen facilities, there were a few shortcomings which left me a bit disappointed by the whole experience. We were greeted with a nice lemongrass tea welcome drink in the lounge which was very pleasant. After being ushered into the classroom, we were quite surprised to find that a camera crew would be filming us cooking. The head chef was late and there was no formal announcement what the camera crew was filming for or even if anyone would prefer not to be filmed. It wasn't until my friend started talking to them that we started to understand more what it was all about. The chef apparently is quite famous and regularly has film crews coming through her school so perhaps she is used to them but for the students there it was a bit of a shock and unprofessional not to be told ahead of time that they would be there. Also, this caused major delays with the lesson and we finished 1.5 hours behind schedule due to having to wait for the film crew to finish before starting on a new dish. A few people in the class were getting impatient. While the dishes were ok and instruction was fairly good, the film crew and how the head chef handled them was a big disappointment.
Loved every minute. Really professional setup, this is the 5-star of cooking schools - learnt some great dishes and loved the trip around the market. Would thoroughly recommend

Words cannot express how great this was!. Apart from the fabulous early morning trip to the local market, the informative lessons and recipes, the great practical sessions and the wonderful food - the vey best part of our session was the teacher who was instantly able to adjust recipes to fit in with our allergies etc. It meant cooking two separete dishes each time but we were so appreciative and it gave others in the class another perspective altogether.Thankyou thankyou thankyou.

Great experience to learn something new. We first made a visit to a local market and were shown all kind of things which without help of a local person one would never get to know. Back at the spotless clean and cool kitchen, a very experienced and excellent English speaking chef was not only just explaining what we were going to prepare, but was actually preparing the dishes step by step herself before we all got to our workstations and did it ourselves. This under guidance of her. Whenever we would have finished a dish and were attending the chef for the next dish, other staff members would completely clean up our workstations. At the end we had the choice, take our prepared food with us back home or eat it in their luxury Restaurant where it was served in the same manner as if it would have been ordered from their kitchen; this just looked great. But beware: do not attend their classes with a full stomach. Not only do you get your own prepared food to eat but also what the chef has prepared.... all is so tempting...

Decent. The person that greets with the lemongrass tea is very friendly and the tea is delicious! We had a trip to the market that was very entertaining and is something that is definitely worth doing if you have the opportunity. The only complaint is that the first 30-45 minutes of the cooking class seemed very commercial as the founder of the cooking school was being recorded and there was more teaching to the video cameras than the students sitting in the class. It was very annoying to have a video camera in your face as you were trying to listen and then go into the kitchen area to make the recipe.

Amazing!. My husband and I just got finished with a cooking class at Blue Elephant. It was amazing and worth every penny. From the moment you walk in the door, the experience is special and memorable. We were greeted with a refreshing glass of lemongrass water. Then we were taken by train to an outdoor market. One of the instructors took us to several stalls where she explained all the different fruits and vegetables common in Thai cuisine. She was incredibly knowledgable and spoke in a way that made it easy to understand. We sampled a few things along the way. It was very informative. Once we got back to the school we sat in a private room. The class size was perfect (10 people). We were given full demonstrations of each meal we would be cooking and then went to our own separate cooking stations to prepare our meal. The instructors were very friendly and passionate about Thai cooking. Several sous chefs were on hand to help us as we cooked. After we were done cooking, we all sat around a long table and shared our meal together. We each cooked four dishes. It was more food than anyone could eat. It was all delicious! We were also given an apron, a folder with recipes and food chart, bottled water, tote bag and a prepackaged BE spice packet. Our train fare and food samplings at the market were all taken care of by the staff. Everyone spoke very good English. We arrived around 8:40 a.m. and didn't leave until almost 3 p.m. When we left, the ladies were given a beautiful orchid. This was a very enjoyable and professional experience. I learned so much about Thai cooking, Thai cuisine and ate things I had never heard of before. It was wonderful.

Awesome!. The school does different dishes on each of the days and there are both morning and afternoon classes. The morning class is a little more expensive than the afternoon class, but they take you to the market and show you some different foods and you get to sample some too. The best part of the market trip was getting iced coffee and Thai iced tea in a bag!When you get back to the restaurant, you sit in a classroom and watch a chef make two of the dishes you'll be making. You have the recipes in front of you so that you can follow along and make notes if you need to. Our instructor was very good. He always told us what he was doing and even explained why he would use a certain ingredient. If he ever didn't follow the recipe exactly, he'd tell us why. After watching him make two dishes, we went into the kitchen to make them. There were lots of staff members there to help us out if we needed it, but they mostly left us alone to do it ourselves. After the first two, we repeated the process of watching and then cooking the last two dishes. At the end, we all went into the restaurant and ate our meals together. They provided water and rice for us and they allowed you to bring guests in to share your food if you wanted. It was a really great experience. And they even printed out some recipes of foods that we didn't get to make for us. I can't wait to try them out!
Great place to start.... Great place to start with Thai cooking... the teachers are some what programed.. it all looks good and facility's are great. But is basic very basic.

Excellent!!!. I went for a 2-day course with Blue Elephant during my stay in Bangkok. Very professional with a very well-equipped kitchen. The teaching chef, Charles, was a great guy... he is good and his explanation was clear and simple to understand. The staff there was very friendly and they even accommodated my son and the nanny... very kind of them. Other than just learning how to cook, I also took away some tips on food presentation (which I think is important too).

Fun, good food and you learn something. My girlfriend and me we did the mroning lesson in this cooking school and it was all very good. After a nice tea as a greeting we first had a trip to the local market and learned a lot about ingredients and what is used in several dishes and how to recognise good food. Afterwards the lesson followed a very basic principle. The course is prepared by the chef tasted by the pupils which then go into another room where the ingredients were weighed and partly precut (not the lemongrass, chili etc so you´d better know how to handle a knife) and the pupils cook by themselves (with a lot of help from nice ladies). Afterwards you do have a feast of your own cookings in the main restaurant. It was more than enough food, we got lots of explanations in good english and a lot of helpful hints. All in all a feast.Important notice: Do not plan to eat anything after this for at leat 6 full hours and neither plan anything which you wouldn´t normally do well and truly stuffed at 30 degrees C.

Made for a great start to the day!. I took the Blue Elephant cooking class on my first day in Thailand. It was a great time to do it. I learned a lot about the markets and the Thai cuisine which helped in my shopping and food adventures the rest of my trip. I also met other tourists and travellers from just about every corner of the world which good tips on what to see next.The restaurant is very easy to get to using public transportation. It is just outside the Surasak Skytrain stop. When we arrived at the restaurant, we sat in a small lounge and sipped on a very refreshing lemongrass drink. When going to the market, we ended up getting back on the Skytrain and walking a short way to the market.The market was full of smells, sounds, and tastes. We got to try Thai coffee which is given to you in a bag with a straw. We tried a sweet Thai dessert. The restaurant already has the ingredients ready at the restaurant. This was mainly time for the instructors to show us the different Thai herbs, meats, and fruits. It was a great experience.Once we got back to the restaurant, we each had our own desk with a binder with our recipes and an embroidered apron, all of which we got to take home! The instructors show us how to prepare each meal and share tips for using the kitchen tools and subsitute ingredients if we cannot find the original ones back home. After each demo, we went to the practice room, where I felt like I was on the Food Network. We have our own workstation, with portioned out ingredients in little bowls. After making four (yes, four!) different meals, we got to eat our masterpieces in the restaurant downstairs. There was so much food I couldn't even eat it all. At the end of the class, we received our certificate and a small gift set of Thai sauces. It was a great start to the day!

first class experience. My girlfriend and I had a great half day learning to cook a few Thai dishes. The chef's do a great job showing you how to make the dishes there and what to do when you get home (if you can't find certain ingredients, etc). I did the morning class which went to the market (honestly I did not learn that much at the market, but it was cool to see it). This is definitely not the cheapest cooking class in town, but you absolutely get what you pay for.

good food. Head to Surasak BTS station, look over each side of the station and you can't miss it. I did the morning class, so had the trip to the nearby market to try some fruits, and see some sights; just a usual Bangkok food market but worth a look if you've never been. Then back to the school for the class. The chefs I had were fluent in English. They start out by making the dish while you watch and ask questions, you then try their creation before heading into the kitchen to try it yourself. Don't worry there is a tap in there to wash your hands before getting dirty. Each dish is done one at a time, so you're not over loaded with recipes. Afterwards you have the choice to eat your meal in their restaurant or have it to go. Overall pretty good, a little expensive, but I still enjoyed it a lot. Try not to get your apron too dirty as you get to keep it.

A great way to spend a morning.. I took my husband to a morning cooking this past July for his birthday. He's the gastronome in our house but even I managed to cook a fabulous tasting curry dish and chicken skewers. Housed in one of Bangkok's few remaining buildings of historical importance, the restaurant retains it's glamourous decor of days gone by. A reminder of an era where a tie a jacket was de rigeur and dinning was an event. The cooking school, on the top floor, is modern and functional. The staff are skillful and welcoming. On the day we were there, both the founder and her daughter each came in to teach us a dish each. I look forward to recreating some of the dishes I learnt in my own kitchen.

Exactly the type of experience i was hoping for.. I recently went to Bangkok specifically to take cooking lessons. There are several places to choose from, but I noticed that somoe of the reviews made them seem like they just wanted to get people in, get their money and get them out. I choose the Blue Elephant because it seemed more professional. I wasn't disappointed. The staff knew what they were doing and really made it a great experience. They are knowledgeable, professional and friendly. The class is helpful, serious but not so intense that it ruins your vacation. It was fun,5)3 food was great and the price is pretty good.

A must do in Bangkok. I managed to fit in a Thursday morning class on my last day in Thailand before flying back to the UK later that evening. At first I had reservations about spending my last day in Bangkok in the classroom, but being a keen cook and a lover of Thai food I decided to give it a go. I wasn't disappointed.The morning started with a refreshing Lemongrass drink before heading off to a local market with our instructor Charles, who was very knowledgable and entertaining. The market is one stop on the BTS. At the market we were introduced to different fruits and veg native to Thailand, how to buy the best fish and got to taste a thai iced coffee, pancakes and sweet desserts. It was also really interesting to see locals purchasing their ingredients.Back at the school we were provided with a pack containing the recipes we'd be cooking together with an apron, which we got to keep. At the end of the session we were also provided with a goody box containing Blue Elephant herbs, spices, curry paste and sauces and also a certificate for sucessfully completing the course.In addition to the trip to the market, Thursday's session also included demonstrations of Tom Klong Koong (Spicy & Sour North Eastern Prawn Soup), Plaa Phaow Samoon Prai (Grilled or Baked Seabass with herbs in a Banana leaf), Kaeng Phed Ped Yaang (Red Curry with Roast Duck) and Laab Kai (Spicy Chicken Salad). After each demonstration we went off to our small cooking area to follow the recipe. Everything was well organised and co-ordinated. At the end of all the cooking each of the meals we had cooked were served to us in the restuarant downstairs. They even gave you the opportunity to invite a guest. My boyfriend (who is not a cook!) came and meet me for lunch before we headed off to the airport.The Blue Elephant is easy to get to using the BTS to Surasak station. It is located directly adjacent to the BTS station.I would recommend this to anyone with an interest in Thai food and cookery. I had a fantastic time and found it really rewarding. I was one of the highlights of my trip to Thailand and I have put it to good use by recreating some of the recipes since I've been back in the UKDo it and enjoy it.

Lots of Fun and Lots to Learn. We enjoyed the half-day cooking school on Monday, which meant we learned to make Spicy and Sour Prawn Soup, Chicken with Green Curry, Thai Fish Cakes, and Pad Thai. Our instructor, Charles, was highly entertaining and experienced. The trip to the market before the class was one of the highlights, as Charles introduced us to different seafood, fruits, vegetables, roots and herbs that we were unfamiliar with. We sampled several items and had Thai-style iced tea or iced coffee, which was unlike anything we'd ever had before. Back in the class, for each course, Charles would demonstrate how to use the ingredients to prepare the course, classroom style, explaining the purpose of each ingredient and how and how not to substitute if we can't find these ingredients back home. We sampled his dish, and then we entered the kitched, where each person had his own station, his own ingredients and equipment. We prepared one course, then went back in to the classroom to learn the next, and so on, four times. For each course, we marked our plates with our station number, and when we were done preparing all four courses, we went to the beautiful dining room where a table was set for us with all four of our dishes at our place. We enjoyed eating our food together.This was a great learning experience, made fun by Charles.It couldn't be easier to get to Blue Elephant. It's right at the Surasak station of the Skytrain.

great experience. We did a morning cooking class with these guys and had a ball. Nothing beats going out to the local market with Ni (our host and one of the teachers) and picking up all the produce you'll need for the cooking class. The tuition is simple and superb and I even surprised myself with the end result of my endeavours which I ate later in their very plush restaurant. This was one of the highlights of our week stay in Bangkok.

Great fun, informative, excellent tuition with great results. My partner and I did a half-day cooking class with a lovely tutor, Ni, who took us to a local food market and gave us a fun tour where we learned about and tasted all kinds of new (and obscure) Thai produce. Her knowledge and presentation were very good, and she had a strong rapport with the local sellers.Back at the beautiful old building housing the cookery school, we sat in a well-equipped teaching room where we watched Ni demonstrate methods and prepare ingredients then cook four different dishes. We tasted each dish as it was complete then went to individual work stations in the kitchen, where, using a recipe sheet and with as much or as little guidance as required we cooked and presented the same dish. When all four courses were complete we gathered to eat our food in the pretty restaurant.The results were great! My partner and I shared all our dishes and both achieved very pleasing plates which tasted amazing and far more authentic than most restaurants dish up to tourists. We were given recipe folders and aprons and little gift sets to take away, and I honestly feel confident that we will be able to repeat the dishes with the same success back home.I would recommend this course to anyone with an interest in cooking authentic Thai food. Ni's knowledge, teaching style, enthusiasm, food and her market tour really made this morning a success and I would happily go back again to learn more.

A fabulous way to spend a day. Really good fun.We did the morning course, which included a guided tour of a market which was facinating, and it made all the difference having someone explain the different ingredients.Breeze, our tutor was patient and good natured and really professional and the recipes fabulous.

Great half day intro to Thai cooking. Had wonderful morning session learning basics of thai cookery, inc satay, soups and banana leaf wrapped fish. Two half day sessions would have been wonderful, tho' some Austrian ladies who were on their 5th day thought that was too long. Strongly recommend the morning session where you get taken round a Thai food market - fascinating. Breeze, our teacher, was just great at explaining what things were and what one could use to replace local ingredients which were not easily available. The course is not cheap but well worth it, and very professionally equiped & tutored. And you get to eat what you cook at the end!!

Best Thai cooking experience. Date : 23rd February 2008Having spent 5 days in Bangkok at the Blue Elephant Cooking school I can only rave about the experience. It was run VERY professionally and the knowledge gained from these 5 days will be with me forever. The School teaches a wide variety of dishes and not "street" cooking but Royal cuisine. I would highly recommend the Blue Elephant for 1 day or 5 day. A huge Thank you to all the members of Blue Elephant for an unforgetable week.

First time doing a cooking class. I had a blast! Everything is very well planned and thought out. The time flew by and I came out with recipes and some very functional knowledge of Thai cooking.
I will take a another class here for sure on my next trip to Bangkok.

Never Imagined I Could Cook Thai Food From Scratch. The Maliwan Thai Cooking Class is a wonderful experience that I would encourage everyone to try even if you are not a wanna-be chef. The instructor is professional, patient and insightful. The facility is top notch. The trip to the market to purchase the ingredients provides great context that I am confident will be useful in the future. As for the actual cooking, we prepared five of the most popular Thai dishes. I can't wait to test my newfound knowledge when I return home. The only issue - if you can call it that - is that the location is a bit difficult to find in the Khao San Toad area. Don't get frustrated, just use Google Maps to find he place using the latitude and longitude coordinates provided. Definitely worth a visit.

Great experience. As a family of four with the boys being 16 and 11, we really enjoyed our Thai cooking experience thanks to Mae and her team. The venue was clean, comfortable and well organised as was the whole morning.The visit to the market via tuk tuk was a great experience as was the cooking and the other 3 persons who were also enjoying the session.Cooking was at a good pace and well explainedThe place can be a little difficult to find and our taxi driver did stop and ask the locals where the place was, even though we had the directions/location in ThaiWould highly recommend

exciting experience. I wanted to experience something different and joined this class. Most Thai cooking class provide very similar menus and I'd like to try out a bit uncommon one. Their mystique Thai class was awesome. Mae, the teacher, was very knowledgeable and vibrant. Her English was good and her recipe was simple and easy to follow. Overall, it was very entertaining and informative.

Unique and perfect . We were a small group of three and it was perfect. Mae brought us to a local market to get familiar with the ingredients the Thai kitchen is using. We cooked 4 meals and all were totally different. I am a vegetarian and that was no problem. The other had fish and meat in their dishes, I had tofu or soya. It was a great experience and soooooo tasty I highly recommend this class!

Best way to start a holiday. We decided to start our holiday (honeymoon) in Thailand with this activity. It was a really good decision. We booked our class weeks before our journey and got lucky because no one else registered for the morning class, so we got a private lesson. Mae, our teacher was fantastic. We went shopping to the market close by with a tuk-tuk. Mae showed us all the ingredients and introduced us to the ones we did not know. The cooking class was fun and interesting.We highly recommend this class for anyone interested in Thai cuisine, regardless of no experience or high experience in cooking.

Fun cooking class. My daughter (college age) and I went to Maliwan Thai Cooking in July and enjoyed the class. Mae was very knowledgeable and nice. The other class participants were great! There was a couple from Germany, a guy from France, and a Canadian family with three grade school kids who had been living in Australia for the past couple of years and returning back to Canada. We all enjoyed the class and the dishes we made.Five stars for Mae and the cooking class and her staff! We booked the morning class which includes a market tour. After arriving at the cooking school, Mae led us out and got several tuk tuks for a short ride to the market. The morning market tour was interesting with all the various spices, produce, noodles, fish, chicken, meats, etc. Mae purchased some ingredients for the class, including freshly grated coconut.For our class, we made curry paste for our chicken green curry, shrimp pad thai, tom yum soup and mango sticky rice. Mae also showed us how to make coconut cream and coconut milk for the mango sticky rice from the fresh coconut she purchased.Yes, to get to the cooking school you are walking through some old alleys and building. However, the cooking school and everything inside was very clean. There was air conditioning inside the school, including the cooking area, which is greatly appreciated! Cleanliness and sanitation practices were very good, such as keeping the cooking stations clean, constant hand washing and proper storage/refrigeration of perishable foods. Each student is assigned a colored clip to keep track as each dish is made; you put your color clip on your plate/bowl, so you know what's your dish when they bring it upstairs to the dining/eating area! The directions to Maliwan (on their website) are clear and easily found on google maps. However our taxi driver tried to scam us, even though our hotel told him exactly where to go and gave him the directions and printed map. He would call someone on his cell phone, sounded like he was asking for directions (probably trying to increase the time/distance), even though I showed him my cell phone with our location on google maps. Then he overshot the location, called someone again even though I showed him my phone with the google map clearly showing our location just a block away. We probably should have just bailed out of the cab at that point and paid him what was on the meter. When he pulled up to where he should have originally dropped us off, he tried to charge more than the meter because he said he had to call and use his phone. I argued with him that it was supposed to be the meter and just gave him a little more although I should have just paid the meter price. It was his loss for trying to scam us because if he hadn't played the trick of overshooting the location and trying to charge us for having to call for directions, I would have given him more with a tip.Once out of the cab, we used my phone and google maps to find the building but many of the local vendors were very friendly and asked "cooking school?" and pointed the way for us to go.When the class was over and we tried to catch a cab back towards Ploen Chit BTS, several cabs stopped but the drivers said "no" when we asked to go to Ploen Chit. Mae came out with the afternoon class and we told her we were having trouble trying to get a cab, so she was very helpful and suggested asking the cab to drop us at Ratchatewi BTS and helped us hail a cab and spoke with the driver for us, so we were able to get back. This cab driver was nice, used the meter and did not try anything.Maliwan Thai Cooking class is good. Also, I've taken the Cooking with Poo class and enjoyed that class too. So I would recommend taking either Maliwan or Cooking with Poo if you're interested in a Thai cooking class, depending on where you're staying in Bangkok. If you're in the city area with easy access to the BTS, take the Cooking with Poo. If you're staying more in the Khaosan or Chao Phraya River area with boat access, Maliwan would probably be more convenient. So we enjoyed our class and Mae is really nice, helpful, and a good teacher. Highly recommend Maliwan Thai Cooking class!

See rating breakdown inside my review. 2/5 for ease of finding the place. We were dropped by taxi as per the google map directions provided. Then I had to ask 5 different shops for the exact place and no one knew it. Then I asked one Thai gentleman to call the manager and get directions. It took us 10 min at least of searching within 100 m2 area !! This class should put sign and directions in the street near the place !!4/5 for the vegetables market visit. Nothing special about it. You go there by Tuc Tuc (that's why I am giving this 4 and not lower). 2/5 for neighborhood. I thought such class was located in a much more clean and classy neighborhood. No offense meant but program photos showed as if we were going to a brand new area or building. I was surprised walking in old and dirty alleys to reach there. 5/5 for cooking class itself. And this is the best part for sure 3/5 of where we eat what we cooked. It is just a meeting room and not dining room or table. I think there should be better classes around in Bangkok. Not sure.

Bad experience. We booked this class for the family (we are 5) some time before going.We left the hotel an hour before the class and gave the taxi the instructions and the address the school sended. There were not clear as the taxi got lost several times. That is why we arrived 20mins late and the teacher and the other person they had (only 1 more) were alredy in the market.A woman in the school gave me a phone in order to talk to the teacher, who told us to wait in the class instead of inviting us to joing them in the market. The way she taked was unpolite and that is why we decided to leave and not taking the class.Some days later we did a cooking course with another school who was much for caring and proffesional. The instructions where clear, they advise us where to go and what to do if we arrive late and gave us the way to go to the class from our hotel. The communication via mail was super easy and they ask us to confirm the day before to make sure. None of things are made by Maliwan Thai cooking school.Some suggestions: 1)give better instructions. 2)If you are going to leave to the market if someone arrives a little late advise it in a mail before taking the class.3) More flexibility. We are tourist, we have no idea how is the traffic or where the place is, so if we arrive late it would be nice to give us the chance to go to the market. Offerd a tuk tuk or something like that. We pay a a lot of money (we were 5!) for the whole experience, including the market.In conclusion, this is why is would not reccomend this cooking class.

What an awesome experience!. Mae's cooking class was so much fun; she is knowledgable and fun, and we really enjoyed the trip to the market in the tuk tuk and the cooking (as well as the eating)Make sure you wear closed toe shoes to the market though!An unforgettable experience - an absolute must! Thank you so much Mae!

Saturday evening cookery class. My husband and I attended Mae's cookery school on Saturday evening, we picked our class based on the menus available for the particular class and some of our favourite Thai meals. We decided on the Saturday evening class where we made pork Penang curry from scratch including the paste, chicken and coconut soup, along with stir fried chicken and cashew. The class was a fantastic experience, both my husband and I throughly enjoyed it and was a great end to our Honeymoon.Mae was so informative, her demonstrations were first class and it was great that she encouraged us to continually taste the food and adjust it to our personal tastes.Would highly recommend taking part in one of these cookery classes with Mae :)

My first class in thai. Interesting experience. We went there to the local market by tuktuk, we bought the ingredients ourself. They are all fresh . The main chef speaks good English and she explains everything to us along the trip. The kitchen is clean and neat. They even have air con in there. Easy and fun Enjoy guys :)

Perfect introduction to Thai cuisine. This was one of the best experiences I had in Thailand. Visiting the market was fascinating, and when we got to the kitchen we each had our own work station and ingredients so we could get to work. Mae, our instructor, was very enthusiastic and supportive of our attempts. Despite being novices, everyone's dishes turned out well. I can't recommend this class enough

Amazing!. Worth every penny! Mae made it really fun. She speaks really good English, and was really easy to talk to. She took time in the market to explain what we were buying, and also pointed out new fruits and vegetables we had never seen before and explained them to us as well. Everything is very well organized from your schedule to how everything moves in the kitchen. It made it all so easy, but never once did we feel rushed. Mae would first demonstrate how to make the dish, let us taste hers, and then go back to our stations to do it ourselves. One thing we loved is they didn't have every single ingredient measured out exactly. You get an idea of how much to put in from her demonstration, but you can then "spice it up" or down to your liking. The location is a little difficult, but we had no problem getting there. Here's what I would do, email Mae beforehand and ask her to send you instructions/address (WRITTEN IN THAI) that you can show a taxi driver, then go to their website and take a photo of the map they have on their "contact us" page, it's a really simple map. The taxi will be able to drop you off at least in the proximity of the class, and you can then use that picture you took of their map to find it. That's what we did and it was so simple! Didn't get lost once. We loved our experience here and if we come back with new friends we will definitely be taking them to Maliwan Thai Cooking Class.

Amazing!. My partner and I have literally just come back from having a class here, I walked through the door and just had to write an amazing review straight away! We were sceptical at first - it's down an alley way completely off the main road, but when we arrived we knew we made an excellent decision. The place was spotless, clean, well organised and very friendly. 'Mae' the course instructor was amazing - explaining everything to us, helping and answering questions. It went so smoothly and was really enjoyable. The other lady helping (I didn't catch her name) was very friendly and was so on-the-ball with topping up our drink, making sure we had the next ingredients for the following meal and taking our dirty cutlery etc. The best aspect about this experience is as I have coeliac disease, they made every meal and ingredient gluten-free for me! She even double checked things she wasn't so sure about with me and re-read the ingredients out to me. (It was the first time I had eaten a proper meal in 5 days!) If you're going to do anything whilst staying near Khoa San Road - please go here! Such easy meals which I'll definitely make when I'm back home in the UK. Highly recommended! (Plus you get a certificate!)

Morning class. One of the highlights of our honeymoon. The instructor, Mae, explained everything really well and taught us about the ingredients and cooking methods. She is very friendly and an excellent instructor.At the beginning of class, you hop on a tuk tuk ride to a nearby wet market where the instructor purchases the ingredients, while providing explanations. Amazing class!!
Try this!. We had amazing experience Maliwan Thai. We got information of all ingridients and explanation of how cooking some Thai food!

Great experience! . Loved our time here with Mae and her team! We did classic Thai dishes and they were easy to complete following her directions and guidance. They were able to accommodate a gluten-intolerant member of our group and Mae was able to give me specific directions to make my dishes significantly less spicy since I don't tolerate it well. We loved our time here so much we are considering coming back in our last few days in Bangkok! Also, it can be tricky to find! It's in an alleyway, not on the main street. Call if you get lost like we did! :)

Nice teacher and clear instructions. One of Must-Do activity in BangKok.The teacher was nice and patient. This class let me know the cooking for Thai dishes isn't that hard. Classroom location is a bit hard to find, but it is ok and worth to visit there.Tips: Don't eat too much before you go there, you will have a great meal about what you cooked, and I sure you will enjoy it.

Fantastic. This is definitely a must do in Bangkok. Mae and her team are brilliant and provide a fun learning atmosphere! We did the morning session, which basically meant we were cooking for our lunch. Mae takes you to the local markets to purchase beautiful fresh vegetables and learn about the produce, then it's back to the kitchen to learn, prepare and cook! A great value experience!

Absolutely everything I had hoped for!. I chose the Mistique Thai afternoon class. We were a group of 6, the market visit was an absolute gift of smells, colours and knowledge all with Mae's kind and expert guidance. The class is intense, instructions clear, and the recipes all delicious. As an italian cook, I love food, and really appreciate the importance of ingredients choice (without the class I would have no idea about how to choose..).An absolute recommendation.

Great experience . Just attended Maliwan Thai cooking class today. It was an amazing experience to us. Mae is a good teacher and she provides detailed explanation at local market and during the class. It's very enjoyable experience and highly recommended to all.

Highlight of my trip to Bangkok!. My husband and I did this cooking class together at the recommendation of our daughter. It was the best activity and the best Thai food of our entire trip! Our taxi driver had trouble finding where to drop us off, but if you follow the directions and head down the alley and turn right you will find it at the end. Don't let the location down the alley worry you, once you arrive you will take off your shoes and go upstairs to a very professional kitchen set up perfectly for your class with a dining area up another flight of stairs with excellent air conditioning. We loved going to a local market and learning about the meats, vegetables, spices and fruits. Mae even had a specific place to purchase fresh spring roll wrappers and you can even watch as they are made. After the market, you go back and each student cooks their own individual dishes. We made 4 different things and each one was amazing! Don't miss this opportunity if you are in Bangkok!

Highlight of our vacation!. My wife and I participated in the Maliwan Thai Cooking Class during our visit to Bangkok and had a wonderful time! Although I'm a novice in the kitchen, Mae and her very hard working assistant made the class fun and really helped us appreciate Thai cooking and the work that goes into each dish. The class was hands-on, but it was not too difficult for someone like me with very little cooking experience. Mae took us to a local market to select fresh vegetables and other ingredients and then led us through the preparation and cooking of a traditional Thai meal. The facilities were extremely clean the kitchen was well stocked, and everyone was encouraged to follow proper hygiene protocols throughout the meal preparation. At the end of the class, we sat down to enjoy a delicious meal...the finest Thai food I had ever tasted (must have been Mae's exceptional instruction)!Finding the location of the class can be a little challenging, so don't forget your map from the website and look for the sign at the end of the alley. It took us about 30 minutes by taxi from the JW Marriott, which was well worth the time and effort. This was absolutely one of the highlights of our vacation! In fact, we were tempted to come back the next day to cook and sample some new dishes. I highly recommend this class for anyone who appreciates Thai food and wants to have some fun in Bangkok.

Everyone can cook Thai food!. both my wife and i cook often but have have not really tried cooking Thai food. so we decide to attend a cooking class during this trip. Decided to try this school due to the reviews and price.Online Booking reservations was easy and we got a reply within the same day. they've also included a map and directions in Thai for the taxi driver. Started off with a market tour where Mae was very good in introducing the various food and ingredients as well as answering whatever questions we have. The market tour was really interesting as they have stuffs that we very rarely see back home. back in the school, the cooking lesson was straight forward and to easy to follow. all the ingredients and seasoning pre-laid out and portioned for you before start of each dish. you can still adjust the taste to your liking by adding more or less of the ingredient. it is difficult to go wrong with the dishes. after cooking we get to enjoy the fruits of our labor. the only minus is that as the green curry was the first dish to be cooked, it become a little thick and cool by the time we eat.overall a good and enjoyable class! thank you!

Great value, really fun experience. My wife and I did this on our honeymoon, and we thought it was an awesome experience. For a small initial price, we were able to take tuk-tuks to an amazing Thai market, learn how to cook everything on their menu, and then eat all the food we made.Our teacher was really knowledgeable and super helpful. The class is in English, and she spoke it very well in order to help us learn how to cook traditional Thai dishes. I thought we had to choose what we wanted to make, but I was pleasantly surprised to find out that we actually made everything on the menu. It was a lot of fun, and especially great for us as a couple.We even got official certificates for completing the course at the end of the day. The location that is only 5 minutes walking from Khao San Road made this even better. I would highly recommend Maliwan.

Loved it. The location is in a back alley so it might not be the easiest to search. But they give pretty good instructions on their website so we eventually found the place. Signed up cos I was interested in learning about the Thai ingredients. A typical menu consists of a curry, a dessert and 2 more main dishes. You get to learn to make the curry paste from scratch. Choose from their standard menu or customise one for yourself for a little more premium. Still very much value for money. We were greeted by Mae when we arrived and was promptly brought to the 3rd floor to fill out a registration form and drinks while we waited. Much needed in the hot summer months. Class started with a tour of their local market before returning. All ingredients are already cleaned and prepared for you and no washing is required. They have taken the most irritating part of cooking out for you. Even the quantity is portioned out in advance. They have assistants who will make sure the class goes on smoothly and what ingredient is required will be on the table when you need it. Demonstrations and step by step instructions were provided. Very hands on. Prepare to get your hands dirty. Instructor Mae was also very patient in the teaching. After the class, sit down and enjoy the fruits of your labour. They complete the experience well by giving out certificates to each participant.

Loved this class. . On my last day in bongkok I decided to do this class, I had previously found it on TripAdvisor and decided to do it as it was within walking distance from my hotel. It was a bit hard to find and the area wasn't looking the best, but inside was really furnished and set up for cooking, there was 7 of us and we each had our station with stoves pots,ingredients and utensils. Mea our instructor took us my tuk tuk to the market to buy our fresh ingredients for our recipes. The market was eye opening about thai cooking and lifestyle, we saw baskets of seafood, vegetables we didn't knew exist,eg small eggplants of different colours, mints,curries eggs yellow, red and green curry paste freshly made,chicken with unlaid eggs, live fish,vendors that have a machine to grate coconut for milk and cream, fruits like mangosteen, mangoes and tamarind that can be used in cooking. We then returned to school where we then proceeded to watch Mea demonstrate to us ,we then tasted the finished dish and then cooked our own.Mea made every thing seems so easy and everyone had great results from their dishes.we all got a certificate at end of class. We all sat down to have lunch after we have finished doing our 4 dishes, Mea provided rice to accompany our meat dishes, which some of us were able to have later for dinner at our hotels. I would definitely recommend this class.

Great class and good value. We spent a lot of time looking for a Bangkok cooking class. Some classes did not respond to email enquiries; some seemed very expensive.
