We eventually settled on this and enjoyed it immensely.There are clear instructions to find the class but it isn't immediately obvious (or maybe that was just us being a bit jet lagged).Tuk tuk ride to market followed by interesting walk through market looking at, smelling and discussing the ingredients.The class was well organised with everything to hand for cooking. It was great fun and we got a certificate at the end!

Worth every penny!. Mae was so frendly and helpful. I met some fantastic people and we got a great introduction to thai ingredients and methods. I felt faint during the class and Mae and Ja looked after me so well. The class was worth every penny because a trip to the market was included and the instruction was fantastic. I would highly reccomend this class at the beginning or end of your stay in Bangkok. It is a little trcky to find but follow Mae's directions and you'll make it!

Cooking with the Bros. I completed an evening cooking class with my brothers and it was excellent. Our instructor was friendly and had great English skills (none of Us spoke any Thai). We cooked 3 dishes, green curry paste (and then the curry), soup and pad Thai. And afterwards we got to eat our delicious creations. Turned out we were the only people in the class so it felt very private. The location is a little tricky, in a back street near Khao San. Very affordable too. Happily recommend.

Great. Great cooking class!I arrived just on time in a bit of a rush after over sleeping slightly and found the building fairly easily.The atmosphere and welcome was very friendly and laid back, at the time I took the class there was a choice of 2 menus to cook.I had chosen menu 1 and the rest of that days students had chosen menu 2 so I was lucky enough to get what was essentially a private cooking class!before the class started in the kitchen my instructor took me out for a guided walk through of a local market to buy the produce for the menu i would be cooking which was great fun, a bit of an eye opener and very informative.the cooking class itself was great from start to finish and i cant recommend it highly enough based on my personal experience.

Pure fun. It was really fun to learn cooking from Mae in this cooking class It has been second time I was cooking ever, but still it was really fun for me to taste everything, visit market, learn about all ingedients and cook (it was very sucesfull) P.S. The price contains everything included, so dont't wory about additional costs

Nice cooking class!. After staying in Bangkok for 2 days and visiting many places. In stead of going to the restaurant for lunch as decide to book for the afternoon class and instead of a market tour we had a personal introduction to all fresh ingredients of Thai Cuisine. In comparison to market tours of cooking classes we had taken before, we liked it much more.The class itself is very well organized and the instructors are professional, speak English well and give very good explanations. The prices are very reasonable and this course class made us nice surprise. Highly recommend!

A lot of fun and I learned a little also. My daughter and I signed up for this class and it was excellent in all regards. Mae is an outstanding, patient instructor. The tour through the market was educational (my 22 yr old daughter thought it was a little gross) and Mae was very patient in explaining everything. The cooking class was a lot of fun and we did the right amount of prep to keep it from being tedious. My daughter can be a little sassy ( I am an angel) and mae was able to keep up and keep everything light and fun. Highly recommend this for family fun or just as a couple.

Thai cooking class at its best. I have done a few Thai Cooking classes but Maiwan has to be the most enjoyable I have attendedThe visit to the local market was entertaining and an eye opener ,Mae purchased our cooking ingredients during the visitOnly 5 in class and Mae our instructor was the perfect teacherOnly negative was the green curry and hot and sour soup was cold when we sat down at the end of the class to digestWe did have trouble finding the venue but luck was on our side when we came across a Tourist Office who pointed,us in the right directionWe will return for a follow up session

Awesome!. Really enjoyed this experience. Booked a class with my girlfriend. We were lucky as there was no one else in our group and had a very personal session. Our lovely instructor/teacher Mai took us to the local markets to gather some ingredients and explain some of the vegetables, fruits, meat cuts, traditions and Thai customs. Very eye opening experience. We proceeded to cook some very traditional Thai dishes - green curry, tom yum, pad thai and mango sticky rice for dessert. The instructions were easy to follow and the dishes delicious. Our instructor was clear, friendly and spoke great english too.We paid $45aud each for a 4 hour class. If you are hesitant about the price - dont be! Remember that you get to eat your dishes in a delicious 4 course meal afterwards too! I have little cooking experience beyond the very basics and our dishes turned out fantastic.Book it! Do it!
Fantastic Experience . Mae was brilliant, fantastic English and a great teacher. We were taken around the fresh market to pick our products. Excellent food!
Great experience. Real local cooking class. Very valuable market visit, well prepared cooking and great results. Well done, Mae! Clear recommendation.

Very accommodating!. Other reviews have gone into detail about how friendly, knowledgeable, and skilled Mae and her assistant are, and that's very true.I wanted to mention the accommodations they made for me today. I'm vegan, so I don't eat some of the staple Thai ingredients. But they made sure I had substitutions for every dish (mushroom instead of chicken broth, vegetable protein instead of meat, etc.) and didn't make me feel like a burden.Thanks again, it was a wonderful afternoon!

Insightful, practical, hands-on. I attended three classes over two days and it was a time well spent in Bangkok. We visited the fresh produce market in the morning to buy the ingredients, which alone was an eye opening experience. My instructor, Mae is a great chef and an excellent, inspiring teacher.

Great experience. I did this cooking class in December 2015 as I love both cooking and Thai food. There are so many options of cooking classes available in Bangkok and it is not so easy to choose one. However, this one did not seem commercialized like some others and I should say I made the right choice.The experience was simply awesome since the beginning till the end. I was warmly greeted when I arrived. They had taken note of my allergy as well. It was a small group of 5 persons.I loved the trip to the local market where we bought fresh produce to be used later during the class.Back to the class and the trainer first demonstrated the recipes, we tasted and then made out own. We could also adjust the taste as per our likes (more or less spicy, more coconut milk or not etc… which was very nice). After preparing 4 different recipes, we had lunch and could not believe that we really made those Thai dishes. The plus point: the trainer was the highlight, with very good humor and proudly answering all our questions and explaining the different vegetables, spices at the market. She also provided alternatives to some spices that might not be found in your country. I definitely recommend this class.Location tip : no public transportation like BTS going in this area except for some buses. It was a little bit hard to find the place but this is not a huge issue. Note that it is not located on the main road when you reach there. You should look for a marrow street.

this is what you want to do - market tour/cooking class. don't be deterred by the slightly hidden location. the school itself is very clean and well-run. we are foodies from chicago, and did this on our first day. this is fun and informative. the first part is worth the price alone. mae, the chef/instructor, took us to a local outdoor market to purchase ingredients, where she identified and explained not only the items to be used in our dishes, but numerous other Thai delicacies as well. The market tour lasted a little over an hour and was fantastic. The cooking class itself was a bit slow, but the food was accessible to cooks of all levels, and it was authentic and delicious. The students actually do almost all of the prep and cooking themselves, which we appreciated. Would definitely do this again.

Personal and fun class!. This cooking class is really excellent. We were four friends and had a private class. We had chosen the four dishes we wanted to cook through the site. The market is very interesting. The staff is really friendly and the atmosphere was relaxed. Great food and a lot of smiles!

We had an amazing time!. I did this with my Girlfriend and it was amazing, first we went to the market and pick up our ingredients which was really cool and then we went back to the kitchen and made our dishes. It was very informative and our guide/cooking instructor (Mae) was very nice and spoke English well. It was very professional and very well run. I worked in a kitchen for 6 years and the dishes were excellent and easy to do. You don't need any cooking experience to enjoy this. I would highly recommend this!

Excellent! Put together Brilliantly!. From the start Mae & her staff directed you through the cooking experience. Mae greeted us, took us on tut-tut's to a incredible market where she explain what we were buying and answered any questions. Once we were done grocery shopping, back to the kitchen we went. Preparing the dishes, we had choosen to learn how to prepare.Mae has created a very enjoyable experience! Highly recommended!

A day of positive surprise!. WOW!It was our first whole day in Bangkok and we decided to attend Maliwan Cooking Class. It was really overwhelming experience. Mai, who was the chef, made our day perfect. In fact she was stunning and adorable person:) First of all we've been visiting local market and buying some ingredients to prepare the dishes. There Was also two rides of tuk-tuk included in price of the cooking class. During the visit in the market Mai bought delicious snacks for us which we've consumed before starting cooking. When we were cooking our dishes (4) Mai was introducing all of the dishes and was trying to help us, but be aware - You have to cook nearly everything Yourself so after the course you will be tired:) TIP: When searching the place where the cours is taking place, you should turn in the small street just near petit chinese temple.

:) :) . Great cooking class!!!!!! Lovely girls, and great instructions! Clean kitchen, and the staff are mindful of safety and hygiene. Get the opportunity to go to the markets and have a range of different foods explained to you, create your own meals and alter them to how you would like it, and eat them!! Definitely book here for your Thai cooking class :)

The most valuable cooking experirence. Worth the money !. I enjoyed Mae teaching me. Clear and fluent with English which helps us learn quicker and faster, especially for bachelors with only scrambled eggs cooking experience lol. Market experience was very informative. I am big into authentic cooking, do not take shortcuts while cooking and her classes definitely met my expectations Her kitchen was extremely clean! Mae would demonstrate the dish then monitor me to make sure I get it exactly like hers. She is passionate about cooking and has great knowledge about ingredients all over the world. She was able to tell me what the ingredients would be called in America and in what state( frozen ) I could find them . Not only was she able to teach a technique but explain the science behind the process. She and her colleagues is very hardworking in order to give you the best experience and knowledge. Authentic techniques, patience, helpful, friendly, generous, motivating and also entertaining haha! Would definitely consider going back to learn more dishes the next time I visit Thailand. If you are looking at this class, do not rethink and go for Mae's classes. She will help you out with proper attention. Do not think about the cost if you find it expensive. I registered for 2 classes back to back and it was definitely worth it. I encourage you to go for her classes and I think she said she used to cook with her grandmother which tells me that her cooking style is very authentic. Definitely a co relation with her grandmother and cooking as far as I can remember. Over all GO FOR IT!. mrt IS RECOMENDED. Taxi driver took us around the world lol plus traffic is bad in the morning. lasts stop in mrt and do not listen to google. you reach the last stop real quick (30 mins compared to 1 hour on google)

Authentic Thai wet market experience, fun cooking . I'm so glad this was part of our trip - it was one of the most productive things we did in Bangkok! Mae, our guide and chef, is kind and knowledgeable, but also direct when it comes to giving instructions. The wet market tour was great - I would have never made it into the market myself. There's so much fresh produce and Mae explains all the herbs and spices. She knows everyone. Don't be deterred by the alleyway leading up to the cooking school (it's close to backpackers district, across from a temple) - inside it is inviting and very pristinely kept. Mae's assistants are also very friendly and efficient. It's a nice way to spend the afternoon, or morning (10am start) if you're an early bird. Prices for two persons is 2750 baht, including the market tour, return tuktuk ride from the market to the school, and four dishes. There's the option to leave a tip :)

Very happy we did it. All experience was just perfect. It's situated very close to koansan rd where we stayed. You will start with a market visit where you understand the basic about ingredients ( seems they r using quite a variety of eggplant over there ).once back at the place we prepared 4-5 dishes which were delicious and actually not that difficult to follow.The staff was great, explained everything.Free drinks and we have received the certificate as well.Let's see if I can cook any of this back home .Price was very reasonable 1350 baht

Fantastic. We had the best time ever on this cooking class. The ladies were all so friendly, helpful and informative. It was great to visit the local market (which is an experience in itself) and learn how to cook local thai food. Everything was very well organised and tasted delicious! Thanks for a great class!

Amazing cooking experience!. I found this school from tripadvisor and emailed the company. They replied very quickly and the price is very reasonable. It doesn't pick you up but also save half the cost some other companies charge. Plus finding the place is part of the adventure. I followed the GPS on my phone. Once you find the Chinese temple, it's very easy to follow the direction. I got the morning class at 9 am which is the best because I went to traditional market and produce is still fresh and abundant. Got to see many things I have never seen before. Got back and start cooking. Accomplished 5 famous Thai dishes and they taste really good!!! Highly recommend the class!

One of the highlights of my stay in Bangkok. Couldnt have asked for more. The instructor was very knowledgeable and professional.Very informative trip to the market to pick up the ingredients. The menu covered most of my favorite thai dishes.The Pad Thai I made was as good as I have tasted here. I feel fully equipped to replicate these dishes when I get home. I now appreciate the importance of flavour components in thai dishes: saltiness, sweetness, sour, creamy and chilli heat; and the balance and hierarchy of these which varies depending on the dish.

highlight of my trip, too!. Best food I had in Thailand. The instructor understands the ingredients & flavors well. The day before my class I went running through a market, which was interesting. By chance we went to the same market to get ingredients for our class. She made the market much more interesting than when I went there on my own. Very clean cooking studio. Takes work to find, but well worth it.

Fun. This was very informative and fun. She demonstrates how to cook item then watches us to be sure we're doing it right. When done cooking my food it tasted really good. Make sure you print directions for taxi driver. Hard to find.We were 15 minutes late and missed market adventute.

Highlight of our trip!. We chose the customized-menu class, which was as-advertised with a tuk-tuk ride, market shopping, and a 4-course meal which we each got to prepare at individual cooking stations. Our leader would demo-cook most dishes first and then, after a tasting, she set us free to repeat the dish with tips on how to change the ingredients for different tastes. The class was very well organized and all ingredients appeared at our station at the right time and used dishes cleared away immediately. More than enough food per person by the end.Wish we could go back for a second round.Tips:-Follow website directions to building - entrance is not on the main street and Google Maps would have directed us to the wrong side of the building-Customized-menu class does not mean private (this was fine with us!), but a few others joined our group and cooked the menu we picked out

Fabulous day and delicious food . My husband and I did the class cooking four traditional dishes. Includes a fascinating trip to the local market, friendly and professional teacher, and easy to follow instructions. The food was delicious we couldn't believe we had cooked it!! Highly recommended.

Fun course and very helpful staff. Food was relatively easy to make and the market tour is well worth going on, as it gives you a good idea of what you will need to cook with looks like when you try making it on your own

Great cooking class!. We booked a semi-private class because it barely cost more than the group classes and the menu was customizable (great for vegetarians). Our chef was really knowledgeable and took care to answer all of our food questions. Make sure to come on an empty stomach, I was full for two days after this class!!

Fun experience and amazing food!. My husband and I booked the private class with market tour for our trip in May 2014. As other reviewers mention, the place can be difficult to find and the alley entrance is easy to miss – pay close attention to the directions. Also, allow yourself the extra travel time if you need car or tuk tuk service. We didn’t plan enough buffer time to get a can and our driver was not familiar with the location, so sadly we missed the market tour portion of our trip.The class itself was wonderful! The instructor and her helper did some of the more tedious prep work and the cleanup (if only we could had this at home). We opted to cook 2 dishes, break to eat, and then cook the remaining 2. We were happy we chose this option – we were quite hungry by the time we finished the second dish and portions were large, it would have been difficult to eat all in one sitting. The food was amazing and we were able to customize to our individual tastes for spicy/sweet/etc.While we booked a private class because this allowed us to choose the 4 dishes we were most interested in making/eating, it would have been fun to cook with other travelers as well.

Very nice. The place was a bit tricky to find (inside a covered alley) but it was worth it.Mae was really nice, patient, comfy, energetic, proffesion and smiley. :)It was a great experience of the thai cuisine. The place was very clean and wellcoming. There is an assistent who makes the whole cooking ours very nice and flowing.They deserves 5 stars!!!P.S. i added a draw of the way on a map.

Fabulous experience . We had so much fun with Mae and Ja at Maliwan Thai Cooking Class. Mae was an amazing tracher with plenty of tips on hw to cook your own tasty Thai food. As our favourite cuisine, I'm so glad we can recreate a few Thai dishes at home - albeit with not quite so authentic ingredients. The market trip was a great bonus and the only downside was we couldn't finish all the yummy food we had made!
Excellent. Everything was perfect. 1. Buying food from the wet market.2. Explain and show how to cook the dish.3. Cook it by yourself, with help if required.4. Eat your dishes....yummi.

Great experience!. We had such a great time with May as our chef. There was only two of us, the day was intimate and relaxed. I couldn't believe how amazing the food was - and that we had made it no less! Would definitely recommend

Great teacher + fresh ingredients = AMAZING Thai food. We had an incredible time at the Maliwan Thai Cooking Class. We booked the evening class and ended up having a private class as Mae explained that people normally book the morning classes as they involve a trip to the market. The place is immaculate and Mae's English is excellent. She clearly explained every step of the way for each dish, making it informative and enjoyable. It was so satisfying producing such amazing food ourselves, mainly thanks to Mae's great teaching and the high quality of the ingredients. As soon as it was over, we headed straight to the supermarket so we could recreate these dishes at home. If you're in Bangkok, don't miss out!

Amazing!!! . We were so happy with our cooking class we attended in Bangkok at Maliwan Thai Cooking school. Our teacher Mae spoke excellent English and was such a great teacher! We started with a fun and informative visit to the local market to buy some ingredients. Once we came back to the school we started on our dishes. We made and ate a total of four dishes and they were all fabulous! Mae gave us all of the recipes and a certificate of completion when we left. We are so excited to go home and make all of these dishes again!!
Excellent. Mae did a great job! Lot of fun and easy to make the dishes! Will definitely join it again for next visit.

So much fun and very delicious! . My husband and i took a class with Mae, where she firstly took us to the market to buy the food. I was really looming forward to this bit and it did not disappoint! Mae was really informative about all the different types of food used in Thai cooking.The actual class was great fun! My husband really enjoyed it and he isn't into cooking at all, but Mae made it really fun and took us through it step by step... we then got to taste all our dishes! A really lovely way to spend an afternoon in Bangkok, and we will definitely be trying out the recipes at home :)

Friendly, fun, and tastey. The leader of the class Mae was so helpful and energetic. She lead our group through a local market where we learned all about the foods we were buying and about all the types of shops we visited. Back at the kitchen she was so helpful and patient, especially with me because I have very little cooking experience. The food was great and I felt so accomplished afterward. Highly recommended for anyone looking for a good authentic Thai cooking experience.

Perfect Ending of our Bangkok Trip. My wife convinced me to spend our last day to learn to cook Thai food. First we drove with the Tuk Tuk to the local food market were our great food instructor Mae explained all kind of vegetables and the special ingredients for our dishes. We spend around 1 hour at the market and after we came back to Maliwan cooking class we started immediately to cook. We were amazed how fast and easy it is to cook delicious Thai food, Mae were a great cooking instructor and made things easy for us.For sure we try to cook this healthy kind of food back home once a week at least. A great experience which we can highly recommend.
Mother and Son - Thai Cooking. best by far - we were the only 2 in the class and the shopping experience pre cooking was the best. 4 dishes that you prepare, cook and then enjoy ! Great!

Great class!. Took this class with a friend and was very much surprised about how well planned everything was. Getting to the location can be a bit tricky. I suggest you search for Maliwan on Google Maps on your mobile then even if offline, it will still point you to the right direction.The location is pretty small, simple and clean inside. Everything was well organized - from the market tour to the snack to the cooking and eating at the very end.Our teacher Mae was very knowledgeable and pleasant and overall awesome. Learned quite a bit even if I'm a newbie in cooking. My fingers are all in tact so I say the whole thing was a success. We learned to cook Pad Thai, Chicken Green Curry, Tom Yum Soup and Mango Sticky rice. I may never have to buy Pad Thai outside ever again (Ok, I kid. Sometimes you're just too lazy to cook). Highly recommended.

Great traditional thai cooking experience, professional staff. Taking a traditional thai cooking was something I really wanted to in Bangkok and I was not disappointed. The school might not be easy to find so make sure you read the confirmation email carefully (with the map). The instructor was Mae and she was a great teacher. She could speak English very well.The course started with a visit of a local market where Mae bought ingredients for our dishes. She provided us with many details on local food and habits. We travelled to the market in a TucTuc. Once we got back, she introduced the dishes we were about to cook and we started cooking. The kitchen was clean and well equipped.Mae and her assistant were really professional and really wanted us to have a good time. They prepared the material and the ingredients so that we could focus on cooking. During the break, we could eat our first dish in the classroom (with air-conditioning!), while Mae and her assistant cleaned the kitchen and prepared the second cooking round. We cooked several dishes: chicken emerald, papaya salad, yellow curry paste and chicken, stir fried pork.I would really recommend this school to people who want to have the same great cooking experience as the one I had!

Great experience!. This class was awesome. My 4 friends and I got a private lesson from Mae and her aunt. They were very friendly, welcoming, and informative; they left a good amount of prep and wok work to the students to make it educational. The market tour was fun too and everything was impeccably organized (snacks, ingredient prep, drinks, dish washing). Highly recommended!

Highly recommended. Even during booking, I received quick replies to my emails to arrange a suitable date, time and course for me, as It was my last day in Thailand. Mae is very friendly, knowledgeable when it comes to the ingredients and is a great cook. The trip to the market was interesting and Mae explained interesting points about various Thai Ingredients. There was just me and my friend being taught in our class which was brilliant, it felt so personal and relaxed, everything was just right. I would definitely recommend this place if you're looking for a cooking class in Bangkok.

Fantastic learning experience. Brilliant time. This was a fantastic experience.Upon arrival by taxi.. We wandered down a few alleys which were very dirty and crowded..I was worried at this point that I had chosen badly..I could not have been more wrong.This was such a great experience..including a Tuktuk to and from the local market.. where Mai the guide explained about the various products that we needed. We then cooked 4 meals in clean surroundings . Meals we cooked included Red Thai Curry, Stir fried noodles & chicken and Spring Rolls.... cost includes everythingIf you get a chance to go, take the opportunity it was fantastic

Thai cooking class. A must do if you are visiting Bangkok. Our teacher Mae was so knowledgeable and taught us so much. She took us to the local market in a Tuk Tuk to buy all the ingredients for our meals. We then went back and cooked them all from scratch which was a fantastic experience in itself. A great afternoon.

Wonderful experience!. Taking this cooking class was one of the best experiences my boyfriend and I had during our two week trip through Thailand. Our instructor was friendly, informative, and a great chef! Our class included a trip to a local market, which was great considering our instructor took the time to explain the names and purposes of the different ingredients she was purchasing. I highly recommend this class to others- you will not regret it!

Thai cooking class. Awesome experience, Mae, our instructor was polite, kind and very helpful. She took us shopping to the market to buy all fresh ingredients. We actually did most of the preparation and all of the cooking. It was authentic Thai food at its best!

Wonderful learning experience. I had three classes booked as I love Thai food and it was a great choice. Mae and her team are professional and friendly. Everything is well explained and easy to follow and all dishes cooked tasted amazingly. We had some difficulties the first day to find it as it is a bit hidden in an alley, as we unfortunately didn't read the instructions how to get there beforehand. So, please do so and you'll have a wonderful cooking experience in Bangkok.

great experience!. This is a great way to experience the food culture of Thailand. My instructor was very helpful and sweet. The food tasted amazing even though it was my first time cooking Thai food! I went solo but I also recommend the class for friends and families.

Great experience!!. This cooking class was awe-some!!! The day consisted of going to the market, learning about Thai ingredients, and cooking absolutely delicious dishes! Mae really knows her stuff and made this experience really great for us. If you're on the fence about whether to do a cooking class I say DO IT. It's a great way to learn about Thai culture and you get to eat delicious food at the end of it :)

The very best thing we did in Bangkok. My boyfriend and me did the afternoon class where we cooked 4 dishes. It was the best experience we had during our entire stay in Bangkok! Doing groceries at the market was fantastic and I'm so happy I learnt to make the red curry - very delicious. Mae was extremely kind and knowledgable, and her little assistant, Ja was very sweet and helpful. The studio itself was very clean and we had everything we needed. I can totally recommend taking this class!

Maliwan-our experience. We did not know what to expect from this course, but it tourned out to be one of the best things we have done in Bkk. It is a great way to learn about local food and eating habits. fully recommended. Mirjana&Draganp.s - ladies who run this course are really supportive and avaliable to give all information. Thank you

Very spicy expierience :-). My wife an me participated in a morning class. We really enjoyed the day and left the place with a lot of inputs for preparation and useable informations about the necessary products for thai dishes. And last but not least: it tasted yummi :-)

A great experience. There are many cooking classes in Bangkok and if you're having trouble deciding, Maliwan is definitely worth having a look at. The price is reasonable for an enthusiastic teacher, ingredients, a well equipped kitchen and sous chefs helping preparation. You will leave this class feeling confident in making delicious Thai food to impress your friends! A decision to be made is whether or not to do the market tour, be warned this is quite a confronting experience. In my opinion it did not add much, other than nausea, to the cooking experience.

Great!!!. Due to some no shows, I was the only student in class. So I really got a private class. Mae & Ja are super sweet and friendly. Got to learn a lot at the local market about fruit & veggies I have never see in Holland. The class itself was very clear & interesting. Learned some new techniques and the result was super delish food made from scratch (not to compliment myself, but better than the average restaurants i've eaten in Bangkok ^^) A lot for me to eat all, but they made sure I got a doggy bag. Glad I did that because the sticky rice with mango was GREAT!!! This is most def a must do when you visit Bangkok

Excellent experience. My cooking class in Maliwan with Matinee was absolutely amazing. She was a really nice teacher. I learn a lot when we visited the market. The place where we cook is just perfect. Very clean and each person has is own space to cook. I defenatly recommand it. You'll have a very very good meal at the end of the day!

Great experience!. Instructor Mae was very warm and personable and made us feel at home and at ease cooking! Was good that there were only 2 of us in the class so there was plenty of interaction. Thanks for the great experience!

Great experience. I'd recommend this course to my friends anytime. Our hosts were very nice and professional. It was really great to visit the market with someone local because we got so much new information and it gave us the opportunity to ask all the questions about food that we wanted to. The course itself was very useful and lots of fun. We cooked 4 meals and managed just fine and the food we prepared tasted great!

Flavorful and hands on!. Mae and Ja were great. A quick tuk tuk ride to the local market for fresh ingredients for our dishes. Mae even picked up a snack from a street vendor to hold us over. All the locals at the markets seem to adore her. Dishes were flavorful and we had a lot of great tips on what we can do back home. She was also very mindful of the food allergies we noted. Highly recommend a class with this duo!
Great Day. All the reviews below say it all. Very proffesional, Mae and Ja are really friendly and helpful, the food you make (hopefully) tastes great and you learn a lot. Dont miss it!!!!

Maliwan cook school - very professional. My wife and I attended a cooking class at Maliwan cook school in Bankok. The class started by visiting a local market and purchasing frech products. We then spent 2-3 hours in cooking few dishes that were tasty and beautiful. Our instructor was vary professional and very informative. We had a lot of fun.

Do not skip this pleasure. We chose Maliwan after reading the reviews here and because we could choose the dishes wanted to cook. We took the 'Customisable Daytime Class'.The course started with a tour to the local market by Tuk-Tuk.We got detailed information on all kinds of vegetables and fruits that had to be obtained in order to cook the dishes we choosed. This trip itself was a gem ! Our instructor was Mea who was wonderful and very informative. Everything we cooked tasted delicious. Mea demonstrated every step in a clear and simple way.She explained some tricks and the best way to make it a successful meal.I truly recommend this place .

Do it. . The classes were a little expensive for our backpackers' budget, but we were so happy we did it!The instructor was very informative throughout the entire class!She was very patient, kind, and funny! So glad we did the customizable menu and she was able to supply tofu for my dishes without hesitation! :) so much fun!

I'd do it again!. I've been wanting to try a Thai cooking class and had a hard time choosing which school to attend and I'm glad I chose this! My mom and I did two customized half day classes with them and it was a day well spent! Even from the email correspondence with them, I already felt that I was in good hands. Their emails are very professional and clear. The school is a little hard to find so allot extra time going there. Our instructor was Mae. She spoke English well and her instructions are easy to understand. She adjusts her teaching style based on the students as well. At time, we would cook simultaneously but when a dish is something unfamiliar, she'd do a demo first. The outputs we had are also the best dishes we had our entire stay in Bangkok! I'd love to attend her class again in the future! :)

A great day of cooking. We chose Maliwan because we wanted to be able to choose the dishes we cooked, as we had already done a cookery course in Chiang Mai and didn't want to cook the same dishes twice. We found the cookery school pretty easily by following the instructions and map provided. Our instructor was Mae who was wonderful, enthusiastic and very informative. The market tour was fascinating and we got to take all the fresh ingredients back to the kitchen to cook with. We used fresh spring roll wrappers that we had just watched being made and made our own coconut cream with coconut we had watched being grated. Everything we cooked looked and tasted delicious. Mae explained and demonstrated everything clearly and also took into consideration that we had already done a cookery class and so didn't focus for too long on things she knew we would have already learnt. Mae's assistant Ju was also friendly and worked really hard getting the kitchen ready for us. We had a very enjoyable day and I am looking forward to cooking the dishes now that I am back in England.

The best thing we did in Thailand!. My girlfriend and I love Thai cuisine and have wanted to do a Thai cooking class for ages. After looking at a few options in Bangkok we settled on maliwan due to high ratings on trip advisor and we were certainly not disappointed! We opted for the traditional Thai morning class and cooked amazing tom yum, pad Thai, green curry and mango sticky rice - all delicious. Our chef Mae was friendly and accomodating at all times and had excellent knowledge which she shared with us. She took us to the market which in itself was a fantastic experience that we very much enjoyed. She is a great teacher and made us feel at ease! We will definetly cook these recipes at home and definetly recommend this cooking school to others if visiting Bangkok!

Highlight of our Bangkok Trip. What a great day! This cooking school is like an oasis in the middle of the hustle of the Bangkok streets. The school was a little tricky to find (although the locals soon point you in the right direction) and is beautiful, fresh and clean inside.....and most importantly - airconditioned!! Mae and her team make sure you feel very comfortable and take their time to explain the food and techniques used in cooking fantastic thai food. The ladies made sure we had a constant supply of clean equipment so our time was spent on the actual cooking experience. The trip to the market was excellent. We paid the extra to choose the dishes we were to cook and it was worth every cent. We highly recommend Mailwan Thai Cooking Class!

Cooked the best Tom Yum, Green Curry, and Pad Thai we've ever had!. This cooking class was worth every penny! Get the customized one so you can pick the dishes! You get to ride to a real neighborhood market in a tuk-tuk to learn about the local produce and experience the cacophony of local market life, then you take your outrageously fresh ingredients back to the classroom for cooking! The instructor (Mae was ours), then gave us a few minutes upstairs to rest while she prepped the kitchen. We then were patiently taught how to make the best thai food of our lives! I was especially excited by learning how to get coconut milk from ground coconut meat and hand-grind the ingredients for green curry paste! You also receive copies of the recipes so you can make the dishes once you get home! I learned heaps in this class and had a blast!

SUCH A GREAT EXPERIENCE!!!. We went on our honeymoon to Thailand, and chose this cooking class to take one day in Bangkok. My husband and I had our own private class with our chef Mae, who was very nice and knowledgable! Mae took us to the market and thoroughly explained different foods and what they're used for. Then she led us carefully through the cooking: my husband typically does all the cooking, but Mae was so good that I didn't screw anything up (which is a miracle)! The venue was very clean and nice (and air-conditioned for you Westerners). It was a BIT hard to find, but once we did, we were okay. Also, the food we cooked ended up being some of the best we ate on the entire trip. Thank you Mae!!!

A whole new appreciation for Thai cuisine!. After this class, I have a whole new appreciation for Thai cuisine! At first we were a bit put off by the price (~US$85 for two), but we had the entire place to ourselves, the course went for 4.5 hours and we had a dedicated staff of two! Mae was the course leader and Ja was her assistant. Mae was professional, knowledgeable and friendly and Ja did everything in the background to make the course go incredibly smoothly. The market tour was also a real highlight. Highly recommended!

Had a great time at Maliwan. My daughter booked this cooking course as a holiday surprise for me. This is our first time taking cooking lesson and we had a great time. Applause to Mae our instructor for her good English and wonderful explanation and instruction. Whether at the market or during cooking, we took everything in with great interest.The place was clean and lesson well prepared. All utensils and ingredients properly laid out and all we had to do was just follow and do. But we were given the choice to add or reduce according to our taste preference which was great. The best part was when we sat down to eat the dishes we cooked, there was pride and satisfaction but I was a little disappointed as my dish was not as tasty as Mae's as I did cut down on the chillies and spices thinking it would be too much to me. But after tasting, I should have bravely added all the ingredients, haha!We both enjoyed the 4 hours thoroughly and am thinking of returning and learning to cook other dishes the next time we visit to Bangkok.

AMAZING!!!!. Had the most amazing afternoon here - fantastic teacher, incredible food! Highly recommend. I lost my recipes though so if anyone from Maliwan sees this is there any way I can get the copies of the recipes from you so I can cook the amazing food again at home?! Please!!

Great staff, great food. A very nice morning going round the markets to get some of our ingredients with our guide explaning the unusual itrms on the stalls, followed by cooking and eating four items and eating them in air conditioned comfort.Clean freindly and very tasty.

Best thing I've done in Thailand so far. I don't usually write reviews but this lass deserves to be fully booked every single class.When I arrived it turned out I was the only one booked in for the class, but instead of turning me away or asking me to re-book for a different class I received a one-on-one lesson and tour of the market, something that I am sure a lot of companies would not do.I looked at information for every cooking class in the same area and Maliwan had the most appealing menu and lowest price, a very respectable 1250baht for a 4-hour workshop including the market tour, fresh ingredients and 5 dishes to cook and eat.I've been living in Thailand for 4 months and have seen and bought from a lot of markets, and yet I still learned a lot on the trip she took me on.The cooking part of the class was excellent. The ingredients were fresh and everything was very organised and well-prepared. The staff were so friendly and helpful, and Mae (the teacher) was brilliant, showing me chopping techniques and taking everything at a good pace so I wouldn't get lost. She allowed me to cook my dishes exactly as I wanted to, especially when it came to the curry dish where I chose how much meat/potatoes I wished to add and how thick I wanted the sauce.Great location, as the majority of tourists will be familiar with Khao San Road - I was able to get a free bus from my apartment in Nonthaburi, an hour away, result!Overall it was a highly enjoyable afternoon where I learned a lot, ate a lot and didn't break the bank in the process. I will definitely be back to try a different course.

Loved the trip the the market. My husband and I expected the cooking class to be a fun learning session -- and it was. The trip to and through the market was the best. We learned so much about the local produce and fish! We have been through markets around the world -- often not knowing what we were looking at -- this was great.

Great Learning Experience. Maliwan cooking class was a great experience! We really appreciated the ability to personalize the class by choosing the dishes we learned to cook. We went to the market, which was interesting and eye-opening! The teacher was patient and helpful. She was easy to understand. The food we made was absolutely delicious! We continue to cook Thai food and we like our dishes better than those we have eaten at Thai restaurants back in the US.
Excelent!!!. Very nice training! And food was excelent!We cooked 4 dishes and ate it all, need to sleep after!Don t miss it you will enjoy

Great!. A lot of information at the market tour (wear something that keeps your feet clean from fish juices). We were taken care of like royals. The kind instructor speaks great English, answers the questions and the professional quality of experience just shows up everywhere. The food was delicious, and the teacher knew exactly how much to use chili to make the dishes not too spicy. I got a feeling of attending a TV cooking show of the clean and organized cooking station. The course was not too easy for frequent Western home cooker and included for example cutting, frying and making spices. My less experienced companion got many tips and didn't spoil anything. There were shortcuts that were explained, without them it would not been possible to make that many dishes in time.

Great time, Great Instructor, Great Price. We did the afternoon 3 meal course in January. I told Maliwan that we could not do any prawn dishes due to allergies. That was not a problem as she substituted all the oils and ingredients that could pose a problem. The way into the cooking class is a bit sketchy, but well worth it (besides, it was more my own Puerto Rico induced paranoia than anything else). The instructor is funny, attentive and very patient. She explained all the ingredients and made sure that we did everything properly. I took another thai class back in 2007 but it was too many people while here it was my wife and I, and the instructor. Much more personal, much better (and for 1,900 bhat for 2 people? a steal!).Highly recommend!

Fun day!. I did the 101 cooking course in October when I was visiting Bangkok.I absolutely loved it!I have to say I did quite a little research before choosing Maliwan and in the end I chose it due to two reasons:1. It was the only Thai cooking school I could find in Bangkok which had not only early morning or evening classes but also afternoon classes which worked perfectly with my schedule.2. It was the only place you didn't have to submit an advance payment and simply sign in for a class. That was perfect for me as I didn't know until a few hours before what day I could actually go.Mae, the instructor is pleasant, a great cook, patient and speaks very good English. The place itself is clean, convenient, very well designed.The classes are very small, which was perfect for me as I needed some teacher's attention asI am a very bad cook....we were only 3 in my group which was great.The trip to the market prior to the class itself is really fun and once you get to eat the meal you cooked yourself - you'd be very proud of yourself.I gave this entire experience 4 starts and not 5 only because it took me a really long time to find the place. It's pretty centrally located but on a back alley in a crowded city like Bangkok I simply couldn't find it without the help of a tourist information center I found close by.Other than that, it's the perfect place to have your Thai cooking experience! I hughly recommend it, just make sure to leave time for getting lost on the way there...

Awesome cooking class!. This is an awesome cooking class! Even though I was the only person who signed up for the particular course, the instructor did not cancel. The trip to the market was very educational and the cooking lessons were very professional. I highly recommend this class!

Great experience!. First off, finding the school was not easy. We had someone in our group who was a local and knew where to go. There were 5 of us in the class with Mae as our instructor. She was very patient and explained everything right from the beginning when we visited the wet market. That was very interesting and we were in awe of the entire experience. After picking up all our ingredients, and answering our numerous questions, we headed back to the kitchen. We each had our own station so we were forced to learn everything, from chopping, grinding, and cooking. The class is supposed to be approximately 4 hours, but according to Mae, we chose some dishes that took longer to make, so we ended up staying 6 hours. We ate after we cooked the first dish and started the second one. Since it had to cool, we went upstairs to eat our first dish, then came back and finished the second and third dish. We ate those two, then went downstairs to cook the last dish, which took some time to make. By the time we ate the last dish, we were stuffed. We actually had to doggie bag food to take back. The portion size each person makes is very generous, and Mae did not try to rush us out at all, even after taking all that time. Luckily, they did not have an afternoon class. I think this was one of the most memorable experiences we had while visiting Bangkok. If you have some time, it's a definite "MUST". It was very reasonable, too.

Perfect for Thai food lovers. This class is perfect if you love Thai food as me. We went to the local market to buy the food for the class. Then during the class we learnt 3 dishes. I knew already how to cook some of the Thai dishes. But I learnt new tips. Definitely it worth the experience. Good price for what you get.

Wonderful experience!. My boyfriend and I were on a hunt to take home some thai cooking skills after living in Bangkok for two years. Maliwan was one of the only cooking schools we found that let us choose the dishes we would make. We each had our own station to cook in, and were made very welcome by our lovely instructor. The kitchen was spotless and inviting, and the meals turned out beautifully! Two thumbs up.

Good way to learn thai food and thai cooking. We enjoyed this very much. Clean kitchen and good atmosphere. First you go to the market. You get to learn different products there, she can tell you anything you want to know about the food in the market. Speaks good English. Cooking was fun. More than enough personal help with cooking when necessary. Thanks for the fun cooking experience Mae!

A Great Experience!. My wife and I did this cooking course while in Bangkok. It was a wonderful introduction to Thai cooking, and it was so much fun! When we arrived at the building we met our instructor, Mae, and sat down for a quick drink before heading to the nearby market. The time spent at the market was very informative. We were instructed on which ingredients to select for the 4 dishes we had chosen, and how to pick the best quality of each. We made sure to ask a lot of questions about the foods being sold by each merchant and get an idea of the types of dishes that they were generally used in. Mae explained everything very thoroughly, and gave us a great sense of how the Thai people shop for their meals. After the market we came back to the "classroom" and had another drink to cool off while Mae and her assistant prepped the food. We were given the choice to cook two dishes at a time, and eat in between, or to cook all four at once and eat at the end. We chose to cook all of our dishes and eat at the end. When the food was prepped we went down and began cooking. The instructions from Mae were very easy to follow, and each step was laid out in an organized fashion. After we completed all 4 dishes we went back upstairs to enjoy. As some of the other reviewers said, by the time we finished cooking the first two dishes we made were a bit cold. So if we were do do this again we probably would have chosen to make two dishes, eat them, then make the other two. Needless to say, they were all fantastic! Now, while I'm not completely inept in the kitchen, I'm certainly no Emiril Lagasse, and if I was able to make these dishes come out great, then I would venture to say that anyone could. But don't take my word for it, check it out!

Friendly and interesting Course-perfect. I gave my boyfriend this cooking Course as a Birthday present Because we Wanted to learn how to cook our favourite thai dishes, that we could choose during The booking process. We happened to be The only Students that Day so we Ended up having an Individual and private class with our really friendly and knowledgeable chef. We learned a Lot during that day, incl The market Tour! I would highly recommend this course!

Good Intro To Thai Cooking. We booked this cooking class on a recent holiday to Bangkok as I'm a big fan of Thai food so was keen to get to grips with the cooking. The set up of Maliwan is pretty good despite it's location (I'd recommend you use Google maps). After introductory drinks we were taken to the wet market (you don't really need old shoes but avoid flipflops or open toe shoes) where Mae, our guide, bought all the fresh ingredients we were going to cook with. This was a great opportunity to see all the different produce the Thai's use and Mae happily explained. Back at the place we then prepared for cooking. Mae was a good teacher; telling us to be guided by our sense of smell to tell whether things are done rather than set times. The menu we cooked was good too but my one criticism would be that we didn't eat our dishes after we cooked them. We waited till the end when the first ones were really cold. Still, a top experience and whetted my appetite to get back and try a Thai Green curry for myself!

Thai cooking in BKK - Great to know, what is in your food ;-). I did the class just 2 weeks ago. We cooked 5 main thai foods. We found it very interesting to see, how it was made and espacially, which ingrediants get in the food. We also visited the market to buy a few ingrediants for our meals. Unfortunatly was interesting point very short visit with not much information, since our guide had a bad day and the english was very bad. Not much explanation and not much time. Our guide just run off to all his known places bought the stuff and we went back to the place. Also the cooking was very stressful, since we were standing for more than 3 hours continously at the wok. No break to enjoy the food or the rest between the interesting dishes.Still I liked it a lot, even it is for Thai circumstances very expsensive.

Excellent customer orientated class. I had a class with Mae on Sept 27th where unlike other schools I got to choose the dishes I wanted to create. A tuk tuk ride to the wet markets was awesome! Back at the school I unexpectedly had Mae to myself for the whole morning as others had failed to find the venue and had decided to not attend. Lucky for me - not so much for Maliwan. This business chooses to not take deposits to give a genuine Thai customer experience. Prep goes into each booking so a cancellation 30 minutes after your supposed to arrive means they have incurred cost. This is an awesome class so get your act together! Have your ride drop you off on Th Kraisi. Look for the bank with orange signs, alley way is on the left. Walk to the end, turn right, signs for Maliwan at end of alley. Very clean kitchen and bathroom facilities, excellent teachers, listen to you as the customer. Really great!

Great Class!!. We had a WONDERFUL time in Mae's class. We got to make a variety of different dishes and they came out great. I do wish that we learned a bit more about the history of Thai cooking but the visit to the market was great and Mae was a great teacher and very patient.

Great cooking experience. He've seen the good reviews at tripadvisor and decided to take a class. The kitchens are nice and clean, the staff very helpfull and the food amazing. The cooking teacher spoke very well english but chatted and joked a lot with the other staff during class time. You'll get great pictures and receipts. Go for it!

Great way to spend an afternoon. Found the school easily from the instructions sent to us in the confirmation email and were welcomed in despite being early. Our instructor, Mae, was very friendly and great fun. On the market tour she seemed to know everyone and was very informative of the produce on offer. The actual cooking class was very well run by Mae and Ja and easy to follow. Mae had lots of suggestions on how to adapt the dishes to individual taste. She was very patient and attentive to all members of the class which resulted in our end dishes being successful. One of the best experiences of our holiday and next time we are in Bangkok we will do the morning class. Thanks again for a great afternoon, Mae!

Excellent use of your time in thailand. Took the course as i was interested in thai cooking, and after going for this class it has gotten me even more interested in thai cooking! Really educational and great value for money as it is hands on even.

Enjoyed the course and looking forward to prepare the dish myself. was late for almost half an hour for the AM class due to traffic jam... and when the taxi dropped us at the location, i am puzzled on whether did he drop us at the right place cos there isnt any signs of the school at all... trying to understand from the instructions i printed out and finally manage to find it... maybe the school should consider putting a BIG signboard on the door entrance ... its really hard to find the school.... luckily, mae waited for us and we went to the wet market (am glad we are the only 2 students so we can enjoy the exclusive attention) ... it was a nice trip and saw some greens that i never see before.... when we back to the school, we have a short rest and a drink before we start the lesson... overall lesson was good and i love the pad thai the most as it seems easy to cook ... already bought some ingredients from the supermarket and will try it out soon... i love it!
Entertaining class. Great class, with a tour in the market and explanation of all the products, follow by a very relax and funny class.

A great afternoon in Bangkok. I took the course on my last day in Bangkok and I'm very glad I did. It was a wonderful way to see a bit of the city (on the visit to the market), find out a bit more about Thai culture and, of course, learn how to make some great dishes. I cannot recommend it enough. I now feel far more confident in the kitchen!

awesome morning. booked this cooking class very last minute and I'm so pleased I did- it was highly organised, clean and Mae our instructor/ chef was so friendly. A little bit hard to find so look out for the narrow alley way, four garage doors and a tiny sign and you'll be right! If in doubt ask someone local, they all knew where I was meant to be heading. After a quick refreshment we headed to the market by tuktuk. really interesting sourcing the ingredients and learning more about Thai cuisine. We made green curry, tom yum, pad thai and mango sticky rice. Way too much food to eat at once (you break half way through to eat your first 2 dishes), I was able to have my pad thai and mango rice packaged up to take back home to show my very impressed husband.

Great small class!. I was really impressed with this cooking school for a couple of reasons. First, the attention to detail is impressive. When you arrive the recipes are printed for you. You cook in a very clean kitchen and as you cook the assistant magically takes away dirty dishes without you knowing and refills your water class before you can blink! Secondly, the class takes you out into the community. You visit multiple vendors to get your ingredients. Finally, the instructors are good teachers! They complete the cooking with you, telling you what to do, showing you how to do it, and then prompting you to try. They also sequence the dishes so your skills build across the class. You become more independent at routine tasks in the kitchen and then they introduce more complex skills. Finally, I was impressed with their flexibility. I was quite late due to traffic and they adjusted the class accordingly. As you are in Bangkok and it is a bit tricky to find, I would leave PLENTY of time. You will want the full four hours!

Something different and worth doing!. After some research on half-day cooking classes in Bangkok, I found Maliwan and decided to go for it. I will never regret it! Having only a free weekend in Bangkok during a business trip, this was a great way to spend some nice time with loca people and learn about Thai culinary culture. The visit to the market was very interesting and picturesque. After that, cooking was fun, yummy and easier than expected!!! We got good cooking tips I am taking back home and very good memories from Bangkok. Fully recommended!

Fantastic cooking lesson at Maliwan Thai Cooking Class. I followed a cooking lesson few days ago at Maliwan with my sister, and we really really enjoyed it ! We had a nice time at the market discovering new vegetables, and then in the cooking class, where everyone was helpful and really amical ! And of course, the dishes were amazing (thanks our great teacher) !We would definitely recommand it !And i can't wait to try again the recipes at home !

Great Thai Cooking Class. The class and market shopping tour was excellent. Although the place is tricky to find, definitely take tge map along woth you as you will need it to find the school. Great tips for making curry and all ingtedients from scratch. Highly recommend this school.

Highlight of Our Trip to Thailand. My husband and I had a wonderful time at this cooking class! We started our morning instruction at a traditional wet market. Our knowledgeable instructor showed us everything in the market and answered all our questions. At the market, we also picked up fresh ingredients for the recipes that we had selected. The class itself was excellent; we made four recipes and our teacher walked us through every step. I highly recommend this cooking school -- it feels personal, authentic and professional.

Great cooking class. I signed up for this with two other friends and we all really enjoyed it. The trip to the market was very interesting, and we were all able to pick a dish that we wanted to make. The teacher was pleasant and was able to give each of us attention/instruction when needed. And we have the recipes to take back home with us..... now I just need to find time to make this at home!

Maliwan Cooking Class. This class was incredible--the teacher was hilarious and helpful and really sweet (especially since none of us knew what we were doing in the kitchen.) We made a three course meal over the span of three hours that was delicious and afterwards were given the recipes for each dish. I looked at several different options for cooking classes and chose this one primarily because it was so much more affordable, but I'm so glad I did--everything about the class was excellent!

Great cooking experience. We have great time joining the cooking the lesson last Sat. Our teacher was very professional and we enjoyed going to wet market with her learning the names of different Thai herbs and vegetable. The food we cooked is very delicious and its the best spring roll we had in Thailand. Environment is neat and tidy and cooking utensils are clean. We will definitely try to cook thai food in hong kong soon using the recipe you gave us. Great applause to your team and the school. Thanks for giving us a wonderful and memorable time in thailand.We will come back to learn other thai dishes in the future if we visit bangkok again :)

Great experience - highly recommend it!. We had a wonderful experience with Maliwan Thai Cooking Class. Teacher was lovely and knowledgeable. Equipment was good. The food we made was delicious. My husband, son and I ended up with a private class on a rainy afternoon - it was the perfect way to spend our time together.

Delicious and well-balanced cooking course. Maliwan deserves rave reviews. We have some experience with cooking classes in Southeast Asia and still believe that Maliwan is one of the best. As a disclaimer, I will say that there were only two of us in the Thai Favorite Dishes class and so larger groups or different classes may not have the same level of awesomeness in their class. While the format is similar to other cooking classes (market visit, cook, eat, cook, eat), there are several points where Maliwan stands out.1. Stellar catering to vegetarians. As a vegetarian and meaty omnivore couple, we were surprised that we cooked the same menu. Mae (the instructor) provided a range of textured soy products that approximated the meat used-- different products for different dishes. This is unusual as other courses that we did simply left out ingredients for the vegetarians or used the same old Acme-brand tofu bricks. Mae also tasted the vegetarian dishes to make sure they were close enough to meaty originals. 2. The market visit had a more natural feel. Some courses have set stops where one walks to points A, B, and C with a little lecture at each. With Mae, we wandered the market stopping whenever something wriggling or wrinkly caught our eye. It was also fun to see her haggle for various ingredients. She also shared with us a snack that she really enjoyed and it was fun having the guide derive as much pleasure from the snack as we were (chive dumpling with thick soy chili sauce).3. We felt a desire to get the dish right. Other cooking classes seem to demonstrate a dish or cook along the group but without as much sampling back and forth to see if our pinch of fish sauce is really a handful. Mae cooked with us and let us sample different stages of her preparations to give us a benchmark. It was incredibly helpful and much more than simply following a recipe.4. Photos! Mae took photos of us as we cooked in class and later sent us a link where we could download the images for free. It was such a treat to have photos of us cooking together in class as well as capturing those frustrating moments when tying a money bag seems impossible with fat fingers.5. The whole meal was delicious. We made money bags, red chili paste, panaeng curry, cashew chicken, and minced meat salad. As a set and as individual dishes, each were superb. We know that the cooking class dishes are often good but we found these to be particularly delicious. We believe that one aspect might be Mae's precise approach to adding ingredients in a specific order to ensure that the flavors blend well. We highly recommend this class to anyone from beginner (the vegetarian) to seasoned (the meaty omnivore).

Amazing experience in Maliwan Thai Cooking class. My family offered the cooking class to my dad and he had amazing experience during the half day. The place is very clean and the staff has good knowledge and patience. If you like Thai food you have to try it!

Great and clean cookingclass. Very friendly staff with good knowledge of thai foods and recipes. Everything was well prepared and so smoothly running. Fine cookingstations. Good hygiene. Funny marketvisiting. And - not to forget - a lot of great food of your own to eat after cooking.
Great Cooking Session!. Very clean, new spacious class area. Super nice and engaging teachers guiding us throughout. Really worth the visit! Must try in Bangkok!

A very nice experience for first time thai cooks. Maliwan school is nice, calm, confortable and clean place with very well equiped kitchen. It starts with very interesting and informative visit of a local market place. We were very satisfied me and my girlfriend of chosing this place. The atmospere is great and all staff is very sympathic.The only thing I miss is to get know more about thai cuisine, some more tricks, secrets and not just cooking the dishes from your list. (time is passing fast...) I love to cook and I know a bit the asian cuisine. Therefore I would expect a little bit more of passion while telling me about your cuisine. Ok- we had general classes and not individual one. As I said- we are VERY satisfied of our Maliwan meeting with thai cuisine and would definitely recomend it to everybody. We are very proud of our diplomas. This is great and confortable place. Thanks and greetings to all Maliwan team.

Authentic Thai cooking experience. We enjoyed cooking at Maliwan a lot.The tour to the market gave us an idea how markets in Thailand look like and how shopping for ingredients is done.The chef explained everything very well. She cooked first to show us how to do it and afterwards we tried to do it as good as she did, everyone with his/her own wok.A nice extra: The chef took pictures which where provided for free via email.

Great class for bonding with friends. I have been to another cooking school in Bangkok before so I will list the Pros & Cons of Maliwan over the other school.First the Pros.Our instructor was Mae, she was lovely and cute! Very patient and knowledgeable.The market trip was much better, we went to a nearby local wet market by Tuk Tuk. it was a great market, it was an event itself.The school interior was more modern and fully air-conditioned. The student to teacher ratio was smaller therefore felt more one on one. There were only three students on my date. The environment of the school itself was comfortable and quiet.The Cons.The food after cooking did not looked or taste as great.( this might be due to user problem or the ratio of ingredients prepared by the staff was not balanced).If you don't have any experience in chopping stuff or cooking, you might not experience the whole learning process as you will play catch up a lot as the pace is quite fast.Lastly, the location is nowhere near any BTS or MRT so you have to Cab there.Overall, it's a great class and I will recommend it for any groups or individuals as any cooking lesson in Bangkok is never boring! It's great fun!!So what are you waiting for?? Go! Go! Go!!!!!!!!!

Great cooking class!. Maliwan Cooking class was a lot of fun and I learned a lot about Thai cooking. I was the only one in the class and got a one-on-one lesson. Mae took me on a tour of the local market and knew a lot about all of the local produce and various meats/fish products. We then went back and cooked 4 separate meals, all of which were delicious and my choice. The teacher, Mae, was really nice, knew a lot about Thai cooking, and spoke really great english. Would definitely recommend this class to others!

Wonderful Experience in Learning Thai Cooking at Mailwan. I have been going to Bangkok almost every year, and this is my second attempt in attending learning thai cooking class. As compared to other school that I have attended, Maliwan provided me with more hands-on cooking experience from scratch to end, and having a teacher to coach at most four students in a class, the students are able to benefit more. The kitchen is very clean, bright and well organized, which is a very good environment to learn cooking. My teacher, Miss Mae, is a very nice and patience lady and she even bought me bought me some fruits and desserts that I had ever tried during the market tour. My friends and I really enjoy the cooking lesson, and I will definitely recommend it my friends! Thumbs Up!!!
Perfect cooking class. We had an amazing day with Mae. We cooked some delicious dishes and she explained so many things to us. It was great.

Great cooking class! Thank you Mae!. I attended this class as one of my cooking school tour in BKK. The class is small size ans market tour was very informative (not just explaining what, but she gave some important tips in her explanation, which is very helpful).The cooking is hands on and studio is very organized and clean. Mae, teacher is also very very kind and nice:)I really enjoyed the time so I went back and took another class.Thank you so much and the discussin on cooking class business was very interesting! Hope to see you again.

Great fun and delicious too.. We did an afternoon cooking class here last week and had a lot of fun. Mae, our teacher, took us on a tour of the markets and pointed out all the different vegetables, fruit, tofu, spice pastes, etc for sale - some familiar, some new to us - then took us back and taught us how to cook 4 different dishes in their very professionally set-up kitchen. It was all very hands-on and the results were delicious (we ate as we went). We had done a fair bit of Thai-style cooking already at home, but we still learnt a lot of new techniques, and all of it easily repeatable. Mae's English was excellent, and much of the pleasure was just getting to know her and learn a bit more about the Thai way-of-life. All the staff had a great sense of humour. The class was a bit cheaper than some of the others we read about, but I couldn't have asked for a better experience. We were even able to choose which dishes we wanted to cook. Highly recommended.

An amazing experience! Would highly recommend.. We had a terrific time at maliwan cooking class. Very organized and professional. The cost included everything, from the tuk tuk ride to the marketplace tour to four dishes and then some that were delicious and simple enough to make at home. Could not have been better. Only challenge was finding it. Make sure you bring the directions from the website. Even then the cab driver had a difficult time finding it. Thanks to all the staff at Maliwan who were so fun and attentive.

Great Start to Thai food. The Maliwan Thai cooking class is a great start to discovering the excellent Thai cusine. Small classes, a sparkling clean kitchen and very nice and helpful staff made it a very good experience! Highly recommended !

Nice small class size, personalized experience. I'll keep this simple. The class was very nice. This is the second cooking class my wife and I have taken in Bangkok. The other class was nice as well, but I asked my wife what made this one unique or better over the other one. Here was her top three1. It caters to smaller groups. We were the only two in our class, so it was great to get lots of questions in to our instructor, Ma.2. You can personalize and choose 4 different dishes, which allows you to focus on things you may want to cook when you return home3. Cleanliness - you will wear booties inside, and Ma was very conscious of sustaining a good clean cooking experienceOther nice touches. Ma took several pictures of us cooking with the house DSLR camera to send you later. You also will get a certificate of completion at the end. Quick tip: we got there almost an hour late fussing around with taxis. Click the link inside of the confirmation email. It has full instructions In THAI :) which would have certainly saved us a lot of wasted timeThe food was delicious. Enjoy!

The best food I had in Bangkok!. This experienced exceeded all that I had hoped for! The trip to the market was fun and very informative. My guide happily answered all my questions and was very good at explaining ingredients and how they are used.The cooking part was absolutely wonderful. Mae was friendly and kind in addition to really knowing how to teach others her craft in a warm and inviting way. My favorite part (besides eating) was shredding the coconut on "the rabbit" (a traditional tool used in Thai households). Honestly, what I made in class was the best food I ate in Bangkok! I can't wait to go home and make papaya salad, since the class I can't seem to find one good enough!

Nice and warm!. This is the second time having cooking class in Bangkok. Maliwan Thai Cooking School gave me a fantastic experience in Bangkok. The school is clean and tidy, remember the print the map they gave with you, as it is a little bit hard to find their entrance. The staff are nice and kind, the food they taught us is easy to make and very delicious. Their emerald chicken and mango sticky rice are super delicious. Highly recommend!

Excellent Thai Experience. This class, held by Mae, was phenomenal. I ended up being the only student, but that didn't stop me from having an incredible experience. Mae took me to the local market, showed me the different foods, and explained how to use them. We purchased what we needed for our dishes and headed back to the Maliwan building. Mae demonstrated and then helped me with several Thai dishes, including green curry pasta, green curry, pad thai, tom yum soup, and sticky mango rice. Everything was delicious! I highly recommend this class to anyone who has a passion for cooking and is in Bangkok.

a fantastic food experience. I have to agree with all the reviews on the website, they are very accurate.My husband and I had a great afternoon with Mae, Chin, Ja and Matte(sorry not sure of spelling) and the two other participants. The trip to the markets was fantastic, we feel we would be confident enough to now go and shop for all our fresh fruit and veges. Mae has a wonderful way with all the students and the market stall holders alike. The school is very professionally run and the utensils and school itself are beautifully maintained. As the other reviews mention, it was a treat to be given a certificate at the completion of our class. There was a good mix of recipes which were all cooked in the time we had in class which surprised me as we seemed to achieve so much. There was no pressure to rush as Mae and Chin were wonderful teachers and Ja and Matte were superb in the background keeping everything running well. We did not have any difficulty finding the school as Mae met us but the traffic was heavy so allow for that. All in all a memorable travel experience which I would recommend to everyone, foodie or not, and those that just love a wonderful experience.

Great way to learn more about your favourite food!. Do not worry about signing up for the class alone. You will get to know new people this way. Mae was wonderful with her insights about the ingredients during the local market tour, so try to sign up for the morning or afternoon class if possible. Chin and Mae (our instructors) were patient and really nice. The ingredients are carefully sorted and printed recipes are given. They would demonstrate and guide you along with the cooking so no problem at all for those inexperienced in cooking Thai food (like me). Not to mention the recipes are absolutely delicious! I'll definitely return to learn other dishes as well. We received a certificate at the end of the class which was a really nice touch as a souvenir. Be sure to sign up if you have a few hours to spare in Bangkok.(On a side note, if you are getting to the location by taxi, make sure to factor in extra time for possible traffic jam as I was late. They were really nice though and did not mention about it at all about me being late. :) )

absolutely fantastic. Maliwan's cooking classes are wonderful. From taking our group of 4 to the market to see and experience their local food stuffs, to teaching us how to make the Thai dishes from scratch - Mae and her team were incredible. We got the recipes printed out and a certificate on completion . My travel buddie is not much of a chef, but even she thoroughly enjoyed the experience. Definitely a must when in Bangkok.

Great thing to do in Thailand!. My husband and i were off to Bangkok for our 10th year anniversary. It was our first time in BKK and we had the regular stuff planned : sight-seeing and shopping. Due to a good review in the Inflight magazine, we learned about the option of doing a cooking class and figured, why not?We were so glad that we did!REGISTERING FOR THE CLASS.
