It was very easy to book our class online. Among the different cooking classes offered, only Maliwan offered the chance to "customize" our lesson. There were different images on the website with descriptions which helped us pick what we wanted. I was a little disappointed that we could not pick different menus, but i understood that since we had only signed up the day before, 2 out of the 3 instructors were scheduled to be out of the kitchen that day. This being the case, we were asked if it would be alright to just stick to 4 menus. FINDING THE PLACE. The directions were most helpful, but because the entrance to the class is in a small alley, it took us awhile to figure it out. Based on the directions, after finding Kraisi road (which isn't that difficult), you have to keep your eyes open for a SMALL CHINESE temple to your left. Because there is a BIG Buddhist temple ACROSS the street, and because the Chinese temple isn't very obvious right away ... we passed the small alley without seeing it. The key is that you won't even cross to the end of Kraisi Road to reach Sipsamhang road ... it's RIGHT after the small Chinese temple to your left. You enter a small alley and follow the rest of their directions ... its not far from there :) ...Then we had the MARKET TOUR which was so much fun. My husband and i were lucky in that we were the only students registered for that class that day :) ... we got to ask our lovely host Mae all our questions which she patiently and enthusiastically answered. We even got a bonus of seeing the old lady who makes FRESH lumpia wrapper! It was one of the highlights of this experience.Then the COOKING EXPERIENCE. My husband and i enjoy cooking. Though we aren't chefs, we aren't novices in the kitchen. But what made the experience worth it was the way Mae (and her assistant Ja) would explain all the different spices and nuances with Thai cuisine. We each had our own work station, so we could go at our own pace. The ingredients were set out in a very organized manner which helped our work. We did a lot of the preparation from scratch which also made it very interesting.My husband and I were so glad that we capped our BKK experience with the Maliwan Thai Cooking Class. I am pretty sure that if we were ever to visit BKK again, this is something that we would do all over again :).

Learn how to cook great food. The experience was great from start to finish. The kitchen is clean and well organized, the instructions are printed out and you can take them with you home. The instructors (Chin and Mae) were really nice and it is obvious they know a lot about Thai food. Their guidance is really good and they are happy to give general tips and ideas how to prepare Thai dishes at home by substituting some ingredients.Probably the best thing about this cooking class is that you can choose the dishes, this was the main reason we picked it. They have a variety of options to choose from during your booking (via web, very convenient).The trip to the market is also fun and informative, you can learn about all the strange fruits and vegs you might have already seen in Thailand.Not only the cooking was enjoyable, but the end result was some of the best Thai food we have tried.Before you go there print out the map they send you with instructions for the taxi drivers in Thai. It is very close to Khaosan Rd and finding the place is not difficult, just read the map carefully.

Be a Thai Masterchef!. Excellent cooking class! I left feeling like a Thai Masterchef. It was a fun and relaxed cooking class, with wonderful tasting food cooked by my friends and I. The trip to the market was interesting and insightful to their culture and the instructors Mae and Dha was friendly and accommodating. It was an intimate class, with a very well equipped and clean kitchen with organised instructors and assistants. Plus, the printed recipes for us to take home are easy to follow and understand. The pictures of us cooking was a definite bonus to culminate the experience.

Highlight of Bangkok trip. The cooking class experience was great where the host, Mae gave us a good introduction to Thai cooking. The wet market visit was very insightful and the tuk tuk ride was fun. The cooking class is clean, organized and the instructors were great in guiding us. The dishes were tasty and I had an enjoyable morning with Maliwan Thai Cooking Class.
Excellent. We had a great experience with Mae at our cooking class. With a visit to the market and cooking some yummy Thai dishes. She was very easy to talk to and a great teacher.

Great people and excellent experience!. I had a wonderful time with Maliwan Thai cooking class. I've learned to cook Pad Thai, Green chicken curry, Tom Yum soup, and mango sticky rice. We started from exploring outdoor market for buying ingredients. Khun Mae gave us full of explanation on how the raw ingredients are used in thai cuisine. While we are cooking, she also explained each steps of procedures with culinary knowledge. If you like cooking and thai food, and are willing to learn more about thailand, this class is highly recommendable.

Great thai cooking class.. We had an amazing afternoon with Mae and the girls at Maliwan. We booked a custom class and learnt to cook pad thai, yellow curry, spring rolls and coconut chicken soup. We were lucky enough to be the only two in the class which led to a very personal experience. The market tour was informative and useful for understanding all the ingredients. The class was hands on the whole time with each of us cooking our own Serving of the dish. The food was delicious and straight forward enough to know we will cook it again back home. Highly recommend this class, but go with an empty stomach, there is alot of food!

Excellent Experience!!. A definite highlight to my Thailand trip! The Maliwan staff are professional and hospitable. The class was hands on and the food was amazing! I'm not a genius in the kitchen, but this opportunity gave me hands on to the Thai cuisine...from Pad Thai, chicken curry to mango sticky rice. It was fabulous. Very clean and efficient environment. I do recommend this if you have half a day to spare in Bangkok. Kudos to the Maliwan staff !!!

Delicious!. Maliwan Cooking School ist brilliant!Excellent service, great cooking experience and I loved the walk through the market before the cooking. Mae and Ja are nice and warmly people, I felt really welcome.

Great experience. I had an awesome time learning to cook thai dishes.We ended up being four students and Mae, the chef. Mae does a great job in teaching you how to prepare the dishes.Whenever someone encountered a problem or had a question she helped you out with a smile, just great. This course is suitable for everyone, beginners, intermediate or advanced cooks.The dishes tasted so nice you could think they came straight from a restaurant, hell, I think some were even better than what I had from time to time! :) We did pad thai, green curry chicken, coconut mango sticky rice and tom yum goong.The market visit where you buy some of the recipe's ingredients is nice as well, she explains what the thai chefs use for which dishes and so on, good thai ingredients-lesson right there.Overall just 5*, I paid 1500Baht, some pay 2000Baht, I wouldve paid 2000 with joy as well, well worth the few coins.

Awesome time, Fantastic food!. Mae was amazing. We did the pad Thai/green curry chicken/coconut mango sticky rice/Tom Yum Goong class. Love all those things, and I have to admit--with her guidance the two of us did FANTASTIC! Very tasty, good restaurant quality! The market visit was amazing also. I don't usually use this many superlatives in a review, but the class was great. Lots of time-savers too, she had helpers doing things like shredding fresh coconut for us after we gave it a go. Good thing too, that takes time! Although the taste between fresh, homemade coconut milk and canned is HUGE, so we might actually have to do the fresh thing at home sometime. They also took pictures & put them up on a private link afterwards. **We also went during the height of Songkran, and that was fun, although we got drenched on the way to the market & back. Bring extra clothes in a dry bag! and COME HUNGRY--we did & still couldn't eat it all. Great value for the money.

great experience. Mae is very nice, she explain everything with detail and answer all our questions. Taking cooking lessons helps a lot to understand thai culture, she took as to the market and show all the vegetables, fruits and meats and explain how they use it. We learn how to make green curry paste, pad thai and the great tom yam. It was delicious experience!!! I´ll definitely go back!

Learn to cook thai food. Had a great time learning to cook thai food at Maliwan with Mae! I was the only one that signed up for a class that afternoon, so my experience was as a lone student (though they can have up to 8 students per session). Everything was explained very well and patiently, including a lengthy visit to the market where many foods that we did not use were explained. The kitchen was well-equipped and very clean, with separate distilled drinking water. My food turned out delicious, and they even helped me pack up my leftovers for later. I can't wait to make it on my own!

ilove it..will definitely try this again :). This is the first thing i want to do in bangkok..attend cooking lesson..along with my husband, we went to the destination..maliwan is clean and well maintained..cooking time..we enjoyed every minute and every recipe we're cooking..and my favorite..sticky rice with mango and green curry :) instructor is simply the best..May is so helpful and kind together with the rest. Will definitely attend more lessons with them for more thai recipe :) thanks May and team for a wonderful experience

Very profession.. Very professional tutor, showed us the local market, and their kitchen also very profession and well organized. That day was only my friend and me, we spend a lovely afternoon at Maliwan.

Simply amazing. What to say? Simply amazing! well located, fresh ingredients from the market to make fine dishes, and last bust not least, our charming and lively chef Matinee who made our cooking easy and tasteful!We were amazed that our own dishes tasted that good :DCongrats to the team and keep it up !

Best cooking class ever. Maliwan thai cooking was really really fun. The staff are so friendly and helpful. I used to think i was a terrible cook but the chefs at maliwan made it so easy for me to make delicious food at such an affordable price, 10/10 would recommend. I want to go back and cook with them again!!

very professional. We found Maliwan cooking class after doing an extensive search on Internet, and chose it because we tought we found the best compromise: small class, good classic dishes, nice reviews. We have not been disappointed. The staff is very professional and friendly.The class we took starts with a local market visit, not too long, not too short, and then several dishes (each one of us is cooking the full dish).Everything looks new and clean, and the staff is both very friendly and professional.

Cooking in Thailand. Great experience. Took us shopping for groceries - via tuk tuk. Showed us how to prepare some of their wonderful dishes and gave us print-outs of the recipes to take home. Instructor and her assistance were wonderful. Send us lovely photos of our experience. Thank you.

Do something fun in Thailand. Doesn't want to keep shopping for this trip, then search any special to do. This is our first time cooking in oversea, we learn a lot of Thai material and spice through this lesson. The important point is Tutor teach us to cooked 4 delicious dishes, we can share to our family when we back. Nice Tutor and lovely assistant to prepared all the material before lesson, clean and tidy environment to moved us and have a wonderful noon time.

Friendly and fun authentic thai cookery class. I thought the class was brilliant - great value for money, nice facilities, friendly staff, and great food cooked. The lesson was almost five hours, and included visiting a local food market, preparing five dishes and taking home a brochure and all of the receipts. They also take photos of you in action and email them to you. Highly recommended!

One of my favorite Thailand experiences. The teacher is experienced and caring with good english, the trip to the market is very educational, the recipes and handouts are organized. The best food I had in Thailand, I made myself in her spotless kitchen. This was a highlight of my trip to Thailand.

Highlight of our trip!. My partner and I went overseas to celebrate his birthday. Our first stop was Bangkok. After hours of research, I went with Maliwan Thai Cooking School. The class was amazing. The ladies running it were extremely helpful and were very articulate. They took us to the local market (via tuk-tuk) and gave us an indepth understanding on local products and how they incoperate them in their cooking in day to day life. They were more than happy to answer our questions. We then ventured back and cooked four beautiful classic thai dishes. They tasted incredible and all so very filling. The class was small, which enabled us to get the help we needed. The girls continued giving us pointers along the way. At the end the girls gave us a certificate and the recipes we cooked that day. It was terrifc value for money.. I would more than happy suggest this to anyone. Can't wait to impress my family and friends with cooking one of these beautiful dishes.

THE best value, high quality Thai cooking with the friendliest staff.. This was our highlight in Bangkok and one of our overall trip highlights. They paid for our Tuk Tuk ride to the markets and then we returned to cook some great recipes. We cooked so much food that I couldn't possibly eat it all, but I especially loved the Kai Phad Bai Kaprao (Stir Fried Chicken) and Kaeng Phed Ped Yang (Red Duck Curry). The girls were just the nicest people in Bangkok (everyone we met in Bangkok was friendly so that says a lot). We went an hour and a half overtime, but the staff were determined to help us finish all the recipes, never complained once and never once lost their smile. They even quickly surprised us with a free Thai sweet tea drink (Cha ma now) which my girlfriend and I were talking to them about in the morning and was something they did just for us out of kindness. Just a wonderful introduction to the sights, smells and taste of Bangkok after we got off the plane (which thankfully wasn't late). For the price they ask for, it's a steal and I actually felt bad that I didn't pay more or do any washing up. Thanks girls, you were all beautiful! I'll be attempting the stir fried chicken this week!

comfotable class. Students in the class, but it was by chance alone, I learned without cutting corners, carefully, even if over the scheduled time. Where not even rudimentary tell if it is more than one number.Even though the result was throw away, I thought it was good in the market was able to buy more ingredients to obtain the return is difficult.Teacher, I think there is a business motivation, the next opportunity, and has been further growth.

Practical, interesting and delicious cooking class!. I love Thai cuisine! My Thai friend recommended me Maliwan cooking school when I visited Thailand. I booked a half day cooking class. This course combined practical cooking classes with Thai market visits. The class was really great! The teacher was very helpful and friendly and their kitchen was very clean. I learned one appetizer, one salad, one chicken and Thai curry there (and also coconut cream/milk...). It's a truly engrossing and delicious cooking class. Fantastic experience! Strongly recommendation!

Yummy Time!. Maliwan Cooking classes are great! I was visiting Thailand with my college friend and we were staying in the Khaosan Road area. My friend saw a flyer for the cooking school, and we decided to book a half day course. I’m really glad we did, it was great!We got to go around the local fruit and Veg market (which we never would have found on our own), then Maliwan showed us how to cook then we cooked them ourselves. Maliwan was really sweet, we were laughing the whole time during the cooking, but amazingly the food we cooked turned out to be really nice! I cook curry all the time now. I made Green Chicken Curry for my Mum last week and she loved it, which is great because normally she complains about my cooking! If you are on holiday in Bangkok, you should definitely try a course at Maliwan’s school. We loved it!

Learn to cook Thai!. My wife and I had the entire class to ourselves because the others had cancelled and we had a great time. Mae took us to the local market and explained how to pick fresh produce. The kitchen was very clean and inviting. All of the ingredients were laid out ahead of time so it felt like we were on a cooking show. Mae gave clear instructions and did all the cleaning. She also allowed us to substitute food items that we cannot eat. And the best part is you get to eat your dishes after you've cooked them! Such a great experience!

Fantastic Cooking class. We were on our honeymoon and wanted to learn some authentic Thai dishes to take home with us. I found the Maliwan cooking school online before we left. Booking online was easy. The class was great! The teachers were great in explaining all of the ingredients and generally being helpful and friendly. We had a great time and were so pleased to get an email after we had left with some photo's of us. A would highly recommend if you are in Bangkok!

GREAT OVERALL EXPERIENCE!. My husband and I took the Baipai Thai cooking class while we were on our honeymoon in Thailand. We truly enjoyed the entire experience! The introduction to thai cooking essentials, the structure of the class, quality of the instructors and food we prepared were outstanding! We had a small group of 3 other people which made it even more enjoyable. We prepared and enjoyed 5 courses of traditional thai food and were given several souvenirs to bring home. You could purchase beer to enjoy throughout the session. The facilities and cooking tools we used were clean and the property was beautiful! Well worth every dollar and would recommend this experience to anyone visiting Bangkok with 1/2 a day to spare who is interested in learning some thai cooking!

An awesome experience with great staff and a beautiful location!!. Everything I experienced with this cooking class was excellent!! The booking process was easy and efficient. The arrangements for pick up were convenient and professional. The market experience was one of the best markets I have seen during my time in Bangkok! I enjoyed tasting different fruits, spices and snacks. June opened my mind to tasting more food than I normally would. The staff was professional and a joy to be around. I truly enjoyed the people and the food was DELICIOUS!! I cannot forget the location. It was very clean, comfortable and serene. I wanted to stay just to enjoy the grounds. I would highly recommend this class. It is worth the cost and more!

Good introduction to Thai cuisine. Baipai Thai Cooking School is a hidden gem tucked away in a residential area. Making a reservation through their website was easy. Email confirmation of my reservation was no problem as well. Their very good and careful driver picked me and my classmates up from our hotels in a spacious van and also brought us back after our afternoon class.They gave us a cup of cold lemongrass tea as a welcome drink and asked if we had any allergies or preferences so that everyone would be accommodated and comfortable.The class was a good introduction to Thai cuisine. Maybe some people will find it too easy or not challenging enough, but I think foundations are important. Having knowledge and awareness of some of the herbs, spices, and other ingredients used in Thai cooking is a great way to discover how Thai dishes always have this amazing balance of sweet, sour, bitter, salty, and sometimes spicy.We were given recipe cards to try to recreate the dishes at home, as well as photos of our time in class. Thank you very much once again to June, Chef Puu, and everyone at Baipai Thai Cooking School. I would like to attend another class in the future, perhaps one with a dessert included. I would also like to explore the place some more, as it is styled like a bungalow with amazing architecture.

Excellent team building activity. Our team of 9 from Singapore, China, Pakistan and India thoroughly enjoyed the market visit and cooking class by Bai Pai. Big thanks to June and Noi! Everyone was extremely pleased with the outcome. Now that we are back in our respective countries, we are excited to try the recipes and replicate what we've done in Bangkok.

Cooking Oasis. This is the most gorgeous cooking "estate" I have ever been to. When you arrive its like you're at a high end spa. The view and facility if beautiful, the staff and guides are super friendly and accommodating. We made 3 dishes and ate the last dish as a group upstairs. I was very happy to participate in this cooking class and cant wait to have my friends join me for another lesson.

A morning filled with joy :). You won't regret spending a morning in the Baipai Thai Cooking School! The school was so well planned from picking and introducing herbs, cutting skills, choosing the right ingredient, cooking and presentation. The environment has nothing to criticize - clean and beautiful! The chef NOI and the assistant GOOD were so friendly and patient in introducing every bit of Thai cooking skills, and our party enjoyed the morning so much!The school also took snapshots while you were attentively cooking, and they made you a small photoframe before we left! We were also sent back all the photos by email before we actually returned home! That small touch was really sweet! I have no doubt to recommend Baipai Thai Cooking School to anyone visiting Bangkok!

A must do!!!. We were picked up at our hotel and taken to house. Beautiful open air kitchen. It was so much fun and the food was so good. Totally hands on class. June and Noi were funny and very good at instructing. Would recommend it to everyone.

Stunning afternoon with hands-on Thai food experience!. We visited recently and highly enjoyed the experience. We were picked up from our hotel in Bangkok and promptly escorted to the lovely school. Housed in a stunning house, we enjoyed the open-air views and the exceptionally friendly staff. Our chef was friendly and fun, and very knowledgeable. It was a great way to spend the afternoon! Not only was there the actually cooking class, the overview of the different Thai herbs at the beginning was very enjoyable as well. Highly recommend!

nice staff and good recipe. they offer pick up and drop off service. I took a half day course and it was usuful class. during the class one staff took pictures and after the class they printed one and gave it to me.

Excellent way to master Thai cooking. I did an afternoon course with my 13 and 14 year olds. The course was fun, the English spoken was excellent and the food was amazing. We were in a group of 7 students and prepared 4 dishes - each in the style of the chef preparing them first while we watched, us tasting to see what it should be like and then we copied. We then ate the food we'd prepared. We were given copies of the recipes to take home and photos taken during the session were emailed on to us - which was a lovely touch. The school offer collection from your hotel and drop off back inclusive in the price. Drinks were available to buy to have with your food but plenty of iced water is also provided so buying drinks not necessary. There is a small gift shop but no pressure to buy. If you have any interesting in cooking/Thai food I would recommend this course.

fun cooking class! . i tried many cooking class in Bangkok. it was first time in Baipao. I like how teachers explain Thai cuisine ingredient. if i visit again, i want to do cooking class and market tour. thank you so much Kind and Beautiful teachers! ☺️친절하고 재미있게 태국음식과 재료를 설명해주시는 선생님 덕분에 즐겁게 태국여행을 마무리 지을 수 있었습니다. 촉박한 일정에 시장투어는 못했지만, 다음에 오면 꼭 하고 싶어요!

Best Cooking Class Ever. After Baipai, I try to sneak in a cooking class every time that I travel to a new country (although Baipai is by far the best class that I have ever done). It's a great way to learn more about food and culture. While I was interning in Bangkok in 2008, I went to Baipai once on my own and once with my mother while she was visiting. Both trips were wonderful. The open-air kitchen is absolutely beautiful and the cook and interpreter were lots of fun and very helpful. I love that they show you how it's done and then let you cook your own meal. They really have the entire process down to an art. I use the recipes that I learned all the time, and I even grow Thai eggplants, basil, and peppers on my balcony in New York City now! Also, I bought one of the aprons and love it. It's really good quality and still in great condition all these years later.

Fun half day out cooking!. This was a very nice, well-organized class with good food. The class was full but it never felt that there were too many people. The hosts were very nice and funny, and attentive. It's a nice retreat out of the city. Mind that not all classes have the same recipes, mine had pad thai which was great but not all have. All 4 dishes were very tasty!

A really classy class. Just been to Bai Pai Cooking School and had a fantastic morning learning to cook the Thai way. An excellent experience from the moment we arrived to the final mouth full. June and her chef Puu were fabulous hostesses and excellent tutors. I loved being able to see every move and then be able to have a go myself. The food was excellent and the company equally good. A thoroughly pleasurable experience. An added bonus was the photos that arrived on my phone before I got back to my hotel a really nice touch. Thank you Bai Pai for a great trip - I have no hesitation in recommending this activity.

Best cooking fun ever. Don't eat a big breakfast before you go! June & Puu were fantastic hosts/chefs. So kind & considerate for all needs, helpful to the kids (I'd advise they can use a knife before you go) & met my vegetarian request, perfectly integrating ingredients into the menu with no problems. They even got my fussy eating 13 year old to try curry, flavouring & exotic foods. Can't recommend it strongly enough, in fact we want Puu to come to Chiang Mai with us to cook for the next 4 days! Thank you so much.

An excellent experience . This is our first time to cook the Thai food . It's really an excellent experience ! We took the morning class so that we can explore the market. The teachers are patient ,helpful and inspiring . We must back again next time !

Great great great!. I had a great afternoon at Baipai Cooking School! The team is really nice and they teach you the classic ingreditents live in the garden. The cooking by seeing is also very easy and they take the time to tell you everything and how to do.There are also a few girls which work in the background and do everything that you have a smooth cooking experience. (while you are eating the first dish they already provide the increditents for the second dish)Also nice: They provide a driver for you! Just ask for the pickup (which is included in the price) and they tell you which hotels are possible. If your hotel isn`t in the area no problem - just go to the next hotel they drive to and wait in the lobby. Easy!Every cooking, every dish and for sure the pictures you will get (from yourself while cooking) are great ... next time i`ve been in bangkok i will come again and learn more from Noi!

Such a fun time!. My husband and I visited Baipai cooking class. It is located in a beautiful setting and the experience was fun and interactive. I would definitely recommend it! They also take photos and email them to you after. Because it was our honeymoon, they made a special card at the end as well!

Honeymoon activity. Had a lovely afternoon cooking with chef noi. Great atmosphere and a great way to relax and learn about the local foods. Would recommend anyone to do this. Transfer to and from our hotel

Informative and Friendly. This was the highlight of my stopover in Bangkok.The school is located in a little oasis away from the traffic and bustle of the city. The teachers, June and Chef Noi, were very welcoming. The food that we cooked was amazing. And so much that I didn't need to eat again until the next day. It was great to pick up so many tips and tricks from such good chefs.

A wonderful afternoon at Baipai. My first visit with girlfriend. A worthwhile afternoon spent in good company with Chef Puu, June and 5 other overseas visitors to share our experiences. Explanations so easy to follow. Chef Puu and June, full of humour, made cooking so easy. The school is set in rustic spa setting, beautiful bungalow in thai architecture. Really a worthwhile afternoon spent than endless shopping, eating.

Mrs. Moira Feely Rekus. Baipai Thai cooking school was recommended by a friend. It was amazing. We truly enjoyed our experience!! Chef Puu, June and all the staff were amazing. We had such a good time that we booked our teenagers for Saturday. We want them to experience Thai cooking with this great staff. Thanks for a fantastic experience while visiting Bangkok.

A great experience and fantastic meal. This is well worth it. The cooking class itself is fun and informative. The food that you cook is very tasty and plentiful (come with an empty stomach). And the class takes place in a beautiful compound with highly relaxing water features and gardens. This is a good activity for teenagers and grown ups alike.

Lovely way to learn Thai cuisine. We have now been back for our third visit to this cooking school, and it just gets better every time.The chefs are knowledgeable, witty and really good in the kitchen. The atmosphere is fun and the classes are interactive. You get to meet people from all around the world and share travel stories, but the bonus is that you eat the various dishes you prepared as a group.We will always go back to Bai Pai.

Fair. This school was good for 1/2 day cooking course. It was far from our Hotel on Sukhumvit. Would not pick us up at our hotel because out of their pickup area. Walked 10 minutes to the Sheraton for the pickup. Told to wait in lobby, driver could no find us. The instructors were ok but would not repeat for the price.

Enjoyable hands on Thai cooking experience!!. Within the first few days of our trip, we escaped from the hectic traffic and the never-ending shopping that Bangkok is renowned for, to a pleasantly relaxing yet spicey cooking session at Bapai Thai cooking school. Our sensory journey started with a surprise visit to Or Tor Khor market - new smells and tastes!!! Staff, notably foodie experts, then transferred us to the school kitchen for a fun - filled lesson preparing a 3 course menu. Chef Puu shared Thai gourmet secrets with us and June's sense of humour certainly didn't go unnoticed! The end product said it all and I most certainly would do it again on a next BKK trip.

Well worth it!. Visited in July 2016 with my wife as part of a Thailand birthday trip. We only had 2 days (actually more like 40 hours) in Bangkok, before heading off to Koi Samui for an island break.  When my wife found out I had booked half a day in a cooking class, she was not impressed. She felt that given our limited time, we should be out exploring the city. However I convinced her stick with it, as it had been highly recommended by a friend. The friendly driver picked us up from the hotel at 0845, and we had the usual exciting Bangkok driving experience. The school was quite far from the hotel, and the traffic was pretty heavy. Still got there on time, and the final drive through winding lane ways was fascinating. When you arrive at this little island of paradise amongst the city sprawl, it really takes your breath away.  The entire cooking experience was a joy, from beginning to end. Warmly greeted, we sat around a table with a relatively small group and each introduced ourselves. Our host, June, was charming and warm, getting some laughs right off the bat. Issued with our 'Masterchef' aprons and obligatory waist towel, we were then led down to the beautiful garden for a series of informational talks. Starting with the touch/taste/smell of herbs and plants used in Thai cooking is genius. It's a casual way to meet the group, and sensitises you to the tastes and flavours of Thai cooking.  The actual kitchen and cooking experience was fantastic - perfect blend of Thai countryside character and high quality equipment and facilities. For each meal on our four course menu, we would first gather around the main teaching table where Chef Puu would demonstrate. She is clearly a professional, but made sure to bring us all along on the journey, explaining everything. We would also prepare our own sauces and ingredients here. When ready to cook, we were each dispatched back to our own cooking station to prepare our meal. The chef and host would dart around making sure we each managed to keep up with the recipes, some of which were surprisingly complex. Everything worked perfectly. And the meals were divine. Best of all, between each course a quiet crew of cleaners would sweep through, sorting everything away and preparing everything for the next section. Could do with that at home! Anyway, my wife had a huge smile on her face the entire time, and we both took loads of photos (but no video!). Start to finish it was a great experience, and we both decided it was a great way to spend some of our limited time in Bangkok. Will definitely return in future.

An amazing experience!. I looked on Internet at different cooking schools to invite my husband for his birthday. I choose Baipai because it had great reviews, they organized the pick up at different hotels and the place on the pictures looked really nice.When we arrived it was exactly as expected: the place was stunning with a very nice Thai house, a big garden and some water features. The chef and the staff was extremely friendly and very professional. The cooking infrastructure was great in a very big open space. We really loved it! They gave us a book with all the receipes and they sent us by email all the pictures they took of our day. I am really glad I choose this school and as we just moved to Bangkok I will definitely go back there with some friends and family.

Fantastic cooking class!. This was brilliant. Puu and June were professional, friendly and both had a fantastic sense of humour. The setting is beautiful - cooking open air in a very well laid out and professional cooking school. It was the extra details that really made this stand out above other classes I have done - the mirror angled above the chef's station so that you could see inside the pans, the quality of the ingredients, and the helpful staff clearing away after you in a very subtle way. I will definitely be back during my time in Bangkok! One tip - wear plenty of mosquito repellent - it is outdoors and I came back with a fair few bites as well as some Thai cooking skills!

Truly fun whatever your level. Other than learning to cook some amazing Thai food this experience was truly made by the two wonderful ladies leading us novice cooks through the experience. Puu and June made the entire thing simple, un-pressured and most of all fun.A wonderful experience regardless of your cooking ability - go do it.
Great experience . Simply loved it there. My friends and I could easily learn some of the best Thai dishes and the teachers were so friendly!

Rookies can learn to cook. I would recommend this cooking school for anyone who likes Thai food even if you do not cook well or at all.The school starts with a tour of the Ot To Kor Market. This market provides a great overview of the types of food you can use in Thai cooking. If you are in a place that has cookin g facilities you may want to return here for fresh food to prepare.The cooking school is well laid out with a grow pare to observe the chefs prepare the dishes and then individual cooking stations to allow each student to try to match the chef's creation. Lots of help for the rookies. My wife was scheduled to cook with me but had to cancel at the last minute. Although we could not get a refund they prepared a full meal for her to take back to the hotel.The dishes I prepared were; stir fried Chicken with cashew nuts, spicy grilled beef salad and stir fried rice noodle thai style (Pad Thai).The school can handle three groups in separate areas (prob about 20 per group)Great day

Very enjoyable. Never been to a cooking class. And Thai is one of my favourite foods so decided to take this class based on reviews.Booked online and reservations were sent promptly. There are different cooking choices based on what day you attend. And a follow up email confirming attendance and pick up time.Did the market tour first. Very interest to see all the raw ingredients. Made it easier when shopping later on one own.We were given small treats and water will in the market.We were then taken to the cooking school.My menu was the hot and sour prawn soup,pork parcels and green Thai curry.The prawn soup I have had in Bangkok on my first day and I did not like it at all so wasn't looking forward to making it in the class. But surprisingly it tasted 100% better . The trick was if the soup is left out too long it becomes very sour. So fresh soup is more tasty. It's now my favourite dish.I don't eat pork and they replace mine with chicken so very accommodating. Tasted amazing.Green Thai Curry was made from scratch. And the process was very tedious but enjoyable. My curry tasted amazing. No oil was used as well.I really enjoyed this class and would go further to say this is a must do.Warning when using a mortar and pestle don't look down into the mortar, one of the guest got chill in her eyes not a pretty site.The cooking teacher Pyo was amazing. Spoke clear English and was very funny. Thanks to her I had a very enjoyable class.I have returned home and have made the green curry and it's amazing, the taste was reproducible. Ingredients wasn't easy to find but I managed.

Best part of our Thai culinary experience! . My husband and I booked an afternoon class at Baipai Thai Cooking School, and it was one of the best meals we've had throughout our stay. The setting is just the perfect break from the hustle and bustle of Bangkok. Set in a stunning serene garden. Our hostess June, and Chef Noi were incredible throughout- entertaining, knowledgeable, accommodating, and really engaging. The ingredients were fresh, making for rich flavours and fragrance. We also thoroughly enjoyed interacting with other participants, and exchanging notes and suggestions on things to try while in Bangkok. We also appreciated their suggestion that we take the BTS back into the city afterwards as this saved us at least 2 hours bat we would've spent in peak traffic. We look forward to another experience at Baipai the next time we visit.

An Awesome Thailand Experience . We can't say enough great things about this place. From our hotel shuttle pickup to the ens of our class, this cooking school was very well organized. The place itself is beautiful...A good, clean and comfortable environment.Host June and Chef Noi were very knowledgeable, friendly and overall amazing! Thank you both for giving us a memorable moment in Bangkok!Kenneth and Jamar

My Favorite Activity in Bangkok. I cannot say enough great things about our time at the Baipai cooking school. Our host and chef were both very friendly, fun and kept us involved the whole time. They taught us a lot about Thai food and the ingredients that go in to traditional cooking. They did a great job of showing us how to make something and then have us try it right away while it was still fresh in our minds. The cookbooks were a great help and will be even better when we try to make the food for friends and family at home. This was my favorite part of our trip and has inspired me to take cooking classes everywhere else I travel in the future.

Very tasty cooking class. Pickup was ok, we had to wait 20min for another person who had booked which didn't even show up but this was outside their control and the driver tried many times to call them and then the operator of the tour apologized for the wait.The venue was very nice and well set out and very quiet. The cooking was well run and they took photos of you while you were cooking which they e-mailed through straight after the class which was a nice touch.We enjoyed ourselves, thanks

Wonderful cooking experience~ <3. Nice place and very relaxing cooking class. Beautiful Thai house with well equipped cooking facilities and equipments. Half-day class, 8:30am pick up at hotel and back around 1pm. June and Chef Puu @Baipai both extremely friendly and helpful. I will highly recommend to my friends. Xx Charmaine

Beautiful location; Amazing and accommodating staff. The staff at the Baipai Thai Cooking School blew me away! They were so friendly and accommodating to me and my mother and sister. My mom wrote on her comment card that she did not eat pork, and without her even asking they switched it for chicken in one dish. My mom got overheated at one point (Thailand in May is HOT) and they took care of her, bringing her water and setting up a fan to make her more comfortable. At the end they drove us to a location different from our hotel, which they did not need to do at all.The facility itself is gorgeous. Its spa meets island bungalow meets Thai cooking school. All of the cooking is outdoors. The bathrooms are clean. The cooking locations are similar to a Benihana with the chef in the middle demonstrating and the students sitting around in a semi-circle. All of the ingredients were pre-portioned out for you and after you were finished with each step, staff members cleaned up your station extremely quickly.The food was delicious. We made three courses: fried pork dumplings, Tom Yum soup with shrimp, and green curry chicken. The demonstrations were well done and easy to follow and everyone had their own work space.The staff at the end gave us all little magnets with a photo of us cooking printed out inside and followed up a day or two later with an email attaching all the additional photos they took of us throughout the day.I highly recommend this cooking school. The staff was so professional and kind and really went above and beyond to make sure everyone was enjoying themselves!

Professional and delicious. We had a great time at Bai Pai! After picking us up at our hotel in central Bangkok, June and our chef learned us some great thai dishes alltogether with a good laugh. As special treathment for my birthday they made me a special wishcard and sang me a birthdaysong. Thanks again for this great experience! Xx Peter and Eva

You have to got there. My 4th visit at Baipai Thai Cooking School it is like going to the temple. My 3 favorite things in Bangkok are Baipai School, Temple of Dawn and Lebua Tower. I enjoy every class at Baipai Thai Cooking School and I know I'll be back soon. Very nice atmosphere, great instructors and Thai hospitality. 4 hours session getting to know secrets of Thai cooking.A lot of fun while cooking Thai dishes, meet people from around the world.Thanks again

Best Cooking Class!. The BaiPai Thai cooking school's campus is beautiful. The kitchen is fully equipped and updated. Apple was our host and she was fantastic. We learned how to cook four thai dishes. Our favorite was stir-fried chicken with cashew nuts and the Pad Thai. Our chef Puu (sp) was extremely knowledgeable and she showed us every detail that goes into making the Thai dishes we learned. We learned a whole lot while still having tons of fun! We would recommend this cooking class to anyone visiting Bangkok! We can not wait to try some of out Thai dishes at home. Thank you for the awesome experience!

Awesome and unforgetable Thai cooking class. We enjoyed every moment during the class,nice place with well equipped cooking facilities and equipments. Very good chef, very good staffs Noi and admin staffs. We learned 4 dishes Thai food with full information of ingredients inside one cooking book. Chef showed us step by step how to prepare and cook. We cooked for ourselves after the chef showed us, and we ate the food after we cooked. They provided pick up services at most of the hotels in central parts of BKK. We love to join the class on our next trip to BKK.

Best day ever!. The Baipai Thai Cooking School was so well organized! It was amazing and well worth it. The kitchen was impeccably clean and the classes were taught in English. The day starts with a driver picking you up at your hotel (included) and taking you to an open market where you meet up with your host and the other class members. We had June and she was AMAZING! Really funny and informative. She took us around the market, explained the different ingredients to us and had us taste many different things. She even suggested appropriate substitutions in case we were unable to find the ingredients at home. The actual class takes place in a beautiful kitchen setting where you first observe the head Chef prepare the recipe and taste her version. Then you take your ingredients and cook your own recipes. The first half of the class we made Chicken in Pandanus leaves appetizer and a Green Papaya Salad. You then take a break and enjoy your creation. The second half of the class we made Red Curry Paste and then used the Red Curry Paste to make Pork Coconut Curry. You then sit and enjoy your curry meal with the rest of your classmates. I would definitely do this again when we come back. The recipes vary from morning to afternoon classes.

Excellent day cooking. June & Puu were 2 excellent hosts & teachers at our thai cooking course. The facilities were excellent - food fantastic! We were given recipe cards, emailed lots of photos that they took for us during the course and were provided with lots of information on thai cooking. It was a hands on course where each person had their wok, gas burner etc and each person made every dish.

Wonderful experience. We'll be back!. This was a wonderful activity during our stay in Bangkok. We were picked up from our hotel in a mini-bus and met others who had booked for the day. 2 couples had been before and were returning for another lesson, and another 4 had already been to other cooking schools, so we were the beginners!First stop was a fabulous market - complete with sparkling white tiled floor. Not what we were used to in Thai markets, but huge and completely fascinating. We were shown around with great explanations on many ingredients. We bought some fresh ingredients to cook for the day.Then off to the Cooking School. Firstly we were struck with how beautiful the Thai house and water garden were, and also with how professionally the whole experience had been planned. We all sat around a central kitchen, where we were shown how to do things. We then practiced, before heading over to our individual kitchen stations.My husband who had refused to go initially, - and only came kicking and screaming - was totally absorbed and loved it. The girls (chefs) have great fun and a super sense of humour and the luncheon we cooked was sublime!You could buy beers, wine and soft drinks for the lunch.We're going back at Christmas with friends, and this is definitely on the itinerary again!Oh... and all the others who had done cooking schools in Bangkok before, told us that this was by FAR the best. They had initially recommended others, but then told us not to bother after experiencing this one.

Highlight of my trip. A fantastic experience and the highlight of my trip. The staff are fantastic - extremely friendly and helpful. They also offer a free hotel pick-up. On arrival you are greeted with a drink and then shown around the garden to see what some of the fresh ingredients in Thai cooking look like. I found this really helpful as I did not know some of these herbs and spices. You are also shown the traditional method of making coconut cream and then you are introduced to the spicy, sour, salty and sweet aspect of Thai cuisine with a tasting session of different flavours e.g. tamarind paste etc. After that, its on with the cooking. You are provided with step by step recipes for the dishes you make. They also have a small souvenir shop. Perhaps management should think about selling some of the ingredients used in the cooking class. You are given a fridge magnet with a photo of you as a gift and the rest of the photos they took are emailed to you.Thank you again to the staff at Baipai Thai Cooking School for two wonderful experiences.

Wonderful family event!. Our teenage daughters thought this was the best part of our Bangkok experience! We loved the instructors, the food and the fact that they picked us up from our hotel. We are back now and have been making tons of Thai food! Loved it and would HIGHLY recommend to everyone!

A Must Do!. My husband and I joined the morning class at Bai Pai last Wednesday and had the most wonderful time. We chose to meet our host June at the local market before heading to the school to cook our 3 dishes with our chef, Noi. I cannot speak highly enough of this experience! June made us feel so welcome and was so enthusiastic as she took us round the market. Once at the school she and Noi made the class so much fun! Apart from the friendly staff, it is also clean and the school and its surroundings are just beautiful. A free shuttle service is provided from the city (we could not avail ourselves of this as we were staying further out, but we were given clear instructions about where to meet); cold drinking water, tea and coffee are available throughout the class; aprons and hand towels are provided; there is a lovely area to wash your hands; you are given a little folder with the recipes inside and a souvenir photo fridge magnet at the end; and the food we prepared was just delicious. We loved how Noi demonstrated, then we tasted before we set about cooking our own. Bai Pai Thai Cooking School is a must do for everyone visiting Bangkok. 10 out of 10! :)

THE BEST CULINARY EXPERIENCE. The experience started with the shuttle pick up at our hotel. The shuttle was air conditioned and it made one other stop to collect other members of that day's class.Our guide then took us to a local market where we got an education on the ingredients that go into Thai dishes. We walked around the market and sampled different items and then we were off to the cooking school.The ladies who taught the class were excellent. They were friendly and really engaging with the entire group. They equally shared their time with the cooking pairs and carefully guided us through the basics of preparing certain Thai dishes.We prepared 3 different dishes and they all came out lovely. The presentation was excellent and the taste was everything I expected from Thai food. We also met some wonderful people from different countries in our class and that also made the experience at Baipai one of my best memories of Bangkok.I certainly recommend Baipai Thai Cooking School!

THE BEST ACTIVITY I DID IN BANGKOK. AMAZING!. Unreal and I'll be telling my friends it is a MUST DO. The classroom is open and the location is peaceful. The staff are so friendly and funny. Just the whole way the class was run was unreal. You always got to watch and then taste the teachers work before you went on to do your own and try it. They take photos of your too that are sent to your personal email. Plus you get to take home the recipes you learnt and you have the option to buy more if you like. I don't cook much at home but I cannot wait to do the recipes I learnt from family and friends. Taste better than Thai take out (PS. I'm an Australian)! So cool can't rave about it enough!

We loved our class at Baipai Thai cooking school!. My husband and I visited Thailand for the first time and wanted to learn authentic Thai cooking. Baipai Thai cooking school was an incredible experience. We went to the market with June and learned what Thai ingredients to buy. It was very informative and fun to try all of the different things. Back at the school the atmosphere was beautiful and everyone was so nice and helpful. It was extremely professional and well organized. We loved every minute! We would 100% recommend doing this class. We will be back next trip to Thailand!

Fun day trip!. My sister and I found out about this day trip through our hotel. We booked the day trip and had so much fun at the cooking school. The demonstration was outside and everything was clean. I felt like I was at a resort or spa (nice building). The teachers communicated very well and demonstrated various recipient and cooking techniques. We prepared four dishes and left very full.

Beauitiful informative, wonderful . Mum and i attended a cooking class here yesterday and she is heading back with my sister today..Noi and June were amazingly friendly, funny and helpful. Beautiful tranquil surroundings and the food was incredible. Instructions and recipes were clear and even though i rarely cook, i did well due to their help and instructions.Could not recommend more highly

Interesting and informative. We attended a course here last week and learnt so much... the staff were lovely and very knowledgeable, the setting is stunning.. very peaceful and tranquil and the whole experience set us up well for our weeks in Thailand... can't wait to go home and start experimenting... never a dull stir fry again!!!

Must do cooking class. This place is fantastic. They have a beautiful building and gardens to make the perfect setting. Our host June and Chef were a great combination; funny, friendly and informative. You will learn about the key ingredients in Thai food and then cook 3-4 dishes. It's great fun.

Wonderful. We had a wonderful afternoon at the school.They picked us up ans brought us to the school which was just beautiful located and it's open with a garden. There are no walls around just a roof. They showed us all fresh flowers and herbs and coconut.We cooked on a big table where she showed how to do it and we always could try a little from the meal and then cooked on our own. We had four meals, they were delicious. We've got all the receipes and great memorys. Thank u!

Fun cooking experience in a lovely atmosphere. I had a great cooking class at Baipai. Initially, I chose it because of all the highly rated cooking classes, this one took place in a beautiful, spacious Thai style house away from bustling downtown. The house / cooking school is relaxing and lovely.But the best part was the professional staff, who made the class fun, informative and I was able to execute the dishes well.Everything from the recipe cards/folder to teaching style to free pick up service was very well done. I will be back again soon!

Nice staff, great recipes and lots of fun. Everyone who loves thai food and cooking should do such a cooking class. And I would definitely suggest to go to Baipai. The staff is adorable and they speak a very good English which makes it easy to follow the instructions. They took care of us very well, inclusing also the pickup from the hotel etc. Go there and learn how to make curry paste with your own hands :-)

Fantastic cooking experience. Spending 4 hours learning about Thai food should be one of the main attraction of a visit to Bangkok. This school not only provides excellent cooking classes but you learn about the herbs/vegetables used in Thai recipes, seeing some of these growing and you learn about the flavors of Thai foods and how to get the various flavors of Salty, Sour, Sweet and Spicy. Then you start cooking - watching the chef explain the dishes as she makes them and then doing them yourself. Of course, you not only taste the dishes the chef makes but you get to eat the ones you make. The food was absolutely delicious and we brought home doggy bags! As you are participating, they take pictures which are sent to you after your visit. Shuttle service is provided from selected hotels. Definitely a highlight of our visit to Bangkok. Noi, our chef and June, her colleague were great guides and we look forward to testing our new skills upon returning home.

A must try cooking class in Bangkok. Well designed class with great environment. The school building itself was beautiful. The experiences they brought to us was even more wonderful. We could see many herbs alive in the garden and observed the whole plants . We could see, smell, and even taste them. The demonstration was clear and they provided recipe cards that you can bring it home so that we could follow the instructions easily. The kitchen was nice. The chef and staff were very friendly and considering. The free pick-up shuttle was another great service. I had a great time there and highly recommanded the cooking class at Baipai.

Outstanding. We just got back from our afternoon cooking class at Baipai cooking school and can't recommend it enough. June and Song were exceptional cooks and instructors! We started with a discussion of the different types of herbs and ingredients that are Thai staples. They then showed us how to make coconut cream and coconut milk. From here we moved in to the open air kitchen to start our lesson. We started with one of our favorites .....spring rolls. We also made the dipping sauce for them which was excellent! From spring rolls we made a pork larb salad. This too was excellent. Next up was my all time favorite......Tom Ka Gai. Again......excellent. We finished up with a minced pork and rice noodle dish which was also excellent. June and Song were very helpful and assisted each person to insure that they were preparing the dishes properly. They also broke each dish down into simple steps that were quick and easy to follow. I will definitely try the spring rolls, larb and Tom Ka Gai when I get home.They also attended to all the details from taking photos to printing recipe cards! All in all......I would highly recommend Baipai Thai cooking school to anyone who wants to learn to quickly and easily make a few Thai dishes on their own!

A Must- Do!. I honestly wasn't quite sure what to expect from this as it was booked by a friend on vacation with me, but I am so glad they did! They staff was wonderful from the moment we were picked up and taken to the local market to the end when we were able to sit together and enjoy the wonderful meal we had prepared. The whole experience was amazing from start to finish and I would definitely do it again!

Thai cooking from scratch. We took a half-day class and the food we prepared was amazing. The staff discussed the ingredients we were using & how we could use and/or buy & how to store the items back at home. The school is lovely, and the menus all sounded great so it was difficult to decide which day to attend. They provide you with a recipe book, and after the class send you photos from your class. It was a very nice break from sightseeing in busy Bangkok. They also transport you to and from the school which is great since the school would be difficult to find otherwise.

Very Good. We have done a few cooking schools and this one is FANTASTIC cannot fault this one ,they pick you up at your hotel and take you to the markets where you get a tour and then on to the cooking class absolutely fantastic , all the recipes were easy to follow the instructor and if any problems occurred they were ready to show you one on one. Great day for the money.

Great Cooking Class!. Amazing Cooking Class from start to finish. We did the morning class with the market trip - June was our instructor and guide and it was quite fun to learn about the different Thai spices and watch how coconut milk is made. The cooking class itself was great - very easy to follow along, but complicated enough to feel like you were making a full dish. June and the assistants constantly walked around as you cooked, making sure you were doing everything correctly. The food itself was amazing - fresh ingredients, and was so happy to do this early in our trip, as the rest of the trip we could recognize the ingredients and know what they were. The class comes with a take home cookbook of what you made, and they email you pictures of you that day, which was very impressive. Would totally do again!

Superb experience, beginning to end. Baipai staff picked us up from our central Bangkok hotel appx 60 minutes prior to the start time of our class. Transportation was in a small (appx 15 passenger) motor coach. Upon arrival, lockers are provided for personal belongings. Our class started with our assistant chef who took us around the beautiful and immaculate property to show us the various herbs and vegetables we would be using to create our dishes. Our class consisted of preparing several courses including appetizers (papaya salad and fried chicken thighs) main course (red curry with pork) and mango sticky rice for dessert. Directions are provided by the chef and assistant chef to groups of 10-15 at a time so the experience was very hands on and intimate. The cooking facilities were open air and immaculate. The property was beautiful with foliage, water and many lanai areas. Our entire experience was fantastic. The one thing that caught many (including us) off guard was at the end of the class we were told the driver would not be dropping us back at our hotel due to traffic. Instead we would be dropped at the BTS station. The BTS ride back to sukhumvit was inexpensive (appx 40 baht) and the BTS was extremely clean, cool and fast. We think it was a much more enjoyable experience than sitting in a warm motor coach for a long drive back.

Once in a lifetime experience!. My fiancé and I love to cook, and had heard great things about Thai cooking classes. Baipai met all our expectations and more.The staff was very responsive over email (though I did email twice to make sure the reservation was captured correctly).We did a morning class, were picked up at our hotel at 8:30 and were back by 3pm. We started at the market, then went to their absolutely picturesque school to learn and eat three delicious dishes.Also, doing this at the beginning of our 2 week trip throughout Thailand made everything else even more awesome, and gave us even greater appreciation for each meal we ate.June was a phenomenal instructor - friendly, funny, and professional.Highly, highly recommended!

Family fun at its best. My wife and I took our adult children here today. We ALL had a great time! Fun for everyone. They picked us up from our hotel and "taught" us how to cook for about 4 hours. Everyone left satisfied, and with a little better knowledge of Thai cooking. We'll go again.

So Much Fun!. This was one of our favorite parts of our trip to Thailand. The grounds of the school was very Zen. They teach you step by step how to make great Thai dishes. By the end you're so full! So much fun!

Nice experience. Very nice place, I would recommend the place to everyone who want to know more about thai food. You get pick up before and after the class which was nice. After the class I was really stuffed with amazing food :)

Excellent Expierence!!. The location is off the beaten path, so use the transportation provided. Once you enter the school you are taken back in time. The facilities are immaculate and the chefs are personable and well versed in their craft. Fun fun Expierence!!! Note!!! They take pictures for you and email them at no extra charge!!

An incredible experience!. This was one of the highlights of my trip to Bangkok! The ladies made the class so much fun! I chose the morning option with the visit to the marketplace and I would do the same thing again if I was a first-timer. There were more men than women in my class and everyone loved it!!

Wonderful!. We absolutely LOVED our time at Baipai Cooking School. All of the food we learned to cook was delicious and they were very accommodating of vegetarians. Their chef was a great teacher and was also funny! Overall a great experience. I would go again!

Fun cooking school. Great place to spend and afternoon learning to cook some delicious Thai food. We visited a local market first thing in the morning and saw some of the ingredients we would be utilizing during the class. We then learned to make chicken wrapped in leaves, papaya salad, and red curry. Instructors were great, informative, and fun to learn from.

Wonderful experience . My husband and I had the pleasure of attending a class at Baipai Thai Cooking School. It far exceeded our expectations. The school ibeautifully designed in a serene Thai setting, the teaching is excellent and the lunch we prepared was delicious. Upon arrival, we were warmly greeted and instruction began with a tour and exploration of the herb garden, highlighting Thai ingredients and their aromas, taste, and use. Next was a hands-on demonstration of making coconut cream and milk and how these are typically used in Thai cuisine. Both of these activities helped us better understand the fundamentals of Thai cuisine.  The demonstration area was thoughtfully organized and the preparation, demonstration, hands on cooking, and eating flowed like clockwork. We were given a thorough demonstration of preparing ingredients, cooking the recipe, and eating a sample of the demonstration. We were then guided in preparing and cooking the demonstrated recipe. There was time to enjoy the dish we had just prepared with the other participants – sharing our experiences and subtleties of the recipe just prepared. We never felt rushed and the instruction was excellent – providing a good mix of cooking theory and technique. My husband and I left with a better understanding of Thai cooking ingredients, methods, theory, and technique – as well as a full stomach and a fun-filled experience.

Well worth it. The school is in beautiful surroundings. It is clean and well maintained. The ladies are charming and very helpful. The cooking for fun and recipes were delicious. We would have gone back for round 2 if we'd had the time!

Do not miss this when in Bangkok!!!. Attended the morning class with my father and cousin. What a great experience!!! Scheduled online and they were at our hotel promptly at 8:30am to pick us up. Class size was perfect (about 12 people). We were taken directly to the market, to meet our instructor. The market was amazing! So clean and everything was absolutely fresh. Our instructor taught us about each ingredient we would be using in our dishes as well as showing us everything the market had to offer. It was very educational. We then were driven to the school, which is even more beautiful than the pictures show. The instruction was extremely well done, covering every little detail to ensure we could replicate exactly the dishes as they are authentically prepared. They even took photos of our class as we prepared our dishes and we were each given one as a keepsake. When we got back to the hotel, our instructor had already emailed us all of the photos of our class. No matter what your expectations are, this class will exceed them.

Very fun!. We went to the afternoon class, and had a great time. They pick you up & drop you off to/from your hotel, which was great! You then learn how to cook about 4 dishes. Everything was very organized and well prepared. You get the recipes to take home and things are explained very well. You eat the dishes you prepare as you go, which I loved, so things are nice and hot. i think it might be hard for me to actually make these dishes back at home, but I will try :) The cook & assistant were very fun & very helpful. I would highly recommend going. Also the location of the place is just beautiful. Lovely gardens, just a great set up!

Brilliant!. Wow we loved our day here and would highly recommend to anyone. We were picked up from our hotel and we decided to do the market too where you pick the food you'll be cooking and get to learn about Thai fruits and vegetables. We loved the market and our guide June was amazing. Her English was fab and she was such a laugh! We went from there back to the school which is stunning set in beautiful gardens with fountains and flowers everywhere. We did some tasting of sweet and sour flavours then joined in the cooking class. We made a salad, chicken in leaves and a pork Thai curry. The two girls who led the cooking demo were brilliant and had such good humour. We ate together at the end and enjoyed the food! Delicious. Such good value for money. If I had to make one recommendation it would be seat belts in mini van as the driver on way home was a bit fast and I felt a little unsafe! Apart from that it was an amazing experience.

Best experience on my first day in Asia!. This is my first trip to Asia and it couldn't have started better! Visiting the market first to look at sourcing ingredients and getting an explanation of some ingredients Westerners often don't get to see was an excellent start! Such a nice staff, great ambiance and step-by-step, hands-on well laid out program. Different programs available, I opted for 1/2 day. It was fun and everything tasted great. This activity is all included: transfer from and to hotel, drinks and snacks at the market and ingredients to cook with, back at the school. You get to eat what you make. For some of my co-students, this proved to much as we made 3 different dishes in the 1/2 day class. Getting a ride back to the hotel by one of the owners (it is a family operated business, for over 15 years) was an awesome bonus.

Great experience. Went today to Baipai Thai Cooking school . Whole class is about 4 hrs of cooking, you can come in the morning 9:30 or in the afternoon at 1:30 . School provide transportation as well to pick you up and drop you off. You will cook with some ingredients you never knew it There is a lot of fun cooking together as well mingling with people from all over the World.Go for some fun and enjoy Thai Cooking

Amazing cooking school. I booked a cooking school at Baipai and was not disappointed. I had booked the transfer to the school, which was a clean, minibus with air conditioning that arrived on time. Once at the school I was greeted with a welcome drink and then taken on a tour. This included learning about the local ingredients that were grown and the common tastes of thai cooking. The class itself was great. I am a fussy eater and only eat chicken, which they provided me for each dish (even though others cooked with beef and prawns). The facilities were great and the chef was easy to follow. There were also lots of people to help with the cooking. Overall I made four amazing dishes and enjoyed my day in Bangkok. I would definitely recommend this cooking school.

Amazing Experience. Today was beyond my expectations. Everything was great from Market trip to venue and the extremely nice people. I learned a lot about Thai food basics . June our Hostess is adorable, Funny and very helpful. Song the chef is so sweet and patient . The food we cooked is what you always order from the Thai menu and it is great to learn how to cook it. Everything about Baipai is amazing I strongly recommend it.

Hidden secret. I can't rate this place highly enough. I received free air conditioned transfers to and from this hidden leafy secret, and on arrival I was taken away with how beautiful and spatious the grounds are. This cooking school looks like a five star resort or restaurant! We were welcomed with Thai iced tea, then taken around the grounds to have staple herbs/fruits/vegetables in our recipes shown and explained. Fone was incredibly knowledgeable and patient when explaining all the key ingredients and Thai cooking philosophy. Chef Noi showed us how to make coconut cream and milk from scratch. All in all, we made four courses (cashew chicken, Thai beef salad, pad Thai and for dessert ruby water chestnuts in ice coconut). Chef Noi and Fone are absolute professionals, with the support staff impressive (how did they clean and set up without us noticing?!). To remember this great half day experience, Fone took pictures the entire time and emailed them to us within hours. Thankyou so much, I will definitely be back.

Everybody in our group liked the cooking class. If you are looking for thai lessons in cooking, this is a perfect place to go. Nice garden, quiet envirement, good equipped and a lot of space for a good course. The people speak good English and are very friendly. All together we had a perfect time today.

Great experience. Had a great time during the cooking workshop.The trainers are friendly, take their time for you to help and are willing to provide extra's.Really recommend this school if you looking for a cooking class in Bankok.

Fantastic Experience. We had an Amazing time at the cooking school, fantastic friendly staff and stunning venue.Food was amazing, all the ingredients and flavouring explained and you get to eat everything you cooked,Staff couldn't have been more friendly, informative and welcoming. Their English was also extremely good and they were witty with it.Perhaps a bit more pricey than some others but well worth the value, I would recommend a visit to anyone coming to Bangkok.

one of the best activities we did in Bangkok.. First off, I really liked that this place was very quiet and soothing.The BaiPai cooking school was like a traditional Thai-style house with a little garden.They picked us up from our hotel and return to some tourist spot where we wanted to go. Since we had to get up early for attending the class, the shuttle service was very convenient.We started market tour with Apple, she explained the ingredients and gave us tastings then we were transferred to the cooking school. The class was informative and fun and the facilities was clean as well. We cooked 3 dishes (Pad-Thai noodle, Stir-fry chicken with cashews and Beef salad in Thai-style) and got to eat them all. Apple took pictures of us throughout the class and sent to us via email afterwards.FYI, there's no air conditioning which usually is no problem, but when you cook on hot summer days.. it's uncomfortable to me. One of our classmate shared her experience in the other cooking school and she said that Baipai's Pat Thai is taste better than the other but that the other one have more dished to cook like 5 and gave mango sticky rice as a souvenir after the class. It's small and noisy with lots of people in a class though, as she said both have their pros and cons.I would recommend this activity to anyone who is thinking of trying something different, and if you love Thai food, then give this a go.
improvement to our culinary achievments at home. my daughter went there to do take some cooking classes and liked it very much. I also love the way she cooks now.

Excellent Experience. Got free transfer from out hotel in Bangkok. From the moment we arrived we felt very welcome and at ease. Staff were very friendly and knowledgable. Love garden at the front with herbs and peaceful sitting area. Cooking course was easy to follow, everything clean and simple. Chef was always on hand to help you out if needed. Thoroughly enjoyed and would say it's a must for anyone going to Bangkok!

Great morning. We spent a great morning at Baipai thai cooking school. The staff are really friendly. They explained everything and demonstrated things slowly enough for even the most inexperienced chef. The four dishes we made were all really tasty. They gave us a recipe book with our 4 recipe's so we could take them home to try ourselves. I would definately recommend their services if you are looking to learn how to cook great thai food.

My Thai Cooking Experience. I had a great time learning to cook Thai food. It made me realize how easy it is. The staff were so gracious and accommodating. It also gave me the opportunity to meet other participants from other countries. It was a great learning experience. The place is awesome. I will come for more cooking classes in the future! :)

Fun and educational in a Beautiful environment. Almost did not go as my husband (who is an avid cook) was not feeling well. He came anyway and said it was one of the best activities we did in Bangkok. Apple educated us on Thai produce and herbs in the market visited before class. Fone and Chef Puu gave us step by step lessons - in hilarious wit - in a way so that even the most unexperienced cook could create delicious Thai dishes. The cooking class is in a beautiful traditional Thai home which is very welcoming and soothing. They even take pictures throughout the class and send to you via email afterwards. We highly recommend Baipai Cooking school as a wonderful way to spend your day. Alert: you may not want to eat dinner after taking this class as there is a lot of food to eat.

Well worth a try! . Today's experience at BaiPai cooking school was excellent. They picked us up and return from the hotel with no fuss or problem.nin total there were 8of us, my husband and I booked this through Viatour before we travelled, which has proven to be excellent during our trip in Thailand. However two of the group had booked the night before- so worth a call the night before to try and get on the course! The experience involved us looking closing at some traditional Thai herbs and fruits that they grow here in the garden. Once we did this Apple our assistant for the day introduced us to chef Noi, who between the two of them were very funny, entertaining and put you at ease. I am no perfect cook, and this seemed excellent for those who are confident and less confident at cooking. The demonstrations were easy to follow and then Apple and Noi were at hand to talk you through as you tried. Such new ingredients meant that even an experienced Cook would be trying something new i'm sure, but a novice would feel out of their depth.Well worth a go- highly recommended!

Brilliant Baipai. Today we visited Baipai Thail cooking and it was absolutely BRILLIANT.Personally I'm not a very confident chef but wanted to give this a go as was highly recommend by others.I really enjoyed my day our chef's NOI and assist Apple were informative helpful and both very charming and witty.We cooked 4 dishes and got to eat them all so please I advice to go HUNGRY.

Learn How to Cook Thai HERE!. Attending this cooking school was a highlight of our round the world trip. It was a typical hot day in July, 2015 in Bangkok but the facility which is open was very comfortable. We made 4 different items and them, of course, got to eat our creations. We learned so much. The chef was helpful, her English was good and we had a wonderful time making some authentic Thai dishes. Highly Recommended. We'd go again!

Fun cooking trip.. We did this as a pre booked excursion as part of our Bangkok stay. As a family of four with one 15 yr old daughter and one 12, we were a bit apprehensive but once there this was one of the best trips we did. Professional, informative and most importantly - fun !!!!! Cannot recommend enough !!!!

Definitely do this on your trip to Thailand. Next to hanging out with elephants in the jungle, this is the best thing I did in Thailand. The team is so kind and fun; they really take care of you. They prepare everything (ingredients/cookware) and it's so organized and in an adorable location.
