They help you as you're cooking so it's not stressful at all, but you still do most of the preparation and cooking yourself. Also before cooking they walk you through all the ingredients you're going to use in the garden, which is really interesting. There's even a super convenient shuttle service and they email you pictures from your day afterward. I really recommend this as a great way to spend a half day in Bangkok. It's more original than sightseeing, it's hands-on, it's delicious, and it's a really good price for what you're getting. The chefs and especially Apple are amazing and so sweet. Everything was perfect and I can't wait to start making Thai food from scratch at home.

I love this place, not just cooking class. It's a fantastic travel experience.. They are well prepared, you don't have to worry anything once you book. I like the place for cooking, the food is delicious. My husband has no experience but still can make delicious food.

Whipping up some good food. I thought when I went on holiday I would try something different. This was! Great fun and learned a lot about how to cook. The guides were great and due to my dietary needs they helped me substitute ingredients. I was picked up and returned to my hotel by friendly staff and the atmosphere was relaxing. We learned about herbs and spices which was good and we watched a demonstration for each course before dodging it ourselves. Help was at hand if required. Overall if you want to try something different which includes you feeling full and satisfied after eating what you cook, then try this

Super nice cooking experience. My friend recommended this to me and it was such a great experience. The school is a little away from city centre, very nice Thai-style building with a little garden of herbs. We did everything from scratch, even the curry paste which was really authentic. Best of all, we got to eat everything we cooked!

Beautiful Setting. The school is located in a beautiful area surrounded by a small pond and picturesque flowers. The welcome drink of lemongrass tea was refreshing and tasty.The cooking class was ok, but could have used a bit more detailed instructions on how to cook the authentic way without taking shortcuts. The instructor was very nice but made a comment regarding how Thai people prefer the skin of the blond German girl who was taking the class with me rather than my brown skin which was very offensive. I understand it may be Thai culture, but those opinions need to be kept to herself especially when I'm paying for this service.

Really fun afternoon. I spent the afternoon at Baipai as part of a company outing with my colleagues. I am Thai so was not expecting to learn anything new during the class but I must say even for a local the classes are good fun and pretty informative. We started off learning about the various ingredients and condiments used in Thai cuisine and then went on to cook 4 dishes. The instructors were very friendly and clear and the classes were structured nicely with a break in between each course for us to enjoy our own dishes. The school is located in a relatively remote area of Bangkok but the shuttle bus made it easy to get to and the traditional Thai house added to the charm of the experience. Would definitely recommend to anyone interested in Thai cooking. I have found a new love for Tom Kha Gai as well!

Excellent experience market to table. Our guide Apple was a gem. She met us at the best fresh produce market I've been to in Asia. She explained the ingredients and gave us tastings then we were transferred to the cooking school which is set in a very tranquil environment. The class was very informative and fun. The staff are very good but Apple made the whole experience superb. This is an activity for all groups except young children.

Goog fun class and nice environment. Enjoyed the class, very friendly people and fun class. The market visit (Or Tor Kor) was interesting. At the end of the class, they even gave u back all the photos they took for free. I would recommend this.

Amazing!. Bai Pai Thai Cooking School is amazing. It's about 30-40 minutes' drive from our hotel. We booked this tour via Indochina Odyssey Tours which provided us private car from/return to our hotel. Apple and Chef did a great job making our Thai cooking class so much fun. Before cooking, they gave us a short introduction of ingredients, herbs etc. which helps us know more about Thai food. The 4 Thai dishes were really easy to learn even if you have less cooking experiences. We highly recommend this cooking class!!

Thai Cousine to Everyone. Experience with Baipai was great since the time I booked online. School quickly contacted me for confirmation and at the day of the event everything was perfect. Place is very nice, staff is very friendly and the class is easy to follow and full of information. You can also eat all that you cooked what makes u feel like a chef!! :)

Fabulous Experience. We had googled cooking schools in Bangkok and took a chance on this one! It was absolutely wonderful and we could not have been happier! Our teacher and chef were Apple and Noi...their English was wonderful and they worked hard to make our group of six enjoy the experience. We made several dishes and each one was fantastic! It was all so much fun! The whole class was wonderfully organized with attention to detail.Apple also took several pictures of each student and has already emailed them to us (and our class was just today!).We would highly recommend this class. If we had more time here I think we would go back!

Great Experience! . We have never before been to a cooking school or learned how to cook formally. The class was a great time! It was a small group, only 6 people, and the instructors were funny and kind. English is spoken very well at the school and they pick you up from your hotel. Well worth the money! The facilities are very nice. Highly recommended.

Just fantastic. We were the only two in the afternoon class so we were absolutely spoilt. The venue was beautiful and very professionally set up. We were looked after by Apple, and she was so helpful and kind. Puu was the chef, and was very patient and happy to answer any questions we had. Both Apple and Puu were happy to help on the hands on cooking sessions. The recipes were beautiful and Puu made everything look easy. We got to eat everything we cooked, and it was all fantastic. We felt well looked after and both really enjoyed the experience. We would highly recommend this cooking class.

Absolutely fantastic!!. I have been to this cooking school twice now and have thoroughly enjoyed it both times!!Came with a friend 3 years ago and just had such a great time, heaps of fun and learn how to cook great Thai food.Next time around was last year and I took 2 of my uncles and family friends and had a better time!! They loved it as much as I did!Beautiful house and the set up is wonderful, they have done such a great job to make your experience memorable. The staff are super friendly and have a great sense of humour.I will be attending again the next time I'm in Bangkok.

Wonderful experience. Very many thanks to Fone and Chef March for their hospitality. The school is set out in a tranquil environment, with the staff being pleasant and friendly. The recipes are easy to follow, producing wonderful aromas and taste. Once again thank you Fone and Chef March for the wonderful experience. We will be definitely presenting these dishes to our friends back home.

Great way to spend a morning . We came with the family for the cooking class. Don't have much expectations for this kind of thing but the staff were professional and the class was fun. We started out with a basic explanation of the herbs and ingredients that go into Thai dishes. This introduction was short and to the point and helped during class. The cook demonstrates first and then we each cook our own dish. The staff stood buy to make sure we were following along. The dishes were practical in that I think we could make them at home. At the very least we have a better understanding of Thai food. Highly recommend.
Fabulous cooking experience. This was a wonderful day, infact I went back the next day to learn more recipes. Staff professional, knowledgeable and fun.

Great intro to Thai cooking. I was recently in Bangkok for the weekend and did the Baipai cooking course on the Saturday afternoon. They picked me up at my hotel and took me to the beautiful house for the course. We got an overview of core Thai ingredients and were shown how to cook 4 Thai dishes. Chef and hostess were lovely, course was easy to follow for a beginner and food was great. Great experience all round!

High on gloss, zero on substance. The entire experience felt so scripted. I even felt a hint of condescension from the instructor. They treat their enrolles like kindergarten students, like it is the first time we handled lime, coriander, coconuts, and lemongrass. I guess it is a bad fit for serious home cooks like myself. They score high on amenities and venue - from the hotel pick-up, to the welcome drink, to the beautiful venue and learning area, the nice aprons, and nice recipe cards. However, it ends there. The recipes that were presented were far from authentic. When I raised a valid question on the used of an ingredient, I sense some irritation on the part of the instructor, on which she did not give a convincing reply. The the least, this class might be for tourists with zero cooking skills, and would just like a touristy rather than an educational experience.

Warm atmosphere, excellent cook and nice food. In short, this is the best treat ever for my business trips small these years. Staff: the staff is attentive, nice and funny. On that day of my cooking class, I was kinda grumpy due to some personal stuff and they noticed that right away. They encouraged me to speak up and be relax. Nok and apple did a terrific job. Perfect English, and super funny!!!!!! Class: class material is well organised, and suitable for people who is new to the cruise. Their demonstration is clear and precise, and the staff is also helpful too! I am not used to cooking but they helped me along the way. They r professional and have a deep knowledge in culinary and herbs.Environment: the houses, kitchen and the garden is just pretty as hell!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Food: the food is great!!!! Mango sticky rice, chicken, pork curry and papaya salad. Thank you very much for the class. I was crying on that day before getting on the bus, but I was smiling when I finished the class 6 hours later.

Terrific Experience. We booked this as an addition to the tour we were already taking and brought a couple new friends we met along the way with us. It was very informative and a relaxing atmosphere. The staff is very friendly, everything is very clean, and the outdoor setting is beautiful. They did a very good job of bringing a little bit of paradise into the big city. The food was very tasty and all easy enough to make on your own at home. Turned out to be one of the highlights of our trip. I even forgot my souvenir apron behind and they we kind enough to drop it off at my hotel!

Top Culinary Experience. In a quiet Shangri-la on the outskirts of Bangkok we had a top culinary experience. A free pick up wisked us to a beautiful garden setting where Apple (our instructor) introduced us to the ingredients we would be using in our class from where they were growing in the garden. We received aprons and recipe packets and Noi, our cooking teacher, demonstrated the techniques before we tried the recipes ourselves. The careful step by step instructions were well paced and clear. I think we all felt successful, from the more experienced cooks to beginners in the group. We enjoyed the delicious results as well as the company of new friends on a beautiful teak open air veranda . I think I want to skip some other scheduled activity to come back again before I leave! What a treat! If only all cooking experiences were this good! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED! Check out their website to choose the menu according to the day you want to visit.

Best cooking school. Baipai school is always number attraction on my list when visiting City of Angels.Very friendly stuff along with Thai hospitality. You get to know to the basic of Thai cooking all the good ingredients and cook delicious food. 4 hour classes are just perfect with great menu to choose from. Plus you meet people from different countries.

Setting & delicious food=A perfect afternoon. This cooking school is a Shangri-la: a quiet, beautiful garden and exquisite architecture in bustling Bangkok. The chef and her assistants were friendly, fun, and made it look so easy! We learned a lot (especially about breaking open and using fresh coconuts) and loved each recipe! It was a great experience and we were so grateful they picked us up and returned us to our hotel. No fear of getting lost.

Best Cooking School in Thailand!. Had my third visit to Baipai yesterday. After taking cooking classes from a number of other places, I must say that Baipai is the best cooking school in Thailand. Chef Marsh and Fone are professionals, their love of Thai food and cooking comes through, and you truly learn how to make the food to be able to re-create the dishes at home. The class made red curry and everyone made their own curry paste. In a previous class, we made Pad Thai the original way. Each time I have learned great cooking techniques.The school is set in beautiful Thai house with gardens, the instructions for each dish are clear, and you are helped to make wonderful food. Highly recommend the school!

Expertly run!. What a delight of a day! We are keen foodies, so we absolutly loved this half day cookery course. The setting was stunning and the building was both stylish and well kitted out for cooking. The course was brilliantly structured and planned out. We had our own recipe cards to annontate and keep. No more than 10-12 in a group which worked beautifully. We made 4 varied dishes and to be honest these were the best dishes we ate all holiday. The staff were very knowledgable and helpful. They took photos which were then emailed to us the following day and they even gave us a fridge magnet with one of our photos on it. A free transfer back to our hotel finished off our day. We learnt so much about Thai cookery and it has inspired us to do other cookery courses while travelling and at home... We just hope they are all this good!

Great fun. We were a small group of 6 among which there were two professional cooks. We all enjoyed the experience. It is set in a pretty Thai-style house with open verandas all around. I appreciated the chilled lemongrass drink on arrival.The lessons were very well prepared, all the ingredients in little dishes in front of you with your recipes. While chef Pu is stirring her wok we all get a good view in the overhead mirror!When we've finished our dish we sit down to savour it. They have a cheerful and efficient team.I certainly recommend the Baipai experience.Only inconvenience really is the distance. From our hotel the Centara Grand It took us about half an hour .

Great Time. The school setting is Thai style wooden house, quite deep into the soi from the street which makes it very peaceful like a city getaway. We went there in a group of ten people and did 4 course menu - two first menus individually and the other two in team. We got short breaks in between the first two menus and before doing the team cooking to eat our own food in a Thai Sala next to a pond in the school area with homemade iced bael tea, iced lemongrass tea prepared by the school.The instructors were attentive and fun. All equipment are well prepared. Every dish turned out very well.. much more than we expected! There was a staff taking photos of us and emailed each of us our photos in action. The school also prepared recipe cards and a photo of each of us as souvenirs. Impressive.

What a great experience and great place. This experience was just incredible we had so much fun with all my friends as we did a team outing. The location is just fantastic as it is a really original place in the middle of Bangkok. The facilities where great and the team was very processional as they teach us things you normally never learn in a cooking school like how to make your own coconut cream etc and tamarind paste. So I can only thank the chef and the Bai Pai school for the cool experience and dedicated time to me and my colleagues. By the way something cool was the transpiration as they picks up what was great as Bangkok is really big.

Amazing Experience!. Went to Baipai Cooking School for a team outing with my colleagues from the office and it was great.They picked us up from Asoke in a mini van and took us to the school. Being located 20 minutes from the city, its the perfect place to relax and escape busy Bangkok while learning to cook.Staff is super friendly and the school itself is beautiful. Green lush garden, wooden furniture and small ponds with fish made us realise that there's more to Bangkok than shopping malls and food courts. We were received by K. Apple who together with our chef showed us the organic garden with different thai vegetables, and how to open a coconut and make coconut cream and milk from it. Then we started with the food.As im vegan, they created a special option for me even though i was the only one from the group. I basically prepared the same dishes using tofu and avoiding fish sauce. I was worried as many schools actually cater for vegetarians but not many for vegans due to shrimp on curry pastes. Teacher/chef were amazing and their level of english was incredible as they studied abroad.After 4 dishes we sat down for a beer before the driver took us back to Asok BTS station.Definitely a great place to learn thai cooking, with great people and more importantly, great food.Completely worth it and recommendable!

Great fun!. Great activity while in Bangkok. All the staff was super friendly and entire class was organized very well. We had great time in food market with miss Apple and later the chef Puu and her assistant Fone made the class great fun and we learned a lot. Highly recommended!!!

Wonderful Cookery School experience . Every detail thought of by this Thai cookery school in Bangkok. From pick-up service to taking photos of students and step by step instruction. Cook alongside a Thai chef. All in a relaxed open kitchen and beautiful garden setting. This school spreads by word of mouth and one of the students was back for his 6th visit!

Second time cooking with Baipai. Today I returned to do a second class with Baipai, the first approximately six months ago on my first trip to Bangkok. This time I elected to go to the market, which Apple took a group of us through, all very much enjoying our exposure to dried ingredients, fresh seafood, fresh fruits, spices, posing coconut flesh to create coconut cream and milk. We also sampled various items made from melons and other fruits that were lovely. Afterwards we were finally ready to head off for our cooking experience. Today we prepare chicken with Cashew Nuts, Spicy Thai Beef Salad, and Phad Thai. Chef Puu assisted by Home made our class quite enjoyable, both were keen to know which team members I'd cooked with last year and were certainly happy to have a returning customer. We had a full class, bigger than my first class, yet the chef and assistant easily managed keeping all students on pace when we hit the burners to ensure we all proceed meals that were going to look good and taste wonderful. Again, as with last year, thoroughly recommend Baipai as an experience when visiting Bangkok.

Awesome Experience! :). This was a highlight from our trip to Thailand! The staff were super friendly, funny, and very helpful. They created a great experience for everyone in the class. Highly recommended if your looking for a cooking class in Bangkok! I will be going again on our next trip for sure. And they pick you up and drop you off at your hotel!

Very Nice. We spent a very nice afternoon cooking delicious Thai meals and learning about ingredients. After the class I bought tons of ingredients so I could enjoy green curry or tom yum back home. Staff is lovely and the whole process is very entertaining to those who like cooking.

Perfect activity. The booking, pick-up from hotel, cookery instruction, and dining with others, all a great experience. I've been on Thai cooking courses a couple of times, and always enjoyed it, but the team at Baipai have created a perfect experience. It was just the right mixture of fun activity combined with genuine instruction which will allow you to recreate tasty dishes back home. All in all, a wonderful way to spend a few hours in a relaxing setting and well worth the price.

Wow. What a fantastic Afternoon. Both of us were at a differnt stage of our cooking skills and we both learnt so much. This delightful cooking school is so well run thank you Apple Noi and the team. A wonderful experence not to be missed.

Highlight of Bangkok: Fun, friendly and tasty. A beautiful pocket of Bangkok with friendly English speaking staff, this place is definitely worth a visit.I went with my mom and did the morning class. We were greeted by smiling staff and shown their fruit and herb garden. After trying to shave coconut flesh ourselves, we were sat down around a large table in the kitchen where the chef started to demonstrate how to cook a dish and we were to do it ourselves. With the help of the chef and assistants we made: Papaya Salad, Chicken in Pandan leaves, Red Curry with Pork and Bamboo, and Coconut Sticky Rice with Mango. Each dish was very tasty, and not overly spicy.Baipai Thai Cooking School was definitely a highlight in my trip to Bangkok, as a favourite and memorable experience.

Highlight of my stay in Bangkok. After taking one class, I wished I was staying in Bangkok longer so I could keep coming back every day to keep learning more. Everything about the experience is top-notch. The school itself is beautiful. The photos online look good, but don't do justice to how lovely it really is. The cooking stations are professional, yet fit perfectly with the decor of everything else. I felt like I was on a set for Top Chef, but without the panel of judges telling me that I suck. Our instructors were excellent. They spoke very good English and were able to explain all the ingredients and techniques we were learning in great detail. First, the instructor would run through all the ingredients, what each one brings to the dish, and then she'd demonstrate the preparation and cooking process. They have an angled mirror above her cooking station, so you can easily see a top down view of what she's doing. This was extremely helpful to be able to understand what's really going on. Then we'd taste her dish, and we'd replicate the process, with helpful reminders and tips from the instructors along the way. At the end of the day, I had prepared four dishes that were actually really good, and I think I can replicate them at home. I've been struggling with Thai cooking for a long time, so this is a huge achievement! I wholeheartedly recommend Baipai school, and if I ever return to Bangkok I'm going to set aside several days for classes.

Lovely honeymoon excursion . My wife and I visited here on our honeymoon, we were collected and taken to the school, on our arrival we were greeted by Apple a very friendly and well spoken young lady, both my wife and I cook Thai already but wanted to see how authentic Thai food was cooked, we were given an understanding of the principles of Thai cooking and taken around the herb garden which we found informative, we then went onto the cooking portion of the day which was fun and light hearted yet we were able to take a lot from it... Having read the negative reviews on here I think they are way off the mark and have gone with the wrong motive... We thoroughly enjoyed our day so much so we purchased all the additional recipe guides to try at home, Apple has since emailed photos and offered her help with any of the menus when we return home should we be struggling with any of the recipes. It's not a Thai cooking school it is a fantastic snapshot of how Thai cuisine is prepared and put together with a fantastic tasting result.. Would recommend to anyone lovely people, lovely venue and menu, great day.

Truly fantastic tuition and entertainment. I was a little unsure about attending a cookery school as I felt that it may be a little 'touristy' and not provide any worthwhile tuition or tips. I couldn't have been more wrong. I was picked up from my hotel on time and after a slightly long journey (Bangkok traffic) we started with a tour around the garden and rundown of ingredients the demos and cooking started. We had a very knowledgable chef, well capable of answering our various questions and were supervised closely enough to turn out some stunning food.Our group contained a pro chef and I'm a very keen homecook, food blogger and former Masterchef contestant we both got lots out of the session, as did some who claimed to never cook at home. I would heartily recommend Baipai to anyone with an interest in Thai food at any level.

Great time in this Bangkok oasis. We were 4 Norwegian girls that signed up for this class, 3 teenagers and myself the mother of one of them. We were picked up at our hotel in Bangkok, and taken back after the class. I think we were traveling for 45 min to get there from the "backpacker area" in Bangkok.When we arrived, it felt like we had discovered a hidden oasis. The place itself is amazing, the house, the half way open-air kitchen and the garden with small water ponds. And the greeting was so welcoming. The sweetest woman met us when we arrived, giving us a quick introduction of the area and program.The cooking class itself was facilitated by our hostess and another very charming female chef. Everything was shown to us by them before we attemted doing it ourselves on our own dedicated kichen "island". The kitchen itself was very nice! This is cooking for everybody, both those who have not done much cooking at all, and for those that are new to Thai cooking. We learned how to make 4 different dishes, and of course we got to eat them all. No need to bring anything, but i would reccomend some comfortable shoes. You can also buy some equipment after the class if you wish.We also received a mail with photos the following day, a very nice gesture!All in all a very nice experience that we will remember! Thank you :)

Flavors and fun rolled into one.. It doesn't get easier than this when it comes to planning an interesting day in Bangkok. All it took was a quick e-mail to register for one of the six cooking classes which are available at Baipai's cooking school. A comfortable, air-conditioined van arrived at my hotel on schedule to provide a ride to the facility. The staff was welcoming and personable, the equipment was tidy and well organized, and the recipes were delicious.

Do try and spend half a day here. A Christmas gift as a surprise for our visit to Bangkok. It was great. Learnt some useful Thai cooking tips, cooked and ate some nice food, met people from all round the world, and had some great laughs. A super special half day in the land of smileS and the cooks who trained us lived up to the reputation of the most genial hosts on the planet. Two very funny and excellent instructors who made everything fun to do, even the difficult parts. If you want to learn more about Thai food whilst having a good time invest in a trip whilst you are in Bangkok

Superb experience, high recommended. My husband and I booked a class based on tripadvisor reviews and we don't regret it one bit. Booking is very easy and you get to see their schedule & planned dishes online. You then email them. Upon confirmation, they will also pick you up at your hotel at no extra cost. We chose Friday morning session which included a market visit, golden bag appetizer, tom yum shrimp soup, green curry paste and green curry chicken.The driver came exactly on time to pick us up and we traveled in a comfortable, air conditioned mini van that also had seat belts. We were then dropped at the Or Tor Kor Market which is considered one of the best fresh market in Bangkok (very clean and easy to visit compare). We were then explained bu our guide Chompooh the different ingredients (who speaks excellent English and a few words of French) and we had a nice visit. Since there were only 3 of us (including my husband and I), it also felt like a private tour. They are very considerate also, since I told them that I was afraid of frogs dead or alive, they made sure to tell me where it was and we did not go. We learned and saw many interesting things. For instance, we were shown the difference between coconut cream and coconut milk. The guide also purchased a traditional snack and drink for us.Or Tor Kor Market is great and directly at Kamphaeng Phet metro station, it is also right across the Chatuchak week-end market (some stalls open during the week days). The guide asked us if we wanted to purchase anything but we indicated that we preferred to come back afterwards since we wanted to see it a bit more in details. We were then driven to the school. Honestly it'S a good thing that they come pick you up, it's somewhere in the suburb and you turn left, then right, then.... Impossible to remember how to get there. Anyway, we then entered the premise of the school which is a superb villa with a pond and a small bridge. The pictures do describe the place well and it's just such a beautiful place.The instructions were very good and easy to follow, you even have a mirror on top to see the way the chef cooks. He prepares the dish for you first and then you get to taste it. You then "prepare" your own ingredients. Honestly, you don't really prepare they do the hard work for you (everything is wash, peeled, cleaned, etc.) and you just have to enjoy the little bit of cutting and ponding the puk puk left. Everything is so fresh and they keep their ingredients in the fridge until the last moment. The dishes were all so good and so fresh. Best meal in Bangkok for sure and that includes the 150$/person sunday brunch at the Mandarin Oriental. Our pictures were also taken and sent to us in the afternoon for our souvenir. we got to keep the recipes and were offered with a picture of each of us. We were then driven back to the location of our choice (we went back to the market).I think this school is one of the most expensive ones at 2000 bahts/person but we found it to be so worthwhile, we wanted to be around some quiet and lush surroundings and this place just met everyone of our expectations. We both highly enjoyed it. Highly recommended!Funny thing, their pond has frogs.... One of them came on the grass but since it's a big yard and I was in the house it was ok... lol.. Our guide who knew I was scared of frogs made a face like "no it's not a frog, you didn't see that"... like I said I was fine since it was quite far away from me but I guess some people would find that charming.

Best day in Bangkok. My wife and I went to this Thai cooking school today. We were there with people from Australia, France, England, as well as the US. We all had a terrific time. The instructors were informative yet fun. The food was delicious and everyone there had a terrific time. I would do this again in a heartbeat.

Excellent team activity in a tranquil setting. I visited this school during a weekday in January for a private class with 9 other work colleagues, after deciding on this venue on the strength of other Tripadvisor reviews. Our team consisted of people who had rarely cooked anything (the majority) to those who cooked on a regular basis, and the staff were able to accommodate our diversity, poor humour and general lack of cooking competence with constant smiles and laughter.We were the only people at the school for our visit, and this further added to the sense of tranquillity imparted by the gardens surrounding the kitchens. Aside from the banging of our granite mortar and pestle as we ground ingredients, we felt from the silence we could have been in the countryside of Thailand rather than a suburb only 30 minutes drive from Sukhumvit Rd. The initial introduction to the Thai herbs we would be cooking with on our arrival was an excellent way to set the scene for the rest of the day. I would highly recommend this activity to anyone looking for something different to do with work colleagues that imparts useful skills, whilst allowing everyone to have fun. My gratitude and that of my colleagues goes out to the team at Baipai.

Great cooking experience!. Great pick up and drop off service to adn from our hotel! Market visit was fun, and the market was very neat and clean. Staff were knowledgable, friendly and funny throughout the course. It was a very enjoyable experience, we had just enough time for both cooking and dining. The environment was also very enjoyable, with small pavilions and small tables to allow you to dine with your friends or in groups. Their photography service was also great, they give you magnet photoframes with your photos ready by the end of the course, and they email you back your photos the next day! Very efficient!

Wonderful!. It was an extremely pleasant experience! The drop-off and pick- up were also impeccable.The class itself was wonderful! The chef was charming and hilarious.The teaching was done at a very manageable pace. Everything we needed to know was explained carefully. The grounds are very clean and serine. Before we began cooking, we had a tour of the garden where we got to see and sample the ingredients we would be using in our meal. We also had the opportunity to make some freah coconut milk!I would fully recommend this activity.

Absolutely fantastic. Baipai Cooking School was everything you could want in a cooking class. The staff were knowledgable and friendly and the food was delicious.I am a big food/cooking enthusiast and found the class interesting and enjoyable.It is also a good class for people with no experience with thai food/flavours as there are plenty of opportunities to try and taste along the way.The school is set in idyllic surroundings - you would never know you are in the heart of Bangkok. Absolutely loved it and it was clear everyone else in my class did too!

Absolutely fantastic!. My boyfriend and I had a wonderful afternoon here in a small class of 3! We were so impressed with the friendliness of the staff and the brilliant facilities there. The classes were so informative, we made some gorgeous dishes and learnt a huge amount. This really was a fabulous experience and I would urge anyway to visit as we were so well looked after! The emailed photos and personalised photo fridge magnet at the end were such lovely touches.

Make sure to take a class including a visit to the market. We signed up for a cooking class at Bai Pai that included a visit to a nearby market as well as cooking three different dishes. The visit to the market was definitely a highlight – they showed us the different herbs, chilis, fruits, vegetables, etc. and we got to taste several items. The classes take place in a lovely setting – the building is set amidst lush gardens and koi ponds and classes are in the shade in a large wooden building. The lead chef demonstrated the cooking preparations and then we dispersed to individual cooking stations to cook on our own. They did a lot of the prep work, which in some cases was quite helpful, but in others (ex: grilling the beef for the salad) would have been nice to do for ourselves.

Amazing experience - the whole package. Booked for an afternoon cooking class at Baipai on a stopover in Bangkok to rest and recover from our jetlag on the way home. Excellent friendly customer service from beginning to end. Picked up and dropped off at our accommodation making it easy to access. Well organised package involving welcome drink and orientation to common garden herbs, other thai ingredients, free ice water and coffee, uniform apron, manual with recipe cards to take home, digital photos taken for us and emailed the same weekend! Excellent fun friendly atmosphere in a small personal class size, easy to follow instructions even for beginner cooks, tasty food we will definitely try again at home. Thanks for a great experience, would recommend to any friends or family stopping in Bangkok!

Great way to spend a morning/afternoon. Thoroughly enjoyed the cooking school experience - from the guest door-to-door pick-up/drop-off service to the experience of Thai cooking for all levels. Friendly and knowledgable staff. Beautiful surrounds with modern set up. Simply a must if you have that extra fee hours in the day in Bangkok.

Amazing Honeymoon experience!. This was a perfect morning! We were on our honeymoon and were so welcomed by the Baipai team - especially Cookie and Chef Puu! Highly highly recommend this cooking course as we learnt loads and enjoyed thoroughly! Thank you!

A great way to spend an afternoon. I spent an afternoon at Baipai and had a great experience. Easy to arrange, beautiful surroundings and great food. Everyone was really helpful and knowledgeable, instructions were easy to follow and I would certainly visit again on my next trip to Bangkok.

Great way to experience Thai cooking. My husband and I took a morning class at Baipai Thai, learning to cook Golden Bags, Thai Custard, Tom Yum Goong and Green Curry. I can't recommend the class highly enough. The setting itself is amazing, like a hidden oasis just outside the heart of busy Bangkok. We learnt from Chef Puu and her assistant Chompooh - both of whom were excellent teachers and spoke very good English. The class was a great way to learn to cook traditional thai dishes in a way that will easily translate to cooking at home. Puu and Chompooh were also great at letting us know of substitutes for ingredients which may be more difficult to find. If I ever visit Bangkok again, another class at Baipai Thai Cooking School will be top of my agenda!

AWESOME COOKING CLASS. This is an Awesome cooking class. Everything was hands on, all the food was fresh and tasted wonderful. Puu and Fone were awesome instructors that made the class very enjoyable. My wife and I will definitely visit them the next time we are in Thailand.

wonderful !. This was a fantastic experience!!! Jit and Puu were excellent teachers! The gardens were gorgeous and I felt like I was in a tropical paradise. I liked the demonstrations. Everything was clean and professional. The lemongrass tea is to die for ! Well worth the money. It is more a guided cooking tour as everything is prepped for you but the dishes were wonderful and portion size was good. Recipes come in a lovely pack to take home. 5 stat for location, cleanliness, food and friendliness ! Excellent English I had a great experience ! Loved it !

Everything I was hoping for. This was the activity I was most looking forward to when travelling to Bangkok, to learn Thai cooking, and it most certainly did not disappoint, I had a fantastic time. We started off with an introduction to the herbs that go into Thai cooking, with an opportunity to smell each, and get a basic understanding of each. Next we progressed to understanding the process of creating coconut cream and milk from coconuts, rather than from a supermarket can; we even had an opportunity to scrape coconut flesh from the coconut using 'the rabbit'.The menu you prepare depends upon the day, today we made mango sticky rice, red curry paste for our red curry with pork and bamboo, papaya salad, and chicken pandanus leaves. There was no assumption of skill, and a lot of joviality made for such a fun learning environment, if you struggled the chef or assistant help you get there, and eventually you manage it yourself.I cannot recommend more highly you do thus if in Bangkok, you will enjoy yourself very much, and a sense of accomplishment as you eat the food you prepare. You also get a cookbook with the days recipes!!

Absolutely loved it. Before I wrote my review I read the 5 or so terrible and poor reviews and couldn't believe the rudeness that some people have. I first attended the cooking school in December 2012 and had a blast. I also attended September 2014 over 2 consecutive days and felt very welcome as they had recognized me from 2 years ago. Yes they take you to their garden and pass lemon grass around for you to touch and smell, chilli, kaffa lime leaves, basil and everything else that is involved in Thai cooking. They also inform you as to what herbs and spices work best in stir fries, curries and soups. I love that they have kept the demonstration on how to make coconut milk and cream from a fresh coconut and not from the tin.I also like the new edition of understanding the sweet, sour and salty combination in Thai cooking. Showing what soy sauces to use and what dishes, when to use palm sugar and when to use normal sugar.The staff are extremely friendly, the facilitates are extremely clean, the food is lovely and fresh and they have catered for the less experienced cook to someone who cooks all the time and just enjoys cooking. If you don't want to cook Thai from a bottle ever again and surprise your friends by cooking Thai from scratch then I highly recommend going and having some fun.

Fun easy friendly cooking school. In Bangkok for 5 days went to cooking school 2nd day had such a great experience went back the following day.Done many cocking schools this was the best for instruction hands on approach to the lesson, also the staff head chef Puu was an excellent communicator put her skill across with ease.Cookie the assistant was also very helpful.I would recommend this cooking school to anyone wanting to cook Thai food.

Deliciously fun. We had a great afternoon here. Our tutors Chompooh and Noi were great,really knowledgable and lots of fun.Most importantly the receipies are all easy to follow and should be managed at home!I've done cooking classes at home in the uk with Nick Nairn cook schools and this was a million times better. Firstly we were fortunate to be the only four people taking part but I believe even at their max (I believe 12 but I could be wrong) you would get real value for money!A great way to spend an afternoon!

A really fun afternoon!. Our group of six prebooked an afternoon cooking class. We had a blast! The school is extremely well organized from the bookings to the actual class. It was great to have a driver pick us up in our hotel lobby. The tour of the herb garden was very interesting and the sheltered outdoor setting for our class was perfect. There are fans to keep you comfortable and everything about it was top notch and so much fun! Our 6 were joined by 4 ladies visiting from Hong Kong and we all had the best time! I would love to go again and learn some more. We got to eat our finished products and they were delicious! A great way to spend some time. We all just loved it! They are very considerate at the school. A friend had a severe coconut allergy and all precautions were made and when someone forgot something after class the pick up bus brought it to our hotel the next day. We even got emails with photos taken by our instructors. Truly a great experience with some lovely Thai people.

Cooking class in a tropical garden. We took the afternoon class.The chef is really good and she explains every steps very well.You cook one dish and eat it and then start again and again!It takes a bit of time to go there but it worth it!!!!

Professional, fun and very tasty!. Booked the afternoon class at Baipai the other day. Were picked up at the hotel and half an hour later, we were in this small oasis in Bangkok. We were greeted by Apple and chef Noi. There were only three of us attending, so we were very well taken care of. It was a good mix of watching chef Noi, cooking and eating breaks. No stress but very efficient, as we cooked four dishes during our three hour class. It was a fun day that I absolutely recommend.

Authentic Thai cuisine. This cooking class made me love Thai cuisine more. They have secret ingredients which makes food more enjoyable. When going to Bangkok, never miss in your itinerary a Thai cuisine cooking class.

Best day in Bankok. Attended the cooking school for the afternoon class. My husband felt at first like he was being dragged along.as soon as we arrived we were so surprised. The cooking school is large spacious And absolutely beautiful. The staff were some of the nicest happiest people we have met in Bangkok.we started of with a small class ,just myself and my husband. And then were joined by a Frenchman.We all made spring rolls,pomelo salad ,chicken and galangal coconut milk soup and Penang curry.after creating each dish we sat in the magical grounds to enjoy eating . The staff Apple and Chef were Brilliant. My husband ( I think he enjoyed the experience more than anyone)And I can't wait to go back an do it again next time we are in Bangkok .

Quick introduction to Thai cooking. It was helpful,to start with a quick intro to ingredients. Thai holy basil is different from traditional western basil, not everyone is familiar with fresh tamarind or with making coconut milk and coconut cream. It was extremely helpful to have so much of the prep done for us before we arrived so that we could focus on the actually complexity of the cooking. I did not fly half way around the world to learn how to mince pork or dice carrots, and the advance prep allowed us to focus on cooking and on spices. I think that some of the students who wrote earlier reviews were extremely wrong headed; after the mincing and dicing and slicing, the interesting part of Thai cooking is the assembly. Staff was helpful, I learned how to make a couple of dishes exactly as I want them, and we all had a great time.

Wonderful days cooking. Hello from Ireland. My girlfriend and I had a wonderful day in the baipai cooking school. The food was delicious and the recipes well explained. I cooked the prawns today in Dublin. A lovely reminder of our trip.
A great way to spend a day in Bangkok. So much fun, beautiful setting, yummy food, great team and hotel pick up and drop off....I had a ball. Couldn't recommend Bai Pai more!

Fantastic fun!. We attended this course the day before our holiday ended, it was the perfect end to an amazing trip! My boyfriend admitted after the experience he was going along for my benefit not with high expectations but these changed straight away as we both thoroughly enjoyed ourselves! With an interesting trip to the local market to experience real Thai food and culture we then arrived at Baipai cooking school to a warm welcome! The chefs were hilarious but so talented and helped us to create some masterpieces...we were shocked! We met great people, had a giggle, surprised ourselves with our cooking talent and enjoyed delicious food! Fab experience!
Best trip at Bangkok. So lucky to be there. Me and my friends have a wonderful cooking experience. Thank you for the best course!

great course. a very professional set up with all the hard work done for you.Pooh and Apple were fantastic.the little extras like the photos in fridge magnets and the ones they emailed to us were a nice extra touch.one suggestion is that they could sell some of the great thai curry pastes that they make at the school so it could be taken away in jars as some of ingredients are hard to find overseas.thanks for a great day Dean and Mel

Fantastic fun cooking. One of my favourite activities in Thailand. My husband and I had a brilliant time at Baipai. Chompooh, Chef March and the rest of the team were great; taking the time to explain and help us with our cooking. There was at about 7 of us in our group and we all mixed well and had good fun making our dishes.We were given menu cards to keep and souvenir magnet fridge magnets with photographs of us taken on the day. We were also emailed more photographs of us cooking to remember our day.

Best Souvenir of Thailand. Our afternoon at Baipai was one of the highlights of our trip. They show you how to prepare different menus on different days. We chose the one that included our favorite - chicken satay. They collected us from our hotel and we spent a fun, informative afternoon with Chompooh, Chef Noi and the rest of the team. The kitchen is well equipped. They demonstrate a dish, then you cook your own - while you are sampling your efforts, the kitchen is cleaned and prepared for the next dish.Since returning home we have hosted a few Thai evenings with great success. It is so helpful that any questions you have can be sent to the school and they are answered promptly and extremely helpfully.While you are cooking they take several photos which the email to you for free! A much appreciated gesture.

Excellent. Excellent. Me and my new wife were on our honeymoon and this was gifted to us by a relative. It was extremely good and very enjoyable and I would not hesitate to have booked or payed for it myself if it wasn't gifted to us. A big thank you to all the staff that made this very enjoyable especially chef March and Apple.

A definant must do activity in Bangkok. From the moment you set foot in this private oasis in the middle of Bangkok the experience just gets better and better.The classes are first class with each person getting to cook there own individual meals. The food is fresh and the classes are extremely well organised and the staff are very friendly and knowledgable. Also the staff are able to identify substitutes for various ingredients that may not be available in various countries so that people are able to continue cooking this wonderful food when they return back to there home country.

A real must-do. I attending an afternoon cooking class with my husband in early April, and if it weren't for the fact I attended my best friend's wedding during our Thailand trip, this would have been the number 1 experience.We were collected from our hotel right on time and taken to the beautiful and traditional Thai house in the suburbs. We received a warm welcome and a cup of cold lemongrass tea from Chompooh, and had some time to meet and chat with fellow attendees.We were then taken around the gardens, with common Thai ingredients explained as we went. We were shown how coconut milk and cream were made and even had a go ourselves.After that we were shown around the kitchen, and the tuition from Chef Noi began. There were seven of us in total so it all felt pretty intimate, plus there is a big mirror over the hob so you can see exactly what's going on, and none of it seemed rushed, you could really take in what you were being taught.Each individual station was immaculately clean and spacious, and everything was easy to follow -even for my husband who doesn't venture into the kitchen much! Chef Noi and Chompooh should have a TV show - the make a hilarious duo! The whole thing felt very relaxed and calm, and above all, the dishes we made were wonderful! I've made everything we learnt twice since being home for a few weeks, and will continue to make them, along with the other recipes that we bought from the little shop after we'd finished.All in all it was an incredible experience. It started off as something I was 'dragging' my husband to, but he was blown away by it, as was I! Beautiful surroundings, amazing company, and fantastic food which is easy to recreate. It would be ideal for couples, families, and solo travellers alike and I can't recommend it enough.

Just the best fun in Bangkok. Just had the best Thai experience at Baipai Cooking school in the Chapuchuk area with Jit, Chef Puu and The team@Baipai. Picked up from your hotel, whisked off to the local farmers market at Tor Kor which in itself is culturally stimulating. Then squirrelled through the back streets to a private location purpose built to host small groups in the most beautiful Thai setting that its a shame you can't stay there. Easy to understand staff, super fresh ingredients with english equivalents provided to the Thai vegetables used and a fun, gracious atmosphere that is really memorable. Photos and additional menus sent through to your email free of charge so you're not feeling you have to constantly buy something. It was a brilliant morning that my husband and myself totally enjoyed and can recommend.

Professional, friendly, fun. We had a fabulous time at BaiPai Cooking School. Clean, well equipt and organized in a lovely location, each student has his or her own cooking station. Mirrors are placed so that you can see the teacher working from every angle. We had been excited about learnign traditional Thai cooking, but were concerned our dietary restrictions - no shell fish or pork - would mean we had to forgo some of the recipes on the daily fixed plan. Instead, staff was prepared with alternatives for people like us. They were friendly, helpful and we were able to take part along with everyone else. At the end of the day, we ate what we had prepared together - all aesthetic, authentic and delicious - and left with the recipes we'd prepared and some cookware we'd purchased. We've cooked these and otehr dishes since returning home with as much success and pleasure as we initially enjoyed. We highly recommend this experience to you.

Loved Baipai Thai Cooking School. BaiPai Cooking School picks you up from your hotel. One of the couples in my class returned for a second session. The staff is great. The location is in a suburb, so you have a beautiful backyard to look out onto while you are cooking. They also send you away with a small cookbook full of the recipes you cooked during your class as well as a photo of your experience. Great experience that I would do again!

Profesional, student centered. Great job. More expensive than others but pick up drop off included. Beautiful well equiped facility. Very well organized. Recipes all dooable. The demonstrate, taste do. Fun afternoon. Good way to meet other international foodies. Get a better taste of Thai culture. Starts with tour and taste of local herbs fron garden. I recommend. I have taken manny such courses and this one delivered

EXACTLY what I was hoping for. I was looking for something that was comfortable, clean, covered the most popular dishes, and was as professional as possible in an open course. Baipai delivered on all of those things. Was concerned that they did not have a "market tour" like some others but totally did not miss it - the walk in their garden, seeing the ingredients alive after a delicious cup of ice cold lemongrass tea was something I much preferred to fighting through a crowded Thai market. Staff was fantastic/professional, tons of room at your own, meticulously clean cooking station. I did two courses and the food was outstanding. Thanks to all!

Great Experience. We booked this class based on TA and CNN reviews. We were picked up at our hotel in an air conditioned van and driven to the school. Good thing too - we never would have found it otherwise.The school grounds are very nice. The school itself is open air but there are fans set up to keep things cool. The school has its own herb garden, so many of the herbs used in the class are grown at the school.There were only three people in our class, so there was lots of personal attention. Our chef Noi was really good, but the star of the show was our sous chef, Apple. She spoke English very well and was really a sweetheart. She took pictures of all of us cooking and sent them to us by email.The cooking class is very hand-on. The instructions and simple and easy to follow. And the results were delicious.It was a great way to spend an afternoon in Bangkok.

This is fun and food at it's best!. First off... i am not a cook of any sort. I found this school through TA and because of all the great reviews, I decided to give it a try. The shuttle picked us up (on time) at the hotel and promptly whisked us off. After a short 15 minutes drive we arrived at the cooking school. First.... wow... just wow... it is a very nice open aired building, complete with top notch cooking areas. The two guys who teach you to cook are really funny and made what I thought was going to be boring into a really fun experience. They take you step by step and cook first what you will make and then you get to go try to recreate it. Sometimes after you try to cook it, it looks great and sometimes you just sort of get close. In the end.. the food still tastes great!There were only three of us in the class. The one other person was actually a woman who had attended the morning class and loved it so much she decided to take the afternoon class as well.Overall... money well spent... Great class... good food.. good fun... and good people... I highly recommend!

Excellent!. The service here was impeccable. We had Jit as our guide and Chef Noi, who created a fun and friendly atmosphere for our morning lessson. Starting off with a tour of their herb garden, then grating coconuts for coconut cream before heading into the superbly clean and well stocked kitchen. Everything was well thought out and organised, from the mirror above the demonstration stove to the layout and envelope for the notes. This course was a little more budget wise but well worth it.

Chef and sous is a hoot, awesome property. Really fun, really informative cooking class. We thought the chef and the sous chef were a hoot. Lots of hands on cooking, minus the no fun part (ie prep, cleanup). Awesome piece of property too so check it out! Also go with an emptyish stomach because its basically a 4 course meal, we were stuffed by the end of it!

Our best day in Bangkok. My daughter bought the family a cooking day at Baipai Thai Cooking School for Xmas. What a wonderful present for us all, 5 adults. Hotel transfers were included.The building was a beautiful building in the suburbs divided into cooking, demonstration and eating areas with a lovely herb garden, fish pond. Very peaceful surrounds. We enjoyed the day with Jit, Chef Noi, Cookie and the team. Everything was so well organised, lots of fun, great instructions and the food turned out perfectly. Should we get back to Bangkok will certainly book in again.Thankyou all at Baipai for a wonderful day, good food and great memories.

Great time cooking. We enjoyed our half day market (or tor kor) visit with Jit and cooking class with Chef Puu. First of all, the organisation was really great, the transportation arrived right on time, everything was well scheduled, the school is really beautiful and all the staff was really nice (and very efficient when you cut your fingers with a knife). The market visit was really instructive and yummy. We tried a lot of new flavours (and loved most of them) in a neat place with kind sale people. We learnt great recipes and tips and tricks during the class with Chef Puu, and now we're able to cook Pad Thai like professionals! Everything was perfect. Just in case, if you're used to some Thai cooking at home, you might find that it a little bit slow.

Wauw! Great place to relax, cook and eat!. If you really need to get out of the city and love to cook, this is your way out. They will pick you up and take you to a beautiful house with big garden where your cooking adventure can begin. This is an activity to impress your friends. It's around 2000 baht, but definitely worth it!

A taste sensation. My 17 year old son and I took a half day cooking lesson this morning at Baipai and we both thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. We met our fellow students at the market for an informative walk around before heading to the school. We cooked three dishes after being shown by the chef. All the dishes will be 'achievable' in my kitchen at home in Melbourne. The staff were friendly, personable and very experience with food and flavours. They also looked after my son who had an upset tummy. I certainly recommend this cooking school to enhance your understanding of Thai food and as well as an encouragement to try Thai cooking at home.
Great Fun with the Family. We had a great experience - beautiful setting with great teachers - highly recommend for anyone interested I cooking or eating!

A foodie paradise!. My immediate impression upon arrival told me I had chosen the right cooking school. The pristine and tranquil setting was well designed. The chef staff were professional while also very personal. I loved the walk thru of the garden to learn about the fresh herbs we would be using for our dishes as well as the demonstrations on the difference between coconut milk and cream.The individual cooking and prep stations made it a real hands on experience. I left with lots of wonderful knowledge, the recipes of the four courses we cooked as well as a full stomach from eating all the delicious dishes I cooked. Can't wait to try them out at home!

Cooking school excellence - must do in Bangkok!. Perfect for want-to-be-chefs and the foodies alike. The market was a cultural experience I'm thrilled we didn't miss. Instructors were top notch, food was great (perfect amount of self-prep and prepared), and the facility and grounds were beautiful. Strongly recommend.

Don't miss it! It's highly recommendable!. Fantastic experience! Jit, Chef Puu and the team are not only very nice but very professonal as well. A very good hands-on class on Thai cuisine. I loved the experience!

First class in every way. Although I grew up in Thailand and know what most Thai dishes should taste like, I never got around to learning how to cook them properly. I wanted to learn the "tricks of the trade" which is what brought me to Baipai - an appropriate name, too, since "baipai" means "paddle." My first impression was one of astonished wonder. I hadn't paid attention to the Tripadvisor photos so I was pleasantly surprised to arrive at the beautiful Thai style compound that houses the school. (The place exudes a cheery peacefulness and is well worth a visit in itself.) If first impressions mean anything, the refined, sensible decor told me I had come to the right place, which as I soon found out, I had. The chef's aide, Chompoo, took us on a tour of the garden where she showed us fresh herbs and how to use them; we were also shown how to make coconut cream and milk ( I took five different classes and got to meet the other equally talented and professional chef and sous-chef teams.) Everything is perfectly timed so that you are able to enjoy the cooking process and the food as well as a few dashes of humor from the chef and learn a maximum of skills,too. As for me, my wish had come true: I got to learn things like when and how to use the cream and the milk of the coconut (two somewhat different things); when to stir or not to stir a dish; how to keep the color of a cut eggplant from turning; how to make your own curry pastes, and so on. The best part was when I finally found out how to make one of my favorite dishes, "yum woon sen" or "glass noodle salad": although the one I (used to) cook tasted OK, it was always chewy and somewhat hard to digest until I learned that the key is to... oh well, you'll have to find that out for yourself, now, won't you!

Wonderful cooking experience. Beautiful setting, very friendly staff,well organised.Lovely food!! a wonderfull experience, the kitchen is Modern thai mixed with tradional interior,well equiped.They first show you how to make the recipe and than you have to try it yourself, and than at the end you have your own food as a lunch. There are different formules choices.A must Do!!!

Baipai Thai Cooking School. I attended Baipai Cooking School in Bangkok and just loved the experience. Chef and Jit spoke excellent English, and provided a fun and professional approach to cooking the dishes. It was easy to prepare and absolutely delicious. I have attended some other cooking schools overseas and this was a standout. Can highly recommend the experience. We were picked up from our hotel, so there wasnot a problem with trying to find your own way in a foreign city

Such fun time… and such a delicious meal! A great experience!. My hubby and I spent some days in Bangkok as part of a Southeast Asia tour. Most of Thailand was under water due to severe rain and flooding. That morning we were supponsed to visit tha ancient city of Ayutthaya, which was impossible! We were offered the cooking class as an alternative. AND WHAT A GREAT ALTERNATIVE IT TURNED OUT TO BE!First of all, we do consider ourselves foodies (food enthusiasts) and really enjoy cooking. We had tried pour hand on several Thai recipes before and were happy if not by the trade-off, by the perspective of a great cooking experience. And the BaiPai School delivered on so many levels!I would definitely return for another day class without hesitating. So yes, do book yourself a great time, great delicious food and an experience that may –as it happened to us– change your cooking forever.

Great class!. Beautiful location! Got picked up from the hotel. It would be very difficult to find otherwise. Delicious food. Great instructions! Spoke English very well. I would definitely recommend this. Learned a lot. Got the recipes to take home. They also took pictures during the class and emailed them to us right afterward! Expensive but worth it!

Excellent!. We planned to do something new in each of the places we visited on our Grand Tour :) and we both love Thai food so I booked this via our hotel when we arrived. Book early as the day and time we wanted was already full. We really enjoyed the experience. The staff spoke English and we even learnt a few Thai phases during our day there. The instructions were simple and the food was really good. Great value and we will definitely be using the recipes when we get home to chilly Leeds to remind us of our lovely time in bangkok.

Very charming professionalism. The Baipai Thai Cooking Class was the best half-day class we attended so far (having done quite a few already around the globe). The starting conditions were good: We love the aroma-intense and fresh Thai kitchen, we really enjoy cooking (however usually only on weekends or special occasions) and we recognize high quality and professionalism. We got it all.Experienced and travelled Chef Poo with her sweet sidekick Apple (no joke) were a perfect team. It was great fun to watch them explaining the secrets of Thai cooking (eg. separate the coconut cream from the milk) and to try it afterwards ourselves. The cooking lounge itself opens to the beautiful garden with all the necessary herbs we got an introduction to in the beginning. The class is perfectly organized, in a profi setup and with all tools pre-arranged. So it was fun and easy to follow their hands-on advice and get a feeling for the use of different ingredients, herbs and spices. However, we have to admit that our own-cooked dishes still have room for improvement, in particular compared to Chef Poos very tasty signature dishes. But with the nice little cookbook summarizing all dishes of the class we will continue practicing back home. Thanks for a wonderful morning in your beautiful garden!Inge & Sascha, Germany

Simple, efficient, friendly and tasty!. I took a cooking class at the school while I was in Bangkok for business and I found it to be extremely well-organized and enjoyable. The recipies are simple but tasty, which I find is an advantage if you actually intend to try them at home. I imagine it's not too interesting if you're a seasoned chef or if you've taken other Thai cooking classes before, but as a beginner (and working mom with very little time to cook) I think it's ideal. The place works like a perfectly oiled machine: while you stir-fry someone is silently cleaning up the work station that you've just used to chop, while you chop again, someone else is washing your wok and another person is filling up your glass of water! The chef and the assistant chef were very friendly and helpful (even though at times I felt like their jokes were rehearsed) and the location is superb. I loved the visit to the herb patch where I learned quite a lot about Thai herbs and spices. Thank you for a great time!

What an experience, if you are looking at this...DO IT!!!. Before travelling to Thailand my wife, 2 friends and I had decided that learning how to cook authentic Thai food would be a great activity to do. We found Baipai and were trying to decide between this and the Blue Elephant cooking school, in the end we selected Baipai cooking school. We were picked up from our hotel at 8.00 to travel to the cooking school which is set in a beautiful garden setting where Thai ingredients are grown. At first glance it looks like a Spa retreat with lots of wooden features and a koi carp pond. We met Cookie and Chef Phu upon arrival and were given some delicious lemon tea and our aprons for the day. We then were lead around the garden firstly being shown how coconut milk is extracted from a coconut as well as being shown Chilli’s, Lemongrass and Galangal all growing fresh in the Baipai garden. After having a sensory overload with the smells and tastes of the ingredients we were lead to the ‘kitchen’ which was a vast open aired classroom. We had pre-selected the dishes to cook and Chef Phu would cook each dish explaining each step of the recipe and the ingredients used. Most of the preparation was done before our eyes when each dish was complete we got the pleasure to eat it. Then it was our turn. Firstly each of us had to prepare our dishes so slicing and cutting plus lots of pestle and mortar bashing, followed by cooking at the wok with Chef Phu and Cookie on hand to assist us. As my wife is vegetarian, she was provided with substitutes for the meat for her so all were happy! It was a fantastic experience that was so well ran. Cookie and Chef Phu really made our day full of fun! Cookie took photos throughout the half-day session and then emailed them to us, which was great as these were action shots. At the end of the day we were given a small printout of one particular photo mounted within a magnet as a souvenir which was a great touch. Having just the four of us on this lesson made the experience all the more enjoyable. I cannot recommend Baipai cooking school enough, it was simply brilliant!

Amazing class, beautiful location and super professional. I had done a lot of research before selecting a private Thai cooking class for a friend and I. After the day at Baipai I can confirm that i made the right decision. It was a great experience...utterly professional staff, stunning surroundings (you just don't imagine how beautiful the garden setting will be when driving around the backgrounds near the school). They prepare meticulously for each class and everything runs like clockwork. Amazing kitchen to cook in. I was ill on the day of class and had to miss the last dish...the staff were all so thoughtful and kind in taking care of me. An unforgettable experience.

Great experience staff lovely!. We went on a tour of Thailand with some friends and wanted to learn how to cook some of the local cuisine. Cookie and Puu were our teachers and we had their instruction just to ourselves so there was only 4 of us in a class! They showed us round the spice and herb gardens and taught us the differences then showed how to make coconut milk and shred using age old devices. We picked 4 dishes, were demonstrated in a state of the art kitchen then able to try ourselves! The staff really made the experience they were friendly, helpful and their English was excellent. The setting is stunning and a real highlight from our trip would definitely recommend!

Excellent class. The chef was great, the team made the experience nice, we learned green curry which I have now eaten for four days straight. We made custard with duck eggs, it was good trust them. We also learned tom yum soup and wontons. Great location and experience.

Baipai rocks. We had an awesome time with plenty of laughters, fun, and most important... Learnt some Thai cooking..Very professionally conducted, nice environment and lovely people.Thumbs up to Chom-pooh and chef March

great cooking session - don't miss this one!. All I can do is echo the other reviews on here - that Baipai was one of the highlights of our stay in Bangkok. Many thanks to Jip and Noi for really giving an excellent grounding in not only the ingredients but also the finesse points of Thai cooking. I now know to remove from the heat before adding lime juice and how to make curry pastes and to cook up a very passable Green Curry. The trip there in the comp bus was an education in itself and showed a lot of the real city often from the tiniest side streets. The teaching and advice has advanced my knowledge of the cuisine hugely. It all added up to make for a truly memorable morning and one I would highly recommend to any visitor to Bangkok.

Don't just see Bangkok.... Do!!. Baipai Thai Cooking School is so much more than a hands-on cooking experience. You are taken to the farmer's market first, not only to give you an idea of where the ingredients are purchased, but more so to immerse you into the daily experience of Thailand. Amidst all of the stands of fresh produce....fruit, seafood, meats, vegetables, candies....there are stations of fresh cooked foods. It was the Vegetarian Festival and we all feasted on a few bowls of crazy, tasty corn fritters and sea weed and.....????The cooking school is in the suburbs set amidst outdoor Thai buildings surrounded by typical Thai lush landscaping and lazy ponds with lily pads, all lending to the sense, "Just relax!" The staff were delightfully funny, amazingly helpful, and just so right for the cooking adventure. Among our group of 9 international travelers was a restaurant owner and wife from Australia, two college girls from Hong Kong, and the 5 of us from the Georgia/Mississippi. We all were challenged, laughed a lot, and agreed that we would do this tour again.Lots to see in Thailand.....but don't miss out on the "doing!"

Fantastic experience!. My girlfriend and I visited Bai Pai in July and had a really great experience. The cooking school is in a house on the outskirts of Bangkok and has a large and beautifully crafted garden. The beginning of the cooking class starts with a tour through the herb gardens and an introduction to some of the ingredients you will use during the lessons. The lessons themselves are conducted in a large open plan kitchen with each person getting a work station. The teachers were engaging and relaxed, demonstrating each meal in a jovial and sometimes hilarious style. The meals you prepare are all quite simple, but great if you have never done any thai cooking before (which I had not). Each lesson is accompanied by recipe cards, which you can take home and which provide you with simple easy to follow instructions. After you manage to prepare each of the meals you then have the opportunity to sit down and sample your (sometimes) great cooking achievements, they will even provide you with a cold singha to accompany the meal. Overall a great way to spend half a day in Bangkok and certainly a good introduction to Thai cooking, well worth a trip.

Don't miss it!. Had a great afternoon learning how to cook Thai cuisine. We we shown how to make spring rolls with dressing,a Thai salad and finally Penang curry. We had a small group of seven , with a head chef and assistant who were informative, patient for the less skilled participants and amusing. We were carefully led through the recipes and tasted the chefs version of the dish which was wonderful, before being led through the recipes ourselves with tasting of our efforts as well! We left being well informed, well taught and well fed. We were given a booklet with copies of the recipes we had produced and a fridge magnet each with our pictures in fully cooking regalia. We are also to be sent additional pictures via e mail. The reasonable price included pick up and drop off at the hotel ..a very enjoyable afternoon. Highly recommended !

Fabulous!. I did four consecutive cooking sessions at BaiPai over two days that included the market visit, which I highly recommend. It was great to walk through one of the highest rated markets in Bangkok with a guide to explain the different fruits, veggies and herbs. The classes were seriously professional but with a touch of humor. The cooking facilities are top notch without compromising traditional Thai methods. I had a different set of instructors for each session and they are all terrific. The school is quite a distance from downtown but they have a pick up and drop off at most hotels and it's well worth it.

A very enjoyable morning learning how to cook Thai dishes. Accompanying family who are experienced cooks and who have eaten quite a bit of Thai food, I wasn't sure how our morning at BaiPai would be but based on a friend's recommendation, we booked in, having selected the Thai dishes we wanted to cook. A real bonus is that included in the price is transport to and from the school - perfect for visitors to Bangkok especially.The school is located in a newly built Thai style house, with beautiful Thai pavillion, in a lovely garden that show cases the herbs and vegetables used in Thai cooking.The kitchen areas are very well appointed, with comfortable seating and a good view of the cook demonstrating the dish before you cook it yourself - each person having their own work station, equipment and ingredients.The cook and assistant were delightful, explained well what they were doing, about the ingredients and engaged well with the students, varying their approach for the teenagers in our group.We so enjoyed cooking our own versions of the dishes, and of course eating them too (having tasted the cook's demonstration version beforehand so we knew what we were trying to achieve).Unlike some cooking schools in Bangkok, we were pretty hands-on, did some cutting of ingredients ourselves, and could get the full experience of making our Thai dishes.Overall, it was a delightul and interesting morning whether one lives in Bankgok or is visiting briefly. We all got a lot out of the cooking class and loved the well-designed school. Little touches like offering a cooling lemon grass drink on arrival to giving us each a fridge magnet with a photo of us in action cooking helped to make it a wonderful experience. Congratulations to BaiPai for their hard work and imagination!

A must do. My wife and I decided we would like to attend a Thai cooking course while we were in Asia, and found this one recommended in lonely planet, and rated very highly on TripAdvisor. I would say this is definitely a great use of 4-5 hours. The staff were friendly, funny and very informative. They led us through each of the recipes, let us sample them so we knew what they were supposed to taste like, then let us loose in the kitchens. There were plenty of breaks to let us sample what we had just created, and plenty of staff on hand. They took lots of photos, which they have promised to email us later on, and they gave us a photo each with one of our creations to take with us. The staff even made my wife and I a card to say congratulations on our recent nuptials. Great day, great people, and great food!

I'm now an amazing Thai chef... sort of!!. My wife and were in Bangkok for the last leg of our trip and having done most of the panning I was taking a backseat and the misses was planning our day. When she suggest a cookery class I was filled with the sense that it wasn't for me and I was not going to have fun... I COULDN'T HAVE BEEN MORE WRONG!
