We went on the morning session, being picked up by the school from our hotel and whisked into the suburbs of Bangkok with two other pairs. An Aussie couple and a couple of lovely ladies from Taiwan. When we arrived we were greeted by Jut our soux chef and general helper, his English was perfect and cracked a few jokes to put everyone at ease. We wondered around the garden first being introduced to the herbs and spices before being introduced to our chef Puu. Just like Jut a well spoken, funny and excellent chef who had us all smiling and looking forward to getting stuck into a bit of cooking. If you're a novice or a professional chef I recon you'd have fun on this morning or afternoon. We cooked, stir fried chicken and cashew nuts, Pad Thai, spicy beef salad and water chestnut in coconut milk for pudding. Puu cooks first and we try it... Yummy!! Then we're all sent to our respective stations and copy what we've just seen... It's surprisingly easy if you do what you're told and walk away with a real understanding of how to cook Thai and what ingredients you need. You are given a little booklet so you can do it all at home and get the chance to buy some souvenirs if that's your bag?! All in all a great experience and definitely worth doing whatever your ability. The team there are incredibly friendly and fun and keep you smiling the whole time, there are pictures taken for you so you don't have to worry about that and are e-mailed to you. You are dropped off at your hotel or wherever else you may want to go and above all you eat everything you cook so you won't need lunch... I suggest if you're going in the morning session you don't eat breakfast either... we did and were stuffed by the end!

It's all true. I agree with the many positive reviews that others have shared. I wasn't sure that a cooking class was the best use of our limited time in Bangkok, but my wife insisted. I'm glad that she did, because the food was great, the staff was extremely friendly and attentive, the grounds were beautiful, and we learned a lot about Thai cooking in a short time.

They were great!. You get whisked away by private van from your hotel and brought to this really elegant oasis in Bangkok. It's a wonderful piece of architecture for cooking and eating. The entire program is outdoors, and the staff make you feel special. You will gain an appreciation for the spices used in Thai cooking with a walk through their garden. The staff is pleasant and funny, and the main event is the preparation, cooking and eating of the food. It's great fun, and I had a pleasant time with my wife, and the others who joined. I strongly recommend this class and urge you to partake....it's fun, and its educational. And they serve beer if you want it.

Must do in Bangkok!. This was my fourth time to Bangkok, but my first Thai cooking experience... and one of the highlights of the whole trip.Everything was well organised from the pickup to the drop off at our hotel. Easy to follow recipe cards are provided for everyone; ingredients prepared in advance & glasses of ice water constantly kept full. The facility is top class in a tranquil setting away from the mayhem of Bangkok with seperate preparation, cooking & eating areas.We were in a class of 10 students and our hosts, Nok & chef Noi, were extremely entertaining and accommodating. The food we cooked (menu D4) was perfect- straight forward & great tasting. One of the very nice touches was Nok taking photos during the course - providing us a framed photo & also emailing them all to us a day later.Highly recommended!

Brilliant experience. The whole afternoon was really enjoyable and we learned a lot. The school is lovely and Cookie and Poo are very friendly teachers and we were amazed at how ell we were able to cook each of the dishes. Recommended.

The best thing to do in Bangkok. My husband and myself have just spent the most wonderful morning at the above cooking school. I am a chef but my husband is not but he came with me anyway. He was not the only one brought along by a wife. The staff are friendly,helpful and have a wonderful sense of humour . They take you through everything including the garden where you pick herbs to be used in the cooking. They show you how to prepare and cook each dish before you do it with help if needed.They give you cold towels and iced water and plenty of time between each course to sit down and eat and enjoy what you have cooked.I am booked in tomorrow for another one it was so good. Even if you can't cook you will love it.

best activity in Bangkok. although i went on various activities and tours in bangkok, this was the best hands down, the pick up was punctual and the class started on time. the teaching and instructor were really friendly and helpful. the facility is so pretty and you just want to relax
i enjoyed every minute there. will definitely recommend this to anyone

Must do!. My wife and I travel a lot and we tend to do a cooking course in most destinations. Baipai is a use for anyone who wishes o have a little fun and escape the hustle f Bangkok for a few hours. The interaction from the staff is fun and knowledgable. We had a wonderful time and the good was fantastic! Thank you to Jit! Who met us at the markets and showed us around right through to the cooking part of the day and the end when we were heading off! Well done to everyone! Would love to come back soon.

A great morning in Bangkok. What a great way to spend our morning. My niece and I signed up via the internet and I was very pleased with the quick and helpful responses from Ms Yui. We had a punctual pick up at our hotel and a pleasant ride to the school. The facility was lovely and comfortable despite the hot august temperatures. The demos by Jit and March were informative and entertaining ( at times like a well rehearsed comedy act). The food was yummy and easy to manage. Much of the prep is done in advance and the actual cooking is left to the student. I enjoyed every aspect of our session and would not hesitate to recommend it to anyone. FWIW, with the exception of my niece and me, the class was made up of French people. The language difference was handled very efficiently.If you are looking for a cooking school--this is the one!!

Aroy mak mak. Did the morning cookery class with a visit to the market & it was well worth the early wake up call despite the jet lag!We were collected at hotel & taken to meet Nok at the market who gave us a fascinating & insightful tour. We saw coconut milk being extracted & learnt a lot about the various thai herbs & chillies used in the cuisine.The school itself is beautiful. Very tranquil in a beautiful lush green setting right in the heart of Bangkok. Our chef was March, brilliantly assisted by Jit. The two of them were great fun & the demonstrations were both interesting & amusing as the two of them cracked jokes as they went along.We made chicken & cashew nuts, spicy thai beef salad & pad thai. Each course was demonstrated at the main demonstration table which was superbly set up with a slanted mirror above the chef so you could see exactly what was happening. After tasting the chef's dish we then got to go to our own cooking islands & give it a go ourselves. March & Jit wandered amongst us, giving tips & then we got to eat each course before starting the next one which was a great idea as not only did it mean nothing was having to be kept warm but we got to have a little break before the next dish.We thoroughly enjoyed our morning & it was a lovely, & very filling activity! The souvenir photo fridge magnet & recipe wallet was a nice touch to remember it by.Would most certainly recommend baipai cookery school & will hopefully be able to do another course the next time I'm in Bangkok. Excellent value for money & both interesting & fun."Aroy mak mak" as they say in Thailand! (Very yummy!)

Fabulous Cooking School. My daughter and I took class at the Baipai Thai Cooking School and it was one of the highlights of our trip. My daughter made the reservations on line and we were picked up at our hotel. In the morning we visited the fabulous market and were able to shop. Then we arrived at the school and were amazed at the peaceful gardens. The class was very organized and staff were wonderful, spoke excellent English. The teaching methods blended didactic, observation, hands on and practice. The chef was outstanding and encouraged the most novice students, that would be me! I highly recommend the Baipai Thai Cooking School. One of the other students said she had tried another class at the elephant school but felt the Baipai Thai school was much better.The best part is having the recipes to take home and the wonderful souvenir magnet.

Must do!. This would have to be the best activity we did in bangkok! From the moment we arrived we felt as though we'd been sweeped away to a Seculed Thai garden. The staff were friendly and spoke exceptional English. They taught as a few Thai words to compliment food, which we used a lot.The food was so pleasantly simple to make and delicious!! Never thought I'd be able to cook an authentic Thai meal from scratch in a million years! If you like cooking and love Thai food, this is a must do!

Perfect for novice cooks!. A perfect outing for novice cooks who want to learn the basics of Thai cooking and prepare dishes like Pad Thai. Everything is prepped for you and ready to go and all you have to do is read your little recipe cards after the demo and make it work! Reservations were made online and they also pick you up and drop you off at your hotel! You also have an option to do a Market Tour at one of the upscale wet markets in Bangkok! The whole experience at BaiPai was painless and enjoyable! At the end of your cooking class, you will also receive a cute little magnet of yourself cooking! Kudos to the wonderful staff!

Absolutely brilliant. This was one of our best days spent in Thailand and far exceeded our expectations. We loved every minute of it. Such a beautiful setting and staff were so friendly. Had a lot off laughs and the food was fantastic!!

Learning to cook from Pooh. Prior to my visit to Bangkok I researched various cooking schools on line. I contacted several, however the folks at Baipai were quick to respond and excited to answer all my questions. I had been in Bangkok on business so attended the school on the day I checked out of my downtown hotel and transferred to the Hilton. The Baipai folks provided transportation, so they picked me up in the morning at the Novotel then when done took me to the Hilton boat launch. Cant ask for better service than that. My class began with a trip to the fresh market. What a fantastic opportunity. I watched fresh coconut cream being squeezed from coconuts, shrimp paste being made and tasted more fresh fruit than I thought was possible. We then went to the class where I linked up with my classmates from Hong Kong and the USA. Pooh was our instructor and she was fantastic! After her excellent instruction we would make a course then sit down and enjoy it. You could purchase Thai beer or Thai Tea to go with your creation. After each course we would make another and do it all over. It was an open air facility and beautiful in all aspects. It was a wonderful way to spend a half a day in Bangkok.

Wonderful Cooking School. Today I attended the Baipai Thai Cooking school and loved the entire experience. In was picked up at my hotel and taken to the tranquil surroundings where the school is set. This was about 30 minutes from Sukhumvit (in good traffic). Our group was only six in total and after a walk through the the herb garden with Jit we were introduced to Noi, our chef and instructor . We did the Set A menu which was Pumpkin in Coconut Milk, Chicken with Cashew Nuts, Tom Yum Goong and Green Chicken Curry both made from scratch. Amongst the laughs and after Noi showing how it was done we all got to cook our own individual dishes. All very easy with maximum flavour. we all then ate our dishes in the beautiful setting washed down with a cold beer. After which we were dropped back at our hotels. A very reasonably priced way to learn how the Thais cook. Highly recommended .

Fantastic afternoon at Baipai!. We had a great afternoon on the Baipai cooking course. The course is very well organised - from arrangements made before the course and all the way through the afternoon. We were picked up free of charge from our hotel and taken back at the end of the day.The chefs were great - funny, friendly and entertaining all afternoon. We learnt lots about Thai cooking and they explained to us how to substitute thai ingredients for things we could buy at home for the recipes. We got to eat all our delicious food too!! The house that the course is ran in is lovely and all the equipment and cooking utensils were spotless. I would definitely recommend this course to anyone who has some time to kill in Bangkok!! Great value too.

this makes my bangkok trip different ^.^. I and my friend attended a morning class on 18 May 2013 as I was so looking forward to learning how to cook spring rolls and mango sticky rice. The cooking school arranged pick-up services at our hotel which was so convenient for us.The environment inside the cooking school is comfortable and relaxing. We got introduced to the common kinds of herbs which are available in many thai cuisine and got the chance to use a traditional mahcine to peel off the coconut meat.The cooking school prepared the ingredients and everything was in a right portion and sequence. Everyone in the class managed to cook after seeing the chef demonstrated once. The flow of the class was good, the chef cooked the cuisine first as demonstration. Later, we went back to our cooking station and did our cooking part. Therefore, it is not difficult to cook the yummy cuisine.The chef and the staff were nice and helpful. It was really an interesting experience, I would try other cooking sessions in the cooking school if I come to Bangkok again.

Baipai cooking experience 2013. On 18 March 2013 we attended an afternoon session at the Baipi cooking school. It is a must when visiting Bangkok. In fact it was the highlight of our holiday. This is the second time we have visited and when we next go back to Bangkok we will definitely be going again. The chefs (Noi and Jot) make it a fun and educational experience and I have definitely now acquired a taste for Thai food. We were picked up from our hotel and taken to the beautiful school in an authentic Thai house. We collected the herbs that we would require from the herb garden and then proceeded to start on our 3 course memo. You can adapt the food to your own taste. The first course was eaten downstairs and the main (Thai red curry) and sweet (banana in coconut cream) was eaten upstairs in the dining room. During the cooking session many photos were taken which were then emailed back to me in Australia. We were also given photos of us on fridge magnets. I highly recommend a visit you will not regret it.

An absolute must - worth every penny!. A friend and I attended a morning cooking class that began with a trip to the market to purchase the ingredients that we would be using for our cooking class. This was a wonderful learning experience and helped to orientate us to food shopping in Bangkok. The service and instruction at Baipai was incredible. From pick up at the hotel through to drop off, this experience was nothing but professional. The location of Baipai Cooking School reminded me more of a sanctuary than a cooking school. Our instructor was incredibly knowledgeable about Thai cooking and spoke great English. She made everyone feel comfortable and relaxed during our time together. She was attentive to dietary needs and the levels of heat people could tolerate and helped us to modify the dishes we were preparing based on this. We prepared three entrees during our class using the fresh ingredients we had purchased at the market earlier in the day. We ate our final entree upstairs together in a restaurant-style fashion. At the end of the class we received our graduation gifts which were included a personalized photo magnet which had a photograph of each of us cooking during the morning. Baipai Cooking School was a wonderful experience and well worth the money. I would recommend that you purchase an apron and take it home with you as a souvenir and smile when staff take the many photographs throughout your cooking class as these are emailed to you following your class and make a lasting reminder of a wonderful day.

Fun filled experience. I attended the class in April, 2013. I was collected from my hotel and taken to the school which was located in a wonderful relaxed compound. Beautiful and ambient. Professional and efficient staff. The morning class (9 in total) started with a walk through the herb garden with Jot. Next to the cooking staion where Noi the chef(Jot and Noi work well together-happy and informative with good english) explained the dishes we were to cook. We were presented with a small folder of recipes and made the desert first. She showed us how to cut, cook and present the dish. We then went to our cooking staion (in pairs) and made the dish which we ate after finishing. This routine was repeated with every dish we made. I thoroughly enjoyed the day and would recommend it. I was delivered back to my hotel at the end. Our group was small which allowed us to talk and mingle. The food was delicious and the staff friendly and efficient. Would go again!!!! Annette E

Top Notch. First of all the place is beautiful. Second, the staff is very professional. This was a wonderful experience overall. The school sends a car to pick you up and whisk you away to paradise. The menu itself was a little disappointing, but they did send us some other recipes when we asked. A very nice touch was they took photos of you while you cooked and sent them to you, this was a very nice touch.

Delicious and fun, if not a bit slow. We did Baipai for an afternoon and enjoyed it immensely. The school picked us up and took us on a long, confusing journey, but the grounds are beautiful. Our instructors Jot and Noi were cheery and helpful, and full of good humor. The English was great and the recipes were yummy. If you're any kind of semi-experienced home cook, it may move a bit slow for you. The pace seemed to work for most of our small class, but we probably would have liked more doing and less watching the instructors. That said, would recommend if you have a free half-day in Bangkok!

Cooking with smile). Cooking with smile - its phrase can be second name of school) The chefs was very frendly and has a lot of joking. It was nice experience, but I was with my baby and it was hardThe pecepies is simple and it ll nt interesting for professional chefs but for travalers its coodNice food, nice staff and nice organizationbut I have seen one large a minus. the program was built "cook & eat, cook & eat ... and 4 times like that.." We was running from table to table) I prefer when one big dinner of the and, but its only mine own opinion

Great day out. this was a great, organised cooking school. it was fun and the food was great. the market tour was informative and the transport was good. it was a good tour just to get there. i would do it again

Totally recommend!. Hidden in the back streets of Bangkok, a Garden paradise cooking schoolHelpful and full of knowledge Chef and trainers.Your given your own recipe book, photos, and friendly staff there to show you around the gardens which herbs are used and then get stuck into cooking a 3 course yummy mealThe school is so relaxing and a very enjoyable site/tour to visit

A spa-like experience!. You'e picked up at the hotel and brought to a fruit/vegetable/fish market for a tour, then it's a short drive to the school.I was in awe when we got to the school. It looks like a health spa with water features, few walls and simple furnishings.The chef and an assistant will show you how to assemble and cook each of three courses. In between, you'll assemble and cook each dish at your own wok, then eat it with plenty of leisure time between courses.You'll be greeted with a welcome drink of chilled lemongrass tea served in a decorative tin cup. Those cups can be purchased at their small gift shop after the overall instruction. The gift shop also sells spatulas, aprons, woks, etc.This is a fantastic, memorable experience not to be missed if you have the time in Bangkok.

Great Fun. This was my first cooking class, the 3rd for my wife and our 1st together. The driver picked us up from our hotel at 12:50pm and delivered us to the cooking school located in a quiet suburban area, a little tropical oasis with a beautiful 2 storey Thai building, which was very well designed and laid out. They conduct morning and afternoon cooking classes run by typocally beautiful Thai ladies, kind, sweet and helpful. First you get an interactive tour of their herb gardens which includes making coconut cream & milk. Every class has 4 courses with different combinations every day - choose the one you want from their website. Each course starts around the chef's bench with a demonstration, questions/answers and tasting. Then it's to your own cooking station with the menu to have a go yourself under their supervision. After each course you sit by the pond and enjoy your cooking. The final course, the mains, once cooked is taken upstairs to enjoy in their dining area overlooking the garden. Their drivers then are you back to your hotel, we returned at 5:45pm thanks to the typical Bangkok peak hour traffic. We both thoroughly enjoyed ourselves at this school, it was very relaxed, informative, enjoyable and funny. Our only regret was that we did this on our last day in Bangkok, we just wished we had more time to enjoy another cooking class. I have no hesitation whatsoever in recommending this to anyone who loves food and wants to spend 5 hours having fun.

Awesome Thai cooking experience !!!. This class was awesome !!! Learnt how to make a delicious green curry paste (and also three other dishes) . The class was also beneficial as I learnt a lot about Thai food and which chillies make their Thai food hot !! (Which has been a huge bonus being over here on holidays for a few weeks ) would definitely recommend to anyone who loves their cooking like me!!!!!

Highlight of Thailand Trip. BaiPai Thai Cooking School was a highlight of my trip. It's a little oasis in the middle of busy Bangkok. The chef and chef's assistant were both so friendly, had a great sense of humor and just wanted to ensure we had the best, most authentic experience. The school itself is beautiful and the dishes we made were delicious. I would highly recommend this school as a perfect way to spend a half day in Bangkok. Even if you won't be in the city for too long I still would say this is a must-do!

baipai cooking school bangkok. This was one of the highlights of my trip. Not only able to choose the day you wish to attend but also the menu you want to cook. The staff are so helpful [ if a but slack with the knife as I am,] The repertoire between the two chef's is an entertaiment in itself. We saw how to do it, tried it and then attempted our selves and THEN compared our dish to the chefs.. !!!!!!!!!.All in all a wonderful experience even for the very young to a senior llike me. If you can hold a knife and cut cut cut you are a starter. I will go again when I return to Bangkok.

Fantastic!. Saw this on trip advisor, and my husband and I decided to give it a go!Great venue, and a wonderful vegetable garden to explore. Nok, our teacher made the class fun and very easy to follow, she demonstrated, we ate, then we cooked the dish ourselves. We had a great mix of students, some who had never cooked before (including my husband) to experienced cooks. We came away having thoroughly enjoyed ourselves, and my husband who doesn't even know where the kitchen is at home, booked up for a 2nd class two days later!If you go to Bangkok, this cooking course is a must.

Wonderful experience. I led a group of volunteers to Thailand and as part of the trip I signed us up for this cooking class! I love Thai food and was looking forward to learning how to cook some of it! Myself and the team were not disappointed. The staff, from the pick-up driver, to the chef and her assistant, were all wonderful and very nice. The grounds of the school are amazing. It's worth the trip there just to see the building and the garden. We were given a tour of the garden before the cooking class and shown the Thai herbs. We even made our own coconut milk and cream to use later in an recipe. This is definitely worth your time if you're visiting Bangkok and you enjoy Thai food.

Great addition to any trip to Bangkok!. We spent 2weeks in Bangkok with a group and on our last day we went to the cooking school. It was one of the highlights of my trip most defiantly. I am not someone does much cooking at home so I wasn't sure what to expect, but the grounds alone of this school is worth the class! It's a sanctuary in the middle of Bangkok! All ingredients for your set menu are grown right in the garden! Our chef and host were very lovely, knowledgable and patient. You are to make 4 dishes, by watching the tutorial given by the chef, then you take your ingredients to your "kitchen" and try yourself. To save on time (class is only half day) most veggies etc are pre-cut. It was the best meal I had the entire time in Thailand! Worth taking a half a day to do!

Great way to spend half a day!. A wonderful lesson were you learn 4 thai recipes and time to eat as you go! It was truly a delicious experience and fun! We had step by step lessons and they emailed us pictures at the end and gave us a cookbook of what we made. This was a beautful site outside of the city that was nice escape that was peaceful.

bkk cooking class. The BaiPai cooking class was fabulous! The gardens and the property were so relaxing and beautiful that we did not want to leave. Puu and her staff were very good and welcoming to us. Driver picked us up and took us back, could not be better. Food we prepared was delicious too, had so much we took it home and ate on our patio overlooking the river. Best cooking class in Thailand.

Totally Thai Experience. The school was wonderful. Our hotel water taxi provided the most efficient arrival. The instructors were fantastic, the food was outstanding. The presentation was easy to follow with hands on instruction.
The best part was enjoying our dishes!

Our Favorite Activity in Bangkok!. This was hands down our favorite activity during our stay in Bangkok! The shuttle from the cooking school came and picked us up at our hotel and in the shuttle were a couple of other people who were also attending the cooking class.Once we got to the Baipai Thai Cooking School location, I was quite surprised to see how serene and beautiful it was in the middle of all the hustle bustle of such a big city.From the second we got there till the moment we left, it was extremely interactive and fun.Our instructors were absolutely hilarious and they taught us how to make really yummy things. You get a mini cookbook and a pen to take notes while they teach you. I have yet to make anything but I plan on trying some things that we learned.You cook 3-4 things and after each item, you take a break and enjoy eating what you made and interact with the other people who are also taking the class. I believe the class size is only 8-10 people so it's very intimate and gives you a chance to meet people who are visiting from other countries. We met people from Australia, Colombia and other places so it was really cool!After the final recipe, they take you upstairs to the dining area so you can really relax and enjoy your food.They surprised us with a little souvenir which was a photo magnet of you cooking which was really sweet! Those 2 magnets are still on our fridge and everytime I see that magnet, it makes me want to go back and experience the cooking class all over again!Lastly, they have a little gift shop where we ended up buying a couple of things. We got a knife and a mortar pestle (the thing they use to mash guacamole/spices in). I thought the mortar pestle would look cute in our kitchen but the best buy was definitely the knife. It was only $8-10 and is hands down the best knife I've ever used. A knife like that here would be well over $50. So if you don't buy anything else, make sure to buy their knife!! I didn't have any issues bringing that back on my flight. Just make sure you put it in your check-in bag and not the carry on.Hope you enjoy the cooking class as much as we did!! :D

A very fun experience!. My sister and I did a half day cooking class at Baipai during our recent trip to Thailand. We were picked up at our hotel by an extremely courteous driver and made the short trip out of the city to the school. The grounds are beautiful, as is the house that the school is in. Chef Puu and her assistant, Jit, were very friendly and very funny. They both spoke English well and did a great job explaining the dishes that we made. A lot of the prep work is done ahead of time for you, which was fine by me. The cooking instructions were easy to follow and we got a copy to take home with us. We ate everything that we made and I was stuffed by the end! It was a really great experience and I would recommend it to anyone!

Brilliant - location - staff - food - all amazing!!. My two sons and I spent a morning learning how to cook 4 fabulous recipes - Thai Green Curry and Tom Yum Goong soup being our favourites. The Baipai School was spotless and the surroundings idyllic. The staff were friendly, fun and helpful. We were picked up from a nearby hotel. We enjoyed eating the dishes we had prepared. If you love Thai food and enjoy cooking then I cannot recommend this school highly enough.
We loved it!. Fantastic experience!!! Great location, great people, great food and lots of fun! Perfect to escape from Bangkok City to calm down for some hours.You should do it.

Highlight of our trip to Bangkok. Cannot recommend this cooking school highly enough - the staff were wonderful and so understanding of my health issues which make simple knife skills very difficult. They assigned me a personal assistant so that I could fully participate. The recipes were wonderful and we got to eat everything we cooked. The transportation to and from our hotel were included as was a very enjoyable and informative trip to the market. Lesley R - Toronto

Fabulous cooking course in Bangkok!. We decided to try the course at Baipai as it was so very well reviewed by other contributors, and it completely lived up to expectations and more! We were collected from our hotel, and spent about 4 hours at Baipai, touring the gardens learning about growing herbs and spices before starting cooking. The staff are terrific, Natalie is a great teacher and Chef Noi is a natural presenter and should have her own cookery show on TV! We learnt a lot from the demonstrations and cooked 4 courses of wonderful food - Classes are about 12 people or so, and everyone has their own work station. We cannot praise it highly enough, and will do another course next time we're in Bangkok.

A great experience. I highly recommend this place if you want to experience some authentic Thai cooking traditions in a beautiful Thai establishment. Even better, you even get to eat the fruits of you labour afterwards. Great and freindly staff!

Great enviroment! for a perfect cooking class!. the cooking school provides free round trip transfer to and from the school 2000 baht per person. great establishment i heard its newly build not too long ago. the lower level have 2 separate part for 2 classes to go on the same time. the max number of ppl for each class is 8. we all seat at a U shape table like a chemistry class. we all got a set of well prepared menu cards then after the chief's demonstration we test what it should test like. we than move on to our own turn. after the food is prepared we moved on to the dining table to enjoy our food after each course. this is a great day of fun my bf said this is his first time wearing an apron but this is the high light of our whole bangkok trip! the best thing is they will take photos of u during the cooking class and at the end not only they printed of a print each for the student on a fridge magnet as a gift for u. they also follow up with an email with all the pictures from the class. GREAT!!!!

Superbly organized, clear instruction, nice setting. Ok, it's a fair piece from city center, but that gives the tranquil setting a more relaxed atmosphere. Well designed facilities with nice style created a wonderful atmosphere. We picked set "D" as the one we'd most likely cook at home. From beginning to end, our cook and her sous chef/describer offered clear explanations as they demonstrated techniques. Watch, do; watch, do; watch, do, eat, and so on. Nice pace between recipes also afforded opportunities to chat with fellow chef wannabes. Over the course of four hours, we cooked, learned, and dined. Yes it was a little warm, but they kept our water glasses topped up at all times, and in the end we concluded it was an excellent, relaxing and fulfilling (experience and stomach-wise) way to spend an afternoon in Bangkok. One couple with us returned for their second course -- that says bundles. If only we had more time....

Absolutely top class!. We can't rave enough about our experience of BaiPai. We did the market tour and cooking class making three dishes which we ate together. They may seem a bit pricier than most but absolutely worth it. They picked is up from the hotel and dropped us back and the house where the classes take place is absolutely lovely!Very friendly staff, very professional service and all the recipes! Top class.

Cooking Thai Style. I found this cooking class to be very informative and fun! The staff are friendly and helpful and the setting is in a garden that makes you feel very relaxed and at home. You learn about the herbs and spices you will be cooking with and are then shown a demonstration of how to cook your dish and then after you cook yours you get to sit down after each dish and eat it. Yum thats the best part :) You also get to keep your recipes and the photos they take during your class are emailed to you. The class goes for about 3 hrs and is a 20 minute drive out of Bangkok city.

Absolutely great experience!. The driver from Baipai picked us up from our hotel right on time and after picking up one other person close by we drove to a farmers market and met Darin who did a great job of showing us around the market explaining what everything was, how it is used and letting us smell various herbs, plants and taste exotic fruits. She purchased a number of items and then we drove to the cooking school which was a pleasant surprise. We entered a compound with a nice garden and a Thai style building purpose built with classroom kitchens, dining areas, lockers to store your stuff and seating areas. We were given our recipe books, aprons and assigned numbers for our stations.The chef demonstrated each recipe, we sampled the finished product and then we made and cooked our own.The food was great, they kept providing us with water as it was hot and plenty of support. Afterwards they took us back to our hotel.

Fun and very tasty!. My partner and i came here not expecting too much, we arrived and fell inlove with this place and the people. This place is a little escape from the city, the gardens are so nice and everything is so clean. The cooking class itself was amazing, they helped my partner who only came cause i made him and they understood and joked about how he was "only there to eat" everyone was in on the joke and he ended up loving the class. The food was really good i cant believe i cooked it! The class was informative and just so much fun. Came home and have already made some of the dishes!

Excellent experience. A cooking class with Nathalie and Poo was the highlight of our weeklong stay in Bangkok earlier this month. The booking arrangements, class confirmation, collection from the hotel and the trip to the markets all went well; and was relaxing given the humidity and bustle of Bangkok. The cooking school is set in a beautiful garden and the kitchens are open, lots of cool ceiling fans and a very pleasant environment. The classes may be more suited to a novice, but a reasonably experinced home cook can still pick up a few useful hints. The staff are very pleasant, and all have good english. This cooking school is something I would recommend for a break from the shopping malls and markets of Bangkok.

disappointing. i recently attended this school and was not impressed. i am a chef working in atlanta. i came to bkk just to learn some thai cuisine. i didn't think the class instruction was good enough and worse of all it was really uncomfortable. there was no A/C and the chairs hurt my back. the weather in bkk is not conducive to outside classes. it was also inconvenient to get to the school. the teachers were nice and the food was decent, but i would not do it again.

Great for beginners (including teenagers). *Site was home-oriented, clean, outdoor-style, personalised, good ambience, outstanding facilities*Chef and assistant provided and re-emphasised clear instructions*Tour of herb garden was informative*Great transport arrangements*Excellent preparation and organisation*Service was perfect (I had Darin as the host) and polite and entertaining*GREAT VALUEAs a teenager inexperienced in cooking, this was a perfect 'difficulty' for me. Parents, if you feel like visiting the markets or going shopping when your children do not want to, send them here. Great way to pass the morning or afternoon productively, yet in a relaxed manner. Also great learning experience. I was arranged to be picked up and return at one of the hotels and I can assure that the transport is very safe. Also great for dads (or mums) who are currently not interesting in cooking but want to have more passion/interest in it.

Fantastic day. My partner and I got told before we left Melbourne that we must do a cooking class at Baipai, so we booked with our travel agent to make sure we didn't miss out as we weren't going to be in Bangkok for very long. It was a such a good experience with a lovely mixture of people in the class (from Australia, Hong Kong, Italy, Brunei) all keen to learn a thing or two. It was a fun and informative session, with hands on cooking and clear demonstrations. The food was delicious and has inspired us to do more Thai cooking at home instead of just getting Thai take-away! The cooking school has beautiful gardens where they grow some of their own ingredients. It was interesting to see how some of these looked before harvesting. We all went home with a photo fridge magnet and recipes from the session. They also pick you up from your hotel and drop you off afterwards, which was very convenient as we would never have found the place by ourselves. All in all it was money well spent. Thank you to Chef Noi and assistant Natalie for making it such an enjoyable day.

The best !. Last year for the 1st time we decided to do a cooking class in Bangkok. We had actually chosen another cooking school, but since they were fully booked we ended up with Baipai. And afterwards we were very lucky we did (see last summer's review). So, this year we decided to repeat the experience and chose another menu and instead of going in the morning and also taking in the market, we opted for an afternoon class. We learned to cook other dishes as a result. And we again enjoyed doing this class tremendously. Baipai is a very well organized school. The atmosphere is great. The teachers are very knowledgeable and experienced. With a great sense of humor. My husband who is diabetic and the fact that he cannot have sugar in his food was always taken into account. Even though it is a bit pricey, it is money well spent and we'd certainly do it again anytime. Thank you Baipai !

Perfect Introduction to Cooking Thai. The market trip was a small group, which made it easy for us to ask a lot of questions about the different foods. We learned the names of some of the fruit and tried samples. It was quite a beautiful setting, there were multiple kitchen stations with all of the upgrades, and everything was open to the outside. After each dish was prepared we all sat at the nearby table and enjoyed our meals. Everything tasted wonderful and each dish also had recipe cards so we can make the dishes when we return home.

Lovely location - ideal cooking class for the beginner.. I was short on time in Bangkok so I chose this school as they offered a half day course and collection/drop off from the Hotel was included in the price (a good thing too, as I would never have found it otherwise,). The course cost me 2200 baht as I was alone, although the price would have been around 2000 baht per person had I been part of a group. The school is not far from the city centre, but it feels a world away and is very peaceful. The location is set up as a formal school in a modern wood/concrete house with kitchens that open onto gardens and ponds. The teaching itself is straight forward and follows a set formula - you are issued with a booklet containing 4 recipes and you proceed to work through each in turn, led by a chef/teacher with an assistant. Whilst you are watching the demonstrations by the Chef, an army of assistants hustle in the background to prepare your workstation with everything that you will need. In this respect I do not think that this school would suit an experienced cook as much of the work is done for you (you are given just enough of each ingredient to make the required dish - pre-washed, peeled etc). Obviously you get to eat whatever you cook, and it is a great chance to chat to your fellow students. Most importantly though, the food that we cooked actually tasted really great. Overall - a really fun and informative experience.

The Best Cooking School. We had the chance as recommended by friends in Bangkok to try a morning cooking class at Baipai & WOW what a great experience it was - only wish we had taken class at start of our holiday then we could have taken a second class! The staff where amazing - friendly & informative - the Villa / kitchen/ garden surroundings where amazing - just serene to be there. The food we cooked was simple - easy to follow & tasted GREAT - we can't wait to have many Thai dinner parties with friends back home.Personal touches like Darin our guide took photos during the morning then sent them to our email with a lovely message - what a nice surprise when we returned home. One of the memories for us from our holiday in Thailand.

Great Cooking School. I've been to this school twice now and it is excellent. The location has been changed since I last went and it's now fabulous. The lessons are very good and the staff very friendly.A great way to pass the morning or afternoon.

Highlight of our stay in Bangkok!. We have been to Bangkok now seven times and generally only stay 2 or 3 days to do some shopping. This time we thought we would try something a bit different and since we love Thai food a cooking class seemed like a good idea so we checked out the options on Trip Advisor and went with the Baipai. This has to be one of the best things we have ever done in Bangkok, the experience alone was great and the chef and other staff were humorous, informative and more than happy to answer any questions along the way. The food we consumed throughout the day was even better! It was a great way to learn by seeing how it was done and then getting the opportunity to make our own which surprisingly turned out pretty good. We have tucked our recipes away to keep them safe and will look forward to having a go at cooking them again as soon as we get home. Thoroughly recommend this experience to everyone and it will be the first thing we do when next in Bangkok.

Far from the madding crowd - in Bangkok!. As a first-time cooking class attendee I wasn't too sure what to expect, but this was a great experience for my entire family. The instruction was most entertaining, and I picked up quite a few pointers about Thai cooking. But the hero of the afternoon was the location. While you start to wonder where you are going to end up as the bus winds through increasingly narrow suburban streets, the journey is worth it. The villa and surrounding gardens are beautiful, and provide a relaxing backdrop to tasting your own cooking. If you are planning an afternoon session, plan for a late dinner afterwards!

Really interesting - even the drive there was an experience. Other people have written about the course, which we also thoroughly enjoyed. We were collected from our hotel the central part of Bangkok and I found it really interesting to be driven to what seemed to be a suburb of Bangkok, down narrow winding roads until we arrived at the very pretty building where the classes were held. I felt we saw a bit more of the real Bangkok than we otherwise would have. The classes were great and I loved that they followed up once we were by emailing some more photos they took. I highly recommend this as a real taste of Thailand in more ways than one.

Great fun. This was our first time trying a cooking class and couldnt have had more fun. They picked us up/dropped us off from our hotel which was nice and easy.Nice small group, with a hilarious double act of Head Chef and her assistant leading the class that wouldnt have been out of place on morning television.Good mix of food to learn to cook, from spring rolls, a curry, nice salad.My wife is a vegetarian and we had let them know in advance, so they ensured she had plenty of substitute veggie ingredients.The class is set in lovely ground, with a very modern and clean cooking area. They took some great photos of us throughout the class and emailed them through after.

Good introduction to Thai cooking!. This is a very popular cooking school in Bangkok. I tried to book for it at least a month before the course and was told that the day I wanted was full and was placed on the waiting list. Fortunately there was a cancellation and was able to jump in.So we went for the Saturday morning class and was picked up at 8:30am at our hotel, arrived at the school and saw this beautiful garden with herbs and vegetables. We were served with a cooling lemongrass tea immediately.The class began promptly after everyone arrived and started a tour around the garden and was introduced some of the commonly used herbs in Thai food. Everybody had their own stations and was given a glass of iced water throughout the class.The demonstrations were quite clear and I had no problem following the instructions. We even cooked our own lunch!The only little complaint I would have is that everything was pre-cut and didn't take part too much, but I guess the focus was on the cooking technique and it was more of an introduction to thai cooking.I would recommend this class to you if you are keen on Thai food and cooking.

Great to do. They picked us up from our hotel. The grounds of the cooking class are amazing. Our assistant cook Natcha was lovely and spoke English very well. Our Head Chef Tao was very good at showing us techniques to improve our cooking. The facilities are very good and the menus you make are great. Very filling! Lemongrass tea is very refreshing when dealing with 32C heat.

One of the best things we did!. We really enjoyed our Baipai cooking experience. I love cooking and love eating, and it was really interesting to cook traditional Thai food. My boyfriend ( who usually leaves the cooking to me!) wasn't too keen on having a thai cookery course, but was so please that he did. The chef was very funny, friendly and added to the fun of the course. I now feel that thanks to BaiPai we can cook a mean Panang chicken Curry!The menu packs were a lovely touch and I still refer to them (almost a year later!). We were given photographs of us cooking, which was really great too. I would have loved to have been able to attend more classes but we ran out of time and had to go home!

Baipai Cooking Course. A delightful experience. The venue was an oasis in the city limits of Bangkok. Beautiful grounds with lovely gardens. Cooking class was held in outdoor kitchen, everything was organized to the nth degree, the food was delicious and the instructors insured that we understood the whole recipe and how it was done. Course cost included transportation both ways. We received follow up email with photos that day. No pressure to buy their products, really well done!

Truly enjoyable. We really enjoyed the friendly and easy-going atmosphere. The lesson was well-conceived and easy enough for amateurs like us. We got to enjoy our own cooking at the end of the lesson. We will definitely go back during our next trip to Bangkok.

One of the BEST things we did in our 14 days in Thailand!. We originally had our third day in Bangkok as a free day, but twice in the 2 previous days we had run into people who had taken a cooking course at Bai Pai cooking school and raved about it. So we arranged it through our hotel to attend the morning session. We were picked up at the hotel around 8am and we drove to other area hotels to pick up other class participants. The school is located outside of the city, about a 30ish minute drive. We arrived at the school and we were greeted by Mona, who would be our group leader for the day along with our chef, Noi. The place is stunning. Open air, but well ventilated, so not too hot. It really looks like the set of a cooking show on the the food network! We were given cold towels and a cup of cold lemongrass tea and explanations of how the morning would proceed. We started with a tour of the gardens and were shown many of the ingredients we would be cooking with. After that we learned how to make fresh coconut milk and coconut cream. Anyone who wanted could have a go at grating the fresh coconut. Simple and easy. Then we moved to the kitchens to prepare the days menu. Homemade green curry with chicken, chicken pandanus, egg custard and papaya salad. It was an amazing hands on learning experience. Both Mona and Noi were amazing, a real comedy duo, who were always helpful and offering good tips. Ice water was constantly being refilled and we took regular breaks to eat the food we had just prepared. Somewhere after the 2nd dish, my husband and I decided that we were having such a great time, we wanted to stay for the afternoon course as well! On that menu, spring rolls, masaman curry, pomelo salad and chicken holy basil stir fry. We asked Mona if there was availability, and she arranged it in just a few minutes, no problems, no fuss. The morning course ended and they informed us that we all Passed and handed out refrigerator magnets with action shots of us cooking throughout the day. Nice touch! Onto the afternoon session, it was us and 4 others, small and cozy! We had Nat as our leader and I cannot remember the chefs name, but he was great as well! Afternoon session was just as great and we ended up getting along really well with the other participants, so much that we all decided to go on a day trip the next day together!! At the end of the day, we ended up buying 4 of the knives used in the course, plus several beers and our grand total for 2 of us, whole day of cooking instruction, plus round trip transfers was about 8000 Baht. Astounding value for money! And truly an awesome. Awesome day. This is a MUST if you are a foodie or just love to cook. Appropriate for any level of skill!! DO IT!!

Best thing we did in Bangkok!!. We booked this cooking class for our last day in Thailand, and when the day came we were tempted to spend our money on shopping rather than this cooking course, but I am so thankful we didn't! They pick you up from your location, and when you arrive, you are absolutely pampered the entire day. Its located in a beautiful, serene area. Upon arrival they give you a copy of all the recipes to keep and a delicious cool sweet tea drink. The show you how to do everything so it is simple,and truly authentic. Throughout the day we were given iced towels (which were a blessing since it was so hot) and ice cold drinking water. The food was so delicious, and by the end of the day we were bursting at the seams we were so full! The chefs were such a hoot, we will truly miss all the staff. We had such a fun time we absolutely recommend going, it is 100% worth it!!

brilliant. Fantastic cookery school. Excellent service - we booked online, they pick you up from your hotel and return you at the end. Staff were BRILLIANT - extremely competent as well as entertaining and friendly. We learned a lot, the setting and food was beautiful. They even made me an impromptu birthday cake. We will return for more!

Enjoyable and easy!. A really enjoyable way to prepare your own Thai food, well managed, friendly and reasonably priced. Demands no real cooking skills (the best chef in the group was a teenager) and everything is from the basics, including making your own curry paste.

Great activity in Bangkok, slick operation. Took a class yesterday. From the first email inquiry through to our drop off everything ran like clockwork. We decided on the Friday morning market tour and class. The market tour was informative and well conducted. Our guide, Cookie, was delightful, knowledgeable and a credit to the school. We had opportunity to ask questions and take lots of photos. Cookie also organize lots of taste tests. Recommended!The school itself has been well described below, it is an unexpected oasis.Small touches like lockers, hand washing facilities, lemongrass tea and keeping our water topped up were much appreciated.Our menu was golden money bags, Thai beef salad and pad Thai. Instruction by Chef Noi and Mona was concise and entertaining. We watched Noi, tasted the produce then made our own version. Lots of opportunity to ask questions. Clean and hygienic kitchens. Entertaining and friendly staff. Sitting down with our group of 11 was a very pleasant way to taste each course.Website is comprehensive. We paid 2000 Bht pp as a couple.Highly recommended.

Best cooking school. When on vacation overseas, I love to attend cooking classes. This was the best cooking school so far. My hotel was outside pick-up area to we had alternate pick-up location which was easy. After pick-up, took about 30 min drive to market. Market was very clean and really nice. There was sooo much food I would have loved to try. After we did our market tour we were off to school which was about 20 min drive. Arrived to cooking school and site was beautiful and breath taking. It was like paradise. Love the way the school was set-up and how it flowed. The teacher cooks the dish and you taste test then you cook your own dish and then you eat your own dish. Every student has their own cooking station so you don't have to worry about eating someone else's food. Only did one cooking class but would return. Great experience. My cooking group had 8 but there was also another group there of 8 that had their own kitchen and you didn't see them again until the end.
Excellent. I went to the school yesterday and I really loved it, the staff were so friendly and helpful and the food was delicious. I would highly recommend it.

Fun fun fun. This is the third time we have done a cooking class at Baipai and we loved it just as much. The staff are great and provide very entertaining, informative lessons. The food is great so don't eat a big breakfast before you go.

Had to do this when we were in Thailand. This was our second visit to Bangkok. This time we had spent some in Chiang Mai before returning to Bangkok for four days. As had done most of the 'usual' sightseeing trips in Bangkok before, we thought we would include a cookery school this time. The trip was arranged with our tour guide, but if I look at the cookery school website, I could have booked directly. I enjoy cooking, so the trip was mostly at my behest, but my wife came along as well.We were collected from our hotel and taken to the school - it seemed like a 20 minute ride.When we arrived at the gates and they opened, I was truly surprised at what I saw. The school itself is in its own grounds and is like an oasis of peace inside a bustling city.Although there were quite a few students attending the session - all seeming to arrrive at once in a number of minibuses - we were split into smaller groups and that was pretty much the last we saw of them until we ate lunch.Each group was split into six, each group had a guide and a cook. After a bowl of lemongrass tea (fantastic), we were shown around the gardens to see all the herbs and spices growing before we went to the openair classroom / kitchen.Cookie (our english speaking guide) talked us through the processes and each group had its own english speaking cookery instructor. We had a number of demonstrations on how to cook an element of the meal, then we each had a cooking station where we would do the process for ourselves.In the end, we prepared a four course meal, which we ate partly in our smaller cooking group (the soup and satays) and the main course and the dessert we ate as a large group.It was a really well organised session, well worth the money and helped me produce some great tasting Thai food. We each ended up with a recipe pack and some fridge magnets with our photos. What was a nice touch they emailed us photos they had taken during the session. At the end of it all, we were taken back to our hotel or dropped at the shops - whatever we selected.It was a great session, really enjoyed. Even my wife enjoyed it - and she was not that keen when I suggested we should book in the first place

Iron Chef meets Benihana" - You'll have a blast!. An afternoon at the BaiPai cooking School is the ideal activity for those who have already enjoyed Bangkok's highlights. While not inexpensive by Thai standards (@$60), it was worth every penny. The fee provided door to door taxi, a welcome beverage, three delightful hours of cooking demonstration, practice and "taste testing" and a final meal of the four courses you have prepared, all amonst conversation with new friends. The facilities are clean, open air, the instructions are easy to follow and the teacher and hostess are so delightful you'll want to take them home as your private chef!. There's an eye to safety too, they were very responsive when I got chili pepper juice in my eye. Fun day - I highly recommend it. (Traveled in Oct 2010 - never got around to reviewing...)

A delightful day cooking. I really enjoyed my market tour and cooking class at Baipai. The facilities are beautiful and the staff are profession yet fun. They go out of their way to make sure you are having an memorable experience. I learned several new things about Thai cooking and enjoyed a lovely lunch. It was also nice that they pick you up at your hotel and drop you off at your hotel or any other sight you would like. I will definitively take classes there again.

Beautiful experience. We loved this! They picked us up at our hotel, took us to a market and explained the food we were seeing and offered us samples. The school is purpose built and in a beautiful setting. We each had our own cooking station and then had our own food for lunch. They were very accommodating to my gluten allergy, offering substitutes.

Great Bangkok experience. Very enjoyable experience. We started in the market. If we had questions about some food we saw, our guide Mona would buy some of it and let us taste. The building is very nice. Lots of help with the cooking. We had LOTS of food, tasted the food the chef made, then ours. We were not rushed, ran 1.5 hours over schedule which was great. Some of this was due to traffic. Have taken a cooking class in Vietnam and this was excellent in comparison.

Came away with confidence and a full stomach. After attempting to cook thai food for many years with little success, it was time to learn from the locals. Baipai was chosen due to the reviews on tripadvisor and the fact that they had a pretty cool website that made booking easy. I did two days of courses, learnt 7 dishes, all the popular ones you eat in any thai restaurant and attended the market tour on one morning. All in all, this was an amazing two days where professional staff made your day run so smooth and enjoyable. Both days, I didn't have to think about lunch or dinner as you eat everything you make. Highly recommend this to thai food lovers who want to learn to cook this amazing cuisine. You will be surprised how easy it is too cook amazing thai food in your own home. All courses are in english only.

The best family experience. My husband and I along with our two children, aged 12 and 9, we were a little worried about how the children would go. We were promptly picked up at our hotel and driven to the school, wow, how beautiful, the grounds building, furnishings were impressive. We were greeted by our host who took us upstairs where we had a welcome drink and learnt what we would be doing. We were given a tour of the grounds and introduced to their herb garden and taught how to make coconut milk and cream. Next we were taken where we met the chef, who was assisted by our host who spoke great english translated. We made a dessert and then were joined by a larger group where we sat around a large table with ingredients where each dish was demonstrated to us. We moved over to individual work stations where we prepared our dish. The children were more than accomodated and encouraged by the host and the chef, cooking the same dishes as the adults. At the end of each dish, the area was promptly cleaned and restocked with ingredients for the next course. At the end of the courses we all ate our prepared dishes together. I would say that we as a family had a fantastic day and enjoyed every bit of it. We were hesitant about taking the children but they enjoyed it just as much as we did, it was very hands on and the children coped very well. I would highly recommend this cooking school to people of all ages, we as a family learnt a lot, (even that I was making our Thai curries completely wrong) and I can see us as a family cooking the meals that we learnt at home. Thank you for a wonderful day

We loved it!. We had chosen another cooking school but our tour operator sent us to Baipai. When we realized that we were a little upset but at the end we loved it! The place is beautiful and the staff, specially Mona, is very very nice! Everything is very organized and clean and we cooked many delicious dishes. They picked us up in the hotel on time and at the end took us back in comfortable vans. We highly recommend it!

Fabulous food you can cook at home. We have been to Baipai Cooking School on 2 occasions, both times with our niece aged 12, then 14. She was the only kid on the course but they treated her well and she was old enough and mature enough to do everything the adults did, cooking her own meals at her own cooking station and absolutely loved it enough to do it a second time when we visited again. Kids who are not prepared to be a part of the class would not be welcome as there is nowhere for them to go off and play.Having said that, the food they teach you to cook is fabulous. It is Royal Thai cooking, not village style. It is very hands on - you watch the chef and taste, then cook it again yourself and eat it. There is a translator to assist with English if the chef can't make themselves fully understood. We always do 2 courses in the one day - very tiring, but you go away with 8 recipes. We find you have too much food to eat. They will give you takeaway boxes if you ask.Everything is very well done and planned - all your ingredients are premeasured, but you have to do the chop chop yourself. You do no washing up. They are very insistent on cleanliness and ask you to wash your hands very often.The setting is lovely, they pick you up from your hotel or apartment (usually takes about 45 minutes from the Silom area of Bangkok). We have done a few cooking schools in Cambodia and Vietnam. BaiPai is by far the most professional in every way - could not recommend them enough - having said that - it is not the cheapest cooking school you could find, if budget is important.

Great experience. Technically, I can't say Baipai is the best Thai cooking school because it's the only Thai cooking school I've ever attended. However, based on my experience during one morning class, I can say that it would be really hard for other cooking schools to surpass the Baipai experience. The setting is beautiful and the staff pay attention to the little details from the moment you get on the shuttle bus. It reminds me of a four or five-star hotel.Now, I just read some of the previous reviews, specifically those critical of Baipai. My conclusion is that different folks have different strokes. Whereas one reviewer might perceive the experience to be well-organized, another might consider it to be manufactured. Whereas one might enjoy walking through the garden and learning about the various herbs, another might consider this to be condescending. Whereas one reviewer might consider a chef assistant to be enthusiastic, another might consider her patronizing. Whereas one person might consider prepared portions to be efficient and helpful, another might consider it too easy. You get the point.So I guess it boils down to what you are hoping to gain from the class, your budget, and your current experience level. If you want something down and dirty (not literally), Baipai might not be your cup of tea. But if you are someone like me with limited cooking experience and a penchant for new experiences in beautiful settings, then Baipai may be well worth a visit.

We loved it. We got picked up from our hotel by the Baipai minivan, and brought into a modern cooking school building in a pretty garden. The class itself was fun, the chefs were very knowledgeable and helpful and spoke very good English. We thoroughly enjoyed it and liked the dishes so much, that we have cooked them multiple times after getting back home. Visit Baipai and you won't be disappointed.

Beautiful Oasis in the Middle of the City. The Baipai cooking school was one of the best things we did on our trip to Thailand! It was a lovely atmosphere, very peaceful and beautiful. The staff were great - very helpful and funny. We learnt so much about Thai cooking, including spices, vegetables and style of cooking. The staff were aware that certain ingredients cannot be obtained in certain countries and so told us about alternatives which we could easily find. It was a wonderful day and well worth booking into!

Best day ever... Attended the afternoon class to learn how to cook sping rolls, papaya salad, beef stir fry and Penang chicken curry. We were shown how to make these dishes by Chef Noi and Khun Mona, these 2 ladies work so well together and ensure there is alot of fun and laughter to be had. We had a great afternoon learning to cook these Thai dishes and of course Chef Noi made it look so easy. The surrounds of Baipai are also very lovely and peaceful to learn to cook and eat the food you have just prepared. They have thought of everything and are very organised. I would highly recommend this cooking school to everyone.Chef Noi first cooks the dish and allows you to taste the dish so you know how it should taste, then its off to your work stations to cook it yourself. Chef Noi also explains if you cannot find certain ingredients in your own country, what alternate ingredients can be used. Everything is cut and prepared for you, all you have to do is slice and dice and pound in the mortar and pestal, then cook the meal. There is also another lady working in the background who cleans up after you and then prepares your workstation for the next meal. Baipai also pick you up from your hotel and drop you back afterwards, they have lockers with keys if you need to lock you bag away.. Very very organised, thanks for a great day, cant wait to try these dishes in my own kitchen..

Great fun for all the family. We booked on the net with no problems at all. Organised with them on the net about my 6 year old daughter cooking with us. Also not a problem. Picked up from our hotel in air con van. Fantastic place, very well run and very informative regarding ingredients and cooking. They included my daughter as one of the cooks, she was unable to use the hot cooking stoves, which is understandable regarding safety issues.We were given aprons, recipe cards to take home and photos of our day. We all had a great time and enjoyed eating our food after cooking it. The only thing I would suggest is to take a bottle of water to drink. We would/will do this again.

Well orchestrated, fun, educational, gorgeous setting. Popular recipes.. I went for a half-day in the morning, including the trip to the market, which is an essential part of the information available at this school. People who missed that were not up on ingredients as much, and getting the correct ingredients is key. The recipes we did included Satay and Pad Thai - yes, perhaps a bit lame in that these are the most well known, so I felt that they weren't giving away any great secrets to Thai cooking, but perhaps there are more to be found in a multi-day class. Nonetheless, the experience was excellent. On-time pickup in nice van, drive out to the morning market across from JJ market, then to the house, which, when revealed behind the tall gate, is simply gorgeous! Lovely garden, house, well organized kitchen, bathrooms, lockers, everything needed. The staff was particularly good and knowledgeable, and they spoke English well and taught with enthusiasm and good humor. The kitchen for students was fine except for the very dull knives they put out (more dangerous than a sharp knife as the saying goes..) The Pad Thai I cooked was one of the best I tasted of this ubiquitous dish. A tour through the garden was also very informative about the ingredients used in Thai cooking. So, all in all, a great way to spend a morning, afternoon or all day! Value is decent as half-day during this time was only about $60 US

Great experience, glad we went here.. A wonderful atmosphere, after the winding drive here it is a magic surprise when you see the house and the garden they have here. The kitchen is well thought out and designed. It was great to be shown some of the produce in the garden and seeing feeling and smelling the differences to some items compared to what we would use in Western style cooking. We were there after all as we LOVE Thai cooking, this course now has given us the skills to shop right and cook their wonderful recipes at home. Thank you Nok.

Traditional Thai house,garden tour of herbs and great cooking class. This is a return visit to Bangkok with my daughter and wanted her to experience a Thai home and cooking.This class was fabulous.Learnt lots about the use of herbs,chillis,pandanus leak and made 4 easy and tasty dishes.We return tomorrow for our 2nd class.Would recommend this class to a wide range of people.they are organised and efficient and collect you from your hotel in an air conditioned van.

A little piece of Thai cooking paradise. When the Cooking with Poo class was booked out, I emailed a few fellow expats & asked for a cooking class recommendation I could do with my mother in law - who is a brilliant cook - so her standards are high. All three recommended BaiPai. After a quick email we were booked in for the afternoon class - 1800THB. We had to BTS it to Asok where we were picked up & taken to the school, which is a little piece of paradise in the BKK burbs! Our guide was lovely, as was the chef. They gave us a quick run through the herb garden & showed us common Thai ingredients and why they are different to what's at home - eg Ginger v's Galangal & what we could substitute if we couldn't find it at home. We did 4 courses, all very yummy. The chef does a demo of the recipe first, then you move to your stations to do it yourself. To squeeze in that many dishes a lot of the prep work is done for you, eg the tenderloin for the spicy beef salad was already cooked. The food was delicious, I'm looking forward to trying the make the marinated chicken & peanut satay - yum! Compared to Cooking with Poo this is very slick. The environment is lovely, the English level excellent, the staff are lovely - a very polished outfit! I would recommend it and will certainly be going again.

Best day in Bandkok. First we went to the Market and saw the local produce we would be using and how they made the coconut milk and cream then off to classMy husband cannot cook but he can now make chicken satays we learnt to make 3 dishes in total When we arrived home there was an E Mail with 15 photo taken on the day wonderful

Cooking fun. Great start at the market but a page to help as a reminder of some of the vegatables we tried and were shownThe cooking instruction was excellent and the food tasted goodTravel to and from good trip Surrounds and equipment very goodWould recommend as better than a holel as this was hands on they showed then we did it

Delicious food and i cooked it :). This is great if you have a morning or afternoon to spare. They prepare everything for you and you have everything set up for you to use. Even someone with little cooking experience could do this course. Some of the cooking techniques were very useful and i bought some of the recipes from here as i enjoyed it so much.

Great experience. Transportation from our hotel to the school was prompt. The class was a lot of fun. The instructors were engaged and encouraged participation from the class. Learned about the local ingredients and what substitutions we could make if we couldn't get the ingredients at home. Learned how to make Thai Beef Salad, Spring Rolls, Green Curry with Chicken and Egg Custard. Delish! Have made the recipes at home and they are just as good as they were in Bangkok! Enjoy!

A "must do" for anybody who likes thai food. This morning my husband & I took part in a cooking class organized by Baipai Thai Cooking School. The reservation procedure was easy : just filled in the form on the website, received a confirmation a little later in the day, confirmed the booking by telephone and agreed on a pick up time.Pick up from the hotel was on time and after picking up a few other people we went to the market. Very clean, very attractive market. Got to learn about all the ingredients used in the dishes we were going to make later. Was very interesting. We then were driven to the house where the cooking took place, which is a beautiful open house in the Tchatutchak district where the cooking islands are downstairs and seating area upstairs.We received plenty of bottled water to keep us hydrated during the course and then we met the chef. The chef and his assistant - the young lady who had been with us at the market - explained every dish first, cooked the dish in front of us and then it was up to us to recreate it. With their help. In the end we could eat what we'd cooked.It was all in a very relaxed atmosphere, it was lots of fun and it was also very well organized.Everybody who worked there was so friendly and helpful.It really was a great experience which I most certainly would like to do again next time I'll be in Bangkok. And this is also true for my husband.After the cooking lesson we were driven back to our hotel.You don't need to bring anything, there are lockers to store valuables, everybody receives an apron and a towel. Do bring your camera because there's plenty of opportunity for nice photoshoots.

Good school, friendly teachers and reasonable variety. We did the afternoon course and were picked up in a very clean and airconditioned van from where we were staying at 1245pm near Thanon Sathon. After collecting some other people we took the freeway and about 1/2 an hour later arrived at a beautiful traditional Thai collection of little 'sala' style two storey buildings. After a cool towel and some excellent icy cold lemongrass tea we did our introductions with Mr Tum, who was our guide for the afternoon, and Chef Nok's assistant.We had a group of 9 which was actually perfect, with a range of people from Australia (us 2 and 3 others), two Brits, and a German/Dutch couple. Everyone was very keen which helped, and readily asked questions of the very knowledgeable Chef Nok as we went along.Our menu consisted of Spring Rolls (made from scratch), Som Tum (spicy green papaya salad), Stir Fried Beef with Big Chillies and the best dish - Panang Curry (again - paste and all made completely from scratch). There are a number of other menus you can select from - it just means you select what day you want to attend to get that menu (the menus are aligned to certain days). There was another course finishing as we arrived but the changeover was seamless and we barely saw them as they finished up and left.The preparation behind the scenes was great and again seamless, by the team you'd been through the instruction part, your own individual cooking station behind you was ready with all the ingredients ready to be chopped up or whatever was necessary to make your dish.The first three dishes we made and then sat down to eat once each was ready. This is the first school I have done where you can buy beers to have while you eat - a bonus since the day was very hot and since the place has wide open walls and fans (no aircon) unless the fans are cranked or there is a breeze it can get quite warm. This is probably worsened in the afternoon, but that said it didn't detract from the course.The last dish took a bit of time to make but then we wandered upstairs with our plates and had rice and more beers with them. After that we moved to the office/boutique shop to pay (I thought that this was particularly good since they don't demand money up front - it makes the experience nicer in my eyes).After all was said and done the driver drove us back to our hotel and we arrived about 1815hrs. One of the best parts was having the pickup as opposed to trying to find your way to a particular place by a certain time. Another really nice touch was where they email you a number of photos that they take of you as the day goes on - and at no extra cost. The professional recipe cards in a little stand/folder are all available for sale (in case you can only do one course - that said there was a British fellow who had done the course 4 days before and returned to do another one since he liked it so much).Lastly - something I really liked was that we could do the course without going to visit a market. I have done a number of courses and been to the markets in a number of Asian countries while doing them, and while that's great the first few times - after that it's the same thing over again. This is a definite plus as you spend more time cooking.

excellent way to spend the morning, highly reccommended. we really enjoyed this trip, the instructors were so enthusiastic, genuine and entertaining. We drove through the tiny backstreets of a Bangkok suburb to this amazing house, especially set up and built for cooking classes, it was an oasis in the middle of the city. Empressive grounds, very relaxing atmosphere and very professional staff and kitchens. We made 3 dishes, all tasted amazing, and picked up some helpfull hints and knowledge we will be taking home to impress all our friends. Would do it again if I could!

fun class.
