This class is fun, first they took us to a local market showed us around things, then back to a private residential house to start cooking.It's fun to know people around the world, and learned thai cooking together.after the class, you can just tell them where u want to go , hotel or downtown area, they will drop u off there.Nice service, nice staff.If you attending a morning session, just remember DO NOT eat breakfast, cuz you will get so full after it...

Great Introduction to Thai Cuisine. From the hotel pickup to being dropped off again this experience was just great.A perfect balance between theory, ingrediants, preparation, cooking and... eating!Two dishes were simple, two were not - but I think we will be able to reproduce all four at home and impress our friends!Nat was a perfect hostess and the environment was delightful.This was probably one of the only experiences in Thailand were they didn't try to sell us things and we didn't have to negotiate anything (in fact the photos that the Baipai team took during the session were sent to us for free by eMail the day after the course and we were given a Magnet with our photo as a going away present!)!Great value for money (much cheaper than option the hotel was trying to sell).For the reviewer who complained that this was too easy, well, living a long way from Asia we very much enjoyed the Garden tour and seeing what the ingrediants look like when they don't come out of a can/plastic bag. We are not Thai kitchen experts (although we are big fans of Thai restaurants) so this was great help for us - that's why we took the course. We have done similar classes in Paris where we live and found Baipai much better than the French classes for French Cuisine! We also saw that at the same time as our class they were also giving a private class to a professional cook from the US, perhaps that would have been more appropriate for you.

Awesome Experience. This was an excellent cooking experience. Chef Nok and her off-sider Tum were awesome in conveying how to expertly prepare and cook the 4 dishes we made that morning. Also which was invaluable, the background for each ingredient and what to use and what not to use, especially with what you can source back home.Disregard the negative reviews relating to it being a basic and impersonal course; this was far from it. We had 9 people in our group and our hosts interacted with all of us. Also getting to know ingredients and why they are used and why others are not is part of being able to cook these dishes like a pro.Make sure you book at Baipai. It's a great way to spend half a day with these professional and entertaining hosts in Bangkok!

Look Elsewhere for a more Authentic Experience. My daughter and I signed up for the half day, afternoon session, at Baipai Thai Cooking School based upon a recommendation from one of my daughter's friends. The school is located in a beautiful setting outside of Bangkok. Upon arrival we were given a cooling cup of lemongrass iced tea and an apron. Next we were introduced to our instructors Tum and Chef Nok. No time was wasted! The cooking demonstration began immediately. The pace was exhilarating! Demonstration lesson, off to our cooking station to cook what we just learned, hurry up and cook, then eat...repeated until we cycled through all four of our recipes. Whew! The recipe cards are beautiful, the instructors personable and funny, the food was mediocre but pleasing to the tourist palate, the pace is ridiculous and the cost is comparatively expensive. If your visit to Thailand will extend to Chiang Mai, I would recommend waiting to attend cooking school there. Chiang Mai offers a plethora of cooking school options where you can receive full day instruction with more menu options for half the cost. If attending cooking school in Bangkok is your only option then I would suggest you look elsewhere for a more authentic Thai cooking school experience.

Excellent hands-on class with great chefs!. My husband and I booked a cooking class at Baipai as part of a 4 day trip to Bangkok - very glad we did as the class was top notch!We were picked up from our hotel (on time) and whisked away to a lovely residential part of the city. On arrival we were humbly welcomed with lemongrass tea and refreshing towels.We attended the morning class where we learnt how to prepare and cook golden tasty parcels, hot and spicy soup (Tom yum), Penang curry and fried pork rice.The class was enjoyable and made very entertaining and informative by Nat and her chef and team of helpers. The kitchen was clean and well equipped! Our workstations were always cleaned down for each item we cooked!The class had 9 people which was just right and did not feel too busy/ full.The line up was to watch the chef prep and cook an item and for you to follow at your own work station. This line up worked very well and it was highly interactive and fun.The reciepes learnt were delicious and we had plenty of time to enjoy the food we had made over a drink, without feeling rushed in making the next item.After class, the school then took us to back to the City to a location of our choice! An excellent service!The cost of the class was well worth it, it included ingredients, learning to cook 4 great traditional items, eating the 4 items, detailed recipe cards and a reliable pick up and drop off service!Shame we were only in Bangkok for 4 fun filled days! Greedily, it would be great to have squeezed in another excellent class... Next time :)

Fantastic hands on Thai cooking experience. I went with my husband and another couple, the course had a mix of single travellers, couples and friends. We attended the half day course in the afternoon, it was a great mix of learning new skills, entertainment and great food. The course kept you entertained the whole time, even though the course was fast paced and you came away with recipe cards to attempt everything at home again.Basically the chef and assistant would do a demo then you would go back to your own station and attempt what you had just been shown. It was not complex cooking which made it entertaining and easy to follow along.We had Chef Noi and she was very funny and helpful (a bit like your mum watching you cook in the kitchen) and the assistant was Tum a bit of a comedy duo.Once you cooked each course you would sit at a communal table to eat it, at which point you could also order drinks which you paid for (beer, soft drinks & water).Highly recommend the experience whilst in Bangkok.

waste of time. you would really need to be an inexperienced cook to get value here. Its not personal..maybe its getting too big. They assume you know nothing, and pass around lemongrass and other common thai key ingredients for you to smell and touch as if they are new discovery ...its all rather perplexing and quaint. There is a sense they are trying really hard but somehow missing the mark.

Great experience, interesting, learnt alot and heaps of fun!. We really enjoyed our Thai Cooking class here. The staff were great and we learnt alot about thai cooking. The dishes we made were delicious. Great place.

A must for all foodies. The best culinary experIence I've ever had started off and ended with a hotel pickup and drop off which is very convenient for tourists. At Baipai, the welcoming, knowledgable and comprehensible Tum and Chef Nok provided our own recipe books and pens, stations from where we learned chopping to actual cooking, cooking tips and laughter. The lessons are simple and easy to follow set in a cozy and clean facility.
Excellent!!. Had such a great time @ Baipai! Tum and Nok were so helpful and friendly. Very worth the time and money, and I'd definately do it again.

Must do for foodies. My daughter and I recently did a class at the Baipai cooking School. If you enjoy Thai food you should put this on your list of things to do in Bangkok, the surroundings are beautiful and the staff are great, informative and amusing.

Great fun day with friends. The Baipai Thai Cooking School was a great day out with friends. It is fun with just the right amount of 'learning to cook Thai favourites' experience. We particularly loved that there was no pushy extra's that you often find with tours, set in a beautiful open plan house and garden.I would highly recommend this for families, friends and even corporate events.Thank you to the brilliant Thai Chefs who made it fun just watching them interact - I definately learnt some tips to cooking authentic Thai cuisine.

You have to do this !!!!. Thankyou Tum and Chef Noi for making my one and a half day stay in Bangkok amazing. This place is well out of town but the school sends a very new, clean bus to pick you up and drop you home. The school is like a resort with resort facilities. Our host Tum and Chef Noi clearly have a healthy respect for each other and made the experience fun and informative. It is very cheap for the experience ($AUD55). Everything is explained to you in regards to the cooking processes and even down to alternatives if you can't get the same food in your home town. You really have to do this class!!!

So good I did it twice. This Cooking School was fantastic. The staff were so helpful and friendly they made learning easy.The recipes were explained and cooked infront of us as a group and then we each cooked the same thing at our own cooking station with plenty of help and guidance from the staff. Then the good part we got to eat everything we cooked after making it.I enjoyed my morning so much, I booked another course for the next day.

A fun day in Bangkok. I was pleasantly surprised with how fun this day was. I was keen to learn how to cook some of my favourite Thai recipes - but the friendly staff made this much more than a cooking lesson. The day started at 9am when the mini-bus picked me up from where I was staying - we headed to the Or Tor Kor market which was full of local produce, Thai delicacies and beautiful orchids. The very charming Nathana (from Bai Pai) led the tour, inviting us to smell the herbs and taste fruits and sweets. From the market we were taken to the Bai Pai Cooking School. Set in a beautiful wooden building, surrounded by lovely gardens, the setting could not have been better to learn how to cook Thai food.The cooking demonstrations were fast; but recipes were provided for us to follow. After the demo, we each went to our station to try and recreate the dish. I specifically chose the day to attend based on the dishes on the schedule to cook for that day. We learnt to make 4 dishes, and we tasted each dish along the way. The last dish was eaten upstairs as lunch which was a nice way to finish the day.The bus returned us all home after lunch - I was home around 2pm.I guess that the amount of fun depends on having a good group in your class - but our group of 11 was very diverse, and there is no shortage of things to chat about with the common denominator of Thai cooking! Attending solo is no problem at all.I highly recommend this school - the staff were extremely professional and friendly. They never seemed to stop smiling which infused the day with warmth.A highlight of this visit to Bangkok !

slick to the point of robotic, not 'cool'. this experience seems so well oiled it and manufactured it felt to me to have lost its essence .. The staff seemed so attentive and uptight that I felt anxious..nobody was having fun and this appeared to make the staff even more awkward. Its too sterile. The food (mostly) pre cut and prepared..might suit the very inexperienced cook...I could not understand the chefs english, she asked me questions I had no idea what she was saying. I wanted something a bit more organic and real, sadly this was not it. I left early, the owner dropping me in the street, to catch a cab back to hotel...not a pleasant experience.

Loved it!. I try to take cooking classes on all vacations, and this one may be hard to top! We started with a market tour, which was such fun! We had some street food which was super yummy. When we arrived at the cooking compound, my jaw dropped - it was beautiful! The cooking class was such fun, and super well organized. The chef would demonstrate how to make a dish, and then we'd be charged with making our own at our own station. A lot of prep had already been done, but this was a great treat for all 4 dishes! Really an enjoyable day in Bangkok, with good company and great food!

A splendid afternoon. Booked this purely because of the great reviews from Tripadvisor. My partner was a little sceptical at first but by the end of the session, couldn't stop raving about it! There is nothing to fault about this experience though it may be a little basic if you have some experience cooking Asian food. There is however a good enough mix of instruction and participation (everyone gets their own work station) to hold your attention throughout. The set-up was world class, very well-maintained with high level of cleanliness. Lots of interesting tips about substitutes if you can't get the right ingredients, or which part of a spring onion to use etc Aside from keeping us out of the bars too early in the day, this was a memorable experience we're still talking about a few days after.

Brilliant - a Must Do. I had an 18 hour stop over in Bangkok between flights so I went to the morning session at Baipai. It really was great fun, very professionally run in beautiful surroundings. The food was fantastic and really easy to cook. Nothing is too much trouble - I was overcome with tiredness and was battling to stay awake which was noticed by the lovely ladies running the course - Nat and the Teacher - and they very kindly plied me with strong black coffee and some Thai remedy was rubbed into my temples and under my nose to wake me up! They were very caring and arranged for a taxi to pick me up and take me back to the airport - and they spoke to the taxi driver as I had been ripped off by the taxi that had brought me from the airport. Cost me half as much on the return journey!
Charming!. Go for it, it's a great experience and the staff is very friendly. You learn quite a bit actually.

Great Great Great Great and Great. An excellent morning with a great team of chefs!! The location was magnificently nested in a communal town. Once the Iron gates slide open, prepare to be amazed by what you see before you and the culinary treat in store!The food is simple to make and will definately be some of the best Thai food you eat while on vacation. I recommend picking up some of the bottled ingredients in a grocery store before returning home, beacuse if you are anything like me, you would be excited to show off your new found cooking skills soon after you return home.The subtle extras such as receiving pictures of your day via email and magnets prepared for you on site to take home as a momento, just add to the experience. Thanx Tum and team for a lovely day

The BEST part of my trip to Bangkok!. I took this class as a way to experience Thai food by cooking it. I am not a great cook by any means..but I thought this would be fun. This class Far Exceeded my Expectations! The Chef and his Assistant Golf were absolutely phenomenal with their attention to detail, assistance with the students and their hospitality. The Chef has worked all over the world and it was a pleasure to have him teaching little ol me..I would absolutely recommend this to anyone that visits Bangkok!

Fantastic food, location anyd people. This cooking experience was made easy, fun and most of all very tasty. The pick up and drop off made it easy as did the prep and clean up being taken care of. The chef and his assistant spoke excellent English and gave a lot of additional information about ingredients, cooking techniques and alternatives. The facilities are excellent and the photo mementos and recipe cards are great!

Once you've seen the grand palace Bangkok - visit Baipai. This cooking school is terrific. We did the afternoon course, got picked up from the hotel and taken to the school. The school is really modern, with excellent chef and teacher. There are small groups which make it fun. The best thing is that there are lots of great touches that make it special - recipe cards to take home, magnets that they make up for you and give you at the end of the visit, free emailed pictures when you get home and lovely people.The food we cooked was simple enough to cook, but with enough technical difficulty that you felt that you had learnt something new that you could do at home. The food we cooked was fantastic and you have the chance between courses (there are 4!!) to taste what you've cooked over a chilled beer or soft drink.After a day looking round the Grand Palace etc this is a welcome break in the schedule. I couldn't recommend it enough - I'll be back!

So much fun. We had so much fun with Baipai on our trip. They picked us up, delivered us to their lovely school, instructed us in five Thai dishes and returned us to our hotel. We enjoyed the delicious food and entertaining staff. Great day.

WOW - fabulous. What a great way to get imursed into the Thai culture. I have set myself a challenge of cooking my way around the world and this cooking school was one of the best I have done so far (and I have done quite a few). Baipai not only gave you the hands on fundamentals of Thai cooking with flair they also made it great great fun. Thanks for a fab time and will most definitely be back again soon.

great fun. this is the best cooking school that i have ever been to so much fun and beautiful location . The chefs are wonderful and very patient . The presentation of the cooking school is second to none ..... Well done guysIt was that good we did a second class

Totally Awesome Experience. My fiance loves cooking so I booked Baipai as a surprise for him. We went with a friend too during our recent holiday to Thailand. It was an amazing experience and we enjoyed every bit of the morning. We learn't alot too and we consider ourselves good cooks. It was a great pace and really hands on. The staff were very friendly, the menu we cooked was varied and I have to say totally delicious and very filling! I would recommend this to everyone and anyone - fab thing to do and great value for money. Thank you for a great experience Baipai!

Delicious, Fun and Educational!. I went to Baitai Cooking School by myself as my husband had a conference. The van picked me and several others up at our hotels and took us to the school which is in a lovely setting. It felt like you had left the hustle and bustle of Bangkok behind. The staff were very friendly and it was nice to meet and get to know the other people in the class. Our leader "Golf" really helped stir the camaraderie and we were all very relaxed shortly after arriving. They showed us how to make each dish then we went to our stations to prepare the dish ourselves which we then got to eat! I must say the food was delicious! We cooked four dishes in total and were given the recipes with clear instructions (we could also take notes while we watched it be prepared) and photos. It was a lot of fun and I would definitely recommend it for a group, a couple or solo. At $1900 baht it was a good deal as well.

The best part of my visit to Bangkok. I enjoy food/cooking and have worked in the food business (gourmet caterer) for part of my career. Despite this, preparing Thai food always eluded me, even when I would hunt down the ingredients at the local Asian market and follow recipes to the letter. So when I made my recent visit to Bangkok, I was eager to take part in a cooking class. Mind you, this is my second visit to Bangkok, so in terms of prioritizing "what to do" during this visit, I had seen many of the sights previously.Blue Elephant cooking school was recommended by my extended family in Bangkok. But I found nothing but good things about Bai Pai online.I called, and, as I was interested in making the most of my time, inquired about setting up a private class (just me, the chef and his assistant). This would let me pick my favorite items to prepare, rather than being stuck with one of the seven menus-whichever one was featured for the class for the day. They were very helpful in making this possible and were very good at following-up to finalize the arrangements by email.I will say the private cooking class was not a cheap endeavor. If you have flexibility in your schedule and can pick a course day when one of your favorite items might be featured in the pre-chosen menu, then that is the way to go, as it is only around $60. The private class for me was around $275 to prepare any 5 items of my choice. They provided transportation to their school, located near the Chatuchak Market (and BTS station). The school is the pleasant little oasis. In talking with their staff, this school is a new location that was recently constructed (an older location nearer the city they have closed). They have little lockers onsite for storage of you personal items during your class. I was welcomed with a little cup of tea, and provided an apron to keep tidy during the class.The mies en place for each of the items we were to prepare was perfect. The materials/menu cards were beautiful. The kitchens: perfectly equipped. The chef and his assistant spoke wonderful english and were welcoming, informative, patient and professional. The chef had me go through the step with him during the preparation of things like curry pastes. He would then cook the item, to demonstrate, then I would go to my station and try my hand at preparing the item. He would watch, and coach, as I went along.After preparing each of the items (which they keep warm for you-total time, door-to-door, about 5 hours) you get to enjoy what you have made. Go hungry, as it is enough food for a small family!As it was a Friday and traffic would have taken FOREVER to get back to the hotel via their shuttle (traffic!!), I had them drop me at the Chatuchuk BTS station. I would highly recommend!

The best food in Thailand - And I cooked it!. I would highly recommend Baipai Cooking school to anyone! Being a massive lover of Thai food and cooking in general, I was a bit worried that I would not learn much. I was very wrong. Our two teachers had wonderful English and thought us the in's and out's about Thai food (still very easy for a beginner cook to do). Good group sizes and the place is amazing and very clean. We laughed, we cooked and we got to eat some of the best Thai food on our whole trip - I just couldn't believe I had made it.

A must do for food lovers of all cooking levels!. We've done a number of cooking classes all over the world and I'd rate this as one of the best for cooks of all levels! Chef Noi was a good instructor and her assistant (sorry i forget her name) was outstanding as well...excellent English, answered all our recipe questions, gave us tips for buying thai ingredients in the US, and had a sense of humor in their delivery. We learned 4 recipes in about 3 hours time. The ingredients were prepped in a way that allowed you just enough hands on experience but not too much work...and chef Noi demonstrated each dish before you cooked it at an individual station (under guidance from the chef and assistants.) What makes the Baipai stand out from other cooking classes: the prepped ingredients and organization, reminders for frequent hand washing, you make and taste your own food (no teams where you make only partof one dish), lots of picture opportunities (your own and by the staff) and nice recipe cards.You should try for a morning class starting around 10am because it is cooler out and be aware their new garden fountain is not yet finished, but you can see how gorgeous it will be once done!

Great fun, great food. I can recommend this to anyone who enjoys Thai food. The course was easy to follow, well run, and fun.They catered for a vegetarian in our class, and even a few kids in the group enjoyed the day.Don't eat too much for lunch if you do an afternoon course, as you end up eating what you cooked throughout the afternoon.I have already had a go at 3 of the dishes at home, with some success.If you can, take some ingredients home with you from the local supermarkets as it can be diffucult to get some ingredients - for example, I still don't have the correct sort of Thai Chilli Paste for my recipes, and our tamarind paste is not quite right.Recommended, great day out.

Great Experience. Had a great time learning how to prepare Thai food and eating it!! Everyone had their own cooking station. They picked us up and returned us to our hotel in an air conditioned van very nice and clean. Very professional and really organized. Would highly recommend Baipai.

I can't believe I could cook edible Thai food!. I wanted to do something different in BKK other than the usual shopping, spas and eating so I chose to take up a cooking class with my hubby. It was such an engaging experience! Booking:Done online. It's very easy and they reply emails promptly. Website is also easy to navigate. Getting there/back:Transport was provided both ways. The driver arrived early and took the initiative to tell the hotel bellboy that he was expecting us. The location:We were given a welcome drink - lemongrass tea. It was very refreshing especially on a hot day. Everything is clean and tidy. There are 2 levels and it's very cosy. It's like going over to a friend's home to cook.The cooking class:There were 8 students, 1 chef and 1 chef assistant. So I would say it was a good student-teacher ratio. The lesson was conducted in English by a very cheeful lady who had a good sense of humour. The banter between the chef and her assistant is cute. The lesson was informative as we were taught the differences between spices. The instructions were easy to understand and they weren't given to us all at one go so it's not overwhelming. The wow-factor:Besides not needing to clean up the mess, you'll get a...well, I think you'll have to try it in order to know what it is :)

Even bad cooks will make a delicious meal. This class was so much fun. It was very hands on. My favorite part was using the mortar and pestle to make the curry paste for Massaman curry. I have to say that the curry I made was delicious! The other dishes we learned to make in the class were pomelo salad, stir fried chicken with basil leaves, and crispy rice cracker with Thai topping. All very tasty. I was originally bummed because I wanted to take the class with papaya salad but I was happy with my selection. Two teachers guided us through a demonstration and then we would go to our stations to cook the food. All the students ate together after each dish. The final two dishes were eaten in the dining area upstairs. You get a folder with recipes and a photo magnet at the end of the class. They also email pictures to you. It was kinda expensive but worth the price.

Adding my endorsement - professional yet personal. From the confirmation to my email booking to being dropped back at my hotel this is one professionally run cooking class. At the introductions my wife admitted that she doesn't cook (any more - after bring up two sons) yet our photos show the delight in her face as she discovered the fun this class provides. The layout of the area is so well done and to food gave me a new appreciation of Thai cooking. This was our 6th visit to Bangkok and it will not be the last to Baipai. One our fellow guest was asttending morning and afternoon sessions every day. That should say something!

WOW. What a fantastic afternoon we had at Baipai. Very professional operation and the staff were wonderful. Didn't know I could cook!! One of the best things I have ever done in Thailand. Would recommend Baipai to anyone interested in cooking or just wanting to do something different from the usual tourist traps.

Great fun and really well organised. I loved this cookery school. They picked me up from my hotel bang on time and took me back again afterwards, all for free. The ladies taking the class were charming and kept taking lots of photos which were then emailed to us all individually aftewards. The explanations were really clear and the food all beautifully prepared for us to use. We each had our own numbered work stations and everything was spotlessly clean and hygenic. I would definitely do this again when in Bangkok - there are several different menus to choose from so it's very varied.

Hated When It Ended. An excellent investment of half a day. Learn what you really need to know to recreate delicious yet do-able Thai meals. Typically graceful Thai cooking teacher Wilairat and her cute hostess "Boom" share their experience and tips for ingredient sources and substitutes, cooking techniques, and never tire of answering questions and interacting with the learners during cooking demonstrations and at the individual cooking stations, where we struggled valiantly--and successfully, with their individual tutelage--to recreate the dish Wilairat threw together so artfully. It was so fun and useful that I will be returning Oct. 30 and Nov. 24 to enjoy learning to prepare Menu Sets 2 and 4. Can hardly wait. Well-organized program, with on-time pick-up and return home excellent, and recipe card packages are very complete and nicely done. And getting to eat it all was icing on the cake!

Brilliant - great fun and very informative. We spent a wet afternoon at the cookery school. perfect thing to do on a wet afternoon! Very slick presentation but the staff were fresh and obviously enjoying themselves as much as we were. The recipes are excellent and the tips given were helpful.

Cooking the Thai Way. From the moment we dismounted the bus, we were welcomed to the school from the lovely ladies. We cooked and laughed, even though it was a very hot day - you forgot about it as your were having so much fun! We watched the teacher cook the meal, very much like MasterChef on TV, which even had a mirror above the teacher so you didnt miss out on anything. Once you were shown how to prepare the meal, you went over to your own cooking station to find all the ingredients carefully arranged on your bench. You then prepared your ingredients and started cooking! It was so much fun and we were well looked after by the wonderful staff - they were very supportive and attentive to our needs, even the novice slow cookers! Continual flow of water refills in our glasses ensured we didnt dehydrate with the heat. We got a lovely photo souveneir of our cooking, as well as the set of recipes we made and they even emailed the photos taken on the day! A must DO for even the worst cook! Worth the visit and the heat!

I can't imagine what could have made this better!. We spent one of the best afternoon of our lives at the Baipai cooking school yesterday! The place is first class from beginning to end. They will pick you up wherever you are staying. (They said they would be there "Between 1:00 and 1:10" - at 1:07 the Baipai van pulled up outside the hotel and we were off)We were there with a couple from Ireland, a guy from France, a woman from Romania, a woman who grew up in Thailand and her Brazilian boyfriend, and a single woman form Manchester. A fantastic group - plenty of time to eat and chat. IMHO it was the right mix of watching, learning, and then doing it yourself. The right amount of time -the right amount of food. I couldn't find a single thing to complain about. Oh - and no hidden fees. The 1800 the charge is the 1800 they charge. Yeah - if you have a beer with dinner they'll charge you, but they even keep your water glass full the entire class. You get beautiful copies of the recipes and a refrigerator magnet with your picture on it, and a bunch of other pictures e-mailed afterward.This place is clearly designed for tourists, but they execute it so flawlessly you won't even realize it. They require everyone to be smiling - and threaten you with doing the dishes if you don't - it was hilarious - tasty.

excellent !!. Transport to the school was flawless, and the entire course session was entertaining, interesting and extremely tasty!! The school is clean and all equipment etc is clean. I did not see any flies etc in spite of having ( covered) sugar and fish stock. Our Two teachers had their presentation down and were very funny as well. I enjoyed meeting people from everywhere in the world--and there were some special requirements which were accomodated without a problem. I also learned a huge amount about cooking Thai food--- which I will use in the future. I am happy that I chose this school and recommend it to anyone wanting a quality, fun program in Bangkok

Enjoyable day out!. Staff very enthusiastic, eager to answer any questions very friendly and fun. Nice set up, all prep is done so basically you combine and cook- but that makes sense as you don't go on holiday to chop in the 40 degree heat! Great learning experience, would go again.

Perfect afternoon on Vacation. We were a little leery considering some of the reviews on TA, but it is not often my husband agrees to take a cooking class with me, so we decided to take a chance!Yes, the chef prepares the dish the first time for you and discusses the ingredients and history of the dish at this time. He also provides possible substitutions you can purchase at home for any of the more exotic ingredients like palm sugar. Yes, many of the ingredients are prepared and measured for you when you go to cook your own. We found this very helpful as we did not want to cut our fingers on vacation...;) We did use a mortar and pestle to crush ingredients, separated a pomelo (like grapefruit) section for the salad and chopped a shallot and green onion in addition to cooking in a wok. Yes, when the hostess prompted, “what time is it?” we did cheer, “it’s eating time”! This made the class feel like an interactive Food Network show: something Paula or Guy would get a kick out of!The chef was knowledgeable, the hostess was upbeat and fun and both brightened the afternoon with many smiles. We shared stories with the other classmates of travel and cooking. Who would think you can learn about Texas dry rub ribs at a Thai cooking class? We were driven back to our hotel full from the tasty food and smiling at the fun afternoon learning Thai cooking secrets!If you are looking for a serious culinary arts/cordon bleu experience, you should try taking a private class. The BaiPai Cooking School is exactly what is advertises to be “a culinary adventure”-perfect to entertain and teach tourist!

I learnt to cook thai food with wonderful people. I love Thai food!I could eat it everyday! What better way then learn to cook it. Baipai is a friendly yet professional set up. The ambience semi open, the recipes presented beautifully with recipe cards in a folder that convienently stands up to make easier reading.The classes were fun, very authentic, and made easy, I thoroughly enjoyed the morning and met some great likeminded people from different parts of the world.

THIS PLACE IS GREAT FUN AND YOU COOK GREAT FOOD TOO!. Baipai is the best cooking school I have found while living in Bangkok. You will have a very enjoyable fun time with Marie and Chef Wat. They know their stuff and are well organized and help you all the way along. The recipes are excellent and easily followed. Visit the website, they pick you up and return you to your hotel in central Bangkok. Highly recommend.

A must do for one and all!. This is one of the two best things we did on a recent two week trip to Thailand. The school offers a rolling series of 4 hour cooking classes morning and afternoon, and you could do them for a week and never cook the same dish twice. (This is a possibility if you want to cover the whole range...one of the great things about Thai food is that the same ingredients end up different depending on what you do with them)Our host, a young English speaking woman, Kedsara ( Marie for those who can't cope in Thai!) is witty and well spoken. She was accompanied on this occasion by Noi who was a brilliant and clear cooking demonstrator.Groups are small (up to 12 I think) and most people will be picked up from the hotel, and the setting is a large open Thai kitchen spoitlkessly clean and light and airy. A stress free kitchen, amazing!Four dishes were demonstrated which would enable you to prepare a full Thai meal...Rice Crackers (make your own) with various different toppings, the lovely Pomelo Salad, the classic Massaman Curry (make your own paste!), and stir fried chicken and deep fried Basil leaves!You see everything being made, and then you do it yoursself. Everyone has an individual work station, and all ingredients aree carefully prepared to make it flow smoothly.You get to eat your own food. There are light refreshments.Best of all you get a folder with the recipes and you can take notes and ask questions. All the ingredients are explained, and you can ask dumb questions and not feel foolishCosts about 1600THB (about $30-$40) which for pickup and four hour course and class is pretty reasonable.When we arrived home we were delighted to find that there were 5 lovely photos emailed to us of my daughter and I.A lot of thought and care has gone into this. It's fantastic

Lost their edge. Had taken class here before. Now the attitude is they feel they are "too big for their britches." Website is always down, emails and registration go unanswered. Class is not as hands on as in the past. Food is already cut, measured and prepared for you, all you do is assemble/throw in frying pan. Menus do not change. Found the teacher not as friendly or approachable as in the past. Tried to enroll for a class previously taken (when I returned home after that class, tried to make recipes and they were horrible nothing like when I took the class, wanted to figure out what went wrong), told I already had that class and spots given to someone else and we were switched to a different class. Was also taking the class with friends which would be their first time whom also wanted that specific menu. If I choose to pay for a repeat class which I would like to take with friends I should be able to. Due to allergies, only certain classes appeal to me. Being assigned a different class (supposedly the only one available) with a menu most of which I could not eat was not pleasant. Ended up taking private class with Angsana thaihomecooking.com. Much better.

Combining Class not a Cooking Class. Good, if you like being talked down to. Vicky, the chef’s assistant, treated us as if we were taking a cooking course for kids. She asks you to enthusiastically repeat the names of dishes. If you just mutter it under your breath, she makes the whole class repeat again and again until we sound like a chorus of baboons performing a trick to zoo goers. The format is set up where you watch the chef cook first and then you get 5 minutes at your station to prepare the same dish that took the chef 15 minutes to cook. It feels like they are rushing you through the class. If you take a second to read the recipe as opposed to just dumping all the pre-portioned ingredients into your wok, Vicky comes over and does it for you. During one of the recipes, she said my dish was finished when the chicken was clearly still purple. Not just a little pink, but purple. Don’t let her push you around. You’re the one who has to eat your cooking, so take your time and cook it right. On another dish, she watched me dump my seasonings in immediately followed by the protein. Then she yelled, “It’s burnt.” Really? I don’t see anything that’s dark brown or black. How is my dish burnt already?Anyway, I think her purpose is to translate the chef, but he speaks perfect English. So, instead, she just repeats what he says. “Now you add sugar.” “SUGAR.” “…and salt.” “SALT.” “…and chilies.” “CHILIES.” However, the most annoying part of Vicky, that made my eyes roll, is when she would insult you and then say, “I’m joking,” with her strange interpretation of a British accent.I felt like I was sitting through and infomercial with an overly enthusiastic annoying host constantly soliciting exciting remarks and applause. When it was time for us to cook, she would ask, “What – time – is – it?” and waited for our annoyed reply of “It’s – Cooking – Time.”The food was pretty good, but most of the cooking is done by the silent helpers who pre-portion the ingredients at your station. When you reach your station, all you have to do is dump the ingredients into the wok and stir. That’s why I described it as a Combining Class and not a Cooking Class. You can pretty much find the same thing at any Gourmet Grocery Store where they have pre-packaged foods that you combine at home in your frying pan and feel like you’ve made a home-cooked meal.At 1800bht a person, this was the biggest waste of money in Bangkok. I wish we tried the cooking class offered at our hostel, which was only 500bht. Even if it wasn’t very good, at least you don’t feel trapped b/c BaiPai is located way South of Central Bangkok. If we tried to walk out (which we considered), we wouldn’t be able to find a taxi or the local Skytrain station. All in all, I’m giving this 2 stars, b/c the food did taste good. The experience was horrible though.

Thai cooking made easy. A great opportunity to learn and cook authetic Thai cuisine for those who have a minimum half a day free in Bangkok.The minivan picks you up which is part of the parcel of all tours and then its a quick dash to cooking school which is located in the suburbs and away from the hustle and bustle of the city. A quick introduction ensues then a trip down to the local food market follows where it's a great educational experience to learn and differentiate the rich variety of ingredients that goes into Thai recipes. Once you get back to the school, then it where the real fun starts and after witnessing the chef prepare and demonstrate how to cook the dishes, then it is your turn and that includes eating your own creation. There is also an opportunity to purchase various merchandise at the end like aprons and tablecloths which I am a sucker for.

Excellent Experience....would do it again!!. I could not fault Baipai cooking School, it was v well organised, v clean as well as friendly. We did 4 dishes and had our own workstation to cook from. Mickey and the chef were excellent, informative and I picked up some great tips. Def recommend this place if you are interested in doing a Thai cooking course!

A Perfect Thai Cooking Experience. While most people seem to do a cooking course in Chiang Mai, our schedule didn't allow for it so we decided to do a course in Bangkok. Given the opportunity again, I wouldnt have done it differently. Baipai cooking school was great from start to finish. We got picked up in an airconditioned van (all 12 of us) from our hotel bright and early and then went to the market where we picked up some of the products we would be using for the course. In addition, at the market we were allowed to sample different customary thai vegetables, spices, curry pastes, and coconut milk crepes.  Upon arriving back at the school, the instructors guide you through the various dishes we made. Since they help prepare a good amount of the dishes in advance, it made Thai cooking seem easy and delicious!!! I highly suggest looking at their very friendly website, and picking the menu which suits your tastes best. We did exactly that, Menu 1, and were happy with every dish we made. Overall, the facilities are extremely clean and the instructors were extremely personable (we had "Vicky"), which led to a great experience. In addition, they were accomodating by dropping us off at Siam rather then going all the way back to our hotel.

Amazing Experience!!. What a great way to spend a half day in Bangkok! A fantastic opportunity to learn about authentic Thai food, ingredients and culture. I am so happy that I signed up for this class! I'm so excited to cook the recipes for my family and friends at home!

I can cook Thai!!!! Fantastic!. If you are looking for something other than sight seeing and shopping in Bangkok then this is definitely a must. We were picked up from our hotel by the organised minibus which was put on by the cooking school, so we happily avoided the 'dodgy' Thai taxi drivers! There is a choice of two classes per day, (am or pm) depending on the night before.Once we arrived at the school we were made to feel welcome and instantly got introduced to our classmates over a glass of lemongrass tea.Once all the formallities were over then we began the serious part of cooking and tasting. Having eaten thai food on numerous occasions, we were lead to believe that it was one of the most complex cusines to make but having taken the class, we found out that it is all in the preparation.Mick was our guide through the cooking whilst we had the chef, called "teacher" actually doing the cooking. We had 4 dishes to prepare and cook during the lesson and an insight into all the various Thai ingredients. The lesson was great, as we got to cook and eat what we made as the lesson went on, plus both of us had fun cooking together. There was plenty of room for each student to cook, without getting hot oil on each other.This is a very well thoughtout establishment, with a overhead mirror reflecting what is in the chefs pan whilst she was cooking. Definitely well worth a visit as this is a lasting souvenir of Thailand that can be given to all your friends back home when you make these dishes.Jaiandash

Super Fun! Even as a single guy.... As a single hetero guy who likes Thai food, I thought this would be a fun trip and it was! One of my more pleasurable days in Thailand. The whole experience was a blast.I had a car come pick me up, and then we picked up the other student. And then off to the school. That's it. Only the two of us!During the whole class , which was presented in perfect English, it was fun and hands on. I'm not a great cook, but man it was fun. I learned how to make five dishes and they all tasted good.After a very full day of eating they brought me back to my hotel. A safe, fun, and family friendly adventure day.

Excellent. I was surprised to see this on the Trip Adivsor list of Top 10 attractions on BKK - but for someone who has lived in and visited BKK countless times- this was great! My husband and I signed up for a class and it was one of the best things we did on our trip. This was especially a nice break from touring other local tourist attractions. The school even arranged to pick us up from the Grand Palace and then afterwards dropped us at our hotel! Staff was friendly and helpful! Would do this again when we go back.
Great experience!. This class was brilliant, the staff are friendly and helpful. the instructions are clear and the results, outstanding! would definitely do it again!

Excellent experience. The best review I can give is to confirm I've been able to take what I learned and replicate the same back in the Midwest USA. The teachers are suberb. And they give optional substitutes for those of us who live in an area where not everything is available year around.This marks my 8th trip to Bangkok and I have determined to complete all 7 courses during this trip. I highly recommend BaiPai Thai Cooking School. It makes the meals almost fool-proof.

Great experience for cooks and wanabee cooks!. We have been to BaiPai on several occasions. The menu changes each day and has always been great value. The instructors are well organised and speak very good English and gently guide you through the menu. We took friends with us and they really enjoyed the experience. I recommend you buy an apron to show off to friends back home.

very professionally run. We had a great morning out. It was nice something different to the normal touring around. The staff were so friendly, we had heaps of fun, met people from all over the world.I booked online, it was easy and cheaper than going through a tour company. Highly recommended!!

Fantastic - That's what the boyfriend said, and he doesnt like cooking!!!. Friendly staff, with a good sense of humour! Good quality ingredients,great atmosphere, Lots of food to try, so dont eat breakfast!! Away from the hustle and bustle of city centre, A group of about 10 people from around the World - we had a good laugh! The staff take photos of you and email them to you for when you get home :)We had the set meu with crispy cups and thai yellow curry with chicken, The crispy cups are so easy to make, its amazing what you can do once you have been shown! Loved every minute of it and would do it again!!

Go, Go, Go! You won't be disappointed.. We happened upon this cooking school on Trip Advisor. I wasn't sure how a cooking school could be rated the number 1 attraction, but now I know why. Everything about the experience was top-notch. They pick you up at your hotel and drop you off. They give you a beautifully designed booklet of the recipes for the day. Each "chef-in-training" has their own station with all the monotony taken out of the cooking with everything prepped for you. The ingredients were fresh, the food delicious. The staff is incredibly attentive, and their English was very good. It really was a highlight of the trip to Bangkok. Thanks Vicky and Nam.

Thai cooking school experience-serene, fun, good value. Booked a morning half day cooking class before leaving for the afternoon flight-works out perfectly as they provide transportation from and to the site of cooking class. The cooking school impressed from the beginning. Very efficient, quick to respond to my internet reservation with confirmation of the pick up time. the driver arrived 30 minutes before the pick up time. The cooking class very intimate-about 12 people, with 4 whom had taken other cooking classes at the same school, implying they had a great experience. greeted by the bai pai staff, which included a translator and our teacher, both made a great and entertaining pair who complemented each other. spoke excellent english. the facility very clean and serene despite being in the busy, loud, crowded environement of bangkok. we donned on our apron with a washcloth and began the cooking class. teacher demonstrated, we ate samples, and then cooked ourselves. the recipes were printed on beautiful pictured souvenirs. we didn't get to see the morning market on this particular class but had heard that this is available with other classes. overall, each cooking demonstration was interactive, fun, and insightful. explained meaning, technique, ingredients, etc. we got to know the other participants in the class, all of whom very friendly and had good conversation when we had the chance to sample our creation at a table. I would say overall, a great value and great experience while in Bangkok. Had heard the Oriental has a cooking class but much more expensive. I appreciate not only the value but also the laid back but very well planned and orchestrated style of Bai Pai. They also had a personal touch of providing magnets of picture taken during the class for souvenir. Lastly, they provided transportation back and were very receptive to making sure we got back to the hotel on timely basis. A big thumbs up for this school. They apparently will be sending pictures via email taken throughout the class and we are awaiting for those.

So much fun! I did this as a single guy!. I don't really cook at home, but I wanted to have a fun cooking course in Thailand ,as I love the food. It was a blast. They picked me up at the hotel and it was like I was on my own cooking show.The whole thing is really laid back!. Not, too hard to do, and by the end of the whole experience I was super full.The instructors were great , really friendly.

A vacation highlight. Recently took a short break and made a trip to Thailand. One my plans for the trip were a cooking class. A few years ago I had taken a half day lesson at Baipai Thai Cooking School and really enjoyed it so it was back for another lesson. The school is reasonably priced around $50 for a lesson and that includes pick up at your hotel. The school is small with largest class size less than a dozen. Each student has there own work station, yes it is hands on and lunch is included, 4 courses you cook yourself my blog has photos and more info http://apps.charleswdavisjr.com/blog/you should make this a mandatory stop in any Thailand visit

The Best Cooking School. This was the best day we had during our seven days in Bangkok.I booked this cooking school via their website, and you don't pay until you actually do the day at the school.They arranged collection from where we were staying and then the wonderful day began.Everything about this place is professional. The school is organised well, run well, friendly, clean and so much fun.You come away with a set of recipes, a full tummy, and friends.I loved this place and will definitely recommend it to all and sundry. You can get all the information you need from their website.Excellent, Excellent, Excellent!

Learn to cook in Bangkok. If you're a foodie, you may be interested in taking a cooking class. There are no short of classes available in Bangkok, we however decided on BaiPai. They offer a number of menus. you'll have to email them for a schedule for the month you intend to visit (it's rather unclear on their site). We did the sunday morning class which happened to include a trip to the weekend food market. This class was so much fun, one of the gals in our group had taken another class a couple days prior and decided to take another. When I go back, I plan to do the same. :)You are given recipe cards with images, and at the end of class they give you a little treat. I wont tell you. They also sell a few things. I purchased the black apron.Ah, one thing. Several tour companies will book this class for you but in our research it's more expensive for the same thing. It was a better value for us to book direct through the school.Here's the link:http://www.baipai.com

Delicious experience in Thai cooking. The Baipai Thai Cooking School is a delightful experience for novice cooks and professionals alike. Every detail is arranged from picking you up at your hotel to preparing the ingredients ahead of time for you to combine, cook and eat!The staff is friendly, speaks English well and makes the time fly as well as being informative and instructive. The class size is small and we enjoyed sitting with other Internationals as we prepared our dishes together, while chatting leisurely. The facilities are clean, cozy and charming. The food was outstanding and I really believe I can make it back at home for my family and friends. I have a whole new understanding of Thai cooking. I would highly recommend this course to anyone!

A wonderful cooking school. I was desperate to do a cooking course in Thailand, and managed to find this one on an internet search and through trip advisor.All I can say is, it was one of the highlights of my trip which, considering it was my honeymoon and I went without my husband and we had a fabulous time generally, makes it pretty amazing!There was a translator - Mikey, whose English was superb and who was fun and friendly, and the cook, who was also lovely. They had a really great chemistry and the dishes we cooked were fabulous. It was relaxed, informative and I am planning to find a thai grocery shop in London this week so I can cook what I learnt this weekend! I just wish I had done more than just one half day, I'd have liked to have done at least another half-day's worth of menus.

Great Experience!. I was hesitant to do this on my own....but decided I wanted to take advantage of the experience.....they pick you up at the hotel and return (included in the cost) so it really was a no-brainer. The classes have 10 people and you each get your own station.....the chef prepares the course while you watch, then you get to cook at your station and then sample your creation. Lot's of fun.....while you are watching the chef, attendants clean your cook station and restock it with the items you will need next to prepare your next dish. They also give you a souvenir kitchen magnet with your picture cooking included.....nice touch. I really enjoyed meeting people from different parts of the world and share my love of cooking.....and eating.....Loved it!

Good fun!. Did an afternoon course at BaiPan cooking school (menu 5) and it was really good fun! The price included hotel pick up and drop off, and what you cook is what you eat – so from 2pm to 5pm, it was constantly grazing!The cook and the cook’s assistant were very good and entertaining. Throughout the afternoon, you have cool water to sip on which was a relief in this sweltering hot weather, and it is topped up at all times.At the end of the session, the staff give you a souvenir which is a photo of you cooking, which is really sweet! During the course, the cook’s assistant takes photos of everyone, and then they frame in it a magnet and you can take it away – I though it was a real personal touch.Definitely recommend this – at 1,600 Baht per person, it was good value for money and an afternoon of fun!

Thai cooking. Did a morning course at Baipai on the day they were doing- money bags - pa-nang curry - tom yam soup- fried ricewhat an amazing experience. The teacher (Naam) was fantastic & gave us lots of really useful tips. Naam demonstrated each dish (which we then tasted) & then we had a chance to test our culinary skills & attempt to replicate what Naam had just done. There is a maximum of 10 to a class & you each get your own gas stove to cook on. Once you have completed each dish you get to sample what you have cooked. Throughout the course you could buy beer, water, soft drinks etc. to have with your meals, all at very reasonable costs Photos are taken throughout the course & when we finished we were each presented with a framed photo of ourselves which could also be used as a magnet. Additional photos that were taken were then e-mailed to us. As an added bonus you were picked up & dropped off at your hotel (all included in the price). would definitely recommend this course to anyone visiting Bangkok.

Great experience. My daughter and I did a morning course on our recent visit to Bangkok. It was the day they were doing Pad Thai which is my favourite dish. We loved every minute of. It was all very professional but most importantly it was great fun. The teachers were friendly, funny and amusing.For anyone who loves Thai food I would definitely recommend this school.

The highlight of my week in Bangkok. This is definitely the best cooking school you'll find anywhere in Thailand. Using traditional methods and ingredients, you can make the best 4 course dinner. Everything is really well organised, and the teachers incredibly friendly. It has a beautiful atmosphere and really well english speaking teachers. I recommend everyone to take this class! They pick you up at your hotel mostly as well! [----] is where you can find other info.

Thai Cooking. On Saturday 4th November 2006 we attended the Baipai Thai Cooking School in Bangkok. This is a must for anyone who likes Thai food and wants to know the exact way to cook it and what to use and where to obtain it. I was never that keen on Thai food however I was holidaying in Bangkok with a friend who is very interested in Thai cooking and I went along with her just for the experience and I was surprised at how much I enjoyed the class and I now feel that I will enjoy Thai food much more because I have done the course, The teacher and the commentator are very good and explain everything to you. You have your own stove and you get to cook the food to your taste be it very hot or very mild and of course then you get to eat it. If you want you can buy beer etc to have with your meal. Before you start cooking you are taken to the market to purchase the food you are going to cook and this is an experience in itself for the normal Australian who goes to the supermarket to buy their food. Highest praise for this course and the way it is conducted.

Best Cooking Class in Bangkok. This class was recommended by a friend and it did not disappoint. The boatride to get to there was quite long but a great way to see the city. We were lucky enough to be the only two people there that day so had a private class. The tour of the garden and fresh herbs was so inciteful and interesting and the food was the best thai food I have ever had. I would highly recommend this class to any foodie visiting Bangkok.

This is THE cooking class to do in Bangkok. Everything about this coking class amazing.We were picked up at our hotel by Victory Monument and driven to the pier where we enjoyed a long boat along to Tam's place. Our driver was amazing, pointing out the numerous monitor lizards we say en route. That earned him a beer from the floating market we passed.We were greeted by Tam, some of her extended family members, Soya Sauce (rooster) and a chatty talking bird (can't remember her name) then given a tour of her garden that had pretty much everything it it from Thai Basil to birds eye chili to lemongrass.We watched Tam as she worked her magic and shared some great stories - ask to hear the story about the 3 women pounding herbs. We then got our turn at cooking. We made a spicy green papaya salad, green chicken curry, coloured sticky rice and mango pudding. If you are looking for more hands on cooking, like doing your own rice, slicing all these veg or making your own curry paste, the class we took may disappoint, but it was an absolute highlight for us.The only complaint I have was that the price was a bit steep.

One of the best classes to attend. The venue and the garden are the best part of the class.. A very funny lady (her name is not Amita tho), she takes you on a quick tour around her home garden which is located on the river. She introduced us to many of Thailand's finest herbs, vegetables, and spices. You get to see, touch, smell, and taste some of them. The venue where you cook is really cool, spacious and well decorated. The cooking itself is pretty easy and straight forward. You don't get to do any or the preparations, just the mixing in the pan or wok. Finally, you sit down and eat the prepared meals. Yummy!!

A fun day cooking with Tam. A boat picked us up at the Hilton Hotel dock and ferried us to Amita Cooking School. Tam, the owner graciously shared her family home and gardens with the class. The well tended garden is lushly filled with herbs and trees that were familiar and new. As Tam took us through our garden tour the afore mentioned rooster crowed and the myna bird squawked every rooster crow and cough and giggle from the cooking class participants. Tam picked what herbs and fruits she needed for the class and then demonstrated several recipes including chicken satay and peanut sauce, green papaya salad, green curry, and mango and sticky rice. We got to taste all that she prepared and then we tried our hand at cooking all of the recipes. The green curry was the best that I have ever tasted! I didn't notice any pests but the cooking school is located on the canals so wear mosquito protection and sunscreen. This was an incredibly fun day and I highly recommend this Bangkok experience!

Will Return evrytime in Bangkok for another day of fun. This was recommended to me as a great experience, and when my wife and our friends (another couple) visited Bangkok in December we where just blown away. We all love to cook and Thai food is at the top of the list. Ms. Tam, the instructor made it feel more like we were at a friends house and she showed us the way to cook great food that was so easy. Great experience, when we all go to Bangkok again we will schedule another visit to learn more. We all wish we had done this sooner. Great experience.Bing & Bong

fun, memorable, and tasty experience!. Tam's cooking class was excellent. It was the singular highlight of my visit to Bangkok. Reaching class by boat, we got to enjoy an interesting view of the city and neighborhood. Tam and her staff were super friendly and helpful, the class was well organized, the instruction was clear, and the facility and setting were first-rate. What fun it was to use authentic, local ingredients, receive expert how-to instruction during the hands-on cooking, and finally enjoy a multicourse meal of delicious food in a beautiful garden setting. Food coma alert: between sampling each dish at the cooking demonstration and then eating the lunch you have cooked, there is lots of food! Too much! You may want to keep to a small breakfast before coming to class and plan for a modest dinner afterwards.

The #1 Highlight of my Bangkok Trip. My mum and I booked a few days in advance so were surprised to find ourselves in a private class - happily surprised of course! A driver collected us from our hotel and drove us to the dock where a friendly lady took us to the cooking school on the river via boat. Once at the school (which we discovered was set-up amazingly well in Tam's family courtyard) we were warmly welcomed by Tam, the school's founder and head teacher. She runs with the school with her cousins and has a rotating roster for the menu. Our day involved papaya salad, green Thai curry, satay chicken, and mango with rice. The class started with a tour of her garden and Tam gave us both a lot of new information about herbs and plants used in Thai cuisine. After that, Tam ran an interactive cooking demonstration which was made seemless by her two support cousins; one did the dishess, and the other played sous chef providing Tam with the ingredients, "this-is-what-I-prepared-earlier" food, and taking away used implements. The presentation was incredible. I've never seen such a tightly run ship. Tam gave Mum and I all the dishes to devour after she cooked them and, of course, they were all supremely delicious. We then went to our cooking stations which Tam and her family had carefully built for teaching groups of students with ease. Tam and her sous chef cousin assisted us in preparing our own versions of the meal and gave us plenty of helpful tips in the process.We then ate and ate and ate. A four-course meal - we were stuffed. But Tam being hte uber-organised person she is, our leftovers were packed up quickly for us to take on our way. The driver who collected us from the hotel was there again at the end and transported us in air-conditioned comfort back to the hotel again.I would definitely recommend this experience to other travellers because it fun, interesting, educational and yum!

Delicious and informative cooking class. My husband and I had a great time learning & cooking and of course eating a delicious Thai meal. We were picked up by boat from our hotel and had a lovely ride to Tam's house and garden on the canal. Most of her ingredients come from her garden and before we cooked she showed us all of her herbs and plants and how we were going to use them in our meal. Her teaching method was excellent, showing us how to prepare before she set us loose to do it ourselves, Lunch was eaten on her lovely patio and all of our dishes were delicious. This is a great opportunity to experience Thai cooking in a home environment.

The Best Meal in Bangkok!. We visited as the first stop on our Honeymoon after flying from London. We were picked up from our hotel and whisked away along the river and through the canals to Tam's Amita Thai cooking school. The school was located in the owner, Tam's, garden which is full of mango trees, kaffir limes, ylang ylang, and Thai herbs. It was a magical start as she walked us through it and discovered Thai ingredients. We wanted to try something other than the typical Thai treats we eat here in London like Green Curry and Phad Thai, so we opted for the Holy Basil Pork & Coconut Pancakes menu. We were delighted to find ourselves in a private class since we went in the rainy season, but the weather was gorgeous. I couldn't believe it was sold out. The food was without a doubt, the most authentic and delicious I had in Bangkok. It was made all the more special by the fact we made it with excellent and friendly instruction. Tam and her family were so welcoming and helpful. This family-run business was a highlight of our trip. We got to take recipes home and had no trouble finding ingredients in London on Electric Avenue. We were sad to discover that some of the lovely exotic fruits Tam cut for us like Mangosteen and Longkong weren't available. That was definitely a lasting memory we'll treasure. Thanks to Amita Thai!

Lovely family run cooking class. Lovely family run cooking class. The school is located inside a family house with a spice and herb garden. Tam the cooking teacher is enjoying (at least it seems) showing you around the garden and explaining the details of the herbs and how to use it. The recipes are simple and can easily be cooked during the class with the help of Tam and here family members as well as at home. Spent a wonderful 4 hours there and would go back.Learned some details about coconut oil and how to get the best of the taste, and color of kafir lime leaves, tamarind, and pandan leaves.

Highlight of the Trip!. Really a pleasure! You are picked up from your hotel and taken by boat to Tam's house on the canal. There she walks you through her garden and you learn about the Thai ingredients. She is very knowledgeable and complete. She truly enjoys what she does.Then she will cook for you, step by step. Explaining everything. Outside in pleasant garden setting. But my mistake was I ate everything she cooked. Because then you repeat the process, with each person cooking at their own station. Then there is a meal together. So I ate twice...But really a lot of fun. She is very organized.

Wonderful experience. Incredible experience at Tam's wonderful house. Lovely people, beautiful garden, cooking delicious food. We were very well looked after, and look forward to using the recipes. Thank you!

All we were looking for. We picked this as it is held in the owner's house in an area on the canals. You get to take a small boat there which is a good part of the experience (particularly if you havent taken a long boat ride along the canals).You are shown plants in the garden that are used in the cooking and get to both see and taste the cooking when being taught how to do it and then get a chance to cook and eat yourself. It was a relaxed and friendly way to learn a little about Thai cooking and Thai life and gave us just what we were looking for.

Nice surrounding and . This is my second visit. This time i picked the same menu as I did last time but I still enjoyed it. The setting is chef tam's family house, we spent about 40 mins on motor boat and getting into the cooking class. The setting is nice semi outdoor, in the backyard / garden. Chef tam explains every herb and ingredient clearly and we all get to do own dishes which made it every enjoyable. Highly recommended

Amazing. We went to Amita thai cookery course this morning and I can't fault it. The whole morning was amazing and extremely well thought out. If you are considering a Thai cookery class whilst in Bangkok I can highly recommend Amita Thai

Run don't walk to this Thai cooking class. Going to Bangkok? Remember the name AMITA THAI COOKING. Located on one of BKK's longs(canals) it is an absolutely delightful way to spend 4-5 hours and come away with a full belly, lots of knowledge about Thai food including recipes, and an incredible Thai experience for a very decent price. You see the herbs you use growing in Tam's garden. Chase after the rooster and his hens. See how to cook, then do it yourself. Be between 1 and 18 class members (most classes are on the smaller side so much more personal attention) and experience what it is like to eat your own cooked food. It all takes place outside on the patio in a beautifully kept area. Listen to the long tail boats passing with tourists unlucky enough NOT to be with you. Tam's English is impeccable so conversation is easy if you speak English. Even converse with the chatty Mynah bird. Tam lives here. She cooks here. Her roots are in this house. It is fun. It is delicious. It is an experience you can take home and gloat over. Even taste again and again. If you miss this in Bangkok, you've missed part of Thailand that you will regret.

A rare gem.... This is one of "those" unique experiences that simply cannot be missed... that you will talk about for years.We were introduced to Tam's cooking class by friends, who accompanied us for their second experience with Tam. Also in our group of eight budding Thai chefs were two couples from Switzerland who were also introducing their friends to Tam's class.After being picked at your hotel in the morning, be prepared to spend the better part of six hours for this excursion... it is WELL worth the time!Tam is a gracious host in her residential surroundings which, in addition to some wonderful Thai cooking, will give one an insight to Thai living.

Rocked it for us. Tam, who conducts the cooking class, is an amazing story teller and a wonderful host. She takes students through the garden in her ancestral home on the river, talking about the herbs to be used in the class. The demo is fantastic and almost personalized. The actual cooking you do is a lot of fun -- and you get to eat what you cooked. But the fun begins even before you reach the class -- on the boat that takes you through the river and the canal, don't forget to ask the boatman to give you a chance to "drive" the boat!

Amazing Experience. What a great way to spend a few hours cooking and talking with the wonderful Tam who was so accommodating letting us come into her home to do some cooking - i could have stayed all day long just talking with Tam and wandering around her beautiful gardenIf you are looking for something very different to do I would highly recommend visting Tam and her family for the afternoon.

Amazing experience, extraordinary teacher!. The surrounding is beautiful, the facilities are top of the line, and the teacher is super professional and nice. We had a great time at Änita Thai Cooking Class" and it is highly recommended if you want to try something a bit different in Bangkok. Thank you so much for the hospitality, the delicious food and lovely presentation. Eatours team.

Authentic Thai Introduction to the Culture. If you would like to go home with very warm memories of Bangkok and an authentic experience of Thai culture and people, then most definitely take a cooking class with Tam. You get so very much for your money. First, a very kind gentleman picked me up from my hotel (my hotel was a long way away from the city center and Tam did not charge me extra for picking me up). Then, you are taken to the boat pier in an interesting section of old Bangkok. Another gentleman accompanies you to Tam's house via boat through the canal system. The canal trip alone is a very interesting and eye-opening experience because you not only see some of the monuments that old Bangkok has to offer, you also see how the people live on the canal (and the interesting water creatures that reside there as well). Tam and her family are waiting for you at their private dock at their residence. The classes are held in an outside kitchen (granite counter tops individual stoves in a covered pavilion) in Tam's backyard. She has another covered pavilion for eating the dishes afterwards). After refreshing you with traditional drinks, Tam takes the time to show you her herb garden (how often do you see a turmeric plant) and you pick, smell and discuss the history of the herbs and their health benefits. In addition, she has some delightful characters in her garden including a rather naughty talking bird and an arrogant rooster! You will be delighted at the local boat traffic (nothing touristy here) that floats by honking their horns and selling their wares as they have for many decades. Tam will then talk you through each dish, discussing the ingredients and the proper way to prepare the dish. After watching, her family members will then assist you in cooking the very same dishes (everything is prechopped and prepared all you have to do is cook). No messy clean ups! Then everyone takes their food to the tables and enjoys a meal together. Tam (never still) is busy cutting fruit and introducing you to almost local favorites that you might not have tried in the market. (Note, there is a locker to keep your belongings while you cook, and very clean bathroom facilities).All in all, this was one of my favorite experiences in Bangkok. I recommend that you not miss it!

A great experience. What a great way to spend half a day. Door to door service from our hotel. The transport arrived on time and the trip there included a 40 minute boat trip down the river which is always fun. Tam and her team were so efficient and the class was very well organised. We got to eat the dishes we cooked too.The company of Tam's mynah bird was also great for us being bird lovers.Thoroughly recommend this cooking adventure!

Beautiful cooking experience. We got picked up from our hotels and were dropped off at the pier. Getting out at 8am means that you actually get to enjoy Bangkok when it's not stinking hot! The 30 min boat road to Amita Class was just a great touch! Our lovely instructor, Tam and her great team which is made up of her family, are just lovely. We were treated with some welcoming appetizers (tempura of fresh greens picked from her own organic garden) and refreshing drink. Tam then showed us around the the beautiful garden afterwards and introduced to us all the herbs we'd be using for our class later in the morning.The class was very easy to follow and the great team Tam has defo helped every step along the way. Tam has a great sense of humor as well.Altho the price is slightly higher than the other ones I found on google but this is totally worth it.Really and it was one of the best meals too I had there! :)

Must do!. wow...you gotta go! Great experience from being picked up in a boat and arriving at Tam's on a canal! Great entrance, greeted by smiles and snacks! Quick tour around the garden and then Tam demonstrates the dishes! Best part, you get to cook it without all the prep and clean up! Flavors were fantastic! I also did a cooking course in Chiang Mai which doesn't even compaare to this one! Tam and her family are super friendly, helpful and a joy to be around! I have since made the dishes since I've been home and they are all very tasty, easy to make and fantastic! Thank you for this amazing experience which I will never forget!

A true thai experience!. From start to finish, this was an excellent experience. I was transported by boat to Tam's lovely family compound. The boat ride itself is really amazing, and took about 40 minutes. Once there, we toured Tam's herb garden and learned the medicinal and cooking applications for the various herbs. Tam is personable and obviously takes great pride in her family compound of three generations. I've always been interested in learning Thai cooking, and this was an excellent introduction. The demonstrations were clear and easy to follow. We then made two dishes followed by a sumptuous lunch. I also really enjoyed the company of my two german classmates...a mother and a daughter. I would recommend this highly!

The best day in Bangkok.. I visited this Cookery School as part of a cookery tour of Thailand and it was an absolute delight. The journey along Bangkok's waterways by water taxi (included in the cost) was a great start to the day.
