We disembarked at the private jetty & entered a perfect oasis away from the hassle yet in the midst of the city. This is a family run school and everything was well organised and friendly. The herbs and spices we used, we sampled fresh from the garden and everything was cooked from scratch. I'm a beginner & some of our group were chefs but everyone was accommodated at their level & when we ate our meal in the pagoda by the river, it was terrific. The riverside garden is lush & peaceful. Everyone was helpful, friendly & fun. Check out the minah bird, he's hilarious! I'd highly recommend this wonderful place & wish them well for the future.

A wonderful experience!. I love cooking and on my trip to Bangkok I wanted to have a thai cooking class to learn more about Thai food, ingredients and how to prepare it. Me and my husband made our reservation for the class on the school website and at 8 am a driver on a van showed up at our hotel as it was programmed. He took us to a hotel pier and from there we took a boat together with other people who would take the class with us.The boat ride takes about 30 minutes taking you to a residential area of Bangkok where boats are usually used by residents.We got to the school and we met Tam, our teacher. She invited us for some tea and some appetizers. In a very relaxing atmosphere and chatting we went around her garden as she gave us leaves and roots of typical thai ingridients to smell, taste and learn their names. That was really special. Later we all set around a table where she cooked each one of the dishes that we would learn to prepare. She showed us the ingredients, gave us great tips on how to cook and we had a sample of each one. Then it was our turn to cook on our own. Each one received a set with the ingredients and with the help of some assistants we managed to cook the dishes step by step. When everything was ready we sat and had a wonderful lunch.mit was so much food I could hardly eat half of it. It was a wonderful day I'll never forget.

Best Part of Our Trip. My husband and I had heard about Amita Cooking Class through a co-worker. We had no idea how wonderful the day would be. The service was amazing (door to door pick up), kind, warm staff and amazing cuisine. The set up is beautiful. You feel like a local, just hanging out in a beautiful garden backyard. Tam and her staff do a wonderful job teaching about Thai cooking and modeling the dishes to begin. Afterwards, we got to try our hand at three of the dishes. The food was phenomenal and the recipes are actually things I will try to recreate at home. This is a must do if you have a morning/early afternoon free.

The highlight of our visit to Bangkok!. We have visited Bangkok many times but one thing we had not covered before was a Thai cooking class. A search online gave us several options from which we selected Amita.Right from the start the organisation of our event was very good. We were met by an Amita representative who took us to our hotel's pier where a boat was waiting to take us to the Amita family compound. The river journey lasted about 40 minutes - longer than anticipated due to the volume of river traffic at the locks - not a delay to complain about - sitting on a boat on the Chao Pray River on a sunny morning! On arrival at the site we were warmly welcomed by Tam the course teacher. On this morning we were the only two 'students' so throughout the lesson we had individual attention. After an introduction to the course content we had a tour around the compound's herb garden where we learnt a lot about different herbs used in Thai cooking - very interesting and informative.The 'classroom' consists of the teacher's cooking station and can accommodate a maximum of ten students. Tam explained very clearly what we would be cooking - Khao Mun Som Tum (Coconut Rice and Papaya Salad), Satay (Moo, Gai or Nua) - a choice of Pork, Chicken or Beef, Khang Keaw Wan Gai (Green Curry Chicken in Coconut Milk) and Khao Niew Ma Muang (Mango Sticky Rice). In the first section we stood at Tam's station watching and listening as she explained the ingredients, cooked the dishes and at the same time gave us a running commentary on what she was doing and why - fascinating!Then, it was our turn. We were given preparation/instruction cards for the dishes we were to prepare. Tam and another member of her family stood by and gave us adivice when necessary as we prepared the same dishes which Tam had prepared. The finale - on completion of the cooking, our dishes were taken from our stations and set out on a table located under a canopy in the garden. When we approached the table the dishes we had cooked looked wonderful and we have to say, they tasted wonderful too - not because we are accomplished in cooking Thai food but because of the excellent care and attention we received during the session! At the conclusion of the course we were driven back to our hotel by an Amita representative. From start to finish the course was run in a professional but relaxed manner. On our next visit to Bangkok we would hope to have another session at Amita and learn to cook more Thai dishes. We have no hesitation in recommending Amita to others

Great day with Tam and staff. I highly recommend spending a few hours with Tam and her staff learning how to make some great Thai dishes. First we were picked up on time by a driver to meet our water taxi and fellow classmates. It took us about 20 minutes or so to reach the school by water taxi. However this gave us time to get to know the other people in our class. It also gives you another view on Bangkok living going through the canal to see people's homes and the wildlife there.We reached the school and was greeted by Tam (the owner) with a drink and cool towel. There was a beautiful table set outdoors (but covered) next to the garden. It was such a welcoming and awesome place to spend the day. Tam did her introductions and we proceeded to the garden to get familiar with some of our ingredients. She also has a talking parrot that is cute but not annoying. After our tour through the garden, we went to the outdoor kitchen where we watched Tam cook the dishes first then we prepared the same dishes with help from her staff. Once everyone has completed their dishes, we took our food to the table where we had lunch together. I would recommend paying attention to all instructions because you eat what you cook. It was a great experience that I highly recommend.

Fantastic Cooking Class in Bangkok!!. My younger sisters and I wanted an authentic Thai cooking experience while staying in Bangkok. Our hotel was on the Chao Praya River, and we were picked up by boat promptly on schedule at 8:30AM. After a short boat ride down the river and a beautiful canal we arrived at Tam's family's compound. We were welcomed with some light, delicious snacks of tempura herbs from Tam's garden and fresh pressed lemongrass juice complete with lemongrass straws. Tam introduced us to all the herbs and spices that we would be using during the class - all grown in her own garden which overlooks the canal. Tam had a charming rooster named See Ew or Soy Sauce and a very funny bird named Basil. We started the class by watching Tam perform a demonstration of each course (of which we got to try everything). It was absolutely delicious, and Tam broke things down in such a way that was entertaining and easy to follow. Her sister's fiance mixed us up some Thai tea as a treat while we watched; the small attention to detail was truly heartwarming. Our menu included spicy fresh papaya salad, pork satay with spicy peanut sauce, green chicken curry with green coconut rice, and mango with sticky rice. Every course was outstanding, and it was fascinating to see Tam use herbs to color the rice green. She even crushed up some edible blue flowers to turn the sticky rice for dessert purple. It was absolutely beautiful. We then each suited up in an apron and made each dish at our own station. All the ingredients were prepared for us in little bowls, and Tam and her relatives stood by as we recreated the dishes. After only a couple minor spills we sat down at a the table overlooking the canal to enjoy. Needless to say we needed a nap after how much we ate! While we were enjoying the food, Tam's nephew Tian came around and drew Henna tattoos for us. He was quite an artist and it was an unexpected surprise. The whole thing lasted until 2:30PM when Tam's husband drove us back to our hotel. They make certain to only book one group per day so that everyone gets a truly unique, relaxed experience. Everything about this class was fantastic and I would absolutely recommend it!!!

Gluten Free Cooking Course in Bangkok. Amita Thai is a fantastic authentic Thai Cooking Course - From the pick up at our hotel, a transfer onto private boat we cruised the river, turning into a side khlongl and were dropped off at the pier of the cooking course. Beat that!The garden was full of stories and aromas, plants and soya sauce, the resident chook!Tam was a legend. We had a coeliac in our group and she simply went our and researched what we could prepare and eat. The whole menu was suitable for anyone with a gluten intolerance condition or preference. And Tam had really researched.It was a first for Tam but she made it all feel so easy. Thank you Tam. If you are looking for a fantastic experience it doesn't come any better than this. Loved the boat trip - what a way to get to a cooking course. Appreciated the extra effort Tam went for our group. Brilliant!

Two guys go cooking. Only three days on a stopover from Europe to Australia. It was a toss up with my friend to go watch a fight or go cooking. What a great option to pick cooking. Interesting boat trip to a family compound. Highly professional and great insight in to Thai cooking. Definitely a highlight of Thailand and come to think of it the whole European trip as well

We loved it!!!. I chose this to celebrate my 39th birthday with my husband. Pickup was exactly on time at 10.30am. We were driven with 1 other guest to a boat then travelled to Tam's house on a canal. Unfortunately it was raining but we didn't let this spoil our day. Upon arrival we were treated to specially cooked snacks and a yummy lemongrass drink. It was very relaxing as Tam told us about how to cook the snacks as we waited for another 2 guests to arrive.We went for a tour around the garden learning about herbs which we found interesting. We were all given an umbrella so the rain didn't bother us.Tam then cooked each dish and explained how to cook it all the while. After we were each led to our own cooking stations and we all cooked the dishes. My husband has never really cooked and he found it easy and enjoyable. There is no pressure. There are plenty of family members to help. The table was set beautifully for lunch and we enjoyed all the food we had cooked. There is definitely plenty of food! We had had breakfast at about 9am. Lunch wasn't cooked until after 2pm but we felt fine as we tasted Tam's cooking along the way. Bathroom facilities excellent.As it was my birthday, my husband had apparently told them and they all lines up and sang Happy Birthday and presented me with a lovely wooden cooking spoon! I thought that was really sweet.We arrived back at the hotel around 5pm.We both thought it was a great way to spend the day...highly recommend!!!!!!!!

I really enjoyed the day: and I usually HATE group experiences. I bought a cooking class at Amita Thai Cooking School as a surprise gift for my husband’s birthday. I was really happy with the day, which as most people have said starts with a spot-on-time hotel pickup, an interesting trip up the river and into a side klong, then to Tam’s atmospheric house on the khlong. I consider my husband and I to be very well informed about Asian food – we have lived and worked in Hong Kong, Singapore and Malaysia and we tend to hang with the locals, not living an ‘expat’ life so we encounter a lot of local food. Nevertheless, we learned quite a few things about the herbs and plants in Tam’s garden and although we already cooked most of the dishes included in the class at home, spending time listening to Tam was like being in the home of a local friend and picking up tips on their way of doing things. There were only four people in total the day we were there so it was really easy to engage Tam in conversation and ask questions that were specifically of interest to us. We learned a lot, enjoyed the atmosphere and cooked some aroi food. I will attach some photos, as I like to take pics. It was not a cheap day, but I felt the money was well spent, unlike many mass, herd-‘em-around day tours one could take. We NEVER go on group things so I was nervous about this, but it all worked out perfectly.

sooo nice!!. Everything about this experience was great. The boat ride to get there was fantastic, with some views of the canals around the city. Amita's house is beautiful and she is a great hostess. We had a tour around her garden as he explained some basics of thai cooking and then began the cooking class. we learned a lot and hope to do ome cooking back home.it is a bit pricey compared to other cooking classes but definitely worth every baht.

A great activity to do with friends in Bangkok!. Had a terrific morning/lunchtime last weekend with friends who were visiting Bangkok for the first time. We had a great time even before the class started! The boat trip along the narrow canals is actually a great (non-touristy) way to see a different part of the city. We all loved everything about the class, the teacher, the recipes, the setup, the location, the garden etcetcetc - just go, ok! (Even if you've done lots of Thai cooking classes, you'll still enjoy this one, and as I said, it's a great thing to do as a group.)

Cooking in the garden. Cooking in a Bangkok Garden. What a wonderful experience to take the trip to the Amita Thai cooking school. Greeted by a wonderful host, it was a splendid day to have such an enjoyable time with the food of Thailand. If you enjoy cooking or gardens please do yourself a favor and go to this school and enjoy a wonderful day.

An experience of a lifetime. You must take Tam's cooking class while visiting Bangkok. I learned so much, not just about Thai cooking, but cooking in general. Tam and her staff are patient and kind. Our class only had 4 people, so there was diffantly an intimate feel. Her home and garden are truly lovely. Being a vegetarian Tam went out of her way to also demonstrate how to make each dish vegetarian. I know the skills and recipies I learned are something I can take with me.

A wonderful cooking school!. One of the highlights of our stay in Bangkok! Having participated in many hotel run schools while on vacation, this one is head and shoulders above the rest. The day is spent in the lovely villa owned by Tam. Passionate about cooking, she shares her knowledge of the various herbs and spices that she grows in her Garden of Eden. She then demonstrates a wonderful full meal before sending us off to our individual stations where she and her assistants assist us in preparing the same wonderful dishes. Entertaining, caring and a wonderful instructor, this is a wonderful way to learn and bring home fabulous and easy to make Thai dishes to continue to enjoy at home. Highly recommended!

A highlight of our Thailand honeymoon. My husband and I attended the Amita Thai cooking class at the end of our 2+ week honeymoon in Thailand. We are both food/cooking lovers and wanted something more authentic yet still fun - and this was exactly what we were looking for. There were a few last minute cancellations in our class so we essentially had a private lesson with Tam - who is so engaging, informative and sweet. We felt like we were spending the day with a dear aunt, versus a stranger. Everything was wonderful - the lovely boat ride and beautiful house, the welcome snacks, meeting the animals (We miss you Black Sesame and White Sesame!), the informative garden tour, the cooking class itself, and most of all, eating everything. YUM. We also got recipe cards at the end so we could replicate everything at home! The whole process (booking, transportation to/from our hotel) was very organized and professional. And I can't say this enough but Tam is the sweetest and most engaging instructor. You'll feel like you're with family. This was by far the PERFECT excursion to end our honeymoon trip. We still reminisce about the class to friends and family. Highly recommended.

Absolutely Fantastic!. Just spent the day here cooking Thai food and what a fantastic day we have had.From the taxi pick up to the boat trip to the venue, to the setting, to the cooking everything was perfect.Tam and her team looked after us so well and after a trip round the herb garden you get down to the demonstration, then you get to cook for yourself......best of all you get to eat it!!The whole day is relaxed, very informative and fun! It is a great thing to do if you want to see how too make delicious Thai food from all natural ingredients.Thank youAlan & Ollie.

Best way to send the day!. What a better way to enjoy Thailand then to have a understanding of basic Thai cooking. Tam is such a sweet, funny woman and is also great teacher. She has everything very organized from the time they pick you up at your hotel until you depart. You will have a great time and when your done making your lunch you get to enjoy it on the veranda overlooking the canal. Truly a great day and you could not ask for more.

This was absolutely amazing!. You must do this. My travel agent put this in our itinerary in Bangkok. My husband and I are travel (and food) snobs. We have done several cooking classes, too.This was amazing. Everything from the fun car and boat ride to the place to the end was superb! This place had systems down, charm mastered & of course the cooking was fabulous. If you love to cook or hate it; if you love Thai food or could care less. Either way, this event is just so fun. Don't miss it! VERY UNIQUE experienced from a 4th generation Thai running this family business.

Wonderful way to learn Thai cooking. My husband and I chose Amita on the recommendation of our friend who did the same class a year earlier. A lovely boat ride (11th Oct) took us to Tam's lovely warm home, not to mention the entertaining bird ! Tam was very entertaining and knowledgeable helped by a couple o lovely girls. The atmosphere was very relaxed, lots of chatting, laughing along the way. We learned how to prepare and cook 4 different Thai dishes including my favourite Sticky Rice pudding with Mango. By the end of the cooking class, the food was laid out on the table and we had a wonderful lunch !If you are looking to learn Thai cooking in a pleasant relaxed warm atmosphere, Amita is the place !

Bang For Your Buck. Spent a wonderful day with Tam in her lovely home. If you wish to learn Thai cooking, this is the place. The food was good and fresh, her stories entertaining. No need to pay for an expensive lesson in a fancy hotel when you can be invited into someone's home.

Fantastic way to spend a day in Bangkok. We just got back from our class and every expectation we had was not just met, but exceeded. The boat ride up the river and canal was a wonderful way to start the day. Our boat captain slowed down to point out the landmarks and the various monitor lizards along the bank. Upon arrival, Tam greeted us with a refreshing lemon grass tea and a sampling of some of the various plants from the garden. The cooking portion was incredible. Tam walked us through the recipes and we sampled for "quality control" during the demonstrations. The cooking demos were incredibly informative and easy to follow. During the hands on portion, we had full support as we whipped up a feast. Lunch was up on the terrace by the river and could not have been more pleasant or relaxing. This was not only one of the better cooking classes I've attended, but also one of the more memorable and enjoyable activities we had in Bangkok. I would highly recommend this to anyone. I would definitely return.

Wonderful insight into Thai cuisine. The Amita cooking class is an experience not to be missed starting with pick up at a central hotel location and a trip along the Chao Phraya river and Bangkok canals to reach the homely location of the class. The instructor Tam adds a touch of fun and humour to the cooking experience and is more than happy to share her expansive knowledge about herbs and spices (and their medicinal and other properties) along the way. We were met with a refreshing lemon drink and some tasty appetizer snacks before the interesting and educational tour of the herb garden. We were then treated to some delicious recipes prepared by Tam with super fresh ingredients. Her instructions were clear and easy to follow and good preparation for our own culinary attempts. There were three in our party so we were lucky to have a lot of individual attention from Tam and her everpresent helpers during the hands on session - Tam even took some photos for us. The resident mynah bird provided entertainment throughout the morning - not to mention the rooster soy sauce and his partner white sesame. Would definitely recommend this cooking class for anyone wanting to learn more about Thai food and how to cook it. I certainly plan to go back for another session with a different menu.

What a great cooking experience. We spent a wonderful half day with Tam (Instructor/Owner) and all her helpers. We were picked up from our hotel and driven to a pier and caught a motor boat up to the Amita Cooking Class. Tam greets you with a cup of tea and some nice little eating treats. The fun really begins when Tam demonstrates your four courses with very clear and easy to understand steps. You then cook the same courses with guidance from Tam and her assistant. We then all sat down and ate our meals which were wonderful.Make sure you get to meet the cheeky minor bird "Kapow" he is amazing with his sounds as well as 'Soy Soy' and 'White Sesame'. You are dropped back to your hotel on completion. It is well worth 3000 baht (AUS$93) per person. You can even buy cooking utensils at a very reasonable price.

A warm and memorable experience. The half day program is very well thought out and the course itself takes place in a serene, canal-side house just outside of Bangkok. Amita, or Tam, who leads the class is warm, humourous and knowledgeable. Different recipes are taught on different days of the week. First, you're shown the basic ingredients, then Tam demonstrates how to cook the dishes before the hands on session. Classes are limited to 12, so there is lots of individual attention. This ia a relaxed, enjoyable and instructive way to spend half a day. Highly recommended.

One of the best cooking schools!. We signed up to Amita's Thai Cooking hoping to learn more about Thai Food. From the morning pick up at the Hotel right through to the end everything was made easy for us. The ferry transfer was a great insight into the Old Bangkok capital and way of life. Tam has a wealth of knowledge, great humour and really welcomes you into her home. We learnt heaps about Thai ingredients, culture, and the preparation of their food. There was six of us in the class and we all had a great time with lots of laughs (and FOOD!). Tam has a great set up, everything is super clean and ...no dishes! We definately will remember this cooking class experience and highly recommend it to anyone with a keen interest in food.

Ton of fun and we learnt heaps. When we arrived Tan was waiting for us on the jetty. Hang on I thought this is going to be different. We were ushered into her outdoor dining room and we tried a beautiful lemon drink with some herbs from the garden done tempura style.Then we wandered around the garden looking and smelling different herbs that Tan would be demonstrating in the class.Next it was a full on demonstration of four different dishes with Tan showing how easy it was to cook each dish. After each dish was cooked we got to taste each one. Next was our turn. We have twin 13 year old boys and Tam concentrated helping them whilst other in her family assisted the rest of the group. We then ate our feast at the outdoor dining table again with Tam introducing exotic fruits for desert. We were suitably full once we had finsihed.We would not hesitate in recommending Amita Thai Cooking Class to anyone as you are going to someone's home... Tam we'll be back.

A memorable way to spend a morning in Bangkok. I endorse all the positive comments to date: an exceptionally well-organised set-up, from pick up at my private address, the fascinating boat ride through the klongs to get to the delightful suburban villa location, and the way that every aspect of the learning experience had been carefully thought through. There was probably more demonstration than actual doing, and the helpful way in which all the ingredients were lined-up in precisely measured portions meant all the students really do is add them to the pot in the right area and stir whilst trying to give the impression we know what we're doing. But the whole experience is great fun, ending with an excellent substantial dinner on the veranda - and most importantly it works so well because of Tam's patience and delightful personality.

Everything we hope it would be. My daughter and I had a wonderful experience with Tam at her Amita Cooking School. We were the only participants but we are confident that your experience will be equally as good. From the pick up arrangements, the venue, the food and all the trimmings that make any experience special was all here. Tam and her 'family' of staff were delightful, patient and wonderful hosts. We were travelling to Hua Hin that afternoon and unable to eat all that we had cooked so Tam and the team packed it up for us in 'travel proof' containers for us to enjoy that evening. Thankyou Tam for a great morning. We would recommend without a doubt and would definitely return. Oh, and the food was divine!

Great Thai cooking class in a serene and fun environment. I took a Thai cooking class (love Thai food) Sunday morning 2 weeks ago. I was picked up at my hotel and driven to a boat pier on the river, then taken to house on the river (after 20 mins or so on the boat). Apparently an are where it used to be the old capital of Thailand. You feel like you're quite a ways away from the hustle and bustle of Bangkok. The house is surrounded with a fantastic herb garden. Tam, the instructor and owner of house, gave us a tour and introduced all herbs that are typical to Thai cuisine.Tam cooked few typical Thai dishes for us, explaining the history, the ingredients, etc. Then we were provided all the ingredients to cook all the dishes ourselves. At the end we sat on the veranda (by the river, under lovely shaded area) and what we prepared. It was a fantastic experience. At the end, we were then taken back to our hotels. Thanks Tam for a great experience - I'll do it again next time I'm Bangkok.

A Must do in Bangkok!. This was not just a Thai cooking class, it was an amazing experience. Amita (AKA - Tam) shares not only her beautiful garden but also her traditions and amazing cooking skills which have been passed down from generation to generation. I learned more than I could of ever imagined, not just about the dishes we were cooking that day but also about how to make herbs last longer, health benefits of ingredients, how to use ingredients in other recipies, about Thai traditions, and it goes on and on. The entire experience is perfectly organized, clean, the decor is inspiring and Tam is just an absolute delight to speak with. I would recommend this to any person of any age or background. Next time I am in Bangkok this will be the first thing on my list of to-do's. This was the highlight of my time in Bangkok!

A Great Experience - Do not Miss. Amita thai cooking is a great professional (but very personal) experience. From pick up at the hotel, the speedboat along the river and through the canals to "old" Bangkok and the arrival at Tam's personal home with very well set up cooking and instruction area this was an experience. Meet by Tam, who also instructs, we were made welcome with a drink and snacks. We then walked the gardens as Tam explained (with a delightful sense of humor) the various herbs and vegetables. Then into a demonstration of thai cooking followed by us preparing the same dishes. (see pictures). Tam and her assistants made the cooking easy and her friendly approach and sense of humor made this a fun event. It may not be the cheapest cooking class but you get an experience you will not forget. http://www.amitathaicooking.com/

Well organized, professional, tasty and thoroughly enjoyable!. My friend and I really enjoyed the cooking class at Silom Thai Cooking School. From the start they were very professional in emailing us specific and clear instructions to the meeting point. The short trip to the market was interesting. The cooking school was a charming place with vintage decorations.Our teacher Joo was very good in giving us more information on Thai cuisine. Her instructions were also very clear. The class was well organized and professional - most of the prep work was already done for us. We had a lot of fun cooking and eating the dishes we cooked. Highly recommended!

Incredible authentic experience. First thing is you should definitely go to this class hungry. My one disappointment was that when we went to the market, we didn't get to walk around and shop for ingredients but went to one stall where everything was already pulled aside for us. It was very interesting though to learn about the different smells and tastes of Thai cooking. And the class itself was incredibly entertaining and impressive. We had a 5 course meal - shrimp Pad Thai, a salad, spring rolls with sweet chili sauce, chicken in green curry, and mango with sticky rice. I was a bit disappointed that a lot of the food was prepped and cooked for us, but considering how much needed to be done in the time given this makes sense. And there was still plenty of hands on fun, followed by eating. And the ambience of the school was really incredible!

Excellent !. My daughter and I attended a morning cooking class at Silom Thai on Oct. 31, 2016. We greatly enjoyed it and were impressed by the friendliness of the staff and the thought that had gone into ensuring a well organised, fun learning experience for all. I have previously been to other cooking schools in Bangkok and this one is definitely the least intimidating and best value for money. I would like to point out that much of the morning is spent on cushions on the floor which was fine for us and made for a very charming atmosphere. However, people who find it difficult to sit on the floor should probably choose a different school.

Amazing and funny cooking class . I think this is the best activity of my Bangkok trip. Our teacher is very funny. I learned how to cook thai food and the knowledge of different ingredients. Besides, the cooking class is not expensive and you can enjoy 5 dishes. I will definitely join their cooking class again during my next visit .

Wow! So much fun. This was my first cooking class, and let me tell you; any future classes I take will have a difficult time impressing me more than this place did. From the moment we started they were so organized, efficient and fun. We learned so many great things. I cannot stress enough how amazing this experience was for us. My boyfriend was a little apprehensive to go, and when we were done he was thrilled. He was really glad he came. We would of signed up for another one if we would of had time.

A great experience!. After visiting Bangkok for years, this is my first time considering taking up Thai cooking class. I must say, I should done this much earlier! Highly recommending Silom Thai Cooking School! We had Jay showing us the wet market in the morning before the start of our culinary journey. We enjoy every mention of preparing to cooking of our Thai cuisine! Jay speaks very fluent English & we enjoyed his class a lot! It is my hubby's first time cooking, he had a great time too!

An excellent way to experience Thai cuisine. Me, my wife and a friend booked the evening class.We had a great time! the guide was very nice and explained things clearly. We ate the dishes as soon as we finished cooking - unrivaled freshness. All seasoning and ingredients are pre-measured so there's not chance of ruining the dish.We also received a nice cookbook.All in all, it's a great way to spend several hours and enjoy good food & company.

Great cooking experience! . Did an evening course. Gung was our teacher, she was great and very engaging. Had a brilliant time and cooked five courses and then got to eat them too. Facilities were good, great value for 900 baht. School a bit tricky to find but signposted from Silom road.

A cooking class is a must do when in Thailand!. We really enjoyed the class! It was such a great experience! Easily the highlight of our Thailand trip. You dive into Thai culture and experience the real taste of Thai food. We found out about Silom Thai Cooking School in a guide book and then we booked it online in advance on Cookly, because we read the classes are very small and quickly fully booked. 5 Stars

A delicious, fun, cultural experience. My wife and I participated in a Silom Cooking school after receiving a recommendation from a German friend who had done it several months earlier. We love food and were looking for an opportunity to learn a little more about Thai culture through their food.While the market experience was fairly brief, it gave us a better understanding of various vegetables, spices, etc. that are used in thai cooking. Definitely a plus to experience this.The actual class was thoroughly enjoyable. We were kept busy for the entire time, never felt rushed, and enjoyed the delicious fruits of our labor. The smaller class size (10 people) kept the class intimate and enjoyable and made the experience feel more like we were in a chef's home versus in a cooking class (the building was actually a small house, so that contributed to this feeling as well).The instruction was well presented and clear and we truly felt like we learned a lot from the class. The take-away recipe book at the end of the class will definitely be used back home!We'd highly recommend Silom to anyone else visiting Bangkok and looking for this type of experience.

great experience and great staff. at first we went to the local market and the chef (who was very young) explained about the different ingredients of the dishes, afterwards we took a tuk-tuk to the school and created the 5 dishes. the chef explained how to prepare the dishes and everything was so well planned and clean. of course we eat the dishes we prepared and also got a recipe booklet. i enjoyed the experience a lot, though i wish we could spend a bit more time in the market.

Value for money. This is indeed a very good cooking class and put together the very fair price of 1000 bath its very recommendable. We had a morning class starting in the market and then at the school. You get a very explained introduction to the thai ingredients and how to use them as well as how to make the famous curry paste. After the class we got a book with our recipes and even more to try at home. The book is very usefull as it has pictures and names for alle the ingredients so you can go and get what you need when you get home and wanna try yourself.At last the staff is very polite, patient and helpfull. 5 stars without fancy kitchen and equipment but tons of authentism

Dear solom thai cooking school. I am Spanish chef, and I really enjoyed and learned a lot at silom Thai cooking school. I want to thank especially my beloved teacher of teachers P, koong, she is very funny and teaches and cook with soul and love. Thanks guys...

Leaning Thai food cooking essence!. I have been to Thailand many times.While I have Not known Thai food at all.Just eating, and felt spicy.In this cooking school, I learned Thai cooking culture,and learned how to create Thai flavors.I learned that Thai food are composed of many flavors.It is like a spicy orchestra magic!The teacher(Miss Kum) is so brilliant person.Teaching in so many expression and humor.My lesson was so fun time.The teacher is very kind talking with easy English.I enjoyed cooking with HongKong tourists.It's so fun leaning with people from other countries.I recommend this cooking school to people who loves Thai people and Thai food.タイ料理は食べるだけで、どのように作られているかまでは知りませんでした。この料理教室で、タイ料理が様々な香りから作られていることを知り感動しました。まさに香りのオーケストラです。先生は優しい英語とユーモアを交えてタイ料理の作り方を教えてくれます。タイ人と、タイ料理を愛するすべての人にこの料理教室をおすすめいたします。

Wonderful cooking class.. Took a cooking class at Silom Thai Cooking School in Sept 2016.The class was very well organized. We booked an afternoon class through our hotel the night before. We met the owner (and her assistant) at a location right outside the market along with 6 other people taking the class. She was very friendly and provided water while we waited for the rest of the participants. We then toured the market where she showed us different spices, fruits, vegetables and ingredients that is typically used in Thai cooking and that we were going to use during the class. The school's location was not too far from the market (about 5 minutes walk). She provide aprons, recipe book and we each had a cooking station. The class was very hands on and although some of the food was prepared in advance, she showed us exactly what (and how) was done. The teacher was friendly, funny with an engaging personality. She discussed substitute ingredients we could use if we didn't like a particular ingredient and even provided us with ponchos when we were leaving because it started raining. The class lasted about 3 hours and we learned a lot about thai cooking. We really enjoyed the class and felt the instructor made it fun for us. I would definitely recommend it to anyone interested in learning Thai cooking.

Silom Savvy & a Sensationally memorable Thai Cooking class. A trip to Bangkok is definetly not complete if you have not tried the most authentic cooking class in Silom. Nestled amogst the spaghetti electricity lines, busy streets, alleys and ordinary homesteads. Silom Thai Cooking School is a well hidden, yet quite accessable gem to find. It was awesome fun and so informative to learn how to make each and every one of the authentic Thai dishes. The chef and staff is well organised, professional, funny, helpful and so much more. It is an experience which will enrich a traveller's life in many ways. Keep up the great work STCS! U guys are just Awesome!

Great way to spend an afternoon. Silom Thai Cooking School was recommended by friend and lived up to their words.Book in advance! We followed directions given and met near a market as a group and were taken by Tuk Tuk to the villa/restaurantOver about 2-3 hours ,we were shown how to prepare a soup, main course and desert all of which we ate.It was great

Amazing Class. We took an evening class with Jay and it really was as good as the reviews on here suggest.The room had really cold air con and was spotless. They teach you all about the Thai ingredients and what they're used for etc and then you make the dishes one by one. It was a really social activity and I learnt loads. You eat everything you make and it was hands down the best pad Thai I have had! This is a must do in Bangkok

Great experience !!!!. Emily, Emma and I had a wonderful day at Silom Thai School. Had a great teacher, always smiling and very kind. We learned a lot from the market to the discovery of so nice flavours, cooking methods and practice. When we left, feeling very happy, we were rewarded with a raincoat to protect us from the pouring rain outside. Warmest thanks. Will definitely come back. Françoise (from France)

Awesome class. Had a very very good session with chef goong and she make the whole session very very enjoyable. I will never imagine myself whipping a delicious plate of phad Thai within mins cook up a full course of Thai cuisine within a few hours. Great knowledge are shared during the market trip and I will definitely come back for more!!!!! Bravo to the school and chef goong.

Best place to learn and network !. Visited for a morning Thai cooking class , with 9 members from 9 different countries.Great schedule packed in half a day , very effective n thoughtful session. Good faculty , playful introduction to Thai cuisine. Definitely recommend.

Goong Goong Great . What a fantastic afternoon cooking up what tasted like authentic Thai food, who knew it was so easy?!Quick trip to the market, I would imagine the morning class would be better for the market experience as this is when it's a hive of activity, afternoon most people from market have left or are having a rest next to a fan because of the heat. Cooked up Hot and sour prawn soup, pad Thai, red curry paste for our red curry, fish cakes, sticky rice pudding with mango - I must say I was impressed with my own dishes! Just right, and you get to eat everything you cook. That's dinner sorted for tonight! We were in their new building which was great, nice and spacious and very well decorated and set up. Nice aircon downstairs where we all prepared and ate our dishes, upstairs however (where we cooked) was a sauna, hopefully they might be able to get aircon up there at some stage or an extractor fan. Nice sized group. Our chef Goong made the whole experience an absolute delight. Fantastic sense of humour, perfect English and excellent teaching and people skills! Good value for money too! Overall highly recommend.Thank you for a great day

Total liars!. Me and my friend visited Bangkok the second time and was hoping to join a cooking class taught by chef Jay since we really had an enjoyable time last visit in March 2016. We sent emails to the school requesting for a class by chef Jay but were told it was his day off. However, when we arrived at the assembly point, we found Jay there leading another class. We immediately requested to change to his class but were totally neglected by the staff in-charge. When we protested, the staff gave us excuses saying that Jay was off yesterday and because it was our second time etc. We found that it was totally unacceptable and such arrangement reflected badly on how the school handled customers' requests. We thus decided to quit this time since the staff ignored our dissatisfaction bluntly.

Highly recommend with a group or solo!. I came here on a whim today & am so glad! Well organized from start (tour and market shopping) to finish (you'll make 5 wonderful dishes and go home with a recipe book). I came alone but quickly made friends with others in the group and I absolutely loved our chef/instructor, Koong! She was informative, friendly, and funny and made sure everyone enjoyed the entire day.

Fab Class!. The experience started with a short visit to a market stand where our instructor explained the importance of various Thai specialty ingredients and spices. We were treated to a quick tuk-tuk ride to the cooking school, donned aprons and got ready to chop. Each participant had her own work station, as well as own wok for cooking. We watched our instructor make coconut cream and coconut milk, and were able to taste many of the ingredients in the dishes. We made a soup, salad, and entree and were able to enjoy these dishes for lunch, ending with the traditional mango sticky rice. A bonus of this class was receiving a book with all the recipes. Also worth noting - the decor of the cooking school was quite charming!

Great time but hot as hades. We learned how to make a number of Thai curry dishes over 3 hours in our cooking class. First you sit in airconditioned (god bless it) rooms while the instructors give you some background on what you will be cooking and how to do it.Then you go outside into a hallway where there individual cooking burners set up for each student. There is a teacher there to guide you through the instructions and help you if you get stuck. We were there in May and it was 100F outside - almost unbearable. Instructors were awesome and the entire class was really authentic and enjoyable.

Fun approach to the complexity of Thai Cooking. I take Muay Thai students of mine here every year and they love it. It's super fun, inexpensive and DELICIOUS. They are friendly and make the experience unforgettable

Fun and hands on! . Had a wonderful time learning to cook authentic Thai food! I was late so unfortunately I missed the market tour but was staff lead me to a nice waiting area and supplied me with chilled water. Class size was small so we were able to ask questions and receive help if needed. Placed importance on presentation so it was fun learning how to plate our food. I made the best pad Thai I've had in Thailand! Everyone got their own work station. Highly recommend!!

Must-do in Thailand!. Great experience and delicious food! You should not miss out on this cooking class. Everything is quite professional but still in a nice atmosphere. You really get to learn a lot and can take away a free book with all the recipes offered throughout the week. I was very happy to have taken this class!

Great activity to do as a group . I loved this cooking school. I had so much fun cooking with my friends & other companions we made. You'll learn a lot about Thai cuisine & how most common Thai dishes are composed. You even get a mini tour to the local market & learn how to select the most freshest ingredients. Our teacher was awesome, he has a vast knowledge in Thai cuisine & was very funny as he kept us very entertained throughout the entire process. It was a very interactive class where we learned everything from the history, to the process of cooking & preparation & also how to present & plate our food. We also received at the end of our class a book with all the recipes we cooked along with additional recipes that were all pretty simple to cook. I highly recommend this to everyone who loves to cook & enjoys Thai food.

I CAN NOW MAKE PAD THAI!. I had so much fun taking this class. Our instructor is also a hoot! If you already cook, you must really just take in the experience which is AWESOME! It is a great way to meet other tourists as well. I think it is cheaper to book it directly from the school. I booked mine through my hotel and they charged me an extra 200 bhat. If you have some time in Bangkok, I highly recommend this experience! Keep smiling!

A Great Morning Out. A great morning out for two of us. Our tutor was very nice, friendly and knowledgeable. Great to enjoy what you have cooked after each class. Remember skip breakfast! Would definitely recommend.

Cooking at its finest. What to do during a 36 hour layover in Bangkok? Taking a cooking class was just the right thing and doing it with Silom was perfect. Everything worked perfectly. Meeting point very well described, stall on time, etc. But the best was our instructor "Nam". She radiated passion and instilled some in each of us. Thank you. The food we prepared (ourselves) was better than anything I ate in a restaurant.

Great Group Outing!. A group of seven (7) extended family members (and friend) participated in December 2014. We had ages 10 - 60+ and everyone enjoyed the experience. There was a young German couple who also participated so 9 people in total. Koong was the instructor and was very patient, informative, and funny. It was well-organized with staff preparing, setting up, and cleaning up as we went.The recipe book they provide is well-done and professional with detailed pictures and instructions, as well as several pages that illustrate the ingredients and describe them so you will have an easier time finding them at your specialized grocery store upon the return home.Highly recommend!
Thai cooking at it's best. We loved the cooking course, going to the market first, then cooking and then of course, eating the self prepared food. Wonderful!
Wonderful!!! Can't be better!!. What a wonderful time! The teacher has very good sense of humour to make the cooking lesson very lively! The whole lesson was filled with laugh and fun!!

Great fun and very sociable. A fun, friendly and accessible class which was very well run from start to finish. The market visit was a bit disappointing as there was little exploring of the market but that was made up for by the tuk tuk ride and everything that followed at the school itself. A professionaly run class with some great food to enjoy through the morning. If you consider you would pay this price to sit in a restaurant and simply eat the food this is a fantastic bargain and a great way to spend half a day in Bangkok. If you like to cook you will enjoy this one.

Great experience!!!. This school is fantastic. Not only the prices are a lot cheaper compared to other famous Thai cooking school, the school itself is beautiful!!! The decoration is awesome, the teacher is adorable (Jan) and yes, we learned a lot...at least some fun stuff to try back home. Totally recommended!!!!

Highlight of our Trip!. My daughter and I attended 2 days of cooking lessons at Silom---and we think that this experience has been one of the most enjoyable activities we have done! The Chefs (Jay & Oat) were knowledgeable and funny and made our class very fun and interesting! I highly recommend taking a class at Silom Thai Cooking School!

Great experience !. Highly recommend Silom Thai Cooking School..everything mentioned in previous reviews very accurate. Professionally done. That being said it was alot of fun and informative. Pad Thai , fresh green curry and Mango sticky rice. Amazing Cuisine made simple Best to arrive hungry..there's a lot to eat. Well done ! I will be back.Cheers Bob

Memorable experience👍🏻. It was one of the highlight of my trip to Bangkok back in Dec 2015. I feel like I owe them a review if I don't express how much I enjoyed the cooking class. It was a fun experience from picking us up from a tuk tuk to the market, then off to the property where the class was taken place. By the end of the class, I guarantee that you will have a full tummy with delicious food + you will master in Thai cuisine lol just joking on the later part. But yea they made the entire cooking experience fun and easy for a person who doesn't even know how to cook.

Awesome fun and learned how to cook a few things. Did a couple of cookery classes with them and both days the menu was different and the teacher was excellent. On the first day had a quick tour of the local veg market and seafood market to get ingredients which was interesting. The menu of what you cooked was very good as all thought requiring just basic skills was the type of food you would probably want to try and cook when you are home such as Phad Thai and Red Curry.The teacher was amazing and I really cannot rate her high enough she was fun and engaging also making sure people understood what they needed to do and making sure everyone wass enjoying and learning at the same time.Absolutely loved this and high recommend if you have a spare morning or afternoon that you book a class with them as you learn a few dishes have fun and also eat what you cook.

So much food!. We were recommended this cooking class from the hostel we stayed at and it was great. We looked up a few and this one was far better value, can't remember the price.We first went to a local market to pickup the food we needed as we learned about the foods.Then we traveled by tuk tuk to the cooking school, there was 10 people in our class.We all made our own soup, Pad Thai, and curry dish.We also made mango sticker rice, fish cakes and the curry sauce as a class.The food was so good and we were all sooo full.The class also came with a cookbook that we got to keep that included the recipes we cooked as well as many more.A must do at some point if you travel to Thailand

Not really a cooking class, but a fun activity with great food!. We wanted to try something new on our latest trip to Bangkok so we made a booking for an afternoon class with Silom Cooking School. The booking process was a breeze and they replied you with all the details you need very speedily. Locating the meeting point took a bit of detective work using Google Street View, but I think that is mainly the problem of Thai street names not being very consistent when translated into English. We were provided with bottles of water upon reaching the meeting point (which was really helpful because it was really warm in Bangkok then!) and then brought to the market. The 'market tour' (for the afternoon class, at least) as some others have said before, isn't really a tour. We were basically brought to a store opposite the market where the guide explained to us the ingredients we will be using. She then distributed the various ingredients needed into the baskets we were holding onto (just for the experience?). We then took a tuk tuk from the market to the school. The 'school' compound was quaint and nicely decorated. The whole process was very well-planned. The guide/teacher was entertaining and professional. We prepared, cooked, and ate each dish at a time. Most of the ingredients were pre-measured for us, and the cooking process was highly supervised by the guide, leaving really very little room for students to mess things up. The result was delicious food that seemed to have been cooked by you! You will also receive a recipe book at the end of it, though I have not tried cooking with it. All in all it was a great experience and I do recommend it even for those who has never stepped into the kitchen. Though if you are looking to really learn how to cook Thai dishes, then you should probably look elsewhere.

Silom Cookinng School was once of the best experiences we had in Bangkok. I planned a trip to Thailand with four of my Japanese students, and while trying to plan the trip, I offered suggestions to them; one being the Silom Cookiing School. It was a great experience for me as well as my students. I am sure I will return on my next trip to Thailand. You need to check their website to find the right day for you. Each day has a different menu in case you want to go two times while you are in Bangkok. We choose a day when some of the food was not too spicy; students choice. We started with Papaya salad, then cooked Pad Thai, Masaman curry, and Tom Yum Goong, and ended with Mango sticky rice.

Very nice experience. We went as a family and it was a very fun and interesting morning. The organisation was very good, Mrs. Mai was very fast in replying my request and sent me every information we needed to get there. The teacher was a young lady with good humour, who explained us everything. The location is gorgeous, 3 small but well designed little dining-,preparation- and cooking-rooms. The class consisted of 10 people and they even took care of special requests (f.e. no fish, not too spicy). We would surely go there again!

Fantastic experience. Had an amazing time at the school today, preparing and eating 5 different delicious thai dishes, including my favourite Pad Thai. Our leader Jay made the whole experience 5 star! He explained everything clearly and had a really good sense of humor. The preparation of each dish is so well organised and each dish was full of flavour. A defintie must do when in Bangkok!

Favorit cooking experience in Thai. I like Thai food, and food culture, teacher introduce us well about ingredients, and culture, schools are cozy and cute. clean. this month I will visit again Bangkok, so I will go sliom again for learning Thai cuisine. It is better taste than restaurant! :-)!!!

Super recommended!. Super recommended!We did the morning cooking school. The market tour was so fun! And as a bonus, they took us to the market with a tuk tuk. It was our first tuk tuk ride ever, so we were so thrilled. Jay, our teacher was very entertaining and yet he has lots of knowledge about Thai food.The cooking lesson was interactive and definitely not boring. The food that we cook was delicious. Lots of food (5 dishes)! We were so full at the end. Remember don't eat big breakfast. The venue itself has this vintage look and nicely decorated. Very clean too!Overall, this cooking school is very recommended!

Even Better than Anticipated!. My husband, daughter (age 24) and I attended this school on a Sunday morning and we couldn't have been more pleased. Our chef spoke good English, was friendly, knowledgeable, and funny. The hotel we were staying at suggested a different Thai cooking school but we chose this one based on the Trip Advisor reviews. (This is my first ever review because Silom Thai Cooking School made me want to!) Although there were probably 50 or so persons waiting on the designated corner to meet up with the chef, we soon learned that there were multiple chefs taking their group to multiple locations. We were placed in groups of 10 and introduced to our chef before heading out to the market. Besides the expertise of our chef, she also addressed my shellfish allergies without fail.If you want to be taught how to cook Thai food by a wonderful chef using authentic cooking facilities, and then eat your amazingly delicious creations, please choose Silom Thai Cooking School. You won't be disappointed!

One of our Bangkok Highlights. We loved it! First we went to the market together and than we cooked five menues: tom yum, pad thai, red and green curry and mango with sticky rice. Everything was so delicious, actually it was one of the best things I ate in Thailand. The instructor was really nice and funny. Even the men in our group very positively suprised ;)

Great instructors, delicious food, and amazing service. I shopped around for cooking schools and chose Silom because it had a high rating.I can see why that is the case. We started the class in a market where Jan explained a wide variety of ingredients that are used in Thai cooking. When we returned to the school, everything was neatly and beautifully assembled for us to cook. We cooked four dishes (and then prepared the fifth dish - mango sticky rice) one at a time as Jan explained how we make it and offered assistance at the stove. Each student got his/her own chopping block and cooking station. Everything was so organized and the people were so friendly. I would highly recommend this school to anybody that is interested in food, or even just finding a fun activity to do for a half day.
Wonderfull cooking class. Wonderfull experience with great chef Oat. Children of 8 and 11 loved it and eat thai food afterwards as they know how it's cooked. Great visit to local market.

Deliciously fun experience!. I didn't think that attending cooking class would be such a fun experience and great learning time done in Bangkok.I booked the class a day before, after searching for alternative for some cancelled plans. I was lucky to get the places in the class on Friday evening. The communication with the school was very smooth and clear. All information (VERY detailed) were provided.The class itself was awesome - you have a chance to get to know some tips about thai food cooking and ingredients used. Everything is explained step by step, then you have a chance to cook and taste your dish. The time flies very quickly and you do not realise the class is about to end until you taste the dessert. That was a perfect choice for Friday evening - combination of joy, learning and dinner at the same time. And you can go hit the club afterwards :-)One tip - if you want to make some dishes after getting back home, check the recipe book before leaving thailand and get some fresh ingredients from the market.Enjoy!

Fun experience. We reserved a private group class beforehand. Since we were a bit late, we skipped the market experience. The chef is very humorous. Food we made was Delicious. Everyone enjoyed the morning there.

Brilliant experience!!!. Family of six visiting Bangkok-brilliant cooking experience, the boys (31 & 24!!!))) gained fantastic knowledge & experience on how to cook and present Thai food - exceeded all our expectations!! The cookery class run by Jaay (host & chef) made the day - his knowledge, experience and rapport with all his cookery students was superb, well done, Jaay!! We will definitely return when back in Bangkok!! A must for any traveller!!

Delicious food!. The food is incredible! This is from someone who cannot cook. Go to the market, learn about the ingredients, make preparations, and cook. Some of the work, like chopping shallots is already completed for you. Some will love that, I preferred the practice, but you still learn the fundamentals of cooking. The cookbook given in the end helps fill in some of the gaps for the things they do for you and the recipes are delicious. So good, I've already been twice.

Highlight of the trip! . Very energetic teachers excited to share their culture and food with you. The class was easy to follow but had room to make your dishes with your special touch. One of my favourite memories from the trip!

Highly recommend this!!!. Our tour started from the hotel to local maket where we bought ingredients for the lesson. We cooked and tried great Thai food. Chief was so fun with good English. All excellent.

Stood up and no one cared. The two of us arrived early as per the instructions given by email. After waiting and waiting we called and were told to wait another twenty minutes at the meeting point. Twenty minuted later we were told the class was already in the market.The woman on the phone gave complicated directions and didn't seem to care. We even arrived early. The attitude of the staff was awful and luckily Sompong cooking school were collectin students at the same station. We joined their class instead and it was amazing

Always a highlight when I visit Bangkok. I have been to this cooking school 3 times now, I always try and get here if I have time when I visit BKK.You start by meeting at the nominated meeting point, get broken up into your groups then off to the market. You get to see the fresh produce at the market, collect your goods required then off to the school. The classes are informative and teachers are friendly and entertaining. The school is clean and professional looking and I have always felt safe with the facilities. Cant wait to visit again when we next visit BKK in January. They do look after you, and the food is ALWAYS delicious. The take home cook book and certificate is a nice souvenir (although I am yet to reproduce the food at home exactly like the school, practice makes perfect) :)

A highlight of our Bangkok adventure. We made the booking via Internet and correspondence was always quick and helpful.I was panicking about the instructions given as they were so detailed but there was nothing to worry about.Our guide, Jay, was hilarious and I would recommend getting into one of his classes. He took us on a market tour where we collected up the groceries for the days class.On foot we made our way through back streets and alleyways and this gives you a real sense of being a local.The cooking school is across 3 or 4 levels and we were on the top level with a great outdoor kitchen. There were only 6 in our group and his was a good number.We had a 10, 14 and 15 girls with us and Jay was wonderful with each of them. He had the 10 year old next to him so he could monitor her closely and this allowed for my husband and I to enjoy the class without worrying.This experience is worth every cent.

A fun afternoon making new friends. A really great set up here at Silom - you're taken to the market (pretty standard for a cooking class) then prepare and cook 5 different dishes. The venue is wonderful and the popularity of the school means that you're preparing and cooking and eating with lots of others which makes it really fun. The team here are out-going and speak a range of languages.

Great Afternoon. We took the afternoon class with Nam and it was one of our favorite experiences in Bangkok! She was patient, friendly, and knowledgable throughout the entire class. Even though by the afternoon the market has mostly cleared out we still were able to learn a lot about the different ingredients. There was a large group at the cooking school but they divided everyone into two smaller groups allowing for a more intimate class, which was awesome. The food we made was great and I would recommend this school to anyone traveling to Bangkok and wanting to take a cooking class.

Silom is Doing it Right!!. My first cooking class was in Peru. It was overpriced and we all took turns stirring the single pot as only two burners were available for a group of 10. Then came Silom! We signed up for an afternoon class, everything was AMAZING. Food: delicious. Our teacher: very informative and so so funny. The price: unbeatable. We had individual burners and the opportunity to do everything from making coconut milk to creating curry paste (and of course cooking our multi course meals). We loved it so much we plan to return in a few days for our third class. Do it. You won't regret it!! Just plan to skip a meal or two that day

Great Afternoon!. We did a cooking class two days ago and it was a really good time. Good explanations, nice atmosphere and cool insights into one of the best cuisines (in my opinion) in the world made the time totally worthwile. Highly recommended.

Awesome lesson on cooking Thai food. We had so much fun, my teenage girls loved it too as well as eating the food after. Delicious. A good Evening activity that involves your dinner combined into one package, teacher was funny and kept everyone's attention

Fun family evening meal. Our family, including two teenagers, enjoyed this evening cooking class very much.You each cook your own portion of food, so you can adjust the ingredients and spice level to your liking.There were 9 people in our class, which did not feel crowded. Each person has their own prep and cooking area.

A really fun thai-m. We went to Silom cooking school recommended by our hotel, it was easily one of the best experiences for us in Bangkok! Our teacher, Phim, was funny and enthusiastic. The food tastes incredible despite us being novices, and the school itself was really well set up. Highly recommend this experience to anyone!!

Best food of the trip. This is wonderful. I loved every part of the cooking class. they take you to a market for ingredients then to a cute little home converted into a school. It was wonderfull and cost 1000 baht so about $30

Totally Worth It!. There were three options, and we chose the evening class, which did not include a trip to the market to acquire ingredients (the other two classes included the market trip). We walked down a narrow, seemingly sketchy alley to get to the address, only to discover a wonderful cooking facility. We waited in a dining room for everything to be prepared, and then we were called to the next room, where Chef Oat had laid out ingredients and cutting stations for each of us. Chef Oat was informative, took his time, had a great sense of humor, was kind to our children, and really had it going on. (And his English was excellent!). After each demonstration/food prep, we would go to our own individual cooking stations, cook our dishes, return to the dining room to eat what we had cooked, and returned to the neighboring room to have the next demonstration/preparation. Everything was extremely well organized, the ingredients were fresh, and the instruction was terrific. We all received a recipe book at the end, so we weren't distracted by trying to remember how to reconstruct these dishes at home. Lastly, we also took a cooking class in Chiang Mai which wasn't as good, and which did have the trip to the market included. It was fun to visit the market, but it was also distracting because I spent part of the time dodging the speeding mopeds and motorcycles that frequently whizzed by. So...go check this class out in Bangkok!!!

Fantastic Overview of Favorite Thai Dishes. You will learn your favourite dishes by simply participating in their efficient and well choreographed lessons. You will also learn simple but eye pleasing presentation of your dishes which is so natural in Thai cooking. Silom teaches you 4-5 dishes but gives you the cookbook for ALL their lessons, to explore more dishes on your own. Tip: Pay close attention and follow their directions exactly. Can't miss the meeting points.Teacher Nam was awesome.

The Intensive course was amazing. I did the intensive course (one week), which means that I cooked and tried 28 dishes (mains, salads and desserts). I am a professional Greek cook and I wanted to learn the basics in Thai cooking. I am happy to declare that my target has been accomplished and I gained a certificate in Thai cooking! I was totally satisfied with my choice of this school. They are professionals, speak excellent english and give everything that is neeeded to understand and practice the essentials in traditional Thai cooking from scratch. I want to say a big thanks to all the excellent chefs I worked with (Jan, Nam et al, kapunka!!). Suffise to say here, that each day I had a different chef-teacher. I also want to thank Mai, the persona at the front desk with the amazing hair that organized everything perfectly. I was taught more than what I was promised and I also met people from all around the world. Totally value for money, great fun! Don't miss it!!!

Fun and enjoyable experience!. It was a great way to spend half a day doing something different from the usual shopping in Bangkok. Booking the class was simple via email and clear instructions were given about where to meet. It started with a visit to a nearby market for grocery shopping which I would not have had a chance to visit by myself. Our instructor was engaging and told us a lot about the different kinds of herbs used in Thai cooking. This was followed by a short walk to the cooking school where we spent a few hours on hands on preparation, cooking, and eating our own creations. The ingredients we used to cook were very fresh (think squeezing coconut milk from coconut shavings with your hands) so the dishes all tasted great!Best part is the instructors are all fun, funny and know how to interact with a class of mostly strangers so it made the whole experience great :)

Great morning out. Started by getting great directions to the meeting place and continued to impress for the whole session. We went to the local market to collect ingredients before heading back to the cooking school for our lesson. We got taught precisely what was promised and also the opportunity to taste what we cooked - was brilliant

Fun and truly scrumptious!. Our chef Nam made our cooking class so fun. She has great sense of humor and make all the steps and ingredients so easy to remember even you made all the dishes from scratch. (Even make your own coconut milk). They all speak perf ct english Totally money for value. We are happy that we have signed up. Only need to eat light breakfast because you will be eating since 1030am till 12pmFor morning class, take bts is better. Don't take taxi.

Thai Cooking made easy!. Good experience.Instructor Jay was humorous and made the lesson very interesting.We paid 1000 baht each person for a Tuktuk ride and the cooking class with ingredients included.Had to skip the market tour due to the floods but it was still good fun.

Good place to make and eat Thai food.. I went with a friend and we both loved it. Even though we were late a bit so couldn't join the market tour but it was still good. My instructor was Jan. She is really sweet and nice. She speaks English very well. The cost was 900baht for a person through travel agency. They also give a cookbook so you can cook by yourself afterwards.

Great experience. One thing to to on rainy day. First they take you to market close by. Our class teacher explained diversity of vegtables and spices used in Thai cousine. Then, you go to the classroom. The name of our teacher was OAT so look him up. He is patient while explaining and teaching. Great time spent there and I gain knowledge and experience to be able to make common Thai food. It costs 9000 Thai Baht.

Delicious, fun, excellent value. My sister (minimal cooking skills) and I (more skilled) took this class and both thoroughly enjoyed it. The menu was excellent and our results were delicious. We made what looked like smallish portions but still had enough we took the leftovers and ate for 1 1/2 more meals!! The tutelage was excellent. The market trip we took to get the ingredients was informative and fun. The location was easy to get to / get back to our hotel - we took the train & walked/shopped on the way. There were lots of helpers to keep us on track & clean up afterwards. The establishment was very clean - we all had our own cooking stations. This was one of the most fun things we did in a very fun trip.

Delicious cooking for dummies (You can't mess this up). I thoroughly enjoyed my experience. I am someone who cannot cook, but the teacher made the experience fun and enjoyable. She also made sure that the hard parts were covered by the staff and that we only did the things we couldn't mess up.The food turned out great. We made seafood padthai, fried spring rolls with papaya salad, chicken curry, and sticky rice with mango. Everything was prepared from scratch, using authentic Thai cooking methods. I highly recommend this for anyone who wants a unique experience of Bangkok.

Exceeded expectations with service and flavor!. We signed up via email and Ms Mai responds really fast. She gave us such elaborate directions on how to get to the meeting point that it's not possible to miss it. Really nice to receive this great service beforehand. It set the bar. We did the afternoon class with Naam and she was fabulous. She knows a lot about the ingredients! We did a short trip to the market and got the explanations on the ingredients there. You don't really go and buy them, they've already prepared them to save time, but the info you get is very interesting. After a short walk of 5 min you get to the school where they give you time to relax in an airconditioned room. Everything you do (except the cooking itself) is in aircon. They have obviously prepared a lot of the foods already but you still get to do a lot yourself and you prepare the pad thai completely by yourself. Everything is delicious!! They speak good english, so very understandable. You get to eat all the foods (+/- 5 dishes), so I was really full by the end. Def don't eat a big lunch beforehand!In short, extremely friendly people, amazing food, learned a lot about the ingredients and they really try to make you feel comfortable considering the heat in Bangkok. Recommended for everyone!! Thank you!!
Great cooking class . They accommodated my shrimp allergy easily and were very friendly. Very informative and had helpful directions. The food was delicious.We had a great time!

Best Cooking Class Ever!!!. I joined the afternoon class cause all morning classes was fully booked when I tried to book. Everything was far beyond my expectation. The good thing is there was an air conditioner inside and most of time we stayed inside except when we used the gas stove. Even my 8 year old daughter, who was only watching cause it was too dangerous for a small kid, enjoyed the class. Teacher Joo was really great in every way and I want to come back to BKK to join another class in the near future.

Jay says don't eat too much chili or... The chef Jay was the highlight for us as he had a lot of energy and some good quality jokes "I'm slicing the mango straight even though..."For 900 baht it was a simple experience with some great foodBut you should only go for a light fun experience, most of the ingredients are prepared for you so you're really just putting them in a wok and stirring. This was fine for us, and fine for the price we paid, but I think they might want to offer something more than this in the future...Also, the walk to the school was quite interesting. We went on a Friday night and it excluded the trip to the market, which wasn't a problem for us as you can get a bit over-marketed in Bangkok pretty quickly. Go along and use it as a first step toward more complicated cooking courses Best of luck to Jay

Super fun way to spend your morning.. Loved the experience! Very well organized, signing up and payment was super easy. We started with a trip to the market to buy the ingredients we will use, the guide also talked about common ingredients in Thai cuisine. Everything we prepared was super yummy and after eating everything, I didn't even need to have lunch.

Fun, well organized and delicious. My wife and I were very happy that we spent one afternoon in their cooking class. It gives a general introduction as to how Thai food is prepared. The words "fun, well organized and delicious" make a perfect summary of our experience that afternoon.

Great and Informative Experience. The whole process of booking the class was very smooth, the school gave us clear instructions on how to get to the meeting place from our hotel. Our teacher (I think her name was Nam) was very informative and we had the opportunity to smell and feel the herbs we were using during our market tour. The whole lesson was very organized. Used utensils were changed to new ones quickly. We got to hands on for most of the dishes and sufficient time was given for us to eat after each dish is cooked. Be ready to climb up and down the stairs though as the cooking is done upstairs while the preparation is done downstairs (aircon room). We enjoyed ourselves throughout the lesson! Highly recommended!

Nice experience. No Air-Con.. It was a great cooking experience and fun class to be with Silom Thai Cooking School. Can see how much effort they have put in to make the class interesting. Perfect for those who can't cook at all. However, weather in Bangkok is too hot and it was slightly difficult to cook under the hot humid weather without any air-conditioning. Otherwise, would have given it 5-star.

well organized. I joined an afternoon class. I was at first taken aback by the large crowd of people waiting at the appointed street corner but then realizede were were divided in groups of 10 or less. Our instructor took us to the market and explained about Thai ingredients. We were given a basket which was a little lame as the shopping had already been done and the market was basically finished. I suppose the morning class has a more interesting market experience. The instructor was excellent and entertaining. She was assisted by cleaners and cookers which made everything very efficient. The instructions to the place are a bit over the top (and have one mistake) but helpful to get there in time. The cook book you receive could be improved and is hard to work from once home. Good value for money compared to other cooking schools

Wonderful cooking class that accommodated allergy. Was able to walk to class from our hotel- le meridian. Started at market and teacher described herbs and other local ingredients we would use. My daughter and I were in a group of 5 in total. Very nice people. My daughter has a serious nut allergy and they were able to accommodate us. Made 5 dishes and there was so much to eat. Had a really enjoyable afternoon

Perfect end to my Bangkok trip. I spent a wonderful evening at Silom Thai Cooking School.
