The school is about 10 minutes from Chong Nonsi Sky train station and easy to find using the very comprehensive instructions provided in the the confirmation email. Our instructor was the very knowledgable and entertaining Joo.In the evening class there is no market visit so we had a very informative session being shown through all the typical ingredients by Joo.What I particularly liked was eating what we cooked course by course rather than eating it all at the end, this was particularly suited to the evening session.The session was very well structured and the cooking itself provided a real insight to real Thai cooking.In addition I thought the course was great value at 900 bht.Wholeheartedly recommend and was one of the best excursions on my almost 4 week trip to the Far East.

Afternoon Course 1 Cookery. I visited on my own and was made very welcome as part of a larger group (11) I was also a little late (distracted by Silom) but asked directions to the market at the jewelry shop on the corner (at the meeting point) and found the group really easily.Great class with a lovely teacher (Nam), food was wonderful and I learnt a lot.Within easy walking distance of Metro and BTS.

Fabulous Morning . My friend and I went on a morning cooking class were delighted that we did, we both enjoyed it immensely. We met at 9am and were quickly mixed into small groups and introduced to our cheerful chef, Joo. A quick trip to the market was informative and fun and as we visited different stalls Joo explained a little about each ingredient. After the market, a group of tuk tuks were conveniently waiting to take us to our school. Our building looked very unassuming from outside so we were wonderfully surprised to find such a beautifully designed school inside. There was a gorgeous dining room and different preparation and cooking stations. We made 5 small dishes each and ate them as we went along. My friend and I are complete foodies but novices in the kitchen but we felt the level expected was perfect, we learnt a lot but didn't feel intimidated. Similarly, we were both happy with the 1000B cost, definitely well worth it in our opinion. We'd both whole heartedly recommend this experience, it's perhaps the most fun morning we've had in Bangkok. I'm sad it's over! Enjoy.

Great class, informative, fun!. I took this class twice in the last two weeks and both times were great. The staff is very friendly and knowledgeable. I would say this is a must do if you love cooking or want to learn about the true Thai style cooking. I recommend going in the AM class, so you get to go to the market and see many local ingredients. Its about a 3 hour class, and you get to eat 4 entire dishes! I will be back next time I stay in Bangkok. Thank you!

The Best Part of Our Trip to Thailand!. My husband and I have been to Bangkok often because our son lives there. We always promised ourselves that we'd take Thai cooking lessons on the next trip. The fourth time we visited Bangkok we finally did it. We signed up for a four-hour class at the Silom Thai Cooking School and had a simply wonderful time. The class begins with a guided tour of the local outdoor market, complete with explanations of the ingredients we'd be using in the four-course meal we'd be cooking. So interesting! The instructor was very personable and the activities in the class were fascinating. I really enjoyed squeezing coconut meat to make coconut water and coconut milk. After each course was prepared we sat down to savor our efforts. The cost of the class was only $30, about what you'd pay for the same meal in a restaurant in the US, minus the instruction.

Great moment in Bangkok. I love Thai food but never been to Thailand, and also I am a french cook, these reasons are my motivation to do this program.I am really satisfied with what I saw, what I learned, and what I've done, I brought every ingredients, material back to my country, and try to copy this wonderful experience.This is something you MUST DO in Thailand.

Wonderful Experience!. Booking: Fast, easy, efficient communication from the school side. Information is quite complete on their website. You choose the course, then they will send you email regarding how to meet them. Payment is done directly at their place. They put note to be punctual so that participant can join the market tour which is a very informative one.Price: I believe it was one of the most affordable in Bangkok. I was a bit reluctant to book since other schools put much more higher price but seeing the good reviews, I am relieved to have chosen them.Cooking guide: Ms. Mai. Such a lovely and informative person. Her English skill is decent and understandable to assist us throughout the class.The place: Though location wise is strategic in Bangkok, the cooking school is located at a small alley, in a 3 story house (If I am not mistaken). Only stairs are available so better inform the school if you are taking elders with you.The activity: I enjoyed the whole activity starting with the market tour then to the cooking part. I got to see how clean the market was compared to local markets in my country. Ms. Mai was very communicative and shared her knowledge in Thai cooking and ensuring that each of the participants (there were 8 persons in my class: 3 Indonesians, 2 Chinese, 2 UK, and 1 US) received the same attention. The class was so much fun and resulted in a super delicious meals. I joined this class with my mum though she was a bit reluctant at first and knew everything already because she cooks but in the end she was happy to have participated in the class. We left the school with full tummy as well!Note: My mum and I are Moslems so use of ingredients are a concern to us. Luckily they did not show us any non halal ingredients even when we were at the market.Summary: Money well spent! Would love to join again :)
Afternoon cooking fun. This was such an enjoyable experience and one which I'd highly recommend to people who want to learn a bit about Thai cooking.

I feel like I can open a Thai Restaurant now. I always thought cooking was complicated until I attended my first ever cooking class. Basic introduction of the various Thai Ingredients was provided to us during the market tour. It's a great deal for someone who rarely steps into the kitchen like me.We had a chance to make our own fresh coconut milk which was the main ingredient for most of their dishes.Instructions and introductions were clear and precise along the way. So clear that it feels like I have mastered everything in that short 3 hours. Taste was good and comparable to Bali Thai, Thai Express and any Thai food restaurant you can think off.You think it's difficult to remember the steps and ingredients? Fret not. A copy of their recipe will be distributed at the end of the day.Make use of this chance to have some bonding with your friends, family or even better make new friends!

Excellence. This cooking school is excellent. For a reasonable price, they take you on a tour of the markets to source and learn about fresh ingredients, then teach you how to prepare for and make 5 thai dishes. The set up is fantastic- all the utensils and ingredients are prepared for you to save wasting time (although you do get taught how) and it's all ready to go. You get a cookbook with recipes to try when you leave as well. The food was delicious, and we made it all ourselves! The only downside is that now I'm back home, I can't replicate what I cooked there... but I was definitely feeling confident as a thai cook when I was at the cooking school !

Amazing!. I loved my experience at Silom cooking school. Our instructor Pim was great and funny. We had a small group of 5 in our class allowing for one on one instruction and involvement in the cooking. We made 5 dishes and got to cut and cook all of our own dishes. It was very structured and flowed well. I would recommend to anyone looking to learn about Thai ingredients and ways cook iconic dishes (pad Thai, to yum soup, curry)

The price is reasonable. I had a good time there.. The school is growing fast so the teacher takes us to a new location for the class. The teacher is very humorous and the service staff are working well so we still had a good time to enjoy learning there. I would say it is a value for money activity.

Excellent! . Very very very good! I highly recommend this course. Our teacher, Jay, was extremely friendly and energetic and knowledgable. His English is also very good. It was the perfect amount of watching and hands-on cooking. The food we made was so good and we got to keep a recipe book. Definitely do this class if you enjoy cooking or even if you just enjoy eating :)

Highlight of our Holiday!. I was sceptical at first about booking Silom, as it was by far the cheapest cooking school I found, but with the opportunity to cook the most dishes. My intuition was telling me you get what you pay for, so my expectations weren't high... but I couldn't have been more wrong!! In fact, this cooking class was probably the highlight of our 11 night trip to Bangkok and Koh Samui. My boyfriend and I absolutely loved it.We decided to book the 9am class after reading reviews saying that the food market is a bit more lively at this time. At the market we were led by our guide (Chef Pim who was amazing!) to pick up our ingredients and taught about them all along the way. After the market we were led down numerous back streets to the cooking school itself where we were taught to prepare and cook our dishes. The whole experience felt really authentic, unlike I guess some of the other more expensive cooking schools, where you're probably taught in some state of the art hotel/ restaurant kitchen. We sat on cushions in the prep room to chop and prepare our ingredients, and cooked on portable gas hobs with authentic woks and hand-made coconut spatulas and ladles- like proper street food!To cook and eat 5 dishes may sound like a lot, but each portion of food was relatively small so we were left feeling full but not uncomfortable- it was the perfect amount of food for lunch. Upon leaving we were presented with a recipe book containing all the dishes we had cooked that day (plus many more) along with pictures and descriptions of all the ingredients required in order to recreate the dishes at home.To conclude, the staff and facilities were amazing, not to mention the food! I would highly recommend this experience to anyone who has even the remotest interest in thai cooking and food, I guarantee you will have the best time and for roughly £20 a head it really is amazing value for money!!

A great Thai cooking and eating experience in the heart of Bangkok. A great Thai cooking and eating experience in the heart of Bangkok.I will be honest and say I was nervous about going here as it seemed in the middle of nowhere in Bangkok but my wife had prebooked it and as usual the wife was right and I was wrong as it was brilliant.It is easy to get to basically just hop in a taxi and then where you get dropped there is signs down teh alley ways that tell you where to go, just make sure you get to teh right course as it seemed there was a few in teh same area. Coming home just walk back to the main road and we flagged down a taxi in a matter of seconds.The cookery course was excellent and the people running it were really helpful. A beautiful selection of fresh goods was displayed for us and we cooked our meals with a really nice group of people from all around the world.I would recommend this to anyone wanting to experience a different evening out and learn how to cook some proper Thai food.I was also say if you are going here then have a light or skip lunch so that you have room for all teh food you make :)

Great cooking class and cultural experience!. This is a great Thai cooking class and was a highlight of our trip to Bangkok. My kids were engaged, learned a lot, and tried and enjoyed new foods. I highly recommend this!

vibrant AND efficient! . Look no further- Silom is the best! Not only do students learn to prepare and shop for 5 delicious Thai dishes, but the school is somehow both efficiently organized and charmingly personal, and for 1000 baht, a steal.From the market trip to the prep and dining rooms to the outdoor kitchen, every setting offers a must-photograph vignette, with piles of brightly colored vegetables and stacks of vibrant linens and serving ware. Classes are small enough so each student can participate and ask questions, while dietary modifications are handled with care. Other students in our class commented they were so glad to sample a wide range of foods in a tidy environment after falling ill from several other restaurants in the city. The best part of the class is the full-color cookbook we received after enjoying our meal- it exceeded my expectations. I felt able to fully participate in the class knowing details would be outlined later. I am motivated and equipped to cook what I learned- and hopefully return for another of their many course offerings some day!

Will definitely come back. morning course was started with a wet market visit, from there, they sent us to a cooking campus by tuk tuk, this service is also included in the package .It was so much fun and the food we cooked was nicer than many restaurants that offer Thai food. The campus I went to was divided into a practice room, a dining area and a cooking area. Lots of efforts had been put into the decoration of this cooking school. Would recommend this school to anyone coming to Bangkok

You should try!. I have no idea about how to cook Thai food before taking cooking class.It was very easy to cook and the most important thing was the foods I cooked is much delicious than restaurant foods.The master explained kindly all there is to know about Thai food.Very good experience!!
A Fun Day For Cooking. We enjoyed our cooking class with Chef Pim. What a wonderful way to learn about Thai food and Thai culture. The visit to the market was a joy. Overall a fun experience!

Fantastic way to spend an afternoon in Bangkok. This is a must do in Bangkok. Organising it was easy, just an email. Meet on a random corner and then get taken on a mystery tour ending up at the kitchen, which is down an alleyway. A whole afternoon of learning, cooking and eating. They take you through each course, preparation, etc. The tutor was fun, knowledgeable and a joy to be with. I am a vegetarian and my needs were well catered for amongst all the meat eaters, not a problem. 1,000 bht and worth every single one.

Probably one of the best experience I've ever had!!!. I never knew that I would enjoy my solo trip this much! It's a good thing I have added this in my itinerary. I always love Thai food. Our instructor, Nim, speaks very good English and made sure that everyone of us is enjoying. She made cooking very easy. She was able to explain every ingredient and how is it used. The food we have cooked is really delicious and authentic plus I get to meet new friends from other parts of the world. It's also very cheap, for only 1000THB you'll learn, get a free cook book and gain new friends. Definitely a must thing to do in Thailand! I couldn't say more.
Delicious. Spent a fantastic 4 hours shopping, preparing, cooking and eating 5 delicious courses. Well worth the money and a fantastic venture in Thai cooking.

Honeymoon cooking!. Was a great day out as part of our honeymoon to go learn how to cook authentic Thai with our master chef Oat! First of all we walked from the meeting point to a local market to pick up all fresh ingredients for our food. Oat spent some time talking through all the different ingredients just to teach us how they may differ from our countries and why they use them and allowed us to touch and smell them all to get familiar. Once all the ingredients were picked up, we walked to the cooking class where we talked through what we were going to do and then moved in to a room to prep out ingredients. At every stage Oat was talking us through why and how we do things being very visual and engaging to the multicultural class we were in. He helped cater to the tastes of individual people too, myself being the only vegetarian and two people who would not eat coriander so made special cases in prep for us which was good to see. We made Tom Khai with paste from scratch, Pad Thai, green curry and mango sticky rice, all of which were amazing and tasted so good because of course, part of cooking school is to eat everything you make!! We will definitely be making this again at home with our complimentary cook book and the know how! Oat was amazing teacher, very diligent, friendly, helpful and funny and could not recommend a class with him highly enough!

nice & tasty experience. It is located in a narrow not impressive soi, but when you reach the place, you have to say WOW!Sweet simple decorated pace. Very nice and funny people.You begin in a nice dining room with tables for four. You get drinks & lockers for your belongings.Then you go to the classroom. We were 4 Israelis, 2 Koreans & one Japanese.The teacher – Aot, a nice man with a lot of humor sense.We cooked Tom Yum Koong, chicken green curry, chicken red curry and mango sticky rice.It was the evening class so we didn’t go to the marker but….they brought the market to the class!You seat on the floor while during the lesson but can ask for chair….It was delicious and cost only 900 Baht per person.

A fun cooking class!. We had Pim as our cooking instructor. She is very skillful, knowledgeable and friendly. The cooking kitchen is very clean. Many helpers are helping to prepare ingredients and clean the cooking place. They charged 1000 Thai Baht for a half day cooking class with a short wet market visit, which is very reasonable. The good news is we eat what we cook! I was introduced to many Thai natural ingredients/spices on how to cook a proper delicious Thai dish! We had fun, we cooked and ate together, and repeat! I would love to go back again for another cooking class, but cooking different authetic Thai dishes. Haha...

Deliciously good. . After hearing by word of mouth about this cooking school I decided to try it for myself and I was not disappointed. In a clan atmosphere they had us in a small group of six and taught us the menu. It was well organized and the food portions were perfectly sized. They even give you a menu to take home with you.

This cooking class was the highlight of our trip!. A friend recommended taking a class at this thai cooking school when I was planning my trip. It's not something I would have thought of on my own, but ended up being the favorite activity of everyone on the trip. To start out, we were sent in groups to the market where our guide pointed out the different ingredients we would be using in class and how to choose whatever freshest and best. We then walked back to the school and began cooking. The majority of the prep work (and all of the clean up) is handled by the competent staff. Students alternate between the kitchen and dining room, learning to cook a dish, cooking it, than eating it. The outcome was some of the best food we had on the trip. Our teacher "Kung" (means shrimp in English) was energetic, enthusiastic and funny. We all loved learning from her.

Great afternoon with a fantastic teacher!. After meeting the fantastic Mr J we visited the local market where we learnt all about Thai ingredients. After this we went to the school and prepared some of the Thai classics which all turned out amazing! I would highly recommend this on any Bangkok visit!

Amazing. Came her with 2 others from my hostel. We all agreed that this cooking class was probably one of best things that we have done in Bangkok. Our leader was so friendly and made us smile and laugh the whole time. It started with a small walk through the market to collect our supplies then we returned to the school for detailed and hands on lessons for cooking 4 different dishes. Would highly recommend to everyone! Possibly not young children as you are using hot frying pans and sharp knives.

Fantastic Cooking Class. We looked at a few cooking different cooking classes during our trip to Bangkok, but we had two kids that were with us (ages 7 and 11) who also wanted to attend. Many classes would not accommodate but Silom Cooking School was more than happy. It was a great experience, with a trip to the market and then hands-on cooking instructions. I highly recommend Nam, our teacher, she was an excellent instructor and very knowledgeable. Thanks for the great time!!!

Great cooking school. We bought ingredients from the local market and then got to cook them properly the Thai way. The cooking instructions were clear and we made food that was really delicious. It wasn't too hard - I can barely cook myself but Thai cooking is not too tricky as long as you have a good teacher. We made chilli fish cakes, red curry, Tom Yum soup, Pad Thai and mango sticky rice. Would definitely recommend this excellent cooking school.

A fun morning in a beautiful little cooking school!. What a wonderful experience! The confirmation emails contained great information on how to get to the meeting place. I felt welcome the minute our class met, and were drawn together in the market, getting to carry ingredients in our baskets. The rooms of the school itself are very beautifully and colorfully decorated. Everything was very organized and comfortable; we only prepped one item while sitting on the ground, then rest of the prep was done sitting at a table (I don't think I could prep everything on the floor for that long a time!). The dishes were delicious as well--it was a very fun and filling morning!

Lots of fun. This school offers cooking class for basic Thai dishes, Pad Thai, Mango sticky rice, curry etc. I attended morning session which starts with a site visit of local wet market (what an experience!), chef teaching in a funny way, me and the classmates laugh a lot while cooking our Thai dishes. We ended up eating the Thai cuisine prepared by ourselves, and trust me, they taste awesome!Strongly recommended to everyone!

A must do on your visit to Bangkok!. The school runs small classes (only 1-9 people) in traditional open kitchens three times a day! The school is professionally run and is a must for any visitor to Bangkok, regardless of culinary skill!Before the class even started I have to praise the school for their amazing welcome email! Details of where to meet the chef for the market tour were extremely detailed and easy to follow by public transport or taxi. They even suggested a leaving time, based on traffic and a letter for your taxi driver in Thai to make sure they get you to the right place! Amazing customer service!Every class (except evening classes) starts with a guided trip to a local market to buy the fresh ingredients needed. Your chef explains the variety of vegetables, herbs and spices available as well as their uses, differences and substitute items – great for when you get home and can’t source a specific ingredient! For all of the dishes we prepared the ingredients and cooked the dish in less than 30 minutes! We always prepared all the ingredients before we started cooking in the extremely hot woks stationed outside and this means your not panicking over chopping something whilst the wok burns.This was one of the best cooking classes we have done anywhere! The level of service from the school was amazing and the instruction/experience was fantastic. I feel confident in making these dishes again, ingredients permitting, and think the value for money was exceptional! The class is the perfect way to experience authentic Thai culture and cuisine and would be my must do for Bangkok!

Amazing, must do. We found the meeting point easily from the instructions provided and met by the chef at the right time. We walked to a market near by which was quite small but great to see all the food. We then walked to the school about 10 mins away where we were welcomed with cold water and fully equipped teaching rooms. Overall the class was amazing and we would it again, we loved the food and it made us try new things. it was very hands on and you got to make 4 courses for just £20!

Lovely way to do team building in Bangkok. Full marks for a fantastic afternoon under the brilliant guidance of Khun Jay the chef. The outside temperature was easily 34 degrees today, yet the experience was really pleasant and comfortable for all of us. And not everyone in our group is comfortable in the heat. Light-hearted fun, really delicious food made in no time with everybody participating. A massive recommendation to anyone wanting to have fun as a group, ideal for business but also for friends or family. Thank you so much!

Superb!. We were certainly glad the website and booking confirmation recommended that you don't eat before you go - even if I may say so myself, the dishes we cooked tasted gorgeous and we all waddled away at the end of the course happy and full!! The teacher was clear and easy to follow, and added humour and personality to the event and made sure everyone got involved. Great value for money, and a lovely setting to cook in made this a truly enjoyable experience. Highly recommend to all!

Fun and Tasty!. My partner and I were both very satisfied with this activity. We met our teacher at Chong Nosi at 8:40am and took BTS to Saphan Taksin to start the local market visit. It was raining heavily at the beginning and luckily we were in trainers. Those in slippers got to step into dirty water in the market. We were provided with an umbrella, bottled water, and a basket to take away our ingredients from the shops. We then went to a local home to start our cooking. We prepared the ingredients for each dish on ground floor (air-conditioned), cook the food on 1/F (no air-con), and enjoyed our dish on G/F again. Each of us was treated a Coke. Our food tasted really good, and the teacher chef gave each of us a recipe book. The teacher chef demonstrated how to make Mango Sticky Rice, as a result, we had got an extra dessert after meal. The class finished at ~12:30pm and we left the school with full stomach. Basically, we were very happy with the class, just that (1) the class size wasn't 9 as indicated in the company website (we had 11 of students) and (2) the class wasn't conducted in Silom Cooking School's official place. These doesn't affect our experience, but would be appreciated if we were told of this arrangement in advance.

Interesting cooking class, friendly trainers. Joined the morning cooking class while the hubby is at work.Started off with a morning market tour and then back to the school to start the cooking class.Small groups of 5-7 person with clear and step by step instructions on what to do. Some of the ingredients were already pre-prepared but there are some which we had to cut it ourselves. Yummy food and reasonable price! Recommended!!

Wonderful we had a blast. This was a wonderful class with a excellent teacher in a lovely space. We cooked a 5 course dinner and the food was fresh and delicious. Me & my 3 friends really enjoyed it money well spent for 4 hours and they give u a cook book for free. I would recommend this class to anyone visiting bangkok.

Enjoyable experience . We visited here in February and I thoroughly enjoyed the class from start to end! They first take you around a Thai food market and explain how to go about buying food and what to look out for good and bad. After that your taken to a small cosy kitchen /classroom and the lesson begins! I think we did about 5 dishes I was very full up and felt like I picked up a few tips. Overall I'd recommend anyone to go also it's good for people who want to go on their own as this was a case for someone in our group but she was very included pretty early on!

Bloody brilliant!. Me and a friend ventured to this class and jay our chef/performer/host/fantastic guy was absolutely brilliant! We laughed the whole day while learning how to make some seriously tasty Thai dishes. We definitely left feeling not only full but as though we could replicate the food we made at home (with extra help from the cookbook provided by the school). I couldn't recommend this class enough, and if I ever find myself back in Bangkok I would head straight here for another class. A massive shout out to jay who made the day so enjoyable...what a really nice guy and even better Thai ingredient god!

The Next MasterChef. Taking this cooking class, the beginner's Wednesday class, was the best experience I had while in Thailand. Everything went smoothly from the clear instructions on how to get to the group meet up point, to the cooking of the 5 different courses. Joo was our instructor and not only did I leave the class proud of the dishes that I had cooked, but I was also happy to have gained so much knowledge about local ingredients and cooking techniques. Joo's pace was great and she made sure to answer any and all questions that our class had that day. I wish I could have taken more classes while in town. If I return, I would definitely take another class. I was kinda wondering how so many reviewers could give such a perfect rating, but to my surprise, this 5 star rating is well deserved. I am now obsessed with mango and sticky rice, and I look forward to cooking these dishes for my family and friends!

Loved this experience!. I went to Silom based on its fantastic reviews on TripAdvisor. Did not disappoint! We did the evening class and cooked with Jay. He was not only hilarious and very entertaining but also really knowledgeable about food, ingredients and methods we used. The class is never dull and super hands-on, you learn a ton and the food is delicious (provided you follow instructions correctly!). Highly recommended for foodies and novices alike.

Great experience with Joo. I found Silom cooking school in Lonely Planet, it being described as 'basic' and 'best value for your baht'. By no means was it basic however - The house they take you too is modern, clean, well decorated and quaint. The food and facilities were very good and there was a varied range of ingredients to choose from. So it was certainly great value for money!Joo was great - great English, very informative and welcoming. Her staff worked really hard too - as soon as you left a room it would be cleaned and prepared for the next task like magic without you seeing anything.The food and company was great and I couldn't have asked for a better Thai cooking experience in Bangkok for only 1000 baht.Only negative was that it was quite intense and a bit rushed as you are trying to fit 5 meals into the space of 3 hours, but that's understandable seeing as they have two other cooking courses each day to fit in. Therefore an entirely positive experience I'd thoroughly recommend.

The highlight of our Bangkok trip. My wife and I had a fantastic time at the Silom Cooking School. We took the Thursday course since we liked the menu line-up. Our teacher "Oat" was both informative and funny with his dry sense of humor and sarcasm...he was great. Everything was planned to perfection...from the pick-up at the train station meeting point, to the wet-market walk-through, and even the preparation and cooking between dishes was planned meticulously. The cooking school house was beautiful, bright, and very local. A must-do if you're in Bangkok!

Fascinating and delicious!. BKK is super hot at the moment so we were relieved to spend half a day cooking in the air conditioned classrooms. Our instructor, Oat, was entertaining, knowledgeable and engaging. I was most impressed with his flexibility- he catered for lots of different dietary requirements with such ease. MenuGreen Chicken Curry (we even made the paste) Tum Yum Soup Mango Sticky Rice Salad Rolls Pad Thai I have attended a number of different cooking classes around the asia but this one has to have been one of the best. TIP- don't forget to skip breakfast- you will be full.

Cook with a pro, eat like a queen, impress your friends back home. What a fantastic experience; a highlight of our trip to Bangkok. I lived in Thailand for 3 years but never managed to recreate the perfect Pad Thai once I left. After 4 hours with the cooking school team I am ready to serve up a five-course Thai feast anytime. The session begins with a local food market tour before trotting down several sois to find the school, tucked away in the local community and quirkily decorated with a homestyle vibe. It's very much a hands-on experience with amateur cooks getting to chop, pound, stir and taste a wealth of ingredients/produce before taking part in a wok-off with other students as you cook your way through 4-5 dishes. Apart from getting to eat yourself silly, you also get a souvenir recipe book and can buy some kitchen implements on the way out. A fab alternative to the standard tourist trail...and a new skill learned in the process!

Fun if you are looking for a tourist adventure. Overall it was a fun experience and the Chef who took the class Jaan was lovely.However I was looking for a cooking class that was more than just a tourist attraction so I was a little disappointed - but I should have known.Most of the preparation was done for us already so it was really easy for all ages.So if you are looking for a real cooking class this is probably not the place.

Brilliant Experience. I absolutely loved my night of cooking at the Silom Thai Cooking school. The staff were wonderful and made it such a fun night!! I made tom yum, phad thai, fishcakes, red curry with chicken and sticky rice with mango. The chef was fantastic; he taught in a fun and engaging way and was so enthusiastic it was impossible not to get swept along. The food was delicious. You get to eat it after you cook so definitely make sure you go on an empty stomach! I paid 900 baht which I thought was excellent value. You get a cook book at the end which is great to have. Definitely a must do for anyone who loves Thai food!

Highly recommend. What a fantastic experience, great instruction, nice facilities, for the full market experience I would recommend the morning class as the market was winding down in the afternoon. That being said you still go to the market and they go through each ingredient. Very reasonable (actually cheap!) pricing and absolutely amazing food. We had pad Thai at Thip Samai and I thought it was the best I'd ever had, until we made our own here. Reasonable class sizes and lots of food.

Incredible Thai experience! . Very friendly staff, lovely Thai atmosphere! I made spicy shrimp soup, Thai green curry, chicken noodles and mango & sweet sticky rice for dessert! Class was 3.5 hours (9am-12:30) for 900 Thai Bart (£17).. Very good value for money! Would definitely go again! Have a good time if you're visiting

Great cooking school!. I've spent an afternoon with Ju who taught us the basics and the spirit of Thai food.An easy way to discover Thailand's amazing cuisine, with a knowledgeable teacher.You start with the market, where you try and smell all the ingredients, then you get to prepare and eat 5 different dishes, like Pad Thai (the best ever) or green chicken curry And you can leave with a recipe book for a very affordable price.A great time spent, I'm going back next week for lesson number 2!

Some of the best food we've ever eaten. Of the best meals we've ever had. Plus the class was informative, enjoyable, and made Thai cooking very understandable. Can't wait to get home and try out the recipes ourselves!

Must do place for all visitors. Went to market bought fresh produce and then went to cooking school. Jay instructor was so pleasant and knew all about his food products. He made the day very interative and team work. Food was so tasty and could eat all of the couses made. Best not eat before attending this class. Go home know make thai dishes from scratch. Ms & Mrs England
A must do!. This tour was excellent! The trip to the market was definitely a highlight. We cooked and ate delicious food + made new friends from all around the world.
Amazing place to learn about Thai food. . Very tasty and delicious food, with lovely people and a very interesting class. I really liked it. Decoration of the place very cool.

Informative, Brief, and Enthusiastic! Delicious, too.. The instructors were completely wonderful, I had a great time taking this class. Really enjoyed getting to do so many dishes, and enjoy them with an international group. Would do it again in a heartbeat!

Good fun and interesting learning experience - and very tasty!. Having found this school on the internet, and looking at the lessons, I decided to take the morning beginner cooking course on a Saturday, with 3 friends. We had a couple of alterations requested (no seafood, one was a vegetarian) which were happily accommodated.Once you've signed up to a course, the school administrator sends some clear instructions with pictures for the meeting point ahead of the course itself. There is even Thai language printouts to show the taxi drivers, if you're really stuck.At the meeting point, we were met by our instructor, Oat, who clearly checked which members of the class had allergies or intolerances (very reassuring!), before embarking on a guided tour of the fresh food market, and then back onto the cooking school.As for the school itself, well, it's clean and tidy, with lots of whimsical decorative touches. There is space for everyone to prepare, cook at individual gas burner stations, and sit and enjoy their food. Except for the cooking stations, which were on the balcony, everywhere else was air conditioned.Everyone is given a chance to prepare the foodstuffs we had just bought from the market, and everyone is sat around the instructor while he demonstrates techniques and teaches the basics of Thai cooking. We all cooked the meals individually, but under the eye of the instructor at all times, who guided us through every step (and prevented us from making any mistakes!).After each meal is cooked, we were allowed time to go back to the dining area to eat the meals we had just prepared, while the school staff prepared the cooking stations and prep areas for the next meal - so no cleaning duties required!!This is a really enjoyable way to learn how to cook Thai food. The "teaching" sections are very clear, the instructor was fun and answered all our questions, and the food itself was some of tastiest I had eaten on the entire holiday (even if I had cooked it myself!).If I had more time in Bangkok, I would have loved to return for the advanced courses. I will be back!

Fantastic! Highlight of our stay!. This was awesome! 1000 baht for a half day class.Excellent instructions provided on how to get there with maps and taxi instructions written in Thai. Not hard to find though.We went to the market to get our ingredients included in the price and got a tuk tuk to the school. It's like a house and beautifully decorated! Excellently equipped and warm welcome. We cooked tom yum prawn soup, pad thai, chicken massaman curry, papaya salad and mango with coconut sticky rice. Preparing and learning about the ingredients and British alternatives. Had group photos and could take them throughout. We were given a recipe book after and aprons to borrow during the class.Absolutely fantastic!!

Excellent Way to Learn how to Cook Thai Food!. From the Market to the kitchen, down to your personal Plate.This is a great way to experience and learn thai cooking.Personally I love thai food and doing this was a great experience. You will eat your own dish.After everything, they will provide you a recipe handout.It's a good half day activity. Highly Recommended for foodies! :)Visit their website: bangkokthaicooking.com

Great Experience! . I took the afternoon beginner cooking course on a Thursday. From the very beginning, the class was great. Our group's instructor, Jan, arrived perfectly on time at the meeting point and we were given a water bottle before visiting the local market to go "shopping." Basically we just visited one stall where the ingredients were waiting for us but Jan gave us a thorough overview of each ingredient. The cost covers a tuk tuk ride back to the school. The school is in a very cute 2 story Thai house. Everything is incredibly clean and there is cold drinking water for you to fill up your bottle. Drawers with locks are available for your belongings. During the course, we made our own coconut cream and milk, tom yum soup, green curry paste from scratch for our chicken curry, phanaeng chicken curry, pad thai and sticky rice with mango. Most of the ingredients are measured out for you so the majority of the time is spent learning about each dish, chopping a few ingredients, cooking at the stove and eating! The food is delicious and Jan is very funny and patient with everyone. Her English is great and her instructions are very clear. She also acted as the group's photographer. At the end you get a small cook book that has many other thai dishes. As someone who typically cooks very basic food, I found the class really enjoyable. For individuals that routinely challenge themselves in the kitchen, the course may be a little dull. Nevertheless, the school is run very well and considering it is only about $30usd for 4 hours of instruction, a 5 course meal, tuk tuk ride, etc, I think it is more than worth it for an incredible experience. Also, you can take what you learn back home with you!

Just a great experience!!!. Went to Silom That Cooking school at night 6pm-9pm. Although we didn't have the market tour, out chef explained each ingredient as we were preparing to cook. Dishes were simple to make but yet so tasty. Honestly, I think the taste of the food was better than most of the restaurants we went to. It must've been the cook ;)Just the taste of the food alone was worth the cost. Learning about the ingredients we used is knowledge I can keep and use with me for the rest of my life. The preparing and the cooking was fun and interactive. All in all a great experience!! Highly recommended!!!
The best cooking class in silom. I gave trying silom thai cooking classs. Instructor is well known and professional.Now,i can cook Thai food at home when i want to have.Thank you your great lecture .

Super tasty food and great fun!. We did the evening course with the lovely Jakajan and had so much fun cooking delicious food. Although the amount of exotic ingredients might be daunting, Jakajan made everything so much fun and provided a real insight into Thai cuisine. Especially delicious was the Tom Yum soup - my favourite. Definitely recommended!

Loved the experience . We loved the experience, made new friends, and learned how to Cook delicious Thai food. The instructor was knowledgable and taught us a lot of dishes (5 in total). He made the class very enjoyable.

So much fun!. Met up with my cousin in Bangkok, and she suggested to do a cooking course. Would've never thought of doing that myself; turned out to be one of the most fun things to do in Bangkok! We went on a tour of the market and then on to the cooking school to prepare our own food. You've got your own cooking station, and you cook the food you prepped yourself. Plenty of soap to wash your hands, and your cooking equipment is nice and clean. We had chef Gung taking us through the process and she was both professional with a sense of humour. Not hard work at all, just learning by doing in a relaxed environment. So when in doubt, definitely go for it!

best pad thai in Bangkok!. We had a lot of fun taking the cooking course with Silom Thai. We first started the class with a brief show in the veggies market to pick up some ingredients, after which we went back to the school to cook them all! In this class we cooked three different kinds of dishes. The group was small and the teacher was explaining everything to us. Overall a very enjoyable experience!

Fantastic fun. Took my parents here and loved every minute. We were taken around the local market to explain the herbs and veg then off to the school where we made Tom Yum Goong - so tasty then Pad Thai - amazing plus fresh spring rolls and then we all contributed to a green curry paste and were shown mango sticky rice. A great way to spend half a day.

Such a great experience. Such a unique experience. We were taken round the market to collect all the ingredients and the got a tuktuk to the school. All the ingredients were prepped ready for us so all we had to do was the fun stuff! We got to eat everything we made so go on an empty stomach. It was so reasonable, around £20 for the whole thing including a recipe book to take with you to recreate it all back home.
deserves all the praise it gets. just a very friendly and enjoyable experience. I am not into cooking myself but I enjoyed every minute of it. Props to our guide Jan for making it fun. Recommended.

Amazing experience . If you like to cook then this is the class for you! Instructors are funny and knowledgable and you do not leave hungry! The complimentary recipe book was a nice touch. Would definitely recommend!
for Foodies out there...a must do while in Thailand. Highly recommended...it was worth every Baht i paid. Dishes we cooked were the best i've ever tasted for Thai cuisine.

Worth every penny spent. It was a fantastic experience. Our teacher T. Gade was fantastic! I can't think of a better way to get to know the ingredients, taste, aromas, answer to questions you may have about Thai dishes. The best part you prepare the food yourself and it was delicious. Sticky rice with Mango, it was to die for. You get a copy of the recipes made and a list of ingredients with pictures, awesome!

Fabulous - wish we could go again!. The whole experience from start to end was well done. The pad thai and tom yum soup that we made were among the best I've ever tasted. And now I know what all the fuss is about sticky rice! The market visit was informative and the cooking facility was adorable. SO much fun.
excellent and exotic. what a fantastic way to experience the local and fresh ingredients and learn to cook and taste your own masterpiece. very nice experience.

Loved it, always a winner. If you love to cook or explore other types of food, this class might be for you. First, you can explore the markets of Bangkok and then cook a lot of Thai food. The you get to eat all the Thai food. We've taken visitors here and they come out loving Thai food. The classes are fun.

Fun experience with friends. The cooking instructor was very nice and helpful. The whole experience was so much fun especially when you are taking the class with a group of friends. Should've gone there with an empty stomach.

an all around fun experience. Recommended and arranged by our hostel host, we took the Silom Thai Cooking Class. Cost was 1000baht/person (I think), and we met at the front of Silom Soi 11 at 9am. Off to the market, and then back to their school for a few hours of cooking and eating. You are entertained, informed and satisfied. Great fun and I highly recommend it.

Cook your own Thai Dinner!. We always wanted to learn how to prepare Thai dishes that we love like larb, tom yam n green curry and were delighted that this was exactly what they offered as part of the course. But do check out the website as there may be different dishes each day. We paid 900bht per person and found it overall to be very good value. Besides those dishes mentioned they also taught us pad thai and mango sticky rice. The teaching was comprehensive. We loved it thaet they taught us to make green curry paste from scratch.Amneties were good as they were taps for us to wash our hands before prep of each dish and separate cooking and dining areas. Lockers were also available if you needed somewhere to put your shopping. And drinks including coke zero was provided free! After everything was over, there provided us with a receipe book and we even got our instructor Ju to sign it. Thanks Khun Ju!

Sharing cooking fun with the ones who don't speak your language !. It was a really exciting experience ! Our class comprised of tourists from Germany , Hong Kong, America & Korea. The chef who speaks fluent English is very entertaining. We were first shown to a local wet market for choosing fresh ingredients, then went back to the cooking house to do washing, chopping and cooking. I don't cook, but the procedure was made simple and easy. We finished the class with all the dishes cleared. We did share lots of laughter during that 2-hours class.

So much fun! . We went here for an evening cooking class as a couple and had a great time. Not only did we get to cook Pad Thai, Spring rolls, Papaya salad and a Chicken curry we had a lot of fun doing so. The class was good value for money and our teacher who's name I can't remember....was so funny. He was very entertaining and informative! I will return the next time I'm in Bangkok.

Great Experience. My Wife and I did the Silom Thai cooking class and we had a great time. The class started with a walk through the market where a guide told us about a number of different ingredients used in Thai cooking. We didn't have to do any actual shopping though because they had already pre-selected all of the ingredients we needed. Once at the cooking school, we were introduced to our instructor, Jay. Jay was hilarious and he made the cooking experience a ton of fun. We made five different dishes and all were incredibly delicious. The cooking school gave us a recipe book and a set of chopsticks as a honeymoon gift :).Silom Thai cooking school is great value for money at only 1000 Bhat per person, which is half the cost of other cooking schools in the area. Trust me, you are truly getting more for less. I highly recommend Silom Thai Cooking School.

Excellent!. My finance and I took this class during a short trip to Bangkok. The class was well organized and we had a great time. Although there was no hotel pick up, the class meeting spot before the market tour was easy to find and close to the BTS. On their website they actually have a video of how to get to the meeting spot from the BTS. The confirmation of our spots in the class was very quick via email. I highly recommend this class to any traveller.

Superb at Silom Thai!. My son and I took a cooking class here our first day in Bangkok. What a wonderful way to start our trip. Gung was our host and was fantastic. The instruction was fun and the food was excellent. We left with a book of recipes we will enjoy for years to come!

Must-do in Bangkok!. My family of 4 decided to do something different other than shopping in Bangkok and we decided on Silom cooking class after reading the reviews in here.Very impressed by the efficiency of the staff - from replying emails almost immediately to ensuring that our cooking experience was as seamless as possible. We did the night class and missed out on the market tour, but the introduction to the different types of thai spices and herbs was very informative and interesting as well. This was a great experience - even though they prepared most of the ingredients for us, we still had enough hands-on experience cooking most of the courses ourselves. Every dish was truly delectable, as they used only the best and freshest ingredients. You can imagine how fast we emptied our plates after each course. All of us had a wonderful time and we left with tummies feeling absolutely satiated. Value for money, and i would definitely recommend everyone to try this at least once.

Value for money and GREAT teacher. I go with 2 friends during New Year time. They bring us to visited local market nearby which is a very Great experience because none of us visited such a local place in bangkok before. Our teacher and staff are very friendly. Teach with their heart. Really love we can cook by ourselves to have this unforgettable moments. And we can eat what we cook. They also custom make a cake for a visitor’s birthday which makes us very warm and the cake taste great!

Should be number one 👌🏿. I can't thank the staff enough for such a great lesson! I learnt so much and you get an excellent well presented recipe book to take home. Everything was explained really well and I left absolutely stuffed! Highly recommend a lesson while you're in Thailand. Anyone can learn these dishes and it was a lot of fun.

Value for money. I joined the Thu afternoon session, 1000baht with market tour and five dishes which is value for money. The market tour is a very simple one, bring you to a small market and show you a large basket of food that we are going to cook. It's not a time for you to walk the market (I joined other classes that will give you free time in the market). Then we bring the food back to one of their cooking studio by tuktuk. They will pay the fare so this is an extra Thai experience. We were assigned to a studio that is with two stories - chop and prepare the food on the ground floor and then bring the food to upstairs to cook. And bring the dish back to the ground to eat. Everyone got a big bottle of Coke so you don't need to prepare your own drink. The dessert mango sticky rice is prepared by the teacher. The other dishes are prepared by us but they will chop some meat in advance for you. Be sure not to eat before you come!

"Edutainment" meets Thai cuisine. Based on Silom's daily menus and our schedule, we participated in their Saturday morning class with the local market tour. Our instructor, Jay, was fabulous from start to finish, and overall we learned a lot about Thai cuisine and had a great time.1. Silom staff responded promptly to all emails and provided plenty of information for us to easily find the meeting spot/school.2. The market tour was a true tour in that Jay pointed out the ingredients used in Thai cuisine in general, and we were handed the ingredients we were going to use toward the end of the tour (i.e. we didn't select or buy anything). If you've already visited a fresh/wet market, I would skip this tour because you'll get a better look at your specific ingredients during class.3. Jay conducted the tour and class in fluent English. The take-home recipe book is also in English and is a helpful resource.4. The class was very well organized, and in particular I liked that we prepared a dish, ate it, prepared the next dish, ate it, etc., because then you weren't too hungry during class. Jay and the staff set up our work stations for the next dish as we were eating the previous one.5. For us, the tour and class together took about 3 hours (9 am - 12 pm).

A Feast x 4. My wife and I researched various cooking schools for our last day in Bangkok. Our private tour guide recommended this school. And are we ever glad she did. First, it is about half the price of the fancy schools, and probably ten times better. You start out picking your ingredients in the market. The teacher explains what they are and how they are used in Thai cooking. Then with a small group (10 for us) you go to a house or school specially set up for learning how to cook. We made 4 basic dishes which were delicious, and the presentation was so interesting. Everyone is so friendly, and the experience is a definite highlight of visiting Bangkok. You even get a surprise dessert made by the staff, as well as a menu book. Fun for everyone and a great memory. I hope we continue what we learned when we get back home.
A highlight of my trip!. This was such a fantastic cooking class! Fast pace, humorous teacher, delicious food. I will definitely be going back on my next trip to do the next level.

Awesome experience!. My friend and decided to take this cooking class for one of our afternoons in Bangkok and it was one of the best days that we had! Our instructor was Nam and to start the class, she took us to a market to explain the different items that you'll be using that day. There are lots of spices and vegetables that we don't have in Canada so it was really informative. The actual cooking class was a lot of fun and we made several different dishes. We started by making fresh coconut milk and then started preparing tom yum soup. After that, we made pad thai and green curry chicken. There are also a few other dishes such as mango sticky rice that you learn how to make. All of the food that we made was delicious and they weren't cheap about any of the ingredients. For example, two of our dishes had 2 fresh shrimp added while we were cooking! Very clean and well-kept location as well. It was 1000 THB for the 4 hour class and I would highly recommend it!

Such an adventure. This was the HIGHLIGHT of my Bangkok trip. Everything was so Organised and well planned. So worth the 1000 baht. For 3 hours - you get to learn 5 dishes, eat what you cook and take home a cook book. However nothing beats the experience in itself. Going through the market tours, learning things from the Chef and preparing the ingredients and cooking it. Don't worry about getting to the place. A guide will be there to receive you at various meeting points along the way to the school. The main meeting point is at Chong Nonsi BTS station at exit 3. If you don't know how to cook - this is for you.If you know how to cook - this is for you too!

Fun and delicious. The booking of this course online was already fun and friendly. Very nice confirmation and good tips for getting there. The class was super, the food delicious and Kung makes it easy for us to follow. Only sitting on the floor while preparing the food was a bit difficult for us, but when you eat the dishes you have prepared, that is easy to forget.

Great cooking class!!!. Love this cooking school, everything is organized,good environment, and reasonable price.The Chef bring us to local wet market where the locals get their daily food supply, he explained and show us the ingredient we needed for the class, good lesson for choosing ingredient.The cooking school is well organized, lovely place. We cooked green curry, padthai, spring roll and tom yum is just taste like a local. The chef maintained his humor from beginning to the end of the class which makes the cooking more enjoying and relax. Such a lovely day. Will go back next time.

Great cooking class. The cooking classes they offer are just awesome. It starts with a local market tour. The instructor would introduce Thai ingredients to students. Then you will be taken to the cooking school. The classroom is not fancy but very homey. It's located on the second floor of an apartment. And then the instructor will lead you through each step to make authentic Thai dishes! You will be given one recipe booklet after the class so you can prepare on your own. The price is only 1000 THB , very reasonable. Highly recommmend!

Yummy, fun, and we learned a lot!. We made a last minute decision to do a cooking class and booked with Silom on the recommendation of our hotel owner. We are so glad we did! Ju, our instructor, was excellent. She had a great sense of humor, was an expert cook and teacher, and really brought our group (6 of us) together. We took the evening class, which does not include the market tour, so we missed out on that. The cookbook they give you at the end is very professionally done, and with this and the experience of the class, I feel confident that I can replicate the recipes we made in class. Thanks Ju!

Fantastic cooking in Bangkok. The Silom Cooking School is well worth a visit. You walk the nearby markets, learn about the ingredients - fruits, veggies, meats, and fish - meet the vendors, and carry your basket back to the School. Where you learn to prepare 4 courses.They keep the group small (you can choose morning or afternoon times) and Chef's instructions are easy to follow and extremely interesting. All of this culminates in the most delicious foods. And they give you a delightful recipe book at the end. Lots of stars for this one!

Fun cooking and easy to do. I have joined their beginner class in afternoon, the courses are very easy even you have no cooking experience (like my husband). the biggest harvested for me is know the principles of curry paste and Tom Yum and mango sticky rice.

Great cooking class. We took visitors to one of the morning mid-week classes and loved it. The small market tour in the morning wasnt as extensive as some others but since it wasnt crowded you could really explore and learn about all the ingredients you would use later. The school itself was lovely. The instructors were patient and explained all you needed to know in great detail. We made a nice variety of dishes and the little cookbook provided at the end is great. Come hungry!
Amazing and fun cooking!!. Great staff with good humor! Learned alot. It was fully booked, so order 2 weeks in advance. I strongly recommend it for anyone.

Good and bad. The good: 1. Cheerful instructor2. Variety of dishes 3. If you come 3 times, the 3rd time is only 4 baht. The bad1. Don't really teach you how to cook. They basically provide you the ingredients and you cook them. 2. For the dishes we made, some didn't taste that great.

Very good cooking school. I did a half day course at Silom Thai Cooking School and it was really a fun and interesting experience. The school is very professional but managed with passion. The chef we had did a great job explaining the ingredients und the ways of preparing them. The price was 1000 Baht, witch was very reasonable and you learn how to cook several meals. Big recommendation!

A highlight of our trip to Thailand. Definitely take a cooking class and you certain,y cannot go wrong with Silom. Excellent experience from beginning to end. A small class where we were all able to ask questions that we had. We started with a tour of the local market and I really enjoyed learning about the vegetables and what might be comparable in the US. Unfortunately many ingredients do not really have a good substitution. The classroom was very comfortable and nice and cool with the AC. Our menu included spring roles, masaman curry, papaya salad, and pad Thai. I am not exaggerating when I say that this was some of the best food during our entire two week trip in Thailand. Also plenty of food so want to go there hungry.The instructor (don't remember her name, sorry!) was very good, patient with all of our questions. She very much seemd to enjoy what she was doing.Great experience and highly recommend.

Fun cooking class in Bangkok. We were met by our enthusiastic hostess who took us through 5 courses of Thai cooking. Everything seemed simple but tasted great. Amazing how quick everything was cooked. We have tried some of these meals since we got home, but somehow they don't taste quite the same!

Fun and great food. It was easy to book and well organised. The staff were excellent and made sure everyone had a great time. The Chef Jay was hilarious! You won't leave with a huge amount of new skills and some of the recepies were rushed (particularly how to make curry paste) however you will gain a better understanding of the fundamentals of thai cooking. In other words its not a serious cooking course. The food we cooked was incredible, some of the most enjoyable food I have eaten in Bangkok. Such a great way to spent a morning or afternoon in Bangkok. Highly recommend it!

Truly authentic Thai cooking. This is my second visit to Thailand and my second visit to the Silom Thai Cooking School. It was just as good as the first time. Guided by friendly, happy cooks, you go to the market for supplies and to learn about the ingredients of your food. Then it's back to the kitchen for a few hours of fantastic cooking lessons. Each moment is fun, informative and thoroughly enjoyable. Hands on cooking and loads of information to be had. The staff are very friendly and funny and they know their stuff and none of it goes over your head. At the end of the day, you are provided a cookbook with all the information you need to take your new skills home to try on your friends and family. Thank you, Silom Thai Cooking School. Next time I come back, I'm coming again...on your third visit, you get s certificate!

Save Room!. We've been to several cooking classes in various countries, and this one was by far, the best we have experienced.The market tour was really quick, which was perfect considering the hot and humid weather. Each participant will make his/her own food at the cooking school. It's only for a few of the chili pastes, etc. that the group has to divide/conquer tasks. Otherwise, you have your own burner and eat your own cooking! And the food is filling/delicious!Our cooking teacher was Jay/Jake. He was hilarious and made the class fun. We laughed a lot, learned to make delicious Thai dishes, and had a lot of fun! We'd highly recommend this class for anyone who wants to learn a bit more about Thai food and who wants to cook a bit of it at home!

What an experiment. My husband loves Thai food. We decided to get on a mission to conquer the world of Tom Yum and Green/Red curry and Kafir lime and Galangal and Lemongrass... etc and take a plunge into learning Thai cuisine whilst on our holiday in Bangkok and can I say; taking this class was one of the best experiences we had.The class was fun filled and our teacher/chef Pim was humorous and patient and gorgeous. It was a small batch of 3 couples where everyone got individual attention. Pim answered our questions related to Thai cooking and substitutes to their ingredients. We all made the paste together but cooked separately. We had our own cooking burners where we made our own Green curry and Tom Yum and Sticky rice with Mango.We went for the vegetarian option and there was no differences except of Tofu instead of chicken and prawns. Since coming back to Australia, we have given our newly acquired skills a shot but its nowhere close to what we made on that action packed night. I would presume that we used all fresh ingredients in Bangkok where as here we resorted to coconut milk and creme and tamarind paste from the supermarket shelf and frozen galangal. I have faith that in a few attempts we will achieve our dream of cooking Thai cuisine.Their address is at a convenient location, though it is in a narrow lane but there are clear markings leading to the final destination. Its approx 10mins walk from the nearest BTS train stop. We spent our evening at Bangkok Fashion outlet first as that's pretty close to Silom Thai cooking school and the BTS. They have different options on different days, one can choose days that have dishes you are particularly interested in if you have the liberty of time. Its value for money and if you love Thai food I would definitely recommend this class, you'd be making and gorging on your own cooked Thai dinner.
Amazing. It was a great experience, I learnt a lot and we had fun at the same time. They even gave us a small book with recipes and we ate what we cooked. It was fun and delicious.

Highlight of my stay in Bangkok. An absolute must. Going to the market to buy your food is fascinating (and I spend a lot of time in Thailand). The guide and our cook was very interesting to listen to and a lot of fun to cook with.The food we prepared was good old Thai favourites (none of this trendy or fusion food). We did Tom Yum Goong soup, Pad Thai, Spring Roll, Green Chicken Curry and Mango with Sticky Rice. You also get to eat your food as you cook it aswell rather than all at the end so dont' have a big breakfast if you go to the morning session. they also give you a cook book to take awayThe efficiency of the place was also incredibly impressive given they had so many classes going on and we cooked so many courses - every area was prepared like clockwork for the next stage.Can't wait to go back and take my husbandOne thing however to note is that you spend a lot of time sat on a cushion on the floor whilst doing the food preparation - I enjoyed the experience but maybe not so ideal for people who are not comfortable doing this although I fully expect that they would provide you with a chair because they were most helpful and friendly

Perfect. Couldn't have asked for anything else. The staff are knowledgeable and the food is excellent. This class fully enhanced my overall tourist experience. And the price...wow. Highly, highly recommend this experience.

Great fun with teacher Koong. Don't hesitate a minute, try one of their cooking classes! They are extremely well organised, clean and you learn how to cook 4-5 dishes in one afternoon while having fun at the same time. And, of course, you get to eat delicious food Our teacher, Koong, was very professional but also loads of fun and made us laugh throughout the afternoon.

Don't miss this. We made homemade coconut cream and milk, you will sit on the floor for this,, just an FYI. The rest of the training takes place sitting in the prep room and at the cooking stations. We then made Tom Yum Soup, pad Thai, homemade red curry paste, red curry chicken and mango with sticky rice. They are very good with.diet accommodations, level of spiciness of your dish is controlled by you, bring your appetite

Great Time, Delicious Food. Although the actually school was a little hard to find, we had a great time preparing and cooking delicious Thai food. She started by having us make coconut milk by mixing coconut shavings with milk and squeezing the liquid of it, a far cry from opening a can. She saw I had trouble sitting cross-legged on the floor and got me a chair and table for the next round. We each had individual woks and got to adjust the spiciness of the meal to suit our own tastes. My husband, son, and I took the class. It is a great time for old, young, and people from any country.

silomthaicokeryschool. This was my fourth visit to this excellently run Thai cookery class. It is very practical if you eat your production lunch is not needed. Tuition is mostly in English with helpful reference for other speakers. The ambience is especially wel chosen and presentation always scrupulous. New students profit from a very educational market visit before the course starts. Today I paid less than 1000 baht and was delighted to meet such a pleasant bunch of people. Booking is done online.

A nice afternoon to learn some thai cooking. Went in blind and enjoyed my experience learning about the ingredients that go into thai cuisine. Everything was well explained on what ingredients, how its cut/mashes, and how it's cooked with some nice secrets are added. The food we made was delicious because of the fresh ingredients and the time and patience in making the dishes. Though I feel like most of the hard work was done for us, it would of been nice to take time to do the harder tasks.

Highlight of our honeymoon in Thailand!. After a two week honeymoon in Thailand my husband and I have ranked our cooking class at the Silom Thai Cooking School a top two overall from the whole trip! From the meeting spot to the market visit and cooking experience the whole day was very well organized and executed. The school itself is an authentic thai kitchen and was very clean and well air conditioned which was good because it was oppressively hot outside. Our instructor Chef Jay made the day even more memorable. Jay has an amazing personality and was a riot to spend the day with. Very funny, hospitable and welcoming. He was very knowledgeable of the ingredients and cooking methods and provided an enjoyable and educational experience where we laughed a lot and ate delicious food (some of our favorites from the whole trip!) I was so impressed with the whole experience and while there are many destinations in Thailand where cooking classes are recommended the Silom Thai Cooking School made our choice in Bangkok totally worth it! I'm sure all of the instructors are excellent but I highly recommend requesting Chef Jay!

The Best in Bangkok! . FANTASTIC! This is the BEST thing I've done in Bangkok! If not, in all of Thailand! We chose today based on the menu (Tom yum, Panang, Pad Thai, Green Curry Paste & Green Curry, Mango Sticky Rice). We met the group on Silom road across from the local produce market. Our teacher whose name was Oat, took our small group around explaining what to look for in finding the freshest and best Thai ingredients. We had little baskets each (with complimentary water), and as we walked around picked up our shrimp, fresh coconut, chicken and veg for our meals. We then headed back to the school. There was a few groups cooking today, and I have to say that things were so well run and very efficient. One group would be out cooking whilst the other was in their rooms preparing and learning. They catered to dietary requirements and preferences as well (which was really important to my friend who couldn't eat shrimp, and another man in the group allergic to peanuts).Oat explained to us why the key ingredients are so important, like tamarind or galangal ginger. He chatted to us about his family and own cooking experiences, telling jokes with a clear passion for Thai cuisine and teaching this to visitors. He was also very patient in answering all our questions about the different ingredients or dishes that we had tried across Thailand. The school itself is very clean and welcoming, with the preparation rooms and the dining room both air conditioned and comfortable. You cook outside on gas stove tops with woks. There was only one person per cooking station and we got to eat the five meals as we prepared across the day. This was also really affordable, at only 1000 baht for the half day. We also got to take full recipe booklets and post cards home with us. You can also purchase additionally the aprons and bowls/spoons as souvenirs if you like. I'd really recommend this school, I have a passion for food and cooking so this is something that will stay with me forever! Thank you such much to Oat, and Silom Cooking School! :)

Very cool way to learn more about Thailand. I decided to give my husband a surprise "gift" as his birthday present. And so I called up the school.Very friendly & helpful staff. Please call to make reservation before you go. They are mostly packed. Overall, an amazing experience. Our teacher was very humorous & patient. She explained all the ingredients & cooking steps in great details.We definitely learn more about Thailand through the food culture.What's best is that you get to learn how to cook, get a recipe book & eat what you cook. So please go with a half-empty stomach. All for an estimated cost of SGD 40. :)

A Great morning. Attended Silom cooking school on Christmas Eve, informative instructions on where to meet and the itinerary for the day when we booked.Met by Nam our chef, teacher and guide for the day, before heading across the road and into the market for our tour. Informative and interesting the tour lasted about half an hour collecting ingredients before heading back over the road to the school.We were in a group of 6, one of several booked in that day.We cooked Tom yum soup, made a green curry paste which was used to make a green curry, Penang curry, Pad Thai as well as being shown how to prepare sticky rice for mango sticky rice which was presented at the end of our course/ meal.At the end of the day we were given a rather nice booklet containing the recipes we had cooked that day as well as several others (that we've tried since and are equally delicious)It was a great day and made 2 food enthusiasts very happy indeed. Highly recommended and great value for money for less than £20 a head.

Fun Experience!. We're so glad that we joined Silom Thai Cooking School during our trip in Bangkok. We have so much fun and it turned out to be our highlight in our Bangkok visit. Going to the meeting point was easy. (They even send you the map and video to guide you to the meeting point.) At the meeting point, the staff introduced the instructor (Mr Jay, very funny person) and bring us to the nearby market for the ingredient class. Then he took us back to the classroom for the cooking section.Overall, Mr. Jay did a fantastic job in guiding us for authentic Thai cooking. his sense of humour brings so much laughter within the class and the food were delicious.Will definitely recommend to family and friends for this cooking class.

Best Decision ever!!!. We signed up for this cooking school based on the good reviews in trip advisor and it was the best decision ever! Our chef - Nam was very friendly, speaks really good English and very knowledgable about Thai food! There were only 10 students and it was so fun, easy to learn and we made 5 dishes in 2.5 hours! We really recommend this to anyone who wants a great Thai experience in Bangkok! We will definitely come back again!

Best Thai Cooking Class I've Done Yet!. I've done three previous cooking classes (and dozens internationally), and this was one of the most fun I've had. Compared to other classes in Bangkok, this one was a bit cheaper (which wasn't why I chose it, but that should be noted anyways.) I chose Silom Thai Cooking school because the diversity of the menu. I'm a bit tired of making Massaman curry and pad thai every class I take! Our chef, Jay, was HILARIOUS and made the experience really fun. We made five dishes, and to be perfectly honest, the pad thai I had was the best I had on the trip--certainly better than what you'd get at most tourist-oriented restaurants--and I made it! I also loved how Jay showed us how to take great food photos, how to plate food, and also was just such a funny guy. Compared to other cooking classes, you do a bit less. I didn't have to measure anything, chop anything more than a few vegetables, and I certainly didn't have to do vegetable carving. If you'd prefer to do those things, there's other classes you should probably take instead. Personally, I don't get much out of having to measure stuff on my own. I'd rather get to the fun part. If there's only one thing I wish we could have done, I wish I could have made my own green curry paste as we all have different spiciness tolerance levels. Other than that, I would absolutely do this again and recommend it to anyone!

Spot on to learn about Thai cooking and have fun !. If you are looking for a Thai Introductory cooking course near Bangkok centre, look no further ! we had a blast for the 3h thanks to Koong our chef. She took us quickly round the local market before heading to the school to start prepping and cooking. Koong was funny, relaxed but also giving us the right level of facts and tips. We cooked 3 classic Thai dishes (Tom yan, Pad thai and masadam curry) and we were showed how to make papaya salad and mango sticky rice. After each of the course, you seat down with the rest of the class to eat together and enjoy your creations. The classes are 12 maximum so it doesn't feel like a factory and not mentioning it costs only 1000 baht each !

Great experience!. We went to evening class and had so much fun. The teacher was funny but very professional and ambient was cozy and welcoming. We learned to make real Pad Thai, massaman curry, spring rolls, Som Tam and mango sticky rice. Overall it was a great and educational experience.

Awesome experience! Best value in Bangkok!. Silom cooking school is a gem. The price is the best value in Bangkok, and the quality is excellent! The staff is super friendly and hospitable. Best experience by far in Bangkok!

I can't believe I made such great tasting food. From start to finish this was an incredible tour and the best 4 hours spend in Bangkok. The tour through the local market was incredibly interesting and informative.
