In 4 hours we made and ate 5 traditional thai meals (Pad thai, Tom Yum soup, Green Curry, Red Curry and sticky mango rice) - every course was some of the best thai food I have ever eaten... and you leave with the recipe book in hand. A must do tour - even for the culinary challenged.

Fantastic experience!. The class was excellent. Our teacher was very funny and informative. You start off by going to the market. All the items are prepackaged for the group to expedite the process but they still educate you on the food available and how to pick good ones. You cook quite a few courses when you get back and each one is delicious. It takes a few hours but you can tell they are very well organized. While you are eating, they are prepping the next course so the class continually moves. Great course, would definitely recommend.

Group Fun & Entertainment :). ~This was almost a year ago our team went to Bangkok together but it's too much group fun not to report :)~Karine had researched online that this place had a great program to learn about Thai food as well as do something together (HIGHLY Recommended)~Getting to Silom Road Soi 11 at noon was easy if you first downloaded the map and directions in Thai for the Taxi/Tuk Tuk driver (see photos)~Our group had no problem going to the meeting point separately and once our guide "Gee" gathered us they gave us a basket each to go shopping at a nearby market (lots of photos)~At the market we were introduced to some Thai spices & vegetables and how to distinguish them :)~Then a 10 mins walks back to the cooking school where we donned aprons and sat round for our first brief by "Gee" which was to wash the food!~First she told us about how the mango sticky rice dessert would be cooked later and how long it would take to steep the rice in steam, so the rice had to be done by the time we got there~Next we all had tasks to cut/chop/pound for all our 3 dishes before we learned how to cook them (there are a few surprises and a few methods that are simple & new)~Tom Yum Gung started our soup, Green Curry Chicken with rice, Pad Thai & Mango Sticky Rice a great meal for a hungry afternoon out cooking... Good Dun!~Everything we cooked tasted delicious and absolutely Thai YUMz~At the end of our session we were given the recipe book & a coconut shell wok stir fry souvenir that really works :)~"Gee" is an amazing communicator in English and distinctly her jokes were spiced just right at every point when there was something local to tell us (Very Funny)100% a Great Outing when you've a group to go & 1000% RECOMMENDED for Family & Friends!

Fantastic!. This is a must-do for the food lovers. The hosts are amazing and know their stuff. I learned quite a bit about the crucial ingredients and cooking methods. The class was four hours long but time just flew by. What made it better was the others who were in the class with me. Never have I met so many interesting people at the same time!

Great class, great price. The instructor was very outgoing and friendly, he knew the names of most of the ingredients from the countries in the region (e.g. in Japanese, Korean, Indonesian) or good substitutes. The class is run very efficiently, the food is delicious and fun to cook, you'll be full at the end, no need to eat before, and you get a little recipe book to take home. The visit to the market is short, but it's nice to see. A good way to spend half the day in Bangkok.
First time cooking class. This is highly recommended for those who want to have fun while want to learn how to cook Thai dishes. Very enjoyable experience.

Great Experience. It is my first time to attend cooking class overseas. A good activities if you already visit Bangkok many time. It is starting with the market tour and explain diff kind of herb which we will used later on. The place of the cooking class is awesome and teacher is funny.We get to eat what we cook, a great experience there!
Excellent . Great atmosphere, with a great host! Local fresh ingredients used. I would recommend this to any wanting to learn, and take some practical knowledge away.

Very Nice!. I never really write a review right away after I got back from a place/activities but this one was too memorable (in a very good way!)The direction that they gave us in the confirmation e-mail was very clear, had no trouble finding the meeting point. They were on-time to, which is always nice.I got Goong as our instructor, very nice, funny and friendly (couldn't ask for a better instructor!). She told us how to pick good shrimp when shopping and was very informative about Thai's herbs... I love the atmosphere of the market. Experiencing locals, I guess?My group consisted of of 7 people: myself, one family of 4, and one couple -- it was very diverse (and there are kids!) but nonetheless still fun. We get to eat what we cook ofc. I learned a lot about Thai food and ingredients in general.Oh and in the end they'll give you recipe books, too. Very nice and worth my 1000 Baht (It's really cheap compared to other cooking classes). I would totally recommend this to anyone seeking alternatives when travelling in Bangkok :)

Great Experience. Each class holds 9 students. We purchased all 9 and had a private class for 2 enabling us to pick our own menu. The instructor met us at the Sky Train station. We went to a nearby market to purchase fresh ingredients. This class took about 4 hours. We had a great time.

Wasted Time. In an effort to get out of the hotel and do something different, I thought I'd do something completely different, i.e. take a cooking class. Based in no small part on the reviews that Silom Thai Cooking School has gotten here, that is the school I picked. Big mistake. One thing I do--perhaps too much--is check email when I travel. I hate returning to 700 emails and I hate missing important info, so I check it early and often. The day I was to take the class at Silom Thai was no different. The directions that the owner had given me was that I should arrive at 9:30 sharp, so I arrived 15 minutes early. My first impression was that the school was dirty and disorganized. There were a couple of people on the first floor who may or may not have been attached to the school. They were not overly helpful, but did direct me upstairs to where the classes were to be held. When I got upstairs I was met by two women who did work for the school and when I asked about the class, I was informed that the students were already at the market. Now, this was surprising, as the trip to the market to buy ingredients was supposed to be part of the course. I asked why they left early and why I wasn't notified, to which one of the women replied, "Oh, no one told you?" I told her no, they hadn't and she replied "Oh. Well they are at the market. You can go find them." No apology, no "oops" nothing other than a suggestion that I go to the market several blocks away and look for a random group of strangers on the off chance that I would be able to figure out which ones were in the class. I thanked them for their time and turned to leave at which the same woman reminded me to go the market, find the people I had never seen and then come back for her class. I smiled brightly and said "Nope." I will say that in a way, I am relieved that it happened this way, because I had seen another cooking school on my way to Silom Thai CS, by the name of Sompong Thai Cooking School and what had been the subject of idle curiosity along the lines of "Why are there so many cooking schools in this location?" suddenly became my Plan B. My advice? Skip Silom Thai Cooking School and give serious consideration to Sompong Thai Cooking School.

Fun and very friendly cooking school. We were able to get into our night class the day before. Even though we arrived late due to crazy Bangkok traffic, we were welcomed and joined the class right in. Our instructor "shrimp" she called herself was very nice and patient with our kids who were our helpers, shared our food and got their own free mango sticky rice! The food was delicious, recipe book coming home with us - would do it again!!!

Great activity if you have half a day. I have been to Bangkok several times and wanted something different to do. This was a great activity- if you have a few days in the city and have seen the temples I would strongly recommend this activity. We met along the street and walked across to the market where we learned about the different ingredients in the Thai kitchen- galangal a type of ginger, kefir lime and all the types of curry. Then back to the school to begin cooking. We were two groups of 8- each group in separate locations. The prep room and the eating room were both nicely air conditioned. We cooked outside the room. Staff kept everything running smoothly- cleaning the wok after each dish we prepared. Oat our instructor spoke excellent English and made the morning very enjoyable. I learned that not all tofu is soy based. As we prepared the food we sat on mats on the floor- this may be hard for some people but I am sure arrangements could be made if it is too hard for you to get up and down. We prepared about 8 dishes- learning about curries and coconut milk. Compared to other cooking schools I have gone to, this was very hands on. The cookbook given at the end is a nice souvenir. Excellent value for the money!! Everyone should do this!

Really great experience . Decided to do the class of the afternoon at the last minute, didn't regret it! All the staff was very friendly, the tour at the local market and the cooking class were very instructive. My cooking instructor was super nice. You get tea drinks, biscuits, and a good recipe book at the end. Really worth it!

Fun, laughter, and GREAT Food!. I am so glad we did this class! We were not sure if it was something we wanted to do but this was one of the highlights of my trip! The beginning is a bit confusing as they had 5 classes meet up at the same time, but they get you organized and going pretty quickly. The market tour was short and sweet so you could get trait to the cooking. We were with Pim and she was so fun and knowledgable! She joked with us and put up with our silly comments. :) the menu was amazing and food was great. I loved to eat it and understand what I was making and eating. If you go to bangkok, take an afternoon and do this course. Very worth it!

Fun Afternoon. We have been to many cooking classes around the world and this was fun. Started with a market trip which was disappointing as the market is mainly closed by afternoon but did run through lots of ingredients. At school it was nice and clean and well laid out. Only problem is if you have any mobility issues as lots of stairs and most of prep done sitting on floor (table area for eating). Recipes were good and fairly easy to recreate at home/

Great experience to end a 2 week southeast asia trip!. Last minute decision and Silom was able to accommodate my wife and I. I looked at a few places and felt Silom had the best overall value from reviews and price standpoint. Pim was our chef. She was great, funny, and very knowledgeable. It was hands on experience which helped with learning. The school is a nice, cozy building. The afternoon class went by smoothly. The food we made was delicious! We got a nice cook book with recipes which was a nice take-away. Thank you Pim!

Fantastic Experience!. A fantastic half day experience learning about Thai food. This company is VERY well organized which made for an excellent experience. Each course was hands on followed by tastings. All recipes where delivered in the end in a printed copy for easy reference at home. Thank you for a great day!

A Highly Entertaining, Educational & Delicious Experience!. An absolute must for foodies looking for an authentic Thai experience in Bangkok. The journey begins with a shopping adventure through the back alley markets of Bangkok, ending up at the charming cooking school location. The experience is extremely well-organized from start to finish, cooking our way through 5 incredible courses. Our instructor Jay (who should have his own cooking show) was the cherry on top with his hilarious and charming personality. Left feeling truly inspired and immediately went shopping for Thai cooking supplies to bring home. Highly Recommended for travellers of all cooking levels!

Great time learning to cook. We had a lot of fun during our afternoon cooking class. First, we went to the market to buy what we needed, then we cooked for the whole afternoon. Do not eat before going there because you eat everything you cook (which is a lot). Our chef was very cool, very funny. I highly recommand this place!

Great Experience!!. I have purchased numerous cooking lessons for my husband in the U.S. and in different countries. This was really one of the most enjoyable.Pim was a fantastic instructor, making the class informative yet still very casual and fun. The food was delicious as well.I would highly recommend this schoolIt was, thus far, one of the most enjoyable things we have done in Bangkok

Fun filling deliciousness. . Really enjoyed this course. Have done a few cooking courses around the world and this one ranks par with the other good ones. Thanks to chef Yai. Explained everything and made the experience really enjoyable. Left very full and satisfied. In fact didn't need supper as still full. I see there are some bad reviews but these must be outliers as they run a very tight ship. So if you don't want to be disappointed then don't be late. I see this class is located in the same ally way as sompong cooking school which has a more impressive TA review however they are slightly smaller and newer I think. (Welcome to correct me if I'm wrong). For this reason I can imagine they are probably more personal. Silom does classes of 6-8 I think. We were a class of six. All with our own wok and ingredients. Back to sompong, they took very long to respond to my emails and didn't answer the phone and when they did someone answered that wasn't able to assist us as the person that was able to was cooking (I'm just saying things might have got confusing with us speaking English in their defense) that said I'm not comparing the two schools I'm just stating what happened to us. Both get good ratings. And because Silom had much better correspondence and communication we went with them and thoroughly enjoyed it. I should note, sompong did get back to me but that was after phoning and booking with Silom. The receptionist at our hostel recommended.

Couldn't recommend more!. We visited at the start of December as a last minute decision to do a bit of Thai cooking whilst we were in Bangkok. Best decision we made all holiday!My first thought was that it was a bit pricey (I think we paid 900 Baht each for the 3 hour class?) But it was so worth it! We did the evening class and so the food we made was our dinner. We started with Tom Yum soup, then Pad Thai, then Green Curry and sweet rice with mango for desert. So we were well fed! Water was also provided free to go with our meal.Jay was our chef and so entertaining! We had such a laugh and he taught us so much about Thai cooking! Id go again tomorrow!If you're thinking about going - don't hesitate! Best money you'll spend in Bangkok!

Perfect way to get started in culinary world of Thailand. We were very satisfied with the whole experience. You start by learning about the ingredients that are used in Thai cuisine and then you will make five different dishes which you can obviously enjoy later. The class can be done even if you have never cooked before. It really is that easy. One recommendation: go there with an empty stomach, because you really will be bloated afterwards.

Fun Experience!. Each group had only 9 people, which was perfect. We cooked soup, an appetizer, main dish, desert. The instructor was fun, and two other employees were very helpful. I had a great time!

Awesome Thai with Awesome Jay!. Totally amazing! I cannot recommend this school highly enough. The course was terrific, our teacher/chef Awesome Jay was, well, awesome!, the location and facilities were excellent, and we learnt to cook up a Thai storm! And, you get a recipe booklet so no need for notes or trying to remember what goes in what dish. From the market visit to select veggies and herbs, through to cooking and eating the dishes, this is a 'must do' when you're in Bangkok. We will definitely be returning next year to do the advanced course.

Tuesday Afternoon Class - December 2015. The overall experience from start to finish was really hands-on and lots of fun. We started at the local market where we learned about thai ingredients. We were each handed a basket filled with produce and hopped on tuk tuks to the cooking school. The school is in a house where the prep, cook and eat areas are separated indoors and outdoors. Each of us had our own prep and cook stations where we made, pad thai, tom yum goong, red thai curry paste, red curry, fish cakes and mango sticky rice. The entire 4 hours was never dull and everything was very efficient and ran smoothly. You could tell that they have a lot of experience, as everything was so well organized and they were even able to accommodate vegetarians. After we cooked each dish, we were able to eat it before we started the next dish. This is great way to spend an afternoon in BKK. I would highly recommend and go back. The only improvement would be to give better instructions on how to leave the cooking school and back to the BTS, as the map they gave us was slightly confusing.

Excellent cooking class which is entertaining and easy to understand for beginners. Exceptional showmanship by Chef Jay.He was entertaining, cracks up lots of jokes throughout the demonstrations and cooking, and instructions were clear and easy to understand. Great cooking class for beginner Thai cooking class.Very reasonable pricing as well! If you are an expert cook and have high expectations, i think this class may not be suitable for you. =D This class is a "chill chill, relax, have fun, enjoy" kinda class. =)

Highly recommeneded even if you don't usually enjoy cooking!. Oliver from the cooking school was great. He took us on a market tour and showed and explained all the main ingredients for thai cooking very clearly and patiently. It was great that they allowed my children to sit quietly in a corner while the adults cooked.The food was delicious and the instruction was clear. Oliver was patient in answering all the questions and knowledgeable. He even accomodated to a person who was allergic to curry and let him cook another non curry dish instead. The cooking course is highly recommended.

Perfect cooking course for holiday. Do not spend the extra money on other courses (eg blue elephant)! This place was perfect for our one day Thai cooking course.This course was particularly great because1. The staff prepped most of the vegetables and boring bits so you don't have to waste your time doing it. They also measured out the spices/etc, so that when cooking you just chucked them in-- just like on the cooking shows on tv!2. Oliver (chef/teacher) is absolutely hilarious and fun to spend time with.3. They accommodate food allergies/preferences-- so I got chicken substituted for shrimp, and my wife had no nuts in her dishes.4. You do fun things like learn how to make thai spring rolls and sweet chilli sauce from scratch.5. All the recipes work-- our food was all delicious, and super-easy to make. I have no fears about making pad thai, massaman curry, green papaya salad and even sweet chilli sauce at home now.I think Blue Elephant is double the price-- seriously, do not bother, come here instead. Literally the only thing I can complain about is that my dodgy knee hurt when we were sitting on the floor cooking, but everyone else didn't seem to mind.

Amazing cooking class in Bangkok!. We had the fantastic chef Pim as our teacher. The day was really fun and all five dishes were awesome. The cookery school facilities are excellent and the whole house is decorated beautifully. You also receive a recipe booklet at the end with everything you cooked as well as extra recipes to try at home. If you're looking for a professionally run and reasonably priced cookery class in Bangkok, try Silom Thai Cooking School.

Fantastic !. We had wonderful time during our cooking class especially beautiful chef Goong made it very entertaining for us ! The dishes we made were super tasty and I'm looking forward to cook them at home . We met some people who have been to her classes already 3 times ! At the end of class all of us got cookery book with all the recipes ! Super fun .

Incredible. If you are in bangkok I wouldn't miss this. Incredible food - the best we'd eaten in Thailand. Great organisation, the facilities were amazing and the teacher was great, we had such a laugh. Well worth it and we left with a recipe book. Book a couple of days in advance to avoid missing out.

Silom Thai Cooking School - MUST DO!. I booked this a few months in advance but upon arrival, i changed my plans from the morning to the evening session and this was easily done by the staff at the cooking school.This was a highly enjoyable class and it was the quickest 3 hours of my life. As we did the evening class, our teacher, Yai bought the market to us and went through all the core ingredients within Thai cooking - with the heat of that particular day, I cannot say I was not relieved to not be traipsing the market!The class itself was informative and hands on and we worked with others to complete dishes and we got to taste each dish as we cooked. Might be because we hadn't eaten as we were saving ourselves for the class but I can seriously say it was the best food I had tasted all trip and we had cooked it ourselves! We made tom yum goong soup, thai fish cakes, red chicken curry chicken,pad thai and finished off with mango with sticky rice. We were truly stuffed by the end of the class and was presented with a detailed booklet of all the recipes we made in class and more.I would highly recommend Silom Cooking School and if I had time, I would've definitely enrolled in more classes!

Best attraction on our holiday! . So much fun, so well organised! The house where we cooked was really special and the dishes we made so yummy! And our teacher was called Mona and she was excellent and fun! Perfect English, too. Highly recommended!

A professional cooking school. No wonder so high rating. It's very thumbs up service !!The staff is so efficient that their will guide you to the nearest BTS and meet in a specific location.The chef will be there to bring us to the morning market (except evening session)After all the morning market shopping, we went back to the cooking school and start preparing the ingredients. Hygiene is very important as our teacher keep asking us washing hand.The place is in air con setting. Water and Coke is provided to cool down ourself. Our teacher, Mr Jay is very patient and charismatic in conducting the session, you won't be bored and the time pass very fast.We will come back for course no.2.It's worth every single cent and time there.

It's all already said!. It's a great day, well organised, funny, friendly, beautifully presented and tasting. Worth it each bath You pay. Extremely profissional. It is not a up close and personal experience, but it is simply really well Done. Don't miss it.
Fantastic. Very well organised and fantastic tasting food. You even get a recipe cookbook took take home. Very enjoyable and informative.

Very well organized.. Me and my wife like to cook and like to cook asian food so we took this class. The way it was conducted since the market visit to the sequence of the whole steps was inspiring and we just hope to find the necessary herbs abd vegetables to cook it at home. Thanks Wot!

Excellent intro to Thai cooking. Loved the course, wasn't sure about this at first when my partner suggested it but really glad we went in the end. Great food and great fun cooking. What really made it was our host, Jay. His energy is infectious and really made the course enjoyable

Entertainment with cooking. I don't especially like cooking..which is irrelevant as the cooking school made the whole experience fun. Off to the markets to get the ingredients..who knew there were so many types of basil..let alone chillies?Only 9 people per class so it is very friendly and everyone is soon chatting away.The set up is well done. There's a preparation room where you sit in a circle and prepare the ingredients for a few different dishes (including red curry and pad thai). Then out to the balcony to cook it all up (each person has their own station) and then to a separate room to eat..and, damn, it looks and tastes like the real thing!!!!It is a very well run, entertaining and tasty way to spend a few hours. Highly recommended!!!

Now cooking Thai back home!. I am a big food enthusiast. And when it comes to Thai food, I go crazy. Thai cuisine is my absolute favourite, after having visited 60 countries. So, I attended this cooking class and I was truly satisfied. The chef was not only knowledgable but also very funny and entertaining. We prepared different dishes and he gave lots of tips and tricks. He also gives a recipe book, which is quite useful when you're back home. Guess what? I did a crazy shopping on my last day in Bangkok, had to buy an extra luggage for all the Thai ingredients I bought, and now cooking Thai food for friends, family and of course for myself back home. Strongly recommended!

Authentic Thai Cooking Class. We had a class with 8 other people all from different countries (Denmark, New Zealand, Holland, Canada) and us from the U.S. so it was a very basic introduction to Thai cuisine. We had Nam as our teacher with the two from Holland and she was awesome, we felt like Nam truly had a passion for cooking. Since we took the evening class we weren't able to actually go to the market to shop for our ingredients, but they had everything prepared for us and showed us all the different spices, herbs, vegetables, etc. The best part for me was learning about tamarind as I have never known what to do to prepare it for cooking, so those special techniques about what to actually do with some of the ingredients was worth the class itself. We cooked pad thai and massaman curry, but Nam did the work and demonstration for the papaya salad, fried spring rolls, and coconut rice. I would've loved to have been able to actually try the bok bok for the papaya salad, but I understand it would probably take a lot more time to have each person actually cook each entree. I did like the pad thai as it felt authentic to me, we didn't add any of the red coloring or ketchup like they do in America and I really liked it, all the other dishes were average. I should mention I am half Thai and I have grown up with Thai food so I feel like I can tell the difference from authentic and Americanized. All in all I think it was worth the class if you're interested in learning some techniques you can try so you can make Thai food at home.

A fun and worthwhile experience. Bangkok is such a cheap city so paying 1000 baht (£20) for a half day course may seem a lot but this was a lot of fun and the food we cooked tasted great. On the downside, the market trip felt rushed and our course lasted from 1.40pm to 4.25pm (not 5.30pm as advertised on the website).

Great class with loads of useful info on traditional Thai cooking and great food. In a group of 10, we set of for a market tour where the teacher explained the differences between classic Thai ingredients and in which dish they are used. Going to the school with tuktuks with our cute shopping baskets that had cold water waiting for us in it was a nice touch. Do come hungry though. The loads of delicious food I consumed kept me going for hours afterwards and the worst part of it is now not all the food tastes that good longer :)) Full course menu from soup - main - salad - sweet and even a crash course on how to prepare massaman curry paste traditionally. Great teacher, great food and the school design was great with its many vintage decorations. Definitely recommended

Awesome cooking class. Very well organised, excellent cost benefit, and delicious food! I really enjoyed the experience and we could eat all the meals we prepared (so much by the way). After the class we get a recipe book with all the information about what we learned and all thai ingredients to cook at home. I do really recommend it!

Great teacher and the best thai food in my trip. We took the morning class.10 people in one class.We went to the wet market first. The teacher explained different kind of ingredients to you and taught you how to choose the food with good quality.Then we were arranged to go to the new school by tuk tuk. The new school was well renovated with a warm and classic atmosphere. Do not forget to bring your camera.We chopped, cooked and ate with so much fun.Nice experience.Do not forget to buy the frying blade made by coconut.Enjoy

A tough one to top. I attended the afternoon class on the 29th. It was both great fun and very fruitful. The market visit was fascinating - who knew there were 3 different types of basil, 4 different types of ginger.... Following the market visit, armed with a basket of produce a-piece, we hit the classroom where we prepared our ingredients for the first recipe. Our chef clearly described what we should be doing, answered any questions we had and had a great sense of humour - not to mention stressing a solid stone pestle and mortor to its limits :-) following the prep (where I got a little helping hand from others :-) ) we went outside the classroom to cook our meal. This part was surprisingly easy; and the results were amazing! The same steps were followed for each of the 3 mains we did, although the desert seemed to materialize out of nowhere.All in it was a great course, and I really enjoyed the company of the other attendants. I wish others have the same great experience.Neil

Best Thai food we ate so far!. We had a great time and cooked excellent food with best ingredients. We met new friends there and had the best time. Our cooking chef was funny as hell, laughed all day. Absolutely recommendable!

Awesome cooking class. Well-organized, traditional Thai cooking class. The school provided helpful directions on getting to their location and a map for the taxi driver. We enjoyed the market tour and learning about local ingredients. Each dish we prepared was even better than the one before! The class was hands-on, but still easy to follow for beginners. A highlight of our time in Bangkok.

Well organised worthwhile cooking class. I first tried to enrol in a much more expensive class, which was closer to the hotel, but glad I found this one. When I said I was nervous about finding the meeting point at the skytrain station they sent 2 pages of clear faxed instructions, and a map, and I successfully met with the Silom contact at the right time. The class was friendly, humorous, and best of all the recipes made sense after the visit to the market to buy the ingredients, and the clear instructions. After the class we were given a little book with the recipes in English and pictures of the ingredients - all together a well organised friendly morning, as well as delicious food to eat in an air conditioned environment.

A great experience. I would highly recommend this cooking course. The staff are brilliant, informative and so funny (with perfected English). The cooking course was very well organized and fun throughout. Whether solo or a group you are encouraged to make friends and join in making it an even more enjoyable experience. Tang was our teacher and I would highly recommend trying to be in her class if possible as she definitely made the day! Old and modern techniques are taught throughout the class including any ingredients alternatives you may need. Food is cooked and eaten straight away when hot and fresh. At the end you are given a recipe book with everything taught plus much more. Definitely a great experience if ever in Bangkok and highly recommend the market tour if you have the time.

loved it! . found this school on TripAdvisor. so glad for awesome reviews. booked a class and was confirmed even when I was in hk, then came, chef jay was so awesome, had a lot of fun!! the place was clean, staff was awesome, the food was so good!!!

So happy we did this!. A friend recommended this a s a must do in Bangkok and I'm happy we took his advice. We went with our teenage daughter and had a great morning.You'll stop in the market to shop for you supplies then off to the school for a hands on experience.. The food was delicious. The teacher was fun and informative and we came away with recipes. I would go back next time for a different menu just to try different things.

So much fun. this was the best way to spend my first day in Bangkok. I missed the market tour because my cab driver could not fine the meeting spot but once I was able to get out and follow the email directions to the school it was quite simple.I was greet by a wonderful lady, sorry I don't remember her name, and given a bottle of water and alocker to put my belonging.we were taken to another room where Chef Oak proceed to instruct us on what to do. He was wonderful, super funny and patience. I loved every minute of my time at the Silom Thai Cooking School and would recommend it to anyone who is looking for something fun to do while in Bangkok.

Toong was phenomenal . This cooking class was a must for us. We both enjoy cooking and wanted to improve our skills with Thai preparations. Toong educated us about the "thai" cooking formula and what considerations go into making a dish. Also, we were taken to a market and given a crash course on ingredients and how to use them.The class was held in air conditioned "winter rooms" so eating and learning time was comfortable. Her grasp of English was strong and we understood the lessons in their entirety. The cooking was done outside in an authentic manner and we were obligated to cut and prepare the majority of our ingredients. Also, we were given tips on alternative ingredients for cooking at home if authentic ones weren't available. Terrific experience. Would do again if a different menu was offered (the menu offered was perfect; we would want to further expand our skills) A must try for a visit to Bangkok.

Thai cooking class. Had a great half day with Chef Jay, first visiting the market, then learning several Thai recipes including pad Thai, spring rolls with mango salad, chicken curry and sticky rice with mango. He was delightful, while offering the class of 12 plenty of hands-on opportunities. I highly recommend this Thai experience.

Complete cooking class with reasonable price. Silom Thai cooking school offers a complete course for 3-4 hours, including market tour to introduce the ingredients that will be used in the class. They held the course 3 times everyday with different kind of menu so I can choose the most convenience time for me and what kind of menu that I want to learn. Ms. Tango was my instructor that time, she is very nice and friendly.

Excellent afternoon spent learning about Thai cookery. The half day course (1000 Baht) starts in the food market to show you the vegetables and herbs you would be using before taking a tuk-tuk ride to the school itself. The school is in a bit of a run-down area, but once inside it's fully functional and air conditioned.We started with vegetable and herb recognition and a very clear explanation of how each one fitted into Thai cookery before moving on to preparing the first of our dishes for the day, the soup. The programme was simple – prepare a dish downstairs, cook it upstairs and then return downstairs to eat it. In this way we worked through a full Thai meal, course by course, with understanding and ownership.You needed little skill or experience to get a lot from the afternoon. The teacher was great and all were involved. Well worth it!

Wonderful class!. We really enjoyed our cooking class! Our instructor was not only knowledgable, but very charismatic, which made the class very enjoyable. The place can be a bit hard to find, but other than that I would definitely recommend this class!

Great morning learning and eating. . Starts off with a visit to the market where many of the ingredients are explained you each pick up a basket and the teacher slowly fills them all up. Then it is back to the school to cook up to give dishes. You prepare the food cross legged on the floor and in my case because of my knees and age they gave me a stool. The preparation and cooking is easy but an eye opener as to how easy it is to do Thai cooking. I'd recommend this course to anyone interested in cooking Thai food.

Well worth doing. Recently visited Bangkok and had wet weather so looked for something to do indoors. Silom Thai is just a short walk from the Shangri La so we went to investigate and ended up booking an afternoon class the next day. It was EXCELLENT! Very well organized in very good facilities. Just enough hands on to make you feel like you were cooking but enough pre preparation that even if you can't cook you'll end up with great tasting food. Over the four hours we picked up fresh herbs and veges from a local stall and then cooked four delicious dishes. The young instructor - can't remember her name - was very pleasant and engaging. Thoroughly recommended.

Hands-On fun for the whole Family. We had the most enjoyable time here and booking the cooking class was so simple. Just fill in the online form and they will get back to you on email really quickly to arrange a session that you can attend. There were 3 class times daily to choose from and the most popular is the morning class. Both morning and afternoon class involves a market tour. The afternoon class gets to see the vegetable section of the market only as the rest of the market has closed. If you want a full experience of the fresh “wet” market my advice is to book early so that you can get in the morning session. The evening class has no market visit but you still get an explanation of the different ingredients. As for us, we have seen the wet markets before so not so important, we still got the lesson in the different vegetables and herbs that are essential in Thai cooking in the afternoon session. The school is very well run and organized and they even had a bottle of water and basket for us to take on our supervised shopping expedition. We went as a family and had my seven year old son with us. They were so accommodating with our request of non-spicy food and he was able to eat all the food that he made (they just didn’t put chilli in his dishes). He was even able to prepare ingredients and cook like the rest of us, albeit standing on a stool to reach the wok and burner. I think what makes the school is that everyone is involved hands-on in the preparation of ingredients, cooking of the dishes and best of all you get to sit down and enjoy the fruits of your labour. We had a wonderful instructor called “Goong” that was her nickname it is shrimp in Thai. She made the day and the cooking class! She was very funny, engaging, entertaining, knowledgeable and made the whole class fill at ease and experts in Thai cooking (well at least we all thought so). Even the organizer Ms. Mai (I think that was her name) was also very engaging and funny.We would recommend this school if you are would like to do a cooking class in Bangkok. There is a reason why they are getting really great reviews…..they are really really good!

If you like Thai food, this is worth your while.. Location is a bit sketchy, but place is great. Since we did the evening class we did not do the shopping with them. Upstairs they have a great set up. With a small dining area and a separate prep area as well as individual cooking stations. Our teacher was great, explaining every step to us as well as the different ingredients Thai people like to cook with. At the end of the class we had our best meal along with a great cookbook with many recipes that we will attempt at home.

Time Well Spent, A Must To Do In Bangkok !. With numerous cooking schools to choose from while I was browsing the net, I keep coming back to Silom Thai Cooking School. Then, the excellent reviews from others helped much to finally convinced myself. Mai had been very accommodating and prompt answering my queries. I did 3-day cooking class where I initially inquired for intensive course. Mai advised me to try first the 3- day class. And she was spot on! Even 1 day of cooking class provided 5 course meal which you can prepare to your friends and family once you head back home. Market tour was short and sweet and will give you sufficient knowledge of the authentic Thai spices and vegetables. My 3- day class allowed me to experience 3 instructors (chefs), Juju, Oliver and Tango. All speak fluent and clear English . They were all engaging. They were all have their own charm and sense of humor of making the class interesting. Great job guys! Keep it up! . And of course, this cannot be missed...the pretty interior of the classrooms and dining rooms! Nice ambiance...rustic and homey! This class is worth the $$$. Expect to be hands on as they really let you do the cutting/cooking. Indeed, time well spent, a must to do while you are in Bangkok. Great avenue to meet new friends too!

A highlight of our time in Bangkok. This class was so much fun. We had an excellent instructor who was funny, engaging and knowledgable. We did the afternoon course which stretches from 12:30 to 4:30. There are also morning and evening classes available. The course goes through 5 courses with a cadence of prep (chop etc..) cook (do stuff in a wok) and eat for each of the courses. We were amazed at how easy it was to cook dishes that properly represent the complex flavor of thai cuisine. All the 'unfun' parts like cleanup are handled by an assistant. This course has inspired us to buy a nice wok and bring some Thai cooking into our home. They provide you with a small recipe book that outlines the dishes learned as reference. Note: all prep/cook work is done in pairs. If you are solo or an odd number group you will probably be paired with someone random. Not the end of the world but something to keep in mind.

Thai Cooking Class. During the 4-hr lesson, you can experience a shopping trip to wet market and then followed by hand-on experience in cooking 5 different dishes mainly main courses, dessert and chilli paste.You will eat all the dishes you cooked and received a colourful recipe book at the end of the lesson. The class size is about 10 and you have the chance to meet tourists from different countries and it is a really an enjoyable experience in Bangkok !

Favourite Cooking Class in Bangkok. Love the instruction and food tastes delicious. I definitely recommend this Thai cooking school for anyone who wants to unlock the mysteries of Thai cooking. You won't believe how easy it is once you have done it.
Organized very Smart. It was valuable program to understand thai food culture. They have a lots of experiences of this class.

Insightful and Delicious Class. Our cooking class included a market tour in which Ju explained to our all the ingredients we were to use for that day's class. When we got back to the school, Ju was very knowledgeable in explaining each and every ingredient. The whole class was very well prepared and neatly displayed. I was very impressed with the way all the dishes and ingredients were laid out for us after every dish we cooked, especially since we had 4 separate meals. It was very easy and simple to follow the instructions, which is great for any beginner. The food was also easy to prepare and delicious to eat. I would highly recommend this class to anyone interested in learning about Thai Cooking. Ju also left us with a cook book which I will definitely use!

Highly recommended, must do in BKK. First of all, price is reasonable. Secondly, arrangement is smooth. We made reservation online and were told to meet a BTS station. Then we had a quick local market tour, and moved to a nice little house, just like a local home. We made 5 dishes (well maybe 4 and a half, but it's good enough) and we finished our own dishes (not sharing with someone or tasting the instructor's dishes, i.e. it's a 5-course lunch). Instructor is funny, speaks good English, gives clear instructions and offers to take enough photos for us. At the end we paid by cash and got a little cook book with the recipes. Conclusion: very enjoyable authentic Thai cooking class at reasonable price, highly recommended.

Amazing cooking class! Loved it!. This was by far the best cooking class I've ever done. We made 5 delicious dishes. We did a quick market tour, the. We went to a beautiful room where we prepped our ingredients. In the center there was a stunning display of the fresh ingredients we were using, and we were talked through each step by our lovely tour guide tango. We each had our own station to cook each dish, and then went to the classroom to eat it.All the staff were absolutely lovely, very knowledgable and informative. They were very happy to take photos and change ingredients of your weren't keen on particular spices or ingredients. Amazing afternoon!

Best cocking course in Bangkok. We took this daily course after we've reserved lots of recommendations from friends. During this cooking class, we've made the best and famous dishes from the Thai cuisine. It was funny, educational and practical day. Jay, the chef was amazingly adorable. Happy I did it!And I'm using the recipes's book till this day.

Must do when in Bangkok. Now that I have been to both Silom Thai Cooking School vs Chef Leez (apparently #1) I have to say that Silom Thai is so much better...don't be fooled by Chef Leez rating as the owner kept bugging students to write a review after the class...in my honest opinion, Silom is definitely the clear winner here.We were a group of 6 people hence they organized for us a private cooking class..They have 3 separate area (preparation room, cooking area , dining area) which makes everything more organized...our teacher Tango was so entertaining and she totally made the cooking class more fun to learn...she was also super patient and accommodating to our request..highly recommended!!

A must do in Bangkok . What a fantastic experience! The meet up was on time and well planned. You get all the info you need beforehand. The chef was fantastic and entertaining. Lovely clean house, fresh ingredients and delicious food. Well worth the asking price!

Highly recommend this enjoyable day. What a wonderful experience this was. I've never done a cooking school so I didn't know what to expect but I was not disappointed. The friendly staff were so happy to guide you through your meals, as well as explain in depth about the dishes. The trip to the market was great and the tuk-tuk ride was an absolute joy and a surprise. Our meals were superb, the flavours were all made from scratch and I was inspired to take it further back home. I loved this experience and I would happily recommend to do a class, if you're looking for something a little more relaxing than your typical Bangkok day. I'd definitely do this again.

Amazing Cooking Class!. My partner and I did the 4 hour cooking class and it was fantastic! Our chef was a lovely Thai man who was extremely funny and entertaining. He was very knowledgeable and explained how each of the ingredients went together, what to use as replacements if you can't find them in your own country, and explained how it all went together. It was very well priced, I would have paid more for what we did; it was amazing. They provided everything and guided us through the entire cooking experience with each recipe and it was super simple! I feel like I can cook those things again without trouble. At the end, they gave us a recipe book that had everything in it. It included the names and pictures of all the ingredients, including the obscure Thai ingredients that I would have forgotten. Definitely do NOT eat before you do the course, because you get to eat everything that you cook and by the end you're very full! Highly recommended!

Loved It!. The teacher/chef is a very knowledgable, patient, and funny man. We had a great time in this 4 hour class and learned a lot about Thai cooking. I would highly recommend it and would take another class at this school upon our next visit. The school was not difficult to find.

Highly recommended, great introduction on how to cook Thai food!. We booked this last minute for our last full day in Bangkok and I am so happy we did as the experience was fantastic! We went for the afternoon course which involved going to the market, which was closed however our lovely instructor Yai(?) went through some of the ingredients that we would need in preparation for our cooking session. She went through all the produce in great detail and with enthusiasm. My Fiancé and I are quite keen foodies so found learning about the different types of ingredients and their uses really helpful. Our small group then getting into a couple of tuk-tuk's to where the cooking school was based. The building for the cooking school is very much like a house so felt very personal and inviting. The decor was really cool with kitschy, vintage like trinkets dotted around. We made in total 5 dishes including classics such a tom yam goon, pad Thai and Thai green curry, we also learnt how to make coconut milk and cream the traditional Thai way which was a nice touch as well as learning how to prepare sticky rice. The step to step guide as to how to prepare and cook each dish was informative and our instructor Yai was really enthusiastic, funny and made the whole experience good fun. We looked at doing the cooking course at the Oriental Hotel which was double the price, but I am glad we chose the Silom cooking school and would recommend this course to anyone who wants to learn about Thai food in a fun, relaxed, homely atmosphere.

Food Thai Style. Yes it's a cooking school and we know that Bangkok has many. This would have to be one the better and one of the cheapest. The option for the course are good, morning, afternoon and even an early evening course. We opted for the morning course, easy to get to the meeting point, we chose the morning one to experience the market in full swing with Rhais buying their daily food. After a short trip around the market we were treated to a short Tuk Tuk ride to a very nice house, for our 3 hours of fun. Out teaching had good command of English, and was funny as well, the course was very interactive, and good for children as well. The food was fresh, and we had the task of cooking, pounding, chopping etc to make four dishes, which you get to eat. When I next have visitors it will be on the top of my list to do with them.

Silom Thai Cooking Class. One of the best thing that I did in Bangkok is to enroll in a Thai Cooking class. Silom was one of the schools I enrolled and they did not disappoint me. I have learned so much about Thai cooking. Our teacher Tango is very informative. the market visit was also fun. i will definitely go back for more cooking lessons.

Very recommendable! Great activity for an afternoon.. My daughter and I planned this last minute on our last day in Bangkok before flying home. Didn't manage to get in contact by phone so sent email and got quick response. Ample information and directions on how to get to the meeting spot. The lady who met us there was not necessarily friendly but rather resolute. But she managed to put all the different groups together in no time, so it was efficient. We were coupled up with some other folks and then our chef for the day, J (or Yai?). She is a very cheerful and friendly woman who speaks excellent English and explains everything. The market tour was a bit of a joke, we spent no more than 2 minutes in a market stall and all the pre-purchased ingredients were divided over our baskets. After that we were put in tuk-tuks because of the rain and swiftly brought to the cooking school.The school itself was in a wonderful building, with different rooms, very tastefully furnished and decorated. The dining room was airconditioned. There was also a preparation room and an instruction room, and the kitchen was an outside, open one (but roofed). Everything was very well arranged and organized, with us moving from one room to another under Yai's directions and the other staff members clearing up after us. But it never felt unpleasant or mechanic. The atmosphere was quite relaxed, there was time for some questions and pictures were often taken. We cooked (and ate) 5 dishes and they were all lovely! We also got a recipe book at the end. I think this activity is excellent value for money and I would really recommend it if you have an afternoon to spare in Bangkok!

Fun Foodie Time. Great fun and tasty food. For the half day courses you shop in a local market, learn the basics of Thai food, assist in preparation and cooking, then eat!! Omg, so yummy!This is a very busy place but they handle the groups with ease. If you want a more in-depth experience, there are full day and multi-day courses available. Fun way to experience Thailand and Thai food!

great fun. super experience. would def do it again. I always wanted to do a cooking class to learn more about Thai food.I chose this one because of all the nice reviews I saw online and I was not disappointed at all: the food that you cook is amazing and you get to try all of it one at a time: you cook, you eat, and repeat. The day started by a walk down the fresh market, which was a great introduction to different Thai products and a fun way to start the day. Then you move to the cooking school itself. We cooked 5 dishes in total, they were all superb. At the end you also get a booklet of all the recipes that you learned.What I particularly enjoyed, on top of the quality of the food itself, was the whole flow of the day. Being in Thailand you can sometimes expect badly organized tours, late, loose etc… but this wasn’t the case at all for this class. It was always on time, perfectly organized and tailor-made so that you spend a fantastic 4 hours. It never gets boring, too slow, or too fast, or too much. It is really well made and I really enjoyed this aspect. The cooking instructor is a lovely Thai lady that speaks a good English and explains very well how everything works.Great fun, I would recommend this. And great value too !
Thai Cooking Class at its best.. Lovely experience here to cook Thai food and you get to enjoy the food that you cook after. Yummy yum.

a MUST join for food lover or those who likes Thai culture!. I registered the course (course 1 for Monday) online, it is easy and convenient.Price is only 1000 Baht, and every minute of the 3-hour class I enjoyed a lot!Course includes: taking us to the local market to choose best ingredient-->preparing the sauce/coconut milk/ coconut cream and ingredient-->cooking-->enjoy our foodThe teacher on that day is very nice, can speak fluent English with a bit thai accent.During preparation, she will teach you how to choose the best and fresh food for cooking, e.g. shrimp, and let you smell or taste some food. Her teaching is very detailed with humors. Cooking part is very easy even for beginners like me. Air conditioning is available in the living room and we do not feel hot at all. They provided lockers and apron. The room are very beautiful and every shot of our food is perfect.The school is quite near BTS station, take only 10mins to walk, of course, you can take a tuk-tuk back from school to the BTS station.Definitely a MUST TRY during your thailand trip!

7 Day Intensive Course Review. I did the 7 Day Intensive Course because i'm staying a month in Bangkok and love Thai food. If you REALLY want to learn enough to be competent cooking Thai food at home you need to do several days or do the 7 Day Intensive Course as I did so that you really understand how technical Thai recipes and cooking are to achieve that awesome taste you only get in Thailand. At the end of a week you'll have enough understanding to blow the minds of your family and friends with your Thai cooking (assuming you can get the ingredients where you live). The staff are truly awesome and friendly here as you can see from the 500 plus 'Excellent' reviews. Go here to learn Thai cooking.

Thai Cooking Fun. I had an amazing time there. I had gone there with my husband and my cousin and his wife. We had specifically told them that we are vegetarians which they accommodated while planning the recipes for us. When we mailed them our address we got a detailed mail from them guiding us how to reach Chong Nonsi station from where Mai was to connect us to our Cooking Teacher 'J' . J was fluent in English and that was a relief to my cousin :). We were given tickets to Sapan Takshin from where we got down and were take for market visits which was great fun. We were given a water bottle and a basket to carry all that stuff to the school. The cooking school was aesthetically done. We had our tables to eat. A Big Table where we were to do our prep stuff and on the upper storey the cooking stations. We learned, made & ate Tom Yum Soup, Pad Thai Noodles, Mushroom salad with toasted rice powder and Green Thai Curry with rice. We made one dish and then devoured it before moving on to next. We also leant and ate mango sticky rice in dessert. We were handed over the recipe book which had all the details and then there was this photo session. It was one of the highlight of the whole trip.

A must if you like Thai food and cooking. My wife and I attended their morning class with about 6 other students. The morning begins with a trip to the local market with an explanation of the food and the wonderful walk through the open-air market. We class returned to the school where in a delightfully friendly and humorous manner we cooked about 6 courses which we ate. I continue to cook the dishes that were taught to us. A must if you like Thai food. When I return to Bangkok I will take the the following cooking class and without out hesitation would recommend the experience to any amateur home cooks like us.

Went twice and was equally impressed both times!. I went to the cooking school solo in June and went back when a friend came to visit later in July. I was impressed equally both times. The staff is extremely friendly, the facilities are clean and efficient and above all else, it is probably some of the best Thai food I've had! They also give you a cooking booklet after you are done which details how to recreate the recipes at home. I haven't tried it but I feel like I have a good grasp on the concepts and has probably made me a better chef overall. Bon Appetit and you will NOT regret coming here!

Cooking school. I went alone, by rocommendation of a friend, and I loved it! It was definitely the 1000 Bach worth. The food was good and we all made our own and in the end we got a little book with all the recipies. The teacher too was good. I have nothing bad to say

Fabulous: Fun and a Feast. If you're looking for a cooking school experience while in Bangkok, don't miss the Silom Thai Cooking School. Booking was easy, and the directions for finding the meeting place were excellent (including a picture and directions for a cab driver). It was fun to visit the market and even more fun to cook the meal. Our guide/chef was terrific: personable, funny, and knowledgeable. We had many good meals while in Thailand, but the food at the cooking school was the best. A cookbook is provided at the end, which is a great souvenir and source of inspiration. It was a great experience.

it's all about the guide/chef, excelent expiriance. I think that in such cooking school you need a special guide/chef. our guide has a unique sense of humor' we loved the way he reached us. a very good way to understand the cooking methods and ingredients of Thailand. Our guide name is Jauy. Hope wrote it well.

Fantastic way to get to Know Thai food.. I'm not gong to repeat the glowing praises for the staff, great facility or fun atmosphere. There are plenty of reviews that discuss that. I want to highlight how wonderful the experience is for first time visitors to Thailand. For people who may be intimidated to try the food in Thailand, having an understanding, engaging English speaking teacher to walk you through the various foods, tastes, and culture is a fantastic way to begin your foodie journey to the country. Along with the convenience of being able to request substitutions or vegetarian options, you will be able to really get to know and enjoy Thai cooking with confidence. In my opinion, the Silom Cooking School is a great investment and should be on everyone's itinerary for their first trip to Thailand.

The birthplace for my addiction to sticky rice with mango!. So glad we booked a course with Silom Cooking School. Our chef was incredibly friendly and entertaining, the food tasted absolutely delicious and best of all we now know how to cook them at home! A definite must for anyone who appreciates thai food and a really good way to spend the morning in the city. Definitely skimp on breakfast beforehand- you won't be wanting for anything for a while after this! Brilliant value for money.

The way Thai people cook. This was my third cooking class in three weeks (the first two were in Hanoi and Siem Reap). The four hours started with the obligatory trip to the market with our chef Jay (nice guy) to check out the types of vegetables and spices we'd be using, then off to the kitchen to prepare our meals. The set-up at Silom Cooking School is up some stairs with two food preparation rooms and a small dining room in a line inside and the gas cooking stations in a line outside. First we prepared a delicious Tom Yum soup followed by a Pad Thai. In the preparation room we sat in a circle on the floor while Jay expanded upon the ingredients and led us through the steps. Each time we finished cooking a course we went to the dining room to eat it. The next two courses comprised a curry and, my favourite, mango and sticky rice. When I'd finished eating that lot, I could hardly move!I know we had a chef overseeing our culinary skills, but you do get a real sense of accomplishment having prepared and cooked the meals yourself. The secret for the school is to provide a teacher who is both skilled in cooking and teaching, but also entertaining. Jay ticked all the boxes - a lovely man with a good sense of humour. At the end of the session we were all presented with recipe book containing the meals we cooked plus others. To summarise, if you like to eat Thai food you really should try to cook it, especially the way the Thai people do. I know you will have fun at this place.

A lifelong memory made!. Wow! This is an experience not be missed if you have any interest in cooking whatsoever. We went as a family of 5 (3 kids- 6,9 and 12) and spent the afternoon cooking 5 traditional Thai dishes. I won't spoil the surprise by saying which ones they are. This is really great value for money as we arrived at 2 and cooked and ate until 6. Left very happy and very full but the main joy is what you learn about the combinations of spices and ingredients that make Thai food what it is. It am vegetarian and I was catered for very well alongside by more carnivorous family! Each dish is explained in detail and cooked with care and attention to detail. We now just need to find the ingredients to use when we get back to the UK. You also get a small but excellent cookery book to take home so you can remember what you need and what to do. Very special experience and one we will remember forever. Very highly recommended.
Loved it!. We enjoyed the market shopping experience and loved learning how to prepare typical thai dishes. We went as a group of five friends and had a blast. Go on an empty stomach!

Well worth the money!. My husband and I did this course in a Wednesday so we leant how to cook pad Thai, spring rolls and massaman. Jay the teacher was amazing and explained everything to us. we started with a tour of the local market to get the ingredients and then started cooking. It cost us £20 each for the whole morning which is a lot cheaper than what the hotels charge. For this you get to cook and eat 4 meals and get to keep a cookery book with loads more recipes in. I would definitely recommend this and was the highlight of Bangkok for me.

Fun. Fun experience learning about the staple ingredients used in Thai cooking and having hands on practice for some cooking methods. Dishes we prepared and cooked were delicious! We left the places full and satisfied :) The school also gave us a recipe book to bring home inclusive of the the dishes we cooked, as well as other Thai dishes. After the class ended our teacher offered to walk with us to the nearest BTS, which was extremely kind and helpful of her. Thanks, Silom Thai.

Highlight of our trip!. Attending a Thai culinary lesson at Silom Thai Cooking School was one of the best parts of our Bangkok trip! Instructions were easy to follow as the teachers spoke very fluent English, and there was an adequate amount of hands-on during the lesson. Special thanks to Teacher Aey who was such a fun-loving lady; we enjoyed ourselves and had so much fun and laughter in her class. We are definitely looking forward to coming back!

Full up!. I had a great time at the Silom Thai Cooking school. You start by getting your little basket and heading into the local market being shown what to pick for the menu and given tips on freshness of seafood and veggies. We were in a group of 8 or so. Preparing some excellent food then eating it. The staff had great English and our chef enjoyed a laugh with us. So many people then booked onto further classes and if I'd have had time I would of too. Definitely put a few hours by to take a class and if you have dietary requirements they will cater for you.

Well organized, high quality course. Delicious meal!. Everything was wonderful! So much so that I took a 2nd class just 4 days after the first. I'd go back again in a heartbeat. I just wish they sold their cooking supplies (new) in all locations. :-)

Cooking class. Very nice place. The teacher has been very patient and tried to teach us a bit about thai kitchen. Not only some kind of theoritical infomation which you can find in the books, but also practical part. We tried to create our own curry from teh scrach or our own sweet sticky rice with mango. Personally i'm using cookbook which we received there and the food is very good.
Excellent experience. The teacher was professional to answer all your cooking questions. We especially love the Wet Market tour before starting the cooking part. Thumbs up!

Eating, Learning and so much Fun. I've recently moved to Thailand and signed up since it sounded interesting. It was a lot of fun! There were 7 of us in the group with a mixture of nationalities.We were showed how to make coconut milk and cream and then a number of dishes, which were all delicious, my favourite being the Tom Yam Goong.At the end of the lesson we were given a recipe book.The cost of the course is 900 baht. There are 3 classes a day, I did the evening class which doesn't include a market visit, but they sort of being the market to you, showing you local ingredients and giving you a chance to smell them.All in all it was an amazing experience, I would do it again and I'm looking forward to taking friends and family with me!

FUN & fabulous Thai Cooking Class. From the moment we met Jay, our teacher, I knew the experience would be great! He was warm, charming and knew his food! This was an outstanding and FUN excursion to our trip. The courses we prepared were delicious and easy to follow. I loved the freshness of the foods and the cleanliness of the place. Beautiful home kitchen!! So wonderful!

Best Thing I Did in Bangkok. I booked this cooking class based on Lonely Planet's recommendation and I was not disappointed with my experience. It was definitely the best thing that I did while I was in Bangkok. Jay was the instructor for the class. He did a wonderful job of walking us through our dishes and he kept us laughing while we prepped and cooked our food. The class is very affordable (1000 baht) and you leave with a full stomach. They provide you with a recipe book so that that you can make the dishes that you did in class at home. The best food that I ate in Bangkok was the food that I cooked in this class. As far as the facility, it is very clean and they provide you with a locker to keep your personal items in while you cook. The staff promptly met our group at the meeting point and Jay also walked us back to the BTS station afterwards. Prior to the class, they did an excellent job with communicating via email regarding the booking of the class, giving detailed information and photographs about the meeting point and answered questions about the class. If you are going to spend anytime in Bangkok, I would highly recommend this cooking school.

Great experience. I would first like to say I consider my self a serious hobbyist in the kitchen, I went to culinary school and I have worked in the industry. This was a fun experience which I will do again, but don't go to a Thai cooking class expecting a culinary school education like some of the reviewers expect. It's simply not like that.I brought my sister and parents to this cooking school and we had a great experience. Joel our instructor and guide took us out on a market tour and showed us a bunch of Thai ingredients. After the market, he brought us back to to the school where he went through the preparation and cooking of each meal. Joel was extremely funny, informative, and helpful. It was such a fun experience for the whole family and everyone around. I would highly recommend it to everyone and I would definitely do it again.

Best cooking class in Bangkok. Loved the cooking class! It starts at the maket where we picked up all the ingredients for our 5 course meal. Our teacher Jiji was the best! So funny and with quick and easy steps to follow. We ate everything we prepared and had a lot of fun in the process. It is really cheap because it includes the meal, the class and a recipe book!

Even for Large Groups!. We have taken a few cooking classes in Thailand and this one was excellent. The area they had was much larger than others with many classrooms and plenty of places to cook. They do EVERYTHING for you and make it as easy as possible all while helping you to understand how to do it all. We had a great time and this is highly recommended if you are in Bangkok. The ladies that teach you are super quirky but add a lot to the entertainment of the experience. Even if you are a terrible cook you can't mess up with them around. They are aware of food allergies and make every effort to accommodate so don't be afraid to try it out!

Our favourite thing in Bangkok. Going to the Silom Thai Cooking school was absolutely a highlight for us during our stay in Bangkok. My girlfriend and I both signed up, having seen the good reviews on here and for the fact that it was on the street next to ours. What a fantastic decision! The school is so well run that we ended our 3 and a half hour course with 3 minutes to spare. Over the course, we learnt to cook 5 dishes, including Tom Yum Kung, Pad Thai, Deep Fried Fish Cakes, Chicken Red Curry and Mango Sticky Rice, as well as how to make sticky rice, red curry paste and sweet chili sauce. We first went as a group to the local market to get the ingredients after which we were taken back to the school to prepare and cook each of our dishes, which we promptly ate. Our teacher was Goong with her assistant Nam, and she was mindblowing: fun, friendly, insightful, charismatic and deeply knowledgeable about the food as well as an outstanding teacher. We had to resist very hard not to do the evening class on the same day.Try get Goong as your teacher, but I'm sure they're all amazing. Obviously go hungry.

Great half day course!. We had a fantastic tour of the market followed by practical class with loads of food try- would definitely recommend. Great activity to do in a group or way to meet people if you are travelling alone.

Lovely and practical course!. I had a lot of fun during the half-day course. The instructor was really comical and everybody had great fun.The course was useful and practical! I was able to whip up the dishes at home by myself after attending the course (I'm not much of a cook). Instructions were easy to understand and the school provides q recipe book that you can bring home. Time well spent!

A fantastic day out with great food!. It was my 1st time doing a thai cooking course and I really loved it. The concierge at my hotel recommended it, also a very good price for a 5 course meal. The house where they held the course is very clean and the staff very helpful. The chefs are funny and they made it extremely easy to cook thai food. The ingredients used were fresh and of good quality. All and all I loved it and would definitly recommend it.

Brilliant afternoon . We visited Silom Thai Cooking School on the recommendation in Lonely Planet. It was easy to book and the staff were really helpful (especially when we got lost!). The teacher was hilarious and very friendly. We learned to cook five different dishes (which were delicious) and given a recipe book to take home. The course is very hands on and the staff want you to get involved! In total it took about three and a half hours. Take an afternoon to do it and make sure you are hungry!

A wonderful experience. I booked in a last minute a thai cooking lesson for me and 5 more friends. We were late because of trafic jam in Bangkok. Chef and staff was still here for us. In a booking lesson we prepare 4 different recipe. When we arrived chef explain to us the particularity of thai food. We start by rice, vegetables and meet. We finished by dessert (sticky rice with mango). More than thai cooking lesson, chef was very funny and smyle on face. (I'm french sorry for my english)

Very fun and delicious cooking class!. We enjoyed the afternoon cooking class todat at Silom cooking school, we had a short visit to the market (which officially closes at 10 am), so take the early class if you want a busy market. We had Chef Non, and he took us to a different location then the actual school but very clean and perfect location.We had the "starter" course which was delicious with a soup, pad thai, green curry and a stickh rice and mango desert. All was done in a pleasant atmosphere with a class of 9 in our case. Everyone can make the dishes, next time i would choose a slightly more challenging course but as a start to thai cooking this is an excellent course!

Great afternoon . We were met on time by our teacher, Tango. She took us to the market and explained the items that we would be cooking with. We then walked a few mins to the cooking school. The school is immaculately clean. You do your prep in one room then eat your food in another room. Tango was a great teacher, really engaging, funny and full of useful cooking tips. Everything we cooked was delicious, and as you are cooking your own dishes you can set it to your own heat levels. You are given a recipe book to take away at the end of the day. This was one of the best afternoons we had in Bangkok and we found it great value for money.

Have to do this. I can't say why I signed up for this course, but I am really glad I did. "J" was our chef and I am not sure there is a stronger advocate for Thai cooking, hospitality and humour...! He was fantastic, as was the cute kitchen house we prepared the meals in. My advice, take the morning and afternoon classes with the market visit, and do not eat any meals on the day you go....

Interesting Experience in Bangkok. Thai food is one of the major reasons that lead us to Bangkok, and going to Silom Thai Cooking School was actually the best experience we have had during our stay. First, you can pick the course you like according to day available, e.g. course 1 refers to Monday, and course 2 refers to Tuesday. Second, it is very convenient to make a booking. Just fill in the form from its website and the staff will reply promptly with detail of how to getting there and what to prepare. They also pay special attention to allergy or request such as vegetarian menu. Third, the chef and staff were really nice and humorous. They speak fluent English! The 4-hour class is never boring and please, believe me!, the marketing tour was so much fun. Each of us cooked for our own, and you can decide whether the dishes is spicy or not. The decor was so great too (and, very good for photo-taking, just in case you'd love to upload to Instagram or Facebook;P)1,000 baht per person is worth spent! I would definitely recommend the class to couples and friends! It is such a nice experience cooking with them while you don't need to do the dish washing after the fun!

Best cooking class ever. My partner and I were extremely impressed with this cooking class. Our instructor, Kuhn, took us to a local food market to purchase the fresh ingredients for a five course Thai meal. The course was well thought out and we simply ate amazing food that we cooked ourselves! We learned so much and had such a fun experience. We would recommend this school as "a must experience" if you're coming to Bangkok.

Amazing cooking experience. We enrolled a morning class. Our chef first took us to the market to buy ingredients and then we back to the school to start our class. The class included a five courses menu from soup, salad, curry paste, main course and dessert. For the day we attended, there were five classes and each class were only eight to nine students and students were from different countries. at the end of the course, the school would give you a cook book.
Great experience!. So much fun, it was great to go to the market in the morning and the staff are wonderful. Arrive hungry, you cook about 6 dishes!

Thai me up!!!. Wonderful way to spend time in Bangkok!We started early in the day, met up with the rest of the small group in our class and headed to the local market to learn about ingredients used in Thai cooking!Then headed back to the cooking school, a short walk away, hidden away in the residential area in Silom.Our instructor taught us basic Thai dishes, and was very polite and witty! She patiently and clearly explained the cooking techniques! Interesting to interact with folks from different countries part of our cooking group!Had a wonderful time learning how to cook! Plus you get to eat what you create and more!!!Highly recommend spending time here rather than visiting touristy places !!!

disappointed class. I booked June 24th Silom Thai cooking class. Comparing to Sompong, the Chef Oliver is not a detail person. When I ask questions, he seems not pay attention. He also not teach dish in detail comparing to Sompong. I feel so disappointed. If you don`t want to explore more details in cooking, Silom is suitable for you because you won`t feel tired. Silom almost help you in cutting thinks which is quite easy for beginner.

One of the best activities of our trip.. We did this the last dat in Bangkik, it was one of the highlights. It was super easy, but you still made delicious food. The instructors and management were very funny and also very professional. It really was an excellent time and I recommend to try this school.
