Adorable!. I took my mom here when she came to visit and it was one of the best highlights of our trip. The food was delicious (as all Thai food is), but even better the instructor Tang (as in Tango ^_^) made the class so much fun. You get a neat booklet with a bunch of Thai recipes to take with you for free and they include all veg alternatives. I'm a veg, and they were able to accomidate me perfectly. Definitely recommended!

Great fun. Good fun along with some simple techniques to create classic Thai dishes at home.We mad Pad Thai, followed by spring rolls with sweet chilli sauce and salad. Then we mad Chocken Massaman followed with mango and sticky rice.I would highly recommend this for anyone looking for an interesting 4 hours and a good feed,

Best day in Bangkok !. Spending the afternoon at Silom Thai cooking really was the best day spent in fast-moving, traffic dominated Bangkok. Indeed this experience permitted us to relax, enjoy making and eating some delicious and authentic thai food as well as discussing with great people from Bangkok and walking around the very dynamic area of Silom!The instructors were young, fun, patient, intelligent and explained all very clearly, we had the opportunity to learn how to make 4 different and delicious dishes after going to a local market to pick up the ingredients. Going to the market really was a plus as I learned new names of spices and vegetables, and gave a supplementary 'experience' to the life of Bangkok.Of course, the dishes made; pad thai, sticky rice, yellow curry and papaya salad, all were equally delicious, and the very close help given permitted everyone to successfully prepare them. The quality of the ingredients given was perfect, they were fresh and very tasty. We also learned to make a tomato rose which was very fun and a good to impress your friends.We were also greeted with a lot of very delicious Thai tea and pineapple biscuits which were some of the best ever tasted. I really really do recommend a day in Silom cooking school if passing by Bangkok, for amateurs to professional cook this is perfect!!!!

Must have experience. I loved the experience of cooking Thai. It enhanced the enjoyment of Eating Thai food altogether. Now i know whay i am eating. Such sweet chefs. And coordinators. A well planned- precise- well executed cooking day for all Thai food or just Food Lovers. Go for it once.

Amazing Day. We had so much fun at Silom Thai Cooking School. A great teacher, Ms Goong, walked us through the marked to buy groceries which we afterwards prepared at the school. We learned a lot while having a great day.
The thai cuisine is wonderful and this is a great way to gain more insight.

Instructor Kung made the world of difference. I love this cooking activity! I was so lucky to have Kung as my instructor. I went with a party of 4 and she made us laugh from the beginning to the end. Not only did she entertain us with her hilarious jokes, she even fed us with food that we cooked ourselves! 5 dishes in all! The food was yummy and the information that she gave us during the cooking activity was very useful as she used to be a professional chef for 2 years in Phuket. Her experience certainly showed and she gave us lots of useful tips in the kitchen. I wish I could bring her back to Singapore. She has such passion for life that is infectious! It is also good as we made some friends from USA and Taiwan as well as fellow Singaporeans in the class. What fun!My only regret is that I didn't know of this earlier. If not, I will definitely book another session with her. What a wonderful day in Thailand. Thank you, Kung!

Interesting & Unique Activity. Its our first trip to BangKok and we booked the cooking class through their website. They have a list of dish menus to choose from which I found delightful. The staff got back to me the day itself when I sent the reservation form via their online portal.We got to get a local market tour to get the key ingredients before heading back to the school for the cooking class. Non, who is our instructor, entertained the group of 6 with funny jokes. We got to learn 6 Thai dishes during the 3 hour class.Really fun class where you get to meet people from all over the world and cook Thai food together. Definitely will be back for another class!

Highlight of my trip!. Booking the class was easy enough through their website. Detailed instructions were given regarding the meeting points which is great for first timers to Bangkok like myself. We had Chef Jay. He was so entertaining and full of information from the time he met us for the market tour right through to the end of our cooking class. I learned so much about the herbs and ingredients that we were going to use for our cooking i.e. everything small just like our chef!!!!The cooking school itself was very clean and we each had our own preparation and cooking station. Cooked our own portion and ate each dish after we cooked them. The lessons were very clear and gave me a lot of confidence to know I too can cook authentic Thai food.Never a dull moment with Chef Jay. Strongly recommend his classes and I hope to return for more classes in the future.

A gentle introduction for beginners. We went for the easier course and boy it was fun. Started off with a marketplace walk around, 'killed' a chicken, picked our ingredients, and then headed off to the rather obscure cooking centre that was really quite a nice place (with air-con!). Our instructor (Non was his name) was hands-down one of the funniest instructors I've had in all my travels. If you can, request for him. The instructions given were clear, and the food super yummy. Pad Thai, Mango sticky rice, Papaya salad, Chicken curry, Spring rolls. Yum. But it wasn't very hands-on for the mango sticky rice. All in all, a great experience, and a nice way to start a trip in order to establish a baseline for your tolerance of some great Thai food.

Great experience. I chose to take the Silom Cooking class after looking through 4-5 other cooking schools. I was turned off by some of the other places' high price (I think Blue Elephant was 4k Baht!!!) and limited selection. Silom was reasonable (1.5k Baht) and featured a good selection of dishes I liked/wanted to learn how to cook. The course starts in a wet market near the school where the instructor tells you how to select produce. The students are then led back to the cooking school and taught how to prepare the ingredients and cook them. Our instructor, Kiki, was very nice and knowledgeable. She spoke good English and made the experience fun and humorous. The food that we made was great and I've already made one round of Pad Thai since coming home.

Great cooking classes! . Went to check out their cooking classes during our few days within Bangkok, and the classes were very well organized, hygienic and fun! Highly would recommend these classes, especially to those who have no prior cooking skills or knowledge.

Great fun and great food!. we booked last minute (almost 1-2 hours before the evening class started) they replied quickly and had room for 2 of us! We were joined with another 2 students so the class was small which was delightful and meant it was easy to learn well together. Very insightful on the ingredients and the chatting was good fun too, we made 5 dishes in total and had the joy of eating them straight after we made them!I'd highly recommend this cooking school, there was a promotion so we only paid 900B1

Very well organized. We've joined a evening class because we don't really want to go to the market and shop for the ingredients (it's too hot). The course is very well organized. Our class has 8 people in total. They have prepared everything for us. We have cooked 4 dishes and they were all delicious! And the price is very reasonable - cooking + eating = 900 bhat. And the place is very clean and tidy. The Chef explained everything very well and clear. Happy Cooking!

Experience of Thai food . Because of the strong, positive and excellent reviews been given via trip advisor, I went with my loved one during our holiday in BKK. No regret and good experience. The chef who attended us and conducted the cooking class is friendly, frankly well experience and everything with sequence. We really have a good time. In the end of the class we are given a recipe book. We loved Thai food. Thanks Silom Thai Cooking School

Informative & interactive. I paid 1000baht for a half day afternoon experience & it was more than worth it. We came in a group of 3 & my mum decided to back out last minute. They were very accommodating regardless and even invited her to just hang around and watch. Very kind! Our chef, Tango, really knew her stuff & made sure to talk about how we could get certain ingredients in our home country. For 1000baht (about $40 SGD), you get a market tour, detailed cooking instructions, eating everything you cook on the spot & a recipe book of 25 dishes at the end of the class. Plus a humorous and lively chef! Come for a different kind of Bangkok (instead of just shopping)!

Small groups, knowledgeable cooks, good facilities, good fun. My wife & I took our 2nd Beginners Course, the 1st being Mar 2014. We wanted to reinforce some of the things we had learned on the 1st visit. We asked them to customise the dishes slightly so we didn't do the same ones.We can only say good things about this Cooking School, they always answer our emails prior to arriving & are easy & friendly to deal with. Our classes were 4-5 people, very good instruction from the Cooks (who always seem to have a good sense of humour), very hands on with food preparation & then outside to cook the dishes. The support staff do a great job of cleaning up the mess while you go away & eat the dish you have just cooked!Authentic Thai food with fresh ingredients. Price is reasonable compared to other Operators, some of whom seem to charge excessive amounts. We look forward to our 3rd visit.

Really fun. It was a really fun experience that I would try again as it wasn't expensive. But the thing is I didn't learn much.. The instructor "J" was amazing, we laughed a lot and without him I wouldn't have as much fun. The school is pretty and promotes a friendly atmosphere where you can meet the other students as you also eat together what you made. I would definitely recommend it but don't expect to become a Thai chef after!

Fun with friends and delicious results!. My friends and I were excited to dive into the spicy, sour, sweet flavors of Thailand during our trip to Bangkok and found that at the Silom cooking school! I was glad we scheduled our class on our first full day in town, so that for all the following meals we would benefit from our newfound knowledge. Our instructor was nice, funny, and interactive with us. Smelling and tasting all the components gave some dimension to the recipes. Some of the dishes like the mango sticky rice became the group favorite dishes from our entire stay in Thailand!

One of the Highlights of My Trip!!. I have to say that this class was probably one of the best things that I did while I was in Thailand!! They took us to the market to see and pick all of the ingredients that we would be using for the day and took the time to explain to us all of the general elements of Thai cuisine! Afterwards they took us to the school which was in a very unsuspecting area of downtown and it was the cutest little house! We made about 5 dishes altogether under the direction of one of the most colourful people I have had the pleasure of meeting, chef (awesome) Jay!! If you have only one day to do something different in Bangkok, I strongly suggest you spend it at the Silom cooking school! Can't wait to head back to Thailand and do another class!

Not the best. Not really knowlogde chef and really poor explanation at the market , they just show you the really essential for the the class and looks like questions are not really welcome, the food was ok but they didnt show the prep of desert ....

Great experience ! Very friendly . I had this recommended to me and wasn't disappointed at all. Cooked some great dishes after a good market tour. Left feeling very full indeed ! Would not hesitate to recommend and go again !

Excellent Cooking School. I wanted to do a cooking school when we last came to Thailand, but left it too late to sort anything out, on our return trip it was a top priority!We chose this one due to its great reviews and also for value for money; it was a great price compared to many others.Accurate directions ensured we arrived at the meeting point without any hassle and met our guide/chef, Tango.We had a trip to the market and picked up some produce and an introduction to some of the ingredients. Next we walked back to the cooking school which wasn’t too far away. Once back we made and ate all the dishes as per the menu, all of which were great and we could even swap out seafood etc. for those who couldn’t or would eat them (not all schools seem to allow this). You ate what you cooked so you could adjust the heat level to your taste which was good.Tango our chef was fantastic, great fun, very informative and she made the day a great experience. We also did another cooking school while in Vietnam and Silom Cooking School was our favourite.Would recommend and return to do another menu on a return trip.

Surprisingly one of the best!. I never would have thought that a cooking class would be this fun. There were five of us who took this class with Chef Khun. We prepared and cooked 4 Thai dishes. Our version of Path thai is probably the best I had among all the path thais that we tried in Bangkok. This was also the only place where I enjoyed the taste of Chicken curry (we made curry paste from fresh ingredients!) The people here are very acommodating and hilarious which made the experience even more memorable. Every penny spent was worth it!

Good fun and very educational. The class was good fun and educational throughout, from the market tour to the prep to the cooking. Even though I was probably the most experienced cook in the group and had cooked Thai food before I still learned lots! No experience was necessary and the novice cooks in the group had no problem taking part.A very enjoyable and educational class for a good price, I will definitely take another class next time I go to Bangkok. In the meantime I will continue trying to re-create the dishes at home from the recipe book provided.The only negative I can find is that after the course no guidance was given on how to find our way back to the metro (the group had taken taxis from the market to the class).

Wow! What an experience!. I was so satisfied with this class and so are the other members of our group. Chef Non was a great teacher. Very entertaining course and delicious foods. Make your you go with an empty stomach. 5 meals are very filling.

So Fun and Educational!. My brother and I had an amazing time. We were so full by the end. We did the night class so it was our dinner and it was delicious. It was probably the best Thai food I had ever had because we had made it fresh ourselves. The teacher was so great. She spoke English very well. It was a class of 6 including us (3 pairs). We cooked Tom Yum Soup, Green Curry, Pad Thai, Chicken type of appetizer of which I forget the name, and Mango Sticky Rice. We each had our own cooking station. The room we ate in and prepared the food in were different. The room we ate in was really air conditioned and smelled of fresh lemons. It had nice relaxing music. It was wonderful because Bangkok was so hot and humid even at night. The air con was beautiful. At the end they give you a recipe book. It was a great experience and I am super happy we did this in Thailand because there is not much else excursion-wise to do in Thailand.

Had a very good time!. Loved everything! Starting from the staff picking us at the station and caring about us from the beginning. The visit to the market and the cooking class were amazing. We had to cook everything and all the dishes were delicious!

Recipes We'll Use Forever. This class was awesome and the entire process from start to finish was memorable. We met our teacher at a train stop and she guided us to a local market where she explained all of the local fruits, vegetables, and produce we would be using in our dishes. She spoke English very well, which made the language barrier almost non-existent for us English speakers.Once we got to the cooking class, we were instantly set up to cook. It was very interactive and hands on. The recipes were delicious and everyone had a great time. We also took a cooking class while we were in Vietnam so it was fun getting a different perspective on Asian food preparation and cooking. We even received a cook book with the recipes we made, plus many others. The teacher was willing to answer any questions we had and correct us on techniques if we weren't doing something quite right. A great experience and something I would recommend to anyone visiting Bangkok.

Excellent afternoon. We learned about market shopping for ingredients and then learned how to prepare a 5 course thai meal. The teacher, Jay, was knowledgeable and entertaining and kept things moving along. there was no need to find a supper that night we ate what we cooked and there was plenty. Our school location was very comfortable - felt like you were at their home - could have been too.We were given a cookbook which will be most helpful.

Great Food and Fantastic Introduction to Thai Cuisine. We had our initial reservations about Silom Thai Cooking School because it was one of the cheapest cooking class options out there but signed up anyway because of the great reviews we read online. And we were not at all disappointed.There were about 40 students or so signed up for classes but we were split up into 5 groups of 8 students each. The groups were further assigned to one of the two cooking school locations. The smaller class sizes meant personal attention and the opportunity for more hands-on kitchen work. The class started with a quick visit to the wet market to learn all about Thai ingredients, including a coconut grating demonstration. We were each given a shopping basket to collect the ingredients. Then we walked back to the school, which despite its humble-looking appearance and location down a quaint-looking residential alley, is very efficiently and professionally run.We were first ushered into an air-conditioned waiting room, which doubled up as our dining room while the kitchen helpers prepared the dry kitchen next door. We were then seated in a circle on the floor, in Thai fashion, and taught how to de-vein shrimps, peel onions, prepare our own coconut cream and milk and so on. We prepared the ingredients for each course before cooking them. This helped space out the chopping, cooking and eating, which worked really well for us. The cooking was done along a long walkway instead of a real kitchen, which some people may take issues with, but this only adds to the whole local experience. Our chef, Tango, was not only great at teaching us the basics of Thai cooking but also affable and very funny.We've been to cooking classes all around the world and Le Cordon Bleu it is not but for the price you pay, Silom Thai Cooking School is a true gem. We had Pad Thai the day before in one of Bangkok's top-rated restaurants and the Pad Thai we made at the school won hands down. The other dishes were also stellar! We were also given color-printed booklets of 20+ Thai recipes to bring home. The only regret we had was not having more time in Bangkok to do additional classes with the school.

No reply. I was only visiting Bangkok for a week and before visiting, I came across this activity and immediately wrote it in my itinerary and scheduled it for my last day or the day before my last.Upon arrival in my hotel in Bangkok, i ensured all my itinerary tickets and schedule, and called Silom Thai Cooking School with the contact details they have in their website; they said we can't have a booking over the phone and only through their online application form and from which they will reply with the confirmation and course itinerary.I have sent 2 forms over 3 days in two different email addresses that I have and have not received any reply and confirmation within my whole stay in Bangkok. So sad that this was the one I was most excited with with my whole trip.

Best dsy of our holiday!. What an absolutely amazing experience! We had such an entertaining time right from the moment we met our chef! Everything was so well presented, so clean and beautiful and worth so much more than we paid! Would do this again in a heartbeat!

Such a fun addition to vacation!. I have attended this cooking school twice. Once last year alone and this year I brought a friend. The class is well organized and tons of fun! Since I attended their first course already, but wanted to remain in the class with my friend, they traded it some of my meals so I would have to repeat anything. I thought this was very thoughtful and showed that they really wanted me to enjoy the class again. Our guide was very funny and nice. I would definitely recommend this class when visiting Bangkok. I plan on returning for another course next year and hope to bring more friends. If you do attend, bring a large appetite!

Highlight of our trip to Bangkok. A very enjoyable and educational afternoon starting in a local market to learn about ingredient names and their purpose. Then it was back to the school (actually a beautiful private house) to prepare and eat 5 tasty dishes. Jay was a fantastic host, teacher and chef and made the experience informative and entertaining. Food was superb and there was plenty of it - the whole afternoon was organised very efficiently and it would be hard to improve this experience. Well worth the 1000 baht paid directly to them (they only take cash) and I'd suggest its not worth shopping around to save a few baht with a heap of commission then being paid to a booking agent! My 14 year old son loved the experience and I'd say this activity was suitable for kids from 12 and up. All in all highly recommended and the best afternoon we had on our 5 day visit.

Fun experience, book in advance to get discount. Details - The meeting point was at 9 am, somewhere nearby a local fresh market. Someone came to split many of us into a group of 6 max, and bring us to the local market. The lady explained to us some of the common ingredient used for Thai cuisine and cooking and it's rather interesting. However, expect to see a lot of flies and mosquitoes around the area. The dishes we made on Monday include Tom Yum Goong, Pad Thai, Green chicken curry, a Thai Salad, and Mango sticky rice. It's quite a lot of food, 5 courses. Everyone will be preparing their own dishes and cooking their own small pot of Tom Yum Goong, and so on, so it's rather interesting and fun. After cooking each dish we would return to a little air con room to enjoy what we just cooked, while waiting for the lady to prepare ingredient and set up for the next dish. So you will be eating the 5 courses throughout the morning so make sure you don't eat heavy breakfast or else you won't be able to enjoy what you just cook. It really tasted up to restaurant standard, or even better. By the time we enjoy our last dish i.e. mango sticky it's already 12pm. It's by far the best morning I had in BangkokPayment - I come across this cooking class online in asiaworld. Asiaworld is like an online agent where if you booked through them they will give you a discount. To book directly with Silom cooking school will cost you 1000 baht, but if you book through Asiaworld it claimed to be 990 baht. Not a lot of difference but still it's a discount. However, the Asia world never get back to me, and never confirm my appointment so we end up paying the original price 1000 baht after the class. At the meeting point, I saw many other people who booked the cooking class in advance, and on the receipt it's showing 800 baht only. So I bet if you try harder and book in advance, you could get much better discount. Don't feel quite fair though people are all paying different prices for the same cooking class. Why can't they standardise. Location wise - not particularly convenient as it's not closed to the skytrain. Fortunately taxi fare was cheap from Pratunam area (51 baht one way)

Favourite day in Bangkok!. We spent the day at Silom Cookery School and had the most amazing day! Our teacher Tang was so friendly and fun and brilliant at explaining all the different ingredients and their purpose. The trip to the market in the morning was a brilliant start to the course, and then we cooked 5 delicious Thai courses (coming from fussy eaters!). We were even sent home with a whole booklet of recipes and extra information. A must do if you are in Bangkok!

Fun afternoon with delicious food. A great way to spend an afternoon - learning ingredients & cooking techniques. Our teacher Aey was fabulous and we throughly enjoyed eating our way through our lesson!

Had to come back for the third time!. If you're passionate about Thai food, this is an excellent class. Got to learn more than 15 dishes in 3 days. Koong is a brilliant teacher - very knowledgeable, patient and funny. Highly recommended.

Great taste and great entertainment!. We only spent 4 days in Bangkok... If we had more time, we would come back and join another class! It was a very entertaining afternoon, the cooking itself was great fun and the results were delicious. Everything was perfectly organized, the chef was charming and the cooking advises very useful. Back in Germany we use the Silom cooking book in our kitchen and already succesfully prepared a few Thai dishes (Phad Thai, mango sticky rice, tom yum goong)!

Do not judge at a 1st glance. Get in and then...appreciate it.. We had a tough time trying to book in advance Thai cooking classes for a Sunday. Upon arrival, we asked our local tour guide and after 3 calls, he got 2 spots for 6:30pm class. it was in a walking distance from our hotel in a "look-like" safe area. We got into an alley with "very local" appearance and felt uncomfortable but decided to keep going straight. Got into the school and the front building is not what we were expecting. again, decided to keep moving and got so well impressed with the organization, cleaning, smiles everywhere, easy and traditional recipes, every single ingredient was showed and explained in detail so we could identify what it was. For me, this was a TOP activity I did in Bangkok. I would do it again if in Bangkok in the future.

A 6 sigma cooking school!. I always wanted to attend Thai cooking classes and fortunately my wife chose Silom Thai for me. Apart from learning the nuances of Thai cooking, I was particularly impressed by the efficiency of their processes and systems. The guide and our instructor was just awesome. I really had a great time!

the highlight of our trip. Everything was perfect. The cooking class begins with an interesting local market tour. Then we were taught to make 5 dishes with the ingredients we bought. The chef was very kind and informative. And of course all our dishes taste excellent! This is definitely worth to try for your visit to Bangkok!

Would do it again in a heartbeat. Taking cooking classes in Thailand was a must for me. After reading the reviews I decided to go with this one. Someone waited for us at the skytrain to escort us to the cooking school, she was very friendly, kiki. To our suprise she was also the chef that gave us the class. We learned to make 5 awesome dishes. She explained in detail the preparation and the ingredients used in each one of them. After she explained how to cook one dish, we went and cookes it and so on. The class was very easy, even my husband that does not cook found it to be very easy and interesting. Overall the experience was amazing but the best part was the chef's sense of humor, we couldnt stop laughing. She is great. At the end of the class they give you, The Bible, with all of the recepies given in class and more. The cooking school has a cozy and beautiful space for teaching and cooking. We would have take more classes if we did not have to leave the next day. We took the night class and I recommend it if you want to skip the market( not that we want to skip it, but there was no space in the day classes).

absolute must. my wife and I were really looking forward to visiting this cooking school after all the positive reviews and it exceeded our expectations. we were hosted by Tang who was friendly, funny and informative. All in all we were taken through 5 dishes in total, all of which were brilliant. Prior to cooking we visited a local market and learnt about common Thai fish and vegetables. I would add my voice to the many who highly recommend Silom Thai Cooking School and if we are in Bangkok again, we'll definitely be revisiting.

Best thing I did on my trip. Wonderful fun experience. 900bht per person to learn to cook about 5 dishes over 3 hours. They are very accomodating for people with allergies as my partner is allergic to egg and they took care to make sure that he still cooked the same things as everyone else.Very VERY good value and a fun night out. Our chef Jay was very memorable and an enjoyable person to learn from.Thoroughly recommend to anyone wanting to take a cooking class!

Very Good. Silom Thai Cooking School was on of the highlights of our trip to Phuket. The chef was very knowledgeable and entertaining during the class. We started the class with a trip to the market where the chef described the different Thai ingredients. We then headed to the apartment area where the classes are taught where everything was already setup and prepped. We made a variety of delicious food that included curry, spring rolls and salads. Overall, the class was excellent and an okay value.

Thai food!. Had our class with teacher Koong. This is our first time attending a cooking class and do not know what to expect. Our class have a total of 8 person. Learn 5 dishes: tom yum koong, pad thai, green thai curry, chicken and mango with glutinous rice. The whole session was enjoyable, and we get to eat the food that we learnt/make. Recipe book given at the end of the session. Yes, we had fun....Definitely an experience to remember for our Bangkok trip.

Returned for another class and had even more fun!. I took a class at Silom last year and it was my favorite experience in Bangkok. So when I found out I would get to spend a few days in Bangkok, the first thing I did was sign up for another class. The teacher (Koong) was excellent! I was grouped together with first-time students, but given the chance to cook 5 different dishes, since they were making the dishes I had made before. This turned out to be the best possible situation because I got a review lesson on the things I'd learned last year and got to make some new things! Couldn't be happier with Silom and I'll definitely be returning when I'm back in Bangkok again.

A very memorable day learning authentic thai dishes! Super fun & knowledgeable teacher Gong made the time fly to quickly. The course is very well organised so no time is wasted. The brief tour of the market is informative & after picking your ingredients you are ready to go.The place of the venue is very nice, very clean, 10 working stations on the outdoor of the terrace with mini garden,beautiful plants.The course is hands on, after cooking each dish you enjoy tasting them.So if you do afternoon class you better skip lunch!I think the price is good value .Great experience,loved it,thanks to the team

Who knew you could unlock the mystical mysteries of Thai cooking in just a few hours?. The Silom Cooking School, was a perfectly excellent trip into Thai cuisine. The thing I learned about Thai cooking, which should surprise almost nobody, is that if you assemble real Thai ingredients and throw them together in a pot or a pan, it’s going to taste good. Case in point – the first thing we made was Tom Yum Goong – spicy sour shrimp coconut soup. Basically, you prep a small pile of ingredients, including the Thai trinity – galangal (Thai ginger), kaffir lime leaves, and lemongrass – then you add birdseye chiles, which will sear your soul if used properly, and a few other things like fish sauce, shrimp, and some other stuff (I have already sent home the very helpful recipe book that they gave us so I’m working from memory), and you add a few shrimp, some water, and a bit of coconut milk and you throw it into a wok and cook it for four minutes. That’s it, kids! And let me tell you, this was the best damn Tom Yum Goong I’ve ever had. It was tangy, spicy, and it had all those great Thai flavors that you almost never get at Siam Palace, or King of Bangkok, or King of Palace of Siam, or whatever your serviceable non-Thai-owned neighborhood Thai restaurant is called.Other mysteries were revealed. We made our own coconut milk and coconut cream, which was like finding out the trick of sawing a lady in half. Here’s how you do it – take a coconut, shred it, add warm water, and squeeze it into a fine mesh colander (the Thais use woven baskets, but who’s got one of those?). The product of this is coconut cream. Then you take the just-squeezed coconut shreds and add more warm water and squeeze it out again. That’s the coconut milk. Crazy, huh? The technique trick I learned about coconut curry is that you combine the coconut cream and the curry paste and reduce that for a while, then you add your protein and the coconut milk (and the obligatory mise en place of spices and condiments) and reduce that for a while, and you’re done. It’s not insipid and watery, like I always make. The whole thing takes ten minutes. We also made our own curry paste. This was really easy, even though we used an old fashioned mortar and pestle. Just throw thai basil, thai cilantro (there are several kinds of both), some big not-so-spicy chiles, some little really spicy chiles, and some other stuff in a bowl (or food processor), and you’re done. Who knew?I will say that our instructor (who used to live, of all places, in Waco, Texas) may or may not have been the Rachel Ray of Thai cooking. He seemed perfectly fine with using canned coconut milk and prepared curry pastes. I’m sure he was right, but when I get home, I’m going full monty with all the homemade stuff.We also made penang curry, pad thai, and sticky rice with mango. They were all shmabulously good, especially the sticky rice, which is now my favorite dessert. That one is ridiculously easy – steam (don’t boil) some glutinous rice, soak it in sugar and coconut milk, and top it with some sesame seeds. Your guests will think you’re god, and you’ll giggle and titter at how easy to please everyone is.

Highlight of Bangkok. I took the cooking course with my two children (aged 10 and 12) and what a great experience! We had a lot of fun learning about the different Thai ingredients, cooking together and eating the delicious food. Everyone was very friendly and at one point my son didn't feel well and was made comfortable and checked on by the staff. I'm so happy we decided to take the course.

Top Class! Highly Recommended. This class was excellent... Our instructor Jay was exceptional in his detail and teaching. He was also the life of the party.I thought it was a great touch to receive a recipe book at the end so we can out dishes when we return home.

Chef in progress!. One of the highlight of the Thailand trip is cooking! Our chef of the night is Chef Oat. He is witty and funny, plus we have a lot of fun cooking. Cost TH1000 per person for 5 course meals including dessert. Definitely will be back again!

Great Family Activity!. First, let me say that I'm a 51 year old guy with an 18 year old son who's just like me and a wife and 16 year old daughter. So when it was suggested that we go to a cooking school I wasn't overly excited. I mainly hoped my wife and daughter would enjoy it. It ended up being one of the highlights of our trip. There were about 20 people which they divided up into three groups. We had eight in our group with our Instructor Oat. To start they gave us all baskets to carry as we followed Oat around an outdoor market. He explained the differences between the vegetables, noodles, and spices at the market. Next we went to the school where we prepared four different dishes all of which were outstanding. For each dish, we'd start out in one room everyone in front of their own chopping block. The ingredients were all laid out for us. It was very organized. Oat would then explain what to do as we all cut, kneaded and mixed the ingredients. Along the way, he would explain the differences between different types of peppers curries etc. He was very easy to understand. I believe he said he had spent time at Baylor University in Texas. After the initial prep work, we'd all head outside where they had eight woks on gas burners all set up and we'd set about cooking. Everyone prepares their own dish. As we'd cook, he'd come by and ask if you wanted shrimp, chicken, pork etc. Once it was finished, we'd head into the little dining area to eat the food we had made. This cycle repeated four times. Finally ended with some sticky rice and mangoes. I think the whole class lasted about four hours and cost about $30 per person. I can always tell when my family enjoys doing something. That was day three of a two week trip to Thailand and Laos. We did A LOT of stuff. By the end of the trip we were still all talking about the cooking class.

Fab introductory course for Thai cooking. My girlfriend and I attended an afternoon class at Silom Thai Cooking School. My g/f had previously taken part in a course at Silom two years ago but insisted we should go back as she enjoyed it so much the first time around. We went to the market to start off and find out about the ingredients that we would be using over the course of the afternoon. This was very interesting. We got to run through step by step which ingredients were used for each recipe and also get a feel and smell of some of the ingredients. Great idea to set this part at the market where the wheeling and dealing for these Thai ingredients takes place in traditional every day life.We walked on to the Silom cookery school and made a start. Our tutor was very informative and made us all feel at ease. We were lucky because on the day there was only 4 in our individual class whereas there is usually approximately 10, not that this should put anybody off. For me especially. as a pretty poor cook, the tutor made me feel relaxed and explained everything fully in clear English. We touched on the preparation and ingredients involved for each dish and then took part in the cooking which was the really fun part. The stoves are piping hot so be cautious but it means the individual meals can be cooked effortlessly in two-three minutes. You then go into what was dubbed the 'winter' room to enjoy what you have produced and take souvenir photos. From the 3 hours we were on the course we made Tom Yam soup, red curry, Thai fish cakes, Pad Thai and our desert was made for us to enjoy at the end, sticky rice and mango. It was all scarily delicious!!My one small criticism and maybe an idea for the future was perhaps the desert could have been demonstrated as part of the course and not just presented at the end. This should not detract from what was an afternoon well spent. Prices for our course was 1000b per person. For what you received food wise alone was reasonable. You also are presented at the end of the course with a recipe book for all meals made on the day and many many more! Overall, a truly great afternoon out and you also save yourself buying lunch and dinner!

Excellent learning session . The cooking class was extremely fun... A short but informative market tour was organised prior to the morning class... After which there was more in depth explanation in the class room... Followed by the preparation of ingredients needed... Cooking was done at the individual stations... Had a great time cooking, as well as interacting with the participants who came from different parts of the world!

Fun, different way to spend an evening. I was a bit cautious as we approached in school as it appeared to be down some dodgy back alley but when we found it the place, we were greeted nicely, asked to take shoes off and sent upstairs to wait. The chef was funny and entertaining, making us laugh a lot. The other participants were a good crew too. We learnt about ingredients and made three dishes in the evening. We were active all the time, either preparing the ingredients, feeling and smelling ingredients,cooking or eating. The course cost 900B and worth every penny. The kitchen, teaching and cooking area was spotlessly clean and very quaintly decorated. I can absolutely recommend going on the course, 3 hours of brilliance.

Great cooking school - Morning class with Market trip. Lovely clean kitchen, well organised, great chef and we were given a book to take away too. Couldn't fault them and it was the cheapest course we looked at Would recommend them.

Fantastic. I have done this cooking class twice with two different sets of visitors and we all thoroughly enjoyed it. I would highly recommend it to anyone. The staff are great, really friendly and funny and really informative. I think it's great value for money and a very memorable experience.

great experience. Just a few blocks away from where I was staying (Novotel Fenix Silom) so the location is very convenient for me. It's even better that it is one of the cheapest cooking schools I have come across. The instructors speaks good English and explained clearly about each dish in a simple manner. I have definitely enjoyed by experience.

Unforgettable experience. The class begins with a tour in the morning market, brought personally by the chef himself. Speaks good English and very patient! *thumbs up* attended the basic class, and throughout my stay in Bangkok, I had the best tom yum, phad Thai and penan curry in the cooking school, cooked by me, directed by the chef himself! In every lesson, there're usually about 8 people, and I would say each of us actually was given enough attention during the class. The chef was very attentive, accomodating vegetarians, student's food allergy, preference and etc. Definately an unforgettable experience! Enjoyed every min of it!

Great cooking with a great teacher!. Booked an afternoon class here in February 10th 2015 for 1000 baht. If you're a very serious chef who loves doing their own prep then this course is not for you. If you're a amateur cook who wants to learn some of the fundamentals of Thai cooking in a fun environment then I would recommend this class. First up they take you to the markets. Very interesting as they explain all the ingredients. Next they take you back to the cooking school. As other reviewers mention, some of the prep is done for you whilst you do other things. In all we made 4 dishes - Tom yum soup with prawn, pad Thai, red Curry and fish cakes with sauce. There was also sticky rice with mango which we had for dessert. I didn't include it as a dish we cooked because it is a simple dish that requires the rice be soaked, steamed and served with mango. In any case, all of the food we cooked was crazy delicious! (Aroy mak mak!!!/อร่อย มาก มาก!!!)Our instructor กุ้ง/Gûng (which also incidentally means prawn) was amazing. Very friendly and knowledgeable, my girlfriend and I both though she was delightful. In summary, great place to visit if you have a morning/afternoon free, want to have a amazing time learning about Thai food and love eating! Come hungry!

A great girl's day with silom thai cooking school!. Silom Thai Cooking School is a great place to spend half a day in Bangkok! It was a definite highlight of our trip. For the morning class, you begin with a trip to the market where you’re introduced to traditional Thai ingredients that make all our favorite dishes like Tom Yum Soup. Then, you’re taken to the Silom Thai Cooking School itself where you cook dish after dish, with the help of a super friendly chef of course! My favorite was the Chicken Green Curry and the Pad Thai. It’s always a confidence booster to know you can whip up a popular Thai dish within 20 minutes! Check out more pictures of my cooking class here! http://eatprayjade.com/2015/02/22/sawadee-ka-10-things-to-do-in-thailand/

Fun and delicious experience for beginners. We did the morning class because we wanted to do the market visit and had a great time! I think there are at least 2 different school locations and depending on the number of people, you will be broken into smaller groups and sent to different markets & school locations than the one listed on their website. We were sent to the one near Saphan Taksin Station where we could see a real local market (several locals were haggling and buying while we were there). We were also lucky enough to get the (newer?) cooking school where the preparation room was in a lovely decorated house (full of cute cooking/food-themed artwork on the walls and shelves) where we had comfortable tables/chairs to work, so we didn't prep on the floor like some of the other reviews say. Our teacher Tang was friendly and made jokes throughout the entire session. The pipelining was very efficient so when we had finished cooking something upstairs with the woks, the downstairs was already prepped with the ingredients we needed to chop for the next dish. We never felt like there was a lag or that we were too rushed, and we had more than enough time to enjoy each hot dish after cooking it. However, this is not a class for someone who is serious about learning how to prep/cook these dishes after going home or are hoping to discover special techniques for improving the taste. As many other reviews say, you do not really prepare anything from start to finish. I did this class more for the fun hands-on experience. You get to do a lot of traditional "prep" work that even Thai people rarely do anymore including mashing up various ingredients in a stone mortar to make homemade green curry paste (much more exhausting than it looks) and squeezing out fresh coconut cream and milk from coconut meat. The food we made was some of the best we had in Thailand. Be sure to go hungry because you will end up eating a lot. Our group was a total of about 9 people, so we didn't feel cramped at all. Everyone was super nice and from different backgrounds, so it was also fun talking to people during the "eating breaks." Highly recommended for people with limited time in Bangkok but want to try out a Thai cooking school. We even get a small recipe book with all the dishes we made and some others. For 1000 baht, this was a fun, stimulating, and very cost efficient experience!

Wonderful Cooking Experience . The cooking class is wonderful and suitable for families. The instructor is knowledgeable and interesting. We were introduced the essential thai ingredients at a market prior to explanation and real cooking at the school. The dishes we learnt were simple but delicious. The sequence of the class is cook, eat, cook, eat. So you get to eat every dish you prepared while still hot. We cooked tom yam, green curry and Pathai and were shown how to prepare sticky rice to go with mango. Overall the experience is fantastic. It's really money and time well spent! The cost is $1000 thai baht per adult and 800 for kids. You can book the class via email.

good class for those with very, very low expectations. Having been to an excellent cooking class in Chiang Mai (Siam Rice Cooking School) I had something to compare this class to. They fell short in absolutely everything except for the enthusiastic personality of Jay, our teacher.From the "marketing" through the "classroom time" it was all very assembly line and superficial. Of the five dishes we supposedly made, we only participated (made nothing from start to finish) in making three things. If you are looking for a very light sort of cooking experience then this is fine. If you really want to do make entire dishes, including doing a lot of the prep work, then save your money for the excellent schools up in Chiang Mai.I hated sitting on the floor for the little prep that we did. The woks were lined up along a balcony, staring at the neighbour's laundry. Not aesthetic or pleasant.I'm only glad that I wasted 1000 Bhat and not more.

a wonderfully entertaining and engaging experience. this was a wonderful class that made me glad I worked up the courage to go to a cooking class alone. It was very inclusive and easy to follow. The food was delicious and time flew. A special mention to chef 'jay' who was such a character and a brilliant instructor. Highly recommend.

An awesome day out. This was a great class. We did some shopping at the market and then went back to cook Tom Yum, panang curry, pad Thai and green curry. The prep work is done while sitting around together in a room, and then you head out to the cooking stations to cook the meal. The teacher was really funny and entertaining, and the food turned out excellent. The Tom Yum soup was my favourite. A really fun half-day out, And at the end you get a book with all the recipes.

You must experience while in Bangkok. A must if you love food and cooking. This class includes a trip to a local market with explanation of Thai ingredients and substitutes. Very useful information. The class was easy and doable for chefs of any skill level. These dishes were the tastiest ones I experienced in Bangkok and we made the best Pad Thai I have ever had! This class is worth every dime.

a different way to enjoy Bangkok. Rather than went shopping, I chose joined cooking class during my visit to Bangkok. It was an enjoyable afternoon with new friends and gaining some knowledge, starting from learning about the ingredients of each dish to cook your own favorite dish.Class rooms set were unique and traditional. Chef Aey was very fun and experienced instructor. Staffs was very efficient to help.The portion for what we cooked was just nice for 1 person. At the end of the class, Chef will handed a recipe book, so don't bother to write during class just listen and enjoy

Do it, soon after you arrive!. What a great cooking school, the food was too notch and what a great way to get a feel for the different Thai dishes. Also the cookbook can be used as a reference after the fact for ordering in Thai- for some reason this opens up food possibilities and makes for better culinary experiences, who knew?!

Fantastic experience with yummy food. From learning about the ingredients to cooking and tasting some delicious Thai food, this really is a fantastic experience. Who wouldn't want to learn how to make some of tastiest dishes on earth? The staff were very fast at responding to emails, provided lots of information beforehand and were really wonderful on the day. You sit on the floor to prepare things the traditional way but they were happy to get a stool for one of the people in our session. The personal details didn't stop there either - they really make sure that everyone gets involved and the teacher helped with translations / cultural differences too. Some people have said things are prepped for you and marked the course down... It's actually just that some ingredients are measured out for you (which is normal at a cooking class) or things which take hours (e.g. sticky rice) are pre-made so don't let that put you off. You get to prep everything and learn so much about how Thai people prepare food... even the effort put into pastes! And yhe food we made was delicious. In fact, the Pad Thai I made here was one of the best I've had! So proud, haha. A great added bonus is that you get a cook book full of all the recipes you do and more. Highly recommended!

Just great! Highly recommended!. My boyfriend and I just did a cooking class two days ago with the Silom cooking school. In total it was a great experience! We met up at the meeting place and then went together with our chef Jay to a local market closed by! There he explained the main ingredients of thai cuisine! It was great fun! After we finished with the market visit we were brought to the school! We think there are more schools in different locations! Anyway, the school itself was really nice with great decor and it was spotless clean! Jay and his two helpers supported us during the cooking! We made four dishes ourselves and then the last one sticky rice with mango was done for us! We can only recommend Silom cooking schoon as price value ratio (1000 Baht) is fantastic! Thanks again Ray! It was great meeting you!

Evening Class is Very Convenient. My friend and I booked the evening class after arriving from Koh Samui that same afternoon. It is really convenient that there is an evening class because the morning class does take a good portion of your day so I like how they also offer this. Silom was very responsive to emails regarding meeting location, menu, everything, really. Upon arrival at the metro meeting place which was easy to find (they also provide a youtube video with directions of where to meet and how to get all the way to the cooking school), we were greeted by Koong. She was also our teacher. She was so friendly and had a wonderful sense of humor. Our class had quite a few requests actually, from people who only eat seafood, strict vegetarian and me, an alternate menu since this is the second time I've attended the class and have already cooked the items on the menu everyone else was making. Koong remembered each and everyone's requests and never failed to give us the appropriate attention, even if we were making something different from the majority of the class. The class went smoothly. The way it works is that you prepare and cook one meal all together as she describes to you the ingredients you are using, then you eat it in a comfortable, air conditioned room (that has lockers for your belongings as well as a bottle of water for everyone upon your arrival). I've attended other classes where you cook all dishes then eat them all at the end but here, you eat each dish after you cook it. It is good bec it is still hot and fresh and you can concentrate on the flavors of only that dish. There were a few dishes like the minced chicken salad and mango sticky rice that she just shows you how to make instead of making yourself which makes sense because I think it would be too difficult to make an individual size (but I say that coming from an Asian family where everything is made to feed an entire village).As I mentioned, this was my second time to visit this cooking school and I would go back because of how smooth it work and how great the instructors are. Last time I also had a witty and friendly instructor but I also think this reflects the Thai people and their personality. I only gave 4 stars however because it didn't seem that the food was as amazing for me as it was last time. Obviously that is in my hands since I'm the cook but I opted for the fried rice since I have already made Pad Thai and I found it too salty with the fish sauce, oyster sauce and soy sauce all together. Maybe the second time isn't as an exciting an experience. I still highly recommend it nonetheless.

A Must For Thai Food Lovers. Excellent instructor who speak fluent English. Learn Thai cooking through market visit, local ingredient and seasoning plus Thai ways of food preparations. Cook your own tom yum goong, pad Thai, green curry, mango sticky rice and etc. Special price for Malaysian because the owners is also a Malaysian. Classroom is nicely decorated with special locker for everyone. Definitely worthwhile

Absolutely Awesome!. If you are in Bangkok and searching for a quality, authentic cooking class, then look no further. This class is a must do! Our teacher ('Tang') was absolutely lovely and went out of her way to make sure everyone was enjoying themselves. We even got to do a trip to the local market before our class. Highly recommended and thanks again for a great afternoon!

Fun cooking class! . Despite my fear of having to actually make something edible, koong and the others at silom cooking class made it a fun and educational experience! This is a casual cooking class focused on fun and basic knowledge of the dishes. Aspiring Asian cuisine masterchefs look elsewhere. Food preparation is already done beautifully for you and getting to eat your own creations? Awesome.

Really worthwhile. We did a class a month ago and having now travelled throughout Thailand we have to say it was the best food we had throughout our trip. Our teacher was lovely & made adaptations to accommodate my nut allergy & my partner's vegetarianism. Nice environment. Loved the cook book to take away. You sit on the floor for a lot of it so dress accordingly & maybe contact them beforehand if you have a back problem. The market tour aspect was the only thing that could be improved. It wasn't a working market which makes it a lot easier for the teacher to talk to you about the ingredients but I'd liked to have found out how to buy things and for what price in a real market.

Best Cooking Class I've Taken. I had a wonderful time during my cooking class. Our instructor, Tang, was very engaging and funny, and made the class really fun. She was very knowledgable and answered all of our questions. The recipes were delicious, and we received a really nice recipe booklet at the end of the class that included not only the recipes that we cooked in class, but also lots of other recipes and information about Thai ingredients.I travel frequently and have taken several cooking classes in different places, and this is the one that I've enjoyed the most. And it's a great deal--only 30 baht for six recipes! I highly recommend this cooking school.

A great evenings experience. We attended an evening class. This trip does not include a market visit, but you are mass aware of this during booking. The class itself was excellent and Oat, our teacher, was brilliant. He explained about all the different Thai ingredients and was great fun. Some dishes we made individually and others, like the green curry paste, we made as a group, such was a great laugh. Water and a cola was provided in the dining room and at the end of the evening we got a very good quality recipe book too.The only reason for the missing 5th star was the slightly scary arrival! We found our way to the school, thanks to the maps and signs provided in the booking email, but on arrival and with very little explanation, were told to get onto the back of the waiting mopeds who then drive us off, without explaining where we were going or why. It turns out there had just been a slight mix up regarding group numbers and the school were very aplogetic and we didn't miss anything, but as a new visitor to Thailand, moped rides to unknown destinations werent top of the agenda!

A very well-thought out and delicious experience!. I had a fabulous time with the tiny exception of the meeting at the train station. It took a while for our chef to call back and forth to the office to figure out exactly how many people we were supposed to have, and they decided to give us BTS train tickets to another studio a couple stops away at Sathorn (same company, just another location because the Silom studio was full) - it was fine because they paid for our tickets but I was a bit annoyed because I had actually just come from the Sathorn station so it was a waste of time and money.As soon as we got to the cooking location at Sathorn, though, everything was friendly and wonderfully well-planned and executed. There were separate areas for eating, prepping ingredients, and cooking. For example, we prepped our ingredients for pad thai, then we went upstairs to individual woks and burners, cooked our food, and went downstairs to eat. When we were ready to make the next course, the green curry, we went back to the prep area and saw the staff had already cleaned our stations and knives and set the ingredients for green curry on the table. When we went upstairs to cook, the staff had also cleaned our woks and spatulas so that we were ready to make the curry. It was really a well-oiled machine.Aey was an awesome teacher who was energetic and funny and really communicated great knowledge and passion about food. We had done an evening class which is a bit cheaper but omits a trip to the market for shopping, and as a substitute, Aey had laid out beautiful arrangements of the ingredients and taught us about their different uses and origins and let us smell each unique herb. She also used our cameras to take pictures of us at various points during the class, which was great.The food we prepared was truly excellent - some of it was even better than what I had experienced at home (my parents are Thai) or in Bangkok. Tom yum goong was one favorite - the flavor was amazing and I actually feel like the recipe was easy enough to execute at home. The green curry with freshly-made paste was incredible, as I've had delicious green curry before, but the fresh paste flavor was something new and bright and divine. It had a ton of ingredients, but fortunately we got a recipe book to take home, so perhaps I'll give it a shot again :)This cooking school is a great value, very educational, and very yummy! I can't believe I ate everything I made!! I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this.

Solid introduction to Thai cooking. I've done two and half cooking classes at Silom. I've enjoyed my time here and liked interacting with the staff. What to expect.... One or two students will always show up late, so the group will probably leave without them. Next, a market tour. It's briefer, but you can see, and buy, some of the vegetables you'll use later in the class.Then you will go to the school and begin preparing dishes. There are 3 rooms you'll use. One is for sitting and eating, another is for food prep and finally there is room where you'll be cooking. The cooking room is more like a hallway and all the skillets will be set up in a row. The instructors will take you through 5 dishes in a normal class, but I have opted to take some private time with instructors to learn dished not taught in the class. You have this option, if you are willing pay extra. Out of the 5 dishes, you will really study 3 hard. The other two dished will be heavily assisted by the staff.After cooking each dish, you will retire to the first room to eat. So you'll be prepping, cooking and then eating. Repeat, repeat, repeat.... The entire class will work together to mash ingredients in a mortar. This will probably be for a curry. At the end of the class, you will get a nice color booklet with the dished you learned, and lots more. If you like the dishes you cooked, I recommend asking the staff to direct you to the closest super market. Buy the harder to find ingredients. The class will be fine for people with little cooking experience. Most advanced students will probably enjoy as well. Definitely an enjoyable afternoon in Bkk. Maybe, like me, you'll develop a skill for cooking Thai food and impress your friends back home ;)

I cooked a 5 Course Thai Meal!!. Had a great time going to market and picking out all our fresh ingredients at the local market, basil, curry, peppers, shrimp, etc. Then went to class and learned how to season and prepare each dish, finally cooking, then eating each dish! The best cooking school!! A must when visiting Bangkok.

Excellent Introduction to Bangkok!. Silom Thai cooking school thought of everything. The 5th star is for all of the details. Not only do you learn how to cook a traditional Thai meal but it tastes amazing, and you learn a bit about the Thai culture. Chef Aye taught use what to purchase at the market, the differences between the unique Thai ingredients and how to cook a delicious meal. The cost of this experience was unbelievably reasonable. We will definitely be returning for another cooking course.

Great experience. This was a well organized and informative class. From the moment Aey meet the group at the Skytrain Station she had everything under control. She showed us how to ensure you are buying fresh sea food and fruit and vegetables, explained the importance of the proper heat and cooking oil and how make your own curry paste. The classroom are clean and well organized. It was a great experience from start to the last mouthful of mango and sticky rice desert.

Enjoyable night. we took the monday evening class, 900baht per person, we were late, so didnt catch up with the guide to school, but it was easy to find with the instruction email sent to us (10 mins walk from BTS). it was great and fun.the tutor was a funny guy, we all enjoy the food that we cooked for ourselves! a cook book will be given at the end of the class. thumbs up!

Fun experience!. Me and my husband booked this cooking class at the last minute. The teacher spoke fluent English, explained each ingredient and dish and detail and was very friendly and funny. She also provided alternative ingredients for those we may not be able to find in Canada, as well as a recipe book. We made 5 dishes: Tom Yum Soup, Masaman Curry, Pad Thai, Papaya Salad and Mango/Sticky Rice. The food was great and the overall experience was really fun! One note - the school can be a bit confusing to find as it's hidden in an alley way. Make sure to give yourself enough time to find it!

Love It. I participated in a morning class to learn to cook five traditional Thai dishes. The instructor brought me to a local market where to buy main ingredients for cooking. The classroom was tiny and clean. They provided locker for all participants to store personal belongings during the class, which made everyone more convenient. Although instructor Tan is young, she has very knowledge in Thai food and its background. I highly recommend this cooking school to everyone.

Great for cooks and non-cooks. The class was easy enough for those who don't cook, yet there was enough information on Thai cooking tips that those who can cook can leave thinking that they've learned a lot to bring home. Suggestion - go to the class with an empty stomach as you will be eating a lot of fresh and delicious food and probably the most delicious you will eat during your trip in Thailand.

Best memory from Thailand. This was one of my favorite things that we did in Thailand. It's a great price and a really fun, half day activity. The staff are so great and knowledgeable and fun. The cookbook with recipes is a great touch.

Excellent values, delicious food!. We booked this class after learning that our first choice (at another school) was full and I honestly can't think of any way in which the class could have been better! They were very organised, communicated well (in advance and on the day), the instructuon was good, the place was clean, the staff were friendly and funny and the food was amazing. They even made substitutions for my sister and I who have food restrictions - we enjoyed ourselves and came away with happy tummies! If you are in Bangkok and want to learn some Thai cooking in a fun and entertaining way, check out Silom Thai Cooking School!

Small Classes.... Big Experience. Have been to this cooking class twice, and came away both times with lots of new information .The instructors were very gracious , and "patient".... Would recommend this experience to anyone new to Thai cooking.

Average. We were promised to prepare 5 dishes. Although all dishes tasted nice, we did not get the time to make all dishes ourselves. Instead, the school did a lot for us and we had the feeling that they were a bit in a hurry. In addition, we had to eat the meals quickly as we had to go on to the next dish. For the dessert, we did not have to do anything; the school prepared everything. We have been in another class in Chang Mai as well, which was better and more personal.

A fun and filling morning. We had a great time with Tang learning more about Thai cooking and ingredients. The market tour was interesting and we got to touch and smell all the different veges used in thai cooking, they have so many different types of eggplant!!We also got to make coconut cream and milk, I had no idea it would be so easy! We did some preparation but other easier things were done for us so it didn't feel like a lot of work either. Everything we had was the best I'd tasted in Thailand, especially the green curry, so fresh and tasty!!I was absolutely stuffed by the time we left!!We also picked up a couple of wok stirrers made from coconut shells which were the same as we used in class. These were a steal at 50 baht each so definitely ask about them.

Fantastic way to learn Thai cooking. On my last day in Bangkok I needed to kill an afternoon before flying home, and this certainly entertained me for hours! Firstly visiting the market, we were introduced to new ingredients. We then went to the school and began our course. Both the lady who introduced the afternoon, and our chef, Oat, spoke fantastic English and were a great laugh. We learnt to cook 5 different meals (eating all of them as you go, so don't eat before!!) and came away with a recipe book which saved having to write anything down during the afternoon. I would recommend this to anyone, of any ability in cooking. As a lone traveler it's also a great way to meet new people and hang around with them afterwards - food always brings people together!

fun!. Definitely recommend. Was so much fun. The market experience was really not much of a shopping experience, as everything was pre-purchased before our arrival, but I was okay with that. Our teacher was knowledgeable, engaging and a delight to learn from. The facilities were new and clean. The cooking process was great fun, and the food we ate was the best Thai I've had over the years (probably due to no MSG). The only thing I was not so happy about, was how close we were placed next to each other at the cooking stations - too crowded. So close, actually, that when we were frying the eggs for the pad thai, the oil from my neighbor kept splattering a bit up my hand and arm - nothing serious, but did sting a wee bit. More space between cooking stations would be appreciated. Aside from that, a most enjoyable experience. Would sign up for another class on next visit, but for a different menu of course.

Highly recommend this cooking class!. What can we say. This was one of the highlights of our trip. We had the best of time going to the market, meeting new people, learning more about Thai cuisine including preparation, ingredients and how to cook each item. If you are looking for something unique to do in Bangkok, do consider this!

Good value for money but too much rush. It´s in a typical Thai newbourhood, the welcoming was nice organized. I was a bit disappointed that the market tour was in such a rush and we really didn't learn too much about the market itself.The cooking was also a bit fast made, but the lady knew what she was doing. I wished they would have explained more about the origin of the food, and would have also only used local ingridients (the potato for example which they used is from Peru).Anyway, was a nice day in BKK and the food was great.

Without a doubt, one of the highlights of our trip!. My fiancee and I were in Thailand for a 13 day tour around the country, and we began our trip by taking a class with Silom Thai cooking school on the first afternoon of our arrival in Bangkok. Beginning our trip with this class turned out to be an amazing way to begin our trip. The chance to visit the market and then prepare 5 different dishes helped us develop a thorough understanding of Thai cuisine, and it allowed us to enjoy even more each and every meal we shared for the rest of our trip, as we better understood the ingredients, preparation and presentation that was put before us, whether we were eating in a fancy restaurant or from a roadside food cart in a market. The school itself is very well organized, there was great communication with them from the moment that we made our first inquiry and right through the entire booking process, and we recieved an email with very detailed directions that made finding the RV very simple. Our chef was Koong, an enthusiastic and talented lady that was proud to teach our group of 8 about the cuisine of this beautiful country. We began with a very informative trip to the market where we learned so much, and then after a short walk, we got down to business, and Koong led us through the preparation of a soup, salad, Pad Thai, Green Chicken Curry, and Mango with sticky rice. We were coached through the preparation of each dish, using traditional methods and pure fresh ingredients, and then went outside to the woks to prepare each dish under Koongs careful guidance. The highlight was getting to eat each of our creations, so my one piece of advice is to arrive hungry, as you will get a chance to eat alot of great food.  The school itself is clean and very well setup and organized. A nice room with tables to eat, with lockers to store your possessions, and a great classroom where we sat on the floor and prepared our ingredients before heading outside to cook on the line of woks. All of the staff was friendly, helpful and very knowledgeable, and I can say without any doubt that when we are back in Bangkok we will once again be visiting this great school to learn more about cooking this suculent cuisine. We even left the class with a great Thai cookbook, full of great information, and since coming home have purchased a wok and found a local store that stocks most of the Thai ingredients, and are continuing to practice all that we learned from this great school.  Highly recommended and without a doubt, one of the highlights of our trip.

perfect morning !. such a crazy morning ! We were with TAN, very nice thai girl who is chef, we make the market with her, and she explain everything very well, we met others people who were nice as well, i really, WE really enjoy ! thank you !

Silom Thai Cooking School was a highlight of our trip!. A friend from Hong Kong was keen on joining a cooking class and chose The Silom Thai Cooking Class for an evening course. It truly has been one of the highlights of our stay here in Bangkok. Chef Oat is a wonderful instructor. He has a terrific personality with a lovely sense of humor, is generous and so knowledgeable about Thai cooking and ingredients. I highly recommend learning to cook Thai food from Chef Oat at the Silom Thai Cooking School. Even if you are not much of a cook, you will enjoy the experience. Since we will be in Bangkok for a few more weeks, I plan on returning to learn more about Thai cooking.

Food is the key. We love food, we took an streetfood tour earlier, but this was the top.I don't belong in the kitchen at all, so this was a surprise!I am able to cook my own thai meals now, like noodles and soup, and take a bit from Thailand into my kitchen!What a lovely day!

A Great New Experience. We’ve been to Bangkok for so many times, normally just focus on shopping, massage and spa. So we decided to do something special this time, we finally made a good and right choice by joining an interesting Thai cooking class. Since I am not very keen on cooking, but just want to gain a new experience, so in view of the price and location, we picked the “Silom Thai Cooking School” and made an on-line booking, that was very easy and user friendly indeed with quick reply and clear instruction. They arrange 3 sessions per day, i.e. morning, afternoon and evening. We choose an evening session and it was awesome and full of fun. The class size was just good, only 8 people per class so that the chef can notice and respond to everyone’s need. Actually, special thanks to our teacher Koong, a very nice chef and she speaks very good English, so that her explanation and instruction was very clear, also she made the class very entertaining as well.

The highlight of my trip to BKK. I took a cooking class with the Silom Thai Cooking School on a whim and it ended up being the highlight of my trip. I chose it because it was the only school that I could find that offered night classes so I skipped the market portion and joined at 6PM and was SO glad I did. The instructor, Oat, made the whole experience. He was profesisonal, curteous and, most of all, hilarious! Loved him! The entire set up was done brilliantly with a lot of prep done ahead of time but not too much so that you didn't feel like you weren't actually cooking the meals. Everything was explained in detail and you felt like you couldn't fail. Eating all of the delicious dishes was the best part! They even provide you with a full cook book after the class so that you don't have to worry about taking notes during the class. The place is a bit hard to find so give yourself extra time to get there. You won't regret going!

Great cooking class. This was my third visit to Bangkok. Previously, I took a Thai cooking class at a hotel. While I learned a lot at the other class, I thoroughly enjoyed my experience with Silom Thai Cooking School.Our instructor was friendly, knowledgable and quite funny. We took a tour of a local market. We learned tips for picking out seafood and various vegetables. The class was divided into different "phases" for each dish. First, we would sit on the floor in one room and prepare the ingredients. I learned a few food prep techniques (juicing limes, shredding limes leaves, etc). Then, we would take our ingredients and carry them to our woks. After spending a few minutes cooking, we would proceed to the dining room to eat our meal. After eating, we would return to the food prep area to begin the next lesson. For 1000 baht, we prepared five dishes. Our class was relatively small with eight students. At the end of the lesson, we were completely full. The food was delicious. Definitely a highlight of our trip.

a lovely taste of Thai culture. This was More than a cooking class. it was more of an introduction to Thai culture.A great opportunity to get to know the people. I find the best way to get to know people is to eat with them. Our chef, as well as a world of eclectic participants made this a fun afternoon.We walked to the market together discovered wonderful fresh fruits and vegetables to bring back to the school. We then began to prepare and learn the history behind our recipes.We then sat together to enjoy the flavours! Yum yum!A special thanks to Kong ....she was simply "Fabulas"

Great experience. My boyfriend and I took an afternoon class with the school and thoroughly enjoyed the whole experience. We were 1st taken to the market and had a chance to see what different ingredients go into the meals we were cooking that day then back to the school to start. There was another class alongside us which was nice as the communal dining room was a chance to see what the other group created. Our chef Gigi was very informative and explained all the different steps of making each meal giving us the chance to participate as a group. By the end of 5 courses I was very satisfied and ready for bed. The course is very worth the 1000 bhat price and I’d recommend it to anyone both novice and experienced.

Excellent. Silom cooking school was wonderful. Highly recommended. I dint usually write reviews, but I can not recommend this experience enough. The hotel I was staying with recommended another program. I did my research and pucked Silom. I am so glad I did. It was less than half the price, fun, and absolutely excellent. I would take a second class if time permitted. O
