Perfect!. Everything went smoothly, from the market tour to the cooking class. We learned how to make pad thai, spring rolls, green papaya salad, massaman chicken and mango sticky rice. We ate the dishes after we made them so go with an empty stomach, cause it's a lot of food!Our chef was nice and friendly and we had a great group of people from different countries.

Great experience. What a great place to end the holiday. Although I would advise to take this class as soon as possible simply because it is great fun and you actually learn a lot about what you will be eating during your stay in Thailand.The quality of the food was excellent, our instructor Tang was very funny, gave a lot of information about the menu and ingredients and her English was perfect. After the course we even received a small book with a ton of recipes so we could try and recreate this beautiful food at home!

Best Cooking Class in Bangkok!. This was the best cooking class I could find in bangkok. Best class for your money. Did the Friday evening class which featured a five course meal. The food we made here was the best I had during my whole time in Thailand. The instructor was friendly and very informative and we all had a great time! Many people in the class were repeat customers! Would definitely come back!

Love thai food. Since we were eating thai food everyday, and loved it so much, we contacted the cooking school last minute, and they were able to fit us in.We went out shopping for our own ingredients and we were able to prepare our own dish in less than half an hour.An experience richer, and we've learned something new!Very fun for all, and certainly a go for the thai food lover!

Awesome class!. My boyfriend and I have just finished an evening class with Tang, and both came out raving about how great it was and what a wonderful teacher Tang was (informative, friendly, funny!) fWe made pad Thai, massaman paste, massaman curry, papaya salad, spring rolls and finished off with a mango sticky rice - and we got to eat each dish we made too! It's fair to say that we left with very full bellies, as well as a cook book each. I would highly recommend this course, and it's such good value for money too. Thanks guys!!

Great Cooking Class hidden away on a Silom Soi.. We had a wonderful culinary experience at Silom Thai Cooking School. Our teacher Goong was a wonderful teacher. She took as to a nearby market to buy the foods that we would need to make the courses, and we proceeded to make 5 courses. Most of the students packed up the extras to take home...Not my travel companion and I! We ate it all!!! Delicious, educational and fun! They included a cookbook to take home to try at home.This is the kind of experience I like to take home from my travels.

Best Thai Food and Great Experience. We've been in Bangkok for four months for work and we eat out almost every night as we're living in a hotel. We try new restaurants all the time and my boyfriend and I agree that the five dishes we made in the Monday night, 3 hour, level I cooking class were by far the best Thai dishes we've tasted in Bangkok... and we made them ourselves! The class had great instruction, it was paced very nicely so that the evening never dragged on. I was tired at the class as I had been working all day but I had fun and was entertained the whole time. We can't recommend this experience enough.
Great Taste. Very good experience, we had a blast. The food was great the class was in english. The price was perfect! Highly Recommended!

Best experience in Bangkok!. This experience is truly superb. My husband and I visited to get a taste of authentic Thai and how to prepare it at home. What an exciting way to spend the morning. And the food you create is fantastic, I couldn't believe it came from our hands! Oat was our instructor. Not only was he so entertaining, but was also incredibly informative. We are vegetarian, but they were so accommodating to everyone's needs. We prepared Tom yum soup, mango sticky rice, pad thai, green curry and Penang curry. One more delicious then the next. They also provide you with a small cook booklet with all the recipes so you can share the experience at home with your friends. Truly the best day we had in Bangkok. Thank you silom cooking school!

My 3rd Lesson. Interactive lessons and rewarding a experience as usual. You get a certificate and a discount on completion of your 3rd lesson. Aoe is a superb teacher and has varied her Thai dishes to accommodate me with each lesson. I highly recommend this cooking school in the Silom district.

Something for a change: thai cooking is fun. We are a family of 3 trying out a new experience in thai cooking instead of the normal shopping trip in bangkok. We booked through email with prompt reply and details on the meeting point.We choose the Wednesday am slot on 19 nov 14. Our chef "shrimp" brought us for a market tour where she introduce the ingredients that we are going to use for our dishes, and some of the unique vegetables found in Thailand.With our marketing basket filled with ingredients, we took a stroll back to the school and start our lessons. We cooked green papaya salad, mussaman curry, mango with sticky rice, pad thai sai kai and spring roll. They accommodated our request for an extra dish, red rubies with a small fee (prebooked through email as they need to prepare the coconut). Our chef is cheerful and makes our lesson fun. To our surprise, she is also able to name some of the ingredients in mandarin. We enjoyed our lesson and foods. The only dish which I dislike is the mussaman curry which we prefer our sg style curry.Overall, it is an enjoyable experience and a very full stomach filled with delicious foods cooked by ourselves.

Great experience! Must do in bkk. The good:- very affordable compared to some other cooking schools- we made 5 dishes! - you get a lot of food! enough to take some home- approachable instructor with good English - class progresses at a good pace, not too fast and not too slow- easy to find; 10min walk from a BTS station- they give you a recipe book at the endThe not so good:- you prep on the ground, can get uncomfortable The food we made was delicious and we can't wait to apply what we've learned when we get home!

A great starter class. Very affordable, accessible, friendly.. While visiting Thailand, I most definitely wanted to take a Thai cooking class. There are many good cooking schools in Bangkok, and I chose Silom Thai based on reviews. I was very happy with the results. the class was easy to book. I simple sent an email inquiring about availability. I heard back relatively quickly and then all I needed to do was confirm that I understood the instructions on how to get to the meeting spot, and that I was indeed going to attend. Payment is made at the end of class and is 1000 Baht, which is a very affordable price to cooking classes. The meeting spot was quite easy to reach from the Sky Train (BTS) station. It was a full class today and everyone was very friendly. Our instructor Goong met us and took us to the market where she gave us a short introduction to Thai herbs and vegetables. We toured the market further and bough ingredients for the five dishes we would make. We got to see the stand where they grind coconut to use for making fresh coconut milk and cream, some lovely seafood stalls, and other assorted stalls. My only regret is that I didn't ask more questions while at the market. After the tour we walk to the school, and start prepping. We started by making fresh coconut milk from the ground coconut we bought, and Goong explained how we would steam the sticky rice for the desert dish. After that we all started prepping for the fist course. Hot and Sour shrimp soup. At this point, I should note that we prepare the food communally on the floor. If you have trouble sitting on floor for long periods of time or trouble getting up off the ground, this could be uncomfortable to you. They do provide cushions and a short stool if you need one. After prepping the ingredients, we step outside to the gas stoves and start cooking. Then we take our dish to the dining area and enjoy. We repeat this process for the next 3 dishes. And the final dish, dessert is served after we finish our fourth dish. If you are looking for a class that you prepare everything from start to finish with no guidance, this is not the class you are looking for. But in my opinion the real value here is the knowledge of the instructor. Take advantage of it and ask questions and Enjoy!

Great Fun and Affordable Class. They have ruined Pad Thai for us!! After the class, we cant bring ourselves to have Pad Thai elsewhere as the one we cooked in class was delicious! It's a good thing we now know how to cook it ourselves now!Ms. Aye was very funny and knowledgable. We first went to the market where she taught us about common thai ingredients and alternatives to ingredients which may not be available elsewhere. She was meticulous and engaging and kept everyone's interest throughout the class. We prepared Tom Yum Goong, Pad Thai, Panang Curry Chicken, Green Curry Chicken and had mango with sticky rice. They were all delicious!The classes were well organised and Ms. Aye spoke good English. We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves and loved the food we cooked.

Great course and affordable!. Very good staff that speak excellent English. Learnt a lot of recipes and many good tricks to do them properly. Very good price. Only 1000 bath for 5 courses and a trip to the market. A very nice introduction to the Thai kitchen. We had a really fun day. Will go back next weekend for the next level class.

The context is good but a bit commercial!. I like Thai food and joined a similar cooking class in Chiang Mai.May be Bangkok as a big city, the pace of walk is much faster than in Chaing Mai.I found that this class is very rush, from the market tour to finish the five dishes. The teacher is rushing. I couldn't feel the teacher really like or enjoy cooking. It is only a job.If you like to cook Thai food, it will be better for you to find a place which can allow you to slow down your pace of walk and enjoy cooking and learning the culture.

Amazing Thai cooking class at reasonable cost. This 5 courses meal cooking class is amazing. I learned a lot of different vegetables and herbs that are unique to Thai cuisine during the market trip. The tutor, Ms Goong, made the cooking class very lively and funny. What an enjoyable learning experience!P.S. As we need to sit on the floor (with chusion) to prepare our dishes, it may pose some difficulty to those who are not used to.

Most delcious food we ate the whole trip. We thoroughly enjoyed our experience with the Silom Thai Cooking school. We loved that we were educated on Thai cuisine while getting to go to the market to pick out our food. Our teacher spoke great English and was clearly passionate about teaching. My husband and I agree that the meal we made at the cooking school was the best we had during our 2 week trip through Thailand.

Best cooking class in Bangkok, no doubt. We have lived in Bangkok for almost 9 months now and I have taken two classes with the Silom Thai Cooking school. They are really amazing. For 1000 bahts (much cheaper than other schools) they start giving you a basket with a bottle of water and taking you to the market. I live in the neighbourhood and I assure this is a real Thai fresh market where everybody does their daily shopping. The introduction on Thai vegetables is fantastic (and necessary!) and after that you go back to school where you have a nice air-conditioned waiting lounge and the cooking preparation room. The actual cooking takes place at the stove at the balcony. You do get to chop, clean, pound and cook almost everything and you eat every dish as you finish cooking it. Teachers speak amazingly good English and are hilarious and very entertaining. Your three hours fly by and you wish you could start all over again. The food is some of the yummiest I have had in Thailand. First time we cooked Pad Thai, Spring Rolls, Som Tam, Masaman curry and fried banana. The second time, they made sure I cooked different dishes so it was Tom Yum, Fried rice, Fruit salad, Red curry, Sweet mango with sticky riceWithout a doubt, a must do in Bangkok and an amazing time :)

A Delicious Afternoon!. We didn't really know what to expect going in to this, but out of the many options we decided to go with Silom. We found this to be a great value class. The "market trip" seems to be a market set up specifically for cooking schools in the area, which is still nice as your chef tells you about each ingredient you'll be using. We really liked our chef but we could also see and hear the other chef and she seemed to be just as great and funny! Great group of people running the place!Here's our blog post about the day with our photos :) http://oywir.com/2014/10/silom-cooking-school/

Must do activity in Bangkok. There are many Thai cooking schools around town. But this one is fantastic!Your teacher first takes you to the market to explain some of the unique local ingredients and what they are used for. Then after a short walk you go to their "school" where you alternate between cooking and eating. We prepared 4 courses (Tom Yum Soup, Phad Thai, Green Curry and of course desert). The staff was so well organized that it didn't even feel like work.The preparation for each course was entertaining due to a friendly, charismatic teacher, who spoke (and joked) in perfect English. Not only did he show you how to make things, he also explained what substitute ingredients to use if the local Thai ingredient is not available where you live. Overall, it was a great experience and a highlight of our trip!

what an experience. the whole morning was just amazing. we got taken first to a local market to learn about the thai ingredience we all were provided with water as we were walking around.we then were introduced to our chef who was lovely and spoke very good english. all the food we made we ate. thouroughly enjoyable. i would definatly go back again. learnt so much as we got a cooking book at the end of what we made and reciepies to try ourselves.

Quick but perfect. After comparing the prices for the cooking classes in Bangkok, I somewhat expected Silom Thai Cooking School to be mediocre, but for a mere 1000 baht you get the complete package. You start with a quick trip to the market (which is actually just a small place across the street where they have all the ingredients that are frequently used in Thai cooking, but you don't need anything more) and after that you return to make a whopping six dishes in a couple of hours. Our instructor Coong was not only hilarious, but also very fluent in English and she even spoke a few words Dutch. The rest of the team is great as well. After the class you even get a small booklet to take home with you. If you like Thai cooking or even just Thai food, this is the place for you!

highly recommended for those who want to learn thai food cooking. teacher Noom handled the class very well, no dull moments, the recipes we cook were much tastier and delicious compared to what we ordered in the restaurants. Made some friends, the class was superb!!!

Fantastic experience! A must do in Thailand!. We chose this school from an overwhelming array of cooking schools online. Silom stood out mainly for the weekly menu and very reasonable pricing point. The class went beyond my expectations.Pros:- Very well organised with the timing and flow of each dish.- Funny and lovely teachers (we had Chef Tang who was new but was guided by Chef Aey)- Facilites were very clean and tidy.- I really liked the set up when we were all at the stoves cooking. The teachers were able to inspect each person's progress very quickly and easily.- Each person gets to cook their own dish so it's very hands on.- We all received a lovely recipe booklet at the end.- All 5 dishes were absolutely delicious!Cons:- Only one. Prep was done on the floor. Although it was very clean and I didn't have a problem with it, I noticed that not all students could sit crossed legged on the floor for too long. So for elder potential students, this may pose to be a challenge. Also, if you're wearing a mini skirt...I'm already looking at going back for another class. I highly recommend this cooking school!

Best thing we did.. My partner and I recently went to Silom Thai cooking school for a lunch time session. As beginners we cooked Tom Yam, Pad Thai, Massaman curry paste and then made a curry with it, Pappaya salad and mango sticky rice. The food was amazing and our chef 'A' was entertaining. You also get given a recipe book at the end of the day so you can recreate the food back at home. It is our stand out day from our entire Thailand trip. The sessions do different items per day and then increase in difficulty the more times you go, honestly i'd go to all the sessions if I had enough days. Great day.

Fun must do value activity in Bangkok. Silom Thai Cooking School's introductory course provided one of the best hands on introduction to cooking Thai at home.Our instructor Gee was friendly, funny, and extremely knowledgeable about cooking Thai food. The market tour and introduction was most helpful - she explained the differences between the various herbs, and vegetables that give Thai food that distinctive aroma and taste.We learned to cook 5 different dishes plus green curry paste, which I thoroughly enjoyed. We had a tasting of every dish we cooked, each of which turned out absolutely delicious. Highly advise to take a late breakfast or a very little lunch as we ate everything we cooked, leaving me very full towards the end of the class.

Exceptional. I cannot recommend this enough! What an amazing and unique experience. I visited Silom cooking school with a friend for the 6pm session recently. We learnt to cook 6, very amazing dishes & learnt about the ingredients & methods which will make it easy to take what we learnt home & cook Thai food! The class size was 6 people which was great as it's very personal & you feel really involved. You cook the dishes & then get to eat them in the restaurant room next door. The food was amazing, as was the teaching & they made it so much fun. You also get to take away a recipe book included in the trip. The course lasted 3 hours & they run 3 times a day. Please find the time to do this, you will not regret it!

Lovely !. We did the beginner class in Silom Cooking School with Chef Non being our teacher. Unlike rest of cooking school, we were fascinated by the market coaching trip which was unforgettable. At the end of the lesson, we were well entertained, educated and enjoyed a sumptuous 5 course thai cuisines. Simply say, we loved it and would highly recommend it:)

Value for money Cooking lesson. Great experience overall. We booked the class only one day in advance and got the afternoon session. We got to go to a local market to pick up fresh ingredients (although it was mostly for illustration purpose). The instructor led the group to the school which is quite hard to locate on your own. Four courses meal were taught - just as advertised, the instructor was really funny and friendly. Got to taste your food afterwards. They also gave you a nice cook book with lots of interesting recipes. Highly recommended for a authentic experience to Thais cuisine

What a great afternoon!. Had a great afternoon cooking at Silom Thai.Booking was easy and joining instructions were very clear.The staff were good fun from the visit to the market right through all the prep and cooking.Loved all the dishes that we cooked and then ate. I had booked my husband and 13 yr old dughter too and they were somewhat unsure that thy would enjoy it but all of us agreed that it was a really enjoyable afternoon

Lots of fun and delicious. Taking a cooking class was one of the best things I did in Bangkok. My favorite thing was the trip to the market were the teacher told us a lot about thai food. The cooking afterwards was great too. Good atmosphere and delicious food.

Lots of fun and lots of great food!. My boyfriend and I knew that we wanted to try a cooking school while we were in Bangkok and we used TA to help us find one. Silom Thai Cooking School gets a lot of great reviews and looked to be exactly the experience we wanted. We definitely weren’t disappointed! After booking the wrong date initially we realised that the date we wanted was full, however the school opened up the same night that we were corresponding with them especially for us! They went over and above to ensure we got the evening we expected, it was excellent!Our teacher Jay brought so much fun and enthusiasm to the class. He met us at the BTS station and walked us to the school. Straight away he was very friendly and we could tell he was passionate about cooking Thai food. When we got to the school Jay taught us about Thai ingredients and showed us how to prepare them before helping us cook our own Thai food. He is a very skilled chef. The menu is excellent; there is so much food and a lot of different dishes so you definitely get your moneys worth!The first dish we made was Tom Yum Goong (spicy sour shrimp soup) followed by Pad Thai (fried noodle). Then we made Pha-neang Nuea (Pha-neang curry with chicken) and green curry paste to go in our Geang Khew-wan Gai (green curry with chicken). Because you cook the dishes yourself they can be seasoned to your own taste, which is good because I’m not very good with a lot of spice. My personal favourites were the Tom Yum Goong and the Pad Thai, although they were all really good. Dessert was Khao Neow Ma-muang (sweet sticky rice with mango), which was also delicious.Silom Thai Cooking School is one of the best things we did in Bangkok and I would definitely recommend it to anyone who is looking for a fun, cultural experience with some great people in a fantastic city.
My second lesson. My second lesson was just as enjoyable as the first. Ms A's class was educational and entertaining. I can't wait for my third lesson which will only cost 400 baht.

Hugely enjoyable!!!. I've visited the other thai cooking school (Bai Pai) twice before and tried Silom Thai out for the first time this trip, and I can only ask myself why I didn't come here earlier. Our teacher, Non, was entertaining, very easy to chat with, and makes the entire class interesting and highly comprehensive. You really get down and dirty with handling all the ingredients yourself, and you are taught how to deal with the ingredients from the very basic. Will definitely be back to try out the different classes. Thanks for being the highlight of the trip!

Great fun, great food, great staff!. I chose to book Silom cooking school for me and a friend after reading other reviews on TA and we weren't disappointed. Even before arriving in Thailand, the service was fantastic - great correspondence from My and she kept us well organised! Non, our chef, took us around the market and talked us through the ingredients we needed for our dishes and how these differed from what we would find elsewhere in the world... The general rule is that everything is smaller in Thailand! We all had a chance to contribute, create the dishes and enjoy them all together. There were 8 of us in our group, a range of nationalities, which allowed us to interact. Non was absolutely fantastic, so enthusiastic and funny - really made the class what it was! I would love to return one day to learn a range of other dishes.

So much fun. I joined the cooking class early morning session myself and really enjoyed it. The cooking class starts with a wet market tour where the chef introduced the Various Thai ingredients to give us an initial idea of Thai cuisine. Then we came back to the school and prepared to get started on the real cooking. My teacher Ms A is a very lovely and funny lady with a great sense of humour which makes the four-hour cooking journey filled with laughter and fun. What impressed me the most is the teacher will always walk us through the ingredients first then share the key cooking techniques before we get our hands dirty. The cooking class really triggered my love for Thai food, I can't wait to try to home-cook a few Thai food when back home.
Great. We enjoyed this cooking class very muuch because we have a great time to get more acknowledge about Thai Food and their culture. Do not miss it!

Best way to spent your 24 hours in Bangkok. As a cabin crew member traveling the world, we only have 24 hours to enjoy amazing Bangkok. In these few hours I spent at the Silom cooking school I really got to experience something typical Thai.You learn, you cook, you eat and you have a lot of fun.Loved our skilled, enthusiastic, happy and fun teacher!Thank you so much again and I hope to see you soon to try some of the other dishes.
Possibly the best part of our visit. If you think you might like this experience, you will love it. Wonderful teachers and a great way to spend a few hours. Highly recommended.

Wonderful cooking experience in Bangkok!! Definitely one of the best in the league.... Our review is really long overdue but definitely we must rate this cooking school. Definitely one of the best in the league!! We booked the cooking class online and everything was stated clearly with different menus of the day (many selections of dishes) and the price is inclusive of return transfer to/from hotel (we met at a meeting point), a tour around the market and getting to know the types of ingredients that will be used in every single dish that will be cooked later and is really worth it! Learning to cook 5 different dishes and eating it right after was fun! Best part is that, everything was taught from scratch and we had to do everything including washing, cleaning, cutting up the ingredients and cook and transform it into beautiful, delicious, tasty dishes!! The stations were very clean, organized and the chef is fun and engaged with all of the participants. No regrets joining this!!

interesting, happy and fruitful experience. my friend and i tried this cooking school for 2 reasons: 1. good reputation, 2. cheap. first of all, what impresses me is their service, the reception lady is very responsible to send us maps and meet-up details. the chef bought us to wet market and told us the little skills to cook thai food. we cooked and had one soup, one salad, one dessert and two main dishes in the morning. it was a totally fun n interesting experience to learn what to buy and how to cook original thai food in a simple n easy way. we enjoyed it a lot!

DIY cuisine restaurant!. It is more like a DIY cuisine restaurant, NOT cooking class. Making Thai food was a good experience but it definitely using fresh and high-quality ingridient for every cooking class so the dishes were really awesome. You gotta try this. I gonna do it again, when i have a chane to come here.

What a Fun Thing To Do.. I have actually booked a Thai cooking class at this establishment two times. Once was March of this year. Then again today. If you are interested in Thailand cooking at all and are looking for something to do while in Bangkok, this is well worth the time. Both times we cooked 4 items then ate them. First you go to a market to collect most of the items you will need to do the cooking. Because I had been to the class about 6 months ago they took special care to make sure that I made a couple of items that were different from the rest of the class. Then at the end they give you a nice recipe book of the things you make. The instructors are a lot of fun and patient answering any questions you might have.Again if you are looking for something to do while here in Thailand that is very authentic and are interested in food and cooking, this is an excellent class. Tell them Ron recommended it to you.
Fun cooking school. I did this last year. It was a fun cooking experience and we made several dishes including my favorite Pad Thai!

Interesting and Fun. The staff is very very nice: They will teach you the basics on ingredients and how the key components of thai food are prepared and cooked. Very easy to follow, you will have fun for sure. I definitely recommend if you have a afternoon free in Bangkok. Come prepared, because you will eat non stop, and it will taste awesome.

The best. We spent a fantastic afternoon going to a market, and then going to the cookery school to make and eat 5 courses of Thai food. We all (2 adults, 2 teenagers) loved every minute of it. In particular, our teacher Jay was soooo funny we didn't stop laughing. Reading other reviews, most of the teachers they employ are great fun. Recommended.

Engaging!. Animated and friendly instructors who made the cooking session even more fun, despite the fact that I knew no one else. I learnt so much about Thai ingredients, freshness, and Thai cooking that I'm appreciating the culture (and the people) even more! Thank you Aye & Nusi! ( and the silent but hardworking helpers in the background)

Excellent cooking class!! . The class ran we attended ran in the afternoon for aprox 4 hours. We made 5 dishes... All delicious! Oliver, our teacher was friendly, super informative and really funny. He made the afternoon a lot of fun. Definitely worth the money and a great way to spend an afternoon in Bangkok away from all the madness!!

Cooking School with Children. My 10 year old daughter and I had a great experience at Silom Cooking School. Our instructor was Non and he was funny and provided good instruction. We learned how to cook traditional Thai dishes such as pad thai and chicken curry. They did a lot of the prep work of the ingredients beforehand and for some of the dishes (like making the curry paste and frying the bananas), Non did most of the cooking while the students observed. For this reason, I'd say that it is not the place for serious chefs who want to do all the hands on preparation and cooking (hence my 4 star rating), but for me and my daughter, it was perfect. We didn't get too bogged down on chopping and preparing and I was happy to let Non do the deep frying of the bananas and spring rolls. So, if you want to learn the basics of cooking Thai food, not spend too much time prepping and pay a lower price than some of the other schools out there, this is the place for you.

An enjoyable evening. Three stars or four stars? I didn't think it deserved a "very good" but is more than "average". It was a good evening overall. Sanusi the owner is a very friendly and welcoming individual and did everything to make us feel comfortable whilst we waited for a torrential downpour to pass. Situated off Si Lom Road down one of the side roads (No. 11 I think). You pass another cooking school on the right before you get to Silom cooking school so just keep walking and follow the signs. The cooking lesson itself was a little disjointed. Lots of prep already done for you, delivery of the session was pretty slow (mainly due to a German family with two kids who received lots of attention). All of the prep work and "teaching" takes place on the floor, not very comfortable to be honest. Jay, the instructor, seemed to be in a hurry to get somewhere and the "sticky rice and mango" dish was done for us with no input from us and the green curry paste was not brought together enough, the result being a very "rustic" paste with huge chunks of ingredients. The Tom Yum soup tasted fantastic and was by far the stand out dish. Definitely worth a visit and if you book directly you can save money as opposed to booking through a hotel.

Interesting and engaging chef!. The meeting point was easy to find as they give really good directions in the email confirmation. We had Jay as our chef for the day and he took us to the market tour in the morning. He taught us the various thai ingredients and it was really an experience. The market wasn't as dirty as I would imagine too. We walked to the cooking school in about 10 mins. Most of the ingredients are prepared for us already. The students were involved in some basic peeling, cutting and grinding which was just as fun too! We made 1) Tom Yum Gung, 2) Phad Thai, 3) Papaya Salad, 4) Masala Curry, 5) Mango Sticky Rice. All of them are so delicious! Be careful of the small chili, it got into my eye and I can't stop tearing. Horrible! But anyhow, we really enjoyed the class and it is really affordable at only 1000baht per person. We went for the Sunday morning class and there were two classes. Each class has about 8 - 9 pax.

If it's not spicy, it's not Thai food!. I loved it! Great way to spend the afternoon and learn about thai ingredients and food! We cooked 5(!) dishes, the cook was always smiling and having fun with us ("big fire, big fire!!"). We really did all the cooking & preparing ourselves (except the dessert) and got the recipe book at the end. Very professional!

fun and definitively worth doing!. After one or two days in bangkok and all of the sightseeing this is a great way to get to know more about the culture. We learned a lot about the different ingredients which make the thai cuisine so unique. As i loved thai food a lot it was great to have the opportunity to learn how to cook the most famous dishes pad thai, tom yam soup, green curry, minced chicken salad and mango sticky rice. It was nice to learn how to make the curry paste from the scratch, as the curry paste you can buy in europe is expensive and always comes with fish sauce in it, which is not great if your guests are vegetarian. Everything was fresh and clean, which i think is important when you're trying to cook in asia. I appreciated the fact that we didn't have to take notes or anything, we were given a tiny cooking booklet at the end of the class, which included all the dishes we cooked and many more. As BKK was my first destination, i didn't want to take along a lot of heavy things, so the size of it was great! The chefs were fun and thought us really well. The best thing is eating your fresh, self-made thai food! Enjoy!

So much fun. I can not recommend this enough.This is the 2nd cooking class I have done in Bangkok, the other was great but this was FANTASTIC, Jay was the highlight, he is a funny, intelligent and very interesting chef, who had us all in fits of laughter from start to finish.In the other class we ate all that we cooked at the end, I liked this one because we ate as we cooked each meal. They were very accommodating to individual tastes and requirements. The class was so very well organised, the food was amazing, I will be going again when I return to Bangkok. I had a really really good time.

Excellent, fun and tasty. Everything about this course was wonderful: location, instruction, price, and food itself. I highly recommend a cooking course for anyone visiting Thailand. We took this course on the last day of our two week trip and I left realizing I should have taken it on the first day I arrived; we learned so much about not just the foods we cooked, but about dining in Thailand in general, how to pick a good restaurant, understanding the exotic fruits and vegetables of the market, identifying fresh vs. old seafood, it goes on and on.We emailed the day before and they confirmed our reservation very quickly and sent very detailed instructions for where to arrive in the morning. We went on a brief market tour which was very fun and informative. We then made a short walk back to the kitchen, which seemed to just be a converted home, not really an industrial restaurant type space. Which was fine by me. We then cooked the pre-set menu one by one, which included tom ga soup, green curry paste and then green curry chicken, fresh spring rolls with freshly made chili peanut sauce, mango and sticky rice, and pad thai. I think on different days they have different menus. I also asked for a khao soy recipe, which they emailed me a few days after. The instructor was very nice and very funny, and did a great job involving everyone and helping us to get to know the other random people that were in our class. The food was delicious as well. Everything was top notch, very highly recommend. Oh, and this was the least expensive of the 4 or 5 other Bangkok cooking classes i took. Might have been a little shorter, but I didn't feel like i was "rushed" through any of the lessons, it was exactly the right length for a casual course.

Highlight of our Trip. The best thing ever, but seriously it was a highlight of our 25 day trip. We were given extremely detailed instructions in advance on how to get to the cooking school, something we lacked in other experiences on our trip. In a small class, we learned about the ingredients used in 5 classic Thai dishes and possible substitutes to use at home. We got to make our own coconut milk too! We cooked Pad Thai, Tom Yum Soup, Green Curry Paste as well as curry, Panang Curry and Mango Sticky Rice. Our instructor was super passionate and high energy!!! A must do even if passing through Bangkok!!!
Super morning out!. Two of us had an awesome morning with Mr Jay and his merry gang! Two thumbs up!The market trip was nice and informative, staff were friendly and made everyone feel at ease

A must do. A top activity that was on my list of things to do was a Thai cooking class well I was visiting my friend. I'm extremely happy with my choice to go with Siloam cooking school. The lady I was first in touch with gave me good directions right from my friends apartment. We met as a group and she brought us to meet our chef teacher. My groups teacher was jay. He was hiliarious. He took us through a near by market telling us about the stuff their and what we were purchasing. We witnessed a last bartering for a real live chicken as another was beheaded and plucked. We then went to the class room/prep room. As we were prepping dishes jay was really good about letting us know what equilivent ingredients we could get in canada or the states. We prepped, cooked and were professionally served our dishes. While we were eating the prep room was cleaned and the new ingredients were set out. Jay was helpful by taking pictures while we were cooking. I enjoyed meeting and hearing the stories of my fellow classmates while we ate our food. at the end we received a cookbook of all the dishes the school teaches. We made 5 of the dishes. All were delicious. Go hungry.

Great experience & Must be done. Doing this course on my own was a bit daunting but Koong, our chef, made it an excellent experience. the trip round the market for the ingredients was very informative. The whole experience of learning to balance taste, sweet with sour, coupled with friendly banter made it an experience not to be missed. Koong explained what substitute ingredients could be used if thai ones aren't available at home. The explanations by Koong were great & the food we produced was worthy of many restaurants! At only 1000 baht, it was well worth it. & we got a recipe book as well? We can also email them any questions when we get home.

What a treat!. I've made it a point to take cooking classes when I visit a new place, especially a city. Silom produced one of my favorite classes around the world thus far. I loved that they offered an evening class, which is great when you want to do the more touristy things that are closed in the evening. The directions they provided for me were personalized and even included a video to ensure that I had no doubt I was in the right meeting spot. I arrived 20 minutes early just to be sure I was on time and the chef was already there waiting for me.We began promptly at 6 and Ott (I know I am spelling this incorrectly) walked us through all the ingredients we'd be working with. He gave us so much insight on the different variations of basil, ginger, rice (did you know there are over 6,000 species of rice??). Even the most knowledgable cooks in the class learned plenty of new information. The class flowed well, we were each preparing our own meals therefore we were able to cut, chop, and make our dishes ourselves (the best for of learning in my opinion). Most importantly, the food was delicious! Best Tom Yom Soup I've tasted in a long time. We thought the entire staff was friendly, courteous, and hilarious. They were always cracking jokes.I highly recommend this school.
Must Do. It was the first time I joined the cooking class in Bangkok. The chef "Goong" was so great and I did enjoy every moment there!

Best in the Biz. I have been to Silom Thai Cooking School twice now and both times were fantastic. It is a perfectly clean place, the staff are very accommodating, the teachers are interesting and kind, and the food we made was DELICIOUS. Some of the best Thai food I've had- I can't believe we cooked it ourselves. They describe in detail what ingredients are going into the food and it is so organised- you don't have to clean up a thing! A great experience all around- even if you don't normally enjoy cooking!I think this Thai cooking school is the best one in Bangkok and I will definitely take friends here!

Loved experiencing the true culture of Bangkok!. From the beginning to end, we had a great time. Absolutely LOVED going to the market with our little baskets and getting a lesson on some of the local produce and shop for the ingredients that we used to cook with. We made 5 courses; spicy and sour soup, spring rolls, chicken/shrimp pad thai, green curry chicken/shrimp, and mango sticky rice. Prepping all of the food was really fun and educational. Oat did a great job explaining everything about the ingredients. The rooms where we would prep and eat were nicely air conditioned to get out of the hot Bangkok heat but the stoves were outside. It was okay because we really weren't at the stoves for too long. My husband is the farthest away from a chef who can barely boil pasta and managed to make all 5 courses without cutting a finger off, setting the place on fire, and/or manage to get food poisoning so if you are concerned about not being good enough, don't sweat it! Our chef Oat was hilarious and made the class so much more enjoyable. When we were trying to catch a cab back to our hotel when class was over, we had a cab driver try to scam us and Oat observed the whole thing and went above and beyond and helped us get onto the sky train and get back to our hotel okay. Would definitely recommend this class to anyone!!

Unforgettable experience. We went for a half a day cooking session and we were left absolutely amazed. The level of organization, attention, delicacy and friendliness were incomparable. We were told a lot of information about spices, traditions and customs and we enjoyed the visit to the market very much . The chef, Gum, was extremely friendly, attentive, skilled and easy going. We particularly liked as we'll the premises which were simple, yet delicate and decorated with excellent style and taste. The fact that this was a really hands on experience was a major point too. Everyone receives a cooking station and you really need to listen to the instructions. In other cooking classes I've been in the past it was more of a look and learn experience rather than hands on.Needless to say, the dishes were delicious and allowed for custom spice level adjustment.We definitely recommend this place. Thank you Silom school for such a great experience.

Great experience. This is a must do if you want a real Thai cooking lesson. You will learn several recipes and shop in a local market for the ingredients. They give you a cookbook so you can prepare these dishes when you return home. Overall, a great time...

Wonderful evening!. Well, we don't know how many times we have been to Bangkok. I think this is typical for Hong Kong ppl. We search for something different and this Thai cooking school pop up top on goggle's list. They are situated in a residential area and honestly if not lead by the staff we could never find it. Price is very reasonable. And most impressive is the cook - Jay, he is a very funny guy and taught a lot of Thai cooking tips. He makes the class even funnier. This trip worth a try and likely will join again!

Very enjoyable food experience. Spent the morning at this cooking class. There was a class size of nine which was ok, we were taken on a quick market tour to pick us supplies and then Jay, the very enthusiastic and enjoyable leader took the group through several dishes which we cooked, then ate. Delicious I would have to say. Very informative, lots of useful information and given a small cookbook at the end. Cost was B1000 which seemed very reasonable.

Great for a few days in Bangkok. This class was extremely enjoyable and made for a memorable 3 days in Bangkok. Oat was a great instructor and was willing to go at a pace suitable for the entire group. At the end of the class, you receive a small cookbook with recipes for the dishes you made amongst others. I would highly recommend this to any friends traveling to Bangkok.

Informative, easy and fun. This was such a fun experience. Our teacher, Oat, was knowledgable and professional. Some dishes were more complicated than others, but all were fun to make. The review of Thai ingredients was very helpful.
"So delicious" . Great experience! First you went to the market a buy all your stuff and than you cook 5 dishes! I just can recommend it, great fun and good food! Go there a try it!

Excellent experience. Had a great time learning to cook Thai food. Instructor was well spoken and humorous and clearly had a passion for food. Was not super in depth but sufficient for a home cook. Class was well organized and flowed well. Email contact was fast and directions given to the somewhat hard to find school were good. Classes are mostly on the floor so if sitting Indian style with a small cutting board and your ingredients in front of you is physically difficult then you should be prepared for being uncomfortable and may want to look elsewhere. We did the night class which was a bit cheaper ( by 100 baht each) because it does not take you to the market. We had seen plenty of Thai markets so didn't feel like we needed another. We even got a small cookbook at the end. We cooked 5 things and ate a 4 course meal. I dish was green curry paste used to prepare green curry. We also learned how to make a sweet and sour red chili paste. They had lockers to put our valuables in and provided aprons. Hand washing was required and encouraged. We even made coconut milk and cream from a whole coconut!

A must-do in Bangkok!!!. I did the one day cooking class with a friend and I would definitely recommend it for many reasons!!! First of all, the staff there is amazingly nice! And funny!! Then, everything was perfectly well coordonated (the visit of the market-not too long, the description of the food and ingredients we are going to use afterwards, the sequences of the preparations... But mainly: we had so much fun!! And it was delicious!!

Excellent Thai cooking experience. A very enjoyable way to spend a few hours in Bangkok. We made delicious meals under the expert and entertaining guidance of our teacher Kung. We started with an educational visit to a market followed by preparing our four-course banquet. Very good value and highly recommended. I cannot imagine how some of the very much more expensive classes can better those of Silom Thai Cooking School.

Brilliant!. This cooking school was recommended to me by my brother who did it last year, and it still exceeded expectations! The food was amazing, the market your was interesting and it was all topped off by 'Amazing Jay' the chef who was hilarious and spoke amazing English. Such an entertaining morning, this is a must do in Bangkok!

Amazing experience!. Brilliant from the start! Loved the market tour and we got to see where all our produce was coming from which was great! Our chef Jay was AMAZING! Really fun, engaging and a great teacher! The food that we cooked was lovely just make sure that you come on an empty stomach because there is a lot and you don't want to miss out on any of it! Great experience and I would recommend it to everyone!

Perfect Bangkok Experience!. Each staff member made this a fun and easy event. We met up at the metro station and walked to the market where we started learning about, and collecting, the ingredients we would be using in the 5 dishes we prepared.Details abound throughout the experience. No time to take notes though, too many dishes to prepare and consume. Don't worry, you'll get a cookbook at the end which we used to capture the stored info we had collected all day.The staff help you understand what ingredient to buy in Thailand before you return, and also, which substitutions can be made in your own kitchen.

Awesome experience!. Cant wait to go back and do the next course! Spent 4-5 hours cooking amazing Thai food and learning about Thai ingredients. When you book, ask to be taught by 'Amazing Jay', incredibly funny and can speak very good english. Would recommend to anyone wanting to learn Thai cooking.

Come hungry, leave happy.. Wonderful experience! The facilities were great, the chef was wonderful, I learned a lot about Thai cooking and we ate food that couldn't get any fresher. I think this was the best food I've had in Thailand (and I've done some food tours). Even if you don't like cooking, this was worthwhile.

Memorable experience!!!. What more can I say that hasn't already been said by other reviewers. We had a BLAST! The spot on the street where you meet up with your group was a little confusing. However once a couple girls from England arrived, and another girl from the States (we all had a 'lost look' on our faces) it was clear that we were in the right spot. Sure enough our instructor showed up and split us into groups and were were then off to the market. They explained all the ingredients were were going to be using that day. The instructor was very clear and patient. At the end of the class we had all made some VERY tasty Thai dishes!!

Great experience cooking with Jay. This is my favorite cooking class I have taken so far. It is more hands-on and you work together on the prep work and then cooking the food together. Prep work is nice because you get to chat with Jay who is excellent and will teach you all about Thai food, cooking techniques, and so on. He's very funny, knowledgeable, and will show you how to make the food look great and taste great at the same time. I find the cost to be very reasonable compared to other cooking classes as well. You have the option of going to a market with Jay before the cooking begins and I recommend you do it. This way you will get to see all the different herbs and vegetables that are important for Thai cooking. Very positive experience.

So impressed. I am a professional chef and wanted to do this with my family. I was very impressed with the whole package. The market experience was great, staff were awesome, the dining room and kitchen room are great. The food and recipes are fantastic and very easy to grasp. The preparation for the class going on behind the science is what makes this experience so great. This is a must do if you are interested in learning a little about thai cooking!

Highlight of Bangkok. My partner and I attended a morning class during our three day stay in Bangkok. It was by far the top experience of our time in Bangkok and a stand out highlight of our month in Thailand. The information we were given on the location of the school and how to get there prior to the class was incredibly detailed. On arrival we were shown around a local food market and picked our ingredients to cook with under the supervision of our competent and friendly chef Oatmeal. We cooked 5 dishes which were some of the tasiest things we ate in our whole time in the country. The class was relaxed and fun but also well organised and slick. A must do for anyone visiting Bangkok.

Best 4 hours spent in Bangkok. Highly recommended. Awesome Jay certainly lived up to his name. Nice small groups meant lots of interaction. Packed full of information and then food to match. Do not leave Bangkok until you've learnt to cook at Silom Thai Cooking School.

Fun way to spend a morning . For those looking for a fun and inexpensive way to spend a few hours, and learn something new, taking a cooking class here fits the bill. The class is meant for beginners and those with little knowledge of Thai cooking so everyone can take it. There is a quick market visit to give you a feel for how Thais shop, and also intro to the various ingredients you will cook with. During the course, you will cook five dishes - and eat them - so best cone with an empty stomach. Fast, simple to cook dishes that can easily be made at home ... The Chefs who teach are fluent in English and make the course terrific fun. Chef Ort was especially great.

Funny and Filling. We visited this cooking school after already taken a few others during our travels throughout asia. I must say this was one of the best we have gone to. Even though the place is a little hard to find it is definitely the gem of silom in bangkok. We made a bunch of dishes (alot of food! because each student makes their own dish) that were quick and came out amazing. We learned alot about things we can do back home in the kitchen and even shared many laughs with our instructor who was quite funny.

Great cooking school in central Bangkok. We did the Wednesday afternoon session. The instructor showed us step-by-step instructions, taught us about the local Thai ingredients and told us the alternative ingredients that we could use in our own countries if the Thai ingredients weren't available. We cooked a total of 5 dishes but everything was from scratch including the coconut cream, curry paste and sweet chilli sauce. The food we cooked was authentic and delicious. The cooking school staff were all extremely friendly. I was particularly impressed by the clear instructions we got sent about how to get to the cooking school, including a letter written to Thai to give to the taxi driver to tell them where to take us. The cooking school has a very relaxed atmosphere yet still was very well organised. The price was very reasonable at 1000 baht or around $30AUD. I would definitely recommend a cooking class while in Bangkok.

Outstanding experience and great value. My partner and I attended the morning class whilst in Bangkok. We were taken to the local market first to learn about Thai ingredients - this was a very slick but not contrived process.Afterwards our chef, Oatmeal, taught us five different dishes with great skill and humour. We ate all of them, and found them amongst the tastiest things we've eaten since we got here!Wonderful, friendly, staff and fantastic value; highly recommended.

Great Experience. My daughter and I attended the Silom Cooking School while in on a tour of Thailand. Since we did not have a lot of time, we choose to attend an evening class. Since the market is closed in the evening, they brought the market to us. First the instructor showed us a wide variety of Thai ingredients and explained their use. Then we started preparing the ingredients including Masaman curry paste and cooking each of 5 dishes.. The recipes were easy once you prepared the ingredients and, knowing that it would be difficult to find some of them in the US, the instructor was careful to point out which one were optional and/or suggested alternatives. The food was delicious and we had more than we could eat. We had such an educational and entertaining evening that we chose to attend another class at the end of our tour..

This was a great way to learn about Thai cooking!. There was nothing I disliked about this!! Everything was great! The teacher was full of energy and also very funny! Oat (pronounced more like Ott), was a wonderful instructor! He even showed us where to get a good drink in the city! The food we made was to die for!! Do this if you are interested in learning about Thai cuisine!! This school is fantastic!!

Super great. we had a lot of fun and learned a lot. Before cooking, we went to the lokal market and bys thefresh food. Non, our cooking teacher gave us much explains about Thai spices and vegetables. There are small Groups ( max. 6 persons) and it is cooked in the traditional Thai style. 3 course menue. You get lots of tips and tricks. Who likes to cook yourself at home Tai style should definitely make this cooking class.

Great teachers and amazing value for money. I did the course on Monday morning and Tuesday morning and afternoon. As I would be repeating some of the dishes, and I wanted to learn some from the Wednesday menu, they adapted the lesson for my needs. The chefs are fun, obviously great cooks and each added some of their own experience/way of cooking, which was great to see. You would probably be paying half of the course's price just to eat anywhere quite cheap, so learning how to cook was like a massive bonus. Will defo come back to learn some other meals. Eduardo/ Brazil

Great balance of market tour, cooking, learning and eating. Just perfect!. We loved this cooking school after a not so enjoyable cooking tour in Koh Samui this was wonderful. Firstly and customer service from Ms My pre tour was faultless, quick to confirm bookings and provided ample information to get to the meet spot! Be sure to arrive on time! Next our cooking instructor 'amazing J' was so knowledgable, humorous and personable that he made the experience even better than it otherwise would be. The quick market tour was great to see some different thai ingredients, and J's explanations were also quite informative. A lot of preparation is done on advance to allow us to see the preparation of the tricky bits first hand while still being able to enjoy four courses in just three hours. I really liked the format. We cooked one course then ate it, then cooked second course before eating it and so on, so we could taste everything without getting too full and without wasting our food. We did Tuesday set a and I cannot believe how tasty my cooking was, I certainly surprised myself thanks o the tips and assistance provided. Do yourself a favour and book this course I'm sure you will surprise yourself also. The actual cooking is done outside however most of the prep and eating is in an air conditioned room so it's quite comfortable. The set up is homely and basic but completely adequate for a comfortable and thoroughly enjoyable cooking adventure. Do this if you like thai food and want some skills to replicate the true thai taste at home, I can't wait to practice my new skills for friends and family back home!

Fantastic. Just perfect, from the booking where they send you extra detailed and customised direction all the way to the cooking. Small classes (8ppl max), very friendly and funny chef(s), yet very knowledgeable and speaks good English, great presentation of all the ingredients and techniques. You get to do all the most classic dishes that you will already have eaten tons of in Thailand (pad thai, green curry, tom yum, etc...), and eat them straight away while they prepare the next lesson. The recipe book you get to take home after the lesson is well done. A++

Great suff - Jay rocks :). We had a splendid time at the Silom Thai Cooking School. Jay, you rock!Booking process was very easy and the joining instructions were very detailed and accurate.We learned lots, had amazing food as a result of it and also laughed heaps! I had the best pad thai ever, and I cooked it myself!!!The market tour was interesting, too. Can't wait to apply my knowledge at home.We came with our 3 year old son and it didn't seem like a tiniest trouble to have him around. A must do when in Bangkok.

Cooking school . The cooking class was great, included short trip to the market, back to school, and prepering delicious Thai dishes in great atmosphere, funny instructors, and overall great value for money. 1000 baht for a 3 hour Hands On class. Definitely worth it!

Best cooking class ever. Non was an excellent host and teacher - very patient and interesting. I especially appreciated his talk at the market where he showed the "boring" (Western) versions of Thai ingredients - though boring, it was good to know what ingredients I could substitute at home. Non also had a great sense of humor - loved him taking "selfies" with his students. Non also made sure to ask each of us with cameras if we wanted photos taken while we cooked - very thoughtful.Each day the school teaches a different menu - I took a Sunday class with Tom Yum soup, massaman curry, green papaya salad, pad thai, and mango with sticky rice. Though you do some prep work as a group (making coconut milk, chopping some veggies), much of the measuring and other prep is done for you. As an avid cook, this was a bit disappointing but I still felt I learned a lot about the cuisine and how to prepare it. The glossy cookbook provided at the end is an excellent reference too. The food was FANTASTIC and I left feeling very full. If you take morning class I would recommend having some breakfast before hand - you don't really start eating until 10:30.The cooking school sends excellent directions to get to the meeting point. The school is set up in a tall building - you hoof it up some stairs to get to the classroom, so if mobility is an issue, this isn't a good option. Also you do the cooking in woks set up outdoors on the patio - on a hot day this is a bit uncomfortable, but the prep work and eating is done in air conditioned rooms.

A must do in Bangkok. We had an extra day so googled cooking classes and was glad we went with this one. It was a highlight for us, our chef Non was amazing and so friendly and funny, it was so well organised and definitely value for money, we ate heaps. It was great to go to the markets and see and buy the food, it was all so fresh and colourful, and we didn't even have to wash the dishes. Make sure you sign up!

Great value, lovely time!. We had such a nice time at the Thai cooking school and ate enough to last a week! The food was delicious, the staff so friendly and helpful and value for money was second to none. I booked the course very late but the staff went out of their way to sort it out for me. I highly recommend this!

Must do!! So much fun, amazing food and wonderful people.. If you don't take a class here you are missing out big time. This was by far one of the most fun things I've done on this trip. The people at this school are so kind and will make sure you are taken care of. I just adored my instructor, Goong, which means shrimp in Thai. She was so enthusiastic and just loves her job and working with tourist. She nick named me Miss America! The food was so delicious and I was stuffed at the end. You start off by going to the market and then head back to the cooking school. It's well organized and at the end they give you a cookbook. I want to take another class next time I came back. Thank you Silom Thai cooking school and I especially thank Goong for giving me such an amazingly memorable experience in Bangkok. Much Love!!!

Expert chef, diverse & plentiful food, well organized. Professional and fun from start to finish.We cooked 5 courses in only 3 hours and learned a great deal about thai ingredients. Our instructor spoke great english and taught us about 10 kinds of basil, eggplant and ginger in the market. We also learned how to make tamarind paste, coconut cream and fresh curry paste from scratch.I know enough to cook a Thai meal at home! They were very organized and got us cooking a large amount of food in a short amount of time. All ingredients were beautifully presented.Everyone should take this class if they like cooking (or just eating) Thai food.

Best day I spent in Bangkok!. This class was the highlight of my time in Bangkok - I only wish I'd had time to come back for more. The staff were friendly, helpful and entertaining. They gave great instructions about the meeting point, so I had no trouble joining up with the group for the market tour. The school is lovely and peaceful. Everything we cooked was delicious and I felt like I learned quite a bit. Hoping to be able to recreate some of the dishes at home (thanks to the glossy recipe book they sent us home with) and to return here for another class or two next time I'm in Bangkok. (Of all the cooking schools I looked into, this one was significantly less expensive than the others - a great value!)
Interesting experience. The school is great at communicating with their prospective students..we were given very cleat directions to the scjo

The Best !!. Really makes a fun day, and you will be the friend in your crowd who becomes known for your Thai food. Loved doing the shopping in the Thai market for what we used, and as that the school has aprons and utensils you can purchase if you want. (Ask them-they don't tell you :) ) PLUS you get to eat a 4 course lunch! So the price is right for a great day.
Great experience. The afternoon spent learning how to cook Thai food was funny and useful. Everything was so good! The staff is amazing!
Non is a master. We learnt a great deal and found it both satisfying (we ate a lot) and hilarious. Non is so funny and a true master chef. We wish him and this school all the best

Wonderful activity. Silom cooking school has perfected this activity. Everything ran like a well-oiled machine. Delicious good. Entertaining chef/instructor. Good for beginner or more knowledgable chefs.

A fresh experience!. After a couple rough first days in the city (the constant feeling of being "taken for a ride") this was a welcome change to my opinion that was forming on Bangkok.We met our wonderful teacher at the market down the street from the school. She showed us all sorts of information and facts on Thai meats, veggies and fruits. She quickly learned who we all were and remembered for the duration of the class. Once back at the school we were shown how to make 5 different dishes. The school does all the prep work while you are eating each dish so it's very easy to follow along with what goes in what but still a lot of fun to cook each thing yourself. At the end we received a cooking booklet that shows a ton of Thai recipes. I ended up talking with the owner at the end of the (very inexpensive) experience and he's going to send me a recommendation for a shop in NYC where I can buy some of the Thai ingredients. So great!

Great Activity in Bangkok. My friend traveled all over Asia and went to cooking classes in each country. He told me that the Silom Cooking School was the best one he attended, so my wife and I decided to sign up. They didn't disappoint as we had a great time with our instructor Nom.The first little bit is spent at the market. Instructions are provided for the meeting point which is at one of the BTS Skytrain stations so it's very easy to get to. At the market, Nom was very good at explaining all the ingredients we were getting. Some of the ingredients are variations of what we have back home such as ginger and eggplants. After we loaded up with food, it was a short walk back to the school. At the school we were able to do some preparation such as making our own coconut milk and chopping some of the ingredients. However, the school does a lot of the legwork for you. Although they do a lot of the prep, it was still great to learn the basics of Thai cooking and the reasoning behind some of the steps. The woks we used are extremely hot so the food cooked super fast. We made tom yum soup, pad thai and red curry. They also prepared us some deep fried fish cakes and mango with sweet sticky rice. Nom is a funny guy and made the class quite enjoyable. We had a small class of 7 including us from Canada, another couple from Germany, two guys from Malaysia and Japan, and a girl from France. We definitely enjoyed this experience so if you're looking for something to do in Bangkok or if you get tired of all the temples (which you probably will...) consider this class. My wife said it's one of the highlights of our trip. We also really liked the utensils we were using to mix the food in the wok. They were made of coconut shell, didn't burn and were very light. The school sells them for 50 bhat each so we picked some up to bring back home. As mentioned in other reviews, we also got a cookbook which we've been using at home. Thanks to Nom for a great morning!Tip: If you're in the morning class, have a light breakfast beforehand. We didn't get a chance to eat and the first meal is at about 10 or 10:30.

Fantastic experience. We are so glad we decided to book a class at this cooking school! We did the morning class with the trip to the market. The teacher who spent the day with us explained everything about the ingredients and dishes with great enthusiasm. He was very entertaining:) We loved how we all sat on the floor and went through all the ingredients that would go into the Pad Thai, Massaman curry, mango sticky rice etc. All of the food tasted wonderful! At the end of class, "oat" the instructor gave us a recipe-book, which is great for remembering all the information we were given when we get home and start cooking this by ourselves. Do go here when in Bangkok! It is a great experience; budget friendly as well!

Fantastic experience and value for money!. I am so glad we did the Silom Thai cooking school. We left it quite late to book as we had been uneasy about the protests occurring in our area, however we were able to get a spot at Silom Cooking School with just a few days notice. And we are so glad we did! Mhai's communication via email was very quick and personal, and it was very easy to organise this way. The instructions on where to meet are extremely thorough (its not that hard to find!) and its very well organised, especially as its a simple, small establishment.The market tour is not to be missed, a real highlight for us, just to see where they get all their ingredients and although we are foodies we still picked up some helpful tips. Our group leader 'Oat' was friendly and entertaining and helped to make it a very enjoyable, light hearted experience.The cooking component was also great - making everything from scratch in traditional ways. What I liked especially about this school was that you each make your own individual dishes - so if you don't like seafood, or coriander, or whatever - you simply leave out of your dish (or substitute). Simple! So perfect for fussy eaters, vegetarians, those with allergies etc. You make a dish then eat it, and make the next etc. So definitely don't eat much before you come, you'll be eating a lot of delicious food!We each got a recipe book at the end with all the recipes we made plus more, and helpful tips of the ingredients and how to find them etc.For 1000 baht p/p this is exceptional value for money and a genuine, not-to-be-missed experience to have in Thailand. I would recommend to anyone!

So much fun!. Taking a cooking class was something I really wanted to do on my trip to Thailand. There are many to choose from and I randomly chose this one. The price was right too (like $30 US!). Upon booking, I received a very detailed description and pictures of where to meet the chef in the morning. We took a taxi to the location (we took the train home as there was a station semi-close by, and I like taking public transit... also it can be hard to get a metered taxi off the street in comparison to a hotel). While at the market our instructor reviewed various types of peppers, mushrooms, ginger, eggplant and more while comparing it to the "boring" generic types that are found at most supermarkets around the world. We were also provided a cold bottle of water at the market. The school itself was a short walk away. The cooking itself was done out on a balcony area as we rotated between two air conditioned rooms in the building to prep the food and eat the food. The instructor was very helpful and knowledgeable about the food, and she had a sense of humor as well!. I can't remember her name though! We took the morning class on Sunday February 23 with the female instructor. We made Tom Yum soup, Pad Thai, Massaman Curry, Sum Tom and made the coconut milk for Mango with Sticky Rice. Everything was DELICIOUS. We left with full stomachs. A cookbook with all the recipes we made as well as other recipes were given to us complimentary. And you could also buy an apron for 500 Baht. So much fun! Next time I'm in Bangkok I want to try the other courses here!

i highly recommend this cooking school. i had a problem finding the meeting place because my map was old, but in the end a helpful person gave me directions. They meet with you, give you a basket with some water and off to the market a few blocks away. Then back to the school using back streets, its amazing how Thai people live. The school is air conditioned (thank you) and very clean. They teach you about ingredients and you chop up the vegetables and devein shrimps. Ask for a stool if you are like me and can't sit on floor. Then we cook each dish on our own woks and tiny stove. Thai food is spicy sweet and sour. It really was a good experience that I will be doing again at night without the market tour since it was soooo hot. Non our chef was happy and very knowledgeable and just kept smiling. Thanks Non!

Awesome Class/Experience!! A+++. My wife and I really enjoyed taking this class - it was a wonderful couple of hours. Probably my favorite activity in our 4 months of travel. Our guide/chef was awesome (unfortunately, I forgot his name, but I know that he runs a Thai Restaurant in the UK) as he was extremely knowledgable, energetic, and just made the whole experience fun from teaching us about the ingredients in the local marketplace, cleaning/preparing the food, and of course cooking! He was extremely engaged to his students and encouraged everybody to participate. It also helped that our group was great. We cooked several dishes and gave us a sense of accomplishment. It never tastes as good when I'm cooking by myself! Our chef also provided us with a delicious mango sticky rice (made by him) at the end. Extremely well organised in every detail. From my understanding, quite affordable compared to other cooking classes. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!
Good value for money. Perfect organisation, good explanations, also choices for vegetarians. Just go there if you want to learn about Thai cooking.

Brilliant!. Right from the start my experience was brilliant. They were quick to reply with availability. the instructions/info for the day had pictures of where to meet and there was also a section written in Thai you can show a taxi driver to get to the meeting spot. Our chef was called nom (I think) and he was competent, had good English and was very witty. Our group of 8 were laughing throughout and we all enjoyed it immensely. We learnt lots about the cooking and the food truly was the best we tried in our 3 weeks in Thailand. Be warned, you will be stuffed by the time you leave. The recipe booklet at the end is also very good quality. I can't recommend this place enough.

A Great Experience. So Much Fun, going to the market, preparing food, cooking and best of all, eating our creations. Our chef, Jay, was the best, with his wit and knowledge of Thai food. Don't miss it! Another plus, the fee was half the cost of other cooking schools!

Wonderful Thai Experience!!. After reading the many reviews on activities to do in Bangkok, Thailand, participating in a half day cooking school seemed to be close to the top of the list. After doing research and reading reviews on which cooking school to participate in, we decided on going with the Silom Thai Cooking School. The tour started in the market where we were introduced to all the various types of ingredients that are used in Thai cooking. Not only did my husband and I thoroughly enjoy learning and being introduced to some many new types of food, we loved being a part of the everyday local Thai life style. Following the tour of the market and obtaining all our ingredients we were taken to the school and given a moment to take a quick break before getting on with the food preparation. We really enjoyed the small group environment that this school allowed for – which we found very intimate and relaxing. All members of the group were given specific duties in order to help prepare the 5 course meal that we were going to be taking in. The way the program was set up was that we, the group, would make one dish at a time, enjoy it and then move on to the next. My husband and I did the Friday course which we really enjoyed and highly recommend. Thank you for a wonderful experience!

great activity and awesome food!. If you love cooking and would like to know more about Thai food, this is the place to go! It is not expensive and the teaching staff very competent and engaging! I would definitely go back for more!

Amazing class with Jay!. We had the pleasure to attend a Silom Thai cooking class with Jay as our teacher, and it was truly amazing. He was very informative, attentive, funny and really knew his cooking. The ingredients were fresh, and the recipes were very nicely explained.We had our market tour (a look at the Thai ingredients and the basics of Thai cooking) which we found very interesting and highly informative. We learnt a lot, even though we read and cooked a lot of Thai food already.I would highly recommend Silom Thai if you want to do a cooking class. It was extremely good value (900 thb), and the recipe book they provide is extremely good quality and not printed on paper (unlike many cooking schools we have attended).Thumbs up, we will definately return.

A must if you are staying in Bangkok! Highlight of the trip.. Silom cooking school is amazing. The meeting place was walking distance from the sky train and step by step details on how to get there are emailed to you once you make a booking. Once we met out teacher Jay ( who by the way is amazing!), we headed to the wet seafood market and vegetable market. Jay showed us the difference between produce and what dishes could be made with them,we were allowed to touch and smell. We were each given a little basket which i thought was very cute. We then walked the backstreets through ally ways and backyards and got a feel of how thai people live. once we reached, we removed our shoes and entered an airconditioned prep room where we were showed how to cut and clean our ingedients, we had a portion for ourselves. We then prepared delicious pad thai,tom yum kung,sweet rice and mango, green curry and rice paper rolls.It had a very homely and inviting feel to it. Everything was so well organized with lots of info given to us throughout the class. We were also given booklet at the end with all the recipes to take home.We looked up other cooking schools and Silom Thai was by far the best value for money AND had the best menu. I would definitely go back everytime :)

Great if you have a low budget. If you have a low budget, but you really want to learn how to make a Pad Thai and Tom Yam Soup you should try this cooking school. It´s in a typical Thai newbourhood and you do the cooking in Thai style: you take your shoes off, you prepare the food sitting on the floor like one big thai family and you cook the food yourself! This is not a place to take your mother, but for people on a low budget this is certainly a great place.

Fun afternoon. What a great introduction to Thailand. We did the class our first full day there. The meeting place was just a few blocks from hotel so it was easy to access. The class was extremely fun and educational. The price was great especially compared to others classes I found online. I highly recommend this school.
