Fabulous experience!. Taking the cooking class at Silom Thai was a highlight of our trip to Bangkok. Our chef, Goon spoke English very well, and was a great teacher. We made 5 dishes and everything was very well planned and fun. They sent very specific directions for the place to meet by the market to me by email, even a section in Thai for the taxi driver. I highly recommend taking one of their classes during your visit.

Delicious, very well planned. I went to the school without booking, and was lucky as there were two people that did not arrive.Very happy about it as the experience was very good. I had another course in Chiang Mai, but this was very well planned, they not only teach you how about the ingredients and preparations, but are also keen in the presentation, as it is shown in their rooms and kitchenware.Our teacher Non was very friendly, funny and helpful.

Friendly, delicious, interesting. The afternoon cooking class in Silom Thai Cooking School was one of the highlights of my trip. Starting with a funny and informative market tour, the whole class is extremely spectacular, interactive and fun. The instructors spoke good English, were extremely friendly and did their best to make it a unique experience. We prepared five meals - three appetizers, a main course and a dessert. Great value for money! It's definitely a must if you spend at least three days in Bangkok and like Thai food.

Yummy, friendly, good value. The meeting location was very easy to find, Our leader/chef was Jay, he was very happy, and spoke great English, he made everyone feel relaxed and answered any questions as well as having some goodBanter. The food was great, we were taken through stepBy step and got timeTo enjoy. Lots of food, I would recommend not having breakfast/lunch before going so you can enjoy it all. The placeWas clean and tidy. We had had aGreat morning! And would recommend it to other, defiantly value for your dollar, you also get a recipe book to take home :)

Entertaining, Educational, and Delicious. Our class at Silom cooking school was one of our highlights on our trip to Asia. I am not a great cook but wanted to give a cooking class a try. Our teacher was fantastic and made everything easy, first 5 course meal I have ever made. I am a vegetarian and they were able to add tofu instead of chicken/ fish and were very careful to keep my food separate. The cooking school was very clean and we enjoyed our meal greatly!

Extremely enjoyable Thai cooking class. The cooking class at Silom was the favourite part of my Bangkok trip! I had booked the morning class and met the guide from the school who directed us to our teachers. The teacher leading my group was Goon, and she is absolutely amazing! She took us on a tour of the local market and introduced us to the ingredients we would be working with. She was happy to answer any questions we had and made everyone in the group feel comfortable. Once back at the school we were shown to the lockers where we could keep our belongings while we did the cooking. There were two separate rooms, one for enjoying the food we cooked and one for the cooking lesson. The actual cooking was done in the open along the corridor where each student had a separate cooking station. We cooked five dishes during the entire session that included tom yam goon, pad thai, fish cakes with sweet chilli sauce, Thai red curry and mango sticky rice. Goon was very patient when explaining how to cook each dish with detailed explanation of the ingredients and cooking technique (which is very basic). After each dish was cooked we got to eat it and were sufficiently full by the last couple of dishes! At the end of the class, you are given a recipe cook which recaps the dishes taught on the day as well as other popular Thai dishes. The class costs 1000 baht which is payable at the end of the course. Also do note that the dishes taught each day are slightly different and can be viewed on the school website.
Such a fun experience!. We learned how to cook one of our favorite cuisines and had fun! Def recommend going here while in Bangkok--it was a great experience

Great experience!. I did not have high expectations given the course was only 3.5 hours long (including a trip to the market) and we were to prepare puppetry basic dishes, but I was pleasantly surprised. The school is well organized, and the instructor I had offered good tips and was fun to work with. For someone who is familiar with western cooking, this was a good introduction to Thai cooking.

Wonderful cookery school. Our morning at cookery school was such a fun experience. we had booked on line and were told to meet at the sky train station near to the school. Our guide was there promptly and took the group to the market with our wicker baskets to buy the ingredients for the menus. The school is like a house tucked down a side street of Silom. You prepare the ingredients as a group then have your own cooking station to cook the dishes. We made 5 dishes - pad Thai, green curry, red curry, Tom yum soup and mango sticky rice. After making each dish you sit and eat your food - I would recommend having a small breakfast! At the end of the morning you receive a cookery cook so you can recreate the dishes at home. It was such a fun experience! The course costs 1000 baht per person - approximately £20 - it is such good value. We went to another cookery school last year which was very impressive and slick but on reflection the Silom cookery school was much more fun! Well worth a try!

Best part of Bangkok!. This was definitely one of the highlights of our time in Bangkok. We booked our spots in the class about a month in advance. I had originally wanted to try another local cooking school that overall had better reviews, but they were closed for the Christmas holidays. This turned out to be a blessing in disguise as we ended up at Silom! Our instructor was Noni and he was the best. Very knowledgeable, patient, funny and friendly. The market tour at the beginning of class was great. We learned how to pick out fresh shrimp and what the different Thai ingredients look like. We were put into a group of about 10 people total and we all worked together to create the meal, chopping veggies, making rice, mashing tamarinds, etc. All of the cooking is done outside on gas ranges and the food you make is amazing. You will be stuffed at the end of the class, so don't eat too much at breakfast and don't plan on eating much for dinner later. The instruction and all the interaction we had with the Silom staff was first-rate. A really dedicated and kind bunch of people. One thing I thought was kind of weird was that the school emailed me a set of instructions in Thai to print out for our cab driver, along with very specific directions to the meeting place. This turned out to be the BEST THING EVER. After being in Bangkok for about 5 minutes, you will realize the incredible value of this. Thank you, Silom, for the amazing experience. We've already made Pad Thai at home and while it wasn't as great as what we made with real fresh Thai ingredients under Noni's direction, it was still delicious!

The best meal we had in Thailand. We were in Thailand for 10 days and the best meal we had was the one we prepared at the Silom Thai Cooking School, and still we had dinner at many good restaurants! We were in a group of 8 people, our family of 5 and 3 other young people. Our chef, Jay, was not only funny and entertaining, he was also very professional and we felt we learnt a lot during the evening. I'll never forget the taste of the Tom Yum soup... I must say that this was one of the highlights of our trip to Bangkok!

Fantastic!. One of our favorite activities when visiting Bangkok. We had a great experience, led by chef Kung (shrimp in Thai... Spelling may be wrong!) ... She was knowledgeable, friendly, fun and funny. This is a must do activity. Can't wait to cook my 5 course Thai dinner for friends.

One of the best experience!. My wife and I found this via the Internet, and we booked this quite a while in advance, communicating by email with the cooking school.On the day itself, we waiting at the Chong Nonsi BTS station, and was picked up by Chef Oat. Along with 6 other students, we were led by foot to the cooking school (roughly 2 kms away by foot). The class itself is held in a pretty basic premise in a low rise apartment building (stairs only, no disabled access).What I like:1) Chef Oat - very attentive, good communications skill, and was able all the time.2) Small class - 8 persons in our class was just right - everyone got some attention, and yet it didn't feel like we're in a too large a group.3) Simplicity - The way the class was arranged, it feels like you won't be able to FAIL your cooking ... you'll always make your dish.4) Eating your own creation - We eat what we cooked.The fee is THB1000 per person, and classes are held 3 times daily - morning, afternoon and nightly. I attended the night class, meaning there isn't any market tour, but it suited me just fine because I still get to learn about all the Thai cooking ingredients.Recommended!

anyone can be a chef ^-^. The class started off at the local market where Chef Path brought us through the smell and taste experience of ingredients that we would be using for the dishes. Upon reaching the school, we were settled in and started preparing basic ingredients like cutting the chicken, washing the vegetables. The real cooking started with Chef Path leading us step by step in preparing the ingredients for the individual dishes. The dishes were cooked individually and we were given time to taste our food before continuing to prepare the next dish. It was a fun time and a must try for anyone who wanna do something different besides shopping in Bangkok!

Great Experience!. Great Chef - instructor. Perfect location. Great experience - from the market tour to the cooking academy. The price is more than good. The instructor is a lovely guy, a great chef with perfect attitude. It is amazing how easily can you create those great Thai dishes. And not only during the class, but at home as well. Go there, have fun. Cook!

Thailicious. What a great way to learn about Thai food. We took two cooking classes this week at the school. The first class was with Pat. He met us ( class of 7) and walked us over to the market. We were each given a basket and a bottle of water. We learned about the types of spices used in Thai cooking. We then walked around the market and gathered the ingredients for our lunch. Back to the school and then on to prep. We each cleaned, crushed, deveined, and chopped our way through four courses. After cooking each course we then ate.We enjoyed it so much we signed up for another class three days later. Each of the chefs has a comic side to them which makes the classes even more fun. Very organized, fun and just down right tasty.

Yummy Thai Food. I took a thai cooking class with a group of 16 people I was traveling with. The class was absolutely amazing! The school itself is beautiful and all of us had so much fun during the cooking class. They are super accommodating to food allergies and if you are allergic to something they can provide you with an alternative. And the price for this class is AMAZING! Plus you will be stuffed by the end. Our cooking instructor was a guy named Jay and he was so funny. All of us loved the class and would definitely recommend it to everyone! They also give you a recipe book to take home - YUM!

Brilliant afternoon. We were so impressed with our experience. The school was really well organised so we got the most out of our time. We really enjoyed learning how to cook delicious Thai dishes in a fun, relaxed environment. This was seriously good value as well!!

Well organized, clean, interesting, value for money and FUN!. My husband was tentative about doing a cooking course but he found our chef Jay so hilarious and entertaining from beginning to end. An informative market tour and very helpful involved cooking sessions. We cooked such tasty meals thanks to our master chef Jay! Can't wait to try all the recipes when we get home!

Such a great experience!. We had such a good day, this course is great, you learn how to prepare and get to practise cooking on your own hob. We went to the market first and learnt about the ingredients then got to try it for ourselves. It was very well planned out and all went very smoothly, we had Jay as a guide and he was brilliant, a great cook and hilarious. We got a book with the recipes in to so we don't forget which was a nice touch. Would like to book another day if we have chance

Fantastic meal and experience in bangkok. Opted for the Silom cooking school for our first day in bangkok. Was such a great way to delve into bangkok. The class started at the market where our teacher (a UK chef who spends his vacation teaching at home in bangkok) gave us a great tour and tutorial through thai ingredients. We covered all our basis from veggies to protein and it was a great start to the program. The menu as well covered all the key touch points from making green curry from scratch to the usual pad thai (best version we ate though), spring rolls with a homemade chile sauce, Tom yom soup and sticky rice with mango. Given the price we paid, experience we had, it was one of the best meals and value we had in bangkok. It was the perfect amount of prep, really delving into the different types of ginger, herbs and how to prepare them for each dish. Everyone cooked their own dish in their own wok station with high heat burners. It was great for beginners and experienced cooks and was taught with such a great pace and demeanor. Highly recommend.

Mr. We had a absolutely great time at Silom Thai cooking school, you start a day with market tour so you get the learn about Thai vegetables and fruits after shopping real fun starts !! Koong , (means shrimp) our teacher was amazing! So lovely, funny and knowledgable. The manager who I can't remember her name was the same. We made some new friends and some great Thai style cooking instruction. If you are looking for a cooking school in Bangkok, these guys are top notch Ali&Joseph

Excellent introduction to Thai food, great time for the whole family. We booked a morning class, which included the visit to the market. Our instructor Kûng (her name is Thai for shrimp!) took us to the market and we learned about different key Thai ingredients. This was helpful for later, when we actually used the ingredients, as we had already been introduced. It was really interesting to see the variety of ingredients, some familiar, and some new (boring ginger vs. finger ginger!) Our party of 6 (Mother in law, my wife and I and our three kids- 9, 7, 2) had a great time both making and eating each dish. The older kids were especially proud of their creations. Kûng was so genuinely kind to them, it was like we spent the morning with an old friend. They have things down to a science as far as logistics and flow of the program. If we find ourselves in Bangkok again, we'll definitely be back, I can't recommend them enough!

Affordable and great learning.. Classes are small and very personable. You learn very traditional Thai dishes, that are popular with the locals and tourist. The Chef instructors speak great English and everything is broken down step by step so you understand. I'm taking as much 5 classes and it's well worth the cost. Would recommend this school to anyone wanting to learn to cook Thai food.

Superb. I can't praise the school enough. The atmosphere was warm and friendly yet with impressive logistical planning; each activity was seamless and much work was going on behind the scenes to make our experience so enjoyable. The pre-course information was also helpful. Our teacher was knowledgable and very skilful at making everyone feel welcome and pleased with their own dishes. We were only in Bangkok for 2 days and we spent one of them here- a decision we are very pleased about. We will try to go back soon.

So much fun and so delicious. Our teach Kûng was super sweet and funny while teaching us how to make traditional thai recipes. We learned how to make tom yum kûng, chicken pad thai, green curry with chicken, and mango sticky rice. We learned a lot about all the different ingredients that are "filler" and others that are main ingredients and what is available in our countries vs things that are only in Thailand. Everything tasted great and I can't wait to try some of these recipes when we get back home. Great way to meet people and have fun while cooking. Highly recommend!

Amazing.... Look no further!!!!!. What an amazing experience!!! You have to ask for Jay who is not only knowledgable but hilarious! The produce was fresh, the kitchen clean, the staff friendly and the food was delicious! One of the highlights of my trip! Love love loved it!!!

Great value for money!. We booked places for the cookery course held on a Tuesday morning (Course 2A) so that we could go on the market tour. Our guide was Goong, who was exceptionally enthusiastic and made sure that everyone was involved in the class throughout. We learned all about the different herbs and ingredients of Thai cooking in the market, and were then shown how to prepare them in the cook school nearby; from washing to chopping, we all gained new cooking skills. We each had our own individual gas cooker, so everyone had the opportunity to make each dish, rather than it just being a demonstration, which was brilliant. Also, one guest on our trip was allergic to shellfish and this was accommodated very well, plus we all got to try an extra vegetarian dish :) We got a cook book with all of the recipes from our course (and more) included, which was a nice touch. This was a morning well spent in Bangkok, and I thoroughly enjoyed the whole experience - all staff were friendly and very helpful, and I would definitely recommend this to others!

Best Cooking School Ever. If you go you HAVE to ask for Jay!! He will make your visit unforgettable! All the food was outstanding, and the staff was very friendly and up beat. They explained every step from visiting the market, to explaining every ingredient, every step in the process, and gave us very helpful tips. I would complete all 7 classes if I was in Bangkok for more than two days! DO NOT LEAVE BANGKOK WITHOUT VISITING THE SILOM COOKING SCHOOL!!

Awesome experience, great way to spend an afternoon, going back!. Terrific cooking class so happy that the first one I called was closed this was great. I initially called/emailed one from a CNN article on Bangkok cooking schools and got no response. This was a golden find and easily accessible from MRT or BTS which made it so much better. The staff spoke excellent english, were knowledgeable, good teachers, and hilarious. Really can't express how great the whole experience was. Wish it wasn't my last day and I could have gone back a second time to learn more, certainly on my list for the future.

We laughed as we learned. It was my wife's birthday and we signed up for something different to do. Turned out it was the highlight of our week in Bangkok and the whole trip. Our guide and teacher for the day was Kung (sp.?) ... She was so generous and intelligent and friendly.The school is several hundred metres from the main street so they meet you on silom road and take you there after a trip to the market. This arrangement worked really well. The market trip is interesting and fun, the classes are the same.You get to sit on the floor for chopping and preparing, then all get their own cooker. It feels like traditional home cooking, with the freshest ingredients imaginable. It's brilliantly organised so you get to make 5 or 6 dishes in just a few hours. Brilliant.

Awesome experience, interesting and smiling staff. Definitely a must in bangkok! Awesome teachers, ideal group size, very interesting! We came as a family and lived it! Just be careful with traffic jam to get there, from khao San it took us more than 1 hour. Also: don't eat breakfast before as you get to try everything you cook from 9am to 1pm: 4/5 dishes!

Best cooking course. I have spend 5 days at the school now. Everyday I have cooked 5 different things all the chefs I have worked with have been amazing. I would recommend this cooking school to anyone, I have had so much fun learning but also the atmosphere in the school is one you can not put a price on. The school is always clean and class rooms are always cool, cook outside and create the most flavourful food dishes that you have ever created. 10/10 is my rating would love to go back someday. Chef Nusi has really put a gem of a cooking school together here.

An amazing experience and very hands on. This is a great cooking school with one of the best prices in town. The market tour was fantastic with all the local foods explained. The guide also gave examples of vegetables from other countries that could be used when you get home. The cooking class itself was very informative and interactive. The food cooked was delicious and easy to make. You are given a cookbook which has what you cooked aswell as many other recipes. Highly recommended.

Fantastic - don't hesitate to book!. We booked a morning course with Silom cooking school largely because it was the cheapest. Some reviews described it as rough and ready, which we thought was fair considering the price. But it turned out to be an incredibly professional, educational and fun addition to our holiday. Our instructor Oat was fantastic (and hilarious), taking us through the various ingredients at the market beforehand and then showing us how to make five of the most delicious dishes we had all holiday - and we ate out a lot! The pad thai and tom yum soup were especially tasty. I'd recommend doing the early class, because the market is full of fresh ingredients in the morning and you won't be tempted to eat before you go - you'll want to save your appetite for the food you make. As well as cooking and eating, the instructors are brilliant at giving you information and advice about Bangkok, and it's useful to talk to your fellow cooking students about their experiences too.We plan to go back to Bangkok and some of the islands at some point in the future, and we will without a doubt book a class at Silom again. Not to be missed!

Fun and interesting. Learn Thai cooking in BKK, this is one of my recommendation, the Silom Thai cooking school, all you need is have fun, cook, and eat. Great to spend a half day at the cooking class. You might, finally forgot what you learn from the class but surely and truly it is fun and full of laughing. They bring you to the local market and teach you how to cook Thai. Great great

Excellent cooking school. My husband and I had a wonderful morning with Chef Jay. He is an excellent teacher and the proof was in our food....absolutely the best Thai food we've eaten. The school is well organized, clean and fun. This is well worth the money. Other cooking schools charge more, but I can't imagine that they are any better. The recipe booklet will come in handy. Don't miss out if you have time in Bangkok.

Fantastic cooking experience. I would strongly recommend Silom Thai cooking school. The classes are small enough to provide good group interaction and adequate individual supervision. The teaching is done in an air-conditioned facility whilst the wok cooking is done outside. Our chef had an excellent command of English and was very witty!! I did not expect to laugh and learn so much about cooking! The market tour was very good as we were shown vegetables that would otherwise be totally unrecognizable. The dishes selected on the menu were delicious and the course was very well organized in terms of teaching and logistics. I would highly recommend this course to anyone in Bangkok - you will learn lots while having a great time.

Fantastic expierience!. Our cooking teacher was Gung...She's such a lovely teacher very concerned about her students and her jokes are so funny we were loughing nearly all the time... the walk across the market was one of the highlights not to say everything was a highlight... the food is all fresh and there is used no prepared ingredients... all is made on your own even the sweet chili sauce...I simply can recommend this school... it was great... thank you Gung!

Fun family afternoon. After reading reviews on Trip advisor and a few blogs, I knew this was the school for me. I took my son (age 13) and daughter (age 10) with me to the cooking class at Silom Thai Cooking school. Was not quite sure if kids would be welcome, but much to my surprise they were welcomed with open arms. I especially appreciated how Oat our chef master treated them so kindly and put them to work.We learned how to make 5 dishes. All were delicious and of our own creation, so there were no empty plates. That alone is a victory for me as a mom, getting my two kids to cook something new AND eat everything off their plates ( every meal must come from here! LOL) so proud of them! The kids came home and gushed for hours to their father about how much fun they had. (Now that is a another win! Tweens rarely do that.) The trip to the market was also fun and we learned a lot about the key ingredients. THey also left us with a recipe booklet, so we could make it all at home. It was also quite nice to get to know the other travelers in our group who all brought their own spice to the experience. We were the only family there that day, but I am sure not the only ones who ever brought children. Mostly adult traveler groups. Sign up was easy, so was check out. I can't recommend more highly. We'll be signing up for another class before we leave Thailand.

Educational and YUMMY!. Go hungry! The instructor was very funny and made us laugh through the entire class. You will prepare the ingredients while you learn what everything is and how to properly use it in Thai cooking.You will eat a LOT in class, so try to avoid going to the bakery down the street before class (my mistake :), but worth it!!).You will be given a cookbook at the end of the class, which I have used several times to impress my family with everything that I learned.

Fun and food. I was recommended the Silom Cooking School by a colleague and so pleased I went. Our chef was Jay, a very funny and friendly host and had us laughing all afternoon. What a great personality and a fantastic member of the team at Silom. The visit started at 1.30 with a visit to the market to be shown the ingredients for the afternoon. Then we took our baskets of fresh produce to the school to prepare the food. We made coconut milk and Thai red paste from scratch and used them in the cooking. The food was amazing and definitely recipes I'm going to cook. The Thai fish cakes were my favourite out of the 5 recipes we cooked and ate ! I was so full when we left :.) You also don't have to memorise everything as they give you a great booklet with all the recipes you've made and more. It's certainly an entertaining afternoon which I'll definitely do again.

Best way to spend a rainy day !. We had already booked to do this course before we knew it was going to rain, but despite the weather Mai was at the SKYTRAIN station to meet us as promised and then we went to meet up with other students and also to then divide into groups of 6, then onto the market. I just loved the market - the produce was incredible and everything so much cleaner than many asian markets. We had Jai (hope the spelling is correct) as our Teacher and he was such a lot of fun and made us all relax. My husband really enjoyed the class and has promised to try out the recipes once we are home.This well priced class is highly organised and well worth the time spent. The morning went so quickly and we were so full, that we could hardly eat much dinner that night. If we return to Bali we will also return and do another class on a different day to try the other recipes, but it was a pleasant surprise to find that in the book that we were given on completion of the class were all the other recipes from the other days as well. Congratulations on a well organised business.

So much fun!. What a great day, Chef Jay and host Mai were the ultimate entertainers. Despite the heavy rains, we soldiered on through to the local market to pick up our ingredients for the day. Back at the school, we turned those ingredients into 5 flavour packed dishes. Informative, great food and most of all heaps of fun!

Best cooking school. Fun, interesting, real.... Not to be missed.. We had 3 days in Bangkok. A cooking class was top of our list of things to do, but we wanted to do a market trip with it too, so we could understand the local foods. We ignored all of the tour guides pestering us on arrival and sort out Mr Google for reviews. We found Silom and we're not disappointed. We would have paid more than 1000 baht for this. Staff, classes & food was excellent. Best part of our stay in Bangkok.

Excellent afternoon well spent. I'd booked the cookery class a month or so in advance having read the reviews and arrived in Bangkok literally an hour or so before I had to be at the meeting point. Nothing like cutting it fine.So taxi directions provided (thank you Silom, you don't know how useful this is as subsequent cab rides about the city proved difficult but that's another story) I arrived at the meeting point and there were 5 or 6 people already there. Then there were another 5, then another 6. I became a little concerned having just done a cookery school in Saigon with only 5 people, this was becoming a crowd rather than a class.Then (thankfully) we were split into groups of 8 and introduced to our teacher. And off we went to the market to collect our veg. I have to be honest, I've seen enough fruit and veg stalls in SE Asia already so wasn't that bothered. Mistake number 1. A very interesting lesson it was too. Don't miss it as if you're familiar with produce back home, you can see and hear about the differences between what they have in Thailand. Then back to the superbly organised 'school'. Busy, well equipped we set about making Pad Thai, Yom Tom, Green Curry in quick succession. Each dish prepared by us, the students, from the collective chopping and cleaning of veg, to the pounding of our green curry paste. I wish I had remembered the teacher's name but she was friendly, interestingly and an excellent teacher.Anyway, it's a perfect afternoon to spend in BK and to my surprise, I have to say I had the best Pad Thai I've ever eaten, and the even bigger surprise was that I actually cooked it.

Really enjoyed it. Really enjoyed this cooking class!It was very enjoyable and the chef was brilliant.Its really easy,you basically prep the food and throw it into the pan and your done!It was such an enjoyable afternoon and a must do in Bangkok!

Don't think about it, just do it. Went on the cooking course this morning and it was brilliant. Great fun, great food. Really interesting to go to the market too so don't miss that part. The chef spoke great English and was very funny. You won't regret doing this.....

Great day, well worth it!. Spent the first half hour wandering trough the lokal marked getting to know the ingredients. Between each cooking thhe chef explained all the ingredients in detail and alternative substitutes one could use at home. Love the spring rolls and fried thai banana. Gets my full recommendations!

Great fun and the food was amazing. We were a group of 7 and had a great time learning to cook some delicious thai dishes. The visit through the market was easy and informative with plenty of time for questions and photos. We then went to the nearby cooking school and made some amazing dishes. The day is split into sessions so that after cooking each dish you get to enjoy it while it is hot. I have done other cooking courses and this is one of the best. Great fun!!

Wow! Fantastic. Starts with a trip to the market, look at the different veggies and fruits, back to school for cooking. What fun, great food, so much we were full, that's lunch and dinner covered for today! And the price? So so cheap, well we think so anyway, I didn't compare others, and there are two others in the same street, but this was run very professionally, clean, perfect chefs to help, great food, go on do it!

This is the BEST place Don't waste your money on other schools!!. This was the best time I've had in Bangkok. Absolutely everyone here is a gem. From Chef Jay to the manager Mai (sorry if the name isn't spelled right) they are just perfect.The instructions are clear, the ingredients are ridiculously fresh, they repeat everything and are open to questions.I cook constantly at home and am a little bored with shows and magazines and cookbooks sometimes. It's been an intense hobby for over ten years so not a lot of things are new to me BUT I learned soooo much there!!Chef Jay had us in stitches the whole time we were there and took his time to explain everything.His knowledge of other cuisines and places was also very comprehensive.I was gonna spend over 3x as much at the Blue Elephant but they didn't get back to me for 3 days. Silom Thai took 10 minutes to get back to me and they are busy!

Yummy food - great host!. I had a fantastic afternoon - a quick trip round the market and then between each meal we were talked through the ingredients! Great food - didn't know I could be such a great cook! I would definitely recommend this cooking school!

Great fun. We had a great morning cooking with Nusi. He is hilarious and made our day so much fun. The dishes we made were delicious and easy and we will definitely be cooking them at home. We had our class at Nusis house as we were after a private class and it was beautiful. Loved every minute. Nots sure the market tour added much, as we really only went to one stall and discussed ingredients. It would've been better to wonder through a larger market and see all the ingredients and curry pastes, but apart from that the day was great!

We'll worthwhile. I highly recommend it! You really learn there, get tips and experience. Most importantly - you have a good time. Also what was very important to me was that it wad very clean and hygienic ! We also each had our own cooking place so you really did the cooking. The cookbook you receive is also very good and informative. The price is reasonable, so it is a very nice way to spend a few hours. Thanks!,

Great date day. My wife and I loved this afternoon. She is vegetarian and they were very accommodating. We made the best Pad Thai that we had ever tasted, massaman curry and my wife's new favorite green papaya salad. We highly recommend Silom they put an excellent program together.

Enjoyable, practical cooking class. We went to the Monday morning class. We loved the overall length of the class, packing in a short market tour to buy what we cooked later and then making five dishes ... While having time in the afternoon for more sightseeing. The market tour was fun and we learned about unique produce to the country. The large group of 21 students was split into three manageable classes of seven each, so the instruction felt intimate. Chef Oat was knowledgable, humorous and friendly. We helped chop vegetables to prep and then learned about each dish one at a time --learning, prepping, cooking, eating. The food was delicious and each student had his own wok station. The facility was very nice, extremely clean and a good teaching environment. The staff was great. My main recommendation would be to let students do more of the prep work, as it felt like we were waiting a while to get started in the beginning. We loved the recipe book we received at the end, and learned key principles we can apply later.
Come hungry!. Come hungry because you get to eat so much yummy food. The market tour is a little brief but the cooking class is a lot of fun & v enjoyable. Well worth the money!!

Well worth the money!. We had the owner as our chef, Nusi. He was so funny and lovely! The tour to the market at the start was interesting where i learnt a few interesting things. We then got led to the cooking school. The lady Mai who gets you sorted with washing your hands, belongings in lockers and aprons was also so funny and nice. The food was so so good! Definitely make sure you go on an empty stomach! A great way to spend an afternoon and would highly recommend!

Something rather than shopping and massage. We had fun there. The chef teach Koh is a very friendly and nice instructor. She fought us a lot of local veggie from market shopping. And it is very nice than everyone has their wok and can cook our own dishes. I will try Thai cooking when I am back home!

Highly recommended!. Go for the class with the market tour, it makes the lessons more worthwhile to be able to experience how to identify the different fresh ingredients used in Thai cooking. Lessons are conducted in a fun, interesting and interactive ways. The food turns out to be surprisingly tasty and exceeds my expectation! Would be back there for sure to learn to cook more dishes in future. Highly recommended!

Awesome experience!. Awesome experience! Our three kids were looking for something different while in Bangkok and this school provided it. The afternoon flew by as we loved everything about this cooking school. The market was fun, the food was great, and the teachers were really helpful. This is one of the best priced cooking schools in Bangkok, but I have hard time thinking others could be much better. A great, memorable experience that we would recommend to everyone!

Holiday highlight. We did a night time cooking class on a Tuesday night. The group was small and friendly. The instructor ("Oat") was incredibly informative, approachable and created a wonderful experience for us all. The place is incredibly clean and there is a very strong focus on personal hygiene (i.e. we washed our hands pretty much constantly throughout the evening). You get a recipe book at the end with even more recipes than covered during the class. This was truly a holiday highlight...The only recommendation I would make is give yourself a few extra minutes to get there. It's very hidden and out of the way, and it is actually a bit further than the website directions map implies.

Worth your experience. Entertaining, interesting and enriching!. Do something different on your holidays to Thailand. Besides shopping agenda, do learn how to cook Thai dishes just like the Thais. Guided tour to the market and preparation of the ingredients. At the end of the individual hands-on lesson, you get a recipe book and of course, new knowledge, lifetime experience and new friends. Had a great time at Silom Thai Cooking School. Will recommend to friend who are interested and hope I can join in again!

This is the cooking course to do. We arrived at the meeting point in the midst of a heavy downpour and were greeted with warm smiles and umbrellas!This is the cooking course to do. We were taught in a friendly Thai way, with lots of laughter and felt at total ease. It was like being invited into their home. Food is delicious and you certainly will be able to impress your friends and family with some proper Thai cuisine.

Exceeded expectations.... My friends and I decided to take thai cooking lessons and I chose Silom Cooking School based on the tripadvisor reviews. The reservation process was quick swift and on the selected thay we showed up to the pick-up area.I won´t make it very long, suffice to say that we one of the funniest half-days in Bangkok... Mai and the rest of the team are just brilliant... the chefs are just plain fun bus serious stuff as well when cooking.. we learnt to cook Tom Yam soup, green curry, patai, chicken salad and dessert... the premises are very warm and welcoming in a very thai way... we left with our tummys full and a smile in our faces... they gave us a recipe book which contains plenty of recipes as well... I would completely recommend this to any person visiting Bangkok, either with friends or alone... they cater to all group sizes and ages...

Fun activity for the morning even if you don't normally cook. My wife and I had fun attending the cooking lesson here. The morning started at around 9am with a market tour. The chef Jay was a bubbly chap and went through quite a number of Thai ingredients (for us the novice cook) in the market. We weren't sure if we could find the same type of things back home and so he did recommend some replacement, which would probably be useful (whether it tastes as good or not remains to be seen). We made four dishes, including a dessert. Not totally from scratch as some of the things were already pre-cut. This is okay by us as we were not there to learn to cut things perfectly anyway. The food we prepared was delicious and frankly better than all the other similar Thai food we had during the whole trip ! So even though I didn't plan to actually cook when I got back, I now itch to cook the dishes we learned !

Best place to learn Thai Cuisine. My daughter and I had so much fun. We learned so much. Our 3 days wasn't enough. We will come back there for sure to learn more.. Chef instructors are so accommodating, and so was Miss Mai.From Team Philippines: Krissy and Alecx

One morning in Bangkok. A fabulous day...We picked this school on the basis of a Google search. 1000 baht? Really what could you expect for that? A fun day...a superb, witty and VERY competent bunch of people who walked us through the market...the ingredients...the preparation...leaving us only to enjoy our efforts that's what .If you would like a few hours which could stay with you a long time...Silom Thai cooking school should be on your list.We are keen amateur cooks and we found this to be perfect for ALL levels of ability. Do it... :)

Very fun teacher, great experience!. I typically schedule a cooking class whenever I visit a new city, and I enjoyed this one very much. I picked a day that had the menu I wanted to learn and we started by walking through the wet market to pick up some ingredients. We went back tot he school and started cooking. The teacher was very funny and he taught us a lot of background info about Thai cooking. I had a great time and the food was delicious!

Fantastic value. My daughter and I have just completed half a day at the school and we were actually at the owner's home which was so lovely and artistic. We had a fantastic time and I would book another half day if I could. It is brilliant value and the food we cooked was superb. Would highly recommend. Incidentally I had been considering the Blue Elephant which was right next door to our hotel but after a pretty average and over priced meal there I decided against spending bht 4k for their course and I am so pleased I chose Silom instead.

Brilliant Experience. Had a fantastic morning here at the end of our holiday to Bangkok. Staff were friendly and spoke good English. The trip around the market was informative and very interesting. Food preparation and eating was done in an air conditioned room, which was most needed, yet cooked outdoors which added a bit of novelty to the overall experience. The recipes were delicious and there was a good variety in the menu. There was no hard selling and no expectation to tip at the end. It was the highlight of the holiday for our 17 and 15 year old children, which was most unexpected! I would highly recommend this to anyone and it was great value for money at 1000 Baht per person (for Menu 1).

Cheapest anjd best! The highlight of my Thai holiday!. We looked for a cooking class and this was the cheapest we found (1000 baht/£20 pounds each).We got a trip round a food market, with full details on all the thai ingredients, cooked 5 dishes and got to eat all we cooked! Pad Thai, Red Curry, Fish Cakes, Tom Yum Soup and Mango Sticky Rice (my favourite!!!)The staff are really friendly, very funny and make it a really great experience!Just one tip... dont eat before you go!!!

One of the best activities in Bangkok. Having already done one awesome cooking class in Bangkok we weren't sure anything could top the experience. Well, we were very pleasantly surprised by the Silom Thai Cooking School, we had so much fun. The experience starts with a brief but very informative market tour before heading off to the school with baskets of ingredients. We were told we'd be shown 5 different dishes in the space of the morning, seemed like an impossibility but it wasn't. the preparation is done in the traditional Thai way with each of sitting on the floor with the chef sitting front and centre. Each one of us assisted with preparation along the way. When preparation was complete for each dish we then moved to the balcony to each of our cooking stations to finish the dish. Help was always at had with a very attentive Chef Oat keeping his eyes on proceedings. As soon as our dishes were cooked we then moved to the dining room to devour our tasty creations.At the end of the class you are presented with a really nice little cookbook with each of the ingredients and dishes detailed within. There are also bonus recipes in the book. We were also given a very simple but very effective wok spatula made from a coconut shell to take home.Honestly for 1000 Baht you would be hard pressed to find a better value activity in Bangkok. Can't recommend this place and the experience highly enough. Oh, and I would suggest not eating before you go to class as the 5 course meal is quite filling!

Great experience!. It started with a tour over a market where we got introduced to the different Thai ingredients with all our senses: touch, feel, smell and taste. Back to the cooking school it was a real hands on course with preparing our very own coconut milk, curry & massaman curry. All was done with lots of fun and laugther! I only can recommend it.

AWESOME CLASS. This was by far one of the coolest things we've done in Bangkok and amazing value for money. Jay was our teacher and he was the absolute best....I could spend so much time with him....he made the class so much fun and was very knowledgable....wish we had more time to do more with him..what more can I say the food was great all made by us....my husband and I had a blast thanks heaps Jay....From Robyn and Sam

Flawless experience!!. I had a very special evening!I sent an email booking my cooking lesson for this evening.The reply was very well explained. The place is beautiful, very clean, functional and nicely decorated. The teacher(Koong is excellent! I couldn't praise her highly enough!!) is wonderful: funny, attentive and speaks very good English. I was also very happy with the meal we cooked(every day of the week is a different menu). The experience of seating on the floor to learn about ingredients and mixing them was very autentic. We went to a different room (standing up this time) for using the hob and again another room(with table and chairs) for tasting each course). Well done!

A great way to spend half a day in Bangkok. This was the second time I attended and it was just as enjoyable as the first. I took a different class which covered different dishes, but the method was the same. You slice it, dice it, cook it and eat it. A five course lunch of perfect Thai home cooking. You decide how much spice you want to add (if any). Class two included chicken cashew and fried fish cakes with dipping sauce which were - as usual - excellent.If you like to cook, this is a Bangkok must.

Great fun and really tasty!. Great way to spend a day in Bangkok. Started off with a trip to the local market which was really interesting, then we got to cooking all sorts of Thai yumminess. Goong, our teacher, was so lovely, and the class was a perfect balance of hands on doing it yourself and guidance. I'm a keen cook and my boyfriend is a novice and we both loved it.Most importantly the food we made was amazing! Absolutely stuffed afterwards, avoid a big breakfast/ lunch.Looking forward to using our complimentary recipe books when we get home!

Fantastic day. If you have a spare day and a spare 1000baht (aprox. £20) I would wholly recommend silom cooking school. Everyone is encouraged to get to know each other and make friends which was perfect for me as a lone traveller. Everyone attending is up for a laugh and a good time, we made 6 meals in 4 hours and after making the meal you sit down 'as a family' to eat it together. Find out which menu you want to be cooking on the website, it gives you the course schedule per day. At the end you are given a cook book with each of your recipes in and more. It was such a lovely day and you are able to take so many great pictures to remember it by.

big fun!. I did this class together with my girlfriend. She likes thai food, I like cooking ;-). We took the morning class, which starting at a local market. You learn the basics about thai cooking in a fun and friendly way. All was very well prepared by the school which made this cooking class a laid back activity. We ate enough for a day (so skip breakfast) and went home inspired to do some thai cooking. We also received a nice little cookbook containing the dishes we prepared (and others).

Lots of Fun. My boyfriend and I did the evening class (we had hoped to do the earlier classes as you get to go to the markets to buy your ingredients but sadly they were fully booked). However this did not dampen our fun! There were 4 of us in the class which was a really nice number. We cooked 4 dishes in all and ate each one after we had cooked it. I was stuffed in a good way at the end of the evening! Our chef/teacher had an excellent sense of humour and explained everything from each ingredient to particular methods really well. At the end of the class you are given a cooking book with various recipes including the dishes that were made during the class. The cooking facilities were also really clean and easy to use. This was an excellent activity to do in Bangkok and I would love to do it again!

Thai Cooking in Thailand - a MUST do!. My husband and I decided to go to a cooking class while in Bangkok. We chose Silom because it offered classic dishes prepared in a classic way (i.e., on the floor and in a house with outdoor kitchens) and included a market tour. You meet your chef at a street corner near the market and are escorted through the market with explanations on what everything was and how to buy it. One of the things I learned was how to tell if a shrimp is fresh! It was also helpful to learn about all of the vegetables/roots/herbs I am not familiar with (Tamarind for example). Our chef was Oat and he was gracious and patient and very good at teaching the art of Thai cooking. This is the first hands-on cooking class I have taken that I actually got to do everything – most classes you share the experience with 1 or more other people. We each made our own portions of each dish – no small task in that we made 5 dishes plus our own green curry paste. We even made our own coconut milk which was a great experience. Each day has a set menu of items you will cook – so if you want to come to this school, pick the day that offers the menu items you’d like to learn to make. All of the prep work is done is a large room on the floor with a mat and all of the ingredients arranged in beautiful baskets and dishes – each person has their own chopping block and knife and chops everything needed for all of the menu items. We were even taught to wash and arrange things in a pleasing way before we cooked. Each person has their own cooking station as well so you really get the experience of actually cooking it yourself. Being a Monday, we made Spicy Shrimp Soup, Pad Thai, Chicken Salad, Green curry with chicken and desert rubies in coconut milk (this was amazing – who would have thought turnips could be so good?) The class also included basic instruction on what was important in Thai cooking and what was not – so that recipes are not set in stone – just certain parts. Good to know! The best part was eating it all! All that for $35 US and excellent camaraderie with other students from all over the world and you leave with a cookbook so you can’t possibly forget how to do it! It was the best experience we had in Bangkok! We should have signed up for more days! So if you find yourself with 5 hours with nothing to do in Bangkok – this would be a fun, enriching, delicious way to spend that time.

Fun & very reasonably priced. Not being a fan of cooking I didn't know what to expect from this Thai cooking experience! It was first class. Meet for the market tour as it's really interesting to see & be told about the various ingredients that are essential to Thai cooking.Oat the head chef has a great sense of humour & the morning flew by! I still can't believe I made Tom Yum soup from scratch & Thai Green Chix curry.Made a change from shopping & at 1000 Baht was very reasonable.

Exceptional value & immense fun :). The perfect way to spend a morning in Bangkok. Selecting produce from the market and then back to the delightful school premises for some hands on cookery.Brilliant, informative and witty instruction from Oat our head chef for the session. I will definitely be going back when I'm next in Bangkok. Five thumbs up from me.
Must do when you go Bangkok. Cooked most of the dishes. Manager Maai & Chef Oat is friendly and humorous person.You eat what you cooked.Price is reasonable.

Easy and Fun. In the few hours you are with your host and the cooking school staff you are completely immersedin the instruction of Thai cooking. The market visit, the clean and we prepared school all a great cooking lesson. Light hearted and tasty. Go have fun and learn. I cook every day and I learned a few new things!

Sweatshop school with sleazy owner. We are from Hawaii, in the food business, and generally very supportive of food businesses anywhere in world, having taken numerous courses in Asia, Europe & Hawaii. Had our hotel call to confirm meeting place & time, only to have no one from school appear. We found our way to school through Bangkok heat, and were met with derisive and flippant owner who dismissed their lack of concern for their failure to meet us or even answer phone call with statement that "that's okay, you're here now." Cooking instructor was already returning from market tour with about 10 other students, and it was obvious that we were expendable as students given the others present. Same reaction given by Mai, his point guard, whereupon my wife decided we didn't want to continue given their arrogant & flippant attitude. Owner grabbed my arm, and my wife stopped me from decking the poor excuse for cooking school owner. He had Mai send me an apologetic email afterwards, throwing Mai "under the bus" and giving her all the blame for their horrible manner. Before we left, saw "cooking setup" which features elbow to elbow woks with no room for prep or anything else, hence my reference to "sweatshop operation." Despite other reviews, do yourself a favor & take classes elsewhere, this place is a dive.

Fun way of learning the basics of Thai cuisine. What you get for your money:We booked online and communication was great!Meeting with your instructor close to market area. You get a little basket for the shopping, with half a liter of complimentary water (which you can refill back at the cooking school as often as you like, so don't bother bringing your own).A little tour through the market, including explanations of Thai vegetables and herbs and what the difference is in regards to our European versions. We were two groups with 6 people each, so not big groups really.Walking back to the school, you prepare I think five or six dishes in 3h. And you get to eat them all :) Tbh, some steps were prepared by an armada of well organised and almost invisible helpers, others we did ourselves hands on. You get inside knowledge about traditional Thai cooking utensils and what are basic musts in the dishes and which ingredients you can replace which what ever is available at your market back home.Our instructor Koy had a great humor and we had some great laughs!The two groups ate together in the same room but were instructed separately. Meal preparation took place traditionally on the floor but a chair was offered if you wanted one. Everyone got their wok assigned outside for the actual cooking sessions. Hand hygiene is held high and before every session of food preparation you are asked to wash your hands. At the end of it all, you get a little booklet with all recipes (and more) you have done during the day and less of a question mark in your eyes when looking at menus in Thai restaurants in the future!On your way out you leave the fee of 1000THB in a basket.We have done this course as a couple and enjoyed it very much!For someone that already has basic knowledge of Thai cooking, this mightn't be the class to be taking but I think they offer advanced courses as well.We would recommend Silom Thai Cooking School!

I love it!. When you are in Bangkok, doing this cooking class is a must! Fun to learn, fun to cook and fun to eat! Although the cost is around USD $35, the experience and the food you eat are way more than it. We had a five course meal and it was real Thai cooking and not the wanna be Thai food!

Fun and filling class!!. Really enjoyable and learned some cooking technics and detailed information on the ingredients! The trip to the market is simple and not as hot as I have expected and they are very caring to make sure all of us has a bottle of ice water! The way back to the class is short and everything was set and ready for us to cook! Our chef was Oats and he is a super funny guy and made our class more energetic and fun! I was amazed with our easy to cook Thai food and very delicious too! I have already tried one of the dishes at home and it was as easy! My friend enjoyed it as much as I did and we had so much fun! Highly recommend this to anyone who wants to try Thai cooking class!

A must-do in BKK. Putzing through the market, chopping and stirring, laughing and eating. Add this as a must -do when you have time in BKK. I arrived clueless about how I'd spend my three days in BKK -- aside from temples here and there -- and I'm so glad I booked this class as a recc from a peer.Not technical, but that was the fun of it all. As our instructor Chef Jay said, "Just be yourself." He was great.

Amazing. Fantastic cooking school our teacher Oat was amazing and really made you relax and enjoy the class. It's the first time I can say I enjoyed eating my own Thai cooking. It is so simple when you know how :). You start with a trip to the fresh markets and pick all the veggies and herbs. Then back to the school for cooking and eating. Thanks again to Oat and Mai for a really great day out. Best value and best fun cooking school I have done.
Great fun. Was great fun and great value for the price. Very interesting trip to the market followed by easy to follow cooking instruction and good, simple facilities. Definitely recommend.

Oh What Fun. My husband and I took this class together and it was quite a lot of fun. I looked at several options for classes and decided to go with Silom, and glad we did. The menu included some classic Thai dishes, which is what you want when you dont have a lot of time. We took public transport to the school, but they provided very detailed instructions and it was totally easy and stress free. The trip to the market first was a nice treat and then on to class. Chef Jay and Maai were quite delightful and we learned a lot. Can't wait to get home to host my first Thai dinner party.

Best thing we did in Thailand. So fun! Mai and Oat made the trip informative and exciting. You'll meet on the street, but don't let that scare you off. Head over to the market where your chef explains your ingredients, head back to the cooking school (modest but comfortable accommodations) and get a detailed class on what you're cooking and how to cook it. Eat all day and walk out of there full, educated, and carrying a cookbook. I really can't explain how great this was.

Good value and tasty food, but not hands-on enough. My partner and I are foodies, and were disappointed that a lot of the prep work was done for you and there was a bunch of sitting around between dishes. If you're looking for a class with some hands-on components, but fairly easy as a participant, this would be a good fit. If you want to go through all the steps of each dish, this is probably not the right class for you. Overall, it felt pretty touristy for a cooking class even though the chef was very knowledgeable and all the food from the day was delicious. We also appreciated getting a printed recipe book, which we've already cooked from at home.

Fun, easy, well-organized cooking class. This was a great half day activity. Email responses when signing up were prompt and thorough. Finding the meeting point is easy - the email they sent me had four photos of the meeting spot so it could not be missed! The instructors speak excellent English and make the class easy and fun. My pad thai and massaman were delicious. I highly recommended Silom Thai Cooking School.

Great cooking experience. The morning was exactly as promised. Met as a group near a local market and bought fish and vegetables with our guide/cook who had a great sense of humour and was very knowledgeable. We then walked the short distance to the actual cookery school to prepare and eat the first of our five dishes. The quality of instruction and information was excellent. We learned a lot and we had a great time. Would thoroughly recommend it!

Fantastic Cooking School. Our family attended the morning class in which we met on the street and walked to a nearby food market to gather our ingredients for the day. Our chef was outstanding and the food was to die for. We all loved the class and have already made the dishes at home.

A great experience that delivered all it promised.. The small group of eight that we were part of included dedicated cooks determined to grasp the finer arts of Thai cooking down to ourselves - who thought it might just be fun to learn a little and enjoy the process. When the half day was over it seemed all were well satisfied.The whole process was highly organised. The detailed instructions to reach them were faultless. And there was a backroom team setting lots of stuff up while our informative cook walked us through the big issues at a pace that we could easily follow and in excellent English. It was all charming and personable – our names were remembered, questions were asked and encouragement was given. Better still, we got to eat what we had cooked ourselves and it was really delicious. So something had gone right.It also seemed incredibly good value with dedicated tuition, lots of support, all the ingredients and a nice booklet of the recipes we had worked through. Surprise – there was not even a big sell and a ‘please exit through the gift shop’. We left with a nice experience in our hearts, a warm tang on our lips, and our wallets not having been raped. A lovely way to spend half a day in Bangkok.

you have just have to!. There was four of us who booked it last minute by phone. There was no problem. They sent us a map and directions by fax to our hostel. We met our amazing chef who was full of energy and spoke English very well. She took us for a tour of the local market so we could pick up the ingredients we would need for our class. That experience alone sets it apart from other classes. Having the knowledge of the ingredients is something I'll remember for ever. The school is clean and appealing. It's beautifully set up and user friendly. They keep it interesting and fun. The best part is how well organized it is. There were 8 people in my group and there was never any waiting around or clean up. We would go out and cook and we would come back to the classroom and it was set up to go for the next task. This is a must do! Worth the 1000 Baht. Best experience so far in Bangkok!

silom thai cooking school tops. We hadnt booked any tours for our 3nts in bkk, so went to conscierge and took a punt on what they offered - we booked this school and got the train about 4 stops from where we stayed (Ibis Siam - right at National Stadium station) and met Olly our chef - there were 7 in the class and we all got baskets to take to local markets where olly gave us a good tour and was very informative about all the sights and smells!!! - we then went back to this little apartment - in 'suburban' bangkok, and he showed us how to cook Pad thai, spring rolls, green mango salad and yummy coconut battered bananas....was delicious, ive already made a few of the things from the recipe book we were given. Olly was a joy, very funny, and knowledgeable, we had a ball - definitely recommend, my travelling companions said it was the highlight of bkk !!!

Great experience!. This was one of the highlights of my trip. I learnt so much in the 4 hour class and had so much fun learning too It was awesome going to the markets to get all the food fresh and learn about each ingredient as well.Our tutor was so funny and he got everyone involved and seeing as it was a small group of 7 people, we were able to get one on one instructions and was great to leave having made some friends.

Really enjoyed our cooking class here - many thanks everyone. Really enjoyed our day cooking class here at the Silom Thai cooking school. The instructor was great, and we learnt a lot about the delicious herbs and spices that make up a selection of famous Thai dishes.Yes, the 1,000BHT fee each was a little steep but we had 4 or 5 dishes there and the school gave us a lovely book with a recap of recipes created.I was particularly impressed how the school amended the recipes for my friend who has many allergies.

BEST BANGKOK ATTRACTION!. If you are looking for something different to do in bangkok, than i suggest this. Its in the heart of silom, and was a great way to learn about cooking thai. I thought it was very reasonablly priced too. Just 1000 baht and you cook 5 dishes and eat them all! We had such a great time and the staff were super friendly. We also got a booklet at the end of all the recipes so no need to write anything down.

Good times and you get a recipe book!!. If you are suffering from temple fatigue, then take a break and learn some Thai cooking. This is the most useful, helpful and enjoyable thing we did in Bangkok. The day started with a visit to the local market. We had chef Oliver (great guy) who explained the various local Thai ingredients used in Thai cooking. After grabbing a few items from the market, we headed back to the cooking school along the hidden alleyways of Bangkok by foot. Everything was well prepared and so organized. Good flow through out the class. Highly recommended. It costs 1000 Baht per person and worth every penny.

Pricy but a great experience. I was surprised to hear the price (1000 baht) of the class but my husband and I really enjoyed ourselves. We took the evening class so the market visit wasn't an option for us but the chef did a great job of introducing all the food items to us at the school. 4-5 dishes (I can't recall) were made in total so you really end up stuffed towards the end. The school itself was very well hidden so I appreciate being picked up from the metro stop. The chef was accommodating to my dietary needs which was much appreciated.

Amazing food, great teacher!. My partner and I did the afternoon cooking class with Goong as our guide/teacher. We paid 1200bhat for the course as we booked through an agent and thought it was worth it. We started by going to the nearby markets for an informative tour on thai vegetables and collected some of the ingredients needed for the day. We didn't know what we were going to make untill we arrived which was one of the bonuses as we thought there would be too many good things to choose from if we had to. Once we arrived at the school, a very clean organised place that smelt amazing, we were sat in the dining area for about 5 min while they set up our rooms. We were each given interesting books about Thailand to look thru while we waited. There was 6 people in our group and 6 in another group in the next room. We made a total of 5 dishes, starting straight away with pad thai (the best one we had in Thailand) which we then were able to enjoy straight away for lunch. We then made vege spring rolls with sweet chilli sauce and papaya salad and ate them in the class. We finished by making banana fritters and massaman curry and got to enjoy them for dinner and even got icecream with the banana fritters for dessert. All the food was exceptional and was adjusted to our individual taste I.e spicy or not spicy. The course was not make your own but we all had a pretty good hands on experience and learnt all the necessary skills needed to make it at home. Our guide goong was a lovely lady, very friendly helpful and funny. Being a chef myself I found this a great experience and would do it again to learn something different. We all received a recipee book with about 30 dishes in it and could take free postcards at the end.

The best 1000b spent, great course, great teachers great fun!!. I saw this course recommended in the lonely planet and the night before I emailed and they replied almost immediately. The course was great it begin with the visit to the market which was great as we got to learn how to pick the best ingredients and also what to use when you get back home if you can't find these items! We cooked 6 lovely dishes and we have tried one since we got home. The chef teachers are great, very informative and very open to questions, its good fun and the groups are not too big. We would highly recommend this course we had seen others without a market trip that cost more. However you do need to grt to the meeting point yourself but they will fax the directions in thai to your hotel so you only have to show this to the taxi driver and it shouldnt cost any more than about 70b to get there which isnt bad for a good experience. its great fun and you get to meet great people all whilst learning about delicious Thai cooking! Also we did the morning course and found it hard to eat the food at the early time so if your like us and more used to eating afternoon I'd go for the afternoon course so you can fully enjoy all your creations. In saying that we brought two dishes home so ask for a container if you can't eat it. Enjoy!!

The cheapest and well organized. Two reasons we took this Thai cooking class one with it's located not far from our hotel and second they are well organized with the easy menu and they way they thought us how to differentiate the herbs and which what to use on each dishes and you can also separate the chilies or spices as you wish.the cooking was not that difficult as some Western foods.Easy to catch up and you must love cooking then it is fun to learn Thai cooking

Love it. Came to now about this cooking school while searching online. Decided to go for it as the location is quite near to my hotel and the price is quite affordable with the amount of dishes we are going to learn and also the wet market tour.The chef is funny and taught us the different types of ingredients and some cooking tips. It's only after this cooking class, then I know the difference between coconut cream and coconut milk, and how to identify the difference. And the best is how to squeeze the lime juice with the knife and letting it drip into a small container using simple steps.We get to taste and eat the food that we cooked immediately. The ingredients were fresh, I could not imagine myself eating the Tom Yum Goong I cooked myself. Apart from cooking, I also get to know friends from around the world who share the same passion like me for cooking. I really recommend to join this class and they have different menu each day. I love this experience and will surely be back again.

Awesome...i will come back. We booked a class and everything worked out as planned. They even helped with food allergy problems and found substitutes. The food we mad was awesome and we met really nice people. First we went to the market where we learned everything about certain vegetables and then we went to the school where we made our own coconut milk and all kinds of dishes. I fell in love even more with thailand and I already loved it! I hope to come back one day and do my second cooking class here!

Well spent 1000 B!. For this price - you really can't ask for more - you get the market visit (for me the most interesting part), well English speaking and funny guide,´great meals... all in very nice environment! Recipes are given in the end as a small book. I appreciate also the unusual parts of the course as making the coconut cream and milk and home-made curry paste.

Enjoyable cooking experience. My husband and I took a cooking class at Silom Thai Cooking School and highly recommend it. We researched a couple of options before our trip to Bangkok and decided to go with a Silom Thai because of their menu, convenient location and price. I corresponded with them by e-mail to make arrangements for a Monday morning class. On the morning of the class we waited in our spot at the Nonsi BTS but no one came to pick us up so we went back to our hotel to check e-mail. Monday was a holiday and I thought maybe we had missed last minute instructions. I didn't have any messages from the school and I sent an e-mail letting them know that we had missed them. Within minutes we had a e-mail apologizing for the miscommunication and we were offered a free class that afternoon or another day of our choice. They called the hotel and faxed information before we had a chance to respond to the e-mail. We took the afternoon class and had a great experience. Mai made sure that everything was OK and overall the school is very well organized. Oliver was a good teacher and answered all of our questions, most of the actual cooking was hands-on. The class was very basic which met our needs because we were not familiar with Thai dishes before our trip. Because we each made our own dishes, we were able to add as much chili as we wanted. The recipe book reinforced what we learned and helped us find seasonings to take back home with us.

Fun ,learning experience! Love it. Been to bangkok few times, this is first time doing the cooking course.. Really great to see the market place and learn few stuffs. Can't remember the chef name but she fun, loving person to keep the engery flowing. We cook dish by dish, ate together , so remember not to eat too much for breakfast.. By the time you reach 3rd dishes, you are very full.. The meal we cooked is the best we ever tried in bangkok.. And it so simply..definitely will be back to learn more.. Keep up the good works! 2 thumbs up!

A must.. I did this with three friends while in Bangkok in 2012. It was so much fun and we learned loads about Thai cooking. Firstly the instructors give you a tour of a local market, they are so knowledgeable and make everything so easy to remember. You then go to the school and do 5-6 different dishes, you are helping and involved for the whole class. The instructors manage to maintain their high levels of energy for the whole thing, entertaining the class. You get to eat everything you make and you get a complimentary cook book. The facilities are very traditional and wonderful. I cannot praise this facility enough. It is a must while in Bangkok.

Good environment, Interesting and informative class. I attended the morning session with three courses prepared by ourselves. The day started with market visit. The cook Oliver is a humourous man and he speaks good English. He provides clear steps to us and explains the ingredients. The three rooms in the school are well furnished and clean. Overall the class is well oranized and easy to make people happy and fun. The manager Mai provides a very clear direction to the school before our departure and she replied our enquiries promptly. Will recommend to other visitors even they are not good at cooking. A good try!

Great trip to market, great price, great recipe book. Great price hence registered this after introduction from friends. Love the market tour, introduction on various key thai ingredients. Had fun learning how to cook. Took the morning class which was 9am-1pm. Tomyum soup - just felt it was not as flavouful as some I tasted elsewhereRecipe book was great! Lots of thai dishes... thanks lots

So much fun and a great experience. It was the first that we participated at a Cooking Class and we regret already that we didnt came already before. We stay every year in Bangkok and for sure for the next visit we like to attend again. It is a great experience and we enjoy a lot. First to the market and afterwards starts the cooking class. It is great value for money what you get in this four hours and you can take something with you what you will never forget.

Great Class and Teacher. I took a half day class about 4 years ago and enjoyed it greatly. So much so that when I am in Bangkok in April, I have signed up for two more classes. The instructor is funny and knowledgable and a little full of himself, but a good guy all in all. I have not taken any other cooking classed in Thailand but would recommend this one.

Absolutely fabulous!. We did this course on the last day of our travels and what a brilliant way to finish! First of all we went for a walk round the market where we learnt about the different ingredients we were going to be using. Then we came back to the school, and made five delicious dishes. Our teacher/chef Jay was amazing and kept us thoroughly entertained! Everyone should do this course whilst in Bangkok if they have the chance.

An incredible experience. This was the best cooking class I've ever taken! One thing that made it stand out was that each of us in the class made every one of the dishes, from start to finish. (Other cooking schools I've been to divide the labor, so each participant ends up cooking only some of the dishes, and even then sometimes only a part of the ones he or she works on.) So each dish I ate was one that I prepared from beginning to end. (Well, almost: typically, the raw materials were measured and laid out in advance.) The personnel were great: our chef, Oliver, was charming, informative, speaks excellent English, and has a great sense of humor. The manager, Mai, was helpful and pleasant. It is also an excellent value, one of the less expensive of the very many cooking schools in Bangkok. One thing to bear in mind is that the school is in a third-floor walk-up apartment, so if you're disabled or stairway averse you might take that into account.

Worth the price! Not a ridiculous amount of food (which is good). We found this cooking school after several hours of exhausting internet research and were not disappointed. Most of the cooking schools in Bangkok are quite expensive, and while this was certainly more than we had paid in both Vietnam and Cambodia for similar cooking experiences, this one was much more professional and reasonable. The market visit wasn't that interesting, especially if you already know what all the fruits and vegetables are, but it's probably worth it for many people. Back at the school, you get some really nice personal attention because it's not a restaurant with a cooking class in the corner - it's JUST a cooking school, which is great. There are two things about Silom Thai Cooking School that I commend them on. One is that the food proportions are very reasonable.
