You cook each dish one at a time and then eat them, which spaces things out a little, and you also don't get mountains of food to eat. You won't leave hungry, but you won't feel like death either. The other thing that was nice was the cookbook we received before we left. It's a full colour booklet containing all the recipes they offer, including lists of ingredients and pictures of everything you should use. We were able to take the book over to Top's Supermarket around the corner and purchase a lot of the spices and pastes so we can cook Thai food when we return home!Thanks James (our chef and teacher) for a fun afternoon!

Trip highlight. Without a doubt this was the trip highlight for myself and two friends. Very easy to book online, with detailed instructions on where and where to meet along with directions and photos.We booked the morning class which included a trip to the local market to buy our ingredients, then back to the school where you were seperated into smaller groups with a chef. Our chef spoke really good english, was very friendly and genuinely happy to teach us. Goong was her name, I believe.Everything was very clean and well organised. The food was amazing, once we had finished cooking, we were able to sit down at our dining table and eat! Recommend not eating breakfast beforehand! There were 5 courses.We made Tom Yung Goong soup, Chicken with cashew nut, Phaneaeng curry paste, Green Curry with chicken, Phanaeng curry and how to make mango and sticky rice.The school offers morning and afternoon classes, different receipes for different days of the week. We would definitely go back again.
A real treat. This was a great half day experience. Chef jay was great. I recommend the am class as the market tour is not to be missed. We cooked the best curry I have had on my trip.

Loved it - highly recommended!. As the least keen chef in our relationship, I was happy to go along to this cook school but didn't expect too much. Turned out to be great fun, however, and a real highlight of our Bangkok visit. Booking and directions were really simple, and the actual afternoon was meticulously organised - I couldn't believe the number of dishes we got to make and enjoy without feeling rushed.The atmosphere is very homely and friendly and you are soon chatting with your fellow class-mates and teachers. Presentation of the ingredients is gorgeous - truly food for the eyes - and the cooking so simple and enjoyable.All in all, highly recommended and a real bargain at the price compared to other cook schools we looked at. Just make sure you don't eat much before coming - you'll be stuffed!

Very nice experience. Our chef was really kind and spoke very well English, which is a breath of fresh air in Thailand. The lessons where well organised and the area was also hygienic, important for cooking. At the end we received a recipe book and now we're trying the recipes ourselves at home. The lessons are set up for everybody and it is nice to get acquainted with Thai products and dishes. I would recommend the cooking school class to everybody. Not only for the experience but also the nice meals you are able to eat afterwards.

Fabulous food, excellent entertainment. From the shopping at the local food market, to the education in Thai cooking, and the entertainment of our chef Oliver, I can't think of a better way to spend the New Year in Bangkok! The ingredients used were so fresh, so full of flavor, each of the 5 courses we prepared, were like magic in the mouth! The shrimp, the chicken, the fresh herbs and vegetables, were all quality ingredients. We even learned to make our own curries, sauces, and spice blends, using ingredients we can easily find in our local markets back home. At the end of this wonderful adventure, we each received cookbooks to continue preparing this heavenly cuisine at home. Would go again the next time we are in Bangkok!

We had so much fun. We absolutely loved this. We made a late booking and were accommodated easily. Even though I didn't pay for my 9 year old daughter, Oliver let her do a few bits. He and David are great. Everything is well run. Oliver is really funny too. The food that we made was absolutely delicious. I can't wait to try it at home. You even get a recipe book at the end to take away.Loved it. Woudl definitely recommend.

These ladies are awesome. Silom cooking class was an unexpected highlight of our visit in Bangkok. We picked this school based on price and a recommendation in a travel book. Upon the first communication with them, we were instantly impressed, and they never let us down. Silom runs an incredibly professional operation. Extremely clear and concise directions and instructions were emailed to us on where to meet. The trip to the market is well planned and executed, giving a great intro to the ingredients used. The actual brick and mortar cooking school is well laid out, extremely clean, and pleasant to be in. They have the class organized very well and everything is done at a perfect pace. These women seem to have taken classes on how to teach people because the instruction method is excellent. Of course, the food selections are great and tastes absolutely delicious! My wife and I felt that what really made the course a success is the people running it and their commitment to a good product. Thank you, Mai and Goong for a fun afternoon!

Informative, fun, and tasty. Silom was very highly recommended to us by friends who had done it and we were not disappointed. The trip to the market was interesting and we learned a great deal about the ingredients. Our female chef had a wonderful personality, very good English, and effectively engaged everyone in the diverse group (the other couples were Japanese, Korean, and French). The afternoon class was a good way to escape the heat of the day and have an early dinner. The food we made was some of the best of our entire trip.If we had had more time in BKK, we might have gone back on a second day to make other dishes ... it was that good.

Absolute must!. The school is more affordable than most of the schools in Bangkok
The class was great and chef Oliver was particularly hilarious and fun.
Great atmosphere and teaching

A must do in Bangkok! Evening class makes for the best dinner.. My husband and I have been touring Vietnam, Cambodia, and Thailand for the past few weeks and have been to 4 cooking schools (2 in Vietnam, 1 in Cambodia, 1 in Thailand). This one was by far the best! Great chefs, great menu, explained all of the ingredients/techniques, and excellent food. Our group was 8 people which made it intimate and personal. Our chef Goong was funny, knowledgable, and had been cooking since a child. Highly recommend the evening class.

Excellent activity in BKK. I booked a class by e-mail when I was in BKK. I received an answer and confirmation very quickly. Also the instruction for the location were good.The group was good, eight person.The instructor spoke good English and made a good athmosphere in the class. She also explained clearly very important basic issues concerning Thai cooking. I really enjoyed this experience and warmly recommend this to everybody.

A great activity in Bangkok. After searching the net for a decently priced school which did the dishes I wanted and had some availability, I came across Silom Thai. They had a very competitive price and their communication was excellent. They emailed us a response and the details and then asked for final confirmation. We were provided with Thai directions to show the Taxi driver and it was generally a pleasant experience.The dishes we cooked tasted and looked great. Our instructor was awesome. A very funny man. I was very happy with this half day activity in Bangkok. I highly recommend Silom Thai, if you have time.

Most enjoyable and instructive. Planned a trip to BKK to learn some Thai cooking, ended up being an on again off again last minute trip.So was unable to book ahead, when I arrived in BKK, I contacted Silom Thai cooking school, and they were able to get me onto a course the next day. I enjoyed the class so much that I proceeded to attend classes for 3 days straight.I particularly appreciated the extra effort made on my behalf on the last day, where the dishes scheduled were a repeat of my first class, so instead of cooking the same dishes, they arranged a special menu for me.Also because I attended classes 3 days, I received a cerificate - a nice touchThanks to all at the school.

Beyond Expectation. I attended the cooking class at Silom Thai cooking without high expectation. Reversably, Chef Jay had changed everything. His talented had me surprised how well he explained all the questions I had asked him. Evenmore, he advise lots of additional useful knowledge to all the student. He is patient, polite, and hilrarious. Four hours with him was just like 2 hours. Chef Jay, thank you so much. Should I happen to come back to Thailand. It is definitely you who will be my chef. Thank you.

informative, easy to learn & definitely an enjoyable experience.. my two friends & i has an added advantage in getting to learn from two wonderful chefs Oliver & Goong. (due to a switch of class since one student didnt turn up, nothing to worry about). both of them were amazing, informative. taught you what you can subside an ingredients with should we unable to find back home & etc. above all, in they love to add humour in the classes that makes the whole experience more enjoyable. & oh, for my muslim friends, fret not. it's halal. the owner is a muslim. & also you can see for yourself when they bring you to the market. they got the chicken from the halal stall. (:

Enjoy learning about Thai cooking, and the food's halal too!. We completed our class today and agree with the other reviewers- it's well run, and an interesting way to learn about Thai cooking, from ingredients, techniques, etc, from knowledgeable cooks. A plus point for us is that the owner is Thai Muslim and hence the ingredients used are halal.Also, no MSG used..excellent! I never knew my favourite Thai dishes were so easy to make until i attended this class!

super !. Take cooking lessons at the Silom Thai Cooking School was a great experience.Price 1000BHT for 5 or 6 hours is a super price. (Kho Lanta is aaround 2500 to 3200 !)super organization, clear vocabulary even for those who would not feel comfortable with english, structured, technique, humour, delicious meals, family ambient, very nice place.I strongly recommend this place !!

Memorable experience, great food and friendly team. We attended another class at the Silom Thai Cooking School since our first visit four years ago.Now, Nusi no longer runs classes on his own but he has a team of chefs and assistants who speaks good English (very important if you are going to learn anything at all) and are friendly, professional and great at what they do.Mai confirmed our booking via a couple of emails. She met us at the train station in the morning and took us to the local wet market where we met Goong, our chef/teacher for the morning class. After the introduction to the local produce in the market, we went back to the cooking school which is housed in a three storey apartment/building. Goong took us through the cooking of five different types of Thai food. She explains each step clearly, guide us as we each cook our own food and offering advice on ingredient substitutes so that we can actually cook the same food back home.What makes the cooking class interesting is that everyone is given his/her own wok, chopping board, etc., so you get hands-on experience instead of just watching the chef cooks. After cooking each course, we sat down to enjoy the food we cook ourselves. Even people can't cook like myself enjoys the experience very much.Overall, the experience is still just as splendid, the team is still as friendly and the food is still as great as we had experienced four years ago. We will definitely visit again the next time we are in Bangkok.

So inexpensive that you have to cook on the floor!. I would joke that it is so inexpensive that they cannot afford tables to cook on, but it is, as we were told, a traditional way of Thai cooking.So, now all jokes aside, this was one of the best experiences that I have had in Thailand in 15 years of visits to Thailand! The Silom Thai Cooking school facility was very clean, and well maintained. When you arrive at the school, you are provided with a locker for your personal belongings, although I kept my camera with me, and am glad I did.The days menu was very well thought out, providing a variety of Thai staple foods to learn from.Keep in mind, in a 4 hour class, you will probably NOT be able to learn everything about Thai cooking. And I know that will be a surprise to some people out there. So all of the ingredients are pre-measured for your convenience. This makes it kind of a 'paint by numbers' class, but that is not a bad thing. We were able to spend more time on the process of making the base ingredients. I never imagined I would learn how to make coconut milk or cream, but today I learned this very simple practice, and am sure I will use it at home to improve my cooking.I also did not know how relatively easy it is to make a masaman curry paste. Everything was presented clearly and concisely. The staff spoke clearly in Englsh, which is truly appreciated by the lingually challenged like myself. But our class, which was broken into two groups, was made up of an Aussie, an American, a couple of Kiwi's, several Germans, and a nice young couple from Korea. It seems that everyone was able to understand the class, and more importantly, I think that at the end of the class, we all had a great boost to our Thai cooking confidence, and had a great time doing so.And dont worry about taking notes... the school provides you with a recipe book at the end of the class, so that you can try these things (and more) at home.In all, it was a great experience in which I learned a lot, made some nice friends, and had a fantastic meal that I can proudly say that I made!And who knows... if time permits on the back end of my trip, I may attend another class at the Silom Thai Cooking School! I would genuinely tell you that this was 4 hours and THB1000 well spent, and I look forward to experiencing it again soon.Finally, if the two women from Germany or the couple from Korea read this, I hope they will contact me (no offense to the men in my group :) )

Great experience !!!. Had a great time at Silom cooking school .Jey and may are the best !!!!I recommend this wonderful expiriance to everyone even if you r not very good in the kitchen .It's fun ,simple and most of all tastey !!!!

Brilliant cooking school. If you're looking for a wonderful food experience then this is it. Start out with a walk through the markets selecting the local fresh produce then back to the school to prepare, cook and eat! Friendly, informative and very helpful it is simply a wonderful experience. Couldn't recommend it highly enough.

Highlight of our holiday. Had the best time of my stay in Bangkok.Thoroughly enjoyed ourselves.Well worth the Thb 1000.Will do this again when next in BKK. Well organised yet very relaxed atmosphere.We highly recommend.

From Soup (Tom Yum) to Nuts (Cashew Chicken). From the moment we were greeted by the schools manager Mai...to when we were given a cookbook of Thai recipes as our parting gift...this was a well oiled machine. A delightful mixture of education, entertainment and delicious food were the incredients for a memorable experience. The entire class lasted about four hours and started with a trip to a local market to procure all our fresh produce where we were taught about each of the incredients and their use in traditional Thai cuisine. We cooked 5 dishes (including mango coconut sticky rice for dessert) so make sure you don't eat much before coming or you wont be able to enjoy all the fruits of your labor.

A lot of fun!. Do it! So worth it!The staff was so friendly and taught us a bunch of stuff. I'm not an experienced cook. I don't even like to cook that much, but I'd do it again tomorrow morning.They even give you a nice recipe booklet with all the recipes they teach their students not just the ones you did that day.Two thumbs up!

Amazing bangkok highlight!. one of the highlights of my trip, I'm a big foodie and adore cooking in general, I felt that our school was cozy, intimate, educational, fun, and our teacher Oliver was funny and a real cool guy. It really allowed me to get to know thai culture on another level and i learnt so much in this 4 hour experience. One of the greatest experiences in thailand! Great value for the price (1000baht!) and the school trusted that you'll show up so you dont need to put a deposit, the reservation is easy and hassle free. we went to the market closeby to learn about local produce!

Bad luck, resulted in good luck!. Silom Thai Cooking School to the rescue!!First,the bad luck: My husband and I, along with our friend who was travelling with us, arrived in Bangkok all excited about a full day tour that we were on early the very next day. Unfortunately, as luck would have it, the tour was cancelled at the last minute (20 minutes after the scheduled pick-up time) due to complications. There we were, the three of us standing in the hotel lobby at 7:30 a.m. on a Sunday morning with nothing to do :(Now, the good luck: My husband jumped into action immediately by checking with the hotel's concierge desk to see if there were any other tours we could get on at the last minute. With some quick phone calls and quick decisions we opted for the last three spots to join that morning's cooking lesson at the Silom Thai Cooking School. Best decision ever!!The whole experience was fantastic! We rushed (as time was not on our side) to the meeting point, to be warmly welcomed by our very friendly guide Goong and the other participants for that mornings class. Our first mission was to tour the market and learn about all the fresh ingredients we were going to cook with. That part was definitely an experience of itself. We got to touch, taste and smell some of ingredients to know how to pick out the best, and that is exactly what we did. Only the best would do! All of us received a basket (which included a bottle of water) to put the fresh produce into, in order to help carry it back to the school, which was within walking distance of both the market and pick up point. Very convenient!Upon arriving to the very clean and attractive decor of the school, we were more then excited to get started. With shoes off, aprons on and hands properly washed, we were tasked with washing and artistically presenting our fresh vegetables. The rest was simple prep and lots of fun. We each received a chopping board and knife and a tray to place our prepared ingredients on. Chef Jay entertainingly demonstrated the cutting of the ingredients that were new to us and those that had to be prepared with a special technique. After the demo, we had to do our own, which also resulted in each persons dish being unique and to their own personal liking. With the rest of the ingredients already pre-measured for us, it was off to our individual woks to start cooking. It was a memorable moment to see all of us in a long row at our own cooking station and Chef Jay and Goong in front of us, assisting each of us as neccessary to accomplish a successful dish.After preparing each dish (tom kah gai, chicken & cashew nut and red curry chicken), which we did on our own and the rest (glass noodle salad, fish cakes and bananas in coconut milk), which was done by Chef Jay and as a group, we were taken into the dining room where we proudly ate our own creations. Not wanting to be competitive in any way of course, each of us claimed to have made the best dish :)At the end of the tour, they even reimbursed us for our taxi fare to the school.All three of us want to highly recommend taking a day off the usual highlights of Bangkok tour and join this fabulous cooking school for an experience you will never forget! Thank you Chef Jay, Goong and all the other wonderful people at the SilomThai cooking school for rescuing our day. It was the best!!!

Best experirnce ever with Thai food and amazing chef. Having traveled around asia is just one of our dream. Learing the culture and all attraction places in malaysia, vietnam, and thailand was just unquestionably amazing. Both my wife and I decided to end up in Thailand and decided to join thai cooking class in BKK at Silom Thai Cooking School. We surely enjoyed the cooking class with the talented Chef Jay who explained everything we want to know plus some additinal tricks to let us cook inn our country for impressing our friend in the coming christmas festive. We have to say that the school is so lucky to have Chef Jay being as the cooking instructor at school. Should you have a chance to take the cooking class at Silom Thai Cooking. We encourage you to request Chef Jay as your cooking instructor. You will be surprised how much information you will get from him plus the tenique of taking picture from your finished food. He is one of the Chef who are fill with artistic touch can cater you from beginning to the end. Jay, you deserve this regonition.

I Paid THB1000 For The Highlights Of My SEAsia Trip. Its more than a cooking class! Its a place for you to know yourself better and increase your confidence level. Regardless of how bad your cooking skills, this class will show you how skills can be gain. Not only that, you learn how to be more sociable, strengthen your communication skills and bonding with your partner/friends/family. I would really recommend this class if you introvert type of person.Until today, me and my partner still talk about our memories on this class. We crack into laughter when talk about this. Thank you to our great cheft, Oliver, who made this activities as the highlight of my SEAsia trip. He possessed a very charming character, very hospitable and of course really funny.For vegetarians, you should not face any problem as this place is vegetarians friendly. Please inform them on your reservation email or while doing market tour. For Muslims, they dont use any pork or lard. Perhaps they bought meats and chickens from Thai Muslim seller. Nusi (owner) himself is a Muslim, who can speaks Malay as well.All my foods taste good. Usually I cant eat my self-prepared meals. But this time, I dont leave anything on my plate. If you have to pay for hotel breakfast, skip that! This morning session can cover your breakfast and lunch. You wont get hungry coz when you done your 1st meal, then you start eating before going to the next meal.I will come back here. Very enjoyable, very entertaining and very knowledgable. I feel like a new person once I treasured a cooking skills deep in myself. Oliver is not only a clown, but a motivator! Love each one of you guys!p/s hopefully you guys dont raise the fee. we will always support you from behind ;)

One of the highlight activities of our trip.. My wife and I visited Thailand at the tailend of the rainy season. On a day when I knew the skies would open up (and they did in buckets), we went to Silom Cooking school. We eat Thai food all the time at home in New York City--at least once a week at Sura on the UWS. The food we made at Silom was some of the best Thai I've ever had. Jay was our market guide and chef instructor. He was very entertaining. Silom Cooking School was a great time and a perfect rainy day activity.

Thai cooking made easy. Jay was our chef, very engaging and helped get all the group together. The added attraction is that he takes you to the market first to get the ingredients for the 3 dishes we are going to make.The food tasted great and was fun to make and an amazing value for money. Suggest u go hungry otherwise u won't be able to finish it allMy wife and I fell ill a few hours after the food but we met a couple who cooked with us who were just fine so maybe it was something else. Definitely a good 4 hours of our time.

Excellent class and lots of fun - a must!!!. Thoroughly enjoyed this authentic cooking class and am so pleased we decided to do it. From walking the market and buying ingredients, to preparing the food, to the actual cooking and the eating, it was wonderful. The facilities are excellent and the information given thorough and Helps you understand and appreciate thai food. I wish we'd done it earlier in our trip. Even my partner who is not a cook had a great time and actually surprised me with the quality of his dishes. The staff at the school are brilliant and the information received beforehand excellent, including instructions in Thai for the taxi driver. Mai, the lady who met us is a real character and only added to the experience. Thank you so much, an experience I will always remember.

Simply the best. A fun filled event with real cooking involved. I really don't like cooking classes where you prepare some spices and veggies and then you don't get to cook the food. this is really a demonstration class but at Silom I got to do everything and learnt a lot. You get to participate, cook and eat unreal food. The cook was informative, attentive, funny and patient. I have done cooking classes all over Asia and this one wins hands down. Congratulations!

Fun filled cooking class. This is a cosy cooking school located at the third floor of an apartment. If you are looking for facilities with a professional kitchen, this is not the place. I liked the coziness of he place and it's simple equipment that you can find in your own kitchen. No fancy gadgets, just a wok, stove, mortar and pestle and your hands. It starts off with a tour of the local market where our teacher, Jay, introduced us to the common ingredients that you can find in Thai cuisine.Then we headed to the School. Preparation work is done while seated on the floor, so, ladies, please wear confortable pants or shorts. It's usually, prep the ingredients, proceed to the stove to cook, then feast on your creation and repeat..We did five dishes in total (the menu changes daily, so check their website for what you will be learning for the day) - Tom yum soup, green curry, chicken salad, pad Thai and water chestnut dessert.Each class is nine people max. Our teacher was great and funny. And depending on your luck, you may have very funny classmates that add to the fun. I don't cook at home. For a novice cook, I found the instructions easy to understand. The cooking was easy too with the exception of the heat from the stove. Thai food needs to be cooked in high heat as well.The class comes with a free recipe book that covers the common Thai dishes and items.

Cannot recommend this Cooking School enough. I was in Thailand on business and had a spare evening free so decided to book the cooking school. Goong met us at the train station and walked us through some alleys (i was a bit nervy, but all good in the hood!) and we arrived at Silom.Really well executed school. You cook on the balcony, and there's two rooms: a dining room and a prep room. Goong was just so lovely. Really patient and just happy to share her knowlege. Explained every principle and technique thoroughly, and the details of ingredients that was easy to understand.We made fresh coconut milk, and then prepped Tom Yum Goong (made with the fresh coconut milk). For me this was the highlight of the night (and dessert!). Just so simple, but incredibly delicious.Then onto Chicken and Cashew stirfry. After that we made Penang Curry, and of course the Thai Green Curry. All done with patience and attention to detail. After that we had the sticky rice and mango. Just a wonderful experience, and was a highlight of my trip.I've already used my take home cook book (which has LOADS of info in it!)So if you're wandering around Bangkok, love proper Thai food and have a few hours to kill, this is DEFINITELY worth it! Thank you Goong!

Wonderful experience. My family (age range of 12 to 72) decided to do this course together one afternoon. The staff members at Silom Thai Cooking School were very organized and sent a confirmation by fax to our hotel with details on how to get to the meeting place. First the market trip, which only had a few remaining stalls open (they open very early) but our instructor Jay made identifying the vegetables and herbs informative, fun and interesting. The actual school is located inside one of the small streets and occupied a whole floor of the building. It was a bit of a walk from the market to the school and my 72 year old mother struggled especially in the heat but Jay was understanding and slowed the walking pace. We sat on the floor when preparing the ingredients and my mother coped with this. I was worried when my 12 year old son was asked to cut the vegetables but he was properly supervised so he also coped. There was never a dull moment and we all loved the experience of preparing the ingredients, cooking two dishes then eating them together as a group. There were also lots of photo opportunities while cooking and eating. The owner refunded us the taxi fare to get to the school and gave a discounted rate for the 12 year old. It was value for money and truly a memorable experience for my family.

Awesome! Can't go wrong with 'em. I was in Thailand on a solo trip and decided to take up the classes on a Friday when my other friends were busy shopping during the way. I am so glad I took the glasses.Mai was the coordinator who we worked with to schedule the class and she did a phenomenal job in the entire process. I had this super huge shopping bag with me that Mai took it with her to the school since we had to go to the market to pick/learn about thai vegetables. That was so very sweet of her!Jay was our chef and his sense of humor was simply amazing that made it a lot easier for the team to cook. His style of teaching was fantastic!I made the Tom Yum soup, Pad Thai, Larb Gai and the Green curry chicken. They also taught us how to make the green curry paste.The owner was just a nice gentlemen. Spent some time talking to him and taking some pictures.When I go back to Thailand, I am doing all of the remaining courses to get my certification :)Don't miss this one travellers!Have fun.

Uncomfortable. My girlfriend and i recently went to a few schools in Bangkok. Silom is a good school and the owner is a really nice guy. We decided to come to this school cause it was so so cheap and there were many good reviews. Honestly, my girlfriend and i left the class with back pain, since the class is conducted entirely on the floor. All in all, if you're young the class would be a lot of fun, but as we are a bit older we were not as comfortable as we would have liked.

Lived up to our expectations, plus serendipity!. We had booked this morning class with some high expectations. And the team met them! Plus, we enjoyed some unexpected discoveries - sweeping away usual misunderstandings about unusual ingredients & cuisines!My friend and I experience french cuisine all-year-round, but we definitely love world-cuisine. We are always looking for different cooking routes and every travel is an occasion to be surprised by new flavours. In the end, we gathered a view, an understanding - + techniques - of Thaï cooking, which enabled us to better enjoy and savour our next meals. Everything was perfect from the start: booking, call-back, confirmation + precise itinerary mailing. Then, on the day, warm welcome at the place, near-market extensive visit, lively and educated introduction to Thaï cooking ingredients on the spot, grabing and smelling fresh herbs, scrubing unknow vegetables, etc. The scholl is nestled on the first floor of a nice wooden house. Our team leader, Jay, was excellent. He loves cooking, and has a unique school-teacher style, colored with numerous subtle tongue-in-cheek remarks. He drove us energetically through the whole session with undefeatable energy - bravo, Jay!This a first-class experience, with a dedicated team: have a taste of Silom, you'll be happilly surprised!

Fantastic experience!. We took the Wednesday afternoon course and we had Jay as our instructor. It was a fantastic day. We were divided into two groups and brought to the market and we were shown all the vegetables which and told about all the vegetables we were going to use during the course of the day.It was very enjoyable getting to prepare all the courses and getting to cook them up on the wok outside the preparation rooms. The papaya salad which we prepared was a bit too spicy for my liking, the spring rolls were very nice, the massaman curry while not the nicest we have ever had was nice but I would have preferred if we could have taken out the non edible items such as the cinnamon sticks. The pad thai we prepared was fantastic and the battered banana was delicious. By the end of the evening we were so full from all the eating.The course was fantastic value for 1,000 baht per person especially when you consider that if you eat all the items you prepare during the course of the afternoon in a restaurant in Bangkok they would probably cost more than this alone. Also you get refunded the cost of your taxi there and they give you money and advice on the best way to get back to your hotel, which all in all is excellent and a very nice way to finish a fantastic day.

Great Cooking School, Fantastic experience. We had a fantastic morning with the Silom Cooking Team. Jay was our chef, he was great fun, made amazing food, explained things really well and answered all our questions - great guy. We went to market to get the ingredients, did some preparation (some done for you to allow you time to do more dishes). We each cooked at our own cooking station and then ate each dish whilst it was hot, then moved onto the next dish. If you haven't got room for all your courses then you can have it to take away with you! Great price compared to other cooking schools - only 1000Bhat per person. And they give you a refund on any taxi/transport money you spend getting to the school. We stayed near Koh San Road (other side of town) and decided to get the Orange Flag Ferry down to Central Pier (15B) then got the Skytrain to Chong Nonsi (20B) - then a 5min walk to the meeting point - for us, this trip was much more pleasant than sitting in rush hour traffic and made sure we didn't miss any of the class. They send you information and a photo of the meeting point so very easy to find. Recipe book is great, glossy, pictures, ingredients listed, steps to cook it are all explained and more recipes than you do on the day, so more to try at home. Highly recommend - enjoy!

Amazing - book it now!. We really wanted to do a thai cooking class, but most were a bit out of our budget. We came across Silom Thai cooking school and saw that it had good reviews - but the price was very reasonable!We booked the class in the evening for the next afternoon - and almost immediately we received a reply confirming that this was fine and giving us very detailed directions on where to meet them. You meet on the corner of a street in the Silom area of Bangkok - sounds a bit strange, but it's not at all! They even give you directions in Thai to show the taxi driver! We met a lady there who took us across to the market where we met our teacher, Oliver. He taught us all about the Thai ingredients and it was very interesting. We all got little baskets and we shared out the ingredients that we needed for the day and made our way to the cooking school.The building is really nice. They have a terrace area that has all of the cooking stations lined up. There is a preparation room which is brightly coloured and you all sit around on cushions learning and following your teacher. There is also a dining room where you get to enjoy all of the wonderful food! The class was so good! Oliver was an excellent teacher, and he was so so funny! His sense of humour was brilliant! We got stuck in and helped with everything, chopping up our own ingredients and helping with various things like making the thai green paste with the mortar and pestle and "massaging" the coconut!!It's amazing how quick and simple thai food is to make! You cook everything yourself at the stations on the terrace. When you are ready to dish up, the staff have your plate ready with some delicious accompaniment like rice and various spices etc. Then you get to EAT!Every day is a different combination of meals, but we cooked Tom Yum soup, pad thai, thai green curry, a spicy chicken salad with sticky rice and a dessert. I cannot express how good the food was! I didn't taste a nicer pad thai or thai green curry for the whole 5 weeks I was in Thailand! Delicious. Don't eat before you go to the class! We didn't and were still very full by the end! We paid 1000baht for the class which we thought was brilliant considering the great day we had, and all of the amazing food that we got to cook and eat! They even paid for our taxi to the class on top of that (90 baht) and gave us money to catch the ferry home! Such great service.Choose Silom Thai Cooking School!

Fun and Tasty. We just did the cooking class and it was a great way to spend an afternoon in Bangkok. Goong was our chef and she was very entertaining, informative, easy to talk to and all in all a very pleasant person.we did some cooking and preparation of some of the dishes, while others already had the preparations done and also Goong cooked some of the dishes herself as she demonstrated. We actually like the fact that we didn't have to do most of the prep work since it gave more time to learn the instructions and also to sit and enjoy the food. If you are looking for a school that will have you slicing/dicing ALL of the ingredients this class is not for you.The cooking schedule is well thought out and ran like clockwork. They have the itineray and menu planned very well.The food we prepared was so tasty and we were surprised that we could actually make these tasty dishes. Any food you don't finish will be packed up in take-away containers for you to take back to your hotel room.

A must do experience in Bangkok!. I booked a course with the Silom Thai Cooking School after doing some research online and decided that they offered the best value for money experience. The booking process was very simple I filled out an online form on their website and the next day they sent me an email confirmation with my booking. In a separate email they sent an extremely detailed map, 4 photographs of the meeting spot and they even provided a note to give to the taxi driver written in Thai so that I would be delivered to the right spot. They told me how long it would take to get there by taxi and roughly how much it should cost and what time to leave the hotel so that I would definitely get there. They also provided contact mobile numbers if I was to arrive late.My course started with a market tour with my instructor Jay who was just fabulous and very passionate about Thai cooking and being a teacher. He was also very funny. Jay showed us all the different produce available and then what we were going to buy for the recipes that we would be preparing.Back at the school was just the best experience, I loved all the cooking and the preparation of what is involved to make those fantastic recipes that I had been eating! 5 courses later I left extremely happy and would recommend this to anyone. It was easy and catered for every level of cook.I also went by myself but this could be done by couples and families. Jay was wonderful including a young boy who had come with his parents.I had a great day - thanks to all at the Silom Thai Cooking School.

Really good experience. In the morning you would go to the market and get the ingredients, the teachers are very nice and depending on the day there's a different set of meals you can cook. You cook the dishes one by one and after every dish eat it immediately (fresh and still hot!). The price is definitely worth it and for us they even gave us back the money for the taxi in the morning. Just can recommend it!

Fantastic introduction to thai food. I highly recommend this cookery class, it was only a 10 minute walk from our hotel (however they do refund taxi fare). We were met on time by Chef J and taken to the market where he gave a detailed explanation and we tasted the key thai ingredients, then it was a short walk to the school which is very professionally laid out and well organised. A lot of the prep is done for you which makes the cooking part all the more enjoyable. My 2 children, aged 12 and 8 also took part and were very well looked after, the sense of achievement when they (and me) made tom yum soup, pad thai and green curry was fantastic, moreover all the courses tasted fantastic. I did not have a better soup or curry in the following 2 weeks in Thailand! Good value for money also as you eat everything you cook!

A Fantastic Experience. This cooking school was just fantastic. It was informative, professional and just plain fun. The staff at the school were really friendly and welcoming and the class was so well organised. The only thing I might suggest is to slow down the classes and let the students do a bit more of the preparation themselves (we were a bit spoilt and much of the preparation was done for us). This might even mean reducing the number of dishes taught but I'm sure this would give students a better idea of the work involved in preparing beautiful Thai food.The best part of the class though was our teacher Koong. She was quite contientious in educating us about thai ingredients. When we were at the market, we received a great lecture on what the ingredients were and how they were to be used. She also had a great sense of humour and an entertaining way of teaching. It was hard not to be caught up in her enthusiasm. At the end I got to take home what I couldn't eat and showed off my creations to my partner. The only regret I have is not going back for a second class while I was in Bangkok!

The most professional and organized. My first thoughts were 'wow, this is so professional and very organised' which is why I think we had such a great time and experience. We had to arrange our own transport to a meeting place, which was later refunded. We met our instructor who gave us a basket and bottle water each then we walked to the market to learn about some Thai vegetables and seasonings. We then waled to the cooking school and learned more and prepared our dishes. If you go to the website of silom Thai cooking school, they have the courses showing what the dishes are for certain days so you can choose what you prefer to make. We liked two menus so decided to go on a Monday and Wednesday. We highly recommend you going here. The bathroom was nice and clean. Our instructed was Koong who had a great sense of humor and English speaking was clear.

Great Experience. I would recommend this to any lovers of food! Professionally run place. Nice place to meet fellow foodies. And the food we cook is great and we get to eat it all - the 5 course meal!!! Highlight of my trip :-)))

One of the most memorable experiences in Thailand. My boyfriend and I spent a few days in Bangkok on our trip to Asia a few months ago and decided to spend one of our free afternoons taking a Thai cooking class. We are so glad we chose Silom. Everything was perfect. From the market trip, to the way the techniques and ingredients were explained to the manner in which the class was taught. The class size was fairly small, which allowed a lot of one on one teaching and hands on experience. Not to mention the food was amazing and plenty of it - we were stuffed after all the courses we prepared and ate. Highly recommend.

Fun, tasty and informative!. We had a really good day with Silom Cooking School. Our first stop was the market where our cook explained quite a lot about the main Thai herbs and vegetables. After the market you go to the actual school. It's all very clean and hygienic, the cook even uses plastic gloves to help preparing the food. Quite a lot of things are prepared for you, but the actual cooking is left up to the students, so I still feel like I came out a lot wiser. The dishes you cook are really tasty and the cooks friendly and funny. Definitely worth the money!

Even good for those who consider themselves experienced cooks!. Well-organized and informative, Nusi has built a great little business here sharing his expertise in Thai cooking. The market in Silom is just the right size, and teachers rapidly integrate and intrigue the group, introducing the variety of produce used in Thai cooking into the shopping. Once at the school, teachers use inventive ways to get the group involved in the preparation and cooking processes and then bringing it all together at personal burners. The recipes are simple but tasty, and the cookbook is equally clear once you return home and try to recreate what was learned in class. What I really appreciated about the Silom Thai School -- and I've gone twice now, once on my own and once with family members -- is the smooth organization they've incorporated into the class experience and the very friendly ambiance they create. Using teachers and staff, students are able to maximize their time in the classroom to ensure a variety of activities, a clean environment, and a positive experience. There is always a new bit of information or some new technique shared which makes the class worthwhile, no matter how experienced a home or trained chef you are.

Finger lickin spicy great!. I cannot praise how much fun this was. Not only was this class knowledgable in terms of thai cuisine but also with spices and ingredients. Jay, our teacher made is really fun by keeping it light hearted and funny.In our class, we made Tom Yong soup, pad thai, coconut milk, green curry paste and finally thai green curry with chicken and rice. We started the tour with a visit to the local market where the ingredients were explained and then started the cooking in groups.After each dish has been made you eat this with your group. In the end you also get a great recipe book which not only gives you the instructions for your dishes but others too. Oh,and they also pay for you transport there. We had a fun half day and can highly recommend this to everyone! Thanks for a great time!

A wonderful way to spend a day. I absolutely adored this school. They take you down to the markets and explain the vegetables we were going to cook with, then back up to the kitchen, to prepare and finally, cook. The meals were amazaing - the guy that I cooked with actually said "I can't believe I just made this!". The chefs are hilarious and full of personality. All my thumbs up for this place - such a cool, cheap, delicious way to spend a day.

Super great experience, highly recommended!!!. I wasn't expected too much but turn out it's a highlight of my trip.Instructor is nice, super good food, wonderful experience, and unexpected colored receipt with photos. I would recommended to all my friends who going to BBK.

Great Thai Experience. Teacher was wonderful, food was incredible and the cook book they send you home with is very helpful. Take lots of photos to remember what you made cause we made 5 dishes and the procedures together once I returned home... Hot as the dickens cooking over an open flame in 100 degrees but absolutely loved it!

Good way to spend a half day in Bangkok, do not eat beforehand!. We did the morning class, in hindsight afternoon would have been better due to the volume of food! The trip round the market was very interesting with all the ingredients explained very well. I would have personally preferred a cooking course that was a bit more hands on. We cooked some dishes, but some were prepared for us and all we did was the eating, not that I'm complaining too much about that! There were also a lot of dishes crammed into 4 hours, it would be better as a full day course, or fewer dishes covered in more depth so we could actually cook them. For someone not too bothered about the cooking side of things, and wants to see Thai food cooked, enjoy the food and get a recipe book at the end this would be perfect.

Great for begginers. We went to a class at the school and it was better than my expectations. First thing, this is a class for begginers. If you are already a cooker, this is not for you. But if you are like us, 4 brazilians that love to eat thai food and had never cooked it, this is the place to go! It was the high point of our days in Bangkok. Starting with the things that were not excepcional: the locations is really a little bit strange, but since somebody from the school will meet you in the skytrain station, I didn't see much of a problem with that. The course started in a market. It was a very simple market with nothing really interesting.Now the good things: the food was amazing!! I can't believe how simple everything was to do and how good it was to eat! It's true that many things came pre-prepared, but on my point of view just enought to skip the boring parts and going to the real fun. The teacher was really nice and explained a lot. We did some chopping, some misturing and the cooking. The smells were unbelievable! The ambience was good and the best was the food! And it was a lot of food! We just loved it! I highly recomend it! And the price? Only, US$ 32 per person.

Nice cooking experience. Attended the cooking class with my youngest daughter. We both found cooking class very good and really enjoyed it.Had a short trip to the market before making the dishes. We prepared four dishes as well as eating them. We were given the advice in the confirmation email that we should not eat to much in advance. This prooved to be a very good advice as there was so much food that we could not it it all.Class was funny as well as informative. A recipe book was also provided.Transportation was also included in the price making it a bargain.

I make pad thai regularly!. This cooking class was excellent and you will be FULL. It was one of the highlights of our trip to Thailand. Come hungry. It really helped me to become a healthier cook with the recipe book provided. I actually cook pad thai a few times a week and mango salad occasionally as well. Small class size and the trip to the market was awesome.

Superb – Go hungry leave fulfilled. My husband and I both really enjoyed this experience and would highly recommend trying the Silom Thai cooking class. We went in late Dec 2011 and this was the best food we had while in Bangkok and it was enlightening to see how it all came together. 1) We chose it based on the positive reviews and its proximity to our hotel. The walk up to the building isn’t to cheek, but the venue itself is clean and well organized. 2) Don’t go on a full stomach – if you like Thai cuisine you will want to keep eating each dish. Luckily, you get to taste things throughout the day. It’s not one big sit down meal so remember to enjoy but pace yourself throughout the half day class. 3) You start out at one of the markets where they teach you about the essential produce for Thai cooking and you get to experience how locals do their grocery shopping. 4) Ladies don’t wear a skirt or dress (I made this mistake)! As per most Asian cultures you sit on the ground at the edge of a mat while preparing the food (don’t worry you eat at a table). You’ll be more comfortable in pants or shorts and don’t have to worry about flashing anyone while getting up or down. 5) There is air conditioning. You’re only outside while using the woks because there is high heat and grease so it’s better to cook outside rather than in. You prepare and eat inside so don’t let this deter you. 6) They give you a copy of the recipes. So when you return home you can share your Thai experience with friends and family. Overall the Silom cooking class has been a lasting positive memory for us and we always enjoy sharing stories about our experience. We’d go back!

Perfect for the novice Thai cook!. As an American who likes to cook and eat interesting food, this place was a treat for me. I took three half-day classes with Nusi and Oliver during March and April 2012, and I had a great experience. I had no problems with communication or transportation, plus the price was lower than most.I did read the few negative reviews here and offer this response:- The food I ate tasted very much like what I eat on the street and in restaurants, and I've been living here in Bangkok for six months, so yes -- I think you can call the results authentic. We made coconut milk and red/green curry paste from scratch - they were right on. I needed to learn about the raw ingredients, and that definitely happened -- excellent beginner training.- They do try to cram about five different dishes into a half-day. The result is that 1-2 of them are mostly made for you, and then you do the final heating in the wok -- not the best way to teach and learn. Personally, I would rather create all that I eat there, even if that means I get to try less dishes.- If you are already a serious and experienced Asian cook, this may not be the best place for you, as much of the instruction may be redundant, and you may want a different experience.After three classes, I feel ready to move on to something more advanced. All in all, I am glad I did it. I can now create, at home, numerous Thai dishes (that Thai locals have tried and given me a thumbs-up for)!

Informative, Hands On Cooking Course, Great Value!. My family attended the Silom Thai Cooking School in Juen 2012 and loved the informative, hands on class. Our guide through the market made us laugh and let us know great information when cooking thai food.The class size was kept small, only 8 people in our group so we could all hear him well and be involved in all of the cooking. I had never made my own coconut milk before and it was great to see how that was made.They were prompt on getting back to me with my booking and email replies, they helped us plan out our trip while we were in Bangkok and the staff working there were all very friendly!The food tasted delicious and we were glad to bring home all the recipes with us to try at home. We enjoyed not only making the food, but learning the key ingredients in each dish along with certain ingredients that can be substituted and how. Request Oliver as your guide/chef he is fantastic!The value for the experience is great, definitely worth the price! We didnt eat the rest of the day - we were all so full!!

Amazing!. My husband and I had a wonderful time at Silom cooking school. The classes are small, the instructors are friendly, and you are given the oppertunity to meet other travelers from around the world! The whole experience is top knotch. The two stand out asspects of this experience are 1) Shopping in the local market 2) educational value. The instructors really take the time to make sure you know what goes into ( food and feeling) the meal you are making. This is a wonderful half day activity I recommend to anyone;singles, couples, and families :)

Excellent cooking class very entertaining and great value for money. After receiving very clear instructions from Silom cooking school as to where to meet before our market we met our guide at the sky train station and of course she was on time and ready to go. We headed down to the morning market where we met Oliver who was our teacher for the day. Oliver was very good and funny keeping the tour and class very informative and entertaining. We learnt 4 dishes on the day and all of which were amazing. The school was well presented and very clean and without doubt my next trip back to Bangkok will include another visit to Silom cooking school. Thankyou for a great day!!!

First Hand Thai culture and cooking experience. I accidentally found the Silom Thai Cooking school on the web. Our first plan is to go to Pathaya or samui island were one of the best thai cooking school can be found. But unfortunately, there is a little bit of difficulty arranging our scheds due to limited time. Anyhow, the timing favored us because when i booked our Hotel in Bangkok, Silom Thai cooking school appeared. At the end we took a 3 days cooking class to earn a certificate also (They only issue certificate for 3 or more days of classes). It is a great experience because, we not only learned how Thai people prepare their food in their native way and tradition but also to explore the hidden beauties of bangkok. Thank you and Sawasdeekrap

Fun half day cooking course!. I found this cooking school via my lonely planet guide and really had a great half day there! You go to a market first and then try out cooking a total of six dishes AND get to enjoy them lateron. So don't eat any breakfast before coming here! :-)I learned a lot about spices, vegetables, etc. and can only recommend this place!

Amazing experience. I would love people to know what a fun day this cooking school provides. It's an awesome thing to do with your partner and will definitely go back with my husband.Oliver is the Best! He showed us everything....I loved it !

Unique experience... Only in Thai!. The instructor was hilarious... I went there with my family members... At first they were skeptical about it but at the end of the lesson they were craving for more.. Everyone definitely enjoyed the whole package.. It's rather an unusual experience because this one, u paid for the lesson, u eat ur own food, and u go back to ur own country with SKILLS!!! How good is that? I'm going back there again to learn other dishes... U will not regret this!

Fun Instructor. Just returned from class and had a very good time. Chef Noonsi (sp?) is a fun, high spirited instructor who keeps the class moving along. Classes are part practical and part demonstration. Most of the instructions were done by all people to some degree. There were sixteen people in the class which made for a tight fit, but everyone had fun.Be prepared to sit on the floor a lot. You sit on the floor for instruction. You sit on the floor for preparation. You sit on the floor for a little bit of the eating. If you are old like me, find an excuse to stand and stretch your legs.The cooking is done outdoors in woks over gas. It is hot! But the cooking time is minimal.All of the dishes were enjoyable, easily replicable at home and rotate daily. Wednesday afternoon dishes were Pad Thai, Green Papaya Salad, Deep Fried Spring Rolls, Musomun Chicken, Deep Fried Banana and Ice Cream.Drinking water was provided. Taxi fares were refunded by the school.

Worth a try. I like the cooking environment because it's Thai style home and kitchen decore. Visited local market before the class start, then chef Nusi gave us some knowledges on Thai cooking ingredient. He is a very cheerful and talkative person.It was a casual cooking class with laugh and fun, nothing serious. Remember to attend class with a very empty stomach because you are going to finish what you have cooked..I had got refund 100bath taxi fare even I went there by bts...

Fantastic - learnt how to make coconut milk, curry paste and 5 delicious dishes plus the market visit. This cooking school based in Silom was brilliant value for money. The four hour lesson included buying the ingredients at the local market and getting a run down of all the ingredients used in Thai cooking. We then made five fantastic dishes: tom yam soup (with prawns); prawn pad thai; chicken larb gai (salad); green chicken curry with homemade green curry paste and white turnip in sweet coconut cream. The food tasted fantastic and better still we were given a souvenir stir fry flip made from coconut and the recipes. All for just 1000 baht. The instructor was hilarious and very good value. I highly recommend this cooking school.

My favourite activity in Bangkok. My boyfriend and I signed up for the morning session in February. It was one of my favourite activities during our 3 day stay in Bangkok. The school refunds you for any transportation costs and they give very clear instructions on how to get there or where and when to meet for pick up. The class starts off with a trip to the market where you pick up all the ingredients. Then you head back to the school to prepare the vegetables and then prepare to cook the dishes one at a time. Some will say the cooking class is too easy, but it is still very hands on. We squeezed our own coconut cream, chopped all our vegetables, and made red curry paste by pounding chilli and seasoning with mortar and pestle. For 1000 Baht/person, this class is great! The instructor was also very funny and made the whole experience very enjoyable. I would most definitely recommend the Silom Thai Cooking School for a cooking class in Bangkok!!

Great and good value experience. Easy to book and communicate with. Really fun, informative,interesting morning . The chefs were full of character which made for lots of laughs, fellow 'pupils' from all over the world which made great social mix.The food we cooked was amazing and the preparation was very hands on and inclusive of the group.We will definitely go again.

Casual cooking class, good food. My husband and I attended the afternoon session of this class. We're big foodies and love to cook at home, so we tend to be more serious about cooking classes. Although the class was fun, it was too laid back for people like us. There isn't much discussion about ingredients, different ways to do things, cooking methods, etc. We've attended other classes where the experience is much broader with the instructors teaching us about knife skills, cooking tips, rhyme and reason of flavor combinations, etc. But, the instructor/owner was really fun and entertaining and you will have plenty to eat and the food you make is delicious. Plus, it's one of the lowest-priced cooking classes we found in the area.

professional and friendly cooking class in Bangkok. I attended a morning cooking class at Silom Thai Cooking School. First we went to the market to buy the ingredients, then the teacher helped us prepare the dishes we eventually ate. The class was very well organized, I was given precise instructions to reach the place by taxi, I was refunded of the taxi expense, I learnt useful and easy recipes, and above all this I had a lot of fun !I strongly recommend this experience !!

One of my best experiences in all of South East Asia. If you are looking for a great cooking school this is it. The food is absolutely amazing. If you can go on a day when the green curry is being done, it really was fantastic. It's a really hands on class. Warning... Don't eat before you go, you will be eating 5 delicious meals in 3 hours!!!

EDUCATIONAL+ENTERTAINING. SILOM COOKING SCHOOL,is a unique experience.The school caters(twice daily) for those who want to learn about thai cuisine.I attended 2 morning classes in a row.Each class had 12 students divided into 2 groups of 6.The 4 hour session started with an ingredient gathering tour around the local open market.We then returned to the school and began the ABC of Thai cuisine.Sanusi the owner of the school who took my 1st class was a great teacher using wit+humour to transfer his wonderful knowledge of this intricate cuisine.During the 4 hours we sourced,prepared and cooked 4 different Thai dishes from curry pastes,curries,to salads+deserts. At 1000 bts,this is the best 4hrs i have spent anywhere without taking my clothes off. A must for anyone with half a brain and half a day to spare in Bangkok

Fantastic experience, well organized and a fun atmosphere while you learn. The one thing I really wanted to do in Bangkok was participate in a Thai cooking School. This place was great. They take you to the market first to show you what you are buying and what it looks like in a raw state. Then you learn how to make coconut milk and curry paste from scratch. We made four dishes and participated in Course 4. Great experience. I highly recommend.

SO Much Fun!. This place is everything you look for in a cooking school! Staff is friendly (actually funny at times)! The place is clean, small intimate classes 8-12 people. Practical teaching you can bring back home and even a little cookbook!PLEASE have a very, very, very light breakfast! You will leave stuffed!!The food turns out excellent! I live in NYC and have had some great Thai food and this place is on par with the excellent Thai food in NYC. It's hard to believe that you can make 4+ dishes within a few hours but it all works out!Also, the other great thing was that they used Halal meat! To all the staff at Silom- Thank you so much for a wonderful time!

Perfect. Silom was the first and best of all the Asian cooking schools I have attended. From the start of the day to the end of the class it was a great experience. We were given instructions for the skytrain and were met by a friendly staff member at the station. On the market tour, we were given cold water bottles, which was such a nice touch in the hot Thai climate! Our guide, Oliver, was friendly, funny and very well-informed. He explained what each ingredient was and how it was used. Before cooking each meal, we spent some time washing, peeling and preparing the ingredients. The school is beautiful and very welcoming. I loved how we cooked one dish at a time and worked on our own individual work station. I was happy to make my own dish and taste it. Through everything, Oliver and the other staff members helped us and answered our questions without being overbearing or patronizing. I highly recommend this cooking school, for people of all abilities and levels. You won't be disappointed - or hungry after!

Excellent, fun, informative and delicious. Highly recommend. Starts with market visit and an explanation on Thai ingredients. Next you make coconut milk. You cook and eat your way through five courses. The instructors are fun and informative. Great way to spend an afternoon. Cost was 1000 baht and it was well worth it.
Interactive, educational & fun. Fun, great food, interactive! It's good to go to the market and look at the different ingredients used in Thai food.

Not Authentic. Pros: nice ambience and nice place. Beautiful displays. Good group of people.Cons: teacher had a hangover, food tasted awful except for the desert, we used bad cooking techniquesAs another reviewer put it, "tourist fake". This school is cheaper then most and will give you a very generic tourist experience. If you are a cook and/or actually want to learn something about thai cooking, spend a little more and go somewhere else.

Amazing morning!. I went wi a couple friends for my birthday and had a blast! The people working there are so friendly, the facility is so great and you really get an intro to Thai life and culture. Plus, the food was amazing!

Great teachers/staff, great food, free cookbook at the end! Awesome!. This was really great. It was the cheapest school I saw. They don't have pickup but they reimburse you (generously and without any arguments, I might add!) for your taxi at the end. The teacher was nice and had a great dry sense of humour which I really appreciated, and he answered all our questions and had good advice on how to get ingredients/substitutes in our home country. They gave you a bottle of water at the start and a free cookbook at the end. We didn't have any vegetarians but they seemed very flexible. I highly recommend it!!!

Fantastic Experience. A great afternoon! The teacher was hilarious and clearly loves his job. The market visit was incredibly useful as I hadn't known the names of many spices or vegetables used in Thai cooking until today. Make sure you don't eat too much before hand, and definitely don't make plans for dinner after class - we ate so much!

Fantastic Value - High quality food. I went on two cookery courses in Thailand, Silom was outstanding and much cheaper than the other school. Nusi was so much fun, it was relaxed and absolutely suitable for a holiday experience. I became quite fussy after going to Nusi's classes as nothing quite matched up to the dining experience we had there, what's more we made it all ourselves. I highly reccomend these classes - I would do it again if I visited Bangkok. It was one of the most enjoyable things I did in Thailand. Keep up the good work Nusi, you would be proud of me - i enjoy a Thai meal once or twice a week back in South Africa. Although its quite difficult to find some of the ingredients, like galangal ginger. I managed to get it in a jar pickled and dried. Also dried Kaffir Lime leaves.

Tasty, easy to follow recipes, good value for money. Attending the class with my friend, and we had great time here.I have to say, the food is much tastier than what you can get from street food, and may be even better than some restaurant. May be they adjust the taste to fit with foreigner, but it works perfectly for me. Each session has 5 dishes, but you could request for additional if you already learn how to cook it before. So i ended up having 6 dishes/session, no additional charge :). The key thing is that they make it so easy, that give us extra confident to make this at home :). Price is pretty good too, comparing to all other cooking school, and they reimburse for our transportation cost, so end up about 900/class. Staff is very friendly, and they make the environment very cozy, relax and enjoyable. Net, highly recommended :), will return here if they have more stuff in the menu

I can cook thai food now!. this is one of the "most-do" if you love thai food. the 3 hours session is so enjoyable. we cooked pad thai, tom yum, thai green curry and more. the first thing we did in the morning is to go for the market tour and understand more about thai ingredient and spices. after that we walked to the school which is approx 10 mins away from the market and started washing and preparing all the ingredients. then we moved in to a room to squeeze coconut milk and then we started cooking. The steps are quite easy to follow and the teacher were quite patient. we were all given a recipe book at the end of lesson. for 1000baht, the experience is really worth it. remember to come with an empty stomach for the delicious food that you have cooked.

Outstanding course and excellent value. This was by far the best cooking course that we have attended and it was great value. Nusi (the instructor) was so informative and took all the mysticism out of Authentic Thai cooking. He made it really easy with his excellent English and fabulous sense of humour and mannorisms - it was real fun! The food we cooked was delicious and we have since tried this at home, back in Canada, with real success. We have no hesitation in recommending this place.

Great food, great fun!. I have done several cooking courses on my travels and this is one of the best.A fair price in Bangkok. Excellent, humorous teachers. Hands-on cooking. Delicious food.I would heartily recommend this activity for anyone with a half day (or a week) free.

Amazing, amazing, amazing!. Really enjoyed this course and would not hesitate to do it again!I took my boyfriend for our anniversary because I knew he loved cooking and we learnt so much and enjoyed ourselves immensely. I would really recommend it to anyone - the food is delicious and you get to make all the dishes yourself.We did a Monday course and it was the best green curry I have ever had!Thanks to everyone there!

Goos experience. It was a good day out at Silom Thai cooking school. Once you book, they send a detailed email about how to reach the meeting point, they also faxed a copy to my hotel.On the day of class, they picked us from the designated location and took us to a farmer's market where our host explained each ingredient. After going to the cooking school, first we prepare all ingredients, washing and chopping, then the host explains how to cook the dish. They take great care of people who have not cooked before, so that they do not get hurt due to hot oil or while chopping.The menu changes every day so better opt for a day which has maximum of your favorites. After the class we got a printed booklet of the recipes. The only downside was that I would have preferred a little more hands on experience in cooking, I felt the class is more of a day out than a great learning experience, nevertheless I had a great time.

Dinner and a show - and great value. My husband and I hadn't done a cooking course before, and we decided to fit it in at the last minute on our last day in thailand. We chose Silom because you go to the market, learn about ingredients, and it's far less expensive than similar cooking classes in the city. When we met our instructor, Nusi, or as i had misinterpreted initially "Lucy," he was fantastic. He speaks English very well and is hilarious. He was telling jokes at every turn and making the class even more interesting with his sassy flair. You cook most of the courses, but not all - but it's not a problem, since you've done the hardest ones yourself. The menu changes on a daily basis, but i learned some of my favorites while at the class, and you get to bring home a cook book of the recipes you learned that day. It was a great value for the money.

Exceeded expectations. Our host met us with baskets near a street market so that we pick up fresh ingredient that we would need. He was thoughtful enough to have a bottle of water in each basket so that we could stay hydrated while shopping. He turned the shopping into a lesson, stopping at several booths and teaching us about each ingredient. Then we all walked back to the cooking school. We made several very tasty meals. I appreciated that he let me be picky and have chicken in my meals, rather than shrimp. Our host was very entertaining and his helpers were very nice. At the end we received a homemade cookbook which included all the recipes we had used as well as some others. He gave people's train fare back to them at the end too, which was very surprising. As me and my friends didn't take the train, he gave us a set of the wooden utensils we had eaten with. All in all is was a great experience! I highly recommend this cooking school.

Nice experience. We were happy with our experience and enjoying cooking and eating all of the delicious food. The only recommendation is that I would have preferred having more of a hands-on experience with some of the dishes. Even though this class fits in six dishes, it is more like four, two of them are made by the chef. Overall, good bang for your buck: classes are 1000 baht while most are closer to 2000 baht.

Oh my god, I CAN COOK :-). Joining this class def enriched our last days in BKK!! For the first time we stood behind a wok and stirred and fried and stirred and realized how easy it is! And we were lucky, as the chef himself was our teacher this day (2 days a week). The 4 hours of lesson are absolutely well organised and it was a great mixture of market visit, cooking theory, wok action and fun! AND the selfmade DELICIOUS Thai dishes!!!In the end we got all recepies, which are fully understandable explained. The first thing we do, when we are back home is to buy a wok and go for it!!!

An Excellent Experience!. These courses are an excellent introduction Thai cooking and a great way to spend half a day on your visit to Bangkok. The day is very well organised and represents great value. I can thoroughly recommend and will be returning to master more dishes in the future!

Fun but not authentic. I've been cooking thai for some time now and pretty experienced by now. This school is fun but don't expect to bring home authentic recipes. I guess the dishes are adapted to the western taste too much. To be honest, the dishes we prepared were tasteless. I'll be trying another school next time...

Have been impressing family & friends back home!!. I chose to the Silom Thai Cooking School because it also included a visit to the market which I think is really important as many Thai ingredients are not known to us (foreigners). This was a really good choice as I feel much more comfortable in the kitchen now and know all about various chilies, herbs and spices. The course was not only extremely easy to follow and informative but it was also a lot of fun. I cannot remember having such a laugh while learning something useful. Since getting home, I've often used the booklet provided to us after the course, added my own choice ingredients and every dish has been a success. Both family and friends have been wowed with my Thai cooking. I never would have thought it was as easy as it is but it was thanks to Nusi's teaching skills and the Silom Cooking school that I now always have lemon grass, kefir limes and lots of chilli in my kitchen. I cannot compare to other schools, but based on my experience, I cannot recommend this school enough.

Absolutely Brilliant!!!. Could not believe how good this course was, it was the highlight of my whole trip to Thailand!!! The course was well organised, i was sent thorough instructions and directions and the course even covered our taxis costs getting there! The course was such good value for money, we cooked 7 dishes, and ate them all! We went to an authentic thai market where they spent lots of time explaining about every ingredient. The school was very authentic and lovely, with good facilities. Its not state of the art, but fantastic all the same! Both teachers had word perfect english and were really funny. I absolutely loved this course, one of the cheapest we found and absolutely the best!

Something a bit different. When you've done the normal tourist activities in Bangkok, why not do something you can impress your friends at home with? I searched cooking schools in Bangkok, and several came up, but because of location and menu I chose Silom.Course lasts about 5 hours, and the menue changes from day to day. First a trip to the local wet-marked, to learn about the different ingrediences, and then back to school. Cleaning, chopping, cooking and then eating what you've just made, can't be better than that! The instructors we had was fun and easygoing, spoke wonderful English, and I will be back there on my next visit to Bangkok. Bring a camera, and a friend if you want to, and get cooking!! You get a recipe booklet afterwards, so no need to write down anything. I loved the whole experience, and they even catered for my food allergies. Book early, course seem to be very popular, maybe also due to the price, a very reasonable charge!! Kob koon kaa :-)

Worth it!. We booked the morning class 1 week in advance from home. I sent an email which was answered just a few minutes later. Nusi, the teacher gave us instructions where to meet and sent a document with the address in thai to show the taxi driver. After a great tour of the market Nusi clearly instructed all dishes and the food we made was amazing. Two persons share a wok and food is prepared in air conditioned rooms. One of the best deals in Bangkok, so worth it.

Best event in Bangkok so far. The food we made was amazing, the venue was so incredibly wonderful, I was half expecting a couple stoves in an alley but it was air conditioned and so professional.Nusi is as funny and enjoyable as he is knowledgeable about cooking. One of the best deals so far in Bangkok, so worth it.

Great afternoon cooking and laughing. I had an excellent afternoon at the Silom Thai Cooking School! The dishes were great and the instructor was informative and very entertaining. The class was well run, good value and while we were preparing ingredients for the next dish the cooking area was seamlessly being cleaned and setup to cook the dishes being prepared.
