The class I did ran from 1:40pm – 6:00pm. I would highly recommend this school.

Fantastic Experience and now I can Cook Thai!. Three of us took one of Nusi's cooking classes where we learned to cook a good variety of dishes, checked out a local market, learned what chili was for what - need I go on. It was the best investment of my entire 2 1/2 week visit to Thailand. Nusi is fun and informative and imparts knowledge with ease. I'd recommend this to anyone who would like to have a go at recreating Thai food at home. The class was a large one, yet we all worked together and had time to chat and get to know one another too. I took a different cooking course on Phuket which was 3 times the price, one hour longer and they came nowhere near to what Nusi taught us. He didn't chat on his mobile phone and was entertaining every moment - it's a well oiled operation. The market visit was a little more difficult as the space is restricted and not everyone can stand near enough to hear everything but it taught me how the Thais shop and what they buy and why. Excellent morning, would recommend to anyone interested in learning Thai cookery.

The yummiest cooking experience ever!. The teacher, Nusi, was fabulous. He was so kind and encouraging and had a great sense of humor. He gave a great tour of the market and clearly instructed all dishes. Each dish was fabulous. The class was with six people, a great size.The amount and quality of food we got was amazing. I would highly recommend.

A must do in Bangkok. My husband and I debated on taking a cooking class because of our busy schedule during our 4 day stay in Bangkok, so we ended up booking a class on the morning of our departure date. We booked this one because it was in walking distance from our hotel (Lebua at State Tower) and had a good review.I made an online reservation using their website and received a call about 5 minutes later to confirm my reservation. They sent me an instructions on how to get to the meeting place and a map to my hotel room that night.The instructor was very knowledgeable and explained everything very easy and simple, even my husband who is not into cooking enjoyed the class and said it was one of the best activities we did in Bangkok.The instructor took the students (8-10 people) to a local market and explained Thai ingredients and bought them right there. Every student was given a small shopping basket with a cold water bottle and we carried the ingredients to the school which was about 5 minute walk from the market.The presentation was beautiful and the instructor added finishing touches to the dishes that the students prepared. All the dishes were so pretty so your food looks like it was prepared by a chef. All dishes we made were the best I had in Thailand.Highly recommend this cooking school to anyone who visits Bangkok.

Value for money without compromising on quality. This cooking school was my first experience in Bangkok the morning after I arrived in Thailand (23th April 2011). It was a fantastic was to start my holiday and I thoroughly enjoyed the tantalising experience. Nusi, the teacher, is an excellent teacher with a funny side to him. I really enjoyed his sense of humour. The morning started with a trip to a local market followed by cooking 5 dishes. The Pad Thai was one of the best I've tasted in Thailand and I made it myself (with Nusi's help of course). If it's your first visit to Thailand, this is a fantastic was to experience popular thai dishes and you could order it again if you enjoyed what you made. Other cooking courses are 1800 baht + but Nusi charges 1000 baht which is a good price for what you get. I would love to go back again. Nusi is very good at responding to emails.Hassan

Awesome cooking class! You gotta go!. My best friend is currently living in Bangkok and she recommended two schools for us: Silom and Blue Elephant. She said both were pretty similar, but she enjoyed Silom a little better so we booked a reservation with them.We got picked up by the Nusi by the Chong Nosi train station. Others met up with us and then he gave us 40 Baht, a cell phone, and a map and hailed cabs for us to the meeting spot. After everyone had gathered, he took us shopping at a market across the street. At the market, he pointed out everything that we would need for that day and talked about the different types of well, everything. After we had gotten what we needed, we walked a short distance to the school. He and his team taught us how to prepare the ingredients (how to clean and cut the vegetables, how to cut chicken or peel shrimp, how to make coconut milk) and then taught us how to cook! We made five dishes – tom yum soup, pad thai, chicken salad, green curry, and sticky rice in coconut milk with mango. Everything was delicious! At the end, he gave us all a cookbook with the recipes we made and then some. I thought it was also very nice of him to give money to everyone for their travel back to their hotels. I don't actually cook and I am lucky that my husband enjoys doing so. Usually I feel a little intimidated by these classes, but Nusi made you feel comfortable! I may actually start cooking ;) It was a very entertaining, very informative, and fun experience. And we highly recommend!

Great experience... suitable for home chefs. Went to Bangkok for cooking classes. Took 1 day at Silom Cooking School and 2 days at Blue Elephant Cooking School. Enjoyed the lessons conducted at both schools. Silom is very relaxed and the recipe is made simple for us. Overall, I had a great time.

Perfect way to celebrate my wife's 30th birthday. I booked us in with my wife's parents for the morning Thai cooking lesson with Nusi. It proved to be a lot of fun.To start he is an incredibly entertaining host and he takes you shopping in the local markets to buy all the produce fresh. After shopping, it's a quick walk back to his house which has been carefully tweaked to provide ample room for up to 14 people per class.Nusi gives a very informative lesson, explaining the at behind each dish and encouraging you to get involved in both preparation and cooking. You follow a 7 course menu (don't have breakfast!) which varies each day. He is helped by a team of friendly and hard working assistants who help to make the experience enjoyable.All of us loved the experience which is a unique insight into Thai cooking. At 1,000 baht per person it may at surface value seem expensive but believe me, it's great value and you will come away happy.thanksjames & muneeza

Fabulous time cooking with the Thais. My husband and I went to the Silom Thai Cooking School in Bangkok as part of our visit to Thailand. We had a wonderful experience and highly recommend this school to anyone interested in learning the basics of Thai cooking. Sanusi is very professional and provided directions to his school, met us, and took us to the market. We prepared the ingredients and made five dishes - pad thai, green curry with chicken, tom yum soup and more. Everything was clean and organized. We cooked outside on a small terrace and prepped inside. At the end we received a cookbook that explained everything about the ingredients and had clear recipes. All in all, it was a great experience!

Fun time. This is the second cooking class I have taken in Bangkok, the first being at the Blue Elephant. Different experiences. Silom is more relaxing, more hands on, and includes a trip to the market in the morning. Nusi is quite the comedian, so you will have a great time.

Amazing! Wonderful!!. I had a very memorable moments last Saturday (Nov 20) in attending the cooking class organized by the Silom Thai Cooking School.The school's principle and also the chef, Nusi met us at my hotel lobby and then we walked to the BTS station Chong Nosi to meet other participants. Nusi gave me a mobile phone and 40 baht and told me to go to another meeting point by taxi although it is only a one-minute distance. After the taxi ride, all the participants followed Nusi to go to a local market and Nusi gave everyone of us a basket to buy the materials to cook.Nusi taught about how to select the ingredents: meat, seafood and vegetables. After the market, we went to his cooking school on foot. His cooking school was on the fourth floor of a local residential. We all pu ton an apron, and then we were taught how to wash and clean the ingredents.Nusi was an organized and well prepared man. His cooking methods were simple and easy to learn. I enjoyed my self made Thai food very much.The learning fee is 1,000 Baht, not very cheap, but you will have a very enjoyable experience in joining Nusi's Thai cooking class.

Great Fun. I am a long time resident of bkk and have taken cooking courses at other more expensive venues. Decided to try this one with visitors from UK as they wanted a more adventurous time! My friends are vegan and they were accommodated by appropriate ingredient substitution. We thoroughly enjoyed the communal cooking experience. The class consisted of 8 students and we took turns squeezing coconut, chopping veg and pounding with mortar and pestle. The kitchen was not stainless and sterile - there are other venues offering that. Cooking outside (without airconditioning) on the terrace overlooking other flats was a treat. I thought it was a REAL Thai experience. (note: Khun Nusi only spoke on his mobile once). Would recommend as a great way to spend a morning.

great fun to learn thai cooking. The best fun $30 can buy. We were met by our cooking instructor. He didn't introduce himself to the 14 of us but in the end all came together and we prepared and cooked 4 great thai dishes. It was a shame our instructor spent time on his mobile phone but when we did have his attention he made it an afternoon to remember.I could recommend this course. I think it is also called the Bangkok Thai Cooking School.The instructor organised our attendance perfectly.

Funny experience. I attended this cooking class in the end of march and I think it was a fun experience worth the 1000 bath. The location is easy to find and you learn some basic things about thai vegetables and cooking. It was very basic and since we were in the afternoon class it seemed like the teacher was a bit tired after his morning session so I would recommend the morning class. We were just 6 students from different parts of the world and in all age groups. If you dont expect a gourmet class you will be ok!

You must go!. This was so good we went twice in one trip. At 1000 Baht it is fantastic value and half the price of anywhere else as he seems to keep his overheads down to a minimum to give good value. He had three rooms for the school, built above the apartment he lives in. Nusi is a very entertaining teacher and packed loads into the afternoons. We walked up the steps to the three well laid out, scrupluously clean rooms full of fresh food and spices. Its well planned, informative and above all fun. A fabulous way to spend a few hours.

A different Bangkok Experience. If you enjoy eating Thai food, why not learn to cook it. Nusi teaches it in a easy to learn and fun manner. Everyone has a part to play in the shopping of the ingredients, the preparation of the food and the real hard work of all - eating your creations! Nusi is an excellent teacher - entertaining and speaks very good english. We had such a fun time there, meeting people from different countries - Nusi even lists down various places in the respective countries as to where you can obtain the ingredients used in the class so you can practise even when you return home. The service provided by Nusi is pretty good as he pays for your transportation from your hotel.It is definitely a 1000 Baht well-spent!

Cooking with sass- and not in a good way!. I want to start off with something positive. When you walk into Nusi's cooking school, you're greeted by a clean, organized place. Don't be alarmed by the walk there; this is not the scene from a tourist brochure, but any Bangkok veteran knows that looks can be very deceiving. Yes, the area would be considered less classy to some, but his school is, as mentioned before, clean.Nusi pays for your transportation, and is very generous with reimbursing you for your travel, something I've never heard about before here. His school is a close walk from the Narai hotel, and the market is close as well. His school is decorated with pictures of his travels. After working in Bangkok for a short while, I am happy to see someone who has marketed their skills properly and done something other than waiting for someone to give them money. He has truly created something successful, and for that I am happy!This is an ideal class for beginners. We learned a lot about ingredients, and were taught the very basics of Thai cuisine. The pad thai and tom yum we made were amoung the best I've had since moving here to Bangkok. This is not however, a class for those who are experienced cooks. Having said that, I will say that there are changes that need to be made; Nusi himself. He spent the whole time answering his cell phone, which annoyed us to no end. I understand that he had business calling, but a simple "I'm sorry, I have to take this" would have sufficed. Or better yet, putting the phone on silent mode and calling whoever back when he had the time. He should also mark a good time to call on his website.He was very rude and dismissive, shouting out orders and at one point became very aggitated when some people forgot their plate of ingredients outside, saying something along the lines of "I said it before in English and I know my English is good enough" (in Thai-English) . That pretty much marked the end of my defending him; until that point, I figured that there was mostly a language and cultural barrier that made him sound so impolite. But as the day progressed, he got sassier and sassier!For those of you on a tight budget with a very easy-going nature who want a basic intro to Thai cuisine, this is your class. But for those of you who expect something a little less... military... go somewhere else.Please note that you will have to sit on the floor to prepare the ingredients. Anyone with back or knee or any kind of problem that would make this difficult should inform him in advance.

Good hands-on class. The class is good for those do a bit of cooking at home and would like to be hands-on. There were five dishes for the day. Two of the dishes were more or less "demonstration", but the other three required students to even chop and wash the ingredients. Went on a Monday, so the three hands-on dishes were tom yam soup, pad thai and green curry chicken (with all students chipping in to prepare the curry paste and we all made the coconut milk from coconut flesh). The menu is in fact very ordinary but one gets to experience how the dishes are prepared from scratch. I have enjoyed the class but I would say for those who don't want to be too hands on it might be better to shop around for other cooking classes in the city. Nusi, the teacher, is a bit eccentric and funny, which made the morning even more enjoyable.

Good value, basic. We enjoyed the class overall. We visied the market, prepared and cooked three dishes completly, one dish which was half prepared, and sampled a desert which was demonstrated.The class is run in what I presume is Nusi's appartment, in two rooms set up for cooking.The class cost 1000 baht which was reasonable for the level of the class. All participants in our group were in their 20s and 30s. The class had a budget feel to it, which was appropriate for the cost. The explanations were not that detailed, and Nusi does seem slightly burnt out from running two classes a day. If you are looking for a reasonably priced, standard introduction to Thai cooking you will enjoy the class. If you have a prior knowledge of Thai cooking and a bigger budget, you may want to go more upmarket. The food we cooked was tasty, we certainly didn't need lunch afterwards, and it was enjoyable sharing travel stories while chopping vegetables.

Excellent day out. We booked a morning lesson at the last minute for this course. The menu is set and changes day to day. Sessions start early in the morning and finish about lunch. The setting seems odd as it takes place in a small apartment block off the beaten path. It is about half the price of similar courses we priced. There are about 10 people at each lesson. Firstly you are taken to the local market for supplies and each ingredient is explained to you. Then you return to the school and wash and prepare the ingredients. Then you start to cook! We did a fried rice, red shrimp curry, spring rolls, banana fritters and a local salad. It cost us 1000 baht each. He even covered the cost of taxi's or subway from that. The host/teacher has very good English is very helpful. Was the highlight of our Bangkok stay by a long way.

Interesting experience!. I participated in one class at Silom and had an enjoyable day. However there were some unexpected aspects to the class. As others have said there is no pick-up service. I recieved a fax at the hotel to meet at a skytrain station (my husband accompaanied me- as you can imagine I thought this a bit odd). There were 2 others also waiting. The man - lucy? arrived and we all got in a taxi to the hotel where the others were waiting.We arrived at the market - first a vegetable stall where we got baskets and water, then to a fish and meat market (a very clean and sterile one!!) where we bought ingredients for the food. Several times we had a short lecture on noodles, or whatever. Then back to the veg stall and quite an informativen lecture on the veg. Eveyone ended up with a basket full of produce.On to the apartment which was very hot - I am afraid the fans were not up to the job that day. It soon became clear that there were 15 people in a spaceeant for a maximum of 12. This was fine whilst we prepared the shrimp, chicken and veg (even though we had to sit on the floor to do this - not something mentioned in the advertising) but when the cooking started 3 people had to be a second shift cooking and eating seperately. What made this worse was that instead of choosing 3 different people for eaach course the same 3 continued, even though others offered to take their places. Naturally the 3 felt a little excluded but they took it in stride.We had good information during the preparation but the cooking phase was a bit rushed with the assistant having already put out the sauces etc..I am an erxperienced cook and , although I did get a lot of information from this course, I was a bit annoyed by the crowded environment (we met at 8.30 and left at 3pm so it was a long day and very hot) and the lack of detailed information on the cooking techniques.I chose this course as I thought it would be more down to earth and less 'sterile' than the others and not only because of the price. I did enjoy myself and learn something but I was also a bit dissappointed.

tourist fake. Cannot understand all the good reports about this cooking school.First of all: there is no professional pick up service. We had to wait at Narai Hotel closeby until everybody arrived. In the meanwhile our teacher did phone calls and did not take care for us. From the hotel we went to a "market" closebye which was in fact one stand for vegies....... from there we went to the venue where the cooking class is taking place.Not too far, but I think you can expect a shuttle for that.Finally the course startet. First dish was fine - Tom Yam.Second dish: Pat Thai - taste of both was average. Our teacher did not explain about the way to cook and was always in a hurry.The third dish, a Larb Gai, was rediculous. Everything was prepared and the teacher just showed us how to throw the ingredients together. No word about the preparation of the meet, no word about the other ingredients. After 3 minutes his basic words: "Enjoy"!The Thai Curry was the next dish - frankly to say: I can do better. But this was not all: the cooking was more or less to heat the ingredients, because everything was already prepared. This is not a cooking class, it is a tourist fake, I think.My plan was to do 4 days, but I cancelled the next days after the first day.

Excellent cooking class!. This was one of the nicest cooking classes I've ever did in Asia. We buyed everything in the market, chopped the veggies on the floor (it was hygienic!), cooked the food on the verandah and ate in the cook's very nice appartment. Highly recommend it!

A very enjoyable activity, but don't expect too much. If you're looking for a half day activity, then a cooking class is good fun. You get a bit of education, get your hands dirty and stuck in, get to chat and meet new friends, and some great food to eat during this.Nusi meets you at a local hotel. The organisation of this can be a bit haphazard, most people waiting randomly in the lobby not knowing who to look for. He then takes you to the local market, and buys the ingredients with you, giving you a short and fairly random lessons on the types of food available.His class is held in a local converted apartment. No aircon, but plenty of fans, which is bearable. The group washes, chops, grinds and then cooks each dish under his instruction and gaze. You get through about 5 simple dishes in a lesson, which is quite satisfying on the brain and on the stomach. Nusi is a strange character. Slightly rude but funny at the same time. Maybe as a previous chef, this is what you get - just think of some of the chefs you see on TV! He does seem a little burnt out though, probably from taking two lessons a day, 7 days a week. Overall, don't expect in-depth high level cooking education. Expect a good time and you'll enjoy it. And at 1000 THB, it's half the price of many similar classes around. He'll even pay for your taxi.

OK but agree with the reviewer who says its overrated. I agree with the previous reviewer - if you don't know much about Thai food or don't do much cooking yourself then you will probably love this course. However as someone who is a bit of a foodie and already knew quite a lot about the ingredients/cooking I didnt feel I got a lot from this course. We cooked: fried rice, spring rolls, fried bananas, red curry with noodles and a som tam. I felt a lot of the dishes were "toned down" for european tastes (e.g. the som tam I ate around town had a really intense fermented fish or crab taste but this one was pretty tame! as was the curry).It was interesting to do some kind of "activity" on my trip but if you are a bit of a foodie then don't expect to be "stretched" on this course. The trouble is, from my research, cooking schools in bangkok tend to be "rustic/down home but introductory" (this one) or otherwise very "upmarket" (Blue Elephant etc) - but there doesnt seem to be one which caters for people who want to learn about rustic (ie not fancy Royal Thai) food but who already have a fairly good knowledge of thai cuisine/ingredients AND who want something relatively cheap (from memory the Blue Elephant/Hotel schools were charging in the region of $100 + USD whereas Silom only charges about $30USD.So I think there is a bit of a gap in the market for a cooking course in Bangkok which teaches homestyle cooking in a relatively basic setting (like Silom) but that goes into more depth about the ingredients, history etc so that people with a basic understanding/experience of thai food and cooking will still get a lot out of it.I have heard from other people there are a lot more cooking schools to choose from in Chang Mai - so if you are travelling there you may want to give Bangkok a miss as i would imagine if there are more options in Chang Mai its more likely you will find a better course.So all in all - I had fun but didnt really learn much - as a way to occupy a morning and have something to eat it was OK but definitely not that memorable.

Enjoyable but overrated. I went with my husband for a morning class. First the tutor took us to a typical Thai market and gave brief explanations on different spices, fish & ... Then we went to the "school" to wash and sort out the ingredients. There was no air con - only fans - which made the experience really hot and sticky. The tutor was a character... a bit moody and not as nice as most other people you will meet at random in Thailand. Anyway, he did teach us all that was stated in the menu... it was a group effort and I loved interacting with people of different cultures and countries. He did also pay for travel expences - to and from the school.However, since I am a bit of a cook at home and kinda know the basics, it did not live up to what I thought it would be.I would recommend this for people who do not cook regularly and want to learn the basics of Thai cooking. Also, for individuals who live in Europe, US - the whole washing dirty vegetables, skinning shrimp and doing everything from scratch does appeal - I relate to that. But since where I come from we do this on a daily basis, the novelty has worn off. Altogether it was not bad. I felt reviews were very overrated.

Loved This Cooking Class. this is our second time to bangkok and we wanted to do something new, so we went and cooked with the lovely host n meet other great people from around the world!i think everyone should go n learn how to cook thai food! make sure u dont eat before u go as you get extremely full!!!!

Terrific way to spend an afternoon!. I have always loved Thai food, and when I found out about this school, I signed up for 2 lessons (choosing the menus which had most of my favourite dishes!)My husband was initially apprehensive about accompanying me, but he was completely won over by the end of the first lesson. We were fortunate to be in a very small class on the first day, so we had a wonderful time chatting, while cutting, dicing, chopping and pounding away, Nusi first brought us to the market, and it was fascinating to learn about the different types of basil, ginger etc that are used in Thai cuisine. We were then taught how to prepare all the dishes from scratch, from washing the ingredients, to cutting them up, and finally mixing them up and cooking them. He taught us in a way that made it seem so easy! We initially had doubts when he told us not to have a heavy lunch before going...we wondered if we could come up with something edible! So we were pleasantly surprised by what we managed to cook: the dishes were all delicious!We have no regrets signing up for the cooking class. It added a different dimension to our holiday, and enriched it beyond the usual shop/eat/temple experiences. What's more, I can now replicate some of my holiday experience for my family at home! Highly recommended. Keep at least half a day aside for this!!!

A Great Way to Spend a Morning in Bangkok. I was recently in Bangkok on a business trip and had a spare morning. I signed up for a cooking class with the Silom Thai Cooking School. This class cost just a little over half the cost of other schools I had researched. The class included transport from my hotel. The day started with a visit to the market to purchase the ingredients. We then prepared and ate five different courses. The menu changes each day.I had so much fun. It was a great way to meet people and spend a morning. If I had more time, I would have attended additional classes.This class is not 5 star in terms of commercial kitchens, but offers so much more in the way of culture and a Thai experience.

Thai cooking with a personal touch. This is THE place to go for a hands-on experience on Thai cooking. The class starts with Nusi, the owner/instructor, taking the class to the local market to shop for supplies. The walk through the market is an experience itself with Nusi explaining all the various Thai herbs and spices.It is then back to his little abode to learn all about Thai cooking. He starts off the class by showing us how to clean and prepare the various ingredients, including making our own cocunut milk and curry paste (instead of buying them ready from the market).We then cook five courses of Thai food, taking a break each to enjoy our "masterpiece". For someone totally ignorant of cooking, I find myself learning quite a bit about cooking and surprisingly the food is delicious!Nusi is very professional and speaks good English. His approach and his centre gives a warm personal touch to the class.

This is the place to go to learn Thai Cookery. From the start when you visit the wet market to buy the ingredients to the end when you eat the food you have cooked and prepared yourself this is a brilliant experience.Well run by Nusi and his team these courses - I did all 4 - show you how to buy,prepare and cook exquisite Thai food. I defy any Thai restaurnant to produce better food than was produced at this Cookery school. Great value for money as you also get to eat 5 dishes (which you cooked yourself) everyday.I didn't go anywhere else but this has to be the best

The real deal. I wanted to learn traditional Thai home cooking, no shortcuts for tourists, and I am pleased to say at Silom Thai cooking school thats what I got and a great deal more. The course starts each day with a trip to the day market to buy fresh ingreadients, and to explain about the vast choise of things Thai cooks can use in every day cooking.Then back to the school to learn hands on, how to clean and prepare all the goodies, yes you even make coconut cream and milk by hand, because thats the way its done here. Nusi not only knows his stuff but knows how to teach it, in a clear and fun style making each day something to look forward to. the school is not a stainless steel palace like Rick Stiens place. but is one floor of a newish appartment block, bright and airey and kept very clean and fresh by Nari and his staff, you dont have to wash up! I for one could get used to that. You will not find better value than this!! and the rest I will leave for you to find out for yourself , because thats the way I like it.  Chok dii Trevor Matthews uk

Fun cooking and great food. My boyfriend and I took this cooking class which turned out to be truly enjoyable. Nusi, the cooking teacher, was such a character and a lot of fun. The round we made at the market was an eye opener as we got introduced to many local vegetables/ herbs that we never knew existed. Then we proceeded to prepare the ingredients and make every dish from scratch. The dishes that we cooked were exceptionally good (and by the way, we do have high standards!) Without exaggeration, his Thai green curry was the best we've ever had - we were shocked that our favourite version came from a cooking class rather than a local eatery/ restaurant!We also think that the course fees are very reasonable at THB1000/ person (compared to some other courses charging double this). In all, the experience exceeded our expectation and we highly recommend it to anyone looking for a great way to spend half a day in the city.

Tast of thai. I was shocked to not see this guy on trip advisor so here I am ... This man was so nice and his class was awesome. I sitll can't believe that I made my own coconut milk and thai green curry!WE started with a market tour where we collected our ingredients. We were all given cute baskets and water to fend off the hot sun.Class also included a cook book of the items we cooked.

Great experience. We attended the class on Sunday morning right after our arrival by midnight flight. It was all because to attend the weekend class which has a brief local market tour with the chef! It definitely worth such a bit tough schedule. The friendly chef has very deep knowledge and gave us clear answers to all of the questions.

Beautiful location, very informative, good food.. Took the class on a Wed and coconut is in every dish so I didn't eat most of the food but the class was so well done, informative and fun it didn't seem to matter to me. To see the complexity of every dish is amazing and has to be appreciated by every foody ! Instructor speaks english very well and really funny at times.

Must do activity / authentic Thai cooking. I went with my wife on our honeymoon to do this activity at the Mandarin Oriental. We did a lot of research on a lot of cooking schools but we felt this was by far one of the best choices we made. The chef was very enthusiastic and had a clear passion on his love to teach and cook. The school did an excellent job on providing detailed materials on how to prepare the dishes, what the dish looked like, and what ingredients to use. This was a great resource because you could really sit and listen versus worrying about taking a million notes and pictures. He would pass out samples and consistently call to the class to keep everyone engaged. Him and his assistant are with you every step of the way so it's almost impossible to mess up.Our chef did a wonderful job on explaining each ingredient, the history of them, where they are from, and great alternatives to use if you are from different areas of the world.My suggestion to everyone is to check the menus before you go because everyday is a different meal. At the end you have a group lunch and enjoy all your dishes together. A truly must do while in Bangkok!

Wonderful experiences!. My husband and I went to the cooking school during our 3rd stay here in Thailand. We have done many other cooking classes on various trips and this cooking school is by far the most professional. We were able to book our class immediately for that day and they were able to accommodate my food allergy. The first thing I noticed was how clean everything was, the presentation area, the ingredients, the cooking area, the chefs themselves, everything was sparkling clean. The class was small, only 4 of us, which is important to note, they do not cancel classes because of small sizes. It was a formal but intimate setting with lots of personal attention. The class was very informative, with lots of detail explaining the difference in ingredients as well as the processes of making certain ingredients. There were pictures, flash cards, and we were encouraged to taste everything. The class is set up in a way where the head chef explains the dish about to be prepared and all the ingredients to be used. This is where the tasting of individual ingredients occurs. Then we move to the cooking area where they was chef will demonstrate how to prep the ingredients for cooking. The tasks are divided among all parties so everyone gets to participate. The best part, you get to eat the food you cook together and it is all prepared for individual presentation by the assistant chefs, it is not served family- style. We received a parting gift and a certificate upon completing the class. I enjoyed the experience so much I returned the following day to participate in another class while my husband was on business. The menu was completely different and I was the solo participant. The school did not close merely because only I had registered for the class. This was an outstanding experience, if you are looking for a professional, educational and super clean cooking class, do not miss this cooking school!

Really good fun morning. What a wonderful morning. We were 4 in the class and chef Narain put us at ease straight away. All taking turns to produce 4 really typical Thia dishes. Each dish was broken down and the ingriedients explained in detail very interesting tasting everything as you go along. We all sat down at the end and ate all our hard work together getting to know our new friends. Very worthwhile time highly recommend doing.

A fantastic experience. A must for anyone wanting to know more about Thai cuisine. It is very good fun and truly interactive, the best bit is that you get to eat all the class has cooked at the end in a very convivial setting. From washing your hands and perfuming them with fresh lime leaves to picking the fresh herbs it is a truly authentic experience.

Great Experience. I have been staying at the Mandarin Oriental for many years and this trip was the first time I attended the Thai cooking school and I wished I had not waited this long. What a great experience. The instructor was friendly, funny, very knowledgable and he really made you feel comfortable. After cooking the 4 course meal the team set up a beautiful table for us to enjoy the dishes we created. I look forward to my next visit and next class.

Beverly. I attended the Oriental Cooking school with a friend from Vancouver, and we had a wonderful, interesting morning learning a lot about Thai ingredients, Thai food and Thai cooking.I highly recommend the school as a fun, entertaining experience while in Bangkok.

Fantastic Cooking Class!! A highlight of my time in Bangkok!. This was a fabulous experience! Chef Narain Kiattiyotcharoen, his apprentices, his assistants, and the administrative staff run a top rate cooking school through the Mandarin Oriental Hotel. Chef Narain is the star of the show and for good reason - he taught us to cook amazing Thai food while sprinkling in culinary history and humor, all in impeccable English. The two of us who attended that day made Dumplings with Crabmeat Filling, Stir-fried Jelly Noodles with Chicken, Red Curry of Prawns & Pineapple, and Banana Croquettes, all of which we ate for lunch. We left with the recipes and a nice bag of souvenir spices and an apron. As they feature different menus on different days, I will certainly plan on returning next time I'm in Bangkok. Highly recommend this!

Wednesday cooking class with my Mum. Wednesday cooking class - lovely menu mixed today, beautiful facilities and location, terrific teacher who speaks well and is funny... Lots of knowledge - presentation and a terrific mix of dishes .... You receive a big certificate of completions and goodie bag full of Thai spices ... Collected by boat to and from our hotel to cooking school.. Definitely recommend this cooking school you'll love it.... Well worth it!

EVER THE BEST MANDARIN ORIENTAL THAI COOKING SCHOOL. The cooking school of Mandarin Oriental brought me a fantastic memory as the place, the location, the instructor and the meal area provided are gorgeous! The instructor and assistants are helpful, knowledgeable and professional that made me feel so proud to join the class. I definitely will join again and recommend to my friends. The instructor is really nice and talkative, we enjoyed the whole training with full of joys and yummy taste.

Cooking school!!. We were on a cruise vacation throughout SE Asia. We love Thai food so decided that this would be a fun thing to do in Thailand. It was educational and fun! I was disappointed though as I thought we would be not only participating in the preparation, but that it would be Thai food. Chef Narain prepared all the food as we watched. It was pasta, serviche, fruit dessert, piccata...nothing that I would consider Thai. It was an enjoyable time...got certificates, bag with an apron....we ate what Chef prepared....got some good tips. Had I known I would have tried a different venue for authentic Thai food.

Excellent cooking course . Was looking for a special cooking course for me and my partner as it was his birthday present and this course did not disappoint. The chef was very knowledgable and I learned a lot about Thai cooking, ingredients and tools. The food we cooked was not your average meal which was great and set it apart from other cooking courses offered in Bangkok. Also the setting of the Mandarin Oriental was so beautiful and peaceful. Perfect I must say! Anyway I am still dreaming about all the food we cooked on this course and after living in Bangkok for 2 years it was probably one of the best meals I've had. Amazing that we even cooked it! The only thing I would change about the course would be the market 'tour' which didn't seem that informative. I would definitely recommend this cooking class if you are looking for something special.

Thai Oriental Cooking School - A Must for Foodies. Chef Narain from The Oriental Thai Cooking School is a most fabulous instructor! He was fun, informative and the four hour class was most enjoyable. There were a total of 3 students so we received very personalized instruction. Chef would demonstrate and prepare a dish then the 3 of us went to work in the test kitchen to prepare the same. We learned about traditional Thai ingredients and were given a goodie bag containing Thai spices and an apron. I highly recommend this class for anyone who enjoys cooking or want to learn more about Thai cuisine.

Learn from Thai Master Chef. Attended the cooking class conducted by Chef Narain, 4 courses were taught and he shared quite a lot of Thai cooking technique to us. Best part of the course is you can bring along your kids and we joint as family, pretty good!

Cooking Clas with Mandarin Oriental, Bangkok. Chef Narain Kiattiyotcharoen from The Oriental Thai Cooking School was our instructor on that day. We made 4 menu, Black Sticky Rice with Egg Custard, Green Curry of Chicken & Eggplants, Tapioca Balls with Pork Filling, and Stir-fried Clams with Roasted Chilli Paste. Chef Narain is a (very) humble person, he told us many stories about the ingredients which mostly came from Asia, also he was a traveler by heart as well, so the cooking session felt like a short time for us. On the other hand, the service from Mandarin Oriental was very great! They picked us up with a chauffeur-limo and the MO representative guide us. Here, we can enjoy the breakfast aside from Chao Phraya river, definitely a very relaxing time every morning.

Fun morning cooking. Enjoyable morning cooking several Thai dishes and learning about Thai ingredients. Chef Narain is very knowledgable and makes learning fun. We got to try and sample as we went along and he was happy to offer alternatives to my husband when pork was one of the dishes we cooked. Only four people in our group and we sat down at the end to a lunch of the food we had prepared. Given a goody bag containing an apron, various spices and recipes. All in all a great morning. Just wish that we had more time to attend the other lessons offered. Very reasonably priced.

A very enjoyable morning . My husband and I attended the cooking class today, and it was a very enjoyable morning. The instructor was very professional and friendly, and spoke superb English. Instruction was very clear and the lesson was well-paced. He demonstrated the cooking and we had the chance to cook the dishes ourselves too. We cooked 4 dishes which included an appetizer, a soup, a main dish and a dessert. You can check the hotel website before reserving as the menu is different every day of the week. After finishing cooking, we ate the food we cooked at the very beautiful Thai restaurant near the cooking school.

Best Thai-Cooking-School!. I did the six-day hands on cooking class and it was a beautiful expierience for me! 24 dishes in six days. The Chef Narain is an excellent teacher with huge knowledge and humor. The class begins at 9am and ends at 1pm from monday to saturday. The lunch is included. You will enjoy your own food accompanied by the Chef. Any dish will be shown first by the Chef and after that you will cook it by yourself in small groups. One day I was the only student so I got a privat lesson. The other days we where in two or four people. The stuff around the Chef is very nice and always helpful! They prepare a lot of things and clean the working stations after - I already miss that at my home ;-))The recipes are based on the traditionell Thai-Kitchen- no crossover. I learnd a lot about the ingredients. Back to Germany it's hard to get them really fresh :( The Cooking School is located across the river opposit the Oriental Hotel. You can easily take the shuttle boat from the Oriental Hotel. The school itself is situated in a very nice ancient wooden building. I definately raccomand this cooking school - even if You haven't much time in Bangkok You could spend only one or two days like most of the people do. I also raccomand the Restaurant "Sala rim naam" at the same place. We had an excellent and delishes Thai-Dinner at the terrace long the river with a beutiful view.Dr. Martin Genau Cologne/Germany

wonderful experience. had chef nariin as teacher. he sparkled from love for cooking and was a great and entertaining teacher. learned much and was a great experience i didn't want to miss. one of the highlights of my trip. beautiful setting in the hotel area.

very Mandarin Oriental... Probably one of the priciest in Bangkok for a half-day course but expected when you're booking at the Mandarin Oriental so at least you already know the premises will be top-notch and that the class was going to be personalized...an easy advantage since they only do small groups (4 in my class)...most memorable part of the day would have to be Chef Narain Kiattiyotcharoen who not only showed passion in what he does but also genuine interest in each one of us, making sure we actually did learn a thing or 2, unlike other cooking classes where our instructors seemed jaded (who wouldn't after giving the same class over and over again)...after class, he still took the time to answer my many questions and gave me a list of places to go buy utensils, ingredients, cookbooks, etc....ขอบคุณมาก !!!

The best place for Thai cooking school. I'm Thai people & I love all restaurants in Mandarin Oriental Bangkok. I know from hotel staff that there is a Thai cooking school. Then, I apply for this school. The school is absolutely perfect. Aj Narain is very kind & friendly. He is not only teach how to cook, but also he gives some knowledge about each ingredient. Overall, everything is great. This is the best Thai cooking school in Thailand. :) :)

Highlight of Bangkok. Chef Narain is a charming and knowledgable instructor for this excellent cooking school. I highly recommend this half day class for anyone interested in Thai food and Thai culture. The setting is in a beautiful bungalow and the famous Mandarin attention to detail is evident in all aspects. I have attended this class twice, each time bringing a friend who loved the experience. Check the hotel site for which day of the week you wish to attend...each day features a different menu. Attendees included amateurs like myself and chefs from around the world. This is a hands-on class and you will learn much more this way. Many mysteries of Thai spices are explained with substitutes offered for those without a Thai provision store close at hand. At the end of the class you will enjoy the fabulous food you prepared.

Absolutely wonderful experience. I can't stress enough how wonderful our experience was with this class. My husband and I have taken cooking classes all over the world in impressive settings and this didn't fall short of expectations one bit. The chef was engaging and an overall pleasure to be around. What I was most impressed with is the organization and structure of the program. Never have we learned so much in such a short time while also being deeply engaged in the process. Overall, it was worth the cost of admission and then some. I also wish there was a cookbook available but literally that's the only complaint I could possibly have.

Most memorable activity in Bangkok. The Oriental Cooking School is the first cooking school in Bangkok and it is definitely the place where one should go if they are looking for a place to get to know Thai cooking. Chef Narain is the famous Chef who taught us how to cook some Thai dishes. He and his assistants did a great job conducting the class, do the preparations and assist us to do the cooking itself. The day me and the group attended the class, we were introduced how to cook the Curried Shrimp Paste Dip, Stir-fried beef with green curried paste & papaya, chicken in coconut milk with Galangal, and pumpkin custard for dessert. The class itself was conducted in a very enjoyable manner that students will not get bored and lose attention. Chef also did a great job with giving examples that are easy to remember, He also have a great sense of humour. Overall me and the group enjoyed the cooking class.

Second visit. We have attended the school six years ago and we returned this year and we loved it just as much!The chef is a real card, he laughs and jokes and he loves compliments!It's very hands on so you are not just watching but getting involved.Enjoyed every minute and left feeling very full!

Mandarin Oriental culinary experience. One must spend a whole morning and up to around 1330 to attend a daily morning class (menus change daily each day of the week, and for seasons), if not for catered classes . Also, like other famous afternoon tea, etc., very advance reservation esp. for holiday high season if making outside of hotel (one's home outside bangkok, etc.) is pressed. There were 4 tables allowing about 4 persons to share the "highlights" of cooking tasks after seeing the chef teacher demonstrate and explain in the separate "classroom" rather than each person being responsible for own pot and pan going directly to be comsumed by self (like in blue elephant cooking school). At the end of the "cooking and preparation session" mostly done by staff who may outnumber the students, everyone is seated at one table to enjoy the prettily arranged lunch menu. There are explanation of thai food ingredients in general using supplementary materials, and notes are neatly arranged when one returns from "cooking session" to "classroom" as well as welcome sweets and drink in the same way (hotel fairies here as well?) At the end of the class, everyone receive award-like certificate and an original apron and cloth bag filled with spices to take home. Hotel guests receive 10% discount, and majority of the attendants come from the premise, while others also enjoy these pampered cooking/dining/cultural experience.

Great introduction to Thai cooking. The Oriental Thai Cooking School is a charming and informative introduction to Thai cooking.Set in a beautiful and airy old building across the river from the main hotel, students are guided through the ingredients, preparing and cooking a Thai set menu.Great fun, social, informative and entertaining. Exceptional teacher and support staff to guide you through the process.

Amazing experience! A must-do!. It was really an amazing experience and excellent value for money. It is a full day of eating, indulging, learning and socializing. You are greeted with Thai delicacies and sweet drinks -- and then you keep eating, learning and indulging from there. Prawn eggplant salad, Thai pumpkin, different types of rice, the most amazing Tom Yum Kung, and one of the best Tab Tim Crob desert ever made. It is an all day experience -- we didn't leave until almost 2:30.The setting is incredible as well, located in an old Thai house, near the spa! With views over the chef’s organic garden. Talking about the Chef, chef Narain, was simply amazing, knowledgeable and very hospitality. The food was also wonderful and super fun. We also learned a lot of great, practical cooking tips and mastered the art of Thai cuisine. I wish they had a signature cookbook. I really cannot recommend the Oriental cooking school highly enough – and we will delightedly do it again on our next trip to Bangkok - this was undoubtedly the highlight of our three week trip tot Thailand!

Must do in Bangkok. If you like food, cooking and eating it, this is a must for you. You start by picking out the day and therefore menu of choice. We picked the Saturday. We were picked up in a AC van, nice and refreshing! We were dropped of with the guides at this local market. Amazing walk and explanation thought the market. You get an explanation of ingredients, chance to buy whatever you want. After walking for some time you finish the market tour and get a nice cold bottle of water while we wait for the pick up towards the cooking class. The rest of the team has prepped the ingredients and you are ready to start cooking in groups of 6. Great explanation is given. Simple yet delicious dishes are cooked and eaten by you directly. Worth every Baht!

I cooked with Poo. .....and I liked it. If you want to have a pleasant and interresting morning, youshould join this venue. It is well organized and informatve. You won`t learn howto cook, but you can take some valuable tips home with you. The location, the markettour, the nice staff and the charity Poo supports is well worth the money. I can only recommend to take this class.
Fabulous and recommended experience. Visited the market first (not for the faint hearted!) then cooked an amazing meal back of 3 courses.

Amazing Experience!. The market was a great experience, followed by a thoroughly enjoyable class in Poo's kitchen. It was a well organised day, the cooking demonstrations were clear, he staff were so friendly and the food that we made was AMAZING! Poo purchased a variety of fresh fruit from the market for us to sample for dessert, along with the sticky rice and mango!! Well worth the money! A must do if visiting Bangkok!!! Because they vary the menu each day I will definitely be back!! Thanks Poo!

Amazing. - Highly Recommend!. Cooking with Poo was an amazing experience. One of the highlights of my time in Bangkok.The class starts with a tour through a local market. Amazing to experience the sights, sounds and smells with a local guide. It was a really authentic experience and provided a lot of insight into local life.From there we proceeded to the class. It was incredible to hear Poo's story of growing up in the slum and all about her Helping Hands charity. She is an inspiring lady. However, even if your class isn't taught by Poo, all the 'friends' are charming. Everyone got to cook 3 dishes. We ended with a banquet of local fruit and mango sticky rice. Totally recommend!

The best Cooking & Cultural experience. This is the best break / holiday activity you can do in Bangkok. My wife or I take all our friends visiting Bangkok & its always their favourite activity!The market is a cultural experience & fascinating (although not for the squeemish but you can stay in the van if you dont want to see it).The cooking is authentic yet made simple, so anyone can do it.You also get to try lots of fresh fruits at the end e.g. snake fruit, jojoba, rambutan, longan etc.The staff are lovely & entertaining, khun Poo is always a delight and as someone endorsed by Jamie Oliver, the price is amazing value. Your money goes to this wonderful project which continues to transform many peoples lives within this community.There were children on our visit & they enjoyed it too.There are also great souvenirs & gifts to buy there & at the shop next door.You will not be disappointed!

not for the sqeemish at the food market but a great time cooking and finding great flavours. a fabulous insight to every day life at a food market but be aware there are some sights you will need to brace yourself for !!! I loved it and totally embraced the experience with the smells sights and busy atmosphere. then once the ingredients were bought we all went to the slum area where Poo has the cooking school. The cooking was fab and even with a little language problem we all learnt how to cook thai curry, beef salad and tasted some really unusual fruits. A great time and fun was had and I would love others to try it too.

A 'must do' experience in Bangkok. From 8.30am when we met the group until I had eaten till I was fit to burst at 1.30, 'Cooking with Poo' is a superb sensory experience - capturing so much of Bangkok in half a day through the smells and sights at the market; the set-up of her kitchen in a slum; meeting the inspiring and wonderful Poo and friends - oh, and did I forget to mention, the brilliantly planned 3 dish menu you learn to cook with ease and flair (thanks to Poo and friends’ preparation before we had arrived). I've already cooked one of the dishes since returning home thanks to the excellent instruction and recipes given out at the end.I also came away inspired by Poo who has not only started the school, but she is helping her entire community to thrive thanks to her kind, generous nurturing spirit.I cooked on my own as my husband was working and everyone was so friendly - it would be a great work trip or experience with friends.I liked that although I know there are plenty of more formal cooking courses in Bangkok this felt very authentic in the set-up, going to the market and being within the local community - AND that I've come away inspired to actually try the recipes rather than feeling that I'd never cook them due to them being too complicated etc...It was more than just a cooking lesson, thank you to Poo and her amazing friends for an unforgettable experience.

Cooking with Poo. I received a recommendation for Cooking with Poo from a co-worker and I am so glad I decided to do it. Fabulous service from Poo, Noi, and Thai. We had a market tour and were able to see all kinds of fresh foods: from meats, seafood, vegetables, fruits, live animals. Poo's school was fun and inviting. We made and ate a lot of food. Thank you Poo and friends for the authentic Thai experience!

Exiting visit to the market and brilliant cooking class. This was the best experience in Bangkok for me and my husband. Interesting and fantastic to get a look at how things really work. The market was so good and the class, Poo and her staff was very professional. Very nice to meet people from all over the world that is curious to see how they manage to make a living in an place you would not expect to find something as professional and good as this. I asked the guide if all the fresh meat and fish get sold during the day and she said all the hotels and restaurants buy the ingredients they need for cooking. Interesting

Inspiring and unique experience. Brilliant, very authentic introduction to thai food. Be prepared to encounter the wet market, about as un-touristy as you can get but you are well aware that you are experiencing the real deal. Great explanations of uses of produce (animal and vegetable) as you go round. The cooking school bit is a great introduction to thai cuisine, but not intimidating for those with little or no experience in cooking. Poo and her assistants were all brilliant. Full of annecdotes and character. You're are also made aware, through their profuse thank you's of how much you are helping the local community by attending, they offer plenty of souvenirs but there isn't pressure to buy any. You do get recipe cards for free in a lovely thai elephant bag at the end as part of the classes.

Tastey food. My wife and I had a wonderful experience cooking with Poo. I have always wanted to make Tai food and I got to fulfill my ambition. A great time no pressure and easy to understand recipes. Poo works hard for her ambition to help others less fortunate that herself. She and her gang do a great job for her community well done to all involved. If you would like to learn a new skill and help other please take this cooking course you will not be disappointed.

Good time with Poo and her crew. We started by the visit of the main Bangkok market early in the morning. It really worth the trip : I learned a lot about the local vegetables and fruits not to mention the live bullfrogs.Then we headed to Poo kitchen where we learn 3 recipes : the first one was chicken with mushroom, the second was shrimp pad thai, the third was Massamam chicken curry.What I did not anticipate is what we would start eating at 10:30 am !Also we miss the recipe for the tamarind sauce but maybe Poo wants to keep some secret...We had a nice time there, I recommend this cooking class.

You might just be cooking with Poo. Visited in Sep 2016 and went to the market first it's a very dirty and not much short of a bio hazard waiting to happen. No sign of a fridge in sight and the meat has probably been out in 30 deg plus heat for hours. Cooking school was ok but didn't fancy eating anything that came from that market. Ok if you like that sort of thing. Beware your pushed towards another house opposite to buy cheap tat

Have incredible fun supporting a fantastic cause!. Cooking with Poo was one of our highlights of the whole of Thailand! Poo is an amazing woman and both her and the rest of her staff are friendly and fun to be around. The experience starts with an amazingly authentic tour of a typical Thai market where you will buy the fresh ingredients you will later cook with. The actual cooking school is the most intimate we found and takes place in Poo's old house in the middle of a Bangkok slum and you have the extra benefit of helping people improve their lives by providing and income for the whole village. A really humbling and important experience to see and support the poor people whilst having fun and learning how to cook authentic Thai food! Poo gives the course little personal touches like a free bag of recipes and I really recommend choosing this cooking course as they go out of their way to make you enjoy yourself whilst feeling you really have supported a great cause. Like everywhere in Thailand it is important to contribute to tourism in the most ethical way possible, and cooking with Poo allows you to really feel like you've achieved this. Really, really excellent!

Cooking with Poo & Friends. Interesting treat to be guided round the market for half an hour - it's so big and we'd never have noticed it from the street. The cooking experience was delicious and fun - I'll definitely try the recipes at home. And one of the lovely things about whole thing is that some of your money goes towards helping the people of the slum; the location of the school. It's truly worth it.

Amazing experience and incredible food. We have lived in Bangkok for a year now but this was honestly one of the best things we have done here. Poo and her team are fantastic and friendly and welcoming. We started the day being shown around the biggest fresh food market in Bangkok to collect the ingredients we needed. The market is lively and colorful. After this we went to Poo's kitchen which is still located within the Klong Toey slums and we were told the history of the kitchen and the area. Then we were shown how to cook four separate and all equally yummy and amazing dishes by Poo herself. The ingredients were fresh and tasty and the instructions were easy to follow. It was really fun and we were all stuffed by the end. Poo signed recipe books for us and we had the chance to meet some of the local small business owners as Poo gives a lot of support to them. It was a great day and I've already recommended it to everyone we know. Good value for money when you consider the amount of food, quality of ingredients and the fact that large amounts of the proceeds support the locals. Fantastic! Thank you Poo!

An energetic whirlwind of Fun!. Poo is amazing - from the warm greeting to our spirited trip through the market, I knew this would be a great experience. She showed our group wonderful things and even how to tell good from bad fruit and vegetables. Then, off to her great cooking studio, where she and her genuine, warm colleagues guided us through three dishes. Each was simple to prepare but complex to taste! Cannot wait to get out and try these recipes again. This is THE way I wanted to be introduced to Thai cooking - directly and from the heart!

It was a fantastic experience!. From getting picked up at the Emporium Suites, to visiting the markets and then the class itself, it was a wonderful time. Poo and her team are very professional. The dishes we made were tasty. I am not a confident cook but with the team's help I was able to create my dishes. I highly recommend Cooking with Poo and Friends

Fun, easy and delicious!. This class was a blast. I took two different classes, and enjoyed them both immensely. Poo and her team are great, and make the how experience easy and interesting. You'll get an eye opening tour of the Klong Toei Market, which is bustling with life, but maybe not for those with a PETA membership. After that, it's off to the school, nestled in the slums nearby. Don't let the word "slum" scare you, as the area, and school itself are very safe. I really liked the school in particular, it was colorful, clean and inviting. Most of the prep work will be done for you, so all you'll have to do is slice, dice and stir your way to some delicious dishes. The staff is also very helpful in suggesting alternate ingredients, and give you a nice little bag with the days recipes in it (although I highly recommend getting the cook book also!). Again, highly recommended, the only word of warning I have is not to make lunch plans after! Between the 3 dishes you make and the fruit and desert sampling at the end, you'll probably be stuffed! Hope I can go again someday!
A fantastic experience . My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed this experience. It was organized efficient and Poo was very sweet. Highly recommend this cooking class

Do this!!. The course was a great balance of information, education, fun and practice! Poo and her team are great and very knowledgable. The tour around the market was amazing. The dishes relatively simple but delicious, no great culinary skills required but the end results were very tasty. Also had a fruit tasting so we know which ones to buy ourselves now!

Best of Bangkok . Incredible must do experience, start of the day at the market was an experience in itself, too many sights sounds and smells to take in. Poo and her team were most gracious hosts and the food was incredible!

Wonderful and enjoyable experience. This is a very well organized cooking class.You will meet at 830am and finish at around 12:30pm.We started by visiting the Khlong Toei market to purchase some local ingredients. After visiting the market, you will be brought to Khun Poo's kitchen to learn how to cook three dishes.We learnt how to cook the lemon grass salad, phad Thai and massaman curry. Very simple but yummy.During the class, I have learnt some nice tips on how to prepare and cook Thai food.Khun Poo is very funny and her team members are very professional and efficient.Furthermore, joining the class is a noble cause. 10% of the fees goes to helping develop the surrounding community of Khlong Toei.

Foodie delight. My friend and I were recommended to do Cooking with Poo and what a fantastic experience it was. The tour around the market and walking through the slum community to Poo's cooking facility was very humbling experience and an amazing eye opener. An excellent way to learn Thai cooking with Poo and the simple incredibly easy recipes are fantastic. I bought her cookbook and have cooked a few meals already!!! It is a must especially with Poo putting the money back into her community and improving life of others within the slum area. I will recommend this to anyone going to Bangkok. Well done to Poo and friends :-)

Great Experience and culture shock!. My girlfriend and I had a tour with Poo along with 8 other guests. We learned a lot about Thai cooking and will certainly implement it in our future dinner plans. Poo and her team is very professional and fun. Her kitchen is in the family home in the slums which makes it very authentic. The cooking environment is beautifully done up with attention to detail from the aprons to the recipe gift bags. The tour through the market in the morning can be SHOCKING for some people. You will see meat and animal products which WILL upset some people, especially vegetarians and queezy guests. This is the Thai culture and tradition and the way they've been doing it for years. You can pull up your nose and complain or, like me, embrace the moment and see it as an eye-opener and learning curve into other traditions and cultures. Iv'e learned a lot about Thailand cooking and food in one day thanks to Poo and her team!

BEST ACTIVITY EVER!. What a wonderful way to explore Thailand and the local cuisine. First, you are able to explore the market with a guide- seeing animals, vegetables, etc. where most restaurants in Thailand buy their items. Then, you get to take everything fresh and cook it! Everything is so organized, comfortable, and easy to do! Don't be afraid to try it! The best part? Your money goes to supporting a community in Thailand that needs it most! ;)

Absolutely Amazing. We were recommended this to do by a friend who lives in Bangkok and has done the cooking course twice before. The booking system was easy and there was also a space to say that we were vegetarian (we couldn't go on the veggie menu day) and that worked perfectly with substitute ingredients prepared for us.The whole project that Poo has set up is commendable and the fact that her cooking school is still in a slum area is an important part of the experience. The instructions, collection and drop off were clear and slick.The only part I didn't enjoy was the food market due to the amount of live animals for sale, but that is a personal feeling and something that is part of Thai culture, so perfectly valid.A must do even on a short visit; we only had 3 days in Bangkok, but wouldn't have missed it.

Fantastic cooking class. Interesting market tour and lovely guides. Poo was very friendly and knowledgeable, menu yummy and easy to cook and easily reproduced when we got home. A great half day activity.

Five-star experience. Would definitely recommend Poo's cooking class for everyone travelling in Bangkok and interested on Thai cooking. Interesting story behind Poo and her cooking school. In the same time to do some good for Poo's community!Easy to book from her website, you get detailled instructions where to come before the class (remember to reserve enough time especially in the morning because of the traffic - even in the BTS). After gathering in front of the hotel You get to experience the market where the ingredience for the cooking is acquired. You can also purchase some for Yourself if You want to. After market You head to the kitchen to do the cooking. When You make the reservation You can choose what kind of menu You want to cook. You have a chance to cook three different cources and also enjoy Your cooking as You get to eat Your own creation between the cooking.After cooking You can purchase for example the Poo's cook book (definitely recommend!) or some other items. They also drive You back to the meeting place, so You have the rest of the day to do some other things (and definitely don't have to think of eating anything else for the rest of the day because You have just eaten four-course lunch!).10+ for the experience! Also a good way to meet like-minded travellers while cooking!All the best for Poo and her friends, keep doing the good job!

Cooking with Poo was a highlight of our trip. My 21 year old daughter and i heard about this cooking class from a fellow South African who raved about the class. I am so glad we went with this particular food tour. We were collected at the Emporium Hotel as promised, right on time by the cooking school - taken to Klong Toey market which was so interesting. It was lovely to have the different food stuffs explained. We were shown all types of weird and wonderful vegetables and fruits as well of loads of live produce. The journey to the "slum" area where the school is was comfortable in the aircon van. We were given bottled water to cool down in the vehicle. On arrival we were enthusiastically invited in down a long narrow walkway between the houses to the cooking school. Once at the school - a small house - we were shown the cooking stations (8 in total) where the group of 16 cooked 3 dishes in 2 shifts each. We got to eat what we made. Poo is delightful (and so are her friends) and spent time telling us how her school came about. We were offered a chance to buy her book (which is lovely by the way) as well as some fun souvenirs. Right opposite Poo's doorway is a small shop where the local people (Helping Hands) can exhibit their goods for sale. This is definitely a good cause and an authentic experience that i would do again if i came back to Bangkok.

Community Experience!. I am glad we booked this class as it allowed us to see a different side of Bangkok - a real community. We were able to see how booking this cooking class benefits the entire community and everyone who is involved there. The market was alive (literally) and vibrant and it was great walking through with someone that could explain things. The location of the cooking class is also authentic and the food was great. A wonderful experience for our family with 2 teenage boys! If you are in a group - book ahead - it seems to be quite busy.

Great Experience. Everything anybody has written previously, in the reviews, pretty much says it all. Even the advice not to wear open toe shoes came in handy.The food was excellent and such a great experience.We felt compelled to buy the apron!

I cooked with Poo , and I Liked it. Went in July with the family including 3 teenagers . cooked 3 dishes , It makes Thai cooking simple and fun . it is also a community project so it does your heat good as well as your stomach . a fun day all round

Great for tourists and expats! . I have gone 3 times - different menus. I did my grocery shopping in the market, with advice from Poo and staff on what is in season and what to choose. Then I cook 3 dishes myself, with help from Poo - eat there or take home. Finally, I got to taste about 10 local fruits and then eat mango and sticky rice. Yum! Can't recommend it high enough! You won't regret going at all!
So very fun!. A great time! Everyone was friendly, the market was amazing and the food was very quick, easy to make and most of all, delicious! Thank you for a great time!

They are great.. We were pick up in town ant taken to local market to buy food. They taught us everything to make sure we can cook when we are not with them. Now I think I can open Thai restaurant in My country. I bought her cookbook to recreate some great Thai food at home. Would highly recommend

Excellent way to start exploring Bangkok!. Poo was very friendly and spoke great english. Her staff was also very kind and spoke great english. The tour of the market is a fun way to experience the local culture and Poo made the cooking fun and easy. Very delicious too!

Nice food!. We met outside the hotel in the morning and then visit the wet market. We saw fresh seafood. Later we went back to the cooking studio and Poo explained everything clearly. Food is definitely delicious!

A welcome cultural experience. The whole experience - trying the recipes - meeting the teachers - immersing in the locations of the market and the school - was delightful and positive. Highly recommended.

Great morning. My husband and I went along to this course with high expectations from what trip advisor reviews showed and we were not disappointed. It was very informative and fun. The group of 12 were from all over the world and everyone looked like they had a great morning. The market tour was an eye opener, not quite the Kiwi Farmers market but one of my tour highlights. Great work Poo and thanks to you and your team.

Good comprehensive simple recipes. This was great! Transportation and water included. They purchase fruit for you to try. WEAR CLOSED TOE SHOES!!! They take you to a food market and there's live fish and chickens... So if you don't want splashes on your feet... Wear closed shoes. The English spoken is very good and they gave options of shrimp or chicken to cook. Very sweet people!! And desserts!!!

Highly Recommended. The perfect combination of challenge and convenience! Pickup/dropoff location was very easy to find. Staff handled most of the prep, yet every attendee had a chance to make each dish from start to finish. The market tour was our favorite experience in Bangkok, especially sampling all the unique fruits afterward. We loved hearing Chef Poo's story and seeing how much the school benefits the entire neighborhood.

Fantastic - Must do when in Bangkok. Well organised trip from beginning to end. Market was confronting but a real fascinating insight into real Thai life. Poo and her staff are really friendly and the food we made was delicious. Will definitely try recreating when we get home.

2nd time just as good as the First Time!. This was our 2nd time taking a class from Poo. This time we brought our son and his girlfriend. Just as must fun as our first time. The market hasn’t changed -:) The cooking area is very nice considering there was a fire there a few years ago. Poo has a great staff making the whole experience fun. In Bangkok and have a few hours….see Poo! Got new recipes too boot!

Amazing experience! . My study abroad group was able to experience cooking with poo and friends and it was so amazing! We were brought to a local Thai market and were able to walk around with a local to explain what things were, what they liked and didn't like, etc. the market was outstanding! From live stock and seafood to spices and fruit, there's nothing else I've been to that compares! Everything is at such a great price as well! We returned to poos kitchen and she told us a little about herself and her background of cooking. She used to cook outside her home and has now overcome many obstacles to get where she is now and owns this amazing business. It has helped not only her, but her community in the slums as well. We cooked pahd see ew, green curry, and beef with cashews. We enjoyed mango and sticky rice and a variety of fruit for dessert as well. Everything was so delicious, I cannot wait to make these things at home! Let's just hope I am able to find the ingredients! Thank you poo and friends for the hospitality, I loved cooking with you today!

Amazing cooking experience. . I wanted to take a cooking class while in Thailand so read tripadvisor reviews and selected this one after all the raves, but mostly for the story behind it. Poo truly gives back to the community and is quite a wonderful hard working success story. There are MANY cooking classes here in Bangkok, but this is well worth it and takes you to a unique setting. It was entertaining, informative, and the food was fantastic. This could not have been a better experience. For those like me, sensitive to heat- this IS air conditioned and the van for transport is as well. Congratulations to Poo and her team for giving us a wonderful experience.

Poo and Friends is AMAZING. You want to see the slums of Klong Toey - the largest slum in Bangkok - SAFELY? You can be picked up from your hotel and taken for a tour of the fresh market, and then into the slum to be taught how to cook Thai food and then eat it. Poo has been to England and cooked with Jamie Oliver, now a celebrity.....she was encouraged to begin a cooking school by my daughter-in-law. Poo is a really beautiful lady

So Glad I did this class.... The class was informative, interesting, revealing... Loved the tour of Klong Toey wet market... Skinned "country" rat, frogs, deep-fried insects were all interesting to see and experience. Mrs. Poo wasn't there, but her "stand-in" was good, even though her English was a little sketchy. The dishes were challenging enough and the fact most of the food was prepped was very much appreciated. Learned lots and met some interesting people.

Loved cooking with Poo. Poo and her team are incredible and very organized. This was my favorite activity in Bangkok and it was amazing to visit the market and see how hard the vendors work. This was an eye opening experience. Poo is very kind, humble, funny and warm and made the whole experience delightful. We made delicious dishes and the recipes are simple which you can make at home. I highly recommend Cooking with Poo.
