Excellent! A must-do in Bangkok!. I have done many cooking courses during my travels, and this was one of the best. The market tour is essential for understanding Thai cooking. We were able to cook the entire meal (not just parts), and I learned a lot. The recipes are fairly straightforward with not too many ingredients. I will definitely participate again the next time I'm in Bangkok! I love the social message also.

Wonderful experience and the food I cooked came out delicious :-). Poo and the team she is working with are lovely and very professional. Moreover, it is for a great cause, where the money we pay partly goes to helping the people in the Klong Toie slum district to improve these peoples lives...health care, schools etc. I will come again and will recommend my friends to go.

Fascinating. Our tour began with a walk around the market. It was really interesting to see where all the food we would cook with tad been bought that morning. The class itself had us cooking lots of delicious food, and Poo was great. Worth every penny.

Just what I hoped!. I am just back from a fabulous morning with Poo and her team. The experience was seamless from start to finish and I feel fortunate to have seen a side of Bangkok that I imagine remains obscured for most visitors. The market tour was a real eye opener and the food we prepared was just fantastic. I especially appreciated the gorgeous buffet of seasonal fruits! I really applaud Poo and wish her many more years of success with this endeavor. Can't wait to try these recipes at home!

Amazing experience! A MUST do in Bangkok!. My mom and I really wanted to do this class and honestly it was the best experience I have had in Thailand! Poo and her team were amazing through the whole experience from the market tour to the cooking school - honestly this is a Must do! There are lots of options for cooking classes but her story, the stories of those in the neighbourhood and the accomplishments that she has achieved through this endeavor are amazing and inspiring! Cook with Poo, support the people of Kong Teoy and learn to cook some of the most delicious Thai dishes! Thank you Poo!

If you do only one thing in Bangkok do this !. Yes the temples and the bright lights are around every corner in Bangkok and wonderful they are too, but this is a real insight into everyday life for thousands of local people and a rare opportunity to spend time within the community and to help this wonderful lady achieve her dream of Improving the lives of many who are unable to do so themselves.Fun, entertaining, educational, inspiring and unmissable is how I would describe this ..... Do yourself a favour and book this now to support this amazing lady and her team ..... You will not regret it and emerge uplifted and enlightened and itching to cook Thai food at home. Thank you Poo and don't ever stop dreaming

Memorable experience with my daughter . My husband was in Bangkok on business so I was looking for a fun mommy/daughter day with my 8 year old. This was it. Poo and her staff were accommodating, friendly, and knowledgeable. I booked maybe 2 weeks in advance and let them know my daughter didn’t want to cook her own meals, rather help me. They didn't charge for her but treated her just like everyone else. The meals were delicious! Even my 8 year old loved them. Getting to the meeting point was a breeze on the skytrain. Poo's driver was about 1/2 hr late but they dropped us off about an hour late too. The group we had was about 10, including people from the states, Australia, New Zealand, Europe...it felt like a family and it was nice to cook and eat together and hear everyone's stories. The market experience was amazing, like no market I've seen. Live animals, huge variety of local fruits, curries, sweets, anything you can think of, they had. We wore sneakers and glad we did as the wet market is truly wet. The cooking was unbelievably easy and we received the recipes to take home in a homemade sack.

I cooked with Poo and I loved it!. Went to Bangkok to stay with friends and wanted ro do something different while there. My friends found this on the internet so thought I'd try it. So glad I did. Was taken around the food market first ... don't go if you're squeamish. So many fruits and veggies I've never seen before. Got a chance to try many of them after the cookery lesson. Poo was great fun and after telling us how her cookery school came into creation showed us how to cook (and eat) 4 wonderful dishes in a morning. Easy and great fun. Would recommend it to anyone who wants to try good Thai cooking and meet some great people.

Fun, flexible and feel-good. Cooking with Poo was a great experience. Highlights included: walking through the market, trying and discovering new fruits (and old: like mango!), learning new kitchen skills, the professionalism/flexibility (i am a vegetarian) by which we were met by Poo and her group. Also, you can't help but to feel good that the money goes back to the community, as Poo is really invested in bringing her neighborhood up with her!

Wonderful cooking class + foodie market tour + lesson in social entrepreneurship. This was one of the highlights of my 3 days in Bangkok. Poo guided us through a wonderful cooking class + foodie market tour + lesson in social entrepreneurship. It's much more than a normal cooking class and at the end we got to meet a few other of the social entrepreneurs in the slum and buy their products too!

Inspiring cooking and insight. Went there after recommendation from friends, the class included a walking tour of the food marked. Prepare yourself for lots of 'interesting' sights and smells. But the market is an experience - this is Thai everyday life and a fascinating chaotic world. The cooking class was great, Poo herself was very enthusiastic about the food, her work for improving life for the poor, and how her work enables her family and the community to move forward. The food we cooked with a little help from her friends was great, they did a great job of explaining the different vegetables, spices, and fruits. We made several great dishes, including green curry (with curry paste from scratch). Great experience, worth every Bath!

One of our trip highlights!. A brilliant course with a good cause behind it too. Profits made from Poo's course are invested back into providing jobs in the local community. Well organised throughout, fun, different, welcoming, well taught, clean and hygienic, and a really memorable experience - definitely recommend!

More than a cooking class. First you start with a visit of klong toey market,which is the slum of bangkok. It's very interesting! You see beautiful things,but also things you quite like a strong stomach for...My tipp:put on closed shoes! I went wearing flip floos and to walk around in all sorts of juices wasn't very appealing.After that you go to poos kitchen in klong toey slum. The kitchen is very nice and even has an ac..;)The cooking class was enjoyable and the dishes were yummie. Poo provided a lot of information about thai cuisine and also about klong toey and how she started this project. I find the philosophy behind it very impressive,generous and beautiful!Basically poo is doing this for the sake of the whole community and shares the income for exsample with teenagers of the slum so that they can go to university.I would highly recommend anyone who likes thaifood and wants to do something good for the poor people of bangkok,to go to cooking with poo!

Enjoyed every moment!. My two daughters, Amélie 7 and Maena 10 years old -who enjoy eating asian food- embarked with me on this cooking adventure. I picked this class because it is about supporting a community as well as learning about ingredients and techniques. All the team made this expererience great for me and them. We started with the fresh market. The day before I visited the same market with my daughters, but having Noi to explain and answer our questions was very precious, and made the visit way more enjoyable for the kids! They loved the fact that everybody was very nice and attentive.The team understands that if one of them doesn't like an ingredient or has allergies, there is no fuss about it, and an alternative is suggested. The explanations/demonstrations were clear and simple, so the kids could start right away. It was fun, delicious, relaxed and interesting. The flow of the class was well orchestrated between setting up the ingredients, explaining the dish, preparing , cooking, cleaning and tasting it. All this is only possible with a great team work from the helpers that are working in the kitchen. All the left overs were packed away, ready to take out. We picked a Wednesday so we could learn the pad thai and the coconut soup, my kids favorite!Poo has a great sense of humor and she is passionate about her food. She truly enjoys sharing her knowledge, and more so she loves people. She is sharing with us her amazing story, and all the positive outcomes for the neighborhood. We were lucky that she was there that day.Me and my daughters got a great experience, and we highly recommend to choose that class. It was our first cooking class ever, first time in east Asia ever. We bought all the ingredients and cooking ustensils in Bangkok the next days to keep the culinary experience up as we brought back home her cooking book!Thank you so much for opening your kitchen!Marion, Maena et Amélie.

Inspiring, educational and fun!. I was looking for a casual cooking school in Bangkok that wasn't going to break the bank (Mandarin Oriental) and wasn't going to take all day (I had to attend a scavenger hunt organized by our hosts starting at 1:15pm at Lumpini Park). Long story short, Poo's cooking school was wonderful. The walk-through the busy morning market supercharged the senses, at times was harrowing and overwhelming, but got me ready to cook and EAT! The school itself is tucked away in the neighborhood where Poo grew up. No frills, honest, inspired little cooking school. The dishes were 1/2 prepared, so we mostly did some chopping and then, as most Thai food goes, just turned the burner on high and in 5 minutes it was ready ... and delicious. Just an FYI, in case you're thinking you'll be contemplating and dissecting a recipe for an hour. This is all very quick, which was perfect for my schedule. We prepared three dishes (beef salad, shrimp pad thai, and green curry) and then gorged on mango/sticky rice and a table's worth of exotic and local fruits from the market. Poo is wonderful, obviously. And her team is fantastic. Can't recommend this enough, especially for a curious amateur cook looking for a fun 1/2 day diversion and who thinks more like Anthony Bourdain and less like some Michelin chef in terms of what a foreign "cooking school" should deliver.

Great day out!. This is a great cooking class. The recipes are delicious and you have a great tour of the market in the morning. It's just the right mix of hands on/prepared ingredients. Poo is very entertaining. Great way to spend a morning! Would highly recommend.

Great experience. What appealed to me, was the fact that Poo's kitchen is in a slum and that some proceeds go to help the community.It was very helpful being picked up from a central point and very easy to get there by train.I really enjoyed going to the market beforehand and the cooking was a great experience.I had far too much to eat and made some new friends!

An absolutely must do! . My absolute favorite part of my visit! Started the morning with a great cultural experience walking through the market. The actually cooking class was just as wonderful. Poo is an amazing lady with a huge heart!!

Loved it!. I have just got back from my Cooking with Poo session and I am still smiling now! Such a fantastic morning, Poo and all of her team are wonderful and incredibly friendly and welcoming. Our menu today was the spicy beef salad, phad thai and green chicken curry. Poo and her team then also prepared sticky coconut rice with mango for us along with a selection of other fruits from the market for us to try.Everything today was totally spot on - pick up on time and the whole morning ran like clockwork. The dishes were all very straight forward to prepare and were absolutely delicious. I cannot recommend this highly enough.uI will definitely return for another session next time I am in Bangkok.

Highly Recommend-A Unique Experience in Bangkok. Just returned from a great morning with a very full and satisfied stomach. The whole experience was so well organized, interesting and fun! We were picked up in a nice van and then taken to a local market where we were able to see and learn about the fruits, vegetables, seafood and even insects. Then off to the cooking school in a nearby slum area. Don't be put off by this. It is a nice set up. The staff are all very friendly and lots of fun. A lot of prep done ahead which is nice and helps things go faster. The food was delicious including a sample of a variety of fruits at the end. They are a real community business and it was nice to feel like we were helping in a small way at the same time as learning and eating of course.

Easy and FUN. My brother and his wife wanted to take a cooking class while visiting me in Thailand and I have always suggest cooking with Poo - I have her cos book and love it. Some of the best recipes. The registration is easy and the use of pay pal quick. The drop off and pick up location is easy and always on time!

I've been 3 times!. I live in Bangkok and have been to cook with Poo 3 times, for myself and with our visitors. It's a wonderful, fun, relaxed experience. You are met and taken in a minibus to Bangkok's main market. It's not for the fainthearted but totally fascinating and a real experience. From there you are then taken to Poo's cookery school in the slum area where she first started cooking. Each time I've been we've cook 3 different dishes and then finished off with a whole rage of unusual fruits to try. The staff and Poo are all friendly and knowledgable. The food you cook is delicious and easy to follow. Don't eat before you go, you'll have plenty of yummy food while you're there!
Cooking with Poo is a Must. Great experience with lovely persons !Had 2 courses, really enjoyed the team and atmosphereas well as easy access of the cooking coursesStrongly recommend to do it!

Just a fantastic experience. This cooking school appealed as it supports a local charity. We particularly enjoyed the trip round the market initially and it was a real assault on the senses! We enjoyed the fact that the cooking school is in the slums where Poo used to live. The house has been converted into a small cooking school which thankfully is air-conditioned. The cooking was easy and with the book we purchased we will definitely do it at home. Our friends really like the apron we also bought which says 'I cooked with POO and I liked it!'

A foodies dreams in the middle of a slum!. I recently took part in Poo's half day cooking class with 6 other work mates as a team building exercise. As a self proclaimed foodie, I got really excited when I first heard what we were doing, although I will admit, I was taken aback by the name! First part of the tour/class kicks of in Khlong Toey market, which is Bangkok's biggest fresh food market. This place is not for the fainthearted as it has plenty of live animal's waiting for slaughter right in front of you. It has everything from insects to frogs, pigs to chickens, fish to vegetables and herbs. For this reason it can get a bit smelly, but you have to expect that in an open market like this. I personally enjoyed this a lot as it's a cultural insight and something so different to what you can experience compared to most western societies. Poo's team provide a guided tour and are more than happy to explain any weird and wonderful things you want to learn more about. From here you head back to Poo's kitchen which is below her house in the middle of Khlong Toey slum - this is what makes this experience even more special - but don't let this put you off. Poo's kitchen is well air conditioned, clean, and has a toilet should you need it. Her lessons and recipes are easy to follow, and all the prep apart from chopping vegetables is done for you. As part of the package Poo provides the recipes you cooked to take home with you in a nice colorful bag, handmade by a local within the slum. Not only is this a great cultural and cooking experience, Poo donates 10% of her income into the local community that has gone towards providing new roofing for her neighbors, children's books and toys, and many other great things. So in effect your helping support the slum as well. This is a must do if you have half a day spare in Bangkok and something great to do as a team, a couple, or even a group of friends.

A great experience. This is a fascinating and fun experience - starting with the biggest, liveliest and in some ways most challenging market you can imagine with gizzards, intestines and chicken blood mingling with a rainbow of colour from the fruit and vegetables. The cooking itself is a combination of practical instruction, hands on practice and anecdotes of what it is like to live in the slum of 100,000 people and ways in which enterprises such as this one can help. It may not be the most culinary based form of instruction but it is a wonderful combination of the cookery information and the philanthropic. Well done to Poo and her team.

Best part of our trip to Bangkok. This half day cooking class was a wonderful experience. I researched several other cooking classes in Bangkok and I'm so glad we chose this one. We were lucky to get in on a cancellation because the class was fully booked during our stay in Bangkok. I really like the small business/family ownership story Poo tells of the beginnings of her cooking class. It was easy to find the meeting point in the morning and the van was on time to pick everyone up. First we went to a food market and toured around, learning about the different foods eaten in Thailand. We had the opportunity to buy things as we walked through and our guide was very helpful in explaining what things were and the cost. Then we were back in the van to the cooking school, set in the slums of Bangkok. The school is modest, but everyone had space to sit, cook and eat together. We had an appetizer, soup, main meal and dessert. The food was wonderful and I've tried several different recipes from the cookbook I bought while there. At the end, Poo put out 10 different kinds of fruit, ordered from least sweet to most sweet. I really enjoyed trying some fruits I had never heard of before but had just seen in the market that morning. I also enjoyed shopping for some homemade goods after the class. These products were made by families who had started small businesses with help from Poo and the profits she makes from her cooking classes. Again, I'm so glad we chose this class as opposed to one of the cooking classes offered by the big hotels. And the price was right, too. About half the price of other classes. Thank you for the wonderful experience, Poo and friends!
Great experience !. Thanks Poo for showing us some cool recipes with your good energy. It's nice to see a different side of Bangkok, poorer but still happy Thai smiles :) Would defs recommend :)

I loved cooking with Poo!. This really is an experience you do not want to miss. If you love cooking and care about improving the lives of people in the slums of Bangkok then this cookery course is for you. Khun Poo was amazing. Her business has helped many people in her community. The began with a trip to the market, which was extremely interesting as the produce was so weird and wonderful. Lots of colours, textures, flavours and live animals. Once back in the kitchen we learnt how to cook delicious Thai dishes such as Lemon grass salad, Phad Thai and Massaman curry. The methods were simplified down into such manageable steps that even those who can't cook/won't cook would feel a real sense of achievement. The best part was eating your own creation. Overall I had an amazing time and hope you will too if you choose to go.

I cooked with poo and I liked it!. We wanted to do a cooking class in Bangkok and came across this on trip advisor. The reviews read well so we went and were so glad we did.The meeting point was easy to find and Poo and her friendly team met us. We all got taken to an eye opening Thai market which isn't for the faint hearted. Poo warned us about this before hand and we didn't have to go if we didn't want too.We tried a few things and picked up a few bits to try at the class. We then went to the cooking school which is in the middle of the slums. Poo is an inspirational woman and has done so much for the surrounding area. We cooked and ate delicious Thai food, then got taken back.If I was back in Bangkok, I would love to try out another class. A highly recommended activity to do in Bangkok!

Can't get enough of Cooking with Poo!. A must for anyone traveling to Bangkok. Poo and the team are all lovely and make it an unforgettable experience. I've been twice now and will definitely go again.

I cooked with Poo - and I LOVED it!. This was such a unique activity that allowed my husband and I to experience the true Thai culture, first-hand. Our visit to the wet market with Poo was intense - so much to see, it is almost overwhelming! The actual cooking school is a charming space hidden away in one of Bangkok's biggest slums. Poo has done an incredible job in supporting her local community while making visitors feel welcome and comfortable. The three courses we cooked up were delicious and flavourful, and we were given detailed recipes so we could replicate the meals, back at home. Poo and her team were friendly, funny, and helpful. The morning flew by in a flash. So, so, SO glad we did this!

Warm friendly people, good cooking techniques. I have been to 5 or 6 different cooking classes for the day in Thailand and Vietnam. Without fail they have all been enjoyable and entertaining. Cooking with Poo is not the classiest of schools, but the staff are warm, knowledgable and great communicators. That is enough for me!

Fantastic!. If you're looking for a unique experience, then I highly recommend Cooking with Poo! From the morning pick up, to the amazing walk round the wet market, to the history of it's beginnings, right through to the actual cooking and eating, it is a well run set up. I felt truly inspired, and the following day went to buy my store cupboard ingredients and cooked the Tom Yum Soup and Chicken with Garlic dishes - delicious, even though I may say so myself.Thank you to Poo!

Inspiring . There are many cooking classes in Bangkok and we have been to others, but only Cooking with Poo inspired and moved us, with Poo's passion and cause to better the lives of her fellow residents at Bangkok's Klong Toey slum through her cooking school. Enough said about that. Cooking with Poo makes Thai cooking accessible, minimum on fuss, maximum on flavour. It motivated us to cook Thai dishes from her cook book when we return home. The Tom Yum Gai and Mango Sticky Rice was up there as one of the best ones we have tried. The most meaningful part is of the cooking class fees goes towards work in the slums.

Get hands-on with Thai Cooking - a unique experience.. This is a great way to have a total experience of Thai cooking. Poo starts you off with a quick stroll through the wet market (Khlong Toei) where she explains the beautiful array of fruits, vegetables and other tasty delights on display. The walk-through is as real as it gets - this is the real deal where locals shop for their daily chow. The place can get chaotic specially in the morning. Poo then herds the cooking team to her humble kitchen, located within the slums. Notice the walkways and the modest homes. Put your apron on and get busy as this queen of Thai cooking shows everyone how is done. Do not worry -- everyone gets it right eventually! And the best part of the class is when everyone sits down and partakes in the fruit of their labor. It's a great way to top-off the morning - eating your very own Thai food. Foodies would love this adventure.

Authentic . This is the real Thailand with a real storyTake the opportunity to visit the markets but critically a slum area and see the reality of life in Bangkok all in the safe and gourmet hands of this wonderful woman

Great thing to do in Bangkok. I went to the Tuesday Class because of the menu. We started the trip with a stroll over a local market in small groups, which was very interesting. The cooking class is located a few minutes drive away from the market. The cooking was fun and Poo told us interesting facts about Thai cuisine. The dishes tasted great! In the end we also had the chance to try some unusual fruits we saw at the market. In general: great thing to do in Bangkok by supporting Poo, who is really active in helping others businesses in this "slum" develop.

Authentic locals Bangkok cooking class and market tour. Poo and her staff were incredibly friendly and informative while teaching us some basic Thai recipes of the Bangkok culture and leading us through a fresh goods market frequented by local residents. Experiencing the open air market and having our guide explain how locals use spices, produce and animals (including insects and amphibians, along with animals familiar to westerners) to create dishes was a day not to be missed.

Great Fun. Came here with one of my best friends. The shopping trip to the market was an eye opener and the group sizes were just right.The cooking class itself was wonderfully entertaining. Definitely recommend this for something a little different to experience during your holiday to Bangkok.

Cooking with Poo. This was about my 20th visit to Bangkok and this was by far one of the best mornings spent wandering the wet markets, Klong Toey and whipping up a storm of Thai food at the end of the morning.

Highly recommended!. We did this class/tour in December and had a fabulous time. Going through the market with guides was great, and Poo made every meal seem so easy to make. There is a ton of food, so we'd recommend just having a little of everything, and then they can pack up the rest for you- if you have somewhere you can store it. This was super fun and a highlight of the trip! Even if you don't care much about cooking, as long as you enjoy eating, you'll have a great time.

Absolutely amazing day of cooking including a tour of the markets. This was my favourite day in Bangkok. We were picked up from the town centre and taking on a tour of a local market - wow, you can honestly buy anything and everything! Then it was back to the cook school and we were treated to fantastic cooking with experience with Poo and her team. They showed us exactly what to do and we were able to make some amazing dishes. We got the recipes and I also bought lots of the recipe books. Poo and her team were so lovely and friendly. I was gutted when it was all over!

Took me by surprise. I agreed to this tour because a friend wanted to do it; but I'm not really the type to take a cooking class. This was SO much more than that. It's a personal trip with Poo thru the Khlong Toei market, a market that is unlike any other I have ever been to (and I live in Thailand). You buy your supplies there, and then head back to her kitchen to put some of the tastiest Thai dishes together. It's easy, it's fun, and it's an experience completely unique to Thailand.

Great tour of food market and delightful lesson in cooking.. An amazing woman who imparts a lot of information about the foods of Thailand and ways to prepare it in a relatively short period of time. Her work in the community is also impressive. I want to take another class from her.

Fantastic experience. What a wonderful experience this was for my family. I have three children who all learnt how to cook their favourite Thai dishes and they are now ready to cook me dinner at home.Poo and her staff were welcoming and taught us a lot about the place where they live. We were moved by Poo's story and the great work that Helping Hands and Urban Neighbours of Hope are doing in Bangkok.

Great market tour and cooking class. You are in Klong Toey slum for this tour. The market is crazy. All sorts of amazing sites (insects to eat, bags/boxes of frogs to buy...still alive, fruits you've never seen in Europe and huge, ripe & juicy)The cook school itself if well maintained, clean, air conditioned etc. We went for the Thursday menu and cooked pad Thai, spicy beef salad and green curry. Also had mango sticky rice. All was so tasty! Everyone cooked their own dishes so you made everything rather than just contribute to a group session. Poo and her team are an inspiration. This was the thing we loved most about the social enterprise of the school and what she is doing in the area. Money well spent. Got her cookbook to recreate some great Thai food at home. Would highly recommend
Cooking school best. A couple weeks a family want poo cooking school ,said it is the best and she teaching people from all over the world who cook just like they do in the slams.

Cooking to support the community. Starting with an exciting market visit and continuing with cooking. Great food especially the lemon grass salad and masaman curry. Ethical choice as part of the money goes to support the poor community nearby.

Fun Day with Poo!. I had an amazing time learning how to shop for, and cook Thai food with Poo! She and her team were very nice and the experience of cooking along with her was such an enjoyable experience. I also admire how she has helped her community with some of the proceeds from her cooking classes and her books! She truly is a special woman. I highly recommend Cooking with Poo to anyone that wants to learn the basics of Thai cuisine. It was a very fun time all around. Enjoy!

Awesome cooking class. This is an amazing experiences for all ages. first you will go to a market and buy all your food fresh! After you learn about what Poo has done to help her community. Poo is an amazing woman. Poo has taught her staff and another lady she helps what a break is.

Great experience.. We were not sure what to expect when we book this but it was one of the highlights of our trip to Bangkok! They pick you up in (an air conditioned) mini bus and take you to a local market for a tour... It was eye opening to say the least (let's just say I won't be eating frog ever again!) I'm not sure i can say i enjoyed the market tour part of the experience but i'm glad i did it. You are then taken to the cooking school which is in the slums, it seems to be a bizarre place to have a cookery school but when you go and hear how the cookery school came about and how integral Cooking with Poo is within the developing slum community it makes total sense! Don't let the fact that the the class is in the slums put you off. The air conditioned room is clean and comfortable! We got some great cooking tips, had lots of fun, ate some great food (that we cooked ourselves) and learnt a lot! I would definitely recommend this for anyone visiting Bangkok who loves to eat or cook with bold flavours! Any ability will fit in here!

Makes Cooking Thai Food Look Easy. Wonderful way to while away a few hours.Staring with a stroll around the local wet market (eye opener) to gather some ingredients you then go to Poo's kitchen make 3 dishes.Great flavours and a superb introduction to Thai cooking.

A MUST DO in Bangkok!. What an awesome experience! From the market tour where we purchased some of the ingredients for our cooking class (and this isn't a normal market that tourists go to) to the class itself, it was all such a fun and memorable experience. Poo and her staff could not have been more friendlier, knowledgeable end professional. The food we prepared was so good that I'd have to say it was a top three Bangkok eating experience for me (and for all that know Bangkok, its a pretty awesome city for eating!) I can't wait to do another class with a different menu. Also, probably the best part about taking this class is discovering how Poo has been able to leverage the success of her business to help her local community. Take the class, I promise you'll love it! :)

Awesome afternoon . An excellent market tour and cooking class that helps to transform lives of the people in the local slum communities. The market is eye popping wherever you look. Poo and the other ladies are so helpful and friendly. I'd thoroughly recommend this activity.

Fantastic class with local community. Absolutely recommend! Market tour was great with lots of explanations and amazing sights. Cooking itself was With simple recipes that capture the essence of Thai cooking and definitely are possible to replicate back home. Another amazing part that Poo's class is located in one of city's slums and the money from school leaves visible impact for Poo and people in her part of the slum. There are lovely hand made crafts right there in the slum and you have a fab opportunity to purchase Christmas gifts knowing that money goes into the hands of the ones in need.
Great Project. The project ist well done by Poo. The organization is great. Cooking was fun and to visit the market very interesting. Would do it again for sure!
Legendary . Superb morning with a really inspirational lady. The market tour was brilliant and the cooking class was superb. Everything was really well organised. Thanks Poo
A must do in Bangkok. Take the time to attend a Cooking with Poo class. Totally worth doing even if you are only in Bangkok for a short while.

What a beautiful woman.. Poo and her staff taught us so much and engaged with us so easily. There cooking skills are incredible and it didn't take a cooking genius to replicate their good food. Poo gave us a lot of fascinating background information. 10/10.

Superb!. The market was fascinating. Mad us realise how sanitised everything is in the West! The cooking was fun and informative, and in an air conditioned kitchen so comfortable too. We made 3 great dishes, which you could either eat or take away with you. Chom Poo is lovely. We bought her book and an apron - all in a good cause. Highly recommend this half-day trip.

Great day out. The cooking school is wonderful and as much as I enjoyed it, it was the markets I really enjoyed. It was like stepping back in time to before the major supermarkets destroyed our fresh food chain.A percentage if your money goes to projects that are lifting the local community out of poverty. So go have a great day and cook with Poo.
Very interesting !. After a fascinating tour of the market, Poo showed us how to cook easy tasty mealsWell worth the money!

Great and Fun Experience. I booked the cooking class for my sister and her friend so that they could have great time when I was working. They just loved it. Touring around the Klong Toei market is almost as fun as cooking with Poo.

If you like cooking, do this in Bangkok.. This is a very worthwhile way to spend half a day in this great city. We not only met the amazingly resourceful Thai women, but also a group of ten other tourists from five countries. We shared the van ride together and the visit through the Klong Toey Market...amazing in itself. Then we were taken to the cooking class kitchen for a well-organized class wherein we cooked three delicious dishes and were served a tasty dessert of sticky rice and mango. We received the recipes and visited across the way where we could make purchases of craft items made by women in the area, if we were so inclined.(no pressure). My husband and I both thought this was one of the best experiences of our Bangkok trip...we loved it. This woman is an entrepreneur who is looking out for her neighbors too. She and her assistants run an efficient school for those interesting in learning about Thai cooking basics.

Don't miss it!. Cooking with Poo gives you both a great visit to the KlongToei-market, and you learn how to cook fantastic Thai-food. It is so easy, tasty and wonderful! Everything is well organized. The only thing I was a little dissapointed of, was that we where a quite big group of 13 people, and that the stroll throug the market went too quicly to get it all - but I suppose I had too high expectations. In all the day was great, I got the book, and now I feel confident in cooking a lot of thai-dishes and buy food on the market myself. I hope to visit Poo again some other time and another menu (just pick another day).Thank you Poo!

Fun and informative morning learning how to cook Thai food. I had wanted to 'Cook with Poo' when we were in Bangkok 2 years ago, having been given the book. But I left it too late and it was booked up. So I booked as soon as I knew what dates we would be in Bangkok this year. So my advice is book early! We had an instructive visit to Klong Toei wet market, a place I wouldn't have ventured into on my own. Khun Poo guided us around, explaining, answering questions and buying ingredients for the class as we went. And then onto the little cooking school, where we cooked a range of dishes, ably assisted by Poo and her colleagues. We ate our creations as we went along, but by the end we were much too full and donated our our surplus to Poo's neighbours in the slums.It was great fun, and gave me more insights into how to cook authentic Thai dishes at home. We were given the printed recipes in little drawstring cotton bags made by another fledgling business in the slums, and had an opportunity to buy gifts made by more enterprises. It was wonderful to see how much impact Poo's resourcefulness is having on the whole community. My husband wasn't very keen on going when I booked up, but he was really pleased I persuaded him, (and now he can cook Thai food for me!)

Fun, Tasty and Inspirational Experience. A nice van picked us up at Emporium and took us to the Klong Toei market. Our guide took us on a leisurely stroll through the Klong Toei Market - lots of time for photos or buying food. The produce was beautifully displayed, and our guide explained what we were seeing. Then we got in the van and went to Poo's cooking school. She demonstrated a dish and then we made it ourselves, each with our own burner. The dishes were easy to make and delicious yet still healthy. Poo explained how her business has helped so many others start small businesses in Klong Toei: the woman who makes her cooking aprons, t-shirts, bags to hold the recipes, a cookbook, and the woman selling handicrafts across the alley. It was truly inspirational!

Poo is the best thing to think when you hungry!. Experience how to cook Thai's food and learn more about spirit of Thai cousin! This is the real Thai style cooking school that you can learn a lot more than cooking class. If you do love Thai's food, don't missxoxo

Great Authentic Thai Cooking Experience. The whole day was a fantastic experience. The wet markets were a great eye opener to a different culture and life style. The guides were excellent in showing us different produce and explaining how it is used in Thai cooking. We then made our way to Poo's place to start our culinary delight. Everything was very organised and the girls were patient with all 13 students, who successfully cooked lunch and enjoyed eating it.Would highly recommend to anyone wanting a genuine Thai experience. Lee enjoys wearing his Cooking with Poo apron while cooking on the BBQ.

One of a Kind Experience. This was recommended by a travel guide and I am so glad we signed up for it. Poo and her team were all very kind and attentive to ensuring everyone had a wonderful experience learning to cook and become a bit more educated about Thailand life and culture. Please take the time out to bring back some new cooking skills!

Cooking with Poo. I spent a wonderful day cooking today with Poo and her assistants. However today was more than a brilliant cooking course - it was a chance to find out and support a great social enterprise - Helping Hands. Please attend this course - enjoy some wonderful thai dishes and of course meet Poo! You wont regret it!

Fabulous experience cooking with Poo.. I had a fantastic time with Poo and her team, excellent market tour, easy to follow instructions for cooking and everything was run very smoothly and efficiently. Loved that it was held in the slums of Bangkok all added to the experience. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend this class for anyone. Would definitely do it again on my next visit to Bangkok.

Great food and experiences with lovely Thai People!. My 5th or 6th time Cooking with Poo and Team, and loved it all over again!The market tour, step by step instructions and cooking, with laughs and delicious food was so good! Great to take home a few gifts and memories as well. :)I'm sure I'll be back for another fun adventure.

Want to learn how to cook Thai - go here!. Incredible from start to finish. Purchase a cookbook to take a piece Klong Toey with you!Khun Poo, Khun Tai and Khun Noi are the kindest most genuine group of women we met. If you are looking for a relaxed informative cooking session I humbly promote this tour.

I cooked with Poo and l LOVED it!!!. If you are visiting Bangkok and want an experience that touches the head, heart and sends your taste buds to heaven, then THIS is for you!! Poo is nothing short of inspirational! Having overcome many challenges, she has developed her entrepreneurial skills to build a business from scratch in the slums of Bangkok that not only benefit her customers but also the community in which she lives. Want to see a local side of Bangkok that tourists never see? Then a Thai cooking experience with Poo is for you! Visiting the wet markets gives you the chance to experience and taste delicious local delicacies as well as witnessing food groups you never realised existed! The cooking demonstration was humble, practical and fun! Putting the meals together was so easy, quick and fun! l am now a convert to Thai cooking, having taken the class, bought the cookbook and sourced all the ingredients back home. Everyone who participated in the experience raved about it! So much more than a cooking class!

FIrst Experience With Thai Cooking Was a great success Thanks to ChumPoo and her Helpers!. It was a really great experience, I have never cooked Thai food before but the simple yet delicious ingredients and ChumPoo's cooking explanation before each dish followed by her helpers observation in making sure we didn't add too much or too little of the the ingredients ( they really explain how to make something less spicy or more spicy, also sweeter or saltier) , made the experience enjoyable and tasty! It is also great that they have products you can buy at the end to help their community even more.

I think of this daily..... I don't even know where to begin. Poo and her staff were the kindest people I've ever met. They take you through the Klong Toei market to buy your ingredients. If you're grossed out by dead animals you probably won't enjoy the market, but it's beyond authentic. This is a great place to take photos.  As far as the cooking class WOW. My wife said even though we made it the pad thai was one of the best we had while in Thailand. I highly recommend buying her book. She's a great asset to her special community of hard working friendly people.

I loved it. A cooking school in the slums of Bangkok, doesn't sound that good, but...it's clean, air conditioned and a percentage of the profits is returned to the community to establish other micro businesses. Through friends I 'saw' the morphing of this wonderful lady, whose name actually means Apple Rose, from a person eaking out a basic existence for her family to a leader and philanthropist determined to help others in the slums overcome abject poverty. The school is well organised, a clean well maintained bus picks you up and stops off at the slum market for a quick tour and an opportunity to buy really really cheap and delicious fruit and other food. The tips and skills to make delicious thai food are passed on and you eat what you cook. Highly recommend this his school

You've read the reviews - just go and do this. Very entertaining tour. You walk around a local market place and then cook food with Poo and her crew. Although located in a poorer neighborhood, the cooking school itself is very clean - definitely a nice place to cook. No cooking skills required and this is definitely something you won't forget. Poo and her crew are hilarious and you'll leave with a smile on your face. If you dont like this there is something wrong with you.

So much fun!. Cooking with Poo was such a fun experience, I would definitely recommend this to anyone visiting Bangkok. The food is absolutely delicious and there is one instructor for every two or three people which makes this a very personal experience.

Put a little back into the country that provides your holiday experience. We have visited Klong Toey on several occasions,mainly because we met Poo on her last UK cooking tour. The cooking school is located in the heart of Bangkok's largest slums where income for those with a job is just a few dollars a day. The cooking school and the products sold in the little shop over the other side of the alley help provide local family's with a sense of worth and confidence. I would recommend anyone who wants a real taste of Bangkok to take the opportunity to visit Poo and see what the real Bangkok has to offer.

Wonderful experience . I and my friend did this cooking class last month . Poo is very inspiring person , who have created an interesting place to visit . A cooking school , in the center of the klongs . You are guided to one of hidden markets , were you buy the ingredients and it was very interesting. Afterwards we cooked 3 meals . They were delicious . At the end, you could buy a cook book and across the laneway you could buy beautiful handicrafts , made in the slum. The staff were really lovely and helpful . Thank you Poo for a lovely morning. Would recommend it !

A Fabulous Bangkok Food Experience and Klong Toey Insight. This was a well managed tour, well paced, with comfortable transport and lovely, helpful guides. We spent a good hour being shown through the Klong Toey wet market, and then visited Poo's kitchen in the Klong Toey Slum. This was a really interesting place to visit, and to see what can be achieved in projects like those run by Helping Hands. The kitchen was airconditioned :) and well equipped. Everyone was able to have a turn cooking each of the three courses we prepared, and to spend time watching each other cook and tasting the food, which was excellent. At the end you could buy a cook book and across the laneway you could buy beautiful handicrafts, made in the slum.The staff were really lovely, friendly, helpful and informative. Our group of 13 included people from seven countries, aged from 14 to 55. Overall it was a fabulous experience, that I'd recommend.

A perfect way to spend the morning . I've done 3 other cooking classes in Thailand and this was the best. The passion Poo has for her community is beautiful and contagious. The trip to the market first thing was a bit stomach-turning. Vegetarians beware. The sight of all the animals in cramped cages waiting to be killed was difficult to see. As were the pig's heads and carcasses strewn about. However, I'm so glad I went as it made me respect where my food comes from even more. You can see lots of insects, toads and rats for sale as well and the smell is something else for sure! However Poo and Tai lead you through the stalls with patience and with an expertise honed through many years of daily visits. The class we basic, so suitable for all ages; there were some kids in our class. But still, there was a lot to learn and Poo and her team made it fun and the food was superb! You get the chance to take photos as well as buy merchandise from Poo and others in the area once all the food has been cooked (and devoured.) as a treat they also laid out 10 different Thai fruits for us all to try. Thank you, Poo! What a lovely morning in busy Bangkok.

Best Cooking School for all ages. You can wait in the hotel lobby for the van to pick you up in the morning-there are bathrooms there. The van is brand new and very comfortable and spacious. The groups are small so it is easy to talk to the guide and comfortable because you don't feel like you are in a big crowd. The tour of the market is un forgettable and so much better then going on your own because you can ask what everything is, and you can have the opportunity to pick up a few things at the kitchen supplies shop int he market that you can't find elsewhere. Once at the cooking school it is very clean, and very organised. Once again because the group is small you don't have to wait in line for anything and everything is ready for you. It is avery friendly and happy place to spend the morning. Afterword we had the opportunity to help a neighbour by purchasing things from her small shop so that she can send her children to school. The food that we made was delicious and we will go again in the future. We had 10 & 14 year old children that loved the day and it was all easy for them to prepare along with us.

Such an excellent and different way to explore!!. As all the other reviews say it really is an amazing experience doing 'Cooking With Poo' Booking was easy using her website and you can pay through PayPal. You can see the recipes for different days on the website so you can choose your day to coincide with your favourite dishes.If you like cooking or even if you don't it's such a fun experience. We met her staff at the Emporium in Central Bangkok early in the morning at 830am. If you arrive early there is a Starbucks and Au Bon Pain inside the Emporium Suites on the first level to grab a drink or breakfast but don't eat too much because there is lots of food to eat that you cook. Their driver took us to the local market to see all produce available in Thailand. There is so much to see (and smell omg), meat, chickens, insects and frogs!! The guide explained so much about the market and the different fruits. The floor is quite wet and sometimes slippery in places, be careful. You can buy anything you see while on the tour so bring money with you. The market visit is not for the faint hearted and you can stay in the van if you don't think you can stomach it. After the market you jump back in the van and are taken to the Cooking place. You do have to walk a little to get to the actual place but it's quite straightforward and the you are with Poo's staff. We are made to feel so welcome by Poo and her staff. Even thought you are with other people you are put a ease very quickly. We washed hands, put on our aprons and got to work. Poo explained each and every ingredient she used and even catered for special dietary requirements. Being allergic to fish is hard in Thailand as fish sauce is used in lots of recipes but Poo was so good and suggested alternatives for me like using Soy sauce instead. We made 3 dishes each. After each dish you got to eat it. It tasted like it had been made by a professional not by me. Delicious! Once we finished cooking we were given an array of fruits to try, all that we had earlier seen in the market. Brilliant tastes. And the finale was the Thai sticky rice and mango. My goodness how good it was. You must try it, don't be put off.  Take money with you as there a few bits to buy like aprons, cooking books and T-shirts. You also get to take the recipes we cooked home so you don't forget the details. You get dropped back to The Emporium around 12:30pm. Poo explains her story as she goes along and is to be admired for the work she does tirelessly in her community. It's a worthwhile experience to do especially knowing that some of your money goes directly back to community. Well Done Poo...
Just wonderful!. Had such a great time ''cooking with Poo'', Poo is such a fabulous hostess, charming, fun and informative. Definitely book this! x

Amazing and inspiring.. We enjoyed so much Poo's cooking lessons. We had a perfect morning visiting the market and cooking her recipes. Our admiration for her huge contribution to her people and ... the rest of the world. Thanks so much, Poo.

great staff, delicious food, interesting location and lots of fun. The tour started out with a look around a farmers market where the staff showed us around, explained various items and purchased the produce needed to cook up our dishes. The market was not what I was expecting, in a good way, I have been to several markets through out South East Asia and felt this was the most authentic experience. Make sure to not wear flip flops (which I did) as the floor is a bit messy. I really enjoyed the market tour. We then hopped back into the van and met with Poo at her home where the cooking class takes place. It is very apparent that Poo is a fixture in her community and has decided to stay despite her success. I enjoyed having the opportunity to see how locals live in Bangkok as this location is not somewhere I would have thought to visit during my stay. Poo and her staff explained why certain ingredients were used in the dishes and made sure to modify the dish for each participant dependant on their taste. We made Papaya Salad, Tom Yum with Prawns, Chicken Pad Thai and had fruits and mango with sticky rice for desert. I was surprised by how well the food turned out as we really did do the cooking on our own. They provided helpful recipe sheets for us to take home so we can recreate. Be sure to bring a bit of cash to purchase the famous cook book and some other knick knacks. I ended up getting a few books for friends back home. I really enjoyed this tour, one of the highlights of my time in Thailand. Highly recommended!

A must do whilst in Bangkok. Wow, what a great morning this was. After being sent the cookery book as a present from friends in Bangkok, our son was really keen to do the cookery course during our visit. We booked online in advance and were able to all attend ( children 11 & 8 ). The market was an experience ! And the cooking a highlight of our day. So helpful, relaxed and fun for us all and so easy to do again back in the UK - been home 3 days and made our first dish already from the receipe sheets. Can't recommend enough. Thank you all at helping hands

A repeat customer, it was better than the first time. Hi, this cooking class is a great experience. This was my second visit. The class are small, friendly and enjoyable. It was very down to earth and eye opening.

Highlight of Thailand. This was BY FAR a major highlight of our entire backpacking trip! Poo is an amazing woman and her story is so uplifting! You make THE yummiest food! And the tour in the market was so awesome. The staff is so sweet and you will really learn a lot. Once in a lifetime and a must!

Authentic and fun. Poo's cooking school is unusual mainly because the location is her home in a non-touristed part of town. Poo grew up poor and has become a local icon by leveraging what she learned about cooking as a child into a thriving business that supports the local community. Well, and she is fun! I have taken many cooking classes in Asia and this was among the best.

Experience not to be missed. If you want to know more about Bangkok and Thailand you have to engage with Poo. Cooking with Poo involves a visit to the wet market of Klong Toey district and cooking with Poo and her assistants. The market is an adventure in itself; one of the cheapest and biggest markets in BKK, with a variety of foods (including live animals) that is breathtaking. Poo's assistants are ready to explain everything you see while buying ingredients that they will need later on, and that you will be cooking! You might want to get your own supply of spices, like fresh lemongrass or pad thai noodles. What followed is not only about cooking. Poo is above all a community worker, somebody who cares about the slum in which she lives and which she has not abandoned since her success story with cooking started some six to seven years ago. She has helped numerous families in her community earn a living and enjoy better lives than the majority in the slum. She has provided jobs and encouraged people to venture into own small enterprises that cater to tourists who take the cooling class. In addition, she is a skilled cook, the class is well organised and the food tasted excellent! If you like to cook yourself, do buy the cookbook that she wrote and indulge yourself in tastes of Thailand. Since I got home I cooked tom yum soup, using Poo's recipe, and found it particularly good. The final touch of adding some lime made the difference to previous recipes that I have used.

Superb example of a memorable visit combined with an 'eco experience'.. Do not miss this!You have to go to understand what is really going on here. It's not just a cookery class.From the pick up, to the walk around the food market, to getting hands on with the preparation - cooking - eating (or taking away) what you've done, and getting a bit of information about how the area is benefiting from this school, well, it's a real gem of an experience.Great for all ages and I'd suggest something that would be forever remembered too.It's fun and informative; Saiyuud Diwong (Poo), and her team keep it all moving at the just the right pace so that everyone has a grand time (the young ones with us absolutely loved it). All of us had big old smiles on our faces.I'd suggest carrying a packet of wet wipes just in case feet get splashed during the market walk.And by visiting you'll also be making a big difference to the lives and prosperity of the people who live in this poorer part of town.Marks out of 10--------we gave it a 10 plus!C and JB

Visit to Poo's cooking school. Don't miss the chance to visit Poo's cooking school..learn some new skills and hear of the wonderful work she does in Klong Toey supporting and encouraging women who are their family bread winners.The food we cooked was delicious and the sticky rice and mango to die for

Great cooking experience. My husband, son, and I had a great time at Poo's cooking school. Wear good shoes that protect you from splashes at the market and enjoy so many interesting sights. Poo and her team were amazing and the cooking class is run extremely well.

I love Poo!. I'm really glad booked this cooking class before coming to Thailand! Most tourist attractions and tours I did there felt a bit rushed and seemed to only provide the bare minimum for your money, Poo goes above and beyond!Not only do you do cooking, but you have the trip to the market and lots of lovely stories from Poo and her staff which will keep you entertained.The food we cooked was absolutely delicious. It was the best green curry I had in Thailand! And the deserts and fruits were out of this world! We had a taster of many different exotic fruits that I had never even seen before. The only bad part of the day was I discovered that I love mangosteens and they just aren't available in the UK.

Interesting and enjoyable. The Poo experience starts with a tour of the wet market from which Poo sources her food for the the cooking class that follows. The tour was very interesting and for our two children an eye opening experience of how others live. The actual cooking workshop was well run, very tasty and inclusive. Thanks Poo: highly recommended.

Excellent! Fun, informative and grata value for money!. Just went on our cookery class this morning and we weren't disappointed. Picked up exactly on time and taken to the market where you behold some wonderful sights and smells. The market is really busy but Poo and her colleague lead you round without a problem explaining about various products on the way round. From geese, chickens, pork, seafood to herbs, spices and fruit and veg, the experience is eye opening. After this we ventured to the cookery school where Poo explained how it came about and how they give back to the community. We cooked beef salad, pad Thai, and green curry all of which we're delicious. If you're vegetarian don't worry they will provide veg or tofu alternatives. Dessert was mango with sticky rice and some weird and wonderful fruit picked up in the market. You have the opportunity to buy Poo's recipe book and other merchandise which all goes towards the charity helping hands. It was a fantastic experience and would recommend it to anyone. We had great fun and Poo and all her colleagues are really friendly. Not to be missed!

Great Cooking Class, Lovely People, Wonderful Cause. Words cannot express how much I loved this cookig class. Poo was an amazing teacher and the assistance were great as well. If you are considering taking a cooking class in Bangkok only consider this one. This one has a meaningful cause and a beautiful story. Proceeds of the class go back to the neighborhood. I really enjoyed myself and continue to tell people about my experience. Book early SLOTS FILL UP FAST!
Go go go!. We had an amazing day with Poo and her team, first being shown around at the local market, and then learned to cook dishes I have made several times after the came home! Thank you Poo!

Cooking with Poo. What a fantastic activity from start to finish, Poo is an amazing, very generous and proud lady. We followed her very clear instructions, took the Skytrain and meet at Mall, driven to the Wet Market where Poo walked us thru, telling us about items of interest - thank goodness we had someone to follow as you would get lost - its huge! Then onto Poo's cooking class held in her home amongst the "slums" where she was brought up. Great experience, awesome food, a full on morning. A MUST DO when in Bangkok - any age or gender.

Cooking experience but not a cooking class. I enrolled the class in a sudden basis, and did not read through their website and tripadvisor comments. I selected their class only based on their ranking at tripadvisor. My first impression before starting the class is their charge is comparatively high, as I originally planned to enroll another school who charged THB500 less than poo, but it's fully booked for my date unfortunately. Anyway, I am willing to pay for the THB500 extra with a high expectation. On the date of the class, we were asked to wait at the Emporium Suites for their car to pick us up to the market and the school. their team is easily recognized with cooking with poo Tshirt on. Their car is new, clean and edge, the inside is a bit similar to the one picking up Korean pop star.We spent around 1 hour in the market, as the staff spent sometime in buying the ingredients at the same time. I think the market would be those locals going to, as they have all kind of things selling.. In fact this is not special to me as Asian but it's amazing they also sell like ants, ants eggs, various of insects. We just walked around and you can ask any question to the staff, but one of their English is not fluent, and basically you don't expect them to teach you how to select an ingredient. We drove another 15-20mins from the market to the cooking school. And when I arrived I realized it is inside a slum in Bangkok. The school is small but with air con and the slum area is clean. This is eye catching to me. The date I learnt the classic Thai cuisine : padthai, tumyum soup and papaya salad. The ingredients were well prepared by their staff and all we have to do is cut it into small pieces and mix them up in the pot. I am so disappointed for such as I do expect some cooking skills as take out, not just eating the food. We spent time eating more than cooking there. I agreed with most of the average reviewers comments (I have read them all after the class), their comments are the most fair one. Before the class finished, they brought around 8-10 kinds of Thai fruits for us to try. It's good and should be amazing to those westerners. As an Asian, we know very well what are the fruits are. In general the experience is ok and I think poo is a truly smart and enthusiastic person that really want to improve the living standard of her village by their own ability. But the fee, to be honest for me, is a bit high. And this can only call an experience class not a cooking class. Agreed with those who have fair comments, if you truly want to learn cooking skills, pick another. If you want to experience Thai slum and willing to help them, this may not be a bad idea to join poo

Great market tour and excellent class. We started with a long tour of the food market, where one of Poo's staff showed us and explained all kinds of interesting foods, from insects to live fish and frogs, meats, fruits veggies, spices, and prepared food. She bought what we needed for the cooking class (none of the scary things), and the van took us to her teaching kitchen, located in the slum where she grew up. She told us about her project helping the residents of the slum work, and then we got cooking. The staff had prepped most of the ingredients, and we then did a bit of (easy) last-minute prep and the actual cooking. We cooked three dishes, eating each one after cooking. The standout was green curry with chicken, using freshly ground curry paste (pounding it with the mortar and pestle made the kitchen smell wonderful before it even hit the pan). Best green curry ever. At the end, she gave us a sampling of fresh Thai fruits and mango and sticky rice (also the best ever!). Poo is charming and warm, an excellent cook. After the class, we started noticing that her book was in stores all over Bangkok. Having tasted the food, we understood why.

An experience not to be missed!. Last week my husband, myself and another couple had the joy of attending Poo's cooking school. It was an experience I would recommend to anyone visiting Bangkok! From the eye opening sights (and interesting smells) of the market, to hearing Poo's inspiring story. The entire morning was great! Oh and of course there is the cooking class itself which was clean, well prepared for and delicious! All of Poo's assistants were wonderful and were extremely nice. I have even tried my hand at one of the dishes- it wasn't the same but it was still pretty good! Maybe just a bit more pratice

Amazing . This is a must do when you in Bangkok. Meeting place was easy to find. Mini bused to the wet market. Real sights and smells in the market. Noi guided us through the market , she was fantastic. Then to Poo's for cooking class. The cooking was brilliant and you eat what you make. Poo explained all the great work she and her team do for the community, helping people in the Klong Toey Slum.

Highlight of my trip!. Loved this cooking class with Poo!The day started with a trip to a local market which was a really great experience. Our group was able to ask questions about the food there and were given meaningful explanations and answers. Next we headed to Poo's kitchen where we were able to cook each individual dish for ourselves. This was greatly appreciated as you felt like you really did cook each dish yourself. The food was amazing!!! We chose the menu that included green papaya salad, tom yum soup, and phad thai. All were really great. Poo then had mango sticky rice for us for dessert (to die for!!) along with many fruits grown in Thailand available for us to try. Poo sent us home with the recipes for each dish we prepared which I also really appreciated. All along the way Poo and her staff were very friendly and willing to help us out, answer questions, etc. Overall I had a great time there, and left with a very full belly!! Loved it!

Been in Bangkok 15 years. Today we joined a group of people for Poo's daily cooking class. We were collected in a mini bus and escorted through Bangkok's biggest wet market in Klongtoey before going to Poo's kitchen in the Klongtoey slum district. A fabulous experience and Poo and her staff were so friendly and charming plus we all got skilful help in the art of Thai cooking. Poo gives a lot back to the Klongtoey slums and has helped people to help themselves. She has a big and generous heart and Noi her assistant should also be mentioned as friendly and helpful. I have been in Bangkok 15 years and this was one of my most enjoyable experiences. I will definitely go again in the near future and recommend others to do the same.

Fantatic cooking course with vist to marked. Visit to the biggest food market in Bangkok with an introduction to all the fantastic ingredienser of thai kitchen befolke we ended up preparing a four course meal with those very fresh frukter and meats directly from the market. Poo and her staff very efficiently run us through all the dishes and we thought we were master chefs as we ate the very tasty meal. When we realize that the cooking school is started as a microloan project and has given work to many families in the Klong Toey slum, one can only be impressed. This is a winner if you want something special When in Bangkok.

One of the things that made our trip to Thailand memorable,. We booked from home. Liked the possibility to choose from different menus. Arriving there was a real natural experience. Right in the middle of everyday life. The food market was intense and awesome. But the best was cooking with Poo where she comes from. And we met so many other nice people that we cooked with. This is nothing we wanted to miss for the world. Go and experience yourself. It is worth it.

Brilliantlyl run cooking short Thai cooking course & market visit. Well organised. Efficient pick up. Fascinating tour of Klong Toey market offering a glimpse of real Thai life that tourists rarely see.Great cooking instruction by enthusiastic staff and you get to eat what you cook.Nothing to criticise. A great product

Worthwhile and and small door onto yet another side of Bangkok. I recently attended my second class at the school and found it an even more worthwhile exoerience. As a vegetarian I really appreciate that all recipes can be adapted. Kuhn Poo's operation remains small but everything is good quality from cooking utensils to the extras to purchase afterwards ( including the cookbook and bags made by another local enterprise). The team have great energy to make the cooking fun and to relate personally with the students. This is a small door into yet another side of Bangkok - and well worth the visit.

Fantastic experience!. The experience of little tour to traditional market was fun and food was just amazing, even they prepared all ingredients to make cooking easier enough for us, I still felt like I can cook Thai food, haha...I had a great time anyway! I am also glad that I can learn how to cook as well as they use this money for helping poor people, love the idea!

Best food in all of Thailand was eaten in this course. We enjoyed every part of this class from the the market visit to preparing and eating delicious foods to sampling local fruits and deserts. Well organized and very friendly. The best food we ate in Thailand was in this course .

Fantastic morning.. This is great, efficient pick up and a wonderful experience from the market visit. We went with our 10 yr old son and we all loved it. Met poo back at cookery school. Great to hear her life history and to appreciate just how much she does to help the local community. Good opportunity to see firsthand slum area. Cooking school was very clean and well run. Great to cook a few dishes and try different fruits and recipes. She has such enthusiasm you will leave this activity with a big smile on you face.

Everything about this is so very worthwhile. I live here and have taken guests to several different classes. Others may be more refined in delightful settings but this one teaches you more than how to cook what are delicious, simple and famous dishes with very tasty vegetarian options. I can't think of a better way for a visitor to include a glimpse at the rough side of life in Bangkok and a chance to support first hand people that need it. I wish I hadn't gone to the market. I was disgusted by the sights and smells. Vegetarians take your iPad and keep your head down.

Fantastic food and amazing story!. If you are coming to visit Bangkok, or you live here, this is a great way to experience the food, from beginning to eating. The market is busy and eye-opening, as is visiting Poo's neighborhood. Not only is this a fun cooking class, but it also supports small businesses and entrepreneurs in her area. Her success story is inspiring, and getting to meet her was so enjoyable.

Brilliant (just don't eat breakfast!). My husband and I were super excited about cooking with poo after reading all of the TripAdvisor comments - we weren't disappointed! From start to finish it was well organised and informative but yet still lighthearted. The wet markets were really interesting and probably not something many travellers get to see. The cooking itself was fun, nothing complicated, yet the food was produced was incredible - best we ate in Bangkok (just don't have breakfast as there is a lots!). Overall a really great experience!

Best thing we did in Bangkok!. We went on this cooking course on the last day of our honeymoon and it was the highlight of our time in Bangkok and one of the highlights of our whole trip. The market trip was a real eye opener and great fun. It was great to have knowledgable staff on hand to tell us what everything was. The cooking part was brilliant, really well organised but very relaxed and fun and it was great to know it was all for a good cause.

Loved it! Enjoyed it!!! Must do again next time. A great experience walking through Khlong Toey Market, found a lot of great deals on tumeric, mango, spices and herbs. The cooking was simple but delicious and induced me to cook Thai at home. Particularly, i like the purpose behind the event... Helping the community. Kapunaka Khun Poo and team (Khun Noi and Khun Ban). I loved and enjoyed every minute. Keep this up. Will definitely come again.

Great experience but not for the faint hearted. Well i had been looking forward to this since seeing it on TripAdvisor and I was not disappointed. I would say the wet market was a eye opener especially for a Brit as the way the animals were caged and prepared for selling were not what we are used for and the couple of vegetarians in our party found this quite distressing, I being from a chefs background found it very interesting. The actual cooking with Poo was great fun and as I am not use to Thai cooking found it extremely interesting and she and her assistant made it very easy to join in even for the people in the party who were not use to cooking. Great fun and would recommend

Thai cooking make easy with Laughter and touching hearts. Book the Cooking with Poo as one of my to do list when I am in Bangkok with my 10 year old daughter for a vacation. As it is highly recommended by many other tourist and heard from my local friends. It was indeed the highlight of our trip. Poo's cooking school helper bring us to the local wet market for a tour and buy the ingredients. The wet market is eye popping with exotic spices, herbs, meat and fruits. It was a like a playground for me...I am a chef (French-Asian cuisine).Poo and her helpers are very warm and friendly. Not only are they teaching Thai cooking but it is also for a good course. My 10 year old daughter thoroughly enjoy it. If a kid can cook Thai food...so can you.

One of the highlights of our Bangkok visit. My teenage children (ages 13 and 15) and I attended a course with Poo and it was definitely one of the highlights of our Bangkok visit. The market visit was mind boggling and the cooking part of the course very enjoyable and informative. We experienced parts of Bangkok that we would have missed out on had it not been for the course. A very worthwhile cause. the whole day was also very well organised.

Fantastic, humane business- please support Poo!. The cooking course was fantastic, starting with a tour of the wet market and then followed by demonstrations, cooking and eating. However what really stood out was the professionalism of the staff and the way that the business gives back to the community. Nestled in one of the poorest districts of Bangkok they take time to explain how the business developed and is now able to contribute to other local enterprises. It's a ripple effect. K.Poo's enthusiasm is infectious and we came away feeling that we'd learnt a lot while also having a really fun experience with an inspiring lady and her team. Oh- Don't eat a big breakfast as you eat as you cook.

I cooked with Poo and I loked it. Definitely a highlight of my stay in Bangkok. Sweet /quirky staff showed us the most amazing market that I wished I lived in and Poo and her team were fantastic at her charming cooking school. We saw signs for other cooking schools near our hotel and felt bad for those who hadn't taken the opportunity to choose Poo. The location of her school was nestled in the heart of the small community she works with and cares for dearly. Snack light before going to be able to grab quick purchases at market and eat the delicious food she teaches you to make. Thanks!!

So much more than just a cook school. We went for a cook school experience. It was excellent but in addition we experienced so much more by visiting parts of Bangkok we would otherwise never have visited. We were taken in a comfortable air conditioned minivan to the Thai food market frequented by Bangkok restaurants, and the Bangkok slum. Fascinating and educational. It was also great to discover that not only were we benefiting from a great cooking tuition experience, the reasonable price we paid would also be assisting this impressive social enterprise to fascilitate many people improving their lives.
Great. great time. Simple recipes. Fantastic cause. Poo great host. One of best markets in Southeast Asia. Highly recommend.

A bit of fun and an education. We had a great morning The best part was going round the Bangkok wet market , you see some sites you'll never forget and helps you understand the Thai food chain ! Might put you off eating for a bit though.The actual cooking school is in the slum area and is interesting to see .The food demos were ok, friendly people and great to meet Poo herself who has recently been with Jamie Oliver.I think they need to let you do more prep and cooking but that's just my view and the food items we cooked were very much the sameGreat to cook with poo though

great experience. we all love thai food, but when it comes to cooking it, it never seems to taste the same. I was amazed how fast and easily thai food is cooked. I usually spent lots of time between cookbook and stove, but now I know that I bother far too much. Poo is great - just what I always wanted - cook Thai streetfood. It's the best when it comes to flavours. With Poo you need not worry about MSG, except what's already in the fish sauce or the soy sauce, but MSG seems banned from her kitchen. I would highly recommend this cooking class as a great day out - a very different kind of day out - when visiting Thailand (couldn't be more indigenous).

Friendly, informative and flexible. Our cooking lesson today was fantastic. The wandering of the Khlong Toey markets was a great way to start the session so thatby the time we were back at the school we felt like we knew the ingredients we were working with. We did the lesson as a family of three, with a six and nine year old. They were both included and welcomed and were especially pleased that they could alter their recipes by adding more or less of specific ingredients to suit their tastes. Family friendly cooking!
