To top it off it benefits the local community. A great way to spend half a day, then to take the khlong boat home.

What a great inspiring and funny woman. The nicest Thing we did in Bangkok. First you get to a hotel and from there you go to the market and do some shoppings. Poo explained a lot about different foods on the market. The cooking school is in a suburb and very well equipped. Poo is creatief a mini economy with her activities and that is really good. And she is funny too. We love Poo!

A great hands-on experience!. I found this cooking class on the Internet before we left for our trip to Bangkok. We booked the class which included an exciting a memorable trip to the open market to get the supplies we needed for the class...what an experience! The trip to the market and cooking class took a half day. Poo's staff comes to pick you up at a meeting place. We needed to take the SKYTRAIN to that location (very easy...but allow enough time). Poo and her staff were excellent in every way. EVERYONE got the chance to cook and eat what they cooked. We had had other "cooking classes" on this tour, but none that were hands-on like this one. Get her cook book! A wonderful day, and, her place is air conditioned!

An enjoyable way to support local Thai people.. Even if you are not "into" cooking, you will leave Poo's cooking school feeling great about being able to create some authentic Thai food (and eating it) and being able to contribute to the economy of this impoverished area. We (4 female friends) had a wonderful, fun time with Poo and her staff along with 6 other visitors. A perfect number for a morning of cooking good, tasty food. Very relaxing. The tour of the wet market before we went to the school was quite an experience and gave us an insight into how Thai people shop daily for food for their homes and restaurants. Would love to return to Bangkok and choose another menu to try.

Highly Recommended. A great half-day experience combining a market tour and cooking class. Poo and her staff are very welcoming and friendly and the event runs like clockwork. It is very well run and Poo adds a lot of interesting side discussions to her teaching style. It's a fun event and also supports some very worthwhile community activity and training.

Fun and interesting class!. My husband and I really enjoyed the Cooking with Poo class! The tour through the Khlong Toey wet market was very interesting and amazing to see all the different items. It's something that we probably wouldn't be able to fully do on our own, because it's huge and we'd get lost!Poo and her two assistants were great! There are five cooking stations set up in part of her home. The room has air conditioning, so it is comfortable.It was a lot of fun to make the dishes and delicious! This cooking class was perfect timing for us because we spent a couple of days in Bangkok and then we went to Phuket for a week at the Marriott Phuket Beach Club timeshare, which has a full kitchen. So we were able to cook the dishes, (Pad See Ewe, green curry, beef and cashew nuts, mango sticky rice, pumpkin custard) that Poo taught us or are in her cookbook! And we've made some of the dishes since we've been back home.It's great and really inspirational how Poo helps support her neighborhood and community with these cooking classes! Highly recommend signing up way in advance, as the classes get booked quickly.We'd probably take another class with Poo when we return to Bangkok!

My fave Thailand experience. We got a tour through the Khlong Toey food market which was a fun experience, there are lots of foods that I didn't know existed. Than we went to cook with Poo who is a lovely lady and made the cooking fun and easy, if you are not a good cook it doesn't matter because they help you. I highly recommend anyone who has the chance to book in to cook with Poo :) :) :). Make sure you book ASAP as it is a popular activity to do.

A memorable and "non-touristy" Bangkok experience. Even though Khun Poo was away on holiday, my friends and I thoroughly enjoyed our morning and came away with some great memories and good tips for Thai cooking. Everything is well-organized but there is still all the charm of the "wet" market and Poo's little cooking school deep in the heart of the Klong Toey community. I recommend this to visitors and expats alike.

Inspirational and delicious. I have done this cooking class three times in 6 yrs. I find Poo and her team inspirational. They all live in an urban slum and have found a way to support themselves and their local community. Cooking with Poo shows takes you on an educational walk through a huge food market and then you cook three dishes and eat them. A tip is to not eat breakfast. Great way to learn more about what you are eating.

What amazing people. A wonderful experience and Khun Poo and here amazing team are an inspiration as they work hard to put money back into one of the most needy communities anywhere.It was awe-inspiring to hear the story of how Khun Poo has made such a success of what she does against the backdrop of abject poverty.It was great to know that as we toured the fascinating market and learned about Thai cooking, we were not only supporting Khun Poo's charity but our money was going to so many good causes.If you live in Bangkok and know the city, or even if you are just passing through or are on holiday, this is a 'must'.A truly unforgettable experience.

Great day in Bangkok. This cooking class is a definite must while in Bangkok. You get to explore parts of the city that you probably never would on your own. They pick you up from a few locations around town (we were coming from Sukhumvit) and shepherd you to the market for a walk through. The place is massive and it is interesting to see all the different variety of food compared to a north american grocery store. Then they take you from the market into the slums where Poo's cooking classroom is. You feel safe every second you are there and have absolutely nothing to worry about. The room is cute and although it is well made up and renovated it gives you the tiniest idea how small some of the slum houses can be. Poo helps guide you through the recipes fairly quickly (it's thai food there isn't that much fanciness about it) and you get to taste and enjoy all the dishes. There are some very handy cooking tips that I gained from the day - including that the more you cut a chili pepper up the hotter your dish will be that it's added into!

Phenomenal Experience A Must Do in Thailand. Poo and her staff were personable and educational. Not only was the food excellent and a treat on Christmas Day away from home! You get an intimate perspective of Thailand from a native's point of view not to mention the help it provides to the community & cooking school! This is a wonderful value with a lot of take home knowledge and information! Definitely try to fit this in your schedule if there is room, book early!!!

Cooking school and charity. A great opportunity to get a different experience in Bangkok. Poo is a very inspiring person, who have created an interesting place to visit. A cooking school, in the center of the klongs. First you are giuded to one of the hidden markets, were you buy the ingreediens. Then you go to Poos place and cook the stuff by the help of Poo and her staff. The profits of school is handed to the area. In conection with the school, you can buy handcrafts made by the neighbours.

Beyond food experience.... started with walking through a local Thai market guided by a local was an amazing experience in the morning. The market is similar in many ways to my home town wet market except that we seldom see finger-long water buds with other insects which were recommended for deep fry... and also rainbow coloured cordial drinks in plastic bags ready for take away. Poo's kitchen was not fancy nor sofisticated, we could imagine the original state in the same slum area when she cooked for her family many years ago as a younger girl, just that without any air conditioning, nice flooring nor modern toilet facilities. Poo shared with us her story on how this all started, which added more meaning to the whole cooking experience. We were being told that by participating the cooking class, we actually were also helping the community in other ways, that we had joined in the helping hands. We had 12 ppl in the team, 6 cooking pans, we split into two teams in the cooking. So we got to taste our own cooking while watched other team mates coordinating with their new learnt skills, which somewhat entertaining... :)Food was good, ingredients were fresh, and the best thing was we didn't need to wash up the mess after each dish! I enjoyed the mango sticky rice dessert the most as it just tastes good and different from other mango sticky rice I tried, maybe it's the taste of home-made that made it special. I also can't forget the strong smell and taste of snake skin fruit among the fruit platter. 4 hours crushed course cooking with Poo opened my eyes and widened my stomach. I would highly recommend for anyone who wants to know more than just thai cooking.

An incredible cooking experience. The cooking class started with a tour of local wet market - a perfect way to learn about the various Thai cooking ingredients. We then head to Poo's cooking school in a local slum area. The school was spotlessly clean, and the class was very organize. The class was fun. Poo and all the staff were extremely friendly. Best part - the fee we spent on the class will contribute to the Helping Hand project which aid the local slum area. Thank you Poo for the wonderful experience and keep up with the great work!

Good Experience -Don't miss visiting the local market. We did check out couple of cooking classes online before finalising with Poo.Another cooking class said to offer more dishes - but they charged more and even wanted to charge for my 4 year old !Luckily we didn’t go for that and Instead booked with Poo.It was a wonderful experience starting with a visit of the largest fresh market in Thailand - The khlong toey market.You surely cannot miss visiting the local market and its unique to Thailand.We enjoyed the cooking. The Yum Ta Krai (Lemon Grass Salad), Pad Thai (Thai Noodles with Prawns),Gaeng Massaman Gai (Massaman Curry with Chicken)and the dessert - all tasted really nice.My 4 year old was also taken care of as Poo kept him busy with some colour pencils and drawing book- so that me and my wife could enjoy the cooking full time.It was our first day in Thailand and what better way to start than visiting the local market, cooking the local food and of course eating it all :)

Amazing experience. There are so many cooking experiences on offer in Bangkok. We chose this mostly because it seemed less touristy i.e. off the beaten track and the proceeds of the fee we paid go to the local community. Poo and her colleagues met us at a central hotel in Bangkok and took us to a local market to shop for food that we would use during the cooking class. What an amazing experience to be in the Khlong Toey market. It gave us a direct glimpse into how locals do their shopping in a market that is so unique from what we would see in a Western country. We then driven to the kitchen where the class was held. Poo has such a friendly, informal style of teaching the class and a great sense of humour. I felt like I was cooking with a bunch of friends. At first, I merely liked the idea that the proceeds helped the local community but the kitchen itself was located in the local community area and we got to see the direct impact of how the community was being helped. That made the experience all the more amazing.

Enjoyable and delicious. We had a great time at Khun Poo's cooking class. She is energetic, funny, and passionate about her work as well as earnest in her efforts to give back to her community. Although her original school had burned down in a fire a few months back, she and her team worked hard to relocate the school to another home in the slums. She arrived late that October day at the meeting point (The Embassy Suites), but her warm, open, and friendly personality won everyone over (Bangkok traffic sucks anyway). We first visited the overwhelmingly large Khlong Toei market first, where Poo and her assistant Nuy explained the exotic and wonderful food items that could be found. When we arrived at the "classroom," I found it to be quite clean (everyone removed their shoes). We also didn't have to do much prepping as each course was pretty much ready to go after an initial set up (veggies cleaned and meat chopped up appropriately, etc). Instructions were very easy to follow, resulting in delicious Thai dishes that we have been able to replicate back home (take-home recipes are provided). Although we didn't get to actually prepare it, the mango sticky rice dessert was the best I've ever had. If you're looking for something to do in Bangkok for a morning, check Poo's website. It's set up quite well and intuitive to navigate.

Fantastic for all of the family. I booked this on the basis of the excellent reviews here on TripAdvisor and I am so glad that I did as I would now recommend it to anyone visiting Bangkok. It is a "must do". Beforehand I wondered if it would be suitable for my son (13) and daughter (10) but they absolutely loved it. They prepared and cooked all their own dishes and Poo and her colleague helped them to select the right degree of "spicyness" for each dish. This meant that my daughter, who isn't great with spicy food, could eat everything she made. We also all really enjoyed the market trip and luckily were not put off by the sights, sounds and smells of the meats, fish, animals and insects on display there! It's rare to find something which everyone enjoys equally but this was the case with Cooking with Poo. I'm now hoping that the family's enthusiasm for Thai cooking will continue until we get home!

Informative and delicious!. This is a well organised, informative and highly enjoyable tour that I would highly recommend.Firstly, we toured the local market picking up our ingredients for lunch. Poo has lots of energy and shares her knowledge about all types of food and everyday life in Bangkok.Next we went to her local area for the cooking class. We made three dishes in total. All the ingredients are prepared and layed out for you to chop and cook yourself - everyone cooks and eats their own dish so you can leave out ingredients you don't like or add extra of those you do. I don't eat shellfish, and having advised Poo of this previously, an alternative meat was kindly provided. After all 3 dishes had been enjoyed, we were provided with 6-7 'unusual' fruits to try - this was really interesting and an added bonus!Finally, we enjoyed some sticky rice and mango, bought some a cook book and went happily on our way with full stomachs and smiles on our faces.

Interesting and great fun. We met up with Poo's colleague Nuy who was covering for Poo while she was on holiday. This did not detract from the experience at all.We started with a tour of the Klong Toei market and learned a lot about the market itself in addition to the merchandise, some of which is not for the faint-hearted.Following this we spent a couple of hours cooking our way through some simple Thai dishes which were incredibly tasty nonetheless. We cooked the best green curry I've ever eaten. The instructors were really friendly and full of energy and I walked away with a smile on my face.You receive recipes for the food you prepare at the end of the session which is a nice touch.

Practical and funny! . This is a great thing to do when visiting Bangkok and I would recommend it to anyone! I didn't get to meet Poo herself, she was on a well deserved vacation, but the two girls we had did a great job.You get to go to the food market, which is always a lot of fun. And back at the kitchen they teach you how to cook thai food with instructions simple to follow. We were a group of eleven people, but it didn't feel crowded. There was time and room for everyone.

Fun and Instructive. Great trip out for a small group, max 10. Amazing and surprising trip round the market first, with knowledge and experience of the team made it really interesting I hate to think how busy it would be at 02:00am when it opens.The team are well informed and ensure we were all included in the history of the school, cooking the menu and helping to create (don't have breakfast before you go) lots to eat and try. A very surprising set up in its location. I went on my own while in Bangkok but met a great group as part of the visit. Overall a fun half day, collection and drop off included in a very reasonable price which supports the charity.
Simple but effective. Well rehearsed simple dishes. Delivered well eventhough Poo was on holiday. Great fun. Thouroughly recommend.

Cooking with personality. I think if you are genuinely wanting to learn how to cook, especially from scratch, this is probably not the class for you. However, if you are a visiting tourist and are looking for something different to do and have a new experience, it is totally worth it. Poo has a huge, bubbly personality and her staff are lovely. If anything the trip is worth hearing her stories and experiences and knowing the money you are paying for this class goes towards helping out her local community, she's truly inspirational. Don't forget she has also cooked with Jamie Oliver and travels the world because of her cooking, you are truly in the presence of a celebrity! All in all the experience was worth it and don't forget to take some cash so you can buy the cookbook!

A lot of fun. We had great fun last Saturday. The tour of the market with its live animals/fish and then the cooking class were great. Apart from learning how to cook phad thai, we also did masaman curry and a lemongrass salad. For dessert, we tasted different Thai fruits. Very happy and it was fun for my boys (8 and 11). They have the feeling that they will be able to cook our meals from now on (that remain to be seen.... ;) I recommend.

Second time cooking with Poo, brilliant again!. You really can't go wrong when looking for a fascinating and fun morning than cooking with Poo. Well organised and small group size equates to a great experience. The wet market is an eye opener but certainly not as gruesome as you might expect, wonderful insight and knowledge around thai cooking and where the ingredients come from. The cooking was at the new venue following a fire at the previous premises. Facilities are excellent. Great to meet other travellers, prepare some brilliant food (have a light breakfast!) and meet Poo and her charismatic helpers. Just do it....

A must do when in Bangkok!. We were recently in Bangkok and a definite hi-lite of our time downtown was our "Cooking with Poo" class. It is just fun to say! We were taken by van to the market nearby to purchase our ingredients for the class and what an incredible experience that was! The class itself was very well organized and we learned how to make a fabulous Som Tum salad, Tom Yum soup and an excellent Pad Thai dish that we will for sure do again. I am vegetarian and was able to make my own vegetarian dishes while others also were able to enjoy their meat dishes.Can't thank you enough for the experience Poo! You and your team are excellent and we had a lot of laughs! We really appreciate what you are doing for the locals and the local area - keep up the great work!

Bangkok highlight !. What a priviledge it is to meet someone like Poo. Here is someone who was given a chance and not only did she grab it, but she dedicated herself to this project and has turned it into a success story. I defy anybody who is self-employed or who knows about business not to be inspired by Poo.The pick-up is punctual, everything is professionally handled and yet what leaves you with a glow is the awesome personality of Poo who just shares and shares and shares. No question about Thai food is too stupid for her and the tour of the market is just jaw-dropping.Since coming back, I have cooked most of her recipes and they even work back home !Please go and support Poo and Helping Hands, you will emerge enriched.

Excellent Thai Cooking Class. It's my first time enrolling cooking class during my vacation in Thailand although it was not my first time in Bangkok. I know about Poo through Google search and Tripadvisor. Having seen that there are lots of good reviews by the people, I have decided to give it a shot to this cooking class.We met up at Emporium in the early morning and proceed to Klong Tuey Market, Poo tried her best to explain every single ingredients will be used in Thai cuisines, it was hot and wet in the market but this didn't stop my curiosity to Poo's market guidance.After market we went to Poo's place and started to learn cooking Tom yum, Larb and Stir fry garlic chicken, and lastly we had mango sticky rice prepared by Poo which is awesome. Poo and her staffs tried their best to help us to finish our cooking lesson by explaining and assisting beside us, so even though you are the first timer, it is absolutely problem free for you.It is a completely new experience for me in Bangkok even though I have traveled here several times. Rather than shopping or visiting tourist attractions, I would say by taking cooking class it will help you to understand more about the art of Thai cuisines and of course the beauty of Thai culture.

fun local experience. we joined a 'cooking with Poo" class last week and had a great time. Very authentic and great fun. Poo really is quite the personality and her story and work is what makes this tour so unique. She's doing wonderful things with the local community and this cooking tour is a great way to not only learn how to make some great Thai dishes but also gain insights into a unique cultural world. thoroughly recommended.

More than just a cooking course. Really enjoyed this cooking course, I have done a couple around Thailand and felt that this was the best as it helps a good cause and you get a brief glimpse of the life of Poo;)She is a great host, actually all the people involved in running the course were very friendly and it was a fun experience.I really enjoyed the food and was surprised at the ease with which it was made. The market trip was an experience worth going all by itself.Glad to have done this and cannot recommend it enough:)

I loved cooking with poo!!. The floating market was great and fascinating and the tour guide was friendly and cheery. The cooking class was great fun and loved rating the food as you cook it. The money goes back into the slums so makes it that bit more worthwhile. want to do it again!

Fun and great experience. The staff and all the people we met were so friendly, informative and helpful. They taught us to cook 3 Thai dishes, including green curry, that we were able to eat after cooking, which was absolutely delicious. This is a great way to see a different side of Bangkok and experience authentic Thai cooking. Look up Jamie Oliver's cooking with Poo YouTube video to see how good Poo's culinary skills are. I would most certainly recommend this cooking course and would be more than happy to do it again. Each day has a different menu for you to look forward to cooking up and eating!

Authentic Bangkok experience. A professionally organized experience which allowed me to see the markets homes and surroundings of day to day people it did not seem like a tourist venture. It was good to know some of the participation fees were helping Thai people in need. An enjoyable educational small group experience conducted well despite the make do facilities due to their recent fire.

Cooking with Poo and loved it. I had a brilliant day, I rocked up on my own, there were 10 altogether, some in groups, some alone and we made a really friendly group altogether. A van picked us up from our meeting point and took us to the market at Klongtoey Toey where we were guided through and shown different produce. We were then taken to the slum and were guided step by step through a very typical thai menu. I'm so pleased to have seen this area and to have met Poo and her friends. It was a fab day and totally worth doing again when we have visitors. I'm so pleased to have learnt how to cook these dishes. An experience to remember and a very worthy charity to support. Take some extra bht to buy the book and a souvenir that the locals have made.

Such a fun day!. 10 was a good number of participants. We learnt so much about various fruits and produce on the tour of the wet market. Then mini van took us to the cooking school. Efficient and professional. And making a difference in the community. Take some extra baht to buy the cook book etc.

A fun and delicious way to spend a day!. Many come to Thailand for its culinary attributes. If you're one of these, then cooking with Poo is a must-do activity. The day begins with a tour of Klong Toei market. Not only do you get to learn about the ingredients you will be using later in the morning, but you get a fantastic overview of Thai market culture, products and produce. Even those of you that are well-versed in cooking will learn more than you expected. Your group, which only includes about 10 people at a time (book in advance) then go to the Klong Toei neighborhood to Poo's kitchen. The original kitchen was destroyed in a fire, but the staff had an alternate site up and running almost immediately--they are dedicated professionals. Along the way you walk through one of Bangkok's poorer districts, opening your eyes to a Bangkok not most get to see. Do say hello to the locals and children. Unlike "slums" in other metropolises, you will feel welcome and safe.The workshop is masterfully organized. You learn to whip-up a 3-course meal in a matter of two hours. The best part: you get to eat your creations. They prepare recipes for you to take home as well. The cooking will also introduce you to basic Thai cooking techniques and aromatics. You'll definitely want to show off your skills as soon as you get home.The best part though: Poo and her staff. They were amazing in every way: welcoming, informative, funny, and energetic. They were superb ambassadors of Thailand, its people, and its culinary traditions. The proceeds go to the local community and help support activities for disadvantaged children and women in the community.What a wonderful way to spend a day.

I cooked with Poo and LOVED it!. A really fun experience, so happy I did it. The market was fascinating, much less touristy and had so much more variety in items. The cooking was fun and I was amazed on how simple, yet flavorful the dishes were to make. What made this experience most special was that Poo takes you to her home to do the cooking. Her school is not fancy by any means, but you can appreciate her story and how she got started because you are there in the heart of it. She welcomes you to her neighborhood and into the school that is attached to her home. It was a very personal, warm and authentic experience. I highly recommend it, gives you insight into the lifestyles of those in her neighborhood. I was sad to hear that Poo's home and cooking school along with many other homes was burned down since my class on August 2. I believe that she is already back and running in a new temporary location. This is a glimpse into the kind of work ethic she has. Her story is amazing, you have even more of a reason to support her cooking school now! Go for it!

Must do!. Well organised. Booking & communicating was easy. Great mix of:- seeing inside the slum (which this business is helping), - finding your way around Klong Toei market, - understanding what is at the market, why, and what to look for when chosing the best produce, - learning about Thai ingredients, and what you can use instead if you can't find it back home, - cooking & eating great food,all in one morning, without feeling rushed!Make sure you arrive hungry! and even then you might want to take one dish home (กลับบ้าน 'glab barn').Often fully booked well in advance - especially on popular days - so book as soon as possible.Really enjoyed it thanks.

Fantastic experience. This was one of the neatest things I have done in a foreign country--a nice contrast to visiting tourist sites, hanging out at the beach, shopping, etc. After trying for a long time to get into the class I finally succeeded. Only ten people are accepted at a time so you need to reserve far in advance. You start out by going to the rendezvous point--it is very close to the Skytrain stop and easy to find. You are picked up and taken to the gigantic Klong Toey food market to buy ingredients. That was an amazing experience with all kinds of weird and exotic things for sale including frogs, many varieties of seafood, marvelous tropical fruit and vegetables, flowers, etc. It was really informative to have somebody with you who understands it all and can explain why one type of lime is more expensive than others, which dragon fruit is ripe and who has the best rice pudding. After the market, you go to the cooking school. It is right in the middle of her neighborhood on a little alley. The "classroom" is small which explains why the courses are only for ten people. It was quite relaxing and easy to cook--everything is explained in simple terms and a lot of the ingredients are already pre-cut. It is like cooking with friends. The experience demystified the process of making Thai food--when you actually do it yourself it is really not that difficult, just a question of knowing which spices to use. As long as you are not totally inept, it will not be a problem. What you cook depends on the day of the class. Check the website for the meals on the day you will be there. All in all a very rewarding experience, from going to the market, preparing the food, eating it, visiting the neighborhood and chatting with the other "chefs". It had a real low key, friendly feel to it and cannot recommend it enough as something quite different from the regular tourist activities. On thing to note is that the apron used to cook is not to keep--you have to purchase it at the end if you want it.

Make This Part of Your Trip to Bangkok. What a fantastic experience this was. This was one of the highlights of our trip to Bangkok.It was very easy to find the pick-up location. The tour of the market was very interesting. Transportation was very comfortable.And then there's the cooking class itself. Great, just great.I applaud Poo in her efforts to help the people in her neighborhood. A fantastic lady. Very much to be admired.

Tom Yum Soup. Rec’d a Poo’s cooking class gift for my b’day from my daughter during our visit to Bangkok…was not disappointed. Enjoyed the trip to the open air market and the hands on teaching approach for the 3 items we cooked. Well worth the ½ day visit, don’t pass it up. But you have to book early, like 4-6 weeks in advance, the class of only 10 fills up fast.

We cooked the best Thai food ever with Poo!. Our family wanted to learn Thai cooking during our 3 week travels in Thailand and we found Cooking with Poo advertised on Trip Advisor. We booked this course over others because of the price but also because of the work that Poo is doing to improve the lives of people in her community.Cooking with Poo was one of the highlights of our trip. Poo is a wonderful lady, very funny and full of energy. She obviously loves what she does and has a passion for helping others and making positive impact to people in the community.The trip to the market was fascinating and a bit of a culture shock but we loved the experience! The food we cooked with Poo was the best Thai food we had in the three weeks we were in Thailand. We all wish we had been able to go again another day for a different menu.If you want to go, book early and soak up the experience. Not to be missed.

Incredible experience. This was one of the highlights of our trip to Bangkok. The online booking is simple and easy to use, even allowing you to note any eating restrictions you may have. The staff coordinates with the students a central pickup/drop off location because the business/class is located within a "slum" of Bangkok and difficult to locate. The transportation van first takes the student to a local wet market for a guided tour of the market allowing students to experience the true feel of shopping in a Bangkok market. After the market, the van carries the students to Poo's business, where we enjoyed our cooking class. The class is limited to ten participants which is nice as five participants cook, then the other five cook. It's super easy and fun as Poo and her staff are super friendly and fun to work with. The food was fantastic also. We would highly recommend Cooking with Poo to anyone visiting or living in Bangkok. Part of the profits made from the cooking class also go toward helping those in the Poo's community with education and employment...just another reason to participate!

A great way to start a trip!. At just 1200 Baht (Around 20 Pounds) this is such great value for money. Essentially Poo is a local Thai who used to run a food stall not too dissimilar to the ones you see at the markets. She since began a small cooking class that has allowed her to cook with the likes of Jamie Oliver, and tour around the world. And it's easy to see why! Her food is amazing!First you meet Poo (She's named after a Thai variation of apple that sounds a lot like Cook Poo) by the Emporium Suites which are a little tricky to find with the directions, but it's close to the skytrain route so it was super easy - even for us rookie Farangs! The price of tickets includes everything, even Poo's airconned minibus that carts you all over town. Poo and her staff take you through the markets and explain all the different foods and fruits, how they taste, and how one might use them in cooking. Whilst the staff and Poo speak very good English, it was sometimes hard to understand at times but all very interesting. I loved that Poo buys the ingredients as she goes around the markets, being sure to funnel money from her success into the local markets of poorer families. The different foods and stalls are so interesting, and Poo has a story or two about most of them! One thing I would have liked is for the staff to encourage everyone to get to know each other first, because everyone stayed with the person they came with until near the end - so this might not be ideal for solo travellers. Poo introduces you to her friends, has loads of interesting stories, and even takes you to her home where you sometimes meet her family. She tells you how she first started out, and how she now makes enough to pay for a small kitchen next door which is wonderfully air conditioned! The staff are excellent, the cooking really fun and quick with three different dishes, and an awesome desert buffet. A few little touches I really loved were that Poo will wrap up your food to take home if you've already eaten. She offers merchandise at the end but makes it really clear that there is absolutely no pressure for you to buy anything. She gives you a little goody bag with the recipes you cooked to remind you when you get home. Her tour involves much needed water breaks where she buys everyone a drink. As well as buying all her ingredients from the local market, Poo pays 20% of your ticket to the Helping Hands foundation that helps give struggling Thai's a chance to work and earn money - this is done primarily through crafting souvenirs. Poo encourages you to look around the little house next door and look at some of the stuff they have made, again making it clear there is no pressure to buy. After everything, she drops you back to the emporium - it's so convenient and a great laugh - I would definitely recommend it! It was so useful knowing a bit about the fruits and foods before buying from the local markets!

Excellent Class. We really enjoyed the trip to the market and the class was terrific! Definitely book before you come to the country as the classes fill up quickly. The only suggestion I have (which I already told them) is to provide water before the market tour and not after because the market tour is very nausiating. The smells and the sights will weaken even the strongest of stomachs.
Amazing experience. We had such a great time at both the market and the cook school and learnt so much! A highlight was getting to see how many people in thai slums life. Poo is a great teacher!
Poo好老師讓我速成小廚娘. Fast learning in Thai food, what a fabulous cooking class it is!!泰國菜一學就會，非常棒的廚藝學院非常親切又巧手的好老師，不但廚藝精湛。

YUMMY. The visit to the wet market was fascinating. Poo described all the items that we would not be familiar with. Her cooking school was small but very well run and I enjoyed the way the class was presented. I have been to one other cooking class and we waited until all the food was prepared to then eat together. While eating together was nice, I was starving by the time we were done cooking. At Poo's, you cooked your own serving and then ate it. A very nice alternative. I enjoyed tasting all the exotic fruit and the way she presented the recipes in cute elephant material bags. A highlight of our trip.

Excellent Experience Cooking with Poo. Had a great time today. We visited a local market and then cooked three thai dishes, each of which I anticipate cooking in the future. Transport was to/from a convenient location right off of a BTS Skytrain stop. It was an enjoyable experience that benefits myself as well as the community in which Poo works and is very involved in.

First time we have cooked with Poo!!. Unfortunately we were 10 mins late to the pick up point so missed the minibus!! Was a bit dissappointed we did not get a call or no one answered the mobile number when we called. It was totally our fault but this meant we missed the market tour. However, when we found our way to the Poo Kitchen we had a wonderful time and cooked some great dishes. We ate what we made and it was very tasty. The set up is very informal and relaxing. Poo herself and her staff are very charismatic and gives you an instant feeling of friendship. A % of the income goes to charity to help the poor which is a nice touch. Overall a brilliant way to spend 4 hours. I also reccommend taking a brief walking tour of the area around the kitchen and you will see some genuine Thai life.

This was awesome.. A great 4 hours spent in a small group. They escort you shopping at the local markets for fresh produce to cook with, a bit of history, then back to the kitchen to prepare 3 classic Thai meals. I will be doing this again....

Authentic experience. There are many cooking classes you can enjoy in Bangkok but this one feels like it might just provide the most authentic experience, plus you know the wider community is benefitting as well. A highlight is the visit to the vast Klong Toey market where ingredients beyond exotic are available. Back on Poo's new premises you will hear her remarkable story and then each have the opportunity to prepare 3 dishes. You will amaze yourself how quick & simple it is to create something so tasty and you will take home some of your most worthwhile memories of Bangkok...and probably a signed cook book as well!

Brilliant time had!. Had read about cooking with Poo and was keen to have a cooking course during my stay so seems a natural choice. Easy to book, well run and great communication, a well organised outfit. No surprise when you finally meet Poo.Simple pick up the emporium suites which are so easy to find from the sky train as recommended by Poo. Then off to the wet market. A true assault on the senses with some amazing selection of produce on sale from bargain foodie gifts to take home to live animals about to meet their maker. Not for the faint hearted but neither is it carnage. Educational explanations of all the bizarre and wonderful items follows. Produce collected we head back to the cooking school. The small groups mean that everyone has their fair share of time and attention. Cooking the dishes was great fun and relatively simple. Don't eat breakfast as you'll be eating what you cook! Once the four course are over, the last one is the amazing fruits from Thailand, you get the opportunity to buy some merchandise. No pressure at all but they make great gifts and you are supporting a great lady in her work with the poor. Poo's energy and enthusiasm is infectious. Get your self along for a really fun 4 hours, brilliant - Bon appetit!

Great Fun. We had a great time on this trip. The market tour was a real eye opener. So many foods you've never seen before and a few you wouldn't want to see again but it was a 'real life' experience in a proper Thai working market. The cooking lesson itself was good fun. Poo and her team are very skilled cooks and were able to teach the techniques required with ease. You get to eat your food or donate it the choice is yours.

Thanks for amazing time ,Poo !. My friends and we did cooking class with Poo and we did not regret with our decision .She was super friendly and knowledgeable ,helped us know how to cook Thai food .From her experience ,we have got excellent time in Bangkok ,and tasted delicious food .Thanks for your great cooking class Poo and we are going to recommend all our friends to you if you visit Bangkok !

Thai cooking made easy. Thoroughly enjoyed my time spent with Poo and her team. Poo shared her remarkable story with us and I admire her drive and support for her community. I was surprised at how tasty, quick and easy the dishes we created turned out. First thing I did when I got back home was buy a mortar and pestle. The class was full on the day that I wanted to attend so I just emailed her in case there was a cancellation. They were most accommodating and I managed to get a spot at the last minute due to a cancellation and paid on the day.

Most Amazing Experience in Bangkok. My husband and I and our two children, aged 6 and 4 recently attended a cooking class with Poo. We spent five weeks on holiday in Thailand and I can honestly say that this experience was one of, if not our most amazing high light of our whole vacation!We were emailed with confirmation of our booking and clear instructions for our pick up at a central mall location in Bangkok. We were picked up by Poo and her friendly staff and first taken to the Klong Toey Market, where Poo and her staff gave us guided tour. The market was vibrant, selling all manner of fresh and exotic produce from bugs, frogs, eels and crabs, to mango, coconut and all the freshest tropical fruit and vegetables. Our six year old son loved every minute! Poo's English was great and she loved our kids and even bought our daughter candy-floss (cotton candy) at the market as a special treat.After the tour of the market where Poo showed us where she buys all her produce, we were driven to the Klong Toey Slum and taken to her cook school located in the slum. Her cook school kitchen is large and accommodating. It is clean, air-conditioned and completely hygienic with a western bathroom. We then spent the rest of the morning learning how to cook and then eat three different delicious Thai dishes. Poo was more than happy to have our kids there and even let them assist us as we prepared our dishes. The instructions were easy, Poos staff were fabulous and we could adjust the amount chillies/heat to our taste and so even our 4 year old daughter loved each dish!!! Poo even treated us to mango sticky rice and various tropical fruit that were all new to us.Poo explained that her cooking school is part of the Helping Hands foundation that also supports the employment and empowerment of other Klong Toey Slum residents. Absolutely inspirational!Can't recommend Cooking with Poo enough. Thanks Poo and team!!!

A really warm person can learn easy thai dishes. What a great morning! We first visit a typical thai foodmarket and after we cooked 3 meals. It was really easy to learn and also delicious! Khun Poo is a really warm person, and tells a lot of impressive stories about the slums. Amazing what this lady reached!
Best experience in Bangkok. My friend and me did a cooking class with Poo and very enjoyable every minutes here .This must be the most amazing activities after a week in Bangkok !

Une belle expérience et de belles rencontres.. I deeply recommend this beautiful experience in the heart of the true life Thaï. A stroll to the market to buy our ingredients to be cooked, the authenticity of premises, the smells, the discovery, the surprising meetings.Then we take the way to the kitchen ´s Poo in the heart of true Bankok. Simplicity, joy, and the discovery of the cooking Thai, finely easy and full of savour which we eat at the end of each realisationWe leave with the wish to do it again and to adopt this cook which please us so mutch !!!Thanks to Poo and to her for her partner for their reception and their learning.Rozenn and Françoise from Nantes - France

Great experience even if not the best cooking school. When my friend asked if I wanted to go I jumped at the chance because this is different to the myriad of cooking schools I have previously done.The market tour was far more interesting than normal, mainly because it wasn't a tick and flick exercise. On this tour you really got to spend time walking through the market and seeing more than just the ingredients needed for the recipes you were going to prepare.The experience of walking through the slums was a real eye opener.While I appreciated the air conditioned kitchen to some extent I think I would have preferred the previous kitchen for a more authentic experience.The cooking itself was very basic but it didn't clean to be anything else.For those that have been to other cooking schools the cooking experience may be a little disappointing.Having said that you do get some hints and tips that I have not previously received.The food was nice and from previous experience will be easy to replicate at home. The Pad Thai was disappointing but I think that is because on of the staff assumed I didn't want up use fish sauce and instead put soy sauce in my dish. I could really taste the soy and I think it spoilt the dish.On the day my friend was unable to join me as her son was quite unwell. We knew there were no refunds but given you can take home any food you don't eat it would have been nice if they asked if I wanted to cook her share to take it home for her. Then again I probably should have asked that question.If you have not previously been to a Thai cooking class I would definitely recommend this class because of the overall experience. If you have been to Thai cooking classes go if you want a different cooking experience but don't expect advanced cooking.Oh and don't park a car at the Emporium Suites, the parking is very expensive particularly by Bangkok standards.

YOU MUST DO THIS. Cooking with Poo was one of the best things that I have since arriving in Bangkok almost a year ago. If you are going to do a cooking course then you must choose this, if not for the charity benefits, do it to meet Poo! She is a wonderful woman and very knowledgeable about Thai food and the culture. The team picked us up exactly on time and looked after us right up until they dropped us off near our home again around 2pm. The dishes that we made were all delicious and she was very generous about everyone having as much fruit and mango sticky rice as we wanted at the end. We could take home anything we didn't eat and we all had a good go at cooking each dish. We made lemongrass salad, pad thai and massaman curry. She did not pressure us into buying any of her souvenirs and products but we all wanted to by the end. She told us funny anecdotes and stories the whole day and gave us a great tour of a proper Thai market (not for the faint hearted though!) This is for a good cause and at only 1200 THB you can't go wrong. The only thing that makes me sad is that too many Westerners will change the market and the area where she lives. For the time being, the money invested by farang's has helped a lot of people in Klong Toey especially anyone linked with Poo.

Amazing. This was an amazing experience for me and my friends to share. The market tour was educational and Poo was clear and informative whilst sharing her vast expanse of knowledge of the ingredients and history of the area's culture with us. She and her team were very patient and helpful during the actual cooking (menu 6-Saturday) and I was amazed at the lovely tasting outcome of the cooking as I am no chef! After the cooking we were offered a lovely selection of 10 different exotic fruits to taste and as much mango sticky rice (so delicious) as we could manage. All of our questions were answered by either Poo or the team and afterwards we were given beautiful bags containing the day's menu's recipes.The fact that the project has helped so many people in the area (Khlong toei) and also further afield better their quality of life also shows what a wonderful woman she is.Thank you for a wonderful day.

Great experience!. Cooking with Poo was one of the highlights of our trip! Not only did we get to learn how to make and eat a really tasty meal, we got a great tour of the market and learned about the lifestyle in Bangkok. Poo is a wonderful host!

Thank you Khun Poo. Definately the best thing to do when staying in BKK. Everyone was so friendly and they taught us so much about cooking and Thai culture. Brilliant! We had a great time. Thankyou Poo

A great day!. The opportunity to spend time with Poo and her team was a highlight of our time in Bangkok. The tour of the local market was eye opening particularly for those of us accustomed to North American supermarkets! The cooking experience with Poo gave us new ideas for old favourites and showed us how to prepare new favourites. Mango sticky rice has now become an obsession! Poo and her team are great ambassadors for all she holds true and her commitment to social responsibility is inspiring.

What a day!. Fun, informative, educational... and something that anyone can (and should) enjoy as part of their Thailand experience. From the early morning pick-up to the market and then to Klong Toey it was the best way to get a snapshot of the 'real' Bangkok, its people and culture. And then its food..! I'm no foodie, or even cook of note, but I enjoyed every moment and couldn't believe how successful the end result was. I love how Poo's initiative is serving and blessing her community, and I can't recommend the "Cooking with Poo" experience more highly!

A memoriable experience. This was great experience for my daughter and I when we visited Bangkok Thailand. We got to experience the fabulous Klong Toei Market and Poo gave us all an informative and fun experience cooking the food that we had purchased. I was impressed by the fact that she has stayed in the slum and built up her business there which greatly helps the community. Poo is a great example in how one should live. It was a first rate experience and I highly recommend it to everyone that visits Bangkok. May God bless Poo with continued success.

Fun and Imformative. Cooking with Poo was great fun and an unforgettable experience. Poo and her helpers make sure you have a great time learning about the ingredients and cooking Thai food. OK the relatively short time you spend with her won't turn you into a chef but it gives you inspiration to have a go when you get home. It's just a shame our markets at home don't sell the things the Klong Toey market does.

Superb. Cooking With Poo is a fabulous little initiative. Firstly, it's great for those who wish to gain more insight into Thai food and all the intricacies like markets and such like. Also, it's great for the area. Cooking With Poo promotes the Klong Toey area of BKK, one of the biggest slums in Asia. The fact that Poo (short for Chumpoo, meaning Rose in Thai) still houses her programme here draws great attention and economy to the area. fIf you wish, you can donate your meal to the unfortunate souls of Klong Toey, but there's no expectation. The book and apron (' I cooked with Poo and I liked it') are great investments and something my girlfriend and I, who live in BKK, use regularly for our meals.
Great class. We had great time to enjoy cooking Thai Food. It was quite amazing and unforgettable. Do not miss out this great activitiy when coming Bangkok

Wonderful experience. A friend and I went to the cooking class. The market tour was authentic and fascinating. The class itself was hands on, easy to follow and the food can be prepared again at home without a great ordeal. I would highly recommend this - it was the highlight of my time in Bangkok.

One of the Highlights of my stay in Bangkok. It was such an honor to be able to take a cooking class for typical Thai cuisine with someone that is the REAL DEAL. Teaching every single class herself, 6 days a week (sometimes even 7) Khun Poo offers her authentic knowledge of the Thai cuisine and its roots with candidness, sensibility and playfulness. It is understandable how her passion for cooking and for helping people have made such a huge impact to her community in Klong Toey. The visit began with the van getting us at the pick up location and two of her cooking staff took us to the Klong Toey market where we learned about the local produce, much of which we used and taste afterwards in the cooking class located in her small cooking school in the slum.It's such an affordable class and you are able to experience real people that aren't trying to rip off tourist but wanting to share their love for their traditional foods and proudly show them a piece of their community. MUST.NOT.MISS.THIS. Everyone was delightful, the cooking was such a fun experience in itself and it's a great plan to do with your friends, partner, older children (11 and up), or a parent. No cooking skills required!!! You will learn this easy and delightful dishes in no time.

Amazing experience...!. A great day out for residents and visitors alike. Very reasonably priced and just about the right length. The visit to the wet market is an experience in itself and is not for the feint hearted, I would not recommend it for vegetarians..... Visiting Poo's school and hearing how it has developed was great. The cooking class itself was also great with everything planned and prepared and the instruction clear and easy to follow..... Food was amazing too.... Definitely recommend...!

Authentic experience. This class is a hands-on cooking experience that educates you not only about the Thai ingredients and cooking methods but also how economic adversity in the slums of Bangkok can be turned around by a community of dedicated people. We made the most delicious chicken green curry using the fresh ingredients that we picked out in the market at the start of the morning. We made our curry from scratch using our muscles with a mortar and pestle. The mango sticky rice was heavenly. The market tour is a bit overwhelming at the beginning with the live toads, snakes, eels and bugs but it soon gets amazing with the displays of fresh fruits and veggies. I would recommend sturdy shoes as the floors are wet and slippery. There is air con in the van and the cooking school so you will be comfortable unless you mistakenly eat a chili pepper instead of the tomato. Poo and her crew are warm, friendly and engaging. Poo is going on a UK tour soon with Jamie Oliver so you can see her outside of Thailand. I have gone to several cooking classes around the world and this is right up there with the best. So much fun!

Brilliant!. We had read glowing reports about this cookery class and my husband and I were not disappointed. It was a great experience, and when we visit Bangkok again it will be on our list to do again, as you have a choice of what you learn to cook depending on the menu for each day of the week. The walk through the wet market - which is vast - was an eye-opener, and the produce was well explained by one of Poo's staff who walked with us. The class held in the Klong Toey slum area was well organised and so enjoyable - you cook, then eat what you've cooked or you can take it home with you. There is a selection of fruits for you to try afterwards as well, and time for photos too! Poo is lovely and has a wonderful personality, besides being a brilliant cook. Everything is very well organised, from being picked up in a mini-bus and returned afterwards. We bought the Poo's cookery book - there is no pressure to buy, but I would recommend a copy. You can also buy a few lovely handicrafts at a nearby house, which is helping the local community, but again no pressure to buy. Poo is coming to the UK soon, so if you have chance it would be worth trying to see her.Thank you to our daughter for organising this wonderful surprise Christmas present - and thank you, Poo, for one of the highlights of our visit to Bangkok!

If you only do 1 thing in Bangkok let it be this!!. You can do cooking schools all over Thailand but this one helps a whole community & has real heart. Not to mention that Poo is an amazing cook who shows you how simple & easy Thai cooking can be. Because of the small class size everybody gets to cook & you eat what you yourself have made. Don't miss out, but be warned the class is very popular & you will need to book at least a month in advance (probably longer in the peak months of dec & Jan)

A wonderful experience!. Cooking with Poo was one of the most enjoyable experiences during my short visit to Bangkok. Poo and her helpers were funny, friendly, and helpful, and the only downside was that the class just flew by! The food we cooked was absolutely delicious and you have the option of taking it with you (it is impossible to eat all of it on your own!) or donating it to the local community. It was wonderful to participate in a class located in the Klong Toey neighbourhood (rather than a flashy commercial kitchen), and Poo's down-to-earth nature and sense of humour made for a thoroughly enjoyable morning. Highly recommended,

Best cooking class I have been to in Thailand. I attended ini October 2013 as I live in Thailand. SO far I have done a few cooking classes in this is by far the best. A complete experience with starting in the market, having all my questions about thai vegies and cooking answered, a visit to the Klong Toey neighborhood (or slum) and meeting some great people there while also helping out the community. Poo is a great fun teacher and I felt good about supporting her to support her community.Very well organised too!

Great cooking experience and a worthwhile cause. This cooking class was the first one I took on my round the world trip, and it led me to make that the thing I do in each country. The staff were very friendly, knowledgeable and helpful, and the tour through the market was a real highlight. Poo was a delightful teacher who obviously cared a great deal about her school and her community. The food we made was delicious and so simple to cook that everyone can, and should, give it a go!

A must do when in Bangkok!. The name of this cooking school really cracked us up so we thought we would give it a go. We had a wonderful time with Poo and her team.We were led through the markets to look at the range of fresh food available everyday. Then we cooked a number of dishes that were SO delicious (sadly, the quality of some of the ingredients here in Australia just aren't as good and my attempts at replicating the dishes just don't match up). Then, we were given a range of fruits to try, which was really cool.I would definitely see Poo again if I went back to Bangkok. It's a great way to learn something new and help out a community.

A really authentic Thai experience!. I have been meaning to write this review for quite some time as I visited Bangkok in August 2013 but, better late than never, here it is.This is a MUST. Believe the reviews, book in advance if you want a place, and just do it!Apart from learning some very practical and easy-to-take home recipes, this was a great way also to step away from the tourist treadmill, contribute to a worthy cause, and see first-hand a Bangkok slum where the course takes place. The market tour before you even start cooking is alone worth the fee. Poo and her team are simply amazing and I remember the other cooks with us being a really nice and friendly group of people.I've just seen that Poo is touring the UK, so if you can't make it to Bangkok be sure to check out the website and see if there's a venue near you.One of the highlights of my amazing trip to Thailand which will be impossible to forget. Thank you!

Highlight of my Bangkok trip!. Poo is an amazing woman who cares about her family and community and helping others achieve a better life. We had a great time shopping at a local wet market where we were the only tourists - a great glimpse at real life Bangkok! We got to learn the local market goods and bought some fruit (mangosteens are delicious fruit, we regret not buying a bunch to eat later) and even stopped by a thai whiskey bar stand for shots. We then headed over to the cooking class, with 8 people total. We each got to cook all the meals and so simple it was. We made delicious papaya salad, tom yum soup, and pad thai. My pad thai was better than what i would get at the street food stalls! Poo also had mango and sticky rice ready for us for dessert and a variety of fresh fruit samples for us to try from the market. She did a great job explaining thai cooking techniques and provided copies of the recipes, however, we just bought her cookbook as there are more thai dishes we want to try out. Overall a great experience and for a positive cause!

Excellent experience. I read about Poo's cooking school online before our trip to Bangkok and loved her story and that this was a simple way to help her and her community. I'm so glad we booked with Poo rather than one of the more 'commercial' companies. The pick-up by mini van at the designated spot and trip to the market was managed perfectly. There were two guides taking us around the market buying the ingredients for our lunch and explaining anything and everything along the way. Seeing some of the 'live' produce was a bit confronting but it really gave us an insight into the real Thai way of life. Once we finally go to Poo's kitchen the hands-on cooking was simple and very satisfying. Seeing Poo's neighbours and hearing how the money gets used to help her community was made me glad our small contribution would help so many people. Definitely recommend this to anyone visiting Bangkok.

Fantastic Experience. Very enjoyable half day - we were met by two of Poo's staff and taken to one Bangkok's main markets where the ingredients for the days dishes were purchased, the market was a real eye opener in terms of both sights and smells, from there it was a short minibus ride to the Klong Toey slum where Poo runs her cooking classes. Poo welcomed us to her kitchen and explained a little of what drove her to set up the helping hands project and what the project has achieved in terms of improving the lives and prospects for residents of the slum.We then got down to cooking 4 dishes including my favourite Green curry - the kitchen was very clean and the staff and instruction excellent - it is amazing how it is possible to produce such excellent food in a very basic setting with very few ingredients - a lesson for me to take home.All in all an excellent experience - Poo is an inspirational woman who has made a phenomenal difference to the lives of many in the Klong Toey slum who would otherwise have had very limited prospects, I would recommend this experience to anybody visiting Bangkok.

A great experience. This is the first time I've been Cooking With Poo and it won't be the last. I heard about it through word of mouth from friends who also live in Bangkok. The market tour on its own would be a worthwhile trip full of evocative colours and smells. The market trip took 1.5 hours, while the actual cooking took 2.5 hours. Poo herself was entertaining and has a great story to tell about how she got to where she is and the charitable work she is able to do as a result of running her classes. The cooking itself was fun, quick and tasty. I'll be returning next week with other visitors to cook a different menu.

yummy - simple - doable. For a long time I had been wanting to do a Thai cooking class but was somehow put off by schools appearing fancy. When I heard of Poo's I knew this was worth a try. It was indeed right on target: simple but great tasting food and most of it very doable even in my normal working days. Before I loved Thai food but felt not confident to cook it. Now I have a good repertoire (using her book) and feel 'I can do this'! Also it is honoring the life and dignity of people in slums. There is true beauty in poor areas! Poo and her community are showing this clearly to their guests.Thanks Poo and friends! We are with you.

Be inspired in more ways than one!. All our visitors to Bangkok love the Cooking with Poo experience - it's great for us to be able to recommend it with such confidence. The market tour is an amazing introduction to the real Thailand. The cooking lesson is always great fun and listening to Kuhn Poo's stories of how far she and her family and employees have come, with a little help from Helping Hands, is inspirational!

Funny, inspiring and delicious visit to Poo's kitchen. After pick up we went to Klong Toey Wet Market. An exiting experience! Frogs, srimps, fish, meat, poultry, insects and much more, together with fruit and vegetables. All looking delicious and at very cheap prices. The Klong going through the market is filled with garbage and very polluted. The smell in the market is not for weak individuals!Then we went to Poo's sooking class and that was a very inspiring, funny and cosy experience, and we got a fine insight in simple Thai cooking with use of fresh raw materials and spices.It was a great morning and Khun Poo and her helpers were very sweet and informative. The food we made was quite simple dishes, but with excellent taste.Strongly recommendable to visit Poo, and the purpose with Helping Hands makes it even more important to take the opportunity to have a Unique experience in Bangkok.

Cook with Poo! You'll love it!. My sister came to visit me in Thailand, and we spent her first full day with Poo! The first hour of the morning was spent at a wet market, which was actually one of our favorite parts. Going to a wet market was so neat because we got to see where EVERYTHING is bought…(and killed) to be served fresh. Seeing the market allowed us to experience an authentic part of Thailand we otherwise would not have seen. It was great to be with a Thai person who could explain what everything was, and what certain ingredients we would be cooking with later. The whole program was well planned, thought out, and very efficient. Poo and her partner were funny, engaging, and delightful. The food we cooked was delicious. The whole experience felt very warm and personal. There were several people in the group who had very strict dietary issues, and Poo made sure that she had substitutes and alternatives for these people. It was a humbling experience to be able to cook in the slum to which our money was going, and hear how Poo got her start. I highly recommend this cooking course among others simply because your money is going to an incredible cause and a dynamic group of hardworking people.

Fantastic!. We went to Poo's cooking school while visiting friends in Bangkok. From the trip to the market to learning how to cook some great Thai dishes, we had a wonderful time. Highly recommend Cooking with Poo!

An excellent way to spend half a day in Bangkok. This was a really excellent thing to do - a very easy booking, simple reconfirmation, the pick up point was very easy to get to using sky train, and the mini bus used to take us to the market and cooking school was in great condition with a very safe driver.Our total group was quite large and we broke into a group of 6 and 5 in the market which made it easier to navigate through as well as to stay with our guide who told us what everything was and what dishes it could be used in. We were in the market for about an hour and then went to Poo's neighbourhood which was about 10-15 minutes away in the mini van. Our guide showed us the house where Poo first lived with her family, and where she started to cook, the next place she moved too (over the path) and then the kitchen and house where she now lives and works (next door to her first house!) The kitchen is simple but spacious and spotlessly clean. Poo welcomed us and explained how she started the business and the other community businesses supported by Helping Hands.Then we started cooking: we made 3 dishes including the one we wanted to learn the most, Green Curry. We couldn't believe how fast and easy everything was, Poo's style is to take out the complication and make it fun and easy. Perfect! We definitely hope to try the dishes again when we get home.If you have the chance to cook with Poo, do it. She is a wonderful inspirational woman, and she is very committed to making a positive impact on her community. Other tips:Don't eat breakfast before you go, you will have 3 decent size portions of food plus a dessert + fruit. You won't need lunch afterwards either! Book early as the class fills up fast (check the web site as they have specific menu's for each day)

Not to be missed.. What a great way to spend a morning in Bangkok. Friendly, relaxed, informative and very tasty food. Poo and her assistants were professional and helpful in every way. Book early, it's too good to miss.

Really enjoyable. We loved our cooking experience - we were a party of four - myself and my two sons and one son's partner - but despite our varied skills we all gained from the experience - we bought Poo's recipe book and have enjoyed experimenting with the different recipes there. We were full of admiration for Poo and her work in the slums and enjoyed experiencing the wet market - we will return.

So much fun in the Klong Toey Slum. Cooking With Poo was the highlight of my trip to Bangkok. The team are so friendly and fun to interact with. I really loved the taster of real Thai life- especially going to the market. The Cooking With Poo team made Thai cooking seem so easy and even the food I cooked tasted amazing- nothing short of a miracle! I'll be back when I next visit to expand my repertoire!

I highly recommend for amateur cooks. I was very lucky apparently to get the last slot of a 12 person class, the only one available during the 4 days I was in Bangkok. Everything was well organized and clearly explained from the online booking to the pick-up point, market visit, and of course the class with Poo and her assistants. It was difficult at times to hear and to understand the explanations of Poo's assistant at the market. However, she answered each question I asked as best she could. And always with a smile. The class itself is a very basic level which is understandable because of the short time available. It however gives a good idea of just how quick and easy it is to prepare delicious, authentic Thai food. If you are looking for in-depth practice, this is not the place. Or maybe Thai food doesn't require a lot of technique. Everything we made was delicious. I appreciated the dessert of exotic fruit. It enabled me to try things I had seen in markets (and some I hadn't) that I hadn't dared buy. They even had a western style birthday cake for a client whose birthday it was. Poo herself is very entertaining with an understandable level of English and lots of stories, enthusiasm and joy. She is doing a truly inspirational job of helping people in the Klong Toey slums to help themselves.

Fantastic!. Probably one of my favourite things while I stayed in Bangkok. The tour of the wet market was awesome, and the food we cooked was delicious! No processed food here, just good ol' Thai home cookin'!The area around Poo's is actually very interesting and it's nice to see a part of Bangkok you might not get to go to on your own.

Cooking with Poo. This is a fabulous way to experience Bangkok from a different perspective. You get an escorted walk through a fresh market full of the most amazing sights, sounds and smells (be prepared to get wet feet). Then on to Poo's place in Klong Toei - a part of town you may never visit on your ow - to try your hand at cooking some authentic Thai dishes; which actually look and taste as good as you expect... reassuring for those less-confident cooks amongst us. Poo is a very entertaining, gracious host and a good teacher too.

Yummy!. We had a great experience cooking with Poo! We found the class using our Lonely Planet travel book after doing an internet search that lead to inconclusive cooking classes. Not only did we get a special peak into “real” Bangkok, Thailand we learned some valuable cooking lessons. This was the highlight of Bangkok for us (we did not otherwise like the city much). It’s a good half-day of activity but worth it. I was really sad to find out when scheduling that many of the classes were already booked, luckily there were two slots open. Book early! They were on time picking us up from the hotel. The market tour was fascinating and informative. Poo’s kitchen is comfortable and intimate. Her helpers assist you and help if you have any dietary issues or just don’t like something. They helped us substitute ingredients (my BF doesn’t eat meat and I cannot do very spicy dishes). You each make your own dish and eat while the other half of the group makes theirs. Having only 8 people makes for a very intimate and fun learning experience. I purchases her cook book and cannot wait to make the dishes here in the U.S. Poo is very friendly, easy to talk to, energetic and ready for anything!

Great way to sea the market and learn how to cook some great food. we where taken around the klong toey market which was great, then where show how to cook some great food. Poo is a very nice woman. and also supports some very good charities.She also arranged a pick up from a set location.
Mrs chris Wilson. This is an amazing experience. There are no negatives for this cooking course. Going round the market is different. What a good day.

We Loved Cooking With Poo!. This was a great experience and we would do it again. It helped us to realize that we actually are capable of making Thai food at home. The only reason I gave it a 4 out of 5 rating is that I couldn't understand one of the women at all. She led my group through the market and pointed at things but I had no idea what she was saying and I'm an ELL teacher. She also taught the first round of cooking and I had to ask for someone else because I simply couldn't understand. Maybe some of the funds from this wonderful project could help the presenters work to improve their English/ accent.

An informative and fun cooking class. Cooking with Poo was one of the most enjoyable things that I have ever done in Bangkok where I have visited many times. I have always been a fan of the authentic Thai cuisine that one can find on stalls and in alleys scattered all around Bangkok. I always wanted to learn how to make some of these flavoursome, delicious dishes. Well now I can.Poo and her staff escort you around the Klong Toei market explaining the amazing sights and sounds (and smells) of a genuine local market, this is no sanitized tourist trap but a real working bustling market that feeds many thousands of people each day. The fruits and vegetables, seafood and herbs are fresh and bursting with flavour. I had never seen Galangal (one of the standard ingredients in Thai cooking) so fresh as I did at Klong Toei market. The guides are well informed and happy to help you delve into the experience and to identify the countless items that the Western eye is unaccustomed to seeing, from frogs to edible insects to the almost infinite variety of herbs and spices.After the market you are taken to Poo's basic but clean kitchen deep in the Klong Toei slum where the best cookery class that I have ever attended is provided. Poo delivers the class with an easy charm and gets to the heart of the balanced flavours of Thai cuisine. She helps grow understanding of the subtleties and techniques required to make multiple signature dishes in the one whirlwind lesson.This attraction was so good that I did it twice. I highly recommend Cooking with Poo to anyone who has an interest in Thai cooking and has a day to invest in Bangkok.

Authentic Experience. My teenage daughter and I were looking online for a cooking class to do while in Bangkok as we both love Thai food. Many were outrageously expensive and held in huge international hotels so felt like it would be similar to doing it back home. We are so glad we booked with Poo and her team. The experience started with being taken to the food market, as other reviewers have said that in itself is an experience. From the jumping bags of frogs, slithering eels and insects it made us very happy when we stopped to buy chicken for the class. It was great to see the many fresh ingredients used and have them explained to us. We then headed back to the klong to start the class. Our group was quite small and everyone got to cook and eat their own dishes. All the dishes we cooked were quick and easy to do at home. We bought Poo's book and have since had several feasts with friends and family. This is a morning tour that you should definitely book. It is a fabulous experience and it is great to know that by doing this tour your are helping the community in the klong.

Amazing sights and smells of the real Bangkok!. Cooking with Poo was an amazing experience and I would highly recommend this to anyone who wants to see how the Thai's operate the largest fresh food distribution operation in Bangkok and of course the fabulous food we cooked was an added bonus! The booking process was smooth and the website is super easy to negotiate through. You will get a confirmation email immediately and a day before our class we got a courtesy reminder email. Unfortunately traffic was hideous that morning and the lovely lady who led the tour eventually got there about 25 minutes late. We ended up walking to the market as the minivan could not get to the hotel in time. The walk was pleasant enough and we got to see Rama iv up close and personal. On the way the mini van swung right past us and picked us up so we got to the markets in style. Ok if you are not used to big, smelly, live animal markets then you might need to brace yourself and for your sanity, wear closed in shoes as they recommend. The market floor is slippery and wet, wet, wet with chicken fat and fish waste so watch your feet. The smell especially near the live chickens and ducks and the fish and pigs was not for the faint hearted. I found it simply amazing and was blown away with the freshness and quality of the products on offer. The tour operator was wonderful and showed us some incredible sights. She's a local and was super knowledgeable about the market. You can buy whatever you like at the market for yourself so don't forget your bhat so you can pick up some mangosteen or fresh lychees for yourself. Bring your camera, words cannot describe this market and the people who live and breathe this lifestyle. As I said its not for the faint of heart but its totally totally worth it. We got dropped to the edge of the Klong Toey slum where Poo has lived all her life.
