She now operates a cooking school there and started from such humble beginnings it really puts things in perspective. Poo is a superstar, she has charisma in bucketloads and her English is excellent. We cooked delicious meals, we were so full I could barely eat the sticky mango rice at the end, that was a first for me!! For me, personally, it was not about the food or cooking class, it was seeing how the real life people of the slum live and work, it was such a contrast to the glamour of the rooftop bars, five star hotels, brand polluted shopping centres and decadent massage parlours us Westerners think is Bangkok. To see how Poo has helped herself and others to make a better life for themselves has impacted me forever. I will never forget how I cooked with Poo and I loved it!

Real people, real experience. The trip to an from the class, held in one of the Bangkok slum areas, was almost as interesting as the cooking class. People from the area assist in running the classes so there is about 1 teacher per 4-5 students - this makes it really easy to get a bit of a hand. The trip through the market at the start is also a bit of an eye opener unless you are a seasoned Asian market-goer. Baskets of frogs, big fish jumping out of the buckets, lots of very unusual ingredients and produce, not to mention the stinking klong behind the stalls make this an experience. Poo also takes you to a little local handicrafts store nearby; items are made locally and are mostly inexpensive. It wasn't a pushy tourist experience so that was fine; we both bought a couple of small items.

Great experience!. Great experience, first the market with all fresh produce, then the cooking, you'll end up with some wonderful ideas to cook at home. Poo and her team are really great. Just book it!

Highlight of Bangkok for my kids. We had the vacation of a life-time in Thailand about a year ago, visiting both Bangkok and Chiang Mai over a week. One highlight that my kids still talk about spontaneously more than a year after our trip was their morning with Poo and the Helping Hands cooking school. Her tour through the market is fantastic and you see a side of Bangkok that you will not otherwise see. Poo brings a positive energy and gives you a local feel that you will otherwise miss in a fantastic city like Bangkok. The cooking is basic but fun and all are involved. Great tour. I would strongly recommend for just about anyone but certainly for families with older kids - pre-teen/teens.

Real life in Bangkok. on the day we were cooking with Poo a BBC film Team was with us (June 2012). So this was another experience being filmed when we were eating and cooking. The market was a great experience.Afterwards we cooked 3 or 4 meals. Sticky Rice with Mango was a dream. The cook book I have to recommend. I cooked several times fried Rice at home and it tastes like in Thailand.

Fun and tasty way to experience Bangkok. This is not a class for professional A-type chefs who want refine their skills, but a perfect experience for just about anyone else.You'll start by going through a real Bangkok market where local residents shop and a guide will tell you about all the fruits, meets and insects you can buy there. Then you'll try your hands at cooking a very simple but delicious meal. If interested, you can also get Poo's famous cookbook and some local handicrafts (which are surprisingly good). The more adventurous of you can also try fried grasshoppers and other local delicacies.I must say, I have little experience with cooking (and almost none when I joined the class), but even now I still make occasional Tom Yum or Pad Thai and the result turns out pretty good. Thank you Poo!

A glimpse of real Thai life. Our day Cooking with Poo was just the right way to start our time in Bangkok. We really enjoyed the local market tour and trying all sorts of fruits we had never tasted before. For the rest of our SE Asian trip we bought mangosteen everywhere we went! The class was simple and easy to follow, the group was friendly, and the local setting was great to be immersed in. It would be very easy to go to Bangkok and only visit the glitzy shopping centres and tourist spots, so I recommend this class as a way to see the other side of the city and learn about traditional cooking at the same time. Poo and all her team are lovely, happy, friendly people, and it is nice to know how much the local community benefits from their efforts. Basically it's a no-brainer - just sign up to cook with Poo, and you won't be disappointed!

Great experience you will never forget. My wife and I have visited Poo's cooking school twice in 5 years and it is something where both parties are rewarded for the experience. Wanting to do a cooking course that wasn't affiliated with a major hotel (and with the attached price tag), I read reviews about Poo's cooking school and decided to give it a go. From memory it was about $40AUD per person which was great value considering the food you get to eat, the experience and what you learn. There are a few set menu options that you preselect at the time of booking.They picked you up from a major hotel with a group of approx 10 other people and took you to the Khlong Toei food market to pick up your ingredients for your meal. This blew us away! There were live fish jumping out of their baskets onto the footpath in front of us, live frogs, skinned frogs, raw meat, fresh fruit, premade curry pastes...it was an assault on our senses in a good way and made shopping at Coles back at home seem sooo boring! You stop at a few stalls and your guide tells you about the different ingredients, what they are used for etc. It was really great having a local show us this market that we otherwise would never have gone to! There also aren't any Westerners here, so you feel like a local, although the stares from everyone else remind you that you're not! You then get taken back to the cooking school which is really one of the houses in the Khlong Toei community. It is a little small, but it is enough for your group of 10. You are provided with cold water on your arrival which is much needed after the heat of the market. Poo is such a lovely lady and when you hear her story, it is so great that she is trying to make a difference and make a future for herself and her community. Each couple is provided with a mini gas burner and each person gets the chance to make their own meal after you watch Poo how to make it. It is really professionally run....all your ingredients are brought out to you to prepare and there is always someone there to watch over you and guide you. There is always plenty of food to eat and it is really a rewarding experience! You finish by having the ability to buy some goods from Poo such as a cook book or apron (`I cooked with Poo and I liked it!), both of which we bought because we really liked them plus we were glad it was helping someone out. There is also a giftware shop next door where some locals make necklaces, really unique gift cards etc which are really cheap and make nice gifts for those at home.If I haven't sold this to you enough....just do it!

Experience Thai Culture and Cooking. From Poo, we learned to cook delicious Thai food and see the fantastic Klong Toey market. Poo is a wonderful guide and teacher. She is enthusiastic, passionate, and knowledgeable. During our tour, we purchased a Cooking with Poo cookbook. We continued to cook after returning home. It was a great experience and highly recommended. This was a highlight of our trip and a way to take a little of Bangkok home with you.

Not to be missed!!. Not to be missed!! I was pleasantly surprised and amazed! Walking through the wet market as a family and with my parents will be a treasured memory! Khun Poo answered my many questions about veggies, coconuts, etc. Anything that is alive and wiggles can be seen in the wet market...and eaten! Ending up at Khun Poo's cooking school/home we spent time learning how to scrape the green papaya to make Tom Som, stir fry the garlic chicken, chop and cut to make the Tom Kha Gai soup. Each person got to make his or her own dish. To my great surprise, my 10 year old son was ecstatic about this and cooked his own food...and even ate it! If you book all 10 slots, you can choose your own menu. The unique fruit and also sticky rice and mango as the finale was awesome. The price is well worth what you get...plus you're contributing to the community. I even bought shirts for the kids for Christmas, apron, and cookbook (which I use often). I am glad I talked my husband in to go going, too! It really is a great family outing and experience...especially a must for visitors. Perhaps what I appreciated the most is that Khun Poo and her staff never made us feel pressured in any way. I felt genuinely fulfilled and appreciated their enthusiasm, and positive outlook. They truly are making a difference.

Well organised, clever and good fun for the whole family.. From pick up to drop off the team work like a well oiled machine. The tour of the market was an unexpected highlight. Lots of weird stuff like frogs, pig heads and wriggly creeping crawly things to keep kids entertained. The cooking class itself was fun, informative and I came away with three new dishes and some chopping techniques under my belt. This is probably one of the best ways of experiencing the "real" bangkok - not to be missed.

a day of visual experience and fun!. This was a fantastic experience walking through the food market with our guides and seeing firsthand where the food is distributed from for Bangkok shops and restaurants. The range of foods is extensive and we loved the spices and fresh herbs which are so numerous.Then to cook with these same fresh foods was a personal adventure and fun.Poo and her team are very friendly and great at assisting us and demonstrating the dishes that we cooked and prepared. You get to eat the food as well.The slum is organised and very suitable for the culturally timid. You will be pleased after you have been on this excursion as your knowledge of Thai food and culture will be enriched. This is a well organised tour.

Best cooking classes. I would thoroughly recommend Cooking with Poo, she is great (along with the other staff), the food is delicious and it's an initiative that was set up in order to help the local community. It's not fancy but is a real hands on experience which also includes a trip to the local market to see where the locals shop.I've done this course many times as I live here and always take out visitors who love it.

wonderful place. cooking with poo really is a great experiance. first you start with a visit to the market- there was no rush and we had enough time to buy some spices and other gifts for friends at home. then we headed off to get started with cooking and i couldnt ask for a better place to learn how to cook original thai food. we had a lot of fun talking to the other tourists and the staff- they were very friendly and helpful- it really was a great day!

Amazing. Simply amazing! A beautiful experience that I would recommend to all the tourists (and expats) coming (or living) in Bangkok!If you want to know something more about the spicy & delicious Thai cuisine and discover the authentic Thai market and people, you cannot miss this opportunity!I have a beautiful remind and any time I give a look at the recipes book I bought there, I smell and taste and see in my mind what I experienced those day.

Great authentic Thai experience. It took me several attempts to book a slot on Poo's thai cooking course, such is its popularity. I was glad that I persevered and finally managed to attend a half day course before my holiday ended. This is a super tourist exeperience with hands on opportunity to cook three fairly simple Thai dishes. You dont need to be a proficient cook and as a male you certainly wont feel initmidated even if you are not used to the kitchen / cooking. The wet market experience to start the day was a novelty in itself. Overall a great thing to do in Bangkok and gives the added benefit of helping the local disadvantaged community

Fantastic experience. I did a one day cooking course with Khun Poo and it was an amazing experience. The pick up service was very well organised and on time. The market tour simply grandiose. I am sure I would not have done the market tour by myself (I did not see too many tourist walking around there). Khun Poo is a great cook and teacher coupled with a very friendly personality. The cooking course itself was fun too. I even have bought the cookbook - dishes are simply explained. I can highly recommend the course! It's definitely worth the money.

Our experiences tour: Cooking with Poo. Excellent tour. Poo is such a wonderful person who has come so far and helped sooooo many people along her amazing journey. This is not a tour but a first hand view of life in the poorer districts of Bangkok and the courage and dedication these people display. The food was amazing and the recipes amaging - so make sure you have a little bit of money left over to buy Poo's cook book. Very easy to cook these amazing meals - no experience necessary!

Fantastic!!. This was recommended to me by a friend and we were not disappointed! It's more than just a cooking class (although the cooking part was great and the food DELICIOUS!) the whole experience is a really lovely trip into a part of Bangkok most tourists wouldn't see. Shopping in the market is an amazing, fun and interesting experience and all of the helpers that work with Poo are lovely and helpful. Really fantastic-I would recommend it to everyone!

A whole new cooking experience. Cooking with Poo takes your trip to Bangkok to a whole new level.Having a guided tour of the wet markets, with excellent explanation of some very strange produce, is an experience in itself. Whilst we were at the market Poo bought the produce for our morning of cooking! Then onto the slum area where we were to cook, this was fantastic, everyone was so friendly and happy to greet us in English, apparently they enjoy trying out their English on tourists. I never would have ventured to the slum area and am so glad that this was where we were cooking as it opened up my eyes to this way of life. The cooking classes were amazingly easy, and absolutely delicious. My girlfriend and I did 3 different days so that we got to do 3 different menus, and could have done more. The only good thing about going home was being able to test my new Thai cooking skills on my family..they were delighted.

Absolutely wonderful way to spend half a day. My wife and I did the morning cooking class with Poo and her helpers and we were so glad that we picked this cooking class. The tour of the market was an experience in itself let alone the delicious food that we got to cook and eat. Not only is Poo a fantastic teacher she is a wonderful human being. The way she is helping others gain confidence and work their way out of poverty is an absolute inspiration. I took the time to sit and listen to some of her stories and could have done so for hours. So all in all, great food, great company and great people.

SuperPoo. Very enjoyable day and often talk and share experience with friends. Great mix of seeing the market and part of the "real" side of Thailand then followed by great cooking clash where the hands on was just perfect. Got to see and experience, learn something and even better my cooking tasted good. The whole team were very professional, helpful, really keen to show and share their experiences. Great morning without the commercial push. The logistics of getting us to and from was also easy and well organised. Even got the book. Recommended

The highlight of my holiday!. Can't recommend this experience enough. It's so much more than just an amazing cooking class. Having Poo walk us through the markets, meeting some of the wonderful people that the cooking classes are helping and coming away with recipes I have regularly used since make this experience something I have recommended to everyone I know heading Bangkok. It shouldn't be missed!

Great learning, great experience. It was a feast for the senses going with Poo to the Thai markets to see fresh produce, and have her explain a lot of the items that you read about in Thai cook books but have no idea what you are looking at.The cooking school is very intimate and ideal for some traditional Thai cooking. Poo's enthusiasm with her able assistants made it a cinch to cook up great food. The challenge for me though was to remember exactly how we did it when I got home. A great opportunity.

A great experience. We really enjoyed this day with Poo. The walk around the market was really interesting (and smelly) and we came away feeling we knew a little bit more about Asian food, which is useful given that we now live in Singapore. The cooking part was fun and made everything seem so easy. We bought the cookbook and have tried a few dishes at home which are all easy to follow and delicious. I thoroughly recommend this experience as an opportunity to see the real Bangkok and give a bit back.

Fantastic!. Had a great time learning to cook with Poo. The tour of the markets was amazing, something I would have probably got lost doing on my own. Khun Poo is a great cook and teacher - my friends love my Thai cooking, and I'll be going back next time too!

GREAT EXPERIENCE. We go to Thailand every year with a team to teach English etc. 10 of us went to Klong Toey and from the start, everything was organised so well. the pick up in the van, the girls who walked us through the markets and the experience of that part of Bangkok, and the fun time we spent cooking 3 delicious meals and some sticky rice and mango to finish off. Poo is a great person, fun and helps make Thai cooking so easy. definitely will be going next time we go. the cook book and aprons that we bought have been popular. Loaned the cook book to my son and haven't got it back! will need to re-order I think. a must if you are staying in Bangkok.

Cooking with Poo - a "real" Thailand experience. I have cooked with Poo twice now, each time was so different. Im an expat living in Bangkok and I always recommend my visitors to try this, not just the cooking but walking around the Klong Toey market and the slums shows a side to Bangkok that you wouldn't normally see.Take a bag for the market - lots of goodies to buy ;)

Cooking with Poo-unforgettable!. Loved the entire experience with Poo, walking through the market and purchasing our ingredients had to be the highlight though. It was wonderful experiencing Thailand with a local!

Experience Real Thailand While Benefitting the Local Community!. If you want to get out of the shopping mall maze in Bangkok and take in a different side of life in the city, let Poo and her dedicated tour guides pick you up and take you through their own neighborhood. I did it twice in 2012. Once with my mom and once with my two girlfriends who were also 24.They'll walk your though the busiest market in all of Bangkok, Klong Toei. It's the absolute lifeblood of the city. Everything is fresh off the boat from early that morning. We picked up ingredients for our meal and learned about some of the strange ingredients that are household essentials for the Thai people. You can pick the brains of the young tour guides about their own lives, or ask them to translate for you while to ask about vendors about how to eat the exotic fruits you are buying. Poo then piles everyone back in the van and her husband drives us to their neighborhood where their kitchen is. This neighborhood is a giant beautiful slum. Bright bits of laundry flap in the breeze above our heads as we move down a narrow walkway to her modest, intimate kitchen. Inside, the gang has burners and cutting boards ready to go for us. There, we cook and eat, cook and eat, through three courses. The green curry and pad thai are as fantastic and the mango and sticky rice for dessert. It's all storytelling, cooking and chowing down. Poo will tell you about how the neighborhood has changed and what role her cooking school has played in the community. It's inspiring, to say the least.

Meet the real heart of Bangkok hospitality!. I have taken this class a couple of times and recommend it to anyone who is visiting Bangkok. Poo, Noi and the team are awesome. It is fun - a great learning experience and the most important aspect for me is that it gives you an insight into the life and people of Bangkok - that you WILL NOT get any other way.A MUST Do in Bangkok.

You don't have to be a cook to have a go!. I went on a one week trip to Bangkok last year and was taken to "Cooking with Poo" by my sister who lived in BKK at the time. I am not one to do cooking lessons either while travelling (or at home) but this was an awesome experience. The trip through the markets was just great with some fantastic photo opportunities and expert commentary. However the cooking was the best part, being expertly instructed by Khun Poo. Highly recommend you buy the cook book as I now have certain Thai dishes as standard meals in my house (especially Gai Ga Team, Larb, and Sticky Rice!). Can't recommend this highly enough. Give it a go!

Cooking With Poo is a Great Way to Start Your Bangkok Trip. I have never been to a cooking class, but have always enjoyed Thai food and this sounded very unique...We did the cooking school on our first day in Bangkok. We learned to take the train to our meeting spot so we became train-wise and that helped us throughout our trip.Poo not only showed us how to cook Thai food, but also how to go to the fresh markets and get the best ingredients -- We spent our first hour on a shopping trip and even had Thai Whiskey (optional at your own cost and risk)....Poo then showed us how to cook great Thai food and also educate us on secrets of Thai cooking.She and her staff were very upbeat and very knowledgeable and everyone was involved --- all of us students had plenty of help in preparing some very good Thai food.Do yourself a favor, and do HER class -- don't do the normal ones -- go to Poo's class and she will make you happy you did.
Delight, Delish, Do Again!. Cooking with Poo is a cultural experience you should include in your plans! Culturally I nsightful, educational & yummy rolled into one wonderful event.

Wonderful Time!. We cooked with Poo to celebrate my Father's birthday in Bangkok. The class was great and the trip to the market was an amazing experience. Poo is wonderful and the food we made was delicious. We highly recommend this class!

Great day out and wonderful food. Poo is a lovely host and a great teacher. I would encourage anyone to go on this lovely trip. Experiencing the smells of the market and the tastes of green curry was one of my favourite things in Bangkok. Poo's social enterprise is built on people enjoying new things and also puts a lot of effort into supporting the community around her business at the same time. If you are keen to do some yummy Thai cooking you won't regret going on this fun day out!

Awesome!. I've been here twice and I would go again for sure. The marked walk is so interesting and the food you make with Poo is easy to replicate at home. This is a wonderful experience that supports a really good cause.

Absolutely incredible. Cooking with poo was a fantastic experience. The selflessness of the organisation to help the community is heart lifting. The organisation of the day long adventure is perfect, with the tour of the market first to get an in site on how the distribution of fresh produce is handled, to the first hand cooking and tasting experience of authentic Thai cuisine is a treat gorgeous the senses. I cannot recommend this adventure highly enough for all ages of travelers.

Touching! Because of authenticity (Echtheit) of people and places.. It is living BKK - impressiv market and "slum" - no tourist-getto.Places you don't see as a "normal" tourist. And Poo and her crew are so kind, powerfull and competent. And everyone cooks his own plate - it's a good concept. And it's a tasty, colourfull and tasty experience. With big smiles! And at home: I cook Poo-Thai-style. I love it. Try it. It is touching and helps so many Thai-people. :-) Ueli Furrer, Switzerland

Wonderful tastes!. Cooking with Poo-course was really nice experience to get to know the thai kitchen. The market was memorable experience but what I really liked was that cooking itself was organized very well, the team had made some preparations so we didn't have to start from a scratch, and we had chance and time to prepare multiple dishes. I warmly recommend

Your cooking will never be the same again!. We visited early in 2013 and enjoyed every moment (even looking at the live beetles and eels in the market!). The whole event was skilfully and quietly organised to pack a wealth of rich experiences into the one morning, with delicious flavours and lots of laughter. Poo and her team are doing an excellent job of creating income amid such poverty, yet it's such good value when compared with other similar courses. And now we can't stop cooking her recipes for the family.

I cooked with Poo and I liked it!!. When traveling in Bangkok, my friends and I knew we wanted to take an authentic cooking class and relied on trip advisor reviews to choose this one. We were not disappointed! I can't say enough good things about my experience with Cooking with Poo. I appreciate that they picked us up at an easy to locate hotel. You get to purchase some of the food yourself and an authentic market (some sights and sounds are rough on the stomach but, hey, that’s Bangkok!) Then they take us to the cooking school which shows you a completely different side of the city. I loved the people we met and the food we cooked was delicious. Plus, if you aren’t familiar with Poo’s story, purchase her cook book and read up- believe me, the money you spend is going to a good cause. We loved the food so much that when we returned home to the states we had our friends over and made 3 more recipes out of the cookbook- they were all delicious. Thank you Poo for a wonderful last day in Bangkok.

Who KNEW I wanted to cook with POO?. This was a fantastic experience. My two girlfriends and I booked a tour with Poo while in Bankok and it ended up being our favorite experience while there. For those of you looking for a cooking tour, this exceeds those needs due to the amazing food you cook, the fun experience of shopping in the market and preparing together as a group, and the great cookbook you can purchase at the end. I've been gone from Thailand for months but still use that cookbook. It was a great experience.In addition to being a cooking tour, it's a great cultural experience to see parts of Bangkok that you wouldn't necessarily happen along on your own (referred to by Poo as the "slum"). The people you'll meet are warm, authentic, and you are contributing to a great cause along the way!

Cooking with Poo. My daughter and I attended one of Khun Poo's classes - and enjoyed every minute. Although the initial trip through the market could be a little alarming to some, it was fun and informative. The cooking class was excellent, teaching classic Thai dishes using some of the ingredients we had shopped for - thankfully not the live frogs! An experience not to be missed, this is real Thai cooking in a very real Thai environment. Excellent!

A great experience and a highlight of our time in Bangkok!. My son and I spent the day with Poo last March and we had a wonderful day. Beginning with the trip to the market which was fascinating. We had a lot of learning how to cook Pad Thai and it is now a meal we often make for the family at home in cold Canada. We also incorporate many of the spiced and techniques we learned about from Poo. She is a wonderful and friendly person as is her staff who were accommodating for my son who wanted to try some different spices. We would highly recommend spending a day there and would certainly go back if we were ever in Bangkok again. It was a great day!

One of the highlights of my trip to Bangkok. I visited bangkok for a week this past fall and was advised to go to a cooking class with Poo. I am so glad that I went, it was one of the highlights of my trip! I loved seeing the market and getting to cook 3 dishes. I really got a sense of what goes into Thai cooking. I also bought her cookbook, one for me and one for my mom. I also met the most interesting people at the cooking class- I'm american, and there was a couple from London, a french guy who had just spent a year traveling the world, other americans as well- it was quite the international bunch! I would recommend this to anyone who wants to get a more authentic feel of what Bangkok is really like, beyond the common cultural and tourist sites. And its a must for foodies!

A really worthwhile experience. The Cooking With Poo cooking class seemed to get it just right. It was not dumbed down, but was accessible to all skill levels. I liked that it was in an actual neighborhood, and I loved our walk through the markets. Poo also went out of her way to make our experience good. For example, when I asked about a preserved egg I saw at the market, she unhesitatingly bought it and let us try it. She seemed really interested in teaching us about unfamiliar foods. I would definitely recommend it.

Exciting day with Poo. A friend of me and l have a very fine day, walking in the foodmarked with a guide,it was amazing marked.When we walk to Poo`s kitchen,we watching how poor people are living in Bangkok. Poo is a great cook and it was fun to learn how to make some thai-food and taste it.A day we always will remember.

Don't visit Bangkok without cooking with Poo. A fantastic cooking course! If you're interested in learning how to cook authentic Thai food, or if you just want the chance to have fun, meet people and see a different side of Bangkok then I can't recommend this enough.

Cooking with Pool. Best activity I have done in Bangkok!! Even though I am a Bangkok resident, I had not ventured down to the Klong Toey market. It was great to go with Poo and her staff who were very informative about the various foods on display and how to use them. Not sure I will be trying some of them though!! The cooking was great fun and the dishes were simple to prepare. You can either eat the dishes as you cook them or bag them up to take home. If you are a resident or tourist in the city, I would recommend Cooking with Poo and have been several times now with various visitors who have all thoroughly enjoyed the experience.

Yeah not bad at all.. I get a bit fed up with all the "oh my god" hyperbole you tend to get with TA. Not sure I'd go so far as to say it was the best day of my holiday or that I had some sort of life changing epiphany as some have suggested, but overall we had a nice day with some nice hosts, we learned how to cook some of our Thai favourites, and would recommend cooking with poo if you're looking for classes in Bangkok.

A fabulous authentic experience. I have done this wonderful cooking course twice as I enjoyed it so much. The market shopping is fabulous but the highlight is cooking with Khun Poo in her kitchen. She is an inspirational women who is not only a wonderful cook but a fabulous entrepreneur who has built a business in very impoverished surroundings and in the process created employment for herself, family and friends. I would highly recommend this cooking course to visitors coming to Bangkok.

Most complete and unique cooking class I've had. The name says it all, and once you get picket up in the morning and dropped off at Klong Toei Market, you realize that this is going to be a very different experience from anything else that you have done in the past, when it comes to cooking. A class with Poo is a unique opportunity not only to learn how to cook great Thai dishes, but also an excellent way to immerse yourself into the true lives of local people and their culture, something that you cannot learn by walking around palaces and temples. Out of all the cooking classes that I took around the country, I certainly recommend Poo's as the best! Don't think twice.

Best Cultural Experience in Bangkok. I spent ten weeks in Thailand and Laos and had many cultural encounters. Cooking With Poo remains at the top of the list. I was able to visit a local market and was educated throughout the tour about all of the foods that I would not have recognized otherwise.The cooking class was excellent as it was very professional and could have been filmed for distribution without any editing! The ingredients were prepared in advance, recipes were handed out and the presentation was very well done. The most encouraging part was that the funds were put back into the community to help the residents rise above their marginalized status. Well done!

Cooking with heart. I couldn't recommend Poo's Cooking School enough. I went in late 2011 and had to come back two years later because I was SO impressed with the recipes I learnt, Poo's friendliness and the quality of the tour and cooking lesson that I had to show more friends this incredible part of Bangkok. Not only are the recipes easy, delicious and made with local, fresh produce but the cooking school is a wonderful social enterprise which is lifting people in the Klong Toei slum out of poverty. Poo has such a big heart for her community and for cooking, it's infectious! Thank you Poo!This is a MUST for anyone visiting Bangkok.

Fabulous Experience. My friend and I had the best morning and will never forget our Cooking with Poo experience.The whole experience was faultless, from booking on the internet, to the transfers, the visit to the local market and best of all the cooking class. We chose this class because it was based in the community and not a high end cooking school. The food was fantastic and plenty of it. You won't go home hungry. I would definately recommend this cooking class to anyone and would definately visit again if I am ever back in BKK

Best thing to do in Bangkok. Khun Poo is an inspiration. Visiting her cooking school in the Khlong Toey Slum of Bangkok is a unique glimpse in to the life and community of Khlong Toey. We were collected from Emporium Suites (BTS Prom Phong) and taken to the market to buy produce for the lesson. Not your ordinary market and quite a unique experience in itself. Then on to the cooking school to learn how to make some delicious Thai food. Buy the book, it is a great memento of the experience. She also sells aprons "I cooked with Poo and I liked it"!! By far one of the best things you can do in Bangkok.

Amazing discovery of klong toey area and fabulous cooking experience. Poo is an amazing hostess who shared her story with us. We first went through the klong toey market which has a wide variety of ingredients coming from all over Thailand. Some were really overwhelming for our western standards! We then cooked 3 delicious dishes with Poo and her team. A worthwhile visit:)

I had the best day with Poo!. I am a 24 year old grad student that completed a term in Bangkok. While there I wanted to take a cooking course. I found Cooking with Poo and knew that I had to go because it was doing such great things for its community. A classmate and I took some time to do this and had the best day! Walking through the market and picking ingredients (actually knowing what was in the food!) was a great experience. Poo I very helpful and everyone's dishes came out perfectly. She also helps you adjust your preferences and gives recipes out at the end!

An absolute must for anyone in bangkok!!!. We were so lucky to get on this course due to it's increasing popularity!! Not only are Poo, the team and everyone associated with this wonderful project lovely people, the cooking was simple and delicious, the market was fascinating and it all goes to a great cause. If you can get on it, do it, but I think it will become more and more popular as word gets around!!

Highly recommended!. I thoroughly enjoyed my experience with Poo in August of 2012, from taking a walk through the extensive market, to learning more about the area of the slums we were in, to cooking great food, to being able to support a local who is attempting to create a better life for herself and those around her. We were able to try different things such as deep-fried grasshoppers, and understand more about the Thai culture and cooking. It was a lovely morning and I would do it again in a heartbeat! Plus, I have a fun apron now ("I cooked with Poo and I liked it!")

Highlight of our trip to Thailand. We had the opportunity to attend this cooking class with my sister in law who lives in Thailand. Walking through the Klong toei market was quite a cacophony of sights, sounds, and smells! The cooking class was fun and food was delicious. We use our "Cooking with Poo" cookbook all the time back in Florida. I love that this a fun activity but also a ministry to help sustain lives of people in the Klong toei area

An authentic and fun cooking class!. Three of my friends and I took part in Cooking with Poo while we were on holiday in Thailand. Poo's class came highly recommended from my Aunty who had been herself a few times. We loved every minute of this morning, from walking the market stalls to pick our fresh produce to learning how to cook Thai-style and of course, eating our creations!!! I HIGHLY recommend Cooking with Poo if you're in Bangkok. An amazing experience to share with friends!

Book in early so you don't miss out on this cultural cooking experience. You know that feeling when you are doing your favorite hobby and you completely loose track of time? That is what Cooking with Poo was like for my husband and I. We enjoyed the cultural experience of the wet market (vegetarians and animal lovers may struggle to see all the live chickens, frogs and ells for sale), but it is well worth a look to appreciate the different living conditions of many Thai people. I was amazed at how intimate the cooking class was and loved how they split our small group in two so I could cook and then eat repeatedly.I loved Po's inspiring back story of how she and the people in the slums came up with this cooking class in response to financial hardship and unemployment.Afterwards there is an opportunity to view crafts that were made in the slums. I brought a lovely necklace from the craft stall that I get many compliments on today.Do yourself a favour and Cook with Poo - you won't regret it.

The best experience that I have ever had in Thailand. Today I spend 4 hours with Poo & her friends, we toured the markets & was explained the various Thai fruit, Vegetables, meats & other delights (Bugs, frogs etc). We then arrived at the cooking school where we had a hands on experience of cooking & tasting 3 Thai dishes.The Green Curry Chicken was outstanding and was the best I have ever had. (Even though I cooked it).I thoroughly recommend anybody experiences this class. First class experience.The work of Helping Hands in the Bangkok slums is brilliant.Rob

Wonderful Poo. On a Bangkok ferry, a local woman said 'don't miss cooking with Poo'. She encouraged every one of her guests to cook with Poo, and did the same for us. And, it turned out that the timing was perfect. The one day to spare between arriving back in Bangkok and flying out was a Monday - our preferred menu. Starting with a market tour, that I wish we had had prior to to our 8 weeks in Asia rather than the last day, we learned about fruit, sticky rice, shrimp while wandering the bowels of the slum area stalls. Dogs lay under the meat counters, the vendors were all business and barely took notice of us, and we muddled through following our enthusiastic guides. By the time we got to Poo we were ready to cook and to eat. Pad Thai, sticky rice and mango, Tom Yum Goong, green papaya salad, all fabulous. The only disappointment was that the much loved 'I cooked with Poo and I liked it' aprons were sold out. I can still taste the green papaya salad when I close my eyes and picture Poo's kitchen.

Fantastic. I went to Khun Poo's cooking class with my partner Jonathan Copeland. I've owned Murni's Warung, a restaurant in Ubud, Bali, for 40 years - in fact it's our anniversary next month - and I've been to many cooking classes in Thailand and around the World. Let me tell you that this is one of the best, not just for the quality of the recipes, but also for the warmth and expertise of Khun Poo and her staff, and for the interest. Klong Toei is a wonderful market, where you will start the class by going on a tour of it, and the slum where Khun Poo teaches is extremely interesting to see and a place that you probably would not otherwise see. The arrangements all worked like clockwork.Jonathan was so impressed that he wrote about Khun Poo in his ebook The Bangkok Story and hopefully it will help Khun Poo in her career. Both of us recommend Khun Poo's cooking class and as soon as we are back in Bangkok in a couple of months we will go again - and again - and again.Murni

Wonderful cooking and cultural experience. I went to Khun Poo's cooking class with my husband and brother. I was so impressed with how organized the whole adventure was. From the beginning, we were met by Khun Poo and her helper and had a chance to chat with the other attendees as we drove to the market. The market was such a cool experience. It had some of everything, and lots of things I had never seen before. After the market, we headed back to Poo's neighborhood to begin cooking. The cooking setup was fantastic. Very basic, clean, and with everything we needed. The food we created was delicious and I love how we go tot take the recipes home with us. Don't miss one of Poo's cooking classes when you visit Bangkok. Book well in advance and have a great time!

Wonderful time with Poo's Cooking School. I took my college god-daugher visiting Bangkok to Khun Poo's Cooking School last year. It was very, very interesting. Poo was a very humorous chef. The morning started with a tour of a local market. My god-daughter was very intrigued, clicking her camera away, to see all the strange creatures from tad pols to roasted silk worms. Khun Poo painstakingly explained each section of fresh food as to the origin and how people eat them. Then we went to her one-room kitchen in one end of the community, and began our 2-hour cooking class. She gave us the menus and even food choices that morning. Along the way, we tasted as we finished each dish. Everyone had a chance to try our hands on the wok and stir-fry. People were delighted at how the spices and sauces and ingredients worked perfectly together to produce the dishes they ate. My god-daughter thought it was the best adventure in town! We had a great time and would recommend this to anyone coming into Bangkok.

Unforgetable Poo. It has been more than a year since we experienced the local Thai market and the wonderful experience of Poo's cooking class, but the memory seems to stand out more and more among numerous activities in the month we spent in Thailand. The market was incredibly memorable as seeing all the varieties of fish, frogs, eels, and other critters came a bit unexpectedly. We then picked up fresh ingredients to return to the kitchen and cook with. All the dishes were simple, made easily, and have been able to be re-created now that we are home. The people couldn't be friendlier. We also love the setting - a home in a poorer community where Poo helps her neighbors - as opposed to a generic kitchen in a high-end restaurant. Definitely a good value. p.s. Don't underestimate the fun of saying "We cooked with Poo in Thailand" when at dinner parties. That alone would make this worth a few extra bucks.

A real Thai experience. I have taken several visitors to "Cooking with Poo" over the years, aged from 14 to 64. Everyone loves the exposure to the market, trying different fruits, and the simplicity of the meals cooked. Khun Poo has also printed a recipe book giving traditional Thai recipes in easy to follow English translations. If you are wondering what to do next Bangkok trip, make sure this is on your list.

Must do in Bangkok!. My boyfriend and I did this cooking class last year while travelling around SE Asia and it was FANTASTIC! Such an incredibly insight into the market, slum, homes as lifestyles of the Thai people that you wouldn't recieve without doing the class!Class itself is very interactive, good delicious and always fun. The best part is knowing that your money is going to a good cause - and actually seeing where it goes!Def book in advance and absolutely do the course!

Fantastic Cooking and Culture Experience in Bangkok!. This was an experience my college age daughter and I will never forget. Starting with purchasing our ingredients at the local market, preparing a great meal with Poo, seeing the neighborhood crafts and getting the opportunty to experience Bangkok in a way that most tourists can't - - this was an experience I would do over and over. Poo and all of her associates were kind, engaging, knowledgeable and added energy every step along the way and I would recommend this to any and all who visit Bangkok!!

A Unique Cooking Experience. My husband and I were looking for something different to do during our two day stopover in Bangkok and we decided to do this due to all of the glowing tripadvisor reviews - and we were glad to did. The markets were quite an experience and some of the smells were a bit rough on the nose (especially first thing in the morning) but it was a great opportunity to see the 'true' Bangkok. To be honest we were expecting the slums (where the cooking course takes place) to be more confronting than what they were. There were hardly any residents around (as they were all at work) and it looked quite tidy and relatively clean. Poo's place itself is really nice.The dishes we cooked were remarkably simple and quick, especially considering how delicious they were. We also brought the cookbook and can't wait to try out these recipes at home (especially the massaman curry from scratch!). The mango sticky rice we had as dessert was just divine - I'm a convert now and was eating it every chance I got during our time in Asia. And of course the best thing of all was that this is all for a good cause! I hope this doesn't lose it's authenticity as it grows in popularity.

Cooking for change. I'd been to other cooking days but those were organised around the idea of learning from a master chef. This is no less educational in terms of cooking, but right now is one of those experiences that will no doubt change as Poos media profile sky rockets. The day is about more than food, it's about changing the quality of life and opportunity in the slums. We took 3 young kids with us, all of whom loved the experience and the staffs willingness to help but not over help them as chefs.It's well worth a trip, even if you elect to watch and not cook at all. The trip to the market was a great experience. Well organised and drama free. Get in now!

cooking with poo. What a fantastic morning! My entire family went to cook with poo today and we loved every minute of it. The kids lovedit too as it wasn't too difficult for them What a great project and great food and people. I highly recommend it to everyone!

Most authentic and enjoyable cooking school. The trip through the market can be shocking for some. The frogs and fried cockroaches…but for me, it made it truly authentic and we were able to see the real Bangkok market. When taken through, we were taught about the different vegetables, how the wonderful sticky rice is made, about the spices, etc. I'm so happy we did this at the beginning of a long trip because we understood what we were eating so much better. And it helped with the culture. The classes themselves are in a very basic place and that was so much better because it was also authentic. Poo is an excellent cook and I learned so much. This class also helps the people in need around Bangkok. It's not only a great, fun class, but it helps the community. I can't recommend this enough.

Great experience on a more local level. On my recent stay in Bangkok I was fortunate enough to visit cooking with Poo, along with my friend. We really enjoyed getting some local tip on some of our favourite Thai dishes. The market tour was also a nice part of the experience. I found it more enjoyable than some of the other tourist tours in Thailand, maybe because of the smaller groups, and Poo herself was a fun host, and very easy to understand whilst being entertaining. I recommend the trip to people who have seen the main attractions and are looking for something a bit different, yet an authentic window on Thai Culture.
Great!. Cooking with Poo has been one of the highlights of my stay. Not only is the visit to the market entertaining and the cooking class exciting/delicious, but Helping Hands is a great cause.

Excellent experience. Last November i Visited with my girl friend.They provide a excellent service.They were so collaborate and helpful. They also provide a fresh meal to me and their servicing department was so careful.They also have a expert tour guild.

A lot of fun!. This is a great tour. The trip through the market is fun and for those who haven't been to a wet market in Asia is an eye-opening experience; even for those who have, it's a tremendous market and very large. Ample warning is given as to what to expect. The group sizes are small enough that you get a full explanation of the various things on offer.The class was tremendous fun and you get to make your own meals, so can customize spice etc to taste. Poo is really cool, speaks excellent English, gives clear directions and has a great sense of humor. Her assistants were very helpful too. The recipes are very easy to follow and pretty much anyone can do this.You make a lot of yummy food here, so go hungry: you will be eating a lot!

Great for beginners. I loved this tour! The class size is excellent, and Poo had an additional guide with us at the market so we could travel in smaller groups (5 to a group) and hear all the information about the market. Luckily, Poo had the foresight to put a little warning card in the van on the way to the market advising us that some of the sights might be disconcerting to those unaccustomed to shopping anywhere but the supermarket. Walking through the market was a bit of a culture shock; live animals, dead animals, pungent smells, and more. Be sure to wear closed toed shoes! The market, once you get over the initial shock of it, is very interesting and has every possible food item available. The class itself was excellent. I have taken classes in the the US at Sur La Table, and this class was comparable, if not better. Each person makes their own meal, so you can make it as spicy/sweet/salty as you want. I went with a friend, and the rotating cooking turns worked out great so we could take pictures, eat our food, etc. while the other was cooking.Poo was very friendly, very talkative, and, contrary to some of the reviews I have read, had an excellent grasp of English and was easy to understand. All of her assistants were helpful as well. It was especially interesting to hear her story about how she developed her cooking school, and how she has remained in the slum to help give back to the area. Dont eat breakfast that morning though, because you make a ton of food and will want to eat all of it! After the meal there is dessert and assorted fruits as well. Make sure to bring some Baht with you too, as there are fun souvenirs and cookbooks available at the end of class.

Fantastic Experience!. I Cooked with Poo and loved it! Really enjoyed the market in the morning, seeing the variety of fruits, veg, meat and fish on offer was amazing! The cooking class was with 9 others. Really well run by Poo and her team, who are really friendly and fun. Its not the most advanced menu but it tasted great. Really impressed by Poo and her team, her story is amazing! Really glad to be supporting a really worthy cause.

A behind the scenes view of Bangkok. My husband and I cooked with Poo and her staff and we loved it. Poo and her team do an outstanding job to help you understand how to put a Thai dish together successfully. When you join the cooking class you get to see a snapshot of the local community which is real and not exploited in any way. The whole tour feels more like an adventure which culminates in some fabulous cooking. We loved the wet market tour and yes, like all local markets across SE Asia, the sights and smells can be an assault on the senses but that's the point of an adventure. If you want to get into the real local community and learn how to make a few key Thai dishes while contributing to the local community, then this tour is for you. Poo is very well known and she has retained her wonderful charm and fun personality. Her team of helpers are fabulous. We highly recommend cooking with Poo for travellers seeking an adventure from their cooking school. We suggest you take a few extra dollars along as their are some wonderful goodies to purchase at the end of the course. Congratulations to Poo for starting up this fantastic project.

Learn to cook Thai. This was an excellent experience. We were taken to a market and saw an amazing variety of fruits, vegetables, fish and more. The cooking class was very well prepared and the dishes were simple but very tasty. I would highly recommend this activity for anyone visiting Bangkok, it was the highlight of my visit.

Highlight of my visit to Bangkok. I enjoyed my cooking with Poo class so much and would recommend it to everyone visiting Bangkok as a must cultural experience. The trip is very well organised and you feel so looked after.I loved the trip around the market before heading to Poo's cooking school for the class. I learnt so much and am now excited to try the recipes from her book myself!Thank you Poo and Noi for a great morning!

I cooked with Poo and loved it!. The visit and tour around the market was an eye opener and not for the weak stomached or the vegetarians. Live frogs and beasties valour and the smell of chickens is yuk. The fruit selection on the other hand was amazing and we got to try a good selection of these fruits at the cooking experience. After the tour came the best bit. Demonstration then cooking the dishes ourselves and then getting to eat it. There is different menus each day so chose your day according to your taste. The kitchen was very clean and air-conditioned you would never believe you were in a poor area. The whole experience was brilliant even the smelly bit. I would thoroughly recommend it. Poo and her staff were amazing and I am looking forward to practising my menus on my return home to Scotland.

a good day out. my hubby attended a cooking class with Poo and enjoyed it very much. the trip to the wet market and being in an area of bangkok rarely seen by westerners was an eyeopener. he ate bugs and cooked 3 courses from food bought at the market. The work Poo does is vital and being a part of her great idea to raise cash and teach people authentic thai foods was most satisfying. If u want to try something different and help her be a healer in her community give it a go!

OMG Love Poo. This was such a great cooking class. The wet market before hand was a bit much but it is always good to see how other cultures do things and if people get food from the wet market than I'm glad I got to see it. Poo wasn't our tour guide in the market but the lady that was did a great job explaining all the different meat, veggies, fruits etc to us. She answered all our questions and allowed us to buy some of the items if we wanted. We did the cooking class on a Monday so you can look up the items we made. Everything was very good and this was my first time eating Thai food. I also loved the fact that the money I spent went back to help the people in the slums.
A must do whilst in Bangkok. Poo and the team are so delightful! So generous with their stories and culture...and the food is delicious! A must do whilst in Bangkok

Very nice cooking classes . I was attracted by the premise of a business that was there to help the neighbourhood. I was surprised by the warmth of the people there and quality of knowledge. You are first taken in the market where a nice overview of different food is made. You can ask questions and they'll answer it very correctly. Then they bring you to the kitchen class. It's a practical class as you would expect. Poo gives you history about her neighbourhood and how her business / our money helps people and how people are happy with it. It's a different kind of approach to your usual cooking class. Then dessert as fruit tasting. Perfect. I liked it a lot. I would however like to have a deeper background on spices and curry.

good experience, good staff and good food in Bangkok. Poo is great and obviously so much thought has gone into everything. They really care. The ingredients appeared to be very good quality too. At the end you try a range of exotic fruits, simply delicious and of course the most amazing mango sticky rice (now my favourite dessert)

A MUST while in Bangkok. We participated in a cooking class recently and had a great time! Poo and her staff are friendly, funny, and we were so happy to spend a morning with them. The market tour is a great touch to the class so you can experience the community culture and pick up ingredients for the class. The class gets you away from the Bangkok shopping mall experience and you see the difference one woman has made in her community. Poo and her staff made cooking the menu very simple and took the time to explain and answer questions. The food was delicious and we were happy to bring new knowledge home with us. I would recommend Cooking with Poo for anyone visiting Bangkok.

Enlightening, entertaining and tasty. I'm not surprised at the reviews on "Cooking With Poo", it is well deserved.Poo is funny, warm and really create the atmosphere of the class. We were picked up by minivan and taken to buy ingredients. It was fantastic to get a guided tour of the markets to see and smell the ingredients that locals buy (make sure you don't wear your favourite shoes). You are then driven back to her neighbourhood and kitchen, right in the heart of the Klong Toey slums.Sample some simple and easy Thai food that you make in turns and listen to stories about the community, her upbringing and foray into teaching Thai cooking classes. It was intimate, fun and a great time to spend with friends. I normally hate souvenirs, but I did end up getting an apron emblazoned with the cheeky "I cooked with Poo and I liked it".A highly recommended experience, easy to follow even if you are no chef.

Fantastic!. Our experience with 'Cooking with Poo' was fantastic and I can't think of a bad thing to say about it! If you are looking for a Thai Cooking class with a difference and which directly puts back into the community this is the one. Perfect time frame, great staff, very informative and educational, great facilities, great everything and wonderful food! Thanks to Poo and her team, we loved it!

Great Cooking Experience. This is a must when visiting Bangkok. Poo is an amazing woman who is doing so much to help her family and community. We were collected by bus from a pre-arranged meeting place. It had been pouring with rain but this did not stop the tour from going to the wet markets and cooking. They had trouble with water in the main cooking area so 10 of us were in the smaller cooking space. This was handled amazingly well. There were 5 people cooking and then they ate this course and the other 5 cooked. It worked really well as we all watch what the others were doing and Poo and her staff made it feel like we were in a private kitchen having a meal with friends! The instruction is fantastic. The food is great. This is a fantastic tour and highly recommended for anyone (including children)!!!

Single Traveller with Time to kill. I had heard great things about this course from some local friends and when I had a morning free to myself before friends came down to BKK I booked straight away. I wasnt disappointed, the highlight for me was the trip thru the local market which made this more of a tour of BKK than a hard core cooking experience, which was what I was after.. but we got to eat all we bought and the cooking was delicious.. highly recommend for single or small group

Fun, inspiring, informative.. Really enjoyed "cooking with Poo". Tour was well organised and well run. Guided tour through market interesting & informative. Cooking was really interesting & inspiring .. Bangkok style street food.. that I have cooked again since I've returned home. I love the idea of the "helping hands" project & highly recommend this.

The greatest morning of the trip!. My mom and I could not have had a better experience! We have never felt so much love from people we just met. Poo and her team are so phenomenal and full of light. The entire day was perfect- from the market tour to the cooking class. The cooking class was set up in a way that gives you confidence to be able to replicate all the dishes at home (just ask my roommates). We bought copies of Poo's book to give to all our friends and cannot wait to return to Poo's kitchen on our next trip to Bangkok! Go! Go! Go! You will not regret it.

Loved every minute. Fantastic! Great experience from booking online right through to buying the book at the end of class.The trip round the market was great, being an expat here I will definitely be back to do my shopping! The class was great fun, we loved the location too. If you're looking for an in depth Thai cooking master class then this isn't for you. This is a super fun day our where you learn tasty but very easy recipes. Absolutely perfect for people who love food but are lazy cooks (like me!) The whole day was so well organised, Poo is great and obviously so much thought has gone into everything. They really care. The ingredients appeared to be very good quality too. At the end you try a range of exotic fruits, simply delicious and of course the most amazing mango sticky rice (now my favourite dessert). I think the cost of the day is fair and all for a good cause. Booking is so easy too, great website and easy to understand. And once you have booked all necessary information is emailed to you, couldn't be easier so go and do it!

Best thing I did in Bangkok!. Cooking with Poo was a brilliant experience. Touring the local markets was a fascinating experience and I learnt to cook an amazing selection of Thai food. There was plenty to eat along the way (it made my day to get so much mango and sticky rice...) and the whole experience was unforgettable. Poo herself has a really inspiring story and it was a real privilege to take the class in her community in Klong Toey. The staff are all very helpful and there was a really nice mix of people taking the class which made it a fun and sociable experience.

A must do for all ages!. A fantastic opportunity to leave the tourist trail and learn some new cooking skills at the same time. The tour through Klong Toey market is informative and interesting, lots of photo opportunities too. The cooking class is great fun and easy to follow for even the most reluctant cook! My hubby and teenage son were soon enthusiastically chopping and stir-frying! Poo and her helpers take time to help everyone and explain everything. Even the confident cooks came away with some tips and ideas to make things easier in the kitchen. A great opportunity to take home lasting memories and recipes.

I would recommend this to anyone!. Our experience Cooking with Poo was fantastic and I cant think of a bad thing to say about it! If you are looking for a Thai Cooking class with a difference and which directly puts back into the community this is the one. Perfect time frame, great staff, very informative and educational, great facilities, great everything and wonderful food! Thanks to Poo and her team, we loved it!

Amazing experience. My partner booked the course on recommendation from a friend in Bangkok. It was the only part of our Thailand experience we booked ahead and it was our treat for the final day of the holiday. An excellent choice. The pick up was easy to find and went smoothly. The market was incredible - not for the faint hearted. It's a real live food market and some of the sights were a bit different to the British, Australian and Dutch markets we were used to. The staff led us round explaining all the different ingredients, so knowledgable and passionate about food and cooking. The school in the slum is really well prepared. The team work so well together, you arrive and all ingredients are ready and you cook three amazing dishes. Poo was great. She talked very lovingly about the slum and about the people and the positive impact the school and helping hands had. She talked us through the recipes and answered all our questions. She was very warm and funny. We had a great time, picked up a couple of new techniques got the free recipes to try back home and bought a few souvenirs. It was great fun, with the market and the slum location, it was also a very unique experience of Bangkok, a perfect way to finish our holiday and great to be putting money into such a great project. Well done Poo and your team.

Inspiring. We have just returned from our cooking class this morning feeling humble and inspired, and not just for Thai cooking.We started out at the markets being shown ingredients for all sorts of dishes. The markets were eye opening, things eaten every day in Bangkok we wouldn't see in a lifetime in Australia, many still swimming, wriggling, clucking or any number of other things. Some may find it a little confronting, but I found it fascinating. The Helping Hands team were extremely friendly and helpful it was wonderful seeing the way the cooking class has made a connection with the businesses in the markets.We went to the Helping Hands class for our honeymoon and Khun Poo taught us 3 dishes and then gave us a desert of mango and sticky rice. I won't go into the detail of the dishes, but it was amazing the flavours that can be produced relatively easily with some basic ingredients. Khun Poo and her team made me realise how easy it is to cook with fresh ingredients.What Helping Hands is doing for the local community is really amazing. The success of the cooking class has a flow on effect into other local businesses and it is quite inspiring.That aside, the cooking class was great, finding the pick-up point was easy via the BTS and the ride to the markets and then the cooking class was very comfortable.I thoroughly recommend this class for the learning and the overall experience.We cooked with Poo and we liked it!

An absolute must. The trip to the market is a delight for all your senses. It's so busy, colourful and so many aromas. Poo is very animated and passionate about her home so you'll learn and see so much here. The cooking is in a special kitchen in her home. It's so simple to make, yet really tasty. I just wish I'd done this trip earlier than my last day so I could have discovered mango sticky rice sooner!Advice: the classes book up well in advance so don't leave it last minute.

A fantastic family experience.. We have just spent the morning cooking with Khun Poo and her lovely, friendly team. We started by exploring the wet market - wear covered shoes if possible and take your camera. We have been living in Bangkok for almost a year but there were still so many fruits and vegetables in the markets that we hadn't tried and wouldn't have known what to do with if we had! The market trip was fascinating and will inspire us to be a bit more adventurous in our food shopping now. (Might still give the insects a miss though.) We had a great time learning to cook Thai dishes and were very impressed with our own cooking! Our teenagers loved it - though if you have wimpy kids like ours, ask for a little less spice in their Green Curry. Two of our children have a nut allergy and Poo adapted the menu for them and was very sensitive to their needs. Afterwards, we walked a little way along the soi to look at handicrafts made locally. An opportunity to pick up presents/souvenirs and support the people living in the Klong Toey slums. A great experience all round and a chance to see more of the real Bangkok.

Really enjoyable and different Bangkok experience. We really enjoyed the trip to the market and cooking session with Poo and her staff. She's a lovely admirable lady, who has achieved a lot for her community and I think the fee for the half day experience is really worth it, as it's quite small for most Europeans but makes a big difference for the Thais. The trip to the market can be a bit tough for the squeamish, but as we're used to this type of dead animal display we didn't mind, took some great photos and enjoyed the explanations about the fruit and different vegetables on offer. The cooking class which was on a Saturday comprise of some of our favourite Thai dishes, Mussaman curry, which was the best we've ever had, and also Mango sticky rice as dessert, again the best we have tried up to this day. Overall I would greatly recommend to everyone who is looking to spend half a day away from sightseeing and do something different (and help out the local community in the process).

Really enjoyable and different Bangkok experience. We really enjoyed the trip to the market and cooking session with Poo and her staff. She's a lovely admirable lady, who has achieved a lot for her community and I think the fee for the half day experience is really worth it, as it's quite small for most Europeans but makes a big difference for the Thais. The trip to the market can be a bit tough for the squeamish, but as we're used to this type of dead animal display we didn't mind, took some great photos and enjoyed the explanations about the fruit and different vegetables on offer. The cooking class which was on a Saturday comprise of some of our favourite Thai dishes, Mussaman curry, which was the best we've ever had, and also Mango sticky rice as dessert, again the best we have tried up to this day. Overall I would greatly recommend to everyone who is looking to spend half a day away from sightseeing and do something different (and help out the local community in the process).

Cooking with Poo. The cooking class today was excellent! The staff was very informative and spoke English very well. The meeting place at the Emporium was easy to find and it was great to see that a coffee shop was available upstairs while we waited since we had not had a chance for breakfast this morning. I especially liked that we could eat our dishes as we cooked them. I also enjoyed tasting the various fruits since I was too intimidated to try them on my own at the street markets. I am excited to try some of the recipes from the cookbook which was reasonable priced. The kitchen and bathroom were kept very clean and the space was very comfortable with plenty of cooking/sitting/eating room for all 10 of us. Khun Poo is such a passionate person and it was our pleasure to have met her. This is a definite must-do for couples, friends, and families with older children (at least 10+) while visiting Bangkok for anyone who loves cooking or even just eating.

Fun & great experience while supporting a good cause. This is not the usual cooking class runs in a hotel or restaurant or commercial kitchen. The session runs at a house in one of the small lanes in Klong Toey. From the booking until the end of the lesson, everything was organised well. Booking and payment was done online. The instructions and tips provided on the email on how to get to the meeting point and what to wear were useful.The class started with the journey to the traditional market at Klong Toey, it was a great experience, particularly with the first part, visiting the Issan people market which sells a lot of things which are not our usual staple ;-) Khun Poo and her assistant Noi brought few samples for us to try later on. For my session, we learnt Thai Lemongrass salad, Stuffed Omelette and Massaman Curry. As many have said, the instructions given by Khun Poo and Noi was quite clear despite language. It is easy to understand their English. Every dish that we learnt to make was for us to taste and eat ;-) For those who will be taking this lesson, mind you, come with empty stomach as there are plenty to eat. The whole experience was fun and enjoyable. Khun Poo also shared with us the story on how the cooking school started, how this school has benefitted many others and transformed their lives in Klong Toey (the infamous slum area). I highly recommend for those who want to learn how to cook Thai food to start with this class. Khun Poo and her team do make it easy ;-)Another tip is to book this class in advance (few weeks or a month prior). As I left it until I reached Thailand, we could only book one person in our group to go for the lesson and I was the fortunate one to go.

A must do for all visiting Bangkok. My husband and I are first time visitors to Bangkok. He planned the Helping Hands: Coooking with Poo experience, I am not much of a cook and didn't know what to expect. Poo's husband picked us up from the Emporium Suites with 2 of her staff, we drove to the Klong Toey fresh markets which was such an amazing unforgettable experience. All of the live animals, beautiful fruits, cooking implements and so much more, one of the staff explained all of the different produce - what it was used for, the Thai and English names, she was very informative, she assisted fellow tourists with purchases from the stalls. We then continued our journey to the slums, where Poo and her family lives. I was unsure what to expect and it was an eye opening experience walking along the narrow paths to the cooking school, all of the local people and children were very friendly. The cooking lesson was great for me as a beginner Poo and her staff answered any questions I had. My husband an avid cook was also impressed by Poo and her knowledge of the cuisine. We were inspired by her story and achievements, we hope to here more from her in the future and are sure she will do more great things. We cooked three dishes stir fry noodles with black bean sauce, Thai green curry (which we helped make the curry paste), and beef with cashew nuts all of which were delicious. She gave us the recipes to make again at home, we finished off the cooking experience with mango sticky rice and fruit tasting a great opportunity to try new fruits I wouldn't have considered trying myself. We purchased 3 copies of her cookbook to give to family in Australia. A definate highlight of our trip to Bangkok, we would recommend to all visiting

The market visit is a highlight. The morning with Poo and her team was one of the best experiences we had in Bangkok. The instructions to the meeting point were clear and the place easy to get to. It was great to have been shown around the Klong Toey wet market - I loved Poo's animated commentary - but it's not for very sensitive people, I guess, and it pays to wear something else than flip flops or sandals. What a range of food - animal, vegetable, mineral, dead, alive, wet, dry - and anything in between! A cooking class without a visit to the market would be only half the fun.The kitchen in Klong Toey 'slum' is simple but tidy. The menu is pretty basic, which suited us because we had no real experience with cooking Thai food. If you want to explore the finer points of Thai cuisine then perhaps another school or a longer class may be more suitable. Nevertheless, the food was delicious and there was plenty of it.The only comment I would make is that it would be nice to have some suggestions how to substitute some of the ingredients, both at the class and in the cook book, which we'll probably struggle to find in the smaller town we shop in.The best thing about this place is the story behind it, of course. Poo comes across as very genuine and truly committed to her cause. The whole team are really hard workers and can be an inspiration to anybody to raise above their own 'glass ceilings'.I'm looking forward to visiting the cafe they are about to open near the market to give young people opportunities to learn employment skills.

Best experience in bangkok. Thank you for a fantastic day, it was the best experience we had in bangkok :) the staff were friendly and Poo is inspirational. The food was fantastic and easy to make with the assistance of the team. The small class sizes made it easy to meet new people.

Great Learning Experience and Food. I try to take a cooking class whenever I travel and was excited to learn some Thai recipes. A little bit about the class: “Cooking with Poo” classes take place six days a week and, cost between $30 and $40 depending on the season, and last approximately four hours, from 8:30 a.m. to 12:30 p.m. They include roundtrip transportation from the Emporium Suites hotel in Bankok to Klong Toey slum (one of the city’s largest slums, located about 20 minutes away), a local wet market tour, hands-on instruction and consumption of three entrees, written recipes in English, and a delicious Thai dessert/fruit tasting. Highlights:* Tour of Klong Toey Fresh Market is unforgettable – it is HUGE and between the live animals, beautiful tropical fruit, and all of the market activity, it’s a feast for your eyes! * Classes are 100% hands-on, and after each course, students enjoy their dish = immediate satisfaction :)* Students experience another area of Bangkok that they might not otherwise explore and Poo’s story of hardship and entrepreneurship are truly inspiring Words of Advice:* It's very hot in Bangkok and since the kitchen where you're preparing dishes is rather cozy, it gets hot! So be prepared to sweat. * Be patient with tour guides and with Poo - they tend to speak quickly so if you need something repeated, speak up!* Take extra cash just in case you want to purchase one of Poo's cookbooks, an apron, or some of the handmade crafts sold next door as part of Helping Hands (a fair-trade initiative that supports micro-businesses within the slum)

What a great experience. Last weekend I did the Saturday cooking class with K. Poo and it was great. I've done a couple of other cooking classes but this one was different. K. Poo was great with all of us and her class, although 10 of us, was managed well. She kept us entertained and taught us some tricks of her trade. It was also great to know that she gives back to her community and to be part of helping others have an opportunity. I would highly recommend this course to anyone interested in Thai food and giving back to the community.

Brilliant experience slightly let down by poor english. It was a great experience to see the wet market with so many different products on offer. The food we cooked was also super tasty and we were barely able to finish it all. However, it was very hard to understand the lady who took us round the market so we actually didn't get that many information about the food sold there. This didn't affect the overall experience too much as there is so much to see and discover by yourself anyway. Poo herself then does the actual cooking class and is much better to understand.Overall great experience and a good alternative to plain sightseeing.

a must-do in Bangkok. I loved the morning spent with Poo and her staff. Firstly, the tour of Klong Toei Market was brilliant.
