All the herbs, meat, fish, fruit and vegetables and the nice and not so nice smells! The size of the market is unbelievable and the staff were knowledgeable about the market and it's products. After the tour the journey took us to Klong Toei slum, where poo lives, and where the kitchen is based for her cooking school. My idea of a slum is shanty towns but the area wasn't what I had in mind. OK, the people were clearly poorer than other areas of Bangkok and the closeness of the houses was a real eye-opener. The people we met along the way were all so friendly.The cooking part of the day was not what you would call a 'lesson'. Poo was simply showing how to make and blend certain ingredients in order to create important Thai cuisine. All of the food of course was delicious and by the end of the fruit tasting and sticky rice with mango, I was stuffed!I bought one of the books from Poo and some of the girls bought some hand-made jewelry in the neighboring shop, which is also run by Poo. What she has done to help the area (she has so many stories) is incredible and she is clearly proud of what she has achieved for herself and the residents of the slum. I recommend this to everyone visiting Bangkok!

Much more than just a cooking class.... Poo picked us up in the morning and drove with us to a very local wet market. We have seen many wet markets in Asia before but this one is definitely worth a visit. Poo explained a lot and even let us try tried insects etc. After touring the wet market she took us to her cooking school in Klong Toei slum. She showed us around, even her own house where it all started and we met her neighbours. The cooking class itself was great. Even our kids loved it and prepared their first thai meal! We highly recommend this class to everyone visiting Bangkok.

the very best day out in Bangkok. This was the highlight of my 2 weeks in Bangkok. We were picked up in a minbus at the Emporium Suites and driven (very safely) to the big food markets.Our guides showed us around the market and explained the ununual fruits and vegetables.The range of fresh spices and herbs was amazing.We then were taken into the slum area for our cooking class with Poo ( Thai for love apple).This slum would be the tidiest and most organised I've seen, residents are house proud (nothing like India).The cooking class was very well organised and a lot of fun. Poo has a grear and entertaining personality and has a great support team.The food is really easy to cook and you get to eat it!There is no pressure to buy her cookbook but we all did as it is well designed and proceeds go to help the local community.This lady (Poo) is a legend in her area. Please also go next door to the tiny shop where a lady sells gift items. The handmade jewelry is of a very high standard when you look closely at the workmanship. We were returned to the Emporium in the minibus. This outing is a must do when in Bangkok. I can't recommend it more highly.

see the real Bangkok. I would recommend this class so much more than the other classes offered in hotels. This class shows you the uncensored Bangkok and its Klong Toei slum, the markets (may cause some people to be squeamish but it was very fun for me), and the cooking was fun and simple. Poo and her team are energetic and passionate about cooking. It warmed my heart and humbled me deeply to learn about Poo's past and all the projects she is involved in to help her neighbours in Klong Toei. I bought the cookbook as well because I enjoyed the class so much! This is definitely a very real/raw experience, and will make you fall in love with Klong Toei and its people. The class was very organized (prompt pick up time, and transport to market, transport back to pick up point at the end of class.)

A social enterprise cooking school. We have some friends who live in the Klong Toei slum to share life and advocate for the people who live there. When we asked for their suggestions of what to do in Bangkok, they said "Cook with Poo!!!" Poo is a woman who lives in the slum and formerly cooked food and sold it in front of her house all day every day - often for less than $10. Some of these advocates worked with Poo to empower her to teach cooking to visitors... she worked hard on her english, started teaching classes with a couple of people each day. Now Poo has a best-selling cookbook, teaches 10 people per day, heads a restaurant and catering service, and employs dozens in the slum. It's an awesome story of using one person's gifts and passion to transform a community. Oh, and she's an awesome cooking teacher who will walk you through how to make simple, authentic Thai dishes. And the tour of the Klong Toei market is an unforgettable experience. I highly recommend cooking with Poo - sign up with confidence that you'll experience an amazing cooking class and market experience, while supporting a remarkable community development project!

Cooking with Poo. I loved this experience. The day started with a tour of the 'wet market' where Poo and her helpers gave an introduction to the wonders available at the Bangkok markets. This was eye opening and really interesting. She then took us to her humble school in the middle of the Klong Toey slum. It was eye-opening but totally safe. The actual cooking lessons were easy and fun and we have use the simple recipies since returning home. Ahain, 'Poo's' assistants were fun and helpful. Everything was clean and hygenic. After the 2 hour class we went next door and bought some of the Klong-Toe handicrafts made as a job creation scheme by women in the slum. They then drove us back to the hotel. Literally we will never forget this wonderful experience and can thoroughly recommend it.

Soul Food. There's been much written about these cooking classes and the good reputation is deserved. The tours are well run and there is no hassle involved even if you are a bit nervous about joining. After collection by the bus; your group will be led through the Klong Toei fresh market to learn about and select produce. It's a bit more lively than a trip round the supermarket: hot, assaulting to the senses and totally captivating. You will then be taken to the kitchen to prepare and then eat your menu. The staff are just perfection and really take care of you. Before you go, find out about how this tour started and the story of Poo; it will really add to your experience. The short time you spend walking from market to the kitchen will give you a real insight into life of the people in this area. By taking this tour, you are supporting hard-working people dedicated to improving their community. Good for the soul!

A must do!. This was a fantastic experience, both the cooking and the market tour. I learned not only some valuable hints and tips that will help my cooking but also about the community that Poo lives in. The tour was well run, the facilities spotless and Poo and her team were so friendly and enthusiastic. I will be recommending this to all my friends and visitors as a must do!

Fantastic way to experience Bangkok. We went based on the TA reviews and also an interest to visit Klong Toey and experience a different side of Bangkok. From top to bottom this is an incredibly well-run tour and cooking class, and we would highly recommend it for anyone visiting Bangkok! I might recommend this for couples or even-numbered groups, since you'll be split into pairs. However, each person gets a chance to cook each dish, and there's plenty of food for all. Our menu included stir-fried morning glory, shrimp curry, spicy beef salad, and mango and sticky rice (the best I've ever had and it's not even close). Khun Poo is there for the duration but also has several staff members assisting with the cooking (and they lead the market tour). One note: Beware that the market tour can be messy (wear shoes!) and, for lack of a better term, graphic, with all kinds of animals on display, dead, alive, butchered, fermented, everything (I elected not to post those photos...). But that's part of the experience - enjoy it, learn something, and support this terrific enterprise by buying an apron or cookbook as a memento!

Second visit, second time GREAT time!. Second time cooking with Poo and it was simply GREAT again:-))) It was very nice(+heartwarming) that staff and Poo recognised me too...I love(d) the market tour+all the known&unknown delights there (I was there two times before but there is always something you dont know/have not seen)! The workshop is always fun and very well prepared+the food so yummy&fresh, my friend I took with me has never cooked Thai before and she was impressed how easy it is to have a tasty Thai dish!!! keep up the good work+happy spirit and good luck with all projects!I love the part that I could ask Poo some questions I had about cooking, I had purchased her book during my previous visit (like which part of the lemongrass to use,etc). Good to know:if you can not finish your food they will pack it for you in a small plastic bag for take-away, as its made by you, so its best eaten by you too:-)Btw it is very handy that the cooking school has different menus from Monday through Saturday like this one can go more than one time and there is always something to learn!!!

Fabulous Morning!. Where to start?! We had a fabulous morning with Khun Poo and her amazing team of helpers. We were collected and taken to the Klong Toey market, which was eye opening to walk through - I avoided the 9am shot of whiskey but my two companions happily indulged! I found the market quite overwhelming as there was so much to take in - I would like to do the tour again as I would have many more questions. Then the cooking was amazing too - I actually can't believe how easy it was to make such great food. I was too full to eat my pad thai but they packed it up to take home with me. Apparently Jamie Oliver is coming over shortly to meet and cook with Poo! A great tour!

Cooking with Poo. We had a great time, first visiting the market and afterwards the cooking with the bought ingredients.An experience you should consider if you like to have a cooking class and support the less fortunate.

so much more than a cookery class. Our morning with Poo and her wonderful team was not only a fabulous culinary experience but a true insight to life beyond the tourist vista. It was a priviledge to share Poo's vision of making a difference through her cookery classes and the other small businesses that she has built with people from the largest slum area in Bangkok. The visit to the wet market was insightful, the cooking well organised, the recipes delicious and realistic. But most infectious was the warmth and passion of Poo's class. I went to learn to cook Thai food and came away with so much more, I have never written a review on trip advisor before but just wanted to add my praise to that of many others, you are an angel Poo!

Helping Hands and Chef LeeZ Comparison. I attended two cooking classes in Bangkok (Helping Hands with Poo, and Chef LeeZ) and so will write a single review that discusses both. I will then rate each class separately under their respective headings. I found Helping Hands particularly insightful because of the location, the (so-called) Klong Toey slum, and also because it combined a visit to Bangkok's largest wet market to purchase fresh ingredients for the class. Many, myself included, are sure to find elements of the market disturbing. There will be areas you'll need to hurry through if you don't want to see live animals, including turtles and frogs, slaughtered. That said it is possible to avoid the more grisly sights, and the market is unquestionably a hyper-sensory experience; a vast array of colors, smells and just about every ingredient imagineable is available there somewhere. And the idea of the slum location shouldn't be off-putting; it was fascinating to walk along the narrow pathways, and to see first-hand how the majority of Bangkok's citizens live on a daily basis. The area was both safe and clean, and the class room on a par with Chef LeeZ's. In terms of the class itself, I would say Chef Lee might have been a slightly more thorough teacher than Poo. Her instruction was more detailed, and various aspects of the preparation and cooking process explained in greater depth. If you are in Bangkok long enough, or have the time and resources to attend more than one class, I recommend both. If your interest is soley on learning how to prepare classic thai dishes, Chef LeeZ may be the better option. If you want to combine an educational experience with basic thai cooking instruction, Helping Hands and Poo might hold more interest. The story, and history of Helping Hands is also gratifying, and something that Poo shares during the course of the class. I should also point out that Chef LeeZ also features a brief visit to a small local market. The recommended instructions for getting to Chef Lee are by boat, so if you don't have a separate river excursion planned, this also adds to the experience. The boat isn't necessary however, and we actually took a taxi back to our Ratchaprasong area hotel (much quicker than the boat option). I thoroughly enjoyed, and highly recommend both classes.

Amazing experience amazing lady. This is the best!!! Real Bangkok with all the sights and smells in the market (good and bad but you are here to see Thailand right?) You get to cook and eat fantastic food and the bonus is you are helping Poo and her wonderful team to share their amazing vision with the most deserving of people. Go and enjoy knowing that you are also helping others. They just opened a wonderful cafe too to give confidence, skills and opportunities for young people from the slums. Munjai Cafe - great coffee and food :-)

Great Experience. Visiting the wet market was an interesting thing, although some people might not like seeing that. Anyway, that's just the way it is in Thailand!The cooking itself was very much prepared, so you basically only had to fry the food (the ingredients were mostly all prepared) but that was okay. You actually find out that Thai cooking is quite easy and fast, and if you buy the Cookbook you do have all you need to prepare delicious Thai dishes.

Cooking with Poo!. We were met promptly and taken to the market by minibus. This market is where many of the Bangkok hotels and restaurants buy their fresh meat, veg, fruit and…frogs.The sights, colours, noise and smells of the market were quite an experience. If you’re of a nervous disposition it might not be your thing, but hey, even if your staying at a 5-star hotel likelihood is the ingredients for your supper came from here.As we were in a group of 4 it was easy to ask questions and find out all about the produce, much of it very different to what we are used to in the UK.On to the cooking school, which is located in a Bangkok slum. We were a little apprehensive but no need to be, we felt very safe and the cooking school was spotless. Poo is an excellent teacher and I can see why Jamie Oliver is doing some filming with her shortly. We cooked 3 dishes each and munched as we went. We will cook these dishes at home. We enjoyed the experience and it’s great news that the cooking school now provides work for 30 people in the slum.In short, do it, a great half-day experience!

Interesting Cultural Experience. An interesting experience - a combination of a cooking class where each participant (maximum 10 per session) gets to cook their own food after Poo demonstrates the dishes. The morning starts with a visit to a local market, where local 'delicacies' are sold, followed by a short trip to where Poo's kitchen is. Besides the cooking experience, it was an interesting cultural experience to see how the people of Klong Toei live.Poo and her colleagues were very friendly and made the morning enjoyable.
Amazing!. Cooking with Poo is a must do in Bangkok. The trip to Khlong Toei market is great. Poo and her team are very friendly and make the cooking class so enjoyable.

Cooking with Poo. Such a stark difference meeting Poo at Emporium, such an exclusive part of Bangkok to only a few minutes away Klong Toey Wet Market and Slum.. This is real Thailand, the extremity that makes Bangkok as amazing as it is..The market you need to be strong.. It is a real market not a tourist attraction, (it has animals, insects and meat there, I found that bit a tiny bit uncomfortable but respect that this is the way it is here,) wet slippery, amazing array of smells from ewww to whoa, sounds, sights and wonderful smiling faces. Amazing place and a little disappointed that I sometimes found it a little hard to hear Noi who conducted our half of the tour group. This was of no ones fault, just circumstance and so if it came to the point I couldn't hear, I took in other things that were around me anyway.From the market to Poo's kitchen.. Poo still lives in the slum, which is extremely clean and not quite what you would expect.. But hey of course these are people too, there maybe not a lot of money in their lives, but that is not to say there is no pride! The cooking is a bonus. Poo is a wonderful teacher, helped along by Noi. Entertaining and 100% hands on. Knowing that the money from this experience goes directly to Helping Hands Foundation the community that you are actually within is heart warming, knowing that the kids in the community will learn skills that will enable them to gain worthy employment and perhaps break a cycle.Food was amazing, new friends from all over the world made within the tour group and a lot of laughs and enlightenment from the morning spent on this wonderful experience. Well done Poo on a wonderful experience .... And we wear our 'I cooked with Poo and Liked it' aprons with pride whilst cooking recipes from our cook book. A tour recommended to foodies and those wanting the real Thailand experience. (Perhaps the market not so good for people who have weak tummies)

Fun and educational. Before I arrived, I asked my friend where I could take a Thai cooking basic class, she recommended cooking with Poo, she is very well known in the cooking circles, no just in Thailand but everywhere, she have a very robust website with classes, options and menus, you can pay online, and that included picking you up a location close to the BTS.I was so happy I did it, the class is just 4 hours but hands on, she explain every detail during the class, and also before you get there you have a tour for the local market, an experience that you have to enjoy at full.We cooked 3 dishes and I understood the meaning of the spices in Thai Cuisine, very didactic, even for people that have never try to cook. I recommend her if you come to Bangkok and want to learn the basis. Her cooking classroom is well equipped and has all that you need.

A nice excursion from the usual tourist areas. We really enjoyed the cooking experience. Not being a cook I was a little apprehensive but Poo makes you welcome and teaches in a relaxed easy manner. I liked the tips about how to cut leaves small and how she uses water and not oils so much. The morning Glory was one of the best I have eaten and the prawn curry was great. The traders market trip was an eye opener with spices and vegetables not seen before and some not available in the west. If you find yourself in Bangkok add this to your itiniary.

Fabulous Half Day Activity. Very well organized tour of the largest market I have ever seen. The cooking class was exceptional. Delicious food using simple ingredients. Any novice cook can enjoy this experience. More experienced cooks will learn more about traditional recipes and local seasonings."Poo" and her staff are more than qualified to keep everyone informed and entertained.The pick up location was easy to access, the van ride to the market was comfortable and the kitchen was very well organized and spotlessly clean. Highly recommended!

Highlight of our trip!. Poo's cooking school was totally worthwhile and a thoroughly enjoyable few hours. Sure there was cooking, and lots of food (skip breakfast!), but we really enjoyed talking to local Bangkok residents and stepping out of the tourist circuit for a day. The school is located a few houses down from where Poo grew up and there was a real feel of community and people getting on with their lives. We felt very privilliged to see this side of Bangkok.Oh, and the market tour was awesome, we asked so many questions and joked with all the stall holders. The photos opportunities were good too.

Great market tour and intro to Thai cooking. This was a great half-day activity - so much amazing stuff to see on the market tour, then a great hands-on chance to cook three classic Thai dishes. Poo and her assistant Noi were lovely and great teachers, and the food was delicious. And it's the cooking school also helps the people of the Khlong Toey slum community. A real highlight of our trip to Bangkok.

The best cooking experience ever!. We went on a business trip to Thailand and as a business importer of Thai food our boss wanted us to have some cooking experience and it was great!!! The market is very eye opening, nothing like I've seen before! I was amazing and I got some great pictures :)The cooking was very simple and so yummy!!! Poo and her team are very nice and helpfull. You don't need to be a chef, even the most beginner person will cook something very nice. I love all the dishes we made and since I'm back I did redo them a lot already! It was a great morning and I will recommend it to everybody!

Poo can Cook!. my other half booked this trip as a surprise for me, and it was just brilliant. Living in HK and having been to many markets, I was not hugely excited about visiting a Thai market, but I found it really interesting and different. I was very surprised at how intersting I found it. The cooking itslef is basic, which is good because you don;t need to be a master cheft before you go. On the other hand, Poo told us that fish sauce is salt, lime is sour etc., so that you could change the taste of your own dish based on that knowledge. Poo does different recepies every day, so having done one course, I am desperate to go back to learn more dishes. A realy well organised, well run tour and everything was on time (surprising for Asia!) I am hoping to be back before long!

Bangkok Life: Behind the scenes. Great market tour, mouth to foot cooking on full display (wear non slip shoes...it's the real market experience)Nearly slipped on an escaping cat fish to the delight of the stall holders.The cooking class was great, but more interesting for me was Poo's story and the example of microeconomics, microcredit, (think Muhammad Yunus/Grameen Bank) in action and the ripple effect within communities when women start small businesses Well worth supporting women's sustainable entrepreneurship and livelihood in newly developed settings.

Awesome morning out. We had a great time with Poo and her helpers on our trip to bangkok. We were picked up right on time with 9 others and enjoyed a quick ride to the klong toi markets. There we were separated into groups of four and taken through. Noi our guide was excellent and got us looking and even trying some very non European foods! The market tour was a definite high light of this tour and I would have loved to go back the next day and brought lots of the great things we saw. Following this we were back in the mini van and of to Poo's place to cook up some Thai food the recipes were easy to follow and Poo and Noi made it very easy to create some great food that we got to eat. I would definitely come again to do this tour and would recommend it to all my friends, the team at helping hands give you an insight into Thai life that you don't see on the tourist strips and we have managed to cook a few yummy things from Poos book back in our home.

Fantastic Family Fun. We are a family of four with teenage boys. Poo's cooking school was a highlight of our trip. We were picked up at the meeting place on time and taken to the markets which were amazing! Poo's cooking school in the slums caters for all ages. The receipes are simple and even our two boys who have only done very basic cooking found it easy and was really yum. It is a great way to support many people who are involved in the cooking school while enjoying a side of Bangkok that you would otherwise not see. A must do.

Learning from the locals, supporting others to support themselves.. Poo is an absolute delight- clever, engaging, a brilliant teacher and chef. A lovely intimate gathering for smallish groups- well worth venturing into Klong Toey to seek out the experience of buying market produce, and then cooking and (best of all) getting to relax and eat each course in the company of friends and fellow travellers. The proceeds from her book sales etc. go to supporting community development in the surrounding slums of Klong Toey. Check it out!!

Excellent value, great fun!. We started the trip at the Emporium Service Apartments in a mini bus and headed to the local markets. There we were guided through the wet and dry areas and given explanations about what we were seeing and how various ingredients are used. I have been to local markets many times in Thailand and other Asian countries, this was easily the most informative and fun trip through a market that. I have experienced. A great start to the morning!Then it was off to the kitchen to put together what we had purchased.Our menu was Pandana Salad, Tom Kah Gai, and green curry chicken fried rice. The curry paste was made from scratch in a mortar and pestle. These were excellent simplified recipes and they produced excellent results.Poo and her team are clear and concise in their communication and they work with the diverse group extremely well.Poo works with the local community and a part of the fee is donated locally. She also has a small range of merchandise for sale (at very reasonable prices) including an excellent Thai cook book.This is an A+ experience.

Wonderful Christmas Present!. We opened our Christmas presents yesterday and discovered invitations to Cook With Poo today, Boxing Day 2012. The visit to the market was an eye-opener, even when you're used to life in Asia, but really informative. They do warn you in advance the market segment is not for the faint-hearted or vegetarians among you, which is sensitive info to give to guests. The time at Poo's kitchen was totally marvellous: Poo is talented, knowledgeable, industrious and unfailingly polite and attentive. The class (we were nine) was fun and time flew by, and the dishes were all easy to accomplish even for inexperienced cooks. And it all tasted great! It was an excellent way to spend time with friends and do a little bit of good at the same time. Poo is a marvel and I am going to look out for her on her England tour in June 2013!

Don't miss it. Our class with Poo was one of the highlights of our time in Bangkok. The tour of the market was fascinating - so many sights and smells. And cooking was fun, educational, AND delicious. The cooking school is a well-run machine, but still feels authentic and personal. Highly recommend.

simply FANTASTIC. simply FANTASTIC, the market tour was absolutely amazing (seeing tons ofnew things:fruits, veggies, seafood, spices) and the cooking afterwards very cozy and so yummy, a must-do for all people who want to get closer to the Thai cuisine! a wonderful way to support the locals too...kopkunka! I will spread the word about your place with BIG pleasure:-))

Great way to finish of my time in Bangkok!. Poo and all her helpers were fabulous. The market tour was so much fun, and it was interesting to see the range of foods that are available to Thai dishes. The school is located in a slum area of Bangkok and balances authenticity with foreign tastes brilliantly. All of the dishes were super easy to make and easily replicable. I have been in Bangkok 2 months and this is most certainly my favorite memory! Poo is fabulous, personable, and funny! What she is doing for her community is wonderful. You get a lot of bang for your buck. If you go to Bangkok and DON'T take this class - you are missing out on something pretty awesome!

The Real Bangkok.. .Cooking with Poo. Having lived in Bangkok for many years, finally made it to do the Cooking with Poo tour. Absolutely brilliant. Wonderful cooking, very authentic and good fun. Highly recommended.

Cooking with Poo. This is an outstanding, 'hands on' community-based cooking experience that starts with pick up service at a convenient location, a trip to the huge, Klong Toey wet market, (it's probably best to wear running shoes and don't forget your camera), and continues with cooking authentic Thai dishes in the Klong Toey community. Khun Poo and her staff provide clear, simple cooking instructions and recipes that can be made at home. One of the best parts of the experience is the eating! The class is small (10 persons) and the cost is extremely reasonable. I was most appreciative of the fact that Khun Poo and her staff adapted the recipes for me (a vegetarian) on the spot, despite the fact that I had forgotten to inform them in advance. I would highly recommend this activity for both visitors and Bangkok residents alike.

Great cooking class & wonderful way to see the "real" Bangkok. I can't say enough good things about "Cooking with Poo." A friend who lives in Bangkok recommended it to me, and it was an excursion that I will never forget. Not only do Poo and her amazing staff provide you with simple recipes that make it easy to cook Thai food at home (whereas some other local schools take you through so many ingredients that you know you'll never find the time or energy to use what you've learned), but the tour of the local market and the Klong Toey slum is a once-in-a-lifetime experience. You are sheparded through the stalls, which feature everything from live frogs and eels, to pigs heads, to the bright and colorful local fruits and vegetables. The staff explain what things are and what dishes they're frequently use in. Then you head to the small, but immacuately kept, one-room cooking school in a different section of Klong Toey...just down the row from where Poo grew up. Poo and her staff watched closely and guided us through making three wonderful courses. They also helped a family from Singapore, who had brought their six-year-old daughter, alter each of the dishes to make it less spicy for the child. During the session, Poo told us about how the school was started and some of the benefits it's provided to the community. About halfway through a group of 10-15 Bangkok police came through the area slum... at first we thought they might be making a bust, but instead they broke out their digital cameras and begin to laugh, smile and take pictures of the school and our class. Poo mentioned how their interest has helped make the area safer. After lunch, we briefly stopped by a little store next door to browse through beautiful cards, crafts and jewelry made by other Klong Toey residents and then we headed back home. It's a part of Thailand that I never would have seen otherwise, and I'm so glad I did. Cooking with Poo is a must for any visit to Bangkok.

The local perspective makes all the difference.. This is a fantastic day out. The morning starts with a tour through the Klong Toey markets with your friendly guide. This made all the difference because believe me, without her you would likely be wondering what on earth certain foods are and what they are used for. I'm talking live eels, frogs, crickets, buffalo skin and chicken feet plus a million other things you will likely never have seen before! (Don't worry, no, you won't be cooking those!) Poo and her team understand that to us farangs, these foods are a bit much! And she adjusts her food a little bit for our liking whilst still keeping it authentic (so no fermented fish sauce or curry pastes with crushed insects in there!) an unexpected extra in this was the story of Poo's success in her struggle with terrible poverty. This is an experience for everyone and the cooking is only a part of it, as the whole day was an experience in itself. Thanks to Poo and everyone else for having us. A brilliant day.

Authentic experience, delicious food, lovely people!. The whole day was incredibly unique and one I will never forget. As a tourist I wasn't expecting to get such an authentic Thai experience and the fact that the staff were so welcoming and friendly made it even more special. Before cooking school Poo and her staff took us on a tour of the local markets where we learned about the ingredients we'd be using. Walking through the markets was quite an adventure and not at all like the tourist friendly markets I'd been to before in Thailand, this was the real thing. I especially enjoyed seeing and tasting all the colourful, spiky and sweet Thai fruit that I had never heard of before.I didn't know what to expect for the actual cooking school. I am a vegetarian and by no means a gourmet chef. Poo and her staff made it SO easy and I was very pleasantly surprised! All of the recipes were simple and there was a staff member in front of my table the whole time helping me. They altered my recipes to make them vegetarian, while the rest of the class cooked meat. The meals we made were by far the best I had eaten during my stay in Thailand and I have been able to make them again easily since coming home.Poo told us some of her story and we learned how the cooking school has helped her local community. I would recommend this to anyone, even just for the food itself, but the fact that it is a good cause and that Poo and her staff are so friendly and welcoming makes it even more worthwhile. I definitely encourage everyone to try this - it was one of my favourite experiences in Bangkok!

If you do nothing else in Bangkok make sure you pre- book a cooking session with Poo and her fabulous staff.. This is much more than a cooking lesson. You begin with a tour of a local market where Poo and her staff give details about the produce - live, dead, fresh and fermented! You the go into the spotlessly clean cooking room where Poo demonstrates and her staff assist you to cook your very own Thai dishes and sample them straight away. We had Menu 6 it was all lovely and I can hardly wait to get home and show off my Thai cooking skills to our family. You can purchase Poo's wonderfully illustrated and detailed book "Cooking with Poo". Pop next door and there are beautiful handcrafts that are made by the local Khlong Toei residents. Fabulous morning.

A true inspiration. Poo and her team of friendly and welcoming staff took us on an amazing experience. English skills are great now and the recipes are easy and delicious. This is a true Thai experience not a slick or unreal tourist experience. We learnt a lot about food, and real life in Thailand. I had attended another cooking school in BKK, but this was far superior. Book early though, Poo is really busy.

Inspirational. Well worth the money. Food amazing and easy to learn. English skills are average to good But they are willing to learn new English words each time. A very fun way to learn with fun people and amazing to see the real Thailand not a tourist version. Facilities very simple but very clean. And totally inspirational to see what is happening with the funds from the school, helping a whole slum community. Well done Khun Poo I will recommend this to all.

My favorite experience in Bangkok. I'd read about "Cooking with Poo" on TripAdvisor and was excited to sign up for a class. Unfortunately, I waited too long and couldn't get the date that I wanted... Sign up early, people!There are tons of cooking school offerings in Bangkok, but Cooking with Poo is the only one I found that offered a different angle. Visiting the wet market may have been worth the money alone - I loved seeing the Thai people shop for there food and getting information on the different ingredients from Poo herself. Also, seeing Klong Toey slum was an eye-opening experience.Poo and her staff are lovely to work with and provide easy-to-follow instruction. All the food we made was delicious and simple enough that I feel I could actually make it at home... I bought the cookbook and plan on using it soon!

Cooking with Khun Poo. I had bought "cooking with Poo" in Australia and was keen to try out the real thing with Khun Poo. We found the booking process very straight forward and the tour very well organised. The ladies who accompanied the group on the market walk were friendly and informative. The market had a very authentic feel. Our small group of ten included my children (8 & 11) and a friend's children (7 & 11) - four in total. Both Khun Poo and the other Thai ladies made the children feel very welcome and very much a part of the experience. The food was fabulous and enjoyed by all. I concur with the comments made by x57114 - fellow tour member and unofficial photographer for the morning (great shots - thanks).

Cooking and shopping - what could be better?. First tip - book early as this cooking school is getting a great reputation. Picked up from central meeting point in their van - everyone was very chatty in our group, from all over the world. Loved walking thru the market having the different foods explained - thought it would be a bit smelly, but it wasn't. Lots of little stalls selling the freshest food you will ever see - wish we could have done a bit of shopping for ourselves. Or van took us to the slums where we donned our cute "I cooked with poo and I liked it" aprons and began chopping and cooking under the watchful eye of Poo and her helpers. We made 3 main meals, which were all delicious (I got mine bagged to go, as I couldn't eat it all). The class finished with fresh fruit and the best sticky rice and mango I have ever tasted. You are given a cute material pouch with your recipes from the class and there is also Poo's cookbook available - get her to sign it, as she is going to be a big celebrity soon. A great way to see "untouristy" parts of Bangkok, and also to support families in the slum, who would otherwise be struggling. Highly recommended.

Excellent instruction and delicous food!. This tour was excellent from start to finish. The pick up location was easy and convenient. The drive to the market was short and there were even bathrooms available. The tour took us through the main parts in the market and the girls explaining the different foods made it interesting and offered great fun facts. The drive from the market to the place we cooked was once again very short and uneventful (always a plus in Bangkok). The kitchen was large enough to move around without being cramped (even though there was about 15 people in there). They had water to drink available and again a clean bathroom. Poo explained the dishes prior to cooking them and her assistants helped explain and teach along the way. Each of our dishes were amazingly delicious and they let us accommodate our own tastes/preferences (i.e. the vegetarians used tofu and I omitted onions from my dishes). They even cut up different local fruits for us to sample at the end. The staff was extremely professional and friendly. I would highly recommend this to others - just book ahead of time, they fill up quickly!!

For now embrace poo. Spending the morning in the company of poo and her staff was wonderful, extremely well organised pickup before you are whisked off to the culture shock of the Thai market.Wonderfully fresh cheap and weird ingredients make this a very special highlight, just because its different doesn't mean it shouldn't be embraced.The cooking school is well organised and as it stands very hands on with poo, I only hope this doesn't change to much as apparently Mr Jamie Oliver is doing something with her next year.For now embrace poo and her wonderful charitable achievement while learning how humble Thai food can be.

Cooking with a conscience - an excellent experience. This was a wonderful experience. The event begins by a visit through the enormous Klong Toei Market, followed by a short walk through the slums to the cookery school. It sounds very intimidating, but it isn't in the least, and at no time did we feel uncomfortable or out of place, or a spectator to other people's poverty (although of course we were). The event is organised by Helping Hands, which is run by Khun Poo, a formidable and charming lady. She, and her helpers, guide you through everything, including the walk through the market and then cooking the recipes. Her enthusiasm and energy are quite infectious, and she is clearly a fantastic asset to that community. The web site is here: http://www.cookingwithpoo.com/contents/en-us/d33.html. The project is grounded in the local community, and offers a wonderful insight into Thai cooking, and into living in one of the largest slum areas in Bangkok. The food (you cook) is also excellent. To gain an insight into Thai living in a poor local area, and the rudiments of Thai cooking, it is hard to imagine anything as good. By supporting this initiative, you are also investing into this community. Strongly recommended.

Fabulous. I only had one day in Bangkok and chose to participate in Poo's cooking classes, it was a great decision, the classes were extremely well organised, the trip to the market and the authentic food made for a fabulous experience. Poo made the whole experience interesting, easy and fun. Highly recommend it.

A Great Time had by all. We booked this class from Australia and were not disappointed. Poo and her staff were just fantastic.We learnt some cooking tricks, ate well and learnt something about the food culture in Thailand. We visited a huge logal wet market and bought the ingredients. We saw a little of local life and whilst the classes are held in "the slums", the kitchen was clean and neighbourhood not unpleasant. We were the only two tourists in our group of 9. The rest were European ex-pats who all had a great time too!

Fantastic, memorable experience in Bangkok. I stayed with a friend for a week in Bangkok and she recommended that I try this cooking school as I was looking for a different experience.The day started with a visit to a local market which was, in some instances, overwhelming (the smells, the sights etc). Don't make the mistake of wearing long trousers as I did as you end up with wet trouser cuffs which didn't smell so good! There were 12 of us in the group and we were split into two groups and taken around the market stopping at many stalls so that the teaching assistants could explain what the exotic fruit, vegetables and meats were and how best to prepare them.After the visit to the market you are taken to Poo's kitchen to prepare 4 Thai dishes (well 3 really as she prepares the mango sticky rice). The chemistry of the group, the seamless way that Poo and her team work together and the knowledge that you're doing something to help the community really makes it a memorable experience. I have always been cautious about cooking Thai food, not believing that I could do it but have come home with new-found confidence and a willingness to experiment. If you're wanting to do something different on your holiday then I would truly recommend this course.

The Real Thing-A Must!. If you want the real thing- going to local market, cooking authentic food- then I cannot recommend this enough! Not only are you learning how to cook thai food the way locals do, you are making an impact through an organization that continues to touch lives in the immediate community. Poo is authentic in her demeanor, clear in her instruction on cooking, and both humorous and endearing. Everything about the class worked like a well oiled machine-simple, direct, and clear- and oh yeah, FUN! Highly recommend!

I cooked with Poo and I liked it!. Cooking with Poo was a lovely experience. The staff were nice and extremely helpful. Due to time constraints, cooking and eating three courses in only about two hours, a lot of preparation is done by the staff before the class and then the staff instruct continuously as you go along. As soon as you have finished each course, you eat it and every dish was delicious! You should allow room for consuming a large lunch. There is a maximum of ten 'students' in the group and three staff so the atmosphere is very relaxed. On the way to the cooking school, which is within the slums of Klong Toey, we were taking on a walking tour through the Klong Toey 'wet' market. The market can be confronting with many living and soon not to be living creatures of every description, such as frogs, crabs, eels, beetles, chickens etc. One of the main purposes of 'Cooking with Poo' is to help to advance the living conditions of the poorest people in Bangkok, which it does to great effect.

Excellent and insightful experience. I would highly recommend this trip to those interested in getting a glimpse of local life in Bangkok. The market tour was a real eye-opener (some elements made me a little quesy though), as was seeing the area that Poo and her team live. There are just ten people per class, which means you get a really intimate experience and a proper chance to talk to Poo and her team. Poo is an inspirational woman, and not only will you come away with some new cooking skills and great memories, your money goes to a worthwhile cause.

Without a doubt a must do. After seeing the reviews on TripAdvisor I decided to give Helping Hands a try. The experience was the highlight of my time in Bangkok! We started by going to a large local market where we saw animals, vegetables, fruits, food and more for sale. The sights and smells are a very memorable experience if you are not used to seeing where your food comes from (you can stay in the car if you prefer). Then we went to the cooking class in the slums, right next to Poo's home. While some things were separated already, you got to cut up all your veggies and assemble. Poo and her team were very attentive in making sure you learned how to do it yourself so you could try it again at home. They also helped me change some of the ingredients in my food since I don't like fish sauce or food thats too spicy. You cook a dish then eat it. Cook another then you eat it. And you do that 4 times so you spend about an hour and a half eating (~10.30-12) so bring your stomach ready for food! If you've had enough however they let you box it and take back.Definitely plan on the 4 hours (8.30-12.30).Here are some tips if you do the tour:* Book in advance. Give it at least 2 weeks I think.* Follow the directions on the email confirmation, they get you exactly to the meeting point.* Don't wear flip flops to the market (which is how the trip starts), or you'll get stinky fish water on your feet.* Have a light breakfast as you end up eating quite a bit.

Book ahead for a memorable experience. This was the highlight of my trip (and I nearly missed it as the Skytrain was so busy!). Having made it on time (just) we were taken to the market which was an amazing experience but not for the faint hearted. There were all sorts of vegetables and fruit which our guide explained to us, and animals in various forms from living frogs to dead chickens.We then went on to her kitchen which is located in the slums. I wish I had taken my son so he could see that more Lego is not the most important thing in the world. We chopped and fried our dishes which took a small amount of time and then ate them...they were delicious.My hint is for you to book this tour about 2-3 weeks before you go as it gets booked out and it would be a disappointment to miss out on something that is both fun and helpful to the local people.

I cooked with Poo and I liked it!. No doubt is this a fantastic experience. I had the opportunity to go on this cooking course recommended by a friend I was staying with (also a friend of Poo) and it was one of my highlights of my swift two week trip. Having the opportunity to see another side of life in Bangkok, the opposite end of the spectrum to the richness of the city, is amazing and being able to help the 'Helping Hands' charity while doing something fun and interesting is brilliant. "Come dine with me" evenings at University haven't been the same since learning to make my own green Thai curry paste! I would recommend this to anyone going to Thailand and would encourage other people to do the same as this is a brilliant day. (And who doesn't want a t-shirt that says "I cooked with Poo and I liked it!"

excellent experience for a cause. There are many cooking schools in Bangkok. This is probably the only one that is located in a slum and that employs poor residents of the city. Poo is gregarious and enthusiastic and makes light work of cooking some Thai dishes. she is also very sensitive to individual taste preferences, allergies, and needs. Not only do students get to cook, they also get a tour of the large wet market from whence many of the ingredients come. Her classes book ahead, so don't wait till the last minute!

Best Bangkok Experience. Of my 8 days in Bangkok this was by far the most enjoyable experience I had. Poo was a real delight and the tour of the market was amazing, and it was so interesting to hear here explaning about the ingredients and some of the sellers stories. Whenever anyone in our group wanted to try a new fruit, Poo purchased it for us to try later. The cooking was so fun and easy, and seeing the difference this cooking school is making in her community is amazing. I am a vegetarian and my needs were catered for with no fuss at all. Definately a must!!!

Great experience for the whole family. We loved the tour of the markets. Our kids aged 10 and 15 were fascinated by the variety of ingredients on sale including insects, eels, frogs and turtles. Poo happily accommodated our daughter's no-chilli requirements and we all devoured the food that we made. Delicious! We are planning on making the Som Tam salad at home as soon as we can get our hands on some green papaya.

market tour a must see. To be honest, the cooking part of the experience does not compare to the market tour. That was way more interesting... sorry Poo! But what Poo does it great for the slum area that her cooking school is located in. She is employing many people and helping the lives of those around her. So if you are going, make sure you do the market tour as it really adds to the experience. If you have done cooking classes anywhere else, just don't go with any expectations and you will be fine. Cooking with yellow Indian curry powder does not seem very Thai to me!

Bangkok Holiday- a great thing to do. What a great morning!! In the midst of rainy season in Bangkok and still saw 'real' Bangkok. We were picked up from Emporiium near BTS Phrom Phong. The first stop was the outdoor market. This is real life Bangkok. The assistants told us people come from all over even hours away to buy at the market. Live snakes,frogs,fish, fresh vegetable, fruits all a great experience to see and so different from the Grocery store. We then proceeded to the Cooking school (Poo's home in the slums of Bangkok). We were in a group of 9 people, each person prepared their own dish. Different menus for each day of the week. Check out her website ( cookingwithpoo)to see the menus and bookings. I have been to another cooking class in Bangkok and paid more. This class is a great Thai experience and same kind of menus as other schools. The cookbook is wonderful and easy to follow. I will be back Poo, it was great!!!

Loved it, loved it, loved it. This is a tour that starts early, as you are picked up at a central hotel location off Phrom Phong BTS station at 08.30 in the morning. But as just outside the Metro station there a wonderful food hawkers, selling you yummy food, like sweet corn waffles (mmmmmm), breakfast was not missed. Plus you get the full Bangkok experience, as you are with all the others in the morning commute.You are being picked up in a minibus, that will ferry you around the two venues (market, school) and back. As that part of Bangkok can be best described as a maze - very convenient service.The market tour was a true eye opener on Thai food for me. Most food in Thailand is really fresh, and almost half the components on that market were still alive...The market tour takes about an hour hour and a half and is well worth it on its own. Most people would never go there in the first place and thus miss out on seeing true Thailand.You are then taken to the Klong Toey slum for the cooking itself. No need to worry about safety at all. You could not be in better hands.The cooking class itself was good and well worth the money as well. I finally cracked Tom Yum after years of (failed) attempts. The secret ? Go and learn it with Poo :-)You get to prepare three dishes, the desert (sticky mango rice) is mostly sourced from the market, as sticky rice takes about six/eight hours to prepare. But what you get to cook is good honest food staple. Stuff that most restaurants in Europe can not get right either. People who complain that the cooking at some other places is more refined, accurate, Thai, whatever, should consider that Poo charges not even half of what the commercial operators charge and that here you are actually helping a community as well (and not just some shareholders).You are given a fair amount of guidance, but if you can not cook in the first place you will need more that that. But if you do know how to cook (in terms of techniques) and do have a palate and know how to operate it, you will learn stuff. Most importantly how to get the balance sweet-spicy-salty-sour right. And once you master this, you are flying.I enjoyed my half day very much and can recommend this to anyone who wants to do something off the beaten track. This here is Thailand.

Family cooking course. Just finished the course with our 2 teenagers and really enjoyed it. Staff very helpfu, Poo is inspirational. Market tour fascinating and not like anything else we have seen. The comments about serious cooking lessons needing to be elsewhere is probably right as this is relatively basic - but that it what we needed

A wonderful and unique experience!. Poo's cooking class in the heart of the Klong Toei slum is a must do experience while you are in Bkk. After the early morning pick-up by Poo's assistant chefs, we were taken to explore the local market with all of its sensory challenges.In the class we were greeted by the very welcoming and out-going Poo. Her kitchen is the community room in the heart of the Klong Toei dwellings. The well set-up kitchen made learning the various dishes very easy. We all learnt our 3 dishes, hand-ons, and ate them as we went ... aroi maak maak!! By cooking our own dishes we learnt how to adjust each dish to our own taste preferences ... less spicy or more sweet etc.Poo and her staff made our morning class a wonderful experience and most definitely a highlight of our stay in Bkk. I would highly recommend this to all.A must-do experience!

Great experience and a great meal?. When a friend suggested we do a cooking class in Bangkok I thought, why not? It turned out to be a great experience and I turned out to be a pretty good Thai cook.We did a trip through the food markets and were shown what to buy and how to choose our purchases, then a quick trip back to the cooking class where we whipped up a very delicious 4 course meal...yum!One of my highlights in Bangkok...try it for yourself

Delightful half day morning class with Poo and team. Just finished this class around noon today. We had a delightful time and learned how to make 4 new Thai dishes. There were 7 students total today. Prior to cooking, we got to explore the market where all the local restaurants and people pick up their fresh produce at wholesale prices. It really goes to show how hard the people have to work all day for so little money. Poo's cooking class takes place a short van ride from this market. Indeed, the location is considered the slums, but by no means scary and her facilities are clean. Poo and her staff are well liked in the community, so you will not get harassed following her crew (not that you would anyhow). If you read the background of Helping Hands Thai Cooking School, you'll really appreciate what Poo and her team has done over the years. I definitely recommend this cooking class if you have an urge to do a cooking class in Bangkok. Oh and if you're allergic to anything, just make sure to note that when booking the class. They'll take care of you.

MUST DO activity in Bangkok!! Incredible experience!. After you get over the very funny name of this cooking class you should book yourself in to do Cooking with Poo! I have been in Bangkok for 7 months and this is one of the best things I have done here, it was not only fantastic for me to learn how to cook delicious Thai dishes (especially green chicken curry- YUM) but to go to experience visiting Klong Toey slum and meet Khun Poo (the inspiring Thai woman who runs this cooking course) and her lovely, talented and friendly staff! Aswell as knowing that the money that you pay goes to people in need. All the food is bought from the local fresh food market therefore helping the community. There is a handicraft shop next door to the cooking class organised also by Helping Hands- that you can visit after and purchase little gifts (cards, bags and cute souviners) hand-made by children and elderly people that live in Klong Toey slum- 100% of the proceeds go to them. Amazing experience!! www.cookingwithpoo.com

If there's anything you don't want to miss in BKK, it's this!!. What an amazing experience! I had heard that Cooking with Poo was the best cooking class in Bkk, and now I know it's true. Small group, easy access with pick-up and return at Emporium, an amazing tour of the Kloeng Toey wholesale market (where you would get lost in an instance if you were to go alone, which you wouldn't even do) where everything is explained to you by your guide (ours was beautiful Khun Noi, Poos second in charge) and you get a real sneak peek into how the real thai food culture works. Then to the actual cooking class, situated in Khun Poo's house -a very simple, tidy and efficient kitchen where everyone gets to prepare their own dishes with the assistance of Poo and her team. Everyone gets to prepare the food the way they like it, spicy, mild, sour or sweet. It's amazing how easy it is and how good it tastes!The entire team speaks English, which is a great effort from them -all neighbours of Poo from the Kloeng Toey slums, now able to work for sufficient pay and enjoy their work thanks to the Helping Hands program. The spirit of this cooking class is unlike anything I have experienced during my 2 years in Thailand -such warmhearted people with true concern for their community and a will to rise above poorness and to succeed. It felt like such a privilege to be allowed to support such a cause, while learning to cook the most delicious thai meals.Even if you are not a big chef or even if you intend to never prepare a thai dish at home, you should go anyway. It's priceless!

Simply awesome!. What a great experience! Visiting the market allowed for a very authentic insight into the Thai (food) culture. The food we cooked ourselves was even better, probably the best curry I ever had. It was a really enjoyable activity and I will surely recommend it to everyone visiting Bangkok in the future. Poo showed us her home and explained everything really well.

Great opportunity to meet & cook with the locals!. What a great experience to be able to travel to the Klong Toey area of Bangkok - it's largest slum and meet 'Poo' and her staff who are from Klong Toey. The Helping Hands crew are happy, helpful and very friendly. The market trip was great, even in torrential rain, the tour was well organised and the pick-up/meeting point was well explained in the documentation & the ongoing contact & reminders for your booking via email was great.Poo was brilliant at communicating in english and her knowledge and honesty about cooking, food explanations, Bangkok and her overallexperiences make the cooking class truly a wonderful experience. The food is fresh, quick to prepare and easy to make and an opportunity to purchase other handicrafts made in the community is a bonus.

Cooking with Poo. This is the second time in 2 years we have done this activity. The meeting place has an excellent coffee shop on first floor just inside the door where you wait near the canopy. The sky train trip is efficient and the walk takes 5 minutes from there to the meeting place so is easy to access. Khun Poo and her team welcome you with lovely smiles and take you through the local market. The explanation of different foods is interesting and the market is well worth the visit. The cooking class is informal and well organized with Poo giving great commentary about living in the slums and some of her life experiences. The food tastes delicious so don't eat a big breakfast. You can ask to take some of your food with you. The team is very obliging and this activity is a highlight for anyone visiting Bangkok.

best food of our trip... and we cooked it. Cooking with Poo would have to be the highlight of our trip, we had 12 people and they all loved the experience, firstly it is not touristy at all, but very down to earth, right in the middle of Klong Toey slum, Poo is excellent at explaining the different foods at the market and also helping us to cook back in her kitchen, if it was double the price it would still be worth it, ps don't forget to purchase the "I cooked with poo and loved it" apron, a sure winner back home...

Cooking with Khun Poo. My partner and I did this on the 9th of July and this is one of the most special activities I have done in Thailand. I spent a year at school in Thailand (along time ago) and never got the chance to cook! This is a real view of life in Thailand, real food which is easy to cook! It was great to see the success Khun Poo has made not only in her life but the life of others, a great lady who is extremely proud of her achievements. This is more than a cooking school experience that everyone should try, I will certainly go back next year for another class.

Sights sounds and tastes all eye opening. Besides my challenge finding the meeting place this was my 100% favorite thing I did in Bangkok. The tour of the slum markets, the cooking class itself, Poo's Helping Hands non profit, and the food. YOu don't have to be cook to enjoy this. i am still thinking about the meal.

Outstanding Experience!. Absolutely loved our cooking class with Poo. I have been to Thailand many times before and this would definitely rate as one of the top 'tourist' activities I have done. The class was easy to book and pay for online, the pickup point was no problem to find and from the moment we were picked up, we had an awesome experience with Poo and her team! They are so personal, yet really professional and what the Helping Hands organisation has managed to accomplish in the Klong Toey community is incredible. Even for the 'non cooks' in our group the meals were simple to prepare but 'arroy maak ka!' I bring teams of people to Thailand every year...the Cooking with Poo class will now be a 'must do' on our programme!

Fun cooking class. I did the cooking class with my mother on June 22, 2012. We really enjoyed the tour of the market and had a lot of fun in the class. I plan to attempt at least one of the dishes on my own now that I'm back home! The only suggestion I would give is that they re-write the directions that are provided in the confirmation message for people taking the BTS. The BTS stop is listed correctly, but the directions given for how to get from the Phrom Phong stop to the pickup spot at the Emporium Suites is completely wrong. It took us half an hour to find the way, and many other people in the class missed the market tour portion of the class because they couldn't figure out the directions either.
a great morning. Poo and her staff do a great job of steering you through the fabulous market and then learning to prepare a few Thai dishes.

A Fun Way to Learn about Thai Food. This is a great way to spend a morning or afternoon. Poo is a natural at teaching how to cook thai food and she has simplfied the recipes making it easy for everyone to produce a great meal in a happy enviroment. As we had never been to Bangkok before we found the pick up for her class very easy to do (just follow her directions on their web site), and you will be met by Poo and her staff, and taken back via the Klong Toey Markets, where you will be told about the market produce as you walk to Poo's Kitchen. The cooking is done in her own kitchen in the Klong Toey neighbourhood, the way Poo teaches, you will find it easy, fun and interesting. I would recommend this as "a must do" for anyone visiting Bangkok as Poos happy personality will make this a very memorable experience.

It's fun to cook with Poo!. I have been to Bangkok many times and was keen to try something different from shopping in Markets! My sister-in-law and I had heard about the work Poo is doing to help her local community which not only gave us an opportunity to learn how to cook some Thai dishes but also a chance to give something back to those who need it most. We really enjoyed the whole experience - from meeting Poo and her team, to navigating the markets and learning about new ingredients, to the actual cooking class itself and just how delicious each dish was that we made! Oh, and a chance to eat an insect should not be missed! They are quite nice actually, just like chips!I would highly recommend you add this activity to your Bangkok agenda - but book early as the classes are small (max 10) which makes it that much more personal & special.

we love ms. chompu. Ms Saiyuud "Poo" Diwong is an inspiring and delightful woman! The quality of her food was clean and delicious, compared to the vendors sprinkled throughout the city. Her instruction was easy to follow. She had great facility and excellent staff to assist us throughout. And she is adorable, friendly, and most of all, inspiring.Day started with a pick up from a well-known and central location off the BTS. Ms Poo and her staff then took us through a tour of a nearby "wet" market: fish, meat, fruits, vegetables, prepared foods, supplies. Not for the squeamish. Then she took us to her neighborhood, where her kitchen and cooking school is located. Each day has a different menu, of about 4-5 items, which her students will learn to cook. She also does a very good explanation of the supplies and prep work. We had an eight-year-old and ten-year-old who was able to do most of the cooking themselves. One of my favorite parts was constructing green curry paste from scratch in a heavy mortar and pestle. Also very lucky for us, it was May and peak time for many local fruits. Poo gave a lovely show/tell/taste at the end of our course. Overall, we were pleasantly surprised at how much we all enjoyed the day.This cooking course was not quite what I first expected, but turned out to be even better. Mind you, it is not in a sterile and professional kitchen, if that is what you are expecting. It is a rented room in her own neighborhood, which happens to be in the Klong Toey slum. That said, we (a man, a woman, and two school-age girls) had an excellent experience, and it was inspiring to hear Ms Poo's story of her cooking school business and the resulting expansion of development and growth in her immediate community. She is so busy with her enterprises, that I would not be surprised if she soon has to put the cooking school itself into hands of trustworthy staff. Thank you Poo!

A really worthwhile thing to do. The pick-up is conveniently located at Emporium Suites next to the Emporium Mall in Sukhumvit road (Phrom Pong BTS Skytrain station) You are then taken to a local market in the nearby Khlong Toei District, and then to the cooking school also in Khlong Toei, which is a poor neighbourhood. The teacher nicknamed "poo" (the thai word for crab) is a lovely woman. Very enthusiastic and a great teacher. The class size is 10 people, but there are helpers as well as the teacher, Poo. It is a very enjoyable and informative class. You will have a lot of fun and you will see a side of Bangkok that most Westerners never see.

Pad Thai won't ever taste the same after you have cooked it with Poo. I like in Bangkok and I have been in Poo's school for several times now. I even take family who come to visit to experience something special: cooking with Poo.I must warn you: Cooking Pad Thai may be real eye-opener. In Poo's kitchen it is soooo delicious that it won't taste any good when cooked by someone else after that.t This could well happen with any other recipe.I also bought Poo's cooking book. Many recipies are way too complicated for me, but it's fun just read the recipies and look at the photos. And there are several simple recipies too.Cooking with Poo it's great, don't miss it!

Cooking with Poo was loads of fun!. I took my partner to the cooking with poo thai cooking as a surprise gift. We had a great time. What I really loved about this course was seeing how simple and quick thai cooking can be. Going around the market was a great experience, it was nice to have a guide to learn about the different goods and Poo is a great guide and a lot of fun. I also really enjoyed going to the slum area where the cooking class was and getting to see a different side to bangkok. It's nice to know that the classes support locals. If you are a looking for a complex cooking course which involves making pastes and complex techniques then this might not be what you want however I thought this was brilliant as I got to learn and understand the idea behind thai cooking and learn a lot about the area and foods. Oh and our cooking tasted great!

Great way to spend a morning. I thoroughly enjoyed this cooking class. The trip to the market was a very interesting experience to see all the different kinds of foods. The class was lots of fun and Poo was a great teacher and was very funny. I would definitely recommend this class.

Fun, interesting, tasty and for a good cause. The Cooking with Poo cooking class might be the best and most fun thing you could do as a tourist in Bangkok. After pick-up by the Emporium shopping mall you will be driven to the Klongtoey Market where Ms. Poo will buy everything needed for the cooking class. The visit to the market is a great in itself, the smells, colors and people. This is the real Thailand!The cooking class is held in the Klongtoey slum in Ms. Poo's kitchen where she is helping people through the NGO Helping Hands. The food that you get to cook is great and it is nice to learn how easy it is to make tasty Thai food. A must do when in Bangkok!
Wonderful experience!!. Khun Poo is wonderful!! You have to try this cooking class! You get a tour of a huge market over off Rama 4 and the whole experience was unforgettable! You have to go!!

I cooked with Poo and I loved it!. Khun Poo is the Jamie Oliver of Bangkok. She cares passionately about the poor and helping them to learn how to cook. Helping Hands is an organisation in the largest slum district and helps people to start businesses by loaning them money. To help finance the project Poo takes you on a tour of Bangkok´s biggest early-morning food market, then takes you back to her kitchen in the slum district and you learn how to prepare and cook a three course meal. The experience is very heartening...she is so revered by the local people and you get to see a side of Bangkok which the tourist doesn't tend to see. It's fun, it's fascinating and you learn so much about so many strange ingredients. My son is nearly 40 and still lives at home, and I thought he might find the whole thing a bit tedious, but he loved it. Definitely, one of the highlights of our stay in Bangkok. Thanks Poo!

Do not miss this authentic experience. Wow. You start at a fancy hotel for pickup but then you are taken to an open market and get to see the real Bangkok, Thailand. Nothing beats the sights and sounds as you walk through to "shop" for ingredients. Once you are done in the market you are whisked away to a local neighborhood in Bangkok and get to cook authentic Thai. Poo knows her stuff and she is a wonderful, witty host. She and her team take the time to show you how to make the recipes as well as fill the time with anecdotes and stories of the people who are working with Poo. This is a one of a kind cooking experience anywhere in the world and so authentically Thai!

An original and yummy way to see Bangkok!. First off, Poo and her team (Tai and Nut) are hard-working people who are charming, sincere, and committed to their cause. Without that enthusiasm, this enterprise would not exist. This class melded tourism and culture together in a wonderful way, creating an original way of experiencing Bangkok. I think how Helping Hands is reviewed really depends on what you are looking for in this class. If you are looking for a personal experience, then this tour is a 5 out of 5. No amount of money can afford a firsthand experience of the Klong Toey and let you participate in the heart-warming story of Cooking with Poo. Khun Poo and her team picked us up from the Emporium Suites at Phrom Phong station waiting with smiles. From there, we went directly to the market, which featured live ducks, chickens, fish, frogs and a squeamish assortment of Isaan foods and fresh produce. Nut was our guide (4 of us) and took us around, answering questions and piping up with information about things she thought might be new to us. Afterwards, we were transported to their kitchen in the Klong Toey, which is simple and clean. There are 5 rapid-heating stoves, so with 10 guests, we took turns cooking. This is actually a great set up for people who want to take turns cooking, enjoy the food, and have time to photograph each other cooking. Some people wandered a distance down the narrow path to explore, while neighbourhood kids gathered outside and peer in on us curiously.If you are looking to gain skill and become a gourmet chef, this may not be the place for you. From a cooking perspective, it is a 3 out of 5. Both the ingredients and techniques are simple. Most ingredients are pre-measured, but they leave the chopping (10 minutes total) to you. I would not expect a workshop with lengthy didactic teachings on how to combine spices or intricacies of a technique. If you are familiar with asian cooking in particular, you may not glean much from this exercise. However, there is always something to be learned, from substituting ingredients, to mortar and pestle, to little tips about when to add lime to cooking. Nevertheless, the food is delicious and plentiful. Most of us could not finish our meal!Advice: Our entire group wore flip flops. My feet never got wet, I just watched out for small puddles here and there. If you want, closed toe shoes would keep you dry but I imagine you would have more to clean afterwards. Dress light because despite the AC and 6 fans, the kitchen heats up fast! Keep a water bottle on you in case you over-spice your food or bite into a pepper! If you want this class, start inquiring early. 6 weeks prior to my class, I noticed that half the days were already fully booked. Book ahead because each class holds only 10 people.

LOVE COOKING WITH POO!!. Cooking with Poo was ABSOLUTELY an incredible experience. Firstly, what an amazing CAUSE and organization! Helping Hands is committed to investing in the local community of Klong Toei and supporting amazing micro-entrepreneurs, who work so hard everyday to care for their children and families. Poo is such an inspiration! What a woman of courage and influence! She has used the skills she has (amazing cooking!!) to completely change her life, and the lives of her community. Our morning with Poo began at 8:30am, when Poo and her husband picked up our group from the assigned location and took us "cooking-students" on an adventure through Klong Toei market. What a fascinating experience! Poo and her team gave us a real insider's view to this beautiful community. Poo then walked us through her community to where the cooking school was location. It was such a joy to have the opportunity to see Poo's home, meet her father, and begin our lesson! Poo and her team clearly explained each dish. Everyone in our group participated in a hands-on way and had a BLAST! Who would imagine that a cooking school would be SO much fun! Not only did our group learn how to make three DELICIOUS Thai dishes, we also gained an experience that will truly leave a mark on our memories of Bangkok. THANK YOU POO for sharing your world with us, showing us such an amazing view of Bangkok, and for giving back to your own community! Hands down, this was my FAVORITE experiences in Bangkok!

We cooked with Poo and we loved it. This is a not to be missed five star experience. For those reviewers who have given 'Cooking with Poo' three stars I think they are missing point, if you want a pure cooking school then book something like Blue Elephant, if you want to see more of the real Thailand whilst helping the local community then read on and book this tour.Having been met close to the Emporium Shopping Mall we were driven to to the Klong Toey Market which is an eye opening experience and so far removed from a Western market you could be on another planet!Ever wondered if your fish is fresh? If its still moving then its a good sign! Not just live fish but chickens, ducks, geese, frogs snakes as well as those not recently departed and partially prepared for cooking, skinned frogs anyone??Herbs, vegetables, chillies by the sack load, the tour of the market was interesting and informative and whilst not for the squeamish my daughters 22 and 17 both had a great time.I even managed to pick up a meat cleaver and some cooking utensils at a bargain price! It was a good job we were on a tight schedule as I could have spent hours there just in the 'shop'!We were informed that until recently tourists were not seen in the slum and our tour group of 10 were the only westerners we saw. We all felt safe, the locals we met were friendly and seemed genuinely pleased to see us, It was then off to do some cooking with Poo and her assistant, we each prepared three dishes, Somtum (Green Papaya Salad), Tom Yum Goong (Tom Yum Soup with Prawns) and Phad Thai.The cooking was informative and great fun and we all enjoyed ourselves and we will take what we learned home.To summarise, a not to be missed, eye opener to a part of Bangkok usually off the tourist route.

Good but not great. I've done a cooking class in Phuket - it was twice the price however much much better at the cooking part of the class (4 times the information & complexity)I will review that later. This class provided an exceptional tour of the klong Toey market. The staff are fantastic. The local areas you get to see are worth it too. HOWEVER the actual cooking part was a little boring for me. It was very standard thai food and not a lot of full on cooking information. Just so you know what to expect. Would I still recommend it - yes - for the overall experience however not really for the cooking part! (especially if they are a total foodie expecting a unique & more advanced cooking experience. Poo really is helping the local community & is an inspiration. Maybe one or two days a week she should offer more advanced classes.

A great way to experience Bangkok other than Temples and malls. As many of the reviews have indicated, this is not for you to become a Thai chef.
