It is a great introduction to Thai cooking if you have never done it before. The recipes are simple and good tasting. I was hoping for more extensive cooking time in the kitchen though.The highlight of the class was the tour of the market. It is not for the weak of heart who are used to buying food in neat supermarket packaging. The market offers fresh produce of fruits, herbs, meats, bugs, eels, and vegetables. It was a photographers playground with incredible colors and variety. Closed shoes are definitely recommended during the tour. Dress cool as it can get pretty hot depending on time of the year. I particularly appreciated Poo and her assistants. They were most charming, helpful and efficient. They seemed to have mastered the single portions down to a science. It was also most helpful that the class was actually hands on. We all took turns in cooking our dishes. I would like to express my deep appreciation to Anji Barker who with others are behind Helping Hands. What they are doing to live and help the slums of Bangkok is amazing. They definitely restore our faith in humanity. Keep up the good work.

Amazing - very unique experience. Cooking with Poo was an amazing morning - I couldn't recommend it more highly. The day began with a visit to a nearby food market. The sights, sounds (and smells!) are incredibly unique - something quite different to anything I've seen before. It was so useful to have an experienced local to take us through - pointing out some of the more interesting foods. We were then taken back down a small alleyway to a kitchen where we got the chance to practice cooking ourselves. We cooked three dishes - fried rice, beef and cashews and finally (my favourite) green chicken curry. The dishes tasted amazing, and I'm looking forward to trying them again when I get home. Poo was a fantastic host - she is friendly, has some entertaining and funny stories She does a fantastic job as a tour operator and cooking teacher. Her staff are also helpful and made the morning a highlight of my trip to Thailand. Poo's background is incredible, growing up in the Slums of Bangkok, with the help of the Helping Hands initiative, she has gone from being desperately poor to running a thriving business which is now investing back into the lives of the local community. If you still needed a reason to book on this tour, the fact you are helping out one of Bangkok's poorest communities makes it an incredibly worthwhile cause!

Not to be missed experience. I found out about this cooking class online and was immediately intrigued. Don't expect to leave here a qualified Thai chef. Expect a morning of eye-opening experiences and sights, plus learn to make a healthy home-cooked Thai meal. You are picked up at a location near the BTS and start the morning with a tour of a wet market. It is quite new and compared to many markets of this type in other Asian countries, it is very clean. You will see live and dead animals, bugs and fish. Many kinds of fruits and vegetables, Flowers, noodles, fresh pancakes. Pooh is filled with stories and information about the food and people at the market. Closed shoes are definitely recommended. I waited till we got to Bangkok to make the reservation for my us and was disappointed to see the first 2 weeks were totally booked. Fortunately we were in Thailand for a month so was able to make a booking on our return loop. I would recommend booking your class as soon as your travel plans are made. The classes are limited to 10 people and absolutely no cooking experience is needed. My husband can vouch for that. He was a reluctant student who thoroughly enjoyed the morning. Pooh has worked hard to make this cooking school enterprise successful. There are about 20 people employed by Helping Hands who are given a chance at a new life. The cookbook, Cooking with Poo, is a very interesting book, not only containing recipes but also background on the slum and some of the people working there. It is also available online for a very reasonable price.

Check out the wet market and the slum, forget about serious cooking. I must say that all the three "average-rating" reviews here have accurately summed up the experience you should expect out of this program. Having read those helpful reviews and with a lower expectation in mind, I decided to sign up for it anyway. In the hope that I could contribute to support Poo and her community at the Klong Toey slum to be financially independent and self-sustainable. The guided tour in the Klong Toey wet market was notably interesting. We found all types of fresh herbs, fruits and vegetables on sale; uncountable amount of live and dead insects on display in large plastic bags; and live chicken and fish waiting for their turns to be slaughtered on demand of any customer. As we were cruising along the market on its wet and filthy floor, we could smell the aroma of fresh crops and the stench of dead animals permeating every corner. We saw how pancake (for spring rolls) was skillfully made on the spot. We also witnessed the laborious and painstaking process of making Thai's favourite dessert, mango sticky rice pudding (Khao Niaow Ma Muang). The market is definitely an eye-opener for those city folks who only shop in clean and air-conditioned supermarkets. Thereafter, we were sent to the cooking school located in the Klong Toey slum. Albeit its high population density, I must say that it looked rather clean and dry. Don't expect to see anything close to what is being portrayed in the Slum Dog Millionaire. In respect of the cooking lesson, frankly speaking, I did not learn very much. The Saturday menu comprising curry prawn noodles, beef salad and basil chicken was pretty foolproof. As an Asian who enjoys cooking myself, I know it very well how to stir fry. I was hoping to learn real Thai cooking skills, as well as how to mix and match different types of natural herbs in Thai cooking. Poo and her assistants instructed us to stir in certain ingredients from time to time but they did not offer much coaching on skills. Lastly we had a mouth-watering fruit feast, which was a great idea to end the program. After all, Thailand is a haven for tropical fruits like mangoes, guavas and dragon fruits! I am certainly not against Poo and her staff. They were a bunch of really nice and friendly Thai people who are trying to make a difference. Just ask them and they would openly share with you their lives in the slum. I am just trying to moderate visitor's expectation by sharing my personal experience here. If you are up for something genuinely different from your usual tours, or you are keen to help the local community, this experience makes a great itinerary. If you are up for some serious cooking skills, like what other reviewers said, look elsewhere.

Fabulous Experience!. The whole experience was wonderful! A real adventure and gave an insight into how many Thai families live and eat. From the market experience, to cooking with Thai success stories, to shopping for home made crafts by locals who want to make something of themselves, it was fabulous. Highly recommend the class to people wanting to see the real Bangkok. Thank you!

Execellet mornnig. you make your own way to the pick up point where you are meet by poo, you then get on a small min bus and taken to the local market. Here you find some most unusual things for sale,after walking the market and picking up a few things for the cooking you go to the cooking school, I loved that my husband who does not cook at home was able to do this and enjoyed it. Poo has taken Thia food and does a healty version. A MUST IS HER BOOK

You must cook with Poo!. We really wanted to do a cookery course whilst in Bangkok and as this came highly recommended we booked with the Helping Hands Cooking School. We were taken first to the market where a member of the team explained all the different ingredients (live or otherwise!) to us and guided us round. Then it was on to the Cookery School in an air conditioned van. We made 3 dishes and watched Poo make another topping it all off with mango and sticky rice. The kitchen was well equiped and all the dishes were really straighforward but delicious. Poo was a fabulous teacher. If your going to do a course make sure you cook with Poo!

Experiencing Poo was great, the class itself was average. If I was to rate this based on the cooking lesson (technique, preparation, instruction..) I may rate this 2 or 3. However, as an overall fun and worthwhile morning it was a great day. Poo is an amazing woman and it is because of her I am rating it 5 out of 5 and it is great to hear the impact she is having on the community. I have lived in Bangkok for 1 year but the bit I liked most was the market tour with someone fun and who really knew her stuff. The school itself is within the local community and was great to visit somewhere new. Conclusion, if you are looking to become a Thai master chef don't expect this, but if you want an insight into Thai culture and life whilst learning some simple cooking then this is not to be missed!

What more can I add?. I am not sure which part of the morning I enjoyed more. The Market tour or the cooking class. Both were truly exceptional. I learned more about different foods and offerings during this market tour than I thought possible. So many "unusual" items for sale. Of course, the cooking class was amazing. The staff were helpful, humourus and just great teachers. Thank you to one and all. You deserve the 5 star ratings you get!

The hidden Bangkok, No1 to do!!. From the first email confirming our booking at the cooking school to the follow-ups before we started we knew that we were dealing with a professional organisation. We were picked up and taken to the wet market where Poo and her team took us for a very interesting walk through the delicacies including insects, frogs, tropical fruits and the curry pastes to name few. After the fresh ingredients were picked up we were off to her kitchen in the Klong Toey slum where we cooked 3 dishes and had desert. All participants got a chance to cook and to our particular tastes, then eat what we cooked.At all times we were gently supervised so that we got to learn as much as possible, but it was in a very fun and clean environment. The cookbook is a must as is the visit to the handicrafts where we chose some great bags as gifts for friends at home. Later we were taken back in the minivan to our pickup point.This event is a must do in Bangkok for the tastes, and the sights that you do not normally see on your trips. Congratulations to Poo and her team and hope that your success and good works continue.

Great cooking class. This cooking class was really a great experience, it exceeded my expectations. I immediately bought the book because I am excited to start cooking at home. Poo is a very energizing and enthousiastic teacher and she teaches in a very simple way how too cook great Thai recipes.

Well worth doing for first time visitor or ex-pat, best green curry and I cooked it !. Really good experience of Thai market . I would not have learned as much without our guide the lovely 'Poo' and the cooking and eating at the cookery school was fantastic , best green curry I have tasted and I cooked it .

We cooked with Poo and we liked it!. A group of 8 of my friends and I did the Cooking with Poo cooking class last week while visiting Thailand. This was our first time in Bangkok and we only had three days to site-see and explore.... A friend recommended the class and said it wouldn't disappoint.... and boy was he right!! We went to China town, MBK, the temple, Buddha,etc... and the cooking class was our most memorable experience."Poo" picks the groups up in a nice area of town (a hotel lobby) and drives you to the Bangkok market. If you are with a large group, make sure that you stand close to her, otherwise it can be hard to hear her in the market. They market was an eye-opening cultural experience. We sampled some interesting food items, she told us how Thai people prepare unique items (i.e. roaches) and we purchased a few fresh items for our class.Next she drove us to her cooking school. The location is in the middle of the "slums" but rest assured, the school is incredibly clean. We watched her assistants santize everything before and after our use. Poo made cooking Thai food easy and fun. Several of my friends purchased "I cooked with Poo and I liked it" aprons after the class.

Cooking with Poo - excellent food & life experience. Cooking with Poo - a fun title and a fun day was in store for us.The day was very well organised, meeting to leave promptly at 8:30 with an hour tour of the local Klong Toey/Toei market, seeing bags of frods, exotic insects, and fabulous fruits.A quick trip to the small cooking school, in the converted front rooms of a house in the Kong-Toey community (which in itself was an interesting part of the day), and we were ready for 3 very simple but well known and well loved Thai dishes.The results were great, and the enthusiasm of Khun Poo was infectious.We finished at 12:30.Wash/toilet facilities were good.Recommend:- be on time.- good shoes for the market walk.- light clothes (it gets hot coking with no air-con)- camera- for friends, families, couples !

Great market experience. Great market experienceWe did a Thursday cooking class with Poo. The directions to the pickup area were accurate and the transport to pick us up was on time and efficient. Poo is a great lady and quiet the friendly chatter. We were first taken to the market in the morning and it was an eventful place, plenty of photo opportunities, def not something you would see everyday. But we thoroughly enjoyed the experience. We headed off to the cooking school which was a short drive from the market. The menu is very basic, all we did was chop a onion and herbs and threw in the chopped meat or in our case the tofu gave it a stir and it was cooked. I guess that’s how thai food is cooked, very simple and basic. Before you know it the class is over. My expectations for the cooking class was high and I expected to take away some useful cooking tips and hints but this wasn’t the case. Nevertheless you pay for what you get and this was one of the cheaper cooking classes however it was a different experience and worth a try once.

I cooked with Poo and I liked it!. What a great day! My friends and I all live in Bangkok and have had many new and great experiences here but I would say that Cooking with Poo has been my favourite so far, I really can't recommend it enough. The visit to the market is an eye opener with Poo and her colleague explaining Thai ingredients very well. Then, back to Poo's place where she lives with her family to start the cooking. We cooked prawn curried noodles, chicken with holy basil and spicy beef salad. It was all explained very well, very easy to do and tasted arroy (delicious)! Poo is an inspiring lady who has worked very hard to get to where she is today and puts it back into her community. Tell your friends and family - this is a must do in Bangkok. Thanks to Poo and her team for a really great day.

Delicious, helping thai people, great experience. Hello, this thai cooking lesson is simply great!You will learn how to cook at home delicious thai recipes with all small tips to make it happen as in a restaurant at home but also, doing this course, you will share with Poo's team a great moment, can ask any question on strange vegetables and fruits from Thailand, visit the biggest market to buy your ingredients... a genuine thai culture experience more insightfull than any other visit in bangkok.Last but not least, you help people to get a better living as Poo's team and company revenues go partly to association for better living in the slam and so on!

Seeing, smelling, hearing, tasting and cooking up Thailand!. This may be one of the best experiences in Bangkok, unless you hate eating delicious food cooked by none other than yourself.Our ride (this is a family business) met us at the designated place and drove us to the market. After a fascinating, informative guided walk through the market in Klong Toey, we were whisked away to Poo's cooking school classroom where everything was prepared and ready for us to get cooking. Poo is extremely knowledgeable and adorable, and her assistants are sweet, helpful and smart.Besides getting to prepare and taste some of Bangkok's best home-cooked food, we learned a ton about the culture of Bangkok, Northern Thailand and the inner-city area of Klong Toey. Even better, we left with not only full stomachs, but full hearts, knowing our experience helped feed others physically, emotionally and spiritually.

Very Impressed. We thoroughly enjoyed our "cooking with poo" experience. The market tour was great (and quite educational), and it was something we wouldn't have been able to do on our own. The actual cooking class was well executed, even though our class was on the larger side. Khun Poo and her staff were very organised and efficient. We cooked the tuesday menu, and it was delicious. The ingredients used were up to western standards. We will definately recommend "cooking with poo" to our family and friends, and anyone looking for something a little different to do while in Bangkok.

Fun and interesting cooking experience.. We had a great morning cooking with Poo! We did the Saturday morning class. The 3 dishes we made weren't complex, very quick and easy, and easy to make again at home. There were a couple of children in our group (i'd estimate them to be aged 8-10) they had a good time and were able to do everything as well. There were 11 in our group. Poo takes a maximum of 12. The group is divided into 2, so one group cooks, then eats whilst the other group cooks!The highlights for me were:The market, it was great learning the names of all the fruit and having some of the meat items explained (ie pork tendons).Seasonal fruit tasting and Thai desserts!! We tried about 10 different varieties of fruit, and it was good to see how some were prepared. I also loved the pumpkin custard. We also got to stop into the handicrafts store next door, where they have some great free trade items. I would recommend this school/Saturday morning class, for anyone wanting to learn some quick and easy Thai dishes and who is interested in seeing a different aspect of Bangkok.I would also highly recommend Poo's cookbook!!!

I cooked with poo and I LOVED it... Absolutley a must do while visiting Bangkok. Poo has a wealth of knowledge and I couldn't get enough of her stories and her cooking is nothing short of Amazing. I can't wait to come back with my kids I loved that the school was in the slums so that everyone that lives there benifits. Don't change a thing, I will be back. Janine from Australia

You won't want to miss this experience!. Right from the time of booking things went well. It was Easy to register, there were good directions to the meeting place at the Emporium Suites and it was Easy to get to - right off the BTS line. Pick up was made right on time and we were soon off to the market. Poo gave us a little bio of herself and Helping Hands as we drove to the our first stop -the market. I have been to many Asian markets but having time to stop and get explanations of things was a first. What are those fruits we asked, well let's buy some and try them poo would say. Why are the eggs pink, let's buy one so you can try one and we did. Poo provided lots of good information and answered our questions with ease and real enthusiasm. She has a dynamic personality and her enthusiasm was catchy.For North Americans who like our meat nicely packaged and refrigerated asian markets can be a bit overwhelming to ones senses. Seeing a frog sliced down the middle and still breathing or a net filled with crabs who suddenly blink and you realize they are really fresh or eels trying to escape from the tub of water they are in, are not things we typically see in Canadian markets. That said it is all part of the culture we were experiencing and we soaked up as much as we could. Poo explained that the average worker in the market earned between 100 - 200 baht per day, about $3 - $6 a day and workers put in 12 a 15 hour days. Many of the workers come from rural parts of Thailand, Cambodia, Laos and Burma and workers also try to send money home to help their families. I found this part of the tour fascinating and could have spent much longer exploring with some-one like Poo to educate me further.We were the off to our cooking class that was also located inside the Klong Toey slum. The classroom was very modest but efficient. There were 10 of in the class and we spilt into 2 groups. The first group took there turn at the cooking stations while the second group took pictures, helped themselves to water or to sit beside a cooling fan. Then as group one sat down to eat their first creation, group Two took there turn cooking. We made three dishes in total. We made 'Tom Kha Gai' - Coconut Soup with chicken which I loved and will make again, 'Khao phad sai gai' - fried rice with chicken, and 'Phad Priow Waan' -sweet and sour pork. All were good and as others have mentioned don't eat a big breakfast as you get quite a lot to eat. Poo also made sticky rice and fresh fruits (purchased from the markets) for our dessert.There are souvenir cook books to purchase along with t- shirts and aprons with the phrase 'I cooked with Poo and I liked it'. Each person in the class gets a small hand crafted bag with the recipes from their class to take home which was a nice touch.After we had finished we were invited next door to a small shop where local handicrafts were sold. It was very modest but there were nice items available.This was more than learning a few simple Thai cooking dishes, this was more about getting a glimpse into how many people live and exist in an area Most tourists would not see if it were not for people like Poo and her 'Helping Hands'. A truly enjoyable experience!

Cooking with Poo was a highlight of our trip. We chose Helping Hands due to previous reviews on Trip Advisor and we were not disappointed. We loved every second of our experience with Poo and her team. We had to wait a bit at the meeting point (but that was because some of the attendees were late, not Poo). Then we headed to the market which was unreal. I would recommend wearing closed toe shoes (not sandals) and to be prepared that you'll see everything here. But it was really a great experience. I especially liked that as we toured the market the staff bought all of the ingredients we need to cook our meal so we all knew how fresh it was. Then Poo took us into the slum where the cooking facilities were. She showed us her home and shared the history of the area. Oh, and the cooking. That was great too! Instead of watching, we all got to cook each thing on the menu. I'd recommend this to anyone who wants a great inside view of Bangkok. I'd also recommend you purchase the cookbook for sale...it's fab!

We all loved cooking with Poo!. Our family, ranging in age from 9 to 72, immensely enjoyed the cooking class. It was easy to get to the pick-up location. The market tour was fascinating, and the instruction was definitely hands-on. Each person cooks their own meal. Don't eat breakfast, because the meal is huge. Poo was a joy, and she was great with our daughter. Her assistants were also very helpful. It's all for a good cause, too.

interesting and loads of fun. My wife booked us into this before we left Canada. I was skeptical but went along for the ride. Turns out it was a lot of fun! Even our 19 year old son, and his girlfriend really enjoyed it. Excellent communication with us after booking. Efficient pickup at Emporium Suites hotel, which is easy to get to from the skytrain. Started out with a tour of the huge Klong Toey market, with a knowledgeable guide, (Khun Poo herself and an assistant) learning about foods-many of which I'd seen in other markets around southeast Asia, but wondered what they were and how they were cooked. Now I know (at least a bit)Then it's a quick walk through Bangkok's largest slum to get to the classroom (yes it's located inside the klong toey slum), and the class begins.Khun Poo runs the school,teaches the class and leads the tour. She's funny, engaging and animated, and made our morning a lot of fun.We made three dishes,all of which we ate. So here's a tip...Don't eat breakfast before coming here. Cookbooks are available, as well as t-shirts and aprons adorned with the catchy slogan "I cooked with poo and liked it". Next door there's a craft shop selling goods made by people in the slum. This is definitely NOT the asian market style "hard sell" though, it's very relaxed and there's no pressure to buy. (but we did anyway)One of the nice parts about Helping hands is that it really supports the community by turning some profits over to educate children and to feed the hungry. Actually a lot of the profits go to these causes, and the list of accomplishments is long.If you are looking for a cooking school that will turn you into a Thai master chef then Cooking with Poo likely isn't what you are after, but if you're looking for a fun way to spend half a day, learn a bit about Thai life, and a bit about Thai cooking, while helping out a good cause, and enjoying a great (albeit self made) meal you can't go wrong with Helping hands. I had a great time.

Best Food I ate in Thailand was when I cooked with Pooh.. This was a great experience. My husband was working so I was left to fill the days on my own. I'm thrilled that I choose to do this. I really enjoyed walking around the markets and learning about interesting Thai ingredients. Then it was back to Pooh's place to learn to cook. Everything was so well organized and efficient. We made Green Papaya Salad, Tom Yum Soup (which I didn't think I'd like, but loved), and traditional Pad Thai. She was easy to understand and energetic. We then sampled local Thai fruits. There was SO much food...DO NOT eat breakfast beforehand! I was a little unclear on the meeting place...just to be clear for you, meet right in front of the Embassy hotel. (Even those @ the front desk of the hotel hadn't heard of her.) This is a definite must do. You won't regret it!

'Loved this authentic experience'. As a family we loved our 'cooking with Poo' experience, from the Klong Toey Market tour to the cooking in the 'slums' class. We made three simple and relatively straightforward Thai dishes with much of the preparation already done for us. This made things basically foolproof and allowed the big class to all get to cook. We enjoyed eating the spoils and tasting all the Asian fruits available as the last course. We were very glad to contribute to Poo's Helping Hand community project and build some confidence in our Thai cooking skills. We thoroughly enjoyed every minute!

Great Cooking and Learning Experience. I had an amazing time with this cooking school. Our day starting by meeting near the Emporium hotel in the morning, and we were promptly whisked off to the largest outdoor food market I had ever been to in my life. Poo and her assistant explained so much about the market, and Thai food culture (from the tantalizing fruits to the not-so-tantalizing insects and frogs). Everyone in the market knows Poo and her staff and are very friendly, some of them gave quick demonstrations of how some of their products were made. While walking through the market there are opportunities to buy some delicious fruit to eat or take back to your hotel (you'll want to avoid eating too much right before the cooking class starts...trust me).Once we finished at the market, we were then driven to the community in which the cooking school is located. It's a small area, but there's enough room for everyone to cook their meals and pitch in with some prep work. Our group made green papaya salad, tom yum soup, pad thai... we finished all of it off with mango and sticky rice and various exotic fruits. All of us were extremely full by the end of the class, but we all had fun cooking our food and eating it too, yum! Poo and her staff are extremely professional, knowledgeable, and helpful. I would definitely take another class with her group the next time I'm in Bangkok.Bonus: this group is big on giving back to the community and helping others thrive. That was one of the deciding factors in why I chose this school over the others (well that and the other great reviews from Trip Advisor).While Poo gives you the recipes of the dishes you make in class, I opted to by her recipe book to try cooking other food and I've been using the book regularly since I've been home.

Blown away. My expectations were for something moderately interesting, this over-delivered big time. Poo is electric, knowledgeable and fun. The tour of the market with excellent explanations of everything was great value by itself, but it kept getting better. I got to cook three Thai dishes, guided every step by Poo and the results were delicious. Best Thai food I've ever eaten and I made it! Do this tour. What a highlight!
The real experience. Outstanding. Poo makes this a real authentic experience. Get beyond the gloss vaneer of Bangkok to see the real city thru the eyes of it's residents and their cuisine.

Amazing experience. Went with my girlfired and we both loved cooking with poo.The day starts off with a market visit which is very interesting.You then get to cook 3 seperate dishes yourself.The food you make is amazing and you are given the recipe cards to take home.However what makes this so special is that poo puts some of the profits back into the local community. So this is tourism with a conscience.Well worth visting.

My favourite Thai Experience. A wonderful day spent with Poo and the ladies at Helping Hands provided an awesome start to my Thailand trip! The cooking course is well organised and the food delicious and the market trip adds a different perspective to the whole idea of Thai cooking!

A different Bangkok experience. Spend a half day and:- visit a large and fascinating food market- learn how to make some Thai dishes- meet some real Thai peopleThis is not a cooking class. It is an experience that, through food and cooking, gives you a better understanding of how many Thai people live. You don't need strong cooking skills to participate - even children can make the dishes as described by Poo. If you want a rigorous cooking school experience, book someplace else. But if you want a fascinating morning with some fun Thai people you cannot go wrong with this activity.

Disappointing experience - this is a charity more than a cooking school. I have nothing against Poo and Helping Hands Cooking School - she is a wonderful person with noble intention to help her community thru teaching Thai cooking for outsiders. However, if you really want to learn something and be able to make something decent on your own when you return, i recommend attending a different school. Unlike the other cooking school I attend the next day, here you weren't shown any special techniques to prepare the ingredients which is very essential to Thai cooking, instead you were told to simply add and mix the ingredients without much guidance, therefore the result is just mediocre and i felt like I didn't learn much at the end. The food tasted good, but not sure if I can re-create it on my own later. Also Poo didn't speak very good English, which could impact the effectiveness of her delivery and clarity of the instruction. So at the end, if you're looking to help out the community while having some fun in the process, then this is not a bad thing to do. However, if you are looking to learn how to cook basic thai food, then you maybe disappointed

Didn't meet my expectations. Do not get me wrong: although her English is very basic and sometimes it is difficult to understand her, Poo is a fun, friendly lady but our overall experience was not what we were expecting after reading all the excellent reviews. We felt always rushed through everything we were doing; the kitchen does not have enough cooking stations for the 10 students there so you end up waiting for the other person to be done, there is not much time for questions about the different ingredients we use or for possible replacements. We feel we have not learnt much about Thai cooking. If you want to taste your food, get ready to start eating your meal at 10.30 am! On the positive side, while participating at this activity you help a good cause as they are part of the Helping Hands organization that helps women and families in the Klong Toey slum.The highlight of the half day we spent with Poo was definitely the visit at the Klong Toey fresh produce market. You get to see what Thai people really eat and get to know many different fruits and veggies that we had never seen before. If you really want to learn some Thai cooking basics, I would reccomend signing up for a full day class that offers individual cooking stations.When in Chiang Mai we attended a full day cooking class with Thai Farm cooking and we definitely enjoyed it much better; we prepared our own curry, prepared sticky rice, cooked all together in the spacious kitchen, had our lunch by the lovely pond and had time to relax and wander around the farm.

A 'must do' for any adult coming to Bangkok. The whole experience is really first rate and quite inspirational. The market tour was very interesting, but perhaps best experienced without a hangover, as watching frogs being skinned first thing in the morning might not go down well with the fried eggs from breakfast! I would have liked time to actually buy some food from the market (this is done for you), but they try to limit the time there due to heat etc. In December though, this is not rreally an issue. the cooking experience was great. Very simple dishes and no food preparation or washing up to speak of. You actually cook in Poo's kitchen which is in the heart of the slum area. It is both engrossing and humbling ad you come away with a special memory and some great new ideas for the kitchen. Go!

Loved cooking with poo. Wow! What a great experience. The market tour is a real eye opener and the cooking side of things is amazing. To make the experience even more special the staff are so welcoming and likeable. It is me of the must see things in Bangkok.

Cooking with Poo is fantastic!. The market experience was an eye opener. Poo was a fantastic guide to understanding a lot about Asian foods, different ways of cooking and different tastes. We cooked a 4 courses fried rice, green curry, beef and cashew nut, and sticky rice with mango. We also tried many exotic fruits we saw in the market. The experience was fantastic!

tourism with a conscience. I treated my kids and mum to a cooking class with Khun Poo after reading the recommendations on Tripadvisor. Nothing disappointed. The entire experience was very well organised and Khun Poo is an extremely sincere and warm personality. My kids loved the cooking lesson though my daughter was very unhappy at having to go through the market tour at first. She doesn't like wet floors, being up close and personal with livestock and was disturbed by the smell. She cheered up quickly during the lesson. My son enjoyed every minute and won't stop asking questions and trying everything that was offered. If you are not from Asia or live in a very sanitised part of Asia, the local market tour is a real eye opener. For my mum who does the marketing at home, she didn't think it was necessary to have the market tour given we live in Singapore and use similiar ingredients in our cooking. Overall, I would recommend that you invest the time on this experience. It's the highlight of our trip. the lesson is easy enough for my kids and me, a non-cook to follow. My mum who is an experienced cook was exposed to a different way of cooking and she seemed to have enjoyed it too.

Freaky market, great experience. I'm no stranger to Asian markets but the trip to this one outdid them all - fried insects, skinned frogs, bubbling vats of strange substances....quite a sight. Vegetarians avert your eyes!The cooking lesson itself was plain in comparison to the Blue Elephant but it serves a different purpose and I felt good to be contributing to the community. Poo is an amazing person who is inspiring to be around. The recipes were simple and used few ingredients - I thought that was great because sometimes Thai cooking can seem a bit ornate and daunting. When I got home I cooked two recipes from here on my first night back - easy. Poo is now taking this concept to the Phillipines and I wish her luck. Recommended, but make sure you book in advance.

Fun, Simple, and your support a good cause. This cooking class is small and lots of fun. Poo is fun to learn from. Our class was rather large at 10 but that is the max she normally takes. This class starts out with a market tour. You are in for an experience if you have never been on a market tour in Asia. Very diffferent from the US or Europe.The instruction is good and simple. She tells you what you are cooking, how to cook it, and gives you reciepes you can take home.A part of her earnings go to help the slums she lives in. It was nice to learn, have some fun, and give to a good cause.
Loved the whole experience!! Will go again in December.. The market was amazing!! Some of the foods were......... Very interesting. I want to go again!

'I cooked with Poo and I REALLY liked it'. WOW! Helping Hands Cooking School gave us an amazing experience, one which we will never forget. This day really showed us 'real' Thailand. We started with a tour of the Klong Toey Market which has to be seen to believed - it is really fascinating! A good idea would be to wear enclosed shoes as we are from Australia we thought wearing thongs would be fine but we were wrong there was puddles all throughout the market and by the end our feet were wet and dirty but we didn't mind, if we went again though we would wear more appropriate footwear! All the locals there know Poo so they don't mind you taking photos of all the different stuff there - our families back home loved seeing the photos of all the strange and wonderful things we saw. The Slums are such a fascinating place! The cooking class was great, we learnt how to prepare coconut soup with chicken, fried rice with chicken, sweet and sour pork and we got to eat mango and sticky rice for dessert - they were all delicious but so simple to make and we have already reproduced them at home several times and they have been just as delicious. My boyfriend is a chef and quite a good cook and even he enjoyed himself, the food and he even learned new things too! I would say this class is great for all ages! Poo is such a wonderful person, she is very happy and a great teacher - we had many laughs with her. The class is such a good price and it felt good knowing that we had participated in something that not only that we really enjoyed but also benefits the people living in the Klong Toey market! We also bought 2 cookbooks one for us to keep and one for a present and the recipient loves Thai food and has already used the book several times (as have we!) This class really is something that you MUST DO while in Bangkok! You will not regret it :-)

Do'nt forget to spend a half day with Poo while being in BKK. No fancy stuff, no tourist cheating... just a very kind and loving young woman who took usto the huge local Khlong Toeymarket and explained us what we needed to know and what we wanted to know about Fresh food. Arriving in her sparkling clean kitchen in the pittoresqueneighboorhood she made us feel at home immediately. Her explanation in English was clearand easy to understand and we learned how to cook a few very tasty dishes which every-oneof us easily can cook "at home". After a very short time, we all felt "united kitchencrew",though we came from Tsjechie, USA, UK, India and Holland. The book Poo wrote is a reallymusthave and precious souvenir to take home, and all of us were happy to be able to buyone and to have signed it by "the master herself". Thanks Poo and GOOD LUCK to you andyour Helping Handsorganisation, surely your a rolemodel to all your friends in KhlongToey

Pure pleasure. I went twice a week to Poo's cooking class, brought my thai friend with me the second time who enjoyed the experience as much as I did. Poo is an amazing young lady, it is a pleasure listening to her, and her recepies are easy and quick to cook and abolutely delicious. She creates a warm and happy athmosphere with her clients from all over the world. I deeply admire the project which encouraged Poo to run her own business and give employement and support for so many people in the Klong Toey Slum.

Authentic, Passionate and Sincere. Authentic experience even for someone who considers Bangkok as a second home. the market tour is very interesting especially the first part where the frogs and the insects are displayed.enjoyed every bit of this and you Poo is definitely sincere in teaching and passionate about sharing her knowledge. she shares insights to various things including family ties in Thai, customs and traditions. its not a staged script, but rather, you will feel like you gained a local friend sharing you the ins and outs of the Thai culture. I am not really a cook yet everything seemed so easy and yummy. i would definitely go back to try menu 1 this time.

If you want to experience the real Bangkok - this is it!. What a privelege to be given a personal guided tour through the local market and learn some Thai cooking tips along the way. Poo and Noi are both knowledgable, enthusiastic and great fun as they take you through the local culinary delights and provide an insight into the lives of many of Bangkok's residents.For those with children don't fear - I took my 2yr old son with me who was cared for and fussed over the whole time. Poo even had a few toys for him to play with while I cooked.If you only get to do one thing in Bangkok - this is the thing to do!

Cooked food, saw stuff, made friends & had fun... loved it!. We met centrally, an easy location for tourists ... went through Klong Toey markets ... great to see & learn about all sorts of different things eaten by people, then went to the cooking school. We divided into two groups ... one group watched first & then cooked, while the other group cooked first and then watched ... We watched Khun Poo & Khun Noi explain the ingredients and how to prepare them & then watched the others cooking. We then cooked ourselves & then ate. Excellent! Love the cookbook too!

Brilliant and completely different way to spend a morning in Bangkok. If you're in Bangkok and have a morning to kill or you're interested in Thai cooking / food then this is a brilliant option. Helping Hands is a charitable venture which aims to support people living in poorer neighbourhoods in Bangkok set up and run their own businesses. Poo and her team run morning (cooler) and afternoon cookery classes in one such neighbourhood. The day starts with an 0830 pickup at the Emporium Suites in central Bangkok. By far the best way to get there is to use the BTS and get off at the Phrom Phong station. The pickup point is at the emporium suites entrance just to the right of the emporium shopping centre. Taxi drivers may find the correct place hard to find. You are then bundled into a minivan and taken to Poo's local market which is a brilliant experience - she guides you through the market stopping to chat about lots of local delicacies (highlights include bags of live frogs - or if you're in a hurry barbecued frogs on a stick! and deep fried insects / waterbugs) and all manner of thai spices, veg, fruit and other cooking ingredients - she stops from time to time to pick up fresh ingredients from some of the stalls (not including a bag of frogs!) and then you're picked up and whisked off to her kitchen / cookery facility. The next couple of hours are spent making and eating a delicious 3/4 course menu of thai food - on our day we did spicy green papaya salad, tom yum soup and pad thai followed by mango and sticky rice. The whole thing was a really brilliant experience. Poo is a really enthusiastic and funny teacher and gives loads of great hints / tips and stories the whole time. Her team are really helpful and friendly ensuring a great time for all including our hard-to-please teenage boys. The only problem is that I'm now expected to produce a thai banquet for all my friends and family at home and I'm the worst cook in the world! All in all we really enjoyed cooking with Poo and will definitely try to do it again if we're in Bangkok.The cost from November is 1200 Bhat per person including all transport, ingredients and tuition.
experience in Thai food. first time learn how to cook Thai hot pot. good soup but don't like spicies very much.

A great experience. We spent one morning cooking with Poo and it was simply fantastic! The market tour was amazing and full of surprises, the cooking class is well organized with sufficient time to take pictures, and enough food to eat. Poo and Noi are full of advices and funny anecdotes, a must to do in Bangkok!

Amazing Experience & a Real eye opener. Just back from our travels to Bangkok & Koh Samui, The absolute highlight of our trip was the morning spent at the Helping Hands School. Totally realisyice Thai life & food is to be experienced during the day.We were met at the Skyline Suites & went directly to a massive local market & experienced (The real Thai life) This was just mind blowing and we found the aray of produce & food their out of this wordls. Khun Poo showed us various ingredients and explained lots of different things, Our funniest moment was the Eels trying to escape the bucket they was in?? The school was amazing really authentic & Local. If you do anything whist your in bangkok do this...... Truly was amazing Thanks xx

A fun day of learning and eating.. Experience the Bangkok culture with genuine ladies Poo and Noi who invite you into their community to share authentic thai recipes and techniques. The tour includes an informative and eye opening trip to the local markets followed by interactive cooking classes. The chicken with Holy Basil and chilli was my favourite dish. They also include the opportunity to try the local fruits eg. mango and dragon fruit. Bring a little extra cash as right next door is a handicraft store with amazing jewellery and fabric bags.

So glad we did this! Poo was great. All around great experience and such a good value. We toured a local market to buy fresh ingredients then went back to the kitchen to cook classic thai dishes like pad thai, green papaya salad, and whatever the lemongrass shrimp soup is called. Poo (the instructor) is great. So friendly, happy, and entertaining. Class was small (only 10 ppl) so we each got to make each dish for ourselves. Learned about thai ingredients and she also provided samples of local fruits and foods. Mango sticky rice was our favorite. It was WELL worth double what we paid for this tour. It also seemes to go to a good cause (buying local food and helping employ the local people from a poor neighborhood).

Fabulous! We cooked with Poo, and loved it!. Amazing experience wandering through the Klong Toey fresh market with Khun Poo, seeing all the interesting fresh produce and bizzare items that we would never consider eating. Fantastic hands on cooking class with excellent instructions. Khun Poo and Khun Noi speak english very well and were able to guide us through making some delicious authentic thai dishes (aroi maak maak!). We just loved this experience and would recommend it to anyone wanting an authentic cooking school experience in Bangkok with the additional knowledge that you are also supporting a worthwhile community endeavor which is really and truly changing lives. Don't forget to buy the cook book and apron! Fabulous gift for family and friends back home.

I cooked with Poo and I LOVED it!. Khun Poo, Khun Noi and the rest of the wonderful team, thank you for a wonderful morning spent wandering through the local markets and savouring the flavours of Thailand. Sweet, sour, salty and spicy ... and that was just the people in the markets! The food we cooked was easy to make and most enjoyable...you cook it so if you don't like it I suggest you blame the cook (you)! Make sure you take extra money for the cookbook, apron and the handicrafts sold in the house next door. A great experience and I'll be back!

It not only is yummily educational but it shows the real Thailand!. The Food is the yummiest in the world! And u can take it home, not only in a bag to your hotel but to your home country. This cooking school gets u into the culture, the real Thailand.

Amazing Experiance !. We had to meet at a central meeting point. There were about 9 people in our class. Po seems like a very nice lady. First she took us to the market at about 8:30 am (tip: wear closed shoes instead of sandals), where we learnt about interesting fruits/foods which we never new existed. She purchased ingredients for the class. Then we made our way to her kitchen - small but enough for 9 people. We were split in group of 5 and 4. But it worked well since eash dish takes only about 5 min or so to prepare. We made fried rice, spicy beef with cashew, chicken green curry and banana in coconut sauce. Everything was very tasty and she was a great teacher. If you aren't able to eat everyhting you cooked, she'll pack it for you. Best come to class on a light tummy so you can savour the food. The class ended by 12.30pm. And we were dropped back to the meeting point. The class costed us 1000 baht per person and she only collects the cash at the very ends (no need for pre-payment). I would advise to bring 500 bath extra to buy her book :)

I enjoyed myself. The cooking class was fun. I enjoyed the tour of the market and looking at all of the exotic foods. Every person cooks your own dish. There is no "sharing" dishes. In our case we had around 11 people. 6 went first and then the other 5 went. I was worth 1,000 Baht to us. She is the sweetest woman too. Above all else just go to the class for the charity aspect of it. She sells a cookbook that is very well put together too.

Enjoyable!. Walking around Klong Toey market and spending the morning preparing food and cooking with Poo in Helping Hands's friendly place was such a nice way to experience a different taste of Bangkok. We think it's a recommended experience for everybody who wants to dive into real life with some fun - and not only for adults. Our kids - 17 and 10 - really enjoyed it!

Fun activity that was also delicious!. Decided to do something totally different for me and what a perfect choice this was. Met up with Poo and assistant and went through the wet market. If you can imagine it - it's there! Fruits and vegetables that I've never seen before. Then off to Poo's kitchen where each of us had our own work station. Four dishes were prepared by us with assistance and eaten without assistance! I must say, I cooked some awesome Thai food. Before the cooking session ended, we were given a cute Thai print bag with the printed recipes to take home.

Great staff, Great Purpose, with one small suggestion. As other reviewers have noted, this is a very unique experience that most cooking schools don't offer. The market walk-through is a must do, and I highly recommend wearing rubber sandals or shoes you don't mind dirtying. From there, it's a very short ride to Poo's cooking school. It's small and we had 12 in our course. 6 cooked at a time while the other 6 sat/waited (but this worked out for picture taking purposes...plus each dish does NOT take long to cook). As the title above mentioned, we were slightly confused with the menu selection. I confirmed the menu we would cook two separate times with Helping Hands via email. I did so as this was part of my girlfriend's birthday gift and she has various food allergies. When the van pulled out of the meeting spot, Poo confirmed we would be cooking Menu #3, which is what I had confirmed. However, two other participants complained and wanted Menu #2.....low and behold, when we arrived at the cooking school, everyone was cooking Menu #2. Not sure how this happened, but we were slightly annoyed. Otherwise, this is a great experience that shouldn't be missed. Especially considering the charitable aspects of the cooking school. Don't forget to pick up a cookbook, which is worth the 500 baht.

Great experience and tasty food - also helping the community. This tour is highly recommended. There are only 8 people in the group so it is very personalized. The market is great - you need to stay up close to be able to hear all about it. The food was very quick to prepare and tasted delicious - it is best not to eat breakfast before you go! We had eaten breakfast so were not able to eat all the food that we cooked. However, this turned out to be good as we were then able to put the food into a container and offer it to people who were not so fortunate who lived near to Poo's kitchen. There is an excellent recipe book for sale too.

A great insight into a bangkok market for locals and excellent cooking.. This was a course I discovered last minute and was lucky to get on with only a couple of days notice due to a cancellation. It is advisable to book weeks in advance as it is becoming very well known and popular.It was great. We went to the market with Khun Poo and her team, where we found out about the foods of Thailand and Thai culture. Because Khun Poo is known by the market sellers you can take photos without feeling obtrusive, and there are great shots to be had. Khun Poo then takes you to her kitchen in Khlong Toei (the slum area) which is great as this is a part few tourists see. By doing this course you are helping to support this area and it's people as many are employed by Khun Poo and she and the organisation do alot for their neighbours. The food was delicious and the course was fun. Khun Poo and Khun Noi are both lovely.

Great experience! Delicious Cooking!. It was a great experience for me. I didn't know that Thai cooking could be so simple and it taste delicious! Just need to get the right ingredients and be patient and you'll have a great meal for yourself and your family! :)Simply an experience that you wouldn't want to miss out!

Excellent Experience!!!. This was fantastic and I highly recommend it to anyone. The trip through the market was awesome and I would have gladly paid 1,000 Baht just for that experience. Yes it might not be the ideal place for an animal rights activist with the chickens, frogs, eels, etc in very close quarters and the whole severed hogs head lying on a table but this was a small part of the vast market. The dishes were quick and easy to make and all of them were so delicious. There was no pressure to buy Poo's book or the jewelery in her neighbor's home. The only issue that might bother some people is you don't have a choice in which menu is selected for the class so you may want to check in advance to before you sign up for a particular day. Overall, we truly loved this experience.

A great experience. Picked up outside big mall and taken to wet market. Take a camera everyone knows Poo and they all smile and pose for picks. This is an amazing self-help initiative. Then cooking class in a genuine slum area house (room). Dishes simple and hands on just 9 participants so lots of one to one. Great. If you need some hand made cards for the year go to the Handicrafts shop on the way out

Best Experience in Bangkok! Will be back in a Heartbeat!. My husband is a chef and he loves Thai food. He was particularly keen to find out more about the cuisine and after going through multiple websites for Thai Cooking Classes in Bangkok and Koh Samui, we decided on Helping Hands.It was really easy to get to Emporium Suites to wait for our pick-up. The 4 hour class we had with Khun Poo and Khun Noi was the highlight of our trip in Bangkok. We enjoyed going to the traditional market and seeing how the ingredients were all brought together. When we were brought to the 'slums', you could see how Khun Poo interacted with the community and how they understood why 'foreigners' were in their midst. Khun Poo taught us a few tricks / techniques to use the simple tools they had to get something done - it was a eye opener for someone like me who is hardly in the kitchen.The kitchen set-up was simple and effective. Everyone had their chance at each dish and got to taste what they made. There was the option to bring the leftovers back with you but our group decided to pass it on to the children who will have it for dinner when they got back from school.We are looking forward to going back to try our hands again with a different set of menus. Since the class, everywhere we went, we were true critics of Thai food - knowing what was the missing ingredient and what could be done to make the dish better!

Great Experience, & I got my picture in the paper!. A window into real Thai living conditions. First stop is the Khlong Toey Markets - these markets are for the locals, not jammed with cheap merchandise for the tourists, but local food produce. The Issan section of the markets are a bit hard to bare, with frogs, bugs & fish on display for sale. The fruit & veggie section is fun - Thailand has so much amazing produce that I've seen no where else in the world.. the King of Fruits Durian - if you can get past the smell... Then head into the slums where Khun Poo lives with her young family and into the cooking school facility. This is a real eye opener - hard to believe so many people live so close to the poverty line. The food you make with Khun Poo if yummy - but don't be tempted to eat all the dishes you cook as they just keep coming - make sure you leave room for desert! mmm sticky rice & mango! I then headed next door to the handicraft shops where ladies are making jewellery and beautiful greeting cards - I bought my years worth gorgeous christmas cards. I cant recommend this experience enough & the idea that it is giving these hard working people an opportunity to earn a solid income makes it even better.

Simple and sustainable. No better way to travel sustainably than by supporting the local community that you are visiting. Cooking with Poo is exactly that. The cooking experience begins in the local market where ingredients are bought, then we travel to Poo's home in the Klong Toey slum where the cooking class is held. A simple, efficient and tasty experience of cooking 4 Thai dishes is overseen by Poo and her helpers. As well as putting 10% of her proceeds back into the community, Poo cooks for the AIDS Hospice and takes local community members to the beach on Saturdays. Altogether a fantastic experience that is highly recommended!

Best food i've cooked in my life!!. This cooking schools begins with a tour of market where we purchased the food we would later prepare. The guided market tour alone is worth the 1000B cost. We spent about 30 minutes walking the seemingly endless labyrinth of vendors. Poo was careful to explain the items that may be unfamiliar to tourists and what they're used for. We then traveled to Poo's house, traditional Thai residence and cooked in her own kitchen. There were 4 stations to prepare our meals at. The menu is predetermined, but there are 5 different meals that are posted on her website. We began with Pad Thai which surprisingly only took about 10 minutes to prepare. Our 2nd course was Cashew Chicken. Both were absolutely delicious. Our 3rd course began with a lesson on how to prepare curry from scratch. Each member of the group took turns grinding and smashing the ingredient in a stone bowl until we had the paste with which to prepare our next course, green curry with chicken. Wow! It was amazing. Just when i thought i couldn't eat another bite, local fruits were passed around for everyone to taste. Most were new to me, including mangosteen, dragon fruit, and a few others i cannot recall the name of. We concluded our experience with a delightful desert of coconut sticky rice with fresh mango. Everything was so flavorful and easy to prepare that we couldn't help but purchase Poo's own cookbook (500B). She was happy to autograph it for us and pose for a few pictures. Well worth the cost and would go back in a heartbeat.

Fantastic Experience!. The cooking class was a great thing to do. Poo is a charming, affable, fun loving guide through the outing. She takes you through the market (which is amazing) and lets you see how food is bought and sold in Bangkok. Then you head back to the kitchen and cook your delicious dishes. Everything was excellent! We are vegetarian and she was more than happy to change dishes accordingly. Her kitchen is located in a slum, and it was quite an experience to see that side of the city. Ten percent of the price of the class goes back to Poo's community. She is involved in all sorts of community building outside her cooking school including feeding and teaching cooking classes to children and feeding older people in the area. Her cookbook is 500 Baht (~20 US dollars) and is a lovely little book. Highly recommended!

Must go place. i have been to many cooking class, but this is such a special one. in a normal cooking class, you just went there and everything has been prepared. but here you must go to the market yourself and then find the ingredients. it was really fantastic when cooking Thai dish and enjoyed in Thailand. i learnt some very simple dish here, but they were very good. rather than just go around and shopping, go for more valuable thing. this time i brought back home much more than souvenirs.

Awesome but stay in the van if you are an animal lover.... My husband and I took this cooking class. Overall it was great. You are picked up at the Paragon Suites, which is a hotel next to the Paragon mall, next to the sky train stop. A Van with AC takes you with Pooh (the teacher) to the market. This is where I wished someone warned me of what I was going to experience. I almost fainted and cried right there. Terrible animal cruelty. I think I was stupid to not make the link and decide to get into the market. You have plenty of opportunities to go to a market that sell other stuff. But this, was too much. Chickens and all kind of alive fish, frogs, sea food in general. It was very very sad. Then you are taken to Pooh´s home. Everyone cooks!!! It is awesome. You can have vegetarian option as a variation of every dish, just let her know in advance when you register. The best veggie curry I had during my trip was the one I made there and I never cook! Even the fried rice, was awesome! She is very nice, funny and makes you feel very welcomed. It is short but you do lots in those 4 hours!The cost was 1,200 baths per person.It was great besides the market experience.Enjoy!

Kill Many Birds With One Stone - Learn to cook, eat what you cook, visit a wet market, help a micro-business.. Decided to do something different on my recent visit to Bangkok. Signed up for a basic Thai cooking class @ Helping Hands Thai Cooking Class, which is a micro-business operating in Klong Toey, a slum. The project, which not only helps Poo raise her family, but provides employment for her four helpers, husband, who drives the van and does the marketing, and the wet market stall holders, who supply fresh produce for the daily classes. In my session, there were four of us. We cut, marinate and cook the dishes, and get to eat them, too! Cost is Baht 1,000. We all meet outside the Emporium Suites (Phrom Pom BTS station), which is at the right side the the upmarket Emporium Dept Store, at 8.30 a.m. Poo's van picks us up, drives over to the wet market, have an hour's tour - hot, steamy and wet - and then head for Poo's kitchen. Cooking and eating take no more than two hours. You are dropped off at the Emporium Suites before 1 pm. Then quickly head into the Emporium for some cool air and some cool refreshments or shopping therapy.

Awesome time!. My family of four loved the class and market trip! Pooh is a great teacher and she knows a lot about Thai dishes. The Klong Toey market tour was one of the best parts of our entire trip. It is very hot and can smell pretty bad, but it was definitely worth going through and seeing all the animals, meat, fruits, and vegetables. Pooh explained the different foods we saw and how they were used in Thai dishes. All the cooking was hands on. You get to make your own individual meal. The beef with cashews dish was really tasty. Other people in my family loved the green curry with chicken. We spent about 4 hours at the market and cooking lunch. We also got to try various fruits from Thailand that we had never seen before. Other cooking schools have you watch the food being made, but we really enjoyed making our own food. The cost is not too expensive compared to other schools, and it is definitely worth it! I would highly recommend doing this if you go to Bangkok.

Absolutely Bangkok's best attraction. The highest recommendations from a traveling Dane to Khun Poo and her staff. While cooking food and touring the Khlong Toey market for ingredients you'll learn about life in Khlong Toey slum. The real treat is Khun Poo and the girls at the cooking school. Seldom have I come across nicer and more inspiring people. Oh, and the food that they'll teach you to make is D-E-L-I-C-I-O-U-S...Go there and you'll see what I mean!

A Bangkok gem. Trip advisor's have raved about this Bangkok attraction and, based on those reviews, I too have attended and succumbed to the charms of Poo and her lovely staff at the Helping Hands Cooking School. What a delightful and insightful peek into the culture and lives of Bangkok people. Besides actually learning to cook Thai food simply and effectively, there are added bonus's such as the tour of the Klong Toey wet market. Poo now also has an excellent Thai cook book out - Cooking with Poo. It's the most useful and practical souvenir you could wish for from Bangkok.

Wonderful Experience in Bangkok, Fantastic Green Curry !. We attended the cooking class on 5 May 2011 at Helping Hands cooking school. It was the best cooking class we have ever attended.People there are nice and fun and very sincere. We had a wonderful time. We also had the best green curry in their kitchen. We have been to many Thai restaurants back home, but none beat the green curry done by Helping Hands . It was so full of flavour and rich in taste. The cooking session was very interactive and easy to follow. Before this we never know Thai cooking can be so fun and easy. The cooking class is the highlight of our trip to Bangkok. Highly recommended.
the best ever. with a mix of great tasting food an the nicest people you'll ever meet i thought it was a great experience an i would differently do it again poo makes the the best food OF ALL TIME!

Brilliant. Our trip to the Helping Hands cooking school was a highlight of our time in Bangkok. The market tour reveals a wonderful and colourful side of Bangkok that most visitors would not experience. It's authentic, educational and fun. On returning with bags of goodies to the cooking school we got busy preparing a range of delicious Thai favourites. Poo ran the whole affair brilliantly with patience and humour. The group laughed, bonded and ate - what more could you want? A soulful, cultural and unforgettable experience!!

Rich flavours, rich experience!. This cooking school is certainly a rich experience, and not just because of the great tasting food that you get to prepare (and eat!). It was a privilege to be shown around the local markets and experience a cooking school right in the middle of Klong Toey, one of Bangkok's biggest slums. I have found that the best overseas trips I have been on are those in which you get to meet local people and experience a small bit of what life is like for them- the Helping Hands Cooking school will give you this and much more! Thank you for the wonderful experience Poo & Noy, I can't wait to purchase a copy of your cookbook.

Best Green Chicken Curry Ever!!. I had a great time at the cooking school in the Klong Toei slum. Khun Poo made the whole experience a lot of fun and she clearly loves what she does. The wet market tour beforehand was an eye opener as everything from live (or skinned) frogs to a vast array of insects can be bought. Getting to the cooking school is a bit like walking through a maze in the slum so you are definitely in the 'thick of it'! The meals we chose to cook were easy and very tasty and the green chicken curry was the best I have ever had. I can only put it down to the ingredients being fresh and the curry paste made from scratch. It was a great way to spend a morning in a part of Bangkok I would otherwise have never walked into!

Teenagers give cooking class a massive thumbs up!. Cooking with Poo was an absolute highlight of our (two teenage boys and their mum) week-stay in Bangkok. Poo and her lovely assistant (Nok?) picked us up in a mini bus and took us to the markets where they showed us local delicacies (hopping frogs anyone?). The we went back to Poo's kitchen in the Klong Toey slums and cooked up a storm. My teenage boys are not usually interested in cooking; they're more interested in eating. But the dishes were easy and quick to make, and delicious to eat, and the boys were really proud of their efforts. Of a three-week holiday all up, they said Cooking with Poo was the best experience of all. I just hope they'll now be more keen to cook at home! Poo was delightful - funny and engaging and it was really interesting to get a glimpse into her home and the lives of the people living in Klong Toey. We would definitely do this class again. Thank you Poo! Diana, Bondi, Australia

The most delicious Thai food I've had....and I made it myself.. The Helping Hands Cooking school was a standout memory of my trip to Bangkok. Poo is a wonderful teacher. Poo's recipe's are quick and delicious and bursting with flavour. Her class is lots of fun and the market tour is amazing. I eagerly await Poo's cookbook that is due out soon and would recommend this experience to anyone heading to Bangkok. Make sure you ask Poo about her own remarkable story, and the story of the Klong Toey Slum. The story of Klong Toey will linger like the taste of the delicious food.

Wonderful experience & fabulous food. If you are interested not only in learning to cook delicious Thai food, but also want to understand what's happening in one of the largest slums in Thailand, then get to this cooking class. Not only will Khun Pooh give you an extraordinary tour of the enormous Bangkok food market, but you'll learn to cook some amazing Thai dishes. Pooh has a delightful and engaging spirit and her enthusiasm for Thai cooking is infectious. You'll learn how to shop for the right ingredients and then combine them into fabulous food. I actually prepared Phad Thai that tastes better than my favorite Thai restaurant at home in Philadelphia. My morning at this cooking school was one of the highlights of my trip to Thailand.

Rewarding, Affordable 1/2 Day Culinary and Cultural Experience. I attended a Helping Hands market tour + Thai cooking class with two other adults and found it to be the most rewarding part of our five day visit in Bangkok. The opportunity to tour a vibrant wet market (meat, seafood, fruits/vegetables) with a local is a rare treat. Our guide and instructor, Kung Poo, was engaging, knowledgeable, fun and a talented teacher. Her English is excellent and and it is very easy to communicate with her. The $1000B fee was very reasonable given the length of the experience and the food we prepared and ate. Most of all, it was fascinating to enter Klong Toei, a part of Bangkok that I would have otherwise missed, and to meet people who live and work in the neighborhood. Helping Hands is a social enterprise, which made the experience even more rewarding. Highly recommend for anyone age 10 or over. This would be difficult for smaller children (small space, hot kitchen, 4-5 hours).

Authentic, rare experience. It is a rare experience in a country where you don't speak the language, to get right into the heart of its culture. But this little gem of a cooking school really gives you the opportunity to see the authentic thai markets (without tourist mania) and to actually learn to cook thai recipes and then of course eat them! Plus, supporting small businesses is always better.

Sensational Thai experience - DO NOT MISS!. A group of friends and me participated in the Helping Hands cooking school and it was one of the best experiences I have had in South East Asia. I have travelled quite a few times to various parts of Asia and this cooking school allowed me a unique insight not only into the wonders of creating Thai food but also the thriving life of Thai street and market culture. Heading off early in the morning to the market with Poo and shopping for our ingredients was a great start to the experience. We listened as she explained all about the various herbs and spices and expertly guided us through the colourful and busy market. Loaded up with everything we needed we headed to the school and were taught how to cook 3 dishes. I just LOVE Thai food and this was the best I reckon I have had. As well as an unforgettable experience - Helping Hands provides an opportunity for employment and income in a corner of our world that is incredibly poor - so not only do you get culinary satisfaction, you also get to feel pretty satisfied that you have done contributed to making the world a better place! DO IT!

BEST COOKING SCHOOL EVER!!!. A fun and great cultural way to learn how to cook thai food with an organisation that helps disadvantaged people with employment through the development of micro-enterprises - like this cooking school. Get to experience the main food market in Bangkok (Klong Toey Market) and then you take all your ingredients back to cook in Khun Pooh's (the teacher) home in the Klong Toey Slum Community. You cook huge portions of food and have heaps to take back home for dinner. Khun Pooh is warm and friendly and is a great teacher. So you get to learn how to cook thai food, eat thai food and help out a business that is empowering people out of poverty. This is a unique opportunity to get away from the normal commercial tourist ventures and see authentic life in a district not usually visited by tourists.

A fantastic experience !. If you are in Bangkok and have had enough of shopping & massage then do yourself a favour and book a mornings adventure with Helping Hands Cooking School.The tour includes a trip to the market to buy your ingredients before learning how to cook several Thai dishes (you choose from a variety of menus) in a genuine thai house in Klong Toey.Khun Pooh runs the enterprise and is a wonderful guide & teacher - a great personality who will turn you into a budding Thai chef by the end of the day. This is not a posh sterile cooking school but a real home-cooking lesson in one of Bangkok's poorest neighbourhoods. Trust me when I say you will love the experience.The half day program includes pick-up in airconditioned van, a trip round the fascinating Klong Toey market to pick up the ingredients you will need for your cooking (tip: don't wear your best dancing shoes as they will get dirty especially if it rains). You also get to see some fo the stranger products on offer at the market such as frogs, bugs, etc. Then it's back to Poohs place (don't laugh !!) to turn them into a sumptious thai buffet. Class sizes are kept small at 4-5 which ensures you get lots of individual supervision and the class is taught in an informal atmosphere which ensures you have a lot of fun. After being shown how to cook each dish from scratch it's over to you to let your inner Jamie Oliver out - making the dishes and eating them. The biggest surprise......just how easy each dish is to make. You will leave thinking "why the heck have I never done this before". Another tip: do not have a big breakfast before going on the tour. You will cook 4-5 courses and the portion sizes are huge....thus you get full very quickly. We left with bags of takeaway.And the best bit........these guys are part of a charitable organisation who are helping some of Bangkoks poorest communities raise themselves out of poverty through supporting micro-business ventures. It's not charity but teaching people at ground-level how to set up a business - and you will see exactly how successful they are if you take this tour.

Everyone should try this!!. This was a real treat! Every part of the experience was excellent, from booking and reservations, the class, staff to student ratio, the teacher, method of instruction, comfort and cleanliness of facility, down to the food you make and eat. They don't even try to sell you anything at the end! They are quite responsive when you send your reservation as well as with follow up emails. Maps and directions are provided so I felt like everything was easy and it would take a lot to still get lost :) Officially you meet the teachers at a nearby BTS station, but we went directly to school as we were close by. The day starts by going on a quick trip to the market. The market is clean and there wasn't a big crowd, so it was a nice visit. The class itself, though you do a lot of dishes in a short amount of time, was thorough. You learn about ingredients - why you use this type of basil over the other, for example, and Thai cooking techniques. They even have time to teach you how to make a pretty rose from a tomato. Very well organized and there were staff available to assist if you needed help at any stage. And everyone was happy and injects humor and quips and it is just a fun time. We made a full course menu, and all of them, I loved and will try to make again. The facility was comfortable. Air-conditioned area for class and dining and clean toilets. Water and tea and biscuits available throughout and you get to take home a cookbook. I would pay more for this experience than what they are asking for. Totally worth the time and money. Wear socks if you don't like going barefoot.

Could not fault this excellent school. From the moment they met us at Chong Nonsi BTS until it was time to say goodbye at the end of the class, everything was organised to perfection. The staff's love of what they do and the enthusiasm with which they share their knowledge of Thai culture, ingredients and cuisine is fantastic. We were a class of about 18 people but the staff kept us all involved and at no time did I feel rushed or left out. The whole venue was spotlessly clean and the staff worked like a well oiled machine to prepare ingredients, clean things up as we went along and generally kept us all enjoying the whole experience. We made 5 great dishes which we could either eat at the end or take with us. In addition we each got a cookbook with all the recipes we made plus many others. I would highly recommend this school

A different way to learn about Thai culture. What a fun experience! It is very well organized, informative and fun. Even if you don't consider yourself a cook, you, too, can make yummy food with this class. I am inspired to cook many of the recipes we were given back at home.
Enjoyable and interesting . We were 3 friends in this cooking workshop. The staf is very nice and welcoming. The food that we are made was amazing! Worth the money and time! Don't miss
