amazing cooking experience in Bangkok. i and my family joined the sunday morning class. The cooking experience was amazing. Our teacher, Irin, is very nice and friendly. You no need to worry that you can't understand the content of the class as she can speak fluent English. We can cook 3 dishes and 1 dessert. If you have any questions during the class, Irin and her assistant will help u immediately. The classroom is clean and comfortable. I enjoy the class very much! thanks!

Wonderful experience, professional, fun, and mmm tasty food. Firstly the class has been expertly organised and the staff are just superb, professional and friendly. The class room is clean and well stocked, and if you are lucky you will get some delicious Thai iced tea. If I am back in Thailand Bangkok I will seek out this cooking school again, as it really was such a wonderful experience. I like that you visited a market and had chance through out the class to eat your dishes. Also good that you could take photos, videos and get a cook book at the end.

A fantastic experience. My boyfriend and I took this cooking class and had a great time! We cooked four amazing dishes, the food was delicious and the staff were so welcoming and helpful. Would recommend this to anyone!

Warm and fun cooking class. The class was very well organized and teach the Thai cooking with very simple, also practical ways. The teacher was great and also she was so kind of offering us the ride back to station due to the rain, Thank you very much for great memory in Thailand!

Loved it. . I knew when I visited Thailand that I wanted to take a cooking class. I found this class reviewing Trip Advisor's reviews. I'm so happy I chose this place. Irin was funny and personable. She made us feel very comfortable in the class. We were initially broken up into group to go shopping. Nancy was my guide and she was fantastic. I learned so much in this class and had a great time cooking delicious food.

Amazing!. We really enjoyed our cooking class here! We took the afternoon class, so we didn't go to the market, but the instructor had baskets of various vegetables and herbs. She explained what each one was and how to use it in cooking. We were given a cookbook to keep and to take notes in. We made four dishes and also learned how to make red curry paste. We cooked over individual stoves and made our own dishes however spicy we wanted them. We also learned how to decorate the dishes and make them look fancy. The food we made was so delicious! I'd highly recommend taking this class - it was one of the highlights of our trip!

Really learning Thai cooking. I joined the morning class and visited the traditional market. The staff explained many ingredients in Thai food which helped me to know how to cook Thai food a lot. They are teaching you the food that you are able to make it when you go back to your home town, not just some fancy cuisine. The teacher and staff are all very nice and organized. It's so worth it to take the class!

A great Thai cooking experience . This is my second time joining a cooking class in Bangkok !It was still very exciting experience .The good part is we all get to cook at the individual stove. We get to prepare four dishes in totalTeacher has been very clear in instruction The classroom is clean with air con for the non coming part .

Great Experience Ever in Bangkok!!!. I really love this program, I can know how to make Thai food that I like, and can also know Thai cultures! Very friendly service, warm teaching, good environment!!!진짜 대박 강추해요!!! 반나절 시간내서 참가해 보세요~~ 태국에 대해서 더 많이 이해하게 됩니다. 친절한 서비스와 깨끗한 환경은 말할것도 없구요!! 이 프로그램 덕분에 카레재료랑 똠양꿍, 팟타이 재료 많이 사들고 돌아갑니다!!! 강추강추!!!

Great time!. My friend and I were both excited about this cooking class, but the experience we had far superseded what we had even hoped for. Our teacher Koy was extremely talented, and she showed us great general cooking tricks as well as the ins and outs of Thai cooking and easy substitutions to use in other countries. We got to cook and eat amazing food. Overall, we had a blast!
Pretty good stuff . Delicious! We get a great time, learned 4 dishes, met nice people and had a great time and great food!

Great experience!. This was a lovely way to begin my time in Thailand! We only had 5 days but I was eager to try a cooking class. The directions to get to the school were excellent. After arriving, w e divided into groups and went to the marketIt was a traditional local market, which was everything I wanted. We received instruction on local Thai ingredients and them had free time (10 min) to wander. The cooking portion was extremely well organized! Chop was demonstrated, ingredients laid out for us silently by very efficient quiet worker and then we chopped out own. Cooking was demonstrated, and then we cooked our own. The manged to provide pre-done items where it was not essential to the cooking (ex cooked potatoe) while letting us do the "Thai stuff" (making the curry part way in a Mortar/pestle). Air conditioning, good instruction, excellent English, this place was great. And I had a really great meal tha I made and can replicate in my home!

super experience. i highly recommend this class for understanding the local products, the spices usage and the cooking method! very effective, khun Nancy was really nice and english very easy to understand!Can be visited and tried with relatives, friends and kids! perfect gathering in a nice downtown place and the final touch is so delectable! you eat what you've cooked!

Amazing cooking class. Our cooking class was amazing. So well organized. Each person got to do there own cooking. The food was amazing and the trip to the market before cooking was really informative.
Cooking class. Brilliant! Teacher n tutors are all informative n energetic. attentive always. Superb rundown with clear pleasant demo n practice. vv clean

Best Thai cooking class ever!. Earlier this week I attended the class with Irin - it was fantastic. Irin was a fabulous teacher, easy to understand, informative, interesting, funny and I loved all her special tips that she gave us in regards to Thai cooking (you will have to book a class to find out what they are!!).Every meal cooked was delicious and so very easy to prepare. There were many participants from all over the world and all agreed the ingredients used are easily sourced in all countries. The trip to the market was fantastic also.Don't go past this school if you love Thai food - its the best.

Very fun class. Attended the class wanting to learn mango sticky rice and we did learned how to make it. Total of 4 dishes taught and they were easy and surprisingly tasty too.The market tour was in interesting with introduction to local produce.During the class, the instructor, Irin was helpful, informative and funny at the same time. Everyone was laughing and enjoying the class. The best part of the class was,.... You don't have to do any washing! Everything is prepared for. Highly recommended! Do this if you're in Bangkok.

Amazing experience. Went there with together with my friend. There was much more fun than expected. We really enjoyed it. The teacher was very nice, and it was very easy to understand step by step hoe do cook traditional thai food. We did 3 dishes and 1 desert. They also gave us a booklet with all the recipes (not only those 3 dishes), and other important information such as their vegetables and seasoning. Everything was very well-organized! They have a pick-up service from the nearest BTS station. They also took us to a market which was quite interesting as well. The service is very good!!! And they food we made tasted good as well :)
Good memories . Perfect cooking school for everyone!I can enjoyed not only cooking but communication with travelers who joined the class!

Good fun. We chose this class for the varied menu. We live in Asia and have travelled to many southeast Asian countries so weren't keen on going to another market. A quick phone call and they were flexible to give us a little price break and met up with the class when they returned from the market. Khoy, the instructor was very knowledgable and I picked up a few great tips. Another plus, they handed out an actual recipe booklet instead of printouts from just what was cooked that day.

Outstanding experience. Is our first time joined a cooking class in Bangkok, highly recommended and excellent place. So easy to learn and understand the Thai cooking method, is clean and neat place. They bring you go to the market only 5 mins by walk, very conviennce location.

AMAZING cooking class! A MUST DO if in Bangkok!. My boyfriend and I just finished Nancy's class and had the BEST time! With so many cooking classes to choose from in Bangkok it was tough to choose but after reading reviews from others on Sompong I knew this was the class for us. Our instructor, Nancy, was extremely informative and ALOT of fun! From the market tour, to watching her making the dishes, to us making the dishes, there was never a dull moment. We learned and laughed ALOT and we could not have asked for a better class and instructor. We left with a lot of knowledge about cooking Thai food, very full bellies, an awesome cookbook with over 30 Thai recipes, and wonderful memories. A must do if you ever visit Bangkok! Thank you so much to the Sompong school class helpers and Nancy for a wonderful cooking class experience!

Cooking class. We were collected at the train station,we were taken to the market , learnt a lot about herbs and flavours. The instructor was easy to understand and just lovely.We enjoyed the class and highly recommend it

Must do in Bangkok. Doing a Thai Cooking Classic in Bangkok is one of the Must Dos while in Bangkok and Sompong is a perfect place for it. The classes are between 8-10 people and everybody gets to cook on his own working station. We did the morning session with the market tour and it was interesting to hear about the different Thai vegetables, herbs and spices. Very nice teachers with good english.

well thought out class, great experience. I joined the Tuesday class with my mother (she's in her 60s) and my older brother (30s). The class, including the market tour, was really well thought out and well-organized. The timing of every activity and every break was spot on and was enough that my mother didn't feel too tired. Irin, who led our class was a great host (and hilarious too!) so we really enjoyed our time with her :)Would definitely recommend this for a group activity, chill but well-paced, enough to keep your attention but not so much to tire you! We also got to pick up some great tips about thai cooking and will most definitely be trying out these dishes at home. Great experience and we all walked away saying how much we loved it :)

Best cooking school in Bangkok. The class started with a tour of the market, before we returned to start preparing. The difference about Sompong and the rest of the schools is that the cooking is done in an air-conditioned room. This matters especially when you're in Bangkok! You don't want to be sweating while cooking. More so, the class had a smooth transition between dishes, and you get to enjoy your food at the end of it all. The recipes used are the best. Teacher Irin as a fantastic teacher as well. Her instructions were clear and precise. This is a must go!

Well organised for Thailand . Had a spare day in Bangkok and for this place from reviews on this App. First off really well run for Thailand I have been traveling to Thailand for over 20 years so I know what Thai organisation is like. I ranch and got clear precise direction on BTS station and time Exit 3 Chong Nonsi Sure enough the ladies were waiting at 9 am. Really clear instructions and great English from Irene the instructor. I have 40 people working for me in Hospitality in Australia and I can say that this school is really well run. Restored my faith in Thai organisation. Seasoned travellers will know what I mean by this. At 1000 baht it's great value for money

Amazing experience!. Went with a number of friends, all of whom had varying cooking interest/experience. Everyone absolutely loved this class. I personally learnt so much, and the recipes we cooked were fantastic. Great that you can do some parts in groups. Also appreciated getting the recipe book to keep so we can keep cooking these delicious recipes. For 1000THB it is 100% value for money. I wish I had the time to do the other days and their respective recipes too. Thanks to Khoy the teacher-helpful, informative and friendly. Overall a highlight of Bangkok.

Perfect introduction to Thai cooking . Informative market tour, perfect group size (5-6 per table), awesome booklet and very good step-by-step explanations before and while cooking. Also, you can taste the instructor's example before you cook the food yourself. The portion you cook for yourself is huge, but you can take the leftovers home. We absolutely loved it there-thanks for a great day!

Awesome experience. My boyfriend and I chose this company for a Thai cooking class after comparing many of the highly rated ones on trip advisor. We were so pleased with our choice! The trip to the market was awesome and answered so many questions we'd had about the produce we'd been seeing and Thai food in general. The class itself was fun, well structured and the food was delicious. We both know how to cook already but we learned several new tricks and techniques from the class. A major plus is the cookbook you get to take home! Absolutely awesome.

Delicious, fun and educational!. This was a totally delightful experience from our meeting at the BTS station, to our trip to the market and throughout our class. Everything was so well-planned. Our teacher was so informative and had a great sense of humor. We learned a great deal and created some delicious dishes. The class is held in a very welcoming environment. I'd love to go back!

Step by step, easy thai cooking. When in Bangkok and looking for a cooking class, Sompong Thai Cooking School is definitely a good adress. With the sky train it was easy accesible - Chong Nonsi, exit 3. The pick up by the cooking school staff was very efficient and well organised! Before the class started, we headed out to the near market to buy some ingredients. Our "classroom/dining room" was airconditioned and while cooking, we went to an outside area where the cooking facilities were set up for each of us. Koy explained and pre-cooked everything step by step. We could try it first, for us to know how spicy we wanted to cook our own meals. Then it was our own turn to try and cook the menu. Since I've tried to cook thai food myself, I even appreciate the taste more than I already did. Many thanks to Koy and her lovely, helpful staff! Your recipes are simply delicious!

Detailed. Delicious.. You'll get a full half day of expirences in; a market tour, herb and vegetable explanations, detailed cooking instructions, and a cook book. Really you'll learn everything you need to impress your friends. Superior value. Look no further.

DEFINITELY A MUST!. Had an amazing time today at Sompong Thai Cooking School! The food was delicious, the people were absolutely lovely and we learnt so much, suitable for all levels of cooking. Hands down the best experience we have had in Bangkok!

WONDERFUL WAY TO SPEND A DAY FROM MARKET TO COOK TO EAT!. So amazing. well organized, delightful instructor who made it fun. With the humidity, they had tons of fans going in really cozy environment and endless water and cold tea. Loved talked about food, then going to market to get the food. I even learned how to make a flower out of a tomato peel so presentation plate looked good enough for Martha. Its so clean, the family works as a team and you wont be disappointed. each day is a different menu so i wold like to go back and take classes for a week!

Unforgettable . Just finished our cooking class. Everything was perfect from picking us up at the Sky Train to attentiveness of staff. Instructions are in very good English with a joke and Thai smile:-). We visited the market and picked up the ingredients, also got a complimentary book with Thai recipes including the ones we cooked. Even those of us who were lazy and didn't want to spend five hours for this cooking class were totally fascinated. Definitely recommended.

Fantastic, family-run cooking school. My wife and I took the cooking class based on the good reviews and were not disappointed. The place is impeccably clean, run by a family with a passion for what they do. The market visit was fun and informative. Among various items we learned how to make curry paste from scratch, sticky rice and mango, as well as a pomelo salad that on paper did not sound that appealing but in reality was delicious. You get a small cookbook included, I also appreciated not being sold additional items -- your fee includes everything. Highly recommend if you want an authentic experience.

A must-do in Bangkok!. Our friends set this up for us as a gift for our honeymoon and it was an amazing experience! The staff picked us up near a BTS stop so it's easy to access from anywhere in Bangkok. We then took a short walk to the local market where we were taught about local spices, foods and ingredients. We then walked back to the school, which is owned by the family, and began our cooking lessons. The staff were incredibly friendly and excellent teachers! They gave easy to follow instructions and by the end of the lesson we'd made a 4 course meal (green curry chicken, thai fried rice, Thai salad, and pumpkin pandan custard for dessert). The kitchen and school were extremely clean too!! Take this class!!!!

My Bangkok Trip Highlight. I have travelled to Bangkok many times before, but this trip I learnt Thai Cooking in Sompong and it made me want to cook Thai Food at home, with the easy to follow recipe book given. I had a wonderful time learning from the expert Irin from our market tour, and cooking the all the wonderful Thai Recipes. Thanks so much Sompong for giving us a chance to learn from your school. Another thing is this school is very accessible in Silom and the classes are run 7 days a week. I will definitely attend your classes again on my next trip to Bangkok.

Cooking made fun. Great experience. The Sompong team made the class really fun and easy to follow. Good introduction to Thai cooking and South East Asia spices/herbs/veggies.Shared some basic cooking tips as well. Highly recommended.

Amazing. After arriving at the station to meet our instructor from another school (Silom), we were stood up by that school but asked Irin from Sompong who was there collecting her own students. She agreed without hesitation and we were so happy to join her class.The class itself was wonderful and very informative. The food was amazing. All of the staff were friendly, funny, and kind. Highly recommended. Thank you all so much for saving out morning

A great way to spend the day. My wife and I did the morning class and it was a great time. We chose this school based on TripAdvisor ratings and the fact that it is cheaper that the other top schools. It was also much closer to our hotel and on the BTS line. We were not disappointed. The staff were very pleasant and since we went in the morning, we also got a market tour. We cooked several dishes and they all turned out amazing. We left full and with take away. We would highly recommend this to other travelers. It was a great way to spend the morning.

Amazing family experience . Our booking was for a Friday morning. The class was from 09:30 - 13:30. It included a trip to the local market and the preparation of four dishes. The menu changes for each day so that may be something you want to check out.Irin was a great teacher. Very informative and delivered with a lovely sense of humour. Lots of great tips were shared throughout the day. The kitchens were all exceptionally clean and the supporting staff were all very helpful. We booked at the very last minute. The class was actually full when I tried to book initially but Nancy really helped us out here too. She rechecked all the bookings to try and fit us in. Luckily for us someone cancelled so we could be accommodated.All in all a great experience for the whole family and a wonderful way for us to conclude our stay in Bangkok.Recommendation: book early! This is a wonderful experience and it would be a shame for your family to miss out. We were very lucky to sneak in at the last minute.

Hesitation turned to satisfaction. Fantastic experience, led by Joy. Her and her staff, along with her aunt, run a great family business. The class was intimate, educational, friendly, and fun! The facility was very clean and the flow of the class was impeccable! I highly recommend. I've recently been to another cooking class in Chiang Mai and I would choose Sompong in Bangkok as the winner.

A great experience. Had a wonderful time at this cooking class. It is very well organised from the booking process to the end. The staff , especially Koy (our teacher) were excellent. You are very well looked after. We had a group of 17, split into small teams, which means the class is very hands on- you're going to properly cook and not just be the one in charge of chopping a carrot! Each student has their own cooking station. I loved making the spicy fruit salad- I experienced flavours I hadn't tried before and got to practise my tomato carving skills! I would throughly recommend the Sompong school, you even get a little tote bag and a cookbook which details all the ingredients needed for thai cooking along with pictures and written in thai and english. Can't wait to use my new knowledge at home. And to top it off the class is incredible value for money. You won't be disappointed and Kop Khun ka to everyone at the school!

Great experience . Really loved this cooking class! It was the best experience in Bangkok so far. The process of learning and cooking was amazing, the food was really delicious. Much better than any restaurants!! We are very happy we took this class, highly recommend it to everyone!

The best day. We chose Sompong from all the cooking schools offered and it was the best choice. All the arrangements were easy and managed extremely efficiently, for example the pick up at Chong Nonsi station worked like clockwork. The market visit was highly informative, both about Thai culture and ingredients. The cooking instructions were excellent, with lots of culinary tips and skills. The food was delicious, and the staff preparation and back up was first class. All the staff were very helpful and encouraging. It was thoroughly enjoyable and a really authentic taste of Thai food and culture.

Very good cooking experience. Cooking is nade simple with its comprehensive steos clearly explained. I was particularly impressed with the hans on exoerience and the dedicated cooking station fir us to cook our dish. Having out own cooking after class complete is simply a bonus when you take pride the delicious dishes you have orepared. Must try!

If not interested in Cooking, go there to eat amazing food!. I just loved this class, not only because the school was proffessional with good skilled and humorouse teachers. But I loved that we went to the marked to learn about the products we use in foodmaking, and mainly because this was the best food I had in Bangkok! Oh my god the red Curry they made here was unbelivable! I know the curry I will make home wont taste the same, but at least i know how to make my own now!And the price for the class is so affordable!

Great cooking class!. Teacher & staff are friendly, educated and helpful. They speak English too. Great class! We learned 4 dishes and also made our own home made red curry paste. They even helped me get a taxi back to the hotel. The trip to the market was informative. I had a question and sent them an email the night of the class and they answered me by morning! I really recommend this school!

Even my 9yo girl enjoyed it!. I booked the class with my 9yo girl just the afternoon before and it was no problem. As instructed we met at Chong Nonsi BTS at 9am and someone with a red apron took us to the school in a car not far fr the station. We started with a market visit. One of the staff Priya (?) explained and showed us in great details the different chillis, eggplants and gingers used by the locals, the difference between coconut cream and milk and lastly all those wet spices like palm sugar tamarind and shrimp paste. It was a great practical class! Back to the school, Koy the instructor taught us how to make creamy chicken curry, papaya salad, Phad Thai and banana in syrup. It was my girl's first attempt at cooking and she learned to cut and chop, scrap and fry, all under the close supervision of Koy and her team. The team worked seamlessly with her and used equipment and utensil were moved out of the way quickly and quietly so that everything looked very efficient and organized.Koy broke down the ingredients logically into dry and wet spices and taught us how to mix them in the most efficient order. She also peppered many cooking practical tips throughout the class and beginners will find them very useful. As a first time cook, I'm very glad my girl was learning all the good and safety habits from an expert like Koy! As a group of 3 or 4, we made the curry paste first. Koy then gave a demo on how to make the curry and let us have a taste. Thereafter we cooked our own using separate stove. Even my girl who was apprehensive abt the spices, followed Koy's amount of ingredients to a T because it suited her taste buds perfectly! After cooking the curry we moved back into the air conditioned room where we ate our first dish wif rice. Eating this first was a great move cos by then we were all famished!The highlight of making the papaya salad must be the making of the tomato rose. "It's not important but it makes your salad look expensive" she joked. Everyone oooaahh-ed at the completion of the beautiful rose. Even my girl can do that! We had a fun class, had a f.u.l.l. lunch and even packed the leftover back. We even got a goodie bag home as a souvenir.For 1000BHT per pax, the class was money well-spent. However I felt the experience would even better if the school would also provide the transport back to the BTS. In our case although we were given instruction to walk back but it was a fairly long and tiring walk in e hot mid-day sun.

Best experience in Bangkok!. I have just finished my meal at the Sompong Thai cooking school. The food was delicious! The woman (I'm not sure how to spell her name, I apologise) who led the class was attentive, helpful and a talented chef. Everything was very simple to understand and still produced amazing effects. I couldn't recommend this cooking school more, especially since it was the best price for 5 hours that I could find. The experience is laid back whilst also being highly stimulating, with an inclusive cooking book, coconut peeler and tour of a market, my day could not have been better. Go to this place!
Best cooking course ever!. The course was fantastic. We booked via phone yesterday and were picked up at the metro station. Irin was a great teacher and I would recommend the school any time!

Easy 5/5. Sompong Cooking school easily deserves a 5/5. The morning course starts with an excellent market tour with demonstrations and explanations of ingredients. This is followed by a well run course in a well equipped classroom. The staff are excellent and very informative. They explain, demo, then let you cook and help when needed. The support staff set everything up between food courses. The food is great and differs depending on the day you attend. This means you could go back for another course if you wanted. You generally cook about 4 meals per course but also get given a quality cookbook with their full range of meals. The course is seamlessly run and well worth the price. Will do again.

Fun, well worth going!. I love cooking, Thai food included, so I am not exactly a beginner, but still enjoyed the experience very much.The class starts with a visit to the local food market where you get the explanation of all the usual ingredients used in Thai cooking.After that, you go to one of the classrooms which has air-con and is very clean and cozy. The instructor is nice, has some assistants and lots of knowledge. The menu depends on the day, each day there are four dishes and one curry paste being prepared.I loved to see the proper way of preparing mango with sticky rice which I have made and eaten many times before, but here it tasted really great.It was an interesting experience for me because I have seen some details which kind of refreshed my memory.At the end of the class, you can either eat all the food that you have prepared, or take it to-go.Well worth a visit and with the price of 1000 THB very good value for Bangkok.

Fun and informative class. Excellent class to learn how to cook traditional Thai dishes. The trip to the wet market is very informative, and the recipes were very easy to follow so you can perfect your dishes easily. Teacher Koy was very friendly and gives very clear instructions step by step. Overall very fun and interactive. Highly recommended!

Fun and recommended!. My wife and myself are first time attending a cooking class in a vacation, it is a wonderful experience and both of us enjoying it very much.The class organize very well starting from pickup at the bus stop near the ChongNonSi BTS station, follow by the welcome drink and introduction of the class. Before the actual cooking start, they will bring you to the local wet market and introduce the ingredients to be use for the cooking. they will take care of all the ingredients to purchase and you would just need to listen and hang around and of course you can buy the extra ingredients if you plan to bring home.During the cooking class, Irin show us step by step of the cooking method. All the ingredients are well prepared by the staffs. The staffs are well prepared and very organize, excellent job to them! We like some cooking method teach by Irin, especially crafting the flower with tomato is quite express us(you will know how simple it is when you attending the class). We can't finish some of the dishes and it is pack well by the staff for us to bring back. (the food still taste good after 4-5 hours from the class).Overall, it is highly recommended and have fun!

Absolutely amazing!!. My friends and I had the most wonderful experience at Sompong, the staff was super friendly and helpful and the food was absolutely delicious. Our instructor was wonderful and very knowledgeable about Thai cuisine. I highly recommend Sompong Thai cooking school.

an enjoyable morning!. once more I visited your fine establishment and again I was confirmed - You run a great business and Irin did again do a great job.the helpers at the restaurant too makes it easy to visit you with my kids, who all three of them enjoyed their homecooked mealGo here - you will not be disappointed, and will have a great experience to take with you

Cooking Class. I loved this cooking class. It's nice that they give you a recipe book right when you come in, they tell you in advanced the menu and asked you if you have any allergies. The team is extremely nice and they keep track of you to make sure you don't ruin your own meal. Both cooking rooms have wifi and air conditioning. But get ready to get hot when you are cooking. The food taste was good they do it so that it's not too spicy and they tell you how to adjust accordingly. They also give you options of ingredients in other countries. As part of your class you get a tour of the market and an explanation of every ingredient that will be used in the recipe. For people that never wonder around market I think that's an awesome experience. I'm the type of person that love to explore around the market so this was right down my aisle. But it was definitely a plus to have somebody explain you what everything was. I usually try to go with a local to the markets but not everybody knows as much about cooking. But sompong cooking team definitely knows everything you need or want to know.

Great cooking school!. We went to Sompong Thai cooking school by recommendation of a friend. Honestly wasn't expecting it to be as amazing as it actually was!Super clean, good and extensive explanations, nice atmosphere, great staff and mostly...really amazing food!Worth the visit!

Great experience!! Bangkok highlight. As all the reviews say, this class met all of our expectations. Place is clean, staff is friendly, food was delicious. I emailed them two days before we took the class and they were very accommodating and able to get us on the schedule. The class was taught by Koy, who was a great teacher and super sweet. We made our own red curry paste, Thai omelette "salad", shrimp and pineapple curry, and chicken with basil. For dessert we made mango with sticky rice (a Thai classic). For beverages they provided Thai iced tea and lemongrass tea- both were delicious. At the end of the class they give you a canvas tote to take with you. You also get to take home a cook book with all of their recipes! They take cash only and the class costs $1,000 baht (about $30 USD) which was well worth the value. Highly recommend! No cooking experience is needed.
Highly recommended . Very good local experience. Every one should try.Getting to know more about Thai cooking and the local people in the market. Fun and educational.

Leaning how to cook Thai food. I have never done a cooking class before, but I have to say this was an awesome Thai experience.Firstly, they take you to the local food market to look at the Ingredients you will need, then with demonstrations and supervision from the staff, we got our hands dirty by preparing and cooking the dishes. The teachers were super helpful and I enjoyed every minute of this. You will have a great time meeting new people and cooking and eating all the delicious food you prepared.I highly recommend this place when you visit Bangkok, it has a great vibe and you will learn new skills from the very friendly staff. Thumbs up.

This is a great fun cooking class for all people and all ages.. Being a solo traveler I travel mostly for business or for FOOD. This half day class was the most well-spent time & the highlight of our trip in Bangkok. We have never cook so well.. We booked the class on 12th Apr 2016, Tuesday.As indicated in the website, we get to cook these dishes on Tuesday:(1) Chuu Chee Curry With Prawns(2) Home Made Red Curry Paste(3) Chicken Galangal In Coconut Milk Soup(4) Pomelo Salad(5) Mango With Sticky RiceA. BookingI made the enquiry using facebook messanger, but didn't get any reply. In desperation, I submit an online enquiry via Sompong Cooking School Website on 6th Apr & received a confirmation email 3 days later. The school admin kind enough to remind us to confirm if we have any food allergies.B. Getting ThereWe stayed at Eastin Grand Hotel Sathorn. It's only one BTS station away for us to travel from Surasak - Chong Nonsi. The admin informed us clearly to wait at Exit 3. There was a one way transport to take us to the school. In case we are late, the email also included a clear instruction on how to get there.C. Instructor KnowledgeThe teacher (Koy) speaks fluent English. She's very knowledgeable in showing us varies kind of vegetables & spices that we will be using in our cooking. Most importantly, she taught us how to pick the freshest ingredients. For those who are not familiar with Asian cooking, she explained it very clearly how to avoid the spicy chilli judging from its size, how to differentiate the herbs that has stronger scent, etc.D. A Trip To The MarketA visit to a local market is only available for the class in the morning session. Each of us was given a basket (to put the groceries in case we buy anything from the market) & a fan to cool us down from the heat in Bangkok. This is such a nice touch. More tips were shared by the teacher as we walked by the market stalls to purchase the fresh ingredients. The class fee include everything we need for the course. You only need to spend the money if you want to buy some ready-made spices in packets to take home & some yummy street foods along the way. Again, being a tourist, we were given 10 minutes to walk around & take photos.E. The CookingHygiene was practised throughout the course. Every basin is equipped with hand soap. Each of us wore an apron & a small towel was placed in the front pocket for us to wipe our hands. The teacher demonstrated the chopping, pounding, slicing techniques in order to avoid injury while handling the gadgets. After the teacher finished cooking a dish, each of us get to taste it. If we like the aroma (in term of sweetness, spiciness, salty taste, etc), then we just followed exactly the ingredients portion as shown. That will be our turn to cook our own dish. Kitchen assistants were there to observe how we prepared the dishes. They will jump in to help, but still leaving most of the cooking to us so that we could really learn from it. The cooking process was smooth. Everything was clean & put in place in a blink.F. EnvironmentThe class is air-conditioned, only the cooking place isn’t. When we were there, it made us felt like they’re our friends & family in Thailand.G. ConclusionThis half day class was the most well-spent time & the highlight of our trip in Bangkok. We have never cook so well.

Great cooking class. A great experience!. My husband and I were not sure which school to go with and in the end, we are so happy we chose Sompong. It was perfect for us! Super experience!. So great to be there, teaching style was great, learned a lot at the local market trip. Very friendly and yummy food. Highly recommended!

Awesome. The Best Thai Cooking School and truly an amazing Thai cooking experience. I’ve heard good review about this cooking school for a long time. feast for the eyes stomach and soul. My daughter(13) and I went to Sompong Cooking School as it was close to our accomodation and had a great menu ! Excellent, Excellent and More Excellent!. This is part two of my review of cooking schools in Bangkok and if you have not read my review of the horrid Silom Thai Catastrophe, um Cooking School, perhaps you should. Therefore and without further ado....If you're in Bangkok and if you want to ave a delightful day, take a class at Sompong Thai Cooking School. Clean, neat, and staffed by professional, courteous staff, it is a wonderful way to liven up your vacation.I won't bore you with the details of how I wound up there, but suffice it to say I am glad that I didn't waste a single second longer at the school I had originally visited. Not only were they drops of time I'll never recover, they also represented time I didn't get to spend at Sompong Thai Cooking School (STCS). I wandered in unannounced and was immediately greeted by Irin, a wonderful young lady who--as luck would have it--was to be our teacher for the day. I explained the situation to her and she said that it was no problem, the class had not started and that when the other students arrived, we would go to the market. Then she offered me coffee or tea and naturally, being an Ugly American and all, I chose coffee. Within just a few minutes, the rest of the students arrived and off we went to the market. The next hour or so was spent wandering around the market with our little baskets, looking at this, smelling that and listening to our guide explain the differences between curries, spices, types of ginger and a host of other useful and fascinating information regarding cooking in general and Thai cooking in particular, then it was back to the school to try our hands at it.Irin was waiting for us when we returned and the next three hours were spent listening to her unpack a veritable cornucopia of knowledge and cooking wisdom, all the while smiling and laughing and in general just oozing good will and joie de vivre. She is a true delight.She let me volunteer to stir the sticky rice (I did it wrong) and also rescued my tomato when I was trying to make a little flower from the skin. It was a massacre in the making, but after her intervention, looked quite passable. I think I have a photo to post. The individual students in the class cooked Mango sticky rice, Pad Thai, a chicken curry and something else which escapes me. Regardless, it was all good and we wolfed it down like a last meal. Obey me. You will go to Sompong Thai Cooking School and take a class. You will be glad you did.
Good experience. Learning Thai food cooking at Sompong school is very good. The teacher teach clearly and easily to understand. It's worth to come.
Reviews are true . I can't really add anything to what has been said. I went here last Sunday for the morning class and time just flew by. Great teachers and staff, great food, just a must do.

Terrific fun!. Hard to say much more about this place that hasn't already been said in other reviews but honestly it's an amazing experience, thoroughly professional and easy to see why it has been rated so highly on TA. Lots of fun, great people, useable cooking insights and even I managed to make something that tasted great!

Excellent!!. Me and my boyfriend had such a great time!After reading the reviews I had high expectation from this course, and it actually got even better then I expected!The staff was very professional and knowledgable, and the atmosphere was so relaxing! Great value for money. Defiantly recommend it!!!

Great learning experience . Firstly would like to thank Ms Koy for the wonderful experience during the class and Ms Nancy for the tour in the market. The clear explanation of each ingredient in the market trip has really been beneficial. We were also taught how to differentiate what's fresh, and not, and the food taught by Ms Koy was pretty awesome. With the detailed cook book given, it definitely helps us to remember the steps more easily.

Excellent staff and food - very family friendly and great value for money. We a great mix of people visiting this cooking school and were very happy with the whole of the day. The staff were really good at helping with the kids and baby - if the parents had to step out of the class to help the children, the staff stepped in and continued the cooking for the parent, so they could join right up and continue without being left behind. The market was great to visit and we learned a lot of new things about Thai ingredients and the difference to European ingredients. Looking forward to revisit.
Excellent!. Good price and fun! The teacher explained clearly and you will visit local market with happy experience there!

Excellent family activity. The class was well organised and there is a free pickup from a BTS metro station. Starts off with a trip to the local market, where the chef will introduce to you the various key ingredients used in Thai cooking. After buying the fresh ingredients, you proceed for class. Typically, four dishes are introduced. The pace of instruction is slow and steady. There are ample helpers to assist if you run into cooking issues. The instructors speak good English and are patient. The classroom is well equipped and clean. Would strongly recommend.

Excellent Visit! . Amazing experience with Koy, along with Nancy and Tang! I felt like I was at home; no pressure if I wasn't able to do preparations perfectly, and best of all, everybody learned how to cook our dishes well. Definitely a great place to be in if you want to learn cooking Thai!

Worth a visit! . Koy, Nancy and the staff was very friendly and helpful in sharing not only the Thai cuisines recipe but also knowledge about local culture and cooking techniques. Strongly recommend for those who has passion for Thai food and I will recommend this course to my friends too!

I've taken cooking classes in many countries, but this was the best! Organized, paced well, outstanding instruction!. It was my first time to Bangkok and it for business. I had one free day and I wanted to take a cooking class. I googled cooking classes and this one had great reviews. I can see why! They were amazing - from detailed instructions to find the place, to the level of organization, the cookbook with colored photos and pronunciation guides, but the instructor was just lovely! What a fun day - and delicious food!

Great experience, great food!. My wife and I decided to join the Sompong cooking class as a last minute decision during our trip to Bangkok. The staff from the cooking school are very friendly and professional. We felt welcome and looked after the whole time. The school is very clean and each person gets their own cooking station. We really enjoyed visiting the market place with Nancy, we learned a lot about the core ingredients needed to make good thai food. After the market visit we learned to make several dishes with Koy where she explained and showed us the techniques, followed by us making the dishes ourselves. The food we made was very good. Probably some of the best we had while we were in Thailand. Overall we were very pleased with our experience. We will definitely return and I will recommend this cooking school to my friends and family!

A Perfect Culinary Experience. First time to attend a culinary short course in Bangkok with a group and it was such an amazing experience. Chef Koy was a perfect teacher with a lot of patience...she taught us well from choosing the right ingredients, to marketing and preparation. It was such a homey ambience and the bonus part is, you will eat what you cooked!! ... From Tom yum soup, to papaya salad, green curry chicken, and sticky rice with sweet manggo..it was indeed a perfect gastronomic experience!

Awesome experience to learn thai cooking . Attentive service :)Organized teaching and presentation Approachable team and always accommodating to needs Cooking is effortless and great satisfaction as recipes are easy to follow and fool proof :)

Fantastic!. Wow, what an incredible experience. The class ran from 9:30am till 2:00pm, it started with a short walk over to the local street market where our hostess/owner Chotika Bungarat explained the differences between al the local vegetables & spices. We then headed back to the school which was clean & offered individual cook stations for each student. Each student prepared and cooked Mussaman Curry with Chicken, Tom Yum Prawn Soup, Chicken Fried Rice and Sweet Sticky Rice with Mango. This is a family owned and operated business who formerly owned a restaurant but the current generation decided to do cooking classes instead. Next time I'm back in Bangkok I'll be attending again as the menu changes daily.

Perfect School, Perfect Price!!!!. If you are in Bangkok and want to learn how to cook authentic Thai food and have a great time too, please book with Sompong Thai Cooking School. They are the truth. I got a last minute reservation, and I almost missed the driver at the BTS station where they pick you up. I am so happy I saw him at the last minute. They take you to the market first, and then you cook the foods you learn about. It was a great experience. A 10 out of 10. The food was excellent and the price was very reasonable at 1000 BHT. The next time I am in Bangkok, I will go to another class for sure.

Excellent Way to Spend a Morning. During an early October visit to Bangkok I had the pleasure of attending a cooking class at Sompong cooking school. The good reviews this place gets on TripAdvisor are accurate. It was an overall excellent experience. Irin was our hostess/instructor and did a great job. It was an easy place to find via BTS and, as promised two young gentlemen in red aprons were waiting for the various class participants and us and drove us to the nearby cooking school, which was about a 5-10 minute walk (no transportation was provided at the end of the class so I had to walk! If it wasn't so humid, it would have been a nice walk.) After arriving and having some refreshments, we went to the nearby market. It was a nice touch that they provided baskets and a hand fan--yes, it was hot and humid the day I did this class. We learned all about the various vegetables and fruits and saw how curry paste and coconut cream and coconut milk were made. There also was time to buy a few Thai cooking items--much cheaper than I saw later in my trip. We returned to the school and began preparing four dishes: a red curry with pineapple and shrimp, a Thai omelet appetizer, a stir fry chicken, and my favorite--mango sticky rice. Everything was extremely well planned and fairly easy to prepare. Irin and her assistants did a good job moving things along. At the end of the class, they gave us a cookbook with the recipes we made and more....that, and eating the tasty dishes we prepared made this a very economical day as I probably would have spent nearly the amount I paid for the course eating in a restaurant and I can guarantee the food would not have been that good or buying a Thai cookbook. The place was super clean and they offered plenty of water and tea so one did not get dehydrated. If you are looking for a cooking school in Bangkok, I definitely recommend Sompong. They vary their menus too so if I go back to Thailand, I would try them again.

Authentic, attentive, all-inclusive. Spent a wonderful day with Koy learning how to cook outstanding Thai specialties. We have taken cooking classes all over the world, but Sompong Thai cooking school is the most well organized and educational that we have participated in. They create the textures of Thailand with a visit to the market, and a hands on cooking experience

Definitely the best choice. When we first stepped in the classroom, everything is well-prepared. They provided drinks and cookies for the hot weather. All the staffs smiled like old friends and family that made you feel really good. Later, they showed us the local market and introduced the details of the ingredient we used that day. Per the cooking, they had everything organized that you could follow each steps easily. I don't cook at my house, but I made really tasty food here :) Overall, they provide more than you expect. Finally, I would like to thank the Sompong family to have this wonderful cooking class. I will never think of a second choice if I want a cooking class in BKK. I also promise to come here again when I'm in BKK.

BEST COOKING SCHOOL IN BANGKOK. The best cooking school that we have been to in Bangkok. When visiting Bangkok we always go to a cooking school. Somp0ng has been the best so far. Value for money to easy to get to ( short way from MRT ) pick up from station available friendly staff and best of all we learned new things about Thai cooking.Go book for a class you won.t be disappointed.

One of our best experience in Bangkok. It's an interesting and delicious Thai Cooking class experience. Highly recommended if you're a foodie . A great experience and would definitely come back for more cooking sessions.

A great Thai Cooking Class Experience . I love Thai food & attending Sompong Thai Cooking School has given me the skills to cook my favorite dishes at home! Easy to book just go online book via email they will send you a confirmation email, no need to pay upfront you pay cash at the end of the cooking class. Very well organized, easy to locate, friendly & full of knowledge, English is very good (with a Thai accent) Upon arrival you are offered cold or hot Thai tea & pineapple biscuits what you wait for everyone to arrive, you the head to the market to buy the produce we are going to cook with & are given a detailed explanation on the different types of Thai vegetables we will use & what the alternatives are if you can't find them in your country! But before we leave we are given a basket, a fan & a bottle of water for our market tour. Upon arriving back we get into cooking we cooked about 5 different dishes including 1 dessert & got to eat it along the way or at the end if you were full you could take it away. Bottled water & cold Thai tea available for you to help yourself through the class. You get a printed linen shopping bag to keep aswell as a detailed recipe book with not just the recipes we cooked on the day but other traditional recipes too! A great experience especially for a solo traveller where you can meet like minded people. 1000 baht per person

Sompong - A dream come true. I'm a keen amateur home cook and was looking forward to this , was joined by my partner that till this trip had not had much Thai food. It was the highlight of the trip for her and a very good time for me the facilities were homely , it a joins their home , but that adds a nice touchKoy the presenter has good English and is very enthusiastic and that is infectous and she tried to educate about Thai cooking and achievable stuff ie(packet mixes , alternatives, quick and easy versions etc ) not just teach you how to cook one meal This course went for close to 4 hours and cost something like $40 Australianand you eat the meal you create fantastic value , great time and I would encourage tourists to put this type of thing on their travel intinery , look at the reviews for this class and others hardly a negative There is a different menu each day of the week, I'll certainly consider for my next visitSompong is supposed to mean a dream come true

They made me an expert!. I have returned to this Thai Cooking School four times with visitors as I really cannot fault the staff and the cooking classes they run so well. In a very professional manner their customers are guided through the approx. 4.5 hour class, beginning with refreshments, a brief outline of how things will run; and then its a 5min walk to the local market. Then the very competent and good English speaking guides provide information about the various spices, fruits, veges where you are able to smell and touch each one, then a tour through the market. I won't go into too much detail as half the fun is wondering what is going to happen, but rest assured you will not be disappointed. Each person has their own workstation and gas burner so no watching other people do the business. Thank you so much, my last four visitors had a wonderful morning and even better evening eating all the goodies they brought home with them.

fun and interesting cooking class experience for beginners!. my husband and i were here in June 2015, its our first time in thailand and we both love thai food. i am interested in cooking but he is only interested in eating, but i still convinced him to come to the half day cooking class with me. let's just say that this cooking class really boost his confidence of cooking when he sees the result! The class was very fun, we were taken to the local market to get to know thai veggies & spice/herbs. we were also shown how fresh coconut milk& cream was produced.we were then given a 4 course menu, consist with classic thai dishes. everyday is a different menu so you can check their site to pick the day of the menu that you are most interested. the first curry dishes was collaboration with your team, and the rest will be do it yourself. the instructor have a good sense of humour, it has a good atmosphere throughout the whole time. we learned some thai cooking techniques, veggies crafting, it was easy and fun! and the result was great, really tasted much better than restaurant!!! we were then able to eat what we've made there or with the option of take them home. if you plan to eat there, i would suggest to really have a very small breakfast. as you will be having curry+rice dish+soup or salad+ dessert, the portion sizes looks very small in the plate but it was quite full filling.

Such a wonderful experience!. I initially planned to do a cooking class in Chiang Mai, but then I had time on my hands in Bangkok so I did some research and based on Trip Advisor I decided to take a class at Sompong's Cooking School. Best decision ever!! They teach a different menu every day and so you can choose what you want to cook based on the day you come. Just look on their website for the menu. I went on Friday (or Thursday?!) and the menu was awesome: Massanam curry, tom yam soup, fried rice and mango sticky rice. I was picked up at the BTS station as promised and we were driven to the school. The staff was so nice and welcoming. The classroom we were cooking in was simple, homey and beautiful. Our teacher, Irin, was wonderful, with a great sense of humour and speaking absolutely fluent English. She explained the whole process first and then we cooked our dishes following her directions. And the outcome was so so good!!! The only thing that we did not cook by ourselves was the mango sticky rice but that did not bother me a bit. The class consisted of 10 ppl and Irin had an assistant teacher who was always ready to help. In the end you get a cookbook with all the recipes (not just those you cooked on your chosen day) as well as pictures and description of the ingredients. All in all, you can't go wrong with this cooking school. It's an amazing value for money and you not only have a wonderful experience but can also impress your friends and family at home with some great Thai dishes! :) Also, if you are a solo traveler, don't worry and just go. Special thanks to Irin's assistant teacher: I forgot some things in the classroom and he ran almost all the way to the BTS station to catch me and give me my stuff! Thanks so much!!

Very good cooking class . They have a very good hospitality, they took us to the market, tought us different types of Thai vegetables, spices and coconut processingBack to school we did like four or five different dishes, perfect taste, gave us some gifts and tye cooking book with more recipes than we cooked in the class,Thank you, it was a great time and pleasure meeting you

Good for novice cook. I have very limited cooking skills, but very helpful instructors were there to guide every step of the way.The staff was friendly and professional, and the food turned out amazing. Even better than many of the finer Bangkok restaurants I've tried so far!For only a 1000baht I had a great time, and also made a four course meal which would be enough to feed 2 people.Also a bonus was learning about and smelling/trying the different ingredients, and what role they have in dishes.Just be warned that you will probably have to spend the afternoon resting after overeating. :)
A must thing to do in Bangkok!. It was a wonderful experience learning and dining Thai authentic dishes! The outcome was so yummy! I thoroughly enjoyed every detail of the class. Good Job!

Great cooking class. Definitely recommended. The staff was great, the class was very well organised and well run, and most importantly the food was delish! It is quite hands on which was good. The rooms were also very clean but still had personality.

Local Experience!. The cooking school would start with bringing you to the market for the morning session, introducing you different kinds of ingredients which Thai would use. Then to allow you to shop around the market for what you want to bring home.After that it would go back to the cooking school and start cooking. Not all dishes to be cooked by you and some of the stuff are prepared already. However, during the intensive 3-4 hours you would be able to know what's inside and how to cook at least 3-4 thai dishes.Fun experience!

Authentic Thai cookery course. I lived in Bkk for many years, and wanted to experience an authentic Thai cookery course. This course was excellent. Informative, detailed, welcoming, and such attention to detail, from the market visit, the cookery instruction, to the behind the scenes clearing up. We got to watch how the dishes are made, then it was our turn to prepare and cook. We tasted the original dish, and could then amend our own dishes to our own taste, according to how spicy we liked our food. Brilliant course, delicious dishes and great cookery booklet to take home. Book it now.
Best cooking class in Bangkok! . My friend and I loved this class it was very interactive and the teachers were great. Felt very one on one even with a group.

Excellent cooking class and teacher + staff. This was so much fun to do in Bangkok. The school was 4-5 min. away from where I was statying (Cooper Hostel). The price was more than ok, considering the class lasts about 4h, you learn to cook delicious food and you get to eat it.. oh and you get a recipe book (with all the recipies, not just the ones you did on that day). You should go before (or maybe check their website) to see what recipies she is teaching each day and then book according to your taste. All along we could dring free lemon ice tea and the room had fans. The staff was amazing and always willing to help and they were really patient. The teacher was amazing and so funny! If you want to do a that cooking class, I really recommend you book here.

Everything was just perfect. Me and my boyfriend enjoyed every minute and every bite we had during this wonderful cookingclass. In about 4 hours you will learn how to make 4 delicious thai dishes and the crew is just super friendly. I would recommend this cooking class to everyone!!

Best cooking school experience so far.... Lotsmof insider tips, tips you won't find in text books... Like the expiration dates of your coco sugar and such... The best part is that the food you are cooking tastes far better than the same ones you order in the street or food arcades. It's cheap and the icing? Free gift and free recipe booklet.

Sompong Thai cooking school. This was literally the highlight of my trip to Bangkok . I went to this course with my daughter who is 12 years old ( absolutely suitable for a child of that age who has done some baking/ cooking previously ). This course is planned and organised brilliantly . The directions to get there are very clear - we asked our taxi driver to call the school directly . He was given instructions and we got there promptly. The course was taught by Irin who was thorough and humerous at the same time. An absolute pro. The attention to detail is outstanding . We each had our own cooking station , equipment , utensils, aprons - all perfectly laid out . It felt like you were cooking in someone's quaint kitchen . The dishes used were beautiful . Everything from the trip to the market, to the demonstration of how coconut milk is made , to the demo of how to carve your own rose from a tomato - it was all brilliant . We cooked 4 of our own dishes .I am confident that I can now cook Thai food well. Absolutely outstanding experience !! Thank you !

The best thing you can do in Bangkok. The Sompong Thai Cooking School is by far the best experience you will have in Bangkok if you're a bit of a food fan.The staff are all very happy to help you with anything, are extremely friendly and always on hand to offer some tips without making you feel embarrassed to seek aid.The menu is constantly changing day by day and the chance to go to a local market and learn about Thai ingredients is a wonderful experience. I would recommend it above all other activities and schools, simply because the personal touch and the atmosphere is a perfect harmony of relaxation, fun and learning.
An absolute joy. Fun, friendly, informative and unbelievable value for money. The menu was mouthwatering and our teacher, Irin, was just brilliant. I'd go every day if I could!

Don't miss it if you are fan of learning cooking . Great experience with a viber team. Excellent teaching and good organisation too, you discover all the vegetables ingredients you are going to cook at the market. The explanations are clears and demonstratives, the time is also enough for each meals. Finally, the dishes were fabulous and very tasty . Even best that you can eat at the restaurant. I did the cook lessons with my friends, we really had a good time. It's entirely worth to experience.

Clean, Easy and Relaxing Hands-on Experience. Location: Near the city, easy access by taxi.Service: Great service, very helpful teacher and assistants. Environment: Very clean, except a few flies that were unavoidable. Indoor air-conditioned classroom for introducing ingredients and preparing them. Outdoor sheltered kitchen for demonstration and cooking by ourselves.Food: Good taste, great concept to let us each cook our own dishes and have a meal afterwards with our end products.Communication: Good English in general.Experience:Four of us (1 adult, 3 teens) found this school on TripAdvisor and contacted them through email. At first only a morning session was available, which we couldn't make it, but they arranged an afternoon session just for four of us. We love Thai fruit, and they were kind enough to purchase mangosteen and durian for us. Our menu included Green Papaya Salad, Green Curry with Chicken, Stir-fried Chicken with Cashews, and Mango Sticky Rice.Everything were in sets. We each had one apron, one chopping board, one knife, one set of ingredients for each dish.The teacher first explain the ingredients that are rarely seen, such as Thai herbs and baby eggplants. Then she demonstrated how to chop them and the respective seasoning, and cooked once in front of us. Then we cut the ingredients by ourselves and cook them, with the help of assistants if we need them.After one dish is cooked, they cover it for later use. When all dishes are cooked and reheated, they provided us with rice noodles and rice, and we sat to eat dinner. It was a wonderful hands-on experience to learn some Thai cooking, and it was satisfying to eat the dishes cooked by ourselves.Overall speaking, this cooking class is a must-go for people who are interested in the Thai culinary culture, or want something that is beyond the mundane shopping and eating.

Extraordinary experience of traveling in Bangkok . If you can spend half day to Lear how to cook Thai cuisines, that will open a new window for you to know what's real Thai cuisines taste like.The teachers are friendly and with passion to interact with students.Let you understand each ingredient in Thai cuisines. And the learning kitchen is very comfortable.The most important is the dishes you made by yourself are extremely yummy than all this food you've tried before.Strongly recommend!

Great experience. Everything was good about the day, I really enjoyed going to the market and learning about the Thai fruit and vegetables. We then returned and were taught well how to make each dish in stages. Putting the learning into practice was easy as there were several helpers in the class to assist in clearing up and checking our progress. The curry was lovely and the Phad Thai was different from anything I had made before. I enjoyed the papaya salad and the mango was a delight - not to be eaten too often! I was able to get most of the ingredients back home and try to recreate the meals. Many thanks for a great time.

Great Experience & Fabulous Cooking Adventure. On our First Day in Thailand we went to this fabulous cooking school.First they give You a Basket & we all walked to the local food Market near by.The Teacher explained to us about the different fruits & vegetables that we will get for our cooking school!We were a nice group of people from all over the world:Europe, China, USA & Hong Kong.After buying all the Fresh Food that we needed for our cooking experience, we walked back to the class.We introduced ourselves & started cooking.....!The Chief instructed us & we followed!Pad ThaiSalmonSticky Rice & more!It was a Wonderful Experience & a thoughtful way to get people together in a peaceful manner!Highly Recommended!By the way: after cooking & at the End of the Class we actually ate sampled the Food & it Was Excellent !!!

You won't regret it!. My boyfriend and I booked last minute to do their Friday cooking course as the menu looked delicious. Already big fans of Tom Yum Gung, we were eager to learn how to make it. When you arrive you are warmly welcomed and offered cold sweet tea or water, and invited to explore the school and take photos. When everyone is settled in, you are briefed about what you will be doing that day. We were taken to the markets to learn all about Thai ingredients and vegetables, and enjoy an authentic market experience. I can honestly say I learned a lot! Back at the school, you are allocated individual cooking stations and taken through each dish which you cook yourself! Everything is clean and easy to understand and execute thanks to the amazing staff. When it came time to eat the meals we had created we were blown away by how good they were. The Chicken massaman, Tom yum Gung and fried rice were the BEST we had in Bangkok thanks to Sompong's recipe. We were too full to eat our mango sticky rice, so the staff kindly packed it for us and we enjoyed it the next morning (it was amazing). It was great value for money. Thank you so much for this wonderful experience, we would recommend it to absolutely anybody of any age and experience level who seeks to have fun and eat some incredible food.

The Best Experience!. The teacher, the staff, the environment. Everything was good. I enjoyed the class. The teacher took us to a local market and gave us a quick preview of some thai spicy. We got a chance to do some shopping in the market and trust me, you can always get the best price in local market. I had a bag of mangosteens which was cheap and delicious.You can meet different people from all over the world. Come and try something different from other tourists do.

Amazing hands-on Thai cooking experience. Cooking class at Sompong Thai Cooking School is one of the best and most memorable experiences during my stay at Bangkok. The school is clean and organized, and we were driven to the school. We had an in-depth tour of the market where Irin shows us all the spices, vegetables and curries used in the class. There were refreshments when we finished the market tour, and each dish was demonstrated, and all of us having our own cooking stations to make our pad thai and red curry. (The mortar and pestle was shared among students). The staff are friendly and helpful. The staff are very accommodating with one table for us who have nut allergies so we can recreate the same dishes, and food can be packed if you can't finish. Amazing experience, wonderful customer service and cookbook and bag at the end were wonderful attention to detail to top it off.

Best Cooking class ever in Thailand. I stayed in Bangkok for 7 days during June 19th~25. I attended Sompong June 21th morning and Silom June 24th Thai cooking class. I highly recommended Sompong Cooking class for below reasons as I tried other Hotel cooking class. Sompong is the best ever.1. Pick up and transfer from BTS Chong Nansi Exit 3 which is quite easy for students and transfer from there to school. Arrive school, we have icy drinks and basket and bamboo fan so we won`t feel too hot going to traditional market. Comparing to this, Silom`s pick up location is quite not easy2. Teacher Irin explains all the Thai herbs in details and tell us what we are going to use in which dishes. Silom just show these are herbs and smell it, not explain in detail.3. when cooking, Sompong Teacher Irin really explains in all the details for every dishes and notice you how you cook to make dishes taste well and all ingredients presents beautiful. Silom only focus on ingredients presentation which makes your photos look beautiful.4. For the same 5 dishes, we in Sompong works for 4 hours but in Silom, it only took 2.5 hours to finish. 5. I forgot my recipe book in Sompong. When I go back, they find it for me named Doris. Lovely.I highly recommended to go to Sompong and will book again this class next time when I visit Bangkok. I will skip Silom. Silom is suitable for persons who only want to SEE how to make Thai dishes instead of exploring and learning Thai cooking. I highly recommend teacher Irin in Sompong.

Hands down the best Thai cooking experience in Bangkok. I have been to other Thai Cooking Schools and Sompong Thai Cooking School hands down is the best. Not expensive and very organised. Koy has excellent english and has a great sense of humour. We were met at the BTS exit and driven to the school. The school is very clean and well organised. Refreshments are offered upon arrival. Water and a hand fan is provided while at the market (which can be very hot) The market is clean and not over crowded. Koy makes every person feel a valued customer and provides times for questions and to explore the market. Back at the school there is plenty of staff to help with the smooth running of the class. Everyone prepared and cooked their own food in their own cooking space, not always the case in Thai cooking schools. I learned so much from Koy, as she gave advice about storage periods for curry pastes, Thai ingredients and handy hints to other aspects of Thai cooking. Everything has been well thought out and is executed extremely professionally. If you can't eat all your cooked 4 course meal (I certainly couldn't) it is packaged for you to takeaway. I was completely impressed with how much attention to detail has been thought of at this school. Definitely a must while in Bangkok.

So much fun!!. My cousin and I LOVE thai food and were so happy to get spots in this cooking class at such short notice. It's ranked very highly and we quickly understood why! The staff was SO friendly, they came and greeted us at the train station and drove us to the cooking school, where they had fresh cold Thai tea for us. Once everyone assembled we were given baskets and fans and water to take to the market with us, where teacher Koy gave us a tour and showed us all the essential ingredients that go into Thai food. She was so informative, and so funny! We got a bit of time to explore, and then headed back to the school to start our lessons. The format was extremely organized. The staff works together in a really cohesive way and everything was super clean. I am a complete amateur when it comes to cooking but teacher Koy made it very easy for us to follow along. The food we learned to make was amazing, and she even taught us how to make our dishes presentable! Our menu was chicken panang curry, pad thai, mango with sticky rice, and papaya salad. All of it was phenomenal. I would highly recommend this class to anyone looking for a fun activity to do while in Bangkok!

Highlight of my trip. The three of us really enjoyed cooking with Sompong Thai Cooking School. The menu was great and our teacher Irin was very sweet and professional. All the staff working there was very helpful and we were very well looked after. The course itself costed 1000 thai batt, it is great value for money and we were so full we didn't eat until 10 pm that day. We were picked up at the BTS station and were given a lift to the school where we settled for a couple of minutes before getting to the local market.Water and a fan was given to us which I found to be considerate. The market tour was great, Irin showed us different ingredients that would be used in Thai cooking and we were given some time to shop for curry paste, thai tea and different sauces. The price at the market are quite abit cheaper than big c. After we got back from the market, we started to make food and the teaching was fun and spontaneous. Everything felt very natural and nothing was force. It was really refreshing.Refreshments were provided throughout the course and I loved the lemongrass tea.We ate all the food we cooked and the school also provided sticky rice and really nice thai rice noodles for us to eat with the curry. What was really impressive was how clean everything is, the floor was clean, the chopping board was clean. After each dish, the chopping board would be replaced with a new one together with the knife. Raw meat was put into small plastic bag and not once did my hands touched them while cooking. This goes to show how well they organize everything. The whole experience was great and I will recommend this to everyone who will visit Bangkok. You don't have to be an expert in cooking to join, anyone can do it.
Friendly staff and great food!. The one that you shouldn't miss in Bangkok!So in love with the food and staff here.A tour and introduction of local market and cookbook included.

No need to go out for Thai anymore!. We'd seen the tourist sights before in Bangkok and were looking for something different to do but still be immersed in the Thai culture. This cooking class was wonderful and certainly gave us an opportunity to engage through the Thai cuisine. Online booking was easy and response times excellent. Irin, our instructor, was confident, warm, and very competent in english. The facilities were spotlessly clean and other staff very efficient and helpful. The food we cooked was delicious and we can reproduce it and other dishes at home through the excellent cookbook we were given which also suggests substitution ingredients. Definitely delivered what was promised and exceeded expectations.

Better than 5 star restaurants. We've been to severall top thai restaurants during our stay in Bangkok and we have not tasted anything similar to the food we've cooked by ourselvs in the sompong clases. A dynamic hands on class with great teachers and assistants - an example of warm profesional service. It was a wonderfull experience and we highly recommend it. The place may look simple in the photos, however when you get here you fell like you on a simple but beautifull place which makes you feel like you are on a typical thai home - very clean and charming. On the top of that, the money you will spend is worth it. You will have about 4 spectacular dishes and also a recipe book including many others.

The food cooked here tastes better than restaurants outside!. I'm a noob in cooking but under the guidance of Koy, the food tastes so good! I'm not a fan of curry but the one that the school has taught tasted great! My favourite was the chicken fried rice, it was easy to cook and delicious. You don't have to be an experienced cook to come here, everything here is taught from scratch and very educational indeed. Definitely worth going, i know i'll be back the next time i'm in Bangkok!

Unique experience!. I like the menu which was more unique than another cooking school that I was looking at. Our teacher Irin explains clearly throughout the session and the assistant would come around to check each persons' progress. Some dish require a group effort but it was alright but the experience of cooking your own meal and the process and outcome of the cooking bonds is enjoyed by everyone especially with my friends!!Bought some local ingredients like sticky rice and pastes so that I can cook them when I go back home! Would certainly recommend this homely place for anyone interested in doing something unique besides shopping!

Yum food and very organized cooking experience!. So this was my first cooking class and I have to say, this was pretty awesome. Koy was a knowledgeable and well-spoken. The only reason it's getting a 4/5 is because I'm comparing it to the class I took in Chiang Mai - which I preferred, sorry Koy! >_<You get picked up bright and early from a convenient location (like at the bottom of a subway stop on street level). Tip: confirm the exact pick-up location. We weren't sure if we were looking for someone at the platform level, at the bottom of the steps, maybe the bottom of the other steps... anyways we luckily found our driver and off we go!
