You arrive at this building - the outside is where the cooking is done and inside behind closed doors and blessed AC is where the prep and eating is done. You get a quick intro (and a mini snack with refreshing iced tea) before it's off to the markets. Everyone gets a fan and a basket (Koy puts a different ingredient in each person's basket) and Koy talks about what to look for in coconuts, the differences in curry powders, uses of different kinds of chilies, etc. You then wander the market for a bit and you can buy stuff from the vendors for your own consumption.You head back to the building and start prepping. Each ingredient will be divided equally into separate bowls and you"ll be given instructions on what to do - e.g. cut, chop, pound. The most difficult thing for me was the use of an actual gas stove top & wok, especially for the phad thai. There were guys standing around to help you but I found they were laughing at me more than being helpful T__T All things considered though, the food turned out great! Hurray! In the end, we ate: Panaeng Chicken Curry, Phad Thai, Papaya Salad, and Golden Banana in Syrup (dessert); the dessert was made by the helpers of the cooking school while we prepped our ingredients. I just wished we could have skipped the Papaya salad. It was a big bowl and I didn't care much for it.  Once everything is all said and done, you leave with an extremely full stomach, happy taste buds, and a booklet of the recipes you just learned. Unfortunately, you have to find your own way home from the cooking school, so be sure to ask for directions :(

Very good experience! . The cooking school was absolutely great. Irim took us to the market place and explained about all ingredients for the menu. The coconut pressing machine was funny! The cooking room was perfectly suited with all facilities and Irim explained very well how to prepare the dishes. She was a great and funny teacher. One of the best things I did in Bangkok and one of the best Thai meals I had. The cooking book you get to take home is very useful.

Excellent. This Thai cooking school was excellent, after going to the market where our great guide Irin explained all the local ingredients and how to find them we cooked 4 dishes, her explanation of how to do everything was clear and helpful and it all tasted delicious, we would definitely go back on another day to learn how to cook some other dishes, a must for any Bangkok trip!

Fantastic day. I visited Sompong thai cooking school for the Friday class. It was an intimate class of 4 people and our host Nancy was perfect. Very good at teaching us how to cook the Thai dishes and also very welcoming, friendly and funny. The food was exceptional and it was a fun day. Going to the market and picking the ingredients was lovely and Nancy explained the flavours and use of the ingredients.

Attended a cooking class.. I love Thai cuisine and wanted to know the basic Thai cooking and ingredients. After attending Thursday class I was really immpressed by the class. I think I had the best meals during the visit in Bangkok. Highly recommend for those who loves Thai food and love to cook. I'll be going back for more lessons in my future visits. Thanks the Sompong team for giving us such a wonderful experience.

Great day, great people and great food.. Been back 5 times and enjoyed every visit. Koy and Irin are both great teachers with a good understanding of English. The market visits are informative. The teaching is fun, well supervised, patient and authentic as the girls second generation cooks. I asked about a dish that they weren't teaching and after class they secured the ingredients and taught me 1:1, how good is that? Also good meeting other nationalities and generally having a fun day. I would recommend Sompong cooking lessons to anyone who has 5/6 hours to spare in Bangkok.

Great Thai cooking class .... Very well organised, the session starts off with a visit to the local market to purchase some of the ingredients to be used in the class, after around half an hour at the market we headed back to the classroom to begin cooking our 3 course meal - complete with mango sticky rice, yum! We also learned to make red curry paste from scratch which was an added bonus. Our instructor was Irin, she was fantastic and her English is really good and easy to understand ... thank you Irin! I had my 2 children with me (aged 12 and 10 years) and they thoroughly enjoyed the experience as well! I'd highly recommend this cooking school, it's clean, well run, very reasonably priced and they use the freshest ingredients. An awesome way to experience the culinary side of Bangkok!

Awesome experience!. This cooking school is absolutely amazing! We booked it already before we came to Bangkok and i came to this place with a good feeling because they made you feel welcome already with the mails. The whole experience is very good organised and the staff is really friendly. The cooking school is a family business and you can feel that as everyone is very nice and caring. The food we prepared was better than any Thai-Food you can get in my country and they made the whole lession easy to understand. I also really appreciated that they told you what alternatives to certain ingredients you can use. Also the price was very good as you get a whole morning of cooking and awesome food you can even take home if you can't eat it all there. One of the really good things as well was, that they didn't use any MSG in their cooking. Before you even start cooking, they take you to the local marked and explain you a lot of interessting things, eg. the difference between coconut-milk and coconut-cream. I would recommend this Cooking school to anyone who likes food and cooking and i can only say the best things about this place. Many many thanks to Koy and her whole team for this wonderful experience.

Second fantastic visit. We enjoyed our second visit as much as the first. Delicious menu and informative tips in a spotlessly clean and very well run cooking school. Our teacher Irin was wonderful - we loved having her again. She is funny, knowledgable and does a fantastic job. If you want a great authentic experience in a homely environment choose this school, you won't regret it. Thanks Irin and Sompong staff.

Fun, interesting and informative. Had a great time visiting local food market, seeing demonstrations and practicing.Then eating what we'd cooked was great. I've had the chance to try out some of the recipes since I've been home.Would definitively recommend this school to anyone wanting a fun and informative morning or afternoon in Bangkok.

A Good Starting Point. This was my third cooking course in Thailand, and it was a very enjoyable experience.Sompong's staff were very welcoming, knowledgeable and displayed a relaxed attitude to the day's cooking. The highlight was the market your, with an opportunity to see coconut milk and cream being made, which helped understand the cooking methods later.This was an introductory course, as we worked in groups to prepare dishes rather than individually. We made the green curry paste together, getting a few bashes with the pestle and mortar before someone else finished the hard work. I appreciate that this was due to time constraints, but it was still a shame.I still learned plenty and was very impressed by the chicken with cashew nut stir fry and the hospitality!

A lot of fun and organized but not stressful. This is a really enjoyable activity (more than a hardcore Thai cooking class). The five-hour program is extremely well-run and they manage to balance sticking to the schedule and making it relaxed (the air-conditioning and tea served were a nice touch). The instructors were very easy to understand and seemed genuinely interested in teaching us something and the helpers made sure we didn't screw up. I have tried my hand at Thai dishes before, so I understood some concepts like frying curry paste in coconut cream, but the visit to the market alone gave an education on how coconut milk is actually pressed, different types of basil and ginger, and so much more. The menus are offered online and we have a nice blend of pad thai, penang curry, papaya salad and the mango sticky rice, all big staples I wanted to learn more about. All in all, a great job and I would have spent 3-4 times this in New York City for basic Thai cookery.

Delicious and fun!!. This cooking class is easy (beginners level), fun, friendly and most of it the food is de-li-ci-ous! First you arrive at the school to meet your "co-cooks" and teacher for the day. There you have a welcome drink. Then you head up to the local market with a small group and the teacher show you different varieties of Thai fruits, herbs and vegetables. After less than 1 hour you go back to the classroom to start cooking. You eat a first dish at mid-time and the rest for lunch or dinner. You get to keep the recipes book and are encourage to try doing everything by yourself, although the teacher makes the complicated parts in a central table for everyone. At the end of the session, you feel like cooking Thai food is easy (finding the ingredients in your country might be more of a challenge!) and eat so much that you might want to take a nap or a doggy bag after, which you both can!

Should I apply for masterchef now ?. For not more than a 1000 Baht, you can :- learn names of weird vegetables you spot in the market.- know how to cook them and transform them in a delicious dish- eat this wonderful dish of yours- feel proud to have satisfied your brain and your stomach !The staff is very profesionnal and friendly. The atmosphere was relaxed and fun. I will definitely recommend this cooking school !

Even steven... almost. We attended another Thai cooking class about 1.5 years ago, it was called Silom Thai and funny enough it is located in the same alley as Sompong Thai ! I purposely chose Sompong Thai this time because the course fee was the same as Silom Thai. We cooked Tom Yum Koong both times (again, a deliberate choice).I would say both were enjoyable, though I would probably give Silom Thai just a tad higher rating - maybe the instructor was more humorous, maybe it was the first time we attended a cooking lesson, maybe the dishes were just that little bit more delicious... But then again these are all quite subjective. Anyhow, I think both are so similar that you can choose one or another, depends on what you'd like to cook and whether their menus fit your plan.

Excellent Thai Cooking Class. The course was very professional and informative, especially the visit to the local market to buy the ingredients for our dishes. The location is at the end of Silom 13 and is easy to get to by taxi, if you use the details from the booking confirmation email - especially if you are late for the pick up at the Chong Nonsi BTS. The staff are really friendly, have excellent english and really make an effort to make you feel at home. Finally the cost is very competitive and is a far better option then the ones offered at some of the big hotels.

Nice teacher. The teacher is very friendly and helpful. We were pick up from the BTS and send to the school. Market visiting will be interesting for tourist who has never been to the local market. The cooking process was taught step by step and you are allowed to take videos and pictures. After cooking you can have your lunch and steam rice is provide. They are very thoughtful to provide boxes if you want to take home the food. However after the class, you will have to walk about 10mins to the BTS. It's a pity the service stop after the class ended at the premises.

You never know if u never try ,Best of the Best !!!!!!!. They say food is the heart of a culture, and this class gives you a hearty slice of Thai culture with a heaping portion of food! Whether you love to cook or love to eat, this day is a fabulous!!!And Who knew that cooking school would be so fun? Who knew that you could pound dry spices and make your own curry paste,i have no idea How to cook and this is a first time for me to cook but i love to eat thai food so much that why i should learn it ,First we met at the school morrning with bubbly &sweet teacher "I-rin",she was so funny, charming, helpful, delightful, and smart! I enjoyed my day immensely. I learned so much while visiting the morning market as i purchased fresh items for my delicious Thai food recipes. and then we back to school. The school is beautiful and the kitchen is clean and bright with fresh air and natural light pouring in and u can see all kitchen utensil it very nice and look traditional products form thailand that made this place is mirthful.after that we start and i enjoy the main time was spent cooking and eatingPaPaya salad, pad Thai, panang carry, and mango sticky rice were divine. I can't believe i made it by my self and i so proud of my self so much on that time i took some pictures of foods and send it to my mom immediately ,really wanted she know that all the dishes I cooked.haha and also we even get to take the cookbook home with us! (Not all places do that. Some keep it a secret.) I highly recommend this. after finished enjoy eating,they are also offer us and ask for take a way The foods if you can not finish your dishes and bring it to enjoy more at home that is a very good service and look professional im so happy to visited and spent time today , i hope to go back again some day and bring along more friends to enjoy this unique & wonderful treasure.
Wonderful cooking experience!. Teachers are really nice and patient:)Meals are delicious! Definitely will come again:-)

Please ask before throwing away our cooking!. The cooking class we took was outstanding!!! My husband and I love Thai food before going to Thailand, so we decided to learn how to cook by using the local ingredients and seasoning. Erin was our teacher in the AM class that day, we went to the Indian market 1st, she explained how to make coconut milk, powder, curry paste and coconut & palm sugar, and after that she took us to the veggie shop and explained all kinds of eggplants, basils and herbs they use to cook Thai food! That was a well-prepared introduction before the cooking class! (FYI: I heard that you don’t get to go the market in the PM class because shops close early.) After we went back to the classroom, she explained the schedule and menu of Friday to us. (You can take the printed out recipes away with you, they came in a folder!) We had great fun cooking with her and everyone else in the class! There was only 1 thing requires some improvement, my husband and I checked their webpage saying that it is available to take out your food if you cannot finish eating them. So we decided to share one portion and take out the other one. However, there was some female assistant asking my husband if he finished, my husband said “Yes”, and he was actually going to ask “Can we take out?” But that lady took his Masaman curry away very quickly and dumped into the trash can. Actually, his curry turned out great; we were hoping to have more later. So that was kind of sad. Anyway, other than that, we had great experience cooking with them. Instead of the curry my husband cooked, I asked to take out the leftover of my curry, they packed some steamed rice for us as well which was very thoughtful!! We will definitely want to learn other recipes from them again in the future.

Highly- recommended, highly experiential binding activity . Attended a thu session with family.
Everyone felt it was an extremely bonding activity. Overall: 4.5/5
Value for $: 5/5
Cleanliness: 5/5
Irin, our teacher, was vvvv patient and excellent command of English and of coz, her warm Thai hospitality.
I will recommend my friends to go.

Great activity. We had a terrific experience at Sompong Thai Cooking School today.Irin, our main teacher has a passion for Thai cooking that is contagious. Here instructions are clear, she repeats everything 3 times to make sure all the students get it, and she seems to be everywhere instructing and helping as the 13 people in our class cooked their dishes.After watching Irin prepare a dish and then taste it to judge the level of spice we wanted to use when we cooked our individual portion, we prepared and cooked according to our own taste. There were aides to help us with technique in addition to Irin.Good recipes, good teaching, good food and good company (the other students ) made for a top notch activity. Highly recommended.

Brilliant experience. My wife and I went there as part of our honeymoon trip around Asia and even though we turned up on the wrong day and late (motorbike taxi from the metro station was fun!) we were welcomed with open arms. Absolutely brilliant experience with an expert cook who made the trip around the market and explanations of the ingredients to the actual cooking itself really funny and informative. I eat a lot of Thai food but the green curry I made was easily the best I've ever tasted. Highly recommended.

One of my best adventures in Bangkok. Started the day off on the BTS going to BTS -Chong Nonsi (exit #3) by 9:15 am, please note that the exits are numbered they will meet you there at the exits, & not on the street. From there they take you down to the road put you in a car then a few blocks later you arrive at the school (Sampong Thai Cooking School Silom Soi 13. On arrival they welcome you with hot coffee or tea and some delicious cookies and let everyone get situated, they outline the trip to the market where they show you how to gather quality ingredients for the dishes that you will prepare, there is a chance to use the restroom, & then off to the market for a very informative & interesting 40 minute trip. Upon returning to the class you are offered the restroom, but required to wash your hands (attention to sanitation was impressive) then in great detail and with great patience they walk you through how to prepare each dish. I didn't believe that we could finish our menu in the time aloted, to my surprise we were done and had enough time to enjoy our delicious meal with our classmates. We had such a good time we rebooked for another class. We left class with a cook book consisting of our meal plan and good knowledge to be able to cook it for ourselves. If you enjoy Thai food come learn how to cook it for yourself, and impress your friends. Thanks for reading, hope it was helpful.

Excellent cooking class. The combination of the course was excellent - market walk + cooking class. The tutors were very helpful and attentive to your need. The tuition was the best class I have ever had because the courses are simple but delicious and you can always replicate it at home!

Cooking Skills, Fun and Laughter. The reason why Sompong Cooking School is rated so highly is that it is that good. After returning home to Australia I was able to prepare three dishes that were given the stamp of approval by the family cooking experts. I do not normally cook for other people.The day started with a trip to a nearby market. The vegetables and herbs were explained. Coconut cream and milk preparation was demonstrated. A group exercise started the cooking. We jointly prepared the curry paste for the main dish of the day. Informative and an opportunity to get to know your colleauges for the day. The instructor and her assistant guided us through the preparation of the four dishes. Each dish tasted great. The tips what toppings (garnishes) to add to the dishes to get the absolute best out of the them was literally the icing on the cake.Highly recommended by a former expat and frequent visitor to Bangkok.
Genuine passion for sharing thai food knowledge. Our passionate Teacher and excellent school logistics/operstions made my day!I have leart a lot and it was so much fun!

Amazing way to experience Thai cuisine. My wife and I attended yesterday and couldn't have imagined a more spectacular way to experience Thai food and culture first-hand. Koy was our instructor and made us feel at home immediately. Very affordable rate (1000 baht), delicious tea refreshments, excellent staff, freshest authentic ingredients, clean facilities, and delicious recipes made for an experience I will never forget.

The Highlight of Our Trip!. My husband and I love Thai food, but the restaurants near us in NY are hit or miss. So, we decided to take a course. Koi (or Koy) was our instructor and she was highly skilled, polite, easy to understand, patient and understanding throughout. The class is cool, clean & light snacks/tea are provided. The parts of the class that are open to the outside are nice because it let's all the cooking smoke/gases out.Everything was very organized and well run. And, our food was absolutely delicious. She makes the dish first, then let's you taste so that you know how to modify the one you will make to your taste. Now, I do recommend take classes from other schools because each chef will teach you different techniques. But, we definitely liked this one the best from a well rounded experience perspective. We would absolutely attend hers again if we make it back to Bangkok.

Cooking class in Bangkok. Fabulous!A great half day class, that went for hours!Irin was wonderful teacher, who had the organisation of the class very well sorted out. We all got to do the practical things and cook for ourselves, on our own stoves. She gave continuous encouragement, answered all our questions and the food was terrific. The whole set-up was clean and efficient. Generous recipes were provided. We could not fault our day.

Excellent hands on instruction in Thai cooking. I've been to cooking classes in several countries and this one stands out as one of the very best. You begin with a visit to a local market to learn about and select the main ingredients. All the staff speak English very well and they provide detailed and understandable instructions every step of the way.In our class we prepared five different Thai dishes. Everything was made from scratch and the instructor walked us through each step with lots of insights, cautions and hints that you would never get from a cookbook alone.All the recipes are given to you in print at the beginning of the class so you can take notes as you prepare each dish.This was a really great experience and I highly recommend it.

A really fun experience. Irin and the team at Sompong were engaging, enthusiastic, and informative throughout the morning. The trip the market allowed us to experience and learn about the local way of shopping for the freshest ingredients. Back at the cooking school, we were shown how to make each course in a fun way. The whole experience was excellent from start to finish and we would highly recommend this to anyone visiting Bangkok, even if cooking isn't something you do often.
One of my best experience in Bangkok. The teachers are super friendly, class is full of laughs and delicious food. I would recommend to everybody who is interested in learning about Thai food :)

Delicious Food, Great Value. We did the cooking class on NYE. The dishes were fabulous and gave us great appreciation for Thai food. We made Pad Thai, Mango Sticky Rice, Papaya Salad and Curry Chicken. We were with group 2 (Irin). She was fabulous. We learned a lot about the types of foods, some new preparation tricks and even some food decoration (tomato rose). Everyone working for the school was incredibly helpful. The class requires a half day allocation, as ours went from 230-7 or so. We did walk to a nearby market which was probably a little bit of a waste as nothing was open in the afternoon. We could've just as easily have done this in one of their 2 buildings. All in all I would recommend this to any of my friends and I'd do it again if I visit BKK again.

Great experience!. My husband and I were in Bangkok visiting our friends for a few weeks and they referred us to Sompong Thai Cooking School. What a great experience! We loved walking around the market learning about all the ingredients we were about to cook with. Learning how to make curry paste was fun too, but be mindful that your arms will get a work out! The staff were very helpful and explained each dish thoroughly. I am so glad they let us take the cooking pamphlet, so we could try them at home! All in all a great experience and would recommend it to anyone interested in learning how to make true Thai food!

A very good experience. I really like this experience! To go to a local market for a 45-min introduction of really thai traditional food. The instructor Koy spoke simple and easy English so that everyone can understand. She made the cooking very easy to understand and also fun too!The cooking venue is actually her home. It is clean. The venue is divided into 2 parts, indoor teaching part and outdoor cooking part. There are air-conditioners indoor and fans outside, so we did not feel hot at all. They served us hot / cold tea when we arrived.The cooking is really enjoyable as well. There are 12 ppl in my class and divided into 3 groups to make the curry paste. Koy will cook the tradition style first and let us all to have a taste, so that we can adjust the amount of spice or sugar in our own dish. All of us can cook all the dishes and try the taste ourselves. And they are all very delicious!!!! The portion is a bit large for girls but you can pack them home!

Enthusiastcally led cooking class. The day was busy so they had 2 classrooms of 12 people set up. They had emailed the day before about switching the dessert to Mango Sticky Rice which we all said was an excellent idea.We were taken to a local market and given an in-depth description of every Thai and foreign vegetable that was available. This was quite informative although a bit of information overload. Back at the school we worked together to prepare the curry paste ingredients 'chop chop chop' and took it in turns to mash it in the pestle and mortar.When cooking dishes the 'teacher' cooked the whole dish through herself before letting us loose (all the cooking generally took less that 5 minutes). All ingredients were prepared and measured out and additional staff circulated the room while cooking.The day was informative, well run and very friendly.

Incredible Value. This place is amazing. The atmosphere is wonderful, the venue is perfect - homely but well equipped, tucked down a Soi but easy to find. The food we made was incredibly tasty - I've eaten a lot of Thai food in my time but THIS was mind-blowing. The staff are super-friendly. The second you finish using a knife or bowl, an army of helpers are on hand to whisk it away. And lots of little touches like great home-made iced teas, good washing facilities, etcI really have no idea how they do it for the price and the only bad thing is that paying such a small amount of money for such a great experience actually makes one feel a bit tawdry. So I made sure I left a generous tip!

Very educational and fun! . Very well prepared and planned market tour. It was educational and interesting to learn about some of the different spices and ingredients used in Thai cooking. The air-conditioned classroom was very nice and we met some lovely people. Our teacher (Irin) was both very cute and good at explaining! My girlfriend and I liked her very much! The recipes was very good and easy to make and the prepared dishes look great! Will definitely try cooking the dishes when we come back home!

Cook Thai food like a local. I was in Bangkok for a few days and decided to take a cooking class with the great team of Koi. No regret! I have taken several cooking classes in Asia and Europe and this was one of the best ones and at great value. Here you learn hands on and I am sure I will be able to cook the recipes on my own once back home. Koi and her team explain very well and simply the basics of Thai cooking. After a trip to the market (with great explanations of vegetables, sauces and how to make coconut cream) we cooked several recipes. First Koi demonstrates what is to be done and then we all do it again by ourselves. Chopping, cooking in the wok and then eating. We all got a booklet with the recipes to bring back with us and we were able to make photos and some videos in order to remember the recipes. I mentioned that I would love to come back one day to learn to cook Padtai, and Koi offered to teach me right afterwards for only 300bath extra. Very professional and much appreciated!All in all a great cooking learning experience that I will definitely recommend and come back to next time with my hubby or friends.

Best cooking school. This was my first time to participate a cooking class in Thailand. I would say I had a great experience in here learning about how to cook a few traditional thai foods. Before the class started, the teachers brought us to the morning market and explained what kind of materials were suitable to prepare the foods that we were going to cook. During the cooking class, the teacher will demonstrate how to cook the food and then we did by ourselves after that. The teachers can speak fluent English. They are passionate in cooking and willing to clear your doubts at any time. Thanks for giving me such a great cooking experience. I will definitely come back here again !!!

Must do when in Bangkok..... Unfortunately it is not possible to give 6 star rating..;-). This was really a unique and unforgettable experience. It started already with a trip to the market... simply great.. not only a great place to take pictures but the information that was given by Nancy was very usefull. There was also some time to walk around on your own to do some shopping. Then afterwards the cooking class itself... what to say about it: simply perfect... hands ons and with some humour. I did not know I cook such nice things myself... thanks to Koy and the whole team. Also interesting was the fact that alternatives where proposed for a lot of ingredients as you cannot find everything at home. This is really a must do when in Bangkok, even if only for a few days !!

Great Class. My partner and I visited the morning slot on the Saturday. We started the class with a trip to the market with the very friendly and informative Nancy. She told us all about the market and the produce that you could get from here along with a demonstration on how coconut milk/cream is made.Back at the class Koy was our teacher, and she was excellent. She made everything very clear to us and was very hands on when it came to getting assistance.We had leftovers to take home as we had made too much and they happily boxed this up for us.This is a must do if you have time spare in Bangkok!

Amazing Cooking Class. We had a great experience at Sompong. Definitely one of the best hands on cooking classes we've taken and the food tasted great as well. Koy was a fantastic teacher, and really helped us understand the nuances of working with coconut cream and milk and how they affect the dishes. I'd recommend taking the morning class as the market is closed during the afternoon classes.Great experience!

Delicious recipes and a fun, informative day. I joined the Wednesday lunch class. It started with a trip to the local markets, followed by cooking back at the school. The guides were very informative and lots of great ingredients to see, smell and taste. The class itself was good, although we didn't get to do any of the prep work as this had all been done for us. Ultimately that saved a lot of time in preparing 4-5 dishes! They all tasted fantastic, especially the papaya salad and chicken curry. And best of all: everyone got a copy of the recipes to take home with them.I'd recommend this for anyone that loves food, cooking and eating. It's not too difficult or arduous. And a great way to escape the midday heat in Bangkok!

Monsoonal Afternoon Bliss. If you're considering a cooking class, this place is great. Perfect memorable experience.It was pouring rain when we arrived for our afternoon class. We were fortunate to be by ourselves.If you want less people and don't mind a less-busy market, the afternoon class is a great option. Ours was from 2.30 until about 6.30.You will leave with leftover food, it's impossible to eat everything when you're there!

Awesome experience with amazing food and staff. It was such a last minute decision to do a cooking class and we really wanted to do the Friday class with Mussaman Curry and Tom Yum Goong. Nancy got back to us the morning of and we were off! We regret missing the morning class, but Nancy was still very informative at the market with little places open. Koy and her team were such great teachers. We loved that we each got to make each dish. Koy really helped us cook and understand each ingredient along the way. We even got to take home what we couldn't finish! I definitely recommend this class to all!!

Family cooking class. Amazing experience for the whole family.We where a large family of 8 people and where able to get our own private class. The cooking experience was fun for the whole family and where able beforehand to set-up the menu we wanted to cook. Irene was a very good instructor and easily understandable and took good time explaining each dish and how to cook it.We strongly recommend that attending a Thai cooking class is a must do when visiting Bangkok.

Perfect half-day out in Bangkok. Our experience here has almost completely changed our view of Bangkok.Sure, they are geared for tourists, but in a way that is highly professional and not in the slightest geared towards a rip-off - in fact, frankly, they are not charging enough for the service and experience that they are providing. Almost every other place we have been in Thailand has had terrible service and is just geared towards parting us from our money.Sompong showed us another, much warmer, side to Thailand. This is an old family business and is staffed by extended family, spanning multiple generations and their friends. All of them were lovely and full of smiles.Koy, who ran our class, is warm-hearted, professional and helpful (and gorgeous). We had six in our group, including the daughter of our friends who is twelve and our son who is thirteen. Koy and all of the staff were fantastic with the kids and we lost no fingers and got no burns! Nancy, who handles administration and also took us through the markets and helped in class was knowledgeable, personable and again, great with the kids and also handled the entire booking process very very well.This was a wonderful experience and all six of us were left confident that we could cook all of the (delicious) dishes that we learned today again by ourselves.If we can find the time, all of us are keen to go there again later this week for another class.We enjoyed cooking with everyone else who was in the class with us, from all around Asia and it was clear that everyone was having fun.And, did I mention? The food we cooked was absolutely delicious and as each person cooked their own, we were able to tailor spiciness, sourness etc. to suit our own tastes and Koy was very clear on how that could be done. For us, this was MUCH better than our experience of the food at Nahm last night.Awesome school and we would recommend them without reservation.

Amazing time!. While making the booking, the staff asked if I had any allergies or if there was anything that I don't eat. That already gave me a very first impression of the school! They seem to really care to make it a really good experience for you.As I was late to meet at Chong Nonsi for the class, they had someone pick me and 2 other students up from the station a little later. Then, Teacher Nancy gave us a quick run through of the day's plan before we headed to the wet market.Teacher Nancy was really helpful in explaining to us the different ingredients used in Thai cooking and the whole trip was really enjoyable and informative.When we got back to the school and started cooking, Teacher Koy was really encouraging and her explanations were really clear. She even gave tips on how we can re-create the dishes at home if some of the ingredients used were difficult to find in our countries. We had ample time to work on the dishes and she would often tell us to taste what she had cooked before we started. This is so that we can adjust the seasoning to our liking. She even gave suggestions on how we can present our dishes.I had such a good time in this cooking class and it was the highlight of my Bangkok trip! I can't wait to go back for more lessons.

Family Fun for a great price. Our family of four (mom, dad, girls 8 and 10), spent our first morning in Bangkok at this cooking school. The children thought it was great to get to use real kitchen equipment (sharp knives, cook over fire) and the staff were very good with them. There were a lot more people in the class than I thought there would be, but certainly enough staff to handle us all. Well organized, but with a personal touch - you did not feel too "assembly line" tourist attraction.We made way more food than we could eat. The trip to the market was fun and informative. The actual lessons were very good. My husband felt it was one of the better parts of our trip. For the price paid / time spent this was a good value. We ask for a recommendation to a place for a massage and went where they recommended and it was a good value as well (Health land).

Fun cultural day. We were picked up from a the Chong Nonsi subway stop by staff wearing the recognisable red apron with others taking part in the class. We were in a small group of 8 which was a nice size as it made it a more personal cooking appearance. We went to the market and were shown all the ingredients we were going to use and alternatives that we could use in our countries. Nancy and the team were patient with us and demonstrated everything. We were given a recipe book to help us follow what was happening and a pencil to make notes. The recipes are different on different days of the week. We had an amazingly fun time and loved eating it all. We were also given free iced tea and free bottled water

Fun and filling. Had a great time learning to cook - and eat - Thai food. But frankly the trip to the market with detailed information on what is what, how to identify it (and whether it is good or not) and when to use it was the most interesting and useful.

4th Sept 2014 cooking lesson. Nancy the shaperon picked us up at Chong Nonsi station to the cooking kitchen. Then we walked to the wet market to purchase & learnt the type of species & ingredients need for this lesson. She's good as she can tell the name of the products in various foreign names especially in Chinese & Malay names. The cooking instructor Irene was patient with us & did a good job in her demonstration & illustration to explaining all the processes & why need to do it the way. She's well spoken in the English language young & pretty. Food you can't finishing eating after you cook them, they helped to pack them for you to take away. All participant is given a recipe manual & pencil. Thank you for the great time in the cooking lesson. When I'm back in BKK, I'll definitely join again to pick up more Thai cooking lesson fr you & recipes as well.

Words can't explain how she made me feel like home!. Sompong Thai Cooking school is a friendly home with the GREAT spirit of koy whoruns the school, I find the classes very good value for the money and best of allthe experience of real thai cooking in a home environment. I would like to recommendthis to all people who would like to spend a special day learning and creating wonderfulthai food. I can't wait to come back again!We love you ……..Konrad

My visit to Bangkok was worth for the palace visit and This cooking class.. The best of Tailand in my oppinion are: the food, the nice people and the beaches. This cooking class offers the two first. Away of the unreasonable disorder in Bangkok and the treatment of locals seeing tourist as US Dollars with legs, eager to bargain the money away from you....... Sompong cooking class is amazin, respectful and fun.

Fun cultural experience. Great option for a cooking class in Bangkok. The staff were all very friendly and patient, and there were enough of them to ensure everyone in the class had individual attention (especially for those of us that are complete beginners to cooking :).At the start of the class, the group takes a trip to the market where the instructors explained the different ingredients that we'd be using, and how to replace thai herbs/vegetables with alternatives that we could find back home. We learned to cook 4 dishes, which, although exhausting towards the end, did not feel rushed. They also provided a recipe book with the 4 dishes taught in the class - looking forward to trying to recreate the menu back home!

A must to do in Bangkok!. We still can't belive how perfect this cooking lesson was! From the pick up at the BTS station to the degustation, everything is so organized and comfortable that we could have spent easely one more week of cooking lesson there.The visit to the market is instructive, the food tastes great, the staff is attentive and helpfull (we had one 8 years old girl in our group and one staff was helping her when needed all the time!), the place is nice and clean ... Everything is there for you to have a wonderfull time! Don't hesitate one minute, go for it!!Si vous cherchez une immersion de qualité dans le monde de la cuisine thai sans vous ruiner, vous avez trouvé!De l'accueil à la station de BTS à la dégustation de vos plats en passant par la visite au marché, tout est organisé à la perfection, sans jamais vous stressez bien au contraire.La visite au marché est très instructive, le personnel est vraiment sympathique et aidant (si vous avez des enfants intéressés par la cuisine n'hésitez pas, un membre du personnel veillera sur eux!), la salle est propre et accueillante et surtout les plats sont excellents!Vous ne regretterez pas d'être passé par Sompong Thai School, n'hésitez pas!

Great experience!!. I bumped into this school by chance. I don't regret it. It was a great experience. Staff is friendly, and gives you many tips from how to choose ingredients, to in which order to cook them, and what you can buy in the market to bring home.The visit to the market was very enlightening, we discovered how coconut milk is made, and all the different types of herbs in the Thai cuisine.The class was fast, many ingredients were prepared in advance to minimize waste of time. Still, we had to use some elbow grease when making the curry by hand.In sum, a great experience, I'd definitely will go back if I return to BKK

Well organized, great food, great instruction. This is the first time I have ever taken a cooking class while traveling and will now do this regularly. This was a great class, the instructor was knowledgeable, spoke English very well, practiced safe and healthy cooking, and had a great support staff to make this a success. We visited a market first, learned about different types of curries, Thai spices, types of basil, and other vegetables. We made Green Chicken Curry (curry recipe by hand), stir-fried chicken with Cashew nuts, a Thai mixed fruit salad, and Mango with sticky rice (the best I've ever eaten). I highly recommend this, you do get to cook, chop, stir-fry, etc. and then eat. This is fun, educational, and a good value.

Outstanding!!!. From Melbourne, Amy and I spent few days in Bangkok before our wedding in Koh Samui. Friends of mine recommend us to do the Sompong Thai Cooking School.It was easy to access, very good english, the visit of the market was interesting, the menu was traditional Thai cuisine. Thank you Koi for this great experience. Highly recommended for anyone. Gaetan and Amy :-))

Amazing food, excellent experience. The Wednesday menu was delicious. I came into the class wanting to see how the papaya salad was made, and left as a big fan of the Penang curry. They pack whatever you can't eat immediately so for smaller eaters such as myself this means you're sorted for dinner as well. You're also given a handy recipe book (included in price) so you can cook for yourself back home.The morning class is recommended as the local markets have mostly shut by the afternoon and understanding the difference between similar looking but not similar tasting ingredients such as the fresh and sour tamarind pods. Be aware that there are 2 cooking schools down Silom Soi 13. I waited at the wrong one for a few minutes. The yellow signs with red writing belong to another cooking school and there are many of them. The 2 red signs are from Sompong, and the first is not visible til you're a fair way down the alley. Sompong is at the end of the wider alley next to a pink building.

Amazing morning with lovely people. Such an amazing set up from start to finish. Honestly cant think of anything I would change. The people were lovely and always on hand to assist. They thoroughly explained every detail but kept it fun and light hearted. The venue is quaint and homely- and they really make every effort to make you feel at home. Worth every penny and would definitely go back to learn other dishes!

The best experience in Bangkok. Far much better than I expected. Comfortable environment, kind people, and good foods to eat, what else can beat these amazing things ! They really offer the best service in a reasonable price !

Definitely a must do in Bangkok. Great cooking school, get to experience the market before hand and learn all about the ingredients and the staff are very helpful and speak great english. Very easy to follow and the food tastes great! Lots of food so make sure you pace yourself or take it home for later :)

Outstanding experience at a great price. This was one of our favorite experiences in Bangkok. Everything was very professional and fun. The staff were insightful and helpful. The dishes were not too complicated. If we return to Bangkok we will probably go on a different day just to try cooking another item. Just a great experience.

Thai Cooking Adventure. We loved our day at Sompong Cooking School...from the market trip in the morning to the feast at the end we had a really great day. The set up was wonderful and everything moved so efficiently and well. I was worried that we wouldn't get much hands-on cooking time but Koi and her team have developed an incredibly balanced, fun and busy lesson. There wasn't much standing around. Koi does a short demo and then leaves it up to her students, always moving around the room (along with her helpers) and lending a hand to anyone who might need it. The food we made was absolutely delicious and we learned a lot about Thai ingredients, both at the market and during class. At the end of the market tour you have some time to pick up some ingredients to take home which was great as we had the experts and hand and therefore knew what to pick up. We loved the class and the food and can't wait to try it out on all of our friends at home! Very inspiring! A real highlight of our trip and I highly recommend the experience to ALL - any level of skill would feel comfortable and at ease and undoubtedly, have a great time.

Amazing experience and journey through thai cuisine. That was a great day! Food we did was just delicious and so tasteful! You gave us great tips, that definitely will be useful later ;) fantastic market trip, as food is great, you explained the ingreedients and basics so well so we know where the taste comes from. Everything was so well prepared! Thank you, and see u next rime i am in bkk!

Best experience in Bangkok!. Thank you so much Koy and Krit we had an amazing day! We learnt so much about Thai food which you explained to us in perfect English! The market trip was really interesting and cooking was so much fun! We used good quality local ingredients to cook with. The food was delicious and the atmosphere was very happy and friendly! The cooking equipment was very clean too! We would recommend that everybody travelling to Bangkok visits Sompong cooking school :) ... Thanks for the best day we had in Bangkok!

Lovely family run cooking class. Really enjoyed the afternoon cooking class with Koy. You start off with a market tour where a lot of Thai vegetables are explained. For the afternoon tour most market stalls are closed, but that was no big deal since the explanation is sufficient. In perfect english !The cooking workshop itself is orderly and proper. They make you feel at home! We had kots of fun cooking and learned A lot from Koy. Would definately recommend!

Highlight of our trip!. This cooking class was my favorite activity in Bangkok! Irin is very knowledgeable, super nice, and funny. She is a great teacher. She explained all the ingredients in the market and made each dish (total of 4) step by step and gave us a recipe book to take home at the end of the day. The best part was that the cooking class kitchen was very very clean and we made the best red curry I had while in Thailand. Our class size was only 5 people so it was nice and intimate. I highly recommend this activity for anybody who loves Thai food and wants a hands on experience!

Excellent introduction to Thai food. We often try to learn about cooking when we travel, and Sompong Thai Cooking School looked to be our kind of course.Due to some circumstances, it ended up with only the two of us in the class. For us that was good because we had access to our teacher (Irin) all the time, but also a bit sad since it is nice to meet people from different places with the same interest as you.Anyhow, the class was very good - we learned to make Chicken green curry, Home made green curry paste, Stir fried chicken with cashew nut, Thai spicy mixed friuts salad and a delicious Egg custard in pumpkin.We enjoyed the time and to learn the basics of Thai food. Thanks for a great course!

Unique experience when being in Bangkok!. We joined the morning class. Someone picked us up at the BTS station on time. After, they dropped us off at the cooking school. Before start cooking we headed off to a nearby market where we learned about the ingredients of the thai kitchen.Irin explained everything in detail. After, everyone had to cook himself/herself. Food was excellent and also the assistance of the staff.We highly recommend this place to everyone who wants to see Bangkok from a different point of view!

Nice experience. I definitely recommend Sompong cooking school, it was a great experience, I could learn how to cook 3 dishes and a dessert.I would just regret the fact that there were so many students (about 15 or so).Despite the numerous team (6 to 8 people !), I wish I had had more time to chat with the teachers.

A Different Experience. This is a fun way to learn how to cook. The class was very informative, all the staffs were eager and willing to assist us. Irin was very generous in sharing informations regarding ingredients, Instructions were easy to follow , best of all , we cooked our own food! The food taste great!Don't miss the chance to join Sompong Thai cooking school, It will add spice to your vacation!

February 8 morning class. This was so much fun! We were met at the Chong Nonsi BTS station just after 9am and ferried to the school location where we enjoyed tea and we were introduced to our instructor Irin. After going over the itinerary we were split into two groups for the short walk to the market where we learned about the ingredients we would be using from Irin and Nancy (I appreciated the information about coconut milk vs cream - I've been buying both for recipes and now I know I don't have to!!). Another short walk back after an opportunity to shop and the instruction began, with sticky rice first up. Then we learned to make red curry paste and a thai omelette salad which we immediately enjoyed as an appetizer after being instructed on how to create a tomato rose garnish. After appetizer, back to cooking to complete our menu of red curry with pineapple & prawns and stir-fried chicken with holy basil. The food was absolutely delicious and although the website advises you to have breakfast beforehand so you don't get too hungry, I was absolutely stuffed when I finished eating dessert. I regretted the full breakfast and would advise going light on food before you start the class; if you can't finish your portions, they'll gladly pack it for you to take with you later. Finally, at 1000B, it is a bargain. True, you will be cooking outside instead of an industrial kitchen full of stainless-steel appliances, and you may not complete the entire menu yourself, but if you crave that, the Cordon Bleu is waiting for you and your money. I had a great experience with a friendly group of travelers from all over the world and a heck of a lot of fun.

Fun, informative and tasty!. Thanks to trip advisor we found this cooking class great! Held in small groups, you get to visit the markets to pick up the produce, the staff very friendly and most importantly the food was delicious.

Half day cooking class. My wife and I cook Thai food at home but thought it would be fun to get some training while on holiday in Bangkok. After reading many positive reviews on TA we reached out to the Sompong Cooking School to schedule a class. Nancy and Gai were extremely responsive to our emails and quite thorough asking if e had any special requests as well as any allergies they should consider. I was especially interested in learning how to make papaya salad and they included that as well as Penang chicken, Pad Thai, and bananas in syrup for the half day class. The first part of the class we went down the street to a typical Thai market to procure the ingredients for our meal. While my wife and I live just outside of NYC and have ready access to many of the ingredients we used Nancy and Gai explained substitute ingredients that could be used. During the class Gai was funny, supportive, and kept the pace moving and interactive so it was a very fun and informative class. We ate what we cooked and everybody no matter what level they were prior to the class thought their dishes came out terrific. All in all this was a great way to spend our morning and the folks at Sompong were wonderful. Next time we come back to Bangkok I wouldn't hesitate to sign up for another class and learn to add a few more dishes to our repertoire. If you are looking for a fun way to spend half a day or more in Bangkok put Sompong Thai Cooking School on your list.

AMAZING!. My husband and I just finished a morning cooking class. Everything was well organized. Someone was at the BTS station to pick us up when we arrived. Then it was short ride to the school for a quick break and then we set out to a market, where we learned about and bought the ingredients we would be using. We were also given a chance to buy spices, curry paste, etc to take home with us. These things are readily available at our home Asian market, however, you can't beat Thailand prices. I spent $6USD for stuff that would cost me at least $20USD! Next began the cooking - we made Panang curry, pad thai, papaya salad, and mango sticky rice. Aside from the main teacher, there were many cooking aides to help us. At the end, we got to enjoy our food and take home any leftovers. The only thing I wish I had known before going was to wear insect repellent. The short walk to the market had mosquitoes and I'm prone to getting bites. Sompong thought of everything though and even provided insect repellent.

Awesome food and a lovely admosphere!. My boyfriend and I took the afternoon class on January 3rd of 2014. Our teacher was the lovely Irin who did a great job of teaching us about traditional ingredients of Thai meals and about the tips and tricks of how to cook them to perfection. The class began with a visit to a local food market where Irin's collegue Nancy introduced us to all the fresh ingredients that should be used that day. Afterwards we returned to the school and started preparing the meals one after the other. First Irin explained all the steps to the class, then you sit down and start preparing the ingredients for your own meal. The coordination between the many people who work at the cooking school is amazing! Every time you turn back around to your assigned place at the table, a new set of fresh ingredients and clean cooking supplies stands there waiting to be used. Then everyone goes over to their cooking station - a gas cooker with a wok for each of the students - and proceeds to cook their food. Don't worry, you will get to eat it right away in the comfy dining room! The tables are arranged perfectly and there are lots of beverages to choose from. That day we cooked Mussaman Chicken Curry, Tom Yum Goong (spicy prawn soup), Khao Phat Kai (fried rice with chicken and egg) and Mango Stickrice for dessert. Everything tasted so amazing we couldn't believe we just cooked these things ourselves :)I absolutely recommend visiting a cooking class at Sompong Thai Cooking School if you enjoy cooking and eating good food! It's absolutely worth the cost of 1000 Baht (about 25 € / 34 $).Thanks so much to Irin, Nancy and everyone else at the School!
Very friendly and enjoyable cooking class. I took two day lessons. Very friendly and enjoyable cooking class with fun!

The BEST cooking class (it's all about the instructors). This was my first cooking class, but it was clearly the best. I booked for my whole family on a very busy holiday time and they opened up another classroom / kitchen for just 8 of us. The setting was very intimate, and we were able to learn from the close hands-on instruction. We started with a trip to the market learning a lot about the varied fruits and vegetables and how to select them ripe and fresh. In fairness, a cooking course really isn't about the recipe. In fact you will get similar recipes online or at any other course. Furthermore, most facilities are of similar caliber, with clean environment, and one burner per student layout. But what sets these courses apart is truly the instructor... and in this case the instructors were incredible. The instructors teach WHY each step is important, how and when to substitute ingredients, WHAT the cooking process is doing to the dish, and the whole time they are engaging, sweet, encouraging, and funny. Irin was our instructor, and we all were luck to have her tutelage.

Amazing!. I went with my friend for a thai cooking class in this amazing, clean and very friendly thai cooking school.Kh Koi she's a great teacher, very well organized and cleaned!Well done!Khop un kraap!

Highlight of Bangkok. Hubbie and I are touring a few Asian countries for our honeymoon. This is by far my favorite tourism activity by far!Very organized! Took train to station and met by school's representative at station exit. They drove us to school. Got introduction. Walked to the market to learn about our ingredients and to pick up food ingredients. Irin (Irene) was our instructor. Can't enough enough great things about her. She was so charming, humorous, and skilled teacher! While staff is lovely! You watch instructor make each dish. Then you (individually) get to make each dish too! Met other students and it was a blast for everyone. It's a steal! You must sign up now. Either paypal for class before or pay Thai baht/cash when you arrive. No credit cards. WORTH IT! Loved it!!

A brilliant morning. Booked this a bit last minute so had minimal expectations, and it was great. Incredibly well organised (you watched a demo then miraculously all your mess disappears) and well explained recipes. I would pay 1000 baht for the awesome meal we cooked, but with the market visit and the lesson, it was a bargain. Do it!

Do it...you will love it!. I booked this tour months ago and I am so pleased I did. We all loved it - we are a family with a 16 year old and a 14 year old. The food was fresh, delicious and so authentic. The staff were superb and our main support staff/chef was funny and skilled. The market trip was an added bonus so do the morning tour if you want to see this. I would not hesitate recommending this company, they are value for money and operate very well. Thanks for a fantastic experience.

What a Wonderful Cooking Experience. We usually travel a lot for fun and enjoyment. We do enjoy the beauty of nature while on trip. But the trip to Thailand had a new experience. The great cooking course at the Sampong Thai Cooking School added a new chapter in my life. Cooking food always fascinated me and my wife. We both love cooking together But I can tell you this was a great experience at Sampong Thai Cooking School. It took only 1000 baht per person and we learned 5 different types of meals. Both chef and Staffs were friendly and very helpful. Last week me and my wife prepared Thai food on our son’s birthday party. As we served it, it was very strange experience for the guests but as they tested they responded amazingly. Everyone praised our choice and the party was very successful due to that Thai food only. We are really thankful to the Sampong Thai Cooking School.

Unbelievably good . This class was such a highlight for my stay in Bangkok. Always take the morning class, because in its beginning they take you to the markets to purchase what you will be cooking and in the afternoon the markets are closed so you would miss that experience. Such an informative class where everything is explained and taught so well... And the food, is to die for! Beautiful, traditional and flavoursome... And after cooking it all yourself so rewarding. I work in the travel industry and I will suggest this to all my clients... It was a great and unforgettable addition to my holiday.

Something different in bangkok. We didn't know how the cooking lesson would turn out to be, but boy, what a unforgettable experience for us. The chef and school staff were very helpful and friendly. We even made some friends from the states... The part I liked best was we get to eat our own food after cooking them. They even helped us to pack our food if we decided to take away. Really enjoyed ourselves there.

A must experience for all visitors.. Every time I visit Bangkok I always like to come here for a course. This trip I came three times and enjoyed every minute of it. All the staff are very friendly and always on hand to assist and make you feel at home. The trip to the market is an experience and the stall owners very friendly and willing to share information. You don't have to be a master chef to come here and mixing with other nationalities enables you to share both culinary and cultural differences. Instruction is great, everything from providing the ingredients to clearing away all done by assistants allowing you to have a trouble free lesson and everyone having their own cooking station. Eat in the dining room which is so comfortable and share each others stories or take it away In boxes provided. Cooking is easy and tastes great and you will not find another course that provides value for money like this school. A must do in Bangkok.

Love this cooking school!. Chose this school because of its location (near my hotel) and price ( half to a third the price of others) and was very happy with this family run cooking school. Small grouip, hands-on lesson with great teachers. Loved the educational trip to the market. All the dishes we made (4) were delicious. Breast to understand the ingredients, mixing of tastes, etc. Don't miss out!

Perfect Introduction to Thai Cooking!. There are so many great things to say about this experience I don’t know where to start! First, Irene and Nancy are just amazing! Nancy picked us up at the BTS station with a quick car ride to the cooking school. We were very warmly welcomed with beverages and an introduction to the cooking class and then off to the market we went baskets and all. I love that at the market they were able to explain about each individual ingredient that we would be using and took the time to allow us to taste and sniff everything. A quick walk back to the school and cooking began! We cooked four courses and each was better than the next! One of the best things about this is that you can cook your dishes to taste, whether it be more or less sweet or spicy. Irene was fantastic at explaining each step along the way. The process was very efficient and the rest of the staff cleaned and set up while we were learning and then everything was ready when it was our turn. Everyone has their very own station and does every step themselves with help, as needed. I don’t cook often and I learned so much about Thai cooking in general, it was quite fun even for non-cooking enthusiasts. The entire day was just fantastic. Our favorite thing about the day aside from cooking and eating was the atmosphere. We had such a great group and it felt like a family sitting down to cook together. The whole day was a lot of laughs and good fun. I would greatly recommend anyone choose this awesome cooking school. Thank you Irene, Nancy, and team! We really felt like family.

Really great experience. I am in Bangkok alone and wanted to fill in a day so booked a class at Sompong cooking school. It was easy to get to the meeting point from the BTS firstly so that was a relief. I thoroughly enjoyed going to the markets and collecting all the fresh ingredients. Our guide was fun and informative. We only had 8 in the class which I think gave it an even warmer feel. Not only were the meals delicious and easy to prepare with staff overseeing us but we got some awesome tips for cooking in general. I highly recommend and may even go back another day myself

Excellent for both the avid chef and those seeking fun. A cooking course at the Sompong Thai Cooking School added another amazing dimension to my visit of Bangkok. The team was extremely well prepared and organised. After a very hearty sa wa dee khrap (hello) we were allocated our workstations and the days' proceedings were explained. Not soon after our hearty welcome, we were all handed our own shopping baskets and fans to cool our faces. The 5 minute stroll to the wet market was extremely interesting and was key to the course. As visitor to Thailand one does not always understand what you are looking at when you explore the stalls in the markets and streets. The tour of the market added a whole new dimension to enjoying food in Thailand and helped to understand the food, street smells and the tastes. We amongst others, saw how coconut milk was made and learnt how that was different from coconut cream. A whole new world also opened when we were shown the many types of basil, eggplant, chilies, coriander etc. and what the different uses are.The course was completely hands-on. Cooking instructions were easy to follow and no prior cooking experience is needed to make the most unbelievable dishes that one could feast on. I would recommend the course to the traveller who would like to learn more about Thai cooking. The course is however also excellent if one seeks a very nice fun-filled day which is ended off with excellent food. Excellent experience all-round.

Wonderful experience!. The cooking experience is wonderful. Teacher Irin was giving us very simple instructions and the food is really fabulous - even far better than the food we ordered from the restaurant. We cooked 4 dishes - Masaman Curry, Tom Yum Prawn soup, Fried rice and a dessert. We had so much to eat! My 13 year old son had a great time cooking and tasting the fantastic dishes!1000baht per pax is a steal! They will pick you up from Chong Nonsi BTS station which is a short walk to the school but they will send you via a car to the school so no worries about where is the school is at all. :)Thank you again to Irin, Nancy and the team, for the wonderful experience! We will be back for sure when we next visit BKK.

Great food! Incredible instruction.. Koy and her staff do such a wonderful job. You are invited into her home to cook, literally her grandma is walking around helping with all of the dishes. We got to go to the market and pick out the ingredients and then go back and cook 4 meals. It was delicious and everything was well prepared so the flow of the class was easy. I loved my morning here!

Highly recommend!. I did this course today and I would highly recommend it. All staff are really nice, the cooking school itself is very informative, clean and well worth every penny. It's a very cheap course only 1000 baht per person- cheapest I found. If you have a spare four hours book into the morning class and learn your way through thai cuisine.

Top Notch Experience. After reading the reviews on Tripadvisor, I knew this was the perfect cooking school choice for me. The deciding factor was the fact that they would meet me at the Chong Nonsi BTS station, which removed the worry factor about how to find the school. We did have to make our own way back to the station, but it is absolutely not a problem.I chose a morning class, which included a trip to the market. This ended up being a really fun and informative experience. The school itself is charming and spotlessly clean. The staff are professional, fun and attentive. The price was extremely reasonable. I really enjoyed learning about the ingredients used in Thai cooking. Most of the prep work was already done for us, such as measuring and assembling the ingredients, but we did the actual cooking in the wok. We worked and dined at tables of six, and it was enjoyable to chat with fellow travellers from around the world.It's worth noting that this is an experience that is fun to do if you're with a friend but is also really enjoyable if you're solo, as I was. Booking online was simple, and I received a reply by email almost immediately. I will absolutely do this again if I'm in Bangkok again.

Very good choice for cooking class in Bangkok. Nancy and Koy were a pleasure and very gracious. It is worth taking the morning class so you get to visit the market and learn about the ingredients and buy them if you wish. I was so excited to find out that we were learning to make sticky rice and Mango, one of my favorite Thai foods. They have a set menu for each day of the week and we made 4 courses. Some tasks are handled as a table group but you prepare your final dish on your own. The food was really tasty! And we received a book of recipes. The location was also good, very near the BTS/sky train. And the price was much cheaper than the Blue Elephant, which our hotel was recommending.

Fun and delicious experience!. If you can, do the morning class because they take you to a local market. I loved the explanation of all the ingredients (some things I didn't even know existed!) and possible substitutes if you can't find a certain ingredient in your home country. The facility was sweet and homey, and very clean. The staff were friendly and wonderful - Teacher Koy was great. Food was excellent!

ABSOLUTELY A MUST IF YOU´RE IN BANGKOK!. We took the class with Amp and had lots of fun, went to the market and she thoroughly explained a lot about local ingredients and how to pick them. Then we proceeded to cooking and attention to detail is amazing. The best cooking lesson I´ve had so far, I would absolutely recommend it and at this school, price-quality relationship the best.

Well explained and easy to follow steps.. I have been to other cooking classes in Thailand before attending this cooking school. I found the instructor (Ms Koy) here very good. She patiently explained the processes and the reasons behind every step so that you can cook the perfect curry. Other kitchen tips, such as the proper way of squeezing a lime also drew oohs and aahs from us. The kitchen setting and individual cook stations gave us ample space to cook in comfort. Really like their little touches such as putting a small incense clay stove under each table so as to keep the mosquitoes at bay. Well worth the money.

Best Thai Food Cooking Class in Town!. I went to Sompong Thai Cooking School yesterday. It was my first cooking class. Koy (teacher) made my first time cooking experience fun and memorable. She was incredibly knowledgeable and helpful. She gave a very clear and detailed instruction, also tricks of cooking Thai food. Just follow her simple steps; before you know it you are able to made tasty Thai plates. Her crews, which consist of five people, also did an excellent job of taking care all of students. I highly recommend to anyone who wants to learn how to cook delicious homemade Thai food.

Highly recommended for anyone who like Thai food.. I'm half Thai and have been to Thailand many times to visit relatives. My Thai mom is a great cook and have taught me how to cook many Thai dishes. I went to Sampong cooking school to add more knowledge to what I already know. After taking the class, I found out that I know very little. I wish I have taken this class from my first trip to Thailand 20 years ago. All the dishes were delicious (better than my mom's cooking) or any Thai restraurant that I have eaten in the U.S. The class was fun, and very informative with excellent instructors. You will cook and eat the food that you cook. I took left overs home for my mom to try and she was impress as well. We were also given recipes for all the dishes. I highly recommend this class for anyone who like Thai food.

Really great class for learning some thai cooking. I went to the cookery school this morning and was really impressed. Koy and her team were very friendly and knowledgable and really tried to make everybody feel at home. We were first taken to the market and given a really interesting insight into some of the main thai ingredients before heading back to the school to cook four dishes. The cookery school was lovely. My class consisted of 11 people, which is the maximum, and it felt like a good size group. The cooking area was nice and cool and very clean. Koy explained the dishes really well and I feel I would try to make all of them again at home. We were each given a recipe book for everything we were making, which we could make notes on throughout, and Koy gave really useful tips on what substitutes could be used for different ingredients if we couldn't find them at home. I thoroughly enjoyed the experience and would recommend it to anybody.

Chop Chop. I am a flight attendant so I visit Bangkok quite regularly. Sompong Thai Cooking School is easily the best activity I have ever done in this city. After you arrive you are taken to a local market where various ingredients are explained. It's super interesting hearing about fruits and vegetables you have never seen before. Then it's back to the classroom to cook up a storm. The teachers are very thorough and friendly. We made four dishes before sitting down to eat, and literally every single one of them I would cook again. The bonus is they hand you a recipe book with everything you have made so you can do just that. There are seven different set menus, one for each day of the week, so provided my next visit to Thailand isn't on a Monday, I will 100% visit Sompong again!

First class cooking course. I had high expectations of this and had been looking forward to it greatly all holiday as I really enjoy cooking and Thai food is a favourite of mine.I found it to be excellent value being less than half the price of some available. The tutor was clear and concise without ever being too simplistic. It's pitched really well and works for beginners and those who already have experience of cooking Thai food.This great fun and informative and I'd recommend it to anyone who has a spare half a day in Bangkok!

Memorable & great cooking experience in Thailand!^^. My first cooking lesson in Thai is so memorable and helpful, and as a green hand, I was worried a little before this cooking class. Teacher Koy was so nice and patient, explaining all things clearly and I was so happy to make all the four courses on my own. I feel excited and would love to cook for my family once I return to my own country. Strongly recommended! Graeme & Justine

Sompong Cooking...Where Your Dreams Come True. This is one of the best and funnest activities I have done in Bangkok! Sompong is a family business with a warm and welcoming environment where I felt right at home. At a nearby market, Teacher Nancy showed us many different vegetables and herbs, explaining how Thais use them in the recipes. It was good to have this basic knowledge, especially for beginners like me. We made 4 different dishes, with Teacher Koy explaining clearly and demonstrating the process to all of us. We all had our own cooking stations and supplies, and the staff were very attentive to making sure we had everything we needed. My favorite recipes were the Mussaman Curry and Golden Banana in Coconut Milk. After cooking, we sat down in an air-conditioned dining area with mangoes and watermelon to supplement an already delicious meal! I can't say enough good things about this cooking school. The staff treats you like family, the environment is homey and professional, and the recipes are simply delicious. I will make a point of returning, hopefully for all of the sessions so I can learn each recipe!

Brilliant fun, great food, great experience. This is a first class experience. We booked a couple of days before, choosing our day by the menus. First we went to the market and both learned about the local fruits and vegetables as well as getting to buy local foods. Back to the outside kitchen to cook and learn. Loads of fun, plenty assistance and at the end, an amazing 4 course meal that we had made ourselves. A bargain!

Must do for the foodie. I just did this today and has a fantastic experience. I recommend this to foodies and non foodies alike. Service, food, atmosphere were all excellent and I would go again of I had more time in Bangkok!

Fun and informative. This was a great experience, lots of fun and so much good produce to cook with. The market tour that began our experience was informative with the opportunity to obtain some ingredients for our own pantry (these were acceptable to Australian Customs on out return home). The food was interesting and there was plenty of help from staff in the preparation, as well as having lots of fun. Key was delightful and was happy to include other recipes in our take home cookbook, even when we didn't cook them that day. We were provided with lots of hints along the way about Thai cooking in general as well. Just make sure to write down all those hints in your cookbook, as I found I had remembered some but not all of Koy's hints. Thanks to the Sompong team, my Musaman is the talk of the family at home. Yum!

Great fun and food. We had a great time at Sampong cooking school. My partner and I had our almost 5 year old with us, and all the staff were so accommodating and welcoming of him, providing him with paper and pencils to draw when he had had enough of the cooking. The pace was relaxed, but we learnt a lot, and it was very hands on so we also got to practice. There. We're plenty of staff on hand to help out, so we got through lots quickly. The walk around the markets was interesting, and the lunch we produced at the end of the session was delicious! Overall this was interesting and fun. I'd definitely recommend it if you are looking for a cooking school in Bangkok.

A very nice experience. We had a very nice afternoon/evening here. We started off with some home-made ice tea and then a visit to a nearby market, where the fundamentals of Thai Ingredients where explained. Then we went back to start cooking.
