Our Teacher (Lana) was very humorous, resourceful, had a very high level of English and is a good instructor: she learned us some very nice (and easy) tricks on how to decorate using vegetables, how to plate items, and some handy tips on how to select food and how to cut it (more) quickly.The setting is very cute and all the staff is very helpful and friendly: They make a good kitchen team!. Our group was very international (Dutch, Spanish, German, Japanese, Canadian and Taiwanese) and we had a lot of fun, it all was very relaxed. Having been a self-thought chef and restaurant manager in many countries around the world, I was impressed by the professionalism, attention to detail and overall atmosphere that was created.We were there on a Sunday and learned to make 5 items – family recipes, not westernized. All came out with a perfect balance of flavors, a recipe book was us to bring home which also featured a lot of background information.The price/quality ratio here is really, really good –There are many cooking schools in Bangkok, but after this visit here - I really do not see why anyone would want to go anywhere else! I can highly recommend Sompong one and will definitely return on a next visit.

best group cooking class experience. This was the cheapest cooking school that I found at 1000baht per person, and in my view, apart from the 1:1 class I attended, this was the best. I tried 4 cooking schools and 1 hotel cooking demonstration altogether. On arrival I was given a cool drink and a choice of tea and requested to take my shoes off. This answered my first question... what to wear on my feet. Coming from a country where OHS is OTT I was concerned that I should have brought closed in shoes, but chose to wear sandals anyway because of the heat. I needn't have worried, bare feet was the norm here. I had tried to book an afternoon class but they advised I move to the morning class because of the heat (or maybe because they didn't have anyone else booked). The preparation room and cooking stations are in a covered outdoor verandah, so not airconditioned but plenty of fans and plenty of water to drink. The morning started with a trip to the market but as my knees were hurting from the previous day's walking I opted out of this and just stayed at the cooking school - drinking cool drinks, eating home made cookies and reading all their previous visitors comments and photos displayed on the walls. I also had a long conversation with Koy and the class teacher (sadly, I didn't write down her name). I found out that this was a family business run by Koy who was living here with her mother and aunt. Koy had learned to cook with her aunt in the family restaurant. This was traditional family cooking at it's best!When the others arrived back from market we donned our aprons and washed our hands ready to begin. We were reminded frequently to wash our hands and not touch our faces so that nobody got chili in their eyes. Each person was given their recipe book and a pencil to write down notes. There were 2 tables of students, 5 on my table and 7 on the other table. The school takes up to 30 students but divides into 2 classes in separate premises, so I think that means max of 15 in a class. This was fine because everyone was cooking the same dish and there were lots of helpers as well as the main teacher. The teacher started by talking about the whole menu, and the role of curry pastes. Then she would explain each dish and demonstrate the preparation of vegetables. This was followed by the students preparing their vegetables... so it was easy to look around if you had forgotten what to do next, and plenty of helper teachers wandering around to jump in when someone was stuck. Then the teacher would demonstrate the cooking of the dish, ending with her demonstrating presentation of the dish. Then the students cooked and decorated their dish with plenty of help from the helper teachers. The dessert dish of custard in pumpkin was cooked as a group, one for each table. So each student took a turn in the preparation of it. The teacher would explain the key ingredients, and which could be left out or substituted if necessary. She also explained medicinal purposes of some of the ingredients... like which ones act as a laxative... explaining why so many visitors get diarrhoea when coming to this culture... it's not food poisoning!!!!!! There were plenty of opportunities to take photos, the teacher helpers also willing to take photos at opportune moments... and plenty of time to write notes in the recipe book - which I did frequently as there was so much verbal information that was not written in the recipe book. After all the dishes were complete we retreated to the airconditioned dining room where all our dishes were laid out on the table, and staff added steamed rice and noodles. They offered coke, water and tea to drink with the meal. We each ate our own dishes and had more than one share of the pumpkin dessert. We were also treated to complimentary mango and sticky rice. The mango was the best mango I have ever tasted... and I have eaten lots of mango! The staff packed up the leftovers in plastic containers and even gave me extra servings of the custard in pumpkin and sticky rice to take home to my husband. One potential disadvantage is that you are all cooking the same dish. But really, I found this made it easier for us as a group as you could see what each person was doing, and it helped cement correct/incorrect techniques. The recipe book was fairly basic so I was writing lots of notes so I would remember specific instructions at home, and the repetition watching others helped me to keep up. Also much of the technique is learned, and can be applied to other things, so it is the technique of preparation and cooking that is learned more than the specific dishes. At another cooking school where we were cooking different dishes I found it much more confusing to follow the instructions for my own dishes. This is particularly so when the English is not so great, but the English spoken here at Sompong was excellent and I had no trouble understanding. Obviously it works out better if you are staying in an apartment rather than a hotel to be able to use all the leftovers for another meal.

fun, interesting and delicious!. This was my last activity of a four-week trip to Cambodia and Thailand and one of the best. It wasn't my first cooking class, but it is the best by far. First, the class was totally hands-on. The class made everything from start to finish. Secondly, the recipes were standards found in Thai restaurants, and they were not complicated. Third, the food was AWESOME!!! We started with a trip to the market, which was fascinating and informative. Then, we started the cooking class, which began with a demonstration, after which time each person had his/her own cooking station to prepare the three dishes. We were supervised and advised when there was too much or not enough heat. Finally, the teacher and all her staff were delightful. Strongly recommend.

A definate must do. We did this course at the end of our 2 week vacation. It was incredibly fun and we learned a lot. Since then I tried it back home and it actually tasted just as great! It took a little longer to prepare with out all the help but it was still amazing. It's a traditional family business and they are all very friendly making it a very enjoyable experience which I will surely repeat when I'm back in bangkok. We were just the two of us but at no time did I feel any pressure to hurry it along. We got all the help and attention we could wish for. Be carefull though we nearly ate all the food we made which resulted in an near inability to walk iwith such a full stumach. Worth it though!

highlight for my trip!. it was amazing!staff are very frirndly.before the class the chef bring us to market and teach us how to choose good and suitable ingredients which is funny and informative.all the dishes are very delicous and they serve us with our self cooked lunch with mango and iced thai tea!both hubby and i find it very interesting and shall go again next time.

Excellent value. This wasn't my first cooking class. One year ago I did one in Chiang Mai, which was mainly about eating. The group size was too big to really keep focus when the teacher explained importand details. This was different at Somphong Thai Cooking school. This time I wanted to bring some thai cooking skills home. And I feel I will. A warm greeting with cold drinks was followed by the standard market visit. The tour was interesting and well thought out. There was no pressure to buy third party goods that the school would get comission for. The teacher Koy was friendly and patient with our questions. When we headed back to the school we made feel like at home. We cooked Red Curry, Stir-fried prawns in tamarind, Larb Gai and Sticky rice Mango. A nice set, which was'nt too much of a challange to eat. The thing I liked the most about the style of teaching was the constant reminder to wash hands and the possible substitutes for some "thai-only" ingredients.We had no breakfast and that was ok like that. Bare in mind not to eat everything of your dishes, since they will pack the leftovers "to go" and you will still be able to enjoy the dessert.After all, this cooking class was a very memorable thing to do with my girlfriend. Can recommend this place thoroughly for people who want to bring home some easy-to-use recepies.

What a fantastic activity!. Spent the morning doing a cooking class- what a fantastic experience, really reasonable and enjoyable. The chef presenter was truly wonderful! For 1000 bhat had a 4 course meal with coke and tea and learnt how to cook all 4 dishes from scratch - my favourite dish was the prawn and pineapple red curry. The morning visit to the market to get our ingredients was also informative and fun! I would recommend this experience to anyone visiting Bangkok!

Fun, fabulous and fantastic!. An excellent morning! Slick, well run and fun. Lots of opportunities to cook yourself in simple and easy to u dear stand steps. The market tour worth the time. Insightful and eye opening. The four dishes plus drinks plus plus plus.... Made for a great day. Good equipment, recipe booklet, enjoyable vibe. Certainly would do another day!!

ENJOY THE COOKING CLASS WITH KOY AND AMP;). Hey!
I spent a beautiful day of cooking in somphong and i can highly recommend the whole team for their legendary cooking skills...def. give it a shot when you r in bangkok;)
Much love,
Stef

The best Authentic Thai cooking School in Bangkok. I recently had the pleasure of learning how to cook authentic Thai food in Bangkok. What a brilliant, fun, knowledgable, and enjoyable experience. Koy's was lovely and very hand-on teacher including all her staffs. Every dishes of my own cooking were delicious, and by far this is the best Thai food I had in Bangkok. I would definitely recommend Somphong Thai Cooking School to anyone who like to experience cooking Authentic Thai food in Bangkok!!!!! Great jobs.

Wonderful day, permanent change. This review is 7 months overdue. We visited Sompong Cooking school in September 2012, and one thing lead to another after that day and we never got to writing the review which the experience demanded. The reason we do it now, despite the delay, is that the one visit with Koi changed the way we eat, permanently.We were lucky in a special way on the day of our course in that the other 4 students didn't pitch (it was in the green season, so more quiet). We had Koi to ourselves, and the wonderful thing about this was that there was literally no place to hide. When the time came to cut ingredients as she'd shown, we pretty much had to do so under close scrutiny. We are sure it is that way even in large classes, but are both pretty bad students in general, and tend to think we'll get it later. Being alone had the wonderful effect of transforming a simple action into a sort of fundamental understanding. The one-day course also ruined our eating experiences over the next 10 days as nothing we ordered was as nice as what we made at Sompong, with Koi.Returning home we found that what we'd learned enabled us to be creative in addition to making a few standard dishes. It is this we are most grateful for; it is this that demands a late review. No other cooking course we've taken has had that effect.Go there. We hope it changes you too.

Great thai cooking experience. It was my first time in a cooking school and I was impressed with how they organised the whole experience; from the morning market tour, cooking demos step by step, preparing ingredients as a group and cooking your dishes individually. We couldn't possibly have done everything individually because of time, so I thought there was a good mix of individual and group activities. They also keep reminding us to wash our hands to be sure we keep our food clean. Nothing beats enjoying your own cook thai food for lunch. You will be amazed at what you can cook with some guidance; the food tasted better than in reataurants!. I would recommend this activity for first time cooks, occasional cooks but maybe not so for the pros since the steps to follow are quite elementary.

Hospitality at its finest. The Somphong Thai cooking school is Thai food culture at its heart. You start the morning off with a market tour to buy all the ingredients which is where you see how the Thai live and breathe food. After that the cooking class is in the family home of the staff. The hospitality and the attitude of "this is your home" was very warming and makes you feel relaxed. I think this really shows the true Thai friendliness and was a great way to escape the bustle of Bangkok's main streets.The food was outstanding and the recipes being family recipes are so authentic you just can't stop eating!The class went for a few hours and the time flew. I would recommend this as the one MUST do activity in Bangkok. Forget Wat Pho, go to Somphong Thai Cooking School!

Heart and soul. There are times that people go above and beyond. It is the reason why so many people rate this little family business so highly on this site.The school gives a real Bangkok experience in terms of shopping at the market smelling the smells and seeing the sites of everyday life in Bangkok. The teacher shows a remarkable grasp of her craft and her culinary culture, warmth just oozes out of everybody involved in helping us learn to cook, for this alone I'd give 5 stars.When one of our party became faint from an existing condition the whole place, staff, family and neighbours moved into action, massages smelling salts kindness that puts most of the world to shame just happened and then we we given a lift home! A remarkable experience in cooking and in the kindness integrity and generosity of this Thai family.....can I give 7 stars?

Family, culture, then excellent cooking and teaching. It was great to see the ow the Somphong family transformed the ground floor of their home to make you feel welcomed into their cooking class. With three generations there to help guide you through the whole 4+ hour lessons you could tell it was not only a true "family business" but a passion. It was a great cultural experience with the trip to the market and at such great value! As foodies and teachers we recognized the awesome attitude, skill, and patience of the whole staff. We knew we were in the right place when two members of our class were return customers, and now so are we!
Cook like a Thai. I found the staff at Somphong Thai cooking very friendly and helpful. I really felt that my Thai cooking knowledge had improved and the results that I ate were truly delicious.

BEST cooking class ever!!. My sister and I took a quick trip to Bangkok, and this was easily the BEST thing we did during our whole vacation! The class was more than a class - Somphong welcomes you into their home, treats you like family, and invites you into the kitchen. All of the staff were incredibly professional and kind, with great (easy to follow) cooking demonstrations and guidance, a great sense of humor, and lots of knowledge. I highly recommend this group - I can't actually imagine another cooking school being as wonderful.

Great activity in Bangkok. Very educational, fun and rewarding. Kow should be on tv! I picked this one because I wanted the local experience, not necessarily the 5 star hotel thing. We were taken on a tour of the local market which was so interesting and informative. The cooking school is run by a beautiful family and their extended group of wonderful staff. I learnt a great deal about Thai cooking plus just some really handy cooking tips. The food was incredible and we were looked after like royalty. Highly recommend you put this on your list of must do's in Bangkok.

I like the experience so much when I stay in Somphong Thai Cooking School！. The teather,P’Koy is very nice and kind. I was enjoy there so much. I was studying 7 days at there.The seavice is good, and there is easy to find it. If you cannot find it you can tell them you need pick up service when you booking. Then they will pick you up at BTS.  When you just come they will provide you Thai tea or coffee. and when you feeling very hot they will provide wet tissue for you. And when you eatting they will provide fruits. before you study you will get a recipes and you can take notes what you want, and you can keep it.  I think that If you like to study Thai cooking you should go to there. Teacher will teach you different Thai herbs and cooking way. You also will cook by yourself and eat your food. Most of the ingredients will be prepped for you. You will simply following directions for cooking times and you will learn famous Thai Food recipes. The courses are different on eachday，so you should choose what you are interested. I have learned different Thai Salad and Mine foods and many desserd. Sometime,there like a big family，people were from differnt counties so the atmosphere would be nice and happy. I like the experience so much when I stay in Somphong Thai Cooking School！  However，I would like to say I Appreciate P’Koy and all the staff, all of you are enthusiastic and frendly. I was realy realy enjoy it.

Very good introduction to Thai food. This school was easy to find and close to the Siam area. Having been on a Cooking course in Thailand before, I can honestly say that I enjoyed this one a lot more. No problem understanding the chef, everything was clean and the team worked hard in making us all feel welcome. If you dont want to eat all the food, they pack it for you to take away. I picked the afternoon class as we then had the meals for dinner- much better than trying to have a big lunch after a late breakfast at your hotel.

Fabulous Experience and Food. One of the highlights of my time in Bangkok was learning how to cook some simple Thai dishes at Somphong. The morning started with a trip to a small local market, where our teacher Amph introduced us to various ingredients. She explained the various types of peppers, eggplants and other vegetables. It was very interesting to see the coconut milk vendor and learn how he makes his cream and milk. We ended the trip with a few minutes to shop for ready made curries and other Thai ingredients.Back at the school, which is in a small house at the end of a quiet lane in Silom, we each had our own work station and tray with ingredients. We started with curry paste, which we all made together. With only 8 students, it was the perfect size group. Then we made a fabulous shrimp curry, learning several techniques to ensure a creamy and perfect curry. We also made stir fried chicken and Thai omelet salad. The most interesting dish was the red ruby in coconut milk desert - a popular Thai desert that I'd never seen before. The school has a very clean toilet, free wifi (not that anyone used it) and is very clean. It does not have air conditioning so it can be quite hot even with the fans. I highly recommend this cooking school - it is small, simple and the food was great!

Enjoyed it so much I went back the next day!. Food is a great way to learn about a culture. I picked Somphong based on trip advisor reviews as well as the fact that it's in a fairly central location in Silom and they offer a complimentary pick up at the BTS station. No regrets whatsoever. Koy Is a great teacher, explaining the techniques and ingredients in an easy to understand manner. Given the fact that it's a 4 hour session for 5 dishes, which includes a curry paste, which includes a 40 min visit to a nearby market, it is inevitable that some of the dishes have to be prepared as a class, with the instructor demonstrating and an opportunity for a few students to try their hand at it (e.g. Mango sticky rice). Not withstanding, it is helpful to have seen how these dishes are prepared and I'm sure that with the recipe book given by Koy, I can cook this dish on my own. Overall, the class had a good mix of learning to prepare the ingredients (Koy shared safe and efficient practices for cutting, slicing, chopping, pounding), practicing our knife skills, and actual cooking. It is gratifying to have prepared a Thai dish from fresh ingredients instead of a store bought paste! I appreciated that some of the ingredients were prepared by Koy's team beforehand (e.g. Onions and garlic were peeled, so all we had to do was chop it up)Another side benefit, you get to meet people from differents parts of the workd who share a passion for food. I had such great time on Tuesday, I signed up again for the Wednesday class. Highly recommended!

Back to Somphong Cooking Schools. We were last there in 2012 and knew that on our 2013 Bangkok trip we wanted to go back again. Koy and her team which is mostly family once again gave us a fabulous morning, the friendliest most helpful people ever. We cooked an amazing meal again. After our last trip we have cooked Thai food at home usually every week and Somphong Cooking gave us so much information that we came away feeling confident. Koy gives lots of clever hints and tips which help you prepare tasty authentic food without any problems. As she is talking and demonstrating before you cook make sure you keep notes on what you are trying to achieve, listen carefully for the salty, spicy, sweet, sour order she describes each dish, it will help you later on. Koys aunt (Somphong) gives the best hugs!

Great taste of Thai. I really enjoy cooking and eating just as much. While I live in San Francisco and am exposed to a variety of thai foods, this is my first trip to Thailand so I still am unsure what to order and expect. This was a great class to understand the process of thai food, the ingredients and the names of a variety of dishes. We started the course with a walk to the local market which was very informative and interesting. I learn a lot about ingredients specific to Thailand and in general. Back in the classroom we were more of assembler than cooks, as all of the ingredients were prepped and laid out for us. However, I did learn a few tips along the way. After making four dishes we were able to sit down and enjoy our own dishes. These were shockingly delicious based on how simple they were. Am I a better cook having taken this course? I am not sure, but the experience was highly enjoyable and I now have a better understanding of the process and ingredients that go into many thai dishes. That alone was worth the cost of the course. The staff was very friendly and knowldeI don't know if I would consider this a cooking class as much as a assembly course. Most of the ingredients were already prepped for us and we were simply following directions for cooking times. Realistically this is the only way possible for the time

the best you can find!. I have just spent a week with this school, working with Koy has been great, i am a chef from the UK and cook Thai food in my restaurant, the lesson each day was a great insite into the thsi food and lifestyle.At no time did i feel this place was just out to make money. Koy is very understanding to people who have never cooked, also she can comuniacte in english to a very good standard.If you want a great day and get great value for money then book a lesson.ow..and dont eat bfast in the morning! you eat what you cook and mamas mango is like you have never tasted....heaven

Extremely enjoyable - a 'must do' in Bangkok. I enjoy cooking classes and have been to many over the years. This one was great. The trip to the market was fun and informative. You get your own tray of ingredients and, once it has been demonstrated how to prepare them, off you go. All the ingredients are fresh, including the coconut milk, no reliance on tins. You make your own curry paste, again, no use of electric blenders which never achieve the authentic tastes that you get from a pestle and mortar.I would thoroughly recommend this course; the staff are friendly, helpful and really do know how to cook Thai food.

Cooking with Heart- great experience at a great value. We had a wonderful experience with Somphong. My friends and I were astounded by the genuine hospitality Koy and her staff had for us. At a hotel we had stayed at, they served a delicious Roselle tea, and we were on a mission to find some to bring home. We searched in 3 cities and a dozen market, but we had no luck. Koy not only helped us find these fresh flowers at the market but also her grandmother helped us dry them out too! Koy made us feel so welcomed that it was like cooking with a friend at her home!We loved the extensive 5- course menu that we prepared. Making our own curry paste was so much fun! Can't say enough good things about our experience. Thank you is for the hospitality and the memories from all of us!

Excellent Thai cooking class!. I am sure I am probably repeating other reviews, but this class was amazing! From the moment we arrived the staff brought us ice tea and biscuits whilst we waited for the rest of the class to turn up (we were a Sunday afternoon class-menu red curry, tamarind prawns, spicy chicken salad, mango and sticky rice). We then went to the local market where local produce was explained to us, and we could have a smell and feel of some of the unusual (to me at least) veg and herbs. Some was bought and we returned to the class to start making the dishes. The class was excellent, each person made their own dish so could tailor the spicy ness etc (or omit ingredients if allergies were noted) the teaching was great, and hints were given along the way by the assistants. Everyone was very friendly, questions were encouraged, email contact prior to the class was very helpful and responses were very quick. Overall, a brilliant time was had by me and my three friends, highly recommended, an a brilliant way for us to spend our last day in Thailand! Do not miss this!

Picky Traveler: Highlight of My Trip. I booked an afternoon class to escape the midday heat of Bangkok my first day. I thought I knew where I was going, but got lost and missed the class. I called the next day to apologize rebook. They couldn't have been more gracious and understanding. I was met at the Skytrain station by the lovely Amp in a red apron and small wicker basket. She explained that I was getting a private class that afternoon! We grabbed a taxi to the nearby market where Amp explained all the different vegetables and spices we would be using.Back at the school, which is just a block off Silom road, I was welcomed by the staff in the open air kitchen. Don't worry, there are fans and protection from the sun. It was quite comfortable (and I have trouble with anything over 80 degrees F). They have individual stations so everyone in the class gets to cook after watching Amp demonstrate a recipe. I learned to make 4 different homestyle meals (prawns were my favorite), all of which I plan to cook at home. Amp demonstrated technique and explained each step. It was fantastic! I am not one for fussy food and wasn't interested in the cooking schools offered at the hotels where you watch rather than do. If you want to learn about Thai food and culture in a low key, hands on class, Samphong Cooking School is perfect. I can't wait to go back.

A well-thought and friendly cooking course. Booking : it is very easy, you send an email precising the date you would like to take the course. You receive quickly the answer and the details of the meeting point. No need to pay to confirm your booking. I advise you to choose the day of your course according to the dishes you want to prepare. Everything is well explained on the website. The usual meeting point is at a skytrain station where someone comes to pick you up.The course starts with a market visit during which you learn a lot about the different varieties of vegetables and ingredients you will cook. It is very interesting.During the course, you prepare 5 dishes. Koy is a very good teacher, she first explains clearly the recipe and then she repeats instructions where you are cooking. She is helped by an assistant (so 1 teacher by table) who checks the different stages, gives you advice and helps you if you need. You are given a booklet of recipes. Koy explains how to replace the ingredients you don't have at home.You first prepare 3 dishes, you have a break to eat, then you prepare the 2 last dishes and you eat them. If you are full, Koy puts your dishes in a doggy bag. It is a kind attention.This course is very well thought, Koy and her staff are efficient and friendly.

Great class. My wife and I attended the 26 Dec 12 AM class. This was our third trip to Thailand and third cooking class. Previous one's being in Phuket and Chiang Mai. The class was not only a blast but very informative. Koy met us at the BTS station just as arranged. There was another couple there also. We went back to the school first to get the last member of the class before heading out to the market. Short 5-10 minute walk and we were there. Koy did a very good job of explaining ingredients for what we were making. She also made sure we could tell if they were fresh or not and explained substitutes in case we couldn't find the preferred item in our local markets. Was also a chance for my wife to pick up a few items we couldn't get back home. Then it was back to the school to start. She explained and then demonstrated what we needed to do. All the utensils/pans/etc. were clean and it seemed that every time we finished a step the utensils we were using were swapped out with clean ones. She also made sure everytime we did anything with the chili peppers we would wash our hands afterwards to ensure we didn't inadvertently rub our eyes with less than desirable side effects! We made three dishes which we then ate followed by two more. Every dish was outstanding and we also had watermelon and mango to eat too. Each of us received the recipes for what we made. Koy has a fantastic attitude toward teaching and a fun, bubbly personality. We give this class the highest recommendation if you're interested in attending a cooking class while in Bangkok. You won't be disappointed!

Unforgettable New Year's Eve dinner!. We just loved our experience at the Somphong Cooking School. We were four adults and 5 boys aged 15 thru 21. We learned so much and we made a delicious meal of Red Curry with chicken, Thai Vegetable Soup with shrimp, stir fried mixed veggies with prawns, spring rolls and sticky rice with mango. What a great way to welcome the New Year!

What an amazing time!. This was unanimously voted by my family to be our #1 favorite activity of our trip to Bangkok. We were met at the BTS station exactly on time by chef Koy--easily recognizable in her bright red apron!--exactly on time and professionally. I was worried about finding her in the busy sky train station, but shouldn't have been at all. Koy drove us in her air-conditioned car to the cooking school, where we met the rest of the class and headed out for an incredibly informative tour of a fresh market nearby. Once we got back to the school, we launched into a series of dishes to cook, each one SUPER easy to make, even for our 8-year old, and delicious! They had the perfect balance of "prep yourself" (ever made red chili paste with a mortar and pestle? It's harder than it looks!) with "we did this because it would be too dangerous/tedious for you to do it". Each student had their own stove to cook over, and we all ate what we made on our own. We made panang chicken curry, fried rice, tom yum soup, stir fried vegetables, and steamed banana cake--by the cake, we were STUFFED! My daughter, who eats virtually nothing that isn't macaroni and cheese, LOVED it and ate every bite--we will definitely do this again if we come back to Bangkok!

What a Blast!. My husband, 22 yr old daughter and I wanted to do a cooking class together during our time in Thailand. We were very pleased to find Somphong Thai Cooking School on the Web. Most of the other courses we found seemed quite pricey, and we just wanted the cooking class, not a boat tour or some other add-on. Koy our teacher, is passionate about Thai food and cooking. This was obvious right from our visit to the local market to buy supplies for the 4 dishes and 1 dessert we would make during our 4 hour class. Koy is very articulate and her English is very good. She introduced us to the ingredients we would use and how to know when they're fresh. On return to the Cooking School we got started with preparing the first dish. Instructions were clear and Koy always asked if we had questions, she also provided individual attention when needed. We had a lot of fun doing this activity as a family and learned some new recipes . The recipes were given to us in a booklet after we had an incredible feast of our creations. Her family even helped pack up our leftovers to take away. The cost is 1000Baht/person, very good value for your money.

Excellent friendly experience. We had great fun as family at Somphan. Khun Koy and her staff were very hospitable, they had lot of patience and made the experience thoroughly enjoyable. It was fun cooking everything from first principles and we enjoyed eating what we cooked too! The price was also much more competitive compared to the peers...

Great Fun. We had such a fun time during our cooking class. Koy was a wonderful teacher and all of her staff were friendly and helpful. There were 9 of us in the early morning class. After a trip to the market we then learned how to cook 5 different dishes. Koy was great in accomodating my needs to not eat any chicken, beef or pork so I was still able to participate and eat using substitutions for those items. All of the dishes we cooked were demonstrated first and then we each had our own cooking station to prepare our dishes. The price was also right compared to other cooking classes I looked into. The venue was very peaceful although located in a central part of town. I would do this again if i return to Bangkok.

Wonderful cooking class. I am attended many different cooking classes around the world and this was one of the best. Everyone was very friendly. The class was both a demonstration class and a participation class. The instructor first demonstrated the preparation and the cooking and then as the student I did my own preparation and cooking with helpful guidance. There are individual gas burners around the room so that everyone can cook their own food. We made five dishes and each one was delicious. The recipes are easy to understand. Definitely a good value.

A great experience to understand Thai food. We tried Somphong Thai Cooking School as our last experience before leaving Bangkok. We spend our last afternoon (from 3 to 7:30 pm) and it was more than worth it. I scheduled the class the same day for my wife and me because we like cooking very much and the Somphong family made this an unforgettable experience, the kitchen is like a real Thai kitchen and they take care of every detail, the portions, the techniques, plating, everything perfectly clean and organized. Even a visit to the market to understand how to buy each one of your ingredients, all in a very warm family environment. They give you a couple of souvenirs and your cooking book. Of course, we are planning to try all the 5 different dishes as soon as we go back to Mexico.
Lovely experience.. Very interesting. The finished dishes tasted sooo great! Nice people, and the pick up and drop at the train station made it very convenient.

Wonderful Thai cooking class with Koy and her lovely staff. What a delight to attend such a well run and professional cooking class. Koy and her lovely staff made the half day class and market trip an absolute joy and must do in Bangkok. The recipe book provided makes going home and sharing these new recipes a breeze.

What fun!. We visited Thailand in Oct. 2012 and took a cooking class with Koy and her associates. It by far exceeded my expectations. The class was run so smoothly with 18 students from all over the world. The trip to the market was essential to understand the spices, herbs, and coconut creme vs. coconut milk. It was my husband's birthday and after class while we were eating what we prepared, Koy brought out a birthday cake they had gone out for to share with the class. What a great finish to a wonderful morning!

Unforgettable Experience in Bangkok!. I took the class on October 14th 2012 and I loved it! The marking tour was both informative and real fun. I liked the selection dishes we cooked. Basically all of them can be cooked at home. Koy is a very pleasant young woman and an excellent teacher! Her instructions were clear and comprehensive and easy to follow. As a result I enjoyed delicious Thai food made all (or alsomst all :) ) by myself! Thank you very much, Koy. The time I spent in Somphong Cooking School will be always part of my warmest memories. Oksana

Homey and fun cookingclass. I visited Somphong Cooking school the 5th of october 2012. It was a last minute plan and when I called in that morning I could come over for the class that afternoon. When I came in I was welcomed with a drink into a homey setting. We started of with a trip to a local market about 3 min walk. A lot of things are explained about local thai ingredients. There's sufficient information for the very beginner and the more experienced cook during the whole course, it's nice because the classes are small. I had a wonderful time and I think Koy and her staff have a really nice place. I would recommed everyone to pay a visit to make your Thailand experience complete, it is one of the most fun things to do when you visit Bangkok!

Fantastic cooking course!. Great teachers, lovely market tour and I can't believe I made all that delicious food!Smooth reservation and pick-up at the BTS station and all staff members were so kind and gave great advice and were gracefully patient!

Best Cooking Class Ever! Great Food and Presentation!. Thank you so much Koy. That was the best cooking class I ever had and the food was delicious! ;-). I had a 3 hours private cooking class at Somphong Thai Cooking School and I could choose my own 5 dishes I wanna cook. We cooked -1- Red Curry Paste -2- Che Chee Curry with Prawn -3- Phat Thai -4- Spicy Chopped Chicken Salad -5- Papaya Salad -6- Thai Steamed Banana CakeKoy is a very good teacher and she speaks very good english and also the other staff They are all very nice and considerate. First of all, we went to a close market and she explained me the different types of chilies, vegetables, spices and many more. We also bought some ingredients for my class. I could ask at any time questions and I always got a professional answer.Koy always first shows you how to cook the dish and after that its your turn. She repeats the instructions to you again, while you are trying to cook the dish. Its very easy and good organised. After you finished with all the cooking you can enjoy your food. Its enough food and you will not be hungry for sure. :-) And if you can't finish it, you can take it home.This was one of the best thaifood I ever had in Thailand and the great thing is, I have cooked it! Yeah! I highly recommend this cooking class. Iam also a cook in my hometown and I have done a lot classes there, but I never had a private class. This was the best ever! Now I will do it oftener, because than you have the teacher for you alone. ;-) The email contact was also very quick. She also pays the taxi to get to the cooking school, thanks!I will come back for sure!

Somphong cooking school -great experience!. We had some time to fill and booked this course online late the night before. Quick response, no problems. Koy met us with a welcomed smile, paid for our taxi and we then enjoyed a great menu and left with lots of knowledge on Thai cooking.

Extremely Well Organized. This was an enjoyable and unforgettable experience. Koy is a very good teacher and has thought things through very well. She demonstrates how to "chop chop chop" and "make beautiful" so that we end up with a beautiful tray of delicious smelling spices and herbs, we then cook our own individual portions in the wok.There were seven students on the day that we went, and I'm sure everyone felt that they had received excellent individual attention. We all cooked some great food and we were even given little packages of herbs to take home with us to encourage us to continue our Thai cooking adventure. You are even provided with a booklet containing the recipes you have made and there are chances for you to add your own notes so that you don't forget the invaluable advice.I have no hesitation whatsoever in recommending the Somphong Thai Cooking School.

Superb way to discover thai food culture!. If you're looking for a great way to spend 1/2 of your day, then this is it. We contacted Koy via email. She responds fast, speaks great english and best of all, she was willing to meet and pick us up at a BTS station near our hotel. We learned a lot from this activity and it was indeed one of the highlights of our trip. Highly recommended unique bonding experience!

Excellent family-run cooking school. My wife and I attended this class today. Lucky for us we were the only two students in the class. This class is great for many reasons. First it is owned and operated out of the family home located near the Banyan tree hotel where we stayed. Coy was great about letting us pick the menu. The class began with a trip to the nearby market we learned about the ingredients we will be cooking with that day. We then returned to the cooking school where we began to prepare the ingredients. Personally I found that it was a good combination of prep work done by the student as well as the staff there. It probably is not feasible to have the students do all the prep and cook the food within the time allotted. We then proceed to make five dishes. The first was a chicken red curry. The second was a cashew chicken stirfry. Next we made a banana fritters dessert. And finally we prepared a chicken soup and pineapple fried rice. My wife and I had a great time and found that koi and her staff were very friendly and helpful. We would highly recommend this class to anyone looking for a fun activity in Bangkok.

Cooking class. My sister and I were looking to expereince and learn about Thai food and cooking on our visit to Bankok. The 5hr course was over and above what we expected, the visit and information at the markets was execptional, and the instruction and support by all the staff was amazing.I highly recommed the Somphong thai cooking school for all levels.Thank you for the great experience

A Perfect half-Day. Loved it!!! We booked the course via telephone the evening before and because the cooking school was just a few streets away we chose to walk there instead of the offered pick-up service. Of course we arrived late because we didn't find it at fiirst. But everybody was very nice about it. All of the people working there were super friendly, extra nice and spoke good english. The course schedule was well thought through. And the shopping at the market interesting and exciting. The menu is different every day and it was no problem at all to exchange the meat for tofu/prawns for the vegetarians. The interior is also very nice, like in a classy restaurant. We can recommend it without hesitation and on our journey back home will probably do another class.
easy to learn, great staff and tasty dishes. I had a great time, Koy is really nice and a great teacher, cooked some really nice dishes and I would recommend it to others.

Okay. Pros: - The food we made was delicious. I was so stuffed but still managed to clean my plate because it was just that good. - It was cheaper than other more popular cooking schools listed on tripadvisor. - The facility was clean. Cons: - The website states that the price includes transportation to and from your residence (near by area.) She emailed me saying that they can't pick us up from our hotel because it was was too far. Her exact words were, "Your hotel is far from our school about 5-10 min. by taxi." She reimbursed us for the cab ride there but not for the ride back. The cab fee was minimal so it wasn't a huge deal. - Out of the 6 things on the menu that day, 3 were made "together." Meaning, people either took turns prepping or Koy or her staff just made it for us. Judging from the pictures posted on here and on Koy's website, this isn't always the case which makes it more upsetting as I'm sure the others paid the same price. (For example, to make the spring roll (Paw Pia Thawt), all of us in the small group cut up the ingredients and put it on one big plate. Then, people turn turns stir frying the ingredients on one wok. We brought the stir fried ingredients back to the table where we individually wrapped the spring rolls which were put on another big plate. Then Koy deep fried all the spring rolls while we stood around and watched.) Overall: I think I would've paid a bit more to actually make each dish by myself instead of having others cook a part of what I was supposed to have made.

Hilights of our trip. On time pick up service..Wonderful experience, truly one of the highlights of the trip. Nice people all staff alway smiling. The unfortunate part is that I haven't been able to replicate her meals back at home due to my lack of experience and ingredients. Teacher Koy is so knowledgeable and gives a real world experience into Thai cooking. The market trip was fun and educational at the same time. The food is beyond exceptional, one of my best memories of our trip in Thailand and don't want to say good bye.. next trip in thailand we will back here again!!

Perfect cooking experience!. Today I had my cooking class at Somphong. In one word:fantastic! The people are so friendly, and you really learn how to make the most tastefull Thai dishes. It's very clean and the atmosphere is almost like you're at home. Somphong means in thai: dreams come true. I can tell you my dreams came true today haha! I'm going to enjoy skills at home!

My Best of Bangkok, so far.. A great way to spend a morning and easily the best 1000 baht I've spent so far here in Bangkok. It's 4 hours of happy group fun, brilliant for singles, couples or families and absolutely OK for any language group. Koy is a very pleasant personality with good English, but since it's all show, tell and then do yourself and the ingredients are either familiar or explained and created in process, language is of secondary importance. And you get to eat together what you've cooked, so it's a fun social event as well.My session of 9 participants was me solo, a pleasant young couple from Singapore, two happy Hong Kong girls and a Taiwanese family of four. We melded. It became one of those, "Let's take a group photo" events, and time passed very easily.

La perfetta fusione tra un esperienza culinaria e la conoscenza di una nuova cultura.. Exelent expirence of Thai culinary culture and knowledge of food. Nice and clean kitchen friendly people and relaxed atmosphere.

Delicious Souvenier to Last a Lifetime. Koy's cooking class was a highlight of our trip to Thailand. We felt like we stepped away from being tourists to learn something authentic. Everyone in our family is an experienced cook, but we still learned so much. Koy took us to a real market, taught us about the ingredients and gave us all little baskets to carry the ingredients home. We ate what we cooked and it was one of the most delicious meals we had in Thailand. Considering how amazing all the food was in Thailand, Koy's class is the best of the best. A week after we came home, we scoured our Asian stores in Calgary to find the ingredients to make Koy's menu. As we were cooking, all of us said aloud "chop, chop, chop" as if Koy was supervising. We will enjoy Koy's class over and over again as we make her delicious recipes. Thank you Koy.

A true thai experience. What a great half day with Koy! We were looking for schools to learn not only the thai basics but also the real way thai cooking is done and that's exactly what Somphong cooking school is all about. They dedicated all their attention and time to you in a real thai warm family environment. Very profesionnal, for the non-experienced to the want-to-be cook. We enjoyed so much that we decided to cancel our other plans to add an extra half-day. We will definitively include in our next trip to Thailand.

A wonderful half day with Koy and her team at Somphong Thai Cooking School. My family and I went yesterday for a cooking class at the Somphong Thai Cooking School. It was fantastic. Koy and her team made us having a wonderful time from the beginning until the end of the class. We went first to the local market and then we cooked for a couple of hours. Koy too, her time to explain everything, kids appreciated it a lot.We strongly recommend the Somphong Thai Cooking School to those who want to learn how to cook Thai foods in a very pleasant ambiance.Thank you To Koi and all of your colleagues!Details can be found at:http://www.originalthaicookingschool.com/

Fun cooking. Ive always enjoyed cooking, and i enjoy thai food even more. That is why it was perfect that our hotel recommended somphong thai cooking school to me. The class was fun and easy and more personal. It was as if i was cooking at home, the ambiance was very comfortable. And our teacher, koy is so sweet and she really knows what she's doing. Actually the whole staff were very sweet an organized and we can tell that theyre very experienced. For only a 1000 bhat you get to learn thai cooking and eat them too after! It was an amazing experience. Would definitely go back to learn more recipes.

A highlight of our trip!. You must make the time to visit this cooking school. They make it easy for you - we were picked up at the local train station where we were met with smiling faces. The school is actually Khan Koy's home and instantly you are made to feel at home. I was with my husband and three children (aged 13, 15 and 16) and the staff made us feel very welcome. On arrival we were offered refreshments and some Thai treats/snacks - so delicious but do not fill up as there is so much food to come! We walked to a local market where the fresh produce was purchased for our dishes. The whole time khan is informing us (in very good English) about the produce - we learnt so much. After the markets we returned to the school where we created the most amazing banquet to feast on. The flavours were unbelievable - better than any restaurant we had eaten in - ingredients so fresh, pastes made from scratch and we had created it ourselves. You are given your own recipe book containing all the dishes you created this day. On arrival back to Australia we went to our local fresh fruit and veggie market where we were able to find the fresh ingredients. A quick trip into China town and we had all the other ingredients. Khan of course tells you of substitutes you can use if you can't find the true ingredients. She instilled such a passion for Thai food that we copied the banquet on our second night back home and we prepared and cooked it very successfully - a wonderful teacher!!!! We did many truly amazing things whilst in Thailand and this is one of those. A MUST DO!!!!!!!

Amazing cooking experience!. Good Price + Friendly and fun environment +Great Chef + Convenient TransportationFrom local market to the kitchen, we learned a lot about Thai spice and seasonings and had great fun during a 4 hr course. Koy was very informative and helpful, everything was well organized. Recommended for people who wants to have an in depth understanding of local food.

Wonderful Experience!. We had a wonderful experience at Somphong. We got picked up from BTS station. Upon arrival, snacks and Thai tea were served, and I enjoyed home-brewed Thai tea a lot! The snacks were made from pineapple and tasted delicious, too. Then, we went for a market tour. It was interesting to learn about Thai's unique herbs and spices. Koy also explained the difference between coconut cream and coconut milk, which was a question in my mind for a long time. I also asked how people picked up coconut from the tree, and it was quite surprising to learn that people in Thailand actually trained monkeys to pick up coconut, LOL. All the recipes were clear and not hard to follow. All in all, I like my Thai cooking experience a lot!

The real authentic Thai cooking school in Thailand!!!. My husband and I took two cooking classes from Somphong Thai cooking school that were taught by Khun Koy. We enjoyed every moment we had spent at the cooking class. Khun Koy is very knowledgeable, passionate, generous, flexible, and she is very hands on teacher. We also enjoyed going to the fresh market, and seeing all the fresh ingredients that we brought back to the cooking class. We had such a great time at the cooking class, also Khun Koy is always with you every step during your class. We highly recommend Somphong Thai cooking class to everyone who wants to learn how to cook real authentic Thai food. I guarantee you won't be disappointed, and you will have a good time in the class, and you will definitely be full!!!!

Fantastic authentic Thai cooking school. My boyfriend and I had a great morning with Koy cooking and eating some extremely tasty dishes! We made five dishes in total and Koy was very clear in explaining how to make the best dish and why certain produce is used / or what you could use as an alternative. The trip to the Market was a great start to the course to become familiar with the ingredients for using later on in the class. We'll come back again next year to try our hand at some more dishes!

Long lasting Thai flavours!!. I'm so excited to see that this is on Tripadvisor, because it is definitely an authentic Thai Cooking School! Koy is such a passionate and generous teacher, and flexible too when it was just my partner and I that attended the class. We had such a great time going to the markets for the fresh produce, and then cooking the whole morning, best part was eating till we literally rolled out the door and didn't even need dinner!To date now that we're back home in Australia, we make the green chicken curry on a regular basis, and all friends and family that gets to taste it loves it! Thank you Koy, should we ever visit Thailand again, we'll be coming for our next lesson!NB: We actually went in March 2010, but can't be back dated that far.

Rewarding experience. My wife & I booked a course here and both tremendously enjoyed ourselves. We left with a much better understanding of Thai cooking and a bit fatter, having eaten much of what we cooked.I got my hotel to phone up and make the booking and they wrote down in Thai the address for the taxi driver - and looked it up on Google Maps. Having done that, we found it easily.The market tour was genuinely informative and a good learning foundation for the rest of the morning.We went on a Sunday and covered the recipes listed in the menu on the website. You are given a demonstration or a dish, then cook it yourselves, from scratch. And astoundingly the results were really good! Koy is a charming and thorough teacher. She did a fabulous job.The school is homely, clean and well equipped.We both thoroughly recommend this school.Best not to eat much breakfast before you go though!

Half a day cooking with Koy - lessons learned for life?. I see upon myself as a very mediocre chef. But I love food, and took the chance of attending a cooking class i Bangkok, since the Thai cuisine is one of may favorite kitchens.We took an afternoon class, and it started with a tout to a close by market. Most of the market was closed that late, but our teacher Koy showed us all the ingredients we would use and how to pick out the best ones when you yourself will go shopping when cooking back home.We cooked five different dishes, and Koys English is excellent, and she gave great instructions. Not only what to use, buy why you use this or that specific spice. And what you can exclude or replace, if you have problems to find all the ingredients back home. All the instructions were given in writing upon arrival, so you could add your own notes. I left the class thinking even i could do this. My friend, she is a star in the kitchen, enjoyed the class just as much as I did. So cooking for everyone, not just for dummies as me.I've tried some Thai cooking back home after this, both from what we cooked in class and recipes I found online. The results have been great. I've received so many compliments for my cooking, from people I highly admire in the kitchen (and that is a first). On a potluck, everyone agreed my Thai dish was the best of everything served. And I must say, I thought so too. I hope to come back to Somphong Thail Cooking School one day.To think about: You don't have to bring anything. They have everything you need including refreshments. Facilities are nice, and you can leave your bags in the air-conditioned dining room. We had the first dish on the table after one and a half hour, and after that, we ate so much delicious food so I could hardly walk away from there. So arrive there hungry, but not starving.

Just fantastic - we will be going back in September. We had a fantastic time at Somphong Thai Cooking School today. We originally booked with another school but they must have been full and moved us over to this school which for us was fantastic. We were picked up from Chong Nonsi BTS, driven to the school and invited into the cooking/home area. It was beautifully clean with a welcoming icy cold Thai Tea to drink. Introductions were made, we were given a basket each and we set of the couple of minutes walk to the food market where all manner of things were on display.The different herbs, spices and fresh vegetables were explained in simple straight forward english and we learnt lots of things just doing that.Once finished purchasing our vegetable ingredients back to the home/school we went and the fun began.We cooked some lovely fresh, tasty dishes that we feel quite sure we can easily replicate at home. All explanations and information was simple, after cooking each dish we ate them, we were so full at the end of it I feel I may never eat again!We learnt how to make beautiful plate decorations out of tomato skins (my husband enjoyed that), we made Pandanus parcels out of leaves for our chicken (that was fun to learn).Cold bottled water was supplied, towelettes for cooling down, aprons, recipe book with pens for note taking.Likes: Food delicous, staff helpful, information easily understood, genuine people, everything metculously clean and hygenic,Dislikes: Nothing at allWe would recommend anybody for this course, we only had 5 in the class and it was fantastic. We will be back to Bangkok in September and will be doing another class.I promise you will enjoy it - Di (Kevin and Di Smith)
